response: Preheat oven to 350f. Brush the tops and sides of the bread slices with butter. Place bread slices in a 2-quart casserole. Place a slice of cheese over the bread. Lay 1 chicken breast on each slice of cheese. Sprinkle with seasoning mix. Top each with another slice of bread. Pour the soup over the bread slices. Dot with butter. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve with steamed broccoli or another vegetable.

Heat the olive oil and butter together on the stove top until melted. Add the chopped garlic and the onion. Sauté the onion and garlic until softened. Add the rosemary and the paprika and sauté for 2 minutes. Add the chicken and brown on all sides (about 5 minutes). Add the chopped celery and the lemon juice and sauté for 3 minutes. Add the chicken broth and the wine and bring the liquid up to a boil over medium high heat. Lower the heat and simmer for 1 hour and 30 minutes or until the chicken is done. Remove the chicken from the soup and shred with two forks. Return the chicken back into the soup and cook for 20 more minutes. Serve with rice and garnish with fresh parsley and lemon wedges.

Pour raw rice into 4-qt. casserole dish. Stir in celery, green pepper and mayonnaise. Cover and chill overnight. Stir pineapple and preserves into rice mixture. Add chicken and stir gently until chicken is well distributed. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and season with salt and pepper. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until cheese melts and bubbles. Serve with crackers or use as sandwich filling.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In 10-inch skillet melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Slice corn off cobs. Add to butter along with 1/2 cup water. Cook for 1 minute or until corn is tender crisp. Stir until butter has melted. Stir corn mixture with eggs until blended. Pour egg mixture into skillet. Sprinkle basil leaves over eggs. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until eggs are almost set. Place skillet in oven to finish cooking eggs for 5 to 6 minutes or until eggs are firm to touch on top. While eggs are cooking, place 1 tablespoon of unsalted butter in nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook until butter has melted. Stir frequently until butter is golden brown. Place skillet over low heat. Stir until butter is melted completely. Remove skillet from heat. Top eggs with butter to serve. Serve with smoked mozzarella cheese.

Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan. Cook on medium heat until mixture boils and begins to thicken. Cover and let steep for 10 minutes. Strain. Pour into a pitcher. Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight. Serve cold.

Make a batter of eggs, orange juice concentrate, water, flour. Coat wings lightly with flour. Dip wings into batter. Coat wings with pecan pieces. Cook wings on a large grill or indoors on a large pan for 30-40 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Melt butter in large skillet. Add wings. Cook over medium heat until browned on all sides. Drain on paper towels again. While wings are cooking combine the catsup, brown sugar and tabasco. Drizzle mixture over cooked wings.

Combine the apples with the sugar and place in a baking dish. Combine the flour with the cheddar cheese and mix together. Cut the vanilla wafers into thin strips. Combine the orange juice with the cheese/flour mixture. Spoon the cheese mixture over the apples and drizzle the orange juice on top of the cheese mixture. Top with the vanilla wafers. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 20-25 minutes or until apples are tender. Let the dish stand for 15 minutes before serving.

In a large saucepan cook green beans with butter for 5 to 7 minutes or until tender-crisp. In small bowl, combine lemon juice and mustard. Stir in dill weed. Drizzle over cooked green beans. Sprinkle with slivered almonds and season to taste with salt and pepper.

In a medium bowl combine egg yolks, lemon juice, zest, garlic, rosemary, salt & pepper. Whisk together until smooth. Slowly add in olive oil while whisking constantly. Slowly whisk in mustard & tabasco. Adjust seasonings as needed. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Remove garlic from head. Peel cloves of garlic. Place garlic in roasting pan. Drizzle with olive oil. Roast garlic for about 15 minutes. Remove garlic from oven and set aside. Slice zucchini lengthwise. Remove seeds. Place zucchini slices in roasting pan. Drizzle with olive oil. Place roasting pan in oven. Roast zucchini for 15 minutes or until soft. Remove zucchini from oven. Place garlic slices on cutting board. Crush garlic with side of knife. Stir in vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Add zucchini to mixture. Stir in green onions. Place in serving bowl. Serve with fresh cilantro.
Saute bacon and ham cubes. Remove bacon and ham. Saute onions and bell peppers. Add grits and saute until thickened. Add tomatoes and seasoning. Add bacon and ham. Serve.

In a large pot melt butter. Add onion and celery to pot. Sauté for 2 minutes. Stir in flour and salt. Cook for 1 minute. Add milk. Bring to boil. Stir in cheese. Cook for 10 minutes or until thick. Top with chives. Serve with bread.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Cook chicken until cooked through, about 25 minutes. Set aside. Add olive oil to a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add green pepper and cook until tender. Add the canned tomato and the chicken broth and cook for 10 minutes. Season the rice with salt. In a large bowl, combine the cooked rice with the seasoned chicken, tomato sauce and the bay leaf. Pour the rice mixture into a 3-quart baking dish. Bake the rice for 15 to 20 minutes, or until heated through. Let the rice stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with your favorite side dishes.

Rinse pork under cold waterpat dry. Place in large resealable bag. Add canola oilseason with salt and pepper. Close bagshake until meat is coated. In 4 qt. slow cooker, combine onion and garlic. Add pork to slow cookerdiscard marinade. Add poultry seasoning and white wine to onions and garlic. Pour in pork broth and sweet potatoes. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 9 hours or on high for 4 to 5 hours until meat is tender. Remove pork from slow cooker. Shred meatdiscard bones. Serve over hot rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease or line 12 muffin cups with paper liners. In a large bowl, combine flour, ginger, salt, baking soda, brown sugar, pumpkin and molasses until well blendedmix in egg until smooth. Fold in pecans. Bake 20 minutes or until done.
Mix all the ingredients in a large bowl. Pour mixture into a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Serve.

Preheat oven broiler. Cook sausage and green onions in skillet over medium heat. Sautee until sausage is cooked through and green onions are tender. Meanwhile, beat eggs in large bowl with mustard, salt & pepper. Blend in melted butter and stir in cream cheese. Increase heat under sausage mixture and cook 30 seconds or just until sausage is lightly browned and vegetables are crisp tender. Spoon sausage mixture into 1 1/2 inch wells in 2 (10 inch) cast iron skillets. Pour egg mixture over sausage mixture in skillets, dividing evenly. Top each with 1/4 cup cheese. Bake in preheated 400 degree oven about 15 minutes or just until egg is set and cheese is melted. Sprinkle with thyme. Serve immediately with hot biscuits or fresh bread.

Bring 6 cups salted water to boil in large pot. Add green beansboil 3 minutes. Drain in colander. Return beans to potadd parmesan cheese. Stir in fettuccinecook 8-10 minutes or until pasta is done. Drainkeep warm. Stir in half-and-half. Serve with Canadian bacon. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Cook ground beef over medium heat until brown. Drain off fat. Add all of the seasonings to the ground beef and cook over low heat until the seasonings are well blended with the ground beef. Cook the green beans until tender crisp. Drain the green beans and add the corn. Place all of the vegetables in a casserole dish or 9 x 13 pan. Pour the condensed tomato soup over the vegetables. Top with the ground beef mixture. Pour the steak sauce over the top of the casserole. Cover with the potatoes. Bake at 350 degrees until the potatoes are tender and the casserole begins to brown, about 25 to 30 minutes.

Grate squash and zucchini. Mix with carrot and onion. Add eggs and salt and pepper. Mix well. Stir in matzo meal. Place about 2 tbsp of filling into the center of each matzo cracker. Fold dough over filling. Press down firmly and flatten slightly. Drop into hot oil. Cook until golden. Drain on paper towels. Serve.

Wash potatoes well and pat dry with paper towel. Cook potatoes as directed on package. While potatoes are cooking, grate 2/3 of the cheese, add butter to grated cheese and mix well with your hands until butter is incorporated throughout. Remove potato from heat and allow to cool for 30 minutes. When cool enough to handle, cut potato into 1/2-inch cubes. Add potato to cheese mixture (which will have melted butter added to it) with parsley, chives and garlic clove (minced). Mix well with your hands. Add 1 cup of cream cheese (not fat free) to mixture with your hands, mixing until completely incorporated. Taste mixture for seasoning with salt and pepper or seasonings of your choice (for example, rosemary or thyme). Serve immediately with your favorite meat or poultry dish, or serve as side dish for vegetables or fish.

In a large saucepan, cover sweet potatoes with water. Boil until tender. Drain. Remove the skins from the sweet potatoes and arrange them in a greased 2 quart baking dish. Process the brown sugar and butter in a blender until smooth. Spoon the peanut butter and brown sugar mixture over the sweet potatoes. Sprinkle with cinnamon and top with chopped pecans. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Cream cheese and onion mixed together and shaped into a ball. Shaped ball put in a glass dish and chilled in refrigerator. Next add bell peppers chopped and mixed with cream cheese. After peppers have been mixed in put in pineapple and pecans. Cover with whipped cream cheese. Put in refrigerator and chilled for 12 hours. This ball is best if you have it 3 to 4 hours before serving.
Saute celery and mushrooms in butter until tender. Stir in barley, broth and garlic until thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Mix flour and salt together. Mix the remaining ingredients together with the flour and salt. Add enough milk to make a soft dough. Turn out onto floured board and knead until smooth. Roll out to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut into circles and place on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 425 degrees F for 10-12 minutes. Remove from the oven and brush with a mixture of oil and beaten eggs. Bake 3-4 minutes longer.

Slice the tomatoes in half. Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add the half-tomatoes and cook for 3 minutes. Drain the tomatoes well and pat dry. Slice the onion in half. Pound the onion in a mortar or with a pestle until it is finely minced. Slice the parsley in half. Cut the parsley stems from the leaves. Roughly chop the leaves. Add the parsley to the pounded onion. Add the paprika to the parsley mixture. Add the extra-virgin olive oil to the parsley mixture. Add the juice of 1 large lemon to the parsley mixture. Add salt to the parsley mixture. Add the pepper to the parsley mixture. Add the drained tomatoes to the parsley mixture. Stir the parsley mixture well. Pour the sauce into a bowl. Let the sauce stand for 4 hours. Stir well before serving. Enjoy.

In a medium saucepan combine all the ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low simmer until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Transfer to a small bowl. Add toasted pistachio nuts. Serve.

Preheat oven to 425F degrees. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray and lay parsnip slices side by side on pan until they are all placed in a single layer. Drizzle parsnip slices with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place pan in oven and roast for 15-25 minutes or until tender and lightly browned. Remove from oven and add rosemary leaves and onion slices. Toss all with balsamic vinegar and brown sugar and then add a splash of olive oil. Continue tossing until all parsnip slices are lightly coated with the balsamic glaze and brown sugar mixture.

In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine the rice and water. Simmer for 8-10 minutes or until the rice is tender. In a large bowl, beat the pudding mix and milk until thick. Stir in the rice and raisins and mix well. Let stand until slightly thickened. Serve warm.

Add beef to the slow cooker. Add the onion and butter to the slow cooker. Cook on low for 3 4 hours. Add the ketchup and soy sauce. Cook on low for another 2 3 hours. Add the apple cider vinegar and brown sugar. Cook on low for another 2 3 hours. Add the egg noodles. Cook on low until the noodles are done. Serve with steamed broccoli.
Blend ice with all ingredients until smooth in a blender or food processor. Serve in a glass over crushed ice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine soup and sour cream. Place chicken on rack in roasting pan. Baste with mixture. Sprinkle with garlic powder and pepper. Top each chicken breast with half of the cheese. Place in oven and bake for about an hour or until chicken is cooked. Transfer chicken to platter. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese and broil until the cheese melts.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Cook pork chops in hot oil until browned on all sides. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with cornstarch. Place pork in a shallow dish. Combine rice wine, ginger, eggs, panko bread crumbs, and tonkatsu sauce. Stir until combined. Coat chops with sauce. Arrange in a single layer in a lightly greased 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until brown. Serve hot with rice.
In a large bowl combine shredded chicken, mushrooms (cooked or raw), greens and dressing. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Combine all the dry ingredients, then mix all the liquids together and add to the flour mixture. Fold in the cherries. Pour into a greased and floured loaf pan and bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 60 to 75 minutes. Let cool slightly before removing from the pan and slicing. Enjoy!

Heat the grill to medium-high. Meanwhile, put the tomato sauce and brown sugar in a large bowl and mix well. Add the chicken wings and toss to coat evenly. Grill the wings, turning every 3 to 5 minutes, until the wings are browned and tender, about 40 to 50 minutes total.

Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg. Sift flours and bicarbonate of soda into a large bowl and rub in the butter. Add the egg and beat well. Turn mixture onto a lightly floured surface and roll out to 5mm thickness. Place over a 23cm fluted tart tin and prick the base with a fork. Line with baking paper and fill with baking weights. Blind bake for 15 minutes. Remove baking weights and paper and bake for a further 8-10 minutes or until golden and firm. Brush with melted butter and bake for a further 5 minutes or until golden. Cool completely.

In a large saucepan, combine corn, cream style corn, eggs, sugar, flour and milk. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and cook about 5 minutes or until pudding is thickened. Add salt, pepper, and butter. Serve warm.

Soak edamame in water for 24 hours. Drain and rinse in cold water. Drain again. Blanch edamame in boiling water for 45 seconds. Drain and rinse in cold water. Drain again. Heat oil in a wok or large pan over medium heat. Add ginger and garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add edamame and sesame seeds and toss to coat. Cook for 1 minute. Serve with sesame seeds on top.
Brown hamburger and refried beans together. Add avocado and salsa. Mix well. Add Velveeta cheese. Add garlic powder to taste.

Lay out a wonton wrapper on a flat surface. Spread a thin layer of goat cheese on top. Place a chicken breast on top of the goat cheese. Top with a sliced tomato. Roll up the wonton wrapper around the filling. Repeat with all the wontons. Place the wontons on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Brush the wontons with olive oil. Bake for 15-20 minutes until crispy.
Mix all ingredients together and serve with crackers.

Heat 1 tbsp of olive oil in pan. Saute onion for 5 min. Add bell pepper and saute for another 5 min. Add garlic to mixture and saute for another 2 min. Add diced tomatoes, chicken broth, dried basil and dried oregano. Reduce heat to low-medium and cook 15 min. Add fish to mixture and cook for 15 min. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with black pepper to taste. Serve over rice if desired.

Mix butter and seasonings together. Spread evenly over a 13x9 pan. Sprinkle cereal evenly over top. Microwave uncovered for 6 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Sprinkle cheese over top. Microwave uncovered for another 6 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Stir cheese. Microwave uncovered for another 6 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Stir again and serve.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add soybeans and cook for about 10 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water. Prepare the other ingredients as directed on the package. Pour the soybeans and the cream-style corn into a large baking dish. Top with the cheese and seasonings. Combine the breadcrumbs and paprika. Sprinkle on the top. Bake at 350f for 35 minutes.
Whisk pan juices together with fat. Gradually mix in flour. Add stock. Bring to boil. Boil 1 to 2 minutes. Serve.
In a large bowl combine cooked rice with vegetables. Stir in soy sauce to taste. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread pie filling in bottom of a 9 x 13 inch pan. Pour cake mix into a large bowl. Add eggs, milk and almond extract. Stir with a wire whisk. Pour cake batter into pan. Drop chocolate chips over the filling. Bake for about 30 minutes. Allow cake to cool before frosting. Frost with a store bought icing or make your own. Frost over cake. Sprinkle with chopped almonds. Makes 12 servings.

Mix oil and garlic in large skillet over medium heatcook and stir until garlic is tender. Add chickencook 6 to 8 minutes or until chicken is done. Add ricecook and stir 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and salsacook and stir until liquid is absorbed, about 2 minutes more. Top with cheesecook and stir until cheese is melted. Serve with lettuce and tomato slices. Serves 6.

Place uncooked rice in a large pan. Cover with cold water and boil until all the water is absorbed. Combine all remaining ingredients and mix well. Pour over rice. Bake at 375 degrees for 25 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serves 4.
Cook macaroni in boiling salt water until tender. Drain. Add cottage cheese, sour cream, eggs, and season salt. Mix well. Add shredded cheese. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes.

Add chicken stock and 3 cups water to a saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add butter to a large soup pot. When butter is melted add rice and stir for about 2 minutes. Add 4 cups of stock and cook for 15 minutes. Add olive oil to the risotto and stir. Add 2 cups of broth and cook for 10 minutes. Add remaining broth and cook for another 10 minutes. Add shrimp to the soup pot and cook for 5 minutes. Add remaining broth and cook for another 10 minutes. Add lemon peel and cook for another 5 minutes. Add lemon juice and zest to the soup pot and stir. Remove from heat and add Parmesan cheese and stir.

Preheat oven to 325f. Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 4 minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Place orange in a large bowl. Pour syrup over orange and marinate overnight in refrigerator. Transfer orange segments to a large pitcher and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve chilled with ice cream.

Sprinkle pork with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add pork and brown on both sides. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with caraway seeds. Return pan to heatadd remaining 1 tablespoon of oil. Add onions. Cook and stir until tender. Stir in sauerkraut. Pour in 1 cup sour cream. Return pork to pan. Cover pancook on medium-low heat 5 minutes. Uncoveradd remaining 1 cup of sour cream. Simmer on low heat 10 minutes longer.

Brown chicken breasts on both sides. Season with salt & pepper, then set aside. Preheat oven to 350f. To make the sauce, whisk together egg yolks, water, lemon juice, mustard & salt & pepper. Gradually whisk in melted butter until well incorporated. Whisk egg whites until stiff peaks form, then fold into yolk mixture. Cook asparagus until crisp-tender & set aside. Spoon sauce into serving dish & top with asparagus & chicken.
Mix pudding mix and milk together in small bowl and microwave until set. Add pumpkin and mix well. Fold in pumpkin pie spice and raisins. Spoon into dessert cups and refrigerate 2 hours.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Add flour and salt and beat until combined. Add bourbon. Add pecans and chocolate chips. Divide into two crusts. Place one on bottom of the pan. Fill with filling. Place second crust on top. Fold edges under. Cut a hole in the center and brush with milk. Bake for 30 minutes.

Mix all ingredients in large pot. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Simmer 5-10 minutes. Remove from heat. Strain through fine mesh strainer. Allow to cool. Add 1 1/2 cups vodka. Pour into clean bottles or jars. Use immediately or keep refrigerated. Will keep about 3 weeks.

In a medium-sized pan bring 2 cups of water and 1 tablespoon olive oil to a boil. Add salt and pepper to taste. Reduce heat to low. Add rice and stir well to coat. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Remove cover and cook an additional 10 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Stir in the mushrooms. Cook an additional 5 minutes. Add the onions and butter and cook until onions are tender and rice is tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a garnish of fresh parsley if desired.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 9 x 13 pan. In a large bowl cream butter and sugars. Beat in the eggs. Add the peanut butter and mix well. Add the flour, baking soda and oats. Add the chocolate chips. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes. Let cool completely. Cut into squares. Store in an airtight container.

Melt butter in heavy pan over med-hi heat. Add brown sugar and whisk constantly until dissolved. Add maple syrup and whisk until well blended. Add bananas and stir until bananas are softened. Add rum extract. Remove from heat and pour into a small bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let cool to room temp. Pour into a blender container and add whipping cream. Blend on high until well mixed and creamy. Pour into a bowl, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until well chilled, 30 - 60 minutes. Serve over ice cream or pound cake or cereal as desired.

Cook burgers in skillet over medium heat until brown and heated through. Top rye bread with 1 slice of cheese, cooked burger and another slice of cheese. Place in skillet over low heat until cheese is melted. Place sandwich in skillet over medium heat until cheese is melted and bread is warm. Top with thinly sliced onion. Serve with vegetable broth for dipping.

Slice the bread sticks in half diagonally. Place the bread sticks into a shallow pan and coat with the cinnamon and sugar mixture. Toast the bread sticks for a few minutes until lightly browned. Serve warm with honey or butter and jam for dipping.

In medium size pot brown chicken breast on all sides. Pour off any grease from pot and discard grease. In the same pot add cream of chicken soup water and seasoning (salt and pepper). Stir until combined. Add chicken breast and cook on low heat until heated through and chicken is tender about 10 minutes. In small bowl add sour cream and mix with cayenne pepper and paprika until blended. Serve over english muffins with creamed chicken mixture.

Place pork chops in flour mixture. Shake off excess. Heat butter and oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add pork chops. Sear for 2 minutes. Turn pork chops. Cook until done, about 5-7 minutes. Remove pork chops. Pour off all but 1 tablespoon drippings from skillet. Add onions. Cook until tender. Stir in mushrooms. Cook until tender. Add wine. Cook until wine is almost evaporated. Add milk. Bring to a boil. Stir in thyme. Cook until gravy is thick. Return pork chops to skillet. Top with Parmesan cheese.

Preheat olive oil to about 350 degrees. Crack eggs into a small bowl. In the bowl, mix olive oil with a dash of cumin. Place eggs one at a time into the hot oil. Cook about 3 minutes or until the eggs are cooked through. Drain on paper towels. Serve at once.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a small saucepan. Saute garlic until lightly browned. Add liquid honey and cornstarch. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly for 2 minutes. Add water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened. Serve hot. This will keep refrigerated for several days.

Bring 1 1/2 cups quinoa and 1 1/2 cups water to a boil in a small saucepan. Reduce heat to low and simmer until liquid is absorbed and quinoa is fluffy, about 10 minutes. Cool slightly. In a blender or food processor, combine 1/2 cup quinoa and 1/2 cup soymilk. Process until smooth and creamy. Stir in remaining quinoa and soymilk until thoroughly combined. Add apples and spices and process until smooth and creamy. Serve warm or chilled.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. In an ungreased 13 by 9-inch baking dish, layer biscuits with brown sugar mixture, pecans, cinnamon and butter until all biscuits are used up. Pour enough water into large shallow baking pan to come halfway up sides of dish of biscuits. Bake for 35-45 minutes or until golden brown on top. Let cool for 15 minutes before serving with butter.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add green beans to the boiling water and cook for about two minutes. Transfer green beans to a bowl of ice cold water. Drain. Combine shallot, red wine vinegar, and a pinch of each of the salt and the pepper. Whisk together to combine. Add the olive oil. Toss the beans with the dressing and the cherry tomatoes. Add the fresh basil leaves. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Peel apples and cut into wedges. Place apples and sugar into a 9×11 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cinnamon and flour. Pour the egg and butter over the apples and bake for about 40 minutes until browned. Serve with vanilla ice-cream if desired.

Sauté the chopped cauliflower with olive oil for 10 minutes. Add milk and simmer. Add curry powder to taste. Mix cheddar cheese with mayo and add to cauliflower mixture. Sprinkle with cracker crumbs. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Coat portabella mushroom caps with flour. Heat butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add flour-coated mushroomsseason with salt and pepper. Cook mushrooms for 4 minutes. Add red peppersreduce heat to low. Cook 4 minutes longer. Transfer mushrooms to shallow baking dish. Fill each mushroom with 2 tablespoons crabmeat. Bake mushrooms for 20 minutes. Spread mayonnaise evenly onto one side of each mushroom. Sprinkle with fine dry breadcrumbs. Place mushrooms in shallow baking dishbroil 3 minutes. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

Slice peaches and place on bottom of 9x13 casserole dish. In a saucepan add butter and vanilla bean. Pour in white wine. Bring to boil and cook until reduced and thick. Remove vanilla bean. Pour over peaches and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until tender. Serve with ice cream.

In a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat combine corn syrup and sugar. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes until mixture just begins to bubble. Remove from heat and add peanut butter. Stir to combine and pour over rice krispies. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and refrigerate for 30 minutes until chips are melted and mixture is set. Lift out of pan using a fork. Transfer to wax paper. Cut into squares and serve. Store leftover treats in an air-tight container for up to 3 days.
Boil potatoes in water until tender. Drain. Mash potatoes. Add lard. Mix well. Add salt. Mix well. Serve with onion on top. Serve warm.
Blend watermelon cubes with tequila, orange liqueur, lime juice, sugar and ice cubes in a blender until smooth. Pour into glasses. Garnish with lime wedge and orange slice.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add yellow onion, garbanzo beans, red pepper, red wine vinegar. Cook until onion is translucent. Add white wine vinegar, dried thyme, salt. Cover. Cook 10 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl. Add red pepper, raisins, white wine vinegar. Gently toss. Serve warm. Makes 6 servings.

Place sugar in a small bowl. Add cinnamon. Mix well. Place 1/2 cup of the sugar-cinnamon mixture in a small bowl. Dip each marshmallow half into the mixture. Place the marshmallows onto the crescent rolls. Roll up the rolls around the marshmallows. Place seam side down on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately.

Put the currants into a bowl with the lemon juice. Leave for 20 minutes. Sift the flour into a bowl, add the mixed spice, the wine and the oil. Make a well in the centre of the flour. Pour in the currants. Mix to form a soft dough. Make small round balls of the mixture. Put them on a greased baking sheet. Leave them to rise for half an hour. Preheat the oven to 180c. Put the lard into a saucepan. Put the pan in the oven to melt the lard. Meanwhile, bake the dumplings for 15 minutes. Brush each round ball of the mixture with the lard. Cook the buns for another 15 minutes until they are golden brown. Serve warm.

Heat oil in large heavy-bottom pot over medium heat. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Add remaining ingredients and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Taste and adjust seasonings. Pour into large bowl or individual plates and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a small bowl, combine lemon juice and olive oil. Mix to combine. Add oregano and black pepper and whisk until combined. Add sole fillets to a shallow dish and top with carrots. Drizzle with the lemon juice mixture. Place in refrigerator and marinate for 15 minutes. Preheat a grill pan over medium heat. Grease the pan with olive oil. Drain the sole from the marinade and pat dry. Place fillets on the pan and cook for 5 to 7 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate. Meanwhile, cut the bread into thin slices. Lay the bread slices flat on a work surface and spread with about 1/3 cup of the marinating sauce. Spread each fillet with the marinating sauce and arrange on the bread. Top with carrots. Roll the bread and fillets up. Bring a large pot filled with water to a boil. Cook the rolls in the boiling water until they float to the surface. Remove and drain on a paper towel.

In large skillet cook onion, garlic and carrot with oil for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir broccoli into onion mixture. Cook broccoli for 5 minutes or until tender. Add tomato with its juices and cook 2 minutes more. Stir broccoli mixture and chicken into pasta shells. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Mix to coat. Cook over medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve with salad.

Chop cabbage finely. Heat vegetable oil in a pan. Add cabbage and stir-fry until slightly soft. Add soy sauce, sugar and vinegar. Stir until the sugar has dissolved. Transfer to a serving dish and sprinkle fried noodles. Enjoy.

In a large pot over medium heat, bring the buttermilk to a boil. Stir in the potatoes until completely coated. Reduce the heat to maintain a steady simmer (no more than a gentle bubbling). Cover the pot. Cook until the potatoes are very tender when pierced with a fork. Remove the pot from the heat, drain the potatoes, then return them to the pot to keep them warm while you make the mash. Using a potato masher, a hand mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment, mash the potatoes until they are completely smooth. Add the chipotle and salt, then continue to mash until smooth. Add the black pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Mix flour, baking powder. Cream margarine. Add eggs. Gradually add dry ingredients. Mix well. Fold in preserves. Roll dough to 1/4-inch thickness on lightly floured surface. Cut with floured round cutter (about 3 to 3 1/2 inches). Place 1/4-inch apart on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 to 18 minutes. Remove to wire rack. Cool.

Prepare vegetables as shown in the picture. Pour dressing over vegetables and toss gently. Place lettuce on large platter. Arrange vegetables in decorative design on lettuce. Sprinkle with peanut butter. Serve immediately.

In a bowl mix ricotta cheese, parmesan cheese, and pesto sauceseason with salt and pepper to taste. Place chicken breasts in a deep dish baking dish and pour pesto mixture on top of chicken. Pour soup and wine on top of ricotta mixtureseason with salt and pepper to taste. Cover dish and refrigerate for 4-6 hours or overnight. Pre-heat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. Bake stuffed chicken breasts for about an hour. Garnish with fresh basil leaves.

Marinate chicken wings in the louisiana hot sauce and vinegar for at least an hour or overnight for a super flavorful treat. Remove wings from marinade and dry well. Heat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Place wings in shallow baking dish and pour about half of the ranch mix over wings and toss to coat. Bake for about 25 minutes or until the wings are golden brown and crispy and the sauce is bubbling hot. Serve with celery sticks and ranch dip for dipping.

Carefully shell and slice eggs into halves. Scoop out yolks and place in small bowl. Add remaining ingredients and stir well with fork or wire whisk until combined. Spoon into egg whites and garnish with paprika if desired. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat add the apples and water. Cook until tender. Add raisins. Add sugar and stir to dissolve. When apples are tender, add butter and red cinnamon candies. Stir until melted. Spoon into a 9 by 13 inch baking pan. Bake 20-30 minutes untill brown. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan over medium heat melt the butter. Add the scallions and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the vodka and half-and-half and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and basil and season with garlic powder. Bring the mixture back to a simmer. Add the pasta and cook according to directions. When the pasta is done add the cheese and cook until melted. Serve immediately.

Bring 1 cup of water and 1/4 cup of beef broth to a boil. Add 1 cup of long grain white rice and 1/4 cup of orzo. Stir to combine and then reduce to a simmer for about 20 minutes. Stir in 1/4 cup of low sodium beef broth and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add remaining 1/4 cup beef broth and 2 teaspoons of butter. Stir to combine and season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with dried onion flakes and Romano cheese.
Blend 2 cups of cold water with raspberries and sugar. Stir. Pour into ice trays. Freeze. Add wine. Stir and serve.

Heat oven to 190C/170C Fan/Gas 5. Slice puff pastry into 8 rectangles. Place in a roasting tin and cover with baking parchment. Add 2 tbsp pizza sauce to each rectangle and spread evenly. Add ham and cheese and spread over sauce. Cut each rectangle into four triangles. Bake for 15 minutes until puffed up and golden. Serve hot.

Melt unsalted butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in vanilla wafer cookies. Remove from heat. Cool slightly. Stir in almonds. Press mixture into bottom of an ungreased 13x9-inch baking pan. Refrigerate for 15 minutes. Roll out remaining cookie mixture into a ball. Form into a disk about 1/16 inch thick. Cut into 1-inch strips and arrange in a lattice pattern over crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Refrigerate until serving time. To serve, garnish with powdered sugar or chocolate syrup. This recipe is from the cookbook "Vanilla Wafer Cookies" by Kraft.

Boil potatoes in lightly salted water until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain potatoes and return to pot to keep warm until ready to mash. Peel and mash potatoes with a potato masher or ricer. Add milk and garlic. Mash until smooth. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving if desired. Yields 6 servings.

Rinse the chicken and pat dry. Place the chicken breasts on a wire rack set in a shallow pan. Put the mayonnaise, apple cider vinegar and lemon juice in a large bowl. Mix together and pour over the chicken. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 12 hours. Remove and place on a serving plate and enjoy.

Cook bacon in skillet until brownremove with slotted spoon to paper towels to drain. Set aside. In medium bowl mix mayonnaise with milk and add egg yolksstir with fork until well blendedadd cornstarch and stir until cornstarch is dissolved. Add cooked bacon and cheese to yolks and blend wellpour into unbaked pie shell and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until firm in center. Let stand 5 minutes before serving with green onions and sliced tomato.

Cut submarine sandwich bread lengthwise to make 6 rectangles. Spread 1 rectangle with mayonnaise. Fill each rectangle with turkey and stuffing. Add a slice of cranberry sauce. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover with remaining bread. Serve.

Combine banana peppers and salt and cook for about 2 minutes. Drain and set aside. Combine vinegar, water and sugar and cook to boiling. Remove from heat and add peppers and cook 1 minute more. Combine flour and dry mustard and add to mixture. Cook for 1 minute and then add yellow mustard. Cook 2 minutes more and pour into a jar or glass container.

Peel and quarter the potatoes and boil until tender in salted water. Drain the potatoes and mash them well with butter until they are smooth. In a medium frying pan over medium heat, melt the butter and add the sour cream. Add the onion and garlic and cook until the onion is tender. Mix together the dry mustard and the sour cream and add to the potatoes in the frying pan. Cook until the potatoes are heated through and the mixture is well blended. Season with the salt and pepper and the dry mustard and stir until everything is blended together well. Serve the potatoes topped with the pork chops or as a side dish.

Remove shell from eggs and slice eggs horizontally. Put yolks into bowl and mash with fork or wire whisk until smooth and creamy. Add sour cream and mix well with a fork until blended and smooth. Add shrimp and stir gently until shrimp is coated with yolk mixture. Add lemon juice and caraway seed and mix well. Fill eggs with shrimp and yolk mixture and top with sliced shrimp. Sprinkle with dill and serve.

In a large saucepan over high heat, combine the green beans and water to cover by 1 inch. Bring to a boilreduce heat to a simmer and cook until the beans are tender but still bright green, about 8 minutes for frozen and 5 minutes for fresh. Drain and pat dry. Put the green beans in a large bowl and toss with the butter, 1/2 tsp oregano leaves and the 2 minced garlic cloves. Add the crushed red pepper flakes and 1/2 tsp each of the salt and black pepper and toss to coat the beans with the seasonings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Combine olive oil flavored cooking spray, mushrooms, and onionmicrowave 4 minutes. Stir spinach and bread into mushroom mixturespread into prepared casserole dish. Sprinkle with cajun seasoning and ground turmericmicrowave 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve with French bread and salad if desired.

Melt brown sugar, corn syrup, salt and corn flakes in a pan over low heat for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Pour into a pan and spread in an even layer. Cool. Melt chocolate chips in a microwaveable bowl. Stir in peanut butter. Spread mixture over the corn flake layer. Sprinkle on the chopped peanuts. Place in refrigerator for an hour to set. Cut into bars.

Cut yellow pear tomatoes into slices. Heat the lemon juice to boiling. Add sugar and ginger root. Boil to a thick syrup. Add tomato slices. Return to a boil. Stir occasionally. Pack into sterilized jars. Process for 5 minutes.

Slice asparagus spears lengthwise into 1/2 inch thick slices. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute asparagus in oil for about 5 minutes or until asparagus is tender-crisp. Add cremini mushroomssaute for about 10 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Meanwhile, place chicken breasts between plastic wrappound breasts with meat mallet or rolling pin until chicken is about 1/2 inch thick. Sprinkle with seasoned salt. Place chicken in a large skillet over medium heatcook for about 10 minutes on each side or until chicken is no longer pink in center. Slice chicken into strips. Place asparagus on a plate or in a serving bowltop with mushrooms, chicken strips, and remaining asparagus. Sprinkle with chives.

Dice steaks into 2-inch cubes. Brown with salt and pepper. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Drain fat. Stir together flour and salt. Add to mushroom mixture. Cook for 2 minutes. Add butter. Add consomme, vinegar, sour cream. Heat through. Serve with rice.

In a food processor or blender combine flour and salt and pulse several times. With the processor running add yogurt and water and process until the dough forms a ball and then breaks apart. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead a few times until smooth and elastic (about 5 minutes). Place in a lightly greased bowl and refrigerate until firm (1 hour). Roll out dough on a well floured surface to the size of a large pizza crust and then cut into pie shape.

Preheat oven to 375 F. Place chicken in a shallow baking dish. Pour margarine over chicken. Sprinkle with Bisquick. Add Italian seasoning and blend. Bake 25-30 minutes. Flip chicken over and bake 20 more minutes. Bake 5 more minutes until juices run clear. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and broil for 2 minutes.

Coat steamer insert of steamer basket with cooking spray and place over 4-5 cups of boiling water in a saucepan. Add cabbage and onioncover and steam until cabbage is tender-crisp and onion is translucent and tender, about 8 minutes. Add haddock fillets and cook until tender and opaque throughout, about 5 minutes longer. Remove steamer insert and set aside. Mash tomatoes with a fork or back of a spoon until chunkyseason with salt and pepper. To serve, place haddock on each plate and top with tomatoes and cabbagesprinkle with cheddar cheese and serve.

Pour oil into a pan and heat over medium heat. Add garlic, bay leaves and chillies and cook for about 1 minute. Add prawns and stir for 2 minutes. Add the salt and pepper and cook for another 1 minute. Transfer prawns and their juices to a platter. Sprinkle the cooking oil on the prawns.
Cut potatoes in half. Put in a microwave safe dish. Dot the potatoes with butter. Sprinkle with salt & pepper. Microwave for 8 minutes. Let stand for 2 minutes before serving.

Slice the portabella mushroom caps in half and clean the stem of the mushroom. Heat the olive oil in a pan with the garlic and onion and cook until softened, about 10 minutes. Remove garlic and onion from pan and set aside for garnish. Add the wine to the pan and cook for about one minute. Remove the pan from heat and allow it to cool slightly. When cool enough to handle, slice the mushrooms and set aside for garnish. Add the mushrooms and onion to the pan and cook until the mushroom juices evaporate, about 10 minutes. Remove from the pan and set aside for garnish. Spoon some of the mushroom mixture on top of the hamburger and place the american cheese on top. Put the burger on the grill and cook until desired temperature. Remove from grill and place on bun with lettuce and onion and serve with mushrooms as garnish.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Combine butter, garlic and rosemary in small bowl. Rub mixture all over chickens inside and out. Place potatoes in shallow 2 qt. baking pan. Pour white wine over potatoes. Add chickens to pan and drizzle over any remaining butter mixture. Place in oven and roast 45 minutes. Remove chickens from pan and place on serving platter. Cover and keep warm. Add potatoes to oven and roast 20 more minutes or until tender. Increase oven temperature to 425 degrees F. Coat pan with nonstick cooking spray. Heat pan over medium-high heat. Add lemon halves to pan and cook 2 minutes. Remove pan from heat and add potatoes. Add chickens back to pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Serve chicken and potatoes with green beans.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion. Cook until the onion is soft. Add the brown rice. Cook the rice until it is tender. Add the beef consomme. Heat for 3 minutes. Add the mushrooms. Cook for another 2 minutes. Serve the consomme over rice.

Melt the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the leeks and saute until they begin to soften. Add the shallots and continue to saute for 1 minute. Add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the green onions and saute for 1 minute. Stir in the vegetable stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the soy sauce and molasses. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
Slice ham and provolone cheese. Spread mayonnaise on one side of each hamburger bun. Layer ham and provolone cheese on each hamburger bun. Top with lettuce and tomatoes.

Blend together silken tofu, cream cheese, milk and pumpkin until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Add brown sugar, spice and granola cereal. Stir until well combined. Refrigerate for 4 hours. Serve in parfait glasses.

Cook the sirloin meat in a skillet with the oil. Add the chopped onions and cook for 2 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the vegetables and cook until the vegetables are tender. Remove the meat and vegetables from the skillet. Pour the remaining oil into the skillet. Add the noodles and cook until tender. Remove from heat. Add the meat and vegetables back to the noodles. Mix in the sesame oil, soy sauce and vinegar. Stir in the green onions and sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Serve the noodles warm.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions and drainreserve 2 cups of pasta cooking liquid and return pasta to pot with liquid. Toss together pasta and reserved liquidlet stand 30 minutes to blend flavors. Meanwhile, prepare spaghetti sauce according to package directions using spaghetti sauce and reserved cooking liquid in place of tomato juice. Drain sauce and blend with pasta and liquidadd salad dressing mix and stir to blend. Cook and stir until sauce begins to thicken. Stir cheese into saucelet stand until cheese melts. Pour into lightly greased 2-quart casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Top with mozzarella cheeselet stand until cheese melts. Bake at 375 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes or until sauce is bubbly and cheese is melted.

Place eggs in a pot with cold water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cover with a lid. Cook eggs 8 minutes for soft-boiled. Drain in ice water. Peel the eggs. Place eggs in a large bowl. Slice eggs in half lengthwise. Scoop out the yolks. Place yolks in a separate large bowl. Add mayonnaise. Blend thoroughly. Add mustard, cider vinegar and dill. Blend. Add paprika and onion powder. Fill the whites with the yolk mixture. Place yolks in a small bowl. Add paprika and cayenne. Blend thoroughly. Place yolks into a pastry bag fitted with a small round tip. Fill the whites with yolk mixture. Garnish with paprika.

Soak the chickpeas overnight. Drain and rinse. Drain again. Place them in the crock of a food processor or blender with 1 cup of water. Add garlic cloves and lemon juice. Puree for 15 seconds. Add oil and season with salt and pepper. Puree for 30 seconds. Add the ancho pepper flakes and hot sauce. Puree for 10 seconds. Add cumin and sesame seeds. Puree for 30 seconds. Serve with pita chips.

Preheat oven to 450f. Combine the rye and white flour. Sift salt over the mixture. Add the milk and stir. Mix the egg and the butter into the mixture. Drop the mixture by heaping teaspoons into the muffin tins. Bake at 450f for 15 minutes.

Sprinkle salt and pepper on both sides of the boneless skinless chicken breasts and coat with olive oil and lime juice. Heat a nonstick frying pan on medium-high heat and add the chicken breasts to the pan. Cook on each side for 6-8 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.

Heat 2 tbsp of oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add the beefcook until well browned on all sides. Add the onion and garlicsaute until the onion is tender. Stir in the mushroomscook for 5 minutes. Add the carrotcook for 5 minutes more or until the carrot is tender. Stir in the rice pilaf mix. Pour the orange juice into the skillet and bring to a boil. Reduce the heatsimmer for 15 minutes or until the rice is tender. Stir in the beef brothcook for 3 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Serve with steamed green beans.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add flour and stir with a whisk until smooth. Stir in chicken broth. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook about 3 minutes until thickened. Add chicken and peas and carrots. Cook 5 minutes. Add onions and cook until onions are tender. Stir in biscuit dough and salt. Pour into greased 1 quart casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 50 minutes until biscuits are lightly browned.
Dip fillets first in flour, then in egg. Dip into the batter (and fry in oil) when it is ready. Serve hot with tartar sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl with a handle, mix flour, applesauce, bananas, sugar and egg whites. Stir in baking soda and baking powder. Stir in salt. Fold in nuts (optional). Pour batter into greased 12 cup muffin pan or greased mini muffin cups. Bake in preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.

Peel and cut sweet potatoes into 1/4 inch thick wedges. Place in a baking dish and toss with butter. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg. Cover and bake at 400 degrees for 45 minutes. Meanwhile whisk together eggs, low-fat milk and brown sugar in a bowl. Remove potatoes from oven and place in large bowl. Add egg mixture and mix gently. Add walnuts and chipotle chile. Spoon mixture into muffin cups and bake for 15 minutes or until puffed and golden.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Spray a 12 cup muffin tin with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, splenda, salt and baking powder. In a large bowl, beat the egg whites and mashed banana on medium speed until foamy. Gradually beat in the skim milk. Stir in the bran. Fold into the dry mixture. Spoon into prepared cups. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes.

Melt the butter in the microwave. Beat the egg yolks and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in the baking powder and flour. Mix in the melted butter and the almond and the vanilla extract. Blend well. Use this mixture to make a ball of dough. Roll the dough out about 1/4 inch thick on wax paper. Use cookie cutters to cut out shapes. Place them on wax paper on cookie sheet. Bake in oven at 350 for 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

In a deep skillet or frying pan add oil and heat on medium heat. Cook bread on each side for 1 minute or so, or until lightly browned. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine eggs and vanilla creamer. Whisk eggs thoroughly with a fork or wire whisk and pour over bread. Allow batter to soak into bread for about 5 minutes before frying the bread once again. Fry on both sides until golden brown and crisp. Serve immediately with a drizzle of warm hazelnut coffee creamer on top and a sprinkle of powdered sugar.

Prepare a large pan with olive oil and heat. Place pork chops in pan with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for a couple of minutes on each side. Remove pork from pan. Add sauerkraut to pan and cook for a minute or two. Add tomato soup, stirring to dissolve the soup. Add pork back into pan and cover with lid or foil. Cook for about 20 minutes on low heat. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.
Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Mix flour, salt and pepper together. Dip chickens in the flour mixture. Heat oil in a fry pan. Fry chickens until golden brown. Bake in oven for 25 minutes.

Combine all spices except pecans and sugar. Beat egg whites until stiff. Add spices and beat again. Coat pecans with spice mixture. Place on baking sheet and bake at 275 for 40 minutes. Watch carefully during baking. Do not burn. Cool completely. Makes about 1 1/2 cups.
Mix together the dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients and mix until smooth. Pour batter into a greased 9x5-inch loaf pan. Bake at 375 degrees F for about 55 minutes.

Cut cabbage lengthwise into quarters and then slice into thin strips. Mix vinegars together in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Add ginger and hot peppers. Bring to a boil. Add cabbage and simmer for about 10 minutes. Drain cabbage and rinse with cold water. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Pour over cabbage and let cool. When cool add the garlic granules. Refrigerate for at least 24 hours. (Cabbage may be pickled up to several weeks. )

Melt the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic cloves. Cook until fragrant. Add the tomato sauce. Stir in the salt and pepper. Add the pesto sauce. Turn the heat to medium-low and simmer until thickened. Stir in the cream and the cream cheese. Season with the salt and pepper. Stir in the basil. Remove from the heat. Stir in the cream. Transfer to a serving bowl. Top with the parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.
Mix all ingredients together except for the water chestnuts. Place the water chestnuts in the mixture to coat. Pour mixture into a shallow serving dish. Refrigerate. Serve with pumpernickel rounds.

In a large pot, bring the water to a boil. Add the dried basil, bay leaf and dried split peas. Reduce the heat and simmer for 45 minutes to an hour or until the peas are tender. Drain and reserve the broth. Add the peas to the pot. Add the olive oil and sauté the onions for 3 minutes until translucent. Add the caramelized onions to the pot along with the pea broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until the peas are tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve the soup with grilled pita bread or crisp French bread and enjoy.

Place the chicken thighs into a shallow dish and drizzle with the soy sauce. Then add the water and stir to coat the chicken thighs evenly with the soy sauce and let stand for about 1 hour at room temperature. Drain the chicken thighs and pat them dry with paper towels. Discard the soy sauce marinade and transfer the chicken to a shallow baking dish. Mix together the garlic and onion and sprinkle over the chicken. In a small bowl, whisk together the sugar and the remaining soy sauce and drizzle over the chicken. Bake for 40 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is slightly thickened, basting the chicken several times with the sauce during cooking. Serve the chicken immediately with the remaining sauce spooned over the chicken thighs and rice or noodles on the side.

Wash potatoes and cut into bite size pieces. Put into 3 quart pot of cold water. Cover and boil until tender. Drain. In 3 quart casserole dish add potatoes, cream cheese, sour cream and chicken broth. Mix well. Add bacon and seasonings. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Top with pecans.

Slice eggplant into 1/4 inch thick slices. Brush each slice with a little of the oil. Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 25 minutes. Slice zucchini into 1/4 inch thick slices. Brush each slice with a little of the oil. Place on another greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes. Once zucchini is tender, remove from oven. Slice prosciutto into 1/4 inch slices. Brush each slice with a little of the oil. Place on another greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes. Slice pesto into 1/4 inch slices. Brush each slice with a little of the oil. Place on another greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes. Place eggplant on a cookie sheet. Arrange zucchini on top. Arrange pesto on top of zucchini. Arrange prosciutto on top of pesto. Arrange a slice of ric

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Grease and flour two 12 cup muffin tins and set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together brown sugar and molasses until well combined. In a separate bowl, whisk together brown sugar and molasses until well combined. In a medium bowl, whisk together pumpkin puree and eggs until well combined. Add pumpkin mixture to sugar mixture and mix until well combined. Fold in pecans and mix until well combined. Add in baking soda and salt and mix until well combined. Fold in flour and mix until well combined and there are no more pockets of flour left. Fill each muffin tin approximately 3/4 full (muffins will puff up after baking). Bake in preheated 375 degree oven for 25-30 minutes or until toothpick inserted into muffin comes out clean.

Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Cook pasta shells in boiling water following package directions. Drain well. Preheat broiler. In a small bowl, combine seafood salad with remaining ingredientsmix well. Spoon seafood salad mixture evenly over shells. Sprinkle with cheese. Place shells on an aluminum foil-lined baking sheet and broil until cheese is melted and lightly browned, stirring once. Serve immediately with salad on the side.

Preheat oven to 325f. In a medium bowl, combine walnuts with sugar and water. Place on a parchment lined baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Stir well. Sprinkle with cinnamon and salt. Continue baking for 10 minutes. Stir well. Cool in bowl. Place on a serving dish. Drizzle with vanilla.

Remove tough ends from asparagus stalks. Rinse well under cold running water to remove any sand that might be hiding out in the stalks. Set aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 11 x 7 x 2-inch baking dish. Cook bacon until crisp in pan over medium heatdrain on paper towels. Discard drippings in pan and wipe out pan with paper towels. Place asparagus stalks in prepared baking dish. Combine vinegars, honey and mustard in small bowl and whisk until blended. Stir in olive oil and seasoningsdrizzle over asparagus. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until asparagus is tender crisp and slightly browned in spots. Remove asparagus from oven and sprinkle with parsley leaves and bacon pieces. Serve immediately or keep warm in oven until serving time.

Combine bouillon cube, water and kitchen bouquet in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Boil for 5 minutes. Add 1 teaspoon flour. Stir in flour. Boil for 3 minutes. Season with salt. Use immediately or cool and store in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Boil onion until soft, remove from water and puree in food processor with remaining ingredients except herbs. Pour into an ovenproof dish that has been sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Cook in 350 f oven for 30 minutes. Garnish with parsley sprigs and serve with vegetable sticks.

Make instant vanilla pudding according to directions. Chill until set. Meanwhile, mix fruit cocktail with pineapple juice. Place fruit in a large glass bowl and drizzle with juice. Add marshmallows and gently toss. Fold in pudding. Top with whipped cream. Garnish with fruit.

Mix basil and garlic together into a food processor. Add the cheese and process until it is a paste. Refrigerate for 24 hours to let the flavors blend together. Serve as a dip on baked potatoes or use as a spread on crackers or toast.

Melt butter and sugar together in a small saucepan over medium heat until mixture turns light brown in color (3-4 minutes). Remove from heat and stir in egg yolks. Cool slightly. Stir in buttermilk, flour, salt and baking powder. Set aside. In a separate bowl, whisk egg whites until foamy. Gradually add sugar while still beating until egg whites are stiff but not dry. Fold egg whites into buttermilk mixture with a rubber spatula or wooden spoon. Place about one cup of waffle batter into waffle iron and cook until golden brown. Serve immediately or store leftovers in the refrigerator.
In a large crock pot, combine pork tenderloin, root beer and barbecue sauce. Cook on low for 8-10 hours. Serve on hamburger buns.

In a bowl place artichokescover with cold water. Add 3 tablespoons salt. Let stand 2-3 hours or overnight. Drain. In a large saucepan bring salad oil to the boiling point. Add artichokessimmer 10 minutes. Stir in juice from lemons and limes. Cook 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Place artichokes in an oven-proof dish. Pour over mixture. Cover. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Bring to room temperature before serving.

Bring a medium saucepan of water to a boil. Add brussels sprouts and baby carrots and cook for 5 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain. In a large skillet, heat butter over medium-high heat. Add brussels sprouts and baby carrots and sauté for 2 minutes. Add maple syrup and vinegar and cook for 1 minute or until sauce is thickened. Add pecan halves and chili powder and cook for 1 minute. Transfer to a serving dish and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place chicken breasts in lightly sprayed 9×13 baking dish and season with taco seasoning mix. Bake uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. In small saucepan, combine salsa and sour creamstir until smooth. Spoon salsa mixture over chicken and serve.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, toast fennel seed and peppercorns. Stir constantly for 1 minute. Add olives to pan. Cover and toast 1 minute. Add oil. Cover and toast 1 minute more. Stir in remaining marinade ingredients. Cover and toast 1 minute more. Uncover. Stir to coat olives. Pour into a serving bowl. Let stand 20 minutes before serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the cake mix, eggs and butter. Beat with a wooden spoon until just blended. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Let stand on the cookie sheet for 5 minutes before removing.

Cut bread into quarters. Cut avocado in half, remove pit and cut each half in half. Lay a slice of bread on a plate. Add one avocado half. Add one slice of bacon. Next add a slice of lettuce. Then add a slice of tomato. Then add one tablespoon of thousand island dressing. Then add a slice of pickle. Add a second slice of bread. Repeat with all of the remaining avocado halves. Repeat with all of the remaining bread. Cut sandwiches in half. Serve.
Place all ingredients in a bowl and mix together. Form into patties. Place on skewers and cook in a medium to hot skillet for 5 minutes on each side. Serve with a side of vegetables.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook fusilli until al dente according to package directions. Drain pasta and rinse under cold water. Add the pasta to a large bowl and toss with the tomato sauce. Add the capers and lemon peel and stir to combine. Add the albacore tuna and toss to combine. Add the fresh parsley and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Bring 1 cup of boiling water to a boil in a 2-cup (or larger) heatproof measuring cup. Pour over chamomile tea bags. Steep 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Add pomegranate juice. Stir in Splenda to taste. Add mint sprig. Serves 2.

In small saucepot boil beans with enough water to cover them. When beans have absorbed all the liquid, remove them from the heat and drain the beans in a colander to cool them. Rinse under cold running water to cool them further, then drain well. Place the beans into a bowl with the salsa ingredients and toss well with the oil and vinegar to coat them. Season with the pepper and salt. Serve cool or refrigerate for up to 2 days. You can also use frozen beans for this recipe. Just defrost them first, then proceed as directed.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. In a small pot combine quinoa and water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook covered for about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and keep warm. In a large skillet heat oil over medium high heat. Add onion and cook for about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for another minute. Add broccoli and cook for another minute. Add sun-dried tomatoes and red peppers. Cook for another minute. Add black beans and cook for another minute. Add capers and zucchini and cook for another minute. Add spinach and cook for another minute. Add quinoa and cook for another minute. Serve hot. Top with fresh herbs if desired.

Cream margarine and sugar. Beat in vanilla. Add eggs one at a time. Combine flour, baking powder and cocoa. Add to creamed mixture alternately with preserves. Drop teaspoonfuls of batter on ungreased cookie sheets. Press thumb into center of each cookie. Bake in 350 degree oven for 10 min. Let stand 2 minutes before removing from cookie sheets.
Cook pine nuts and garlic in 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Add spinach, salt and red pepper. Cook over medium heat for 1-2 minutes. Add raisins and stir. Serve immediately.

Saute mushrooms and onions until soft and transparent. Combine mushrooms and onions and season to taste with parsley and black pepper. Place crescent rolls on a lightly greased cookie sheet and cut each crescent into triangles. Place mushroom mixture on each crescent triangle and roll up to seal. Bake for approximately 20 minutes or until lightly browned on top and crisp on the bottom. Sprinkle each turnovers with parmesan cheese and sesame seeds before serving. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat grill over medium-high heat. Lightly oil steaks and season them with salt and pepper. Grill steaks for about 4-6 minutes per side for medium rare or about 7 minutes per side for medium well done. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook the onions until translucent, about 10 minutes. Add the Velveeta and continue cooking until it melts into the pan and turns golden brown, about 4 minutes more. Add sour cream and stir until well blended and creamy. Remove steaks from the grill and slice them against the grain. Serve the steak and sour cream mixture over the steak and enjoy!

Pre-heat oven to 390f. Lightly grease a 9x13 baking dish. Season chicken breasts with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Put chicken into baking pan. Pour lemon juice, rind and water into a saucepan. Add chicken stock powder. Cook mixture for 5 minutes. Pour over chicken. Cover with foil. Bake chicken for 1 hour or until done. In a saucepan combine soy sauce, brown sugar, honey, cornflour and water. Bring to boil. Stir until thickened. Pour over chicken. Sprinkle with parsley.

Saute onion and garlic in oil. Add tomatoes and cook until soft. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add wine and cook until reduced. Add tilapia fillets and cook until done. Add fresh parsley and serve over cooked white rice.

Combine the flour and salt in a medium bowl. Cut the butter into the flour until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Gradually stir in the cream and milk until the mixture forms a ball. Add the parmesan cheese and parsleystir until smooth. Cook the fettuccine in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente. Drain the fettuccine reserving 1 cup of the boiling water in which it was cooked. Return the fettuccine to the pot of boiling waterstir in the remaining 1 cup of boiling water and 1/4 cup of the butter mixture until blended well. Cook, stirring frequently until the sauce thickens. Transfer the fettuccine to a serving platterdrizzle with the remaining butter mixture. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese if desired.

Mix dry ingredients in a mixing bowl. Stir in milk and lemon juice. Add egg and stir until mixed. Turn on a lightly floured surface and knead dough until it forms a ball. Roll dough out to be about 1/4 inch thick. Cut into circles with a biscuit cutter. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes until golden brown. Makes about 12.

Heat oil in a skillet. Brown ground beef. Add onions. Cook on low until onions are tender. Add minced ginger and soy sauce. Cook until heated through. Make four patties. Shape into four patties. Sprinkle dry breadcrumbs on one side of each patty. Grill on medium heat until burgers are well done. Place one patty on each kaiser roll. Top with mayonnaise.

Mix flour with crisco until well blended. Add egg and vinegar. Pour water into the mixture a little at a time until dough is formed. Form into a circle. Dust a cookie sheet with flour. Put the circle of dough on the cookie sheet. Add a pie filling. Bring sides of dough up and over the filling. Seal the edges of the dough. Cut off any excess dough. Put in preheated 400 degree F. oven for 10-15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Crack one egg into a bowl. Add spices and whisk until well blended. Add fresh garlic and whisk until evenly distributed throughout the egg mixture. Add cheese until blended. Pour egg mixture into a non stick pan over medium heat. Cook for about 5 minutes or until the egg begins to set. Add pizza toppings over the egg mixture. Put bagels into the oven for about ten minutes or until the bagels are golden brown. Once the bagels are done, place them on a plate with the omelets on top. Serve immediately.

In a large pan over medium heat cook the oil, pancetta, onions and garlic for 5 minutes. Add the zucchini to the pan and cook for 3 minutes. Add the bread cubes to the pan and cook for 2 minutes. Add the rosemary. Transfer the zucchini mixture to a casserole or baking dish. Sprinkle the grana padano evenly over the zucchini. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F (175 C) oven for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 f. In a large bowl cream together butter and light brown sugar. Add chocolate chips and pecans. Stir in cracker crumbs. Shape into balls and place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake 10-12 minutes. Allow to cool. Enjoy.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain. Stir in half-and-half cream, butter, broccoli florets, sliced mushrooms and parsley. Toss with hot spaghetti. Sprinkle with garlic, black pepper and salt. Stir in Parmesan cheese. Serve. Makes 4 servings.

Spread the pears in a single layer on a baking sheet. Drizzle with oil and toss to coat. Bake at 400f for about 20 minutes or until pears are soft. Remove from oven and sprinkle with fig jam. Crumble goat cheese over pears. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Divide watercress and walnuts between the serving plates. Top with pears and drizzle with balsamic and lemon juices. Sprinkle with mustard.

In a large bowl dissolve yeast in warm water. In another bowl combine the flours. In a small bowl combine the eggs and the water mixture. Add the eggs to the dry ingredients and beat with an electric mixer. Add the butter and walnuts and beat. Add the chocolate and beat. Add the remaining water and beat to combine. Pour into a greased loaf pan and let rise until doubled. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes or until it no longer sounds hollow. Makes 1 loaf.

Butter a 9x13 pan and set aside. In a bowl combine graham cracker crumbs and 1 cup of the fruit filling. Press mixture into the bottom of the pan and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Melt the chocolate and butter together and spread evenly on top of the graham cracker crust. In another bowl mix together the remaining fruit filling and the remaining 1 cup of the chocolate and spread evenly on top of the graham cracker crust. Sprinkle with the coconut and walnuts and refrigerate for 30 minutes. In a bowl combine the sweetened condensed milk and white chocolate and spread evenly on top of the graham cracker crust and fruit layer. Sprinkle the remaining chocolate and coconut on top and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving. This is a great dessert to serve at a party. You can also use different fillings such as peaches and strawberries or raspberries and blueberries for a fun change of flavor. If you can't find sweetened condensed milk you

Preheat slow cooker to 200 degrees. Add chocolate cake mix and pudding mix to slow cooker. Add eggs and water. Stir well to combine. Pour mixture into an ungreased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Cover and cook on high for 2 hours. Cool for 10 minutes. Remove cover and sprinkle with semi-sweet chocolate chips and milk chocolate chips. Stir gently and then top with chopped walnuts. Serve with whipped topping.

Pour frozen green beans into a saucepan of boiling water. Boil 2 to 3 minutes, until crisp-tender. Drain. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Grease a 2-quart casserole. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the potatoes mix and boiling water. Cook over medium-high heat 10 to 12 minutes. Stir occasionally. Reduce heat to medium. Stir in the milk, ham and green beans. Bake at 400 degrees F 15 to 20 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese.

Combine the chicken with all seasonings. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet. Dip each piece of chicken into the flour mixture. Place the floured chicken in the hot oil. Cook for 10 to 12 minutes on each side, or until golden brown. Remove from the skillet. Serve over rice. Makes 4 servings.

Put pizza sauce in a jar. Add vinegar and garlic powder and shake well. Place a pita half in a microwave safe bowl and sprinkle with garlic powder. Microwave for 1 minute. Spread pizza sauce on pita half. Add mushrooms and pepperoni slices. Add lettuce and tomatoes and onions. Roll up. Serve with a cup of ice tea.
Pour some ice cubes into your glass, and fill with the grapefruit juice. Add vodka and liqueur to taste. Garnish with salt (coarse) and slice of grapefruit. Drink with good cheer!
Wash the apples thoroughly. Core and quarter. Place in pot with water to cover. Simmer until tender. Drain. Add cinnamon and nutmeg to taste. Mix in lemon slices. Enjoy. Serve warm or chilled.

Mix oreo cookie crumbs with cream cheese spread. Press into small muffin tins. In a bowl, mix pineapple with sugar. Spoon mixture over oreo mixture. Sprinkle with angel flake coconut. Chill overnight. Just before serving add 2-3 scoops of cool whip on top of each.

Combine greens with dried sweetened cranberries, feta, walnuts and balsamic vinegar in a large salad bowl. Whisk together mustard, honey, extra virgin olive oil, and season with black pepper to taste. Toss with greens to coat, just prior to serving.

Preheat oven to 375. Line muffin cups with paper liners. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar and baking powder. Cut in the cold oil with a pastry blender or two knives until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add the milk and stir with a spoon just until moistened. In a separate bowl, combine the eggs and blueberries. Fold the dry ingredients into the wet with a rubber spatula. Spoon the batter into the muffin cups and bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

Combine shrimp in medium bowl. Add olive oil, garlic, white wine, fresh lemon, Italian seasoning. Stir to coat shrimp. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add shrimp mixture. Cook shrimp until opaque on each side. Add parsleycook until parsley wilts. Add butter. Stir in parmesan cheese. Season with salt. Serve over pasta.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees F (200c degrees C). Spread allspice on both sides of pork chops. In a bowl, combine maple syrup, honey and 1/4 cup waterbrush all sides of pork chops with maple mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 25-30 minutes until pork is cooked through.

Bring 1/2 inch water to boil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add green beans in batchesboil 1 minute or until bright green. Drain in colanderrinse under cold waterdrain well. Meanwhile, cook bacon in same saucepan over medium heat until crispdrain on paper towelsbreak into pieces. Wipe saucepan clean with paper towelsmelt butter in saucepan over medium heatadd garliccook 1 minute or until garlic is fragrant, stirring occasionally with wooden spoon. Add brown sugarcook 1 minute or until sugar dissolvesstir in green beanssprinkle with saltcook 2 minutes or until heated through. Arrange beans in 2-inch wide by 3-inch long moundstop each with 1 slice of baconsprinkle each with pepper.

Heat butter in skillet on medium heat. Add onions. Cook until onions are soft. Remove from skillet. Add chicken breast halves to skillet. Cook on medium-high heat until browned. Add salt, pepper and flour. Stir until well mixed. Add apple cider. Increase heat. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add onions and apple. Cook until apples are soft. Pour sauce over chicken breast halves. Serve with rice pilaf.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Heat butter in skillet over medium heat. Add onionsauté 5 minutes. Add mushroomssauté 3 minutes. Add salt & pepper to taste. Add rice to skilletstir well. Pour broth over rice. Covercook 18 to 20 minutes or until rice is tender. Fluff rice. Serve hot.

Peel avocados. Discard pits. Cut avocados into 1 inch cubes. Place in a large bowl. Cut tomatoes in half. Cut avocados in half. Slice avocado halves into thin pieces. Add to bowl along with chilies. Stir in cilantro. Add lime juice to taste. Add tomatoes to bowl. Stir in onion. Add oregano to taste. Mix well. Add a small amount of salt and pepper. Stir well. Serve with chips. Makes about 2 cups.

Mix together egg, sausage and bread crumbs until well blended. Mix in mozzarella and parmesan cheeses and onion. Shape mixture into 2-inch balls. Roll meatballs into bread crumbs. Heat oil or butter in large skillet over medium heat. Cook meatballs over medium heat for 5 to 7 minutes or until browned on all sides. Drain meatballs on paper towels. Arrange meatballs in single layer on baking sheet. Bake uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes or until cooked through.

In a large mixing bowl, stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. Add canola oil and maple syrup and stir until blended. Stir in water until dough is formed. Bake in greased muffin cups for 20 minutes in preheated 375 degree oven.

Trim excess fat from pork loin steaks and season with pepper. In a small bowl combine bread crumbs with sage leaves. In a large zip-top plastic bag combine pork steaks, egg, oil and seasoningsseal bag and knead 20-30 seconds until well combined. Remove steaks from bag, place on an ungreased baking sheet and drizzle with oil. Sprinkle crumb mixture evenly over pork steaksbake at 425 degrees F 18 minutes. Combine parmesan cheese with 2 Tbsp oildrizzle over steaks during last 2 minutes of baking time.

Boil russet potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain and let cool. Peel potatoes and slice into 1/4 thick rounds. Place potatoes in a shallow bowl with 1/2 stick of butter. Mix seasonings into the butter. Dip potatoes into the butter mixture. Place the potatoes in the baking dish. Bake at 425 until crispy.

Heat oven to 425 degrees. Combine corn and beans and season well with salt and pepper. Roast for 25 minutes or until the beans are tender and the corn is cooked through and has started to turn golden brown. Combine corn mixture and tuna in mixing bowl and season well with salt and pepper and toss to combine. Add mixed greens to tuna mixture and toss well to combine. Add olive oil and lemon juice to taste and toss again to combine. Sprinkle chili powder over tuna mixture and toss again to combine. Serve immediately or refrigerate and serve cold the following day.

Put the flour in a mixing bowl. Add the yeast and sugar. Stir well. Gradually add the salt and water. Add shortening. Mix well. Kneed in bread machine until smooth. Turn onto a floured surface.
