Kneed to a firm dough. Place in an oiled bowl. Cover. Let rise until double. Punch down. Divide dough into 24 pieces. Shape each piece into a ball. Roll each ball into a 12 inch rope. Place cheese balls in center. Roll dough around cheese to enclose. Pinch the dough together to seal. Place dough seam side down on greased baking pan. Allow to rise again until doubled. Bake at 375f for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from oven. Brush each loaf with beaten egg. Sprinkle with coarse ground black pepper. Slice. Serve warm.

In a large bowl, combine yogurt, mayonnaise and lemon juice. Add salt and fresh ground pepper. Stir to combine. Add in tomato. Stir again to combine. In a serving bowl add asparagus. Drizzle yogurt sauce over asparagus and sprinkle with salt and fresh ground pepper.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Slice zucchini into 1/2 inch slices. Place slices on baking sheet. Brush zucchini with olive oil. Sprinkle with dried oregano. Drizzle zucchini with balsamic vinegar. Bake for 18 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Bring broth and chicken broth to boil in large saucepan. Add sage and onion and simmer until onions are tender. Add linguine and cook until pasta is al dente and onions are tender, stirring occasionally. Drain pasta and add to onions and broth mixture. Cook over medium low heat for five minutes and add spinach and bacon, cooking until spinach wilts and bacon is crisp. Add parmesan cheese to pasta and toss to coat. Serve with additional parmesan cheese and black pepper to taste.

Mix together potatoes and eggs. Mix flour with salt and pepper in large bowl and make a well in the center. Add potatoes and eggs to flour mixture and mix until just blended together. Heat oil in large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat. Drop batter by heaping tablespoonfuls into skillet and fry until golden brown on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Serve with cranberry sauce and orange slices (optional) and sprinkle with parsley. Enjoy!

Place a rack in a roasting panset aside. In a medium bowl combine harissa, orange juice, orange peel, cider vinegar, vegetable oil, sugar, cinnamon, salt and pepper. Place chicken in a shallow roasting pan. Rub with butter. Place in a hot oven. Bake until tender and juices run clear when pierced, about 1 hour. Transfer roasting pan to a rack in a large roasting pan, add enough hot water to come halfway up side of pan. Cover tightly with foilbake until cooked through, about 30 minutes more. Transfer chicken to a cutting boardlet rest until cool enough to handle, about 10 minutes. Skim fat from juices in roasting panreserve. Carve chicken into thin slices. Serve warm or at room temperature with sauce spooned over it. Serve sauce separately or stir in sliced orange peel.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place carrots on baking sheet and sprinkle with brown sugar and salt. Roast for 20 minutes.

Spread mustard on bottom half of roll. Spread ham on top of mustard. Spread mustard on top half of roll. Spread onions on top of ham. Top with raspberry preserves. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper. Top with gouda cheese. Close sandwich. Wrap in plastic wrap. Microwave on high 1 minute. Let stand 30 seconds. Cut diagonally.
Place chicken pieces in a baking dish and pour sauce over. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

In large pot or rice cooker, combine rice and broth. Coverbring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer until liquid is absorbed. Add peanuts. Covercook over low heat for 5 minutes. Uncovercook for additional 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Fluff with fork.

Place tomatoes into a large bowl. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon coarse salt. Place tomatoes into a large bowl. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon coarse salt. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon coarse salt. Place vinegar, sugar, allspice berries, mustard seeds and dill weed into a jar or bottle. Add 2 cups cold water. Place lid on jar. Bring mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Turn off heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Strain pickling liquid through a mesh strainer into a small bowl. Add 1/3 cup pickling liquid to tomatoes. Let stand at room temperature for 2 hours. Drain tomatoes. Add pickling liquid to the tomatoes. Cover. Refrigerate for 24 hours. Drain. In a large pot, simmer vinegar with sugar until sugar is dissolved. Add pickled tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 30 minutes. Drain. Return tomatoes to bowl. Stir in remaining pick

Mix together all of the ingredients and bring to a boil. When it reaches a boil, remove from heat. Let cool to room temp. After it has cooled, soak your shiitake mushrooms with this mixture. Let it sit for 12-24 hours.

Bring large pot of water to boil for pasta. Cook pasta according to package directions until tender but still firm to the bite. Drain pasta. Meanwhile, melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add peascook until tender but not mushy. Stir in poppy seedscook for 1 minute more. Transfer to large bowlset aside. In same skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Cook noodles for 2 to 3 minutes on one side or until just beginning to brownturn noodles and cook until browned on other side or to desired degree of browning. Drizzle with poppy seed mixture. Toss to coat. Add remaining seasoning to tastetoss to coat. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings. : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : : :

Place chicken breast halves in a large saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to a boilboil for 5 minutes. Remove chicken from the potcool. Cut chicken into 1/2-inch-thick strips. Place zucchini in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat for 3-4 minutes or until tender. Drain and set aside. Preheat broiler. Place chicken in a single layer on a broiler-proof platter or sheet pan. Brush with 1/4 of the pesto. Broil for 4-5 minutes or until done. Top with remaining pesto. Sprinkle with tomatoes and cheese. Broil for 1 minute or until cheese is melted. Place chicken and zucchini on serving platter and garnish with parsley. Serve with pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix cake mix according to package directions using butter, egg whites and milk. Stir in semisweet chocolate chunks until well combined. Pour batter into greased square baking dish. Bake for about 25-30 minutes or until lightly browned around edges and center springs back when touched lightly.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the carrots, scallions and mushrooms and cook until the vegetables are softened and the mushrooms are browned. Add the heavy cream and cook until slightly thickened. Add salt and paprika to taste. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs lightly. Add the egg mixture and nutmeg to the vegetable mixture and stir until incorporated. Fill each ramekin half full with the vegetable mixture. Place one slice of manchego in the bottom of each ramekin. Top each with the mushroom mixture. Bake for 25 minutes until the timbales are set. Serve hot.

Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and add pizza sauce. Stir in pizza toppings. Layer mixture in greased casserole dish. Top with pizza sauce. Bake at 375 degrees f for 25-30 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Mix chicken rice pilaf mix according to package directions. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute garlic and ginger for 30 seconds. Add mushrooms. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in cooked rice pilaf. Add chicken. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in soy sauce. Heat tortillas according to package directions. Divide chicken mixture among tortillas. Top each with lettuce leaves. Roll up tortillas. Place seam side down on a plate. Serve with additional soy sauce.

In a large mixing bowl combine asparagus spears, spinach leaves, strawberries, pecans and poppy seed dressing. Stir gently to combine. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight to blend flavors. Serve as a main course salad or side dish salad with grilled or broiled meats or poultry.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine milk and coffee creamer in bowl. Mix in flour and baking powder. Add in eggs and vanilla. Stir in sugars. Mix well. Add in butter. Stir in dry ingredients. Fold in chocolate chips. Bake at 350 for about 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

Saute bacon until crisp in large skillet over medium heat. Drain bacon on paper towels. Add green pepper and onion to bacon grease and cook about 5 minutes until onions are translucent. Stir in hash brown potatoes until heated through. Pour eggs into potatoes and stir until cooked through. Top with cheddar cheese, bacon and green onions to serve.

Take 2 slices sourdough bread, and spread one side with butter. Layer ham, swiss cheese and then cheddar cheese. Top with other slice of bread. Cook in skillet over medium-high heat until golden brown. Flip and cook other side until golden brown.

Prepare chocolate cake mix according to package directions for a 10 inch tube or bundt pan. Pour batter into greased 10 inch bundt pan or tube pan. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until done. Cool in pan on wire rack 10 minutesremove from pan to wire rack to cool completely. Meanwhile prepare filling. In small bowl combine chocolate flavor instant pudding and pie filling mix and 1 cup half-and-halfset aside. In small saucepan over medium heat combine vodka and kahluaheat to boiling. Remove from heatcool 5 minutes. In large bowl beat cream cheese until fluffygradually add powdered sugar, beating at low speed until blended. Add cooled fillingbeat on low speed until blended. Invert cooled cake onto serving platedrizzle with vodka mixture. Spread top of cake with cream cheese mixturerefrigerate 2 hours or until set. Just before serving, drizzle with more vodka mixture. Garnish with

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Fold pasta into large bowl. Add vegetables and feta. Toss gently to combine. Add dressing and toss to coat. Serve cold or room temperature. Makes 4 servings.

Mix together the dry ingredients then cut the butter into the mixture until it is the size of small peas. Add the milk until it is the consistency of clay and shape the dough onto the muffin tin. Bake at 350f for about 20 minutes or until they are golden brown and a toothpick comes out clean from the center.

In a medium saucepan, combine rice flour and tapioca flour. Add 1/3 cup of coconut cream and stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. Add more coconut cream if necessary. Stir constantly for about 20 minutes. The mixture will thicken. Turn off heat. Stir in palm sugar to taste. Place 10 pandanus leaves in a large pan. Place 2 tablespoons of mixture in the center of each leaf and roll up. Place in a steamer and steam 30 minutes over boiling water. Serve with coconut.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Season pork chops with salt & pepper. Heat 1 tsp of olive oil in a large skillet. Add pork chops to skillet and saute until golden brown on one side. Remove pork chops from skillet and place on a baking sheet. Add 1 tsp of olive oil to skillet. Add onion to skillet. Sauté onion over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until translucent. Add garlic to skillet. Sauté garlic for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add tomatoes to skillet. Stir in rosemary & anchovies. Add wine to skillet. Bring mixture to a simmer over medium heat. Cook for about 10 minutes or until tomatoes are reduced by about half. Transfer mixture to a small saucepan. Add 1/2 cup of hot water to pan. Cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until sauce thickens. Pour sauce over pork chops. Bake for 20 minutes or until pork chops are cooked through. Serve pork chops with pol

Cook spaghetti in large pot as directed on package and drain. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until tender. Stir in ground beef and cook and drain fat. Add tomatoes and green chiles and cook until thickened and heated throughseason with salt and pepper and cumin powder. Add drained spaghetti and toss togetherpour into ungreased 13 x 9 inch (33 x 23 cm) glass or ceramic baking dishtop with sour cream and cheese and sprinkle with parsley. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and lightly brownedlet stand for about 10 minutes before cutting. Makes 8 servings.

Combine all ingredients except ice cubes and cucumbers in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Add ice cubes and cucumbers and blend until smooth and chilled. Serve with crusty bread or crackers.
In a large bowl, blend sour cream and mayo until smooth. Add cheese, sun-dried tomato, green onions and mushroom. Add salt and pepper. Serve with crackers.

Brush the mushroom caps with olive oil and season to taste with salt and pepper. Grill the mushrooms for about 5 minutes on each side. In the meantime, in a small bowl combine the olive oil and chopped garlic. Remove the mushrooms from the grill and spread the tomato slices over the mushroom caps. Sprinkle with the cheese and basil. Place on the grill and cook until the mozzarella is melted. Serve hot.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onions, bell peppers and hot peppers. Cook for about 3-5 minutes, stirring frequently until vegetables are tender. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds more. Add the beef or lamb cubescook for about 10-12 minutes or until no longer pink inside, stirring occasionally to break up lumps. Stir in the mixed spices, stirring to combine. Serve hot over rice or flatbreads.

Melt butter and brown sugar together. Cook over medium heat until the mixture begins to bubble. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Stir in vanilla. Add heavy cream. Cook until the mixture is thick. Pour the mixture over the fresh sliced peaches. Top with chopped pecans. Serve immediately.

In a blender, puree the raspberries, lemon juice and water together until smooth. Pour into a large glass dish and freeze for at least 4 hours or overnight until hard. Remove from freezer and puree again with a stick blender until smooth and slushy but not completely smooth. Pour the mixture into a loaf pan and freeze for at least 2 hours or until solidified and hard. Remove from freezer and serve immediately. Garnish with mint leaves and serve in dessert glasses with a spoon and a straw for sipping.

Preheat grill to 325 degrees. Grill the chicken 12-15 minutes or until juices run clear. Remove chicken and set aside. In small bowl, combine honey, garlic, pepper, salt and oil. Place chicken in glass pan or on platter and brush with honey mixture. Sprinkle lemon juice on chicken. Grill for 5-7 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with lemon peel. Serve with grilled asparagus.

Heat margarine or butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté the pork chops until browned. Add the white wine. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir the vegetables into the wine. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Add enough water to cover the pork. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer. Cook for 30 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve over rice or mashed potatoes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine tomatoes and their juices in a food processor and blend. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the tomato mixture to the skillet along with the garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the herbs and season with salt and pepper. Pour the mixture into a baking dish. Cook in a preheated 350 degree oven for 40 minutes.

Drain dates in a strainer for about 2 hours. Drain raisins in a strainer. Mash dates in a food processor until they are no longer chunky and they resemble applesauce in texture. Place dates in a large bowl and stir in applesauce, raisins, water and cinnamon. Add flour, baking powder and saltstir well. Add eggsmix well. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake in a preheated 325 degree Fahrenheit oven about 20 minutes until light brown. Let cookies rest 5 minutes before removing from pans. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

Cut muffins in half. Spread with pizza sauce. Add slices of mozzarella cheese. Place on baking sheet in oven for 5 minutes. Then add slices of chicken breast. Put back in oven for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

In a large bowl mix cream cheese, cocoa, and heavy cream with a hand mixer until smooth and creamy. Add in peanut butter and splenda sugar substitute and beat until mixture is thick and creamy and no lumps remain. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch pan and freeze for at least 4 hours or up to 2 weeks in the freezer before serving. To serve remove from freezer and allow to thaw for 15 to 20 minutes before serving.

Put the water and diced tomatoes into a saucepan and cook over medium heat for 20 minutes. Add the olives and artichoke hearts and cook for 1 minute more. Preheat a grill pan or grill. Lightly oil the pan and season the fillets with salt and pepper. Cook the fillets for 2 minutes each side or until just done. Spread the cooked fillets with some of the sauce and top them with a slice of the feta and serve.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees C (fan). Lightly grease a medium baking tray and line it with greaseproof paper. Melt the butter with the dark chocolate and stir until it is completely smooth. Stir in the brown sugar until it is thoroughly combined. Add the egg and beat until it is well combined with the chocolate mixture. Add the flour, the salt and the walnuts and mix until it is fully combined. Drop spoonfuls of the mixture onto the greaseproof paper and press down slightly with a fork to flatten it into a disc shape. Place the rolo chocolates onto each brownie and press down slightly again with the fork to adhere it to the brownie. Place the tray into the oven and bake it for around 20 minutes or until the brownies are slightly golden brown. Remove the tray from the oven and leave the brownies to cool completely before transferring them to a serving plate. Serve immediately and enjoy!

In large skillet cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain. Stir in oregano. Add soup and heat through. Stir in macaroni. Spread macaroni mixture into a greased 11x7x2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Bring the heavy cream and butter to a boil in a small saucepan. Add the cream cheese and stir until it is completely blended. Add the parmesan cheese and stir until blended. Add the nutmeg and season with salt and pepper. Set the cream aside. When you are ready to cook the pasta, bring a large pot of well-salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta according to the package directions. Drain and put in a large bowl. Add the cream and toss. Serve with a sprinkling of fresh basil.

Pour tea bags into a large container. Add 1 cup of water and stir. Add 1/2 cup of sugar and stir until dissolved. Add frozen orange juice and lemonade and stir until slush is formed. Pour into glasses and top with vodka.

Boneless, skinless chicken breasts can be substituted in place of chicken liver. Rinse the chicken liver well. Cut into 6 pieces. Put the chicken liver pieces on the bottom of the center of each wonton wrapper, and roll up firmly into a long roll. Set the rolls seam side down on the prepared baking sheet. To make the sauce, heat the oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the bacon. Cook the bacon until crisp, about 4 minutes. Transfer the bacon with the oil using a slotted spoon to a paper-towel-lined plate. Drain the bacon on paper towels, reserving the oil in the saucepan. Add the remaining filling ingredients to the saucepan and bring them to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the mixture is reduced by half, about 4 minutes. Stir in the reserved bacon pieces, the chestnuts, and the peanuts. Remove from the heat. Cool slightly. Pour the sauce over the chicken liver rolls and sprinkle with the sesame se

Poached eggs are a very easy breakfast or brunch food. They can be prepared ahead of time and then quickly reheated. One of my favorite breakfasts is kittencal's perfect poached eggs with smoked salmon and a lightly toasted bagel. I like to prepare poached eggs in small batches. That way I can have them ready in time for when I eat them. The eggs can be kept warm in a pot of simmering water. If you prefer your eggs with a runny yolk, make sure your water is not boiling. I like my eggs with a runny yolk. So I don't like to have the water boiling. If the water is boiling then the yolks will be hard. If you want to make this recipe with a larger batch of eggs then you should use a wider pan and increase the cooking time. Also keep in mind that you will need more milk. Poached eggs are easy to make and they are a great way to start the day. If you like a runny egg yolk then you should use simmering water and if you like a firmer yolk then you should use boiling water. The time that the eggs take

Preheat the oven to 400°F. In a mixing bowl, beat together the cream cheese and butter until smooth. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs and cream. Combine the cream cheese mixture with the eggs and cream and stir together to combine. Toss the parsley and chives with the salt and pepper. Pour the cream mixture into the pastry shell. Sprinkle the cheese over the top and bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until the filling is firm. Let it cool completely before slicing. Serve with fresh fruit.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add brussels sprouts to boiling water and boil for 3 minutes. Drain in a colander. Pour brussels sprouts back into pot and add butter. Mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a large bowl and mix in the lemon juice and zest. Stir in the dill and almonds. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Brown sausage in skillet. Drain fat. In a large saucepan over medium heat melt margarine. Stir in flour until well blended. Cook and stir for 30 seconds. Add milk and cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 minute longer. Add sausage and salt and pepper.

In large mixing bowl, beat applesauce and bananas. Add sugar substitute and beat well. Add flour and beat until smooth. Stir in salt and baking soda. Pour into greased 9 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 50 to 55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in middle comes out clean.

In a small saucepan combine fresh cranberries and water. Add sugar. Cook over medium heat until cranberries pop and release their juices. Stir in butter, salt and vanilla. Cook over medium heat until butter melts and the cranberries begin to release juices. Stir in sour cream. Continue to cook until thick. Transfer to a heatproof bowl. Cool. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve with your favorite ham. Serves 6-8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook pork sausages according to package directions. Drain sausages and set aside. Sauté red onion in butter until tender. Add red bell peppercook 5-6 minutes. Add cooked sausages to vegetables. Add heavy creamcook over medium-low heat 2 minutes. Stir in eggs. Pour vegetable mixture into an 8x8-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle evenly with muenster cheese. Bake 15 minutes or until center is set. Serve warm. Makes 8 servings.
Blend all ingredients together in a large bowl. Form mixture into small meatballs. Roll meatballs in breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 degrees f for 20 minutes. Makes 12 meatballs.

Season scallops with salt and pepper. Dip scallops in flour. In a skillet heat olive oil. When hot add scallops. Saute scallops for 2 to 3 minutes. Add lemon juice. Cook for another minute. Add tomatoes, shallots, garlic, herbes de provence and salt. Cook for another 2 minutes. Remove from heat and place scallops on lettuce leaves.

Remove chicken from marinade. Heat olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and saute until browned. Add flour and cook and stir 1 minute. Gradually stir in sour cream and milk. Cook and stir until sauce thickens and bubbles. Stir in mustard and next 4 ingredients. Cover and bake at 325f for 35-40 minutes or until chicken is tender. Sprinkle with corn flakes. Bake for 5 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with lemon. Serves 4.

Melt the butter in a large pot over medium-low heat. Add the onion and cook until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add the clams and potato and stir to combine. Add the clam juice and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until clams are cooked and the potato is tender, about 10 minutes. Add the flour and stir until it thickens the broth. Add the milk and half-and-half and stir until combined. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Add the clams and cook until they open and the potato is tender. Season with the pepper and Worcestershire. Serve.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions and garlic. Cook until onions are tender. Add mushrooms cook until mushrooms are tender. Add steak cubes to skillet and brown. Add Italian dressing and marsala wine. Cover skillet and cook until steak is tender about 4-5 minutes depending on thickness of steak.
Combine all ingredients except pecans in a medium bowl and stir until well mixed. Transfer to a small bowl and stir in pecans. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour.

Bring milk and sugar to a simmer over medium heat. Add egg yolks and whisk. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Remove from heat and add salt and vanilla. Cool. Pour into a large bowl and place in freezer for several hours until the ice cream is firm. Serve in a bowl with whipped cream and fresh berries. You can also add some chopped nuts if you wish. You might want to do a search engine search for the other recipes if you bookmarked them.

Cream butter and brown sugar until fluffy. Beat egg and vanilla extract. Add flour and salt to butter mixture alternating with buttermilk. Add nuts. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes or until firm to touch. Cool cookies 2 minutes on cookie sheetsremove to racks to cool completely.

Boil potatoes until soft. Peel and slice potatoes and place in baking dish. Spread potatoes in the baking dish and sprinkle with Italian seasoning. Add cream of mushroom soup and milk and stir until well mixed and potatoes are covered. Sprinkle potatoes with cheeses and bake in preheated 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven for about 30 minutes or until bubbly and heated through.

Preheat oven to 425f. Dice onion and cook until translucent in olive oil with 1/2 tsp of chili powder and 1 tbsp brown sugar in a skillet over medium heat. Place salmon fillets in a shallow baking dish and top with onion mixture. Sprinkle with chili powder and 1 tbsp of brown sugar and toss to coat. Spread sliced potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet and drizzle with 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 tsp of chili powder and sprinkle with salt and ground black pepper to taste. Bake salmon for 15 minutes and then bake potatoes for 20 minutes or until tender and golden brown.

Heat the oven to 325 degrees f. Spray the inside of the 10-inch bundt pan with cooking spray. Arrange the hamburgers in the bundt pan. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, beat the eggs, milk and 1/4 cup of the sharp cheddar until smooth. Pour the egg mixture over the hamburgers. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of the onions and 2 tablespoons of the zucchini. Top with the remaining onions and zucchini. Sprinkle with the remaining sharp cheddar. Cover with foil and bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until the center of the cake is firm and the eggs are set. Uncover and sprinkle with the remaining sharp cheddar and the margarine. Return to the oven and bake until the top is golden brown.
Blend all ingredients together and serve immediately. Serves one.

In a heavy saucepan combine the sugar, flour, salt. In another pan, heat the milk. Combine the milk with the vanilla, stir in the cinnamon. Add the hot milk to the dry ingredients. Cook over low heat until thick. Cool the mixture slightly. Blend in the whipping cream. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Chill before serving. Note: If you want a more gelatinous consistency, use cold milk.

Put berries in a greased 2-quart baking dish. In a small bowl stir together farina and next 2 ingredientsset aside. In a large bowl combine sugar and baking powder. Stir in egg and vanilla. Mix well and pour over berries. Stir in farina mixture. Bake at 425f for 25 minutes. Serve warm.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, heat milk to a simmer. Remove from heat. Stir in cinnamon stick. In a small bowl, whisk together orange zest and liqueur. Gradually whisk into milk. In a medium bowl, whisk together 8 ounces of semisweet chocolate with 4 ounces of Mexican chocolate until smooth. Pour into a 4-quart saucepan. Heat over medium heat until chocolate melts and begins to bubble. Remove from heat. Gradually whisk in hot milk mixture. In a small bowl, whisk together remaining 8 ounces of semisweet chocolate with 4 ounces of Mexican chocolate until smooth. Add to hot milk mixture and stir until combined. Serve immediately with orange slices.

Preheat oven 180c for 10 minutes then place the courgettes into a roasting tin with a little oil and salt. Roast for 30 minutes until tender. Meanwhile, melt butter in a pan with a little oil and fry the fillets until golden brown for about 3 minutes each side. Whizz all together in a blender or food processor. Pour into a dish and coat all over the fillets with a thin layer of sun dried tomato basil oil rub. Place a drizzle of olive oil in a pan with garlic and cook for a few minutes until softened. Mix this together with the courgettes, potatoes and season with salt and pepper. Place the trout fillets onto the courgette mixture. Place in a preheated 180c oven for 20 minutes until cooked through. Serve with freshly grated parmesan cheese and a simple green salad. Delicious!

Pre heat oven to 190 degrees c/ gas mark 5. Grease a 20 cm cake tin with margarine and dust with flour then shake off the excess. Beat margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the flour to the bowl with the margarine and sugar and fold together using a metal spoon until just combined. Then add the egg to the mixture, beating until the cake is light and fluffy. In a small bowl mix together the baking powder with the cocoa powder. Add the vanilla essence to the batter then fold in the cocoa mixture until just combined. Pour the batter into the prepared tin then sprinkle over the top the caster sugar and the orange zest. Place the tin into the pre-heated oven and bake for 45-50 mins until a skewer inserted into the middle of the cake comes out clean. Remove from the oven and leave to cool completely then serve with a good dollop of cream!

In a large pot bring water to a boil. Add tea bag, mint sprigs, cayenne pepper, sugar, lemon juice and cinnamon stick. Cook for about 15 minutes then remove from heat and let steep for another half hour. Pour into a pitcher through a strainer or tea press. Add lemon juice & sugar. Serve hot or cold with lemon wedges for garnish if desired.

Cut watermelon into thin wedges. Place wedges into glasses filled with crushed ice. Add lime juice and ginger beer. Squeeze lime over each glass. Pour vanilla vodka into glass. Garnish with a slice of watermelon and lime wheel.

Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Dip the bottom of each chicken piece in the egg white mixture. Dip the egg white into the flour mixture, making sure to coat all sides of the chicken evenly. Place the flour-coated chicken in the skillet. Cook until light brown on all sides, about 5 to 7 minutes per side. Drain on a wire rack and keep warm until all the chicken is cooked. Place the maple syrup in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the tomato paste and vinegar. Stirring constantly, cook the mixture for about 10 minutes until it thickens slightly. Stir in the garlic clove. Remove the garlic clove before serving if desired. Brush the chicken with the maple syrup mixture. Sprinkle with the parsley. Serve immediately. Refrigerate any unused chicken for up to two days. Reheat in a skillet over medium heat until warmed through.

Combine all ingredients except egg and sherry wine and mix well. Form into 4-inch oval patties and refrigerate at least 1 hour or overnight. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes or until firm and golden brown. Serve immediately with sherry wine as a dipping sauce or with melted butter or hollandaise sauce.

Place the corn in a sauce pan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Drain and chop. Mix the corn and the chopped green chilies with the cream cheese and margarine. Stir in the milk and garlic salt. Add the shredded cheese and stir until cheese is melted. Serve as a dip.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine cake mix, eggs and oil in large bowl with mixer. Beat at medium speed 2 minutespour into 8-inch square baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake 20 to 22 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan 10 minutesremove from pan to wire rack to cool completely. Cream cream cheese and sugar in large bowl with mixer at medium speed 2 minutesspread over cooled cake. Place 1 lemon slice in each of 16 dessert dishes or small bowls. Spoon cheesecake mixture over lemon slicessprinkle with powdered sugar. Refrigerate 1 hour. Drizzle with lemon juice if desiredcut into 16 bars to serve.

Combine all glazing ingredients in a small bowl and stir well. Add enough water to make the mixture into a thin sauce. Brush the glazing mixture over each salmon steak. Grill salmon for about 10 minutes or until desired doneness.

In a large bowl combine tuna steaks, pineapple ring, low sodium soy sauce, chopped ginger, minced garlic and sliced green peppers. Toss to coat. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. Remove tuna steaks from marinade. Thread tuna steaks onto skewers. Grill tuna steaks for 6 minutes per side or until done. Serve tuna steaks over rice.

In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat and add the black beans and cook until the beans are tender and the skins have broken apart. In a large bowl whisk together the beans and the remaining ingredients, except for the chocolate chips. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 12x17 jelly roll pan and sprinkle the chocolate chips over the top. Bake at 325 degrees for about 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the brownies. Let cool in pan for about ten minutes and then cut and serve.

Squeeze the roasted pepper to extract the juice. Add the juice to 1/2 cup mayonnaise. Add the juice from one garlic clove. Season with salt and pepper. Thread a chicken breast onto a skewer with the pepper. Repeat with the remaining chicken breasts. Grill for 4 minutes. Turn skewers over and grill 3 minutes. Serve.

Bake in greased and floured baking dish at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and stir in broccoli and rice. Mix in soup and add pimentos and seasonings and cheese if desired. Bake at 375 degrees for an additional 15 minutes or until bubbly. Serve immediately.

Grease a 1-1/2 quart casserole dish with 1 tbsp butter. Combine the bread cubes with the butter in the dishpress the mixture gently with your fingers until the bread is well coated with butter. Sprinkle the bread cubes with the cheese. In a large bowl combine the eggs with the milk and next 4 ingredientsbeat well. Pour the egg mixture over the bread and cheese mixture in the casserole dishstir gently until the eggs are distributed evenly. Cover the casserole dish tightly with aluminum foilrefrigerate the strata overnight, or up to 12 hours before baking it. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Remove the foilsprinkle the red pepper over the strata. Bake the strata until puffed and golden brown in color, about 50 minuteslet stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Slice one package of graham crackers into thin strips and put them in the bottom of pie crust. Spread cream cheese mixture on top and top with peanutbutter mixture and whipped cream and more peanutbutter mixture.

Cut the tomatoes into halves. Put the sliced garlic clove in the blender. Add to the blender all the other ingredients (including the basil leaves), except the pecorino. Blend well until smooth. Put the mixture into a sauce pan. Cook for about 30 minutes at low heat until it reduces to about half of its original volume. Remove the pan from the heat. Stir the pecorino cheese in to the mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Bake the chicken breasts, uncovered, at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 25 minutes. While the chicken breasts are baking, heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the garliccook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Add the hamcook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add the penne rigatecook for 1 minute or until the pasta is tender but firm. Remove the chicken from the oven and slice lengthwise into 1/2-inch thick slices. Add the pasta to the skillet with the garlic and hamstir in the chicken breast slices. Cook for 3 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Meanwhile, heat the butter in a small skillet over low heatadd the breadcrumbs and cook for 1 minute or until the breadcrumbs are golden brown. Remove from the heatstir in the Parmesan cheese. Serve the pasta with the alfredo sauce. Top each serving with 2 tablespoons of the breadcrumb mixture.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute mushrooms and garlic until soft. Add butter and stir in paprika and flour. Cook 2 minutes. Add salmon and cook for 8-10 minutes or until salmon flakes easily when tested. Remove from heat. Mix in sour cream and lemon juice. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease 1 pizza pan with olive oil or non stick cooking spray. Make pizza dough and roll into a 1/4 inch thick circle. Place on pizza pan. Spread sauce on dough and spread cheese on top of sauce. Sprinkle with dried basil leaves and fresh herbs. Top with mushrooms and walnuts. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes and salt and pepper. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and top with fresh basil leaves and serve immediately.
Soak split peas in water for 2 hours. Drain. Add split peas, vegetable oil, zucchini and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover pot and simmer for 30 minutes. Add turmeric, salt, pepper. Serve.

In a small saucepan over low heat, stir together the sweetened condensed milk and Irish whiskey. Cook, stirring frequently until the condensed milk is dissolved and the mixture is smooth. In a large glass or plastic container with a tight fitting lid, combine the sweetened condensed milk mixture and the whipping cream. Cover and refrigerate until thoroughly cold. In a medium bowl, stir together the chocolate syrup and instant coffee crystals. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until cold. When the sweetened condensed milk mixture and whipping cream mixture are thoroughly cold, carefully transfer the cold whipping cream mixture to a blender. Add the cold chocolate syrup mixture and blend until smooth and frothy. Pour into 10-ounce glasses. Top each glass with a dollop of cream of coconut.
1. Grease a 6x10 inch baking dish.2. Beat egg until foamy.3. Add milk.4. Add pancake mix.5. Add butter.6. Sprinkle cinnamon sugar over batter.7. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Mix together all of the ingredients except granola cereal in a medium bowl until well blended. Then add the granola cereal to the mix and stir until fully blended. Spoon out the yogurt mix into a pan and place in the freezer to firm up for about an hour before serving.

In large crock pot, combine chicken breasts. Cover with taco seasoning mix. Cover and cook on low 8 hours or on high 4 hours. Remove chicken and shred. Add green and red peppers. Cover and cook on high 45 minutes. Add frozen corn. Cover and cook on high 20 minutes. Stir in salsa. Cover and cook on high 20 minutes. Stir in shredded cheese. Cover and cook on high 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve in tortillas.

In a saucepan combine the apple cider vinegar and the pickling salt. Bring to a boil. Lower heat to simmer and boil gently for about 5 minutes. Add the onions and garlic. Bring to a boil. Add the cucumbers. Cook at a gentle boil until the cucumbers are tender. Remove from heat and transfer to a bowl. Let cool for about 1 hour. Transfer to the refrigerator. The pickles will keep for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat oven to 350f. Remove broccoli spears from stalks. Slice spears diagonally to form 1/4" thick strips. Cut rolls in half and spread with cheese. Place strips of broccoli in the center of each roll. Spoon mushroom soup over each roll. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Place rolls on cookie sheet. Sprinkle with seasoned crumbs. Bake for 20 minutes.

Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper and dredge in egg white. Dip chicken breasts in breadcrumbs and then dip in parmesan cheese and coat with breadcrumbs. Cook chicken breast on high heat for 4 minutes and then turn over and cook for 4 more minutes. Chicken is done when internal temperature reads 165 degrees F (73 degrees C). Serve with pasta or rice and sauce of your choice.
Mix all the ingredients and spread on a tinfoil lined plate or a casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for about an hour or until the top is brown. Serve with tortilla chips.

Combine eggs with milk and season to taste with black pepper. In a large skillet over medium heat melt the oil and add the onion and cook until translucent. Add the onion to the egg mixture and mix well. Place a sheet of plastic wrap over the skillet to prevent the egg from browning. Heat to 350 degrees. In a large bowl mix the cream cheese and chives together. In a large skillet over medium heat melt the oil. Add the salmon and cook until browned. Add the salmon to the egg mixture and mix well. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet. Cook until the edges are set and the middle is still runny. Cook for 1 minute more. Transfer to a plate and serve immediately.

Peel lemons and slice into 3cm rounds (use a small mandolin slicer for this). Place in a jug with 1 litre of water and add the sugar and orange blossom water. Add ice cubes and stir gently until all the sugar has dissolved and the ice has melted. Serve.

Place broccoli, chicken broth and water into a large soup pot. Bring to a boil. Cook broccoli until tender. Add milk and salt and pepper to taste. Cook until heated through. Add ham and swiss cheese to soup pot. Cook until cheese is melted. Add half-and-half and butter to soup. Stir to combine. Serve hot.

Prepare salad dressing by whisking together oil, vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Drain the chicken-flavored ramen noodles. Toss ramen noodles and salad dressing together in large salad bowl. Toss in the sunflower seeds, sliced almonds, green onions and coleslaw. Garnish with sesame seeds if desired.

Cream the sugar with the pumpkin. Stir in the evaporated milk until well blended. Stir in the flour, vanilla and spices until well blended. Stir in the margarine until blended. Stir in the eggs until well blended. Pour into an ungreased 13x9-inch baking dish. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes at 350 degrees until golden brown. Cool for 20 minutes before serving.

In a small pan saute onions in butter until tender. Add brown sugar and stir to dissolve. Spoon onion mixture onto a 9x13 baking dish. Top onion mixture with salmon. Sprinkle with salt & pepper. Cover with foil. Bake in a 375f oven for 30-35 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve on a bed of rice.

Lightly brush baguette slices with olive oil. Place baguettes in a preheated 400 degree F. oven for about 5 minutes. Remove from the oven and spread the brie over one side of each baguette slice. Add the mango chutney and the cranberries. Garnish with fresh mint leaves. Serve immediately.

Over low heat, combine cranberries and corn syrup in a saucepan. Cook slowly until berries pop and mixture thickens, stirring occasionally. Stir in butter. Add the sweetened condensed milk. Cook until berries and milk are blended and mixture is thick. Remove from heat and cool. Stir in unsweetened cocoa and powdered sugar. Roll into small balls. Makes about 12 truffles.

Melt one tablespoon of butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add one small chopped red bell pepper and two small chopped white onion. Add one small slice of cooked ham. Slowly pour in two eggs and one-half cup of milk. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. When eggs are almost set, add one cup of shredded cheese. Let cook until cheese is melted. Fold in and serve.

Remove the pit and slice the peaches. Slice the red onion and the green peppers into 1/2-inch-thick rounds. Slice the jalapeno peppers and remove the seeds if desired. Place all the salsa ingredients into a bowl and combine. Chill for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld. This salsa pairs well with fish. Serve as a dip or as a topping for fish.

In a bowl, combine the feta cheese and mozzarella cheese. Mix together the Italian seasoning and red onion. Place one pita on a serving platter. Spread a layer of cheese over the pita. Next add a layer of seasoned cheese followed by slices of the red onion. Finally add slices of the tomato and black olives. Repeat until all of the pita bread is used. Serve at room temperature.

In a small bowl combine yogurt, butter, lemon juice, garlic and spices. Cut lamb into 3/4-inch cubes and place in a large glass bowl. Pour yogurt mixture over lamb and stir to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight. Thread cubes of lamb onto skewers. Grill to desired doneness, turning often to prevent sticking.

In a saucepan, combine the sugar, flour, cocoa powder, salt and baking powder and mix together well with a spoon. In a separate bowl, beat the eggs with a fork and add them to the sugar mixture. Stir in the oil and the vanilla extract. Spread the batter in a greased 9x9x2-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let the brownies cool for 10 minutes before cutting into 9 squares.

Season scallops with salt and pepper. Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add scallops in a single layer and saute until just cooked through. Remove from pan and keep warm. Add butter to skillet and saute chives for about a minute. Add lemon juice and zest to skillet and saute until lemon is reduced slightly. Add fresh basil leaves and toss until wilted. Remove from heat and keep warm. To serve, place scallops on individual plates and spoon the basil lemon butter sauce over each. Garnish with a sprinkle of chives. Serve immediately.

Saute onions and garlic in oil. Add ginger and curry paste and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the vegetable stock and coconut milk. Bring to a boil and then simmer until thickened. Add the pumpkin and vegetables and cook until tender. Serve hot.

Melt the butter and combine it with the flour and sugar. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Stir in the baking powder and milk. Put the fruit in an unbaked pie plate. Pour the cobbler batter evenly over the fruit. Bake at 350f for 35-45 minutes. Let stand for at least ten minutes before serving.

Combine vinegar and sugar in a small saucepan and simmer for 2 minutes over medium heat, or just long enough for sugar to dissolve. Remove from heat and add maple syrup and stir until combined. Refrigerate overnight for flavors to meld together. The next day, pour over thinly sliced canadian bacon and refrigerate overnight or up to three days before serving. Serve with crackers or baguette slices and fresh fruit or vegetables.

Cut the cabbage into 8 wedges. Place a wedge of cabbage in the bottom of a 9x13 inch dish and top with a wedge of potato. Place a piece of sausage on top of the potato. Repeat the process until you have 8 layers. Add a little water to the bottom of the pan. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake in the preheated 350 degree F. oven for about 45 minutes. Remove the foil and add 3 cups of water. Cover and simmer for about 15 minutes or until the cabbage is soft. Serve with rye bread.

Peel potatoes and cut into small cubes. Boil potatoes for about 25 minutes until soft. Drain potatoes and set aside to cool for about five minutes. Slice fennel bulb into thin slices and dice celery into small cubes. In a medium saucepan or Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium heat and add onion and celery to the pot and cook until tender, about five minutes. Add fennel to onion and celery and cook for another minute or two. Add broth, wine and potatoes to the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook for about 5 to 8 minutes or until potatoes are cooked through and tender. Add salt and pepper to taste and serve hot.

Prepare rice paper according to package instructions. Heat a heavy-bottom frying pan on high heat and add about a teaspoon of oil. Fry each fish fillet for about 2 minutes on each side until lightly browned and cooked through. Place fish on rice paper and roll up tightly. Dip rice paper rolls into oil and then sprinkle with black sesame seeds and serve with a side salad and green chili sauce for dipping.

Place the egg in a small bowl. Stir in the water, a little at a time, so that a runny batter results. Add the black beans, cilantro, bread crumbs, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper. Stir together to blend. Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Form the beans into four patties. Add the patties to the pan. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side. Place the patties on a serving platter. Top with the cilantro.

Heat oil over medium-high heat. Add sprouts and cook, stirring often, until they are lightly browned and tender - 5 to 7 minutes. Add butter and stir to combine. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat your oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan with vegetable oil or melted butter. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the sugar and crushed pineapple in its juice. Add in the eggs and mix well. Add in the oil and mix until combined. Sift in the self-rising flour and mix until dough is smooth. Pour into greased loaf pan and bake for about 45 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted into middle comes out clean. Let cool for about five minutes before removing from pan. Cut into slices and serve.

Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Rub pork tenderloin generously on all sides with mixture. Bake at 275 degrees f for 15 minutes. Remove from oven, brush with BBQ sauce. Place in oven at 350 degrees for an additional 12 minutes. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl, whisk together the milk and eggs. In a large bowl, combine the bread cubes, ham, beans and onions. Add the egg mixture and stir to combine. Transfer to a 9-inch square baking dish and sprinkle with the cheeses. Bake for about 35 to 45 minutes until the strata is golden brown and the top is bubbly. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease a 9x9 pan with cooking spray or butter. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, unsweetened cocoa and saltmix well with a wire whisk. In another bowl, combine egg whites, coffee and milk. Add this mixture to the flour mixturemix well until smooth. Pour into prepared panbake for 22-27 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool completely before frosting. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese with an electric mixer until creamy. Add coffee powder and vanillabeat until smooth. Gradually add powdered sugarbeat until creamy. Frost cake with frosting.

Cut cod fillets into 4 pieces and place onto a baking sheet. Spray with non-stick cooking spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place butter pats over each piece of fish and sprinkle with paprika. Place in a preheated 425 degree Fahrenheit oven for 12-15 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Sprinkle with more paprika and serve with lemon wedges and fresh chopped parsley.

Saute garlic cloves over medium heat with olive oil until tender, then add mushrooms. Cook for a minute or so, then add soy sauce and stir well to coat mushrooms with the soy sauce mixture. Add beans to the pan and mix well to coat beans with the soy sauce mixture as well. Add almonds to the pan and cook for a minute or two. Transfer to a serving bowl or plate, and serve.

Mix all dry ingredients in a resealable plastic bag. Shake well. Dip chicken pieces in olive oil. Shake off excess. Dip in dry mixture. Arrange in baking dish. Pour lemon juice over chicken. Bake at 350 degrees for approximately 40 minutes. You can bake it longer if you like it well done.

In large bowl combine ground beef and soup mix. Add remaining ingredients. Mix well and shape into loaf in large lightly greased 13 x 9 inch pan. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from pan and slice into 1-inch thick pieces. Place in 13 x 9 inch greased or lightly oiled baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Serve warm.

Season chicken thighs with taco seasoning mix and place in a 9x13 baking dish. In a large skillet over medium heat combine the tomatoes, garlic and onion. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes until onion is tender. Add to the baking dish. Pour the chicken broth over the chicken. Cover and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the chicken and shred. Add the cheese to the pan and cook for 30 seconds. Return the chicken to the pan and heat through. Serve over tortillas.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place the chicken breasts in a shallow baking dish that is large enough for them to lie flat and fit snugly on the bottom of the pan. In a large shallow mixing dish or in a food processor, combine the breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, and pepper. Blend well with your hands or in the food processor until all of the breadcrumbs are moistened with the spices. Spoon the breadcrumb mixture evenly over the top of the chicken breasts. In a small mixing dish or in the food processor, combine the butter with the garlic powder, lemon juice, and 2 teaspoons of the parsley leaves. Blend well with your hands or in the food processor. Spoon the butter mixture evenly over the top of the breadcrumbs on the chicken breasts. Bake in the preheated oven until the chicken breasts are cooked through, about 30 minutes.

Combine sofrito, vinegar, garlic and tomato sauce in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Stir in beer and simmer until slightly reduced. Stir in beans. Add cumin and oregano. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook rice in boiling salted water until tender. Drain well. Serve rice topped with beans and sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In skillet over medium heat, stir onion and bell pepper in oil. Cook and stir 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add soy sauce and black pepperset aside. Press tofu between paper towels. Cut into 8 equal pieces. Place on baking sheet and bake 10 minutes or until dry and pliable. Cool. In small bowl, stir together spinach and tomatoes. Spoon 1 tablespoon of mixture into each pita half. Arrange tofu pieces over filling. Sprinkle with red pepper mixture. Roll up pita halves. Place on baking sheet. Bake 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve hot.
Cook bacon till crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels, chop bacon into bits and place in large mixing bowl. Add the other ingredients. Mix well. Chill to serve or serve right away.

Cut baguette into wedges. Brush cut sides with olive oil. Bake in a 400 degree oven for about 10 minutes. While baguette is baking slice tomato and cut up red peppers into small cubes. Spread pesto on both sides of baguette. Top pesto with tomato and red peppers. Sprinkle with fontina cheese and bake for about 10 minutes. Serve with toppings and additions of choice. Add pepperoncini to taste.

Cut the cilantro stems off and roughly chop the leaves and set aside. Peel the shallot and finely dice. In a small bowl, combine the cilantro with the chopped shallot. In another small bowl, combine 3 Tbsp. olive oil with the cumin and coriander. Set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together the remaining 2 Tbsp. olive oil with the lemon juice and the kosher salt and black pepper. Pat the salmon fillets dry with paper towels. Rub each fillet generously on both sides with the cumin-coriander mixture. Place the salmon fillets in the marinade bowl. Turn the salmon fillets to coat both sides. Let marinate in the refrigerator for about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the grill to medium-high. When ready to cook the salmon fillets, remove them from the marinade and discard the marinade. Place the fillets on a wire rack over a rimmed baking sheet. Grill the salmon fillets on the preheated grill for

In a small bowl, combine garlic with olive oil. Add parsley and spices. Add parmesan cheese. Mix well. Brush lightly on top of bread. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Yields 4 servings.

Heat oven to 350f. Grease and flour two 9x5" loaf pans. In a large bowl combine brown and white sugar, shortening and egg. Sift together baking soda and flour. Add flour mixture and vanilla and beat until smooth. Fold in rhubarb. Pour into pans and bake for 40-45 minutes. Let cool for 20 minutes before removing from pan. While the cake is baking make the cinnamon-sugar mixture. Combine sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle mixture over hot cake. Allow cake to cool before frosting. Combine powdered sugar and milk. Beat until smooth. Spread over cooled cake and allow to set.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream the butter, peanut butter, cream cheese together. Add powdered sugar and vanilla. Mix well. Fold in the whipped topping. Place the cookies down the center of a large glass baking dish. Add the filling to the cookie layer. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Garnish with chocolate curls. Serve cold.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and stir well. Store in airtight container for up to two weeks.

Cook the pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, peel the shrimp and chop the tails. Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add the minced garlic cloves, capers and shrimp tails. Cook 2 minutes or until the shrimp turn pink. Add the chopped tomatoes, oregano, tarragon, salt and pepper. Cook 2 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly. Add the shrimp to the orzo pasta and toss well. Transfer the pasta to serving bowls and top each bowl with a little feta cheese. Serve immediately.

Bring water to boil in saucepan. Add in green beans. Cook for 4 minutes. Add in garlic. Stir constantly. Cook for 1 more minute. Drain. Rinse beans well. In bowl combine marmalade, orange zest, rosemary, salt, orange juice. Stir until well combined. Add in beans. Stir until beans are well coated. Spray with cooking spray. Cook for 3 minutes. Turn off heat. Add in butter. Stir until melted. Serve warm.
Place ground beef in bowl and add egg and seasoned bread crumbs. Mix well. Form into patties. Grill 8 minutes per side or until done. Serve on hamburger buns. Put tomato slices on top.

Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Cook and stir ground beef and onion until beef is no longer pinkdrain. Add garlic powder and spices. Stir to combine. Remove from heat. Pour pizza sauce over beef mixture. Unroll crescent rolls. Spread 1/2 cup pizza sauce over bottom half of each crescent roll. Sprinkle 1/4 cup parmesan cheese over sauce. Top with beef mixture. Spoon 1/3 cup pizza sauce over beef mixture. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese and remaining 1/4 cup parmesan cheese. Top with pepperoni. Fold up each crescent roll. Cover each pizza with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 10 minutes. Let pizzas stand for 10 minutes before slicing.

Melt butter in large saucepan on medium heat. Add garlic, carrot and celery. Cook until tender. Add rice and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a low simmer. Cover and cook until rice is tender. Add dried chili. Stir well. Serve.
Combine flour and sugar. Blend well. Combine wet ingredients. Add dry and blend well. Spray pan and pat batter into pan. Bake 45 minutes at 350 degrees.

Beat egg yolks with sugar and salt and cook over hot water for 6 minutes. Meanwhile, beat egg whites stiff and fold in. Add milk gradually and cook for an additional 4 minutes. Stir in flour gradually and cook for an additional 4 minutes. Stir in cherry pie filling and apples and cook for an additional 4 minutes over medium heat. Serve with sour cream and sugar.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cut French bread into 1 inch cubes and lay on a large baking sheet or jelly roll pan. Place cream cheese in a medium bowl and beat with a fork until smooth. Add eggs and beat until blended. Add half and half and beat until smooth and creamy. Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat until just starting to brown. Remove from heat and add syrup. Pour cream cheese mixture over cubes of bread and top with additional cubes of bread. Bake 1 hour or until eggs are firm. Serve with jam or jelly if desired.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Saute the onion in the butter until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the broth and thyme and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in the potato and corn kernels and season to taste with the cream and bay leaf. Continue to cook until the potato and corn are tender, about 15 minutes more. Discard the bay leaf and serve hot.

In a skillet, heat the oil and saute the shallots. Add the chicken and cook until no longer pink. Drain the chicken and add it to the shallots. Add the cream and bring the mixture to a boil. Season the sauce with salt and pepper. Cook the pasta until tender. Drain the pasta and add it to the sauce. Add the sun dried tomatoes and cook for a few minutes. Stir in the basil and serve.
Sift almond meal, sugar, cornstarch and salt into egg white mixture. Fold in. Pour into two 9-inch round cake pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serves 16.

Prepare graham cracker crust. In food processor, combine tofu with soy cream cheese, sugar and banana. Blend until smooth. Pour into prepared pie shell. Top with crushed macadamia nuts. Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours or until set. Serve with whipped tofu.

Mix 1 1/2 cups milk with 1/2 cup sugar and bring to a boil for 3 minutes. Add 1 cup cocoa powder and mix until smooth and then let cool. In a small bowl mix 1 cup milk with 2/3 cup sugar and bring to a boil for 5 minutes. Cool completely and mix with 1 cup cocoa powder and 1/3 cup oatmeal until smooth. Add 1/2 cup peanut butter and 1/2 cup butter. Mix well and drop onto a cookie sheet and then place in the freezer for 1 hour and then take out and let stand for 5 minutes before transferring to a cookie tin and then bake at 350f for 20 minutes.

In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, hoisin sauce and rice vinegar and whisk together until blended. Set aside. Thread salmon fillets onto skewers and brush with the hoisin mixture. In a small bowl, combine the green onion and toasted sesame seeds. Sprinkle over the skewers. Grill the skewers over medium heat until the salmon is cooked through, about 10 minutes turning once.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Place the tenders on a foil-lined baking sheet coated with cooking spraysprinkle with the breadcrumbs and seasonings. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes.
Combine all ingredients except pine nuts and butter. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in pine nuts. Cook 1 minute. Stir in butter. Serve hot.

Bake eggplant halves in the oven until tender. Drain and set aside. Slice the eggplant lengthwise. Sprinkle with salt. Let stand until eggplant is tender. Drain. Prepare dressing: mix together oil, lemon juice, cloves and cider vinegar. Stir well. Place the eggplant in the dressing. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and herbs. Serve at room temperature.

Peel potatoes and cut into quarters and place them into a large pot of boiling water. Cook potatoes for 10 to 12 minutes until tender. Drain the potatoes and let cool slightly. Mash the potatoes and add the cream cheese and sour cream to the potatoes. Mix thoroughly with a fork until smooth and creamy. Season with onion salt and salt and pepper to taste. Add a little butter to the potatoes if you desire a little extra flavor and creaminess. Serve warm.

Spread mayonnaise on one side of each slice of bread. Sprinkle with Italian seasoning. Top with cheese. Place sandwiches on preheated grill for 2 minutes on each side. Add pepperoni to grill for 30 seconds.
Combine all ingredients and pour into a large jar or airtight container. Place in refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving. Note: Store in refrigerator for up to 10 days.

Cream sugar and butter in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Add egg yolks one at a time beating well after each addition. Beat in flour and baking powder alternately with sour cream until well blended. Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. Fold into flour mixture until blended. Fold in pecans. Spread into an ungreased pie plate. Bake at 425 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the ovencool completely before adding the whipped cream, and top with the chocolate shavings. (From Betty Crocker's Cookbook)

Melt butter in large skillet on medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook until softened. Sprinkle flour over butter mixture. Cook 1 minute. Gradually whisk in milk. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook 2 minutes. Gradually stir in spinach until wilted. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Season to taste. Cook 3 minutes or until spinach is tender. Stir in bacon bits. Place in serving bowl. Top each serving with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine bisquick mix & water. Add sausage & stir until well combined. Form into balls using a small scoop or your hands. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until lightly browned.

In a small bowl, melt together the chocolate chips and sweetened condensed milk. Stir in the vanilla extract. Spread about one-half cup of the mixture in the center of the lined cookie sheet. Spread the remaining mixture over the filling. Place nuts on top. Sprinkle the candy sprinkles evenly over the nuts. Bake at 400f for 10 minutes or until the top is set. Cool completely.

In a mixing bowl, mix together the crescent roll dough, cream cheese, and blue cheese. Form into a ball and wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 375f. Roll out the crescent roll dough and cut into 6 squares (2 inch squares). Place a ball of cheese on each square and top with a small cut apple slice. Roll up each apple slice and place seam side down on a baking sheet sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly. Serve warm with fresh parsley.

Heat oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat until butter melts and begins to bubble. Add garlic and saute for 30 seconds. Add scallops and saute until brown on one side, about 3 minutes. Add mushrooms to the scallops and saute until the mushrooms have softened and become tender, about 4 minutes. Add wine and lemon juice to the scallops and bring to a boil for 2 minutes. Add scallops and mushrooms to the cooked pasta and toss until combined. Sprinkle with salt to taste. Makes 4 servings.
Mix broccoli, yogurt, onions, lemon juice, chili powder and garlic clove.
Combine all of the salad ingredients in a large mixing bowl and toss to combine. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Cut broccoli in large pieces and place in a glass bowl. Add vinegar and sugar and stir well. Add seasoning and stir well. Place in refrigerator overnight. Remove from refrigerator and add oil. Stir well and serve chilled.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the meat and cook until no longer pink. Add the onions, salt, and pepper and cook until the onions are softened. Stir in the garlic. Add the frozen peas and stir until they begin to thaw. Add the tomato soup and stir to combine. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Stir in the picante sauce until combined. Remove from the heat. Place the cooked meat mixture into a 9-inch square baking dish. Stir in the mashed potatoes. Spread the meat mixture into an even layer. Place the baking dish into the preheated oven. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Cool for 15 minutes before serving.
Add all ingredients to a punch bowl. Stir to combine. Serve over ice.

Mix creamed corn and egg in a bowl and set aside. In a large mixing bowl combine the cornmeal, baking powder and garlic salt. In another bowl mix the salad oil and water. Add the creamed corn mixture to the cornmeal mixture and mix well. Spoon batter into a greased cornbread pan. Bake at 400 degrees F for 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. After the cornbread has cooled slightly add the chopped green chilies and the longhorn cheese. Mix well. Serve warm.

Whisk together flours, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Stir together warm water and vegetable oil in a measuring cup. Add to flour mixture all at once. Stir just until combined. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead by hand 10 to 15 times or until smooth. Divide dough in half. Flatten each half into a disk. Wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least 2 hours. (Or freeze until ready to use.) Preheat oven to 450f. Lightly grease baking sheets. Working with one disk at a time, roll out to a 1/8-inch thickness. Cut out rounds using a 4-inch fluted biscuit cutter. Place rounds on baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until just golden. Serve warm.

Whisk 1 cup sugar and eggs in a 4-cup measure until sugar is dissolved. Slowly whisk in lemon juice and zest. Whisk butter in a small bowl until softened. Stir butter into sugar mixture. Pour into 6 3/4-ounce jars. Cover. Refrigerate at least 24 hours before serving. Serve with scones.

Follow directions for angel food cake mixbake cake according to directions (1 hour 15 minutes). Cool cake completely. Whip cream cheese until smooth. Stir in sugar until blended. Fold in cool whip until well blended. Place cake onto serving platespread with cream cheese mixturetop with pudding mixture. Sprinkle with walnuts. Refrigerate 2 hours or until set. Serve cold.

Place margarine in large saucepan on medium heat. Add chili powder, garlic salt, onion powder, popcorn kernels. Stirring frequently, cook popcorn for 6-8 minutes or until popping slows. Transfer popcorn to large bowl. Stir in cheesetoss to coat evenly. Makes 5 cups.

Cut chicken into serving pieces. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add chicken and brown all sides of the chicken. Add lemon juice and broth. Stir in tomato juice. Add salt and pepper. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in margarine and oregano. Stir until melted. Serve over rice.

In a large bowl, mix eggs and half of the cheese. In another bowl, mix sausage and the rest of the cheese. Spoon sausage mixture into the bottom of an 8x12 pan. Spoon the egg mixture on top of the sausage. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 35 to 45 minutes. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. Serve with toast.

Saute onion and garlic until translucent. Add ginger root. Saute another 1 minute. Add turmeric, paprika, cayenne pepper. Saute another minute. Add lentils to pot. Add water to cover lentils by 2 inches. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover pot. Cook for 30 minutes or until lentils are tender. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with a little fresh lemon juice to taste. Serves 6 to 8 people.
Pour juices into blender jar. Add lime zest and orange slices. Puree until smooth. Pour into cocktail glasses and garnish with lime slices and orange slices and fresh berries.

Cut turkey breast into 1-inch slices. Place 1 slice on bread. Top with 1 ounce of cheese. Repeat with remaining turkey and cheese. Spread with butter. Place on cookie sheet and bake at 350f degrees for 15 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Mix together the eggs and salt in a bowl. Add the nutmeg and oregano and stir. Place 1/3 of the spinach in the bottom of the pastry shell. Place the onion on the spinach. Pour the egg mixture over the onion and spinach. Top with the remaining spinach. Place the swiss cheese on top. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Slice rolls into 10 triangles. Spread one triangle with butter and then spread the almonds over the buttered side. Sprinkle with sugar. Roll up the triangle with the almonds and sugar on the outside. Place seam side down on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with your favorite ice cream or whipped cream.

Put the cream and lemon peel in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Add the pasta and cook until tender. Drain the pasta and transfer to a large serving bowl. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the walnuts and cook until golden. Remove from heat and stir in the fresh parsley. Melt the butter in the same skillet and add the mushrooms. Cook until the liquid from the mushrooms has evaporated. Stir in the walnuts and add to the pasta mixture. Stir in the cream and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
Combine the yogurt and juice. Add in the banana and vanilla. Place the yogurt in a popsicle mould and freeze for at least 4 hours.

Wash basil leaves and pat dry. Finely chop basil leaves and garlic cloves. Process in food processor until very fine, then scrape down sides of processor. Add parmesan cheese and nuts and process until cheese is finely chopped and pistachios are just broken up a bit. With machine running, slowly drizzle in oil in a thin stream while processor is running to ensure it blends in well and does not separate. Add salt and freshly ground pepper to taste. Process until thoroughly combined and sauce is smooth and creamy. Transfer sauce to airtight container and refrigerate for up to 1 week or freeze for up to 2 months. Store in refrigerator or freeze and thaw in refrigerator before using.

Combine all the dry ingredients in a bowl. Place the avocados in a mixing bowl and mash them up with a fork. Add the dry ingredients and stir until the mixture is well mixed together. Serve the mixture with crackers or vegetable sticks.

Combine water and yellow cornmeal (cornflower) and cook over medium heat until mixture forms into porridge. Add heavy whipping cream, salt and pepper. Continue to cook 2-3 minutes until mixture is thick and creamy. Add 1/2 cup of your favorite pasta sauce (primavera) and 1 cup of grated fontina and parmesan cheese. Mix well and pour into 13x9-inch baking dish. Bake at 350f for 15-20 minutes until top is golden brown. Serve with additional pasta sauce and cheese.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Mix together refried beans and 2 cups water. Add jalapenos, green onions and chiles. Heat to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cook until heated through. Place tortilla chips in a single layer in a 9x9 pan. Pour the bean mixture over the chips. Sprinkle with Monterey Jack cheese. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melty and bubbly. Serve with sour cream.

Brown hamburger and onion together. Drain. Add water. Bring to a boil. Stir in V8, tomato soup and mixed vegtables. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Add seasoning. Cook and stir 1 minute. Add cooked pasta. Cook and stir until pasta is tender. Serve.

Combine mustard, brown sugar, maple syrup and dark rum in a shallow dish. Place ham in dishcover and marinate in refrigerator for 24 hours or longer. Remove from refrigerator for one hour before cooking. Bake uncovered at 325 degrees until tender.
Bring sugar and water to a boil. Add brandy and peppermint extract. Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat. Pour into clean glass bottles. Allow to cool completely before capping.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Heat the butter in a medium-sized saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onions. Stir until tender. Add the chopped garlic. Cook for an additional 5 minutes. Add the rice. Stir well to combine. Add the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover the pan. Cook for 20 minutes. Add the turmeric. Stir well to combine. Cover the pan. Cook for 15 minutes. Add the mushroom slices. Cover the pan. Cook for 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven. Fluff with a fork. Serve.

Cut apple into large chunks. Add apple and broccoli to food processor. Puree. Add vinegar and honey to mayonnaisemix well. Combine broccoli-apple mixture with mayonnaise-vinegar-honey mixturemix well. Cover and chill at least 4 hours. Serve with fresh bread.

In a pressure cooker brown onion and garlic with olive oil. Add mushrooms. When mushrooms are tender add 2 cups chicken broth and simmer for 5 minutes. Add arborio rice. Cook for 5 minutes. Add more broth 1/2 cup at a time. Cook until rice is tender. Adjust seasonings with salt pepper. Serve hot.

In large bowl beat graham cracker crumbs and flour until combined. Add melted butter and beat until crumbs are moistened. In small bowl beat sweetened condensed milk until smooth. Add milk mixture alternately with crumbs and beat just until crumbs are moistened. Stir in coconut and pecans. Drop dough by heaping teaspoons onto greased cookie sheet and press each ball down lightly with fork tines. Bake at 375 for 12 minutes or until bottoms are lightly browned. Remove from cookie sheet and place on wire rack to cool completely. Dip each cookie into melted chocolates and place on waxed paper until set and then store in airtight container until ready to serve.

Combine orange juice and orange rind in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir in currant jelly and simmer for 15 minutes. Add port wine and cook 10 minutes more or until jelly has dissolved. Add orange juice mixture to a blender and puree until smooth. Strain sauce into a saucepan and add lemon juice, dry mustard, ginger and cornstarch. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens slightly, about 10 minutes or so. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve.

Divide dough into 10 to 12 pieces and roll each piece into a ball. Place 1 to 2 tablespoons of peanut butter into each ball of dough. Flatten to 1/4-inch thickness and place on ungreased cookie sheet 1 to 2 inches apart. Bake at 375f for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool 1 minute before removing from cookie sheet to wire rack to cool completely. While still warm, top each cookie with 1/2 teaspoon butterscotch chips. Let stand 5 minutes to soften chips before eating.

Rinse off the nopalitos and cut them into strips. Put them in a large bowl with lime juice. Let them sit for 10 minutes. Rough chop the nopalitos. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the nopalitos to the skillet. Cook them for about 5 minutes or so. Add the chopped scallions. Let them sit for another 5 minutes. Add the chopped cilantro. Cook them for another 5 minutes or so. Add the nopalitos to the chicken wings. Cook them for about 15 minutes or so. Then, take them out. Put the wings in a large bowl. Add the butter. Mix the wings to make sure they are coated. Sprinkle the chipotle chiles. Add the chopped scallions. Add the chopped nopalitos. Pour the lime juice in. Mix them. Sprinkle with salt. Serve the wings.

Cream together butter, sugar and eggs in mixer bowl for about one minute. Add vanilla extract. Gradually mix in the flour mixture alternating with the buttermilk in three additions. Beat for about three minutes. Stir in dried cherries. Scoop into cookie sheets 2-inches apart using dough scoop or teaspoon. Bake at 400 for about 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for about two minutes before removing from cookie sheet. Yield: about four dozen cookies.
