In a heavy saucepan melt butter over medium heat. Saute shallot in butter for 1 minute. Add cream to saucepan and bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cook until mixture thickens. Add gorgonzola and cook for 1 minute. Season sauce to taste and serve.

In large saucepan, heat oil over medium-high heat. Saute onions and garlic until tender. Stir in tomatoes and hot sauce and cook for about 15 minutes. Season with oregano and salt and pepper to taste. Add more hot sauce if you like it spicier or more hot sauce for a more intense flavor.

Heat a little oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and jalapeno and cook for about 1 minute or until the garlic is just golden. Add the tomato sauce and cook for 2 minutes. Add the wine and cook for a further minute. Stir in the lemon juice and add the clams. Bring the pan back up to a boil. Reduce the heat and cover. Cook for about 5 minutes or until the clams open. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Discard any clams that do not open. Stir in the basil and lemon zest. Cook for a further minute. Serve the clams with the sauce spooned over. Sprinkle with extra basil and lemon zest.

Slice cucumber in half lengthwise. Using a paring knife scrape seeds from cucumber and discard. Slice cucumber into half-inch thick slices. Set cucumber slices aside. Peel and finely slice sweet onions. Set aside. In a large pot combine vinegar, sugar and cold waterbring to a boil stirring constantly. Add cucumber slices to boiling liquid. Return mixture to a boilboil gently for 2-3 minutes. Add sweet onions to cucumber slicescook for an additional minute or so or until cucumber slices are tender when pierced with a fork. Remove from heatcool to room temperature before serving. Garnish with fresh mint or basil leaves if desired.

In a 1-qt. microwavable bowl, combine 1/2 cup curry powder and 1/4 cup watermicrowave 1 minute. Add green onions, garlic and gingerstir. In a 1 1/2-qt. slow cooker, combine curry mixture, 1 cup chicken broth and 1/2 cup watermicrowave 1 minute. Add ricestir. Add chicken and remaining 1 1/2 cups brothstir. Covercook 4 hours on HIGH. Sprinkle with cayenne.

Combine eggs and sugar in a bowl and beat until thick and pale yellow. Add salt, vanilla and milk and beat until well blended. Pour into pastry crust and bake for 35-40 minutes at 350 degrees or until center is firm and a knife inserted in center comes out clean. To make whipping cream, combine 1 cup of whipping cream and 1 cup of sugar in a bowl and beat until stiff peaks form. Pour onto pie and garnish with fresh berries or sliced peaches and nutmeg.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10 inch oven proof skillet. Mix eggs and wine in a bowl. Place bread slices into the skillet and spread with butter. Distribute cheese slices over bread. Place in oven and bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately. Enjoy.
Combine all ingredients in blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Serve with crackers or tortilla chips.

Boil potatoes until tender (do not peel). Remove from pot, place potatoes in blender or food processor and blend until completely pureed. Transfer the pureed potatoes to large stock pot (I use a 12 quart). Add evaporated milk (I use 32oz) to the potatoes. Bring to boil on medium high heat until it is thickened. Add the bacon bits and the cheese to the potatoes mixture. Mix until cheese is melted. Remove potatoes mixture from the stove, and pour into serving bowls. Top each bowl of potatoes with sour cream, and green onions to taste.

In medium saucepan bring honey, orange juice, and brandy to a boil. Stirring constantly. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in strawberries. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir in cornstarch and cook for 2 minutes. Serve warm.

Place meat in a large resealable bag and add garlic powder, black pepper and seasonings. Close bag and shake to mix well. Place in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours and up to overnight. Remove from refrigerator and allow steak to come to room temperature for 15 minutes before grilling. Grill for approximately 5 minutes per side or until desired doneness is reached. While meat is grilling, prepare the peppers by cutting them lengthwise into strips and removing seeds and membrane. In a large skillet over medium heat, warm the teriyaki sauce and stir in the peppers until heated through. Serve steak with the peppers and rice.
Mix the spinach and basil in a bowl. Add the figs and the vinegar. Mix the prosciutto in with the salad. Sprinkle with truffle oil. Serve.

Combine garlic, black peppercorns, cilantro stem and salt in a large glass jar. Add lemongrass and lime. Fill jar with chicken thighs. Place in refrigerator overnight. Remove thighs from jar. Discard contents of jar. Flake cooked thighs into bite-size pieces. Serve over rice or greens.

Roll out dough and spread with mushrooms. Sprinkle with garlic, oregano and mozzarella cheese and place ricotta cheese on the top half of the pizza dough and fold dough over to cover the filling and place on the pizza pan. Bake at 425 degrees for about 20 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted. Remove from oven and sprinkle the top with fresh basil and kosher salt and ground pepper to taste.

Combine all of the ingredients except peanut butter and stir until thoroughly mixed. Press into a 9x13 pan and refrigerate for at least 3 hours or until set. Cut into squares and top with peanut butter. Store in refrigerator until ready to serve.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in seasoning, tomato, celery and carrotcook, stirring occasionally until tender but not browned. Add noodlestoss to coat. Heat through. Serve with grated cheese topped with crackers.
Mix together all ingredients except crabmeat in a bowl until smooth. Add crabmeat, mix well. Serve with toasted crackers or crackers dipped in the dip.

In a large bowl mix together chuck and seasonings. Form into two patties. Grill on medium heat until cooked through. Meanwhile, make the sauce. In a medium bowl combine olive oil and remaining ingredients. Stir well and pour over burgers. Serve on buns and garnish with parsley.
Combine all ingredients except the canola oil in a jar with tight fitting lid. Shake well to combine. Stir in oil.

Brown hot smoked sausage in 1 tablespoon of hot oil. Add onion, green peppers, celery, water, and tomato sauce. Cook over medium heat until onion is transparent. Add rice. Cook for 15 minutes. Stir in water. Cover and cook for 35 minutes. Stir in salt, black pepper, and parboiled rice. Cover again. Cook for 20 minutes. Stir. Cover and cook for 10 more minutes. Add more water if necessary.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the extra virgin olive oil. Add the bell peppers and cook for 5 minutes. Add zucchini and cook for another 5 minutes. Add lemon juice and rosemary and cook for 5 minutes. Add salt and pepper and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Clean fish by removing scales and gills. Cut fillets into strips about 1 inch wide x 6 inch long and place on a cookie sheet covered with foil. Sprinkle fillets on all sides with thyme, garlic powder and pepper. Drizzle breadcrumbs over top of fish. Drizzle each fillet with butter. Bake for approximately 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve over a bed of reduced-fat potato chips (or a mixture of reduced-fat potato chips and fresh potato chips). Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees c. Roll the phyllo pastry sheets out onto a flat surface to a rectangle. Spread the top 2 sheets with the cottage cheese. Cut the cream cheese into small pieces and scatter evenly over the cheese. Layer the phyllo sheets, starting with a sheet of cottage cheese then cream cheese then another sheet of cottage cheese. Roll the pastry tightly. Trim the edges. Place onto a greased tray and brush the top of the rolls with the butter. Sprinkle the top of the rolls with a little ground cinnamon. Bake in the oven for 40 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown. Allow the rolls to cool for 5 minutes before cutting into slices. Serve warm.

Place the pine nuts in a food processor. Process until the nuts are ground into a coarse meal. Set aside. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until evenly browned. Add the chopped basil leaves and the red bell peppers. Cook over medium heat for about 3 minutes or until the basil wilts. Add the garlic and red bell peppers. Cook for about 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add the olive oil. Cook over medium heat for about 1 minute or until the oil begins to smoke. Add the ground pine nuts. Cook for 1 minute or until the nuts begin to brown. Add the red pepper flakes. Stir to combine. Add the tomatoes. Cook for about 5 minutes or until the tomatoes begin to soften. Add the basil pesto. Cook for about 1 minute or until the basil begins to wilt. Remove the basil pesto from the heat. Add the pesto to the mixture. Cook for about 5 minutes or until the mixture is hot throughout. Serve immediately.

Cook bratwursts according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Cook onion and garlic in oil until tender. Add spaghetti. Add spices and rotel tomatoes. Stir until spaghetti is well coated with spices. Add bratwursts and picante sauce and heat through. Stir in shredded cheese.

In a small bowl, combine the eggs and milk. Beat well. Dip each breast in the milk/egg mixture and dredge in the bread crumbs. Place the coated chicken breast in a 9 by 13 inch pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until the breast is no longer pink in the center. While the chicken is baking prepare the sauce. In a small sauce pan combine the sauce with the oil. Stir over low heat for 5 minutes or until the sauce begins to thicken. Remove the sauce from the heat and place it in the refrigerator. Remove the chicken from the oven. Lift the breast from the pan with a spatula. Place the pan under the broiler for 1-2 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve the chicken over the spaghetti sauce. Top with provolone cheese. Baked chicken parmigiana.
Combine all the ingredients in a slow cooker, stir well and cook for 4 hours on low heat or 2 hours at high heat. Serve over white rice and top with chopped green onions and sesame seeds.

Boil the hominy according to the package directions. Drain and place in a mixing bowl with the sour cream and cheeses. Add the chili and pepper, stirring to combine. Add the salt and pepper to taste and place in an oven safe dish. Place in the oven and cook for about 10 minutes until the cheeses are melted and the topping is bubbly. This is great served alongside chicken enchiladas. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine fruit and flour. In a large bowl combine eggs, milk and vanilla extract. Stir in flour mixture. Add rum. Pour into a 10-inch pie pan. Bake 45 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream.

Cut cod into desired serving pieces (3 - 4 ounce pieces per person). Pat dry with paper towels and place cod pieces between 2 paper towels and flatten into 1/4 thickness (you can use a meat mallet if you prefer). Season well on both sides with salt and pepper and dust lightly with flour. In another shallow bowl, whisk together the egg and 1 tsp of the onion powder and set aside. In a third shallow bowl or on a plate, combine the breadcrumbs and remaining onion powder and set aside. Dip the cod pieces into the egg and then press into the breadcrumbs until evenly coated on both sides. Heat the 2 tbsp of oil in an iron skillet over high heat until the oil is hot and the breadcrumbs sizzle when dropped into it. Add the cod to the skillet and cook 2 - 3 minutes per side until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and serve with rice. Note: We served ours with fresh corn on the cob and a baked sweet potato topped with a little butter and brown

Preheat the oven to 400f. Heat a large saut pan over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil. Once hot add the rosemary and shrimp. Cook until the shrimp is pink and opaque throughout. Set aside. In a small bowl combine the orange juice and zest. Pour the orange juice mixture over the shrimp. Place the shrimp in an aluminum foil lined 9x13 pan. Season with salt and pepper. Roast in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Serve with rice and vegetables.
Prepare a small amount of butter and brown sugar. Add apples and sultanas. Sprinkle over nutmeg. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes. Serve with low-fat vanilla ice cream. Serves 6.
I use the same proportion of stevia to water as I do sugar. So I use 2 teaspoons stevia with 1/4 cup water. I make this with vanilla in mind. So I use 1 teaspoon vanilla with the 2 teaspoon stevia.
Mix yogurt with egg white. Heat cornstarch in skillet and add yogurt mixture. Cook until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and serve.

Wash and pat dry sweet potatoes. In a large saucepan heat milk over med heat. When it reaches 170f add 1 cup sugar and 1 egg. Stir constantly until thick. Remove from heat. Add sweet potatoes, remaining 1 cup sugar and 2 tsp vanilla. Stir well. Bake in greased 9x13" baking dish at 375f for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Add pecans and 1 cup of brown sugar. Stir until melted. Spoon into baking dish. Combine 1 cup sugar, flour and 1 tbsp of brown sugar. Cut in 1/2 cup of butter with pastry blender until crumbly. Sprinkle on top of sweet potatoes. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes.

Preheat broiler to medium. In a medium saucepan, add the chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Add the frozen vegetables and cook until thawed and tender. Remove from heat and add the chicken and tapioca. Cut the orange in half. Remove the seeds from one half and use to cut the other half. Discard the seeds. Place the halves in a small bowl and stir in the marmalade. In a small bowl, stir together the dry mustard and the ginger. Stir the dry ingredients into the chicken mixture. Place the chicken mixture in a 1-qt. baking dish. Spoon the orange mixture evenly over the chicken and sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Broil on high for 5-7 minutes or until heated through and the sauce has thickened. Serve.

Cook rice according to package directions. Drain & set aside. Peel orange sections & set aside. In 2-quart saucepan, stir together cranberry sauce & orange peel. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until thickened. Stir in whipping cream & orange juice. Remove from heat & stir in cooked rice. Place orange sections & lettuce leaves around edge of individual dessert plates or bowls. Spoon rice mixture into center of plate or bowl. Chill 1 hour before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Pound pork chops lightly with a meat mallet. Place in a shallow baking dish. Combine soup, water, vinegar, worcestershire sauce, brown sugar and hot sauce. Pour mixture over pork. Cover and bake at 350F for 1 hour. Serves 4.

Preheat oven broiler. Place salmon fillet on a broiler proof dish and brush with mayonnaise and parmesan cheese. Sprinkle with chopped green onion and white wine. Place under broiler and broil for approximately 4 minutes. Remove from heat and serve. Enjoy!

Mix flour, salt, egg in medium bowl until well blended. Set aside. Heat broth in large saucepan over medium heat until hot. Add flour mixture to broth. Cook, stirring constantly until thickened. Add corn. Cook 3 minutes.

Combine mushrooms and cheese in a bowl. Heat olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add mushrooms mixture. Cook and stir until cheese is melted. Season with salt and pepper. Spread hamburger buns with mayonnaise. Add aioli to top. To serve, place mushrooms mixture on hamburger bun. Garnish with dill weed.

Cook chicken. Strain off stock. When cool enough to handle, cut into small cubes. In a medium bowl combine couscous and stock. Cover and let stand 10 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Fluff with fork. In a large bowl toss couscous, snow peas, green onion, almonds and orange sections. In a small bowl combine orange juice and zest, vinegar and olive oil. Drizzle over the couscous and toss. Add the chicken and toss well. Season with salt and pepper.

Heat butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in flour and cook for about 2 minutes or until mixture is golden. Gradually stir in chicken broth, milk and broccoli. Bring soup to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer for about 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in Velveetacook for 1 minute or until cheese is fully melted. Serve hot.

Brown meat with garlic and onion in skillet. Add tomatoes and chili powder and simmer for about 15 minutes stirring frequently. Stir in refried beans and cook for another 15 minutes until tender. Add tomato juice and simmer for another 15 minutes. Add cranberry sauce and simmer for another 5 minutes. Add kidney beans and cook for another 10 minutes. Serve hot with cheddar cheese sprinkled over top.

Cut each boiled egg lengthwise into 6 wedges and place in a large bowl. Combine all remaining ingredients except peppers with eggsblend with an electric mixer until smooth. Fold peppers into mixturerefrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. Serve with crackers or vegetable sticksgarnish with additional chives if desired.

In a non-stick frying pan over medium heat, fry the olive oil. Add the cumin. Fry until it smells aromatic. Then add the caraway seeds. Then add the olives. Then add the paprika. Add the chopped fresh tarragon. Crack the eggs into a medium bowl. Beat them until blended. Pour the eggs into the pan. Cook until the eggs are just set. Add the parsley. Season with a little salt and freshly ground black pepper. Turn the omelet over to cook until the other side is set. Remove the omelet from the pan. Serve immediately.

Put all ingredients into a 4 cup mason jar, leaving 1/4 inch head space. Fill the jar up to the top with boiling hot water (from the kettle). Cap jar and place in the freezer. Allow to thaw overnight in the refrigerator. You may use the meat right away but it is best to allow it to thaw completely in the refrigerator. If you freeze the meat in smaller batches ( 1 cup at a time), you can use it right away or freeze the extra. To use the meat you will need a freezer storage bag. You can use a plastic freezer bag with a zip lock seal to keep the meat fresh longer. For best results, use a 1 gallon freezer storage bag. (This is the type you will find at your grocery store.) Simply place the meat in the bag, squeeze out all the air, place in the freezer, and use as needed. If you are using the meat right away, take it out of the freezer the day before you wish to use it so it will thaw properly in the refrigerator the next day. If

Sprinkle chicken with cayenne pepper. Drizzle chicken with oil. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Heat oil in skillet. Add onion and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add chicken. Cook 10 minutes or until chicken is tender. Drain chicken. Heat milk in small skillet. Stir in flour. Cook over medium heat for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly. Slowly add in skim milk. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until mixture is thickened. Stir in sherry. Cook for 1 minute. Add parsley. Serve over chicken.

Mix all of the ingredients together except for the breadcrumbs and the cheddar cheese. Place into a loaf tin or oven proof dish that can fit into your oven. Place the loaf tin or dish into the oven and bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until cooked through. Allow to rest for 10 minutes before slicing.

Combine yogurt, cheese, and sugarmix well. Spoon into 4 serving bowls. Arrange fruit over yogurt mixturetop with brown sugar and cinnamon. (You may want to keep sugar and cinnamon separate to sprinkle over each serving.) Serve immediately with low-fat hot chocolate or coffee.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook 10 minutes or until softened, stirring occasionally. Add the curry powder and stir well. Cook 1 minute. Add the chicken and cook 3 minutes. Add the mango chutney and stir until the mixture thickens slightly. Cook 1 minute.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Combine rice and soymilk. Bring to boil and cook over low heat for 1 hour or until rice is tender. Beat the egg lightly and add to rice mixture. Cook for 10 minutes more. Stir in vanilla and cinnamon. Pour into greased 8x8x2inch baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes.
Combine all ingredients except crescent rolls and bake in 425 degree oven for 25-30 minutes. Top with crescents and bake an additional 5-10 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut each chicken breast in half. Place in a baking dish. Sprinkle each breast with chili powder and cumin. Add oil. Top with garlic salt and cayenne. Bake until cooked through and tender. Prepare the chicken. To make the sauce, whisk together lemon juice and lime juice. Whisk in jelly. To serve, place each breast half on a plate. Spoon on a little of the sauce. Enjoy.

Cream together 4 cups sugar, 1/2 cup pumpkin spice, 1/2 cup evaporated milk, 1/2 cup butter. Add eggs. Add to 1 box yellow cake mix. Beat with electric mixer until light. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Let cool. Cut into squares. Roll each square into a ball. Roll into walnuts. Place on wax paper. Makes 24.

Combine the dressing mix and 1/4 cup water in a small bowl and stir until dissolved. Add the oil, lemon juice and remaining water. Brush fish fillets and marinate for at least 15 minutes. Heat a nonstick grill pan over medium-high heat until hot. Add the fish and grill on one side for about 10 minutes or until just cooked through. Flip the fish and grill for another minute or two until golden brown. Serve fish with extra dressing mix.

Beat together eggs, lemon juice and sugar until fluffy and thick. Fold in the butter and cream cheese and add enough lemon zest to flavor. Taste and add additional lemon juice if needed. Chill until ready to serve.

Beat egg whites in a large bowl until stiff peaks form, using a wire whisk. Gradually add the granulated sugar, beating until stiff peaks form again. Fold in vanilla extract. Sift the flour into the beaten egg white mixture, mixing until combined. Fold in the lollipops. Fill a crepe pan or nonstick frying pan halfway full of oil. Heat the oil on medium-high heat until it is hot but not smoking. Pour the batter into the hot pan, tilting the pan so the batter coats the bottom well. Cook for 30 seconds or until the top is just beginning to bubble. Flip the crepe onto a plate or plate lined with paper towel to drain. Repeat with the remaining batter.
Combine rum, hpnotiq and simple syrup with ice and shake well. Pour over crushed ice into a tall glass and top with lime and mint leaves.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter. Add the hash browns and cook until they are well coated with the butter. Add the beef bouillon cube and 1/2 tsp seasoning salt and stir until dissolved. Stir in the pepper. When the hash browns are softened, sprinkle with the remaining seasoning salt and stir. Serve immediately.
Pour pumpkin into a small bowl. Add the vanilla-flavored syrup, pumpkin pie spice, milk, espresso. Pour mixture into a mug. Top with whipped cream.

Remove the skin from the kippered herring fillets. Put the shallot, anchovy fillets, fresh lemon juice, cayenne pepper, olive oil and scotch in a pan over a medium heat. Gently simmer for about five minutes. Add the unsalted butter. When the butter has melted remove from the heat. Add the kippered herring fillets. Cover with a piece of greaseproof paper and allow them to steam for about 5 minutes. Remove the paper and sprinkle with the fresh dill sprig. Serve.

Take 2 cups light bread crumbs and 1 cup beef to 1 egg mixture, enough to make 6 muffins. Mix well. Put mixture into 6 greased muffin tins. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until done. Serve warm with ketchup or mustard.

In a 10 inch skillet heat the butter. Sauté the onions until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in the curry powder and flour until well blended. Stir in the broth and pumpkin. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the brown sugar and nutmeg. Transfer to a blender and puree until smooth. Return to a saucepan and add the milk and stir until hot. Serve hot.

Separate 1 egg white and put aside. Beat egg yolks with heavy cream in a medium mixing bowl until thickened. Fold in 1/2 of the egg white. Add ham. Fold in broccoli. Add cheese, stirring to combine. Pour half of mixture into a greased 8 inch round baking dish. Add remaining egg white and stir in. Bake for 30 minutes. Let quiche sit for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with sliced tomato.

Preheat oven to 275 degrees f. In a large pot or Dutch oven, combine the pork with enough apple juice concentrate and cider vinegar to cover it by one inch. Cover and cook over low heat until the meat is very tender and falling apart, about 8 hours. Transfer the meat to a large bowl and discard the cooking juices. Strain the juices and reserve them for another use or discard them. Return the meat to the pot and cover with apple juice concentrate and cider vinegar. Cover and cook over low heat until heated through. Serve warm with your favorite sides.
Mix all ingredients together. Roll into ball and cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 2 hours before serving. It's best to make it a day ahead and bring to room temp before serving.

In a large saucepan add olive oil. Sauté carrot and green onions in oil. Add oyster mushrooms. Cook for about 5 minutes or until tender. Add vegetable broth. Simmer for about 15 minutes. Add quinoa. Stir and cook for about 15 minutes. Add beans. Cook for about 5 minutes. Season to taste.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Combine all biscuit ingredients and stir until combineddo not over mix. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 12 minutes. Serve hot from the cookie sheet.

Toss the shallots with the red pepper flakes in a large bowl. Add the tomatoes, toss together with your hands to combine. Drizzle with the olive oil & toss again. Season with salt & pepper. Cook the pasta to the al dente stage according to package directions. Drain the pasta & toss with the tomato mixture & basil. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In a large bowl beat together the yogurt and stevia powder. Add the pumpkin puree and the vanilla. Whisk together the flour and baking soda. Mix into the yogurt mixture. Add the eggs and beat well. In another large bowl melt the chocolate and the chocolate chips with the butter and stir together. Add the chocolate mixture to the yogurt mixture and stir to combine. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges of the cookies are golden. Let cool completely. Enjoy!

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Lightly rub the chuck roast with meat tenderizer. Combine soy sauce, orange juice, lemon juice and sugar in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and boil for 30 seconds. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Place the chuck roast in a 13x9 inch baking dish. Pour the marinade over the roast and let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Grill the roast over direct medium heat for 30 minutes, turning frequently. Baste with the remaining marinade. Grill the roast over indirect medium heat for 1 hour 45 minutes. Baste with the remaining marinade. Let stand for 15 minutes before slicing. Serve with steamed rice and broccoli.

Wash pears and cut in quarters. Remove cores and cut into cubes. Put into saucepan with lemon juice and rind, sugar and pineapple juice. Cook over low heat until pears are soft but do not brown. Serve warm or cold. May vary seasonings to taste.

Combine all the ingredients in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 15 minutes until the mixture thickens and is syrupy. Remove from the heat and let cool before serving.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, add the oil. Add the onions. Cook until softened. Add the pork chops. Brown for 2 to 3 minutes per side. In a small bowl, add the flour to the water. Stir until the lumps are gone. Pour the gravy into a large bowl. Add the brown gravy to the bowl. Stir. Add the pork chops to the bowl. Cover. Let simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve.
Sauté onions and margarine in skillet until tender. Add flour and brown. Add seasonings and water. Brown a little bit more. Cover and simmer about 30 minutes. Add sour cream and serve.

In a large glass casserole dish (such as a lasagna dish), layer the turkey gravy, the cooked turkey, the mashed potatoes, the mixed vegetables, the stuffing, and finally the cheese. Bake covered at 350 degrees fahrenheit for about one hour until the cheese is melted.

Mix 2 tablespoons of olive oil with pearl onions and brandy. Warm over a low flame. Add juice and season with salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes. Cut pork chop into thin slices and remove any fat. Season with salt and pepper. Dip in flour and fry in butter until golden brown. Place pork on top of onions and cook for 10 minutes. Add prunes and cook for 10 minutes more. Add lemon juice and remove from heat. Serve hot.

Prepare pie crust according to package directionsset aside. Beat cheese with sugar for about 2 minutes or just until sugar is dissolvedadd eggs one at a time, mixing well after each additionadd pie filling and mix wellpour into pie crust. Refrigerate 2 hours or longer if desired before serving. Top with non-dairy whipped toppingserve immediately.

Boil the vermicelli in the milk for 7 minutes. Drain. Beat the egg yolks until thick. Add the lemon juice to the boiled vermicelli. Drain the cheese. Add the yolk mixture and stir. Add the cheese. Serve.
Put all the dipping sauce ingredients into a blender. Blend until smooth. Serve with fresh veggies.

Cut potatoes into 1-inch dice. Peel carrots. Cut into 1-inch dice. Cut the stem end from each jalapeno chile. Remove the seeds (and some of the white membrane) if you like the chile hot. Put potatoes, carrots, tomatoes, onion and oregano in a large bowl. Add 1/2 cup orange juice. Stir to coat. Add 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Combine oil, seasonings, and cayenne in a wide bowl. Toss with roasted salted peanuts. Transfer to a wide platter. Serve.

Steam potatoes until tender (5 to 8 minutes), depending on the size of potatoes. Meanwhile, toast horseradish root until light brown, about 10 minutes. Cool slightly and grind to a fine powder using an electric spice grinder or mortar and pestle. Add powdered horseradish root to tofu sour cream and blend well. Add sugar and salt to taste, stirring until blended. Stir fresh chives into tofu sour cream mixture. Serve potatoes hot, topped with horseradish sauce.
In saucepan, melt margarine over medium heat. Add evaporated milk, sugar and orange liqueur. Heat and stir until sugar is dissolved. Add chocolate chips and stir until smooth.

Wash the potatoes and boil them until tender. Drain and mash them thoroughly with a potato masher or ricer. In a separate bowl, beat together the cream cheese and the sour cream until smooth. Gradually stir this mixture into the potatoes until blended and then stir in the butter and the onion powder. Season with salt and pepper and a dash of paprika. Serve at room temperature.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add beans and chard and saute for 5 minutes. Add diced tomatoes and cook 2 minutes more. Add lime juice and cook an additional 2 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve.
Place all of the above in a large wok. Cook over a high heat for a few minutes then add water and cook for a few more minutes until prawns are cooked. Drain and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a 10 x 15 jelly roll pan. In a medium bowl combine the bisquick mix with the milk. Stir in the mushroom and onion. In a large bowl beat the eggs. Add the thyme and salt and pepper. Stir in the biscuit mix. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until the center is set. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing.

Brown onions in hot oil until transparent. Add bell pepper and mushrooms and cook until tender. Remove from heat and stir in soup. Pour into a greased 8 x 11 inch square baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Top with noodles. Bake for 15 minutes at 350 degrees. Just before serving garnish with french fried onions.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add beef and brown. Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is softened. Add potatoes and carrots. Add water and soup. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender. Season with salt and pepper and stir in worcestershire.

In large skillet, brown chicken on both sides. Remove chicken from pan and set aside. Drain excess fat from pan. Add cream of chicken soup to pan. Stir in the stuffing mix. Add the water. Place chicken in pan. Cover pan and cook on low heat for 20 minutes. Serve.
Bring to a boil all the above ingredients except the zucchini. Lower heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add zucchini and cook for 30 minutes or until zucchini is cooked. Serve with bread.

Boil asparagus in large pot of water until tender-crisp, about 2 minutes. Drain well and reserve 1 cup of water. Stir 2 tbsps butter into reserved water. Bring to boil. Add asparagus to water and cook for 1 minute. Drain and toss with remaining 2 tbsps butter. Stir in garlic, lemon juice and vinegar and season with salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 5 minutesremove from heat and stir in thyme and lemon zest. Makes 4 servings.
Dump contents of all cans into a crock pot. Stir to mix well. Add enough water to cover the contents of the cans. Cook on high for 2-3 hours. Serve with cheeseballs and/or crackers.

Add coffee to a blender with 1/2 tsp caramel ice cream topping. Blend until well mixed. Pour into a tall glass. Add milk to blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into the glass. Top with whipped cream. Add ice. Garnish with a cherry.

Place cabbage in a bowl. Pour vinegar over cabbage. Sprinkle sugar over cabbage. Place a plate over cabbage and weigh it down for 15 minutes. Remove plate and discard. Place cabbage in a saucepan and add water to cover. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in brown sugar. Cook 30 minutes more. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot or cold.

Prepare bok choy as desired. Combine almond milk, apple juice, vinegar, mustard, honey, cashews and raisins in the blender or food processor and process till smooth. Add bok choy and other vegetablestoss to coat. Serves 8-10.

Wash potatoes and pat dry. Cook in boiling salted water until tender, about 20 minutes for large potatoes. Drain and cool slightly. Cut lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Heat the oil and butter over medium heat in a large saucepan or Dutch oven. Add the potato slices and cook gently for 3 to 4 minutes, or until golden brown and crisp. Add the cream, milk and seasonings and bring to a simmer. Cook gently for about 10 minutes or until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Stir in the parsley and serve immediately.
Wash and dry arugula and rip avocado in half. Shave parmesan over both. Whisk garlic and lemon juice together in a small bowl and drizzle over salad. Toss and serve immediately.

Make instant pudding as directed on package. Pour into a bowl and set aside. To make sauce, stir sweetened condensed milk and vanilla extract in a microwave safe bowl for about a minute or until heated. Pour sauce over pudding. Spoon Cool Whip onto pudding mixture. Arrange wafers on top. Add sliced bananas. Chill for at least 1 hour.

Sift the dry ingredients together into a large mixing bowl and make a well in the centre. Add the eggs and stir in until smooth and light and pale yellow in colour. Add the green tea powder and baking powder and stir until combined. Add the melted butter and stir until combined. Pour the mixture into three round cake tins and level the top of the mixture with the back of the spoon. Place the cakes into the preheated oven and cook for about 40 minutes or until golden brown and a skewer inserted into the middle of the cakes comes out clean. Allow the cakes to cool for a few minutes in their tins and then transfer onto wire racks to cool completely. Serve as is or dusted with icing sugar. Store in an airtight container for up to three days or in the freezer for up to three months.

Prepare bread dough as directed on package for two rolls. Roll out dough on lightly floured surface to 10x10 inches square. Cut into squares or strips (depending on desired serving size). Place strips into ungreased baking dish and bake as directed on package for rolls. Remove from oven and drizzle each strip with melted butter and sprinkle with bacon and cheese. Return to oven and bake for an additional two minutes or until cheese is melted and bacon is browned. Remove from oven and drizzle each strip with ranch dressing mix and serve immediately.

Melt butter over medium heat in a large skillet. Add onions and saute until golden brown. Stir in beef gravy and cook until heated through. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Divide between 2 hamburger buns. Serve on a bed of French fries. Sprinkle with parsley and enjoy.

Mix butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar until light and fluffy. Add light corn syrup. Add flour to mixture. Add vanilla. Stir in butterscotch chips. Press mixture into an 8 x 8 pan. Press corn flakes into top. Melt peanut butter and spread over corn flakes layer. Cut into squares.

Butter one side of each slice of bread and grill in a sandwich press or toaster oven until golden brown. Spread mayonnaise on one side of each slice of bread. Place the two sides together and grill again until golden brown. Remove from press and place one slice of American and one slice of Swiss in the middle. Fold sandwich and serve.

Cook egg noodles according to package directions. Drain noodles and set aside. Preheat oven to 350f. Brown ham in a skillet over medium heat. Add cheddar cheese and cook until melted. Stir in cream of chicken soup. Stir in cooked egg noodles and cooked ham. Spread mixture in a greased 2 quart casserole. Sprinkle top with butter and milk. Cover and bake for 25-30 minutes.
Skewer grapes together with fresh grape leaves. Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with roasted cashews.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Toss the asparagus with the lemon juice and set aside. In the meantime, in the bowl of a food processor, combine the parmesan with the basil and garlic. Pulse until finely chopped. Set aside. On a large rimmed baking sheet (I used two), drizzle the asparagus with olive oil. Add the garlic to the olive oil and mix it in. Arrange the asparagus on the baking sheet. Bake until the asparagus is tender and golden brown, about 10 to 15 minutes. Meanwhile, place the parmesan mixture in a small bowl. With a small spatula, fold in the softened butter. Spoon the mixture over the asparagus. Bake for 2 to 3 minutes longer. Serve.

Cut cabbage into thin strips. Place in a bowl. Dissolve salt and sugar in vinegar. Stir and pour over cabbage. Allow to marinate for at least 30 minutes. Mix cranberry juice with apple juice. Stir into the cabbage. Refrigerate. Before serving, stir to mix again. (Canned cranberry and apple juice can also be used.)

Clean and slice the straw mushrooms into small pieces. Heat the oil in a large wok or a deep skillet over medium heat until hot and shimmering. Add the garlic and stir until fragrant and just turning brown, about 1 minute. Add the straw mushrooms and cook until golden brown and tender, about 2 minutes. Add the soy sauce and stir until blended and the liquid has evaporated, about 2 minutes more. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the salt and pepper and stir until blended in. Serve immediately with rice or noodles or bread.

Melt butter and brown sugar over medium heat until it reaches 230-240 degrees. Remove from heat and stir in egg yolk until smooth. Stir in milk chocolate and flour until well combined. Pour into a greased 9x13 baking dish. Bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes or until top of bars is cracked and edges are slightly browned. Let cool. Combine remaining ingredients. Drop by teaspoonfuls over bars. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes or until topping is set. Let bars cool completely. Cut into bars and serve.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add cavatelli and cook for about 3 minutes. Drain well in a colander. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add broccoli and cook for about 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add chicken brothbring to a boil. Add cavatellicook for about 1 minute or until tender. Toss in parmesan. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. In medium bowl, beat egg lightly. Add flour, milk substitute, salt and pepper. Stir in onion and mushroom. Spread into bottom and sides of unbaked pie shells. Mix together remaining ingredients. Sprinkle over onion mixture. Bake 25 minutes or until golden brown. 365 quick, easy inexpensive dinner menus.

Dice avocadoes, onion, bell pepper, chili and cilantro into 1/2-inch pieces. Place all of the ingredients into a large mixing bowl except the ranch dressing mix. Toss to combine. Add ranch dressing mix and stir until well combined. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers. Serves 6

Cut the liver into small cubes and place in a bowl with the bacon pieces. Cook the bacon in a skillet until it is just crisp, but not burnt. Remove and drain on a paper towel and add to the bowl with the liver. Sprinkle over the bacon and liver the salt and pepper and toss lightly until combined. Serve warm with a toothpick for easy eating.

Season the fish fillets with the lemon juice, cajun seasoning, pepper. Place in the refrigerator for 10-15 minutes. Drain fish. Blend the cornmeal, flour and mayonnaise. Place the fillets in the cornmeal mixture and coat well. Wet your hands with cold water. Shape the mixture into balls. Flour your hands. Shape into patties. Breadcrumbs will stick to hands. Fry the croquettes in hot oil until they are golden brown. Serve immediately with tartar sauce.
Combine apple juice and brown sugar in small saucepanbring to a boil. Remove from heatstir in butter. Arrange pears on plattertop with sauce. Serve with ice cream if desired.

Combine the buttermilk and breadcrumbs into a large mixing bowl and whisk together. Add the garlic powder and chilli powder to the breadcrumbs and then add the seasonings and stir well to combine. Place the chicken breasts into the buttermilk and breadcrumbs and coat evenly then place into the oven to bake at 180 for 30 minutes or until cooked through and golden brown on top. Serve with your favourite salad and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 24-cup mini-muffin tins. Whisk together cornmeal and all-purpose flour. Add remaining dry ingredientsmix well. Combine egg whites and milkstir into dry mixture until smooth. Add onionstir. Divide batter evenly among prepared tins. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Spread salmon fillets with sun-dried tomatoes. Sprinkle with parsley and garlic. Drizzle with olive oil. Salt to taste. Bake in 200 degrees for 20 minutes.

Peel and cube potatoes and sweet potatoes. Add to large saucepan with cold water. Bring to boil. Reduce to simmer and cook until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Drain. In food processor, add potatoes and sweet potatoes. Add flour, baking powder, eggs and seasonings. Mix well. Form into patties and fry in hot oil. Serve with chili sauce.

Bring 6 cups boiling water to a rolling boil in a large saucepan. Remove from heat and add 4 tea bags and stir to dissolve. Let steep for 15 minutes. Discard tea bags and stir in lemonade concentrate. Pour into glasses and add a slice of lemon and a sprig of fresh mint.

Peel and boil potatoes until tender. Drain and set aside to cool. Cube and place into a large mixing bowl. Add ranch dressing mix, sour cream, milk and margarine. Stir well with a large spoon until all the potatoes are well coated. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Mix flour, sugar, lemon zest and salt and keep to one side. In a separate bowl, whisk together the buttermilk and the egg and keep to one side. Cream the butter and add to flour mixture. Add the buttermilk mixture and stir to form a dough. Roll out dough to 1/4 inch thickness and cut into desired shapes. Bake in a preheated oven for 12-15 minutes at 425 degrees Fahrenheit or until lightly golden brown.

Peel and slice red potatoes. Boil until tender. Drain and cool slightly. In a large bowl combine the onion and potatoes. Whisk together the flour and the fat-free half and half. Add the fat free cream cheese and whisk again until smooth. Pour the onion/potato mixture into a greased 13-by-9-inch baking dish and sprinkle with the onions and peppers. Pour the cream mixture over the mixture in the dish. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until set.

In large pot cook the oil with the onions until softened. Add the garlic. Then add the tomato puree, tomatoes, stock and seasonings. Bring to the boil. Add the lardons. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add the beans. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve with fresh crusty bread.

Rinse chicken under cold water and pat completely dry. Using a sharp knife, score chicken flesh on both sides. Sprinkle chicken with sugar and season with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine lime peel and lime juice. In a medium bowl combine rosemary and garlic. Mix together and spread over chicken. In a large bowl whisk together olive oil and lime mixture. Place chicken into marinade and toss to coat. Cover and place into refrigerator for at least 2 hours and up to 24 hours. Remove chicken from marinade. Place on grill and cook until done, about 25 minutes. Serve with desired side dishes.

Preheat oven to 325f. Place pork chops in a 9x13 pan and add crushed tomatoes and brown sugar and vinegar and garlic powder to the pork chops and mix well. Cover with foil and cook for 30 minutes. In a large skillet saute onion until tender and add to pork chops along with the molasses and chili powder and cook another 15 minutes or until sauce thickens. Serve with cooked rice.
Cut strawberries in half. Cut each half into quarters. Mix all ingredients together. Serve as a dip for celery stalks. Add yogurt or mayonnaise to taste.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sirloin steaks. Cook until browned about 5 minutes. Sprinkle the sirloin steaks with the seasoning mix. Cook for 1 minute. Add the broth to the skillet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook until the sirloin is tender. Add the hoisin sauce. Stir. Add the mushrooms. Cook until tender. Serve with noodles or rice.

Sift together flour and salt and set aside. In large mixing bowl beat together shortening and sugar until fluffy. Add eggs and beat well. Add flour mixture and beat until well combined and smooth. Spread batter evenly in greased 9x5x3 loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until done. Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to cooling rack.
Spread each roll with a slice of cheese. Divide sausage evenly among the rolls. Add dill pickles and tomatoes to each sandwich. Serve with a side of mustard.

Cook noodles according to package directionsdrain. Heat a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add oilswirl to coat pan. Add the onion and saute until tender, about 5 minutesstir in garlic powder and black pepper. Add the meatcook until browned and crumblydrain. Stir in the cottage cheese and sour creamset aside. Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking sprayplace a layer of noodles in pan. Top with half of the meat mixture and half of the cheese mixturerepeat layers twice more. Cover with foilbake at 350 degrees F until hot and bubbly, about 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Cream butter and shortening together in a bowl. Add sugar and vanilla and beat well. Stir in eggs and beat well. Combine flour and cinnamon and stir into batter just until moistened. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 2 minutes on cookie sheet and then transfer to cooling rack. Let stand at least 5 minutes before serving.

Heat a large saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil to pan. Add the shrimp to the pan and saute for 4 minutes. Add garlic to the pan and cook for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms to the pan and cook for 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes to the pan and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Transfer mixture to a bowl. Add the rice to the bowl. Stir well. Transfer to a serving dish. Sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

Pre-heat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) Place halibut fillets in a shallow dish. In a small bowl mix together seasoning salt and black pepper then sprinkle over halibut fillets. In another small bowl mix together garlic powder and butter and then spread over halibut fillets. Place halibut fillets in a shallow pan. Sprinkle crackers over fillets and then sprinkle remaining seasoning mixture over the top of the crackers. Bake in the pre-heated oven for about 12 minutes or until the fillets are cooked through (fish should flake easily). Serve hot.

Sift dry ingredients into a bowl. Make a well in center. Add milk and egg to center and gradually add dry ingredients to make batter. Grease a 9 inch square pan with oil. Pour batter into pan. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until golden brown on top. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before cutting.

Peel potatoes. Cut into 1 inch cubes. Cook in water until tender. Drain and set aside. Melt butter in skillet. Add potatoes and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally until potatoes are tender. Add milk, salt, pepper, and stir. Add cheese and stir until melted. Add potatoes to potato skins. Sprinkle with paprika and serve.

Melt butterscotch chips & butter together in saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly with wire whisk until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in marshmallows & nuts. Pour into a 9x9-inch pan coated with cooking sprayspread mixture evenly. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or until set. Cut into 24 squares.

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth. Pour into an ungreased 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking pan. Bake 45-55 minutes or until set. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving. Cut into bars.

Cut cabbage into quarters. Cut green pepper, celery, onion into quarters. Cut carrot into quarters. Mix together all the veggies in large bowl. Mix vinegar, sugar, salt and celery seed. Pour vinegar mixture over vegetables. Toss to coat. Place vegetables on cookie sheet. Place cookie sheet on middle rack of oven. Cook vegetables until wilted, about an hour. Turn vegetables every half an hour. Keep checking the vegetables until they are all cooked. Place vegetables in a serving bowl. Add mustard seeds. Sprinkle salt on top of vegetables. Place serving bowl on table. Serve cold with sandwiches and hamburgers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl, combine flour, coconut and 1/3 cup white sugarmix well with a fork. Cream together 1/2 cup white sugar, 1 cup (8 ounces) cold butter (cut in) and 3/4 cup milk with a mixer at medium speed for about 2 minutes. Add the flour mixturemix at low speed just until blended. Spoon batter into a lightly greased 9-inch square baking panspread evenly. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutesremove from oven and immediately sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons white sugar. Cool completely in pan on wire rackcut into squares to serve.

Wash potatoes. Bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes or until done. Cool. Slice potato into thin slices. Place in serving bowl. Sprinkle with cheese. Add green onions. Top with butter and sour cream. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 deg. In a 9x13 inch casserole dish combine broth, tomato paste, rosemary, thyme, garlic cloves, celery seed, red pepper flakes, and butter. Cover with foil. Bake 1 hour. Remove foil. Add shrimp to broth mixture. Cover. Cook 15 minutes or until shrimp is done. Remove from oven and sprinkle with parsley.

Cream butter. Add sugar. Beat until light. Add egg. Add vanilla. Beat until light. Add flour, baking powder and salt. Stir in farina. Add raisins. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 375f for 12 to 15 minutes. Cool 3 minutes before removing to wire racks.

1/2 cup olive oil, 1/2 cup orange juice, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 cup quinoa, 1 cup water, 2 cups chopped onions, 1 cup fresh parsley, currants and orange zest1 teaspoon saltpreparation:1/2 cup olive oil, 1/2 cup orange juice, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 cup quinoa, 1 cup water, 2 cups chopped onions, 1 cup fresh parsley, currants and orange zest1 teaspoon saltpreparation:1/2 cup olive oil, 1/2 cup orange juice, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 cup quinoa, 1 cup water, 2 cups chopped onions, 1 cup fresh parsley, currants and orange zest1 teaspoon saltpreparation:1/2 cup olive oil, 1/2 cup orange juice, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 cup quinoa, 1 cup water, 2 cu

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain, reserving some pasta water. Whisk eggs in large bowl. Add in cheese. Pour in pasta water a little bit at a time until desired consistency is reached. Stir in buttermilk. Add salt. Add pasta to egg mixture. Stir well. Pour into buttered casserole dish. Bake for 30 minutes.
Cut cucumbers into long chunks, add to mixing cup. Add rum, brown sugar, lime wedges and fresh mint leaves. Mix well and serve over ice.

Brown pheasant pieces in a pan with oil on medium to high heat for about 20 minutes or until meat is cooked through (do not overcook). Add soup to pan and cook until heated through (do not let soup boil). Add water to pan until liquid covers meat completelyreduce heat to low. Cover pan with foil and cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until rice is done (rice will be cooked before meat). Sprinkle with parsley before serving with a salad of your choice.

Put oil into a large saucepan over medium-high heat and saute garlic and shallot until softened, about 5 minutes. Add carrots and cook until tender, about 8 minutes. Add honey and soy sauce and cook until mixture is thickened and carrots are golden-brown, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in orange juice and zest. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving dish and sprinkle with mint. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Place sugar, water, orange juice and zest into a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Simmer until mixture begins to thicken, about 10 minutes. Remove from heatstir in figs and curacao. Serve over ice cream or yogurt. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. Yields about 1 cup of compote.

Cut the onion into small pieces. Dice the jalapeno pepper. Combine with the beans and a large pot of water. Cook until tender. Add salt and cumin and cook for another 15 minutes. Drain and set aside. Mince the garlic. Melt the butter and add the minced garlic and cook until the butter is slightly browned. Add the beans and cook over moderate heat until thickened. Serve hot with shredded cheese and/or chopped onions on top.

Sift together the flour, baking soda and baking powder. Cream together the butter and sugar. Add the orange drink, eggs and vanilla. Pour batter into a greased 9-inch square baking dish. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Cut into bars.

Mix turkey, celery, onions, mayonnaise, soup, salt pepper and pimientos. Bake in greased casserole at 375 degrees for 30 minutes. Stir and top with potato chips. Broil for 2 to 3 minutes until chips are toasted. Sprinkle with paprika. Makes 6 servings.

Boil the potatoes for 20-30 minutes. While the potatoes are boiling, butter the inside of the potatoes. After the potatoes are cooked, slice an avgolemono egg (one that contains the yolk) in half. Carefully remove the egg yolks from the egg whites. Set aside. Place the egg yolks in a bowl. Mix with the white pepper. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher. Place the mashed potatoes into a greased casserole dish. Pour the egg yolks over the potatoes. Season with salt. Cover with egg whites. Place the potatoes into a preheated 375 degree F. oven for 30-35 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 180c/gas 4. Grease and line two 20cm sandwich tins. Sift together flour and bicarbonate of soda. Beat egg and sugar together. Beat in oil. Stir flour mixture and apples into egg mixture. Stir in pecans. Divide mixture between two prepared cake tins. Bake for about 1 hour. Meanwhile, prepare glaze by heating sugar and milk together until sugar has dissolved. When cakes have cooled, make toffee sauce. Pour hot toffee sauce over cakes. Leave to set.

Peel potatoes, then dice them into cubes. Place potatoes into a large pot of boiling water and cook for 8-10 minutes until tender. Drain potatoes, then mash potatoes using either your hand or potato masher. While potatoes are boiling place mushrooms into another pot of boiling water for 5 minutes until they are softened. Take potatoes out of boiling water then add curry powder into potatoes, then add mash potatoes into pot. Place pot on medium heat then add yogurt into potato mixture. Stir potato mixture until well combined then season with salt and pepper to taste. Then add chopped chili pepper into potato mixture if desired. Serve warm or cold.

Melt the butter and the brown sugar together over low heat for about five minutes or until the mixture begins to bubble around the sides of the pan. Increase heat to medium and add the cinnamon and banana extracts and stir until the mixture thickens and turns a deep caramel color. Remove from heat and immediately pour the mixture over the cereal and pecans and stir to combine. Place on wax paper and allow to cool completely before serving. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to two weeks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. Place half of the vanilla wafers into a plastic bag. Crush the wafers with a rolling pin or mallet until they are coarsely crumbled. Place into the prepared baking dish. Place remaining wafers into a large bowlcrush with a rolling pin or mallet until they are coarsely crumbled. Add half of the butter, orange zest, orange sorbet, orange juice, light corn syrup and vanilla frozen yogurt to the crumbled wafer mixturestir until well combined. Pour over wafer mixture in baking dishstir to coat evenly. Bake for 25 minutes or until setcool 5 minutes before serving. Store covered at room temperature for up to 3 days or refrigerate for up to 2 weeks. Makes 10 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 f. Coat bottom of 12 cup muffin tin with nonstick cooking spray. In large bowl, beat together Bisquick mix, ham, onion, cheeses. Stir in sour cream. Blend in egg and seasonings. Divide mixture evenly into prepared cups. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 1 minute before removing from pan. Makes 12.

Prepare a brine of equal parts vinegar and water and add salt and spices. Cut a slit in the bottom of each cucumber and place in a large container with the brine. Weight down with a plate. Place in a cool spot for at least a week. Drain and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 x 13 pan with cooking spray. Combine bread cubes with parsley. Slice orange into eighths lengthwise, then into eighths crosswise. Set aside. Combine orange cubes with orange zest, orange juice, red chile pepper, black pepper, salt, and 1 cup bread cubesmix well. Spoon orange mixture into prepared pan. Arrange fish fillets over mixturetop with remaining bread cubes and orange slices. Drizzle with remaining orange juice. Sprinkle with remaining orange zest and parsley. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 35 to 45 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

To prepare the shrimp, place shrimp on a platter with the tail side down. Sprinkle with the thyme, oregano and pepper. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Marinate for 30 minutes. Turn shrimp over. Rub with remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Grill until shrimp is cooked through about minutes. Transfer shrimp to a platter. Stir together the lemon juice, lemon peel and remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Pour over shrimp. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with lemon wedges.
Beat cream cheese until softened, then add sour cream and blend well. Add chopped bacon, chopped green onions, chopped blue cheese, and chopped walnuts, blend well until smooth. Serve warm or cold.

In large saucepan, heat oil and add onion and garlic. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes or until onion is translucent. Add chorizo to pan and cook for 2 minutes until browned. Add potato and cook for 2 minutes. Add stock and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes or until potato is tender. Transfer soup to blender and puree until smooth. Return the soup to the pan and stir in the chopped kale. Cook for 2-3 minutes until wilted. Season soup with salt and pepper. Serve with croutons.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add green beans and cook until they're tender. Drain them and add them to a bowl. Add butter and garlic and mix them well. Add pepper and serve hot.

Cook rotini according to package directions, drain and rinse under cold water. Combine mayonnaise, dijon mustard and honey in a mixing bowl and whisk well. Combine cooked rotini and ham in a large mixing bowl. Add mayonnaise mixture and stir well to coat. Add celery and gouda and toss well. Serve salad chilled or at room temperature.

Combine all the crab meat into a bowl. Add mayonnaise and stir until well blended. Add Old Bay seasoning and mix well. Add parsley and saltine crackers and blend. Place mixture in a food processor and process for about 15 seconds. Form mixture into 6 patties. Place patties in a greased baking dish. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes.

Prepare pudding according to package directions. Spread about 1/2 cup of pudding in a 9x13 inch pan. Top pudding with 1/2 cup of sliced bananas. Add remaining pudding over bananas. Top with remaining sliced bananas. Place wafer on top of pudding. Cool then refrigerate 3 hours or overnight. Cut into 12 pieces. Makes 12 servings.

Boil potatoes until tender (about 15 minutes). Drain the potatoes well. Mash the potatoes with the boursin cheese, sour cream, salt and pepper to taste. Stir to blend well. Pour the mashed potatoes into a 9x13 pan to a 1/2 inch thickness. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm with extra butter if desired.

Remove all fat from steaks (discard). Rub with oil and salt and pepper to taste. Grill steaks over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until desired doneness. Remove from heat. Dice onions and saute in a small skillet in butter or oil for 2 minutes. Stir in ginger, garlic, curry powder, coriander, diced tomatoes (with juice), and yogurtheat through. Spoon onions over steaks. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 2 hours for later use.

Wash and hull strawberries and slice. Place in bowl and sprinkle with sugar. Add water and mix well. Microwave on High for 2-3 minutes. Stir until sugar dissolves and mixture thickens. Let cool for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Add boiling water to gelatin and stir until dissolved. Whisk in strawberry mixture and cool. Stir in heavy cream. Pour into baked pie shell. Chill. Serve with freshly whipped cream.
Pour all ingredients into slow cooker and cook until sugar dissolves. Serves 12.

Boil green beans, wax beans, and kidney beans in a large pot until tender, about 5 minutes. Drain beans and cool in ice bath. Drain and chop into 1-inch pieces. Add onion, parsley, and garlic. Add dressing and sugartoss until well coated. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Add lettuce just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Grease and flour a 9x5 inch loaf pan. Beat eggs and add stevia. Beat in yogurt. Add flour and baking soda and beat until smooth. Fold in mashed bananas. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes in the pan before removing to a wire rack. Serve warm.

Place apples in 13-inch x 9-inch baking dish. In large bowl, mix sugar and next 5 ingredients. Cut in butter until crumbly. Spread over apples. Dot with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until topping is browned and apples are tender. Serve warm.

Spread the pepper cheese on one side of each slice of bread. Top each slice with the sharp cheddar cheese. Place the slices of bread together, pepper cheese side down on the grill pan for approximately 2 minutes on each side or until the cheese is melted and golden brown.

Blend together peanut butter and butter with electric mixer. Add sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add eggs and beat well. Add dry ingredients and beat until mixture is smooth. Drop by teaspoons onto greased cookie sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes. Do not over bake.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat half-and-half in a small saucepan until it is hot but not boiling. In a shallow baking dish or 8-inch square pan, layer half of the bread in a single layer. Top with half of the cream cheese (or cream cheese substitute). Top with half of the eggs (or egg substitute). Top with half of the half-and-half. Repeat layering 3 more times with remaining ingredients. Place in oven for 30 minutes or until lightly browned on top. Serve with warm strawberry sauce. Prepare strawberry sauce by combining 1 cup of strawberries and 2 tablespoons of sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly until strawberries have broken down. Remove from heat and let cool 5 minutes. Puree strawberry mixture in a blender until smooth. Pour into a small saucepan over medium heat and cook until bubbly. Remove from heat.

Bring chicken stock and water to a boil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add potatoes and onion and cook until almost tender, about 8 minutes. Drain and return potatoes and onions to saucepan. Stir in carrots and season with salt and pepper. Add butter and cook over medium heat until potatoes are tender and onions are transparent and translucent, about 8 minutes. Stir in parmesan cheese and transfer potatoes and vegetables to a greased gratin dish. Bake gratin in a preheated 400 degree oven until browned and bubbly, about 20 minutes. Serve with a drizzle of the pan juices from the gratin dish.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion and garlic. Cook until softened. Add cumin, black pepper and oregano. Cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in potatoes and broth. Cover and cook over medium heat for 25 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Add chicken and cook 5 minutes. Puree in batches in a blender. Return pureed mixture to saucepan and stir in cheese. Cook over medium heat until cheese melts. Stir in green chilies. Serve hot.
Place 2-3 Tbsp of puree in middle of tortilla. Place on griddle over medium heat until cheese melts. Flip and grill on other side until golden brown. Serve with salsa on the side.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. On the stovetop, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is tender. Add lamb and cook until lamb is no longer pink. Transfer to a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, on the stovetop, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add tomato and cook until tomato is tender. Transfer to a bowl and let cool. Cut pita in half. On each half of the pita, place a scoop of tomato and 1/4 of lamb mixture. Top with a scoop of tzatziki. Place each pita on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes.

Melt butter in a medium saucepan. Stir in parmesan cheese and cook over medium heat until cheese is melted. Remove from heat. Add heavy cream, garlic cloves and pepper. Stir until smooth. Season to taste.
Put all ingredients except the broccoli in a crock pot. Stir well. Cook on high for three hours. Add the broccoli florets. Cover and cook on high for an additional hour. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place frozen corn in a large baking dish. Coat the corn with cooking spray. Top the corn with margarine. Add green onion, red bell peppers, red chili peppers, paprika and toss to coat. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until vegetables are tender but not mushy. Serve warm.

Cream Crisco shortening and butter together with an electric mixer and gradually add the sugars, beating at medium speed until well blended. Beat in the egg and vanilla. In a separate bowl, mix together the flour, baking soda and baking powder. Mix the dry ingredients into the creamed mixture and stir until just blended (the dough will be sticky). Stir in the shredded coconut and walnuts. Drop dough by teaspoons onto a lightly greased cookie sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned on edges. Remove from cookie sheet to cooling rack to cool completely before removing from pan to store.

Cook red pepper, onion, and garlic until tender in olive oil over medium heat. Transfer to food processor. Add cannellini beans and process until smooth. Add parsley, lemon juice, salt, and pepper to taste, and process until blended.

Cut each breast into 8 evenly-sized strips. Place in a shallow baking pan. Coat the pan with olive oil. Place strips side by side, overlapping slightly. Coat the strips with the melted butter. Sprinkle with the salt. Bake for 25 minutes at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C), or until the chicken is done. Drain any excess fat from the pan, then add the olive oil. Melt the butter over medium heat. Cook the garlic cloves for 2 minutes, or until they are golden brown. Sprinkle the garlic with the salt. Add the flour and stir for 2 minutes. Add the hot water and stir until the mixture is smooth. Add the broth, the chicken bouillon cube, the fresh lime juice and the capers. Bring to boil, then lower the heat. Cook for 10 minutes, or until thickened. Add the cooked rice. Bring the mixture to boil again for 2 minutes. Spoon over the strips of chicken. Sprinkle with the parsley. Serve

Cut biscuits in half. Place biscuits in greased 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. In a 3-quart casserole dish combine meat and next 8 ingredients. Cook 45 minutes uncovered. Stir once during cooking. Pour meat mixture into baked biscuit dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes until cheese is melted. This recipe is excellent for a crowd. I have served this dish as a side to my meals. It is also perfect for a potluck supper.

Heat a griddle over medium-high heat. Spread butter on one side of each tortilla. Top each tortilla with 2 slices of bologna, 1 slice of cheese and 1 tablespoon mayonnaise. Fold sandwiches in half to enclose the filling, then fold ends over filling to form a half-moon shape. Place sandwiches on griddle, butter-side down. Cook until golden brown, about 1 to 2 minutes on each side or until desired degree of doneness.

Bring 3 cups of salted water to the boiling point in a large pot or Dutch ovenadd potatoes and cook until tender but not falling apart, about 25 minutesdrain potatoes well. Let cool slightlypeel potatoes and cut into quarters, then into eighths lengthwiseplace potatoes in a large bowl. Mash potatoes with whole milk and cream until almost smoothseason with salt and pepperstir in blue cheesegarnish with fresh rosemary.

Pour water into 6-cup measuring cup, sprinkle gelatin over waterlet stand 1 minute to soften. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Pour into 11-ounce punch bowl. Stir in nectar, juices, ginger aleserve at once with long ice tongs. Store unused portion, well covered, up to 24 hours. Makes 24 servings.

In a large skillet over medium heat brown ground beef and dried blueberries until no longer pinkdrain fat. Place in a large bowl with cheese, salt, and peppermix until combined. Form into four pattiescoat with cooking spray. Grill to desired doneness or pan-fry until pink center is no longer pink. Serve with rollstop with lettuce if desired.

Mix 1/3 cup of butter with the breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese and seasonings. Cut chicken breasts in half lengthwise. Dip each half into the butter/bread crumb mixture. Place the chicken onto a shallow dish. Heat 2 tablespoons of apple juice in a skillet and cook the green onions for 1 minute. Stir in the remaining juice and cook the chicken until it is golden brown. Serve the chicken over a bed of rice. Garnish with parsley leaves.

Prepare pie shell. Combine biscuit mix, sugar, milk and eggs in mixing bowl. Stir with spoon until blended. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake in preheated 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven for 15 minutes. Combine butter and vanilla. Brush over hot pie. Sprinkle with coconut. Cool for 5 minutes. Cut pie into wedges. Serve immediately.

Cook rice as directed on package and drain. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook orzo according to package directionsdrain well. Place orzo and rice in a large bowlstir in melted butter and cheese. Stir in vegetable stock and lemon juicesprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large pot over medium heat, cook bacon until fat is rendered, about 5 minutes. Transfer to paper towel to drain and discard any remaining fat. In the same pot, saute onions until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add mustard and brown sugarcook until mixture starts to bubble, about 2 minutes. Pour in the beans and cook until tender, about 30 minutes. Add molasses, mango chutney, bourbon and black peppersimmer until flavors develop, about 5 minutes. Spoon beans into a baking dishsprinkle with bacon and top with cheese. Bake until cheese is melted, about 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a small saucepan over medium heat, bring beer to just before boiling. Stir in paprika until blended. Remove from heat and stir in cream cheese until smooth. Set aside for 20 minutes. Combine cheeses and stir until blended. Fold in cream mixture. Slice almonds. Stuff cheese mixture into almonds. Place in prepared baking dish. Bake 40 minutes or until firm. Serve with crackers or toast.

Boil macaroni in salted water until al dente. Drain. In large bowl combine macaroni and all other vegetables. In small bowl combine vinegar and vegetable oil. Stir into vegetables. Add salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

In large ziploc bag, mix cooking spray, green onion, brown sugar, paprika, ground coriander, salt and crushed red pepper flakes. Add pork chops and shake until chops are well coated. Set aside for 15 minutes at room temperature. In large non-stick skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of cooking oil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and ginger, cook until softened, about 1 minute. Add chops in batches and cook until brown on both sides, about 10 minutes total. Transfer chops to serving platter with sauce drizzled over top. Serve with steamed rice and pickled vegetables.

In large saucepan, heat 2 cups peanut oil over medium heat until just warm. Add onions and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add chiles, tamarind paste, fish sauce and white sugar and cook until mixture begins to thicken, about 15 minutes. Transfer to heatproof bowl or container, cool completely then refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Can be stored for up to 3 weeks.

Bring the broth and water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add the rice and return the broth to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in the chutney and curry powder. Add the raisins and almonds. Cover the pan and continue cooking over low heat for 10 to 15 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender.

In a bowl combine all ingredients, except nuts. Place on a serving platter or tray and sprinkle with nuts before serving. Store covered in refrigerator for up to three days. Refrigerate leftovers for up to one weekbring back to room temperature before serving.

In a medium saucepan, bring 1 1/4 cups of water to a boil over medium heat. Place tortillas in the pan one at a time for 30 to 40 seconds on each side. Remove from pan immediately with tongs to drain on paper towels. Remove any bubbles from pan. Add 1 cup of ice cubes to the hot pan. Reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring occasionally, until mixture is reduced by half. While mixture is cooking, add 1/2 cup of mayonnaise to 1/2 cup of sweet chili sauce. Mix well. Dice cooked chicken into 1/2 inch pieces. Fill each tortilla with 2 tablespoons chicken. Top with lettuce leaves, avocado slices, diced tomatoes and mayonnaise mixture. Top each tortilla with a small amount of basil. Serve with mixed salad greens. Makes 16 servings.

In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heatadd the onion and sauté until tender about 4 minutes. Add the carrots and carrot topssauté for about 2 minutes longer or until the carrots are tender. Add the broth, tomato paste and rice and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add the cream and simmer for about 4 minutes more or until the rice is tender and the mixture is thickened and smooth. Taste for salt and pepper and serve hot with carrot curls.
In a large bowl combine apples, pineapple tidbits, celery, mayonnaise, whipping cream, powdered sugar and vanilla extract. Garnish with walnuts. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Heat oil in small skillet. Saute eggs until set. Add soy sauce to eggs. Add rice. Add tomato sauce. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir. Spread onto greased 2 quart casserole. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool. Serve.

Bring broth to a boil in a medium pot over medium-high heat. Add broccoli to boiling brothreduce heat to medium-lowcover potcook until broccoli is tender, 5 minutes. Drain broccoli, reserving brothtransfer broccoli to a bowl. Add pepper and tomatoes to brothcook until pepper is tender-crisp, stirring occasionally, about 4 minutes. Add broccoli and garlic to brothstir to combinecook until garlic is fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heatadd southwest seasoningcook until fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minuteadd broth mixture to skilletcook until heated through, about 30 seconds. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

Combine flour, salt and baking powder. Add milk gradually stirring until dough is smooth. Knead for 5 minutes. Let rise 10 minutes. Form dough into a ball. Put on a pizza pan sprayed with cooking oil. Let rise 10 minutes. Sprinkle pizza dough evenly with flour. Add toppings. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

Cut the chives into small pieces. Heat the cognac in a small saucepan until bubbly. Add the broth, mustard and parsley. Boil for 5 minutes. Pour into a small bowl. Add the butter and whisk until the butter has melted. Add the worcestershire. Add the beef broth and whisk until the mixture is emulsified. Add the chives. Whisk until the chives are incorporated. Serve over steak or any other meat. Add to mashed potatoes or to poached fish.

Spread 1 cup of whipped topping on bottom of 9x13 glass dish. Spread 1/2 cup of instant vanilla pudding over whipped topping. Add 1/2 cup of sweetened condensed milk on top of pudding. Add 1/4 cup cream cheese on top of sweetened condensed milk. Top with 1/4 cup of whipped topping. Top with half of bananas sliced lengthwise. Top with half of cookie pieces.
