Top with second half of bananas sliced lengthwise and top with remaining half of cookie pieces. Top with remaining half of whipped topping. Freeze for 1 hour or until ready to serve. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) Combine carrot and egg substitute in a medium bowl until carrot is well blended into the egg mixture. Combine flour and baking powder in a separate medium bowl until well combined. Add carrot and egg mixture into the flour mixture and stir until well blended together. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake in preheated oven for about 15 minutes until done. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan. Sprinkle with chives and parmesan cheese and enjoy!

Rinse turkey. Pat turkey dry with paper towel. Combine the tequila and lime juiceset aside. Place a paper towel on a work surface. Place turkey on paper towel. Sprinkle garlic on turkey. Sprinkle salt over turkey. Rub turkey with olive oil. Sprinkle with lime. Rub turkey with garlic-lime mixture. Wrap turkey with foil. Place turkey on a baking rack in a roasting pan. Roast at 325 degrees for 2 1/2 hours. Uncover turkey. Place turkey on a wire rack over a sheet pan. Roast at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Let stand for 15 minutes before carving. Serve.
Mix butter with brown sugar. Add milk and corn syrup and beat until well combined. Add vanilla. Beat until thick and fluffy. Use in place of buttercream frosting on any type of cake.

Preheat grill to medium heat. Slice the yellow onions in half and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle the onions generously with salt and pepper. Place the slices of venison tenderloin in a plastic bag. Add the onions and seal the bag. Slice the portabella mushrooms in half and season each side with salt and pepper. Place the mushrooms, face down on the grill and cook for about 5-7 minutes. Flip the mushrooms over and cook for another 4 minutes. Remove the venison tenderloin from the bag and place it on the grill. Close the grill and cook for about 10 minutes. Place the bacon strips onto the grill and close the grill. After 10 minutes of cooking time, remove the venison tenderloin and the bacon. Turn the grill off and remove the portabella mushrooms from the grill. Allow the venison tenderloin to rest for about 10 minutes before slicing into thin pieces. Serve the venison tenderloin over the portabella mushrooms and enjoy!
Place ritz crackers on a plate. Cut tuna into small cubes and place on top of crackers. Add tomato soup. Sprinkle seasoning on top of the soup.

Heat butter in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender and lightly browned, about 12 minutes. Meanwhile whisk together the eggs and cream in a medium bowl until blended. Season with salt and pepper. Remove cooked onion from pan and pour egg mixture into pan. Cook over medium heat until custard is set and edges have begun to brown and puff, about 10 minutes. Place a piece of parmesan on top of custard and return pan to the stove over low heat until cheese is melted and custard is hot and creamy throughout, about 5 minutes more. Sprinkle with additional parmesan cheese before serving.

In a saucepan heat water to boiling. Remove from heat, add wine, add cranberries with lemon juice to taste, add cooking apples, cinnamon stick to taste, bring back to boil and cook until apples are softened and cranberries are burst open.

Add the olive oil to a soup pot. Add the chopped onion and cook until translucent. Add the minced garlic and cook for 30 more seconds. Add the potatoes. Cook until they soften. Add 8 cups of broth. Bring to a boil. Add cayenne pepper to taste. Add 1 cup of fresh coriander. Let simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Let sit for 5 minutes. Squeeze lemon juice into soup. Stir and serve.

Peel garlic cloves. Place in a blender with water, vinegar and red pepper flakes. Blend until smooth. Add salt to taste. Combine in a small saucepan with oil. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir in parsley. Serve with grilled steak. This sauce is also good with grilled pork.

Cover bottom of 10 x 15 x 1-inch baking dish with pie crust. Pour onion soup into crust. In small bowl combine flour and margarine. Stir into onion soup. Add broth to onion mixture. Add vegetables and cooked chicken. Pour into crust. Cut top crust slits. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 1 hour. Let stand 10 minutes. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Grease a shallow baking pan and line the pan with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Place the apricots in the prepared pan and sprinkle them evenly with the honey, the ground ginger and the slivered almonds. Drizzle the vanilla ice cream over the top and bake for 25-30 minutes or until the apricots are bubbling and tender and the ice cream has melted and is golden. Serve hot or warm.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Crush the pineapple in a bowl. Add the pistachio pudding mix and the cool whip. Place in a pie pan and refrigerate for 4-6 hours. Remove from refrigerator and cut into small pieces. Place on a serving platter. Sprinkle with nuts. Arrange the marshmallows around the pineapple. Top with the mandarin oranges and bananas. Arrange the cherries around the outside of the platter. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8 by 8 by 2 inch casserole dish and set aside. In a small bowl combine the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt and set aside. In another small bowl combine the butter and milk and set aside. In a medium bowl combine the eggs and stir until combined well. Add the dry ingredients to the wet and mix until all is combined. Fold in the bacon and shredded cheddar cheese and pour into the prepared casserole dish. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until the biscuits are golden brown and the center of the casserole is no longer jiggly. Let the casserole stand for 5 minutes before serving so the biscuits will firm up even more. Serve hot.

Soak pork and beans overnight in cold water. In the morning drain and rinse. Strain. Combine all ingredients in a medium pot and bring to a boil. Cook until thick and tender about 30 minutes. Add more water if the mixture gets too thick. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Boil gnocchi in a large pot of water for about 5 minutes. Drain well. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic cloves. Cook until lightly browned. Add spinach. Cook until wilted. Drain well. Stir in tomatoes. Add gnocchi, italian seasoning, salt and pepper to taste. Cover with foil. Bake for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with mushrooms.

Wash sweet potatoes. Prick with fork. Wrap in foil. Bake at 375 for 1 hour or until tender. Allow to cool slightly. Mix ketchup, mustard and vinegar in a small bowl. Place 1/4 of the sweet potatoes in a large bowl and mash with a fork. Add mustard mixture and mix well. Spoon filling onto sweet potatoes. Sprinkle with ground red pepper. Bake 10 minutes or until golden. Serve hot.

Fill a highball glass with crushed ice. Add gin. Pour the freshly squeezed lemon juice over the ice. Top off the glass with club soda. Stir to combine. Drop the maraschino cherry in the center of the drink. Top off the drink with a little more club soda if desired. Serve.

Peel potatoes and cut them into large wedges. Brush them with melted butter, place them on a foil-lined cookie sheet, season with parsley flakes. Bake at 450 until tender. In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion, beef, beef stock, brown sugar and thyme. Cook until meat is tender, about 45 minutes. Add potatoes and carrots and cook until potatoes are tender. Serve with your favorite sides.

In a 4-cup pitcher, stir together sugar and water until sugar is dissolved. Add ice and stir to blend. Add red-hot candies. Stir well to dissolve candy. Add pineapple juice, frozen lemonade and ginger ale. Stir well. Serve over ice.

1. Place lettuce on 12 individual plates.2. Top with beans and tomato.3. Add cucumber and carrot.4. Drizzle with dressing.5. Top with cheese.6. Drizzle with dressing.7. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley. Serves 12.

Combine all marinade ingredients in a small bowl. Place chicken in a resalable plastic bag and pour marinade over it. Seal the bag and marinate in refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Preheat grill. Drain and discard marinade. Grill the chicken over medium heat for 10 minutes on each side. Chicken is done when it reaches 160 degrees in the thickest part of the breast. Serve with potato salad or baked potatoes.

To cook the fish, brush it with the sesame oil and season with salt. Place the fish in a hot pan and cook on both sides until it is browned and cooked through. Drain the fish on kitchen paper. To prepare the salad, slice the bok choy lengthways into strips and toss with the leek. In a pan, warm the olive oil and sauté the bok choy and leek for 5 minutes or until tender. Add the fish fillets and cook for 1 minute. Add the lime juice and stir in the coriander. To make the dressing, put the soy and sugar in a pan with 5cm water and bring to the boil. Remove from the heat and leave to cool. Meanwhile, whisk the egg white and 1 tbsp of the water together. Blend the remaining water with the sesame and coriander seeds. Put the egg white mixture in a blender with the chilli and the sesame and coriander seeds. Blend until smooth. Pour the dressing through a sieve into a jug. Serve the fish on plates with the salad. Pour the dressing over the

Mix eggs, dates, rice krispies, pecans, coconut together in a large mixing bowl. Sift together the confectioners sugar and the flour. Add this to the bowl. Add the vanilla extract. Mix until the mixture holds together. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper. Let dry for 24 hours.
Mix all of the ingredients together and place onto the flatbread. Enjoy!

Melt butter in large saucepan. Whisk in flour and paprika. Gradually whisk in milk. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese. Stuff olives with cheese mixture. Place in spoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake at 375f for 15 minutes.

Using a food processor or a mixer with a paddle attachment, blend flour and salt. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Add cold water, 1 tablespoon at a time, blending until mixture holds together but is still crumbly. Divide dough into 2 equal portions. Form dough into disks. Wrap dough disks tightly with plastic wraprefrigerate at least 1 hour. Roll out dough disks on a lightly floured surface until 1/8-inch thick. Cut out dough rounds with a floured 2- to 3-inch biscuit cutter. Refrigerate rounds for 30 minutes or until firm. Line a 15x10-inch jelly-roll pan with parchment paper. Place 1 round on prepared pantop with 1/3 cup butter. Repeat with remaining dough rounds and butter. Refrigerate until firm (at least 30 minutes), then freeze until firm (at least 1 hour). Transfer to a resealable freezer bagfreeze up to 3

Cut the top of the biscuit and place the biscuit inside a glass bowl. Bake at 375 degrees for 5 minutes. Fill biscuit with egg, ham and cheese. Place biscuit tops back onto each biscuit and bake for 12-15 minutes or until the biscuits are golden brown. Top each biscuit with tater tots and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 2 quart casserole dish with 1/2 tsp of butter. Pour the milk into the casserole dish and set aside. In a small sauce pan over medium heat, melt the remaining butter into the milk until it bubbles. Remove from heat and add the macaroni and mix well with the butter mixture until all the macaroni is coated. Pour the macaroni mixture into the casserole dish with the milk mixture. In a medium bowl, beat the eggs with the salt and pepper. Add the milk mixture with the macaroni mixture and stir well until the eggs are completely mixed into the liquid. Sprinkle the mozzarella and cheddar cheeses evenly on top of the macaroni mixture. Bake the casserole for 35-40 minutes or until the macaroni is tender. Remove from the oven and serve immediately.

In a small saucepan, bring corn syrup and water to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir in cornstarch and continue to boil until mixture is thick and clear. Stir in vanilla extract and food coloring. Transfer to a pastry bag fitted with a small decorating tip.

In heavy saucepan, stir sugar and water to dissolve. Add lemon juice to sugar mixture, stirring constantly. Boil 1 minute longer to make syrup thick enough to coat spoon. Stir in strawberries. Cook until softened, about 10 minutes. Add liquid pectin and bring to boil. Boil 2 minutes longer to set up jelly. Remove from heatstir in vanilla. Pack into clean canning jars leaving 1/2-inch head space. Seal immediately. Can for 5 days at room temperature or for 10 days in refrigerator. If canning, process in boiling water bath for 10 minutes.

Mix all of the ingredients together. Form into a ball. Wrap with plastic wrap. Wrap again with a piece of parchment paper. Wrap with tinfoil. Refrigerate for 24 hours. Remove from the refrigerator about an hour before serving. Unwrap the cheese. Serve with crackers. Store cheese wrapped up for up to 1 week.

Bring half-and-half cream to a boil in a 1-qt. saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in milkheat through. Add garlic powdermix well. Add 2 cups of the half-and-half-cream mixture to each of 4 greased 1-qt. baking dishes. Place 1/2 cup of the half-and-half-cream mixture into a shallow dish. Add 2 tbsp. each of salt and pepperstir well. Dip each potato slice in half-and-half-cream mixturedrain on a paper towel. Place 4 potato slices into each dish. Repeat with remaining half-and-half-cream mixture, salt mixture, potato slices. Sprinkle each dish with 1/4 cup of the cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Top with remaining 1/4 cup cheesebake 5 more minutes. Serve with desired side.

Rub both sides of the pork chops with half of the olive oil and season lightly with salt and pepper. Heat the remaining olive oil on medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add the onions and garlic and cook until softened and translucent. Stir in the chipotles and adobo and cook until the oil is released from the chipotles. Add the pork chops and cook on each side for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the remaining adobo sauce and oregano and cook for 1 to 2 more minutes until the chops are cooked through and browned on each side. Remove the pork chops to a platter and serve with steamed rice.

Spray the bottom of a baking dish with cooking spray. Place 4 boneless pork loin chops on the bottom of the dish with some peanut oil drizzled over the top of each piece of meat. Bake at 375f for 30-45 minutes or until done. Serve on a bed of rice with a dollop of sour cream on top.

Puree salmon. Mix the pureed salmon with the oats and eggs. Add the curry powder and stir until well combined. Form the mixture into patties and refrigerate for at least an hour. Bake at 350 for about 15 minutes. Serve on a whole grain roll.
Peel the yams and cut into cubes. Place cubes in a baking pan and add the lemon juice and salt and fresh ground pepper. Bake at 325 for 1 hour or until yams are tender and golden brown.

Stir yeast in water and honey until dissolved. Stir in flour. Knead dough for about 10 minutes. Roll out dough and place on pizza pan. Spread on topping of choice and bake at 400 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes.

Preheat a medium-sized frying pan on medium-high heat. Add a little bit of butter to grease the pan. Sift baking soda into a mixing bowl with a pinch of salt and stir with a fork. Add ascorbic acid. Sift in the almond flour, then add the eggs to the flour mixture. Stir well with a fork until all lumps are gone. In a separate bowl combine the almond milk with stevia powder to taste. In a large mixing bowl add butter to the pan then add almond flour mixture to the pancake mixture stirring quickly until all lumps are gone. Add lemon rind to pancake mixture then add pancake mixture to the pan to cook. Flip pancakes when bubbles start to form on top of pancakes. Cook until golden brown on each side then remove from pan to plate.

Rub the orange rind over both sides of the salmon. Sprinkle the brown sugar, the chili powder, the cumin, the paprika, the salt, the coriander and the pepper evenly over both sides of the salmon. Wrap the salmon tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight or for at least 8 hours. Bring a large pot of water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the salmon fillets to the water, making sure they are completely submerged. Boil until just cooked through, 3 to 5 minutes. Drain the fish and serve hot or at room temperature with a lemon wedge.

Preheat oven to 375f. Lightly coat a 9-inch square baking pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine the flour, brown sugar, baking soda and salt. In a separate bowl mix together the butter and pecans. Add the butter mixture to the flour mixturestir just until combined. Press half of the batter into the prepared pan. Top with the ice cream topping. Place the remaining batter in a large resealable plastic bag. Cut a 1 inch hole in one cornerpipe over the ice cream topping. Top with the chocolate chips. Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

In a large pan, bring water to a boil. Add pork and boil until cooked through but still tender. Set aside to cool. In a separate pan, bring vinegar to a boil and cook until reduced by half. Add sugar and cook until dissolved. Add black vinegar and cook until reduced by half again. Add soy sauce and cook until sauce has thickened slightly. Add ginger juice and cook until thickened and reduced. Add pork and coat with sauce. Cook until pork is glazed. Drain excess liquid and place meat on serving dish. Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds. Serve with steamed rice or noodles on the side.

In a large 10-inch skillet or pan, saute the garlic and onions until the onions are tender. Stir in the spaghetti sauce and water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir in the ravioli and return to boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook the ravioli until it begins to float to the surface. Remove from heat and stir in the Parmesan cheese. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle the top of the bake with additional Parmesan cheese. Bake in the oven at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 minutes until bubbly. Serve and enjoy!

Cut the zucchini lengthwise into 1/2-inch-thick slices. With a sharp knife make a cut that goes from one end of the zucchini to the other about 1/2-inch from the edge (so it forms a sort of half-moon). Rub the cut zucchini with olive oil and sprinkle the zucchini, cut sides down, with the garlic. Roast the zucchini until it is golden brown and tender, about 20 minutes. Remove the zucchini from the oven and sprinkle each half evenly with the balsamic vinegar and the salt and pepper. Serve hot or at room temperature.

In a large skillet heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the shallot and garlic to the pan. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the crushed red pepper flakes. Cook for an additional minute. Add tomatoes and butternut squash to the pan. Cook for 5 minutes. Add penne to the pan. Cook for 10 minutes or until penne is tender. Stir in the parsley. Toss together. Serve.

Brown beef, drain and return to pot. Add onion and celery. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add green peppers and potatoes. Cook for 5 minutes. Add water and bouillon cubes. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook 15 minutes. Stir in flour and milk. Cook and stir for 10 minutes. Serve with shredded cheddar cheese.

In a large skillet heat oil. Saute onion 2 minutes. Add paprika chili powder red pepper. Stir for 1 minute. Add chicken. Cook 4 minutes on each side. Add tomatoes. Cook 1 minute. Add pineapple slices. Cook 5 minutes. Add red kidney beans. Cook 1 minute. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Rub olive oil all over the chicken thighs and sprinkle them evenly with the salt and pepper. Put the garlic cloves, orange juice and diced tomatoes in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the garlic starts to smell fragrant (approximately 1 minute). Turn off the heat. Put the tomatoes, juices and garlic in a shallow baking dish. Put the chicken on top of the tomato mixture. Sprinkle evenly with the capers. Bake the chicken for 25-30 minutes or until done. Serve over cooked pasta or rice.

Mix all ingredients thoroughly and form into patties of desired size. Cook in frying pan on medium heat until cooked through and brown on both sides. Cool patties and freeze in ziplock plastic bags. When ready to use, grill or fry as desired.
Melt margarine. Mix hot cocoa mix with 1 cup of milk. Place toasted bread in a microwave safe dish. Pour hot margerine over bread and hot cocoa over bread. Microwave until bread is hot.

To make the couscous mix the milk with the couscous and cook on the stove for about ten minutes until it is soft and has absorbed most of the milk. Add in the ground cardamom and the sugar and mix well until the couscous has cooled down. To make the strawberry sauce mix all the ingredients together in a bowl and refrigerate until cold and serve with the couscous or eat it by itself as a breakfast cereal.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar together. Add eggs one at a time. Add vanilla. Mix in applesauce, flour, baking soda, cinnamon baking chips. Pour into a greased 10 x 15 x 1 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Cool cake in pan for 5 minutes. Invert onto a cooling rack. Dust with powdered sugar.

Pour oil into a frying pan with pancettaheat over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add chicken to the pan (be careful as it will sizzle). Cook until golden brown, turning occasionally about 8 minutes. Remove chicken to a platedrain excess oil from pan into a bowl. Add red onion to the pancook until softened but not browned, about 4 minutesadd thyme and garlic to the pansaute until garlic is fragrant about 30 seconds. Add butter to panmelt over medium heatwhisk constantly until butter is golden brownpour sauce over chickenserve with mixed salad greens.

Rinse the beans well in cold water. Combine the ketchup and corn syrup in a medium saucepan over medium heatstirring occasionally. Cook 4 minutes or until slightly thickened. Add the liquid smoke, hot sauce and the beansheat through. Serve over rice or cornbread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. In a large bowl combine the peanut butter and honey. In a small bowl combine the rice cereal and the toasted rice cereal. Set aside. In a small bowl combine the pudding with the nonfat milk. In a large bowl combine the pudding mixture with the peanut butter and honey mixture. Fold in the toasted rice cereal. Spoon mixture into the prepared baking dish. Cover the top of the pie with the whipped topping and swirl with a knife. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Cut into squares and serve.

Mix brown sugar, garlic powder, chili powder, ground black pepper, oregano leaves, salt together. Rub mixture on all sides of tenderloin. Place tenderloin on broiler pan that has been sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Place tenderloin on rack of broiler pan. Place tenderloin in preheated oven for approximately 40 minutes or until internal temperature of meat reaches 160 degrees F. Remove tenderloin from oven and let stand for about five minutes before slicing. Serve with favorite side dishes or sauces.

Combine garlic and lemon juice in a blender or food processor. Process until smooth. Pour into a shallow dish. Add mustard and seasonings and stir well. Marinate chicken for at least 10 minutes. Preheat broiler. Broil 10 minutes for medium doneness. Broil until juices run clear. Serve over rice.

In a large bowl, beat together the milk and eggs until blended. Whisk in the cheese until smooth. Sprinkle the all-purpose flour over the top of the milk mixture and stir in until smooth. Add the salt and pepper and green onions. Fold in the crabmeat. Pour into an ungreased pie plate or quiche pan. Place in the refrigerator for 20-25 minutes before baking. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes at 400 degrees Fahrenheit then reduce the temperature to 300 degrees Fahrenheit for an additional 40-45 minutes or until puffed and golden brown. Let the quiche sit for 10 minutes before slicing and serving with fresh bread or crackers. Serve with a green salad for a complete meal.

In large saucepan add shallot, red wine vinegar and orange juice. Bring mixture to boil. Reduce heat and add orange zest and ginger. Add cranberries and cherries and let simmer until fruit bursts. Add brown sugar and stir to coat. Let cool before serving.

In medium sauce pan add cream of chicken soup and seasoned stuffing mix, and cook according to package directions. Add cooked chicken and heat through. Add onion soup mix and mushroom stems and pieces and cook for 2 more minutes. Add sour cream and parmesan cheese and heat through. Stir in chestnuts and heat through. Spoon mixture into a 9x13" glass dish and top with stuffing crumbs. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or until stuffing crumbs are lightly browned. Serve warm or at room temperature with buttered rolls or biscuits and gravy.
Crush vanilla wafers into small pieces. Put apple butter in a bowl, then add crushed vanilla wafers. Stir in cooled Cool Whip. Chill until ready to serve. Sprinkle with chopped pecans.

Preheat oven to 180c for 3-4 min. Grease and flour a 20cm springform pan or a 20x30cm traybake pan with removable base. In a large bowl, cream margarine and brown sugar until fluffy. Add eggs and beat well. Stir in flour and baking powder, then stir in apple and sultanas. Spoon into prepared pan and bake for 40-45 minutes or until a skewer inserted comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing sides and cooling on a wire rack for 5 minutes before removing sides. Serve warm or cold with a spoonful of cream or ice cream on top.

Boil pasta for about 7-10 minutes until tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a large bowl combine broccoli and pasta with salmon. In another bowl beat the eggs with the milk. Add the black pepper and salt to taste. Pour the egg mixture over the salmon mixture. Stir well. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and chill for at least three hours before serving. Serve with lemon wedges.
In a large saucepan combine all the ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer for 15 minutes. Strain. Serve over ice.

Cook chickpeas according to package directions. Put all the other ingredients in a large soup pot and bring it to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 12 minutes. Season soup to taste with marjoram, garlic, salt, and pepper. Serve garnished with extra fresh baby spinach if desired.

Grind together ham and turkey in food processor. Remove from processor and add in remaining ingredients. In a 9x13 pan, spread 1/3 of the ham and turkey mixture on bottom of pan. Add in 3 slices of french bread and then layer with remaining mixture and top with remaining slices of bread. Cover with plastic wrap and chill in refrigerator for at least an hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 400f. Unroll dough and cut into 8 triangles. Spray large skillet with cooking spray. Add dough and press into large circles. Sprinkle with taco seasoning mix and cheddar cheese. Brown on both sides. Place on ungreased cookie sheets and bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with ground beef and lettuce.

In a small skillet, cook the beef round steak over medium-high heat until browned and cooked through. In a food processor or blender, combine the beef with the garlic and pinto beans and blend until smooth. Spread the beef mixture on top of the tortillas. Top with the diced green chilies and cilantro. Fold the sides of each tortilla in over the filling. Roll up each tortilla into a burrito and place into a baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese melts.

Roll out dough on a lightly floured surface into a large rectangle. Spread half of the dough with 1 tbsp of oil and sprinkle with paprika and dried basil and garlic powder. Top with cheddar cheese and the other half of dough, and press together firmly. Cut into squares or triangles and bake at 425 for 12-14 minutes. Makes about 12-16 pieces.

Scoop out beans from refried bean can into a medium bowl. Heat oil in skillet. Add green chilies to the oil. Cook until softened. Add refried beans to the skillet. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in 1 cup beef broth. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Uncovercook for 5 minutes. Stir in remaining broth. Heat through. Ladle beans onto flour tortillas. Add lettuce, tomato and cheese. Serve with salsa and enchilada sauce. Serves 10.

Boil eggs until just hard boiled. Cool slightly in cold water and peel. Cut eggs in half and remove yolks. Mix yolks with the remaining ingredients. Spoon into the egg whites. Sprinkle with paprika. Refrigerate for 15 minutes before serving. This makes approximately 18 deviled eggs. Serve on lettuce leaves if desired.
Mix cream cheese with crushed pineapple, pecans, green peppers, onion salt. Shape into a ball or spread onto a cracker for hors d oeuvres or use as a dip with crackers or celery.

In a large bowl combine the warm water and active dry yeast. In another bowl combine the stone-ground whole wheat flour and all-purpose flour. Add the yeast mixture to the dry mixture and combine. Gradually add the molasses and vital wheat gluten. Stir well. Pour into 2 greased loaf pans and allow to rise until doubled. Bake at 375 degrees f for about 1 hour. Remove from pan and serve with butter.
Boil or steam potatoes until tender. Drain. Mix with yogurt and salad dressingadd spices. Fold in olives and pickle. Refrigerate 2 hours before serving. Makes 6 servings.

Mix the cranberries and crushed pineapple with sugar and boil for 15 minutes until the cranberries burst open (see photo). Chill. To make the jelly, mix the jello gelatins in a large bowl with cold water until dissolved and then add the boiled cranberry mixture and the orange juice and stir well to dissolve. Pour into a 10 x 10 pan and refrigerate until firm (at least 6 hours). Cut into 1-inch cubes and garnish with pecans.

Melt the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the garlic until lightly browned, then add the shallots and cook for 10 minutes more or until tender. Stir in the mushrooms and cook for another minute or two. Stir in the chicken stock and simmer for about 10 minutes or until the liquid is reduced by half. Turn the heat up to high, add the pasta and cook for about 4 minutes. Meanwhile, peel the squash and cut in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds and scoop out the pulp with a large spoon. Transfer the flesh to the skillet with the mushroom mixture and cook over medium heat until tender. Cook the pasta in boiling salted water until it is tender but firm. Drain the pasta in a colander and return it to the skillet with the mushroom mixture along with the squash pulp. Stir in the rosemary, season with salt and pepper, and cook for about 5 minutes more. Toss the pasta with the squash mixture and transfer it to a 11/2 quart casserole dish. Serve immediately.

Boil broccoli in water for about five minutes. Drain well. Dice butter into small pieces. In a medium saucepan heat oil over medium heat. Saute onion until golden. Add curry powder and cook for 1 minute. Add broccoli, potatoes and carrots. Cover pot and cook for ten minutes. Add chicken broth. Cover pot and cook for about five minutes. Add milk. Cover pot and cook for about ten minutes. Add cheese. Cook for five minutes. Season to taste. Serve with crackers.

Soak rice in water until it swells. Cook it with water and add sugar. Cook it until it thickens. Add saffron. Add pistachios, almonds, cinnamon. Cook it for 20 minutes. This is one of the most popular dessert in Iran. It is very easy to make. This recipe is the same as sholeh zard but it is cooked longer.

In large non-stick skillet over medium heat warm extra virgin olive oil. Add shallots and mushrooms and saut until softened, about 10 minutes. Add lemon juice, dijon mustard, salt and fresh ground pepper. Sauté for 30 seconds. Add garlic cloves and saut another minute until fragrant. Add fresh rosemary sprigs and saut until just wilted, about 1 minute. Serve over grilled bread, mashed potato or over rice.

Cream margarine and sugar together. Add the malted barley syrup. Add the dry ingredients and stir until combined. Roll dough into small balls. Press dough balls flat with a fork. Bake for 10 minutes at 350.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Combine the chicken with the honey, apple cider vinegar, worcestershire sauce, dijon-style mustard, brown sugar, salt and pepper. Let this marinate at room temperature for 1 to 2 hours or overnight. Then bake at 350 degrees f for about 45 minutes. Baste with the marinade while baking, turning the chicken every 15 minutes or so. Serve with your favorite vegetable. The flavors of honey and mustard work well with almost any vegetable.
Combine cracker crumbs and oleo. Mix well. Press into greased 13 x 9-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool. Combine brown sugar and nuts. Spread evenly over crust. Cool. Cut into bars.

Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Saute onion and garlic until onion is tender. Add rice and paprikastir to coat rice. Stir in broth and bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer covered for about 20 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in green pepper and remaining ingredientsstir and cook until heated through. Serve hot or refrigerate and reheat the next day.

Mix pizza sauce and tomatoes together and spoon over the crusts. Arrange the pepperoni and mushrooms over the sauce. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over the sauce and the toppings. Bake at 400 degrees f for 10 to 15 minutes or until the crust is brown.

Place salmon fillets in a large resealable plastic bag. Combine brown sugar and garlic salt. Sprinkle the salmon with the brown sugar mixture. Add the beer. Refrigerate for at least 20 minutes to marinate. Drain the salmon. Place the fillets in a grill basket and grill for 3-5 minutes per side or until cooked to your preference. Top with red onion.

Spray 2-quart casserole dish with cooking spray. Place chicken in prepared casserole dish. In small bowl mix tomato soup and water. Pour over chicken. In medium bowl combine brown sugar, vinegar and cooked rice. Mix well. Pour over chicken. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake at 350 degrees f for 1 hour.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute onion until softened and lightly browned, 5 to 10 minutes. Stir in 1/4 teaspoon salt and the Parmesan cheese until smooth. Transfer to a 9-inch pie plate and spread evenly to form a crust. Bake until the crust is firm and lightly browned, about 8 minutes. Beat eggs and milk until combined in a large bowl. Stir in remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and the crab and feta cheesesfold in onion mixture. Pour into crust and bake until almost set and puffed around the edges, about 30 minutes. Let cool slightly before slicing and serving.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add green pepper and onion. Saute until tender. Add salt and ground pepper. Saute for 1 minute. Stir in cumin and garam masala. Saute for 1 minute. Add ground beef. Cook until browned and no longer pink. Stir in tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until beef is tender. Serve with rice.

Roast 1 large garlic clove (or 12 small cloves) for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Peel and mince the garlic. Put the garlic, 2 cups of the garbanzo beans in food processor. Puree for 1 minute. With the food processor running, slowly drizzle in 2 tablespoons of olive oil through the feed tube. Scrape the sides of the bowl to make sure everything is getting pureed. Add 2 cups water, 1/4 cup of the tahini, 2 teaspoons of the lemon juice, 1 teaspoon of the salt, 1/2 teaspoon of the black pepper, the remaining garbanzo beans, 2 tablespoons of the remaining tahini, the remaining lemon juice and remaining salt and pepper to taste. With the food processor running, slowly drizzle the mixture through the feed tube. Serve immediately or store in refrigerator for up to 4 days.

Combine kiwi fruits and apples in a large bowl. Add raspberries and strawberriesstir gently to coat fruit evenly in sugar. Arrange fruit in a single layer in an ungreased 11 x 7-inch glass baking dish. Refrigerate for about 2 hours or until cold. Heat tortillas according to package directionscut into triangles. Place on a large serving platter with 12 paper napkins around it and serve the fruit in bowls on top of the tortillas. Melt butter over medium heat in a small saucepan. Stir in flour and cook for about 2 minutes or until blended and smooth. Remove from the heatstir in cinnamon and sugar until blended. Drizzle over fruit and serve immediately.

Brown zucchini and tomatoes with onion in olive oil over medium heat until tender and brown. Drain off liquid and set aside. Preheat oven to 375f. Grease an 8x8 pan with cooking spray and set aside. In large mixing bowl mix together cheeses and bisquick mix with an electric mixer until crumbly. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Place zucchini and tomatoes on top of mixture. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Serve with side salad.

Combine all sauce ingredients in saucepan and bring to a boil. Boil for five minutes then remove from heat. Stir in chopped parsley. Transfer to a serving jar. Store in the refrigerator. Makes about 4 cups.

Add garlic cloves and tomatoes to blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Add feta cheese and blend until well-combined. Stir in mayonnaise and parmesan cheese and blend again until smooth. Add artichoke hearts and blend again until smooth. Garnish with pimientos and green onions if desired. Serve with crackers and/or vegetables of choice and enjoy!

Pour hot coffee over ice cubes in large glasses or pitchers until 3/4 full. Add sugar and vanilla to taste. Stir in half-and-half until blended. Stir in milk just before serving to prevent it from curdling. Top with whipped cream if desired.
Bring chicken broth to a boil. Mix cabbage slaw with chicken broth. Remove from heat when liquid is at desired consistency. Combine green onions, pecans, butter and mustard. Mix with broth mixture.

In a large bowl, mix cornmeal with 1 1/2 cups kosher salt to form a crumbly texture. In a separate bowl, whisk together sugar and creamed corn with 1/4 cup warm water. Stir in oillet cool slightly. Add to cornmeal mixture with baking soda, baking powder, 2 cups buttermilk, eggs, corn syrup, remaining 1 cup of kosher saltstir just until moistened. Pour batter into a 12-cup muffin pan that has been sprayed with nonstick spray or greased with cooking spray. Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes or until done. Let cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan.

Place onion on bottom of greased 9 x 13 pan. Cook beef and drain well. Mix with soup, milk, bisquick mix, onion, vegetables, pepper, salt and cheese. Pour into pan. Bake 375 f for 45 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Melt butter in pan. Sauté onions in butter until translucent. Add cabbage and sauté until tender. Add apple cider, apple cider vinegar and salt and pepper. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 20-25 minutes. Serve hot or warm.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Cook sausage until brown. Place sausage in an ungreased 8-inch square baking dish. In a small bowl mix eggs with 2 Tbsp. water. Pour over sausage. Top with green chiles and picante sauce. Bake uncovered for 15-20 minutes or until the eggs are cooked to taste. Spoon into tortillas. Roll up tightly and place seam side down in baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese and bake for 5-10 minutes more until cheese is melted. Serve with Spanish rice or beans if desired.

Peel avocados. Cut avocados in half lengthwise. Remove pit. Scoop avocado meat into a bowl. Add lime juice to avocado pulp. Add shallots. Mash avocado mixture until smooth. Add dijon mustard, parsley, salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Coat pan with grapeseed oil. Heat pan over medium heat. Season salmon with salt and pepper. Place salmon in pan skin side down. Cook until salmon is almost cooked through. Turn salmon over. Spread avocado remoulade on salmon. Cook until salmon is cooked through. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place 2 cups of pumpkin pie spice in the bottom of the crust. Top with 2 cups of pumpkin. Dot with 1/2 cup of butter. Layer 1/2 cup of cream cheese, 1/2 cup of pumpkin and 1/2 cup of powdered sugar. Repeat layering 2 more times. Top with remaining powdered sugar. Beat remaining 1/2 cup of cream cheese with 1/4 cup of heavy cream until smooth and fluffy. Pour over the top of the pie. Bake for 40 minutes. Serve warm.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook rice, stirring constantly, until it turns light brown in color. Add water and bring to a boil. Cook for about 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in pepper. Sprinkle lemon zest and juice over rice. Cover with plastic wrap. Let sit for 20 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Stir in parsley. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Whisk together the eggs and 1/2 cup of the cream until frothy. In a separate bowl, whisk together the remaining 1 cup of cream and the sugar until the sugar is dissolved. Add the egg mixture and the vanilla to the sugar mixture. Sift together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt and add to the sugar mixture alternating with the remaining cream. Stir until combined and pour into the prepared pan and bake for 1 hour or until the cake is done. Remove from the oven and cool on a rack. In the meantime, make the ganache by melting the chocolate in the microwave. Stir until smooth. Once the cake has cooled, spread the ganache over the cake and let it set. Refrigerate until serving.

Melt margarine in a large saucepan over low heat or in a microwave-safe bowl in the microwave. Add mini marshmallows and stir until melted and smooth. Add crispy rice cereal and stir until completely coated in marshmallow and melted. Add vanilla and almond extracts and stir until well combined. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan and let cool for a few minutes before cutting into squares.

Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large casserole dish (or deep baking dish), combine the mixed vegetables, chicken, soup, thyme, salt & pepper. Pour into a 9x9 inch glass baking dish. Roll out one piece of pie crust (or one cup of biscuit dough) to fit inside the baking dish. Cut off excess dough around edges of dish. Cover with second piece of rolled out crust or biscuit dough. Cut vents in top to allow steam to escape. Bake for 30 minutes. Let stand 5-10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place margarine into large bowladd onion, garlicmix. Add cheesemix. Divide mixture into 12 portions, shape into pattiesplace on baking sheetbake for 12-15 minutes or until patties are cooked through. Place 1 teaspoon of patties into each wonton wrappermoisten edges of wonton wrapper with waterplace 1 teaspoon of patties onto baking sheetbake for 12-15 minutes or until patties are cooked through. To serve: place 1 wonton onto a skewerdrizzle with oilsprinkle with seasoning saltserve with salsa for dipping.

Preheat a medium size skillet over medium-high heat. In a food processor or blender combine the potatoes, onion, butter, olive oil and garlic clove. Add to the skillet. Season with the rosemary, sage, thyme, salt and black pepper. Cook stirring constantly until the potatoes are tender about 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Lay crescent rolls on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Slice each roll into 4 pieces. Spread each with a little margarine. Layer ham, asparagus spears and cheeses on crescent rolls. Sprinkle onions on each. Roll each crescent roll over filling. Place seams of each roll down. Place rolls on cookie sheet. Bake 10 to 15 minutes.
Slice onion and peppers into thin strips. Mix all together in a large bowl. Chill for at least an hour. Serve with crackers.

Peel and quarter potatoes. Slice onions and rosemary into small pieces. Cook potatoes and onions in butter until tender. Add seasoning and chicken to potatoes and cook until heated through. Add apple slices and parsley and continue cooking for about 1 minute or until apples are tender but not mushy. Serve with pepper and salt to taste.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook spaghetti until tender but firm to the bite, stirring occasionally. Drain pasta in a colander and set aside. Meanwhile, in a large skillet heat butter and oil over medium heatsaute garlic and onion until tender. Add the milk, eggs and season with pepper and nutmeg. Cook and stir until eggs are set but still moist and pull apart. Stir in the sauce and cook until sauce is heated through and creamy. Mix the sauce and eggs into the spaghetti and sprinkle with the cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

In a shallow pan (I used a 9x13), pour bacon into the pan. Sprinkle brown sugar over bacon. Mix black pepper with cayenne and pour over bacon as well. Place in oven at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until bacon is cooked. I let it cook in the oven about 20 more minutes after that because I like my bacon crispy. YUMMMY!
Melt butter and brown sugar together. Add the rest of the ingredients and stir until smooth. Pour into 13 by 9 inch pan. Refrigerate overnight. Cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 350f. Clean mushrooms and remove stems and gills. In a large bowl add mushrooms and feta cheese. Season with salt and pepper. In a small bowl add black olives, tomatoes and garlic clove and mix together. In a small saucepan over low heat add basil and olive oil and simmer for 1 minute. Pour mixture over mushrooms and mix well. Bake for 10 minutes until mushrooms are soft and cheese is melted. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Melt butter flavor shortening in a large saucepan over low heat. Stir in brown sugar and cook until melted & smooth, stirring often with a spatula. Stir in the water and vanilla and cook for about 2 minutes more. Add the eggs one at a time to the pan & stir until combined. Stir in the flour mixture and milk & stir until combined. Bake for about 30 minutes or until the top is set but the center is still soft. Cool for about 10 minutes before removing from the pan. Top with the milk chocolate chips & serve.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Cook onion until tender, stirring frequently for 2-3 minutes. Stir in flour until smooth, then gradually stir in milk, white wine and blue cheese until thickened. Remove from heat, add pepper sauce. If desired, stir in green onions.

Remove tough stems from kale leaves and discard. Remove leaves from stem and tear or cut into bite-size pieces. Wash leaves in cold water to remove sand. Drizzle oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add leavescook 1 1/2 to 2 minutes or until wilted. Drizzle with lemon juicesprinkle with red pepper flakes and parmesan cheese to taste. Serve immediately.

In a food processor, combine cream cheese and goat cheese until blended. Add lemon juice and process until smooth. Add herbs and garlic and pulse until herbs are finely chopped. Add pecans and process until blended. Add fruit and process until blended. Chill. Using a teaspoon or tablespoon, scoop balls of filling onto parchment paper. Roll in crushed pecans. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Line cookie sheet or baking sheet with foil. Spray foil lightly with non-stick cooking spray. In small bowl, beat egg white until stiff peaks form. Combine garlic powder and celery salt and set aside. Place almonds on cookie sheet or baking sheet and coat with egg white. Place almonds on cookie sheet or baking sheet and coat with egg white. Sprinkle with salt and liquid smoke flavoring and bake for 45 minutes or until almonds are golden brown and crisp. Turn almonds over halfway through baking period if needed. Let cool 10 minutes before breaking apart and serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cream butter and brown sugar together until light. Add dry ingredients and blend. Add buttermilk and blend. Stir in wheat bran. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 1 minute. Pat out to about a half-inch thick and cut with a round cutter. Brush tops with melted butter. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet for 10 to 12 minutes. Yields about 20 scones.

Remove stems from fresh basil leaves and chop leaves. Place in a food processor or blender. Add garlic, salt and half the olive oil. Process or blend until smooth. Add remaining olive oil and process or blend until smooth. Add nuts and blend. Transfer to a bowl and stir in cheese. Use immediately or refrigerate up to 1 week. Bring to room temperature before using.

Brown beef in a large skillet over medium heat until done. Drain any excess fat from beef. Remove from heat. Drain beans well. Add beef to beans along with all other ingredients except for cheese. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add cheese during last 2 minutes of cooking. Serve over rice or tortillas.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1 inch chunks. Put into saucepan with 2 cups water and bring to boiling. Lower heat, cover and simmer until tender. Add sugar, peach halves and 1 cup water. Simmer until peaches are tender. Stir in cloves. Serve hot.
Blend buttermilk with mayonnaise and sour cream in a small bowl and stir in herbs and garlic powder. Mound on a bed of lettuce in a salad bowl and top with bacon and tomatoes.

Thaw peas according to directions on package. Drain and rinse. In saucepan, saute onion and mushrooms in butter until tender. Add flour and stir to blend. Add half-and-half and bring to a boil. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in peas. Season with salt and pepper. Pour mixture over hot rice. Sprinkle with sugar and serve.
In a pitcher combine boiling water with tea bags. Steep for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Add sugar, lemon juice and orange juice. Add sliced lemons and mint. Chill.

Preheat oven to 375° F. Cream together the butter and sugars in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Add the vanilla and mix. Add the flour and baking soda alternately to the butter mixture. Mix until just blended. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto a cookie sheet. Flatten slightly. Bake until golden brown. Cool for 2 to 3 minutes on the cookie sheet. Transfer to a cooling rack. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 400f. Bring water to boil in saucepan. Add celery and carrots and cook over medium heat 5 to 10 minutes or until tender. Drain vegetables and add to blender. Add lentils and cooked vegetables and puree. In food processor or blender, combine lentils with red curry powder. Add to lentils and blend thoroughly. Pour lentils into bowl and add remaining ingredients. Blend thoroughly. Form lentils into 6 patties and place on lightly greased cookie sheets. Bake at 400f for 20 minutes or until firm.

Wash the swiss chard under cold water. Discard the stems and cut the leaves into 1/2 inch wide strips. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the swiss chard and stir until the swiss chard wilts. Add the lemon juice and the feta cheese. Stir until the feta is completely dissolved. Add the pepper to taste. Stir in the salt. Serve.
Melt the butter and mix the dijon with the mustard. Spread the mixture on the bread. Place cheese slices on top of the bread. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

Cut chicken into 1 inch cubes. Mix margarine and curry powder in a small bowl. Rub chicken with the margarine mixture. Bake in 12 inch skillet at 350 for 25 minutes. Remove chicken from skilletcover and keep warm. Stir together the cream and 1/4 cup of the sauce from the skillet. Bring to a boil over medium heatcook and stir for 1 minute or until thickened. Serve chicken in the sauce. Sprinkle with the remaining curry powder.

In a medium pot over medium heat bring rice and water to a boil. Once it starts boiling add a little bit of oil to the pot so that it doesn't stick to the pot. Keep stirring as it is boiling so that the oil does not splatter. Cook for about 10 minutes or until all the water is gone from the rice. Meanwhile in a large pan on medium heat add the olive oil to the pan once it is hot add the mushrooms stirring occasionally for about 5 minutes until the mushrooms are tender. Meanwhile in a food processor or blender add the lemon juice the gorgonzola cheese, cream and lemon zest. Blend or process until smooth. Once the mushrooms are tender add the gorgonzola mixture to the pan stirring constantly for about 4 minutes until the gorgonzola melts completely. Stir in the cooked rice. Cook for another 2 minutes stirring constantly until the gorgonzola mixture has thickened slightly. Stir in the spinach leaves. Season with the salt and pepper to taste. Serve right away with the lemon zest sprinkled over each serving

Melt the butter with the onion over low heat. Add the rice to the melted butter and stir until the rice is coated with the butter. Add the stock gradually stirring constantly. Simmer the rice over a low heat for about 20 minutes or until the rice is tender but not soft. Add the parmesan cheese and stir well. Serve warm with a bit of parmesan cheese sprinkled on top. Makes about 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x9-inch baking dish with butter or oil. Place fillet in bottom. Arrange scallops and shrimp on top of fillet in baking dish and sprinkle with lemon juice and zestset aside. In a large bowl, beat butter and Ritz crackers crumbs until crumbs are moistened and butter is blended in. Sprinkle crumb mixture over seafood mixture and sprinkle with garlic powder and black pepper. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until crumb topping is golden brown and seafood is cooked through and flaky. Serve with lemon wedges on the side if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat. Whisk flour into the melted butter and cook until flour is golden brown. Remove from heat. Gradually whisk in the half-and-half until it is all combined. Gradually whisk in the cream cheese until all is combined. Add the onion and garlic and cook for 1 minute over low heat until fragrant. Add the frozen chopped spinach and cook until spinach is thawed and tender. Stir in the spinach mixture to the saucepan containing the flour mixture. Cook over low heat until the mixture is smooth, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer the mixture to a blender and puree until very smooth. Pour into a large saucepan over low heat. Add enough water to make 1 cup of liquid. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook for 20 minutes over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally until the mixture thickens slightly. Add the parmesan cheese to the saucepan, stirring until it melts completely.

Place a Dutch oven or heavy pot over medium-high heat. Add the lamb and brown for about 5 to 10 minutes. Add the wine and cook until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the oil and saute the vegetables until soft. Add the lamb back to the pot with the vegetables. Add the red pepper flakes. Reduce the heat to low. Cook covered for 1 hour. Cook covered for 1 hour. Add the pimientos. Cover again. Cook for 1/2 hour. Add salt to taste. Remove the meat from the pot. Slice thinly. Return the meat to the pot. Serve.

Cook egg noodles according to package directions. Drain in colander. While noodles are cooking, heat soup in microwave or heat in saucepan if microwave is not available. Add sour cream, garlic powder, pepper and cheese. Heat until cheese is melted. Mix in noodles with soup mixture. Serve hot or warm.

Brush tilapia fillet with soy sauce mixture. Place on a large plate or pan and steam for about 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Meanwhile combine Napa cabbage, scallions in a large bowl. Add the fish when it is ready and toss with the cabbage mixture. Add remaining ingredients and toss again. Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and serve hot with rice.

Drain the tofu, then pat it dry with paper towels. Cut the tofu into 1-inch cubes, then toss the cubes with the sesame seeds and sesame oil. In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the garlic and the hot pepper sauce, and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add the spinach and stir until wilted. Add the soy sauce to taste. Arrange the spinach-stir-fry mixture on platestop each serving with 2 pieces of tofu.

Mix honey, soy sauce, lemon juice and mustard in a small bowl. Place tuna steaks in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour honey mixture over tuna. Close bag and shake to coat. Refrigerate 30 minutes to marinate. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add canola oil to pan. Add tuna steaks to pan. Cook for 6 minutes or until tuna is almost opaque throughout. Add sesame seeds. Cook 2 minutes more or until tuna is cooked through. Serve immediately.

Trim off and discard the woody ends of the celery ribs. Cut the ribs into 1" pieces. Place the celery in a 1 1/2 quart pan and add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover and boil until tender. Drain and cool. Meanwhile, cut the smoked ham into 1" pieces. Mix together the mayonnaise and the mustard. Stir in the celery and ham. Stir in the vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Refrigerate for 20 minutes to let flavors blend. Serve on celery ribs.

Dry rub each breast with garlic salt and pepper. Lay the breasts in a large shallow pan in one layer and drizzle with the oil. Let sit for at least 1 hour at room temperature or place in the refrigerator for up to a day. Preheat the oven to 350f. Bake the breasts for about 25 minutes or until the juice of the breasts runs clear when pierced with a fork. Transfer the breasts to a large platter, sprinkle with the basil and parmesan cheese and drizzle with the lemon juice. Sprinkle the pecans over the cheese and serve.

Boil broccoli head until soft and then mash. Cook egg noodles according to the instructions. Saute garlic in some oil until it turns brownish. Remove and set aside. Toss the prawns with some peanut oil and season with black pepper and sea salt. Place prawns in a large non-stick frying pan and cook on medium heat for about 4-5 minutes until golden brown on both sides. While the prawns are cooking, boil a large pot of water and cook the egg noodles as the packet instructs. Drain the noodles and place in a serving dish. Remove the prawns from the pan and add the mashed broccoli. Add the wine and cook on medium heat for about two minutes. Add the tomatoes and garlic and stir. Season with black pepper and sea salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and the sauce is thick. Place prawns on the noodles and serve.

Brown meat and onion. Add taco seasoning and 2 cups of water. Cook for 5-8 minutes. Add zucchini and frozen corn. Cook for another 5-8 minutes or until zucchini are tender. Add tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Cook for another 5 minutes or until zucchini are tender. Drain and discard tomatoes. Add rice. Stir until well coated. Sprinkle cheese over top. Serve warm.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine cake mix, eggs and water. Mix until smooth. Spoon batter into muffin cups and bake for 18 to 20 minutes. Frost with vanilla frosting.

Cook chicken breasts in crock pot until tender. Remove from crock pot and set aside. Put remaining ingredients in crock pot and cook on low for 2 hours. Shred cooked chicken and return to crock pot. Remove cooked stuffing from box and put in crock pot. Cook for additional 45 minutes to an hour. Serve over rice.

Mix together soy sauce, fish sauce, water and black peppermarinate tofu for 30 minutes. Drainpat dry with paper towels. Thread tofu onto metal skewers alternating with green mango slicesthread 2 mango slices onto each skewer. Heat grill to highgrill skewers 4 minutes per side or until tofu is brownedgrill mango slices for 1 minute per side or until lightly browned. Serve with mango slawgarnish with red onion slices.

Prepare the mayonnaise by blending the mayonnaise, salad dressing and parmesan cheese. Combine the black-eyed peas, macaroni, and broccoli floret. Mix the chopped tomato, green pepper and the chopped crabmeat into the black-eyed pea mixture. Serve the mixture over the prepared mayonnaise. Garnish with the green onion.

Trim and wash green beans. Cut off tops and tails. Slice beans into 1/4 inch pieces. Place in a bowl with olive oil and garlic. Add vinegar, mustard and salt and pepper. Toss together and refrigerate for several hours. When ready to serve, add baby portabella mushrooms and parsley. Mix again.

In large saucepan combine couscous with apple juice. Bring to boiling over medium heat. Cover pan and remove from heat. Let stand 10 minutes. Drain couscous. In separate small skillet cook chicken broth and green onions in butter over medium heat until onions are tender. Add curry powder. Remove from heat. In large bowl combine couscous and chicken broth mixture. Stir in apples. Garnish with chives. Serve with yogurt.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Cut chickens in half lengthwise through the breastbone and discard the backboneseason with salt and pepper. Place chickens skin-side down on a rack in a shallow roasting pan (breast side up). Place sausages in pan with chickensdrizzle with olive oil. Season with mustard, sage, and pepperdrizzle with worcestershire sauce. Roast in preheated oven until chickens are cooked through (about 45 minutes), turning once halfway through cooking time. Transfer chickens and sausages to a plattertent with foil. Cook onions in pan drippings until golden (about 20 minutes). Stir in lemon juiceseason with salt and pepper. Place chicken and sausage on plattersprinkle with fresh sage leavesserve with onions.

Prepare a 9 x 13 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Place thighs in dish. In a small bowl, combine hot sauce, margarine and water. Pour mixture over chicken. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 350f. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl and sprinkle over chicken. Bake until juices run clear and meat is tender, about 35 minutes. Serve with blue cheese.

Preheat oven to 425. Remove stems from mushrooms. Place mushrooms on a piece of wax paper. Brush them with butter and season with salt and pepper. Place 2 oz gorgonzola on top of each mushroom. Wrap pastry around each mushroom. Brush pastry with egg wash. Bake for about 40 min or until pastry is golden.

Beat pudding mix according to package directions in 1 1/2 quarts milk. Add coconut extract. Fold in 2 cups of coconut. Spread 1/3 of coconut over bottom of crust. Top with pudding mixture. Fold in remaining coconut. Chill. Just before serving, spread with whipped topping. Sprinkle with additional coconut.

Season the chicken with garlic powder and pepper. Dip the chicken in the breadcrumb mixture, making sure each side is covered with breadcrumbs. Place the chicken on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes in the preheated over at about 350 until the chicken is done. Top each breast with a slice of swiss cheese. Top the cheese with a spoonful of the condensed soup and a spoonful of the wine. Bake for another 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve with rice.

Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Cool slightly. Whisk in brown sugar and granulated sugar. Beat in egg until combined. Stir in vanilla. Sift together the flour, cornstarch and baking soda. Stir into the butter mixture until just combined. Stir in the chocolate. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto cookie sheets lined with parchment paper. Bake for 9 to 12 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes on the cookie sheet before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Cut carrots into 1/2 inch cubes. Cook in boiling water until soft. Drain. Cool. Preheat oven to 350f. Sift flour and cocoa. Combine eggs, oil, sugar and cocoa. Mix carrots. Add flour. Mix well. Pour batter into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake for 40-45 minutes. Let cool before removing from pan. Makes 14 servings.

Combine pork roast, garlic powder and soy sauce. Add pork to crock pot. Add sliced onions and bay leaf. Cook on high for 2 1/2 hours. Turn to low. Cook for 3 hours. Transfer to a platter. Cover and let stand 5 minutes before slicing.

Preheat oven to 425f. Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute for about 3 minutes. Add rice and stir to coat. Add stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer, uncovered for about 20 minutes until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender and creamy. Add peas and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand covered for about 5 minutes to allow flavors to meld. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Just before serving, stir in lemon juice and zest, walnuts and parsley. Serve immediately.

Melt the butter in a large skillet. Add the onion and parsley. Cook over medium heat for 5 to 7 minutes or until tender. Add the bouillon cubes and boiling water. Bring to a boil. Add the rice. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 15 minutes. Stir in the cranberries. Cook for 5 minutes more. Remove from the heat and stir in the butter. Serve warm.

Grate bananas and dates and mix together. Add oats and oil and mix well. Add vanilla and mix. Stir in flour and mix until well blended. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 9 minutes. Cool on sheet for 3 minutes, then transfer to wire rack. Cool completely.

In a large saucepan, sauté the onion in olive oil until translucent. Add the garlic and thyme. Add tomatoes and carrot. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low, cover with lid. Cook for about one hour. Blend with immersion blender. Taste to adjust seasonings. Add salt if needed. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Place 2 skinless chicken breasts in the center of a 16x12 inch sheet of aluminum foil. Sprinkle the chicken with 2 tbsp BBQ sauce and season with salt and pepper. Place 1/3 cup chopped green peppers around the edge of the foil. Place 1 cup of corn around the edge of the foil. Fold the foil up around the chicken and fold the edges together so that the food is completely sealed. Place the packet seam side down in a large roasting pan and drizzle the remaining BBQ sauce over the packet. Cook in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes. To serve remove the packet from the pan and open. Garnish with additional corn and serve with barbecue sauce.

In small saucepan, heat butter until melted. Add shallots and saute until tender for about 2 minutes over medium-low heat. Add ginger and stir until fragrant for about 3 minutes. Add broth and lime juice and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 10 minutes or until liquid is reduced by half. Add half-and-half and stir in cayenne pepper. Stir in avocadoes and lime slices and refrigerate until cold before serving. Garnish with fresh cilantro and lime slices before serving.

Beat egg yolks with 1/4 cup cold water and salt until frothy. Gradually add sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. Add lemon extract. Sift together the flour and the dry ingredients. Stir into egg yolks and stir until smooth. Fold in remaining flour mixture. In a small saucepan, cook the egg whites until they are stiff peaks form. Gently fold into batter. Pour into an ungreased 10 inch tube pan. Bake at 325 f. for 35 minutes. Remove from oven and cool 10 minutes. Turn upside down onto a wire rack to cool. Cool completely. Dust with confectioner's sugar before serving. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. In a bowl sift together the flour, oatmeal, baking soda and salt. Cut the caramels into small pieces. In a large bowl cream the butter until light. Add the brown sugar, caramels, cream and mix until fluffy. Add the flour mixture to the creamed mixture and mix well. Press the dough into a greased 9×13 baking pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool. Cut into squares. Melt the chocolate chips and drizzle over the bars. Let cool completely before serving.

In a saucepan, combine rice flour and evaporated milk. Bring to a boil. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 10 minutes or until rice flour mixture begins to thicken. Stir in milk. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes or until mixture thickens. Add the cardamom and rose water and stir for 1 minute. Add ground almonds and ground pistachios and cook for 1 minute. Stir in dried apricot. Transfer mixture to a greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with ground almonds and pistachios. Let cool completely. Cut into 12 squares and serve.
Bring water to a boil. Add all the ingredients except the vanilla extract. Turn the heat to low. Cook for 5 minutes. Whisk occasionally. Stir in the vanilla extract. Cook for 30 minutes more.
Put all ingredients in a medium sized bowl and stir until mixed. Serve immediately. This is a great dip for spring rolls or for using as a sauce for a stir-fry.

Make sure to pre-heat your grill. Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Drizzle olive oil over the chicken and grill. Grill for 5 to 8 minutes on each side or until done. While chicken is grilling, combine the pesto with the zucchini and tomatoes. Toss to coat. Place the chicken on a serving platter and cover with the zucchini and tomato mixture. Sprinkle with the chopped scallions and serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9 x 9 inch baking pan. Sift flour, cocoa powder and salt together. Add baking soda and sugar. Mix in the vanilla, vinegar and water. Add vegetable oil. Mix together until a smooth batter is formed. Fold in the chocolate chips. Bake in preheated oven for about an hour. Check the cake at the 45 minute mark by inserting a wooden pick into the center of the cake. If the pick comes out clean, remove the cake from the over. Let it rest in the pan for about five minutes. Transfer the cake onto a wire rack. Let the cake cool for at least an hour before frosting it.
Fill pitcher with 1 quart of sugar and 1 quart of water. Bring to a boil then pour over kool-aid and stir. Add lemonade to taste. Serve over ice.

Put beer in a sauce pan and warm over low heat until warm to the touch (about 120f). Remove from heat and add brats and onion slices to the pan and simmer for about 3 minutes. Drain pan and serve on hot dog rolls with mustard.

Boil spaghetti with just enough salted water to cover until tender but firm. Drain. Toss with oil, garlic and pepper. Divide among 4 plates. In nonstick skillet, heat 1 tbsp. oil over medium heat. Add eggs. Cook and stir 3 to 4 minutes or until eggs are firm. Top each plate with egg, sprinkle with cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Season chicken breasts with salt, pepper and cinnamon. Stir in sherry in a shallow dish. Place in oven to marinate for 30 minutes. Place oven rack in middle of ovenpreheat broiler to high. Remove chicken from ovendiscard marinade. Place chicken breasts under broiler for 5 minutes or until a light golden brown. Meanwhile, combine lime juice and honey in a small bowl. Stir in garlicset aside. Remove breasts from ovenbrush with honey mixture. Return to oven for 2 minutes or until glazed.

Place cabbage head in boiling water and boil until tender. Drain well. Mince onion and green pepper and set aside. Crush and brown in butter and oil over medium heat until soft and tender. Add cabbage and continue cooking until cabbage is tender. Add tomato sauce and water and mix well. Add in minced onions and green peppers. Bring to a boil and add chicken bouillon and lipton onion soup mix. Simmer until ready to serve. Add salt and pepper for seasoning.
Drain shrimp. Toss with mayonnaise, vinegar, onions, celery seed and seasonings. Chill until serving time. Toss with coleslaw mixture just before serving. Garnish with grape tomatoes.

Heat olive oil and sauté onion and ginger. Add chickpeas and garlic and saute until fragrant. Add diced tomatoes and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Add garam masala and cumin. Simmer 15 minutes more. Add salt and fresh cilantro and serve over rice with naan bread for dipping.

Boil potatoes until tender. Cube potatoes into half inch cubes. Add the onions and peppers to the potatoes. In a separate bowl combine the soup, milk and seasoning. Mix in the potatoes with the soup mixture. Pour into a buttered casserole dish. Sprinkle with longhorn cheese. Bake 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Make the pizza dough. Spread the dough with your hands out onto a cookie sheet. Layer the pizza dough with the sauce and oregano. Cover with mozzarella cheese. Then layer with the hamburger. Top with pineapple chunks. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before removing from cookie sheet.

Soak the beans overnight or for eight hours in a large pot of cold water. Drain and rinse well. Add enough fresh cold water to cover the beans by about three inches. Add a pinch of salt. Place a large lid on the pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until tender and falling apart, about two to three hours. Drain and reserve the cooking liquid. Put the beans and liquid into a large saucepan or large soup kettle. Add enough cold water to cover by three inches and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until tender and falling apart, about two to three hours. Drain and reserve the cooking liquid. Put the beans and liquid into a large saucepan or large soup kettle. Add enough cold water to cover by three inches and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until tender and falling apart, about two to three hours. Drain and reserve the cooking liquid. Put the beans and liquid into a large saucepan or large soup kettle. Add enough cold water to cover
Brown the beef in water with salt. Add onion and carrot. Cook 5 minutes more. Add zucchini. Cook 5 minutes more. Drain. Add spaghetti sauce. Add rotini pasta. Mix. Add cheese. Cook 10 minutes more.

Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the pork chops and cook until browned on all sides. Add the wine, stirring to scrape up any brown bits from the pan. Transfer to a baking dish. In the skillet used to brown the pork chops, add the celery, thyme leaves and cream of mushroom soup. Bring to a boil. Pour the mixture over the chops. Bake until the pork chops are tender, about 30 minutes. Sprinkle the chops with the apple. Bake until the apple is tender, about 15 more minutes.

Cream butter and sugars together until fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in vanilla. Sift together flour, baking powder and baking soda. Stir into butter mixture until blended. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 until light brown around edges. Cool on wire racks 5 minutes before removing from cookie sheets.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Wash potatoes. Cut potatoes into 1/4 inch thick wedges. Arrange wedges in single layer on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Drizzle with vegetable oil. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until tender. Yield 4 servings.

Blend papayas with whole milk until smooth. Add sugar to taste and blend. Place in ice cream machine or blender with ice cubes and process for about 20 minutes until smooth and creamy. Add spices to taste. Serve as dessert with ice cream or fresh berries.

Peel and quarter tomatoes and bell peppers into medium-sized pieces. Add mustard seeds and white vinegar and bring to a boil. Add tomato and bell peppers and simmer for about 15 minutes. Pack hot pickles into clean pint or quart jars and seal with new lids and rings. If necessary, boil lids and rings in a pan of water for a minute or two to sterilize and seal tightly when cooled. Store in a cool dry place for at least three weeks before eating or refrigerate after opening for up to six months.

In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Saute the onions and garlic for about 5 minutes or until they are translucent. Add the spinach to the skillet and saute for 5 minutes. Add the tofu to the skillet. Cook for another 5 minutes. In a small bowl whisk together the chicken bouillon, the lemon juice and the water. Add the chicken bouillon mixture to the skillet. Cook for another 2 minutes. Remove from heat. In a large bowl combine the spinach mixture with the breadcrumbs. Season with black pepper. Mix together.

Rinse israeli couscous thoroughly under cold water and set aside. Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add salt to the water and cook the couscous until tender (about 15 minutes). Drain the couscous well and add to a large mixing bowl. Toss with the olive oil and a generous amount of salt and fresh ground pepper. Mix the tomatoes into the couscous. Add the mozzarella cheese and toss again. Tear the basil leaves off the stems. Add the basil to the salad. Just before serving, drizzle balsamic vinegar over the salad.

Heat the oil and a large fry pan over medium heat and add the spring onions, garlic, and red chile. Stir occasionally until soft and fragrant. Add the cannellini and butter beans and cook for two minutes. Stir in the vinegar and salt and pepper to taste. Transfer the beans and vegetables to a large salad bowl and toss with the parsley. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 1-quart casserole dish. In a large skillet over medium heat cook the egg substitute until frothy. Add butter. Add corn kernelscook and stir over low heat for 3 minutes. Stir in corn muffin mixcook 2 minutes. Stir in yogurt. Pour into prepared casserole dish. Bake for 20 minutes or until set. Top with cream-style corn.

Cut the vegetables into small pieces. Whisk together the vinegar, oil, sugar, salt and pepper. Pour the mixture over the vegetables. Toss to coat. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Just before serving, stir in the sour cream. Serve cold.

Bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add the lamb shanks. Reduce the heat to simmer for 20 minutes. Add the salt. Remove the lamb shanks. Drain the liquid from the pot into a bowl. Put the lamb back into the same pot. Add the onion, ghee, mixed spice, plain yogurt, and cornstarch. Cook for 30 minutes. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Wash the potatoes. Cut into french fries. Dip fries in flour mixture. Deep-fry in 375 degree oil for 5 minutes. Fry the fries in 1 inch of hot cooking oil for about 5 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Salt to taste. Makes 4 servings.

Mix the brown sugar and pecans together in a large bowl. Set aside. Grease a 9 x 13 baking dish with the 1 teaspoon of butter. Remove the dough from the freezer and place on a floured work surface. Flatten with your hands into a rectangle and roll out to a 12 x 12 inch rectangle. Spread the brown sugar and pecan mixture over the dough and roll up tightly from a short end. Place in the baking dish and pinch the ends together to seal. Brush the top of the dough with the remaining teaspoon of butter and sprinkle with cinnamon and powdered sugar. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F oven 45 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool slightly and serve with more powdered sugar and warm maple syrup if desired.

Put pork into large roasting pan and add enough water to cover pork by about 2-3 inches. Add seasonings to taste and bring water to boil over high heat.
