Reduce heat to medium and simmer for about 3 hours, until pork is tender and easily pulls apart with a fork. Let pork cool slightly to room temperature. Transfer meat to cutting board and pull meat apart with two forks into shreds. Serve warm or cooled over buns.

In a medium bowl, mix together yogurt and cream and whisk until smooth. Add sugar and whisk until blended. Pour mixture into a large ice cream maker and process according to manufacturer's instructions. Place ice cream in a large metal or glass bowl and stir in lemon juice until blended.

Put oil in a large saucepan or soup pot. Fry the onions and leek with the garlic until softened. Add the carrots, celery, lentils, water and seasoning. Bring to the boil, then cover with the lid. Cook for 20 minutes. Add the frankfurters. Cook for another 5-10 minutes. Check the seasoning. Serve.

Mix yogurt, paprika, cumin and coriander. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Mix in minced garlic. Cut salmon steak into 4 equal pieces. Dip each piece first in flour then egg and finally breadcrumbs. Heat 3 tbsp. of oil in medium pan. Fry salmon cutlets for 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Serve salmon cutlets topped with yoghurt sauce. Garnish with coriander leaves.

Place butter, golden syrup and brown sugar into a mixing bowl. Using an electric whisk, beat together the butter mixture until light and fluffy. Add the caster sugar and beat again. Sift together the flour, cinnamon and baking powder. Add to the mixture with the butter mixture. Gently mix together. Spoon the mixture into a piping bag fitted with a star nozzle. Pipe 15cm circles onto the baking tray. Bake at 180°C for 15-20 minutes. The biscuits should be golden and firm. Cool for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.

Soak the chickpeas overnight. Drain. Place the chickpeas in a food processor with a little olive oil and blitz until smooth. Add the lemon juice and tahini. Blitz again. Add the spring onions and blitz. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with carrots.

Slice tomatoes in half lengthwise. Cut off the tops and discard. Place in a 2-quart bowl. Add the jalapeno pepper slices. Add the garlic and red onion slices. Place the cilantro leaves and black pepper in a small bowl. Add the sugar and salt. Add the mixture to the tomatoes. Squeeze the juice from the key limes into the bowl and stir well. Add the lime slices. Cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days.

Place 1 rice paper sheet on a work surface. Place a carrot and a cucumber on the rice paper sheet. Top with a thin slice of salmon. Roll up the rice paper sheet around the filling. Place a sheet of rice paper on a work surface. Place the rolled up rice paper sheet on the rice paper sheet on the work surface. Repeat with the remaining filling and rice paper sheets. Serve the rolls in a bowl or on a plate. Garnish each roll with a small amount of chilli sauce, lime juice, fresh coriander leaves and mint leaves.

Combine all ingredients in a crock pot. Place ribs on top of sauce mixture. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or on high for 4 hours. Allow to cool slightly before removing ribs from crock pot. Serve with baked potatoes or coleslaw. Refrigerate any leftovers for another meal.

Melt butter over low heat. Stir in sugar and cook until sugar is dissolved. Stir in chocolate chips. Remove from heat and stir in cracker crumbs. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake in 350 oven for 12 to 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine honey, splenda granular & soy sauce in a bowl. Pour over wings & toss to coat. Transfer wings to baking dish. Cover & bake until wings are cooked through (about 40 minutes). Remove from oven & let cool. Meanwhile, combine oil & garlic clove in a small bowl. Stir to combine. Pour over wings & toss to coat. Serve.

Heat butter in skillet over medium heat. Add pork chops and season with salt and pepper. Cook until golden brown on both sides. Transfer to plate. Stir in celery leaves and celery ribs. Pour wine into pan. Add apples. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until apples are softened. Return pork chops to pan. Add bay leaves. Cook until pork is tender. Stir in brown sugar. Transfer to platter. Cover with swiss cheese. Let stand for 1 minute. Cut into chops. Serve.

Cut pineapple and mango in small pieces. Cut pepper in small pieces. Place all of the above in large bowl and add rice wine vinegar. Mix well and set aside for 15 minutes. Drain off liquid and put all in blender and process until smooth. Pour mixture into glass bowls and add juice of lemon and sprinkle with cilantro and pepper. Serve cold.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl combine the Bisquick, quick-cooking oats, brown sugar, cinnamon, butter and strawberry preserves. Stir until the preserves are evenly distributed throughout the mixture. Press the mixture into the bottom of a lightly greased 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes. In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the sugar, milk and cornstarch. Cook, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from the heat and add the vanilla. Pour the filling over the crust. Bake for about 25 more minutes or until the filling is set. Let cool completely. Cut into bars to serve.

Mix all the dressing ingredients together. Make sure it's well mixed. Spread the dressing on the bottom of the platter. Place lettuce on top of the dressing. Place tomatoes and avocado on lettuce. Sprinkle bacon and grated cheese on the salad. Serve immediately.

Heat the olive oil or butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened and translucent, about 10 minutes. Stir in the flour and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon. Gradually stir in the water and tomato puree until smooth. Bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes until slightly thickened. Stir in the sugar and salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 5 more minutes. Remove from heat and add the polish sausage to the sauce. Let simmer for 5 minutes. Serve over hot cooked pasta or rice and garnish with parsley if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spread 1/2 of the ding dong cake in bottom of 9x13 pan. Pour 1/3 of the pudding over cake. Add 1/2 of the cool whip. Top with another 1/3 of the pudding and another 1/2 of the cool whip. Repeat layers. Top with remaining cake pieces. Spread remaining pudding evenly. Cover and refrigerate 2 hours. Garnish with additional cool whip if desired.

Melt 12 ounces of chocolate chips in the microwave or double boiler until smooth. Dump out onto your work surface. Stir in 1 cup of heavy cream. Mix well. Set aside to cool. Beat 1 cup of heavy cream until stiff. Fold 1 1/2 cups of the whipped cream into the cooled melted chocolate. Fold in 1/2 cup chunky peanut butter. Fold in remaining whipped cream until mixed well. Set aside to firm up. Line cookie sheet or trays with parchment paper. Using 2 teaspoons measure out the peanut butter mixture for each truffle. Roll balls of the mixture into balls. Place the balls on the cookie sheet or trays. Place the truffles in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Store in an air-tight container in the refrigerator.

Cut the potatoes into 1/2-inch thick wedges. Bring a large pot of water to boiling. Add the potatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Drain well. Heat the butter and 1/3 cup of the milk in a 2-quart saucepan until butter melts and begins to bubble. Add the potatoes and cook over low heat for 2 minutes. Stir in the remaining milk and cook, stirring frequently until the potatoes are tender but not falling apart. Stir in the cheddar and parsley. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper. Serve warm.

Sprinkle both sides of chicken breasts with salt. In a small bowl combine 2 tablespoons lemon juice with 1/4 teaspoon each salt and black pepper. Place chicken in a shallow dish and pour marinade over chicken. Refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours. Place chicken in a shallow baking dish. In a medium bowl stir 3/4 cup breadcrumbs with 1/2 cup grated Parmesan. Spoon breadcrumb mixture over chicken. Bake at 400 degrees for 35 to 40 minutes or until chicken is done. Sprinkle chicken with remaining breadcrumbs. Bake for 5 minutes more or until breadcrumbs are browned. Serve with Yoghurt sauce. In a small bowl combine 1/2 cup natural yogurt with 2 tablespoons lemon juice. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon salt and black pepper. Serve with chicken.

Drain tofu and pat dry. Cut into small cubes and marinate in soy sauce and lime juice. In a large skillet over medium heat saute onion and green pepper until softened. Add tofu and cook for 10 minutes. Add tomato sauce and simmer for 5 minutes. Serve over rice.

Prepare grill for direct heat. Place orange juice and peanut butter in small saucepan over low heat. Cook until slightly thickened. Add curry powdercook 1 minute more. Place chicken in baking dish. Pour orange juice mixture over chicken. Sprinkle bell pepper and coconut over chicken. Cover dish with foil. Grill 10 minutes. Turn chicken over. Cover and grill until done, about 10 minutes longer. Uncover and grill until golden brown. Serve with cooked rice.

Combine brown sugar and cornstarch in a medium saucepan. Stir in salt, crushed pineapple and lemon juice. Bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in prepared mustard. Remove from heat and let cool. Store in refrigerator.

Wash potatoes and cut into small cubes. Bring water and beef to a boil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook for about 20 minutes or until beef is completely cooked and no longer pink. Drain beef and return to the saucepan. Add the gravy mix and water to beef. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes or until the gravy thickens a little and the beef is completely cooked. Boil potatoes in water for about 10 minutes or until they are fork tender. Drain water and return potatoes to saucepan over medium heat. Add the beef mixture and the milk and stir well to combine. Simmer for about 5 minutes or until the potatoes are heated through and the gravy thickens a little more. Stir in the butter and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm with a side salad for a complete meal.

1. Blanch gai choy in boiling water for about 1 minute. Drain. 2. In a wok or large frying pan, heat oil and saute garlic and onion until translucent. Add gai choy and stir-fry for about 5 minutes. 3. Add fish sauce and sugar. Stir-fry for about 5 minutes. Serve hot with steamed white rice.

In a large sauce pan, heat oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until translucent about 1 minute. Add chicken stock and simmer until cauliflower is tender about 12 minutes or until cauliflower is tender about 12 minutes or until cauliflower is tender. Add evaporated skim milk and nutmeg, salt and pepper. Continue simmering for another minute or two until cauliflower is tender. Puree soup using an immersion blender or transfer soup to a blender and puree until smooth. Return soup to sauce pan and stir in white cheddar cheese until it melts and soup is smooth and creamy. Serve immediately.

Remove tough core from cabbage, leaving only the leaves. Cut cabbage leaves into quarters. Heat a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add 2 tbsp olive oil to the pan (or cooking oil of choice). Add 1 tsp crushed red pepper flakes to oil and stir well to dissolve pepper flakes into oil. Next add 1 cup shredded cabbage to pan and stir for 1 minute. Next add 3 minced garlic cloves to pan and stir for 1 minute. Next add 1/4 cup water to pan and stir for 1 minute. Next add 1 tbsp soy sauce to pan and stir for 1 minute. Next add 1/4 cup freshly squeezed lime juice to pan and stir for 1 minute. Next add 1 tbsp red wine vinegar to pan and stir for 1 minute. Next add 1/2 cup water to pan and stir for 1 minute. Next add 1/4 cup olive oil to pan and stir for 1 minute. Next add 1/4 cup vegetable oil to pan and stir for

In small bowl combine garlic cloves, pepper and 1/2 cup skim milk. In skillet brown pork tenderloin in 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat for 4 minutes on each side or until desired doneness. Remove from pan and keep warm. In same skillet cook and stir horseradish and mustard in butter until smooth and hot, about 2 minutes. Stir in remaining milk and heat through, stirring occasionally. Serve pork with sauce on side.
Combine butter, water, vinegar, salt, pepper and worcestershire sauce in saucepan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cook chicken in sauce until done.

In a large bowl or pitcher, stir together milk, vanilla extract, cinnamon and chili powder. Mix in powdered cocoa mix. Pour boiling water into pitcher. Stir to dissolve. Add instant coffee granules. Stir until coffee is dissolved. Pour into mug. Top with whipped cream.

Combine cabbage, turnips and carrot in a large bowl. Add sugar, white vinegar and canola oil and toss until coated. Pour over sweet-hot mustard and stir until well coated and blended. Cover and let sit for at least an hour before serving. Serve over a bed of fresh lettuce leavessprinkle with celery seed and top with a few celery sticks for a refreshing side dish.
Place all the ingredients in the slow cooker. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Serve with salad or fresh fruit.

Melt butter over medium heat and add onion and bell pepper. Cook until tender. Remove from heat and stir in beef. Season with salt and pepper. Add broth and heat through. Split sandwich buns and add roast beef. Top with swiss cheese and place back on bread. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.

Cook ground beef in large skillet over medium heat about 5 minutesdrain fat. Add garlic and sauté another minute. Add all remaining ingredients except Velveeta and mix well. Cook over low heat for about 1 hour stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and let stand for 15 minutes before serving with crackers or tortilla chips. -- from the carolina panthers recipe book.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1-inch cubes. Place potatoes in large pot and add enough water to cover by 1 inch. Bring potatoes to boil and boil until tender. Drain potatoes. Cool potatoes slightly. Place potatoes in large bowl. Add celery seed and salt & pepper to taste. In small bowl, whisk together sour cream and mayonnaise until smooth. Pour sour cream mixture over potatoes and gently toss to combine. Add eggs and pickle. Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large mixing bowl beat together brown sugar and 1/4 cup water. Add apples and caramels. Place the mixture in a greased 9 x 13 inch pan. In a separate bowl combine the rest of the ingredients. Stir together with a fork until crumbly. Sprinkle crumb mixture over apple mixture. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare a 9 x 13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine the shredded hash brown mixture with the beef stock. Mix in the milk. Add the garlic powder, salt and the pepper. Mix well. Spread the mixture evenly into the prepared pan. Sprinkle the top with the colby cheese. Bake for 45 minutes or until the top is lightly golden brown.

Heat meat in pan over medium heat. Cook until brown. Drain fat. Add cheese, green onion and cook for 3 minutes until cheese is melted. Add in tomatoes and simmer for 1 minute. Add in tortilla chips and serve.

Prepare and drain potatoes as directed. Peel potatoes and boil until tender. Drain and cool. Combine potatoes with sour cream, cream cheese and butter. Mix well. Fold in chives. Transfer mixture to crock pot. Mix together paprika and salt and pepper. Sprinkle over potatoes. Cook on high heat until heated through. Serve immediately.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook potatoes until tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a large bowl combine vinaigrette and hot sauce. Add potatoes and toss to coat. Fold in celery and blue cheese. Let stand for 30 minutes. Serve.

Brush a 10x10 baking dish with olive oil. Place 1/2 of feta cheese in baking dish. Top with 1/2 of parsley leaves. Sprinkle 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes over top layer of feta. Drizzle olive oil over top layer of parsley. Sprinkle with 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes. Place baking dish in oven. Cook for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Place 1/2 of feta cheese and 1/2 of parsley on top. Sprinkle 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes over top layer of feta. Drizzle olive oil over top layer of parsley. Sprinkle with 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes. Place baking dish back in oven. Cook for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Place 1/2 of feta cheese and 1/2 of parsley on top. Sprinkle 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes over top layer of feta

In a large skillet saute margarine and onion over medium heat until onion is tender. Add flour to skillet and stir constantly. Cook 2 minutes more. Add apple juice and stir until bubbly. Add fish fillets and brown 5 to 7 minutes on each side. Sprinkle fish with brown sugar, cinnamon and raisins. Cover and cook 10 minutes. Sprinkle pecans over top. Serve with your favorite brown rice.
Combine coffee with ice cubes and frozen strawberries in blender until slushy. Pour into tall glasses and top with vanilla ice cream and strawberry preserves.

Cut beefsteak tomatoes in half. Place in a medium-size bowl. Add onion to the bowl with the tomatoes. Add olive oil and balsamic vinegar to the bowl. Stir well. Season with salt and pepper. Divide the fettuccine evenly among 6 pasta bowls. Add 1/2 cup of marinated tomatoes and mozzarella to each bowl. Garnish with fresh basil. Serve immediately.

Preheat the broiler. Place the fish fillets on a plate. Sprinkle corn flakes and macadamia nuts onto the fillets and gently pat into the fillets. In a small bowl combine the soy sauce, honey and mustard and brush onto the fillets. Sprinkle parsley over the fillets. Place fillets on a broiler pan. Coat the fish with cooking spray and broil for 3-5 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Remove from the broiler and serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a cookie sheet with butter or cooking spray. Mix the first 4 ingredients in a large bowl until well combinedstir in the oats. Mix in the flour until blended. Roll dough into balls (about 1 1/2-inches each), place dough balls 2 inches apart onto the cookie sheet. Bake until the cookies are set, about 15 minutes. Remove from the baking sheet and cool 2 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Bake potatoes whole on middle rack at 350 until soft. Let cool. Remove skin and discard. Cut potatoes in half. Place cut potatoes on a foil lined cookie sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt. Roast for 30 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile, cook artichokes according to package directions. Drain and chop. Mix artichokes with lemon zest and juice. Season to taste. Add potatoes to artichokes and toss to coat. Sprinkle with chopped fresh parsley and serve. Serves 4.

Peel potatoes and cut into even-sized slices (about 1/8-inch thick). Heat olive oil in large skillet on medium heat. Add sliced potatoes in batches and cook until potatoes are tender and golden brown in spots but still firm to the touch (about 8 minutes). Drain and transfer to paper towels to absorb excess oil. Add butter to the skillet and heat until melted and foaming. Add thinly sliced onion and sauté until softened but not brown (about 5 minutes). Add thyme and beef stock and simmer until thickened (about 10 minutes). Add potatoes and toss to coat in sauce. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Prepare graham cracker crust. Place in a 9-inch pie plate. In a medium bowl, combine egg yolks, sweetened condensed milk, key lime juice and pure vanilla extract. Whip egg whites until soft peaks form. Fold egg whites into key lime mixture until fluffy. Spoon key lime mixture into crust, smoothing out top. Bake 50-55 minutes or until set. Allow pie to cool on a wire rack. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.

Roll out cinnamon roll dough into a rectangle and spread blueberries, blueberry preserves and lemon peel over the dough in a single layer. Fold the dough in half and then roll out again. Cut into 12-16 1-inch squares. Brush with milk and sprinkle with pecans and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet and bake until golden brown. Serve warm with berry preserves for dipping.

Shave daikon into thin ribbons with a mandoline. Toss with ham and crumbled parmigiano. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon butter. Add shaved daikon and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook until softened, about 8 minutes. Toss with ham and 1 tablespoon butter. Season with salt and pepper. Add remaining butter and cook until melted. Add 1 beaten egg and cook until softly scrambled. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Add daikon sprouts and ham and toss to combine. Serve immediately.
Mix all together in large baking dish. Bake at 350f for 35 minutes or until potatoes are tender and baked to desired doneness. Serve with your favorite salad and bread.

Bring stock and lentils to a simmer over medium-high heat and cook for about 20 minutes, until lentils are tender. Purée with a blender until smooth. In a saucepan over medium heat, sauté onion and garlic until softened, about 2 minutes. Add ginger and sauté for another minute. Add puréed lentils and stock, bring to a simmer and cook for about 20 minutes until sauce is thickened and flavors have mingled. Stir in coconut milk and crushed tomatoes and simmer for about 10 more minutes. Season with turmeric and a splash of lemon juice. Serve immediately or refrigerate and serve cold. Garnish with chopped chives or fresh herbs if desired. Makes about 4 cups.

Mix olive oil, old bay seasoning, lime juice, honey, basil leaves in a plastic bag. Add tuna steak to the bag and shake until steak is well coated. Serve over rice or in a pita pocket or lettuce leaf. The lime juice in the marinade helps tenderize the tuna steak. You can also use the marinade to make tuna steak sandwiches or tuna salad. You can use this recipe for any type of meat or seafood that you would like to marinate or flavor.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter the outside of the French Bread and place on a baking sheet. Spoon the sauce over the buttered bread. Top the sauce with pepperoni slices and cheese. Place the French Bread into the oven uncovered and bake for 20-25 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the crust is browned. Enjoy.

Preheat the broiler. Place the fillets on the broiler pan and broil until the fish is slightly browned and flaky. Remove from the broiler and coat with the sauce. Set the fillets on a plate and serve hot with rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl combine white sugar and milkset aside. In another bowl combine flour and cocoa. Combine the flour and cocoa mixtures. Add the cocoa mixture to the sugar mixture and stir until blended. Stir in oats and coconut. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased baking sheet. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until cookies are set. Remove from oven. Cool cookies for 10 minutes before removing from baking sheet.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 13 x 9-inch pan or line with aluminum foilset aside. In large bowl beat brown sugar with butter until fluffy. Add eggbeat well. Stir in oats and rice cereal. Press into pan. Bake 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely. In small microwave-safe bowl heat chocolate chips and butterscotch chipsmicrowave 2 minutes or until melted. Spread over bars. Refrigerate until firm. Store tightly covered.

Steam cauliflower in a steamer basket over boiling water for 5 minutes. Cool and chop. Place chopped cauliflower in a large bowl. Add celery, hard-boiled eggs, green onions, bacon and garlic. In another bowl, whisk together nonfat sour cream, fat-free mayonnaise, fat-free buttermilk and salt. Fold sour cream mixture into cauliflower mixture.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add salt. Add asparagus and cook for 2-3 minutes or until tender. Drain well and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat add olive oil. Add onions and saute for 3 minutes. Add bell peppers and saute for an additional 2 minutes. Add asparagus and garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl and drizzle with vinaigrette. Top with parmesan cheese and serve.

Melt butter in small saucepan. Stir in milk. Bring to a boil stirring occasionally. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in flour. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in garlic salt parsley. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in cheese. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in seasonings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Cut squash in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds and fibers. Place squash face down in roasting pan and add about 1/2 inch of water to pan. Bake until squash is tender. When squash is cooked, remove from oven and let cool for 10 minutes before removing flesh from skin. Cut flesh from skin and add to food processor along with remaining ingredients. Blend until smooth. Strain mixture through medium sieve into saucepan and heat until soup is hot. Serve.

Cook penne pasta according to package directions, drain well and set aside. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, sauté oil with basil leaves for 1 minute, then add sun-dried tomatoes and sauté 2 minutes more. Stir in Asiago cheesecook 2 minutes longer or until melted. Stir in red pepper flakes if desired. Drain pasta well and stir into sun-dried tomato mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Makes 4 servings.
In a large bowl combine all the ingredients except for the lettuce. Toss with a fork. Chill until ready to serve. Serve over lettuce.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place the mashed potatoes in a large bowl and fold in the bacon. Transfer the mixture to a small baking pan that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Use your hands to form the mixture into 12 evenly round patties. Place the patties on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle the patties with the cheese. Bake for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Place broccoli in a large crock pot. Set aside. Place chicken in a large mixing bowl. Add orange juice, broth, honey, dry mustard and teriyaki sauce. Stir gently. Pour the mixture over the broccoli. Place the crock pot lid on the crock pot. Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours. When ready to serve, remove the chicken from the crock pot. Place it in a large serving platter. Place the broccoli in a large serving bowl. Add the carrot. Serve with the chicken. Top each serving with a little honey.

Combine ground beef with taco seasoning. Mix well. Layer in a serving bowl with sour cream, dry ranch dressing mix and cheese. Add chopped lettuce, chopped onions and chopped tomatoes. Stir to combine. Serve with tortilla chips. Serves 6 to 8.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add noodles. Cook for 3-4 minutes or until noodles are tender yet firm to bite. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a wok or large skillet, heat peanut and sesame oils over medium heat. Add ginger and scallions. Cook until ginger is tender and translucent. Add noodles and toss to coat. Add oyster sauce and season with salt and fresh white pepper. Toss to coat and serve.
Combine all of the ingredients into a large bowl. Toss gently. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Serve at room temperature.

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in 9-inch ovenproof skillet and add onion and carrot. Saute for 5 minutes. Add salt and curry. Cook for another 10 minutes until tender. Beat eggs and milk and add to skillet. Cook over low heat until just set and cheese is melted. Top with paprika.

Soak beans in water 8 hours or overnight. Drain and place in a large saucepan. Add water to cover. Cook over medium heat until tender about 1 hour. Strain and reserve the cooking liquid. Add garlic cloves to the beans and cook 10 minutes more or until tender and golden brown. Remove and reserve. Add extra virgin olive oil to the beans. Add salt and pepper and cook 1 minute over low heat to blend the flavors. Pour off the cooking liquid and reserve. Strain the beans through a sieve or a colander to remove any grit or skin and to allow the flavors to blend together. Transfer the beans to a blender or food processor and add the reserved cooking liquid. Puree until the beans are smooth and creamy. Transfer to a clean saucepan and add enough extra virgin olive oil to bring the total amount of oil up to 1 cup. Add the garlic cloves, paprika and hot pepper and simmer for 1 minute over low heat. Remove the garlic cloves. Stir in the kalamata olive slices and heat through over

Crumble cracker in a medium bowl. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add ham and brown. Add pork and beef and brown. In a medium bowl beat eggs lightly and add to cracker crumbs. Stir in tomato soup. Add vinegar and brown sugar. Add meat mixture to cracker mixture and mix well. Form meat into 1/2 inch balls. Place in greased casserole dish. Pour remaining sauce over balls and cover with foil. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for 10 more minutes or until done. Serve hot with your favorite vegetable.

Crack eggs into large bowl. Add heavy whipping cream to egg mixture. Season with salt and cracked black pepper. Whisk to combine. In a separate bowl, mash the bagels into crumbs. Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a small pan over low heat. Add the herbs to the hot butter. Stir constantly until herbs are fragrant. Remove from heat. Add the melted herbs to the eggs. Whisk to combine. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. When the butter is melted, add the eggs to the pan. Cook the eggs until they are firm. Remove the eggs from the pan. Serve with the bagels. Top each bagel half with a generous dollop of scrambled eggs. Top each bagel with a slice of smoked salmon. Serve immediately.

Combine 1/4 cup oreo crumbs and 3 tablespoons butter in a food processor. Process until crumbs are fine. In a large mixing bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Add 1/4 cup oreo crumbs and 1 cup white chocolate chips and continue beating. Add sugar and beat well. Add 4 eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition. Add vanilla and orange zest and beat well. Pour batter into a greased 9x13 pan and sprinkle remaining oreo crumbs over top. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Cool and refrigerate for 2 hours. Sprinkle 3 tablespoons of white chocolate chips over cheesecake and refrigerate until chocolate is hard. Garnish with dried cranberries.
Combine tequila, triple sec and frozen limeade concentrate in a pitcher. Add ice and water. Stir and pour into glasses filled with ice. Garnish with lime.

Peel and core apples and cut into quarters, then halve crosswise. Place in a large bowl and toss with blueberries and lemon juice. Transfer to a greased 2-qt baking dish, spreading to cover bottom of dish evenly. In a small bowl, combine flour, sugar and spicescut in margarine until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle over fruitpat to cover evenly. Bake at 375° for 45-50 minutes or until topping is lightly browned and fruit is tender. Serve warm with or without whipped topping.

Grease a 10-inch skillet with butter. Heat over medium heat. Cook rice, uncovered, over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until liquid has been absorbed and rice is tender. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with cheese. Turn down heat to low. In another skillet, heat the pepperoni slices over medium heat for 1 minute or until hot. Fold pepperoni into rice mixture and cook 1 more minute. Meanwhile, beat the eggs with salt and pepper to taste. Add to the rice mixture and cook over low heat until set on the bottom. Sprinkle with pepper, turn the omelet out onto a plate. Serve with toast or crackers if desired.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until onion is softened. Stir in rice. Add broth. Cover and cook for 18-20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Add raisins and almonds. Toss until well combined. Serve warm.

Combine cornstarch and lemon juice in a medium bowlmix well. Gradually whisk in champagne. Stir in shallot. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to medium-lowsimmer 5 minutes. Add 4 cups of the cheeses (Gruyere and Emmenthaler) in 2 batches. Reduce heat to lowcook 5 minutes or until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining cheeses (Brie)cook 1 minute or until melted. Stir in ground nutmeg and white pepper. Stir in 1 cup of the bread slicestoss to coat. Serve immediately in warm bread bowls. Makes 6 servings.

Spray pizza crust lightly with cooking spray. Place pizza crust onto a baking sheet. Spread hummus over pizza crust. Top hummus with slices of chicken breast. Sprinkle hummus with all purpose greek seasoning. Top with slices of red onions. Sprinkle red onions with feta cheese. Sprinkle red onions with slices of fresh tomato. Top red onions with slices of fresh mozzarella cheese. Drizzle pizza crust evenly with olive oil. Bake at 425 degrees f for 15 minutes. Serve.

Place the chicken wings on a baking sheet. In a small saucepan over medium heat, heat the plum jam until it begins to bubble. Degrease the wings by pouring them into a colander and rinsing under cold water. Add the wings to the saucepan and cook for 2 minutes. Add soy sauce, hot sauce and mustard. Cook for 5 minutes, or until the sauce begins to thicken slightly. Transfer the wings to a platter lined with a paper towel. Serve with celery sticks.

Heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat for a few minutes until hot. Add the mushroom and cook until it releases its liquid. Add the tamari and black pepper to the mushroom mixture and bring to a boil. Add the hot water and bring to a boil again. Reduce the heat to low and continue to simmer for a few minutes until thickened. Then stir in the cornstarch and continue to cook until the gravy thickens. Serve with your favorite vegetables or as a sauce over vegetarian dishes such as seitan chili or vegetarian lasagna.
1place water and yeast into bread machine bowl. Add flour, gluten flour, sugar, butter and salt to bread machine pan. Select dough cycle on bread machine.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add pasta to watercook for 10 minutes. While pasta is cooking, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heatsaute onions for about 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in mushroomssaute for about 2 minutes or until tender. Stir in chickencook for about 3 minutes or until tender. Add Italian dressingcook for about 1 minute or until sauce thickens slightly. Drain pastaadd to skillettoss to coat with sauce. Stir in the California-Blend frozen vegetablescook for about 2 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheesetoss to coat. Serve with additional Parmesan cheese if desired.

Boil the potatoes until soft. Drain the potatoes. Mash the potatoes. Add the cream cheese and the rest of the ingredients. Stir until all the ingredients are blended together. Place in a 9x13 pan. Bake for 15 minutes.

In a large salad bowl, whisk together the orange juice, vinegar, salt and pepper until well combined. Pour half into a medium saucepan over medium heat to warm. Set aside remaining half for later. Dress salad leaves with remaining half of dressing in large salad bowl. Add mandarin oranges, almonds to salad. Toss to mix well with dressing. Add reserved warm dressing to salad to toss well again. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet brown meat and add onion and garlic powder. Drain and mix in remaining ingredients and season with salt and pepper. Shape into patties and cook on the grill or pan fry. Serve on hamburger buns.

Beat cream cheese and parmesan cheese with an electric mixer in small bowl until combined. Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heatadd milk and heat until almost boiling, stirring frequently. Gradually add hot milk mixture to cream cheese mixture, beating until well blended. Cook over medium heat until bubbly and thickened slightly. Add vegetables and season with salt and pepper to tastemix well. Cook and stir until vegetables are tender and sauce is thickened. Drain fettuccineadd fettuccine to saucepan with vegetables and sauce mixturetoss well. Top with additional parmesan if desired.
Slice oranges into segments. Place on large plate. Top with ice cream. Sprinkle with Grand Marnier. Sprinkle with ground cinnamon. Garnish with fresh mint.

Slice white bread horizontally and toast both sides. Place pineapple on one slice of bread and top with bacon and cheese. Press sandwich closed and slice diagonally to serve. Serve with a glass of cold milk for the ultimate comfort food!
Blend yoghurt with all the other ingredients to a smooth paste. Refrigerate for at least 15 minutes. Serve with paranthas or samosas.

In a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer at medium-high speed, beat the sour cream, water, brown sugar, and gluten for 30 seconds or until smooth. Gradually add the bread flour to the mixture all at once and mix on medium-high speed until the dough is smooth, about 30 seconds longer. Stir in the yeast. Beat at low speed for 10 seconds to mix. Transfer the dough to a greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan coated with cooking spray. Cover with a dampened towel, and let stand for 1 hour or until doubled in size. Bake at 375 for 50-55 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the pan to a wire rack to cool.

Trim any excess fat from the chickens and pat them dry with paper towels. Place the chickens in a large roasting pan and drizzle with olive oil. Rub the oregano and salt and pepper all over. Roast the chickens for 30 minutes, then remove them from the oven. Sprinkle the chickens with lemon juice and tuck the lemon wedges under the skin. Return the chickens to the oven and roast until the skin is very crisp and golden brown and the meat is cooked through, about 45 minutes more. Transfer the chickens to a carving board and let them rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving with the pan juices.

In sauce pan over medium heat combine tomato sauce, ketchup and dried onion flakes. Add green pepper and cook until tender. Stir in salt, garlic and celery seed. Add chili powder and mustard and stir to blend. In small bowl combine ground beef and seasoning. Add ground beef to sauce and stir to blend.

Slice pumpernickel bread and cut into cubes. Place cubes in food processor. Process until very crumbly. Add 1 tablespoon butter. Add 1 cup raw sugar and 1 cup yogurt. Pulse until sugar dissolves. Pour yogurt mixture into serving dish. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Place apricots in food processor. Process until chopped. Add apricots and 2 tablespoons butter to yogurt mixture. Cover and refrigerate. Serve with fruit.

Drain lima beans. Rinse and drain again. Put lima beans and ham bone in large stock pot. Add onion and ham bone. Cover and simmer 1 hour. Add dry mustard, vinegar and molasses. Cover and simmer for another hour or until lima beans are tender. Add chili sauce. Simmer for another 30 minutes or until thick and syrupy. Serve over rice.

Cook beef until browned. Stir in onions. Add green beans and mushrooms. Stir in soup. Add milk. Mix in gravy mix. Pour into 9x13 pan. Top with tater tots. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 40 minutes uncovered at 350f.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Cook macaroni according to package directionsdrain and place in a greased 2 quart casserole dish. Stir together cheeses, milk and eggs until well blendedpour over macaroni. Sprinkle with pepper and chilies. Bake at 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) for about 20 minutes or until brown and hotlet stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve with corn chips if desired.

Prepare mango chutney according to package directions. Rub pork tenderloin with spice rub. Place in a shallow roasting pan. Pour mango chutney over pork tenderloin. Cover with foil and roast for 35 minutes in a 325 degree oven. Remove foil from tenderloin and continue cooking until desired tenderness has been reached (approximately 15 minutes). Remove tenderloin from pan and brush with rum. Return tenderloin to pan and sprinkle with additional cinnamon. Cook 15 minutes. Remove from oven and serve with mashed potatoes or rice.

Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan or wok over medium heat. Add the shallots and garlic to the pan, then cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until tender. Add the cabbage to the pan and cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until just wilted. Add the horseradish to the pan and cook for 1 minute or until tender. Add the vinegar to the pan and cook for 30 seconds or until slightly thickened. Add the lemon juice to the pan, then cook for 1 minute or until slightly thickened. Add the salt to the pan to taste. Transfer the mixture to a large serving dish and sprinkle over with the freshly ground black pepper.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease an 8x8 pan. In a saucepan over medium heat, melt butter and sugar. Stir in water and chocolate and bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Beat in the flour and baking soda. Stir in the eggs. Beat until smooth. Pour into pan. Sprinkle with pecans. Bake at 350f for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool. Spread warm brownies with glaze. Melt 3 Tbsp. butter and 3 Tbsp. sugar in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Add 1 Tbsp. milk and stir until sugar dissolves. Bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes. Add 1/3 cup powdered sugar and stir until smooth. Pour over brownies and cool.
Put all ingredients into a large pot. Cook until rhubarb is soft. Puree with hand held mixer. Then strain mixture. Add jell-o to rhubarb mixture. Mix until dissolved. Pour into jars. Let set.

Cut biscuits into cubes. Cook chicken in a pan until done. Combine chicken, soup and cheese and mix well. Place cubes in cups. Pour the soup mixture in each cup. Sprinkle each cup with parsley flakes and black pepper. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 minutes. Serve.

Crack egg into a small bowl. Whisk egg whites until foamy. Stir in chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, salt, pepper and whisk again. Microwave for 30 seconds. Remove from microwave. Add toasted cheerios. Add nonstick cooking spray. Coat cheerios. Microwave for 1 minute. Remove from microwave. Mix until cheerios are coated. Let cool. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Prepare the vegetables by peeling the cabbage and chopping the onions and tomato into small pieces. Cook the ground beef until browned. Drain the beef well. Add the tomato soup, tomato juice, salt, and pepper. Stir well until combined. Put the cabbage on the bottom of a casserole dish. Put the beef on the cabbage mixture. Top with the rest of the cabbage leaves. Place the dish in the oven uncovered until the cabbage is tender. (Approximately 45 minutes). Remove from the oven and serve.

Mix low-fat mayonnaise and dried basil leaves in small bowl. Cook garlic and ground beef in large skillet over medium-high heat until beef is no longer pink and garlic is tender. Drain off fat. Stir in low-fat mayonnaise mixture and five-cheese blend. Stuff each hamburger bun with mixture. Top with lettuce leaves, tomatoes and pepperoncini peppers. Serve.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add the onion powder and nutmeg. Stirring constantly. Cook for about 2 minutes, or until the onion has softened. Add the baby spinach. Cook for another 2 minutes. Remove from the heat. Beat the eggs. Pour the eggs into the skillet. Cook for about 2 minutes or until the eggs are set. Top with the Parmesan cheese. Let stand for about 10 minutes. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a medium pot of salted boiling water, cook potatoes in batches until tender when pierced with a fork (about 10 minutes). Drain well and set aside until cool enough to handle. Peel potatoes and cut them into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. In an 8-inch square glass or ceramic baking dish, melt 3/4 cup of the butter in 1/4 cup olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened about 10 minutes stirring occasionally. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan over medium heat combine the water, creme fraiche and salt. Cook until heated through stirring occasionally. Add creme fraiche mixture to onions along with the cooked potatoes, and toss well to coat with sauce. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

Mix butter, brown sugar in saucepan on medium heat. Stir in milk. Continue stirring until mixture thickens. Stir in crackers. Pour onto a cookie sheet. Let cool for 10 minutes. Melt milk chocolate in microwave. Drizzle over crackers. Let stand at room temp. for 1 hour. Store in airtight container.

Brown meat in a large skillet. Drain meat. Add soup and tomato paste. Bring to a boil. Add macaroni. Cook until macaroni is tender. Stir in 1 can of Velveeta Cheese. Melt remaining Velveeta Cheese. Stir into macaroni mixture. Top with remaining Velveeta Cheese. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 30 minutes.

Cut the salami into thin slices. Spread the buns with mustard. Layer onions on the bottom bun. Top with the salami slices. Top with the american cheese. Place the second bun on top. Spread the second bun with more mustard. Spread the bun top and bottom with barbecue sauce.

Clean and drain the mushrooms. Cut the stems into quarters. Peel and slice the large button mushrooms. Arrange the mushroom slices and stems onto a platter. Brush the stems with a little extra virgin olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in the sherry wine. Cook over medium heat until slightly thickened and the alcohol has evaporated. Add the mayonnaise and whisk until smooth. Pour the alioli over the mushroom slices. Serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 4.

Preheat the oven to 220 degrees Celcius and oil the baking trays with some oil. Cut the chicken breast into slices across the grain of the meat so that they are flat & even in thickness. Set aside the bones & skin from the chicken. In a large frying pan heat some oil over medium heat & add the onions & red peppers. Saute until soft & tender, about 5 minutes. Add the chicken & cook for 5 minutes until it has been lightly browned. Pour in the stock & bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to low & simmer for 10 minutes. Meanwhile remove the skin & bones from the chicken & discard. Mash the chicken with the back of the fork & add the smoked salmon. Mix together & put into the preheated baking trays. Place the stuffed chicken in the oven for 20 minutes until golden brown & cooked through.

In a medium pot over medium heat, add bacon and cook for about 3 to 4 minutes. Add eggs and stir occasionally until eggs are cooked. Add rice and stir for a minute. Add scallion and sesame oil. Season with salt and black pepper. Transfer to a bowl and garnish with onions.

Remove sandwich cookies from package and crush into pieces. Melt butter in large bowl and mix with sandwich cookie crumbs until thoroughly moistened. Add lemon pudding mix and milk. Stir until well mixed and pour into pie shell. Refrigerate until firm, approximately 2-3 hours. Serve with cool whip and lemon drops.
Mix molasses with licorice root and anise. Add flour and icing sugar and form into small balls. Roll in sugar.

Sprinkle short ribs evenly with mustard and horseradish and marinate overnight. Mix together all other ingredients and rub on short ribs. Cover and refrigerate overnight. When ready to grill, pound short ribs to tenderize. Grill short ribs over medium heat until almost done. Remove and let rest 5 minutes. Slice and serve warm or cold.

Dice chicken. Cook until done. Remove bone. Add sausage meat. Cook until done. Add chicken broth. Simmer for about 1/2 hour. Add potatoes. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add spinach. Cook until spinach is wilted. Add sausage mix. Cook until heated through. Season to taste.

Cut the zucchini into 1/2 inch slices. Mix together eggs and parmesan cheese. Dip each slice of zucchini in the egg mixture and coat with parmesan cheese. Place the cheese side down and cook in a non stick skillet for 3 minutes. Flip over and cook for 3 minutes more. Serve with pasta.

Peel sweet potato and cut into 1 inch chunks. Place on baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until tender. Mash with fork or potato masher until smooth. Stir in butter, nutmeg and brown sugar. Beat in heavy cream until blended. Transfer to bowl. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Stir before serving. Serves 4 to 6. This recipe is featured in our.

Wash tomatoes and pat dry with paper towels. Stuff each tomato with cheese and garlic cloves. Pour olive oil over tomatoes. Sprinkle with cracked black pepper and place tomatoes in the refrigerator. After an hour, grill tomatoes in an outdoor barbecue or grill pan until they are completely blackened and softened, turning them occasionally to brown evenly. You may also roast them in the oven at about 350f until softened. Serve immediately with fresh bread.

Peel the onions and cut into halves or quarters depending on size. Put them in a bowl of water mixed with 1/2 teaspoon of salt for 10 minutes to make them easier to peel later. Peel the onions and then cut into halves or quarters depending on size. Put them in a bowl of water mixed with 1/2 teaspoon of salt for 10 minutes to make them easier to peel later. Put oil in a large pot along with the garlic cloves and rosemary needles and simmer for 5 minutes over low heat. Add vinegar to the hot oil mixture and bring to a boil, then add sugar to dissolve. Add the onions to the oil mixture and let them sit in the oil for 20 minutes. Strain them, discarding any skins left behind, then add them to a bowl with the oil mixture and season to taste. Serve at room temperature.

Prepare meat mixture according to recipe directions. Fill a 1/2 cup measuring cup with the stuffing and put aside for later use. Fill a 1/2 cup measuring cup with the meatloaf mixture and put aside for later use. Cut a sheet of parchment paper into 9 squares, each measuring 6 inches long by 2 inches wide. Place a square of parchment paper into each of the 9 freezer bags and seal them closed. Pour the meatloaf mixture into one bag and the stuffing into the other bag. Seal the bags and freeze. To use, thaw the meatloaf and the stuffing overnight in the refrigerator and remove both from the bags the next morning before serving. To cook the meatloaf, preheat the oven to 350f and grease a 13 x 9 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Remove the meatloaf from the bag and put it into the baking dish. Put the stuffing into the greased baking dish and set it aside for later use. Bake the meatlo

Preheat grill. Slice pork lengthwise into 3-4 thin strips. Thread onto bamboo skewers. Rub pork with olive oil. Sprinkle with sweet paprika, ground cumin, a few pinches of cayenne and some salt and pepper. Grill 2 minutes on each side or until browned. Serve hot.

Mix graham crackers and brown sugar together. Cut in butter until crumbly and add vanilla and pecans. Press into an ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 350f for 8-12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely and store in an airtight container or plastic bag in refrigerator or freezer for up to 1 month. Reheat in microwave before serving.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Grease a 9x13 inch pan. Roll out the pie crusts and place in the pan. Pour 2 cups clam juice into the crusts and sprinkle with a mixture of 1/4 cup potato flakes and 1/4 cup carrot flakes and 1/4 cup onion flakes. Place the 2 cups clams in a bowl and sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 cup potato flakes and 1/4 cup carrot flakes and 1/4 cup onion flakes. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes. Sprinkle the clam mixture over the crust and top with the remaining 2 cups clams. Bake for 20 more minutes until the crust is golden brown. Serve with a side of light cream.

Cook pasta as directed, adding bacon and garlic to boiling water as you cook pasta (reserving garlic for garnish). Drain and return to saucepan with cheese and whipping cream. Cook over low heat, stirring frequently until cheese melts and mixture thickens. Taste and add salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with chopped bacon and garlic clove.

Cream shortening, brown sugar and granulated sugar together until light. Add eggs one at a time beating until well blended. Add vanilla and beat again. Sift dry ingredients together. Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture alternately with peanut butter chips until just blended. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets (1/2 teaspoon per cookie). Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until cookies are just barely set. Cool for 2 minutes on cookie sheets then remove to racks to finish cooling. Store cookies in tightly covered containers up to 1 week. Nuts should be added after cookies are baked.

Combine reduced-fat cream cheese, nonfat plain yogurt and garlic in a food processor. Pulse until well blended. Add sun-dried tomato, chili sauce, green pepper, green onion, celery seed and red pepper. Pulse until well blended. Spread in a serving dish. Garnish with fresh parsley. Serve with corn chips or vegetable sticks. Makes 2 cups. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Wash and pat dry the fish fillets. Sprinkle both sides with salt and white pepper. Place a few tablespoons of dill and a few dashes of freshly squeezed lemon juice on a small plate. Dip both sides of the fillets into the dill and then into the cream. Place the fillets on a cookie sheet lined with aluminum foil. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and bake for 15 minutes. Serve with a side of rice or potatoes.

Mix together flour & salt in large bowl. Stir in yeast & warm water until combined. Mix together well on a floured surface for 5 minutes. Divide dough in half. Flatten each half on a floured surface into a 9x4 inch rectangle. Cut each rectangle in half lengthwise to make 2 9x4 inch strips. Cut each strip into 1-inch wide strips. Form dough into 9x3 inch logs. Place logs on greased baking sheets 1 1/2 inches apart. Cover & allow to rise until doubled in size (approx 45 min). Bake 20 minutes in preheated 400 degree oven. Remove & brush tops with melted butter before serving.

In a large bowl add olive oil. Dissolve yeast in warm water. Stir yeast into oil with water. Add salt, sugar and honey. In a small bowl, combine 2 cups of flour with 1 cup of water. Stir into yeast mixture. In a large mixing bowl, add remaining flour to yeast mixture. Knead dough until smooth. Spread dough onto a greased baking sheet. Cover with plastic wrap. Let dough rise in a warm place until double in size. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let cool. Cut bread into 1 1/4-inch slices. Brush with melted honey. Roll slices in granulated sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack.
Add onion to ground beef and cook until onions are soft. Add remaining ingredients and simmer on low heat for 1-1/2 hours. Serve on a hot skillet.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small bowl, combine squash and pumpkin pie spice. Place in the microwave and cook until tender. Scoop the squash out of the shell and mash. Add squash to a large bowl and mix in the flour, baking soda and salt. Add eggs and applesauce and beat until smooth. Add milk and stir. Grease or paper-line muffin tins. Spoon batter into the tins and bake for 20 minutes. Serve warm.
Brown meatballs. Combine gravy mix, mushroom soup and water. Pour over meatballs. Cover with sour cream. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Serve cold with crackers or rolls.

Melt the butter in a pot and cook it with milk until it starts to boil. Add the sugar and the flour and cook until the mixture comes together. Add the almond and the orange peel. Cook for another 2 minutes. Take the mixture from the heat and stir in the chocolate. Let cool and roll into small balls. Place the balls in a pan and cover with the remaining chocolate. Cook for 2 minutes and let it cool.

Cut the cabbage in half lengthwise and remove core and core of the leaves. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add butter until melted. Add the cabbage and season with salt and pepper, then toss and cook until the cabbage is tender but not mushy about 5 minute. Add the garlic and onion powder and toss until the cabbage is well coated and season with more salt and pepper if needed. Serve immediately or cool and chill.
Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl and stir until well blended. Refrigerate for 24 hours and then transfer to a container and refrigerate for 1 week before using.

Preheat oven to 400f. Dice 1 pound of bacon and place in a small pan with a lid. Cook over medium heat for about 20 minutes until the bacon is crisp. Remove from the pan and place in a paper towel. Set the pan aside. Brush the inside of the pan lightly with extra virgin olive oil. Peel the potatoes and slice them crosswise. Place the potatoes in the oven to roast for 20 minutes. Add the vinegar and mustard to the pan with the bacon. Pour in 1/3 cup of water. Reduce the heat to medium low. Cook for 10 minutes. Drain the potatoes and cut them into quarters. Add them to the pan with the other ingredients. Cook for another 15 minutes or until the liquid has reduced. Add the cooked bacon and stir to combine. Season with kosher salt and black pepper to taste. Serve with warm bread. Makes 4 servings.

Rinse rice several times until water runs clear. Add rice to water and bring to boil. Cook for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let rest. Drain excess water. Add milk and bring to boil. Once milk comes to boil, add green cardamom pods and cook for 1 minute. Remove pods and add sugar. Cook until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Add almonds and rose water. Mix well. Serve warm.

Saute the bacon in the butter until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and drain on paper towels. In the pan with the bacon drippings add the garlic powder and cook for about 1 minute. Add chicken to pan and saute until juices run clear. Add the sour cream and soup to the pan with chicken and continue cooking until heated through. Place a chicken breast on each plate and top with the bacon and sauce. Serve with steamed rice.

Put extra virgin olive oil in pan over medium heat and add cherry tomatoes. Stir in fresh basil leaves and salt and black pepper to taste. Cook stirring frequently until tomatoes have burst and are soft, about 5 minutes. Serve over salad or pasta with fresh herbs and olive oil drizzled over top.

Preheat a nonstick skillet over medium heat until hot. Add oil and butter to the pan and heat until it begins to bubble. Add the portabella mushrooms to the pan and cook until golden brown on both sides and tender, about 4 minutes per side. Remove the mushrooms from the pan and reserve for garnish. Increase the heat to medium high and add the remaining butter and the reserved mushrooms to the pan. Cook for about 1 minute more until the mushrooms are brown and fragrant. Add the portabella mushrooms to the pan and cook until golden brown on both sides and tender, about 4 minutes per side. Transfer the pan to the oven and broil until the cheese is melted and browned, about 4 minutes longer. Remove from the oven and let cool for about 1 minute. Meanwhile, cut the sandwich rolls in half and spread the insides of each half of the rolls with the pesto sauce. Add the slices of the rolls to the pan and sprinkle the top evenly with the cheese. Return the pan to the oven and broil until the che

Drizzle chicken with oil. Place chicken on the grill. Cook for about 3 minutes on each side. Remove chicken from the grill and slice. Place chicken on the baking sheet. Sprinkle with green onions. Place garlic clove in the middle of the chicken. Place orange slices on top of the chicken. Sprinkle with soy sauce. Place on the grill. Cook on high for about 4 minutes. Brush with honey and orange juice. Cook for about another 3 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a cookie sheet. Take cookie dough from freezer and roll into a ball. Roll ball into a thick log. Cut log into half-inch rounds. Roll rounds through flour. Roll rounds through cereal. Roll rounds through flour. Roll rounds through cereal. Place rounds on cookie sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Roll rounds through cereal. Roll rounds through cereal. Roll rounds through cereal. Place rounds into airtight container.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add peanuts and stir frequently until peanuts are golden brown, about 3 minutes. Add rice chex, pretzels, onion crackers and cook for another minute. Add seasoning salt, garlic powder and onion powder, stirring frequently until chex party mix is golden brown. Stir in gluten free corn flakes, tossing until corn flakes are well coated in the seasoning mix. Allow to cool completely before serving.
Brown the beef. Drain the fat. Add tomato soup and hot peppers. Cook for 15 minutes. Mix in the velveeta cheese. Pour into a 1 quart casserole. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut the mini whole wheat pita bread into 6 pieces. Place each piece of pita into the microwave. Microwave for 45 seconds. Place the pita pieces into a bowl. Slice the bananas and add them into the bowl. Add the cottage cheese. Sprinkle the Splenda over the cottage cheese. Stir. Serve.

Heat butter and olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the red cabbage and cook until wilted. Add the apple, green apple, apple cider vinegar and season with salt and black pepper. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add honey and stir until the cabbage is glazed. Serve immediately.

In a large pot, bring the brown lentils and the cold water to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for about one hour, or until the lentils are tender (if the lentils are not tender after an hour of cooking, add more cold water). When the lentils are tender, drain the lentils. Place the lentils in a bowl along with the olive oil, garlic cloves, onion and salt & pepper. Stir well. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Refrigerate overnight. In the morning, peel the garlic cloves and remove the onion from the lentils mixture. Place the lentils, the garlic cloves, the onion and the lemon juice in a food processor or blender container with the cilantro (optional). Puree until smooth. Pour the puree into a large pot along with the swiss chard. Bring the soup to a simmer over medium heat and cook until the swiss chard is tender, about 20 minutes. Stir the soup occasionally and add water if the soup

In a large skillet over medium heat melt butter. Add 2 tbsp. olive oil and saute mushrooms in a large skillet until tender and lightly browned. Add chopped garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add spinach and saute until wilted. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Whisk egg whites and salt together. Beat in vanilla and coconut. Slowly beat in the chocolate chips and nuts. Place small heaped teaspoonfuls onto greased baking sheets about 1-1/4 in. apart. Bake at 350 degrees f for 10-12 minutes or until golden. Cool completely on wires. Makes 36.

Peel the apples and core them. Then dice them into small chunks (1/2 inch dice). In a large mixing bowl, mix all of the ingredients except for the pecans together. Toss the apples with the rest of the ingredients until completely coated and serve.

Bring 3 cups of water to a boil. Add gelatin to hot water and stir to dissolve completely. Add sugar and stir to dissolve completely. Let cool to room temperature. Pour into ice cube trays and freeze. Store frozen cubes in freezer for later use. You can also freeze in a ziploc bag for individual use.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute beef until cooked throughdrain off fat. Add onions and pepperssaute until tender. Add beans with 2 cups waterbring to a boilreduce heat to lowsimmer about 5 minutes. Add seasoningssimmer about 5 minutes more or until peas are tender. Add remaining waterbring to a boilreduce heat to lowsimmer until mixture thickens slightlyabout 5 minutes more. Makes 8 servings.

Pour oil into a skillet and heat over medium heat. Drop in the potato sticks and stir fry until crisp. Remove the sticks and drain on paper towels. Meanwhile in a bowl combine the butter and taco seasoning. Place the oil in a frying pan and heat over medium heat. Add the french-fried onions and sauté for a few minutes. Place half of the potato sticks in a baking dish. Spoon half the butter mixture over the potato sticks. Add the spanish peanuts and the remaining potato sticks. Spoon the remaining butter mixture over the sticks and sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 5 to 8 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Gradually stir in all-purpose flour until smooth. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Gradually stir in milk and cook until thick. Remove from heat and add cheese and dry mustard. Stir until cheese is melted. Stir in paprika and salt. Dip toast in egg and dredge in cheese sauce. Serve immediately.

Remove chicken from plastic and discard any excess marinade. Cut into thin strips. Heat sesame oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add pepper flakes and chicken. Stir until tender. Add vegetables and stir fry for 3 minutes. Add sauce and simmer for 3 minutes. Serve over brown rice.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add peppers and jalapeño and cook until tender, about 1 minute. Add mushrooms and venison steaks. Cook 2-3 minutes on each side or until venison is cooked through and mushrooms are browned. Add worcestershire sauce, garlic, wine, mustard and cinnamon. Cook until venison is cooked through and sauce is thickened, about 1 minute more. Transfer venison and mushrooms to serving platter. Serve warm.

Combine the ground beef, pork, sauerkraut, eggs, caraway seed, black pepper and 2 tsp salt in a large bowl. Combine the breadcrumbs with the remaining 1 tsp salt in a small bowl. Stir the breadcrumbs into the ground meat mixture to coat evenly. Form the mixture into a loaf shape using your hands, and place it in a lightly greased 9-by-5-inch loaf pan or a 9-by-3-inch loaf pan. Pour the milk over the loaf to cover completely. Refrigerate overnight or for at least 4 hours before baking. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bake for about 1 hour or until an instant-read thermometer inserted near the center of the loaf reads 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Serve hot with spaghetti noodles and a side of fresh garden vegetables.

Peel potatoes and dice them small (about 1/2 inch) if using a potato peeler or a knife. Boil potatoes in large pot until tender (about 20 minutes). Drain potatoes and transfer to a large bowl to cool slightly. Add butter to the potatoes and mix in diced tomatoes and onion. Cook for 15 minutes on medium-low heat until the potatoes are warm. Mix in chili sauce, salt/pepper to taste and green onion. Top with cheddar cheese if desired. Serve hot!

Cook beef over medium-high heat until browndrain. Add the beef stock, tomatoes with their juices, the green chiles with their juices, and the chili powderbring to a simmer, reduce the heat, and cook for 30 minutes, or until the beef is tender. Add the drained beans, the corn tortillas, and the enchilada sauce. Cook until thoroughly heated through. Combine the sour cream with the ranch dressing mixstir into the bean mixture until well blended. Spread half of the bean mixture into a 9x13 baking dishcover with a layer of tortillas. Spread the remaining bean mixture over the tortillas. Sprinkle with the cheesebake at 350f for 25 minutes or until the cheese is melted.

Bring water to a boil over high heat. Add rice and cook, covered, until tender and all the water has been absorbed. Meanwhile, in a large bowl combine eggnog and nutmeg. Set aside. When rice is tender, add it to the bowl with the eggnog and stir well. Cook over medium heat until the eggnog mixture is hot. Add dried cranberries and serve.

Saute onion in butter until soft. Add tomato sauce and brown. Stir in ground beef until browned. Add long-grain rice, water and sauerkraut. Bring to boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for about 15 minutes or until sauerkraut is tender. Makes four servings.
In a large bowl, combine all ingredients except yogurt. Whisk yogurt until smooth. Pour over fruit mixturestir to coat. Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

Marinate wings in honey and lime overnight. Place wings in a large ziplock bag with chipotle barbecue sauce. Zest and juice limes and add to bag. Shake bag and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Remove wings from bag and coat with flour. Heat 4 inches of canola oil in a Dutch oven to 375 degrees f. Dip wings in cornstarch and fry in batches until golden brown and cooked through. Drain on paper towels and serve with lime wedges.

In a skillet over medium-high heat add olive oil. Add chicken breasts to skillet. Cook chicken 5 minutes on each side or until brown. Cut chicken breasts into cubes. Add olives, onion, pepper, tomato to chicken. Cook 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add feta cheese. Stir in vinaigrette. Cook 1 minute. Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain spaghetti. Add spaghetti to chicken mixture. Serve.

Bring pasta to a boil in salted water. Meanwhile, heat oil in large soup pot over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add broth and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and add tomatoes. Cook for 30 minutes. Add peas, beans, basil, and salt to taste. Cook until beans are tender. Drain pasta, add to soup along with parmesan cheese. Stir and serve.

Pour olive oil into a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chopped sausage and cook until lightly brown stirring occasionally. Remove from skillet with a slotted spoon. Pour the oil from the skillet into a small bowl. Wipe the skillet clean with a paper towel. Add the eggs, milk, salt and baking powder to the skillet. Whisk until the mixture is slightly frothy. Cook over medium-high heat until eggs are almost set. Add spinach and stir gently until it wilted. Top with cheese and cook until cheese melts completely. Serve immediately.

Mix all the ingredients together except banana and chocolate chips. Stir banana into mixture and fold in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet or onto prepared baking sheet (if using a baking sheet without raised sides, it should be greased). Bake at 350 degrees for about 10-12 minutes or until brown at edges. Remove from ovendo not overbake.

Mix the sugar and marzipan until well combined. Add the butter and beat until light and fluffy. Add almond extract and eggs. Combine the flour with the baking powder and add in three batches. Beat well after each addition. Place in a greased and floured bundt pan. Bake for about 1 hour. Let cake cool in pan and remove.

Preheat oven to 425f. On a large baking sheet, spread margarine on the crust. On the margarine place the onion and green pepper. Top with canadian bacon. In a bowl beat the eggs. Add pepper and salt to taste. Pour the eggs over the crust. Bake for 15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Top with picante sauce and shredded cheddar cheese. Garnish with fresh cilantro.

In a large skillet over medium heat melt butter. Add apples and cook 3 minutes. Stir in splenda brown sugar blend and cinnamon. Add water to apples if necessary. Cook for 5 to 10 minutes. In a bowl whisk together eggs. Stir in 1 cup of the cheddar. Pour mixture over apples. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Transfer to a plate. Let cool. Spoon into a 9 inch pie plate. Crumble the remaining cheddar into the mixture. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 24 standard size muffin cups. In a large bowl mix together rolled oats, brown sugar and raisins. Set aside. In a small bowl mix together buttermilk, eggs and brown sugar. Set aside. In a large bowl mix together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add in the brown sugar mixture. Stir in oat mixture. Mix well. Divide batter evenly between 24 standard size muffin cups. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Serve warm.

Blend avocado, mayo, sugar, lime jello, and cream. Chill for about 1 hour. Pour into molds. Let set at room temperature for about 2 hours. Melt gelatin in hot water. Whisk into avocado mixture. Pour into molds. Let set. Serve cold. Store leftovers covered in the fridge.

Wash green bananas under cool running water for 30 seconds to remove any dirt. Drain bananas. Combine bananas, lime juice, 1/2 cup of the water and the salt to a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes stirring frequently with a wooden spoon. Cooked bananas should be tender when poked with a fork. Pour remaining 1 cup of water over bananas. Stir with a wooden spoon for 1 minute. Transfer bananas to a colander to drain for 5 minutes. Transfer bananas to a large bowl. Stir in the sugar, butter, cloves, cinnamon sticks, fresh ginger and nutmeg to a large bowl. Mash bananas with a potato masher or fork to a smooth puree consistency. Pour mashed bananas over the spices mixture. Stir to coat bananas. Transfer to the sterile 1-pint canning jars. Wipe the rim of the jars with a clean cloth to remove any residue. Place the lids on the jars. Use a canning funnel to fill jars to

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. Cream margarine and sugar together until light and fluffy. Mix in eggs one at a time. Add vanilla. Mix in dry ingredients. Fold in mashed bananas. Pour into greased 9x5x3-inch loaf pan and bake for 1 hour 5 minutes. Cool 5 minutes in pan before removing. Cool completely. Serve warm.

In a large glass bowl combine the condensed milk and cold water. Stir until blended. Add the cool whip. Dip the vanilla wafer in the cool whip mixture. Dip in the pudding mixture. Dip in mini chocolate chips. Repeat. Dip in strawberries. Serve.

Preheat grill or grill pan over medium heat. Slice vegetables into 1/2 inch thick rounds. Season vegetables with salt and pepper. Place vegetables on a platter and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with seasoning and drizzle with mustard. Place vegetables on grill or grill pan. Cook, turning often so that all sides are well browned, 5 to 8 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Boil water for pasta. Cook until al dente. Drain. Add butter to a skillet. Add fettuccine. Stir until butter melts. Add heavy cream. Season with black pepper. Serve with smoked salmon. Top with parmesan cheese.

Cook bacon in skillet until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside. Place the chicken breasts in the bottom of the crock pot. Add the beef. Add the diced onions to the bacon drippings in the skillet. Add the flour to the drippings stirring constantly until browned. Add the cream of mushroom soup to the skillet stirring constantly. Pour the mixture over the chicken in the crock pot. Cover the crock pot and cook on low for 6 hours. Add the cooked pasta to the crock pot. Mix well. Cook for another hour or so. Serve with the bacon and garnish with the fresh chopped parsley. Enjoy!

Heat the oil in a medium frypan over medium heat. Add the tomatoes and green pepper to the pan. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the eggs and cook over low heat for about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over warm pita bread.

In a small bowl, mix sugar and cocoa together. Stir in cinnamon and graham cracker crumbs. Place in a 9x9 baking dish. In a blender or food processor, puree the yogurt until smooth. Add lemon juice. Divide yogurt mixture among 6 small ramekins. Top with a spoonful of the cocoa mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve cold.

Add oil to a small saucepan over medium heat. Add ginger and green onions, stirring frequently until ginger is softened and onions are translucent, about 2 minutes. Stir in soy sauce and oyster saucebring to a boil. Add noodles and stir well, coating noodles with sauce. Cook for about 1 minute. Stir in sesame oil and serve immediately.

In a large bowl, dissolve margarine in water. Stir in salt and yeast. Stir in honey, flour and powdered milk. Stir in sugar. Turn bread machine on to the dough setting. Once the machine has completed its cycle, turn the machine off. Remove the bread and place it in a warm place until doubled in size. Punch down the dough and form into desired shape and size. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Allow to rise until doubled in size. Bake in a preheated oven at 400f for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Salt and pepper lamb pieces on both sides. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Brown lamb on both sides. Remove from pan. Add onion and garlic clovecook 2 minutes. Add bouillon cubes. Bring mixture to a boil, stirring constantly. Return lamb to pancover and cook 20 minutes or until done. Stir in spinachcook 2 minutes or until wilted. Combine lemon juice and oreganostir into lamb mixture. Cover and cook 2 minutes or until lamb is tender. Sprinkle with feta cheeseserve over rice.

Prepare spaghetti as directed on packagedrain. Heat margarine in a large skillet over medium heat. Dip chicken in eggdredge in seasoned bread crumbsshake off excess. Place in skillet and brown on both sides. Place 1/3 of spaghetti on a platetop with 1/3 of the cheese mixture and 1/3 of cooked spaghetti. Serve immediately with remaining spaghetti.

Cook the meat with the onions in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook until meat is tender and no longer pink. Drain off any excess fat. Add the tomato sauce to the skillet and stir to mix. Add the corn. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Stir in the mashed potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until potatoes are heated through. Transfer to a greased 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until the cheese is melted.

Slice onion into thin half moons and saute in butter with ground cloves and cinnamon for 3 minutes over medium heat. Add rice and raisins and saute 5 minutes more. Add 4 cups water and bring to boil, then reduce heat and simmer covered for 35 minutes. Fluff with fork and serve.

Combine sugar and 1 cup boiling water in a medium bowl and stir until dissolved. Add citric and tartaric acids and stir until dissolved. Add oranges and lemons and stir until well combined. Let cool completely then store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks or freeze up to 3 months. You can also make this recipe with different citrus fruits or even pears. Just be sure that they are firm enough to cut into slices. You could also use 5050 and add some fruit juice (orange or grapefruit) to the mixture and then dilute with more water (3333) and use it as a cordial or add it to lemonade. If you want the mixture to be more tart then use the 7550 version of the cordial and add some lemon juice or orange juice and dilute with water to make the cordial drinks. You could also use this recipe to make lemon curd or orange curd. Just add butter and whisk until smooth and then remove from heat and let cool completely before using as lemon curd

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin cups. In a medium bowl, mix together eggs, sugar, cooking oil and pumpkin. In another bowl, mix together flour, pumpkin pie spice, baking powder and salt. Add wet ingredients into dry. Fold in fresh cranberries. Spoon batter evenly into prepared muffin cups. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes or until muffins spring back when touched. Cool muffins in pan for 10 minutes before removing.

Preheat oven to 400f. Dust fish fillet with flour and season with salt and pepper. Dip in egg whites. Dip in flour again and shake off excess. Place fillet on rack in shallow baking dish.
