Add 1/2 cup white wine and 1/4 cup water to dish. Cover with foil. Bake 20 minutes or until fish flakes when tested with fork. Remove from oven and drain fillet. Combine lime juice and 2 Tbsp. olive oil in small bowl. Add green onions. Stir to combine. Pour over fish. Sprinkle with 2 Tbsp. butter. Return to oven and broil 2-3 minutes or until butter begins to brown. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro.

In large saucepan over high heat, bring the butter, flour, milk, salt and pepper to a boil. Cook and stir for about 2 minutes or until the mixture has thickened slightly. Remove from heat. Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese. Place the potatoes in a large bowl. Pour the sauce over the potatoes and stir to coat evenly. Put the potatoes in a buttered 2-quart casserole. Bake at 350 for 45 to 50 minutes or until done. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Season scallops to taste with a little salt and pepper. Heat olive oil and butter in a large skillet until hot. Add scallops to hot oil and sauté for 1-2 minutes per side or until done and set on paper towel to drain excess oil. Meanwhile, combine miso paste with seasoned rice vinegar in a small bowl and stir until smooth. Add miso mixture to large skillet and warm through until hot. Serve scallops with miso sauce on top. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and green onions and serve immediately.

Rinse and drain artichoke hearts and place in a bowl. Add 3 tablespoons of broth and 3 tablespoons of white wine and set aside. In a medium bowl mix 3 tablespoons broth with 3 tablespoons white wine and tarragon. Add this mixture to the artichoke hearts and mix thoroughly. Pour marinade mixture over breasts and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake breasts uncovered 30 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from oven and arrange artichokes and olives on top. Return to oven and bake an additional 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Cut potato in half lengthwise. Rub both sides of each half with oil. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Prick each half several times with a fork. Combine paprika and saltrub over each half. Place in oven. Roast in oven for 35-40 minutes or until tender. While potatoes are cooking, microwave garlic in a small bowl on HIGH 30 secondsset aside. When potatoes are done, remove from oven. Add cheese to a small bowl. Microwave on HIGH 30 secondsstir. Add croutons. Microwave on HIGH 10 secondsstir. Drizzle with sour cream. Stir. Add garlic. Toss. Arrange on a platter. Serve hot.

Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the black peppercornstoast the butter until the black peppercorns are fragrant (about 1 minute). Add the brussels sprouts and the olive oilcook for 2 minutes. Add the vegetable stockcook for 2 minutes. Add the hazelnutscook until the brussels sprouts are tender (about 3 minutes). Season with salt. Transfer the brussels sprouts to a platterserve.

Season flounder with salt and pepper. Heat a large pan with 2 tablespoons of olive oil over high heat. Add flounder and season with salt and pepper. Cook until the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 3 minutes per side. Place fish on a plate and cover loosely with foil. Keep warm. In a small sauce pan add the onions, peppers and tomatoes. Sauté until the vegetables are softened and slightly browned. Stir in the capers and olives. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until the sauce thickens. Remove the pan from heat and add the Italian seasoning and freshly ground pepper. Spoon the sauce over the fish and serve.

Puree strawberries. Heat grape juice concentrate and lemon juice to a simmer in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add lemon peel. Stir in strawberry puree. Cook, stirring frequently, 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat. Let mixture cool completely. Puree strawberry mixture in a food processor or blender. Fold in gelatin. Pour into a greased 8x8-inch baking pan and refrigerate until set.

Bring chicken broth to a boil in a saucepan. Add lentils, potatoes and sausage. Stir in garlic. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook 30 to 40 minutes until lentils are tender. Stir in spinach. Heat olive oil in a skillet. Add sausage. Cook until brown. Transfer to a platter. Serve lentils with sausage.

Combine ricotta, egg and sugar in a medium bowl. Mix until smooth. Heat 2 inches of oil in a deep frying pan until a cube of bread browns in 30 seconds. Working in batches, dip 1 tablespoon of batter in the pan for about 30 seconds or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375f. Rinse potatoes. Pierce potatoes all over with a fork. Place potatoes in roasting pan. Drizzle with olive oil. Season with oregano, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper. Toss well. Transfer chickens to roasting pan. Roast potatoes 45 minutes. Roast chickens 1 hour. Turn potatoes once halfway through cooking. Tent potatoes with foil if they brown too fast. Tent chickens with foil if they start to get too dark. Cook potatoes 30 minutes more. Chickens until meat is cooked thru. Serve with lemon wedges. Serve potatoes hot.

Slice dried beef and olives into thin strips. Cut biscuits in half crosswise and brush with melted butter. Combine stuffed olives, dried beef and flour. Add beaten eggs and milkseason with salt and pepper. Pour mixture over biscuits and bake at 400 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Makes about 3 cups gravy. This gravy will keep for about a week if refrigerated and reheats easily if needed.

Combine the pomegranate juice, red wine, cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, sugar, and honey in a slow cooker. Cook on high for 4 hours. Serve hot. (You can also make it in a pot on the stove. Bring to a simmer, cook for 15 minutes to allow spices to infuse the drink. Strain the mixture through a fine mesh strainer into a pitcher.)

In a small bowl, toss bananas with flour and whisk together until they're lightly coated with flour. Heat about 1 inch of oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat until hot (170 degrees F). Carefully dip the bananas into the batter, then into the panko crumbs. Place battered bananas in hot oil and cook until golden brown and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side. Drain bananas on paper towels and serve warm with whipped cream and a drizzle of the cinnamon-chocolate sauce.

Spread cream cheese on one side of each slice of bread. Sprinkle with garlic powder and parsley. Roll each slice into a tight coil and secure with a wooden pick. Wrap each coil in a slice of bacon. Secure with another pick. Cook on a hot griddle or in a 450 degree oven for 10 to 15 minutes or until bacon is crispy. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 180°c. Grease a 12-hole muffin pan with oil. Sift together the flour, raw sugar, baking powder and baking soda into a large bowl. Stir together the macadamia nuts with the raw sugar. Beat the butter with an electric mixer at medium speed for 30 seconds or until fluffy. Gradually beat in the honey. Beat in the buttermilk and pineapple juice for 2 minutes or until smooth. Beat in the egg until just combined. Gently stir the flour mixture into the wet ingredients just until combined. Stir through the yogurt and nuts by hand. Spoon the mixture evenly into the prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre of a muffin comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Refrigerate muffins overnight before serving to let the flavours meld. These muffins freeze well for up to 2 weeks. Freeze any leftover pineapple

Whisk together the lemon juice, dijon mustard, shallot, fresh thyme, olive oil, salt and pepper. Toss greens, pears and walnuts in a large salad bowl. Pour dressing over the salad. Toss again. Place blue cheese crumbles on top.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Grease an 8 x 12 x 2-inch baking dish. In a large bowl, mash the bread until it is in small pieces. Add the eggs, milk and butter to the bread mixture and mix well. Stir in the broccoli. Pour the mixture into the baking dish. Bake in the middle of the oven for about 40 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve hot.

In a saucepan combine the raspberries and pineapple juice. Stir over medium heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Simmer for about ten minutes, stirring occasionally, until the raspberry mixture is reduced by about half. Stir in the raspberry gelatin mixture, stirring to dissolve. In a large bowl combine the sour cream and cold water and add the raspberry mixture to the bowl. Whip the mixture with an electric beater until it is very light and fluffy. Pour into a mold or dish or individual dishes and refrigerate for about an hour to set. To unmold, dip the bottom of the mold into warm water for about ten seconds. Turn mold upside down onto a plate and remove mold. Serve immediately or chill for later use.

Bring 1 1/2 cups water to boil in heavy saucepan. Add cranberriescook 3 minutes or until berries pop. Add maple syrup, brown sugar, cinnamon, and vanillacook 1 minute. Transfer berries with syrup to food processor. Process until smooth. Transfer to jar. Let cool. Refrigerate 3 days. Serve with bread.

Slice bread and brush with mayonnaise and dijon mustard. Top each slice with ham, onion and tomato and cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and bread is lightly browned.

Soak the beans overnight. The next day, drain them. Put them into a large pot. Add the pork fat. Cover with water. Cook at medium heat for about two hours. While the beans are cooking, put the onions into another pot. Fry them gently without coloring them. Add the maple syrup. Cook the mixture until it thickens. When the beans are cooked, add the maple syrup mixture to them. Cook at low heat for about five minutes. Serve. This is an old French recipe. It can be eaten with roast meat or fish. It goes well with fried eggs or bacon.

Chop chicken into bite sized pieces. Place in a large bowl. Mix in bell pepper, raisins, celery and green onion. In a small bowl, combine Miracle Whip Light, mango chutney. Pour over chicken mixture. Add romaine lettuce.

Place the chicken breast in the bottom of a shallow roasting pan. Arrange the onion and mushroom over the top of the breast. Drizzle the butter over the top. Sprinkle with the garlic powder and salt. Bake uncovered in a preheated 425 degree F. oven for about one hour or until done. Pour the barbecue sauce over the top and bake for another ten minutes.

Cut grapes in half. Place a grape cut side down and insert a toothpick in the bottom. Fill each grape with a small amount of whipped cream or sour cream. Roll each grape in granulated sugar and brown sugar. Place each grape in a small dish or on a skewer.
Prepare squash. Saute in olive oil with fresh basil. Add pecans. Makes 2 servings.

Dip chicken in butter then in breadcrumbs. Place on lightly oiled baking sheet. Bake in preheated 450 degree f oven for about 20 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake for 5 more minutes. Serve with lemon juice.

Place a large foil-lined sheet pan on top of a preheated grill. Grill chicken until cooked through, about 15 minutes. Meanwhile, combine all of the remaining ingredients except the chicken in a large skillet over medium heat until butter has melted. Cook until the chicken is done and the pineapple has softened. Brush chicken with the teriyaki mixture before serving. This dish is also good served with rice or noodles. Serve with pineapple chunks or sliced fruit to accompany this dish.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes and cook, stirring frequently 2-3 minutes. Add lemon juice and zest and cook 1 minute more or until fragrant and garlic is browned. Add chicken and season with salt and pepper. Cook 6-8 minutes or until no pink remains and juices run clear.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heatcook parsnips until softened for about 10 minutes. Add green onionscook for 1 minute. Add parsnips, gorgonzola, and black pepper to tastecook for 2 minutes. Serves 4-6 people.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain potatoes and cool them completely. Peel potatoes and cut potatoes into 1-inch cubes and add to large bowl. Stir in remaining ingredients and let stand 15 minutes. Toss to combine and serve.

Peel potatoes & cut into large cubes. Place into 8-quart pot with cold water to cover. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 30 minutes or until very soft. Drain & cool. In food processor, process onion until finely chopped. Transfer to large bowl, add potatoes. Mix well with hands. Beat eggs & add to potato mixture along with matzo meal, baking powder & spices. Mix well. Transfer to 9 x 13 greased baking dish. Press down with spoon until firm & smooth. Bake 45 minutes or until crisp & brown. Serve hot.
Brown pork loin chops in olive oil and then place in crock pot. Add all other ingredients and cook on high for 4 hours. Let stand for an hour before serving and enjoy!

Slice melon into bite sized pieces. Put in blender with mint leaf. Blend for about 1 minute. Add sugar and lemon juice to blender. Blend for another 2 minutes. Pour into glasses. Sprinkle with lime juice. Serve.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, heat 2 tablespoons oil and 1 tablespoon butter until melted. Add garlic and onion and cook until tender. Add tarragon and cook 30 seconds. Stir in remaining oil and butter. Add chicken and cook until browned. Stir in tomatoes and vinegar and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes or until thickened. Stir in capers and wine. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Serve with cooked egg noodles.

Place beets on sheet pan with 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 teaspoon kosher salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Bake at 400 for 1 hour or until tender when pierced with a sharp knife. Remove from oven, cool completely then cut into wedges. Toss beets with apricot preserves and 1/4 cup olive oil. Place beets on platter or individual serving plates with 1 teaspoon Grand Marnier per serving. Sprinkle with freshly chopped parsley and serve with toasted baguette rounds or pita bread wedges on the side.

Stir together pineapple juice and water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Stir in gelatin until dissolved. Cool to room temperature and chill for 2 hours. Stir in cranberry sauce and apple. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Stir in nuts and lemon juice and serve cold.

Place potatoes in a pot and add water to cover by 1 inch. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until potatoes are tender. Drain potatoes and return them to the pot. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened and translucent. Add seasonings and cook until fragrant. Stir in potatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add hot dogs and cook 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve with hot dogs and potatoes.

Mix 1/2 cup water and 3/4 cup sugar and cook until 232 degrees on candy thermometer. Mix 3 tablespoons corn syrup, 1 tablespoon vanilla and 1 egg white and combine with sugar syrup mixture. Drop by teaspoon onto waxed paper and let harden.

Layer crushed pineapple on the bottom of the glass bowl or trifle dish. Then layer bananas, maraschino cherries, eggnog, vanilla instant pudding mix and angel food cake. Top with whipped cream and walnuts. Refrigerate at least 2 hours. This is a nice addition to any Christmas buffet!

For the marinade, combine the sesame oil, garlic and rice wine in a medium bowl and whisk until blended. Add the chicken and toss until coated. Marinate for at least 10 minutes and up to overnight in the refrigerator. Preheat a grill or broiler on high. Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the marinade. Cook the chicken over the grill or broiler for about five minutes per side or until cooked through. Transfer to a large plate and set aside for about five minutes to rest before serving. For the sauce, combine the soy sauce, sugar and five spice powder in a small bowl and stir until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is smooth and thick. Serve the chicken with the sauce on the side for dipping and garnish with scallions and sesame seeds.

Cook the penne pasta according to package directions and drain. Meanwhile, place beef in a large bowl and add the red onion and season with mayonnaise and sour cream. Combine horseradish and season with salt and black pepper. Toss penne pasta with the beef mixture. Add broccoli and tomatoes and toss. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Prepare the crust as directed in your pie crust recipe. Peel the green tomatoes. Cut them into 1/4 inch slices. Heat the butter in a large skillet. Cook the tomato slices until lightly browned. Set aside. Make the lemon sauce. Place the sugar in a small skillet. Add just enough water to moisten the sugar. Heat to boiling. Cook until the sugar is dissolved. Remove from the heat. Add the lemon juice. Stir until the sugar dissolves again. Pour the lemon sauce over the tomatoes. Pour the tomato mixture into the prepared pie crust. Bake as directed for your pie crust recipe. Let cool before slicing.

Pierce stew meat with fork. In a 5-qt slow cooker, combine wine and beef. Cover and cook on low heat setting for 8 hours or until meat is tender. Discard garlic cloves. Heat extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and saute until tender. Stir in flour and cook for about a minute. Gradually add cream of mushroom soup and cook for a minute or two. Stir in meat and any remaining juices. Bring mixture to a simmer. Season with salt and pepper. Cook on low heat setting for about 10 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Make a batter of eggs and cottage cheese. Beat until smooth. Slowly add flour and salt. Whip until thick. Then add butter and vegetable oil and beat until smooth. Add cinnamon. In a large pan heat the oil over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup of the batter into the pan and cook until golden. Flip pancake and cook until golden. Serve with jam and whipped cream.

In large mixing bowl, combine orange and pineapple gelatin mix and 1/2 cup waterstir until dissolved. Refrigerate until firm, about 2 hours or longer if desired. In large bowl, combine pineapple and mandarin orangesstir gently to coat. Drain gelatin mixture. Stir gelatin mixture and cream cheese together until blendedfold in coated fruit. Garnish with nuts and remaining 1/2 cup cool whip.

In a large skillet cook sausage till done, drain off fat. In the same pan add the sliced cabbage and cook till wilted. Into the pan add the potatoes and cover with chicken broth. Cook till potatoes are tender. Mix paprika, seasoning salt and pepper to taste. Pour this mix into the cabbage/potato mixture. Serve topped with the smoked sausage.

In a medium saucepan combine sugar and cornstarch. Gradually add water, amaretto liqueur and lemon juice. Cook and stir over medium-high heat until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in almonds. Serve warm or chilled. Yield: 2 cups.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine rice vinegar and soy sauce. Stir in the honey and cook until dissolved. Remove from heat and set aside. In a large bowl, toss the rice sticks with the sesame seed oil. Add the shrimp and marinade and toss. In a large wok over medium heat, cook the shrimp for about 2 minutes until pink and done. Remove and transfer to a plate. Add the snow peas and red bell pepper. Cook for about 2 minutes until tender. Add the cucumber and cook for about 1 minute. Add the rice sticks and cook until heated through. In a small bowl, combine the cilantro and lime juice. Stir well and add to the noodles. Toss and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375f. Line 2 pie plates with 2 round crusts each. Mix together mustard and cheese. Spread mustard cheese mixture on bottom of crusts. Slice tomato in half and place on top. Sprinkle with fresh herbs and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and crust is golden.

Cut boneless skinless chicken breast lengthwise into 3-inch strips and place in 9 x 13-inch baking dish. In large skillet brown the meat with olive oil. Add the cream of chicken soup and stir. Transfer the mixture to the baking dish. Sprinkle with the diced green chilies, black olives, green onion, and cheese. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbling. Serve with sour cream.
Peel carrots and cut into 4 inch lengths. Cook in butter for 10 minutes. Add basil. Serve hot.
Beat egg slightly. Stir in margarine and sugar. Add dates and nuts. Add vanilla and mix well. Roll into balls. Place on waxed paper. Refrigerate. Makes about 100.

Wash and slice zucchini into rounds about 1/2 cm thick. Dice brown onions and mix with zucchini and breadcrumbs. Crack eggs and whisk with oregano and sumac. Pour egg mixture into zucchini mixture and mix well. Heat olive oil in skillet and cook zucchini fritters until browned and cooked through. Serve warm with tomato and mint salsa on top.

Cut melons into large dice. Cut grapes and jalapenos into thin slices. Arrange fruit on a serving platter or individual plates. In a blender or food processor, combine orange juice, honey and lime juice and blend until well combined. Pour juice mixture over fruit and garnish with lime peel. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Cut short ribs or pot roast into 1 1/2 to 2 inch pieces. Combine mustard and 1/2 cup sauce in a 2 qt. crock pot. Add meat and 1 cup water to crock pot. Cook on high for 1 1/2 hours or on low for 3 hours. Add garlic and honey to crock pot. Cook for 30 more minutes on high or 2 hours on low. In a small bowl combine cornstarch and 3/4 cup waterstir until smooth. Add to crock pot and cook for 15 to 20 minutes longer on low or 10 minutes longer on high. Serve with mashed potatoes and green beans.

Mix together all of the above ingredients except for the bread. Make a well in the center of the mixture, place the bread in the well. Slowly stir the mixture in and around the bread until all of the mixture is incorporated into the bread. Roll the mixture onto the bread into little balls. Roll the balls in parmesan cheese until they are well covered. Place the balls on greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees F for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the sugar and 1/2 cup of the vinegar. Place the strawberries in a medium bowl. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Stir in the sugar mixture. Place the basil and cucumbers in a large bowl. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of the vinegar and toss to coat. Stir in the strawberry mixture. Taste and add more sugar and vinegar if desired.

In a large bowl stir together cream soup and sour cream until smooth. Add the green onions and pimentos. Stir in frozen hash browns and mix until well combined. Pour into a greased 1-quart casserole. Top with shredded cheddar cheese and Parmesan cheese and bake at 350 for about 20-25 minutes or until bubbly and heated through.

In large pot of boiling water cook pasta until tenderdrain. Meanwhile, in large skillet brown sausage over medium-high heatdrain and set aside. In same skillet saute garlic in oil until tenderadd tomatoes and sausagesimmer 15 minutes or until thickened. Add kidney beans and seasoningsstir well. Cook until heated through. Add spinach and olivestoss wellserve over cooked pasta. Garnish with feta cheese and sprinkle with pepper.
Boil eggs until tender. Place eggs in a bowl and allow to cool. Peel eggs and put eggs into a food processor. Add the mayonnaise and salt and blend together. Store refrigerated. Serve cold.

In a small saucepan over medium heat melt the butter. Add the brown sugar and stir until dissolved. Remove from the heat and stir in the hot sauce and apple cider vinegar. Stir in the worcestershire sauce and the ketchup and set aside. In a large saucepan over medium heat cook and stir the breaded tenders for 3 to 4 minutes or until the breading is golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Arrange the tenders on a serving dish. Pour the sauce over them and serve.

Cut cabbage into wedgesshred bacon into pieces. Cook bacon until crispdrain. Saute onion in bacon fat until tenderadd cabbage and saute until crisp-tenderdrain. Add vinegarcook until tenderdrain. Add baconmix well. Makes about 1 cup.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Drain bacon. Coat bacon with flour. Place bacon in a single layer on a baking pan. Coat bacon with brown sugar. Place peppercorns in a spice grinder. Place peppercorns in a bowl. Coat bacon with peppercorns. Bake bacon in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until bacon is very tender.

Preheat oven to 450f. Slice carrots and potatoes into 1/2 inch pieces and toss with olive oil and onion. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange in single layer on parchment paper on a baking sheet. Bake until golden brown and fork tender, about 40 minutes. Remove from oven and add the carrots and potatoes to the bowl of a food processor and process until smooth. Transfer to a saucepan and heat until hot. Add the corn kernels and simmer until tender. Transfer to a blender and puree until smooth. Add the maple syrup and puree. Set aside. Slice bacon into thin strips and fry. Remove bacon from pan and drain on paper towel. In the same pan fry the bacon in the olive oil until crisp. Add the onion and saut until tender. Remove from pan and drain on paper towel. Return pan to medium heat and add the carrot and potato mixture. Cook until heated through. Add bacon and onion back to pan. Cook for 3 minutes and add the corn mixture. St

Preheat oven to 400 deress. Place 1 tortilla on baking sheet. Top with about 1/4 cup refried beans. Top with about 1/4 cup taco sauce. Sprinkle with green onions and bell peppers. Add 1/2 tsp. crushed red pepper flakes. Bake for about 5-7 minutes or until tortilla is browned. Remove from oven. Top with remaining 6 tortillas. Spread with 1/2 cup refried beans. Spread with 1/2 cup taco sauce. Sprinkle with green onions. Add 1/2 tsp. crushed red pepper flakes. Bake an additional 5-7 minutes or until tortilla is browned. Remove from oven. Top with remaining 6 tortillas. Spread with 1/2 cup refried beans. Spread with 1/2 cup taco sauce. Sprinkle with green onions. Add 1/2 tsp. crushed red pepper flakes. Bake an additional 5-7 minutes or until tortilla is browned. Remove from
Cream butter and both sugars together. Add milk slowly to bring to the proper consistency. Add vanilla.

Peel onionscut into rings. Combine onions in a bowl with the milklet sit for 30 minutes. Mix the eggs with the pancake mixdip onion rings in the mixturedrop into oilfry until goldendrain on paper towelssprinkle with salt.

In a large slow cooker or large pot, combine tomato paste, water, crushed pineapple, cider vinegar, salt, pepper, onion, brown sugar, pepper flakes. Mix well with a wire whisk or wooden spoon to dissolve the tomato paste. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat then reduce heat to medium-low. Cook for about 5 minutes stirring occasionally to prevent the mixture from sticking to the bottom of the pan. Add the meatballs and stir until well coated with the sauce. Cook until the meatballs are hot through, about 5 minutes more. Serve hot over rice or noodles.

Chop the lettuce into bite-size pieces. Set aside. Slice the cherry tomatoes in half and remove the seeds. Fill each half with a small spoonful of lettuce. Sprinkle with bacon and add a dash of salt and pepper. Drizzle with mayonnaise and add a generous sprinkling of chopped chives. Serve with crackers or toast.

Sauté the shallots and garlic with the olive oil for about 2 minutes. Add the sausage and continue to cook until it begins to brown. Add the tomatoes and the herbs to the pan. Cook on low heat until the sauce is thick and the sausage is tender. Taste and adjust the seasoning. Serve with your favorite pasta.

Place 2 lettuce leaves in each of 12 small bowls. Divide salmon and shrimp among the lettuce leaves. Add a small amount of yogurt to each lettuce leaf. Top each with a few red chili peppers and a few alfalfa sprouts. Garnish with cilantro leaves and serve.
Whisk together eggs and milk until blended. Beat in vanilla and cinnamon. Mix in mashed bananas and peanut butter. Spread mixture onto both slices of bread. Grill sandwich until golden brown.
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Mix until smooth. Serve immediately or store in the fridge.

Beat vanilla wafers with margarine in a large bowlpress firmly into a 9-inch square baking dish coated with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, beat the egg whites until they stand up in stiff peaks. Beat the egg yolks until they are light yellow. Fold the egg whites into the yolks. Gently stir the pineapple juice into the egg mixture. Pour over the wafer mixture. Cover the pudding cake with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight. Just before serving, whip the whipping cream until soft peaks formfold into the pudding cake mixture. Garnish the top of the pudding cake with pecans.

In a food processor, process cookies until finely chopped. Add cream cheese and beat until creamy. Add eggs and beat. Add sweetened condensed milk and pumpkin. Add pumpkin pie spice and salt. Stir in chopped walnuts. Press cookie mixture into the bottom of a greased 11x15-inch pan. Bake at 325 degrees for about 25 minutes. Cool completely before filling. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Gradually add sweetened condensed milk and beat until smooth. Fold in the whipped cream and pumpkin. Spoon into the baked cookie crust. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Just before serving, top each bar with a walnut half.

Cut each cake into 4 pieces. In a bowl add pudding mix to milk. Stir until pudding is thick. Dump pudding in a 9x13 baking dish. Add cakes to pudding. Top with cool whip. Next add nuts and hersey bar. Serve. You could also put the pudding in the bottom of a trifle dish.

Bring rice and water to a boil in a small saucepancover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes, or until tender. Drain. In a small saucepan, bring pineapple juice to a boil. Stir in sugar. Add pineapple. Bring to a boilcook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Let stand 15 minutes. Drain. In a small bowl, whisk together rice, pineapple mixture, whipping cream, vanilla extract, and 1 tablespoon maraschino cherry juice. Spoon over pineapple. Refrigerate. To serve, spoon rice mixture into a dessert dish. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon cherry juice. Garnish with mini marshmallows. Makes 8 servings.

Cook the beans according to the package directions. Combine the taco seasoning mix, bell pepper slices, black beans, pinto beans and corn kernels in a 3-qt. slow cooker. Mix wellcover and cook on low 4 hours or until the beans are tender. Mash the beans using an electric mixer until most of the beans are mashed. Remove from cookerstir in the salsa until the mixture is well blended. Serve hot. Makes 10 servings.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add penne to boiling water, return to a boil, then cook according to package directions, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. While pasta cooks, heat oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and chili pepper flakes and saute 1 minute. Add tomatoes with their juices and 1/4 cup waterstir. Simmer 2 minutes then add olives and feta cheese to skillet. Cook 1-2 minutes or until feta begins to melt. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Drain pastareturn to pot. Add tomato mixture to pasta and toss to combine. Stir in basil before serving and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Wash and grind green coriander and mint leaves and keep aside. Wash and grind cumin seeds and keep aside. Peel carrots. Clean the carrots with water. Boil carrots until they are soft. When the carrots are soft, mash them with a mixer. Take out the mashed carrots and keep aside. Take the yoghurt and add sugar to it and blend it until smooth. Add the mashed carrots to it and blend it. Now add the cumin powder and cayenne powder and blend it well. Add the mashed carrots and blend it. In a bowl take a mixture of all the ingredients and keep aside. Take a bowl and take the mustard seeds and heat it in oil. When the mustard seeds are fried take out the seeds and keep it aside. Put the raita mixture in a serving bowl and serve hot with any vegetable dish.

Season both sides of pork with salt and pepper. Place pork in an unheated saute pan and add enough butter to coat pan. Heat over medium-high heat until butter melts and foams. Add enough oil to coat pan. Brown pork on both sides. Remove pork and set aside. In the same pan over medium heat add the reduced-sodium fat-free chicken broth. Cook over medium heat until the broth is reduced to approximately 1/4 cup. Return pork to pan and add remaining butter. Stir in the lemon juice and zest. Cook over low heat until the sauce is thickened and the pork is heated through. Serve with steamed rice or mashed potatoes and a green salad. Makes 3 servings.

In a small saucepan, combine cinnamon sticks, cloves and allspice. Add apple cider and cranberry juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until cinnamon and allspice flavors are infused into cider. Stir in granulated sugar and orange bitters. Heat through. Ladle into heatproof glasses. Garnish with oranges. Pour rum extract into each glass and light. Serve.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add pasta to boiling water and cook until tender but firm to the bite, stirring occasionally. Drain well and transfer to a large bowl. Add chicken and peastoss to coat with Italian dressing. Stir in red pepper and onionseason with salt and pepper. Toss with pasta mixture to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least one hour. Stir well before serving.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Slice onions in half lengthwise. Peel each onion and cut into quarters. Place on a baking sheet with the cut sides facing up. Add olive oil to a small saute pan over medium heat. Add onions to the hot pan. Cook until onions are lightly browned on all sides. Place onion slices in a single layer in a baking dish. Pour honey mustard over the onions. Bake for about 1 hour or until onions are tender. Remove onions from the oven. Dip each slice of rye bread into honey mustard. Top each slice with a quarter of an onion. Top with thinly sliced roast beef. Serve immediately.

Prepare and roll out the dough into a 12 inch pizza crust. Drizzle pizza crust with pizza sauce and spread to the edges. Top with chicken and purple onion slices. Sprinkle with chipotle chile in adobo and tomatoes. Bake for 10-15 minutes until crust is golden brown.

Cook sweet peas and water chestnuts in boiling water until tender. Drain well and set aside in a large bowl. In a small bowl, combine sour cream and sugar, and stir until well blended. Add to the sweet peas and stir until combined well. Add red onion and celery. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Fold in gouda cheese and cashews. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.

In a large skillet over medium-low heat, melt the oil. Add the onion and garlic and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the ground beef and cook until no longer pink. Stir in the chili powder, cumin and salt and pepper. Pour in the tomato sauce. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add the refried beans and cook for another 5 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl and place in the refrigerator to cool. To assemble the burritos: preheat the oven to 375 degrees. On a large piece of wax paper, place a flour tortilla and spread the beef filling evenly over the tortilla. Roll up the tortilla. Place each roll in a greased 9 x 13 inch casserole. Repeat with the remaining tortillas. Pour the enchilada sauce over the casserole and bake for 30 minutes or until the enchiladas are hot and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Heat butter and olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, garlic and curry paste. Cook for 3-4 minutes until softened. Add cauliflower florets in a single layer to pan. Pour in enough stock to cover cauliflower. Cover pan with a lid or foil. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, simmer until cauliflower is tender. Remove foil and cauliflower from pan. Puree cauliflower mixture in a blender or food processor until smooth. Return to pan. Add remaining stock. Whisk in cream and yoghurt. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Add pappadams. Simmer for 1-2 minutes. Serve hot with garnishes.
Boil 1 cup water for 5 minutes. Add lavender flowers and mint. Allow to steep for 10 minutes. Remove lavender. Add honey if desired. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Line a 15x10-inch jelly roll pan with parchment paperset aside. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the butter until fluffy. Add the sugars and beat until fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating until blended after each addition. With the mixer on low speed, slowly add the dry mixturebeat until combined. Fold in the chocolate chips. Using a small cookie scoop, place balls of batter on the prepared pan. Press each ball down with the back of a spoon to make a 1/2-inch-thick cookie. Bake until the cookies are set but still soft in the middle, 15 to 20 minutes. Let the cookies cool on the pan on a wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Mix all marinade ingredients in small bowl. Place eggplant in large resealable bag. Pour marinade into bag. Marinate 2-3 hours or overnight. Preheat broiler. Remove eggplant from bag. Place on broiler pan and broil 5-7 minutes. Turn eggplant and broil for an additional 5-7 minutes or to desired doneness. Remove from broiler. Top with parsley and cheese. Serve.

Warm vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat until a bead of water slides off the spatula when dipped into the pan. Add pork (cut into 1/2-inch cubes), ginger (1 tsp), and stir-fry 2 minutes. Add bok choy (cut into 1/2-inch lengths) and stir-fry until wilted but still bright green, 1 minute. Add hoisin sauce (1 tbsp) and rice wine (1 tbsp), stirring constantly until sauce is thickened and bubbly. Stir in green onions (1 tbsp), cook until wilted 2 minutes. Serve over hot thin egg noodles (1 lb), sprinkle with sesame seeds (1/4 tbsp).

In a medium saucepan bring ginger and 2 cups water to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Add lime juice and zest. Mix well. Pour into a pitcher. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. In a medium bowl whisk together melon balls and mint. Add a small amount of lime juice and ginger mixture to the mixture and whisk again. Add remaining lime juice and ginger mixture and mix well. Chill before serving.

Remove the meat from the cracked crab legs. Place the crab meat in a bowl and add the remaining ingredients. Mix well and cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 24 hours. Serve with crackers and/or toast.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a bowl, combine sugar and flour. Cut butter into flour mixture and mix until dough is smooth. Remove dough from refrigerator and roll out on a lightly floured surface to 1/8 inch thickness. Line a muffin tin with miniature tart shells. Spoon dough into tart shells and bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan to cool completely. In a bowl, combine sugar and flour. Cut butter into flour mixture and mix until dough is smooth. In a small bowl, combine eggs and lemon peel and lemon juice. Pour into the dough and fold in coconut. Spoon into tart shells and bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan to cool completely.

Melt the cream and the butter together in a saucepan. Stir until the mixture is smooth. Remove from heat and add the melted chocolate. Stir until the chocolate is melted. Add the creme de cacao and stir until it is well blended. Pour into a fondue pot. Serve with sticks of pound cake.

Clean the shrimp and cut off the heads. Combine the gingerroot, honey, coriander, lemon juice, olive oil, oyster sauce and black pepper in a large bowl. Add the shrimp and toss until evenly coated. Transfer the shrimp into a container with lid, add the water and refrigerate for at least an hour before serving. This keeps the shrimp tender. Makes about 2 pounds of prawns.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Steam cauliflower until almost tender. Drain well. Combine steamed cauliflower, sour cream, chives and salt & pepper to taste. Spread cauliflower in a lightly greased 1 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over cauliflower. Bake in oven 20 minutes.
Combine Miracle Whip and red wine vinegar. Mix well. Add in honey and craisins and combine well. Toss dressing with packaged coleslaw mix and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl, mix brown sugar with 1/2 cup of water. In a large bowl combine the sausage pieces, bacon pieces, brown sugar mixture. Place toothpick on sausage piece. Wrap the bacon around the sausage on the toothpick. Place sausage on a cookie sheet. Bake for 40 minutes. Bring to room temperature before serving.

In saute pan over medium heat saute onion and garlic in olive oil 2 to 3 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook 2 minutes. Add rice and stir to coat rice with oil and paste. Add hot chicken broth and stir until broth is absorbed. Add 1/2 cup chicken broth at a time, stirring until broth is absorbed before adding more broth. Stir in remaining tomatoes and salt to taste. Cook 20 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in cilantro. Serve with a garnish of chopped tomatoes, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 9x13 inch pan. In a large bowl combine cake mix and 1 cup watermix well. Add remaining 1 1/2 cups water and oil. Mix well. Pour into prepared pan and bake 30 to 35 minutes or until done. Meanwhile, prepare pudding. In a small saucepan, combine lime Jell-O and boiling water. Stir until Jell-O is dissolved. Cool 5 minutes. Combine pudding mix and cold water. Stir well until pudding is dissolved. In a large bowl, combine pudding mixture and remaining 1/2 cup cold water. Stir well. Stir in the remaining 1/2 cup water. Fold in lemon gelatin. Pour over cake and refrigerate overnight. Just before serving, fold in the whipped topping.

Boil water and sugar in a medium saucepan. Add cranberries and lemon and orange zest. Boil for 10 minutes. Add juice and marmalade. Cook for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and cool completely. Remove orange and lemon zest. Puree with an immersion blender or in a food processor. Serve warm or chilled.

Place venison loin steaks in large zip top plastic bag. In small bowl combine seasoning salt and pepper. Add to venison loin steaks. Add mustard to plastic bag. Add horseradish to plastic bag. Add olive oil to plastic bag. Seal bag and shake to coat steaks. Marinate in refrigerator for at least two hours. Preheat grill to high. Remove steaks from marinade. Grill to desired doneness. (Steaks will cook more quickly than the grill temperature indicates.) Serve steaks with remaining marinade.
Preheat oven to 350f. Combine dry ingredients. In a small bowl beat egg and buttermilk. Mix all together. Spoon batter into muffin tins. Sprinkle corn kernels on top of batter. Bake for 15 minutes.

In a small bowl mix the onion, oregano, thyme, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Place lamb chops into slow cooker and coat with seasonings. Place the garlic cloves in the cavity of the chops and place chops into the slow cooker. Cook on high for 4-5 hours or on low for 7-8 hours. Remove the chops from the slow cooker and discard the garlic cloves. Serve with your favorite side dish.

Brown the ground beef and onion together over medium heat until beef is cooked through and onion is tender. Drain grease. Stir the macaroni and cheese mix into beef mixture and heat through. Spoon into 2 greased 2 quart casserole dishes or 4 greased 1 quart casseroles. Sprinkle with oregano and cheddar cheese. Bake 30 minutes at 350 degrees f or 20 minutes at 400 degrees f until heated through and cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Peel carrots and cut into 1-inch pieces. Peel and slice onions. In a large saucepan over medium heat, saute carrots and onions in bacon drippings until tender. In a large bowl combine carrot mixture, sugar, seasoning and bacon. Stir to coat carrots evenly. Bake for 40-50 minutes in a 400 degree oven.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1cm thick chunks. Cover with cold water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat then reduce heat to low and simmer for 8-10 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoes well in a sieve and set aside to dry completely. In a large frying pan melt 15g of the butter with the garlic over low heat for 30 seconds. Add potatoes to pan in a single layer and cook gently for 10 minutes, turning occasionally so that potatoes are lightly browned all over. Add the remaining 15g of butter and stir well with the potatoes for 1 minute to melt the remaining butter into the potato slices. In a bowl mix together the flour, 300g of the milk and 1/4 tsp salt. Stir in the cheddar and set aside. Preheat the oven to 180c / 350f / gas 4. Pour the remaining 200g milk into a small pan with 1/2 tsp salt and bring to the boil over high

Preheat the oven to 400°F. Toss the zucchini with 1 Tbsp. olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper. Spread the zucchini out on a lightly oiled or greased baking sheet. Roast for 15 minutes. Toss the penne with 2 Tbsp. olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add the pasta to the zucchini in the oven and roast for about 15 minutes or until the pasta is tender. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix the ricotta with the basil. Toss the zucchini pasta with the basil ricotta mixture. Sprinkle with fresh parmesan cheese.

Thinly slice cabbage and carrot. Finely slice green onion. Finely shred red apple. Mix all of the vegetables together in a large bowl. Whisk together 3 tbsp mayonnaise and 2 tbsp wine vinegar. Drizzle dressing over vegetables and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve immediately.

Slice parsnips and drizzle with oil and salt. Place in a single layer in a baking dish and roast at 450f for about 20 minutes or until tender and nicely caramelized. Stir occasionally to ensure even browning. Remove from oven and add balsamic vinegar and maple syrup. Toss to combine. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in the vegetables and saut for 2 minutes or until tender crisp. Stir in the soup and milk and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 5 minutes or until the chicken is heated through. Stir in the cheese and onions. Remove from heat and let stand for 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Stir in the biscuit mix and stir just until moistened. Drop by spoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet and bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 24 servings.
In a medium bowl, combine first 4 ingredients. In another bowl, combine remaining ingredients and mix well. Add to brown rice mixture and mix well. Serve immediately.

Peel and slice 1 pound of parsnips. Toss in a large bowl with olive oil and honey until evenly coated. Spread on a sheet pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Flip and bake an additional 20 minutes. Remove from oven and toss in mustard mixture. Return to oven for 5 more minutes.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Wash and pat dry eggplants. Slash the eggplants in 1-inch diamond shapes. Place the eggplants in a baking dish. Place the chopped celery in a mixing bowl. Add the shrimp. Season shrimp lightly with salt and pepper. Add the creole seasoning. Mix thoroughly. Drain the shrimp. Add 2 tablespoons of butter to a skillet. Add the shrimp. Cook until shrimp is pink. Remove shrimp from skillet. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter to skillet. Add the sliced onions. Cook until the onions become translucent. Add the eggplants. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the top. Bake the eggplant for 20 minutes until tender. Remove from the oven. Add the cooked shrimp to the eggplant. Mix thoroughly. Serve.

In large bowl combine beef, bacon, onion and garlic. Season with salt and paprika. Mix well. Shape mixture into patties. In large skillet over medium-high heat cook burgers until brown on both sides. Add oil to pan if necessary. Drain if necessary. In large soup pot add chicken stock and potato rolls. Simmer over medium heat until warmed through. Place cooked burgers on rolls. Top with tomatoes and cheese. Serve immediately. Serves four.

Put all the cheese into the fondue pot. Add lemon juice, garlic and white wine. Stir the cornflour into the kirsch. When all the cheese has melted, add the kirsch/cornflour mixture. Bring to the boil, then remove from the heat. Stir in the nutmeg. Serve with bread.

Melt butter in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add onions and saute until translucent. Add stock and bring to a boil. Add peas and simmer until tender. Stir in milk and bring to a boil. Add mint and cook until tender. Puree soup with a hand-held immersion blender. If not serving immediately, keep warm on the stove. Serve with a dollop of heavy cream. Top with romaine lettuce. Season with salt and pepper. Makes 4 servings.

In saucepan, heat 2 cups of water and the butter. Bring to a boil. Stir in rolled oats. Cook for 10 minutes over medium heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in light corn syrup, brandy, raisins and cream. Pour into a greased 3-quart bowl. Cover and chill overnight. Serve with fresh fruit.

Sauté onion and potato in oil until tender. Stir in eggs. Cook for several minutes until eggs are set on bottom of pan and begin to set on top of potato mixture. Flip tortilla over with a spatula and cook for another minute or two until eggs are set and potato is crisp on top. Serve warm.

Roast beef is the mainstay of the classic Walt Disney’s Roast Beef Hash. And the first step in making it is to make the beef stock. The stock is an important component of the hash because it gives it its rich beefy flavor. To make the stock, place the onion in a pan with the butter and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Then add the roast beef, cover the pan with a lid and cook for 1 hour. Transfer the meat to a plate lined with paper towels to remove any excess fat. Then strain the liquid through a sieve lined with paper towels to remove the onion pieces. Reserve the liquid in the fridge for later use. Cook the potato in boiling salted water for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain the potato in a colander and peel it with a knife or your fingers. Then cut the potato into 2-inch cubes and add it to the potato liquid in the fridge to cool slightly. Meanwhile, add the beef stock to the pan with the onion liquid and heat it over medium heat. Then add the potato pieces

Cut potatoes in half lengthwise. Cut a slit into the side of each half lengthwise. Fill slits with chopped bacon and onion. Sprinkle with cheese. Place potato halves in a greased 9 x 13 baking pan. Fold the foil into a packet and place potato packets in the pan. Pour 1 cup water into the pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

Prepare your veggies by cutting the broccoli into florets and the cauliflower into florets. Prepare the dressing by combining the mayonnaise, vinegar, and sugar. Combine the dressing and the veggies in a large bowl. Stir in the bacon. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours. This salad is best served the next day.

In a saucepan over low heat combine tomato paste and water. Add vinegar and stir to dissolve. Increase heat to medium. Stir in remaining ingredients and heat until boiling. Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes. Strain mixture through a colander lined with a cheese cloth. Return to pot. Simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Stir in the cornstarch slurry. Reheat on medium heat until thickened.

Make pudding as directed by package directions using milk instead of water and using 1 cup pineapple juice instead of water. Remove from refrigerator and add all other ingredients except grapes and marshmallows. Stir well and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until completely chilled. Garnish with grapes and marshmallows.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large skillet cook chicken chili according to package directions. Set aside and keep warm. In a large bowl, mix together the cream cheese and cottage cheese. In a separate bowl mix together the broth and sour cream. Pour broth mixture into the cream cheese mixture and mix together. In a 9x13 inch baking dish spread 1 1/2 cups of the chicken chili over the bottom. Top with 6 tortillas, breaking them into pieces if needed. Top with half of the cream cheese mixture and half of the mozzarella cheese. Repeat layers once more. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes or until heated through. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting and serving.

Put beef into a large stock pot and cover with water. Bring to boiling. Cover with lid. Remove from heat. Let stand at least 10 minutes. Drain meat. Discard liquid. Return meat to pot. Add bouillon cubes. Stir. Add ketchup, worcestershire sauce, parsley, bay leaves. Cover. Cook over medium heat until meat is tender. Add frozen stew vegetables. Cover. Cook over low heat 10 to 15 minutes more.

In a small saucepan, combine half-and-half with white chocolate chips over medium-low heat until chips are melted and hot white chocolate is smooth. Stir in vanilla extract until combined. Stir in salt to taste. Serve warm with whipped cream, if desired. Makes about 2 cups of hot white chocolate.

Melt 1/4 cup of the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic powder and cook for 1 minute. Add the parmesan cheese and stir until it melts, stirring constantly. Add 1/2 cup of the dressing mix with the chicken broth to the skillet and bring the mixture to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce the heat to medium low, cover the skillet, and simmer for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the remaining 1/4 cup of butter with the remaining 1/4 cup of dressing mix. Dip each piece of chicken into the buttery dressing mixture and place into the prepared skillet. Cook for 5 minutes over medium heat or until the chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle each piece with parmesan cheese. Makes 2 servings.

Heat oil and butter in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add onion and red pepper and saute until tender. Add mushrooms and saute until softened. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add barley and boil 2 minutes. Reduce heat and simmer until barley is tender. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving platter and sprinkle with parsley.
Cook macaroni in boiling, salted water until al dente. Drain well. Return to pot and add butter and egg. Stir until cheese is melted. Season with mustard and salt and pepper to taste.

Cook pork & beans as directed on packagedrain. Combine the ketchup, mustard, brown sugar and beans in a medium saucepanstir to blend. Heat to boilingreduce heat to medium and cook for 4 minutes or until hotstirring occasionally. Place in a lightly greased 5 quart slow cooker. Cook on LOW for 7 to 8 hours or until hot. Meanwhile, grill or fry frankfurters until done according to package directionsdrain well. Serve over beans in buns. Yield: 10 servings.

In a large saucepan bring 1 cup water to boil. Add egg yolks and sugar, cooking over moderate heat until sugar dissolves and mixture becomes thick. Remove from heat and whisk in corn syrup. Increase heat to boiling and cook until thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and cool. Whisk butter into mixture, whisking constantly until butter is melted. Whisk in vanilla.

Place 8 oz. Of crabmeat in a bowl and add mayonnaise and a dash of hot sauce. Fold in pimento. Fold in cheese. Fold in shallot. To make phyllo shells, lay out phyllo sheets and brush lightly with butter. Layer half of phyllo sheets and brush again. Layer half of crabmeat mixture and brush again. Repeat layers. Cut each layer in half. Fold in half. Place on greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Fill each half with 2 tsp. Crabmeat mixture. Garnish with chives.
Put rind into a pan with water and cocoa. Cook over low heat till thickened and dissolved. Add the orange juice and vanilla. Mix well. Pour into cups and serve with whipped cream on top.

Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add in egg and beat until smooth. Add in the vanilla and almond extracts. Add in the flour and baking powder and mix until combined. Put in the fridge for about 20 minutes. Put the batter into the pan and bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes. Let cool for about 5 minutes before removing from the pan.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add a large pinch of salt. Add the zucchini to the boiling water. Cook until just tender, about 5 minutes. Drain the zucchini. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic. Cook until tender, about 2 minutes. Add the zucchini. Cook until the garlic is golden brown, about 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes. Cook for 1 minute. Add the ricotta cheese. Cook until the cheese is melted. Add the walnuts and hot pepper flakes. Cook until the walnuts are heated through. Add the pasta. Toss until the pasta is coated with the sauce. Add salt to taste. Serve immediately. Recipe can be doubled.
Combine frozen berries, yogurt, and honey nuts in an eight-ounce glass. Top with more berries if desired.
Add a small amount of mayonnaise to a skillet or pan over medium heat. Add the eggs. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until the eggs are just cooked through. Serve warm. Serves 1-2.

In a small saucepan, combine olive oil and red onion. Cook over low heat until onions are soft. Add garlic and cook for another 30 seconds. Remove from heat and stir in brown sugar and vinegar. Let cool to room temperature. In a small bowl, combine the vinegar mixture with capers and season to taste. Refrigerate for 12 hours before serving.

Heat the oil in a large soup pot. Add the onions and garlic cloves. Cook until the onions turn translucent. Add the red chile flakes and cook for 1 minute. Add the sweet potatoes, carrots and vegetable stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium low. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from heat.

Puree lime juice, honey, jalapeno pepper, cilantro in a blender or food processor until smooth. Whisk in salt until salt dissolves. In a large bowl, add tomatoes, corn, and spinach to vinaigrette and toss to coat. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow flavors to blend. Serve immediately.

Pat fillets dry with paper towel. Sprinkle with salt, pepper. Sprinkle with dijon mustard. Dip fillets into melted butter. Coat with honey. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat a baking sheet with olive oil. Arrange tomatoes on baking sheet cut side down. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle garlic clove on tomatoes. Roast for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remove from oven, let cool. Tear basil leaves into pieces. Place basil leaves on top of tomatoes. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heatsaute garlic until tender. Remove garlic from panstir in thyme and pepper. Add salmon fillets and cook 8 to 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork. Sprinkle with lime zest and juice. Serve salmon fillets over cooked rice.

Soak the split peas for about 2 hours or overnight. When the split peas are ready add them with the water to a large pot. Add carrots, onions, garlic powder and the ham bone. Cook for about 2 hours over medium heat or until the split peas are soft. Add the potatoes and cook for another 20 minutes or so. Remove the ham bone. Add the bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with crusty bread.

Boil potatoes in plenty of water until tender. Meanwhile, boil eggs. Place potatoes in a bowl, add hard-boiled eggs. In another bowl, mix aji yellow paste, evaporated milk, saltine crackers, vegetable oil, cheese, salt, olives and lettuce. Pour mixture over potatoes. Serve with hot sauce.

Bring 4 cups of salted water to boil in large pot over high heatadd pasta. Cook until tender but firm to bite, stirring occasionallydrain pasta in colanderreturn to pot. To same pot over medium-high heat, add 1/2 cup oilheat until hot but not smokingadd garliccook 30 secondsadd salmoncook 2 minutes on each side, turning onceremove salmon from panadd brothbring to boiladd pastacook 2 minutesremove from heatstir in 1/4 cup cream cheese, 1/4 cup evaporated milk, parsley, black olivestop with salmonsprinkle with saltserve with lemon wedgesif desired, garnish with additional parsley sprigs.

Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Cut the zest from the oranges into thin strips, then juice the oranges and put the juice aside. Put the sugar into the bowl of an electric mixer with the egg yolks and beat until thick, pale yellow and fluffy. Beat in the orange juice until the curd is thick and smooth. Stir the curd by hand until it is glossy and thick enough to hold its shape. Pour into six 175ml/6fl-oz sterilised jam jars and put into the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the mixture has thickened, turned golden brown and has set around the edges of the jars. Leave the jars in the oven for 5 minutes before removing them. Chill in the fridge until needed.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9-inch springform pan. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup of the sugar with 1/2 cup of the butter. Place the bowl in a larger bowl of ice water. Stir occasionally until butter is melted. Cream the butter mixture with the remaining 1/2 cup of sugar and 2 eggs. Sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Add to butter mixture alternately with the sour cream. Add the vanilla. Spread half of this batter into prepared pan. Add half of the cream cheese. Spread half of this layer over the batter. Repeat layers with remaining batter. Bake in preheated oven for 55 - 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool for 15 minutes before unmolding onto a wire cooling rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a 10x15x1 inch pan. In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. Stir in cocoa, sugar and water. Add eggs and butter. Stir in pecans. Bake 25 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degees. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin with oil. Whisk together dry ingredients. In another bowl whisk together oil, yogurt, and eggsstir in the dry ingredients until combined. Pour into the muffin cups. Sprinkle the cheese on top of the batter in the cups. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown.

To make the crust, place the graham cracker crumbs in an 8-inch pie plate. Combine the sugar and cornstarch in a medium bowl and mix well. Add the egg yolks and mix well. Add the condensed milk and mix well. Pour the mixture over the crumbs and press down firmly to form an even layer. Place in the refrigerator. To make the filling, add the frozen raspberries to 1 cup water and cook over medium heat until tender. Drain and cool. Place the egg whites in a medium-size bowl and beat until stiff. Add the lemon juice and mix well. Add the food coloring and mix well. Add the water and beat well. Place the sugar and cornstarch in a small bowl and mix well. Add the egg yolks and mix well. Add the condensed milk and mix well. Add the cooled berries and mix well. Pour the mixture over the crust and place the pie in the refrigerator for at least two hours. To make the topping, combine the confectioners sugar and yellow food coloring. Frost the pie with whipped to
Muddle mint and lemon juice with the rum. Fill glasses with ice. Top with the club soda. Garnish with the fresh mint leaves. Serve.

Remove stems from portabella mushrooms. Slice caps in half. Brush oil on one side of each mushroom. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Brush each mushroom with pesto. Add mozzarella, then the bacon. Place on bread. Top with pesto. Serve.
Bake potatoes for 1 hour at 350f. Cut potatoes in half and scoop out insides. Put potato halves back together and fill with eggs and cheddar cheese. Top with parsley. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine seasoning salt with peppersprinkle on chops and stuffing mix. Place chops on 9x13 baking dish. Pour soup over chops and stuffing mix. Bake for 25 minutes or until done. Serves 4-6

Place all meatball ingredients into food processor and mix until completely combined. Form meatballs and place on prepared cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes until cooked through. Pour butter into large saucepan on medium heat. Add garlic and sauté for 1 minute. Add flour and stir until lightly browned and fragrant. Whisk in chicken broth and bring mixture to a boil. Whisk in heavy cream and simmer for 10 minutes until thickened. Pour sauce over cooked meatballs and serve warm!

Prepare a charcoal grill for medium heat and soak the wood charcoal. Brush the salmon fillets with the oil. Sprinkle the salt and pepper to taste. Grill the fish for 3 to 5 minutes each side or until done. Remove from the grill and allow to rest. Serve with the bourbon pineapple juice.

Beat the eggs and the milk in a small bowl until blended. Pour into a shallow pan. Add the cheeses and stir to combine. Break the peppers into small pieces and add to the cheese mixture. Sprinkle with paprika. Pour mixture into a greased 9-by-9-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 to 25 minutes. Allow to cool for 15 minutes before cutting into squares.

Crackers: Melt butter. Add cinnamon to butter. Spread on bottoms of graham cracker crumbs. Mix together peanut butter and powdered sugar. Spread on graham cracker crumbs. Add chopped chocolate. Mix together. Add vanilla extract. Spread evenly. Freeze. Bars: Melt butter. Add cinnamon to butter. Spread on bottoms of graham crackers. Add peanut butter. Spread on graham crackers. Add chopped chocolate. Mix together. Add vanilla extract. Spread evenly. Freeze. Garnish with powdered sugar.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add noodlescook until tender but firm to the bite, stirring occasionally. Drain and set aside. While noodles cook, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onioncook until tender. Stir in garliccook 1 minute longer. Stir in noodlescook 1 minute longer. Stir in cabbagecook 1 minute more. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to serving bowl.
In a small bowl, combine butter, cheddar cheese, garlic powder, deli ham, and swiss cheese. Spread mixture onto both slices of sourdough bread.

Bring water and sugar to boil and stir until dissolved. Add fish sauce and cook until sugar is dissolved completely. Add honey and cook until honey is dissolved completely. Stir in garlic and shallots and cook for 30 seconds. Turn off heat and add fish and coconut milk and stir well. Let sit for 10 minutes and serve with rice and vegetables.

Bring a large saucepan of water to boil. Add the potatoes and cook until tender. Drain well. Heat 2 tablespoons of the butter in a 13 by 9 inch baking dish. Add half of the onions and cook until softened. Stir in the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Pour in the milk. Add the cooked potatoes, 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and 1/8 teaspoon of the pepper. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of the salt and 1/8 teaspoon of the pepper. Stir in 2/3 of the cheese. Pour in the cream. Place on a rack in the middle of a 425 degree oven. Bake 45 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. Serve hot.

Put grits in a large pot and add cold water to cover by one inch. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir frequently. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Stir grits and pour into a large bowl. In a separate bowl, beat eggs. Add milk and beat until combined. In a third bowl, mash yellow onion and garlic. Pour into a fourth bowl. Pour milk-egg mixture over grits and stir in mashed onion-garlic. Season to taste. Stir in Velveeta. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes. Serves 4-6.

1. Rinse shrimps well, pat dried. 2. Wash shallot with water and drain well. 3. Add shrimp, white wine, evaporated milk into a pot. Bring it to boil over medium heat until shrimps turn pink. 4. Add shallot, cook until fragrant. 5. Stir in corn flour, cook for a few seconds until thickening. Season with salt & sugar, add chopped garlic for garnish. Serve hot.

Put oats in a bowl and pour hot water over them. Cover and let stand for 10 minutes. Add rest of the water and mix. Stir in yeast and molasses. Slowly stir in spelt and oatmeal flour. When the dough is well blended and elastic (about 2 minutes), turn it out onto a floured surface. Knead until smooth (about 6 minutes). Put the dough in a large oiled bowl. Cover and let rise until doubled in size (about 1 hour). Punch down dough and divide in half. Shape each half into a round loaf and place them in two greased 8 inch by 4 inch bread pans. Let rise until doubled in size (about 30 minutes). Bake in 350 degree oven for 35 minutes. Cool before slicing.

Clean and slice onion and green pepper. Saute in 1 tbsp of butter on low heat until onions are translucent. Add 1 tbsp of salsa, 2 tbsp of tomato paste, salt, pepper, paprika & 2 eggs. Saute until eggs are cooked & onion is softened & add 2 cups of milk & 1/2 cup of flour. Stir in milk & flour & then add 2 cups of shredded cheese & 4 oz of chopped bacon. Stir until cheese is melted & serve on tortillas.

Melt chocolate chips and butter together in a large saucepan over low heat. Stir in the cream. Cook over low heat until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth. Pour the mixture into a heat proof glass bowl. Sprinkle with the Kahlua and let stand for 10 minutes. Refrigerate until chilled. Serve over ice cream or pound cake.

Remove eggplant skin and cut into rounds. Dip eggplant rounds in a mixture of egg, Italian dressing and dry breadcrumbs. Place in an ovenproof skillet. Bake at 425 degrees for 30 minutes. Top with parmesan cheese and return to oven to melt cheese. Serve warm.
Mix together mashed potatoes, flour, baking powder, salt and eggs. Stir in maple syrup. Spoon into a greased baking dish. Bake at 375 for 35-40 minutes until puffed up.

Preheat oven to 350. Peel and halve carrots. Slice into 1/2 inch thick rounds. Toss carrots with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Roast until carrots are tender and lightly golden on top and bottom sides, about 15 minutes. In a sauce pan melt apricot jam. Add carrots and rosemary to the pan and toss to coat. Remove carrots from oven and drizzle with jam. Toss well and serve.

Clean the green tomatoes thoroughly. Cut them in half, remove the seeds. Place them on the rack in the steamer. Add water to the bottom of the steamer. Cover the steamer with the lid. Place the steamer in the microwave. Cook for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove the tomatoes from the steamer. Place them on the cutting board. Remove the stem from the onions. Remove the green tops from the onions. Place the onions on the cutting board. Slice the onions into half-inch thick slices. Remove the stem from the red bell peppers. Remove the green tops from the red bell peppers. Place the bell peppers on the cutting board. Cut the red bell peppers into half-inch thick slices. Cut the onions and the green tomatoes into half-inch cubes. Mix together the cubes. In a bowl combine the vinegar, turmeric powder, and celery seeds. Mix together. In another bowl combine the sugar and mustard seeds. Mix together. Add the vinegar mixture to the cubes. Mix well. Place the relish in a

Spray a 13 x 9 inch pan with cooking spray. Put the seasonings, soup and sour cream in a large bowl. Toss well. Add the chicken to the mixture and toss well. Pour into the pan. Pour the stuffing mix in a small bowl. Sprinkle the stuffing mix over the mixture in the pan. Sprinkle the cheese over the stuffing mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until chicken is tender. Yield: 6 servings.

Mix sourdough starter, 1 cup warm water, 2 cups flour, 1 egg. Beat until well mixed. Let sit for 15 minutes. Add remaining flour, baking soda, cooking oil, instant milk, sugar, egg, salt. Mix well. Bake as you normally would. You may add raisins to waffles or pancakes.

Chop the tomatillo in quarters (leaving the seeds in). Blend the tomatillos in a blender or food processor until they are smooth. Add the chopped chilies (including the seeds), garlic clove, salt and blend again. Add 1-2 cups of water to the mixture to loosen it if needed. Pour the mixture into a bowl (or pot). Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before using or serving. Note: You can use fresh or dried chilies in this salsa.

Remove the husks from the jalapenos and discard seeds and membranes. Rinse the jalapenos under cold water and set aside. Cut the tomatillos in half and remove the husks (keep the husks for another use). Rinse the tomatillos under cold water and set aside. Rinse the onion and set aside. Rinse the cilantro and set aside. Place a large pot over medium heat and add the oil and onionsauté until the onion softens slightly, about 2 minutes. Add the jalapenos and tomatillos and sauté for 1 minute. Add the garlic and sauté for 1 minute longer. Add the vegetable broth and bring to a simmer. Simmer the green sauce for about 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender and the sauce is well blended and thickened slightly. Add the salt and continue simmering until the sauce is as thick as you prefer and the flavors are well blended. Add the fresh mint leaves and stir well to combine with the sauce. Let the sauce cool completely

Cream together butter and vanilla. Add in powdered sugar and mix well. Add the dates and mix until a dough is formed. Place dough in the refrigerator for 10-15 minutes. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface. Cut into desired shapes and place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes at 350 degrees. Allow cookies to cool on the cookie sheet for about 5 minutes. Remove to a wire rack to cool completely. Makes about 20-25 cookies.

Peel beets and cut into 1/2" pieces. Place beets in a non-metal baking dish and pour balsamic vinegar over the beets. Sprinkle sugar and seasonings over the beets. Cover and bake 350F for 2 hours. Cool slightly and sprinkle with additional seasonings. Serve immediately.
Combine popped popcorn with the milk chocolate chips and white chocolate chips. Mix until all chips are coated. Store in airtight container at room temperature.

Combine olive oil and honey in a bowl. Add onions to bowl. Toss to coat. Heat oil and honey mixture in a frypan over medium-high heat until onions are golden brown and tender. Drain. Spoon 3/4 cup pizza sauce on a pizza crust. Sprinkle with feta and fresh mushrooms. Top with caramelized onions and remaining sauce. Sprinkle with dried thyme. Bake at 425 for 10-12 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Garnish with basil leaves.

In a large bowl mix together the coconut milk, cornstarch and sugar. In a small saucepan heat the coconut milk mixture to a boil. Boil for 2 minutes. Add the salt. Cool the mixture for 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in the frozen passion fruit juice concentrate. Pour into the prepared pie crusts. Cool completely. Yields 2 pies.

Heat extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Sauté onions until softened but not brown. Add garam masala, freshly ground cilantro, potatoes, carrots and mushrooms. Cook for about ten minutes over medium heat until mushrooms are tender. Add vegetable stock and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat slightly, cover pot and simmer for ten minutes. Add more stock if necessary. Puree soup until smooth. Stir in freshly chopped cilantro. Serve hot or refrigerate up to three days. To reheat, bring soup to a boil over medium heat for about two minutes, stirring frequently.

Heat 3 tbsp oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the potatoes, celery and onion. Saute until soft. Add the crabmeat. Heat through. Add the bouillon cubes. Whisk in the flour until smooth. Add cream cheese until melted. Stir in the parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Combine melted butter, whole kernel corn, cream-style corn, sour cream, cheese and egg in large bowl until blended. Pour into greased 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with corn muffin mix. Bake for 25 minutes or until heated through and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350f. Sautee the bacon in a large cast iron skillet until browned. Add the cabbage and stir until wilted. In a large bowl combine the cabbage bacon mixture with the olive oil and salt and pepper. Mix well. Transfer to a greased baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes or until the mixture is firm. Let cool for 10 minutes and cut into small pieces. Serve.

Clean asparagus and cut off the ends and then remove the tough outer stem. Wash them well and pat them dry with paper towels. Set aside. In a large skillet, melt the butter. Add the asparagus and cook for about 6-8 minutes until the asparagus is soft and tender. In the meantime, combine the parmesan cheese with the lemon pepper and stir well to combine. Drain the asparagus and then place on a serving platter. Drizzle with the parmesan lemon sauce and serve immediately.

Peel potatoes and place in large sauce pan and cover with cold water. Bring potato water to boil and cook until tender, about 25 minutes. Drain and let cool. While potato water is coming to a boil, place onion in another saucepan and cover with water. Bring water to a boil and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Drain and let cool. To make mashed potatoes, place the potato and onion in a food processor or blender and puree. Add enough whole milk to thin the mashed potato until desired consistency. Fold in fresh goat cheese. Serve warm.

Follow directions on pie crust package for making. Mix the coconut and sugar together. Set aside. Beat eggs and vanilla together. Mix flour and salt together and add to egg mixture. Add milk. Fold in coconut. Pour into pie crust. Bake for 20 minutes at 400 degrees. Let cool. Refrigerate for several hours. Serve.

Place oats, flour, almond meal, salt, maple syrup and peanut butter in a large bowl. Mix well with a wooden spoon. Stir in flaked coconut. Add vanilla extract. Use a small cookie scoop to form balls. Place on a cookie sheet and flatten with a fork. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for about 10 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 325f. Spray a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray and set aside. Whisk together eggs and milkstir in brown sugar, orange juice and spices until blended. Layer bread into prepared baking dish making sure each piece is coated with egg mixture. Bake at 325f for 30-35 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean and the top is golden brown. Serve with warmed maple syrup and butter.

Mix dry ingredients together in a large bowl. Make a well in the middle of the dry ingredients. Make a hole in the center of the well large enough to hold the eggs. In a smaller bowl, beat together eggs, vanilla and milk. Pour into well in dry ingredients. Beat together until the dough comes together. If it is too dry add a little more milk.
