Knead until the dough is smooth and elastic. Roll into a ball, cover in plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size (about 30 minutes). Punch dough down again. Knead for a few seconds. Roll dough into a 12-14 inch log on a floured surface. Cut into pieces about the size of a golf ball (for a standard sized loaf) and place in greased bread pans. Let rise until doubled in size (about 30 minutes). Bake at 400 degrees for about 20 minutes until golden brown. Let cool slightly before removing from pans to a wire rack to finish cooling completely.

Cut the chicken breast in half and season with salt and pepper to taste. Heat the gravy in a small skillet over low heat until hot, about 5 minutes. Place one half of the chicken breast in each of 4 shallow bowls and top each with 1 teaspoon of the gravy and 1 tablespoon of the cheese. Top each with another chicken breast half and cover with foil. Place in the microwave and cook on high for 3 to 4 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Meanwhile, prepare the broccoli: Cook the broccoli in boiling salted water until tender and drain. Bring the 1/2 cup of half-and-half to a boil in a small skillet over medium-low heat. Reduce the heat to low and add the broccoli and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until warmed through. Serve the chicken and broccoli in the bowls with the mornay sauce spooned over top. Sprinkle each with the parmesan cheese.

In a large saute pan heat the butter over medium-high heat. Add the sage leaves and cook until the butter has just browned, about two minutes. Add the salt and pepper and cook for one minute more. Add the ravioli and toss until they are well coated with butter and sage.

Prepare marinade by combining all the ingredients in a glass jar and whisking well. Pour into a large resealable plastic bag. Add salmon and turn to coat all sides of the salmon fillets well. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours and up to overnight. When ready to cook the salmon, pre-heat a grill or broiler pan on high heat. Remove salmon from the marinade and place skin-side down on a greased baking sheet or grill. Grill or broil for 5-7 minutes on each side or until the salmon flakes easily when tested with a fork and has reached an internal temperature of 145 degrees F. Serve with rice or noodles and top with Hoisin sauce and chopped scallions if desired.

Slice ham steak in thin slices. Place a layer of ham in the bottom of the pastry shell. Pour a little sour cream on the ham. Add a layer of ham. Repeat until all ham is used. Pour cream of mushroom soup over ham. Place on top of ham layer. Pour a little sour cream on the top of the ham. Add chives and a little black pepper. Pour a little sour cream on the top of the ham layer. Add chives and a little black pepper. Pour a little sour cream on the top of the ham layer. Add chives and a little black pepper. Bake at 325f until top is golden brown. Let cool slightly before removing from the pan. Serve.

Bring vinegar, mustard, sugar, pepper to a boil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add olive oil and heat to boil again. Remove from heat and cool to room temp. Whisk in salt until dissolved. Refrigerate at least one hour. Toss apple slices with spinach in a large bowl. Stir in apple vinaigrette, tossing until thoroughly coated. Arrange salad on a platter and top with pecans.

Mix cake according to package directions. Fold in poppy seeds and coconut extract. Pour into a greased 10-inch tube pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 60 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to cool completely on a wire rack. Meanwhile, make the filling by mixing all ingredients in a bowl until smooth. Frost cooled cake with filling. Serve with the Cool Whip if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place all vegetables in a roasting pan and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast until vegetables are tender and browned. Place in a blender with oregano and pulse until a smooth puree is formed. Add lime juice and pulse. Serve warm.

Cut spring roll wrappers into squares. Place prawns and bean sprouts in centre of each square. Drizzle mayonnaise and yogurt over prawns and bean sprouts. Drizzle with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with gherkins and oil. Serve immediately.

Beat butter and sugar together with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add condensed milk and beat until well combined. Add baking powder and flour and mix until combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop dough by heaping teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes. Cool on cookie sheet for 2 minutes before transferring cookies to wire rack. Cool completely. Enjoy!
Saute shallots in butter and oil over medium heat. Add mushrooms, sherry, wild rice blend, and seasoning. Stir occasionally until rice is tender and all liquid is absorbed.
Place hard-boiled eggs in a bowl. Mash with a fork and mix in miracle whip. Sprinkle with paprika and salt and pepper. Serve.

In a large sauce pan or dutch oven cook onion, leek and celery ribs for 5-7 minutes stirring occasionally over medium heat until softened. Add carrots, parsnip and barley. Stir to coat with butter, then add tomato puree and wine. Stir to combine and bring to a boil stirring occasionally. Simmer for 1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 30 minutes or until barley is tender. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in parsley.
Boil water, sugar and oranges in a saucepan, stirring until sugar dissolves. Remove from heatadd lemons juice, orange blossom water and ice cubes. Stir until chilled. Serve immediately.

Peel potatoes and slice them into french fry size pieces. Toss with olive oil in a large bowl until covered in oil. Season with salt, pepper, paprika & garlic salt (optional). Mix until well coated. Bake at 350 for 25-30 min. until tender.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease 9 x 13 baking dish with cooking oil. Place 6 baguette slices in prepared dish. Top with 1/2 cup pumpkin puree. Sprinkle with 1/3 tsp cinnamon, 1/3 tsp ginger, 1/3 tsp ground cloves and 1/3 tsp pure vanilla extract. Whisk together 1/3 cup almond milk with 1 tbsp cornstarchstir into pumpkin puree mixture in baguette slices. Cover dish with aluminum foil and bake 25 minutes or until set. Uncoverdrizzle with 1 tbsp honeybake 5 minutes more or until golden brown. Serve with fruit compote or fruit preserves on side. Makes 6 servings.
Mix powdered hot chocolate with cayenne pepper to taste in a mug of boiling water. Add in some more boiling water if needed for desired thickness. Top with whipped cream.

Cook rice as directed on package. Drain rice and return to pot with vinegar and water to cover by 1 inchbring to a boil over high heat. Cook until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender, stirring occasionally, about 25 minutes. Cool completely in pot. In a small bowl, stir together sugar and 2 tablespoons water to make a syrupset aside. In a large bowl, combine remaining 1 1/2 cups water and 1/4 teaspoon salt. In a small bowl, combine vinegar and remaining 2 tablespoons water and set aside. In a large wok or skillet set over high heat, heat oil until hot but not smokingadd spam and cook until lightly browned and cooked through, turning occasionally, about 4 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer to a plate and cut into 1/2-inch cubes (reserve oil in wok or skillet). Cut cucumber into 1/2-inch cubes and set aside. Divide rice among 6 to 8 bowls or platestop each with 1/

Combine the marshmallows and milk in a saucepan and cook over medium heat until marshmallows are completely melted and milk is slightly thick. Remove from heat and stir in lime gelatin until dissolved. Add pineapple and salad dressing and blend well. Place in a 9 x 13 baking dish. Refrigerate until slightly thickened. Add cream cheese and whipped cream. Serve chilled.

Peel and cut potatoes into chunks. Place into a large saucepan with cold water. Bring to the boil and cook for 10 minutes. Drain and rinse under cold water. Add butter and fry lightly. In the meantime, dice onions and fry them gently in sunflower oil until golden brown. Add pepper and salt. Peel and grate the garlic clove finely and add. Add the parsley and the roast pork. Drain the potatoes well and add them to the pan. Add the eggs and beat them with a fork. Mix everything well and cook for another 2 minutes until the eggs have set. Transfer onto a plate and serve hot. The hash can be served with pickled beetroot or pickled cucumber.

Cut each drumstick lengthwise into three parts and remove the meat from the bones and discard bones. Place the meat in a large bowl with soy sauce and wine vinegar and set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and thyme and sauté for 1 minute. Add rosemary and sauté another minute. Add the meat and cook until browned on one side. Add the cornstarch and stir well. Add the honey and pepper and bring to a boil for about 1 minute until thickened. Pour sauce over meat and simmer for about 10 minutes until meat is tender. Serve with lemon wedges and garnish with parsley sprigs and a little more freshly ground black pepper if desired.

Wash and soak red lentils for about 30 minutes. Meanwhile heat the oil over medium-low heat. Add the mustard seeds, cumin and ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the mustard seeds start to pop. Add the turmeric. Once the lentils are done cooking and have absorbed the water add the cooked mustard seeds and turmeric and the red lentils to the skillet. Mix thoroughly. Add salt to taste. Serves 4.

In mixing bowl combine the shortening, sugar and eggs. Beat well. Add corn syrup and vanilla and beat well. Add flour, baking soda and salt. Beat well. Roll dough to one inch thickness. Cut with large cookie cutter. Spread out on greased and floured pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 6 to 8 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Roll warm cookies in melted chocolate.

Mix margarine and shortening with hand beater until smooth. Add vanilla and beat until smooth. Add powdered sugar, 1 cup at a time, and beat until smooth. Add flour and beat until well blended. Spread over cake.
Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Add water, milk, cranberries, maple syrup and stir well. Cook over low heat for 5-10 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Serve warm.

Cook ground beef and drain excess fat. Stir in brown rice and tomato soup. Bring to a boil. Add cabbage and stir until wilted. Add onions and garlic and season with salt and pepper. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until browned. Serve warm.

Boil potatoes in water until tender. Remove from heat and drain. Cool until easy to handle. Peel and cube potatoes into large bowl. In a blender or food processor blend yogurt and garlic until smooth. Add to potatoes and stir with a large spoon until potatoes are well coated with yogurt mixture. Season with dill seed and salt to taste. Cover and chill for several hours before serving. This soup tastes best if made a day or two ahead of time and chilled in the refrigerator before serving.

Combine all ingredients except ketchup. Bring to boil. Stirring constantly. Boil for 1 minute. Reduce heat to low. Stirring occasionally. Simmer for 1 hour. Strain into large bowl. Add ketchup. Stir to blend. Serve with steaks or burgers.

Place 1/2 cup lemon sherbet in each of 6 dessert dishes or ramekins. In another small bowl, combine cream cheese and sweetened condensed milkbeat with an electric mixer until well blended. Spoon over lemon sherbet in dishestop with lime juice. Coverchill 4 hours or overnight. Serve topped with cool whip. Refrigerate any leftovers.

Peel potatoes and cut them into quarters. Place potatoes and bay leaves into a large pot with water. Cover and simmer until tender. Drain potatoes. Transfer potatoes to a large bowl and toss with extra virgin olive oil and season with salt and pepper.

In a small pan melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until lightly browned. Add chicken and cook until cooked through. Add salsa and cook for 2 minutes or until heated through. Shape chicken into 4 patties. Place a little less than 1/2 of each patty on each hamburger bun. Top each bun with a slice of cheese. Place on grill for 2 minutes or until cheese has melted. Top each sandwich with avocado slices and tomato slices.

In a shallow bowl whisk the milk, egg and seasoning salt. In another shallow bowl combine the flour and pepper. Dip each ear of corn in the milk mixture, then in the flour mixture. Fry in oil about 5 minutes or until brown. Serve immediately.

Place tea bags in a heatproof pitcher or large measuring cup. Pour boiling water over the tea bags and let steep for 2 minutes. Meanwhile, combine fresh raspberries, orange juice, lemon juice, sugar, and club soda in a separate pitcher or bowl. Add ice cubes to the raspberry mixture and stir well. When the tea has steeped for 2 minutes, pour the tea into the raspberry mixture. Stir well. Serve over ice with a long straw if desired. Refrigerate leftovers for up to 2 days.

In a large pot boil water with salt. Blanch cabbage for about 2 minutes. Drain. Add red wine vinegar to blanched cabbage. Stir until cabbage is completely covered with vinegar. Drain. Add red wine vinegar to blanched cabbage. Stir until cabbage is completely covered with vinegar. Drain. Add water to blanched cabbage. Stir until cabbage is completely covered with water. Drain. Add carrot to blanched cabbage. Stir until cabbage is completely covered with water. Drain. Add sugar to blanched cabbage. Stir until cabbage is completely covered with sugar. Drain. Add water to blanched cabbage. Stir until cabbage is completely covered with water. Drain. Add red wine vinegar to blanched cabbage. Stir until cabbage is completely covered with vinegar. Drain. Add water to blanched cabbage. Stir until cabbage is completely covered with water. Drain. Add sugar to blanched cabbage. Stir until cabbage is completely covered with sugar. Drain. Add water to blanched cab
Preheat oven to 375F. In large bowl, whisk together eggs and milk. Add in spinach, soup mix and swiss cheese. Stir in 1 cup of frozen vegetables. Pour into pie shell. Bake 15-20 minutes. Serve warm.
Mix all together and serve with chips.
Mix everything together in a bowl. Form the mixture into small hamburger patties. Roll the patties in bread crumbs. Pan fry until browned. Serve.

Cut kidneys into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place kidneys skin side down in a shallow 8- to 10-inch saute pan or Dutch oven with a lid or a deep-sided frying pansprinkle with salt. Melt 2 tablespoons of the butter and 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium heatswirl to coat the bottom of the pan. Carefully add half of the sliced onions to the hot pancook for about 2 minutes or until golden brown, stirring occasionally to prevent burning. Sprinkle with the mushroomscook for about 2 minutes or until golden brown, stirring occasionally to prevent burning. Sprinkle with the remaining saltstir well. Pour 1/4 cup of the wine over the kidneyssprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter and 1 tablespoon of oilcover tightly and cook over medium heat for about 15 minutes or until the kidneys are tender. Remove the coveradd the remaining 1/4 cup of wine and the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter

Drain beansput in slow cooker. Add tomato sauce, onion, vinegar, brown sugar, jalapeno pepper and garlic powderstir well. Cook on high for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Remove jalapeno pepper if desired. Season with salt before serving. Serves 6-8 people.

Toast the bread slices in a toaster oven or under the broiler. Set aside. Spread the cheese slices over the bread slices. Layer the bacon, turkey and tomato slices over the cheese. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs with the milk. Season with salt and cayenne pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the bread. Cover loosely with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 6 hours or overnight. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Bake the strata for about 50 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

1. Wash asparagus well. Peel asparagus. Cut asparagus into 2.5cm sections. Blanch the asparagus by placing in boiling water for a few seconds. Remove from the water with a slotted spoon. 2. In a blender or food processor, add the egg yolks, egg white, lemon juice, orange juice, orange zest, olive oil and salt. Blend for about 1 minute until the mixture is smooth. 3. Drain the asparagus. Arrange the asparagus on a serving dish. 4. Pour the orange mixture over the asparagus. 5. Decorate with orange slices. Serve.

Cut the florets away from the stems. Wash the florets to remove any dirt. In a bowl, combine the florets, butter, virgin olive oil, lemon juice, almonds, salt, and pepper. Toss until well combined. Serve immediately.

Drain and press the tofu. Combine all the ingredients together in a food processor or blender. Blend until smooth. Place in a container with lid and refrigerate for about an hour. Serve chilled. Tastes best after it s been in the refrigerator for a day. Makes about 1 cup of filling.

Boil potatoes until soft. Peel and cube them. Put them into a large bowl. Add cubes of chicken and mix with potatoes. Drizzle with pepper and salt. Add about 1 Tbls of coconut milk. Mix. Add a little more coconut milk until you have a creamy consistency. Add about 1 Tbls of coconut milk. Mix well. Add curry powder to taste. Add a little more coconut milk if too dry. Heat a small skillet and saute onions until golden brown. Add to pot. Add a little more coconut milk and stir well. Add remaining coconut milk and stir well. Put a lid on and cook over low heat. Stir occasionally. When cooked to a creamy consistency, remove from heat and stir in basil. Serve over rice.

Bring 2 cups chicken broth to a boil. Add 1 cup dry white wine. Add orzo. Boil for 10 minutes or until orzo is tender. Add garlic clove to broth. Cook 1 minute. Stir in spinach. Cook 1 minute. Stir in feta cheese. Cook 2 minutes. Season with salt. Stir in 1/2 cup dry white wine. Cook 1 minute. Sprinkle with grated feta.

Cook and cool the ham. Remove the skin and trim any excess fat. Cut the ham into 1-inch thick slices. Place on a large platter. In a small saucepan over medium heat, cook the lime marmalade until thick. Remove from heat and stir in the brown sugar and nutmeg. Brush the ginger onto the ham. Roll the ham in the marmalade mixture. Place the ham on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve warm.

Toast oats for 5 minutes in the toaster. In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, stir together the canola oil and maple syrup. When the syrup starts to foam and bubble, whisk in the cinnamon and salt. Continue stirring until the syrup is golden brown. Stir in the toasted oats and serve.
Pineapple, grapes and strawberries may be sliced or diced. Toss with splenda in wine in serving bowl.

Spread 1 slice of bread with 1/4 cup of mustard. Add 1 slice of cheese. Spread 1/2 cup mayonnaise on remaining slice of bread. Place slice of cheese on top. Add 1 slice of beef. Top with 1 slice of lettuce and remaining slice of cheese. Place on baking sheet and bake 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Drain tofu, place in a large bowl. Add garlic powder and onion powder and stir. In a blender add the tofu mixture, lemon juice and salt. Blend until smooth. Pour into a large bowl. Add raw cashews to the mixture. Add enough hot water to the mixture to make it the consistency of cottage cheese. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Serve with crackers or bread.

In a saucepan combine milk and rice and bring to a boil on medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender, about 15 minutes. In a small bowl stir together cardamom and sugar and add to rice mixture along with coconut milk and heavy cream. Simmer until thickened and flavors meld, about 20 minutes more. Add raisins and stir until warmed through. Divide rice mixture between two bowls and top with chopped nuts. Serve warm.

Mix 1/2 cup whole wheat flour and 1/2 cup water to form a slurry. Add bouillon cubes and dissolve completely. Bring to a boil stirring constantly. Add 3 cups of milk and 3 cups of water and simmer for 30 minutes stirring occasionally. Add remaining 3 cups of milk and simmer for 10 minutes stirring occasionally. Add the ground mace to the soup and simmer for 5 minutes more stirring occasionally. Add the cooked leeks and whipping cream to the soup and simmer for 10 minutes more stirring occasionally. Serve with grated gouda cheese.
Pork chops-trim fat. Brush pork chops with teriyaki sauce. Cook 350 f. for 35 minutes.

In a Dutch oven over medium-low heat, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil. Add half of the rib rack and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with the remaining rib rack and set aside. Wipe out the pot. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil to the pot and heat over medium-low heat. Add the onion and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Add the beer and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until reduced by half. Transfer the sauerkraut and the reserved rib rack to the pot. Add the beef broth and simmer until the sauerkraut is tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic cloves and cook until golden brown. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. In a blender or food processor, combine the garlic cloves with the harissa, olive oil, lemon juice, lemon zest, salt, and 2 cups of water and puree until smooth (the mixture will be very thick). Set aside. Bring a large pot of water to a boiladd a pinch of sea salt and cook the pasta according to package directions. When the pasta is done cooking, drain the pasta and return to the pot. Pour the sauce over the pasta in the pot, then toss with the spinach leaves and the black olives. Transfer the pasta mixture to a serving bowl. Garnish each serving with a drizzle of extra-virgin olive oil and the pine nuts. Serve at once with a sprinkling of freshly ground sea salt.

Prepare dinner rolls. Saute onions and tomatoes in olive oil until soft. Add mushrooms and cook until golden. Season with salt and pepper. Put the mixture into the middle of the rolls and top with vinaigrette.

Melt white chocolate in microwave for 1 minute. Pour over crispy rice and peanuts. Mix well. Drizzle with crunchy peanut butter and miniature marshmallows and mix again. Place in individual baggies and let cool. Roll into balls and dip in white chocolate again before placing in baggies. Let set for several hours before serving. Makes 6-8 servings.

Wash and dry beets. Slice 1/4 inch off each beet. Place in a saucepan with enough water to cover them. Bring to a boil. Cook until tender. Cool and peel. Cut into wedges. In a small saucepan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic clove. Cook until soft. Add vinegar. Cook until slightly thickened. Add beets, walnuts and seasoning. Toss gently. Serve warm or cold. This is delicious on bread.

Bring a pot of water to boil. Add the artichokes in batches. Cook for 2 minutes, drain. Set aside. In a large pan heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the artichokes to the pan and coat them evenly. Add the basil and cook for 1 minute. Add the pine nuts to the pan. Season with salt to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees f. Season the fish with salt and pepper. In a bowl, mix together the olive oil, gingerroot, lemon zest and juice. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the sea bass fillet, about 3 minutes per side. Pour the lemon mixture over the fillet. Transfer to the preheated oven and bake until the fish is just cooked through, about 10 minutes.

Mix the tomato paste, vinegar, rosemary, oregano, paprika and salt with 1 cup of water. Set aside. Mix together the remaining water and tomatoes. Stir in the tomato mixture. Place the breasts in a baking dish. Pour the tomato mixture over the breasts. Sprinkle with the feta cheese. Place the baking dish in a pan. Fill the pan with enough water to come halfway up the sides of the baking dish. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Check to be sure the chicken is done. It should easily pull away from the bones. Sprinkle with the remaining feta cheese. Broil for 1-2 minutes.

Cut meat into 1 1/2-inch cubes and brown. Remove meat and set aside. Add dashida and water to pot. Bring to a boil. Stir in rice cakes. Lower heat to simmer. Cover and cook for 30 minutes. Add meat and simmer for 2 minutes. Add garlic clove and cook for 1 minute. Add sesame oil and soy sauce and simmer for 1 minute. Stir in green onions. Serve immediately.

In a pot boil sweetened condensed milk and cocoa powder. Add butter and vanilla essence and stir until combined. Stirring constantly, add salt. Remove from heat when mixture is thickened. Let it cool down to room temperature then shape into balls using your hands and roll in chopped chocolate sprinkles. Store brigadeiros in an air-tight container in refrigerator until ready to serve. These are best served after 24 hours but can be made ahead of time and served later on.

Wash potatoes and pat dry. Cut potatoes in half or quarters depending on size. Place potatoes in a large pot and add garlic cloves to pot along with enough olive oil to cover potatoes. Boil potatoes until fork tender about 15-20 minutes depending on the size of the potatoes. Drain potatoes in a colander and pat dry. Add salt and pepper to taste and drizzle the potatoes in chipotle sauce. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in medium saucepan over medium heat. Saute onion in oil for 1-2 minutes or until onion begins to soften. Add broth and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and add rice and mushrooms. Cook for 2 minutes stirring occasionally. Stir in peas. Increase heat to medium and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed (about 12-15 minutes). Stir in cream cheese and cook until cheese melts and mixture is smooth (about 3-4 minutes). Stir in lemon peel and parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper to taste. Top with extra parmesan cheese if desired.

Melt butterscotch and chocolate chips over low heat. Stir in chow mein noodles until completely coated. Pour onto a lightly greased cookie sheet. Place a handful of peanuts on top. Bake at 250 degrees until golden brown, about 30 minutes. Let cool 15 minutes before removing from cookie sheet.

Combine cream cheese with marshmallow creme. Add eggs and beat until fluffy. Add flour and beat until smooth. Pour into graham cracker crust. Bake 45 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with whipped cream or strawberries.

Wash the rutabaga and the carrots and cut them into small pieces. Put them in a saucepan and cover them with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook for 15 to 20 minutes or until the rutabaga is tender and the carrots are cooked but still a little bit crunchy. Peel the potatoes and cut them into large pieces. Cook them in salted boiling water for about 15 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and a fork pierces them easily. Drain the rutabaga and the carrots and put them into a serving dish. Add the potatoes and the butter and mix well. Put the mixture into a shallow baking dish. Sprinkle it with allspice and peppercorns and then sprinkle it lightly with salt and cinnamon. Put the dish in the oven and cook for 15 minutes at 450 degrees F or until the top is slightly browned and bubbly. Serves 6 to 8.

Soak fava beans overnight in cold water, changing water once or twice during soaking time. Rinse beanscover with fresh water and bring to a boil over medium heat, skimming foam from the surface of the beans as it rises to the surface. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook until tender but not mushyabout 2-3 hours. Drain the beans and reserve 1 cup of cooking liquid. Transfer the beans to a large stock pot. Heat extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add the saffron thread to the oilstir until it dissolvesadd the beans to the oil-saffron mixturestir to coat the beans with the oil. Add the garlic clovesstir until the garlic is tenderadd the smoked ham hocks, the smoked paprika, the thick slab bacon, the spanish chorizo and the blood sausagestir to coat with oil. Cover and simmer over low heat until the beans are tenderabout 1 hour. Stir occasionallyadd a little of the reserved cooking liquid if the beans look dry

Drain and rinse the black-eyed peas and corn. In a large bowl or serving dish, toss the beans and corn with the green onion, cilantro and tomato. In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar and oil. Add the vinegar mixture to the beans and toss well to coat. Add the black pepper and salt. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Stir before serving.
Add all the ingredients to a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Adjust the taste to your liking. Serve with steak.

In a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish, combine oil, onion, green peppers and tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Add chicken breast to pan. Cook over low heat 1 hour or until tender. Drain and discard grease from pan. Stir in tomato sauce. Cook over medium-high heat 5 minutes to blend flavors. Add tortellini and cook 3 to 5 minutes or until tender. Top with cheese. Let stand 5 minutes to melt cheese. Serves 4-6 as a main course or 8-10 as a side dish.

Combine Dijon mustard, mayonnaise, worcestershire sauce and tabasco sauce in a small bowl, stirring with a whisk until well blendedset aside. Cut each loaf of French bread lengthwise in half horizontally. Remove the top of each bread half lengthwise using a serrated bread knife and discard. Place each bread half on a work surfacespread each side with mustard mixture evenly. Place sausage in a bowltoss with salt and pepper to taste. Divide the sausage evenly among bread halves. Top each sandwich with lettuce and pickle slicesplace tomato slices over the lettuce and sausage. Cover with the other bread halfpress down gently to close sandwiches. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, whisk orange peel with lemon peel and lime peel. Add kosher salt and mix with a fork. Set aside. On a rimmed baking sheet, toss corn with oil cooking spray and salt. Arrange corn in a single layer and roast for 15 minutes or until the kernels are tender. Meanwhile, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add peel mixture and cook until the peel is fragrant and the butter is golden. Place peel and the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter in a small food processor and pulse until combined. In a small bowl, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter in a microwave until warm. Drizzle the warm butter over corn and sprinkle with remaining salt. Serve warm.

Combine salmon, lemon juice, mustard, bread crumbs, green onion, egg whites until blended. Form mixture into 4 patties. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Fry patties until cooked through. Serve on buns. Serve with your favorite salad.

In a large pot of salted water bring green beans to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cook uncovered for 10 to 12 minutes or until beans are tender crisp. Drain beans reserving cooking liquid. In a large skillet over medium heat melt margarine. Add onion. Stir in basil leaves. Cook 1 minute or until onion is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in garlic powder and pepper. Pour beans and cooking liquid into skillet. Toss to coat. Serve warm.

Heat olive oil in a large pan. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add tomato and anchovy fillet and cook for a further minute. Add capers and olives and cook for another minute. Remove from heat and stir in basil. Cook spaghetti in a large pot of salted water until al dente. Drain spaghetti and toss with the hot tomato mixture. Top with Parmigiano-Reggiano and serve immediately.
Rinse and drain romaine. Toss with ranch. Arrange lettuce on tortilla. Add corn, chicken breast, tomatoes and cheese. Fold tortilla and serve.

Cream butter and Crisco in large bowl. Add water, cocoa powder, sugar and flour. Beat with electric mixer until well blended. Add eggs one at a time. Beat well. Stir in baking soda. Beat until smooth. Pour into greased and floured 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake 35 minutes. Cool in pan. Frost with chocolate frosting.

Wash lemons, limes and oranges. Slice the lemons into wedges. Place the wedges in a pitcher or large jar. Add the juice of 3 lemons. Slice the limes in half. Squeeze the juice of the limes into the pitcher. Add the juice of 3 limes. Fill the pitcher with water. Add sugar to taste. Stir well. Let the lemonade stand for 15-20 minutes before serving. Refrigerate leftovers.

Preheat broiler with rack set to lowest position and heat broiler to high. Thread hot dogs with bacon and place onto a broiler rack set in a broiler pan. Broil until bacon is cooked and hot dogs are heated through, about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium heat and add vegetable oil. Add buns and toast until golden brown and crisp, about 3 minutes. Spread sour cream and salsa onto toasted buns and top with hot dogs and avocado.

Bring rice and 2 cups water to a boil in a 2 quart saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until water is absorbed and rice is tender, about 18 minutes. Stir in soy sauce and set aside. In a large nonstick skillet, saute garlic in oil until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Add celery and mushroomsaute until tender. Stir in spinach until wilted and add rice mixture. Add remaining 1/4 cup water and bring to a boil, stirring gently until heated through and liquid is absorbed. Stir in scallion just before serving.

Add coconut milk to a large saucepan. Add curry paste and stir. Add chicken stock. Cook over medium heat until it is reduced by half. Add fish sauce. Add brown sugar. Cook until brown sugar is dissolved. Add zucchini, snap peas and mushrooms. Cook until vegetables are tender. Add bamboo shoots. Add more chicken stock if necessary. Stir to coat vegetables evenly. Taste for seasoning. Serve over rice.

Slice the bread and cheese into 1/2-inch thick slices. Place on baking sheet and brush with melted butter. Sprinkle with garlic powder and top with deli ham and turkey slices. Sprinkle with cooked bacon pieces. Broil 4 minutes or until cheese melts.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Scrub potatoescut in half lengthwise and remove any eyes. Drizzle potatoes with olive oilsprinkle with red pepper flakes and garlic powderseason with salt and pepper to taste. Place potatoes cut-side down in an ovenproof dish or roasting pan coated with cooking spraybake for 30 to 40 minutes or until tenderbrush potatoes occasionally during cooking with additional olive oildrizzle with balsamic vinegar just before removing from ovensprinkle with fresh gingerroot and serve hot or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place hash browns in a greased 13x9 baking dish. In a small bowl, combine soup, mayonnaise and relish. Pour over hash browns. Add onion. Sprinkle with cheeses. Bake for 30 minutes. Top with fish sticks. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until baked through. Remove from oven. Let stand for 15 minutes before serving. Serve with your favorite rolls.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add zucchini and summer squash. Cook for 5 minutes. Add bell peppers. Cook for 7 minutes or until squash is tender. Sprinkle garlic powder over zucchini mixture. Cook 1 minute. Sprinkle seasoning over zucchini mixture. Cook 1 minute or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Cut each pickling cucumber in half and then into thirds. Place cucumber pieces in a large nonreactive bowl. Pour 1 cup of vinegar and the sugar into a small pot and boil for 5 minutes. Pour vinegar mixture into the bowl with the cucumber pieces. Add remaining vinegar and bring to a boil. Remove from the burner and pour into the bowl. Add the rest of the seasoning and stir well. Cover and let stand for at least four hours (overnight is better). Strain the pickles and place in a jar. Store in the refrigerator.

Combine milk with 6 pouches pudding mix and 6 cans pie filling. Stir until well blended. Pour into an 11 x 7 x 2-inch glass baking dish. Refrigerate for 4 hours or until set. Crumble brownie into the bottom of the dish. Top with raspberries. Drizzle with whipped topping. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with spoons or tongs. Makes about 12 servings.

Cook tortellini according to package directions. Drain well. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the broccoli florets. Cook for about 6 minutes or until tender-crisp. Drain well. Add the drained tortellini with the cooked broccoli. Stir in the Alfredo sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for about 1 minute. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

In large skillet brown pork and beans in olive oil until beans are slightly browned. Stir in tomato sauce and mustard. Simmer uncovered until beans are tender. Stir in worcestershire sauce and seasonings. Bake in 10-inch square baking dish for 30 minutes in 350f oven or until hot and bubbly. Sprinkle with green onions and ham. Serve hot.

Beat Crisco until fluffy. Beat in brown sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Beat until combined. Beat in vanilla and milk until combined. Sift together flour and baking soda. Add to cookie batter. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees F for 12-14 minutes or until lightly brown around the edges. Makes about 4 dozen. Store in airtight container or freeze.

In a large saucepan, combine water, wine, soy sauce, tabasco sauce, onion powder, garlic powder, black pepper, sugar and non-iodized salt. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Place fillets in saucepan, cover and simmer for 5 minutes on medium heat. Remove fillets from saucepan and place on a baking sheet lined with foil. Bake at 375 f for 5 minutes or until firm. Let cool before slicing.

Beat egg yolks and sugar together until thick and fluffy. Add custard powder and beat again. Stir in milk and beat again until combined and smooth. Add margarine and mix until combined. Stir in condensed milk and stir until combined. Stir in vanilla extract and cinnamon until combined. Pour mixture into a 13 x 9-inch baking pan that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for minutes at 375f until custard is set and top is golden brown.

Put the liver through a mincer with the onion. Add the soft breadcrumbs and work into the mixture with your fingers. Make the mixture into small balls and put the balls into the beaten eggs. Roll them in the flour and then into the breadcrumbs. Put them into a pan of boiling water and boil for about 10 minutes. Drain the liver balls and serve with the cooking liquid.

Add enough water to chicken to cover. Add 1/4 cup macadamia nut oil. Cook until chicken is done. Remove from heat. Combine stock with macadamia nut oil. Add frozen spinach. Cook until thawed. Add coconut milk. Stir well. Add chicken. Cook on medium until thick. Serve.

Butter a baking dish or pan with oyster shells. In a skillet over medium heat, saute celery in butter until tender. Add oysterscook until opne. Mix breadcrumbs with celery seed, salt, and pepper. Add cream to panbring to a boil. Add breadcrumbsstir until blended. Add oysters to pancover. Bake 10-15 minutes. Arrange scallops in the baking dish. Cover with the oyster mixturebake until scallops are done. (about 6 minutes)serve hot.

In a bowl over simmering water whisk eggs to form a soft scrambled egg consistency. Stir in the whisky and remove from heat. Add the chocolate and whisk to blend. In a separate bowl whisk the heavy cream until firm and frothy. Stir a third into the egg mixture and then into the chocolate mixture. Fold in the rest of the heavy cream and beat until stiff. Refrigerate for an hour or so. Fold in the orange zest and the orange juice and refrigerate again. Serve with a spoon.

Mix together the salt, fennel seeds and black pepper. Rub the seasonings onto the meat. Tie the meat with kitchen twine to keep it from opening. Add enough water to cover the meat. Bring to a boil and boil for 5 minutes. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour. Remove meat from water and place on rack in roasting pan. Let cool completely. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Pour the water from the roasting pan into the saucepan and bring to boil. Add sugar and simmer for 10 minutes. Pour the syrup into the roasting pan and place the meat in the oven. Bake for 1 hour. Remove from the oven and let cool. Slice the meat into thin pieces and serve.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook ground beef until no longer pinkdrain. In a large bowl combine beef with plum sauce, carrots, scallions, cabbage and cilantrotoss to coat. In a small bowl combine rice vinegar, canola oil and saltdrizzle over salad, toss to coat.

In a medium mixing bowl combine the oil, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, garlic, and ground pepper until thoroughly blended. Place the venison steak in a plastic bag and pour the marinade over the steak. Seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 1 hour (for a thicker marinade, refrigerate overnight). Remove the steak from the marinade and grill for approximately five minutes per side. (I used a gas grill. ) Serve with a side of fresh corn or steamed broccoli.

Fill medium saucepan half full of water and bring to boil. Add broccoli and cook until tender - about 2-3 minutes. Drain broccoli in colander and place back in pan with water. Cover and set aside to steam for about 5 minutes to cool down a bit. Meanwhile, whisk together olive oil and mustard in a small bowl and set aside. Heat oil and vinegar in a small saucepan over medium high heat. Stir in remaining ingredients and bring to boil. Remove from heat and set aside for about 5 minutes to let flavors combine. Pour sauce over broccoli and serve warm. Makes about 2 cups of sauce - enough to serve over 2-3 cups of cooked broccoli.

In a large saucepan cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Drain off fatremove bacon. Add onion, garlic and 1 tablespoon butter. Cook stirring frequently until softened. Add broth. Bring to a boil. Cook 5 minutes. Add chicken broth, potatoes, chicken and white beans. Bring back to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 10 minutes. Add arugula. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. In a food processor, mix the arrowroot flour, flour and amaranth flour. Add the sea salt and cinnamon. Pulse to incorporate. In a large bowl, mix the vegetable oil with the water. Add the dry mixture to the bowl and combine. Transfer to a 9-inch pie plate or tart pan. Press the dough down to form an even crust. Cool for 10 minutes before filling.
Mash all ingredients except the hot sauce and mix well. Squeeze lime juice over mixture to taste. Add hot sauce to taste.

Heat oil in a large non-stick frying pan over a medium heat and add the garlic and basilfry gently for 2 minutes then add the tomatoes and cook for a further minute or until the tomatoes have softened a little. Pour over the pasta and toss well. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve immediately. If you would like a bit of extra flavour at the end of the meal, remove the garlic from the frying pan and put it back into the pan with the pasta and sauce before serving.

Cut parsnips into thick slices. Heat butter in skillet over medium heat. Add parsnips, cover skillet, and cook until parsnips are tender. Add water, stirring until water boils. Stir in nutmeg and salt and pepper to taste. Cook until liquid is absorbed, then turn off heat. Serve hot, warm or cold.
In food processor, grind chicken breasts. Add sour cream. Mix with crackers. Shape into small rolls. Place in small muffin pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Makes about 24 chicken fingers.

Boil a large pot of water on the stove. Add a large amount of salt to the water. Add pasta to water, cooking time is 7 minutes or less. Drain pasta in a colander. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook ground beef until browned. Add garlic, oregano, basil, salt and red pepper flakes. Cook until garlic is golden. Add tomato sauce. Stir in cooked pasta. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

Cut 2 slices of bread into 1/2-inch pieces. Place in medium mixing bowltoss with 1 tablespoon butter. Set aside. Heat remaining butter in small skillet over medium heat until hot but not brown. Add garliccook 15 seconds or until garlic is fragrant but not browned. Stir in cajun seasoningremove from heat. Add to breadtoss to coat. Pour 1 inch of water into large microwave-safe glass bowladd remaining 1/2 tablespoon butter to water. Microwave on HIGH 30 seconds to 1 minute or until water boils vigorouslystir in Parmesan cheese. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle over croutonstoss to coat. Microwave 30 seconds to 1 minute or until croutons are heated through. Yield: 2 cups croutons.

Cut cabbage into quarters. Place cabbage in stockpot with onion. Cover with vegetable stock. Bring to boil. Cook until tender. In separate saucepan melt 1 tablespoon of butter and saute the onions until translucent. Add rice. Stir occasionally. Add white wine and stir in the onion-butter mixture. Simmer until rice is cooked. Add cabbage, stirring until well blended. Add cheese and stir until it melts. Season with fresh ground black pepper.

Rinse chicken and pat dry. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place chicken on a rack in a shallow roasting pan. Roast at 350 f for 30 minutes. Remove chicken from the pan and set aside. In a medium saucepan melt the butter over medium heat. Stir in onion and cook until onion is soft and translucent. Add the tomato sauce and Worcestershire sauce. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Stir in honey and cook for about 10 minutes or until the mixture is thick. Return the chicken to the pan and pour the honey mixture over the chicken. Sprinkle with paprika and hot pepper sauce. Bake for 15 minutes or until the chicken is browned and cooked through. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Brown ground beef. Add all soup (1 can cream of mushroom soup and 1 can cream of chicken soup) and stir well. Add Doritos. Stir well. Add green onions. Top with mexican cheese. Bake for about 30 minutes or until cheese is melted.

In a large saucepan melt butter over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add rice to onionsstir for about 1 minute. Add stock/water mixturebring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for about 18 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove cover and cook for 4 more minutes or until liquid is absorbed again. Add vermicelli and parmesan cheesecook for about 3 minutes or until vermicelli is tender but still slightly firm. Remove from heatseason with salt, pepper and bay leaf. Serve immediately or cool completely before storing in airtight container in fridge for up to one week or freezer for up to three months.

Place butter in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat. Add onioncook until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in corn kernelscook for 1 minute. Add jalapenocook for 1 minute. Stir in gritscook for 1 minute or until bubbling, stirring constantly. Stir in watercook until thickened and bubbly, stirring constantly, about 10 minutes. Add thyme and saltcook for 1 minute or until thyme is fragrant. Remove from heatstir in pepper.

Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil. Add salt and noodles and cook for 2 minutes or until tender. Drain and return to pan. Melt the butter in a saucepan over a moderate heat. Add the flour and cook gently for 2-3 minutes. Add the milk and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and cook for 5-6 minutes or until thickened. Stir in the egg and spring onion. Season to taste and stir in the feta. Transfer to a large bowl. Stir in the noodles. Form into 12 cakes and place on a lined plate in the fridge for 1 hour. In the meantime make the sauce by melting the butter in a saucepan over a moderate heat. Add the flour and cook gently for 2-3 minutes. Add the milk and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and cook for 5-6 minutes or until thickened. Stir in the egg and spring onion. Season to taste and stir in the feta. Transfer to a large bowl. Stir in the noodles. Form

Rinse chicken breasts and pat dry with paper towels. In a small bowl, mix scallion, garlic, honey, sherry and ginger. In a large bowl, mix soy sauce with scallion mixture. Place chicken breasts in a large resealable plastic bag and pour sauce over chicken breasts. Marinate chicken in refrigerator for at least 2 hours or up to 24 hours. Grill chicken on medium-high heat until cooked through and chicken registers 165 degrees f on an instant-read thermometer. Sprinkle chicken with sesame seeds during last few minutes of cooking, if desired.

Bring 1 1/2 cups of milk to a boil. Stir in 1/3 cup sugar. Add 1 1/2 cups of long grain white rice. Cook for 30 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add 1/2 tsp. Cinnamon. Let stand for 15 minutes. Add 1 tsp. Vanilla. In a separate bowl whisk together 1/4 cup sugar with 3 whole eggs. Add 1/4 cup of rice cooking liquid. Stir well. Stir in 1/2 cup of raisins. Pour rice mixture into rice cooking liquid in pot and cook for 20 minutes. Stir in vanilla and raisins. Serve warm. Makes 6 servings.

Spread bread slices with butter and season with salt and pepper. Lay half of slices in bottom of 9x13 baking dish and layer sliced bacon, sausage and cheddar cheese over bread slices in dish. Combine eggs, milk and worcestershire sauce in bowl and whisk until well blended. Pour over sausage and cheese mixture and layer remaining bread slices over top of egg mixture. Bake until heated through and topping is browned and firm, about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Let sit for 15 minutes before cutting and serving. Serves 12 to 16 as an entree or 18 to 24 as an entree or appetizer.

Cook rice in a large pan according to package instructions. Meanwhile, saute garlic and onions in a large skillet in oil for about three minutes. Add ham, teriyaki sauce and soy sauce. Cook until ham is heated through. Stir in the cooked rice. Add the eggs. Stir until eggs are just cooked. Sprinkle with the minced peas. Serve warm.

In a large pot bring water and potatoes to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until potatoes are tender. Drain. In a large sauce pan add butter. Sauté onion and celery. Add potatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add evaporated milk and cream of celery soup. Bring to a boil. Add cream of mushroom soup. Simmer 5 minutes. Stir in carrots. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
Melt chocolate pieces in top of double boiler over hot water. Remove from heat. Stir in half-and-half. Add sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice and vanilla. Whisk in heavy cream. Serve warm.

Mix zucchini, onion, garlic cloves and seasonings together. Heat olive oil in a skillet until hot. Pour egg mixture into skillet. Cook over medium heat until eggs are set. Remove from heat. Stir in parsley. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Grease two baking sheets. In a food processor fitted with a steel blade, pulse almond flour, cocoa powder, arrowroot powder, 3/4 cup sugar and 1/2 teaspoon sea salt until mixture resembles course sand. Add coffee and pulse to combine. Add egg and vanilla and pulse to combine. Add the remaining 1/4 cup sugar and pulse to combine. Add baking soda and pulse to combine. Add almond milk and pulse to combine. Add dark chocolate and pulse to combine. Place 2 tablespoons of dough on one baking sheet and space evenly 1/2-inch apart. Bake until cookies are set and tops are cracked on top and bottom sides, about 15 minutes. Cool 5 minutes on cookie sheets then transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Repeat with remaining dough.
Layer the cheese on a platter and surround with the other toppings. Whisk together the vinegar and oil and drizzle over the cheese. Season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.

Clean scallops. Drain scallops well on a paper towel to remove excess moisture. Lightly coat scallops with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic powder and seafood seasoning. Squeeze lemon on scallops and sprinkle with lemon juice. Dip scallops in a mixture of butter and parmesan cheese. Place scallops on a baking sheet and broil on low until tender. Serve hot with mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables or your favorite side dishes.

Cut broccoli into florets and blanch for 2 minutes or until just tender and bright green. Drain and set aside. Peel and cut yellow sweet pepper into 1-inch pieces. Place in a 13x9-inch baking pan and add 1/2 cup water. Cover with foil and bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until tender. Cool to room temperature. Melt 3 Tbs. butter over medium heat and add 3 Tbs. chopped fresh gingerroot and 1/2 tsp. orange zest and saute until gingerroot is tender and golden brown. Stir in 1/2 cup water and simmer until reduced to 2 Tbs. Place cooled broccoli on bottom of pan and spread yellow sweet pepper over broccoli. Pour ginger sauce over all and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Let stand overnight to allow flavors to blend. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Serve warm.

Combine vegetables and water in large saucepan and bring to boil on high heat. Stir frequently for 2 minutesreduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tenderdrain and set aside. Meanwhile, combine crabmeat and teriyaki marinadestir to coat crabmeat well. Cook noodles according to package directions and drainadd crabmeat mixture and vegetables to noodlestoss to coat noodles with teriyaki sauce and vegetable mixtureserve hot.

In a food processor combine graham cracker crumbs and 1 Tablespoon of the cinnamon. Pulse until the crumbs are finely ground and then add the 1/3 cup melted butter and pulse until the dough just comes together. On a piece of wax paper or parchment paper roll the dough into a 1-inch-thick log and place the log on top of the prepared pie plate. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until the dough is firm enough to handle. Preheat oven to 350f. Remove the dough from the refrigerator and use the wax paper or parchment paper to help remove the dough from the plate and transfer it to the prepared baking sheet. Roll the dough into a 10-inch circle on the baking sheet and place it on the bottom of the baking dish. Bake until the edges are set and the top of the dough is golden brown, 18 to 22 minutes. Cool the dough on the baking sheet on a wire rack for 5 minutes before removing the dough from the baking

Heat large skillet on medium-high heat. Add oil. Add shallot. Cook until translucent. Add dry vermouth and reduce heat to medium-low. Cook until liquid reduces by half. Add baby shrimp to skillet and cook for two minutes. Add lemon juice and cook for one more minute. Remove from heat. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Boil water for pasta according to package directions until al dente. Cook pasta until al dente. Drain pasta and save 2 tbs of water for sauce. Add olive oil and butter into skillet and cook for 1 minute. Add cooked pasta to skillet along with remaining water. Cook for another minute until pasta is coated with sauce. Garnish with grape tomatoes and fresh chives.

Melt butter and add flour to make a roux. Add milk and whisk. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add cheese and ham and bring to a boil. Add asparagus and simmer for 5 minutes. Add breadcrumbs and cook for 2 minutes.

Put frozen vegetables in the bottom of the crock pot. Add beef stew meat. Stir tomato juice with water together and pour over all the other ingredients. Season with salt and pepper. Cover the crock pot with a lid and cook for six hours on low heat setting. Stir occasionally throughout the cooking time. Turn crock pot onto high heat for last 30 minutes to thicken the soup. Garnish with parmesan cheese if desired.

Prepare a charcoal fire for grilling. Brush bread with a little olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt and cracked pepper. Grill until lightly browned on both sides. Rub the garlic cloves on the bread under the grill until the bread is toasted and the garlic is tender. In a small saucepan heat the butter with the thyme. Drizzle on the garlic bread when it is removed from the grill.

Wash potatoes and cut into even pieces. Place in a large pot and cover with water and salt. Bring potatoes to a boil then drain. Place potatoes in a large casserole dish with butter. Place in over at 350 degrees for one hour or until tender. Remove from oven and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Chop up bacon into little bits and saute in a frying pan over medium heat until brown. Add potatoes back in casserole dish and spread sour cream over top of potatoes then sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 35-45 minutes or until cheese is melted and potatoes are done. Top with chopped green onions.

Clean apples and cut in half. Place in baking dish. Mix together brown sugar and worcestershire sauce and add to apples. Place pork chops in baking dish over apples. In a small bowl whisk water and lemon juice together. Brush pork chops and apples with glaze. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes. Serve pork chops and apples with a side of potatoes and carrots.

Mix sliced mushrooms with spaghetti sauce & Italian seasoninglet simmer. Place ham, provolone cheese, salami & mozzarella cheese on one side of doughspoon mushroom sauce on top of cheese mixtureroll up & seal edges of doughbrush with melted buttersprinkle with Italian seasoning. Bake at 375f for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into 1/2 inch slices & serve with spaghetti sauce.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the bacon until it is just cooked through (about 5 minutes). Remove bacon from the pan with a slotted spoon, reserving the bacon grease in the pan. Cut the bacon into 1/2-inch pieces. Remove 1/4 cup of the bacon grease from the pan with a slotted spoon. Set aside. Add 1/4 cup of the bacon grease to the pan with the remaining 1 tablespoon of the butter. Add the garlic to the pan, cook over medium heat until the garlic is fragrant (about 30 seconds). Add the water to the pan with the garlicbring to a boil. Add the pumpkin to the pan. Cover with the lidcook in the oven for 45 minutes or until the pumpkin is very tender. Transfer the pumpkin to a large bowllet cool for 10 minutes. Add 1/4 cup of the bacon grease

Prepare bread dough according to package directions. Spread each piece with softened butter and brown sugar mixture. Sprinkle with cinnamon and roll up tightly. Wrap in plastic wrap and freeze until firm, about 2 hours. Slice into pieces and serve with whipping cream if desired.

Cut the sandwiches in half and arrange half of the cookies in the bottom of a 9x13 pan. In a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese and butter. Beat until smooth. Add powdered sugar and beat until smooth. Add pudding mix and milk. Beat until smooth. Spoon mixture onto half the sandwiches. Top with the remaining sandwiches. Spoon or pipe cream cheese mixture onto top of sandwiches. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Top with cool whip.

Mix all the ingredients together with an electric hand mixer or beater and pour into a greased 9 x 13 baking dish or a muffin pan. Bake at 325 degrees F for about 20-22 minutes or until golden brown in color. Serve with maple syrup or jam. Makes 9 servings.

Peel and wash potatoes and cut into large chunks. Put potatoes and enough water to cover into a large pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and cook until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork, about 15 minutes. Drain and cool slightly before peeling and dicing the potatoes. Transfer the potatoes to a large bowl and add the cream cheese, milk, chives and salt and black pepper to taste. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher or an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Serve warm or chilled.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a 13x9x2-inch baking dish and set aside. Combine yellow cake mix with butter and beat with electric mixer at low speed until crumbs are moistened. Press half of the cake mixture into the bottom of the prepared dish and set aside. In large bowl with electric mixer at medium speed beat cream cheese and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and crushed pineapple and continue beating until well blended. Fold in the remaining cake mixture until well blendedspread evenly over the crumb mixture in the baking dish and top with pecans. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes or until center is almost set. Cool completely in the pan on wire rackremove from pan and cut into 24 squares. Melt butter and stir in brown sugardrizzle over the top of the cheesecake squares and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Refrigerate until serving time.

Wash carrots well and trim off ends. Use a vegetable peeler or knife to remove carrot skin. Slice carrots into thin rounds (about 1/4-inch thick). Place carrots on a rimmed baking sheet and drizzle with nonstick cooking spray and sprinkle with kosher salt. Bake in preheated 425 degree F oven until carrots begin to brown (about 20 minutes). Toss carrots with cooked cumin seeds once or twice while carrots are cooking. Carrots are done when the carrots begin to brown in places and become tender when pierced with a fork. Drizzle with additional nonstick cooking spray if needed. Serve as a side dish. Can be used as a dip for pita chips with a dollop of sour cream or yogurt on topor a condiment for wraps or sandwichesor a garnish for soupsor a side dish for rice or beans.

Melt butter and mix with flour and salt. Add milk and mix well. Pour into pie plates and place in 350 degree F. oven for 25 minutes. In the mean time mash potatoes and add to mixture. Add the eggs and bacon and mix well. Top with cheese and sprinkle with parsley. Bake for 25 minutes longer.

Grease a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan with shortening. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1 1/4 cups of cornmeal, 1 1/2 cups flour, 1 teaspoon salt, 3/4 teaspoon baking soda and the sugar. In a small bowl, beat the shortening until creamy with a mixer or electric beaters. Add the egg and beat until creamy againadd the buttermilk and beat until blended. Add the dry ingredients to the shortening mixture alternately with the milk mixturebeating after each addition until thoroughly blended. Pour the batter into the greased loaf pan and bake at 425 degrees F for 40 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted into the center comes out clean. Serve warm or cold.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Dice steak into 1/2-inch cubes and brown in skillet until done. Drain and keep warm. Stir soup and water into oil remaining in skillet, add soup mix and bring to a boil on medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened and creamy. Stir in cooked noodles and heat through. Stir in sour cream and serve over steak and noodles.

Preheat the oven to 350f. In medium skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add pork and onions. Cook until onions soften. Drain grease. Add tomatoes. Stir occasionally. Cook until almost tender. Drain. Add potatoes. Cover pan. Bake for about 25 minutes. Turn pork over half way through baking. Serve with steamed broccoli.
Combine all ingredients in a food processor. Process until smooth. Chill until ready to serve.

In medium bowl toss together corn, green pepper, green onions, brown sugar, jalapeno pepper, tarragon vinegar, salt, fresh dill and olive oil. Refrigerate until ready to serve with chicken or pork kebabs.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Coat chicken wings with cooking spray. Sprinkle with brown sugar, garlic powder, ginger powder, soy sauce and a splash of bourbon. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and toss with ketchup. Return to oven for 10 more minutes. Serve warm with blue cheese dressing.

Place a large shallow ovenproof dish (13-by-9-inch or larger) on the bottom shelf of a 350 degree F oven. Put a few drops of oil into the dish. Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper. Place fillets skin side up on a rack or wire cooling rack set over the dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast until salmon just flakes with a fork, about 10 minutes. Cover loosely with foil. Let salmon sit 2 minutes before serving.

Combine cream cheese with sugar and vanilla until smooth. Add eggs and beat on low speed until mixture is thoroughly blended and fluffy. Pour into a greased and floured 8 inch square pan and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

In a large bowl whisk together flour, sugar, honey and walnuts. In a separate bowl whisk together the egg, water, oil and vanilla ice cream. Add wet mixture to dry mixture. Mix with a large wooden spoon until batter is smooth. Add a little extra water if the batter is too thick. Pour a small amount of batter onto a hot frying pan coated with oil. Cook until the pancake has formed bubbles all over the surface. Flip pancake onto other side. Cook until golden brown. Transfer pancake onto a serving platter and repeat with remaining batter. Top pancakes with honey and walnuts.
Stir French dressing into pineapple. Roll bacon around pineapple. Stick with toothpick. Refrigerate. Ready in 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Spread barbecue sauce over breadcrumbs in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Dip chicken into eggs then cover in breadcrumbs and place in prepared baking dish. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until chicken is done. Serve hot.

Bake at 350f for 45-50 minutes. Add mashed potatoes to cream cheese mixture with eggs. Add flour. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in French-fried onions. Pour mixture in greased 1-1/2 quart casserole dish. Bake for 30 minutes at 350f or until center is firm. Serve hot.

Cut the top of the baguette and hollow out the inside. Put 1 or 2 garlic cloves into the hollowed out bread. Place a slice of light mozzarella cheese on each side of the bread (you can use one large piece or several smaller pieces). Place 2 tomato halves (you can use one large tomato or several smaller tomatoes) on each slice of cheese. Add a generous amount of mayonnaise to each tomato half (you can use less or more to taste). Sprinkle dried oregano and basil on each tomato half and sprinkle a little more pepper on each tomato half. Serve immediately with a fresh garden salad or soup.

Break biscuits into bite size pieces. Heat butter and chocolate together. Stir until melted. Cool. Add molasses and glace cherries. Stir well. Add crushed biscuits and nuts. Stir until mixture is moist. Divide mixture into two greased cake tins. Press into tins with hands. Bake at 180 degrees for about one hour. When cool cut into cakes.

Combine sugar and cornstarch in a small bowl. Mix in the water and rum. Place mixture in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened. Reduce heat to low. Remove from heat and stir in the half-and-half. Reheat to serving temperature. Stir in the vanilla. Keep warm.

In a large bowl combine graham cracker crumbs and icing sugar. In a small pan over low heat melt butter. Remove from heat and stir in sweetened condensed milk and crushed pineapple. Pour pineapple mixture over graham cracker mixture. Stir in flaked coconut and white chocolate chips. Press into a 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Refrigerate overnight. Cut into squares before serving.

In a blender add the pineapple and oranges juice and blend for a few seconds until smooth. Add the raspberry juice and blend again for a few seconds until smooth. Add the grapefruit juice and lime juice and blend once more until smooth. Add the icing sugar and blend again until smooth. Add the ice and blend once more until smooth and serve.

Blend all ingredients to make a dressing. Chop halloumi into squares and coat in dressing to make a marinade. Place halloumi squares in a roasting tin and cook in a hot oven at gas mark 6 (400f) until crisp. Serve straight away.

Trim fat from chicken. Combine oil and seasoning salt with herb seasoning to taste. Dip each thigh into oil mixture and coat evenly on all sides. Place seasoned thighs on wire rack set over rimmed baking pan. Drizzle with pepper jelly and garlic cloves (sliced thin). Roast 40 minutes at 325 degrees until juices run clear when thickest part is pierced with fork. Sprinkle with fresh parsley just before serving.

Mix shortening and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and beat well. Add vanilla and beat. Add the flour and baking soda. Stir well. Add white chocolate chips and fold into batter. Form into balls and place onto greased cookie sheet. Place chips around cookie balls. Bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes. Makes 2 dozen.

In a saucepan heat the butter and add the garlic clove to melt the butter. In another bowl mix together the flour and broth and pour it into the butter and garlic. Bring to boil over medium heat and reduce to low heat. Stir to thicken and then add the half-and-half. Remove the garlic and add the baby spinach. Cover and simmer until the spinach is tender, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and season with nutmeg and salt to taste. Stir and serve.

Peel potatoes and cut in half lengthwise. Slice each potato half into 1/4-inch thick slices and place in large pot filled with cold water. Bring water to a boil and cook 6 minutes or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a forkdrain and cool slightly. Meanwhile, in a large skillet melt 3 Tbsp. Butter. Saute onion and garlic for 3 minutes or until tender. Stir in cream of chicken soup and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook and stir 2 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir in sour cream and half-and-half and heat through. Stir in potatoes and cook 1 minute or until heated through. Sprinkle potatoes with cheese and corn flakes and cook over medium heat 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is melted and potatoes are heated through and topping is golden brown. Season to taste with salt and ground black pepper. Serve warm with hot cooked rice.

Melt butter in a large kettle over medium heat. Add carrots and leek and cook until softened. Stir in rutabagas and cook until tender. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 20 to 30 minutes. Stir in bratwursts. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
Boil green beans in salted water until tender. Drain and cool under cold running water. In a large bowl combine butter and lemon juice. Stir in beans and parsley. Pour into serving bowl.

In a large bowl, beat eggs until fluffy and frothy with electric mixer. Add butter and beat until fluffy again. Add corn muffin mix and 1/2 cup cheeseblend well with electric mixer. Fold in broccoli and scallions. Spoon batter into muffin cups and sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake for 25 minutes at 375 degrees or until a toothpick inserted near center of muffins comes out clean. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch round cake pan with nonstick cooking spray. Place sugar, butter, egg, milk, flour, baking powder, salt and blueberries into a medium bowl and mix until combined. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 40 to 45 minutes or until a cake tester inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 5 to 10 minutes before removing from pan to a cooling rack to cool completely. In a medium saucepan with a tight-fitting lid, bring brown sugar, blueberries, sugar and cinnamon to a boil over medium heat, stirring frequently. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until blueberries pop and release their juices, approximately 8 to 12 minutes. Set aside to cool completely before serving.
Saut onion, carrot and garlic in butter in a large saucepan. Add flageolets and cover. Simmer for 30 minutes. Add thyme, savory, and dandelion greens. Simmer another 20 minutes. Serve.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium-low heat. Add celerysaute 2 to 3 minutes. Add sirloin. Cook and stir until no longer pink. Drain. Combine meat with au jus mix. Divide mixture into 8 portions. Form each portion into a patty. Put into a 9x13 pan. Top each patty with a slice of bread. Place in a 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Serve on rolls.

Prepare pie crusts according to package directions. Combine egg whites and salt in medium bowl. Beat with an electric mixer on high speed for 3 minutes. Gradually add cream of tartar. Add vanilla and beat 1 minute. Combine granulated sugar and brown sugar. Beat until blended. Add pecans and soda crackers. Spread in bottom and up sides of crust. Top with second crust. Seal edges. Cut several slits in top of crust. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Cool completely on wire rack before serving.

Place the meat in your crock pot. Sprinkle with the soup mix and garlic salt. Pour the water over the meat and season with Italian dressing. Cook 7 to 8 hours on high or 8 to 10 hours on low. If the meat is not falling apart when you lift it with tongs, cook an additional hour. When meat is done, remove from crock pot and slice. Serve with buns and fixings. Makes about 12 sandwiches.

Stir the dry cake mix and add to butter and eggsstir well. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets (if you prefer you may grease the sheets). Bake at 375 degrees for 12-14 minutes (may be more or less depending on the heat of the oven). Cool on wire racks. Frost with the chocolate frosting made from the other package of chocolate cake mix. Yield: about 2 dozen cookies.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Line 18 muffin cups with paper liners. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine butter, shortening, sugar, almond extract and vanilla until blended well. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. In a separate bowl sift together flour, baking powder and saltadd to the butter mixture alternately with half-and-half cream, beginning and ending with flour mixture. Divide batter among the muffin cups. Bake for 20 to 22 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in the pan for 5 minutesremove from pan to cooling rack. Frost as desired.

Mix bisquick with sugar. Cut biscuit mix into 32 equal pieces. Place 1 Tablespoon of cheese in center of each piece. Roll each piece up tightly. Place cheese side down in 9x13 baking dish. Place bacon slices between each roll. In small bowl mix remaining cheese and milk together. Pour over bacon and rolls. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Combine soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey and ginger in a small bowl. Whisk to blend. Remove the ginger from the mixture. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the scallions to the hot skillet. Cook the scallions until tender and lightly browned, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the salmon fillet to the hot skillet. Cook 2 to 3 minutes per side. Sprinkle sesame seeds over the salmon. Pour the soy sauce mixture over the salmon. Cook until the salmon is cooked through and the liquid is reduced to a glaze. Serve immediately.

In medium saucepan bring 4 cups of milk and 2 cups of water to boil. Stir in grits and salt. Bring back to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until grits are tender and creamy. Stir in remaining 2 cups milk and butter. Add cheese and stir until melted. Stir in green onions. Adjust seasonings as necessary.

Mix together all the ingredients in a large bowl and form into golf ball sized balls. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Fry the balls until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side. Serve warm with crackers or toast.

Heat butter in a large sauce pan. Add potato chips. Saute over low heat until crisp. Combine all ingredients except potato chips. Place mixture in a greased casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees until hot. Bake potato chips at 400 degrees for 10 minutes.

Cover the bottom of a large pot with a few slices of french bread. Top with sliced onion and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Pour in beef bouillon and enough water to cover. Add a few teaspoons of worcestershire sauce. Bring the soup to a boil on medium-high heat. Turn down to a simmer. Cook for about an hour until the onions are tender. To serve, cut french bread into pieces and layer in the bottom of a soup bowl. Ladle the soup over the bread. Top with a sprinkling of parmesan cheese. Enjoy.

Melt butter and brown sugar together in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir often until sugar dissolvescook for 2 minutes longer. Stir in almonds. Spoon mixture over graham crackers onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Allow to cool completely before breaking into pieces. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

Cream butter with sugar. Add walnuts, dates, and coconut. Stir well. In a separate bowl, beat egg until frothy. Add it to the other ingredients stirring until well blended. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet or waxed paper. Bake for 10 minutes at 375 degrees F. Transfer cookies to wire rack. Allow to cool completely before removing from baking sheet or paper. Yield 2 dozen 2-inch cookies.

Cut the bread into slices or cubes. Melt the butter and brush the bread with it. Place the bread cubes or slices into a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Whisk together the egg yolks, sugar, milk, half-and-half and vanilla until well blended. Pour over bread cubes or slices. Bake for 20 minutes or until set but not brown. Serve warm with powdered sugar if desired.

Brown meat in a large skillet and drain off any excess fat and add the onion and cook until onion is tender and translucent. Add mustard and cook for an additional minute and add the tomato juice and season with salt and black pepper and bring the mixture up to a boil and then reduce the heat and cover and cook for about 25 minutes or until the beef is tender. Stir in the beans and heat through and then add the chili powder and stir and cook for a minute longer and serve with the cornbread and salad.

In a large bowl with an electric mixer beat cream cheese until smooth. Add milk, mustard, pecans and parsley. Continue beating until blended. Stir in cheeses. Mix well. Refrigerate for at least an hour before serving.
In a large bowl, stir together the pudding mix and boiling water. Add jello and stir until dissolved. Fold in the oranges and cool whip. Serve in glasses or mugs.

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees c. Beat the eggs with the sugar in a large bowl until the mixture is pale in colour. Fold in the pistachios, then the lemon zest and juice. Whisk the baking powder into the dry ingredients. Stir the dry mixture into the wet until everything is well combined. Pour the mixture into a greased cake tin. Bake for 25 minutes.

Season fillet with lemon juice and zest. Add oil. Salt and pepper. Brush with oil. Lay out fillets on foil. Add sprigs of rosemary. Broil for 7 minutes. Remove foil. Place under broiler until golden brown. Serve.

Slice the onion thinly and fry it on low heat with a little bit of oil until golden brown. Cut the kohlrabi into small slices. Peel the onion from the kohlrabi. Place the onion slices on the bottom of the pan with the fried onion, add salt and fresh ground black pepper and some flour. Pour the milk into the pan with the onion and kohlrabi, and let it simmer for about 10 minutes until the kohlrabi is tender and the sauce thickens. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper and fresh parsley.

Combine sauce and flour in a shallow dish. Place pork in a shallow dish. Dip pork into the flour mixture, shaking off the excess. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Dip pork in flour mixture, shaking off the excess. Coat the pork with the oil in the skillet. Cook pork for 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until done to your liking. Serve over cooked rice.
