Sprinkle orange zest over bottom of jar. Add granulated sugar, cognac, glycerine. Cover. Refrigerate. Stir every day for 2 weeks. Store in airtight container. Use as a glaze for ham or fowl. Use as a topping for a fruit dessert or add to a simple syrup for making sangria.

In a saucepan melt butter and stir in sour cream and add the flour to make a smooth paste. Remove from heat and gradually stir in the scotch until well blended. Add the hot milk and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add the parsley and smoked salmon and stir to blend. Drain the pasta and toss with the sauce and serve immediately.

Combine milk and honey. Stir in egg and salt. Pour into large bowl. Add yeast and flour. Stir until the flour is moistened. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead dough for 10 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Place in a greased 8 x 4 x 2 1/2-inch loaf pan. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour. Bake at 400f for 45 minutes or until done. Cool in pan 5 minutes before turning out. Makes 1 loaf.

In a medium bowl, combine cornmeal and seasonings. Stir in water to make a batter. In another bowl, beat egg until foamy. Dip tomatoes in egg and coat them with the cornmeal mixture. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat cooking spray. Fry tomatoes until crisp and golden brown, turning halfway through cooking. Drain and serve hot. Refrigerate leftovers.
Combine loquats, liqueur, water and cinnamon stick. Simmer gently for 15 minutes. Cook slowly for 1 hour. Strain mixture into a clean pot. Add sugar. Cook slowly until mixture thickens. Serve warm.

Combine beef brisket, onions and beans in a large stockpot and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heatreduce heat and simmer until beef is tender and beans are soft, about 2 hours. Drain beef mixture in a colander and discard liquid. Return beef mixture to stockpot and add barley. Stir in salt and pepper and simmer for 2 hours. In a medium bowl, combine flour and next 4 ingredientswhisk in 1/2 cup water to make a paste. Stir paste into beef mixture and simmer over medium-low heat for 30 minutes. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup water and simmer for 2 hours. Stir in ginger and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in flour mixture and simmer for 10 minutes. Transfer to a shallow 8-inch baking pan and cover loosely with foil. Refrigerate overnight. Bring cholent to a simmer over medium-low heat and cook until beef is tender and barley is tender and tender, about 1 hour.

Drain the shallots and garlic and discard the stems. Heat the oil and saute the shallots and garlic until fragrant. Add the chicken and stir fry. Add the black bean sauce and stir. Cook until the chicken is cooked through. Serve over steamed rice.

Combine all ingredients except pork. Place pork in slow cooker. Pour sauce over pork. Cook on low for 4-5 hours. Serve with rice. Can be made with boneless pork chops or boneless skinless chicken breast.

Cream butter and brown sugar together. Crush crackers into small pieces and add to sugar mixture. Mix in chocolate chips and pecans. Form into small balls and place onto greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes at 375 degrees.

Unroll crescent rolls. Spread bottom half of each roll with sour cream. Sprinkle with onion powder. Place a piece of bacon in each. Fold up bottom of rolls. Place in ungreased 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake 20 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease and flour cupcake cups or use paper liners. In a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer beat the eggs with the sugar on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 4 minutes. Add the flour and beat until just combined. In a small bowl combine the lemon zest and lemon juice. Add this mixture slowly and gently to the egg mixture and beat until combined. In a small bowl combine the baking powder and flour. Add this mixture to the egg mixture and beat on low speed until combined. Add the butter and beat until combined. Add the milk and beat until combined. Transfer the batter into the prepared cups. Bake for about 20 minutes until a cake tester comes out clean. Let the cupcakes cool for about 2 minutes before removing from the pan.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Prick each potato several times with a forkrub with 2 Tablespoons of olive oilwrap potatoes tightly with aluminum foil and place in a 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) preheated oven for 1 hourremove potatoes from oven and unwrapdrizzle with remaining 2 Tablespoons of olive oilrub potatoes with fresh rosemary and place back into 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) preheated oven for 20 minutes more or until potatoes are tenderremove potatoes from oven and cut potatoes into quartersplace potatoes and other ingredients into an 8x11x2-inch casserole dishtoss together and pour into casserole dishdrizzle with more olive oil and season with salt and black pepperroast for 25 minutes or until potato slices are golden brown and vegetables are tenderserve warm or at room temperature.
Blend lime juice and fine sugar together. Pour into a glass and add bitters. Fill glass with ice. Fill glass with club soda. Stir and garnish with a wedge of lime. Serves 1.

Remove pork from refrigerator to allow to come to room temperature. Mix prunes and chipotle chile in small bowl. Set aside. Heat cooking oil in large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork and cook until browned. Add prunes and tomatoes. Cook 2 minutes more or until pork is cooked through. Remove from heat. Serve immediately with salsa.

Beat eggs, sugar and salt until frothy. Slowly add milk, stirring constantly. Add vanilla and nutmeg. Heat milk mixture until it boils. Remove from heat and cool. Chill thoroughly. Serve with whipped cream.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine tortellini, cream cheese spread, milk and 1/2 teaspoon black pepperbring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to low and cook 10 minutes or until tortellini are tender. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine spinach and tomatoes. Drain tortellinitransfer to a serving bowl. Toss with spinach mixture and cheese. Serve warm.

Combine all the ingredients in a medium bowl stirring until well mixed. Cook the beef strips in a pan over medium-high heat until browned then set aside to cool. Preheat the broiler. Thread the beef strips onto skewers and cook for about 5 minutes until cooked through and slightly charred. Serve warm with the peanut sauce for dipping. Enjoy!
Brown meat and drain. Add remaining ingredients and simmer until desired thickness. Add salt to taste.

Remove wing tips and discard. Cut wings in half. Place chicken wings in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine honey, hoisin sauce, warm water, salt, black pepper and ginger. Pour over chicken wings. Cover and refrigerate 3 hours. Preheat oven 400 degrees. Bake 30 minutes or until crispy and brown.

Peel carrots and cut into pieces. Put in a saucepan with water and cook for 15 minutes. Add brown sugar and cornstarch and mix well. Add vinegar and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add butter and mix well. Serve.

Wash walnut halves and dry with paper towels. Place walnuts in a medium-sized bowl. Add granulated sugar, orange zest, ground cinnamon, ground ginger, ground cloves and nutmeg. Pour water over sugar mixture. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Cover with plastic wrap and let stand at room temperature for 24 hours to allow flavors to meld together. Place nuts in 350 degree oven for 15 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes until nuts are slightly puffed and golden brown. Remove from oven and cool to room temperature before serving.

Boil potato until cooked through. Cool and then cut into thick slices. Remove the outer florets from cauliflower. Place the florets on a cookie sheet and drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Drizzle with white wine vinegar. Season with salt and white pepper. Bake in a preheated 350F/180C for 10 to 15 minutes.

Peel and cut sweet potatoes into 1/2 inch thick sticks. Place them in a roasting pan. Sprinkle cinnamon and brown sugar over them. Drizzle melted butter over them. Cook for about 25 minutes. Stir every 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Melt the butter in a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Add the celery, onion, potatoes, chicken broth, milk and paprikabring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmercook for 30 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Transfer about one-third of the soup to a blenderadd about one-third of the potatoes that were not blended, blend until smooth, then return to potrepeat. Add the remaining potatoes that were not blended to the soup and simmer for 5 minutes longerseason with salt. Ladle soup into bowlssprinkle with cheesegarnish with paprika if desiredserve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 13x9 inch baking dish, spread out corn tortilla chips. Top with refried beans. Top beans with reduced-fat monterey jack cheese. Top cheese with salsa. Bake 8-10 minutes.

Prepare breadcrumbs by mixing together fine bread crumbs and peanuts. Dip each fillet into beaten eggs and coat well with the breadcrumb mixture. Heat olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and cook fish fillets for 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Serve.

Prepare clam sauce. Saute garlic, lemon peel and red pepper flakes in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add clam sauce. Stir until clam sauce is heated through. Add butter to pan. Stir until butter melts. Add clams. Cook 3 minutes. Stir in oregano. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook beans according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan drippings. Stir in green pepper, onion and 1 tablespoon of the brown sugar blend. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until tender. Add cooked beans to pepper mixture. Stir in tomato sauce. Coverbake 30 minutes. Stir in beans. Top with bacon pieces and green onions. Makes 6 servings.

Sift the cornmeal together with the flour into a large bowl. Make a well in the center of the cornmeal mixture. Add the egg, milk, onion, salt, black pepper and cayenne pepper. Mix together with your hands until all the ingredients are well blended. Drop by the spoonful onto a lightly greased griddle or skillet. Cook until golden brown on both sides. Serve with butter or apple butter while still warm.
In a large bowl combine chicken, cream cheese, pepper, seasoning salt and garlic powder. Mix well. Serve with walnuts on top.

Roll out crescent roll dough and cut into squares. Press salami slices into dough squares and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and seasoning. Bake on a greased cookie sheet at 350 degrees fahrenheit for about 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Bring large pot of water to boil. Add soba noodles to boiling water. Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain noodles and set aside. In medium bowl combine soy sauce, lemon juice, wasabi powder and soba noodles. Mix well. Stir spinach into noodle mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with baby shrimp, green onions, pickled ginger.

Put the olive oil, vinegar and bay leaves in a food processor and blend until smooth. Pour the basil vinaigrette into a large bowl and add the tomatoes and garlic. Toss to coat the tomatoes with the basil vinaigrette and let rest at room temperature for 3 hours. Preheat your grill to medium and thread the tomatoes on 12-inch metal skewers. Grill the tomatoes on each side until they are softened and browned on the edges, turning once or twice with tongs to avoid scorching, about 3 minutes per side.
Spread cream cheese and miracle whip on 2 pieces of bread. Put cheese slices between the cream cheese and miracle whip and sandwich together.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Mix together cheeses and lemon juice. Place in a glass bowl and bake for 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and fold in celery and scallions. Let sit for 5 minutes to cool before adding pecans. Serve with crackers or on sandwiches.
Mix dry ingredients. Add milk and beat well. Add sparkling water. Bake for 20 minutes.

In a small pot add the sugar and 1/2 cup of water and simmer until the sugar has dissolved and then add the ginger and lime juices and heat for a further 5 minutes or until the sugar has dissolved and then remove from the heat and pour over the melons and allow to cool and then thread the cilantro onto the skewers and serve.

In a small bowl mix together miso, soy sauce and rice vinegar. Whisk in sesame oil. Add ginger puree to bowl and stir until smooth. Heat a large saute pan over medium heat. Add butter and swirl to coat the pan. Add tilapia to pan skin-side down, sprinkle with salt, and saute until the fish is nearly done (3 to 4 minutes). Turn the fish over to finish cooking (2 to 3 minutes). Remove the pan from the heat and pour the miso mixture over the fish. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and garnish with a wedge of lime, if desired.
Mix cream cheese, olives stuffed green olives, olive juice, mustard and whip together until combined. Stuff cooked eggs with mixture.

In a large bowl combine pancake mix and cornmeal. Add milk and stir until mixture is a thick batter. In a large frying pan add enough oil to coat the bottom of the pan. Heat over medium heat. When pan is hot, pour batter into pan in small amounts. Fry for 1 to 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Serve with butter and jam.
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Mix well. Use as desired.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Grease a baking dish with butter. Combine corn, cream cheese, butter, chili, salt and pepper. Spoon mixture in prepared dish. Bake for 25 minutes or until top is brown. Serve warm.

In a large bowl, combine the cake mix and margarine. Stir in the nuts and coconut. Press mixture into a lightly greased 15 x 10 x 1 inch pan. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes. Remove pan from the oven and immediately spread the cream cheese over the top. Beat the eggs and stir in the confectioner's sugar and vanilla. Spread over the cream cheese. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Cool and cut into bars.

Cream butter and sugar in large mixing bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and water. Add dry ingredients and beat until just combined. Shape dough into 24 balls. Roll in pecans and place on greased baking sheets. Flatten with fork. Bake for 13 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Toss pepitas together in bowladd egg white, chili powder, cinnamon, cumin, cayenne and toss together to coat evenly. Spread pepitas on baking sheet in an even layer and bake until crisp, about 40 minutes. Cool completely before serving or storing. Store in an air-tight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week or freezer for up to 3 months.

Cream together butter and sugar. Add vanilla and beat until light and fluffy. Stir in flour and powdered sugar. Stir in peanuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls on wax paper. Bake at 375 for 10 min. or until light brown.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees. Sieve self raising flour into a large mixing bowl. Cut butter into cubes. Rub butter into flour until it resembles breadcrumbs. Add salt and cayenne. Make a well in the centre of the mixture. Add egg. Pour in whole milk. Mix dough to form a soft ball. Tip dough onto floured surface. Knead for 5 minutes. Flour work surface and roll out dough to about 2.5cm thick. Cut out rounds. Place on a baking sheet. Prick each scone with a fork. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Whip up 3 tablespoons of heavy cream with 1 teaspoon of mustard powder until stiff. Spoon onto each scone. Sprinkle with mull of kintyre cheese. Bake for 5 minutes. Serve with tea.

In large bowl with electric mixer beat almond paste and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat until light and fluffy. Beat in almond extract and flour. Stir in baking powder and baking soda. Fold in preserves. Pour batter into greased muffin pan and fill each muffin cup half full. Bake 15 minutes. Let stand in pan for about five minutes before removing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f and grease an eight-cup loaf pan with vegetable oil or butter. Combine buttermilk and grape-nuts cereal. In another bowl whisk together egg, flour, sugar, baking powder and baking soda. Add the wet mixture to dry mixture and stir until combined. Pour batter into greased loaf pan and bake for approximately 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean. Let cool for about 10 minutes before removing from pan. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Brown bacon in a skillet. When bacon is browned add 2 tablespoons of the bacon drippings to the pan. Add onions. Cook the onions until tender. Drain the bacon. Add the bacon drippings and the bacon to the pan with the onions. Add the juice of the tomato. Add the black pepper to taste. Add the long grain rice. Simmer the rice for approximately 45 minutes. Add salt to taste. Add the Tabasco sauce. Stir.

In a double boiler melt chocolate chips with condensed milk over low heat. Stir constantly until thick. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and salt. Pour into a greased 10x15 baking pan. Chill until firm. Cut into small bars. Sprinkle with chopped nuts. Store in refrigerator.

Trim fat and slice corned beef into thin strips. Place cabbage and potatoes in a large pan. Add corned beef and margarine and stir to coat corned beef with margarine. Add enough cold water to cover the potatoes and cabbage and bring to boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer until the potatoes are tender and corned beef is cooked through, about 30 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent corned beef from sticking to the bottom of the pan. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately with plenty of horseradish sauce.

Wash and dry the mushrooms. Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Once hot add mushrooms and garlic to skillet and sauté for 5 minutes or until mushrooms are tender and cooked. Sprinkle with lemon juice and pepper and salt to taste. Serve immediately.
Combine the first four ingredients in a pitcher and stir well. Pour into champagne glasses and garnish with peach slices.

Cut pork into 1-inch pieces. Add barbecue sauce. Marinate at least 2 hours. Preheat grill to medium heat. Cook pork until done (about 30 minutes). Remove from grill and set aside. Preheat oven to 400f. Brush grill grate clean of any debris. Place pizza dough on grate. Top dough with pork, onions and pickles. Add tomatoes in rows over meat. Sprinkle mozzarella evenly over tomatoes. Grill for 8 minutes on each side or until cheese is melted and dough is browned. Slice into 4 servings. Serve immediately.

In a large mixing bowl beat butter until creamy. Add icing sugar gradually and mix to make a dough. Take a small lump of dough (about the size of a walnut), and roll it into a ball between your hands. Place the ball of dough on a plate lined with wax paper or a silicone mat. Flatten with a fork or the back of a spoon to make a disc. Dip the disc into the water to help the cookie stick to the plate. Roll the ball between your hands to form a ball the same size as the first one. Roll the ball on the plate to make a ball the same size as the first one. Roll the ball between your hands to make a ball the same size as the first one. Roll the ball on the plate to make a ball the same size as the first one. Roll the ball between your hands to make a ball the same size as the first one. Roll the ball on the plate to make a ball the same size as the first one. Roll the ball between your hands to make a ball the same size as the first one. Roll the ball on the plate to make a ball the same size as the first one. Roll the ball between

Bake french fries as directed on package. In medium bowl, combine sour cream and taco seasoning. In another medium bowl, mix ranch dressing and taco seasoning. Remove french fries from oven and top with monterey jack cheese and bacon. Bake for 4-5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with dip of choice.

In a bowl mix yogurt with curry powder, cayenne pepper, lemon juice, garlic and ginger. Add salt to taste. Coat chicken breasts with oil, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place chicken breasts in a single layer on grill rack. Grill over medium-hot heat for 10-12 minutes or till cooked through. Grill breasts to desired doneness turning only once. Meanwhile in a small bowl mix yogurt mixture with cilantro leaves. Serve chicken over yogurt sauce with rice or naan bread.

Peel the apples. Core them. Slice them into thick rounds. In a bowl combine the sugar with the lemon zest. Dip the apple slices into the lemon sugar. Place them onto a lightly oiled baking sheet. Bake in a 425f oven for 15 minutes or until the apples are tender. Set the apple slices aside to cool. Meanwhile, make the cream by combining the sugar with the white wine. Set aside. Cut the sandwich bread into small cubes. Toast in the oven. Melt the butter. In a small saucepan combine the butter with the jam. Warm the jam gently over low heat. Cream the butter with the jam. Stir in the white wine. Set the jam aside. Prepare the apples for assembly. Lay a slice of bread onto the plate. Place a slice of the apple onto the bread. Spoon a tablespoonful of cream over the apple. Place a small dollop of the jam onto the cream. Repeat the steps for the remaining apples. Serve immediately.

Cook broccoli stems in boiling water until tender. Drain and set aside. Cook chicken in water to cover until tender. Drain and set aside. In a medium bowl, combine soup and milk. Add drained broccoli stems and chicken. Sprinkle with light cheddar cheese. Cover with breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes. Serve with garlic bread.
Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate. Refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours. Top with crushed oreo cookies and chocolate wafer pieces. Makes 8 servings.

Mix together all the dry ingredients in large bowl. In another bowl, mix wet ingredients together. Add wet mixture to dry mixture. Mix until thoroughly combined. Spoon into greased muffin cups. Bake in 375f oven for 18 to 20 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean when inserted into a muffin.

To make dough: Sift flour into a mixing bowl. Make a well in the center. Stir in milk, oil, baking powder and salt. Stir until combined. Turn onto a lightly floured surfaceknead until smooth. Divide into 2 equal pieces. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. To make pizzas: Grease cookie sheet. Divide dough into four equal pieces. On a lightly floured surface, roll each piece into a 12 x 10 inch rectangle. Place half of the pepperoni slices, half of the ham slices, half of the onions and half of the cheese onto each rectangle. Fold dough over filling. Starting from long side of dough, roll up dough with filling. Place onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake for about 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Mix all ingredients together. Rub all over roast and bake at 325 for 1 hour.
Combine eggnog with the bourbon, rum, brandy, vanilla extract and nutmeg in a punch bowl. Fill glasses with ice cubes and top with eggnog mixture. Garnish with ice cream. Serve immediately.

Slice French bread into 1/2-inch thick slices. Brush both sides of each slice with olive oil. Place on a cookie sheet. Brush onion halves with olive oil on both sides. Place on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle with salt. Grill until onions are tender. Cut onion in half. Slice peppers in half lengthwise. Cut peppers into 1/2-inch wide strips. Dip sliced onions in olive oil. Place on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle with salt. Grill until tender. Place pepper strips on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle with salt. Grill until tender. Slice feta into 1/4-inch thick slices. Arrange onions, peppers and feta on plates. Serve hot.

Cut angel food cake in half. Put bottom half on plate. Spread half of strawberry puree on top of angel food. Spread half of cream cheese on top of puree. Put top half of angel food on top of cream cheese. Repeat. Cover with whipped topping. Drizzle with vanilla extract. Serve.

Peel and boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain. Cut potatoes in half. Scoop out the insides. Add the potatoes in a food processor and process until smooth. Mix the chopped potatoes with the water and process until smooth. Add the prepared horseradish and garlic. Process until well combined. Add the seasonings and process until well combined. Transfer the mixture into a serving bowl. Spoon the potato mixture into a serving dish. Garnish with parsley. Serve warm.
Mix all the dry ingredients together in large bowl. Mix in eggs and milk and stir well. Pour onto griddle and cook pancakes to golden brown on both sides. Serve warm with real maple syrup.

Pour boiling water over peas and soak for 1 hour. Drain well. Melt 1/3 cup butter in a large skillet. Stir in 1/4 cup flour to make a roux. Cook over moderate heat 2 minutes. Whisk in 1 cup hot milk. Bring to a boil. Add peas. Cook until they begin to thicken. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup flour. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup milk. Cook 1 minute. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup flour. Cook 1 minute. Add 1 egg. Cook 1 minute. Add remaining eggs. Cook 3 minutes. Stir in 1/4 cup grated parmesan. Season with salt. Stir in 1 cup shredded Cheddar. Stir in 1/2 cup bread crumbs. Stir in ham. Bake in a 375f oven about 45 minutes. Sprinkle remaining bread crumbs on top. Bake until golden.

Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 20 to 25 minutes or until thickened and reduced to about 4 cups. Stir occasionally. When ready to use, mix with 1 cup cold water.

Prepare crescent rolls according to package directions. Place chicken in a 9x13 baking dish. Pour soup over chicken. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Roll up each crescent roll around a piece of chicken. Place in the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with a side salad.

Remove the stems from the fennel bulbs and cut the bulb in half lengthwise. Trim the fennel stalks and discard. Slice the bulb into thin strips. Remove the green tops from the fennel leaves and discard. Slice the leaves thinly. Put the fennel and fennel leaves in a bowl. Add the shallots to the bowl. Melt the butter in a large heavy pot over moderate heat. Add the fennel mixture to the pot. Add enough chicken broth to the pot to just cover the fennel mixture. Simmer until the fennel is tender. Discard the fennel stalks. Puree the soup in batches in a blender until smooth. Return the pureed soup to the pot. Add enough chicken broth to the pot to just cover the pureed soup. Bring the soup to a simmer. Add the egg yolks, one at a time, stirring constantly. Cook until the mixture begins to thicken and the yolks begin to set. Season with salt and white pepper. Ladle the soup into bowls. Sprinkle with the f

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. In a medium saucepan of boiling water, cook pasta until al dente according to package directionsreserve 1 cup pasta water, then drain pasta and return to saucepan. Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large skillet on medium-low heat and saute shallots until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Add garlic and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add reserved pasta water to skillet and stir until mixture is creamy, about 1 minute. Add remaining 3 tablespoons of oil and bring mixture to a gentle simmerstir in drained pasta. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer pasta to a lightly greased 13 by 9-inch baking dish, sprinkle with cheese and top with parsley. Bake until bubbling hot all around, about 10 minutes.

Mix 1/2 cup of reduced-fat peanut butter with 1/2 cup of honey in a small saucepan. Cook over low heat until peanut butter and honey are smooth. Remove from heat. Butter one side of each piece of bread. Cut the bread in half to make two sandwiches. Place one half of each sandwich on a plate. Top each half of each sandwich with a banana slice. Place an egg on top of banana. Spoon 1/2 of peanut butter mixture on top of each egg. Sprinkle ground cinnamon on top of peanut butter mixture. Top each sandwich with remaining bread half. Melt butter on a large skillet over medium heat. Cook sandwiches in skillet until butter is melted on both sides of sandwiches. Serve immediately.

Put breadcrumbs into a large mixing bowl. Add the sausage meat and break it up. Add the eggs and mix all the ingredients together. Take a teaspoon of the mixture and shape into a ball. Place the balls on a plate and keep the rest covered in the fridge. In a pan over a medium heat add the chutney and a little water. Stir until the chutney starts to thicken. Pour the chutney into a small jug and set aside. Cook the sausage meatballs until they are golden brown. Place them on a plate and add a little of the chutney. Serve with a side of rice or noodles.

Prepare a mixture of rice flour and water in a bowl until it is smooth and slightly thick. Pour a few drops of lemon juice and stir. Heat coconut milk in a pan and cook until it is reduced by half. Add palm sugar and stir until dissolved. Pour coconut mixture into rice flour mixture and mix until smooth and no lumps are seen. Pour batter into a shallow pan and set aside for 20 to 30 minutes to let it thicken. Drop batter into heated cooking oil and fry until lightly browned. Drain on paper towel and serve hot.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heatadd scallions and cook until softened, about 1 minute. Stir in barleycook until golden brown and fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add pine nuts and cook for about one minute more. Add brothbring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to simmercook until barley is tender (about 40 minutes). Season with salt and pepperstir in parsley. Serve with roasted garlic mashed potatoes.

Cut a circle out of one of the watermelon slices to create a lid. Place a dollop of frozen berries on the inside of a melon baller. Insert into watermelon. Add a dollop of sugar and 1 tsp of lemon juice. Fill the baller with watermelon and repeat steps until all of the watermelon is used up. Place a small dab of sugar on top of each baller. Freeze until solid. Makes about 12 pops.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Melt butter in large saucepan. Add flour, salt and sugar. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly for 2 minutes. Add onion and cook until tender. Gradually stir in sour cream. Cook for 2 minutes more. Stir in the beans and pour into a greased 13x9 baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Combine corn flakes and butter. Sprinkle over warm bean mixture. Top with Swiss cheese. Bake for 5 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve hot.

In a small bowl mix all the dressing ingredients together and set aside. Wash salad leaves and cut into thin strips. Mix all the salad ingredients together except the salad leaves. Taste test the dressing and add more seasoning if needed. Arrange the salad leaves around the edge of the serving platter. Place the salad mix in the center of the platter. Drizzle the dressing over the salad leaves and salad mix and serve immediately. Serves six to eight people.

Mix butter and brown sugar together. Add corn syrup and Cheerios. Stir until combined. Stir in peanuts. Roll dough into 12 balls. Roll balls in powdered sugar. Place balls on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.
Sprinkle chicken tenders with ranch dressing. Dip in butter, garlic salt and pepper. Fry in hot oil. Serve with potato chips.

In a large bowl, combine hot sauce, garlic salt, chicken and bisquick mix. In another bowl, combine onion salt with black pepper. Dip chicken into hot sauce mixture, then into onion salt mixture. Fry chicken in hot oil until brown. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Serve hot with dipping sauce.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta to the boiling water. Cook according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, heat a large pan over medium heat. Add bacon. Cook until crispy. Add onion. Cook until translucent. Add frozen peas. Cook until thawed. Add garbanzo beans. Cook until heated through. Add fresh mint. Cook until wilted. Remove from heat. Drain pasta. Add pasta to pan. Toss until heated through. Season with olive oil, parmesan cheese, and salt and pepper. Serve.

Remove shells from hard-boiled eggs, and slice in half lengthwise. Add a spoonful of blue cheese spread into the egg halves, then top with a spoonful of hot sauce. Sprinkle with parsley, a dash of celery salt, salt and pepper.

Mix milk and flour together in large saucepan. Cook over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes. Stir frequently. Remove from heat. Add 3/4 cup of the melted butter and stir well. Pour into greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Stir in Velveeta cheese. Add ham and the prepared horseradish and prepared mustard. Add egg noodles. Stir. Cover with foil and bake in 350 degree oven for 20-30 minutes. Uncover and bake for additional 30 minutes.
Skewer the meat cubes. Pour the olive oil on a pan. Put the garlic cloves in the pan and grill the meat skewers over a medium heat until cooked and tender.

Brown beef in a large skillet. Season with red pepper flakes and salt and pepper. Drain fat. Add milk and 1 cup of boiling water to skillet. Stir in au gratin potato mixture. Mix in shredded cheese. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 45 minutes or until bubbly hot. Serve with sliced tomato.

In saucepan combine brown sugar, cornstarch and salt. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir in milk until mixture comes to boil. Remove from heat. In small bowl beat egg yolks until thickened. Beat in butter and vanilla. Stir egg mixture into cornstarch mixture. Pour into 9 inch unbaked pie shell. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees and bake for 40 minutes more or until set. Let cool before serving. Serve with whipped cream if desired.

Boil 4 cups of water in a pot over medium heat. Add peas and beansreturn to a boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer until tender about 2 minutes. Drain welltransfer to a bowltoss with olive oilseason with salt and pepperand add fresh mint. Serve warm or at room temperature with fresh mint leaves sprinkled on top.

Melt chocolate chips with peanut butter in a saucepan over low heat until smooth. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper or foil coated cookie sheets. Stir in peanuts and rice cereal after every 30 drops or so to coat in chocolate. Refrigerate until set (about 1 hour). Makes 125 drops.

Melt the chocolate baking squares in a double boiler over hot water (or in the microwave in 30 second intervals) until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in the shortening until smooth. Transfer the mixture to a quart-size plastic storage bag. Cut off a small piece of plastic bag tip and pipe small amounts of the melted chocolate onto the ice cream sandwiches. Place the sandwiches on wax paper to set up until firm (about 1 hour). Meanwhile dip the sandwiches in the candy sprinkles. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator until serving.

Bring chicken broth to boil in sauce pan. Add frozen peas and simmer for about 2 minutes. Stir in honey mustard and stir until smooth. Continue to simmer for about 30 seconds. Add corn starch and stir until thickened. Remove from heat and serve with sour cream or yogurt.

In large saucepan cook chicken breasts in water over medium heat for 15 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat and cool chicken breasts for 5 minutes. Remove bones from chicken breasts. Shred chicken using two forks. In large bowl combine shredded chicken with onion, cilantro, almonds and dressings. Place one whole wheat tortilla on work surface. Spread with 1/3 cup of chicken mixture. Roll up tightly to enclose filling. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling. Serve wrapped in plastic wrap with additional dressing on the side. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Coarsely shred spinach and kidney beans by hand or with food processor. Mix spinach, beans and salsa with cilantro, scallions and salt and pepper to taste. Preheat oven broiler on high. Place tortillas on a baking sheet or on a tortilla press. Place on a cookie sheet with the cut side facing down and press down with a rolling pin until the tortillas are flat. Spoon a thin layer of beans/spinach mixture on each tortilla and roll up. Place seam side down on cookie sheet with baking sheet underneath. Broil until brown on both sides. Top with shredded monterey jack pepper cheese. Broil until cheese is bubbly. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Beat cream and sugar together until stiff peaks form. Fold in sour cream and vanilla extract. Spoon mixture into 6 dessert bowls. Top with cherry pie filling and chopped nuts. Freeze until firm, about 2 hours. Serve cold.

1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Remove the skin and bones from the chicken and cut it into four even pieces. Place the chicken in a casserole dish and set aside.2. Melt the butter in a heavy saucepan. Add the flour and stir for a few seconds until it forms a paste. Add the stock and stir until it begins to thicken. Add the cream and stir until it thickens further. Remove from the heat and add the Drambuie. Stir until it begins to thicken and then add the chicken stock and cream mixture. Return the pan to the heat and stir until it thickens further. Pour the sauce over the chicken and season with salt and pepper. Cover with foil and cook for 25-40 minutes until the chicken is cooked through. Turn the pieces half way through the cooking time. Serve with mashed potatoes and green vegetables.

In a large bowl, combine the chocolate cake mix, egg, butter, peanut butter and cream cheese until well blended. Pour into a prepared 9 inch square pan. Bake for about 40 minutes at 350 degrees until done. Let the cake cool completely before frosting. To make the frosting, combine all the ingredients in a large bowl until well blended. Pour over the cooled cake. Let the frosting set for a few minutes before cutting the cake into squares.

Mix egg and milk with peaches in a large bowlstir in remaining ingredients. Spoon into lightly greased hot skillets (heat skillets coated with cooking spray over medium heat). Cook pancakes turning once. Serve immediately with warm maple syrup.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit (205 degrees celsius). Place the wings on a baking sheet or roasting pan and bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until the skin is browned and crispy. Remove from the oven and let them cool for about 10 minutes before proceeding with the recipe. In a bowl whisk together the ketchup, brown sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil and garlic to create the sauce. Add the wings to the sauce and toss to coat. Serve immediately with extra sauce for dipping if desired.

Drain tofu. Place in a pan to fry until it becomes brown. Add olive oil to the pan and heat. Add garlic clove to oil and fry until lightly browned. Add tofu to pan. Stir tofu until it is lightly brown on both sides. Serve immediately. Season to taste.
Cream together margarine and marshmallows. Add toffee pieces and rice krispies. Drop by teaspoons onto waxed paper. Let stand overnight to set.

In a bowl, mix pomegranate seeds and juice, banana, bell pepper and sweet onion. In a separate bowl mix pomegranate molasses with vinegar and olive oil. Pour over salad and stir well. Sprinkle with salt.

Preheat oven to 180c/350f degrees Fahrenheit (Gas mark 4). Mix sugar-free lemon cookies and margarine together until crumbly. Press onto the bottom and up the sides of a greased and floured 9" square pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool completely before filling. Beat cream cheese and margarine together in large bowl until smooth. Add sugar and beat until smooth and creamy. Add sour cream and beat until smooth and creamy again. Beat in Splenda and lemon juice until cream cheese mixture is light and fluffy. Whisk together eggs and egg substitute and stir into cream cheese mixture. Pour into prepared pan. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. To serve, cut into squares and garnish with lemon peel and vanilla.

In large bowl, stir together all ingredients. Add chicken thighs. Covercook 4 hours or until chicken is tender. Transfer chicken to serving platter. Shred meat. In small bowl, stir together 2 Tbs. of the reserved sauce with 2 Tbs. of the ketchup. Serve with chicken in hoagie rolls.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add bacon and cook until crispy. Remove bacon from pan and drain on paper towels. When bacon is completely cooled, slice into half-inch pieces. Place 2 pieces on each half of a baguette. Add mayonnaise to a small bowl. Stir in the cheese until melted. Spoon over bacon on bread. Top with remaining bacon pieces. Serve.

Cut the corn from the cob and place in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine the shallot, thyme and olive oil. Stir in the butter until well blended. Pour over corn in bowl. Toss gently to coat all kernels. Serve immediately on the cob. For a great summer side dish, serve corn on the cob with shallot thyme butter along with grilled shrimp skewers or grilled pork chops.

In a bowl, mix together prawns, garlic, white pepper and salt. Toss to combine. Transfer to a large baking sheet lined with a nonstick paper and drizzle with canola oil. Roast at 450f for 6-8 minutes until prawns are crisp-tender and garlic is lightly browned.

Heat oil in a medium-sized pot. Add rice and a little salt. Cook over medium heat for about five minutes. Add broth to pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cover. Cook for about 30 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9 by 5 inch loaf pan with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, mix together flour, sugar and beer. Add the cheese and stir until the mixture comes together. Fold in green onions. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake until the bread is golden brown, about 45 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing the bread from the pan. Serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 8.

Season roast with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened about 4 minutes. Add the carrots and celery and cook for 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the wine and bring to a boil. Cook until the liquid reduces to 1/2 cup. Add the roast, beef bouillon and enough water to cover. Simmer the roast for 2 hours. Remove the roast from the pot. Remove the roast and place in a shallow pan. Pour the sauce into a bowl. Serve the roast with the sauce.

Mix berries and sugar in a medium saucepan over medium heat until berries are softened and juices are released, about 15 minutes. Add oleo and cinnamon and cook until berries release their juices. Remove from heat and set aside until ready to use. Mix berry mixture into flour and add milk gradually until batter is the consistency of pancake batter. Pour batter into an 8-inch square baking dish and place in preheated oven for 45 minutes at 400F or until golden brown and crusty on top. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375f. Put flour on paper towel to dry out. Season pork chops with salt and pepper on both sides. Dip both sides of chops in flour and place on large baking sheet. Heat 1 tbsp of oil in heavy-bottomed skillet over medium heat. Cook chops until golden brown on each side and about 8 minutes total. Remove chops from skillet to plate. Add the rest of the oil to skillet and add the carrots and potatoes to the pan. Cook until the carrots are tender-crisp. Add tomato soup to skillet and bring to boil. Add chops back to skillet with carrots and potatoes. Bring to boil. Transfer skillet to oven and bake 15 minutes. Transfer chops to platter and cover with foil to keep warm. Cook the carrots and potatoes until tender, about 15 minutes longer. Add the oregano to the skillet and season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer carrots and potatoes to the platter with chops. Let sit for 10

Place buckwheat groats in a pot and add water. Bring to a boil and simmer on low heat for about an hour and a half. Add onion and salt and cook for another 10-15 minutes. Add parmesan cheese and butter and stir until cheese is melted and everything is well combined. Pour into a greased casserole dish and place in the fridge for about an hour or overnight for a firmer consistency or serve right away and serve warm with some salsa or other sauce.

Bring water to boil in 1-cup saucepan. Add chai tea and oat bran. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes or until oat bran is coated. Remove from heat and add cinnamon and nutmeg. Stir well.

Place boneless skinless chicken breasts on a non-stick cookie sheet. Drizzle soy sauce over the chicken. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hrs. Preheat oven to 400f. Bake the chicken for about 30 minutes or until the meat is done. Remove from the oven. Combine the brown sugar and white vinegar. Drizzle over the chicken breasts. Sprinkle with garlic powder and black pepper. Return to the oven for about 5 minutes or until the glaze is bubbling. Serve hot.

Place chicken pieces into crock pot. Mix soy sauce and peanut butter together in a small bowl and pour over the top of the chicken. Add ginger root and orange rind to the crock pot. Cover and cook on low setting for 8 hours. Before serving add green onions and pour over cooked rice.

In a heavy saucepan over medium heat combine all the dry ingredients and cook for one minute, stirring constantly. Add the milk and bring to a boilcontinue cooking and stirring until thickened slightly, about three minutes. Stir in the chocolate and vanillaremove from heat. Add the butter and stir until melted. Pour into a greased baking pan and spread into an even layer. Refrigerate until firm, about one hourcut into bars or squares and serve. Makes 2 cups.

Mix all dry ingredients together. Add nuts. Mix mashed sweet potatoes with brown sugar. Mix dry ingredients into mashed potatoes. Pour mixture into buttered baking dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Add brown sugar and butter mixture right before removing from the oven.
Cut potatoes into wedges. Toss wedges with oil, mustard, tarragon, paprika and red pepper flakes. Spread wedges on a foil lined sheet pan. Roast until tender and golden brown. Serve hot.

Peel & slice potatoes into 1/2 inch slices. Place in a large bowl. Squeeze lemon juice over potatoes & add dill & 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Toss well & allow to marinate for 1/2 hour. Place potatoes in a large nonstick skillet. Cook until crispy & brown. Drain well. Melt butter in the same skillet. Add potatoes & cook for 5 minutes. Add heavy cream & stir until combined. Serve with lemon wedges.

Soak the mung dal for about 4 hours in enough water to cover by 1 inch. Grind the dal to a paste. Add green chilies, fenugreek leaves, gram flour, asafoetida powder, bicarbonate of soda, salt and sugar. Stir to blend. Add the oil. Mix again. Cook in a waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions. Serve hot. Serves 4.

Place chicken pieces skin side up into 9x13 baking dish. Season each piece with salt and pepper. Drizzle chicken with about 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Sprinkle lemon juice over chicken pieces. Bake at 350 for about 35 minutes until tender. Pour remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil over the chicken, add fresh minced garlic to the pan drizzling it evenly over the chicken pieces. Bake another 5 minutes or until garlic is golden brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle chicken pieces evenly over with fresh chopped fresh rosemary. Serve chicken with any remaining sauce from the dish on the side or sprinkle the sauce over the chicken pieces before serving. Enjoy!

Cut cucumber into 1/4 inch thick slices. Cut tomato into wedges. Cut sun-dried tomato into small pieces. Cut artichoke heart into small pieces. Cut red onion into small pieces. Cut olives into small pieces. Place all salad vegetables into large bowl. Toss all salad vegetables with olive oil, salt & pepper, dried oregano & freshly ground black pepper. Garnish with fresh basil leaves. Serve over Greek salad greens or whole wheat tortilla chips with your favorite balsamic vinaigrette dressing.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Sautee bell pepper and red onion in oil until tender-crisp, about 6 minutes. Add mushrooms and continue to cook until tender-crisp, about 8 minutes more. Add zucchini and continue cooking until tender-crisp, about 6 minutes more. Add the wine and chicken stock cube and cook until the liquid has been absorbed by the vegetables. Add the heavy cream and simmer until heated through. Serve over rice or pasta of your choice.

In the rice cooker add 4 cups of water and the cornmeal. Close and set for 2 minutes on the rice setting. Carefully remove the lid and stir the cornmeal with a wooden spoon until it is thick and creamy. Place the cornmeal back into the rice cooker and add the cheese and herbs. Cover and set for 4 minutes on the rice setting. Carefully remove the lid and stir the cornmeal with the wooden spoon. If the cornmeal is not thick enough, return the cornmeal and herbs back into the rice cooker for another minute or two. Serve the polenta hot with your choice of grated cheese or sliced tomatoes and herbs.

Cook pasta in lightly salted water according to package directions. Drain and return pasta to pot. Stir in artichoke hearts, red peppers, garlic and onion. Add olive oil and cook over medium heat for 1 minute. Add tomato sauce and cook until hot. Stir in basil and parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place pineapple in blender or food processor with honey and corn flour and pulse to combine. Pour into a medium-sized mixing bowl and mix in coconut cream. Pour into an unbaked pie shell and refrigerate until set. Serve cold with whipped cream.

In a large pot over medium heat, brown the beef and drain. In the same pot, add water, seasoning mix and spices. Cook uncovered for 20 to 30 minutes, stirring occasionally with a spoon to prevent scorching.

Saute onions in oil until soft. Add remaining ingredients except for chicken. Cook 8 hours or until desired consistency. Add cooked chicken breasts. Cook an additional hour. Transfer to serving bowl and serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 375f. Wash cauliflower and cut into florets. Cook in salted boiling water until tender. Drain. Mash with a potato masher until there are no large pieces. Place cauliflower in a greased 2-quart casserole. In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and seasonings. Pour over cauliflower. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with Parmesan and parsley. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve with toast.

Combine salt and spices in a 2 quart saucepan. Stir to blend. Add vinegar and sugar. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat stirring frequently. Place cucumbers and onions into prepared crockery container. Pour hot liquid over vegetables. Cover. Refrigerate 24 hours. Serve cold. Store in refrigerator. Microwave until heated through 15-20 seconds.

Melt the butter and sauté the mushrooms and shallot until tender and lightly browned. Add ham and cook until heated through and mushrooms are softened and onion is translucent. Add white wine and simmer for 1 minute then add thyme and season to taste. Cool then blend into a fine paste and store refrigerated until ready to use.

Preheat oven to 350F degrees. Grease a glass pie plate with margarine. In another bowl combine eggs with vinegar. Add sugar and vanilla. Mix well. Add raisins. Sprinkle with salt. Pour mixture into prepared pie plate. Bake at 350F degrees for about 15-20 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack. Makes 1 pie. Serve with whipped cream if desired.

Brown elbow macaroni in butter. Drain. Combine cream of chicken soup, milk, mustard, hot sauce and gouda cheese. Stir macaroni into cheese mixture. Pour mixture into a greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with buttered crumbs. Bake at 375 degrees for 35 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve with additional grated gouda. Cheese is creamy, not grainy. Serve with crackers.

Add marshmallow creme to a blender with a cup of milk. Blend until smooth. Add chocolate syrup and more milk to desired thickness. Pour into a large glass, add ice. Top with graham cracker squares and mini marshmallows.

Wash and dry the greens. Place in a salad bowl. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add the turkey. Let stand until warm. Add the orange zest and juice and the tarragon. Drain. Add olive oil and vinegar. Toss gently. Serve on a bed of greens.

Cut squash in half and remove seeds. Brush squash with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast 35 to 45 minutes or until squash is tender. Remove from oven and place squash on platter. Add honey to the squash and roast until liquid thickens. Add pecans and raisins. Roast an additional 5 to 7 minutes. Serve with melted butter.

Brown side bacon in a large skillet. Add onions and paprika. Cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until onions are tender and translucent. Add steaks and brown on both sides. Remove and set aside in a warm place. Add tomatoes with their juices and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened, about 25 minutes. Stir in potatoes and caraway seeds. Cook until potatoes are tender, about 25 minutes more. Return steaks and onions and brown lightly over medium heat. Stir in sour cream and serve at once.

Melt vanilla candy coating in a large heavy pan over low heatstirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in marshmallowsstirring until melted. Stir in peanuts. Pour into a 9-inch square pan. Refrigerate until set. Melt white candy coating in a large heavy pan over low heatstirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Dip half of each candy cluster into the white candy coating. Arrange in a row on wax paper. Melt the dark candy coating in a large heavy pan over low heatstirring until smooth. Remove from heat. Dip the other half of each candy cluster into the dark candy coating. Arrange in a row on wax paper. Refrigerate until set. Store in airtight container. Makes 24.

Dice chicken into bite size pieces. Cut up jalapenos in half and remove seeds. Spread cream cheese onto chicken. Mix soup mix with water and pour over chicken. Dip jalapenos into cream cheese and roll in breadcrumbs. Fry in cooking spray. Put on serving dish and garnish.

Dice the roast into 2-inch cubes. Combine the satay sauce and coconut milk. Add the roast to the slow cooker. Cook on high for 3 hours. Add the baby carrots and cook for an additional 30 minutes. Sprinkle the roast with the peanuts. Serve on top of the cooked basmati rice.

Cream butter and brown sugar together in mixer bowl until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and beat well. Add flour and stir until dough just comes together. Roll dough into small balls, about 1 inch in diameter, and place them on ungreased cookie sheet about 2 inches apart. Place cookies in freezer for 10 minutes before dipping them in chocolate. Remove from cookie sheet and place them in the freezer for 10 to 15 minutes to harden the chocolate coating. Remove them from the freezer and place the frozen cookies on waxed paper to allow the chocolate to melt. If they are too cold they will crack as they melt. Roll cookies in chocolate until completely coated. Place on waxed paper again to set up and harden before serving.

Heat oil to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Whisk together eggs, sugar, cornflakes, and cinnamon until smooth. Carefully place ice cream into the egg mixture to coat each side evenly. Roll each scoop of ice cream into a ball and drop into hot oil. Fry until golden brown, turning occasionally with long-handled metal spoon. Drain on paper towels then toss with honey. Serve with whipped cream and powdered sugar to taste.

Stir together peanut butter and corn flakes until well blended. Add in butterscotch chips and pecans and mix well. Line a cookie sheet with wax paper and press cookies out onto cookie sheet. Let sit in fridge for at least an hour before serving.
Cook the hamburger and drain well. Stir together the tomato mixture and the chili powder and pour over the meat. Cook for 2-3 minutes to heat through and serve between rolls.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Melt butter in a large skillet. Add garlic clove. Stir in seasoning salt to taste. Add chicken breasts to pan. Cook over medium-low heat for 30 minutes or until tender. Add bacon mushrooms to pan. Cook until bacon is crisp. Stir in heavy cream. Cook until sauce is thickened. Transfer chicken breasts to a platter. Serve with sauce.

Cream the cheese with the milk in a mixer until smooth. Sift the sugar and salt into a bowl. Add the milk mixture to the dry ingredients in the bowl. Beat with a hand mixer on low speed for about 2 minutes until smooth and thickened. Pour into a 4 cup loaf pan or other 2 cup container. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Add the strawberries and stir to combine. Freeze for about 4 hours or overnight in your ice cream maker.

In small bowl combine 1/2 cup boiling water with gelatin. Stir until dissolved. Set aside for 5 minutes. In large bowl combine condensed milk and butter. Stir until well combined. Add gelatin mixture and stir until dissolved. Stir in 1/2 cup boiling water and pour over biscuit crumbs. Refrigerate 2 hours. When set, cut into bars. Store in refrigerator.

Cut the raisin bread into 1/2-inch slices. Mix in the sugar, corn syrup, butter, and vanilla in a large bowl until all of the bread is well-coated. Lay on a large platter and refrigerate for several hours, or overnight. Before baking, whisk eggs in a medium bowl until well combined. Add milk, brown sugar, and vanilla and stir to combine. Spray an 8-by-11-inch baking dish with non-stick spray or coat it with butter. Arrange half of the slices of raisin bread in the pan, cut side down. Pour in half of the egg mixture. Place pan in refrigerator overnight. Bake for 55 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with warm syrup.

Add 2 cups of water to a pot and bring to a boil. Add 2 cups of vital wheat gluten and 1/2 teaspoon of salt and stir until dissolved. Add 1 teaspoon of nutritional yeast and bring to a boil. Add 1 teaspoon of onion powder and 1/8 teaspoon of sage and thyme and bring to a boil. Once boiling, lower heat and cook until the mixture becomes sticky. Remove from heat and let the seitan sit for about 30 minutes. Once it has cooled down, you can use a fork to scrape out the seitan from the container. Shape the seitan into a piece of "chicken" and season it to your liking. You can then cook the seitan in a pan by heating some oil and searing the seitan for 5 minutes. The seitan can also be cooked in the oven for about 35 minutes at 375 degrees F.

In a 4-5 quart slow cooker, combine pork ribs, onion, apple butter, brown sugar and liquid smoke. Cover and cook on low-heat setting for 6-8 hours or until ribs are tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve with barbecue sauce.

In a shallow dish combine flour, salt and pepper. Dip fish in seasoned flour, then coat with butter. Place in a baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes or until done. Meanwhile, in a saucepan melt butter and add capers and juice and zest of lemon. Stir constantly and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook for about 2 minutes or until thickened slightly. Remove from heat and stir in chives. Pour sauce over fish and serve immediately. Serves 4.

Spread one pie crust with picante sauce and cheese. Add sausage and onion to center of pie crust. Beat eggs with milk and pour into center of pie crust and fold sides of pie crust over the egg mixture to seal. Bake at 400 degrees for 25 minutes or until egg is set and crust is golden brown.

In a large skillet, combine pecans and margarine and heat over low heat for several minutes stirring occasionally. Remove pecans from heat and stir in brown sugar. Stir in chocolate chips and pour into an ungreased 13 x 9 inch pan. Allow to cool completely then cut into squares.

In a large pot bring the water to a boil. Add the orzo and cook according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together the green tea bags, olive oil, scallion and raisins. Transfer to a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Stir in the orzo and cook over medium heat for 1-2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Remove the tea bags and serve.

Preheat oven to 350. Beat margarine and sugars together until fluffy. Add eggs and beat well. Add vanilla. Sift together flour and baking powder. Add to the creamed mixture. Stir in pecans. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes. Cool before cutting into brownies.

Mix together garlic, paprika, and parmesan cheese. Place sea scallops in a bowl with a lid. Pour garlic mixture over scallops. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Cook scallops for 1 to 2 minutes per side. Garnish with fresh tarragon.
Combine cranberry juice and soft drink. Add sugar cubes and stir to dissolve. Stir in limes. Chill. Just before serving, pour into glasses, then garnish with lime slices. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line an 8 by 8 pan with foil. Cut the chocolate chip cookie dough into small pieces and place in a bowl. Add the cream cheese and beat until creamy. Add the sugar and the egg and continue to beat. Add the vanilla and coffee crystals and beat well. Spoon the mixture into the prepared pan and then spread the miniature chocolate chips over the top. Bake for 25 to 35 minutes or until the edges are set. Cool completely. Remove from the pan.

Season steaks with salt and pepper on both sides. Sprinkle garlic powder over steaks and rosemary on both sides. Cook in preheated oven at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes, or until done to your liking. Serve with potato wedges, if desired.

Preheat the oven to 200 C (Gas mark 6). Melt half the butter with the garlic and salt and pepper and place the asparagus tips into an ovenproof dish with the garlic butter and toss gently to coat the asparagus. Bake for 10 minutes until the asparagus is tender but still crisp and the butter has slightly browned and bubbled. Meanwhile, make the crumbs by placing the breadcrumbs on a baking tray and toasting them under the grill until they are golden and crisp. In a small mixing bowl beat together the eggs with the remaining butter and season well with salt and pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the asparagus tips and crumbs and toss gently to combine. Place the gratin in the oven for 15 minutes or until the top is golden and bubbly and the eggs have set. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8 x 8 inch square baking pan. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat canola oil and granulated sugar together on high speed for 3 minutes or until very fluffy. Add brown sugar, eggs, cinnamon and vanillabeat until combined. In a separate bowl mix together flour, baking powder and saltgradually add to sugar mixture alternating with milk and beat until just combined. Fold in applestransfer to prepared baking dish. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. While still hot sprinkle with white sugarlet cool completely before slicing.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add cabbage, carrot, onion and garlic. Return to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 15 minutes. Add chicken to the soup. Cook 25 minutes more or until tender. Remove chicken with a slotted spoon. Discard the skin. Shred the chicken. Return to the soup. Add tomatoes. Simmer 20 minutes more. Stir in basil and chives. Serve topped with sour cream.

Slice bananas into rounds and place on a piece of wax paper. Cut oreo cookies in half and place on top of bananas. Cover with peanut butter and add decorative candies. Stick popsicle sticks into the top of banana and oreo.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Whip eggs and cream until thick. Stir in cheese. In a large bowl, toss onion with corn kernels. Add corn mixture to cream mixture. Spoon into deep-dish pie shells. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake until puffed and golden brown. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line an 8x8 inch pan with parchment paper. Put the black beans and water in a blender or food processor and process until smooth. Transfer to a medium mixing bowl. Add the butter and cocoa powder and mix. Whisk the eggs until they are frothy. Add them to the mixture in the mixing bowl and whisk to combine. Add the salt and the vanilla and whisk. Stir in the cane sugar and mix. Fold in the chocolate chips and walnuts. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake for 20 minutes or until the brownies are set and the top is dry. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 12 brownies.

Cook bow tie pasta according to package directionsdrain well. Rinse under cold water to stop cooking process and set aside. While pasta is cooking prepare salad dressing by combining oil, vinegar, salt & pepper into a small bowlwhisk together until well combined. Drain pasta well in a colanderreturn to large pot. Toss pasta lightly with dressing to coat lightlytoss with about half of the grated Parmesan cheesetransfer to a serving plattertop with remaining Parmesan cheese & chopped fresh parsley.
Soften the coconut cream overnight at room temperature. Add the dates, honey and lemon juice and blend. Add the sea salt and blend. Serve immediately.

Place peanuts on baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour or until lightly browned. Cool completely. Stir together peanuts, mayonnaise, curry powder, coriander seeds and salt in medium bowl. Stir in mango and onion. Stir honey into peanut mixture until desired consistency is reached.

Heat olive oil in large saute pan over medium high heat. Saute cinnamon sticks for 1 minute, add flank steaks and saute for 4-5 minutes per side or to desired doneness. Remove from pan, let rest for 5 minutes. Add mushrooms to pan with oil and saute for 5 minutes. Add white wine to deglaze pan and cook for 3 minutes. Add linguine to pan with white wine sauce. Cook for 3-4 minutes or to al dente consistency. Remove pan from heat, add hazelnuts to pan and let stand for 1 minute before serving. Serve with steamed broccoli as a side.

Heat olive oil in large pot over medium heat. Add smoked sausage and cook until brown. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Add onion soup mix. Add water to cover potatoes and cook until tender. Add red and green bell peppers and red onions and cook until tender.

Boil a cup of chicken stock. Cook the couscous in it for 10-15 minutes until tender. Meanwhile, mix olive oil, mint, parsley, salt and pepper. Drain the couscous. Fold in the mint and parsley mixture. Fill the tomatoes with the couscous mixture. Sprinkle the pistachios on top. Drizzle with olive oil. Place tomatoes in a baking dish. Bake in a 350 degree oven until tomatoes are tender and the feta is browned and bubbly.

Combine ground chicken, green onions, lime juice, fish sauce, sugar, red onions and mint in a large bowl. Add 1 tbsp of rice flour and mix well with your hands until mixture clumps together when squeezed in your hands. Place mixture on a flat plate and press it down into a patty shape. Heat 1 inch of oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Dip chicken patty in egg whites and then into the rice flour mixture. Fry patty until crispy and golden brown on one side, about 1 minuteturn and brown the other side. Serve warm with cilantro leaves on top. Serve with sticky rice and a Thai green curry dip.
Beat egg yolks until thickened, then beat in sugar, salt, brandy, vanilla extract. Serve cold.

In a medium bowl, stir together the catsup, apple cider vinegar, orange juice and red wine vinegar. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the meat for 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Add the mixture to the skillet. Stir in the sugar, mustard and hot sauce. Heat to boiling. Reduce heatcook 5 minutes or until thickened. Stir in cornstarch mixture until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in the water. Serve over rice.

Spread some olive oil on one side of the bread. Top with slices of ham and cheese. Put another slice of bread on top. Press with a heavy book or pan to firmly mold. Place on heated griddle or panini press and cook until golden brown. Serve with apricot jam or dijon mustard as a dipping sauce.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray a 13 x 9 x 2 inch pan with nonstick cooking spray. Roll up crescent rolls. Cut into 1 inch pieces. Place 1 cup of cream cheese in a bowl. Beat remaining cream cheese until fluffy. Stir in sugar and 1/2 cup of peach pie filling. Place crescent rolls in pan. Spoon cream cheese mixture over crescent rolls. Spoon remaining peach pie filling over crescent rolls. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Bake 25 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes. Serve with whipped cream.

Prepare yellow cake mix according to package directions. Line a 9x12 baking dish with foil and spray with cooking spray. Mix cake mix with the peach pieces in a large bowl. Pour mixture into baking dish. Pour 1/2 cup butter and cinnamon on top. Bake in a pre-heated 350 degree oven for approximately 40-45 minutes. Let cool for about 10 minutes and then serve.

Bring large pot of water to boil over high heat. Add eggs to boiling water and cook 5 minutes. Drain eggs well in colander under running cold water. Set aside to cool. In a medium skillet, add cubanelle pepper to 1 tablespoon of olive oil and cook 5 minutes or until tender crisp. Add tomatoes and cook 5 minutes or until softened. Add feta cheese and cook 3-4 minutes or until softened. Remove from heat. Add eggs to skillet along with salt and pepper to taste. Cook on low heat for 5 minutes or until eggs are cooked through. Serve with pita bread or fresh vegetables.

Prepare bok choy by chopping into small pieces. Place in large salad bowl, add bell peppers and toss with soy sauce, vinegar and gingerroot. In a small bowl combine sesame oil and scallions, mix well and add to bok choy mixture. Grill salmon fillets until done. Serve on top of bok choy mixture with a side of rice and a small salad. For tofu, add tofu to bok choy mixture. Serve with brown rice and small salad.

Bring a large pot of lightly-salted water to a boil. Add the tomatoes and boil until skins begin to split. Remove the tomatoes from the pot with a slotted spoon. Put the tomatoes into a blender or food processor. Add the celery, onions, beets, lemon juice, sugar, salt substitute, mixed spice, worcestershire sauce and tabasco sauce to the blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Pour the tomato mixture into a large pitcher. Add a pinch of fresh ground pepper. Stir to blend. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Bring water to a boil. Add bouillon cube, soya sauce and cornstarch. Cook until mixture thickens, about 2 minutes. Remove from heatstir in ginger and garlic powder.

1. Preheat a grill to medium-high heat and oil the grill grates with cooking spray. 2. Peel and halve the peaches, then cut each half into thin slices. Sprinkle the peaches with 1/2 teaspoon of the cinnamon schnapps and 1/4 teaspoon of the sugar and arrange on the grill rack. 3. Grill the peaches for about 3 minutes, turning them over to brown on both sideskeep a close eye on them as they can burn very quickly! 4. Remove the peaches from the grill and sprinkle each side with a pinch of rosemary and a drizzle of the glaze from 1 and 2 below. 5. Serve the peaches warm with a spoonful of the remaining glaze for dipping.

In a blender or food processor, combine all the ingredients except the sunflower seeds and blend until smooth. Pour into a bowl and stir in the sunflower seeds just before serving. Serve with tortilla chips or raw vegetables.

Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the harissa and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the balsamic vinegar and the oregano and cook until the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and set aside. In a medium bowl combine the mushrooms with the oil mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Thread the mushrooms onto the skewers. Arrange the skewers on a grill-safe rack placed over an indoor grill pan and grill until charred on all sides and tender throughout. Serve warm with the remaining marinade for dipping.

In a large skillet melt butter over medium heat. Add chicken and saute until browned on all sides (3-4 minutes). Remove chicken from the pan and set aside. In a small saucepan bring the water to a boil. Add the maple syrup and continue to boil for 2 minutes or until reduced by half. Remove from the heat and add the chicken pieces along with the pepper and almonds. Bring back to a boil for 2-3 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the maple syrup is slightly thickened.

Peel and cut potatoes into small cubes. Place in saucepan with cold water to cover and cook until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain potatoes and put through a food mill or masher with pot holders or a large spatula to avoid burning your hand. Put potatoes back into pot and add butter, salt, and pepper to taste. Mash potatoes with the back of a large spoon or pot holder. Add sugar and stir to mix. Stir in breadcrumbs and cinnamon and knead into potatoes until mixture is smooth and firm. Cut dough into pieces about the size of a ping pong ball and roll into balls. Roll balls with your hands until they are about the size of marbles or golf balls. Cook balls in simmering water until they float to the top. Remove dumplings with a slotted spoon and place on platter. Add plums and drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Serve hot with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream if you like.

Saute onions in peanut oil until tender. Add chicken broth. Add chicken. Bring to boil. Add tomatoes. Cook until chicken is tender. Remove chicken. Add peanut butter. Add chilies. Cook until liquid thickens. Put chicken back in pan. Add nutmeg and seasoning. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place pork chops in a 13 x 9 x 2 inch (33 x 23 x 5 cm) baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Tear sage leaves into pieces. Place over pork. Pour water into baking dish until 1 inch (2.5 cm) of liquid remains in the bottom of the dish. Place dish in oven and bake for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and arrange sweet potatoes and apples in a circle around pork. Sprinkle pork and potatoes with brown sugar and cinnamon. Bake for 45 minutes or until pork is cooked through.
Boil carrots and oranges in water until tender. Drain and cool. Mix carrots and oranges together with the raisins. Add lemon juice and water. Mix well. Garnish with chopped onion.

Cook pasta until done (no longer tough). Drain well. In a large mixing bowl combine cooked pasta, tuna and celery. Mix well. Combine remaining ingredients except the cheese. Add to the pasta mixture. Toss with the cheese until coated evenly. Chill several hours. Makes 6 servings.

Stir marshmallow creme with peanut butter till creamy. Spread on top of popped popcorn. Stir with fork to spread. Drizzle milk over top. Sprinkle with popped popcorn, salted peanuts and chocolate. Freeze for 2 hours or till firm enough to cut with knife. Store frozen in plastic container in freezer.

Cream together butter and sugar. Add eggs and beat until fluffy. Sift together flour and baking soda. Add flour mixture to wet mixture and beat until blended. Add milk and beat until smooth. Pour batter into pan or pans. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes.

In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add greens in large handfuls, tossing until wilted, about 3 minutes. Transfer greens to large bowlrepeat with remaining greens in same skillet. Toss with honey, vinegar and salttoss in freshly grated Parmesan. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine first 8 ingredients in medium bowl. Place pork chops in baking pan. Pour sauce over chops. Cover and bake for 1 1/2 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large mixing bowl combine the peanut butter, sugar and egg. Blend until smooth and creamy. Add the extract and stir well. Add the chocolate chips and stir gently to combine. Pour the dough onto the prepared cookie sheets and smooth with your hand into an even layer. Bake for 10 minutes or until cookies are set and firm on the edges but soft and chewy in the center. Cookies will puff up slightly and the edges will darken. Remove from the oven and cool for 10 minutes on the cookie sheet before transferring cookies to cooling racks to cool completely.

In a saucepan heat oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic. Cook until soft. Add tomato paste. Cook for an additional minute. Add lamb and stir until brown. Add curry powder. Cook until meat is thoroughly cooked. Add beans, crushed tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Cook until beans are tender. Add water. Cover. Cook over low heat for 1 hour. Stir occasionally. Serve hot.

Mix the graham cracker crumbs and the vanilla essence. Transfer to a 5-inch cake mould. Pour the sweetened condensed milk into a sauce pan and heat it to boiling point. When it is boiling, add the yogurt to it and stir it until it is dissolved. Pour it over the graham cracker crumb mixture and bake for 30 minutes in a moderate oven. Cool it for 20 minutes. Remove it from the cake mould and serve.

Combine refried beans with a little of the salad oil, the onion and garlic salt and the cheese. Heat the rest of the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the jalapenos. Saute the jalapenos until the skins turn black. Remove the jalapenos to a paper towel-lined dish and let cool. In a blender, puree the jalapenos with the rest of the oil. Pour the jalapeno oil into the beans and add the salt and pepper. Mix well and serve with tortilla chips. Makes 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Mix eggs, milk, sugar, pepper in large mixing bowl. Set aside. Shuck corn and remove corn silk. Remove kernels from corn cobs. Add corn to egg mixture. Transfer to prepared pan. Pour melted butter over top. Sprinkle crisp rice cereal evenly over top. Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes or until set.

Sift together flour, sugar and baking powder in a bowl. Add baking soda and salt. Cut butter into small pieces. Using your fingers or pastry cutter, work butter into flour mixture until mixture is crumbly. Stir in cheese. In another bowl, mix together yogurt and milk. Add yogurt mixture to flour mixture. Stir until moistened. Turn dough out onto floured surface. Knead lightly until dough is smooth. Roll dough to 1-inch thickness. Cut dough into 8 equal pieces. Place pieces 2 inches apart onto lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 450 for 12 to 14 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 8.

In a small saucepan, whisk together cream, instant coffee granules and vanilla extract until combined. In a separate bowl, whisk together pudding mix and Splenda granular until combined. Whisk cream mixture into pudding mixture until combined. Transfer mousse to a large bowl. Refrigerate until set, about 1 hour. Serve mousse cold, garnished with whipped cream. Makes 16 servings.

Into a large bowl sift together 1 1/2 cups of flour 1/4 teaspoon baking powder 1/4 teaspoon baking soda 1 teaspoon salt. Add 3/4 cup sugar and stir to combine. Make a well in center of dry ingredients. Whisk 2 eggs and add them to dry mixture. Add 1 cup of buttermilk and stir until all is combined. Heat griddle over medium heat. Lightly oil griddle with oil. Pour 1/3 cup batter onto griddle to form pancakes. Cook about 1 1/2 minutes on one side until batter is bubbly. Flip and cook until pancakes are done. Serve immediately with butter and syrup.
