Add lime juice to coke or soda water in tall glasses. Sprinkle with sugar. Add maraschino cherry juice and lime slices on top. Garnish with cherries and serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Spray 2 round cake pans. Mash 2 cups of fresh peaches with 2 tablespoons of butter. Mix 1 cup of pecans and 1/3 cup of coconut into the buttered fruit. Set aside. In separate bowl combine 1 cake mix, 1 egg and 1/2 c of water. Beat 2 minutes. Pour into prepared pans. Bake for 25 minutes. Spread fruit over top. Sprinkle 1/2 c of coconut over fruit. Bake for 20 more minutes. Let cool 5 minutes. Remove from pans. Top each cake with 2 cups of chopped pecan pieces.
Wash and trim broccoli. Steam broccoli until just tender. Cool. Combine remaining ingredients in a blender until smooth. Pour over broccoli. Serve.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add mushrooms and garlic and cook until softened. Add half-and-half. Cook until heated through. Reduce heat to low. In a food processor, process cream cheese until smooth. Add the cheese and spinach. Process until well combined. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into a small baking dish. Top with breadcrumbs. Bake for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm.

Split bread in half horizontally and spread pesto on both halves. Divide mozzarella evenly and place on one side of bread. Spread pesto on other side of bread. Top with other half. Wrap sandwiches in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving.
Mix apples with juice and walnuts together and set aside. Whip cool whip and mayonnaise together and add to the apples and walnuts. Then add pineapple to the apples and stir together. Enjoy!

Combine the brewed coffee, cinnamon sticks, peppermint extract and sugar substitute in a large bowl and whisk until all of the cinnamon and sugar substitute is dissolved. In a separate bowl whisk together the evaporated milk and cream until smooth. Add the evaporated milk mixture to the coffee mixture slowly whisking constantly until well blended. Serve immediately or chill up to 2 days before serving.

Beat egg yolks until light and fluffy. Slowly add sweetened condensed milk to egg yolks stirring constantly until all the milk is added. Pour mixture into crust. In a bowl toss tequila, triple sec and lime zest until all combined. Pour mixture over egg yolk mixture and stir until well blended. Refrigerate for 2 hours until firm. Serve with cool whip if desired.

Slice potatoes into 1/4-inch-thick rounds. Cut each round into 3 wedges. Dip wedges into ice water to prevent potatoes from browning. Combine 3 cups peanut oil, black pepper, and salt in a large bowl. Heat oil to 375f. Fry potatoes until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with barbecue sauce.

Mix hoisin sauce, lemon juice, dijon mustard, honey, sesame oil and soy sauce. Cut pork tenderloin into serving size pieces. Sprinkle with garlic, ginger and lemon zest. Marinate in sauce mixture for at least one hour and up to two hours in the refrigerator. Grill tenderloin until desired doneness and serve with lemon wedges on the side for squeezing over the tenderloin during the last few minutes of cooking.

Add dried apricots to a saucepan with the brandy. Place over a moderate heat and simmer gently for 10 minutes. Strain the apricots through a sieve and discard the brandy. Blend the apricots with the cream and white chocolate until smooth and thick. Add the ground almonds and plain biscuit crumbs. Fold through the coconut. Remove mixture from the fridge and form into balls about 2 inches across. Roll the balls in the coconut and leave to rest in the fridge for about 1 hour. Serve.

Wash ham and pat dry. Insert 3 to 4 10-inch metal skewers through ham, spacing them about 1 inch apart. Place skewers in a glass or plastic container. Add brown sugar, lemon juice, prepared horseradish and yellow mustard. Cover and refrigerate for at least 8 hours. Bring mixture to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Boil for 5 minutes. Pour hot mixture over ham skewers. Place ham skewers in a large glass or plastic container. Pour vegetable oil into a large glass or plastic container. Add ham skewers. Cook for 5 minutes over medium-high heat. Turn ham skewers over. Cook for 30 seconds. Drain on paper towels. Serve immediately.

Melt the butter in a large pan. Add the leek and garlic. Cook for a few minutes. Add the veal. Cook until brown on all sides. Add the barley. Pour in the water and wine vinegar. Bring to a boil. Add salt, pepper and sage leaves. Simmer on medium-low heat for 45 minutes or until the meat is tender. Serve with vegetables.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the rice, thyme, oregano, salt and pepper. Cook until the rice is tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in the chicken broth, water or orange juice and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low. Cook for about 25 minutes or until most of the liquid has been absorbed. Stir in the barley. Cook for another 5 minutes or until barley is tender. Stir in the wine, walnuts and parsley. Cook for another minute or two or until rice and barley are tender. Remove from heat. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Slice turkey breast into thin strips and cook in a skillet with some water. Slice pastrami thinly. Spread Dijon mustard over the puff pastry. Arrange turkey breast and pastrami over the pastry. Fold up the ends of the pastry. Brush the pastry with egg white. Bake 20 minutes. Serve with a side salad. Serves 4.

Halve melon and scoop out flesh. Remove seeds and discard. Combine 1/4 cup sugar and 1/4 cup white wine in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and add to melon. Cover and refrigerate until cold. Process in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer’s instructions. Transfer to a container and freeze until firm. Serve in individual dessert glasses and garnish with sprig of mint.

Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper. Place a large non-stick pan over medium heat. Add olive oil and butter to the pan and heat. Place the fillets skin side down in the pan and cook for 3-4 minutes per side or until the fish is lightly browned. While the fish is cooking, mix together the mustard and parsley. Remove the cooked fillets and place them on a plate. Drizzle each fillet with half the honey mustard mixture and sprinkle with the breadcrumbs and half of the paprika. Place the fillets in the pan skin side down. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side or until crispy and golden brown. Sprinkle the remaining fillets with the remaining honey mustard mixture and breadcrumbs. Cook for the same amount of time. Serve with a side of vegetables.
Melt butter slowly in saucepan. Bring orange juice to boilstir in sugar, cornstarch and salt. Cook over moderate heat until thickened and clearremove from heat and stir in lemon juice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and line a 9x13-inch pan with parchment paper or foil. In a large bowl combine flour, cocoa powder and salt. In a separate bowl mix together eggs and sugar until light and fluffy and then stir in vegetable oil and vanilla yogurt until combined. Stir the dry ingredients into the egg mixture until well combined and then add in chocolate covered malted milk balls and stir until well combined and batter is thick. Pour into the prepared pan and bake for 25 minutes until the edges of the fudge slice are just set but the middle is still soft and fudgy. Let cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire rack to cool completely. To make the icing, place icing sugar in a small bowl and add in the milk 1 tsp at a time until you have a thick icing consistency. Spread the icing evenly over the fudge slice and decorate with chocolate covered malted milk balls as desired. Store in an airtight container in the fridge for

Cook refried beans in saucepan. Add tortilla chips and bake 5 minutes. Add cheese and bake 2 more minutes. Mix together sour cream and pimiento. Sprinkle over nachos. Add jalapeno. Serve with lime wedges.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spread half of the prepared crust in a 13-by-9 inch baking dish. Top with half of the tortilla chips, half of the melted butter and half of the salsa. Top with half of the chicken strips, half of the ranch dressing, half of the cheddar cheese and half of the green chilies. Repeat layers with the remaining crust, tortilla chips, butter, salsa, ranch dressing, chicken strips, cheddar cheese and green chilies. Sprinkle with the remaining mozzarella. Bake at 375 for 20-25 minutes or until heated through. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting and serving.

Cook pasta al dente. Drain in a colander. Mix prosciutto with vodka. Set aside. Melt butter in a pan. Add prosciutto vodka mixture. Stir in cream. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir in tomato paste. Season with salt. Place pasta in a large serving bowl. Pour the sauce over the pasta. Sprinkle with Parmigiano Reggiano. Toss lightly. Garnish with basil. Serve immediately.
Boil pasta according to package directions. Drain and cool. Toss pasta with remaining ingrediants. Refrigerate and serve cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small saucepan, combine margarine, brown sugar, molasses& water. Cook over medium heat until margarine melts, stirring until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Stir in egg white. In a large bowl, combine flour, ground ginger, ground cinnamon& baking soda& salt. Stir in molasses mixture. Add applesauce& stir with a fork until well blended. Drop batter by heaping tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until firm to the touch. Let stand on cookie sheet for 2 minutes before removing to cooling rack. Let cool completely.

Peel and cut potatoes in half. Place in a large pot of cold water. Bring water to a boil and cook for about 12 minutes until tender. Drain and cool. Peel and cut potatoes in half. Place in a large pot of cold water. Bring water to a boil and cook for about 12 minutes until tender. Drain and cool. Place potatoes in a large bowl and mash. Add butter and milk. Add salt and pepper. Add cheeses and mix well. Refrigerate until serving. This recipe is from Martha Stewart's Entertaining Cookbook. (Thanks, Martha!)

Peel potatoes and cut into thick slices. Add to a saucepan of boiling water with a pinch of salt. Cook until potatoes are tender. Meanwhile, fry onion in oil. Add tomatoes to onion and cook. Stir in red pepper paste. Remove potatoes from water and drain. Fry chicken pieces in oil. Add chicken to sauce. Stir in potatoes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to boiling. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, in 10-inch skillet melt butter over medium-high heat. Add chicken. Cook 4 to 5 minutes or until browned. Add dill and cook 30 seconds. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Remove from heat. Stir in wine and chicken stock. Bring to boiling. Add pasta. Cook 2 minutes. Add cream and lemon juice. Cook 1 minute. Stir in cheese. Cook 1 minute or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Put mustard seeds and garlic cloves in food processor or mortar and pestle and whizz until they become a fine powder. Add the ale and blend again until smooth. Place mixture in jar or other suitable container and refrigerate for one or two days before use. Refrigerate for up to two weeks and shake before use. The mustard will thicken when cooled and will be ready for use. If too thick, add more ale until consistency is right for you.

Mix bread flour, white bread flour and salt. Add sugar and powdered milk to mixture. Mix well. Add yeast mixture to dry mixture. Add oil and egg to wet mixture. Combine and knead until elastic. Let rise in warm place covered for about 1 hour. Punch down. Divide dough into 4 parts. Roll out each part to 1/4 inch thickness. Shape into rounds. Place in greased loaf pans. Cover with a damp cloth until double in size. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 20 minutes. Cool.

Rinse fish fillets. Place fillets in large bowl. Combine spices. Sprinkle spice mixture over fillets. Coat fillets in cornmeal. Place on cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with rice, grits or potatoes.

Cut the boston butt into bite size pieces. Add the ginger ale, vinegar, season salt and boston butt into a bowl or crockpot. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours. Shake the bowl or crockpot every 30 minutes to make sure the boston butt is evenly coated with the season salt and vinegar mixture. Serve with your favorite bbq sauce on the side for dipping or as you please. Enjoy!!!

Brown beef. Drain excess fat. Add water. Mix in onion, celery, garlic, pepper, mushrooms. Add bouillon. Bring mixture to a boil. Stir in soy sauce. Pour mixture into 1-quart casserole. Cover. Bake at 350f degrees for 30 minutes. Top with long-grain white rice. Bake an additional 15 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Serves 6.

Trim tempeh to 1/4-inch thick. Prepare sauce. Grill tempeh 3 minutes on each side. Thread tempeh onto skewers. Grill until browned 2-3 minutes per side. Serve with sauce. Make sauce by combining all ingredients.

In a 10-inch skillet over medium heat, saute garlic powder until fragrant. Add vegetable oilswirl to coat. Add chicken. Cook 3 to 5 minutes on each side until done. Transfer to a plate. Add broth and noodles to the skillet. Cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in frozen vegetables and chicken. Sprinkle with cheese. Covercook 2 to 3 minutes or until cheese melts. Stir in parsley. Yield: 4 servings. Nutrition information per serving: 238 calories (58 percent from fat), 22 grams total fat (3 grams saturated fat), 171 milligrams sodium, 6 grams total carbohydrates (1 gram sugars), 13 grams protein.

In a 10-inch nonstick omelet pan, melt the butter. Add the chives and cook for about 5 minutes or until they begin to soften and color. Whisk the eggs and season them with salt and black pepper. Stir the eggs into the pan along with the cheese. Cook until the eggs are cooked through and the top is golden and crisp. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine 1/2 cup of the nuts and the icing sugar. Stir in 1/2 cup of the melted butter and mix until combined. In a larger bowl, whisk together the flour and the remaining 1/4 cup of the nuts. Cut in the remaining 1/4 cup of the melted butter with a pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Set aside. In a medium bowl, beat together the cream cheese and the remaining 1/4 cup of the pudding mix. Whisk in the cool whip until combined. Mix in the pistachio nuts. Press the dough into a 9x13 pan. Spread the filling evenly over the dough. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until the edges are lightly browned. Cool completely on a wire rack. Crumble the remaining 1/4 cup of nuts over the top of the bars. Serve.

Season chicken with paprika, pepper, oregano leaves and salt. Put butter in a pan over low heatadd the seasoned chicken to the pan. Cook until golden brown (about 10 minutes). Sprinkle with almonds, parmesan cheese, parsley and oregano leaves. Cook for about 5 minutes or until the almonds are golden brown. Serve immediately with rice or pasta.

Slice bread. Spread mustard on one side of each slice. Fold bottom slice over filling. Top with remaining bread slices. Spread with ketchup. Heat grill pan until hot. Place sandwiches in pan. Cook on each side until bread is toasted.

Wash leeks and pat dry. Slice the white part of the leek lengthwise. Slice the green part of the leek crosswise. Transfer to a large bowl. Add olive oil and parsley to the bowl. Toss to coat. Add the vinegar and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with grilled meat or fish.

Cut up turkey into small pieces and add them to a pan with enough oil to cover. Fry the turkey until cooked through. Remove the turkey from the pan and set aside. Whisk eggs until they are fully beaten and then add the turkey and sweet gherkins into the pan. Cook the mixture for about 30 seconds. Add the sandwich and salad sauce and the mayonnaise. Mix the ingredients well and place them into a bowl. Put the salad into a large serving bowl and add the lettuce. Pour the turkey mixture onto the lettuce and serve.

Bake sausages with mushrooms for 25 minutes at 400 degrees. Stuff mushrooms with cheese and sausages. Place in an oven safe dish with Italian breadcrumbs. Sprinkle with more breadcrumbs and mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Pour the clam chowder into the crust of the pie crust. Place the pie crust on top of the clam chowder. Fold the pie crust over the clam chowder and pinch the crust together. Sprinkle the Swiss cheese over the pie crust. Layer the green onions and the chopped parsley over the cheese. Sprinkle the pepper over the green onions and parsley. Bake at 350 for about 30 minutes.
Layer the ingredients in four tall glasses. Serve with low-fat granola bars.
Mash avocados with mayonnaise, lime juice, worcestershire sauce and garlic salt. Stir well to blend. Cover tightly and refrigerate 2 hours before serving to allow flavors to blend. Serves 8.

In large mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Whisk in vegetable oil, milk and eggs until well combined. Stir in almond extract and poppy seeds. Pour into greased muffin cups, filling them about 2/3 full. Bake at 375 degrees f for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Cook your chicken until its done. Shred it. Place the shredded chicken in a bowl. Pour in rotel tomatoes and velveeta. Add in cumin and salt and pepper. Mix well. Chill and serve with tortillas or tortilla chips. It makes a great appetizer or game day snack. I also love to use this recipe to make quesadillas. Just make some extra and use it in your quesadillas for a tasty mexican meal.

In a large pot, boil 1 ½ cups water with 1 ½ tsp of salt for about 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked through and tender. Drain the rice thoroughly then add 1 tsp of salt to the rice and 1 ½ cups of coconut milk. Cook on medium heat for about 15 minutes or until the coconut milk evaporates. Remove from heat and add 1 cup of sugar to taste and ½ cup of coconut cream. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel the potatoes (if desired) and cut into small wedges. Place in a large bowl. Add garlic cloves and rosemary. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Spread out on a baking sheet. Roast the potatoes until tender. Set aside. Meanwhile, season the cod on both sides with salt and pepper. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Place the cod in the pan, flesh side down. Cook for about 5 minutes. Carefully flip the fish over. Cook for another 2 minutes. Transfer the fish to a plate. Squeeze the lemon juice on the fish. Transfer the fish to a plate. Pour the juice into the pan. Add the cherry tomatoes to the pan. Squeeze the juice from half the lemon over the tomatoes. Sprinkle with the remaining rosemary. Season with salt and pepper. Cook the tomatoes until they have softened. Spoon the cooked potatoes onto a plate. Place a cod fillet on top of each potato.

In a large bowl combine ground beef, tomato paste, eggs, oatmeal, onion powder, salt and pepper. Mix well. Form into loaf shape and place in baking dish. Pour ketchup over top of loaf. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Let stand 15 minutes before serving.

Combine vegetable oil and ground sirloin in a large skillet over medium heatcook and stir until meat is browned. Drain fat. Add chicken stock and paprikabring to a boil. Stir in worcestershire sauce and salt and pepperreduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 1 hour. Transfer meat to a large bowlcover and refrigerate for at least 8 hours or overnight. In the skillet, saute yellow onions in oil for 2 minutesadd meat. Stir in chicken stock and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heatcover and simmer for about 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Transfer meat mixture to a large bowlcover and refrigerate until ready to serve. To serve, place hamburger buns split-side down on grill rackcover and grill over medium heat until grill-marked and heated through, 4-6 minutes per side. Top each bun with a quarter-cup meat mixture and a slice of cheesecover and grill until cheese is melted, about 1 minute per side

Rinse and dry bread and place in a greased 11x17 pan. Cut the bread in half and brush each piece with garlic salt and oil. Place one half of the bread in the oven until golden brown and crispy. Spread cream cheese on the other half and sprinkle with mozzarella and chopped spinach. Place in the other half of the bread and return to the oven until heated through (1-2 minutes). Serve with marinara sauce if desired.

Preheat panini maker for 1 minute (following manufacturer's instructions). Spread 1/4 cup jam over bread slices. Top each slice with cheese, prosciutto slices (overlapping slightly) and 1 egg. Cook until eggs are cooked through and cheese has melted (about 4 minutes). If desired, broil until browned. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet brown the kielbasa sausage over medium heat. Drain the excess fat and set aside. In the same skillet over medium heat saute the onions until tender. Combine the sausage and onions with the sauerkraut and mashed potatoes in a baking dish. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and bake uncovered at 350f for 30 minutes or until the cheese is melted and browned on top.

Preheat oven to 375 f. Lightly grease a 10x14 inch baking dish. Coat the tilapia fillets in seasonings and place in the baking dish. Top with Parmesan and then top with mayonnaise mixture and place in the oven. Bake for 10 minutes or until the fish is flaky and the cheese is golden brown.

Cut leeks and onions into 1-inch pieces. Peel potatoes and cut them into 1-inch cubes. Melt butter in a large pot. Add onion, leeks and potatoes. Sweat vegetables until tender. Pour in stock. Add milk and cream. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for about 25 minutes. Season to taste.

Boil potatoes until tender (about 40 minutes). Drain and cool. Peel potatoes and cut into cubes (about 1-inch cubes). Whisk together sour cream, mayonnaise and pepper sauce. Stir in potatoes and garlic and refrigerate for at least an hour. Toss potato mixture with bacon and hard-cooked eggs just before serving. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

1. In a large bowl or bucket put in plain flour , brown flour , isa , honey , salt , oil , yeast , sunflower seeds , water .2. Mix together until combined. 3. Cover bowl with cling film or wrap it in a damp kitchen towel. 4. Place in a cool dark place.5. Leave for 8-24 hours until doubled in size.6. Grease a large loaf tin. 7. Turn out dough into the greased loaf tin. 8. Cover with cling film or a damp kitchen towel. 9. Leave to rise for 1-2 hours. 10. Preheat oven to 180 c. 11. Bake for 45 minutes. 12. Turn out onto a wire rack to cool.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place corn in shallow baking dish and add water to dish. Add butter and sprinkle with salt and white pepper. Bake uncovered for about 15 minutes or until tender. Remove from oven and cool slightly. Spoon honey evenly over corn and serve warm.

In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown ground beefadd diced garlic, dried chili flakes, refried beans and black olives. Remove from heat and set aside. In another skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Cook nacho chips in butter until crisp. In a large bowl, add beans, salsa and cheese. Divide into 2 bowls. Place a layer of nacho chips in a serving bowl. Top with a layer of beans. Sprinkle with nacho cheese. Top with a layer of nacho chips. Repeat layering until all beans have been used. Garnish with olives.

In a bowl, combine egg, buttermilk and molasses. Stir in cornmeal and mix well. In another bowl, combine flour, salt and baking powder. Stir into the molasses mixture. In a small bowl, combine the butter and baking soda. Stir into the batter just before cooking. Heat a griddle over medium heat. Lightly grease griddle with butter. Pour about 1/4 cup of batter onto griddle for each pancake. Cook until bubbles form and pop and pancake begins to brown. Flip and cook until second side is browned.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease or spray a 8x8 square baking pan. In a small bowl add cocoa and butter and set aside. In a medium bowl add the sugar and carrot. Add the cocoa mixture and mix well. In a large bowl whisk together the skim milk and eggs. Add the applesauce and vanilla and beat well. Add to the carrot mixture and mix well. Pour into the pan and bake for about 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Strain into a glass filled with ice. Garnish with lemon wedge.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over medium heat. Add asparagus to boiling water. Blanch for 3 minutes. Remove from water with a slotted spoon. Drain asparagus thoroughly. Pour half of the oil into a saute pan over medium heat. Add mushrooms and shallots. Sauté until softened. Add thyme sprigs and cook for 2 more minutes. Season with 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Remove from heat. Add the remaining oil to a small skillet over medium heat. Add asparagus to skillet. Season with 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Cook for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Season with pepper to taste. Transfer to a platter. Add shallots mixture to asparagus. Stir to coat. Garnish with parsley. Serve.

In food processor, combine the avocados, sour cream, yellow onion, canola oil and coriander powder. Process until smooth. Transfer to a large saucepan. Add the chicken broth, chili powder and salt. Cook over low heat until slightly thickened. Purée the soup with an immersion blender. Stir in tomatoes and cilantro. Heat through.
Dice strawberries into small pieces. Combine sugar and lemon juice. Add diced strawberries. Let sit for about an hour. Combine strawberries, framboise liqueur. Add ice cream.
In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic. Cook and stir 1 minute. Add chops. Cook 5 minutes on each side or until done. Serve with stewed tomatoes.

Melt the butter and unsweetened chocolate together in a small saucepan over very low heat until smooth and melted. Add the cornstarch and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly with a whisk to prevent lumps from forming. Stir in 1 cup of the milk until smooth and creamy (there should be no lumps). Pour into a large saucepan and set aside. Heat the remaining 1 cup of milk in a saucepan over medium heat until just boiling and then remove from heat. Add this milk mixture slowly to chocolate mixture and whisk constantly until smooth and creamy. Return the mixture to a simmer and cook for 2 minutes or until thickened slightly and has a glossy appearance (there should be no lumps). Pour into a large serving bowl and refrigerate for 1 hour or until cool (do not over chill). Whip the heavy cream and vanilla together until soft peaks form and fold into blancmange. Serve with whipped cream and fresh berries or raspberries and drizzle with chocolate sauce if desired.

Spread pesto sauce over english muffins, arrange slices of tomato, radicchio and goat cheese on top of the sauce. Heat a panini grill or panini press for a minute or two on each side until golden brown. Serve hot with a dollop of goat cheese on each muffin half.

Preheat oven to 450f degrees F. Heat olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add mushrooms with garlic clove to skillet and saute for 5 to 7 min. Stirring frequently. Add lemon juice to skillet with mushrooms. Cook for 1 more minute or until liquid is reduced by half. Add salt to taste if needed. Cut pitas into four equal pieces, brush with olive oil on both sides. Add mushroom mixture to center of pita round and top with mesclun mixture. Sprinkle with extra virgin olive oil and white wine vinegar. Close pita round and serve with lemon wedges if desired.

Combine all marinade ingredients except shrimp and cilantro, and whisk until emulsified. Stir in cilantro. In a large bowl, toss shrimp with marinade and refrigerate 1 hour. Meanwhile, toss roasted peanuts with cilantro and set aside until ready to serve. Thread shrimp onto 4 skewers. Heat a grill or grill pan until very hot. Grill shrimp until cooked through and just beginning to char on the edges (about 5 minutes total). Serve shrimp with cilantro and lime wedges and toasted roasted peanuts on the side.
Dip each fillet in melted butter. Dip in seasoning. Dip in bread crumbs. Place on baking sheet in oven until cooked through.

Melt 1/2 cup butter in 8-inch square pan in 350 degree oven. Remove from oven. Sprinkle puffed rice cereal into hot pan. Cook 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in sugar and honey. Pour mixture onto waxed paper to cool. Cut into squares.

Bring 2 quarts of water to boil. Add salt to water. Cook frozen vegetables until tender. Drain vegetables. In a large skillet, melt butter. Stir in vegetables. Add flour to vegetables. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in milk. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in cheese. Stir in sour cream. Stir in salt, pepper and garlic salt. Serve hot.

Place the oil in the bottom of a large heavy pot. Add the chicken to the pot in one layer. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook 12 minutes on each side. Remove the chicken from the pot. Set aside. Add the broth to the pot. Add the orange juice, marmalade and vinegar. Bring to a boil. Return the chicken to the pot. Bring the mixture back to a boil. Cover the pot tightly. Cook 20 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat. Remove the chicken from the pot. Allow the liquid to cool slightly. Remove the tangerine peel from the pot. Strain the liquid. Add the strained liquid to the pot. Return to the stove. Bring to a boil. Add the chicken back to the pot. Cover. Cook 10 minutes. Remove from the heat. Place the chicken on a serving platter. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Sprinkle with crushed red pepper flakes.

In a large nonstick skillet, heat the oil. In a large bowl combine the eggs and milk. Stir in the onion and green bell pepper. Cook until the eggs are almost set. Transfer to the skillet and cook until the eggs are set and the mixture is dry. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, heat oil until hot. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes, basil, oregano and salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Coversimmer 10 minutes. Uncover. Add fresh basil. Simmer until sauce has reduced slightly. Remove from heat. Transfer to a blender or food processor in batches. Puree until smooth. Taste and add salt if necessary.

Boil new potatoes until tender. Remove and let cool. Peel potatoes, leaving skin on. Cut into 1-inch pieces. Combine potatoes, celery ribs, eggs, onion and parsley in a large bowl. Whisk together the mayonnaise, cider vinegar and lemon juice. Add this mixture to potato mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in the powdered sugar and saltcook, whisking constantly, 5 minutes or until mixture is light brown and thick enough to leave a trail on the back of a spoon when drizzled from a spoon. Working quickly, place pecan halves in a small bowl and roll in mixture. Roll in remaining mixturechill in refrigerator 30 minutes. Melt the dipping chocolate according to package directions and dip the ballsplace on wax paper. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator up to 1 week.

Preheat the oven to 180c/ 350f. Put the flours into a bowl and sift them together. Add the salt and sugar. Rub the butter into the flour with your fingers until you have fine breadcrumbs. Add the dates and walnuts. Make a well in the centre of the mixture. Add the lemon zest, the eggs, the cream and the milk. Mix the ingredients together until they form a ball. Knead the mixture until it is smooth. Add the plain flour if necessary. Roll the dough out into a circle about 0.5cm / 1/4 inch thick. Cut the dough into triangles with a sharp knife. Place the scones on a baking sheet. Brush the scones with the egg wash. Bake the scones for 10 minutes until they are golden brown. Serve with butter.

Preheat oven to 425f. In a 9-inch deep-dish pie pan, toss blackberries with sugar and cinnamon. Cover and refrigerate for about 2 hours. Meanwhile, make the crust. Mix the cornstarch with the 2 tablespoons cold water. Mix into the 1/2 cup cold butter until it is well blended. Mix in the 1 1/2 cups of ice water. Add the lemon juice. Drain the berries. Remove any excess juice. Add the berries to the crust mixture. Spread evenly into the pie pan. Dot the top with the remaining 1/4 cup of cold butter. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce the heat to 350f and bake for 40-45 minutes more or until a knife inserted into the middle comes out clean. Let the pie cool for 5 minutes before removing it from the pie pan. Let it cool completely before serving. Makes 8 servings.

Combine the mango and vegetables in the food processor and process until finely chopped. In another bowl combine the orange juice concentrate, yogurt and water. Add the vegetable mixture to the orange mixture. Add the chicken to the mixture and stir to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 2-4 hours. Pour the marinade into the skillet and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Serve the chicken on rice.

In large saucepan combine bacon with oil. Cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan with a slotted spoon. Place bacon grease back into the pan. Add chopped onions, minced garlic and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add chicken to pan. Cook 5 minutes. Add potato chunks. Cook 5 more minutes. Stir occasionally. Add chicken stock, milk and corn. Cook 5 minutes more or until potatoes are tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with corn chips.

In large bowl combine cheese and butter until smooth. Add vanilla and powdered sugarbeat with electric mixer on high speed until light and fluffy (3 to 4 minutes). Add brown sugar and mix well. Stir in pecans and toffee bits. Refrigerate 30 minutes or until firm enough to shape into ball. Roll in chopped pecans and place on wax paper or platter. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Sift flour with 1/2 tsp salt into large bowl. In small bowl, whisk together milk with egg and 1/2 tsp sugar. Heat butter in 12 inch skillet or large frying pan on med high heat or until melted. Pour milk mixture into bowl with flour and whisk vigorously to blend completely. Pour 1 cup butter into skillet. Cook on med high heat, swirling butter occasionally, until butter begins to brown in spots, about 1 min. Pour in half of flour mixture to skillet & cook over med high heat, swirling frequently to brown on bottom, about 5-7 min or until top is lightly browned. Pour in remaining flour mixture & cook on med high heat, swirling frequently to brown on bottom, about 5-7 min or until top is lightly browned. Remove from skillet & let cool completely on wire rack, about 30 min. To serve, place 2 tbs each butter & hazelnuts on plate or on dessert plate with each slice of hazelnussomeletten. C

In a large pot, saute onion and celery in a small amount of water until softened. Add potatoes and cook until potatoes are tender. Add beef bouillon and beef broth and bring to a boil. Stir in frozen vegetables and water. Cover and cook over medium low heat for 10 minutes. Add tomatoes and worcestershire sauce and bring to a boil again. Reduce heat to low and cook for 20 minutes more until vegetables are tender. Serve with rice or toast and enjoy!

Remove eggs from shells and cut in half lengthwise. Spoon out yolks and place in a large bowl. Add relish and mustard and stir well. Add salt and pepper to taste and mix well again. Spoon egg yolk mixture back into egg white halves. Serve immediately. Serve with toothpicks so you can pick up and eat like deviled eggs.
In a mug heat milk and add bittersweet chocolate. Stir and top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with peppermint stick candy. Optional add schnapps.

Slice brisket across grain into thin strips. Shape into patties. Place patties between two pieces of plastic wrap. Using a meat mallet or rolling pin, pound to about 1/4-inch thick. Combine remaining ingredients. Place patties in a baking dish. Pour over barbecue mixture. Cover dish. Bake for 45 minutes. Place patties in bunsadd barbecue sauce.

Slice the double gloucester cheese and place on a whole wheat slice of bread. Spread a thin layer of mustard on the bottom slice of bread. Place the cheese and mustard on top of the bread. Place another slice of whole wheat bread on top. Cut diagonally and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Prepare muffin pan by greasing cups. Prepare muffin mix according to package directions (using milk instead of water). Combine the egg and milk, add to the dry mix. Fold in the blue cheese and green onions (do not add the pepper). Bake at 400 degrees F (205 degrees C) for 15 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cream together the butter and sugar. Add egg and vanilla extract. Sift together the flour and rice bubbles. Stir in the flour mixture. Drop by teaspoon onto parchment paper. Press with fork. Place on baking sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes. Cool. Dip the biscuit into the melted chocolate. Allow to set. Store in airtight container.

In a large bowl combine soy sauce with liquid honey. Add barbecue sauce and stir until well blended. Place chicken in a shallow dish. Add 1/2 of the honey mixturemarinade 15 minutes. Thread 1 garlic clove and 1 green onion on each skewer. Place on a broiler pan. Broil 5 inches from heat 12 minutes. Turn chicken overbroil an additional 5 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with remaining honey mixture.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute onion, garlic and tomatoes for 5 minutes. Add corn and tomatoes. Cook for 4 minutes. Stir in basil. Drain pasta and toss with sauce. Divide pasta among 4 plates. Top each with crabmeat and serve immediately.

Peel the bananas and cut them into small pieces. Spread peanut butter on one half of each banana. Place one banana half on the bottom of a glass or clear serving plate. Top with a layer of yogurt and another banana half. Repeat with remaining bananas and yogurt. Sprinkle with grape-nuts and top each banana with a peanut.

Heat oil in large soup pan. Stir in mushrooms and garlic clove. Cook for 5 minutes. Pour in water and bring to boil. Add ramen noodles. Stir for two minutes. Remove from heat and add sherry wine and lemon juice. Stir. Add tabasco sauce. Stir and sprinkle green onion.

Preheat oven to 180c. In a large bowl beat the butter and sugar together. Beat in the egg and vanilla. In a separate bowl mix the dry ingredients. Pour wet into dry and mix until smooth. Divide the mixture into prepared paper cases. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the cupcakes comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. Meanwhile, beat the butter with the icing sugar. Add the liquorice and the black licorice and beat until well combined. Ice the cupcakes and sprinkle with liquorice allsorts.

In a skillet, fry onions and paprika until soft and translucent (about 15 minutes). In another skillet, melt butter and add tomato puree. Stir occasionally until hot and thickened (about 5 minutes). In the last minute of cooking the tomato puree add the mustard and bouillon cube. In a sauce pan bring 3 cups of water to a boil and add bouillon cube and salt & pepper. Pour water into the tomato puree and simmer for 2 minutes. Add tomato puree and mustard mixture to the onion and paprika. Add fried smoked sausage and mix well with a wooden spoon to coat all the pieces of the sausage with the onion and paprika mixture. Pour hot water and bouillon cube into the pan and stir to mix well with the tomato mixture. Cook for 5 minutes and then add the sour cream. Stir until the sour cream is thoroughly mixed with the mixture and then serve.

Combine all the ingredients except the breadcrumbs. Form the mixture into 4 burgers. Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet until it begins to shimmer. Add burgers to the skillet. Cook for 3-4 minutes per side, until well browned. Remove to platesprinkle with breadcrumbs.

Place onion and cranberries in the bottom of a crock pot. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place chicken on top of cranberries and onion. In a small bowl mix together catsup, brown sugar substitute and mustard. Pour over chicken. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 4 hours. Serve over rice or serve with salad.
Combine all ingredients in food processor and process until smooth. Serve with corn tortilla chips or crackers.

Beat together eggs and vanilla. Whisk together flour and salt. Add the wet ingredients to the dry and mix together. Grease a waffle iron with butter. Add enough batter to fill the iron. Bake according to the manufacturers instructions. Serve with fresh berries and maple syrup.

Roll pizza dough into a circle and press into a 9 inch pizza pan or on a large cutting board lightly dusted with cornmeal. Spread the pizza with barbecue sauce, then the chicken and a generous handful of shredded mozzarella and cheddar cheeses. Bake on the lowest oven rack for 10-12 minutes or until the crust is crispy and the cheeses are melted. If your oven is not very consistent in temperature (mine isn’t) then I would recommend watching the pizza as it bakes and remove from the oven when the cheeses are melted and the crust is turning golden brown. I like my pizza crispy but I don’t like the bottom burned so watch your pizza closely!

Preheat oven to 350. Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add onion, garlic and cumin and cook until onion is translucent. Add ground ginger and dark brown sugar. Remove from heat. Mix in 1/2 cup water and lemon juice. Remove from heat and stir in 1/2 cup parmesan cheese. Add breasts and cook until done. Serves 2.

Rub beef sirloin steak with oil on all sides. Season with black pepper. Add wine to oil in a large bowl. Add remaining ingredients. Stir to combine. Place beef in marinade. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least 3 hours or up to 12 hours. Remove beef from marinade. Discard remaining marinade. Grill beef over medium high heat for 10 minutes per inch of thickness. (2 inches thick cut would be 20 minutes) Cook to desired doneness. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing. Serve warm.

Mix pie shell ingredients with a fork or pastry blender in large bowl until blended. Press into bottom of pie plate or pan. Bake at 425 F for 10 minutes. In a saucepan combine corn syrup and sugar with a wire whisk over medium heat until corn syrup is dissolved. Bring to a boil over med heat, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and stir in salt. Place eggs into a medium bowl with a wire whisk. Pour hot syrup mixture over eggs while whisking continuously until thickened, about 12 minutes (mixture will be very hot). Stir in vanilla and pecans. Pour mixture into cooled pie shellchill until set. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Heat butter in a large soup pot. Saute celery and onion in butter for 5 minutes. Add flour and stir constantly until flour is a light brown. Gradually add milk. Bring to boil. Stir in potatoes and clams. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot. Makes about 3 quarts. Enjoy.
Mix all ingredients together. Wrap with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours. Slice and serve with crackers.

Mix flour and soymilk lite together. Add oil and beat until smooth. Add bread crumbs and beat until blended. Stir in the egg whites. Pour 1/4 cup batter into a large nonstick skillet. Cook for 1 minute on medium heat until bubbles form on the surface. Flip and brown for 1 minute more. Serve. Makes 4 to 6 pancakes.

Heat olive oil and onion over medium heat. Add garlic and saute until soft. Add tomato paste and tomatoes. Cook until thick and bubbly. Add salt and pepper and herbs. Simmer for about 20 minutes. Add sugar and cook until it thickens. Serve over hot cooked pasta.

Saute garlic in sesame oil until it starts to brown. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Add sugar and soy sauce and mix to coat spinach in sauce. Remove from heat and sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve hot.

Toss all the ingredients together in a large bowl and stir until mixed well. Spread into the bottom of an ovenproof dish that is not non stick. Place into the oven and roast until the asparagus is tender and the tomatoes are slightly charred around the edges (about 20 minutes).

Preheat oven to 325. In a large bowl combine the lemon cake mix with the water and the oil. In a separate bowl beat together the eggs and lemon flavor instant pudding and pie filling. Add to the cake mix and stir until smooth. Pour into two greased and floured tube pans. Bake for 40 minutes. Add the white chocolate chips to the batter. Pour into one tube pan. Allow the other cake to cool completely. Frost one cake with white chocolate and then decorate with the lemon colored white chocolate chips. Place the other cake on a cake round and frost with white chocolate. Allow the white chocolate to harden. Place the second cake on the first and place the cakes on a cake stand. Cut a circle of plastic wrap and place on the cake stand. Place a cake on the circle of plastic and gently press down on the cakes to smooth them. Using a toothpick mark the edge of the cakes. Frost the cakes with white chocolate and then decorate with the lemon

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until translucent, 3 to 5 minutes. Add the bell peppers and cook until the bell peppers are softened, 4 to 5 minutes. Add the couscous and the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the saucepan. Stir until the couscous is well coated. Pour in 1 and 1/2 cups of boiling water and stir well. Cover the saucepan and cook for 5 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and cook for 10 minutes or until the couscous is tender. Stir in the cucumber. Top with the tomatoes and season with salt and pepper.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Cook orzo according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil and the margarine over medium heat. Saute the onions until they are tender. Add the vegetable mix and the orzo and cook until all of the vegetables are tender. Stir in the onion soup mix. Stir in the hot orzo and heat through. Serve with crusty Italian bread.

Mix together dry ingredients. Add water and margarine and stir until soft ball consistency. Drop by spoonfuls on lightly greased cookie sheet. Press with fork. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes or until done. Cool and remove from cookie sheet. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together butter and brown sugar. Add eggs and applesauce. Sift together dry ingredients and add to the wet ingredients. Stir in raisins. Drop by teaspoons on cookie sheet. Bake for about 10-12 minutes.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute garlic in butter until tender. Add chicken breast halves. Season with salt and pepper. Cook 2 minutes per side. Add alfredo sauce. Cover pan with a tight fitting lid. Cook 4 minutes or until chicken is done. Add frozen peas. Cook 1 minute or until heated through. Drain pasta. Stir into chicken mixture. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over top. Cover pan with lid. Cook 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Bring a large pot of water to boil over high heatadd potatoes and cook until tender, about 25 minutes. Drain well. Peel potatoes when cool enough to handle. Cut into half-inch cubes. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heatadd potatoes and onion. Cook until potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes. Drain excess oil from potatoes. Remove pan from heatseason with white pepper. Stir in dillset aside to cool. Whisk eggs until well-combinedadd milk and season with salt and white pepper. Cook eggs over medium-low heat until firm, about 7 minutes. Stir in potatoes and onion. Add smoked salmonseason with more dill. Serve immediately. Garnish with fresh dill.

Melt butter in heavy medium saucepan over medium heat. Stir in marshmallows. Cook stirring constantly until marshmallows are melted and smooth. Add cocoa powder to marshmallow mixture and stir until smooth. Add hot water to mixture gradually stirring constantly. Stir in nuts and candied cherry to mixture until completely dissolved and mixture is smooth. Add chopped cherry to fudge and stir until completely incorporated. Stir in semi-sweet chocolate chips. Stir in eggnog to fudge mixture until completely incorporated. Stir in vanilla to fudge mixture until completely incorporated. Stir in salt to fudge mixture until completely incorporated. Pour into prepared pan. Spread fudge mixture with spatula until smooth. Cover fudge mixture with plastic wrap, pressing wrap to top of fudge mixture to remove air bubbles. Chill in refrigerator for 1 hour or until fudge is firm. Remove from refrigerator and remove fudge from refrigerator. Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired. Store in airtight

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In large bowl, combine sugar and eggs and beat until light and fluffy. Beat in butter and almond extract. Sift flour and baking powder into egg mixture and stir until just blended. Fold in cranberries and pecans. Spoon batter into muffin cups and bake for 20 to 25 minutes until golden brown. Cool muffins in pans for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Meanwhile, cook bacon in heavy large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain bacon over paper towels. Place bacon in bottom of 2-quart baking dish. Top with onions and half the tomato sauce. Add bacon and cheese mixture to baking dish. Top with remaining tomato sauce. Cover and bake at 350 degrees f for 45 minutes or until cheese is melted and hot dish is heated through. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Serve with crisp lettuce.

Mix together all of the filling ingredients in a large skillet over medium heat until meat is cooked through. Remove from heat and set aside. Place about 2 cups of meat into each of the flour tortillas (I used 3-4) Place each of the filled tortillas in a greased 13x9x2 inch pan. Pour half of the can of Rotel over the top of each of the enchiladas in the pan. Sprinkle half of the Velveeta over each of the enchiladas. Repeat with remaining enchiladas & Rotel. Pour remaining meat & Rotel mixture over enchiladas in pan & sprinkle with remaining Velveeta Cheese. Cover enchiladas & cook in oven for 35 minutes at 350 degrees or until bubbly & lightly browned. Sprinkle with shredded Monterey Jack Cheese & serve hot with extra Rotel on the side for dipping!

Slice eggplant in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in a lightly greased 9-inch square glass dish. Slice tomatoes and set aside. Slice the butternut squash in half and scoop out the seeds. Place the squash in a lightly greased 9-inch square glass dish. Slice the peppers in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Place the pepper halves in a lightly greased 9-inch square glass dish. Mix the beef with the coriander and cayenne. Divide the meat mixture between the squash, eggplant and peppers. Drizzle the tomatoes with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place tomatoes over the meat mixture. Cover dishes and place in a 350 degree oven for 1 hour. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 8 x 8 x 2 inch pan with cooking spray. Place 1/3 of the lasagna sheets in bottom of pan. Spread 1/3 of sauce on top. Sprinkle 1/3 of the cheeses on top. Next layer 1/3 of the spinach on top. Repeat until all of the ingredients are used up. Top with remaining cheeses. Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Uncover and cook for 5 more minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Cut into squares and serve.

Slice the zucchini and carrots. Cut the bacon into small strips. Cut the onion into small pieces. Add the onion to the vegetable oil and cook for 4 minutes. Add the bacon and garlic. Cook for 4 minutes. Add the carrots and zucchini. Cook for 4 minutes. Add the self-raising flour and cook for 2 minutes. Add the eggs and cook for 2 minutes. Add the chili sauce and cheese. Cook for 1 minute. Serve.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain and put in a large bowl. Mix in meat sauce and water. Add broth and beans. Add mixed vegetables and stir. Refrigerate overnight. Serve with desired condiments.

Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a large heavy pot over medium heat. Add leeks and saute for about 3-5 minutes until translucent. Add potatoes and cook for another 5 minutes. Add stock or broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat and puree using an immersion blender or in batches with a food processor. Stir in cream and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot. Garnish with avocado and chives.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain, cool slightly then add to large bowl along with green onions and pickles. In small bowl, blend mayonnaise with mustard and season with salt & pepper to taste. Pour over potato mixture, stirring to combine well. Chill before serving.

Place crumbs in a 9x13 pan. Melt the butter. Stir in the cream cheese until well mixed. Spread the mixture in the pan and press firmly to form a crust. Chill. Spread the cool whip over the crust. Layer the walnuts and pie filling on the whipped cream. Chill. Garnish with walnuts and cherries.

Blend cream and basil in food processor or blender until smooth. Set aside. Bring large pot of water to boil. Cook spaghetti in boiling water according to package directions. Drain spaghetti and transfer to serving bowl. Toss with basil cream sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with additional basil leaves and serve.

Fill a large bowl with water and add one tablespoon of honey. Dip the carrots into the water and honey. Put the carrots in a paper towel and roll them around to dry them off. Serve with ranch or blue cheese dressing.

Preheat oven to 180 C (350 F). Grease a 12 hole muffin tin with butter. Cut a 15 cm (6") circle of bread for the top. Cut round slices of bread for the bottoms of the muffins. In a bowl beat together 6 eggs, 2 tbsp milk, 1 tbsp caster sugar and a pinch of salt until thick and creamy. Cut the rind of one lemon into small pieces (1 cm) and mix into egg mixture with some of the breadcrumbs (to stop lemon from sinking to bottom of muffins). Fill each muffin hole with 1 tsp jam and 1 tsp breadcrumb mixture from egg mixture. Put the bread round on top of each muffin then fill each muffin hole with egg mixture to just below top of muffin (the egg mixture should not be too runny). Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden. Serve immediately with ice cream. Makes 12 puddings.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add ground cumin and pepper. Cook about a minute or until fragrant. Add oregano. Cook about 1 minute more. Add beans. Cover with 2 cups water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until beans are tender. About 30 minutes. Add vegetable cocktail. Stir. Add 1 cup water. Cover and simmer until liquid is absorbed. Add remaining 1/4 cup water. Sprinkle with sugar. Add cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.

Rinse scallops and pat dry with paper towels. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat until hot, but not smoking. Add scallops and brown on both sides, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from heat and drain on paper towels. Peel and slice jalapeno pepper into thin rounds and remove the seeds and membrane with a spoon. In a shaker or martini glass add vodka and lime juice and shake vigorously for about 20-seconds. Add the jalapeno pepper and salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve immediately. To garnish, cut a thin slice of the scallop and place on the rim of the martini glass before pouring the drink. Top off with a splash of olive oil and garnish with fresh cilantro and green onions.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 9x13 inch casserole dish. In a small bowl combine butter, lemon juice, zest and 1/4 cup of sugar. Cut bread into cubes and soak in the lemon mixture in a large bowl. Drain bread cubes and arrange in bottom of dish. Top with pineapple chunks. Beat eggs with remaining 1/2 cup of sugar in a large bowl. Pour over pineapple. Sprinkle bread cubes with 1 tablespoon of butter and brown bread cubes in oven for about 15 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes. Pour hot custard on top of bread cubes. Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes more.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Grease loaf pan. In large bowl, combine flour with spicesset aside. Beat together oil with sugar until light and fluffy. Beat together eggsadd to oil mixture. Add pumpkin pureebeat well. Stir flour mixture into egg mixture until combined. Pour into prepared pansmooth top with spatula. Bake 40-50 minutes or until wooden pick inserted comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan to wire rack to cool completely.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Season the beef with salt and pepper and cook, turning once or twice, until browned, about 8 minutes. Remove the meat from the skillet and drain it well on paper towels. Return the pan to medium heat and melt the butter in it. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly for about a minute or two. Whisk in the milk and cook for a few minutes more until thickened and smooth. Set aside. Put the onions in the skillet and cook over medium heat until soft and translucent, about 7 minutes. Remove the onions and add them and the chipotle pepper and the meat back into the sauce and cook until thickened and smooth about 2 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper and cool for a few minutes. Butter and flour a baguette. Add a slice of cheese and a scoop of the meat mixture and bake until golden and bubbling and the cheese is melted about 12 minutes. Serve immediately.

Combine apple cider vinegar, brown sugar and apple cider. Add tart green apples and orange juice. Bring to a simmer. Cook for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Add smoked bacon. Allow to cool. Place in airtight container and refrigerate.
Season cutlets with salt and pepper. Dip in beaten egg. Dip in breadcrumbs. Fry in oil until golden brown. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line 18 muffin cups with paper liners (or use muffin tins without liners). In large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. In separate bowl, beat together milk, applesauce, egg whites until light and fluffy. Gently fold applesauce mixture into dry mixture until just combined. Gently fold blueberries into batter. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups (about 1/3 cup batter for each muffin) and bake for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for five minutes before removing muffins from pan. Makes about 18 muffins.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl combine eggs, sugar, and vanilla. Stir in cocoa. Stir in flour mixture just until moistened. Pour into 3 greased and floured 9-inch round cake pans. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until cake tests done. Let cool 15 minutes. Remove cake from pans. Cool completely on wire rack. Spread with marshmallow creme. Roll in coconut. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Cut cucumber into small cubes and tomatoes into quarters. Mix in honey and apple cider vinegar. Add salt and pepper and mix. Mix in onions and put in fridge until ready for serving.

Preheat oven to 180C. Sift flour, oats, sugar and coconut into a large bowl. Place butter into another bowl. Add hot water to melted butter. Stir until butter melts. Add golden syrup. Add to flour mixture. Stir in margarine until well mixed. Spoon mixture onto baking tray. Press down lightly. Bake for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool for 10 minutes. Store in an airtight container.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Saute carrots and garlic for 3 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook 5 minutes. Add sugar and thyme. Cook for 1-2 more minutes. Serve and enjoy.

Split bananas down middle and remove peel. Insert miniature marshmallows into each half of banana with a toothpick. Place bananas on a microwave-safe plate and microwave on high for 1 minute or until marshmallows are melted. In a small saucepan over medium heat melt miniature chocolate chipsstir until smooth. Place 1 scoop of ice cream on each banana half, drizzle with melted chocolate and top with miniature marshmallow halves. Let stand until chocolate is firm.

Combine sweetened condensed milk, brown sugar and butter in saucepan over low heat. Cook until thickened. Stir in vanilla extract and pour over cakes while still warm. Cool completely then drizzle over top of cakes.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Make pie shells according to package directions. Set aside to cool completely before filling. In a medium bowl combine pumpkin puree, condensed milk and eggs. Mix well. In a small bowl combine spices and mix well. Fold spices into pumpkin mixture and pour into cooled pie shells. Bake for 10 minutes, then reduce heat to 350 degrees and continue to bake for about 45 minutes or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown. Serve warm.

Crush crackers. Add sugar and pecans. Beat egg whites with vanilla extract until foamy. Beat in heavy cream until stiff. Fold egg white mixture into cracker mixture. Pour into 9x13 pan. Melt a Hershey’s kiss and place on top of each slice. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Melt a Hershey’s bar and drizzle over each slice. Yummy.

Slice cucumbers in half lengthwise then cut the halves into 1/2 inch slices. Combine all of the remaining salad ingredients in a bowl. Pour mixture over the cucumber slices. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour to allow flavors to combine. Serve over lettuce leaves or rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Rub margarine over inside of squash. Sprinkle with salt. Place squash on a foil-lined cookie sheet and bake for 45-50 minutes or until tender. Pour honey over squash while still hot and stir to coat. Serve with your favorite dressing if desired.

Bring water to boil. Stir in macaroni. Cook until tender. Drain. Meanwhile in a large skillet, cook the ground beef with the dried onion flakes until cooked. Drain off fat. Combine in a large bowl with the cooked macaroni, ketchup, mustard, salt, pepper, and the Velveeta cheese. Mix well. Pour into a buttered 1-qt. casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve.
Preheat oven to 250 degrees. Place all fruit in a large bowl. Stir in peach nectar and pour into muffin pans. Bake for 3-4 hours until fruit is tender.
Combine mayonnaise and Italian salad dressing. Toss with pasta shells. Cover and chill. Arrange shrimp on lettuce. Spoon pasta shells on lettuce.

Heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add the sweet potato and cook until tender. Add the mild curry paste and cook for a few minutes. Stir in the eggs and cook until eggs are set. Sprinkle with the cilantro and serve with a lime wedge on top.

In a large bowl combine cake mix, butter and eggs. Mix at low speed until well blended. Stir in milk. Add lemon extract. Bake in greased 9-inch square pan at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. Cool. Cut into bars. Roll in chopped pecans. Yield: 36 bars.
Combine all ingredients in a jar and shake well. Keeps 2 weeks in fridge.

Blend together the berries, sugar, salt. Add the oil. In another bowl combine the dry ingredients. Add to the wet mixture. Combine egg and milk. Add to the batter. Pour into prepared pan. Bake at 400 degrees for 50 minutes. Cool for 15 minutes. Remove from pan. Serve.

Trim the bottom of the asparagus and cut each spear in half. Place asparagus in a bowl and toss with the oil and garlic. Place on a cookie sheet and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for about 12 minutes, or until lightly browned. Remove the asparagus from the oven and set aside. To the same cookie sheet, add the bread crumbs and season with salt and pepper. Place the garlic clove in the center of the bread crumb mixture and drizzle with the lemon juice and zest. Place the asparagus back on the cookie sheet and sprinkle with cheese and remaining lemon zest and juice. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the bread crumbs are golden brown. Serve asparagus with grated parmesan cheese and fresh chopped parsley on the side if desired.

Preheat oven to 180c. Cream butter and sugar together and add eggs one at a time. Add hot water and coffee and beat well. In separate bowl sift together flours. Add half to butter and sugar mixture and beat well. Add remainder of flour and beat. Spoon mixture into greased and lined 23cm loaf tin. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes before turning out onto wire rack to cool completely. To make icing, beat together softened butter and sour cream until smooth. Add 1 tbsp hot water and beat until light and fluffy. Add sifted icing sugar and beat until smooth. Add coffee and beat again. Spread over cake.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place squash halves cut side down on lightly greased baking sheet. Bake until tender when pierced with fork about 1 hour. Remove from oven. Cool. Scoop out insides. Discard seeds. Reserve pulp. In large bowl, beat eggs. Add vanilla, rum, ginger, cinnamon, salt. Whisk to blend. Pour mixture into squash halves. Fill with pulp. In medium bowl, beat evaporated milk with electric mixer. Pour into pie shell. Top with reserved pulp. Place pie shell over filling. Bake at 400f for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350f. Bake an additional 45-50 minutes or until filling is set. Let pie stand 2 hours before cutting. Refrigerate leftovers.

Pierce the garlic cloves with toothpicks so they do not explode in the pan. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the shrimp and cook until they are pink, about 3 to 4 minutes. Remove the shrimp from the water with a slotted spoon and drain well on a plate lined with paper towels. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil until hot but not smoking. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook until the shrimp are pink, about 2 minutes per side. Remove the shrimp from the skillet with a slotted spoon and drain on the paper towels. In the same skillet, melt the butter over medium heat until it begins to foam. Add the garlic cloves to the skillet and cook until they are browned all over, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer the garlic to a small bowl to cool completely. In a small bowl, whisk the crushed red pepper flakes with the coarse salt and cracked pepper to blend well. Place the shrimp in the center

Put the cabbage into a steamer or pot with enough boiling water to cover the cabbage completely. Steam for 8-12 minutes or until tender. Cut the meat away from the racks of ribs and remove any excess fat with a knife. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Heat olive oil in a large pan or Dutch oven over medium-low heat. Add the ribs and cook for about 15 minutes or until browned. Transfer the ribs to the steamer and cook until tender, about 30-40 minutes. Serve with the steamed cabbage.
Drain coconuts. Place in blender. Add evaporated milk. Blend until smooth. Add gin. Add sugar. Add ground cinnamon. Add nutmeg. Serve in tall glasses.

In a saucepan, combine coffee, syrup, orange extract and 2 cups of the milk. Bring to boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to lowsimmer 15 minutes or until the mixture is thickened and reduced to 1 cup. In a medium bowl combine the remaining 1/2 cup milk with the chocolateset aside. Stir the hot coffee mixture into the chocolate mixture until smoothpour into 2 heatproof glasses or mugs. Top with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Cream butter and sugar and beat in egg. Add banana and milk. In separate bowl mix flour with baking powder and soda. Add to banana mixture with butter and sugar. Stir in baking chips and nuts. Spoon into greased loaf pan. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour.

Heat the vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the shrimp and onion to the pan. Cook for 2 minutes on each side until pink. Drain the shrimp on paper towels and set aside to cool. In a medium bowl combine the shrimp, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, cajun seasoning and paprika. Stir to coat the shrimp. Heat the vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the shrimp mixture to the pan. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until the shrimp is cooked through and the sauce has thickened. Stir in the cream soups and the milk. Cook over low heat until thickened slightly and heated through. Remove from heat and stir in the shrimp. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles.

Combine all the fruit and marshmallows in a large bowl. Pour the sugar over all the fruit and marshmallows. Let stand for 30 minutes. Add the cream to the fruit and marshmallows. Mix well. Serve as is or over ice cream.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease 8 muffin cups or 8x8 baking pan. Beat cottage cheese until smooth. Add eggs& beat until just blended. Add corn& beat again. Add muffin mix. Stir well to blend. Spoon into prepared pan or cups. Bake 20-25 minutes or until done. For cornbread muffins, bake 12-15 minutes.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the asparagus and boil for one minute. Remove from heat and drain the water. Cool the asparagus under cold water then drain well. Cut into 1-inch pieces. In the meantime, mix all of the dressing ingredients together well and set aside until ready to use. Arrange the cooled asparagus in a serving dish and pour the dressing over top. Sprinkle with the chopped chives and serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Peel the potatoes and cut into 1cm cubes. Place the potatoes in a saucepan with enough cold water to cover them by about 2cm. Bring the water to the boil, then drain the potatoes well. Repeat this twice more, then add the potatoes back into the saucepan. Add the milk, then return the saucepan to the stove over a gentle heat until the potatoes are soft. Drain the potatoes again, then mash them with a potato masher until smooth. Return the mashed potatoes to the saucepan over a low heat. Add the butter, garlic cloves and a little of the double cream, then season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cook gently for about 10 minutes, stirring frequently until the mixture is smooth. Remove the garlic cloves from the saucepan and blend them in a blender with the remaining double cream until smooth. Stir the double cream mixture into the saucepan with the mashed potatoes then stir in the Gruyere until it melts and the cheese is incorporated into the potatoes. Transfer the rosti

Cut cream cheese into 20 pieces. Add beer and stir until smooth. Add ranch dressing mix and stir until cream cheese is well blended. Add cheddar cheese and stir until cheese is melted and blended. Roll cream cheese mixture into a ball and put on a serving platter. Garnish with chopped green onions. Serve with crackers.
Beat eggs until frothy then add the mayonnaise, relish, hot sauce and grey poupon, then fold in the tuna.
Mix all together and pour into ice cube trays. Freeze for about one hour. Remove from ice cube trays and place them in a ziplock bag or a plastic container and freeze.

Cut broccoli into bite size pieces and mushrooms into quarters. Saute garlic in olive oil for 2 minutes. Add broccoli and mushrooms stirring frequently for 5 minutes. Stir in rosemary and season with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Serve hot over rice, noodles, couscous or pasta.

Heat oil in large soup pot over medium-high heat. Saute onion and garlic for one minute. Add portabella mushrooms and cook for another minute. Add stock cubes and water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes or until mushrooms are tender and liquid is absorbed by stock cubes. Sprinkle with chives and serve.

In a large pan melt butter and saute onion until it turns golden brown. Add carrots, celery, peppercorns, bay leaves and flour. Saute vegetables for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add vegetable brothcover pan with a lid or foil and simmer over medium heat for about 25 minutes or until vegetables are very soft. In a blender or food processor blend until smooth. Transfer gravy back to pan and simmer uncovered over low heat until thickened. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix brownie mix according to package directions. Pour into 9x13 baking dish. Top with all-bran cereal. Pour in 1 cup of water and 1 1/2 tsp baking powder. Bake 20-25 minutes. For richer texture use 1/3 cup of butter in place of the all-bran cereal.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place a spaghetti squash in a microwave-safe dish. Cover with a damp paper towel. Microwave for 5 minutes. Remove squash from microwave. Use a fork to separate the flesh from the skin. Set aside. In a large pan over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add garlic and sauté for 2 minutes. Add squash, parmesan cheese, pimientos, parsley, salt and black pepper. Cook for 15-20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in large saucepan. Add garlic. Sauté garlic 30 seconds. Add broccoli and sauté 4 minutes. Pour in broth and bring to a boil. Add wine and simmer 1 minute. Add broccoli florets and simmer 3 minutes. Add basil and simmer 1 minute. Ladle soup into bowls.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and bell peppercook and stir for 5 minutes or until softened. Stir in the garliccook for 1 minute. Stir in tomatoes and tomato sauce. Reduce heat to lowsimmer for 5 minutes. Stir in kielbasa. Cook and stir for about 5 minutes or until kielbasa is heated through. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drainplace in a large bowl. Add the saucetoss to coat.

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees. In a small bowl combine brown sugar with 1/2 cup caster sugar. In the bowl of an electric mixer combine butter and both sugars and beat on medium-high until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat until combined. In another bowl combine flour and lemon zest. Add flour mixture and beat until combined. Add coconut and almond extract and beat until combined. Divide dough into two pieces. On a lightly floured surface roll each piece of dough to a 3/4 inch thickness. Cut into rounds. Place cookies on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 180 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove to wire rack to cool.

Combine the chicken and dressing in the crockpot. Cook on low for 6 hours. Remove the chicken from the crockpot. Place chicken on foil-lined trays. Place the trays on the grill or broiler for 5 minutes per side or until done. Serve with your favorite side dish and salad. Serves 6 to 8 people.

Bring vegetable broth to boil. Add oil and rice to broth. Stir frequently. Once rice begins to absorb liquid, add beer. Stir frequently. Add tomato sauce. Add cheese. Stir. Add broccoli florets. Add mustard. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with a garnish of parmesan cheese.

Boil water with 3 cups red cabbage and 1 cup apples and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain and cool. Add raisins to cabbage mixture and toss with sugar and vinegar to taste. Drain raisins and serve salad with toasted bread as an hors d'oeuvre or as an accompaniment to grilled meat or fish.

Melt butter in a 4 quart dutch oven over medium heat. Add flour and stir with a whisk until flour is a golden brown. Gradually whisk in water. Bring to a boil stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the vinegar and sugar. Stir in salt. Add the cabbage and cook for 5 minutes. Remove the pan from heat. Stir in the pepper. Add the polish sausage. Let stand 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Spread chive and onion cream cheese over a flour tortilla and roll up. Place roll in a sandwich bag or wrap tightly in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Spread horseradish over roll. Place on tortilla. Top with romaine lettuce. Slice tomatoes and place on roll. Slice monterey jack pepper cheese and place in tortilla. Place roast beef in tortilla and roll up. Serve.

Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F/Gas 6. Heat butter in a pan until foaming. Add cream and cream cheese and stir over a low heat until melted. Remove from heat and stir in cheese. Slice corn and put in a baking dish. Top with the cheese mixture and sprinkle with green onions and parsley. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and scatter with chopped garlic and nutmeg.

In a large skillet combine chicken, noodles, onion slices, mushroom soup, and seasonings. Cook covered over low heat until heated through and noodles are tender. Meanwhile in a large bowl combine mushrooms and bread crumbs. Spoon hot chicken mixture into a buttered casserole dish and top with mushroom mixture. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

Place pork loin roast on rack in roasting pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp pepper. Rub roast with 3 cloves minced garlic. Rub roast with 2 tbsp olive oil. Sprinkle with 2 tsp rosemary. Tie roast together with butcher's twine into two 3 - 4 inch pieces at 1 - 11/2 - hour intervals around roast. Place pork loin roast in oven and cook 15 minutes at 425f. Reduce heat to 325f and continue roasting until an internal temperature of 145f is reached, 25 - 35 minutes longer. Remove roast from oven and let rest for 10 minutes before carving. Increase oven heat to 425f. In a 3 quart saucepan, heat 1 tbsp olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 minced garlic clove and saute until golden brown. Remove garlic clove with slotted spoon and set aside.

Heat a little oil in a large pan. Stir in the onions. Cook for about 5 minutes. Stir in the beef stock. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Mix the flour with 1 1/2 tbsp of cornflour. Stir into the beef mixture. Bring to a simmer for 5 minutes. Add 2 tbsp of the cornflour. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Stir in the suet. Season. Pour into a 1 1/2 litre ovenproof dish. Dot the top with the butter. Cover with foil. Bake in a 350f oven for 40 minutes. Remove the foil. Cook for a further 10 minutes. Remove from the oven. Serve hot.

Prepare the adobo sauce by opening the can of chipotle chiles in adobo. Remove chiles and place them in the center of the paper. Carefully remove the adobo sauce. Set aside. In a food processor blend the tequila, lime juice, ketchup, adobo sauce, garlic, brown sugar, salt to make the sauce. Pour the sauce into a bowl. Mix the shrimp into the sauce to coat. Set aside. Heat the olive oil in a pan on medium heat. Add the shrimp to the pan and cook until they are pink on each side. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Place steaks in an ovenproof dish or baking pan. Sprinkle both sides of steaks with shallots. Pour in worcestershire sauce. Bake in preheated oven until done, about 15 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before slicing. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with parsley.
Cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Add flour and mix until well blended. Stir in walnuts and vanilla. Drop by teaspoonfuls on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes.

In a large pot, boil linguine according to package directions, adding a pinch of salt and pepper to the pasta water. When the pasta is done cooking, drain and set aside. In a medium pot, bring chicken broth to a boil and add a pinch of salt and pepper to it. Meanwhile, thinly slice the cabbage with a mandoline or by hand and set aside. Once the broth is boiling, add the cabbage to it and cook it for 10 minutes, or until it's softened and translucent. Drain the broth and set aside.
