In a small bowl or jar, whisk together the sour cream and the garlic powder until well combined and set aside. To serve the cabbage noodles, toss the linguine and cabbage together with a bit of the broth and the sour cream mixture. Top with crumbled bacon and Parmesan cheese (optional). Serve immediately.

Wash the oranges. Slice them in half lengthwise. Remove seeds and white pith. Rub the orange slices with honey, cinnamon stick and orange flower water (if you can get it). Serve with greek yogurt and chopped almonds on top for a tasty and healthy snack!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat butter, peanut butter and sugar until smooth. Add eggs and beat until well combined. Add flour and beat until combined. Press dough into a greased 8 by 8 inch baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes until the edges are lightly golden brown. Cool for about 5 minutes and then cut into squares. Makes about 24 squares.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Cut the potatoes in half lengthwise. Drizzle oil over the potatoes. Sprinkle with salt. Bake for 40 minutes. Remove potatoes from the oven and spread each with sour cream. Sprinkle with parsley. Top each with a slice of cheese. Return to the oven for 5 minutes. Remove from the oven. Serve.
Cook ramen noodles according to package instructions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Transfer noodles to a bowl and add peanut butter and soy sauce. Toss and serve.

Rinse duck quarters under cold water and pat dry. Sprinkle duck quarters on all sides with salt and thyme. Place duck quarters in a large Dutch oven or other heavy pot and add wine. Place over medium-high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook, partially covered, until duck quarters are tender when pierced with a fork or skewer (about 1 hour and 15 minutes). Remove quarters from pot and set aside. Increase heat to high and bring wine and remaining juices in pot to a boil. Skim off any foam. Reduce wine to about 1/4 cup. Remove thyme and garlic. Add duck quarters to pot and cook uncovered until duck is browned and crispy (about 20 minutes). Transfer duck quarters to a platter. Discard solids from sauce. Serve duck quarters with sauce spooned over the top.

Put the chicken in a crock pot. Pour the soup over the chicken. Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours. Take out the chicken. Pull the skin away from the meat. Shred the meat. Put it back into the pot. Take the chicken out of the crock pot. Place the stove top stuffing mix in the crock pot. Add the butter and mix well. Pour the broth over the top and stir well. Add the shredded chicken and the milk and stir. Put the lid back on and cook for 25-30 minutes. Serve with salad and rolls.

Pour pudding mix into 9-inch pie shell that has been prepared according to package directions. Bake for 7 to 10 minutes. Remove from ovencool for 10 minutes. Combine coffee and cocoa mixadd to pudding mixture. Beat the whipping cream until stiff peaks form. Fold into pudding mixturespoon into cooled pie shell. Sprinkle top with almonds. Chill at least 2 hours before serving.

Bring the vinegar, chicken broth and garlic to a boil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in soy sauce and seasoning mix. Add the chicken pieces. Boil for 3 minutes. Add the sesame oil. Simmer for 15 minutes. Serve with cooked white rice.

Soak brown lentils overnight and drain. Rinse them with fresh water. Put them and rice in a saucepan. Add 2 cups water and bring it to a boil. Cover and simmer until lentils are tender. Add 1/4 cup more water if necessary. Drain any excess water and add 1/2 cup chopped onion. Stir in 1/2 cup water. Cook for 10 minutes. Melt 1 tbsp. butter with 1/2 tbsp. olive oil and stir into onion. Add 1/2 tsp. onion soup mix and 1 tsp. salt. Stir and simmer for 1 minute. Add lentils and rice. Stir well. Cover and simmer until rice is done. Serve with bread.

Slice french bread lengthwise. Spread cream cheese on one slice of bread. Add a layer of cinnamon, a layer of vanilla extract, and a layer of powdered sugar. Top with a second piece of bread and press down so that it sits flat on top of the filling. Beat 3 eggs with a teaspoon of milk. Dip each sandwich in batter. Fry in hot oil on medium heat for 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Drain on paper towel. Serve with syrup.

Wash the zucchini well and grate the zucchini on a grater or cheese grater. Place the grated zucchini on a plate lined with waxed paper or a kitchen towel to soak up any excess moisture. Place margarine on the zucchini and sprinkle with garlic powder. Place a slice of mozzarella cheese on top of the margarine. Roll each zucchini slice into a ball and then place the balls into a greased muffin tin or 6 to 8 mini muffin cups. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes. Makes 12 to 18 bites.

In large skillet, saute bacon over medium-high heat until crisp. Remove bacon from pan. In same skillet, saute onions in bacon drippings until tender. Drain. Add potatoes to skillet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle with butter. Transfer to crock pot. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and cook for 30 more minutes. Remove bay leaf before serving. Serve with ham or chicken.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the garlic to the oilcook 1 minute. Add the dressing, teriyaki sauce and chickencook 10 minutes turning once. Serve with rice.

Combine all ingredients (except the corn syrup) and pour into a large bowl. Toss wings until well coated. Refrigerate for at least two hours. In a small bowl, whisk corn syrup and water. Dip wings into corn syrup. Refrigerate wings for at least one hour. Drain well. Spray with cooking oil and grill or bake at 400 degrees until golden brown. Makes about four dozen wings. Serving Size = 1/4 wing.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. In medium bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt. In large bowl combine huckleberries with remaining ingredients. Pour batter into muffin tins and bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
Blend together crushed pineapple juice, orange juice, vanilla yogurt and vodka with ice in blender. Add pineapple wedges to top.

Place apples and pork chops in large pot and cover with water and seasonings. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and cook for 20 minutes. Add bread to apples and cook until tender. Remove chops from pan and brown on both sides and set aside. To the remaining liquid add apples and raisins. Place chops into baking dish and pour liquid over chops and bake for 20 minutes.

In a large bowl, stir together the flour and soup mix. In a small bowl, stir together the milk and pepper. Pour the milk mixture into the flour mixture and stir until combined. Place the cooked chicken breast into the mixture and stir until the chicken is coated. Stir the cheese into the chicken mixture. Pour the chicken mixture into the bottoms of the biscuits. Bake at 375f for 10 minutes or until the biscuits are golden brown and the filling is heated through.

Make chocolate crumb crusts according to package directions. Let cool. Spread pudding in crusts. Top each crust with reduced fat peanut butter and cool whip lite. Top each crust with magic shell ice cream topping and serve.

Trim fat from steak and cut into thin strips. In a food processor or blender, combine steak strips with anchovies and process or blend until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Melt butter in a skillet over medium high heat. Season steak with salt and pepper and cook to your desired doneness. Remove steak from skillet and place on a cutting board to let rest for at least 10 minutes. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise and cayenne pepper and set aside. In a small bowl, combine steak with the mayonnaise mixture and serve immediately on a toasted bun with a pickle and French's yellow mustard on the side.

Prepare vegetables. Drain broccoli well. Drain cauliflower. In mixing bowl, beat soup with flour. Add cream cheese. Stir well. Stir soup mixture into vegetables. Spoon into serving dish. Top with crushed french-fried onions. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 450 degrees for 45 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Saute the onion until soft. Add the flour and stir to form a paste. Add milk and stir. Cook for 5 minutes until thick. Add the American cheese and stir. Add the paprika and pepper. Stir until the cheese melts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine spinach and watermicrowave on high for 2 minutes. Drainreturn spinach to saucepan. Melt 1 teaspoon of the vegetable oil in a 3-quart baking dish. Place chicken breasts skin-side down and season with 1/2 teaspoon of the soup mix. Microwave on high for 8 minutes or until done. Remove from microwave and place on a platecover loosely with foil. Remove and discard skin. Drain excess fat from dish. In a small bowl, mix soup mix with sour creamstir in mayonnaise. Add to dish. Bake for 10 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Melt 3 Tbsp of butterscotch over low heat until melted. Stir in 1 cup of powdered sugar until it is well blended. Stir in 1/2 cup of heavy cream. Add 1/2 tsp vanilla and 2 tsp melted butterscotch. Mix well until creamy and smooth. Set aside to cool to room temperature. Use to frost cake or cupcakes.
Cream together brown sugar and butter. Add flour and salt. Roll dough into 24 balls. Roll in cinammon sugar. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8 minutes.

Cook macaroni in boiling water for 3 to 5 minutes. Drain. Combine milk, butter and cheeses. Mix until smooth. Stir in drained macaroni. Pour into prepared 1 1/2 quart casserole. Sprinkle with white pepper and salt. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Remove stems from mushrooms. Set aside. Clean mushroom caps by using a small damp cloth. Cut a 3-inch slit in the center of each mushroom cap. Put crabmeat into the center of each mushroom. Lay a slice of mozzarella on each cap. Top with a small spoonful of cream cheese and a small piece of garlic. Add salt and pepper. Sprinkle a small amount of lemon pepper. Place mushrooms in a lightly greased 13- x 9-inch baking dish. Bake in a preheated 375 degrees f oven for 30-40 minutes or until golden. Serve.

Cook and drain pasta. In a skillet with oil and flour, cook green peppers and onions. Put in casserole. Mix soup and milk and pour over pasta. Top with tuna and potato chips and bake for 35 minutes at 350. Serve hot.

Warm the oil in a large saucepan. Add the garlic and leeks and cook over moderately low heat until the garlic is golden brown and the leeks are tender. Add the kumara and carrots. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the kumara is tender. Add the pumpkin and the stock. Simmer until the vegetables are tender. In a blender, puree half the soup. Transfer the soup to a large saucepan. Add the carrots and celery and puree the remaining soup in the blender. Add the pureed and blended soup to the large saucepan. Cook the soup over moderately low heat until the carrots are tender. Add the pumpkin. Serve immediately.

Dice steaks into small cubes. Heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the diced steaks and cook until browned, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with oregano. Transfer meat to a bowl and set aside. Add another tablespoon of olive oil to the same pan. Add the diced onions and cook until softened, stirring occasionally. Add the minced garlic to the pan and cook until fragrant but be careful not to burn it. Stir in the beef bouillon cubes and water to the pan. Cover pan with a lid and bring to a boil. Then reduce heat to low to simmer for about 45 to 60 min. Check seasonings adding salt if needed. Add steaks back to the pot along with carrots and barley. Cook until barley is tender but still firm to the bite. Add more water if necessary. Then transfer soup to a blender or food processor to puree until smooth. Pour soup into a large pot or soup tureen and garnish with fresh parsley if desired.

Place chicken pieces in a large plastic bag or container. Add herbs to taste, flour, water and mix well to coat the chicken pieces. Place in a pan and bake at 375 degrees for about 45 minutes or until golden brown. This can also be done in the oven.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place pork chops in a shallow roasting pan or baking pan. Brush chops with half of the ketchup mixture. Sprinkle with brown sugar, salt, pepper and remaining ketchup mixture. Bake in the preheated oven for about 15 minutes or until chops are cooked through. Transfer chops to a serving plattersprinkle with parsley before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spread the crust into a 9-inch pie pan. In a large bowl combine eggs and cheese. Pour into the crust and spread evenly with a spatula. Top with mushrooms and onion rings and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 40 minutes until golden brown. Let the quiche stand for five minutes before serving. Serves four.

Combine eggs, lemon juice, mustard, seasoning salt and dried parsley flakesbeat well. Dip fish fillet into egg mixturethen roll fillet in corn flake crumbs. Place fish fillet on baking sheetdrizzle with butter and oil. Bake at 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) for 35 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork. Let fish stand 15 minutes before serving.

Boil eggs for about 10 minutes then remove from hot water. Place eggs into a medium bowl and pour enough hot water to cover eggs by 1/2 to 1". Set aside for at least 15 minutes. In a large saucepan add eggs, soy sauce, sugar, star anise, cinnamon sticks, black peppercorns and orange peels. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat then reduce heat to a low simmer for about 20-30 minutes or until eggs are firm but cooked through. Remove from heat and let cool for at least 20 minutes. Transfer eggs to a serving dish then serve warm or chilled. Refrigerate leftovers for up to 3 days.

In a large bowl stir together flour, baking powder and salt. Add cinnamon and sugar. In a separate bowl beat the eggs and milk. Add the apple to the egg mixture. In a small bowl melt the butter and add to the dry ingredients. In another small bowl whisk together the milk and egg mixture. Gradually add the milk/ egg mixture to the dry mixture, stirring just until moistened. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an oiled waffle iron. Cook until golden brown. Serve with apple syrup.

In a heavy pan or Dutch oven melt the oil. Sauté onions until tender and lightly browned. Add flour and sugar and cook for 1 minute. Stir in dark beer and stock. Simmer for 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with crusty bread and fresh parsley and cheese.

In a large bowl combine the peanut butter with the soy protein powdermix well to combine the powder with the peanut butter. Add the sugar and then the chips, mix well to combine. Place the mixture into 1/4 cup molds (or you can use cookie scoop) Place the mixture into the freezer for 30 minutes, remove from freezer and roll into balls. Place the balls into an airtight container for storage. Each ball contains 190 calories.

1. Place all ingredients in the food processor and process until smooth. 2. Spoon mixture into a small bowl and roll into 24 balls. 3. Place balls in the refrigerator for an hour. 4. Remove balls from the refrigerator and roll in sesame seeds. 5. Serve cold.

In a large bowl add the pumpkin puree and the brown sugar. Add the cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and cloves. Stir well. Add the apple cider and mix well. In a large glass jar add the moonshine and vodka. Add the pumpkin mixture and stir well. Close the lid on the jar and shake well. Transfer the jar into the refrigerator for about 4 hours or overnight. The moonshine will become cloudy. Serve chilled.

Mix shortening and brown sugar together in a large bowl until well mixed. Add the white sugar and vanilla and mix well. In a separate bowl mix the flour with the baking soda and salt. Add the flour mixture to the brown sugar mixture and mix well. Add the egg and mix. Add the nuts and chocolate chips and mix well. Drop the dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for about 10-12 minutes at 375 degrees.

Soak broad beans overnight in a large bowl or glass jar. Next day, drain the beans. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and mix together. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serves 4 as a side salad.

Preheat oven to 350F. In a mixing bowl, cream together the unsalted butter and peanut butter until light and fluffy. Gradually add the sugars and continue beating until well blended. Beat in the egg and vanilla until combined. Add the flour, soda and chips and mix until combined. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto an ungreased cookie sheet or use a cookie scoop. Bake for about 12 minutes or until lightly browned on the edges. Allow cookies to cool on the pan for about five minutes before removing and allowing to cool completely on a wire rack.

In a large bowl add 2 cups water to 3 cups tapioca starch. Add salt and butter. Mix well. Add eggs. Mix well. Add cheese. Mix well. Add 2 cups milk and stir well. Pour mixture into a greased bread pan. Bake at 400 for 45 minutes.

In a large pot over medium heat, saute onion and garlic in the sesame oil until onions begin to soften. Add shrimp to the pot and cook about 2 minutes per side until shrimp is pink. Stir in curry paste and stir for one minute. Add broth and simmer for 5 minutes. Add green peas and cooked rice. Simmer for 5 minutes more. Adjust seasonings as needed. Serve over cooked brown rice.

Melt butter and brown sugar together in a pan. Add the banana. Cook on low to medium heat until banana softens. Remove from heat and let cool. Add the ice cream and stir until it is fully incorporated. Top with whipped cream. Serve.
Place steak in slow cooker. Add soup mix, water, and peppers. Season with herbs and spices to taste. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Add gravy. Cook for 45 minutes on low. Serve with rice.

Bake chocolate cookie pie crust according to package directions. Let cool. Chill until firm. Place 1 scoop coffee ice cream in center of each pastry shell. Pour 1/2 cup fudge sauce over ice cream to cover. Top with 1 scoop chocolate ice cream. Sprinkle with almonds and drizzle with chocolate curls. Freeze until firm.

In a large mixing bowl combine the starter and flourblend well with a spoon or fork. Add the baking soda and salt and stir gently with the spoon until combinedset aside for 1 hour to allow the starter to rise. Add the canola oil and stir until it is thoroughly blended into the doughset aside for 1 hour to allow the dough to rise again. Using a dough scraper or a rubber spatula, knead the dough for 2 to 3 minutes to form a dough ball. The dough is ready to use when it has doubled in size and is smooth and elastic to the touch. Roll dough to 1/2-inch thickness and cut into circles using a cookie cutter (or cut into squares with a sharp knife). Transfer biscuits to a baking sheet and bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately. Store leftover biscuits in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Reheat in a 350-degree F oven for 10 minutes.

Combine raisins, vanilla and brown sugar. Wrap up pecans and boil in water for 3 minutes. Drain. Stir together brown sugar mixture with flour, baking powder, milk and pecans. Spoon batter by heaping teaspoons onto a greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees F for 8 minutes or until brown. Serve with caramel raisin sauce. Combine brown sugar, water, raisins and vanilla. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thick. Serve over dumplings.

Melt butter in a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Add the onion, celery, and garlicsaute for about 5 minutes or until the onion is softened. Sprinkle in flour and stir until it is well coated by the butter and onion mixture. Add the chicken broth and bring it to a boil. Add the crushed red pepper flakes, smooth peanut butter, soy sauce, and peanutssimmer for 15 minutes or until the soup has thickened slightly.

Remove frozen vegetables from packaging. Place them in a microwave safe dish. Add coffee creamer. Mix until well blended. Add flour and seasoning. Add water and mix until well blended. Cook on high for about 6 minutes. Serve hot.

In a large pitcher, combine boiling water and lime gelatin. Stir until lime gelatin is dissolved. In a bowl, combine orange juice and seltzer water. Pour orange juice mixture into the pitcher with the lime gelatin. Stir to combine. Add ice cubes. Pour orange sherbet into serving pitcher. Top with orange slices and lime slices. Serve immediately.

Mix 1 cup breadcrumbs with 1 cup corn chips. Sprinkle crumb mixture over tilapia fillets. Combine remaining breadcrumbs with remaining corn chips. Sprinkle evenly over tilapia fillets. Drizzle with butter. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake at 375f for 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Cut cucumbers into quarters lengthwise. Slice onions in half lengthwise. Squeeze out seeds of cucumbers and onions. In a large bowl combine cucumbers and onions with 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp black pepper. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes or until juices of cucumbers are released. Drain cucumbers and onions in colander for 15 minutes or until liquid has drained away and cucumbers and onions are tender. Discard liquid. Stir together remaining 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp black pepper with sugar and oil. Combine with cucumbers and onions and toss well. Serve cold or at room temperature with fish or pork. Makes 4 cups.

Beat butter, sugars, vanilla extract, eggs and peanut butter well. Add baking soda & oats to mixture & stir just to combine. Fill cupcake liners 2/3 full. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 - 17 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Let cool completely before frosting. In a medium bowl, beat the remaining ingredients until smooth. Frost cooled cupcakes. Let stand until set before serving. If frosting hardens too much, microwave for 10 - 15 seconds or until soft again before frosting cupcakes. These cupcakes are great for holiday parties! You can even decorate them with miniature candy canes!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Place a piece of parmesan cheese on each breast. In a shallow dish or bowl combine shake-n-bake and milk. Dip each breast into mixture. Coat with bread crumbs. Place breasts in oven. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and add 1/4 cup Miracle Whip to each breast. Bake for another 5 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with your favorite side dish.

Start by preheating your grill to medium high heat for about ten minutes before you start cooking this meal. Meanwhile, put your pizza dough in the oven on a baking sheet and cook until it is golden brown on the bottom, about eight to ten minutes. Once it’s golden brown, remove it from the oven and add a generous amount of barbecue sauce to the bottom crust of the pizza and spread it around evenly. Next, top the pizza dough with cooked chicken and red onion and then sprinkle a generous amount of chili sauce over the pizza. Once the chili sauce is on the pizza dough, top the pizza with mozzarella cheese and put it back into the oven until the cheese is golden brown and bubbly on the top of the pizza crust, about two to three minutes. Finally, remove the pizza from the grill and sprinkle some fresh cilantro on top of the pizza for a little extra flavor and then serve immediately.

Make the lime jell-o according to package directions. Stir in cream cheese and vanilla until dissolved. Fold in pineapple and mandarin oranges. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch pan and refrigerate. Prepare the whipped cream cheese filling. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Stir in whipped topping. Spoon into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Chill until set. Cut lime jell-o into cubes and place in pan of whipped cream cheese. Refrigerate until serving. Garnish each serving with a pecan half and a strawberry.

Peel the garlic cloves and cut them lengthwise into half moons or quarters if large. Place the garlic pieces on a small plate or paper towel and rub the top and bottom of the garlic cloves with the side of a knife or the back of a spoon several times until the cloves are bruised and have released their bitter allicin. Place the garlic into a blender or food processor and add the egg yolks and a pinch of salt and pepper. Add the extra virgin olive oil and the fresh lemon juice and pulse until blended and smooth. Transfer the aioli to a bowl and refrigerate for at least an hour before serving for the flavors to blend together. The aioli will keep for up to 1 week refrigerated or up to 2 months in the freezer.

Heat oil in a large fry pan on med-high heat. Cook ground beef until brown. Drain grease from pan. Add tomato paste and onion to pan. Stir to coat with beef and onion. Cook on medium heat until onion is tender and mixture is bubbly and thickened slightly (about 5 minutes). Stir in chicken broth, steak sauce and garlic powder. Cook for 3 more minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with sour cream or cheese. Makes 4 servings.
Brown beef, green pepper, and garlic clove. Drain. Add soup. Add macaroni. Heat through. Add tomatoes, juice, salt and french fried onions. Heat through.

Season the chicken with garlic powder, onion powder and pepper. Heat oil and brown the chicken. Add soup and cheese. Cover and cook for about 30 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Add olives. Cook for an additional 5 to 10 minutes until heated through. Serve over cooked pasta and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 8 x 8-inch baking pan. Beat egg with 1/2 cup milk. Stir in flour, brown sugar, and cinnamon. Beat until smooth. Stir in butter and vanilla. Beat well. Stir in remaining milk. Spread into greased baking pan. Bake until lightly browned and bubbly, 15 to 20 minutes. Cool completely. Slice into bars. Melt 2 tablespoons butter. Stir in granulated sugar. Spoon over bars. Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Stir in chopped pecans. Spread over bars. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease 13x9 baking dish. In medium bowl, whisk together baking mix, seasoning salt & pepper. Add milk & eggs. Blend well. Fold in cooked chicken & frozen chopped broccoli. Pour into prepared dish. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until casserole is done. Serve with cilantro lime sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together butter and both sugars till light and fluffy. Add eggs, mixing well after each addition. Add brewed espresso and vanilla extract. Slowly add flour. After everything else is throughly combined, add 10 ounces of dark bittersweet chocolate. Form into 1-2 tablespoons sized balls, 12 cookie balls to a standard cookie sheet. Bake for 8 - 10 minutes or till lightly golden on the edges. Let cool on the cookie sheet till cookie begins to set up some then transfer to cooling racks.

Mix brown sugar, olive oil, wine, soy sauce, lemon juice in a bowl until blendedpour over salmon fillets in a baking dish. Bake in a preheated 450-degree oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 10 minutes per inch of thickness of fillet. Let stand 10 minutes before serving with rice. Serves 2-4 people.

Heat 1 tablespoon butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Season beef filets with curry pasteadd to skillet. Cook until browned on both sides. Add remaining 2 tablespoons butter to pan. Cook until butter melts. Stir in 4 cups brothbring to boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer, partially covered, 10 minutes. Stir in couscous. Coverremove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir in tomatoes. Stir in mint. Sprinkle with almonds.

Mix flour, baking powder and soda together. Cream together the powdered milk and 1 cup of sugar with the prunes and the eggs. Add the flour mixture and mix well. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 10-in. fluted tube pan. Sprinkle with the remaining sugar and bake at 350 for 45-50 minutes or until a tester inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 15 minutes before removing from the pan. Serve warm or chilled. Yield: 16-20 servings.

In a blender or food processor place the sour cream and the fresh basil leaves. Blend or process for 2 minutes or until mixture is thick and smooth. With motor running, slowly pour in the mayonnaise. Blend or process for 30 seconds or until combined. Blend or process for 30 seconds more. Add the black peppercorns and crushed red pepper flakes. Blend or process for 5 seconds to combine. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 3 days.

In a large stockpot, saute onion in oil until translucent. Add corn kernels, broth, red pepper flakes, thyme, rosemary, basil, cayenne, salt and pepper. Bring mixture to a boilreduce heat to medium-low and simmer until corn is tender. Serve corn chowder immediately with desired garnishes.

Combine apple cider vinegar with soy sauce, syrup and mustard. Pour over pork tenderloin until covered with liquid. Marinate overnight or up to 2 days in refrigerator. Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Bake pork tenderloin for 2 1/2 hours or until tender, turning occasionally. Let pork stand at room temperature for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with steamed rice.

Place chicken and cucumber in a food processor or blender. Add dressing and blend until smooth. Layer lettuce and chicken mixture on each tortilla. Fold in each end and roll up. Serve with lime wedges and a dollop of salsa if desired.

Wash cabbage, cut off stem end. Cut cabbage in half lengthwise. Slice off core. Cut cabbage into 1 inch thick strips. Cut each strip into 2 inch pieces. Place 1 cup water in a 6 quart saucepan. Add cabbage. Cover and cook over medium heat 10 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Drain. In a large skillet cook bacon until crisp. Drain baconcrumble. Drain fat from skillet. Add onioncook 5 minutes. Add cabbage, soy sauce. Cook 5 minutes. Cook egg noodles as directed on package. Drain. Stir egg noodles into cabbage mixture.
Crush apples in a food processor or blender to make apple juice. Mix in milk and sugar to taste. Add green cardamoms and serve in a tall glass with ice.
Combine the corned beef, horseradish, mustard and mayonnaise. Add the cream cheese and mix well. Spread on a sandwich thin or a cracker.

Finely chop garlic cloves and place in blender. Add sugar, dry mustard and salt and blend until mixture is completely smooth. With blender running, add the sour cream and oil slowly and blend until smooth. Stir in red wine vinegar and pepper to taste and blend well. Pour dressing into an air tight container and refrigerate until ready to serve.

First, prepare the chicken. Remove the skin from the breasts. Place the breasts in a plastic bag or in a plastic bowl and pour the garlic clove and vinegar mixture over them. Make sure the garlic is thoroughly coated in the vinegar mixture. Marinate in the refrigerator for about 2 hours. Grill the breasts for about 6 minutes on each side. Sear the breasts on a skillet using the oil. Cook until brown on both sides. Remove the pan from the stove and drain off the excess oil. Remove the garlic clove from the mixture. Remove the skin from the breasts. Add the soy sauce, honey, red peppers, oil, green onion, sesame seeds, and rice. Heat through. Serve.

Boil the pasta. Meanwhile, sauté the chicken breasts in olive oil with the garlic cloves. Once the chicken is cooked through, remove from pan and place in a separate bowl. Add the kale to the pan and sauté for several minutes. Add the cooked chicken back into the pan along with the feta cheese. Stir in the butter and the chicken broth. Once the mixture is fully combined and heated through, add the cooked pasta and stir until the pasta is fully coated. Garnish with additional feta cheese if desired.

Mix sugar, light brown sugar, salt in saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add cream and cook until thick. Remove from heat. Add pecans to mixture. Pour into greased 9x13 inch pan. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 4 hours. Cut into squares. Serve with coffee.

Boil peas and potatoes until tender. Drain and chill. Peel and quarter eggs. Chop basil. Chop pine nuts. Chop garlic. In a large bowl combine peas and potatoes and eggs. Add basil and pine nuts and mix. Stir in oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and chill several hours. Stir before serving. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve.

Mix brown sugar and granulated sugar in heavy 2-quart saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add butter and stir until melted. Stir in vanilla. Stir in evaporated milk. Cook over low heat 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter. Stir in marshmallow cream. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto waxed paper. Let stand until firm. Makes 48 to 54.
Squeeze fresh lemon juice into two glasses. Add whiskey. Top with simple syrup. Stir in ice. Serve over ice.

Put tomatoes in a blender and puree. Place in a saucepan and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in the basil and mint. Season with salt and jalapeno peppers. Toss with the pasta and top with a mixture of mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.

Slice bananas. Place a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add couscous. Cover with water. Bring to a boil. Cook for 10 minutes. Drain. Add bananas. Stir in evaporated milk and cinnamon. Cover and cook over low heat until bananas are soft, about 15 minutes. Stir in vanilla. Serve warm.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain. Place potatoes in a greased 9x13 pan and spread with ranch dressing. Add bacon and green onions. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375f for 25 minutes or until cheese is melted. Makes about 16 potato servings. Serve with a salad.

Spread soft cream cheese over bread. Arrange sun-dried tomatoes, salami and green olives on top of bread. Spread fresh basil over top. Place sliced tomatoes on top. Sprinkle with pitted black olives. Cut bread into wedges. Serve.
Preheat oven to 350f. Bake for 15 minutes.

Put 1/3 of the cabbage leaves in a saucepan with enough water to cover. Simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and drain. Meanwhile, brown ground beef in skillet. Mix with rice and carrot. Season with oregano and pepper. Form into balls with hands. Flatten the balls and fill each one with a teaspoon of tomato soup. Roll the cabbage leaf around the meat mixture. Place the cabbage rolls seam side down into a greased 2 quart casserole dish. Cover and bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with seasoning salt. Return to oven and bake for another 20 minutes. Serve with rice and fruit.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place a pie crust into a 2-quart casserole dish. Heat beef gravy in a skillet over medium heat. Add frozen vegetables and stir until heated. Add Worcestershire sauce and stir. Add cornstarch and stir until thickened. Pour gravy into the pie crust and spread evenly. Place another pie crust on top and crimp edges. Cut slits in the top. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. If the gravy is too thin for your taste, add more cornstarch. Makes 1 pie.

Melt oil over medium-high heat in large skillet. Add garlic, chiles and oreganocook until garlic is lightly browned, about 1 minute. Add tomatoes and tomato juicebring to boil. Reduce heatsimmer until thickened slightly, about 5 minutes. Stir in salt and pepper. Transfer mixture to blender or food processor. Purée until smooth. Transfer to large saucepanstir in sugar and bring to boil over medium-high heat. Remove from heatstir in filet mignon. Let stand 5 minutes. Brush both sides of bread slices with oilgrill or broil until lightly toasted, about 2 minutes per side. Cut filet mignon into 4 pieces. Place bread slices on plattertop each with 1 piece of filet mignon. Drizzle filet mignon with sauce. Makes 4 servings.

Pour 1 cup of water into a large skilletadd rice and cook over low heat, covered 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Stir occasionally. Meanwhile, sauté mushrooms and onions over medium heat until tender. Stir in the soup and broccolicook 3 minutes or until tender crisp. Add 1/4 cup of watercover and cook 4 minutes more or until rice is tender and broccoli is crisp-tender. Add mushroom mixture and chickencook over medium-low heat 10 minutes or until heated through and sauce is hot.

Heat oil in a dutch oven over med high. Add the chicken thighs skin side down. Cook until skin is brown and crispy. Flip and brown other side. Add garlic cloves, shallot and cook for 3 minutes. Add pepper, salt and wine. Cook until the liquid evaporates. Add the rosemary. Add the marinara sauce. Toss. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve.

In a large saucepan on medium-high heat, heat oil. Add chicken breasts and saute until browned on both sides. Remove chicken to a plate. Add onion, green pepper and celery to pansaute 15 minutes. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cover and simmer until vegetables are tender. Return chicken to pan. Stir in corn. Pour into a pie crust. Top with additional pie crust. Bake 40 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

In a large saucepan over medium heat melt butter. Add meatballs and saute until brown. Add celery and onion and cook until tender. Add soups and cook until heated through. Stir in sour cream. Serve over noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat together butter, sugar, vanilla extract, eggs and milk. Combine flour with baking powder. Add flour mixture alternately with milk to butter mixture. Fold in pecans. Spoon batter into two greased 8-inch round cake pans. Bake for about 40 minutes or until cake tests done. Let cakes cool on wire rack for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Let cakes cool completely before frosting.

1. Mix the egg with 1/4 cup of milk.2. Pour the milk mixture into the egg mixture.3. Add the chocolate chips.4. Whisk all of this together.5. Pour into small ramekins.6. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes.7. Top with a dusting of cocoa.

Remove and discard tough core of fennel bulb. Using a sharp knife, remove fennel bulb into thin slices, cutting along the bulb lengthwise. Slice thinly and set aside. Wash and dry lettuce leaves. Mix dressing ingredients together with enough oil to moisten lettuce leaves slightly. Arrange lettuce leaves on serving platter. Top with fennel slices and scatter tarragon leaves over lettuce. Drizzle with dressing and serve with pecorino romano cheese on the side for sprinkling on top of salad if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit and prepare a large sheet tray with parchment paper. Peel and finely dice 2 medium sized potatoes and place them on the prepared tray. Dice the garlic cloves and add them to the potato wedges. Dice the remaining 2 medium potatoes and set them aside. Squeeze the lemon juice over the potatoes and add the ground almonds and sea salt and pepper to taste. Brush the wedges with extra virgin olive oil and place in the oven for 35 minutes until potatoes are soft and golden brown. Transfer the potatoes to a food processor and puree until smooth and creamy. Sift 2 eggs into a small bowl and beat lightly with a whisk. Add the eggs to the potato mixture and puree again until smooth and creamy. Season with sea salt and pepper to taste and serve with toasted bread and grilled meats.
In a large skillet brown meat in hot oil. Add water and remaining ingredients. Bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes or until tender. Serve over white rice.

Preheat oven to 350F. Lightly grease a 9×13 baking dish. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs. Add the marmalade, butter, milk, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Stir until the marmalade is completely dissolved. Add bread cubes to the bowl. Gently fold until all bread is coated. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Serve warm.

Prepare the graham cracker crumb crust. To make the graham cracker crumbs, use the large holes of a box of graham crackers and place in a food processor or blender. Process until crumbs form. (Do not overprocess.) Place 1 ½ cups of crumbs in a 9 x 13 pan. Press crumbs firmly into pan. Place pan in the freezer for 5-10 minutes. (This will keep the crumbs firm.) Combine remaining ½ cup of crumbs with ½ cup of butter. Press remaining crumb mixture firmly over the graham cracker crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes until crumbs are firm. Allow to cool. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine lemon gelatin, boiling water in a small bowl. Stir to dissolve. Set aside. To make the lemon cheese filling, beat the cream cheese in a medium mixing bowl until smooth. Add lemon gelatin mixture. Stir to combine. Add lemon juice. Mix thoroughly. Fold in

Blend ricotta cheese, garlic, basil leaves, salt, and pepper together. Spread cheese mixture onto the bottom of the lettuce leaves. Add a slice of tomato on each leaf. Roll up and arrange on a serving plate. Sprinkle the basil leaves on top. Serve chilled.

Drain tofu and wrap in paper towels. Microwave wrapped tofu for 2 minutes. Drain. Set aside. Heat rapeseed oil over medium heat. Cook garlic until lightly golden brown. Add the tofu to the pan and toss until lightly browned. Add soy sauce. Cook for 3 more minutes. Add sesame oil, chinese five spice powder and honey. Cook until liquid evaporates. Toss to coat. Sprinkle sesame seeds to serve.

Remove skin and bones from chicken. Shred chicken meat. Place in a large bowl. Add apple and celery. Mix in grapes and walnut pieces. Stir in mayonnaise and juice of one lemon. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix well. Refrigerate for several hours. Serve on lettuce leaves.

Cut bread in half lengthwise and spread with butter. Brush tomato halves with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill tomatoes over medium heat until tender. Brush bread lightly with olive oil. Toast under broiler until browned. Arrange tomatoes and basil over bread. Top with grated garlic and drizzle with balsamic. Serve at once.

In a bowl add butter, cheese, egg mixture, green chilies to mashed cottage cheese. Season with salt and pepper to your taste. In a greased oven proof dish add egg mixture and bake at 350 degrees for 45 min or until golden brown. Serve hot with ketchup for dipping.

Rinse rice and put it in a large pot with enough water to cover the rice. Bring to a boil. Boil uncovered until rice is tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saute until translucent. Add garlic and saute another 2 minutes. Add cilantro and stir for 1 minute. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until broth is reduced to about 1 1/2 cups. Add cilantro cube. Cook over medium heat for 5 more minutes. Stir in rice and salt and pepper to taste. Cook over medium-low heat until heated through and no water is left. Add cumin and stir to coat rice. Serve rice with your favorite meat or vegetable dish.
Combine all ingredients. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Serve.

Slice asparagus into 1 inch pieces. In a large frypan, melt butter. Add asparaguscook 2 minutes on each side or until tender crisp. Remove from pan. Clean pan and set over medium heat. Whisk eggs until blended and add to pancook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from pan. Add milk to pancook until thickened. Stir in asparaguscook 1 minute longer or until heated through. Divide feta among 4 platestop with eggs and asparagus mixture. Serve with smoked salmon on top if desired. Makes 4 servings. Nutrition information per serving: Calories 337fat 19 gsaturated fat 7 gcholesterol 166 mgprotein 19 gcarbohydrate 10 gdietary fiber 1 gsodium 911 mgpotassium 314 mg.

Beat the eggs and milk together until blended. Mix panko breadcrumbs and all-purpose flour together. Dip the crab sticks into the egg mixture and then into the breadcrumb mixture to coat. Deep-fry in hot oil until golden brown and drain on paper towels. Serve immediately.
Shred cabbage and toss with dressing to coat. Add carrot and toss again. Add remaining vegetables and stir until combined. Garnish with peanuts and serve immediately.

Season roast with salt and pepper to taste and place in crock pot. Add water and soup mix. Cook on low setting for 8 hours, or high setting for 4 hours. Remove roast and slice. Place one slice of bread on bottom of bun and add one slice of roast on top of bread. Place 2 onion rings on top of roast and add 1 teaspoon of butter to each side of roast to melt into onions. Place on top of bread and roast. Top with 1 teaspoon of butter and add 1 teaspoon of soy sauce to top of each sandwich. Place lid on bun and cook on high for 20 minutes or low for 40 minutes or until cheese is melted and buns are warm. Add onions on top of sandwich before serving.

Preheat over to 180C/350F. Grease a loaf tin with butter or margarine. Mix flour, nutmeg, cinnamon, butter and sugar together in a large bowl. Beat in eggs and stir in flour mixture until well combined. Add bananas and mix well. Pour into prepared tin and bake for approximately 40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Remove from tin when cool and dust with icing sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a large pot over high heat. Add corn to boiling watercook until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain corn well. Meanwhile, peel potatoes. Cut potatoes into large pieces. In a large saucepan, bring salted water to a boil over high heat. Cook potatoes until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain potatoes wellreturn to saucepan. Mash potatoes with a potato masher or an electric mixerseason with salt and pepper to taste. In a small bowl, combine sour cream and heavy creamwhisk until smooth. In a large bowl or a large resealable plastic bag, combine potatoes with cornadd heavy cream mixture, garlic, chives, salt, and peppertoss to coat evenly. Transfer to a serving dishserve immediately.

Separate the eggs into whites and yolks. Beat the yolks with the yogurt until lightened in color. Stir in the red onion. Mix in the cheese and seasoning mix. Spoon the mixture into the muffin cups of a greased muffin pan. Sprinkle the green onions over the egg mixture in each muffin cup. Place the muffin pan in a large saucepan of water. Bring the water to a boil over medium heat. Cook the eggs 10 to 12 minutes or until the eggs are set but not hardened in the center. Carefully remove the pan from the heat and cover the pan tightly with a towel or cheesecloth for 5 to 6 minutes to allow the eggs to cool. Remove the muffin pan from the water and invert the muffin pan onto a plate to cool for 10 minutes or until the eggs are firm. Run a small knife around the edges of the egg melts to loosen them from the muffin cups. Invert the egg molds onto a plate to cool completely before removing the molds.

To prepare the sauce, combine the plum tomatoes with their juices, sugar, salt and pepper in a large pot. Cook on high for 10 minutes. Add the onions and cook for 10 minutes more. Add the tomato paste and cook for 20 minutes more. Finally, add the basil and oregano and cook for 10 minutes more. Serve over spaghetti. This sauce can be kept in the refrigerator for several days.
In a large bowl mix together cream cheese, cottage cheese, capers, caraway seed and mustard. Add in paprika. Serve with crackers.

Mix 1 cup of margarine and 2 cups of flour. Add milk gradually while mixing with a mixer to get desired texture. Cook 2 cups of elbow macaroni in salted water until tender (do not overcook). Drain macaroni and add to mixer with the onion and garlic powder. Mix well and add salt and ham. Spread macaroni mixture into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan and bake in 375 degree oven for about 20 minutes. Serve hot with crackers or biscuits.

Roll pizza dough out on lightly floured surface to about 10-inch circle. Brush dough edges with egg wash. Spread pizza sauce over dough to within about 1/8-inch from edges. Arrange cheeses and vegetables on sauce. Fold edges over filling. Brush edges with egg wash. Bake pizza for about 15 to 18 minutes or until crust is browned and cheese is melted. Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes before cutting.

Cook green bell pepper in olive oil until tender. Add ground beef and cook until no longer pink. Add pasta sauce and chili powder. Cook until heated through and no longer watery. Stir in macaroni and cook until heated through. Serve hot. Top with cheese if desired.

Make small cuts into bread about one inch apart all over the bread. In each hole place one slice of cheese. Beat eggs and add chives (optional). Fill each cut hole with egg mixture. Sprinkle bread generously with salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes at 375 F (190 C) or until eggs are firm. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. In a heavy 12-inch ovenproof skillet or Dutch oven set over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the garlic and cook until softened and fragrant. Add the onions and anchovies and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the rosemary leaves and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and add the baguette pieces. Place the pan in the oven and roast for about 10 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and brush the baguette pieces generously with the oil. Sprinkle with the sea salt and ground black pepper. Serve hot.

Slice bread in half horizontally. Spread bottom half of bread with olive oil. Place tomatoes and half the gouda cheese onto the bottom bread slice. Place top half of bread onto the sandwich. Spread bottom half of bread with more olive oil. Place onions and cheddar cheese onto the top of the sandwich. Place sandwich onto grill. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes per side. Serve.

Brown rice in olive oil in frypan over medium-high heat 1-2 minutes or until slightly brown and translucent. Transfer to a 3-1/2 quart saucepan or other large, deep cooking vessel. Heat olive oil and melted butter together in frypan over low-medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until softened but not brown, about 5 minutes. Stir flour into onion mixture to make rouxcook for 3 minutes. Gradually whisk in broth. Pour into rice cooking vessel and add chicken bouillon cube and salt. Bring to boil, lower to simmer and cook for 20-25 minutes or until rice is tender and water is absorbed. Stir in enchilada sauce and cook 5 minutes longer or until sauce thickens slightly and rice is heated through. Stir in carrot and green onion to coat with sauce.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Heat the butter and oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Saute the mushrooms for 5 minutes. Add the onions and saute for 5 more minutes. Add the mushroom stock. Season the mixture with salt and pepper. Cook for another 5 minutes. Mix in the tomatoes. Top the mixture with the sour cream. Sprinkle the cheese over the top of the sour cream. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve.

Slice phyllo dough into three equal pieces. Place each piece on a separate sheet of waxed paper and brush with melted butter. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and parsley. Roll up each sheet tightly into a cigar shape. Place rolled phyllo cigars on a cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees f for 8 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for a couple minutes and then top with poppy seeds.

Peel garlic clove and place in food processor. Process to a fine puree. Dice tomatoes and cucumber into 1/2" pieces. Place tomatoes and cucumber in food processor. Puree until smooth. Place tomato mixture in large bowl and stir in garlic puree. Add remaining ingredients. Mix well. Refrigerate several hours or overnight. Serve cold.

Saute onion in butter until tender. Add chicken broth and simmer for 20 minutes or until liquid is reduced by half. Dice 6 slices of French bread and add with onions. Simmer another 20 minutes until bread is soft and onions are tender. Serve with salt & pepper to taste.
In a large bowl, combine the corn, rice, garlic, ginger, lemon juice, oil, salt and pepper. Add the avocados. Toss the mixture. If desired, sprinkle the mixture with cilantro.

Combine apricot halves, brandy, flour, salt, brown sugar, butter in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Add apples. Cook until apples are tender, about 30 minutes. Transfer to a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish. Stir in the oats. Bake at 375f for 25 minutes. Top with almonds. Serve warm.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add carrots and onionscook and stir for 2 minutes. Add celery and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in broths and winebring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer for 15 minutes. Stir in tarragon. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

In a large bowl, mix together the marmalade and mustard. Add the wings to the sauce mixture. Coat wings evenly with sauce. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 8 hours. When ready to serve, drain wings well. Preheat oven to 400. Place wings in a single layer onto a baking sheet. Bake for 25 minutes or until wings are golden brown. Serve with celery sticks.

Preheat the oven to 425F. Combine lime juice, paprika, cumin, salt and pepper in a small bowl. Rub chicken with mixture. Put the chicken on a rack in a large baking pan. Roast 45 minutes or until a thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the leg reads 165F. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest 10 minutes. Carve and serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a muffin tin. In a large bowl combine all the ingredients. Stir until blended. Fill each muffin cup about 3/4 full. Bake for 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let stand for 5 minutes. Remove from the muffin cups and serve warm.

Wash and scrub potatoes and put into a large pot and cover with cold water. Bring water to a boil over medium heat. Boil potatoes for about 15 minutes or until fork tender. Drain potatoes and put into a large bowl. Cut off bottom of roasted red pepper and remove seeds. Scoop out roasted pepper flesh and place into bowl with potatoes. Add spinach leaves and chicken broth. Using a potato masher or a fork, mash potatoes and spinach until almost smooth. Add roasted red pepper and butter and stir to combine. Sprinkle with rosemary and serve.

Add a tablespoon of the extra virgin olive oil to a large nonstick skillet. Add the onions. Cook over medium heat until softened. Add the rice and stir for 2 minutes. Pour in the chicken stock. Stir occasionally until rice is tender. In a small bowl combine the remaining 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil with the Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese. Stir until melted. Sprinkle with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Stir into the rice mixture. Cover with plastic wrap. Microwave for 12 minutes on high. Remove the plastic wrap. Stir. Cook in microwave for another 2 minutes. Stir in the parsley. Serve immediately.

In large pot over medium heat, heat oil. Add potatoes, yellow onion, carrots and celery. Cook for 5 minutes. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender. Add creamed corn. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Transfer to blender or food processor and puree. Return soup to pot. Add paprika and season with salt and pepper. Heat through. Stir in green onions and serve.

Place broth in a sauce pan and cook over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 2 minutes. Continue to whisk. Remove from heat and stir in the butter and cheese. Cook for a few minutes until smooth. Place in a fondue pot. Add additional broth or milk if needed.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Combine the red onion, jalapeno, cilantro and canola oil in a food processor or blender until smooth and thick. Pour the salsa over the salmon fillets and sprinkle with the ground pepper and the sugar and salt to taste. Place the fillets in an ovenproof pan and bake for 15 minutes or until done to your liking.

Melt brown sugar, 1 Tbsp butter and corn syrup together in a small pan until smooth. Add baking soda and stir until dissolved. Add popped popcorn, mini marshmallows and graham crackers and stir together. Spread on a baking sheet and bake at 350f for 5 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and stir again. Spread on a baking sheet again and bake for 5 more minutes. Remove from oven and stir again. Spread on a baking sheet for the third time and bake for 5 more minutes. Remove from oven and stir again. Spread on a baking sheet for the fourth time and bake for 5 more minutes. Remove from oven and stir again. Spread on a baking sheet for the fifth time and bake for 5 more minutes. Remove from oven and stir again. Spread on a baking sheet for the sixth time and bake for 5 more minutes. Remove from oven and stir again. Spread on a baking sheet for the seventh time and bake for 5 more minutes. Remove from oven and stir again.

Cover polenta in water and bring to the boil. Stir and reduce heat and simmer until liquid is absorbed. Add butter and stir until polenta is smooth and creamy. Put polenta into muffin tins and press down to make flat. Spread 1/2 teaspoon of mushroom sauce over each polenta toastie. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately. Makes 6.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Butter 2 baking sheets. Slice eggplants into 1/4-inch thick slices and layer on baking sheets. Sprinkle with salt and bake until they begin to soften and turn light brown, about 1 hour. Mix basil with breadcrumbs and parmesan cheesesprinkle on eggplants. Sprinkle eggplant with salt and pepper and spread with egg. Place mozzarella cheese on top of eggplant slices and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake eggplant sandwiches for 10 to 15 minutes more until cheese is melted and lightly browned. Serve on bread rolls with pasta sauce on side.

Flake 2 slices of bread into fine crumbs. Crumble 2 eggs lightly. Mix the eggs with breadcrumbs, thyme and season with salt and pepper. Dust each fillet with a little of the seasoned flour. In a large nonstick frying pan heat the oil and butter. Dip each fillet in the beaten egg and then in the breadcrumb mix. Place fillets into the hot pan and cook for 2 minutes each side or until cooked through. Serve immediately with crisp lettuce leaves.
Boil beets until tender. Drain and cool beets. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Stir before serving. Store in refrigerator.

In a saucepan place sugar and 3/4 cup of water over medium heat. Bring to boil. Add cocoa and butter. Boil for 45 seconds. Remove from heat and stir in bicarbonate of soda. Add 1 cup of flour and stir well. Beat egg and stir into mixture. Pour into greased and lined 20 x 20 cm cake tin. Bake at 180 degrees for 30 minutes.

In a large bowl combine 2 cups of quinoa with water and 1 tsp. salt. Bring to a boilthen reduce heat and simmer until liquid is absorbed. Place chicken in a shallow baking pan. Combine remaining 1 cup quinoa with remaining 1/4 tsp. salt. Stir to combine. Set aside. In a small bowl mix together the bread crumbs, egg whites, 1 tsp. salt and 1/2 tsp. pepper. Combine quinoa mixture and chicken in another bowl. Spread the chicken in a single layer in the baking pan. Cover with the quinoa mixture. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Turn chicken over and bake an additional 10 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 tsp. pepper. Serve with ranch dressing.

Boil peeled and cut potatoes until tender and drain. Mix together cream cheese and sour cream and stir well. Add butter and paprika and mix well. Add in the cooked mashed potatoes and mix well with a large spoon or beater. Season with salt and pepper and mix until well blended. Serve hot or cold.

Melt butter in a large saucepan. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes. Add rice and cook for 2 minutes. Add broth and bring to a boil. Stir in orzo and simmer for about 2 minutes. Add lemon juice and parsley.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the leeks and carrots and cook for 5 minutes until softened. Add the garlic and cook for 2 minutes more. Add the pumpkin flesh and water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add chicken stock and simmer for 10 minutes. Add cream and season with pepper to taste. Puree with a hand-held blender or food processor until smooth. Reheat before serving.
Cook potatoes with 4 cups boiling water until tender. Drain and add remaining ingredients. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

Prepare Chicken: Combine lime juice and limes in medium bowladd chicken and marinade for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator. Prepare Asparagus: In a small saucepan over medium-low heat melt butter. Add vinegar and sugarcook over medium-low heat for 8 to 10 minutes or until sugar is dissolved and mixture is reduced by half, stirring occasionally. Set aside. Prepare Glaze: Combine brown sugar and water in saucepancook and stir over medium-low heat until sugar dissolvescook and stir for 1 minute or until mixture boilsremove from heat and set aside. Prepare Asparagus and Steam Chicken: Steam asparagus in saucepan until tenderdrain and set aside. Remove chicken from marinade and pat dry with paper towelsseason with salt and pepper. Place chicken in saucepanadd asparagus and glaze. Cook covered over medium heat until chicken is no longer pink in the center and asparagus is tenderstir occasionally and cook for

Melt 1 cup margarine in a saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat and cool slightly. In large bowl beat 1 cup margarine with electric mixer until light and fluffy. Gradually add sugar. Add peanut butter. Beat at medium speed until mixture is light and fluffy. Combine 1/4 cup margarine with 1/4 cup corn syrup. Add to peanut mixture. Beat until combined. In small bowl combine rice krispies and 1/2 cup margarine. Stir to coat. Add to peanut mixture. Fold in 1 cup of the melted chocolate. Pour into greased 9-inch round baking pan. Top with remaining melted chocolate. Let stand until set. Cool completely. Frost with remaining melted chocolate. Cool.

Mix soup mix with flour in mixing bowl. Stir in dressing mix. Add salt. Stir in softened butter. Pour into 15 x 10 x 1 baking dish. Put in preheated 375 oven. Bake 1 hour. Turn chicken over after 30 minutes. Remove from oven when done.

Combine orange rind, orange juice, egg white in small bowllet stand 20 minutes. Process pecans in food processor until coarsely choppedadd sugar, salt, chipotle chile pepperprocess until well blended. Transfer to large bowlmix in orange mixture and cranberries. Shape into 24 (1/4-in.) ballsroll in extra pecans to coat. Place on waxed paper-covered baking sheetfreeze 1 hour or until firm. Store in freezer until ready to use. Makes about 2 cups.
Beat eggs with butter and pepper in medium sized bowl. Then add soup to eggs and stir until combined. Pour egg mixture into muffin tins. Bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the salt and the farfalle pasta. Cook for 9 to 11 minutes or according to the package directions. Drain the pasta. Transfer to a serving dish. Add the olive oil to a large skillet over medium heat. Add the zucchini to the skillet. Cook for about 5 minutes or until tender. Add the garlic. Cook for about 1 minute or until fragrant. Stir in the almonds. Add the mint leaves and season with salt and pepper. Toss the pasta with the zucchini mixture. Serve.
Combine all ingredients except for avocado into large mixing bowl. Gently stir until well combined. Refrigerate for 2 hours to blend flavors. Garnish with avocado, if desired.
Spread bread with butter. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar. Toast until golden brown. Serve warm.

Heat oil in a large skillet over meduim high heat. Brown beef on all sides in the skilletremove to a plate. Pour off all but about a tablespoon of drippings from the skillet. Drain fat from beef. Put beef into a crockpot or dutch ovenpour remaining oil in the pan into the crockpot. Add onions, salt, pepper and garlic salt to the crockpot. Cover the beef with broth, tomatoes and soup mixstir well. Sprinkle the five spice powder on the beefcover the crockpot. Cook on high for one hour or on low for three to four hours until beef is tender. Serve with steamed rice or mashed potatoes.

Cover bottom of 9x13-inch baking dish with 1/3 cup hot water and 1/2 cup soy sauce. Lay out the chicken and vegetables and add the rice. Add the remaining sauce and stir well. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with crunchy peanut butter.
Simmer peas with broth. Add onion and garlic. Cook for 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Add bacon. Season with salt and pepper and garlic powder. Serve hot.

Combine 1-3/4 cups water and the olive oil in the large bowl of a stand mixer. Add the garlic and blend to combine. Add the salt and sugar and blend to combine. Add the all-purpose flour and blend to combine. Add the Italian seasoning and the yeast and blend to combine. Cover the bowl and let the mixture stand for 10 minutes. After 10 minutes have passed, stir in the parmesan cheese until blended. Transfer the mixture to a clean bowl. Cover and let stand for 12 hours. After 12 hours have passed, use the pizza dough in your favorite pizza recipe.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain well and place in a large bowl. Add butter, milk and miracle whip. Stir until blended. Fold in eggs, peppers and onion. Sprinkle paprika and black pepper to taste. Chill in refrigerator. Serve cold.

Heat oven to 400f. Place the tortillas on a piece of foil. Top with the lobster meat, muenster cheese, cilantro stems, and salsa. Wrap the tortillas tightly in the foil and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutes or until the tortillas are warmed through. Serve immediately with fresh lime wedges if desired.

Bring water to the boil in a large saucepan or deep pan and add chickpea flour. Stir continually for about 1 minute until a batter consistency is formed. Add salt and pepper to taste. Remove from the heat and pour into the middle of a lightly greased large baking sheet or pizza pan (if you have one). Sprinkle the rosemary leaves over the top of the batter and pour the olive oil on top of that. Place the pan in the oven for about 25 minutes or until the top begins to brown and the bottom of the socca is cooked through (do not overcook). Remove from the oven and let cool for about 5 minutes before turning out onto a flat plate (or on to a plate the moment it is removed from the oven if you prefer socca hot). You can also serve socca hot with a bowl of vegetable soup or other stew or on top of pasta or as part of a platter of other dishes. You can use the socca batter as a base for pizzas or breads by rolling it out into flat shapes or by spreading it into a thin flat round shape on

Preheat oven to 400F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. On 1 sheet, arrange tortillas. Lay 1 chili pepper, 1/2 cup cheese and 1/2 olive half over each tortilla. Roll up. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Spray tops with cooking spray. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the steaks. Cook for about 3 minutes on each side. Remove from the skillet. Meanwhile, combine the beer and ketchup in a bowl. Place the garlic cloves in the skillet. Cook until tender. Add the chili powder. Stir well. Place the steaks back into the skillet. Pour in the beer mixture. Cover the skillet with a lid. Cook for about 5 minutes. Uncover. Sprinkle the brown sugar and grainy mustard over the steaks. Cover the skillet with a lid again. Cook for another 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Stir the sauce occasionally. Sprinkle the salt and pepper over the steaks. Remove from the skillet. Place the steaks on a serving platter. Pour the sauce over the steaks. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 375f grease a 9×13 baking pan with non stick cooking spray. Cut the pear in half, remove the core, dice the pear. Cut the carrots in half lengthwise, then into quarters. Cut the parsnips in half lengthwise, then into quarters. Toss the vegetables with the oil and place on a baking sheet. Place in the oven for about 20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender when pierced with a fork. Meanwhile, mix the salt with the pepper in a small bowl. Add the chervil and toss to coat. Remove the vegetables from the oven. Transfer the vegetables to the pan, add the parsley mixture, toss lightly. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine light italian dressing and cheddar cheese soup. Stir to blend well. Pour 2 cups dressing mixture into a large zip lock bag. Add chicken breasts and seal the bag. Marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 baking pan with cooking spray and set aside. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add 1 tbsp of olive oil. Place a tortilla into the skillet and top with 2 tablespoons of cheddar cheese soup. Cook tortilla for 1-2 minutes until cheese begins to melt. Remove from skillet and place into prepared baking pan. Repeat with the remaining tortillas and cheddar cheese soup. Sprinkle with green onions and red bell peppers and bake for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and tortillas are crisp. Serve immediately with additional cheddar cheese soup for dipping.

In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. When hot, add the rice, cumin, chili powder, salt and pepper to taste. Cook over medium heat for about 3 minutes, or until rice has taken a rich brown color. Pour in the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low simmer, cover partially, and cook for 15 minutes or until all the liquid has been absorbed. Remove from the heat and fluff the rice with a fork. Stir in the green bell pepper. Serve immediately with additional chili powder sprinkled over each portion.

Cook rice and cool. Stir in currants and mayonnaise. Toss with cooled rice mixture. Add almonds and chicken. Chill for several hours or until serving time. Toss with curry powder and chutney just before serving. Serve with crackers or as a sandwich spread.

Cook sausage in a skillet over medium-high heat until brown and crumblydrain grease and reserve sausage. Meanwhile, in a large skillet cook mushrooms and garlic in a little oil until mushrooms are softstir in 1/4 cup reserved sausage grease. Add collard greensstir in Italian seasonings and 2/3 cup watercover and cook 10 minutes or until tender. Draindiscard liquid. Cook pasta according to package directionsdrain. Transfer pasta and sauce to a large shallow baking dishtop with mushroom mixture and cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook carrots until just tender. Drain and cool. Add butter and carrots to a large saucepan. Add the onions and cook for 5 minutes or until golden brown. Stir in the orange juice and jelly. Reduce heat to low and cook for 10 minutes or until the liquid is thick and syrupy. Season with salt and fresh parsley. Serve warm.

In a shallow glass dish or resealable plastic food storage bag, combine worcestershire sauce, basil, red wine vinegar, oil, honey, garlic cloves and pepper. Add the steak to the marinade, cover the dish or bag tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 24 to 48 hours to marinate. Grill or broil the steaks to desired donenessabout 3 to 5 minutes per side for rare to medium rare depending on thickness of steak. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing. Garnish with lemon wedges if desired.

Put pork shoulder and 1 cup broth in crock pot. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours. Remove meat from crock pot and shred meat. Add remaining broth and barbecue sauce and heat through. Serve on buns. Makes 6 servings.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown meat and onions in skillet. Add remaining ingredients. Cook 1 hour. Uncover and continue to bake for 15 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Mix egg whites and cream of tartar. Gradually add sugar substitute. Add baking powder. Gradually add popped popcorn. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes. Makes 3 dozen.

To make crackersIn medium bowl combine all crackers mix ingredientsgradually add dry mix to oil mixture with wire whisk until thoroughly combinedspread evenly in greased 15x10x1-inch panrefrigerate 1 hour or until firmcut into barswrap in plastic wraprefrigerate at least 4 hours to 2 dayscut into 1-inch squares for serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Slice pumpkin into a large roasting pan and roast until tender. Remove from oven. Scoop out the seeds and roast them along with the pumpkin. Set pumpkin aside to cool. Cut pumpkin into cubes. Dice onion. Combine pumpkin and onion. In a heavy pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add pumpkin and onion and sauté until tender. Add stock and scallions. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add roasted pumpkin and roasted pumpkin seeds. Add thyme and bay leaves. Season with pepper and salt. Simmer for another 10 minutes. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

In a large pot of cold water, add carrots and potatoes and bring to a boil. Cook until tender, about 8-10 minutes. Drain. In another large pot of cold water add beef to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 15 minutes or until beef is brown on all sides. Drain, reserving the liquid in a pan. In a large skillet over medium-high heat add onion soup mix, condensed soup, worcestershire sauce and brown beef on all sides again. Pour stock back into pan, add carrot and potato, bring to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 1 hour 15 minutes or until tender.
Mix all ingredients together and shape into 12 small patties. Place on a baking sheet. Bake 40 minutes at 375 degrees or until golden brown.

To prepare the filling:Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heatadd onion, jalapeno, and garlicsauté 5 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add tomatoes with their juicescook 10 minutes or until mixture is thickened slightlystir in tomato saucereduce heat to medium-lowsimmer 15 minutes or until thickened slightly, stirring occasionally. Draincool completely in refrigerator. To assemble the burritos:Place 2 tortillas in microwaveable bowlcover with plastic wrapmicrowave 30 seconds or until softened. Place 1/2 cup vegetable mixture in each tortillaroll upwrap in plastic wraprefrigerate until serving time. To prepare salsa:Combine salsa ingredients in blenderblend until smooth. Serve with burritos.

Melt chips in microwaveable bowl at 1/2 power (50%), stirring often. Add frostingstir until smooth. Add extract and coloring. Stir. Dip peppermint candies in melted mixture. Place on waxed paper. Let stand until firm.

Melt butter in small skillet over medium-low heat. Stir in brown sugar, corn syrup and walnuts. Cook until bubbly and syrup thickens. Remove from heat and cool. Preheat broiler. Cut the bread in half crosswise. Place half of the bread halves cut-side-down in shallow baking dish. Top with half of banana slices. Sprinkle half of the walnut mixture over the bread. Top with half of the eggs. Bake in preheated broiler until browned, 2 to 4 minutes. Transfer to plates. Top with remaining bread halves. Top each with remaining bananas and walnut mixture. Top with remaining eggs. Sprinkle with remaining brown sugar mixture. Serve immediately.

Place all the chicken in the slow cooker. In a small bowl, mix together the soup mix, garlic salt, and water. Pour over the chicken. Cook for 4 5 hours. If you are using thighs, shred the meat when it is done cooking. If you are using breast meat, cut the breast in half. Serve each sandwich with 1/2 cup coleslaw. Enjoy!

Saute onions in butter until tender. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add pumpkin and wild rice and simmer until pumpkin is soft. Add chives and white pepper to taste. Adjust seasonings to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400f. Beat butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add the egg and beat until combined. Sift together the flours and add to the batter. Beat until smooth. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Cool on cookie sheet for a minute and then remove to cool completely on wire rack.

Cook meat until no longer pinkdrain & set aside. Combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl & mix welladd cooked meat & mix again. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving. Serve on lettuce leaves with tortilla chips on the side for dipping.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boilcook pasta until tender, about 8 minutes. Drain and set aside. Heat oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heatsaute garlic until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add chicken and cook until cooked through and no longer pink, about 10 minutes. Stir in pesto and season with salt and pepper to taste. Meanwhile, melt half of the butter and half of the oil in a large pan over medium heatbring to a simmer and cook until foamy and fragrant, about 1 minuteadd heavy cream and cook until it is reduced by half, about 1 minutestir in chicken stock and simmer until reduced by half, about 1 minuteremove from heat and season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer half of the penne pasta and half of chicken mixture to each of 2 plates. Top with remaining pesto, half of butter mixture and half of chicken mixtureserve with remaining penne pasta and remaining butter mixture and chicken mixture.

Preheat a large skillet over medium heat and add vegetable oil and corned beefcook until browned and drain any excess fat. Add chopped onions and green and red bell peppers and cook until tender. Stir in hash browns and season with cajun seasoning and water and simmer for 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a small bowl combine oil and cake mix. Mix well. Spoon into lightly greased 9 by 13 inch baking dish. Bake at 350f for 35 minutes. While cake is baking make pudding according to box directions. Allow cake to cool completely on cooling rack. Place pudding mix in mixer and beat on high for 2 minutes. Fold in apple pie filling and vanilla extract. Frost cake with pudding mixture. Allow cake to cool completely before frosting.

In a large pan cook ground beef with salt and pepper. Drain fat. Add tomato sauce. Stir in onions. Cook until the beef is browned. Add beans. Cook until heated through. Place a layer of mashed potatoes over the beef mixture. Place a layer of cheese over the potatoes. Place baked beans over the cheese. Place a layer of potatoes over the beans. Place a layer of cheese over the potatoes. Bake in 350f oven for 35 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Combine vinegar, water, bay leaves, whole black peppercorns in 2 qt saucepan. Bring to boil, stirring to dissolve spices. Reduce heat to low and simmer 5 minutes. Add eggs to simmering liquid, cook 4 minutes. Remove eggs using tongs, place in sterilized jars or hot pickling bottles. Refrigerate immediately.

In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook penne according to package directions. Drain. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the garlic and cook for about a minute. Add the sun-dried tomatoes with their oil. Cook until the oil has been absorbed. Add the sun-dried tomato paste and cook for another minute. Add the penne. Pour in the pesto. Cook until the pasta is heated through. Transfer the pasta mixture to a large serving bowl and toss with the basil. Top with the Parmesan.

Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Slice the stems off the mushrooms. Remove the gills with a small knife. Heat the butter in a pan. Add the sliced onions and cook for 2 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and leave to one side. Wash the mushroom caps. In the same pan heat the remaining butter. Add the mushroom caps to the pan. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove the mushroom caps with a slotted spoon. Place in an ovenproof dish. Fill the mushroom caps with the onions. Sprinkle each cap with breadcrumbs. Place the cheese slices on top. Fold in half. Roll each cap up into a log. Place the mushrooms into the oven. Cook for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven. Place the mushrooms under the hot grill for 3-4 minutes. Serve with salad.
