Prepare unbaked pie shell as directed on package. Place rhubarb, brown sugar and strawberry jell-o in large saucepan. Stir in enough boiling water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until rhubarb is tender. Cool. Mix rhubarb mixture with flour in large bowl. In small bowl, dissolve jell-o in hot wateradd to rhubarb mixture. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Chill until firm. Top with whipped cream.
Mix cream cheese and blue cheese until well combined. Spoon into each segment of grape. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Serve with champagne.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly oil a 13 by 9 baking dish. Cut bread into 1 inch cubes and lay them in a single layer on the prepared dish. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly toasted. In a small bowl combine the mozzarella and basil. Spread the pizza sauce over the toasted bread. Top with the mozzarella mixture. Bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Remove from the oven and let the bread cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Boil frozen vegetables for about 5-7 minutes or until tender crisp. Drain well. Pour vegetables into 1-gallon plastic bag with a snug fitting lid. Add dressing and shake well to coat vegetables completely. Pour vegetables into 13x9-inch pan with high side. Sprinkle with oregano and basil. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until heated through.

Place water and chicken broth in a 4 qt dutch oven over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and add carrots and celery. Cook 3 minutes, or until just tender. Stir occasionally. Add onion and ham. Cook 1 minute longer. Stir in the tortellini. Cook 2 minutes longer or until thoroughly heated through. Stir in the cream and parmesan cheese until cheese is melted and hot. Season with black pepper, if desired. Serve immediately over cooked pasta of your choice. Serves 4

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. In medium bowl, combine flour, cheese and garlic powderset aside. Place chicken in large resealable plastic bagseal bag. Using sharp knife, cut chicken breast lengthwise to make three 1/4-inch-deep slashes on each breastseason chicken with salt and black pepper. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heatbrown chicken on both sides, about 6 minutes total. Transfer to baking panset aside. Add butter to skilletcook over medium-high heat until melted and bubbly. Stir in white winecook until liquid is reduced to about 1/2 cup, about 4 minutes. Add chicken broth to skilletbring to boiling on medium-high heatadd hot water to make up 1 cup total liquid. Boil until liquid is reduced to about 1/2 cupadd chicken bouillonboil until mixture is reduced to about 1/2 cup, about 4 minutes. In medium bowl, whisk together flour mixture and lemon juice

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil until hot but not smoking. Add the onionsaute until tender, about 3 minutes. Add the chicken breast halvessaute until browned, about 3 minutes per side. Meanwhile, cut each hot dog bun in half horizontally to make four half bunsplace on baking sheet. Divide the sweet red pepper among the half bunstop each with cheese slice. Top each sandwich with the chicken breast halves and top each with the remaining half bunplace sandwiches on the baking sheet. Bake for 5 to 7 minutes or until heated through. Cut each sandwich into four pieces. Serve hot or cold.

Sauté onion and cauliflower in butter until tender. Combine broth and flour and add to soup. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes stirring constantly. Add milk and parsley. Cook until heated through. Blend cheese until smooth. Pour soup into a large pot. Add cheddar cheese and stir until cheese is melted. Serve with croutons.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat. Place pie shells on the baking sheet. Sprinkle half-and-half evenly over each shell. Place a whole green chili on each shell, and sprinkle with cheese. Place another shell over each one and crimp edges to seal shut. Place baking sheet on center rack and bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown and crisp. Serve with hot pepper sauce on the side for dipping and garnish with fresh parsley and nutmeg to taste.

Bake halibut fillets with spaghetti sauce. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute mushrooms in 1 tbsp. oil. Add halibut to pancook 6-7 min. or until opaque. Serve with spaghetti sauce. Sprinkle with cheesetop with mushrooms.

Cream cheese can be softened in the microwave or a bowl of warm water. Add cheddar cheese, worcestershire sauce, blue cheese and garlic. Mix well. Add nuts (optional). Roll into a ball. Mold the ball into a log shape and wrap in plastic wrap. Place in a bowl with a little water in the bottom of the bowl. Chill for at least an hour or overnight if possible.
Melt the butter. Saute the shrimp in the butter for about 3 minutes. Add garlic and black pepper to taste.

In a large bowl combine sugar-free lemon gelatin, orange juice and 1 cup evaporated skim milk. Let stand 5 minutes until the gelatin is completely dissolved. In a small bowl stir together 1 cup low-fat cream cheese and 2 tablespoons vanilla extract. In another small bowl stir together the remaining 1/2 cup low-fat cream cheese and 1 tablespoon vanilla extract. Fold the low-fat cream cheese mixture into the gelatin mixture. Pour into 6 individual serving glasses. Refrigerate for 2 hours until set. For individual servings use a small spoon to fill each glass. Top each glass with a dollop of the low-fat cream cheese mixture. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with a graham cracker or wafers.

Place 2 tsp oil and 1 tsp paprika into a small bowl. Add rosemary and garlic. Stir to combine. Place the chicken on a rack and rub the oil mixture evenly over the meat. Sprinkle with black pepper and salt. Place the chicken skin side down on a rack in a roasting pan. Add the potatoes around the chicken. Bake at 425 for 1 hour. Serve.

Peel onion and cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Saute onion and butter over low heat until tender and transparent. Add cream of chicken soup and pumpkin. Mix and heat until pumpkin is hot and mixture is smooth. Stir in nutmeg and seasonings. Serve immediately with thin slices of apple on top of each serving. Serve with hot buttered crackers or biscuits.

Cut the papaya in half lengthwise. Remove seeds. Fill each half with the mixture of the chopped onion, garlic cloves, tomatoes, ham, sweet peppers, hot peppers, breadcrumbs. Stuffed papayas can be frozen for later use.
Sift dry ingredients together. In another bowl combine milk, egg and butter. Add to dry. Mix thoroughly. Pour 1 tablespoon of batter onto hot skillet. Repeat. Flip when bubbly. Serve with jam on top.
In a medium bowl, combine the shallots and capers. Stir in the tomatoes, oil and oregano and season to taste. Mix well and let sit for 20 minutes. Mix again before serving.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees F (175c degrees C). Grease a 9x13 pan or a 9x9 pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine cake mix with brown sugar and crushed pineappleblend well with a spoon. Spread half of the mixture into prepared pan. Arrange peaches on top of mixturespread remaining mixture on top of peaches. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes before cutting into barsserve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

In a large bowl combine potatoes, soup mix & water. Cover & cook in crock pot on low for 3 to 4 hours or until tender. Add soup & cheese & stir well. Sprinkle with green onion & bacon bits or crumbled ham if using. Cover & cook for 30 more minutes or until cheese is melted & potatoes are tender & heated through. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Prepare sausage in a skillet. Remove from pan. Cook beef in same pan. When both meats are cooked add the onions to the pan. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the Velveeta cheese. Stir until cheese is melted. Add the sausage to the pan. Stir to coat all the meats. Pour the worcestershire sauce over the meats. Stir to coat. Add the oregano and garlic powder. Stir to combine. Top the rounds with the mixture. Broil 5 minutes or until cheese is bubbly. Serve warm.

Prepare the lemonade by adding the water and salt to the ice water. Place the sugar in a jar or bowl and add the lemon juice and the lemon slices. Shake the jar to combine the mixture. Pour the lemonade into the glasses. Drop the lemon slices into the glasses so they are floating on the lemonade. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Bake chicken pieces in shallow 11 by 7 inch (28 by 18 cm) baking dish for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven until done. Remove from heat and allow to cool for 10 minutes. Slice chicken into 1/2 inch (1 cm) slices. Toast rolls. Spread mayonnaise on the bottom halves of the rolls. Top with chicken, bacon and provolone cheese. Place the top halves of the rolls over the sandwiches and serve immediately.

Remove red pepper from the jar. Place the pepper on the cutting board and cut the pepper into 4 sections. Using your thumbs gently scoop out the seeds. Place the peppers onto 4 sheets of phyllo pastry. Brush the top of the phyllo with butter. Place the salmon fillets on top of the peppers. Wrap the salmon up tightly with the pastry. Place each salmon on a baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes or until salmon is cooked. Serve.

Dice eggs into quarters or halfs depending on size. Peel the potato skin and cut into large cubes. Dice onion and radish into small dice. Bring a large pot of water to boil for the eggs. Carefully lower eggs into water and cook until they are soft. Peel the eggs and cut in half lengthwise to get the yolk out. In the meantime boil the potato cubes in water until softened. Drain the potatoes and add them to the eggs in the pot. Add the onion, radish, fresh peas, dill sprigs and fresh parsley. Cook over medium heat until the vegetables are tender. Stir in the mayonnaise and mix well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with chopped dill sprig or dill weed.

Drain tomatoes and crush with your hands or a wooden spoon. Blend in tomato paste. Stir in basil and season with salt and pepper to taste. I used a food processor for the crushed tomatoes as I had a large batch to do. This recipe was adapted from the New York Times. I added the garlic clove to the sauce as I love garlic!

In a large pot with a tight-fitting lid, combine long-grain rice with water. Stir once. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat slightly. Simmer, covered for 10 minutes. Remove lid and stir. Add butter to rice mixture. Stir. Add turmeric, cinnamon stick, salt and brown sugar. Cook uncovered for 15 minutes. Remove cinnamon stick. Stir in raisins. Cook for 5 more minutes. Serve hot.

Mix flour, baking powder and salt in large bowl. Cream butter until fluffygradually beat in sugar. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in banana chunksmix well. Add flour mixture alternately with buttermilk, beginning and ending with flour mixture. Fold in chai tea bags. Pour batter into prepared loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour to 1 hour 10 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely.

Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked. Frost with cream of chicken soup. Top with sliced chicken breast. Sprinkle with tortilla chips. Bake for 10 minutes or until chips are slightly toasted.

Preheat broiler. Place salsa in small bowl and stir in dressingset aside. Coat both sides of steaks with oil and sprinkle evenly with pepper. Place on broiler pan and broil for 5 minutes or until desired degree of doneness. Slice steaks in half lengthwise and place on individual tostada shells. Top each with desired amount of dressing mixture and a piece of lettuce and cheese. Serve immediately.
Combine balsamic vinegar with sugar on a small plate. Arrange peaches on a platter or platedrizzle vinegar mixture over peaches. Top with blue cheese.

Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Fold in almond extract. Spread cake batter evenly in 9x13 baking pan. Cool completely. Fill each maraschino cherry with a miniature chocolate chip. Cut the cake into three equal layers. Place the first layer on the serving plate. Add a layer of frosting to the top of the first cake layer. Add the next layer of cake and top it with frosting. Add the last layer of cake. Add frosting to the top of the cake. Decorate cake with cherries.

Sauté the onions in the olive oil until they are tender. Add the meat and brown. Add the rice and beans and cook until tender. Stir in the tomatoes and chicken broth. Simmer 15 minutes and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Crack eggs and remove yolks. Fill yolks with crab meat mixture. Makes about 16. Place yolks back in egg whites. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and top with relish. Serve with mixed salad greens.

In a large saucepan over high heat bring the water to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium, add the tomatoes with their juices. Stir the tomatoes occasionally until they begin to thicken. Stir in the tomato puree, oregano, garlic paste, oil, vinegar, onion, and seasoning. Bring to a boil again. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pan partially and simmer for about one hour or until the sauce thickens. Makes about 3 quartsserves about 8 to 10 people as a side dish or about 4 to 6 people as a main dish.

Cut avocados in half remove pit. Scoop out the flesh and discard the skin. Slice dates in half lengthwise. Remove seeds. Place a slice of date in the avocado. Fill each half of avocado with one slice of date. Mix 1/2 cup sugar with 1/2 cup port wine. Fill each avocado with 1 tablespoon of the port wine syrup. Place in refrigerator. Serve.
Slice melon into serving pieces. Combine water, ginger, passion fruit and honeydew in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Pour over melon and serve immediately.

Brown chopped bacon over medium heat. Add onion and garlic cloves. Cook until softened about 5 minutes. Add frozen spinach/chard to onion mixture. Add butter, nutmeg, salt and pepper to taste. Simmer 5 minutes longer. Serve with grated gruyere or emmental cheeses.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees fahrenheit. Chop cauliflower into bite sized pieces. Beat eggs together with condensed milk in a small bowl until blended well. Combine flour with salt and pepper. Combine flour mixture with eggs mixture until well combined. Place cauliflower into 9x13 pan coated with cooking oil. Spoon half of the egg mixture into cauliflower. Sprinkle paprika over top of cauliflower. Spoon remaining egg mixture into pan. Sprinkle top of mixture with edam cheese. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes, or until set. Serve warm.

Cook mushrooms and onion in skillet until tender. Combine sauce, mushroom mixture and pepperoni in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Top with mozzarella cheese and bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with hot dog buns and tomatoes.

In a large saucepan combine rhubarb, water, sugar and strawberry jello. Cook over low heat stirring constantly until rhubarb is tender. Remove from heat and stir in orange juice. Pour into a serving dish. Cut the orange into small pieces and sprinkle over the top. Cut strawberries in quarters or slices. Arrange strawberries on top of rhubarb mixture. Allow to sit for 15 minutes before serving.

Put corned beef brisket in a roasting pan or Dutch oven. In a small bowl mix brown sugar and mustard and pour over the corned beef. Pour corn syrup over the corned beef and mix well with a rubber spatula to make sure all the meat is well coated with the syrup mixture. Cover and cook at 275° F for 3 hours until meat is tender and cooked through. Serve warm or cold.

Pour boiling water over puffed wheat cereal to cover. Let stand until softened and puffed, about 10 minutes. Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl, beat butter with electric mixer at medium speed until creamy. Beat in brown sugar until blended. Beat in corn syrup and vanilla until blended. Beat in cocoa until blended. Pour in puffed wheat cereal and beat at low speed until well blended. Spread onto a large ungreased cookie sheet to form a 10-inch square. Bake at 350 for 30 to 35 minutes or until firm when lightly touched in center. Cool for 10 minutessprinkle with candy sprinkles. Cut into squares to serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook garlic and onion in oil until tender. Add zucchini and saute until zucchini is crisp-tender. Drain off excess oil. Place on a 15x10x1-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Top with tomato sauce and Italian seasoning. Sprinkle with reduced-fat monterey jack cheese and lowfat swiss cheese. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until heated through.
Peel apples. Cut them into cubes. Stir in lemon juice. Toss with celery ribs. Blend together all the other ingredients. Pour over the salad. Add more celery if desired. Refrigerate. Serve chilled.

Combine lemon juice and light soy sauce. Add boneless skinless chicken breast and stir to coat. Marinate for 30 minutes. Drain the chicken and reserve the marinade. Heat a small amount of oil in a wok or large skillet and stir-fry the celery ribs. Add garlic and szechwan pepper and stir-fry until tender. Add the chicken to the wok and stir-fry until cooked through. Add the reserved marinade to the wok and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Stir in the cornstarch mixture and cook for 1 minute. Add the honey and stir to dissolve. Serve at once.
Combine orange juice concentrate, campari and sparkling water in a glass filled with ice cubes and garnish with an orange rind twist.

To make the pesto blend all the pesto ingredients except the walnuts. Pulse in food processor until the mixture is smooth and green. Transfer pesto to a bowl and stir in the walnuts. To make the dip, blend all the dip ingredients except the walnuts. Transfer the dip to a bowl and stir in the walnuts. Serve the dip with a platter of baby spinach leaves.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Remove crust from 1 pumpkin (do not discard) and place pumpkin flesh in an 8 x 8 inch baking dish. Add 1/4 cup water to pancover pan tightly with aluminum foilbake in preheated oven for 45 minutes or until tender. Remove foil from pansprinkle with 1 tablespoon buttercover pan tightly againreturn to ovenbake for 15 minutes or until butter has melted. Remove pan from ovendiscard foil. Remove pumpkin from panlet cool completely. With pumpkin still in pan, puree pumpkin in blender until smoothplace pureed pumpkin in blenderadd remaining 1/2 cup butterpuree mixture until smooth (pumpkin should be very thick). Place pumpkin in a small bowladd 1/2 cup light cream cheeseuse a fork to blend until smooth. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup cream cheese

Boil the noodles according to the instructions on the box. Drain and set aside. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and sauté until the onion is translucent. Add the spinach to the skillet. Cook over low heat for 5 to 10 minutes until spinach is wilted. Remove from the heat. Stir the cooked spinach into the noodles. Add the swiss cheese and stir until the cheese is completely melted. Sprinkle with paprika. Serves 2 to 4.

In a skillet, sauté the hamburger until browned. Add the green chilies, refried beans, cream of chicken soup and sour cream. Stir well and heat through. Place a tortilla in the bottom of a greased 9x13 baking dish. Fill with the hamburger mixture. Roll up the tortilla and place seam side down in the baking dish. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling. Cover with foil and bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Remove foil and sprinkle the top with shredded cheese and bake uncovered for about 5 minutes until the cheese is bubbly and brown. Serve with sour cream and chopped green onions on the side.

Cook spaghetti until al dente according to package directions. Drain. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add spaghetti and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in lemon zest, lemon juice, basil, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Wash and dry bok choy and cut into thin strips. In a skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add green onion. Cook for 3 minutes. Add bok choy strips and cook for 2 more minutes. Add ginger and rice wine. Cook for 1 more minute. Add brown sugar and stir until brown. Remove from heat and add light soy sauce. Stir well. Transfer into serving dish. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Saute carrots and onions in oil in soup pot for 4 minutes or until soft. Add broth and bring to boiling. Add potato and kielbasa and cook for about 10 minutes or until potato is tender. Add bean with bacon soup mix. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until slightly thickened. Season with pepper.

Cut cream cheese into 20 pieces and place into a large bowlplace in refrigerator until firm. Blend together cheeses and seasonings with a hand mixerblend well. Remove cheese from refrigerator and blend in cheese mixture with a hand mixerblend well. Cover cheese mixture and place in refrigerator for at least 24 hours before rolling into ball. Roll ball into pecans and roll into cracker crumbs. Place cheese ball in refrigerator 24 hours before servingthis will make cheese ball easier to roll into pecans. Roll cheese ball into pecans and roll into cracker crumbs. Store in refrigerator in covered container. Serve cheese ball with crackers and assorted fruit as an appetizer.
Mix together all of the above and marinate for at least 2 hours in the refrigerator.

Cream together sugar and butter. Add vanilla and beat well. Add the rest of the dry ingredients and mix well. Add the egg white and mix again. Stir in the raisins. Drop by teaspoonfuls on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden.

Combine flour with 1 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp white pepper. Coat chicken with mixture. In large nonstick skillet brown chicken over medium heat until golden brown. Transfer chicken to plate. Add 1 tsp butter to skillet. Cook over medium heat until butter melts. Add mushrooms and cook over medium heat until mushrooms are tender. Stir in flour mixture and cook 1 minute. Whisk in chicken broth and bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and cook for 1-minute. Stir in half-and-half and cook 1 minute. Serve sauce over chicken.

In a 4-quart saucepan, bring 2 cups water to a boil over high heat. Add basmati ricereduce heat to medium-low. Cook, stirring occasionally for 10 minutes or until water is absorbed and rice is tender. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine turmeric, cinnamon, sugar and lemon slicesset aside. In another small bowl, combine butter with remaining 1 1/2 cups waterset aside. Drain rice into a large bowl. Transfer rice to a 9x13-inch baking dishlet stand for 5 minutes to allow rice to absorb any excess water. Sprinkle with reserved spice mixturedrizzle with butter mixture. Serve hot with lemon slices.

In a large bowl combine green bell peppers, celery and ground beef. Season with salt and pepper. Mix thoroughly. Form meat into meatballs. Place them on an oiled cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes. Set aside. In a saucepan heat the cream of mushroom soup and the buttermilk until it comes to a boil. Add the mushrooms. Stir well and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add the meatballs. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve.

Prepare the graham cracker crust according to package directions. Chill the graham cracker crust according to package directions. Meanwhile, dissolve the vanilla pudding mix in the water and lemon juice. Blend in the lemon gelatin. Spread the lemon pudding evenly in the graham cracker crust. Chill in refrigerator until the pudding is set. Top with light whipped topping.

Prepare an 8x8 baking dish by lightly greasing it. Crack an egg into the palm of your hand. Whisk the egg and slowly pour the egg mixture into the dish. Repeat until all the eggs have been used. In a small fry pan on medium heat brown the ham and stir occasionally until it is cooked. Cut ham into small pieces and add to the eggs. In the same fry pan on medium heat brown the frozen spinach. When it is almost done remove from pan. Crumble cheese into the eggs. Add ham and spinach to eggs. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour the mixture into the prepared dish. Place in 375 degree oven for 45 minutes. After 45 minutes remove from oven and serve.

Heat extra virgin olive oil in large soup pot or stock pot. Add chopped garlic and sauté for 30 seconds. Add tomatoes and chicken broth. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 5 minutes. Pour half of the soup into a blender or food processor. Add egg, pulse until smooth. Return to pot and stir in hot sauce and parmesan cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to serving bowls and garnish with parsley.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. In large skillet on medium heat, add sausage and cook for about 8 minutes. Add garlic and cook until golden brown. Set aside. Place tortillas on greased cookie sheet. Spread mustard over tortillas. Sprinkle tortillas with cheese. Place sausage on tortilla. Roll up. Bake for about 7 minutes. Top each wrap with a tablespoon of sauce. Serve warm.

Cut each breast in half lengthwise. Sprinkle each half with cracker crumbs. Roll each half in parmesan cheese. Beat eggs in a shallow bowl. Dip each half in eggs. Roll in cracker crumbs. Place on lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.

Crush graham crackers in food processor. Press crumbs into the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate coated with cooking spray. Set aside. In food processor with a metal blade, blend cream cheese until smooth. Gradually add white chocolate chips until mixture is smooth. Pour into crust-lined pie plate. Spread smooth with spatula. Freeze for at least 4 hours or until firm. In small saucepan over medium-low heat, melt white chocolate chips with whipping cream stirring constantly until smooth. Gradually add powdered sugar until mixture is smoothremove from heat. Chill at least 2 hours or until firm. Garnish with toffee pieces. Serve cold.
Combine all ingredients in shaker with ice and shake until chilled. Pour into glass filled with ice and garnish with fresh pineapple and cherry.

Heat ground beef and seasoning in saucepan for five minutes on low heat and then add pasta and soup and boil for three minutes. Add water and sauce and bring to boil again for five minutes. Then add cheese and serve.
Place all of the ingredients in a bowl and toss to coat each piece of cauliflower with the sauce mixture. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Brush a pan with butter and heat over medium heat. Lay out one sheet of dough on a lightly floured board and roll out into a rectangle about 12 x 16 inches. Spread with butter and layer with ham, chicken and cheese. Roll up and place seam side down in the pan. Brush with the remaining butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake at 425 for about 25 minutes or until golden brown. You may want to tent the pan with foil for the last few minutes of cooking time to prevent burning. Enjoy!

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Salt water heavily and add linguine cook until al dente about 8 minutes. Drain well and set aside. In another pot melt the butter and saut garlic and shallots cooking until tender. Add the shrimp and cook until they are just pink add the olive oil the lemon juice and black pepper cook for 2 minutes more. Drain the pasta and add to the pot with the shrimp toss and serve tossing gently to keep the shrimp from breaking up. Season with parsley and serve immediately.

Bring 1 1/2 cups water to boil in large saucepan. Add couscous. Stir in olive oil and rosemary. Reduce heat to low. Cover with lid or plastic wrap. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes or until water is absorbed. Fluff with fork. Drizzle with lemon juice. Garnish with fresh rosemary. Serve. Serves 4.

Melt the margarine in a pan. Add the marshmallows to the melted margarine. Add the rice krispies. Mix well. Take out 1/3 of the mixture. Mix in the peanut butter chips. Combine the mixture until well combined. Form into balls. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 200 degrees celcius. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-low heat. Add garlic cloves and cook until fragrant, stirring occasionally. Add chicken thigh fillets and oregano, paprika, lemon juice and brown sugarcook until chicken is golden brown and cooked through. Remove from pan. Clean pan and return to medium-high heat. Add chorizo sausages to pancook until lightly browned and cooked through. Remove from pan. Thread chicken and chorizo onto skewersset aside. In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil and saltset aside. Place tortillas on a clean surfacespread with cheese. Top with chicken and chorizo skewers. Fold tortillas to enclose fillingfold up sides to form triangles. Transfer to a baking sheetbrush with lemon oil mixture. Bake until tortillas are golden brown and cheese is melted, about 25 minutes. Serve with guacamole and sour cream.

Combine all the marinade ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Place pork chops in a shallow dish and cover completely with marinade. Refrigerate for at least one hour. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heatcook the chops for about 4 minutes on each sidethey are done when juices run clear when the meat is pierced with a fork. Serve the chops with the marinade as a sauce over them.

Cream butter in a large bowl until smooth. Add brown sugar and beat until fluffy. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Combine flour and baking sodabeat into brown sugar mixture until smooth. Add walnuts, potato chips, and vanillamix until combined. Drop dough by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten slightly. Bake at 350 f until lightly browned, 12-15 minutes. Cool 1 minuteremove from cookie sheets to cooling racks. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Mix together the butter and the sugar. Add the vanilla extract. Add the flour and the salt. Add the jam. Take small amounts and put them on a cookie sheet and bake at 180c for 10-15 minutes. Let cool and add the thumbprint.

Cream together butter, brown sugar and honey until light and fluffy. Mix in egg and water. Stir in flour, salt and oats until well blended. Roll into 1-inch balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake at 375f for about 10 minutes or until golden brown on the edges. Makes 36 cookies.
Combine butter and cream cheese in a stand mixer. Add vanilla. Cream together. Add flour. Mix until dough forms.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Rinse the wings under cold water until the excess is gone. Combine soy sauce, peanut butter, honey, pepper flakes, crushed garlic and salt and pepper to taste. Dip the wings into the sauce and then into the peanuts to coat well. Roast the wings for 20 minutes, turning them halfway through bake time. Serve hot with fresh cilantro.

In a medium-size bowl combine the Bisquick with the water, sugar, and pure vanilla extractmix well with a fork. Set aside for 15 minutes. In a large bowl whisk the eggs until light yellow. Add to Bisquick mixture and mix well until blended. Spoon mixture onto a lightly oiled cookie sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes before removing to cooling rack to cool completely. Makes about 15-16 pies.

Cook elbow macaroni according to package directionsdrain well. Chop cooked macaroni into bite-size pieces. Place into a large bowlstir in green bell pepper, onion & roasted red peppersset aside. In small bowl, combine sugar & mayonnaisemix well with wire whisk. Pour into large bowl with macaroni mixturestir well to combine. Garnish with chopped apple slicesserve immediately.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add steakscook 5 to 7 minutes on each side or to desired degree of doneness. Remove steaks from skilletkeep warm. Add remaining ingredients to skilletbring to boil over high heatreduce heatsimmer 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened slightly. Stir in steaks. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.

Melt butter and chocolate chips in a saucepan over low heat. Let cool. In a large bowl, mix all the dry ingredients. In another bowl beat egg with milk. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and beat until blended. Let batter rest 10 minutes. Heat waffle iron until ready to use. Ladle batter onto hot iron and cook until golden. Serve warm with butter and syrup.
Combine beef bouillon and water. Add mushrooms, onion and green pepper. Bring to a boil. Add pork chops. Cook covered about 25 minutes. Add salt and pepper if needed. Serve over rice.
Preheat oven to 400. Cut in shortening and blend. Stir in 1/2 cup of cheese. Spoon into greased muffin cups. Bake for 12 minutes. Serve warm. For garlic flavor, sprinkle with garlic salt.

Drain beans. Place in large bowl. Add celery, carrot, green pepper, breadcrumbs, eggs and seasonings. Mix well. Form mixture into 8 burgers. Spray a nonstick pan with cooking spray. Cook burgers over medium heat for 8-10 minutes on each side.

Combine garlic cloves and olive oil in large bowl. Add red onion and green beans. Stir and set aside. Add lemon juice and parsley. Stir and season with pepper and salt. Set aside. Pour mixture into serving bowl. Sprinkle with pita chips.
Mix all the ingredients together with a wooden spoon. Put in a greased bowl. Let rise overnight. Fry in butter. Serve with toast.

Add nuts and salt to food processor and process until nuts are fine and nut meal forms ball. In large bowl blend ice water and flour. Using food processor pulse nuts to form nut meal then add flour mixture and process until dough forms ball. Wrap in cling film and chill for at least 1 hour. Remove from fridge and roll out to 1/4 inch thickness between 2 sheets of cling film. Remove one sheet of cling film and transfer pastry to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour.

Sauté onion until translucent in extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add sausage, caraway seed, red pepper flakes and cook until sausage is browned. Add white vinegar and stir until sausage is cooked through. Add cabbage and cook for about 10 minutes, until cabbage is tender but still crisp. Stir occasionally. Add chicken stock and vinegar, season with salt and pepper and simmer for about 10 minutes more until cabbage is tender.

In a large bowl combine all dry ingredients. In a smaller bowl combine liquid ingredients. Add dry ingredients to wet. Fold in 1 tablespoon of butter and 1 tablespoon of oil. Pour into a greased 9x13 cake pan. Bake at 400 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned.

Sauté garlic and ginger in oil until fragrant (1 to 2 minutes). Add white wine and cook until alcohol has evaporated (2 minutes). Stir in sauce and oysters and cook until heated through (about 2 minutes). Serve with rice and green onions for garnish. Serves 2-3.
Combine the feta, tomatoes, cucumber, tomatoes and olives in a bowl with the lemon zest and juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Let the salad sit for 30 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 475 degrees Fahrenheit. Roll out dough to make 10-inch round pizza crusts (or use pizza dough you can find in the refrigerated section of your supermarket). Spread each with about 1 tablespoon of cream and spread 1/3 cup of mozzarella over each. Sprinkle each with ham and diced red onion. Drizzle each with 1 tablespoon of fresh lemon juice. Sprinkle with fresh ground black pepper and top with baby arugula. Bake 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.

Melt butter and brown sugar in saucepan. Add pumpkin pie spice and mix well. Add in cereal and stir in vanilla and cinnamon. Pour into prepared pie crust and top with pecans. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Serve with whipped cream and garnish with more cereal.

Pat the sole fillets dry with paper towels. Season with salt and pepper. In a small skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the fillets and cook until just golden brown on the bottom. Turn over. Add butter and cook until golden brown on the other side. Transfer fillets to a baking dish. Heat remaining olive oil in the skillet over medium-high heat. Add pesto. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low. Add cream. Bring to a boil. Pour over fillets. Sprinkle with lemon peel. Bake until the cream is slightly thickened and the fillets are cooked through. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine adobo sauce with sour cream and stir until smooth. Stir in lime juice, salt and cuminseason with salt. Serve dip with tortilla chips or other crackers. This dip can be prepared several hours ahead of time and chilledreheat before serving.
Toast baguette. Spread baguette with a thin layer of olive oil. Arrange prosciutto over baguette. Add gorgonzola and basil leaves. Cover with figs. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut green beans in half lengthwise. Put in large baking dish and drizzle with melted butter. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast 20 minutes. Toss with caramelized shallots and dijon mustard. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Slice potato into thin rounds and place on a floured baking sheet. Fill a large pan with water and bring to a boillower potato rounds into water and cook for about 15 minutes, or until tender. Drain water and add cold water to cool them slightlydrain water again. Heat oil and butter in a large fry pan over medium-high heatadd a few rounds of potato at a time and saute on each side for about 1 minutedrain on a paper-towel lined plate and season with salt and pepperserve warm.
Combine apple cider and lemon juice in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until sugar and spices are dissolved. Serve immediately.

Cut the bread into 8 equal pieces. Spread the cheese over the bread slices. Divide the bacon into 8 pieces and wrap around each piece of bread. Drizzle the mustard on each sandwich. Place the sandwiches on the skillet and heat for about one minute on each side until the cheese is melted.

In a large pot over medium heat, saute the onion and garlic until tender. Add potatoes to the pot with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat and then reduce heat to lowcook until tender but not soft. Remove pot from the heatdrain potatoes in a colander over a large bowl, reserving the cooking liquid. When the potatoes are cool enough to handle, remove the peeled potatoes from the waterdiscard the water. Shred potatoes by hand or with a food processorset aside. Place the remaining cooking liquid in a clean large pot over medium heatbring to a boil. Add the cabbage to the boiling liquidcook until the cabbage is tender but still bright greenremove from the heatdrain the cabbage in a colander. Return the cabbage to the pot with the remaining cooking liquiddiscard the liquid. Transfer the cabbage to the colander to drain againset aside. In a small bowl, whisk together the flour and saltset aside. In a large pot over medium heat, saute the onion in the oil until tenderadd the garlic
In large bowl combine tortellini with grapes, mandarin oranges and walnuts. Toss with honey mustard dressing and serve immediately.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion. Cook onion for about 5 minutes. Add ground sirloin. Cook sirloin for 3 minutes. Stir in milk. Add carrots. Cover skillet. Cook for 20 minutes. Add orzo pasta. Cook pasta for 10 minutes. Add beef stock. Stir in bread crumbs. Cook for 5 minutes. Add fresh parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over orzo pasta.

Mix all ingredients except nuts together. Roll into a ball and place on cookie sheet. Form into a loaf and cut slits into top of bread. Bake at 350 f for 30-35 minutes or until light brown. Remove from oven and sprinkle with pine nuts. Let cool slightly before serving.
Cream together yellow cake mix and butter. Add cherries and walnuts. Bake in a greased pan at 375 degrees for about 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Serve warm.

Wash and peel the vegetables. Slice carrots into large pieces, onion into half moons, potatoes into small wedges and turnips into quarters. Toss with extra virgin olive oil and spread on baking sheet. Season with garlic, thyme, salt and pepper. Roast in preheated 375 degree oven for about 35-40 minutes, until vegetables are tender.

Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the celery and onionscook until soft, about 8 minutes. Add the ketchup, lemon juice and brown sugarbring to a boil. Add the vinegarboil until reduced, about 20 minutes. Stir in the worcestershire saucesimmer until thickened, about 10 minutes. Add the mustardsimmer until blended, about 2 minutes more. Season with pepper.

Cut a thin slice off the ends of the bread. Spread butter over one side of each slice of bread. Spread cream cheese over buttered side of bread. Top each slice with a small salad burnet leaf and a thin slice of bread to form a sandwich. Serve with a green salad tossed with olive oil and salt and pepper to taste.

1. Prepare a large roasting pan by lining it with greaseproof paper or foil. Place the oil in a large frying pan set over a medium heat. Add the butter and melt. Add the shallots and garlic. Cook gently until softened. Add the crabmeat and cook until it turns white. Add the lemon juice. Squeeze the chicken fillets to make sure they are dry. Remove the skin if you want. Add the chicken to the crab mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Divide the mixture equally between the fillets. Fold in half. Place the fillets in the prepared roasting pan. Pour over the cream. Cover the pan with foil. Place in the middle of the oven. Cook for about one hour. Remove the fillets from the oven. Serve warm.

Cook sweet potatoes in boiling salted water till tender--about 40 min. Drain potatoes and let cool slightly. In a large bowl toss sweet potatoes with celery, red onion, pecans and honey mustard. Pour mayonnaise over potato mixture. Toss to coat well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Makes 4 servings.
Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Cream egg whites and cinnamon. Add sugar slowly and continue beating until well blended. Add papaya and mix well. Pour into pie crust. Bake 30 minutes.

Wash potatoes. Pierce potatoes with fork or knife. Place potatoes in pot of boiling water. Bring water to a boil. Cook potatoes for 12-15 minutes. Drain potatoes. Drizzle with miracle whip. Add broth. Sprinkle with dried oregano and garlic powder. Place on skewers. Grill potatoes for 5-7 minutes on medium heat.

Heat oil in a large pot and saute carrots and onions for 3-5 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute longer. Add beans and water. Cook for 10-12 minutes or until beans are tender. Add Italian seasoning and salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Peel eggplants. Slice lengthwise in half. Dice potatoes. Place eggplant halves in casserole dish. Add potatoes, chopped tomatoes and a little olive oil. Add garlic and onions. Season with salt. Bake for 1 hour. Add cinnamon to taste. Add chopped tomatoes. Bake for 1 hour. Serve over rice.

Mix water with white sugar and heat until boiling. Cool slightly. Add raisins. Mix yeast with lukewarm water and add to the sugar mixture along with the pineapple juice. Allow to stand 5 minutesthen add pineapple pieces. Place mixture into a large container. Allow to rise until doubled in bulk. Bake in greased bundt pan for 1 to 1/4 hours or until bread is done. Let stand 10 minutes before turning out of pan. Serve hot with butter.

Make the focaccia as directed on package. While dough is rising, heat oil in a small frying pan. Add onion. Cook until translucent. Add rosemary and basil leaves. Cook 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Unroll the focaccia. Brush the top surface of the focaccia with the onion oil. Sprinkle with the cheese. Sprinkle with rosemary and basil. Place focaccia back in the oven for 5 minutes.

Prepare mushrooms by removing stems and cleaning mushrooms. Place olive oil and thyme on a plate and coat mushroom caps with oil. Place puff pastry on a cookie sheet. Spoon a little bit of cheese on the pastry. Place mushroom caps on pastry. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes until pastry is golden and mushrooms are soft.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Wash and peel potatoes. Cut into wedges. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic granules. Toss to coat. Place on a baking sheet and bake for approximately 40 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Return to oven for an additional 5 minutes. Season with sea salt. Serve with ketchup.

Place fillets into a large plastic bag and add enough of the wasabi sauce to coat them. Marinate in refrigerator for 15 minutes. Heat oil in a frying pan and fry salmon until golden. Remove from pan and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Place garlic cloves on a small piece of foil. Drizzle with oil and wrap tightly. Bake 30 minutes. While garlic is baking, combine 1/2 cup of water with beef broth in a medium pot over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Remove garlic from oven. Cut off top of each steak and squeeze lime juice over steak. Add steaks to boiling liquid. Boil for 2 minutes. Remove steaks with a slotted spoon. Strain stock into a heatproof glass container or heat resistant pitcher. Strain the solids from the stock into a bowl. Discard solids. Return strained liquid to pan. Add carrot. Bring to a boil. Add the onion. Cook 5 minutes or until tender. Add steaks. Cover. Place in preheated oven 1 hour or until meat thermometer reads 160 degrees f. Add tomato paste and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in the garlic. Add stock and marjoram. Bring to a boil

Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a 5-quart saucepan over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Stir in the white onion and 1/2 teaspoon salt and saute until softened and golden, about 4 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup water and 1 teaspoon of salt and bring to a boil over high heat. Stir in 2 cups of cold water and bring to a boil again. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until almost all of the water has evaporated and the rice is tender and the grains are just barely separated, about 40 minutes. Transfer to a large mixing bowl and stir with a fork to separate the grains further. Stir in the remaining 2 tablespoons oil and 1/2 teaspoon of salt and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In a large pot bring tomato sauce to a simmer on medium-high heat. Add tomatoes, onion soup mix, water and frozen vegetables. Stir well to combine. Bring mixture back to a simmer on medium-high heat. Add alphabet pasta to the pot. Cook for about 10 minutes or until the pasta is tender. Drain the alphabet pasta and return it to the pot. Stir in the beef. Cook for about 10 minutes or until the beef is cooked through.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook 4 minutes. Stirring occasionally. Add wine and cook until wine has evaporated. Add chicken thighs skin side down. Cook 3 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and cook 6 minutes. Flip and cook 3 minutes. Transfer to a clean platter and keep warm. Stir together the cilantro and parsley. Spoon over the chicken. Serve with rice.

Peel and cube potatoes. Put potatoes and water into saucepan and cook over medium heat until potatoes are tender and water is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Drain potatoes and mash. Set aside and keep warm. In saucepan over medium heat, melt butter and stir in flour until blended. Cook over medium heat until mixture is thick and smooth. Gradually stir in cream, salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat until mixture is thickened and bubbly and remove from heat. Fold in potatoes and dill and serve immediately.

Clean mushroomsdrain. Remove stemschop stems. Heat butter in large skillet over medium-high heatadd mushrooms and onionscook 10 minutes or until mushrooms are tenderstirring occasionally. Stir cornstarch and water together. Stir tomato paste into mushroom mixturecook over medium-low heat until mushroom mixture thickens, stirring constantly, about 5 minutesstir in beef brothbring to a boiladd winesimmer over low heat about 10 minutesstir in ground pepper and cornstarch mixturesimmer over low heat about 10 minutes or until thickened slightlyserve warm.

Prepare a double pie crust and pre bake for 8 minutes. Remove and place on a baking sheet. In a large bowl combine brandy, dried cranberries and walnuts. Set aside. In a large bowl beat together butter, sugar and eggs. Beat in flour and salt. Pour over cranberry mixture. Pour into prepared crust and bake for 40 minutes or until set. Let cool. Add topping of white chocolate chips and chopped walnuts.

Slice pork into thin slices (approximately 1/4" thick). Cut into strips about 1" wide by 10" long. In a large bowl combine all the seasonings and marinate pork for at least 1 hour or overnight (you can refrigerate overnight). Thread pork onto skewers (use soaked wooden skewers). Grill over medium heat about 3 to 5 minutes per side. Serve immediately on steamed white rice.

Mix together condensed milk, coconut, graham wafer crumbs, chocolate chips, and icing sugar. Spread mixture into a lightly greased 8x11-inch pan. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before cutting. Yields about 2 dozen. Makes about 2 dozen. Cooking time does not include mixing.
Put a small piece of cheese on top of each cracker and drizzle half the honey over top. Sprinkle half the pistachios on top of each honey-covered cracker. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 250 degrees. Put the prawns in a roasting tin. Sprinkle with saffron thread and season with pepper. Pour over sherry wine. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from oven and add the garlic and chili. Bake for a further 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Place the prawns in an ovenproof dish. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Drizzle with olive oil. Place in oven for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook noodles according to package directions until tender yet firmdrain well. In a large bowl, beat eggs with sugar until blendedadd raisins and noodles. In a large skillet melt butteradd crushed pineapple and cook over medium heat for 3 minutes or until softened. Add lime juice and cinnamoncook and stir for 2 minutes or until thoroughly heated. Pour mixture over noodles and gently toss until combined. Transfer to a greased 10 x 15 inch baking pan. Bake in a preheated 350f oven for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted near center comes out clean.

In large soup pot saute onion and garlic in olive oil and butter. Add meat to pan and brown, season to taste with dried italian herb seasoning and brown meat. Add tomatoes and broth to pan and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about an hour. Add frozen vegetables and conchiglie to soup and cook another 10 minutes or so until vegetables are tender. Add parsley and cook until wilted about 1 minute. Serve and enjoy!

Place the shortening in a large heavy pot. Cut the brown sugar into small pieces and add it to the shortening. Cream together until it is smooth. In a separate bowl mix together the baking soda, salt, light molasses and sifted flour. Add this to the shortening mixture. Mix together until a thick batter forms. Stir in the nuts. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 325 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before removing from cookie sheets. Enjoy!

Combine brown sugar and pecans in a bowl. Set aside. In a bowl mix flour, baking powder and salt. In a separate bowl mix eggs with butter. Slowly add flour mixture to butter mixture. Add in sugar and pecans. Fold in chocolate chips. Fill greased muffin tins. Bake in preheated 425f oven for 10-15 minutes.

Cut corn kernels from ears of corn and place in large bowl. Cut peppers into small pieces and add to bowl. Add chopped onion and mayonnaise and stir well. Add fritos corn chips and stir. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Serve in bowl the next day. Can also use a food processor.

Sprinkle chicken breast on both sides with salt and pepper and drizzle lightly with olive oil. Place chicken in shallow baking dish and add lemon juice and maple syrup to coat chicken evenly. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and no pink remains in the center and juices run clear when cut into with a knife. Serve and enjoy!

To prepare this recipe you will need to mix 1/2 cup mayonnaise with 2 tablespoons of honey and 1 teaspoon each of mustard and onion powder. Rub this mixture over both sides of each chicken breast. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with ground red pepper. Serve over steamed broccoli and rice.

Soak rice for at least 15 minutes. Rinse rice. Add to a pot and add 3 cups of water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook until softened and tender. Drain rice. Mash rice to remove excess starch. Return rice to pot. Add coconut milk. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook until thick. Add palm sugar. Stir to dissolve. Add coconut cream. Stir to blend. Add salt. Stir to dissolve. Add pandan leaves. Stir to blend. Serve warm.

Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened. Add spinach and cook for 5 minutes or until all of the liquid is evaporated. Add tamari and cumin and bring to a boil. Add the rice and reduce heat to low. Cover and cook until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender. Transfer to a large baking dish and top with tomatoes. Bake until heated through and bubbly.

Preheat the oven to 160c/gas 3. Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg, vanilla essence and jam and stir until thoroughly combined. Add the flour and desiccated coconut and mix well. Turn out onto a greased baking tray and press the dough together firmly using your hands until it is just larger than the tray. Bake for 20 minutes until golden. Leave to cool for 10 minutes before icing. Whisk together the icing ingredients until smooth and thick then spread over the biscuit base. Leave to set before slicing into squares.

In a food processor combine garlic cloves, chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice and soy sauce and blend. Add vegetable broth and process until smooth. Add to pasta cooked al dente. Toss with fresh broccoli florets and toasted sesame seeds.

Remove and discard stems from beet greens. Wash greens and pat dry. In large skillet heat oil over medium heat. Slice beets and bacon and add to oil. Cook beets and bacon until beets are tender. Remove to plate and reserve oil. Add greens to pan and cook 5 min or until wilted. Add oil from pan to greens. Add vinegar and season with salt and pepper.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the beans and cook for 1 minute. Drain. Return to the pot. Add the bacon and garlic. Cook over low heat for 5 to 7 minutes or until beans are tender. Add the tomatoes and the oregano and continue cooking for 1 minute. Stir in the lemon juice and the pepper. Cook for 2 minutes. Drain. Serve hot.

Cook pasta according to package directionsdrain well. Heat butter in a large skillet or dutch oven over medium-high heat until melted. Add ricecook, stirring constantly for about 4 minutes or until rice is coated with the butter. Add chicken brothbring to a boil. Cook uncovered for 5 minutes or until rice is tender. Remove from heatstir in rice, ranch dressing mix and mushrooms. Stir in cooked chickensprinkle with light sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cut squash in half. Remove seeds with a spoon. Place cut side down into a baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until tender. Remove from oven. Stuff squash with canned crushed pineapple. Sprinkle with cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, and ground ginger. Return to oven until pineapple is heated through.

Soak meat with cold water for at least an hour or overnight. In the morning, mix soy sauce with cayenne pepper. Stir well to dissolve cayenne pepper. Place meat with marinade in a large saucepan with lid. Cook meat on high for about 10 minutes or until meat is tender. While meat is cooking, prepare rice according to package instructions with some additional water. In the last few minutes of cooking the rice, stir in the green onions and cilantro. Stir cooked meat from saucepan with marinade with rice and add red bell pepper. Cook on low for about 10 minutes or until rice is tender. Serve immediately with chopsticks or silverware of your choice. Enjoy!
Blend all ingredients except the flat leaf parsley and the pasta in a food processor until smooth. Strain into a serving bowl and toss in the pasta. Garnish with the fresh parsley before serving.

Mix all the dry ingredients in a bowl. Add the wet ingredients and mix well. Grease muffin tins. Spoon batter into the muffin tins and bake at 400 degrees F for 15 minutes. Turn the temperature down to 350 degrees F. Remove from the oven and place on a cookie sheet. While still warm brush the honey and sprinkle with the ground cinnamon. Let cool then remove from pan. Serve warm.

Wash carrots and place in a large baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle with melted butter and toss. Bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes or until carrots are tender. Let stand for about five minutes before serving. These are perfect for a holiday meal or a simple weeknight dinner. Serve with chicken or pork dishes, or simply as a side dish.

Bring a saucepan of water to a boil. Add asparagus and cook until crisp-tender, 4 to 6 minutes. Drain and immediately transfer to a bowl of ice water. Drain again and pat dry with paper towels. Cut each spear in half lengthwise. Toss with dressing and toss with a splash of Worcestershire sauce. Sprinkle with cayenne. Serve warm.

Toast bread and spread butter generously on one side of each slice. Butter the cut side of the mushrooms and place between the two slices of toast. Sprinkle with garlic and thyme leaves and grill for 4 to 5 minutes or until golden brown. Top with grated cheese and place under the broiler until cheese melts and bubbles. Serve immediately.

Carefully pierce the egg yolk and white of the hard boiled eggs with the tip of a knife. Set the eggs into a bowl and cover with ice water. Allow the eggs to stand for 10 minutes. Drain the eggs and transfer to a large bowl. Add mayonnaise, mustard and paprika and mash with a fork. Season with salt and black pepper. To serve, fill each egg with the deviled egg mixture and top each one with a few drops of cider vinegar. Place the filled eggs on a platter. Sprinkle with sugar.

Put all the beans in a large pot with the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 2 hours. After the beans have cooked, add the onion and jowl. Stir to coat. Then add the diced tomatoes with green chilies. Simmer for 45 minutes. Add the salt and pepper and stir to coat. Transfer the mixture to a blender and purée. Return to the pot and cook for 15 minutes more. Add water if the beans are too thick. Serve with tortillas.

Place half of the chocolate cookies on the bottom of a large glass bowl or baking dish. Top with half the ice cream, then the fudge sauce over the ice cream. Add another layer of the cookies over the fudge sauce, followed by another layer of ice cream. Repeat with the remaining cookies, ice cream, fudge sauce, whipped topping and strawberry ice cream topping. Freeze for 45 minutes to firm up the ice cream mixture. Serve immediately with a spoon.

Preheat the oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas 6. Bring water to the boil, add the ribs and cook for 45 minutes. While the ribs are cooking, prepare the salsa by mixing all the ingredients together. Remove the ribs from the pan and cool for 5 minutes. Slice the ribs between the bones and arrange on a baking sheet. Place the ribs under the grill for 20 minutes. Remove from the grill and add the salsa. Brush the ribs with the glaze while they are still hot and serve.

In a large saucepan, combine the sugar and sour cream and bring to a boil. Stir constantly until the mixture thickens and boils for one minute. Remove from heat and add vanilla extract and peanut butter. Stir until smooth and thick. Pour into waxed paper-lined pans and allow to cool for one hour before cutting into squares or bars.

In skillet brown ground turkey and drain grease. In blender or food processor, add ground turkey with egg, onion, mushroom and garlic powder and blend until smooth. In skillet add olive oil and saute mixture until golden brown and drain grease. In skillet add pizza sauce and season with oregano and black pepper to taste. Place mixture into hamburger bun and top with cheese and place under broiler until cheese is melted and serve.

In a saucepan stir together cornflour with a pinch of salt and gradually stir in milk. Stir constantly over medium heat until mixture boils. Boil for about a minute or until thickened. Pour mixture into a heat proof bowl. Let cool until lukewarm then whisk in sugar substitute and vanilla extract. Cover with plastic wrap touching surface of custard. Refrigerate for at least four hours or until custard is set. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. In a large baking dish, toss potatoes with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt. Roast for 20 minutes. Add the beets, onions, sweet potato and parsnips. Season with salt. Roast for another 40 minutes. Slice beets into rounds. Toss beets and roasted vegetables in maple syrup. Sprinkle with chopped garlic. Return to oven for an additional 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Cook your pasta according to directions on the box and drain well. Return the pasta to the pot along with the cream cheese and stir until the pasta is well coated with the cream cheese sauce. Add the cooked chicken and stir until well incorporated. Add the roasted red pepper and stir until well mixed. Serve immediately.

Heat a wok over a high heat until hot and add the oil. Add the peas and stir fry for 2 minutes. Add the rice and stir until heated. Remove from the heat and stir in the eggs until cooked. Stir in the spring onions and the bean sprouts and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Heat a pan on medium heat. Fry up your ham & cheese on both sides (don't press down too much or the eggs will crack). Cut tomatoes in half & put on each ham slice. Break one egg in each ham & cheese sandwich. When eggs are almost cooked (about 5 min) put a pat of butter on top to finish cooking & then flip over (don't burn butter). Serve & Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Slice the carrot lengthwise and arrange on a cookie sheet in a single layer. Drizzle with olive oil. Slice the onion lengthwise as well and place in a single layer on the carrots. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle the garlic evenly on the carrots as well as the onion. Bake for about 30 minutes or until the carrots are tender. Sprinkle the carrots with the vinegar and chives. Serve hot or cold.
Cook tortellini according to package directions. Drain well. Toss cooked pasta with pesto and asparagus. Sprinkle with pine nuts. Toss gently. Season with salt and lemon rind to taste.

Heat extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until golden brown. Add the vegetables and cook until crisp tender. Sprinkle the salt and sugar over the vegetables. Add the rosemary leaves and cook until the vegetables are crisp tender and the rosemary is fragrant. Remove from heat and add the Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spray muffin tin with vegetable oil. Beat together butter and brown sugar. In a separate bowl beat together milk, egg and flour. Stir flour mixture into butter mixture. Fold in blueberries. Spoon into muffin tin. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean.

Prepare chicken breast by cutting down the length of each breast to make them skinny and then cut across to make thin strips. Prepare italian dressing by adding all ingredients to a bowl. Place chicken in large ziploc bag or medium bowl. Pour dressing over chicken. Marinate at least 4 hours or up to 1 day. Grill or bake as desired. Serve with vegetables of choice.

Combine broccoli and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook until tender. Drain in a colander. Combine broccoli and milk in a bowl. Add the soup and rice. Heat thoroughly. Stir in broccoli and cheese. Serve with a salad.

Cut bread into 1-inch slices. Place egg whites, milk, spices & vanilla extract into blender & pulse for 10 seconds. Place bread slices into a 9-inch square pan or dish. Pour egg mixture over bread. Cover & refrigerate for 3 hours. Remove & drain. Place slices into an 8-inch square pan. Top with slices of banana. Drizzle with syrup. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Peel garlic. Cut in half. Place tomatoes in a large glass baking dish. Drizzle olive oil over tomatoes. Sprinkle garlic and dried italian herb seasoning over tomatoes. Place tomatoes in the oven for 1 hour or until softened. Place tomatoes in a blender. Add sugar and salt. Blend until smooth. Strain through a sieve. Stir in pepper. Return sauce to the oven and cook until thick and reduced. Serve over pasta.

Prepare chicken base. Bring 1 qt chicken broth to a boil. Add base. Simmer 45 min. Stir in flour. Add heavy cream. Simmer 10 min. Add salt and paprika. Chop onions. Saute in olive oil until tender. Add garlic. Add sweet onion and saute. Add mushrooms. Add cream mixture. Cook until thickened. Add salt and pepper. Add sour cream. Adjust seasonings. Stir in cooked chicken. Serve over rice. Serves 8.

Combine dill weed, lemon-pepper seasoning, salt, garlic powder and brown sugar in a small bowl. Place salmon in a plastic bag and coat with lemon-pepper mixture. Marinate for at least 1 hour. Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Place salmon skin side down on grill. Brush with oil and cook until just done. Turn and brush with oil and cook for additional 2-3 minutes. Place salmon on a platter and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook broccoli florets according to package directions. Drain well. In a large bowl beat eggs lightly. Mix in milk and onion. Add mushroom soup. Mix well. Combine broccoli, cheese, salt and pepper. Pour mixture into a 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle evenly with Cheez-It crackers. Pour broccoli mixture on top. Bake 45 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Wash red potatoes. Cut into wedges and place in a bowl. Whisk together olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper. Drizzle over potatoes. Tear fresh mint leaves into pieces. Garnish each plate with a sprinkle of fresh mint leaves. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the semi-sweet chocolate chips. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Add half-and-half. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Add salt and vanilla. Pour into individual mugs. Serve immediately. Makes about 3/4 cup.

Melt butter and saute onion and garlic in a skillet over medium heat for 2-3 minutes. Add beef and brown on both sides. Add scotch whiskey and simmer for 2 minutes. Add cream and simmer for 1 minute. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve over hot steamed rice.
Blend ice and vodka with strawberries and basil sprig. Pour into glasses and top with soda water. Garnish with basil sprig and serve.

Spread cream cheese on the surface of the bagel. Slice the pineapple. Put it in the middle of the cream cheese and sprinkle some sugar and cinnamon. Place under the broiler until the cheese melts and the pineapple is warm.

Separate the eggs. Beat the egg whites until they are fluffy. In a separate bowl beat the egg yolks and the remaining whole egg. In a separate bowl beat the egg whites until they are fluffy. Pour the egg yolk mixture into the egg whites. Mix. Beat the milk and the maple syrup. Pour into the bowl with the egg mixture. Whisk. Add the salt and the vanilla. Whisk. Dip each piece of bread into the egg mixture and then into the pan. Fry until golden brown. Turn over and fry until golden brown. Serve hot with maple syrup.

Melt oleo. Combine cereal and pretzels. Add peanuts. Pour over oleo. Add brown sugar and honey. Stir until coated. Let stand for 2 to 3 hours. Spread on waxed paper to cool. Stir in vanilla. Roll into balls.

Melt rice krispies treats. Pour oil over the rice krispies. Stir rice krispies into the oil until they are well coated. Place a small amount of powdered sugar on your hand so that the treats will stick better to your hand. Take a handful of rice krispies treats and roll them into a ball between your palms. Roll them in the powdered sugar until they are completely covered on the outside with powdered sugar. Roll them around until they are smooth. Dip each rice krispies treat into a small amount of chocolate until they are covered completely with chocolate. Repeat until all rice krispies treats are dipped completely into chocolate. Place on parchment paper and place into the fridge to set.

Blend tahini with garlic, chili pepper, lemon juice and 1/4 cup of water to form a smooth paste. Whisk in remaining 2/4 cup of water and salt to taste. Whisk in parsley leaves and set aside for 15 minutes. Place dressing in airtight container for up to 2 weeks in refrigerator. Serve as salad dressing over fresh salad greens or toss with grilled fish or chicken. Makes about 1 cup dressing.

Boil potatoes in water until tender. Drain and place in food processor or blender. Add onion and celery. Blend. Add broth and blend. Add chicken and beef broth and blend until smooth. Add kielbasa and blend again. Add condensed cream of chicken soup and blend. Season to taste. Serve hot.

In a small saucepan, heat the water to a boil. Add the cinnamon stick, cardamom seeds, coffee grounds, sugar, rum extract, and a pinch of salt. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a large measuring cup or heatproof pitcher. Discard the solids. Add the milk and stir to combine. Add more sugar if desired. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large bowl, mix cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder and salt together with a whisk. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. In a separate bowl combine milk, eggs, butter and pork rinds. Pour the wet mixture into the well and mix together with a whisk. Pour batter into a well-greased 9x13 inch baking pan. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool 10 minutes before serving. Enjoy!

Place chicken breasts in a large pot. Cover with sesame oil and enough chicken stock to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until chicken is very tender. Remove chicken and reserve. Remove bay leaf. Discard chicken skin. Transfer chicken to cutting board and cut into cubes. Add mushrooms and parsley to broth. Simmer until mushrooms are tender. Return chicken to pot. Cook until heated through. Season with salt and white pepper. Serve hot.

In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine zucchini and juice. Cook until the zucchini is soft (about 20 minutes). Stir in sugar and food coloring. Let stand until the mixture thickens. Refrigerate until serving. Makes about 8 servings.

Cook chicken. Chop into bite-size pieces. Place chicken in large mixing bowl. Add apple, celery and walnuts. Mix well. In small mixing bowl, combine mayonnaise, mustard and cream. Mix well. Add to chicken mixture. Mix well. Cover and refrigerate 2 to 24 hours. Just before serving, add lettuce. Mix well. Serve cold.

Mix flour and salt together in a large bowl and set aside. Beat egg with vanilla extract until frothy. Add brown sugar and beat until combined. Add flour and baking powder and mix until combined. Stir in sesame seeds and toasted sesame seeds. Add cooking oil to the batter in a thin stream. Drop batter by teaspoons onto a greased baking sheet or into lightly greased paper-lined muffin tins. Bake at 400 degrees F until golden brown and cooked through (about 15 minutes). Cool slightly and serve with milk or coffee.

Cut dough into squares. Place squares on ungreased baking sheet. Make small hole in each square. Place a dollop of pudding in each hole. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Bake at 400 for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
Drain artichoke hearts in a colander. Place in a bowl. Add mayonnaise, cheeses, lemon juice, garlic powder and old bay. Mix until well combined. Serve with crackers or veggies.

In a small bowl, stir together 1/2 cup soy sauce, 1/2 cup oyster sauce, creamy peanut butter, crushed red pepper flakes, 1 teaspoon grated gingerroot, 2 tablespoons minced shallot, 1 tablespoon minced gingerroot and 1 1/2 tablespoons oil. In a large saucepan of boiling water, cook beans until crisp-tender but still bright green, about 4 minutesdrain well. Transfer to a large bowltoss with 1/2 cup dressing and 1/3 cup roasted peanuts. In a small bowl, stir together the remaining 1/2 cup dressing with cilantrotoss with beans. Sprinkle with more roasted peanuts to taste.

Beat eggs and sugar together until thick and lemon-colored. Add milk and chocolate and beat until well blended. Remove from the heat and add vanilla and butter. Pour into pie crusts and bake for 45 minutes at 350f. Serve warm or cold.

In a small saucepan, combine the water and soy sauce and bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from the heat and add the garlic, brown sugar and ginger to the saucepan. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil and add the steak. Cook until browned and transfer to the saucepan and continue cooking until tender (about 20-30 min). Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour sauce over steak and serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Brush pierogies with egg white then dip into breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese mix. Place on greased baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Heat oil in large heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add bell peppers. Cook 8 to 10 minutes or until tender. Add sausage. Cook 5 minutes. Add wine. Bring to a boil. Cook for 2 minutes. Add onions. Cook 3 minutes. Stir in Italian seasoning. Cook 1 minute. Add peppers. Cook for 2 minutes. Add 1 cup water. Bring to a boil. Add oregano. Simmer for 15 minutes or until thickened. Serve over hot cooked pasta. Serve hot.

Place whole chickens on a large plate. In a small bowl, combine seasoning salt and pepper. Sprinkle evenly over each chicken. Place chickens in slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours. Remove chickens from slow cooker and place on a large cutting board. Place slow cooker back over low heat and add butter and Tabasco sauce. Stir until butter has melted and sauce is smooth. Return chickens to slow cooker. Cover and cook on low heat for 1 hour. Remove chickens from slow cooker and let rest for 10 minutes. Carve and serve.
Pour thai tea into large container. Stir in water and evaporated milk. Add sugar and stir to dissolve. Add more thai tea to desired strength. Pour into tall glasses and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch pan and set aside. Peel and core apples. Cut in half and scoop out the center part of the apple so that you are left with the skins on. Place apple halves cut side down in the prepared pan and pour the juice over the apples until they are about half submerged. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove the apples from the oven and add 1 tbsp of the granola to each apple half. Place apples back in the oven and bake for another 10 minutes or until apples are soft and juice has thickened and syrupy consistency. Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
In a pitcher, combine water and all the spices. Bring to a boil over high heat. Remove from heat. Stir in mint. Let stand for 15 minutes. Strain. Serve hot or cold.

Heat oil in a soup pot and sautee garlic until it turns a light brown color, stirring often. Stir in chicken stock and tomato puree and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add diced tomatoes and lime juice and cook for 10 more minutes. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper and stir in cilantro just before serving. Serve with crusty bread or pita chips.

Preheat grill. In large bowl, mash together mushrooms& garlic. Stir in sunflower oil. Form mixture into 4 patties. Wrap buns in aluminum foil to keep them warm. Grill patties until cooked through& browned. Place patties between buns. Sprinkle with gruyere. Serve with lettuce.

Cut the onions into 1/2-inch slices. Place them into boiling water for 1 to 2 minutes. Remove and drain. Place the onions into a bowl with 1/4 cup of water and the honey. Toss the mixture until it's completely coated. Place the bowl into the microwave. Cook at 50 percent power for 5 minutes. Stir the mixture every 1 minute and cook for another 5 minutes. Allow to cool completely before serving.

In a large bowl combine the pecans, almonds and walnuts. Add oil and stir to coat lightly. Add maple syrup and stir to coat nuts evenly. Place herbs on a paper towel and roll in nuts, pressing gently to help the nuts absorb the herbs. Transfer to a wax paper covered cookie sheet and bake for about 10 minutes at 350 degrees until the nuts are lightly toasted. Place nuts on a cooling rack and allow to cool completely. Just before serving place nuts back into the cookie sheet and mix together the remaining ingredients, cayenne pepper and salt and pepper to taste. Add the herbed nuts back into the bowl and toss lightly to coat evenly and then serve.
Combine seasoning and salt&pepper. Drizzle with olive oil, and grill or broil for 5 minutes on each side. Serve with lemon wedges.

Heat butter in a skillet. Saute onions until soft. Add sausage and cook through. Set aside. Slice the bread. Spread a thin layer of bocconcini cheese on each slice. Top with a small portion of the sausage mixture. Place one egg over each slice and top with the other slice of bread. Cover with plastic wrap and place on a baking sheet in the oven. Bake for 20 minutes until eggs are set. Cut into four pieces. Top each with a pecan.

Season the chicken with 1 teaspoon of the soy sauce and the oil. Cover the bottom of the casserole with a thin layer of the honey. Lay the legs on the honey with the thighs up. Cover with the remaining honey. Bake for 40 minutes at 350 degrees.

In large saut pan cook mushrooms in the oil over medium heat for 5-7 minutes or until tender and golden brown. Add white wine and cook for 2-3 minutes more. Sprinkle the rosemary into the pan and let the rosemary infuse the wine for 1-2 minutes. Add the chicken and cook for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown on one side. Turn the chicken and cook for 2-3 minutes more or until golden brown on the other side. Add salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.

Bring a pan of water to boil and cook the potatoes until just done. Drain and rinse under cold water. Melt the butter in a frying pan. Fry the bacon until crisp. Remove the bacon and keep warm. Fry the spring onions with the bacon fat until soft. Add the potatoes and fry until golden brown. Combine the vinegar with the mustard and pour over the potatoes. Add the honey and toss. Serve the potatoes warm.

Place chicken stock, fresh ginger, star anise, orange zest and five-spice into a saucepan over medium heat and simmer until reduced by half. Remove from heat and set aside. Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper. Heat sunflower oil in a skillet and saute salmon until golden brown on both sides. Place salmon fillets on a platter and drizzle with sauce from the pan. Top salmon fillets with bok choy and serve immediately.
