Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add rice and return to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered for 40-45 minutes. Remove the rice from the pot with a slotted spoon. Discard the liquid. In a skillet, cook the bacon until crisp. Drain the bacon. In a small saucepan, melt the butter. Add the onions and cook over medium heat until soft. Stir in the bacon, rice, green peppers, tomato soup, chili powder, sugar, and 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer uncovered for 30 minutes. Serve with enchiladas.

Spray an 8 inch square pan or a 9 inch round cake pan with cooking spray. Mix the peaches, oats, flour, cornstarch, cinnamon, nutmeg and brown sugar in a medium bowl. Stir in the honey. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan. Bake for about 30 minutes, until the crisp is golden brown. Serve warm.

In a large bowl, whisk together sugar, soda, salt and buttermilk until smooth. Stir in butter until well blended. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt 4 tablespoons of butter. Add pecans and brown sugar to skilletstirring constantly until sugar is melted and pecans are coated with caramel. Remove from heat and pour over butter mixturestir until combined. Pour batter onto greased cookie sheet. Bake 10 minutes. Cool slightly before removing from cookie sheet to cooling rack. Let stand until completely cool, then break into pieces. Store in an air-tight container.

Drain the peas and place them into a big pot. Add the water and the onions. Add the celery and the carrot. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook for about 1 hour. Remove the onions. Add the ham bone, the bay leaf and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to boil again and cook covered for about 2 hours. Add the thyme and cook for another hour. When cooked you should have about one cup of broth.

Put peaches in a large bowl. Add cloves, cinnamon sticks and sugar. Toss gently. Let stand at room temperature for about two hours. Add vinegar and toss gently. Refrigerate until serving. Serve with yogurt and fresh mint.
Combine watermelon and cantaloupe in bowl. Add mint and basil and toss. Add lemon juice and simple syrup. Stir. Pour in Amaretto. Chill for several hours. Serve with thin slices of prosciutto.

Cut the cinnamon-swirl bread into 3-inch pieces. Place the bread in a shallow dish. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and half & half. Pour over the bread. In another small bowl, combine the brown sugar and vanilla extract. Sprinkle half of this mixture evenly over the bread. In another small bowl, combine the butter and the remaining brown sugar mixture. Spoon this mixture evenly over the bread. Bake in the preheated oven until the bread is golden brown, about 20 minutes. Serve with syrup or jam.
Mix cream cheese and anchovy paste together. Add lemon juice. Add minced onion and chopped chives. Serve with crackers or bread.

Put sugar, corn syrup, cinnamon & salt into a small bowl. Add egg yolks & beat until thickened. Gradually beat in 1/4 cup of flour to make a paste. Pour into 2 crusts. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. While still warm, pour hot melted butter over top. In a small bowl, beat egg whites until stiff. Beat in 1/4 cup of flour & vanilla. Spread evenly over warm pie. Sprinkle with quick-cooking oatmeal. Bake for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm. Serves 6.

In small saucepan, combine orange juice concentrate, wine, mustard, honey and rosemarycook over low heat 10 minutes or until slightly thickened. Add soy sauce, tabasco sauce, garlic and hickory chips. Cook until heated through. Arrange chicken thighs skin-side down on broiler pansprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of the seasoning mixture per side. Broil 3 1/2 inches from the heat 20 minutes or until golden brown and tenderturn chicken. Broil 10 minutes longer or until thoroughly heated. Transfer chicken to serving plattergarnish with parsley. Serve with warm vegetables or rice.

In a skillet over medium-high heat, heat olive oil. Add breadcrumbs, seasoning, parmesan cheese and stir to mix. When heated through, add frozen spinach and stir to incorporate. Cook until spinach is tender. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve warm or cold.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add shell pasta and cook according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add the minced garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the tomato sauce and bring to a simmer. Add the broccoli and simmer until tender. Drain the pasta. Add the sauce and the mushrooms to the pasta and toss. Add the cheese and toss until the cheese has melted. Serve with additional cheese on top.

Rice Preparation: Bring rice and vegetable stock to a boil. Then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer until rice is tender but still firm. Drain off any excess liquid. Vegetable Preparation: Cook onion and garlic in vegetable oil until tender. Add bell peppers, carrot and corn. Saute until tender. Add to rice mixture. Stir together. Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large saucepan or stock pot, melt butter and cook macaroni and cheese mix for about five minutes, stirring often. Add the cream of celery soup and tuna and continue to cook until the macaroni and cheese is completely tender. Pour mixture into a greased 2 quart square baking dish and top with cheese. Bake for about 25 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serves four.

Remove corn from the cob and cut into thirds. Place in a freezer bag. Add about 3 cups of water. Place the bag in the freezer. When the corn is frozen, remove bag from freezer. Add about 1/2 cup of sugar. Add 2 cups of ice to the bag. Shake bag vigorously. Repeat this process 2 more times. Place in a freezer bag. Place in freezer to store. To serve, remove corn from bag. Shake bag again to thaw corn. To use corn without thawing, remove the corn from bag, place in microwave-safe dish. Cook for 4 minutes. Shake bag again to thaw corn. Remove corn from bag. Serve with your favorite condiments.

Cook pasta according to package instructions (al dente). While pasta is cooking, in a skillet, heat oil over medium heat and add shallot and tomatoes. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Stir in cream, pepper and nutmeg and simmer for 2 minutes. Add smoked salmon and heat through, stirring constantly for 2 minutes. Stir in pasta and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately. Serves 4.

Combine all of the salad ingredients together in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together the white wine vinegar and olive oil. Pour dressing over the salad mixture. Add cumin to taste. Toss together. Serve immediately.

Remove the skin and bone from 4 boneless chicken breasts. Cut into 8 pieces. Place 4 of the pieces in the center of 4 slices of bacon. Roll up and secure with 4 wooden toothpicks. Drizzle with olive oil. Place in a greased 9x13 baking dish. Bake in a 350 oven for 20-25 minutes. Meanwhile, cut 2 small cheddar cheese blocks in half. Place 1 piece of cheese in the center of each breast. Top with slices of tomato. Roll up and secure with 4 wooden toothpicks. Bake with the chicken for 20-25 minutes. Serve with a salad.

Cook beef with salt and water until tender. Remove beef and drain well. Cut into bite-size pieces. Place ghee in saucepan and cook on medium-low heat for one minute. Add curry powder and stir well. Add water and red chili powder. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes. Return beef to saucepan and simmer for 10 minutes more. Add remaining ingredients and cook for 10 more minutes. Stir well. Serve over rice.
Drain tuna. Cut into bite sized pieces. Add tomatoes and onion. Combine with cilantro. Add lime juice. Stir in jalapeno peppers. Season with salt. Top with lettuce. Serve on tortilla chips.
Mix breadcrumbs, coriander, garlic and ginger into ground chicken. Shape into small bites. Dip into beaten egg. Roll in breadcrumbs. Deep fry until golden brown. Serve hot.

Remove the skin and bones from the cooked chicken. Cut into bite sized pieces. Put the chicken pieces in a 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Pour the soup into the dish. Add the crackers, almonds and celery. Sprinkle with water chestnuts and season with salt and pepper to taste. Bake at 350f for 30 to 40 minutes. Remove and serve.

Mix together sugar and 2 cups of the crushed pineapple. Boil 5 minutes or until sugar is dissolved. Cool completely. Add orange jell-o mix to boiling waterstirring constantly until completely dissolved. Add remaining 1 1/4 cups of the crushed pineapplemix well. Fold in Cool Whiprefrigerate until firm. Spread half of the cream cheese over the bottom of a 9 x 13 inch pan. Add half of the orange jello mixturetop with remaining cream cheese mixture. Add remaining orange jello mixturetop with remaining cream cheese mixture. Freeze until firmthaw 1 hour before serving. If desired, garnish with fresh orange slices. Serves 16.
Whisk together pudding mix and milk until completely smooth. Spoon over angel food cake in a 9x13 pan. Add strawberries over the top. Allow to set before serving with cool whip.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine the unsweetened chocolate and the butter. Bring to a boil. Boil for 2 minutes stirring constantly. Add the salt. Add the sugar and whisk until dissolved. Add the whipping cream. Whisk until blended. Cook until it begins to boil. Boil for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat. Stir in the vanilla extract and walnuts. Cool to room temperature. Transfer to a bowl. Chill for at least an hour. Use as desired.
Mix all ingredients. Toss lightly and serve.

Place chicken in a roasting pan with a rack. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the honey over the chicken and rub the honey all over the chicken. Place the apple cider and dry mustard in a bowl and mix well. Pour the mustard mixture over the chicken and rub it all over the chicken. Roast in preheated oven for about 40 minutes. In a saucepan bring the apple cider and honey to a boil. Cook for about 3 minutes. Whisk in the heavy cream and brandy and cook for 3 minutes. Add the butter and cook until the mixture thickens. Add salt and pepper to taste. Transfer the sauce to a bowl and place in the refrigerator until chilled. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for about 10 minutes before carving. Serve with the apple cream sauce.

I made this for a 4th of July party I was having and it was a huge hit! It's so easy to make and so good! Mix 1/2 cup of vanilla instant pudding mix into 1 cup of cold milk (I used 2% milk). Then add 1/2 cup of vanilla ice cream and 1/2 cup of crackers to the milk and pudding mix and stir until the crackers are softened and the milk and pudding mix are well blended into the ice cream. Then add 1/2 cup of margarine and 1/4 cup of sugar and mix well until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Add the mixture to a large bowl and top it off with whipped topping and sprinkles. Yum! You can also add a small amount of cream to the milk before adding the ice cream if you want your ice cream to be even creamier! This recipe is great for summer parties or any time of the year! Enjoy!

Let thaw rolls in refrigerator overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Unroll rolls and place on greased cookie sheet. Cut rolls in half. Spread each roll with about 2 tbsp butterscotch pudding mix. Top each half with about 2 tbsp brown sugar and 1 tsp cinnamon. Place a handful of nuts on top. Roll each half up and secure with a toothpick. Place rolls in the oven and bake for 10 minutes. Serve warm with butter.

Boil rice in 6 cups of water until tender (about 20 minutes). Drain water completely, rinse with cold water to cool down the rice completely. In a pan heat oil add whole spices to it. Add the spices to the rice (if the rice is not well cooked you can add it to the spice mixture). Garnish with coriander leaves (cilantro). Serve hot with raita or salad or curry dish of your choice.

Preheat oven to 250f. Wash and trim the mushrooms and place them in a roasting pan with the bacon and green beans. Cook for about 20 minutes. Mix mustard and vinegar together and pour over the mushrooms. Place in the oven for about 5 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Place mushrooms in a large salad bowl with the beans and bacon. Whisk together oil, vinegar and mustard. Drizzle over mushrooms and toss. Garnish with parsley. Serve.

Combine water and carrots in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook 4 minutes. Add pea pods and cook 5 minutes. Add butter and cornstarch to carrots and stir with a wire whisk until cornstarch is dissolved. Bring to a boil. Stirring constantly, bring to a boil again. Reduce heat to low and cook 3-5 minutes or until thickened. Stir in honey. Remove from heat. Cool. Serve.

In a large shallow dish, combine lemon juice and garlic. Add the chicken and turn to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least one hour. Thread the chicken on the skewers and grill on a medium hot grill for about 7 minutes per side or until done. Sprinkle with herbs and serve hot.

Add olive oil to skillet over medium heat. Add the onions, bell peppers, and butter to the pan. Cook until the veggies are tender. Add the eggs and salt/pepper to the pan. Continue to cook the eggs until they are set. In another bowl combine cream and salsa. Pour over the eggs while still cooking. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Remove from the heat and let cool. Slice the eggs into quarters and serve with tortillas.
In a mixing bowl toss spinach with vinegar and oil. Add all other ingredients and toss again. Let sit for 10-15 minutes. Add macadamia nuts. Toss well. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease muffin cups with shortening. Mix butter and sugar. Add eggs, one at a time. Stir in vanilla. Sift together flour and baking powder. Add dry to wet ingredients. Fill muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes.

Prepare teriyaki glaze by combining first six ingredients. Bring to boil and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Whisk in cornstarch until smooth and then stir in remaining ingredients until well blended. Brush teriyaki sauce over steak and then grill to your liking. Serve steak with dipping sauce for extra flavor and enjoy!

Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Pour into greased and floured 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and poke holes throughout the cake. Make sure the holes go all the way through the cake. Pour the cold water into the holes. Pour the cold ricotta cheese over the entire cake. Sprinkle with almonds. Place back in the oven and bake for another 30 minutes. Remove from oven and cool completely. This cake will be moist and delicious. Serve with fresh fruit.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Heat olive oil in a large sauce pan over medium heat. Add onions and garlic. Saute until softened. Stir in the rosemary. Add pearl barley and cook 3 to 5 minutes. Add stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 25 to 30 minutes or until barley is tender. Add sweet potatoes. Cook an additional 5 to 10 minutes. Turn crock pot to low. Transfer soup to a large slow cooker.

Cook noodles as directed on the package. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons of the oil over medium heat. Add the scallions and ginger and cook, stirring often until softened, for about 1 minute. Add the broth and soy sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the broth is reduced by half. Add the mushrooms and continue cooking until they are softened. Add the cooked noodles and the remaining vegetables. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Prepare seasoning by blending all dry ingredients together in a medium bowl. Place pork chops in a ziplock bag with marinade for 1 hour before cooking. Dry off pork chops with paper towels before dipping in seasoning/flour mixture to coat. In a large skillet with high sides over medium heat, heat 1 tbsp oil. Dip each pork chop in beaten egg before placing in skillet. Cook chops in oil 3-4 minutes per side or until a thermometer inserted into center of chop reads 155f. Serve pork chops with hot sauce on the side. Enjoy!

Brown bacon over medium heat until crisp. Drain all but 3 tbsp of grease from pan. Add corn, lima beans, garlic powder, celery salt, butter and milk to pan. Bring to a boil over medium heat then reduce heat to low. Cover pan and simmer for 15 minutes until lima beans are tender. Remove pan from heat and stir in mushrooms. Sprinkle with paprika and romano cheese.

Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain pasta and set aside. While pasta is cooking, melt butter and saute onion for 3 minutes or until soft. Add garlic and cook 1 minute longer. Add tomatoes with juices and basil. Stir in broth and cook for 5 minutes or until sauce is thickened. Combine cheese and black pepper. Stir into pasta mixture. Pour pasta mixture into large bowl. Serve with cheese sprinkled on top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a jelly roll pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl whisk together eggs and sugar. In a separate bowl combine flour and baking powder. Add flour mixture to egg mixture. In a small bowl add the water and stir in the cocoa. Pour the water/cocoa mixture into the egg mixture. Beat well. Stir in vanilla. Pour mixture into the prepared jelly roll pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack. When completely cool remove from the jelly roll pan. Spread a thin layer of frosting on the top half of the cake. Roll up jelly roll style. Cut into slices. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Lightly coat brussels sprouts with olive oil and spread out onto a large baking sheet or roasting dish. Bake for 20 minutes or until the brussels sprouts are tender and golden-brown on the edges. Set aside to cool. While sprouts are still warm, add honey, lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with almonds and serve warm.

In a food processor or blender, combine jalapenos, onion, garlic cloves, tomatoes, salt, vinegar and cilantro. Pulse until desired consistency is reached. Serve over nachos or tortilla chips with a dollop of sour cream on top.

Cook sausage in a large skillet over medium heat until browned and cooked through, stirring frequently with a wooden spoon so that it doesn t stick and burn. Remove from heat and transfer sausage with wooden spoon to a bowl. Set aside. Meanwhile, mix together brown sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally until the brown sugar dissolves and the mixture is well combined. Add pineapple chunks and banana slices to the saucepan and cook until the fruit is heated through and the sauce is thickened slightly. Add the sausage and pineapple mixture back into the large skillet and stir to heat through. Serve sausage with warm fruit on top and garnish with a pinch of cinnamon if desired.

Cut melons in half lengthwisecut out and discard seeds from each half. Using melon baller, scoop out seeds from remaining flesh. With melon scoop, remove outer rind from each half. Cut flesh in 1/2-inch cubesplace in large bowl. Add grape halvestoss to coat. Arrange melons on platessprinkle each plate with 2 tbsp honeytop each with 2 tbsp mint leaves. Drizzle each salad with 2 tbsp lime juicesprinkle each salad with 1 tbsp red leaf lettucetop each salad with 1 mint sprig.

Mix all of the ingredients together except for the chocolate chips and nuts. Form into balls and place about 2 inches apart on greased cookie sheets. Press chocolate chips into the center of each ball of dough and bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove and allow to cool. Yield: 50-60 cookies (depending on the size of the balls).

Place boneless chicken breasts between 2 pieces of plastic wrap. Pound with a meat mallet to a 1/4-inch thickness. Heat butter and brown the chicken breasts. Drain. Meanwhile, heat soup and wine to a boil. Cook until reduced. Add Swiss cheese and stir until melted. Spoon cheese sauce over the chicken. Sprinkle with cooked ham. Serve with French fries.
Spread cream cheese on one side of each bagel. Top with a piece of salmon and capers. Top with onion.

Preheat oven to 450f. Butter or spray a 6 cup muffin tin or lightly grease a mini muffin pan. In a large bowl combine flour, cornmeal, sugar and salt. Make a well in the center and add baking powder. Stir well and then add buttermilk and eggs and beat until just mixed and smooth. In a small bowl mix oil and red peppers together. Fold red peppers into batter until just incorporated and then spoon mixture into prepared pan(s). Bake for 18 minutes or until tops are lightly brown and a tester inserted in center comes out clean. Remove from oven and allow to cool in pan(s) before removing to a rack to cool completely. Store in airtight container for up to one week.

Blend cream cheese, mayonnaise and ketchup. Add mustard to taste. Stir in garlic powder and blend. Add shrimp to dressing and chill. Cut cucumber into rounds. Remove the skin from the cucumber using a paring knife. Mix the chopped cucumber, onions, green pepper and celery. Add to shrimp salad and chill for about one hour. Spoon shrimp salad onto crackers.

Combine chocolate, walnuts and sweetened condensed milk in a medium saucepan. Cook and stir over medium heat until chocolate is melted. Remove from heat and cool 10 minutes. Pour chocolate mixture into a large bowl. Stir in vanilla and salt. Shape truffles into balls and roll in chocolate sprinkles and coconut. Store in refrigerator.

Puree 4-6 whole ripe papayas and 2 cups of water into a blender. Strain pulpy mixture into a clean pitcher through a fine sieve to remove seeds and peel. Stir together 3 cups of water, 2 cups of sugar and 3 limes. Pour mixture into pitcher and stir well to dissolve sugar. Refrigerate 2-4 hours to allow flavors to blend. Serve over ice or pour into a glass over ice cubes to create a slushy. Serves 8-12.

Preheat broiler. In a small bowl, combine lime juice, garlic powder, chili powder, onion powder, cumin, salt and pepper. Rub mixture over chicken. Place chicken on grill rack. Broil on high for about 15 minutes or until a meat thermometer inserted into chicken reads 165 degrees. Meanwhile, place avocado on a small plate. Top each avocado slice with a slice of cheese. Sprinkle each slice with a pinch of salt. Set aside. Place chicken on a platter. Top each breast half with an avocado slice. Sprinkle each breast half with a pinch of salt. Serve.

Mix in 1/4 cup sugar with 1/4 cup hot coffee. Pour into large serving dish. Sift coffee with 1/2 cup sugar. Sprinkle over hot coffee mixture. Whisk in 1/2 cup cold water. Dissolve gelatin in remaining 2/3 cup cold water. Whisk gelatin mixture into coffee mixture. Stir in 1 cup cold water. Refrigerate for 2 to 24 hours.

Wash the mint leaves and pat dry. Place the vinegar, sugar, Certo and garlic cloves in a saucepanbring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil the mixture for 4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat, add the mint leaves and chili flakeslet stand for 2 hours. Strain the mixture through a fine sieve into a clean saucepandiscard the solids. Bring to a boil over medium heat and boil rapidly, stirring frequently until the jelly reaches the desired consistency, about 20 minutes for medium-firm jelly. Pour the jelly into sterilized jars, seal immediately, and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Makes about 4 cups of jelly.

Whisk egg whites at high speed in a large bowl with an electric mixer until soft peaks form. Add vanilla and cream of tartar and continue to beat until the whites are stiff and glossy, about 7 minutes. Add 3/4 cup sugar in 3 additions, beating well after each addition. Add cocoa powder and beat until just blended after each addition (about 1/2 cup). Gently fold in the chocolate chips. Drop batter by heaping teaspoons onto parchment paper. Bake until puffed and firm to the touch (they will deflate when removed from the oven), 15 to 18 minutes (I used a convection oven). Cool completely in the pan (I used a cooling rack). Break the meringues into piecesstore in an airtight container up to 3 days or freeze up to 1 month.

Stir together cornstarch and 1/4 cup sugar in medium bowlstir in 1/4 cup milk. Bring to a boil over medium-high heatcook 2 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heatstir in cocoa powder. Add remaining milk to cornstarch mixturestir well. Whisk espresso powder and remaining 1/4 cup sugar in 1 1/2 cups milk until foamystir into cornstarch mixture. Pour into 4 individual bowlstop with almonds. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnightserve with whipped topping. Note: Pudding can be refrigerated up to 2 daystop with topping just before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a medium sized bowl, stir together the evaporated milk, cream of chicken soup, flour and seasonings until smooth. Cut the butter into the milk mixture with a fork until the butter is in small pieces. Place the chicken in an ungreased 13x9 inch baking dish. Pour the butter mixture over the top of the chickenspread the chicken with the butter mixture until coated. Bake for about 30 minutes or until done.

Peel carrots and radishes. Grate the carrots. Put carrots in a bowl. Add the radishes. Add the sesame oil, rice vinegar, soy sauce, sugar and cayenne. Mix well. Cover the carrot mixture and set aside for 1 hour. Then mix well and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a 9 by 9 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a medium bowl combine apples, brown sugar, cinnamon, and cranberry juice. Stir to coat. Place apples in dish. Sprinkle pork chops with salt and pepper. Dip pork in butter. Place pork chops on top of apples. Cover dish with aluminum foil. Bake for about 45 minutes or until pork is tender. Remove foil from dish. Sprinkle pork chops with brown sugar mixture. Bake for about 5 more minutes or until brown sugar mixture is bubbly. Serve.

Brown beef with onion and garlic powder in large pot over medium-high heat. Drain fat and discard onion and garlic powder. Stir in tomatoes and broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and add meatballs and frozen vegetables. Cook uncovered for 20 minutes or until meatballs are heated through and vegetables are tender. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve hot with your favorite rolls and butter.

Saut� garlic and mushrooms. Add wine and cook until almost evaporated. Add flour and stir until thickened. Stir in cheese. Heat until melted. Adjust seasoning to taste. Serve with bread, meat and vegetables.

Bring water and milk to a boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Stir in rice mix and return to a boil. Stir in crabmeat. Reduce heat to lowcook 10 minutes. Stir in frozen vegetables. Cook over medium heat 5 minutesstir in margarine and cook 30 seconds longer. Sprinkle with basil, garlic powder. Stir in cheese. Cook 2 minutes longer. Serves 6.

Beat eggs with sugar until light and fluffy. Add salt and pepper to taste and beat again. Add flour and beat again until smooth. Gradually add milk and beat until smooth and shiny. Cook over medium-low heat and stir constantly until thickened and bubbly. Stir in lemon juice and remove from heat. Add more lemon juice if necessary to reach desired tartness. Serve with toasted bread or crackers.

Prepare a large baking dish by lining it with greaseproof paper (or use a roasting tin). Drizzle with a little oil and place in the fridge for a few hours or overnight so the paper will stick down. In a frying pan on a high heat, add a little oil and fry the rosemary sprigs until they’re crispy – set aside and keep warm in a warm place. Add the redcurrant jelly and vinegar into the pan and reduce until thick and syrupy – set aside too. In a shallow dish mix the lamb with the crushed rosemary leaves, rosemary sprigs, a little olive oil and salt and pepper. Arrange the lamb on the baking dish, skin side down and drizzle with the remaining oil. Bake for around 25 minutes or until cooked through. Allow to rest for around five minutes before serving with some of the redcurrant sauce and some rocket leaves.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly grease 2 round 8-inch pans with butter. Cream butter with brown sugar. Add 1/3 cup granulated sugar. Stir in sifted flour. Add the milk & boiling water. Bake for 25 minutes. Let cool. Meanwhile, mix brown sugar & 3/4 cup granulated sugar in saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until caramel color. Pour over cooled cake. Let set.

Preheat the oven to 350°F. Cut the spaghetti squash in half lengthwise. Place cut-side down in an un-greased baking dish. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until the squash easily separates into strands with the help of a fork. Remove from the oven, and discard the seeds. Add the onion and garlic to the baking dish. Cook for 2 minutes. Pour the chicken broth over the squash. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover with foil. Bake for 10 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour two 9x13 pans. In large bowl, mix together apple pie filling and cake mix. Add eggs and beat with electric mixer on low speed. Beat in oil and vanilla. Add walnuts and beat to combine. Divide batter between pans. Bake for 30 minutes or until cake tests done. Cool for 5 minutes and remove from pans to wire rack. Cool completely.

Bring chicken broth to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir in couscous. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Melt butter in a small saucepan. Add peas. Cook and stir 3 to 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in parmesan cheese. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper. Combine couscous mixture and peas in a large bowl. Makes 4 servings.

Boil or steam the mushrooms until tender (about 10 min). Drain off any excess liquid from the mushrooms. Finely dice the mushrooms into pieces. Add lemon juice and cooked mushrooms to the bowl of the food processor with the cream and onion. Process until the mixture is smooth (it will be quite thick). Season with salt, pepper and sugar to taste. If desired, garnish with slices of lettuce leaf. Serve immediately. This recipe serves four as a side dish with meat or poultry. It can be eaten as is or added to hot cooked noodles or rice. It can also be served with fresh tomatoes for an appetizer or as a meal served over hot cooked noodles.

Crack eggs in a large pot and fill with cold water. Bring pot to a boil and cook eggs for about 10 minutes or until completely hard boiled. Drain and cool in ice cold water. When cool enough to handle, peel and slice the eggs in half lengthwise and remove yolks with a small spoon. Mash yolks with a fork until smooth and add mayonnaise and mustard to make a spreadable consistency. Add relish and season with garlic powder, paprika, salt and pepper. Fill eggs with the mixture and arrange on a platter or in a serving bowl. Serve immediately with slices of hard-boiled eggs on each side for dipping.

Cook pasta in boiling water until tender. Drain well. Toss with cucumber, kiwi, strawberry and cashews. In a separate bowl, whisk together all dressing ingredients until well combined. Pour over salad. Top with Swiss cheese. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 12 servings.

Skewer the salmon pieces on the skewers, rub the kabobs with the brown sugar and dijon mustard and let marinade for about an hour in the refrigerator. Put the kabobs on the grill or in the broiler for about 10 minutes or until done. Put the soy sauce and white vinegar in a small saucepan and bring it to a boil over medium heat stirring constantly, and cook until the sauce thickens. Remove from the heat and let it cool for about five minutes and then drizzle the sauce over the kabobs and serve immediately.

Combine cereals and pretzels in a large bowl. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Drizzle over cereals. Stir well. Pour into a 9x13 pan. Cover and chill overnight. Store in airtight container. Makes about 6 cups.

Take slices of prosciutto and lay them on the bottom of the french rolls (butter side up). Place slices of fresh mozzarella on top of prosciutto slices. Spread fig jam on top of the mozzarella. Place the other french roll on top of the jam (butter side down) so that the fig jam is in the center of the sandwich. Grill on a griddle or on the broiler until the bread is lightly browned. Served hot.

Slice prickly pears lengthwise into 1/2 inch slices. Place the slices in a glass or ceramic baking dish. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon, and then drizzle with butter. Bake at 375 degrees for about 30 minutes or until tender. Add a little lemon juice if desired to give it a sour taste. Serve warm.

The best way to steam clams is to use an electric kettle filled with cold water. Place the clams into a steamer basket or clamshell, which will fit into the kettle. Fill the kettle with cold water, cover and set over medium high heat. Bring to a boil for 5 minutes, or until clams just open. Drain clams into a colander and reserve broth for another use. Mix clam broth with 1 teaspoon of cornstarch and set aside to thicken (can be made ahead). Meanwhile, combine 1/4 cup of broth with 1 tablespoon of flour to make a paste for thickening. Place 1/2 cup of breadcrumbs on a plate, add 2 teaspoons of kosher salt and 1/4 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper to taste. Stir to combine. Place remaining 1/4 cup of breadcrumbs on a separate plate. Roll clams in the paste, then coat with breadcrumbs. Heat 1/2 tablespoon of bacon fat in a saute pan over medium heat until

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl mix together all ingredients. Fold in apples and walnuts. Pour batter into a greased 9×13 pan. Bake for 40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for about 30 minutes before cutting into squares. Store in refrigerator.

Cut tomatoes in half crosswise and gently peel away the skins. Cut the tomato halves into 1/2 inch slices and set aside. In a small bowl combine the flour, salt, and pepper. In a large deep skillet heat the oil to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Working in batches dredge the tomato slices in the flour mixture then add them to the oil being careful not to crowd them. Fry the tomatoes until golden brown on both sides, about 3 minutes per side, turning gently with a wire skimmer to prevent breaking them. Remove the tomatoes to paper towels to drain and serve immediately with butter or mayonnaise.
Beat egg whites until frothygradually beat in sugar and extracts. Beat until stiffdrop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. Decorate with peppermint candy pieces.
Layer cream cheese, hidden valley ranch dressing mix and artichoke hearts on bottom of appetizer dish. Add roasted red peppers and black olives. Layer parsley and garlic on top.

Combine all spices in a small bowl and set aside. In a blender or food processor, puree the garlic and half of the cumin. Transfer the puree to a bowl and add the remaining spices. Whisk until combined. Rub the prawns with the spice mixture. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium heat. Add the prawns and cook for about 4 minutes per side until golden and cooked through. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine the yogurt and red food coloring. Serve the prawns with the tikka sauce.

Heat oil over medium-high heat. Add zucchini and saute until tender and golden. Remove zucchini from pan. Add cherry tomatoes and saute for about two minutes. Return zucchini to pan and add basil leaves. Remove from heat and drizzle with vinegar and salt and pepper. Toss with pine nuts and serve hot. Recipe from Food Network's Easy Entertaining.
Put all ingredients into a blender and whiz until smooth. Serve immediately with strawberries. Makes enough for about 4 strawberries or 2 cups of sliced strawberries.

Cook macaroni al dente in boiling water until tender. Drain well, reserving 1 cup pasta water to thin sauce if needed. Combine macaroni, cheese, mayonnaise, salad oil vinegar, onion, ham, and 1/2 cup of the reserved pasta water. Toss until combined. Fold in green peas. Taste salad and add more salt or vinegar as needed.
Combine sugar, star anise pods, grapefruit juice and Campari in a pitcher. Chill. Before serving add sparkling wine to fill glasses. Garnish glasses with star anise pods. Serve immediately.

Bring to a boil over medium heat, unsweetened apple sauce. Reduce heat to medium low. Stir in sugar-free raspberry gelatin. Cook until dissolved. Add unsweetened orange juice. Cook until gelatin is dissolved. Remove from heat. Add ice cubes to cool to room temperature. Stir in diet 7-up. Chill for 4 hours before serving. Top with whipped topping.

Add vegetable oil to a large skillet over medium heat. Dip cube steaks in flour. Cook until brown on both sides. Add onion to skillet. Cook onion until tender. Add mushrooms. Cook onion mixture 3 to 5 minutes. Stir in brown gravy mix and stewed tomatoes. Cook on low heat. Stir in egg noodles. Cook 7 to 10 minutes or until noodles are tender. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve. Serves 4.

Trim excess fat from the lamb. Pat the meat dry with paper towels. Place lamb between 2 sheets of plastic wrap. Pound with meat mallet until thin (about 1/4 inch thick). Season with salt and pepper. Place on plate and refrigerate for 2 hours. Remove from refrigerator and preheat grill to high heat. Grill the lamb for 3 minutes per side. Brush with the pesto-balsamic mixture and grill for another 3 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a large bowl mix flour, bran and spices. In another bowl beat sugar and canola oil until creamy. Add soymilk and pumpkin puree, mix until smooth. Add wet to dry and mix. Pour into muffin cups and bake for 20-25 minutes. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Makes 12 muffins.

Rinse quinoa and place in a fine mesh strainer. Rinse under cold water. Place in a saucepan. Cover with water by 2 inches and add 1 teaspoon of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to a simmer. Cook until quinoa is tender and water is absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes. Let quinoa stand 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and set aside. In a large bowl whisk together 2 tablespoons of the oil, lime juice and vinegar. Season with salt and garlic. Add the quinoa. Mix in corn and tomatoes. Toss with remaining oil and parsley.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel and chop squash in a food processor. Put in a medium saucepan with enough water to cover. Cook over medium heat until soft. Drain and return to pan. Melt margarine and stir in syrup and spices. Add squash to pan. Cook over medium heat for 20 minutes. Serve.

Beat together butter, sugars and banana until fluffy. Beat egg and vanilla together until combined. Stir flour, baking soda and salt into the banana mixture until just combined. Stir in chocolate chips and fold in oats. Drop by teaspoons onto cookie sheet. Bake for 9-11 minutes until golden brown. Cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

Make the beets and onions. Cook the beets with the skin on in the chicken broth until tender. In the meantime, peel and cut the onions and fry them in butter until golden brown. Next make the beet and onion mix. Add the red wine vinegar and the chicken broth. Mix flour into the liquid until smooth. Stir in the port. Add the beets and onions to the soup and cook until tender. Season with the salt and pepper and serve with sour cream. Serve with sour cream.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Stir together beef and remaining ingredients in a skillet. Cook and stir over medium-high heat until beef is cooked through. Serve over cooked macaroni.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Spray a large nonstick baking dish with cooking spray. In a small bowl, mix bread crumbs with pepper, parsley, mayonnaise, water and hot pepper sauce. Place fillets in baking dishtop with bread crumb mixture. Drizzle with lemon wedgesbake for 25 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Heat extra virgin olive oil over medium heat. Add shallot and cook until softened and translucent. Add basil and cook until basil begins to wilt. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Place corn kernels on a large rimmed baking sheet. Drizzle with shallot-basil mixture and toss gently until kernels are evenly coated. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and toss again. Transfer corn to a platter and serve warm.

Saute onions and garlic in a bit of oil until they soften and then add ground beef and seasoning. Cook for a few minutes and then add water. Cook until liquid is gone and then add stewed tomatoes. Stir in cilantro and serve.

Peel mushrooms and cut caps crosswise in half or quarters to remove stems. Clean mushrooms by cutting off any damaged parts and brush with lemon juice. Mix mushrooms with parsley, garlic, olive oil, salt and pepper in a bowl. In a separate bowl beat egg yolk with a fork until slightly thickened, then stir in enough vinegar to thin slightly. Pour over mushrooms and toss to coat well. Transfer to a serving platter and serve.

Melt 2 Tablespoons butter and combine with cracker crumbs. Press crumbs into bottom of 9x13x2-inch baking dish. In small saucepan, heat milk until hotadd pudding mix and whisk until blended and pudding is thickenedremove from heat and stir in ice cream and 2 cups of the whipped topping until blended. Spoon pudding mixture over crumbs and top with remaining whipped topping and chopped Heath bars. Refrigerate until set. Cut into bars and serve.

Whip together cream and cocoa in a bowl. Add chocolate and continue to whip until smooth. Add nuts and vanilla. In a separate bowl, stir together powdered sugar and butter. Mix the dry ingredients into the chocolate mixture. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto waxed paper. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Melt chocolate. Dip truffles in chocolate. Drain. Place on waxed paper. Refrigerate until set. Makes about 18.

Mix together butter and brown sugar. Cream well. Add flour, baking soda and baking powder. Stir in eggs and vanilla. Add peach slices. Pour into buttered 10 x 15-inch jelly roll pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Invert cake onto plate and sprinkle pecans and remaining brown sugar over the top. Serve warm. Serves 16.

Cook the israeli couscous according to packet instructions. In a large mixing bowl combine the coriander and the lemon zest and juice. Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium heat and cook the nuts until lightly toasted. Pour the oil over the couscous and the coriander and toss gently to combine. Taste and add salt and pepper if necessary. Serve at once.

In a medium bowl combine almonds and sugar. Toss until well coated. Spread mixture evenly on a platter. Layer Boston lettuce leaves on top of almond mixture. Arrange strawberries on top of lettuce leaves. Top with spinach leaves and drizzle with poppy seed dressing. Serve.

Cream the butter with the sugar until it turns a light yellow colour. Beat in the eggs one at a time and stir in the zest and juice from the lemons. Stir in the passion fruit pulp and mix well. Fold in the flour until the mixture is well incorporated and a soft dough is formed. Divide the dough into two parts and roll each part into a long log and place on a greased baking tray. Press the ends together and twist the ends around each other into a spiral and place the logs close together on the tray so that they will rise and help each other in the oven. Bake in a pre-heated oven at 180°C for about one hour or until golden brown and firm in texture. Serve with freshly made cream and a sprinkling of powdered sugar on top.
Cut bagel in half & place on serving plate, spread strawberry cream cheese on one half of each bagel. Place sliced fruit on top of each half bagel & serve.

Saute the little smokies for about 5 minutes in a skillet with a little oil. Place the smokies in a small bowl. Add the barbecue sauce and water. Mix well and let stand for about 15 minutes. Pour mixture over smokies and place on baked potato chips. Serve at room temperature.

Wash the figs and remove the stems and leaves. Place the figs in a saucepan and add enough water to cover them by about an inch. Bring to boil and cook for about 1 minute. Remove from heat and drain figs. Repeat this process once more to cook the figs thoroughly. Cut the figs into small pieces and add them to the saucepan. Add sugar and honey and bring to a boil. Turn down to low and cook until the figs have released their juices and are softened (about 30 minutes). Add lemon juice and zest and continue to cook until the jam is thick and syrupy (about 5 more minutes). Remove the cinnamon and clove and let cool completely before storing in refrigerator or freezer (up to 6 months). Makes about 3 cups jamserves 12 to 15 people.
In a large bowl combine hot water, gelatin and pudding mix. Stir until pudding is dissolved. Add mandarin oranges. Stir well. Add cool whip. Refrigerate overnight.
Coat chicken breasts in seasoning mix. Grill or saute until no longer pink in center. Serve chicken topped with ginger lime mayo.

Drain the beans, reserving the liquid. Place the beans in a blender or food processor with the onion, jalapeno, garlic, cumin, cumin, water and salt. Add the oil to a skillet on medium heat and sauté the onion until translucent. Add the beans and stir until the beans are heated through, about 2 minutes.

Bring cocoa powder, sugar, and water to a boil in a saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Cook and stir 5 min. Add corn syrup and vanilla extract and cook and stir 5 min more or until thickened and candy thermometer reaches 240F. Remove from heat and stir in salt. Let cool completely before using. Store in a tightly covered container in the refrigerator for up to 2 months.
Layer lettuce on large platter. Arrange celery, peas, egg, onion, pepper and bacon on top of lettuce. Drizzle with mayonnaise, sugar and cheddar cheese.

Trim the wings and discard any excess fat and gristle. In a bowl combine the honey, curry powder and ginger. Rub the chicken wings in the honey mixture and place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned and tender. Serve immediately and garnish each serving with a slice of lime and a sprinkling of cayenne pepper to taste.

Soak the hens in cold water for about an hour. Place the hens in a pot and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil and cook for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain and set aside. In a small bowl combine the cornstarch with the dry mustard. In a small saucepan combine the vinegar, honey and soy sauce. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Reduce the heat and add the dry mustard mixture. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Add the pineapple and green and red bell peppers. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the hens and cook for 5 minutes. Add the cooked pineapple and peppers. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve the pineapple pepper sauce over the hens. Enjoy.
Put ice cream in a tall glass and slowly pour cola over it. Add chocolate syrup and garnish with a maraschino cherry if desired.

Cut raisin bread into quarters and toast lightlyset aside. Spread butter on bread and sprinkle with cheese and bacontop with remaining bread quarters and press down lightly to sandwich. Place sandwiches on grill over medium heat and cook until cheese is melted and bread is toasted, about 5 minutes per side.

Prepare stock. Dice onion, carrot and garlic. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, carrot, garlic and cook until tender. Stir in basil. Add to stock. Add stock to a large saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil. Add carrots, onion, garlic. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in pasta. Cook according to package instructions. Add to a large bowl. Stir in lemon juice. Remove from heat. Stir in butter. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place asparagus in a bowl and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with kosher salt and black pepper. Roast for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and transfer to a cutting board. Slice off the bottoms of the stems of the asparagus and discard. Using a sharp knife, remove the tough bottoms of the asparagus spears. Drizzle the asparagus with browned butter and sprinkle with lemon zest and juice. Serve immediately.

In small saucepan, melt butter over low heat. Add slivered almonds, cream, white chocolate chips and amaretto. Stir constantly until smooth. Cook over low heat until thickened. Remove from heat and add salt to taste. Serve warm with fruit.

Boil water in a large pot. Add bouillon cube. Stir in rice. Cover and cook on low heat for 10 minutes. Stir in sour cream. Add garlic powder and ground black pepper. Cook 2 minutes more. Stir in parmesan cheese. Transfer to a serving bowl. Let stand for 2 minutes. Serve.
Spread walnuts on one slice of baguette. Top with brown sugar. Sprinkle with salt. Place the brie on the baguette and top with the apple. Put the other slice of baguette on top and serve.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly. Stir in brown sugar. Add milk slowly and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture reaches boiling point. Cook 2 minutes more while stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in powdered sugar with a spoon or whisk until frosting thickens and is smooth in consistency.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8x8 baking dish. In a medium saucepan, heat milk over medium heat until hot. In a separate bowl, beat eggs. In another bowl, stir together sausage, cheese, and onion powder. Pour hot milk into eggs, stirring constantly. Add eggs to sausage mixture. Pour sausage mixture into baking dish. Top with bread cubes. Bake 25 minutes. Serve hot.

Wash potatoes well. Place potatoes in a large pot of cold water. Add the kosher salt. Place pot over high heat. Cook potatoes until tender. Drain. Cool. Transfer potatoes to a large bowl. Add cream cheese. Mash potatoes with a potato masher. Add the butter and cream. Transfer potatoes to a large baking sheet. Roll potatoes into balls. Place balls onto a baking sheet. Place baking sheet on middle rack. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve with sour cream. Serves 8.

Preheat oven to 170c/340f/Gas 3. Grease a 13cm flan dish and line with baking paper. Melt the butter in a pan and stir in the plain flour until a smooth paste forms. Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly until thickened and the mixture leaves the sides of the pan. Remove from the heat and stir in the vanilla essence and sugar. Beat the eggs in a bowl and then add to the mixture, stirring well until smooth and lump free. Pour into the prepared dish and bake for 35-40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Dust with desiccated coconut before serving.

Preheat oven to 325f. Grease a pie plate with butter and then dust with graham cracker crumbs and granulated sugar. Press the crumbs into the bottom of the plate and up the sides. Melt the butter and pour it over the crumbs in the pan to coat them lightly. Bake the crust for 10 minutes or until it is golden brown. Cool on wire rack for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, beat the cream cheese until smooth. In a bowl mix the gelatin with the cold water and set aside to soften. In a saucepan heat the cream over medium heat until it comes to a boil. Pour the boiling cream over the softened gelatin and stir until dissolved. Set aside to cool. In a bowl beat the cream until it is thickened. Stir in the cooled gelatin mixture and the raspberry preserves. Pour the filling into the pie shell and refrigerate for 1 hour or until the filling is set. Before serving top the pie with whipped topping and raspberries.

In a large skillet over medium heat, add the olive oil. Whisk in the raspberry vinegar, dijon mustard and unsalted butter. When the butter is melted, add the mushrooms. Cook until lightly browned. Add chives. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with your favorite bread. Serves 4.

Preheat the oven to 375F. Butter and flour a 9x13 baking dish and set aside. Cream together the butter and the sugars in a large bowl until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Add the eggs one at a time and beat until fully incorporated. Mix in the flour and the baking soda, and then fold in the butterscotch chips and walnuts until evenly distributed. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for about 17 minutes or until the edges are set and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the blondies to cool completely before cutting into bars and serving. Store leftovers in an airtight container for up to one week or freeze for up to one month.

Cook pasta in large saucepan as directed on package for 1 minute less than the time suggested on the package. Drain well. Meanwhile, cook ground beef as directed on package for about 5 minutes or until browned. Drain fat from pan if necessary. Add salsa to panbring to boiling. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes or until salsa is hot, stirring occasionally. Stir in pastacook over medium heat for 1 minute or until heated through. Add nonfat sour creamstir well. Top with cheeselet stand for 1 minute or until cheese melts. Serve immediately.

Slice artichokes in half lengthwise. Remove the tender inner leaves. Place artichoke halves in a small casserole dish. In a food processor combine vegan cream cheese, garlic clove, smoked paprika. Pulse until combined. Add in vegan mayonnaise, artichoke hearts and remaining vegan parmesan. Blend until combined. Pour into casserole dish. Refrigerate 2-4 hours or until cold. Garnish with additional vegan parmesan. Serve with whole wheat crackers.

Soak chickpeas in water in large saucepan. Drain and place in a large pot cover with water. Bring water to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-lowsimmer until chickpeas are tender, about 1 hour. Drain and transfer chickpeas to a food processor. Discard liquid. Add lemon juice and zest, tahini, harissa, garlic cloves, parsley, waterpulse until smooth. Transfer hummus to a bowlseason with salt. Serve warm or cold with pita bread.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Poke holes in potatoes with fork. Place potatoes in a large bowl and pour cheese soup over them. Stir in garlic and black pepper. Place potatoes in a large baking dish and pour soup mixture over top. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered for about 1 hour.

Beat egg yolks until very thick. Blend cornstarch with milk. Add cornstarch mixture to yolks. Continue blending until very thick. Add vanilla. Whip in half-and-half. Add nutmeg. Heat mixture in double boiler stirring constantly until thick. Pour into mold. Bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes. Top with fresh fruit.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Core and quarter the apples. In a small bowl, mix the lemon juice with the clarified butter. In another bowl toss the raisins with the orange flower water. Heat a cast iron skillet or a large pan and coat with clarified butter. Place the apples cut side down in the skillet. Brush the apple slices with the clarified butter mixture and sprinkle with pine nuts. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until apples are soft and tender. Serve warm or at room temperature. Sprinkle with the honey and orange flower water.

Bring 3 cups water to a rolling boil. Place tea bags into a 2-quart saucepan. Add water to tea bags. Strain tea bags into a large bowl. Add remaining water to saucepan. Add cauliflower, onion & celery. Cook over low heat for 20 minutes or until cauliflower is tender. Add butter to saucepan. Add milk & cook over low heat until butter melts. Remove from heat. Stir cauliflower & sauce mixture into tea mixture. Season with salt & pepper. Serve.

Cut sourdough bread rounds into quarters. Spread 1 tablespoon of preserves onto each half of the bread round, leaving a 1-inch border around the edge. Top each bread round with sliced brie and press down lightly. Sprinkle each brie-covered half of the bread round with 1/2 teaspoon of brown sugar and garnish with pine nuts and berries. Place the brie-topped bread rounds in the freezer for at least 30 minutes or refrigerate for up to 2 hours. Serve as an appetizer or dessert. Serve with crackers, fruits and nuts.

Cook spinach according to package directions. Drain well. Add sausage and garlic to the hot spinach and cook for two minutes. Add the olive oil to the pan along with the dried oregano, dried parsley and pepper. Remove from heat. Add cooked pasta to the pan and toss to coat. Transfer to a serving platter and sprinkle generously with Parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In medium bowl, beat together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in flour and vanilla until well blended. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Sprinkle chips on top. Bake 9-11 minutes or until cookies are set. Cool on cookie sheet for 2 minutes, then remove to wire rack to cool completely.

Melt butter in heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir onion and garlic in butter until tender. Stir in vinegar and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 1 minute. Stir in applesauce and sugar. Cook and stir 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in black pepper. Add cabbage and apples. Cook and stir until cabbage is tender. Top with apple juice.

Pre-heat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit and grease a baking sheet with butter or a non-stick spray. Brush parsnips and carrots with a bit of oil and salt and pepper them generously. Bake for about 20 minutes or until fork tender and softened. Remove parsnips and carrots from the baking sheet and place in a blender or food processor with a bit of water and puree until smooth and creamy. Set aside until ready to use.

Put onion into pie shell. Spread cheese on top of onion. Place chili in pie shell on top of cheese. Place frito scoops on top of chili. Sprinkle jalapeno on top of scoops. Serve immediately with some chili on the side if desired.

Heat the oils in a large saucepan and add the onion and bay leaves. Cook for about 5 minutes until onion softens and becomes translucent. Add the beans and stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for about 2 hours until beans are tender. Add the pancetta and cook for about 5 minutes until it browns. Season with sea salt. Serves 4.

Prepare stuffing according to package directions and set aside. Preheat oven to 350f. In a bowl, beat together the sour cream and soup mix until smooth. Add the cheese and blend well. Add the spinach and mix well. Spray an 11-inch souffle dish with cooking spray and pour mixture into the dish. Place the stuffing into a small bowl and spread over the mixture in the souffle dish. Place in the oven and bake for about 35 minutes, or until the center is set and a knife inserted into the center comes out clean.

1. Whisk eggs and 1 cup of sugar with a wire whisk. 2. Add brandy. 3. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat. 4. Remove from heat. 5. Whisk in nutmeg. 6. Add remaining sugar, cream and milk. 7. Return to medium heatwhisk constantly. 8. Boil 1 minute or until mixture is thick. 9. Pour into a bowlrefrigerate 4 hours or until cold. 10. Stir in remaining brandy. 11. Serve cold.

Cook ground beef and onion in a large saucepan over medium heat until brown. Drain fat. Stir in the soup and milk. Bring to a boil. Stir in the cream of chicken soup. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the sour cream. Add the meatballs. Cook and stir over low heat for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with nutmeg.
Bring water to boil. Add sugar and cornstarch. Whisk to combine. Boil for two minutes. Add butter and vanilla extract. Stir until butter melts. Remove from heat.

Brew tea as directed. Let tea cool. Combine tea with orange and grapefruit juices. Stir in sugar and let sit until sugar dissolves. Add ice cubes and stir until ice cubes are dissolved. Garnish each glass with a slice of orange and a slice of grapefruit. Serve.
Cut tomatoes into 1 inch cubes. Cube blue cheese. Mix dressing with blue cheese. Toss tomatoes and blue cheese with dressing. Season with pepper and salt.

In double boiler over simmering water, melt peanut butter and syrup. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Fold in rice krispies and chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. Refrigerate until firm. Store covered.

Wash rice and add it and bay leaf to two cups water. Bring it to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until water is absorbed. Fluff rice with a fork. Melt butter and add to rice. Add lime juice and stir. Add olive oil and stir. Add salt and stir. Fluff rice with fork. Serve as side dish.

Mix seasonings. Mix flour with bread crumbs in bowl. Place chicken in another bowl with oil and egg. Dip both sides of chicken into egg, then into bread crumbs. Fry in hot oil until crisp and brown on both sides.
In a large frying pan, saute garlic and ginger until fragrant. Add baby bok choy and saute until tender-crisp. Add sweet chili sauce, salt and pepper to taste.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until golden, about 1 minute. Add the wine and the tomato puree and cook until the liquid reduces to about 1/2 cup. Add the heavy cream and the basil and cook until the sauce thickens. Turn off the heat. Cut the boneless chicken breasts into 1/2-inch-thick strips. Season with salt and pepper. Heat the remaining oil in a large skillet over high heat until smoking. Add the chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, about 3 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and the red pepper and bring to a boil. Cook until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken. Serve hot.

In a medium bowl, whisk together sugar and milkset aside. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, cocoa powder, and salt. Add the sugar mixture and whisk to combine. Add margarine and vanilla and mix until combined. Stir in peanut butter and oatmeal. Drop dough by heaping teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes or until tops are cracked. Cool cookies on cookie sheet for 2 minutes. Transfer cookies to wire racks to cool completely.

Cut bread into 1-inch pieces. Coat with cooking spray. Arrange in single layer in greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Beat the eggs in medium bowl until blended. Stir in milk. Add dry mustard. Stir in sausage. Stir in bread pieces. Spoon into baking dish. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 45 minutes. Serve with toast.

Bring 3 cups of water to a boil in a saucepan. Add 1/3 cup of rice wine vinegar and 2 tablespoons of soy sauce. Add broccoli and cook for 1 minute. Add 1 cup of chicken broth. Stir in garlic and ground ginger. Bring back to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Drain broccoli. Set aside. In a large skillet, melt 1 tablespoon of butter over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of soy sauce and 1/4 teaspoon of ground ginger. Cook for 1 minute. Add 1/4 cup of cornstarch. Cook for 1 minute. Add 2 cups of broth and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in broccoli and medium shrimp. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in 1/3 cup of soy sauce. Cook until thickened and broccoli is tender. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Cook green onions in oil until tenderadd flour to onions, stirring constantly with a whisk. Gradually add milk, stirring constantly until mixture thickens. Add hot sauce, salt, pepper, crab meat, shrimp and parsleybring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heatsimmer until thickened, about 20 minutes. In a large pot of boiling water, cook egg noodles until just tenderdrain.

Prepare your pasta according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, mix cornstarch with a small amount of cold water to make it easier to measure later. Add frozen shrimp to a large skillet with cornstarch mixture. Add olive oil to skillet over medium heat. When oil is hot, add gingerroot to skillet along with shrimp/cornstarch mixture. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes without stirring. Add frozen stir fry vegetables to skillet along with shrimp/cornstarch mixture. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes without stirring. Pour mixture into pasta pot while pasta is still cooking. Add italian dressing to skillet over medium heat. When dressing is hot, add hoisin sauce to skillet along with pasta/dressing mixture from pasta pot. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes without stirring. Serve immediately with angel hair pasta.

Peel potatoes and dice into large cubes. Cook potatoes in a large pot of boiling water until tender, about 15 minutes or until a fork slides through the potato easily. Drain potatoes and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process. Place potatoes in a large bowl. Add butter, diced garlic clove, salt, pepper, milk and bouillon to the potatoes and stir until well mixed. Heat soup in the microwave until heated through. Serve with a sprinkling of dried parsley.

Cut a round loaf of italian bread in half lengthwise and spread mayo on both sides of the bread. In a small bowl add parmesan cheese and garlic cloves. Mix together with a spoon then spread on top of the mayo. Broil on high for about a minute or two on each side of bread until cheese is melted and golden brown. Serve with crackers or vegetables.
Pour vodka into a shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass filled with ice cubes and add remaining ingredients. Garnish with an orange slice.
Bring water to boil. Add currants and raspberries. Simmer about 2 minutes until currants are tender. Remove from heat, cool. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Pour into sterilized jars and seal.

Place cooked rice on plate. Arrange shrimp on rice. Arrange celery around rice. Place yogurt in small dish. Place mustard in small dish. Place lemon juice in small dish. Place salt in small dish. Place strawberries on plate. Place lettuce on plate. Dress shrimp with mustard/lemon juice/salt mixture. Dress celery with yogurt. Dress rice with mustard/lemon juice/salt mixture. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a medium-size saucepan. Add 2 cups of brown sugar and stir until dissolved. Remove from heat and add the butterstir until melted and smooth. In a small bowl, whisk together the flour and baking soda. Add this to the brown sugar mixture and stir until smooth and thickened. Add 3 eggs and stir until well combined. Pour into a large shallow pan or baking sheet and refrigerate until firm and set (about 1 hour). Meanwhile, prepare the filling by cutting the banana into 1/2-inch-thick slices and stirring in the pecans. When the topping is firm, cut the biscuits in half and spread each half with some butter. Spoon a little filling onto each half and fold in half to form a half-circle sandwich. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Slice the guava in half and remove pits. Mix 1/2 cup of guava with 2 tablespoons of the oyster sauce in a small bowl. Set aside. Heat the oil in a wok or heavy frying pan over medium heat. Add the chicken pieces and brown for 1 minute or so on each side. Add the remaining 1/2 cup guava with the rest of the oyster sauce. Simmer for 2 minutes or so. Add the remaining 1/2 cup sugar, catsup, soy sauce, Chinese Five Spice Powder, and salt. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Transfer to a serving platter. Serve with rice.

Pour cream cheese into a large bowlbeat until fluffy. Gradually beat in granulated sugar. Blend in flour, lemon zest, orange zest and 1/2 teaspoon lemon extract. Beat egg yolks until thick and lemon coloredgradually beat into creamed mixture. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks formfold into creamed mixture. Pour into crustfreeze about 2 hours or until firm. Remove from freezerlet stand at room temperature about 15 minutes before serving.

In a large pot or dutch oven add the hot pork sausage and frozen southern style hash brown potatoes. Cook over medium heat, breaking up the sausage with a wooden spoon until cooked through and the hash brown potatoes are heated through. In a small bowl combine the garlic powder, celery salt, salt and dry mustard and mix well. In a small bowl combine the white pepper and onion flakes and mix well. In a large pot or dutch oven add the hot pork sausage and frozen southern style hash brown potatoes and stir in the garlic salt mixture and white pepper mixture. Cook for about 20 minutes and stir frequently. Serve with country gravy mix for garnish and enjoy!

Bake potatoes 40 minutes or until tender. Cool 10 minutes. Slice potatoes lengthwise and cut into 1/2-inch slices. Mix potatoes with butter and spread onto greased 15x10x1-inch baking dish. Bake at 400f for 15 minutes. Remove from ovenmix together soup and sour cream. Stir into potatoes. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake 10 to 15 minutes longer or until heated through. Sprinkle with green onion.

Bring water to boil in a panadd kale and boil for 5 minutes until kale is tenderdrainadd oil and cook onion until tenderadd tomato paste and stir to mixadd the kale and stiradd the kale and stiradd waterseason with saltbring to boilcook for 2 minutes or until the vegetable is tenderserve hotserve with rice and ugali

Sprinkle salt and pepper over both sides of the pork loin. Melt butter. Saute pork loin in butter for 2 minutes on each side. Add pork to a large crock pot. Add pepper and seasonings to pork. Add water. Cover and cook on low for 5-6 hours or until tender. Shred pork and add to sauce. Stir to combine. Add mozzarella cheese. Cook for 10 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve over rice.

Boil the rice in the water with the saffron. Cook the saffron for 10 minutes. Take out the saffron. Strain the rice. Keep aside. Make a syrup by mixing the sugar and 1 cup water. Bring to boil. Add the pineapple. Boil for 3 minutes. Add the lemon juice. Turn off the fire. Strain the pineapple. Add the pineapple syrup to the rice. Mix the rice with the pineapple. Keep aside. Heat ghee in a pan. Add the pineapple, cardamom pods, cinnamon sticks. Cook the pineapple for 2 minutes. Add this to the rice. Garnish with chopped coriander. Serve.

Preheat oven to 325f. Grease 8 x 8 x 2-inch glass baking dish. Combine brown sugar, butter, maple flavoring, eggs, flour and baking powder. Stir together well. Fold in walnuts. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake 30 minutes. Cool completely before cutting.

In a double boiler, melt margarine. Add chocolate and stir until melted. Add sugar substitute and vanillastir until blended. Remove from heat. Stir in cream cheese. Pour mixture into a greased 9×9 pan. Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm. Cut into squares and top with nuts if desired.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, mix the vinegar, honey and onion together until the onion is translucent. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl combine walnuts, salad greens, apples, cranberries and the onion mixture. In a small bowl mix together the oil, dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper. Pour over the salad and toss. Serve immediately.
Roll up tortillas in lettuce. Cut bacon crossways in halves. Arrange on lettuce. Top with tomatoes. Drizzle each wrap with salad dressing and sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

Wash the chicken pieces. Chop the onion into small pieces. Chop the spinach into small pieces. Peel the taro root, wash and cut into small pieces. Peel the tomatoes, cut into small pieces. Peel the corn flour. In a bowl mix the chicken pieces, onion pieces, spinach pieces, taro root pieces, tomato pieces, corn flour, chicken stock powder, salt and lemon slice together. Put the coconut cream into another bowl. Mix the taro root with the chicken pieces together. Cook in the coconut cream until the taro root is cooked. Add the corn flour to the coconut cream & cook for a few minutes until the corn flour is cooked & the coconut cream is thickened. Cool the taro root mixture & the corn flour mixture completely before serving the taro root with the corn flour mixture on top.
In a bowl, combine the sour cream and pineapple. Mix well. Add the mango chutney. Mix well. Mix in the crushed pineapple. Mix well. Add the cream cheese and mix well. Serve with crackers or a bagel.

Combine cornmeal and sugar in medium bowl. Whisk together water, oil and egg in small bowl. Mix cornmeal mixture and egg mixture. Turn onto lightly oiled baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes. Turn and bake an additional 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add oil and cook until aromatic. Add garlic and cook until lightly browned, stirring constantly. Add parsley, cook for 1 minute. Add spaghettini and cook until done. Add cheese, pepper, and season with salt. Stir to combine. Toss with meat sauce.

Wash cherries and pat dry with paper towels. Place cherries in a large bowl and sprinkle with almond extract and tapioca. Let sit for 20 minutes or until cherries soften. Preheat oven to 425 degrees and generously flour pie crust. Roll out pastry and place in pie shell. Place cherries in pastry shell and sprinkle with sugar. Crimp edges of pastry and brush with beaten egg. Bake 15 minutes at 425 degrees and then reduce heat to 350 degrees and bake until crust is golden brown and cherries are tender, 45 to 50 minutes more. Let cool completely before cutting and serving.

Mix salmon, whitefish, carrots, onions, eggs together. Add matzo meal and mix well. Heat oil in frying pan. Drop about 1/4 cup of salmon mixture into hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Drain. Repeat with remaining mixture. Serve with tarter sauce.

Melt the butter in a double boiler or in a glass measuring cup in the microwave at 30 second intervals until the butter is completely melted. In a large bowl, mix the melted butter with the sugar until well blended. Beat in the eggs one at a time until completely blended after each egg has been added. Stir in the vanilla. Sift the dry ingredients together in a small bowl, then stir the dry mixture into the butter mixture until well blended. Pour the batter into a greased 13x9 inch pan or 8 inch square pan. Sprinkle with walnuts and bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 35-40 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into squares. Freeze any leftovers for later use.
In a heavy skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add garlic and saute for 5 minutes. Add sour orange juice and stir. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir in oregano and season with salt and pepper.

Slice zucchini into 1/4-inch thick strips. Place on a baking sheet. Drizzle with oil cooking spray and sprinkle with seasoning. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and top with dried oregano and ground cumin. Return to oven and cook for 10 more minutes. Serve with chili sauce.

Mix together all ingredients except the lemon gelatin. Cook until the tomato mixture is reduced to about half the amount. Add the lemon gelatin to the mixture. Stir until the gelatin is dissolved. Pour into a mold of choice. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate until firm. To serve, remove the plastic wrap. Allow to sit out for about 10 minutes before serving.

To make the asparagus roll ups, trim off woody ends of asparagus and cut into 1 1/2 to 2-inch pieces. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Add Dijon mustard and horseradishbeat until combined. Add ham and worcestershire saucemix until well blended. Roll 2 asparagus spears around each piece of ham and place spears on a baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, to make dipping sauce, mix mustard and horseradish until well blended. Add cream cheesemix well. Refrigerate. Remove ham from ovenserve with dipping sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and lightly flour two 9x13 inch baking pans. In large bowl with an electric mixer, beat yogurt, sugar and eggs until well blended and mixture is thick and creamy (do not overbeat). In another bowl, combine the dry ingredientsadd to yogurt mixture and stir until blended. Stir in cherries and lemon juice. Pour into prepared pans and bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Mix together the breadcrumbs and parsley. Place half a teaspoon of crumbs inside each vol-au-vent case and place it on a baking sheet. Place a slice of oyster on top of each bread crumb pile and add a slice of cheese on top. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Stir in the flour and salt. Beat well. Cover bowl. Set aside in a warm place until the mixture doubles in size, about 25 minutes. Combine the remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Stir into the yeast mixture. Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic. Place dough in a greased bowl. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 45 minutes. Punch down dough. Divide dough into four pieces. Roll each piece into a 4-inch rope. Pinch dough at the ends of ropes. Shape each piece into a pretzel shape. Place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Brush with beaten egg. Sprinkle with coarse salt. Bake at 450 for 5-7 minutes. Drizzle with melted butter while still warm. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch pan with cooking spray or line with foil and grease the foil. Crush graham crackers and place them into the prepared pan. Melt butter and pour over crackers and stir until coated. Crush raisins and add them to the pan. Melt the chocolate chips and pour over the mixture stirring until smooth and coated. Sprinkle nuts and coconut over mixture and press down with fingers to form even layer. Spoon sweetened condensed milk over mixture and smooth it out with a spatula or your fingers. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes or until firm to the touch and lightly browned. Allow to cool completely on a wire rack before cutting into bars.

In a skillet saut garlic and seasonings over medium heat until beef is cooked through and garlic is fragrant. Add carrots and onion and saut over medium heat until tender-crisp. Stir in cabbage and saute until wiltedstir in pepper. In a separate skillet bring water to boil. Stir in beef-flavor ramen noodles and cook as directed on package directions. Drain noodles and add to vegetable mixture along with soy saucetoss to coat and serve.

Bring the mango pulp and lemon juice to the boil. Add sugar and cook for 5 minutes. Place into a blender with the egg white. Process until smooth. Pour into an ice cream maker. Freeze according to manufacturer's instructions. When ready, process again for a few seconds to make the sorbet smooth. Transfer into plastic containers. Add the chili pepper and give the mixture a good stir. Cover and place into the freezer. Stir every few minutes as the sorbet sets.
Mix all ingredients in the order given by the bread machine.

Cut tamarillos in half, discarding seeds. Place halves into pot with beef stock. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove tamarillos from pot. Cool. Mash tamarillos with the back of a fork. Add brown sugar, stir to dissolve. Heat until sugar dissolves. Add five spice powder. Serve over beef or pork.

Combine the caramels with the evaporated milk in a large saucepan over medium heat until the caramels are completely dissolved. Remove from the heat and add the oatmeal, brown sugar, flour, baking soda, butter, chocolate chips and salt to the caramel mixture. Mix thoroughly until the mixture is very thick.
