Pour the mixture into a greased 13 x 9 inch pan or two 8 x 8 inch pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes until the top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Serve warm with ice cream if desired!

Mix flour with sugar and salt in a large bowl. Pour in water and stir until a paste forms. Mix in butter until it resembles cornmeal. Put the mixture in a greased baking dish or individual ramekins. Place in the refrigerator until firm. Fill a large pot with enough water to cover the apples by about an inch. Sprinkle the apples with cinnamon. When the mixture is firm enough that it holds a ball shape (about 10 minutes), form it into balls about 2 inches in diameter. Roll the balls in brown sugar. Dip each ball into the hot water until it is covered completely. Remove from the hot water and lay on a plate or cookie sheet covered with wax paper. Repeat with all the apples. Place the baking dish or ramekins in the refrigerator for at least two hours or overnight. The balls will be cold when ready to serve. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream or just plain.

Mix flour with sugar. Add salt and strawberries to bowl with flour mixture. Dump into pie shell and cover with top crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Let cool before serving. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Cut off the stems of the carrots. Then cut the carrots into 1/4 inch slices. Dice the onion. Peel the garlic cloves. Cut them into half. Rinse the celery. Rinse the pasta. Remove the skin from the chicken. Cut the breast meat from the bones into bite-sized pieces. Cut the thigh meat into bite-sized pieces. Set aside. In a large soup pot over medium-high heat, combine the oil, carrots, onion and celery. Cook until the onion is soft. Add the garlic. Cook 1 minute longer. Add the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Add the pasta. Cook for 8 to 10 minutes. Add the diced tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the carrots, onion and celery. Cook 1 minute more. Add the chicken. Cook for 1 minute more. Add the parsley. Serve. Serves 4.

Place pork loin in a large zip top bag. Add beer, corn syrup, mustard, onion, chili powder and salt. Seal bag and turn to coat. Marinate 8 hours. Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Remove pork from bag. Place on a rack in a roasting pan. Cook 2 to 2.5 hours or until internal temperature reaches 150 degrees. Remove roast from pan. Tent with foil. Allow roast to rest 10 minutes. Thinly slice and serve.
In a pot bring water to a boil. Boil white rice in it for 10 minutes until tender. Drain water, add salsa to rice until it is coated with it. Serve rice immediately.

In large saucepan bring to a boil 2 cups water, celery, onions, orange juice and lemon juice. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 30 minutes. Add hot sauce and salt. Stir rice into mixture and simmer 10 more minutes. Remove from heat and let stand for 10 minutes. Fluff rice with fork. Sprinkle with almonds.

Prepare sausage as directed. Roll into balls. Shape each ball into a patty about 2 inches thick. Dip patties in beaten eggs. Roll patties in flour. Fry patties until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with sauces.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Unroll pizza dough onto a large pizza pan. Spread with pizza sauce. Layer with mozzarella, vegetables and parmesan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes until golden. Cool for 20 minutes before cutting.

Prepare chicken breasts according to package directions. Remove chicken from stock pot. Add celery, carrot, onions and garlic cloves to stock pot. Add water to cover chicken breasts. Cover and cook over medium heat for 40 minutes. Add chicken back into stock pot. Sprinkle with bay leaf. Cover and cook over medium heat for 20 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain. Add noodles to soup. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover until cheese melts. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 400 f. Place wings on a rimmed baking sheet and season with salt & pepper. Pour oil into a large resealable bag. Add chicken wings & marinade. Seal bag & shake to coat. Remove wings from marinade & place on a large rimmed baking sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven & add ketchup. Toss to coat. Garnish with red pepper flakes.
In large bowl combine cucumbers, onions, vinegar, sugar, lemon juice and celery seed. Stir well. Let stand 1 hour at room temperature. Add salt and pepper to taste. Chill 1 hour before serving.

Cut papayas into 1/2-inch slicesremove seeds with knife. Put slices into a large saucepan with 2 cups water. Cook over low heat until tenderdrain. Combine papayas, remaining 3 cups water, vinegar, sugar, mustard seeds, salt, garam masala, curry powder, onion, and 1 cup water in a blender containerblend until smooth. Transfer chutney to a large saucepanbring to a boilcook over medium heat until slightly thickenedcool before serving.

Cream the butter and sugar in an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add the egg and beat until the mixture is fluffy. Add the hot water and beat until fluffy again. Add the soda and beat until fluffy once more. Add the flour, sugar and vanilla and beat until light and fluffy. Drop by tablespoonfuls on a greased cookie sheet and flatten each cookie with the back of a spoon. Bake at 425 degrees for about 8 minutes until lightly brown.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, heat the butter until melted and hot. Add the rice and stir to coat with the butter. Add the coconut milk and stir well. Add 1/2 cup of the water and cook over medium heat until the liquid is absorbed, 2-3 minutes. Stir in the remaining 1/4 cup of water and cook until the mixture boils. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until the liquid is absorbed, 2-3 minutes. Add the sugar and cook until the rice is tender. Add the banana and cook until the banana is softened and the rice is tender. Stir in the coconut and remove from the heat. Serve hot.

Cook the barley according to package directions. Drain well. Place apples in a large saucepan with the barley and add the sugar. Stir in the cream and lemon juice and bring to the boil. Reduce heat and simmer gently until the barley is tender. Serve hot.

Combine the coconut milk and ice cubes into a blender. Blend until mixture is smooth. Add in the bananas and coconut. Add a couple drops of yellow food coloring if desired. Pour in the Bailey's Irish Cream. Blend until smooth and well combined. Pour into cups and freeze. Before serving top with scoops of vanilla ice cream. Sprinkle with shredded coconut and enjoy.
Peel and dice the cucumber. Toss with the yogurt, dill and salt and pepper to taste. Place a fillet of salmon on each slice of bread and top with the cucumber salad and a bit of butter. Enjoy!

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until lightly colored but not burnt. Add the chicken and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 10 minutes on each side. Meanwhile, put the breadcrumbs in a shallow dish and add the parmesan cheese and parsley. Dip the chicken in the butter and then roll in the breadcrumb mixture. Transfer chicken to an ungreased baking dish. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes. Serve with your favorite sauce.

Slice prosciutto into thin strips and place on platter. Slice oranges into thin rounds and place on platter with prosciutto. In small bowl, combine balsamic vinegar and honey with salt and pepper to taste and mix well. Add olive oil slowly while mixing until blended well. Drizzle dressing on salad and toss to coat. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl, mash the ritz crackers with the feta cheese. Place the cheese on each chicken breast. In a small bowl, mash the basil with the oregano and garlic. Spoon the mixture over the cheese. Heat the oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken about 4 minutes on each side or until done.
Prepare sweet-and-sour mix. Combine citrus-infused vodka and sweet-and-sour mix in a highball glass filled with ice. Top with carbonated lemon-lime beverage. Garnish with a lemon slice.

In a small pan over medium heat, saute onions and garlic in the canola oil until tender. Add dried chilies and cook for another minute. Stir in curry powder and cook for another minute. Add tomatoes and cook for a few minutes. Add water until mixture is thick. Add squash cubes and cook for a few minutes. Add salt and pepper and lime juice. Serve with rice.

Preheat grill on high. Cook hot italian sausages until browned. Slice hot italian sausages in half. Arrange sausage halves in a circle around grill grate. Place peppers and onions on grill next to sausages. Cook peppers 3 to 5 minutes. Turn peppers. Cook onions 7 to 10 minutes. Fill each bun half with sausage mixture. Add peppers and onions. Spread mustard on buns. Enjoy!

Cream together the butter and sugar for 5 minutes or until pale and fluffy. Whisk together the eggs with the orange extract and add this mixture to the butter/sugar mixture while beating. Gradually fold in the flour and orange zest. Divide the mixture evenly between two lined sandwich tins and bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown and cooked. After 20 minutes of baking, gently melt the chocolate and orange chocolate in separate bowls. Dip the teabreads halfway into the chocolate and leave to set on the side for 10 minutes before serving.
Place all of the ingredients in a food processor. Blend until smooth. Form into a ball. Refrigerate for at least two hours. Serve with crackers.

Open bread rolls and spread each roll lightly with caesar salad dressing. Top each with romaine lettuce leaves, slices of chicken breast, and grated parmesan cheese. Spray a skillet lightly with olive oil cooking spray over medium-high heat. Place chicken breast in the skillet and cook until golden brown on each side, about 10-15 minutes total cooking time.

In a skillet over medium heat heat oil. Add onion and garlic and saute until transparent. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until slightly thickened. Add the parsley and basil and continue cooking. Add chopped green bell pepper and cook until tender. Add the chicken and cook until done. Pour sauce over the chicken and serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Trim excess fat from steaks. Season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a 12-inch cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add the steaks and cook until browned on all sides. Transfer skillet to the oven. Cook 10 minutes for medium rare. Transfer the skillet to a work surface. Place garlic clove at center of steak. Season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the remaining oil. Sprinkle with coarse sea salt. Transfer the skillet to the oven. Cook 10 minutes for medium rare. Transfer the skillet to a work surface. Top the steaks with the remaining garlic. Finish with a few sprigs of flat-leaf parsley. Let rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Rinse potatoes. Boil potatoes until fork tender. Remove from the cooking water. Slice into strips. Combine sumaq, chili powder, egg white and salt. Dip potato strips into the egg mixture. Coat with the sumaq mixture. Place the potato strips onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 350f for 12 minutes. Flip the potatoes. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Serve with sour cream or ranch dressing. Enjoy!
Stir dressing mix into mayonnaise and whip together. Add all other ingredients and whip until thoroughly combined. Serve over pasta salad. This dressing also makes a great dip for fresh vegetables.

Place strawberry and sugar in saucepan over low heatcook until sugar dissolves. Add cornstarch and watercook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. In large bowl beat 1 can whipping cream with electric mixer until soft peaks formgradually add strawberry mixture and beat until stiff peaks form. Stir in remaining 1 1/2 cups whipping creambeat until fluffy. In pie shells combine 1/2 cup whipped topping and bananaspoon into each shell. Top each with remaining 1 cup whipped topping and drizzle with strawberry mixture.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease an 11x7 inch baking pan. Cream butter and brown sugar together. Add flour and rolled oats. Press into prepared pan. Bake for 12 minutes. Allow to cool. In a microwave safe bowl, combine condensed milk and chocolate chips. Microwave on high for 2 minutes. Pour over cooled oat mixture and sprinkle with white chocolate chips. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours or until firm. Cut into 2 inch squares to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place muffin pan in oven. Combine Jiffy Corn Muffin Mix, buttermilk and egg. Stir until blended. Fold in pecans and blueberries. Spoon batter into muffin tins. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Remove from muffin pan. Makes 12 muffins.
Blend cream cheese and cool whip until fluffy and creamy. Fold in the white chocolate chips. Spread into the crust and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. I hope you all enjoy the recipes!

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add celery and onions, sautéing 5 minutes. Add ricecook 2 minutes more. Add broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover. Simmer 25 minutes or until rice is tender. In a small saucepan over medium heat bring dates and water to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 30 seconds. Remove from heat. Stir in walnuts. Stir walnuts into rice mixture. Sprinkle with dates. Serve with a salad.

Preheat oven to 375f. In large bowl, beat egg whites and vanilla until soft peaks form. In separate bowl, whisk together sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Beat in egg whites until well blended. Sift together flour and baking powder. Add to butter mixture alternately with milk. Divide batter between 2 greased and floured 9x13 baking pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into centers comes out clean. Cool in pans 10 minutes. Invert cakes onto racks. Cool completely. Serve with cream cheese icing. Makes 2 cakes.

Mix sugar and corn syrup together in saucepan and cook to 250 degrees F. Stir together peanut butter and corn flakes. When syrup is at 250 degrees F., remove from heat and add peanut butter mixture and stir until coated. Pour onto wax paper to cool and harden. Peanut Butter Crunch can be stored in cool place for up to 3 months or frozen for up to 6 months. Makes about 2 cups.

Boil the stock in a large saucepan and add the pumpkin and garlic. Simmer for about an hour. Then add wine, butter, cream and seasonings. Bring to a boil and simmer for about 10 minutes. Purée or pass through a food mill. Serve immediately with crusty bread.

Place 1 c. water in bread machine pan. Add butter. Add 3/4 c. bread flour and salt. Add yeast and 1/4 c. sugar. Program machine for dough setting. When cycle is complete and dough is ready, turn dough out onto floured surface. Divide into two pieces and form into balls. Place on greased cookie sheet. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled in size. Punch down dough. Divide dough into four pieces. Shape into balls and place on greased cookie sheet. Cover and let rise until doubled in size. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes.

Wash and peel potatoes and sweet potatoes. Cut into 1/4-inch thick wedges and place on a large piece of foil. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Wrap potatoes and sweet potatoes in foil and bake at 425 for 35-40 minutes or until crisp tender. Remove foil and sprinkle with ground cumin. Return to oven for 5-7 minutes or until potatoes are browned and crisp tender.

Place asparagus into a large pot and fill with water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil asparagus for 1 minute. Remove with a slotted spoon and place into a serving dish. Drain water and return pot to stove. Add sesame oil and garlic to pot and cook until fragrant. Add mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Add soy sauce and bring to a boil. Add asparagus and cook for 2 minutes. Add white wine and bring to a boil. Cook until asparagus is tender. Remove pot from heat and add cashews. Sprinkle with green onions and serve.

Place beef in a large soup pot. Add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer 1 hour or until very tender. Drain. Discard bay leaf. Shred meat. Put shredded meat into a large bowl. Add onion. Mix in carrots. Mix in celery. Add tapioca, sugar and salt. Stir in V8 vegetable juice and ketchup. Pour stew over meat mixture. Stir gently to combine. Place stew in a 9 x 13-inch baking pan. Cover. Bake in preheated 325 degree F. oven 2 to 4 hours or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Combine 1 1/2 cups yogurt with 4 TBSP jello powder. Stir well. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Combine 1 cup of yogurt with 4 TBSP jello powder. Stir well. Combine 1/2 cup yogurt with 2 TBSP jello powder. Refrigerate. Stir in 1/4 cup blueberries. Refrigerate. Stir in 1/4 cup raspberries. Refrigerate. Stir in 1/4 cup oreo cookie pieces. Stir in 1/2 cup blueberries. Refrigerate. Stir in 1/4 cup raspberries. Refrigerate. Stir in 1/4 cup oreo cookie pieces. Stir in 1/4 cup blueberries. Refrigerate. Combine 1/4 cup cool whip with 1/4 cup blueberries. Stir well. Refrigerate. Combine 1/4 cup cool whip with 1/4 cup raspberries. Stir well. Com

Cream the butter and sugar with an electric mixer until light. Add in the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Sieve in the flour, baking powder and cocoa powder. Add a little of the egg mixture. Stir until you have a thick batter. Spoon out a rounded tablespoon of the mixture onto a lined or greased baking sheet. Bake for approximately 8-10 minutes or until the madeleines spring up when touched. They should be golden in colour. Allow the madeleines to cool completely on the tray. They keep in an air tight container for up to a week.

In large skillet over medium heat, cook turkey until browndrain. Add onion to pancook until tender. Stir in salsa, sour cream, salt, pepper and garlicmix well. Layer in bottom of large bowl. Top with tortilla chips. Cover with lettucesprinkle with cheese. Serve with remaining toppings.

In small dish, mix flour and paprikadunk fillets into buttermilk. Dip fillet in flour mixtureshake off excess. Dip fillet into egg whites, then coat in flour mixture again. Place fillets in large baking dish. Pour lemon juice and worcestershire over fish. Cover and bake 30 minutes in preheated oven at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Garnish fish with parsley before serving.

Mix cream cheese, butter, green onion in bowl. Mix in the white wine. Add seafood and mix to combine. Fold in Swiss cheese and cheddar cheese. Spoon mixture into a lightly greased (or sprayed) baking dish of choice. Bake in pre-heated oven at 350 for approximately 30 minutes. Serve hot with crackers or potato chips.

Rinse chicken and pat dry with paper towels. Coat chicken with cashew mixture and refrigerate for about 30 minutes. Heat oil and butter in skillet over medium heat. Place chicken breasts into hot oil and cook until browned on both sides. Remove chicken from oil and place on plate. Place oil back on heat and add 3-4 tablespoons flour and whisk constantly until flour begins to bubble and change color. Pour in cognac and whisk until flour begins to thicken. Add milk to flour mixture and stir until mixture boils. Continue to cook and stir for about 5 minutes. Pour mixture over chicken and bake for about 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. Arrange chicken in an ungreased 13x9 inch baking dish. Pour picante sauce over chicken. Sprinkle with brown sugar and prepared mustard. Cover and bake for 45 minutes or until done. Serve over cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a 10x13-inch pan. In a large skillet brown sausage over medium heat for about 10 minutes. Remove sausage from pan and crumble. In a large bowl combine sausage, bread cubes, evaporated milk and water. Add mustard, salt and pepper. Mix well. Pour mixture into the prepared pan. Beat eggs lightly. Pour eggs over bread mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for about 45 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.
Blend together until smooth and creamy. Refrigerate for 2-3 hours to allow flavor to develop. Serve over your favorite ice cream cone.

Melt chocolate as directed on package. Pour into a glass measuring cup. Dip Ritz crackers into chocolate until they are coated. Place onto waxed paper to dry. When dry, place crackers on waxed paper and sprinkle with peppermint extract. Melt chocolate and dip the crackers into chocolate. Place onto waxed paper to set up. Once set, place onto waxed paper again and place a whole candy cane into each cracker. Store in airtight container.

Make pie crust as directed on package. Stir together jell-o and 1 1/2 cups water. Add to crust. Fill with sliced strawberries and top with whipped topping. (Can be made with fresh sliced strawberries also. )
Melt together over medium heat and stir constantly for 6-8 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in corn flakes. Pour into parchment paper lined pans and cool completely. Break into pieces and serve.

Slice pears crosswise into thin slivers. Put in a large pan. Add lemon juice and anise seed. Cook over low heat for about 10 minutes until syrup is thickened. Arrange in a baking dish. Pour syrup over fruit. Refrigerate overnight. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream.

Slice chili in half lengthwise. Drain beans (if using) and remove stems from tomatoes. Layer beans, chili and tomatoes in bottom of 13x9 inch baking dish in this order. Sprinkle with oregano. Layer half the tamales over beans. Top with remaining tamales (broken into pieces) and sprinkle with cheese. Cover with foil and bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until cheese is bubbly and browned.
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl. Cover and let stand in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes before serving. Serve with fish or seafood.

Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heatadd garlic and stir 10 seconds. Add leeksauté for 2 minutes or until softened and just starting to brownadd sugar snaps peas and lemon zestsauté for 3 minutes or until tender crispadd lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to tastetossserve

Prepare non-fat powdered milk according to package directions. Stir in boiling water. Cool to room temperature and pour into a wide mouth quart jar. Add non-fat skim milk and stir. Add low-fat plain yogurt and stir. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Stir before using.

Slice the zucchini into rounds and set aside. Slice the onions into thin strips and set aside. Heat the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the zucchini and onions. Saute for 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes and brown sugar. Saute another 5 minutes. Sprinkle the curry powder over the vegetables and stir until combined. Place the vegetables in a 9x13 glass baking dish and pour the broth over them. Top with the parmesan cheese. Bake for 15 minutes in a 425 degree F oven.

Bring 1 quart water, whole milk, cinnamon stick and 2 tbsp of ground cinnamon to a boil in a 4 qt heavy saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in arborio rice. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Add 1 tbsp of ground cinnamon and 1 tbsp of sugar. Cover tightly and set aside 12 hours. Whisk egg yolks in a large bowl. Gradually whisk in remaining milk. Strain hot rice mixture through a fine mesh strainer into a medium bowltransfer rice mixture in batches into a blender. Puree until smooth. Return rice mixture to bowl. Stir in Nutella. Add egg mixture. Stir in remaining 1 tbsp sugar. Cover tightly and let stand overnight in refrigerator. Spoon into individual bowls. Garnish with hazelnuts.

Add the water, green peas & green onions to a large pan. Bring to a boil. Cover & reduce heat. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the mushrooms. Cook & stir for 2 minutes more. Uncovercook & stir for 3-5 minutes more or until green peas are tender. Remove from heat. Stir in soy sauce. Serve over cooked rice or noodles.

Melt 1/4 cup margarine over low heat. Stir in sugar and cocoa until combined and smooth. Remove from heat. Add 1 cup of the milk and vanilla and stir until smooth. Add the remaining 1 cup of milk and peanut butter and stir until combined and smooth. Fold in 1 cup of the oats. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 baking dish and refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour. Spread into a 15 x 10 x 1-inch pan and cut into squares or bars with a knife dipped in hot water. Store in airtight container or plastic bag up to 1 week.

Trim and season veal. Heat butter in a pan. Fry the veal in 2 batches until brown. Set aside. Fry the onion in the same pan until soft. Add veal and cook for 5 minutes. Add salt and paprika. Pour in the water. Simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in the cornflour and cook for a further 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Blend in sour cream. Pour sauce into a greased baking dish. Place veal in sauce. Bake in a moderate oven for about 1 hour. Serve hot.

Blend red wine vinegar, mustard, sugar, salt and pepper in a blender until smooth. While blender is running slowly drizzle olive oil into the mixture and continue to blend until emulsified. Add sun-dried tomato and fresh oregano and blend to combine. Dressing may be refrigerated for up to two weeks.

Mix together the soy sauce, sesame oil, dark sesame oil, crushed red pepper flakes and fresh lime juice in a bowl. Set aside. In a large bowl combine tuna steaks and the garlic cloves. Pour the soy sauce mixture over the tuna and garlic cloves. Let stand for 2 hours. Place the tuna and garlic cloves in the refrigerator until ready to serve. The tuna can be prepared 24 hours in advance.

Peel asparagus stalks, remove tough ends then dice into 2 inch pieces. Heat butter in pan over low-medium heat. Add shallot and asparagus to pancook 10 minutes over low-medium heat until asparagus is tender but still bright green. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Transfer to serving platter & garnish with fresh chanterelle mushroom and lemon juice.

In medium saucepan, combine crushed pineapple and pecansset aside. In separate medium saucepan over low heat, combine sugar and jell-ostirring occasionally until dissolved. Add boiling water and ice cubes. Stir in pineapple mixture. Stir in strawberries. Chill until set.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Pour 1 can of marinara sauce into a 9x13 baking dish. Arrange 10 manicotti (or more or less) over sauce. Top with one can of diced tomatoes and one can of italian seasoning. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake 40-45 minutes. Serve with remaining sauce.

In a bowl, combine dry breadcrumbs, cornmeal, paprika, dill, salt and pepper. In another bowl, combine milk, skim milk and butter. Dip the haddock pieces in the milk mixture to coat then dredge in the dry mixture to coat again. Place in a large baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 400 degrees for 12 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges on the side. Makes 4 servings.
Blend all ingredients with an electric blender or food processor. Form into 6 patties. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes or grill. Serve with vegetable slices or hamburger bun.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add angel hair pasta and cook according to package directions. Drain pasta and transfer to serving bowl. Add garlic and cook in olive oil over medium heat. Add pine nuts and cook until golden brown. Drain pine nuts on paper towels. Add to pasta. Drizzle lemon juice over pasta and stir to coat. Sprinkle with zest. Serve pasta with parsley and additional lemon juice.
Combine all ingredients and blend until smooth. Transfer to a serving bowl and refrigerate. When ready to serve, remove the top layer of the spread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Fill a small saucepan with enough water to cover the spinach by 1/2 inch. Bring to a boil and cook until the spinach is tender, about 2 minutes. Drain and squeeze out any excess moisture with paper towelstransfer to a large bowl. Finely chop scallions and add to spinach along with radishes and parsley. Season with salt and pepper and toss together. Stir in ricotta cheese and lemon juice and toss together. Add olive oil and stir again and taste for seasonings. Spread mixture in an 8-inch-square baking dish. Sprinkle with a few dashes of hot sauce and a little dash of Worcestershire sauce and a pinch of sugar for sweetness and mix together well. Sprinkle with grated cheddar cheese and top with tomatoes and water chestnuts. Bake until bubbling hot, about 15 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers and a green salad.
Whip cream until soft peaks form. Add sugar and lime juice and zest. Fold in vanilla and lime. Pour into serving glasses. Garnish with lime slice and mint.

Mix cornstarch with milk. In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, sugar and vanilla bean. Whisk in milk mixture. Add eggs to milk mixture. In a medium saucepan, heat sugar, milk mixture over medium heat. Cook until mixture thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Transfer milk mixture to a large bowl. Gradually whisk in egg mixture. Return milk mixture to saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in cornstarch mixture. Stir in coconut milk. Stir in rum. Add lime juice to taste. Transfer mixture to a large pitcher. Cool to room temperature. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate 8 hours. Discard vanilla bean. Transfer cream to a bowl. Stir in coconut milk. Chill until cold. Garnish with fresh lime.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. In a large bowl, mix together cornmeal, yogurt, baking powder and water. Add egg. Beat until well combined. Add onion. Add frozen corn. Stir to combine. Spread batter evenly in prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with Splenda. Bake for about 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Let cool for about 20 minutes before serving.
Mix asparagus and butter together in a medium bowl. Sprinkle dijon mustard on top and toss gently to coat. Add fresh lemon juice and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

First make the sauce by blending all the tomato ingredients together with a little water (to get the right consistency). Cook the chicken in the sauce for about an hour over a low heat. You can add more water or some coconut milk if the sauce becomes too thick. Serve with some rice. It is a great dish to make in advance as the flavors just get better over time.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl combine apple pie filling and spice cake mix. Stir until moist. Fold in egg whites. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Allow to cool before cutting.

Place rhubarb in large bowl. Combine sugar and next 6 ingredients in small saucepan. Bring mixture to boilingcook and stir for 5 minutes or until mixture is thickened slightly. Pour rhubarb mixture into pie shells. Arrange pineapple chunks over filling. Cover tightly with top crustsseal edges. Cut several slits in top crusts to allow steam to escape. Bake at 375 degrees f. for 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Wash the cornish game hens under cold running water. Rinse them under cold running water. Remove the giblets from the cavity of the hens. Pat the hens dry with paper towels. Place the hens in a roasting pan. Add the garlic cloves and the sage to the pan. Drizzle the hens with the melted butter. Sprinkle the hens with paprika. Season the hens with salt and pepper. Tuck the lemon zest inside the cavity of the hens. Roast the hens for 1 hour. Baste the hens with the pan juices every 15 minutes. Let the hens rest for 10 minutes. Carve the hens. Serve.

Mix all ingredients in a medium sized jar. Cover with a tight fitting lid. Shake vigorously to combine. Set in a cool dark place for 2-3 weeks. Shake jar every 2-3 days. Taste for flavor. It will thicken up. Store in refrigerator.
Mix flour with almonds and walnuts. Beat eggs with honey. Pour this liquid mixture into the dry mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Mix yeast and 1/4 cup warm water with 3/4 cup flour. Stir to dissolve yeastset aside to foam. In large bowl, combine the remaining water and flour with sugar and saltmix well with a fork to form a soft dough. Turn out dough onto lightly floured surfaceknead until smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes. Add 3 Tablespoons olive oil and knead until smooth. Divide dough in halfshape into 2 balls. Roll each ball on lightly floured surface into rectangle 12 inches long and 4 inches wideform 2 ropes from each rectangle and cross over each other to make cross-shape. Place crosses on lightly greased cookie sheet and cover loosely with towel. Let rise 2 hours or until doubled in size. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Beat egg with 1/2 teaspoon water and 1 Tablespoon olive oil. Brush tops and sides with egg wash. Bake 20 minutes or until golden brown and sound hollow

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a small saucepan over medium heat combine the stuffing mix with the oil and cook for 3 minutes stirring constantly. In a large bowl mix the bacon, sprouts and mashed potatoes together and add the stuffing mix stirring just until blended. Using a greased 2-cup muffin tin or mini-muffin pans form the potatoes into 48 mounds in each tin. Bake in the preheated oven for 35 minutes or until done.

Remove stems from the broccoli florets, cut into quarters and set aside. Cut the remaining broccoli into small florets and set aside. In a large pot of boiling water, cook the pasta shells for about ten minutes or according to package directions, drain immediately. Meanwhile, heat a large saute pan over medium-high heat and add the oil to the pan. Add the garlic to the pan and saute until it begins to turn golden brown. Add the broccoli stems to the pan and saute for about two minutes or until the stems begin to turn bright green. Add the broccoli florets to the pan with the garlic and saute for about two more minutes or until the florets begin to turn bright green as well. Add the anchovies to the pan and saute for about thirty seconds or until the anchovies turn golden brown in color. Add the broth to the pan and bring it to a simmer over medium-high heat. Add the pasta shells to the pan with the broth. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pan and simmer the pasta shells for about two minutes or until the pasta shell

Slice bread into 8 pieces. Place bread on baking sheet and coat with olive oil spray. Top each slice with a piece of ham, an onion slice, a slice of bell pepper. In a small bowl beat 2 eggs and 1/2 cup milk together. Place mixture in a small cup or ramekin (this makes it easier to pour the mixture into each pocket). Pour egg mixture into each pocket. Place baking sheet in oven and bake for 20 minutes or until egg is set. Remove from oven and let sit for 10 minutes before serving to allow eggs to fully set. Serve with hot sauce.

Heat olive oil in a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Add garlic cloves and rosemary leaf. Cook until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes. Add chickpeas, red pepper flakes (to taste), chicken broth and lemon juice. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover pot and cook for 20 minutes. Remove rosemary from pot. Add salt to taste.

In a large bowl mix together flour, baking soda and brown sugar. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl beat butter with sugar and vanilla until light and fluffy. Add in eggs one at a time. Mix in dry mixture until blended. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto greased baking sheets. Bake in preheated 350 degree F. oven for 9-12 min. or until cookies are light brown. Cool on pans for 3 min. Remove from pans and cool on wire racks. Makes 3 1/2 dozen cookies.

Combine glaze ingredients and mix well. Place salmon fillets in a shallow baking dish. Drizzle fillets with glaze and bake for 10 minutes in preheated oven at 375 degrees fahrenheit or until done. Remove from oven and serve immediately with rice pilaf or steamed rice.

Place pork loin in crockpot. Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper. Pour in cranberry sauce and pineapple juice. Mix well. Stir in cider vinegar and Dijon mustard. Mix well. Pour in honey. Mix well. Mix in cinnamon and cornstarch. Pour in cold water. Mix well. Cook on high for four hours or on low for eight hours. Check internal temperature of pork loin and remove from heat when done. Serve.

Cut off greens and tops of beets and remove any bruises on beet tops. Peel and cut beets in quarters and simmer in a large saucepan with water to cover beets for 45 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain and cool beets until easy to handle. Cut beets in half and remove seeds and discard. Place in glass jars or crocks and add equal parts vinegar and sugar to each jar (1/4 cup vinegar, 1/4 cup sugar). Add enough cold water to cover beets and stir in 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon and 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon cloves to each jar. Place lids on jars and store in the refrigerator for up to two months or in the pantry for up to 6 months.

Heat a small skillet over medium-high heat. Add bacon and cook, stirring occasionally until browned and crisp. Transfer bacon to paper towels to drain. Remove all but 2 tablespoons bacon fat from skillet. Add scallops and cook 2 minutes on each side. Transfer to a plate. Reduce heat to medium. Add butter and cook until lightly browned. Stir in lemon juice. Whisk in brown sugar until dissolved. Pour sauce over scallops. Serve immediately.

Bring water and margarita mix to a boil in a medium saucepan. Remove from heat. Stir in gelatin until dissolved. Add berries and stir until berries are coated. Refrigerate until gelatin has set, about 2 hours. Stir in tequila and orange liqueur. Pour into individual dessert glasses. Garnish with lime and mint. Serve at once.

Combine butter and lemon juice. Add shrimp and toss to coat. Sprinkle with coarse salt and fresh ground black pepper. Place shrimp in a shallow baking dish. Bake 12-15 minutes or until shrimp are cooked through. Garnish with fresh rosemary. Serve with toasted baguette.

Combine flour, baking powder and salt in large bowl. Beat butter with an electric mixer in large bowl until light. Gradually add sugar. Add egg yolks and beat until smooth. Stir in cream and lemon juice. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden. Cool cookies on cookie sheet for 5 minutes. Remove to wire racks to cool completely.

Sprinkle chicken breast generously with chili powder, salt, cumin and black pepper. Place in shallow dish. In another dish, combine 2 cups of the corn tortillas and 1/4 cup cooking spray. Place remaining tortillas in another dish. Coat chicken in spray. Heat grill to medium-high heat. Add chicken to grill. Cook 7-10 minutes per side or until meat is no longer pink. Squeeze lime juice over cooked chicken. Place chicken in warm tortillas. Top with shredded lettuce. Cover. Serve tacos warm.

Spread mayonnaise on each slice of bread. Top one slice with tomato slice and sprinkle with basil leaves, salt and pepper and a small amount of olive oil. Top with another slice of bread and repeat process with second slice. Cut sandwiches in half and serve.

Cook bacon until crisp then drain on paper towels. Chop bacon finely and set aside. In large saucepan, cook onion in butter until softened. Stir in celery and bell peppercook until tender. Pour off excess fatdrain on paper towels. Stir in tomatoes with juice, bacon, salt, pepper and sugar. Bring to a boil over medium heatreduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in green beans and cook until heated through. Top with American cheese if desired. Serve warm.

Thinly slice the steaks. Salt & pepper them. Place them in a large glass baking dish. Sprinkle with blue cheese. Top with the cream cheese. Top that with tomato sauce. Top that with worcestershire sauce. Top that with chopped parsley. Top that with garlic. Cover with foil. Place into oven. Cook for about 30 minutes. Slice & serve.

Peel and cut potato into chunks. Place in a pan of salted water and cook until tender. Drain well. Transfer to a food processor and blitz until smooth. Add garlic and coriander and continue to process until a thick puree forms. Place in a bowl and season with salt and pepper to taste. Add a little creme fraiche and blitz again to create a smooth purée. Serve warm or cold with some olive oil and fresh coriander leaves sprinkled on top.

Season oysters in a bowl of cold water and let soak for 20 minutes. Drain and pat dry. Whisk together the flour, cornmeal, baking powder and cajun seasoning. Beat together the eggs and milk. Dip each oyster in the flour mixture. Then into the egg mixture. Heat hot oil in a deep fryer or large skillet. Fry the oysters until golden. Drain. Mix together the mayonnaise and hot pepper oil and drizzle on the oysters. Serve.

Heat a flat grill pan or cast-iron pan over medium-high heat. Sprinkle some flour on the grill pan to prevent sticking and wipe away any excess. Add the cabbage and stir-fry until wilted and tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Add the dashi and sake and bring to boil. Add the eggs and stir to break up the eggs and coat the cabbage. Transfer the mixture to the hot grill pan and let brown until crispy and golden, about 3 minutes more. Add the mayonnaise and stir to evenly coat the cabbage. Add the ham and green onions and serve immediately.
Combine and stir all four of these ingredients into a large mixing bowl. Marinate fillets for at least 3 hours.

Boil the potatoes until fork tender, cool them off. Grind the cumin seeds and cumin with the chilli powder into a fine paste. Mix the yogurt with the ground spices in a bowl. Add the ground potatoes to the yogurt mixture. Stir the mixture until it is smooth. Sprinkle the fresh chopped chives on top of the raita before serving.

Combine the white wine and celery leaves in a small bowl. Set aside. Slice the breast fillet into strips. Season with salt and pepper. Place in a medium bowl. Add mayonnaise and lemon juice. Mix well and add the celery wine mixture. Stuff the strips into the bread and serve.

Melt butter in a skillet. Add brown sugar and cook until melted. Add eggs and stir until scrambled. Add milk and stir well. Place bread in a casserole dish and cover with syrup mixture. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

Soak walnuts in cold water for an hour. Drain. Place walnuts in a shallow pan. Add sugar and salt. Cook until sugar is dissolved. Add vanilla and cinnamon and stir. Cook for about 20 minutes until golden brown.

Fill a 4 quart saucepan with water and bring to a boil over medium heat. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, whisk together tea, orange and lemon juices and Splendastir in orange extract and vanilla. Add mixture to water in saucepan and bring to a boil over high heatstir in cinnamon stick and whole cloves. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Strain mixture and discard solids and Splenda crystals. Return mixture to saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heatboil for 3 minutes to re-crystallize Splenda. Remove from heat and stir in brandycover and keep warm until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a small saucepan, melt butter. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add ham and cook until browned. Add heavy cream and cook until slightly thickened. Remove from heat and stir in nutmeg. In a large bowl, whisk eggs. Whisk in 1 cup of the mushroom mixture. Add remaining mushrooms and stir. Pour into six oiled ramekins or small ovenproof bowls. Top with the remaining mushrooms and the gruyere. Bake for 10 minutes until the top is puffy and golden brown. Serve immediately.

Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan over medium heat and cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat and cook for another 30 minutes, or until the cranberries pop and the liquid has thickened slightly and the fruit is tender but still holds its shape.

Clean and cut out any yellow or tough sections of greens and wash well in cold water. Bring water and garlic to boil in large saucepan and add leeks and bell pepper. Reduce heat and cook for about 10 minutes or until softened. Add greens and continue cooking until greens are wilted, about 10 minutes more. Add bacon and cook until crisp and bacon fat renders out. Add water and cook until bacon is no longer crisp and greens are tender and wilted. Add salt and pepper and cook for another minute or two. Transfer greens and bacon into a bowl and keep warm. Cook bacon grease in a large frying pan over medium heat until it begins to foam and smoke, about five minutes or so. Add collards and stir until they are thoroughly coated with the bacon fat and then transfer them back into the saucepan with the bacon and onions and cook for another minute or two until the greens have absorbed all of the bacon grease. Serve hot.

In a large pot heat the olive oil over medium heat. Saute the onion, apples and curry until onion is tender. Add the garlic and saute 1 more minute. Stir in the cauliflower and cook until tender. Stir in the broth and cook for 2 minutes more. Stir in the vinegar. Remove from heat and set aside for 15 minutes. Puree the soup in batches in a food processor or blender until smooth. Pour the soup into a large soup pot. Stir in the honey until dissolved. Ladle into bowls and garnish with fresh parsley. Serve warm. This soup tastes great with some crusty bread on the side!

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Butter 11 x 7 inch baking dish. Peel squash with vegetable peeler. Cut squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds. Rub cut sides of squash with olive oil. Place squash cut side down in baking dish. Bake in preheated oven until tender when pierced with fork. Remove squash from oven. Transfer squash to large mixing bowl. Mash with potato masher. Add maple syrup. Fold in pecans. Spread mixture into baking dish. Sprinkle with additional pecans. Bake 20 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut potatoes into thick slices. Slice onion and bell pepper. Mix potatoes, onion and bell pepper into buttered baking dish. Season with salt and pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 45-50 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Mix the honey, brown sugar, mustard, black pepper, cider vinegar, olive oil together in a bowl. Add the turkey cutlets and toss until all pieces are well-coated with the mixture. Cook for 3 minutes on each side over medium-high heat or until turkey is cooked through. Serve immediately. You can also serve with a side of mixed greens with your favorite dressing or a cucumber salad.

Mix all the ingredients together and knead to form a dough. Divide the dough into 8 portions. Roll each portion into a ball. Place the balls on a floured surface and pat to make 3-4 inch circles. Heat the griddle or frying pan. Cook the cakes for about 2 minutes each side until golden brown. Serve with fried eggs or jam.

In mixing bowl, beat eggs with sugar until light and fluffy. Gradually add pineapple juice with electric mixer until blended well. In large bowl, combine flour, baking soda, salt and pecans. Add pineapple mixture alternately with margarine & milk, mixing well after each addition until smooth. Pour batter into greased & floured tube pan. Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 60-70 minutes or until cake tester comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack for 15 minutes before removing from pan. Frost with Cream Cheese Frosting or Cream Cheese Frosting with Coconut Flakes.

-Clean and pat flank steak dry. -Marinate the steak in the refrigerator for at least four hours in a mixture of soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic and onions. -Combine the marinade and vegetable oil in a small sauce pan. -Cook over medium heat until the liquid is reduced to a thick syrup. -Remove the steak from the marinade and grill until browned and medium rare. -Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees fahrenheit. Heat vegetable oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork chops and brown on each side for 3 minutes. Transfer pork to an 8-inch square baking dish. In same skillet over medium-high heat add cranberry sauce and mustard. Whisk in vinegar. Pour sauce over pork and turn pork to coat with sauce. Cover pan with aluminum foil and place in preheated oven. Bake until pork is cooked through and juices run clear, about 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Place the cube steaks in a shallow dish. In another shallow dish, combine the flour with the seasoning. Dip each steak in the flour mixture. Dip the steaks in the water. Dip them again in the flour mixture. Shake off any excess. Place them in the refrigerator for at least two hours or overnight. When ready to cook the steaks, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the oil. Cook the steaks for five minutes per side or until the meat is brown on both sides. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Soak skewers in warm water for at least thirty minutes and then thread onto skewers. Put soy sauce and sake into a small mixing bowl and stir until smooth. Place salmon into a mixing bowl and coat with soy sauce mixture. Put salmon in the fridge for at least an hour before threading onto skewers. Preheat grill and thread salmon onto skewers and grill until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 5 minutes per side. Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing over the kebabs and garnish with sliced green onion and poppy seeds.
Place banana in food processor. Add peanut butter. Blend. Add water and blend until smooth. Add Ovaltine, sugar and blend. Add cashews and blend.

Place pineapple chunk in a medium bowl. Stir together cornstarch and 1/2 cup water to make slurry. Stir slurry into pineapple juice. Add pork sausage to juice mixture in bowl. Stir in brown sugar and vinegar. Add pineapple chunk to juice mixture. Stir well to coat pineapple. Place sausage mixture in a large resealable plastic bag or food storage container. Seal bag and refrigerate overnight. The next day preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pork sausage and cook until browned, about 8 minutes. Drain fat. Transfer sausage to a plate. Add pineapple to skillet and cook until brown in spots on all sides. Transfer to a plate. Heat skillet over medium heat. Add butter and cook until melted. Add pork sausage and cook until browned. Transfer to a plate. Add pork sausage and cook until browned. Transfer to a plate. Add pork sausage and cook until browned. Transfer to a

Mix the gelatin and 3 cups of boiling water in a large bowl and stir until completely dissolved. Let cool for 5 minutes. Add the remaining 2 cups cold water. Stir until combined. Add the strawberries and sugar. Taste for sweetness and add more sugar if desired. Refrigerate until set. Meanwhile, break graham crackers into small pieces and put into a food processor. Process until the crackers are fine crumbs. Add the melted butter and process again until the mixture is like coarse meal. Lay out a piece of plastic wrap and place a layer of crackers in the center. Pour in about 1/3 of the strawberry mixture. Repeat layers of crackers and strawberry filling until all strawberry mixture and crackers are used. Freeze for at least 2 hours. Remove from freezer and cut into squares. Top each square with a dollop of whipped topping. Serve immediately.

In large bowl of an electric mixer combine flour, baking powder & saltset aside. In large bowl combine sugar & creamlet stand 10 minutes or until cream is thick & sugar is dissolved. Add eggs & beat until combinedadd creamed mixture to flour mixturebeat until combined & smoothadd butterbeat until combined & smoothpour batter into prepared waffle iron to fill 3/4 fullcook until golden brownremove to waffle ironkeep warm in preheated 200 degree ovenkeep waffles warm in 350 degree oven until ready to serve & serve while warm with butter & maple syrup.
Dice tomatoes and mix them with chicken pieces. Add the rest of the ingredients and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve.

Place flour, salt and pepper in bowl. Dip wings in egg wash. Roll in flour mixture. Fry in canola oil heated to 375 until brown. Drain on paper towels. Put butter into a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in honey until butter is melted. Remove from heat. Add chipotle sauce. Add wings. Toss to coat. Serve with blue cheese dressing on the side.

Preheat the oven to 200c. Lightly grease some baking trays. Take the rolls and cut them into four even-sized pieces. Then cut each piece into four triangles. Place onto the baking trays. Drizzle each piece of bread with olive oil. Add a small blob of chutney to each piece of bread. Top each piece of bread with a cube of cheese. Sprinkle the thyme onto each piece of cheese. Place into the oven for 10 minutes. Once the 10 minutes is up, remove the rolls from the oven. Allow them to cool for 3 minutes before serving.

Sauté mushrooms in butter until tender. Remove from pan and set aside. In a saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add flour, stirring constantly to make a paste. Gradually stir in stock to form a roux. Simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring constantly. Gradually stir in the half-and-half cream until well blended. Add mushrooms and cook 1 minute longer or until tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or cool, cover and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Reheat before serving.

Heat milk and coffee in a small pan until just hot. Remove from heat and whisk in white chocolate and vanilla. Pour 1/3 of the white chocolate mixture over chopped almonds and stir well until chocolate is melted and almonds are coated. Spread onto a 9x13 pan (greased). Drizzle remaining white chocolate mixture over and spread evenly. Repeat with the dark chocolate and cinnamon mixture and white chocolate and vanilla mixture in the same way. Cool completely and cut into bars.

Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in mixing bowl. Cut in shortening to make crumbs with pastry blender or cut in with fork. Add bacon drippings, stirring well to make crumbly mixture. Stir in buttermilk to make a soft dough. Turn dough out onto lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth, about 10 strokes with heel of hand. Pat dough out until 3/4 inch thick. Cut dough with 3 inch cutter or biscuit cutter. Bake biscuits at 400 degrees F for 10 to 12 minutes or until light brown.

In large skillet, brown sausage and pepperoni slice over medium high heat until browned. Add pizza sauce and water. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Stir in hash browns. Top with cheese blend and cook until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot.

Wash berries in a sieve to remove small seeds. Combine berries and sugar in large saucepan and bring to a rolling boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Boil until soft and jelly like (about 10 minutes). Stir in gelatin dessert (the same amount of gelatin as you would use for regular jam). Mix well to blend completely. Pour into prepared jars and seal immediately to prevent jam from crystalizing.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water and add water and strawberries. Whip until smooth and chilled. Lay out angel food cake and spread with gelatin mixture. Arrange berries on top and garnish with whipped topping. Chill for at least four hours before serving. Makes 10 servings.

Cook ramen noodles according to directions. Drain well. Meanwhile, whisk together soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, oil and butter. Toss ramen noodles with the dressing. Chop cabbage into bite sized pieces. Toss with the noodles. Top with sliced almonds and sesame seeds. Serve cold.

In a large bowl, whisk together tapioca flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, cooking oil and baking powder. Add water and stir to moisten. Stir in brown sugar. Whisk in rice flour. Heat a griddle over medium heat. Spoon about 1/4 cup batter onto the griddle. Cook until pancakes are golden brown on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Serve warm.

Place chops in crockpot. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Pour peach jam over the chops. Add ginger and vinegar. Cook for 8 hours or until chops are tender. When done cooking, add Worcestershire sauce. Serve over rice.
Mix all ingredients together. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Makes about 2 cups.

In large saucepan brown fish fillets. Remove from saucepan. To saucepan add celery, carrot, garlic, white wine & dill. Cook 10 minutes. Stir in thyme & old bay seasoning. Add cream of mushroom soup. Heat to boiling stirring constantly. Return fish to saucepan. Cook 8 minutes or until fish flakes with fork. Serves 8.

Peel and boil potatoes until tender. Drain and mash with a potato masher (or use a food processor). In a large bowl, add the boiled potatoes and the eggsbeat well with a fork. To the potato-egg mixture add the salt and flourmix well until dough is firm and sticks together when pinched between your fingers. Cut off small pieces of dough and roll into ropes about 1 inch thick and 2 inches long. If you are using a food processor instead, combine all the ingredients and process until the dough is firm and sticks together when pinched between your fingers. To make the kluski, cut off small pieces and roll into ropes about 1 inch thick and 2 inches long. Place the kluski in a large pot and cover with waterbring to a boil for about 5 minutes or until the kluski float to the surface. Remove kluski with a slotted spoon and drain well in a colander and allow to cool slightly before serving. If you are using a food processor instead, place the kluski in a large pot and cover with waterbring

Beat the eggs well. Add the milk. Melt the bacon grease. Add the egg-milk mixture to the bacon grease. Cook until the eggs are scrambled. Stir in the spinach. Add the cheddar cheese. Remove from heat. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Cream butter and sugar together until light. Add cognac and aniseed. Blend in instant coffee granules. Stir in walnuts and coconut. Add baking powder and flours. Mix well. Add enough powdered sugar to make dough soft and firm. Roll out and cut into rounds. Bake at 350f for 12 minutes. Dust with powdered sugar while still warm.
To make this marmalade, simply combine all of the ingrediants and bring to a boil. Simmer for 15 minutes to let the flavors blend. Serve as is or pour into a jar and refrigerate for up to one month.
Place all dry rub ingredients in a mixing bowl. Mix well. Rub mixture evenly all around ribs. Refrigerate 2-24 hours. Grill 4-5 minutes per side.
Blend together until smooth and enjoy.

Bring water to boiling in a large saucepan. Add broccoli and cook until tender. Drain well. Add tomatoes and celery. Cool. In small bowl combine mayonnaise and cheesemix well. Pour broccoli mixture into a 1-quart casserole. Add mayonnaise mixture and stir until well blended. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Mix curry and cumin in a large bowl and add chicken. Coat chicken with sauce and grill for approx. 18 minutes turning often.

Cook ground beef and drain. Melt margarine in large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in flourcook and stir for 1 minute or until smooth. Gradually stir in hot water and milkbring to a boil and stir for 1 minute or until thickened and bubbly. Stir in beef and mushrooms and heat through. Spoon over potatoessprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until cheese melts. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with sour cream if desired. Makes 6 servings.

Cream together the softened butter with the cheese until it is light yellow in colour (but not too yellow). Add the buttermilk to the mixture and stir until everything is smooth. Add the dry mixture to the mixture in the mixing bowl and stir until combined. Using your hands, roll the dough out to about a quarter inch thickness on a lightly floured board. Using a biscuit cutter or the rim of a glass as a guide, cut out rounds. Place the biscuits on a lightly greased baking sheet (you can use a silpat if you like). Brush the tops of the biscuits with the red pepper sauce. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until they are a light golden brown. Makes about 40 biscuits.

Slice potatoes into 1/2 thick rounds. In a large skillet, add butter to skillet over medium heat. Add potatoes, salt and black pepper and saut until potatoes are tender but not brown. Add tomatoes and ham. Cover skillet. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 10 minutes or until tomatoes are tender. Sprinkle with Swiss cheese. Cover skillet again. Cook 1 minute more or until Swiss cheese is melted. Serve immediately on bread or crackers.
In a large bowl, combine all the dressing ingredients. Toss coleslaw, green onions, dried cranberries and pecans in bowl. Toss well to combine. Refrigerate for at least 15 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 425. Sprinkle drumsticks with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Place drumsticks in 1-gallon-sized zip lock bag. Pour olive oil into bag. Add rosemary and parsley. Seal bag. Shake to coat drumsticks. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Serve.

In a small pan combine the raspberry gelatin and cold water. Heat until the gelatin is dissolved. Add the boiling water and stir until the mixture is smooth. Add the raspberry sauce and stir. Pour the mixture into a 2 quart bowl and add the frozen whipped topping. Stir until the whipped topping is melted. Fold in the raspberries.

Spread mustard over one side of each slice of bread. Place 6 slices of bread on a serving platter. Spread mustard over one slice. Top with beef, green chilies and cheese. Place remaining bread slices on topspread with mayonnaise. Cover with plastic wraprefrigerate until serving time. Preheat grill or broiler on high heat. Grill sandwiches on lightly greased grill until cheese melts. Spread each open sandwich with mustard and mayonnaise. Serve with ketchup or hot sauce if desired.

In a large bowl, dissolve yeast and sugar in warm skim milk. Stir in salt and oil and mix well. Stir in dry yeast mixture and add the rest of the ingredients. Mix well with blender (or with hands), cover and let rise for 1 hour. Punch down and divide into portions for rolling out. Roll out and cut into desired shapes and place on cookie sheet and let rise again. Brush with egg wash and bake about 20-25 minutes in preheated oven to 400f. (If rolls are too big for one cookie sheet, you may need to bake in two batches.)

Cut crescent rolls in half. Spread each roll half with tomato sauce. Layer each roll half with slices of salami, tomato slices and mozzarella cheese. Fold rolls over and pinch the edges to seal. Place on greased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 degrees for about 12 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Makes 4 servings.

Bring a large pot of water and salt to boil. Add broccoli and cook until tender (about 3-5 minutes). Drain broccoli and set aside. Brown chicken in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, about 6 minutes per side. Cool chicken and cut into chunks. Combine chicken, sour cream, mayonnaise, broccoli, onion, and water chestnuts in a medium bowlmix well. Pour mixture into a greased 3-qt casserole dish and top with cheddar cheese and Ritz crackers. Bake until hot and bubbly (about 35 minutes).

Dump all the ingredients in a food processor (except the sea salt) and blend until combined. Form small balls using a small cookie scoop. Roll in a small amount of the sea salt. Place on wax paper to set. Makes about 24 truffles.

Remove tops and stem ends from peppers and cut in half lengthwise. Place in boiling water and simmer for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool. Scoop out and discard seeds and membranes from peppers. Stuff each pepper with 1/2 cup of the pickled mixture and close tops with toothpicks. Place in a 2-quart canning jar and add the remaining pickling liquid to cover the peppers. Process for 10 minutes in a boiling-water bath canner. Makes 8 to 12 jars.

Put cornmeal, mayonnaise and chives into food processor and blend until smooth and creamy. Taste and add salt and pepper to taste. Place fish fillets on prepared cookie sheet and top each fillet with about 2 tbsp cornmeal mixture and press down to adhere. Bake for about 15 minutes or until cornmeal is crispy and golden brown and fish is tender. Top each fillet with 1 tbsp sweet chili sauce and serve.
Crush garlic with the flat side of your chef's knife. Mix basil with mayo, cheese, and garlic. Spread onto bread slices and toast in oven or broiler until golden.

Add rice to a pot. Add water. Cook 8 minutes. Add tomatoes and their juice. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in sugar. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in salt. Cook 3 minutes. Stir in parsley. Cook 1 minute. Stir in cheese. Cook 3 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a large bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and butter. Stir in sugar and spices. Press crumb mixture firmly into bottom of unbaked pie shell. Place apples in pie shell. In small bowl, combine brown sugar and cornstarch. Stir in water. Pour over apples. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until apples are tender. Let cool. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Heat oil in large pot. Add onions. Cook for 2 minutes. Add garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Add vegetables. Cook for 10 minutes. Add salt, pepper, and cayenne. Cook for 20 minutes. Add potatoes. Cook for 15 minutes. Add water. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Add cilantro. Serve with a dollop of Greek yogurt.

In a large pot, saute butter, onion, grapefruit juice until soft. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add carrot and potato. Boil 15 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Puree in blender with a small amount of stock. Reheat soup with heavy cream. Garnish with fresh carrot slivers.

Cut hot dog buns in half lengthwise. Split bun bottoms in half horizontally. Place bun bottoms on a platter. Spread lobster meat in buns. Top with mayonnaise. Place bun tops on lobster meat. Place lettuce leaves on each roll. Garnish each with lemon slices if desired. Serve.

Prepare pesto sauce. Place puff pastry sheet into 11" x 7" baking dish. Place pesto sauce over puff pastry sheet. Add whole tomatoes over pesto sauce. Add mozzarella cheese over tomatoes. Bake at 450 degrees for 20 - 25 minutes until golden brown. Enjoy.

Add 2 tablespoons sesame oil and 2 tablespoons soy sauce to a small bowl. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder and 1/4 teaspoon each of ground ginger and cider vinegar. Stir to blend. Set aside. Sprinkle each steak with 1/2 teaspoon salt. Place the steaks on a resealable plastic bag. Pour 1/4 cup of the sesame oil mixture into the bag. Seal the bag and shake to coat the steaks. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Heat a medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add steaks and cook until cooked to desired doneness. Add the remaining 1/4 cup sesame oil mixture to the hot skillet. Cook and stir until the mixture is thickened. Serve with the steaks.

Preheat oven to 350f. Whisk together sugar and ground cinnamon in a small bowl. Cut holes in the center of each cupcake. Place a cinnamon-sugar ball in the center of each cupcake. Combine cake mix, water and eggs in a large bowl and mix well. Fill each hole of a greased cupcake tin 1/2 full with batter. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cool completely in pan. Frost with frosting and decorate with sprinkles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a baking sheet. In a large bowl combine flour with baking powder, salt and cayenne. In a medium bowl beat eggs slightly. Add flour mixture to eggs. Stir in creamed corn. Fry corn fritters in hot vegetable oil. Drain corn fritters. Arrange corn fritters in a single layer on baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes until golden brown. Serve hot.

Remove giblets from shiitake mushrooms and discard. Place mushrooms in a large bowl with soy sauce, wine, honey, oil, ginger and garlic. Mix thoroughly but do not over-mix as mushrooms are delicate and bruising them will result in a bitter taste. Thread mushrooms onto skewers and grill or barbecue for 3-5 minutes on each side until softened but still firm. Dip skewers in sauce and serve immediately.
Mix all ingredients together. Put meat into roasting pan. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 2 1/2 hours. Turn meat and cook 20 minutes longer or until done.

In a large saucepan over medium heat combine the wine, cranberry juice cocktail and sugar. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and strain into a clean saucepan. In a small saucepan over medium heat combine the water and lemon juice. Add the strained wine mixture and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in the brandy. Let stand for 10 minutes. Ladle into warm mugs. Serve with a slice of lemon.

Cream butter and shortening together. Mix in sugar. Add in eggs one at a time. Mix together. Add in dry ingredients. Mix together. Roll dough to 1/2 inch thickness. Using a cookie cutter, cut out shapes and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425f. Heat a 9 inch pie pan in middle of oven for 10 minutes. Combine all remaining ingredients in a large bowl and blend with a fork. Pour mixture into hot pie pan and bake until set.

Drain chicken and let it cool a little bit. Finely chop pecans and dried apricots into small pieces and mix with chicken and celery. Mix together sour cream and cilantro and add to chicken mixture and mix together. Add salt and pepper and mix again and serve on a bed of lettuce with a side of bread and butter and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 375f. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and stir with a wooden spoon until mixture forms a soft dough. Divide dough into three pieces and roll each piece into a 12-inch long rope on a lightly floured surface. Cut each rope into 12 equal pieces and shape into balls with your hands. Roll each ball into a 1 1/2-inch diameter ball and place on a greased cookie sheet at least 2 inches apart from each other. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly brown on the edges and the peanut butter begins to melt. Let cool on cookie sheet for 2 minutes and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

Slice peaches in half and remove pit. Place in a small bowl and coat with blue cheese and drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Wrap prosciutto around peach halves and serve on small plates with a small side of balsamic vinegar for dipping.

Bring 1/2 cup chicken broth to a boil in a large saucepan. Add broccoli pieces and simmer about 5 minutes or until tender. Drain. In a small bowl, combine soup, broccoli, cheese, garlic powder, salt, black pepper and milk. Spoon into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake 20 minutes or until heated through. Top with french-fried onions.

Prepare pie shell as directed. Combine brown sugar, flour and salt. Stir in cream. Pour over pie shell. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake at 425 for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 375 and continue baking 20 minutes. Serve with fresh berries or fruit.

In a medium pot combine rice, broth and water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low, cover and cook for 20 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in soy sauce, ginger, ground beef, cornstarch and green onions. Cook and stir until heated through and thickened, 2 to 3 minutes. Serve over cooked noodles or rice.

Saute garlic clove in olive oil over medium heat for 30 seconds. Add black beans and onion to the garlic. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Serve with sour cream as a dip. Or add sour cream to beans before serving to make salsa.

Crack 12 graham crackers into small pieces, put into a small bowl. Melt 1 stick of butter over low heat. Remove from heat and add 1/2 cup of peanuts. Stir until coated with butter. Stir in 1/2 cup of chopped peanuts. Press mixture onto bottom and up sides of 9x13-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into bars. Spread 1/2 cup of cream cheese on graham crackers. Mix 1/2 cup of cream cheese with 1/2 cup of cool whip until smooth. Spread over cream cheese layer. Spread 1/2 cup of cream cheese over graham cracker layer. Spread 1 cup of chopped peanuts over cream cheese layer. Cut chocolate syrup into small pieces. Spread chocolate syrup on top layer of graham cracker layer. Refrigerate for several hours before serving.

Cook pasta according to package directions. In a large skillet over medium heat combine the sauce ingredientsbring to a boil. Cook over low heat for 4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Drain noodlestoss with sauce. Garnish with scallions.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar in the bowl of an electric mixer until smooth. Add the eggs and lemon zest and mix until blended. Place a dollop of the apple mixture in each shell. Cut each apple into thin slices and arrange them in a fan-shape over the top of each shell. Bake for 25 minutes. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

Roll out dough and spread with cream cheese and sugar mixture. Layer with pecans and orange zest. Cut biscuits in half and place in pan around the cream cheese mixture. Pour orange juice over the biscuits and bake for about 30 minutes. Let cool before serving.

Prepare a charcoal or gas grill for direct cooking. Brush the pork chops with olive oil. Sprinkle with lemon-pepper seasoning. Place them on the grill over medium heat. Cook 3 to 4 minutes per side. Sprinkle the feta with garlic and herbs. Place it on the grill over medium-high heat. Cook 3 to 4 minutes per side. Remove both items from the grill. Cut the pork chops in half. Place them on a serving platter. Sprinkle with oregano. Serve with the feta. Makes 4 servings.
In a large bowl, combine orange gelatin and lemon gelatin. Stir in pineapple and marshmallows. Refrigerate until set. Just before serving, fold in cool whip and garnish with maraschino cherries.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease and flour a 9x13 pan. Mix sugar and flour. In a medium bowl, whisk together oil, coffee and vinegar. Add to dry mixture and beat until blended. Add cocoa powder and beat until blended. Add water and beat until blended. Add vanilla and beat until blended. Add flour mixture and beat until blended. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into cake comes out clean. Cool completely before frosting.

Mix bread crumbs with garlic salt. Sprinkle round steaks with parmesan cheese. Combine tomatoes with Italian seasoning. Dip steaks in beaten eggs. Dip into cheese mixture. Roll steaks in tomatoes. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes to an hour or until done. Serve with salad.
Mix milk with 1/2 cup of powdered milk in microwaveable container for 20 seconds on high. Stir in vanilla extract and sugar until blended. Place in refrigerator until cold. Stir in cool whip.

Mix all ingredients together in a blender or mixer until well blended. Pour batter by tablespoon onto hot lightly greased griddle. Cook until golden. Serve with butter or maple syrup. Makes about 16-18 pancakes.

In a 2-cup microwavable measuring cup combine brown sugar, water, nutmeg and cinnamon. Stir in nuts. Microwave uncovered, stirring every minute, until nuts are well coated. Remove from microwave and stir well to coat all nuts. Pour into a bowl lined with a paper towel to absorb any excess moisture. Stir well. Spread out evenly on a cookie sheet to cool. Store in an airtight container.

Slice pork into thin strips, marinate in dry red wine, red wine vinegar, soy sauce, minced garlic and ginger root for at least 1 hour. Thread pork strips onto bamboo skewers. Set skewers in a shallow baking dish with vegetable oil for brushing. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until pork is done, brushing with oil occasionally to prevent sticking. In a small saucepan, combine water with cornstarch, sugar and red wine vinegar to make a thick sauce. Heat through, brush over kebabs to coat with sauce during last 5 minutes of baking.

In a medium saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic clove to oilcook 1 minute. Add cumin, ginger powder and cinnamoncook 30 seconds more. Stir in chicken stock, water and ricebring to a boil, reduce heat to lowcover and cook 20 minutes or until tender. Remove from heatlet stand 10 minutes before fluffing with fork. Meanwhile, in small saucepan over medium heat, cook apricot, orange zest and 2 tablespoons water until apricot is softened, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. Stir rice into apricot mixture. Stir in green onionsprinkle with additional cumin, ginger powder and cinnamon if desired.

Preheat oven to 400. Slice potatoes in 1/4 inch slices. Place in a large baking pan. Toss with oil. Bake at 400 for 35 minutes. Drain green chiles. Finely dice. Drain onion. Finely dice. Add to the potatoes along with sour cream. Bake 20 more minutes.
Peel onions and cut in half lengthwise. Place in a baking pan with sides. Dip in egg whites and then coat with bread crumbs. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Serve with ketchup if desired.

Whisk together all ingredients except for the mustard. Stir in the mustard and set aside. Makes about 1 cup. Serve as a dipping sauce for steamed vegetables (carrots, broccoli, cauliflower) or as a salad dressing for tossing with your favorite salad greens and vegetables. Refrigerate leftover dressing for up to 2 weeks. Makes about a pint and a half.

Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil. Add fusilli pasta and cook for about 12 minutes or until tender but still firm. Drain pasta well and rinse under cold running water to stop the cooking process. In a large salad bowl, add the salmon, whip, dill weed, dried onions flakes, chives, red pepper flakes, lime juice, salt, and pepper. Fold pasta into salad bowl and serve.

Brown sausage in a large skilletdrain. Set sausage aside. Slice bread into 1 inch cubes. In a 12x8 pan layer the cornbread first and then white bread. Pour over the sausage and sprinkle the sausage with the sage. In a large bowl beat the eggs and add the chicken broth. Pour this mixture over the bread mixture in the pan. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes or until set. Serve warm.

Place chicken meat in a large bowl. Stir in cream cheese until melted. Add sour cream and stir in seasoning salt. Add onion and stir until well blended. Top with parmesan cheese. Serve with corn chips. Serves 12.

Roll out dough and cut into 12 equal pieces. Roll out 1 piece of dough until it is just shy of the size of the pan. Lay the dough piece into the pan, and press it lightly into the bottom and up the sides of the pan. Spread the mozzarella string cheese over the dough. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the cheese. Sprinkle the pepperoni evenly over the sauce. Place the mozzarella cheese evenly over the pepperoni. Spread the butter evenly over the cheese. Sprinkle the parmesan cheese evenly over the butter. Bake 15 minutes until the dough is done. Let the pie rest 5 minutes. Slice and serve.

In a bowl combine turkey with panko breadcrumbs, sour cream, dijon mustard, mango chutney, salt and chili powder. Shape mixture into 4 patties and place on grill or pan saute until no longer pink on the inside. Top each patty with monterey jack cheese, cover the grill or pan with foil, cook for an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve on buns with your favorite salad or side dish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Season chops with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in skillet until hotsaute chops until golden brown on both sides. Transfer chops to 9 x 13 inch baking dishset aside. Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in same skillet over medium heatsaute garlic until tender. Stir in mushroomscook for 5 to 8 minutes or until tender. Stir in 1/4 cup of watercook until liquid is almost evaporated. Stir in souppour into baking dish over chops. Add green beansseason with salt and pepper to taste. Bake in preheated oven until tenderabout 20 minutes.
