Drumsticks and thighs should be cut up into chunks. Place them into a large bowl and pour over them 4 cups boiling water. Let stand for 10 minutes. Drain. Remove chicken from liquid and put in a saucepan with 1/2 cup of water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil gently until just done. Remove and cool. Add to a blender with onion, garlic and mango. Blend until smooth. Set aside. To the blender mixture add lime zest and juice. Add lime juice and black beans. Add remaining water to blender and blend until smooth. Pour into a 9x13 casserole dish. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove cover and bake 15 more minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve with tortillas.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 13x9 inch (33x23 cm) baking dish. In large bowl beat cottage cheese, eggs and sour cream until well blendedadd vanilla and whey powder and mix well. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until set and slightly puffed. Let cool for 15 minutes before serving.
Mix broth and soy sauce in large saucepanbring to boil. Stir in barley. Reduce heatcover and cook for 30 minutes. Add mushroomscook 3 minutes. Stir in spinachcook 1 minute. Stir in parsley. Serve.

In a large bowl, toss the broccoli with the onion, tomatoes, almonds, gouda and oil. In a small bowl, whisk the vinegar with the sugar until smooth. Whisk the vinegar mixture into the broccoli mixture until combined well. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

In a large pot over medium heat, cook the butter and the olive oil until the butter has melted. Add the sweet onions and zucchinis and cook for 5 minutes until the zucchini is softened. Pour the chicken stock into the pot and bring to a boil over high heat. Turn the heat to medium-low and cook for 10 minutes until the zucchini is tender when pierced with a fork. Remove the pot from the heat and add the oregano and salt and pepper to taste. Puree the zucchini soup until smooth by using an immersion blender or transferring the soup to a blender or food processor for 1 minute. Stir the yogurt into the soup and serve hot or cold.
Bring water to the boil in a medium saucepan. Break eggs in the water. Poach for 5 minutes or until whites are firm but not hard. Stir in tomato. Serve topped with basil.

Combine all of the ingredients except the basil and garlic powder. Mix well. Sprinkle the rub over the ribs and basil leaves and garlic powder. Let stand for 30 minutes. Grill the ribs for about 30 minutes and baste with the marinade.

Mix butter and water in a saucepan over a moderate heat until butter melts. Mix in the flour until the mixture forms a ball. Remove from the heat and beat in the eggs and egg yolks until smooth. Beat in mustard powder and cayenne pepper until thoroughly blended. Stir in cheese until well blended. Place the batter on a floured board and knead until smooth and elastic (about 1 minute). Divide dough into two pieces. Roll out each piece to about 1/8 inch thickness and cut into squares or rectangles with a glass or a knife. Drop the pieces into hot oil and fry until puffed and golden on both sides (about 1 minute each side). Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauces as desired.

Stir together brown sugar and vanilla in small bowl until well blended. Place apples in large bowl. Stir cream cheese with pineapple juice in small bowl until smooth. Drizzle cheese mixture over applestoss with toffee pieces and sprinkle with brown sugar mixture. Serve with crackers.

Mix all ingredients except whipped topping in a large bowl. Refrigerate 2 hours. Scoop into 8 oz jars and refrigerate 1 hour. Top with whipped topping. Refrigerate 1 hour before serving. Makes 8 servings.

Grease muffin tins and preheat oven to 425 F. Sift together the dry ingredients in a medium bowl. In a large bowl, stir together the milk and oil until blended. Mix in the maple syrup, egg and vanilla. Pour into muffin cups and bake for about 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Let cool for a few minutes before removing from the tin.

Bell Peppers - Peppers are best when they are brightly coloured and crisp. Cut off the top of the bell pepper. Carefully remove the seeds with the tip of a knife. Pepperoncini Peppers - Pepperoncini are an Italian olive type of pepper. They have a mild heat and a crisp texture. Pepperoncini are usually eaten raw. To remove the seeds, cut them out of the core. Cut off the top of the bell pepper. Carefully remove the seeds with the tip of a knife. Green Bell Peppers - Green bell peppers are mild. They are the most commonly eaten bell pepper. They are usually eaten raw. Yellow Bell Peppers - Yellow bell peppers are mild. They are the most commonly eaten bell pepper. They are usually eaten raw. Red Bell Peppers - Red bell peppers are mild. They are the most commonly eaten bell pepper. They are usually eaten raw.

Soak mung beans for 4 hours. Rinse and drain well. Saute chopped onions with vegetable oil until translucent. Add beans to pan and saute for 3 minutes. Add soy sauce, 1/2 cup of water and coconut milk. Bring to boil. Stir and simmer for 10 minutes. Add fresh grated gingerroot and fresh chopped chillies. Stir and add salt. Simmer for 15 minutes. Transfer to serving dish and top with chopped fresh chard leaves.

In a large skillet heat olive oil. Add garlic cloves and red pepper flakes. Add evaporated milk. Cook for 1 minute. Add onion and cook for 2 minutes. Add penne pasta. Cook for 10 minutes. Add diced tomatoes. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle vodka over pasta. Cook for 1 minute. Top with grated parmesan cheese. Serve.

Combine pork chops with brown sugar and soy sauce. Place in plastic bag and refrigerate for at least 20 minutes. Heat canola oil over medium heatcook chops for 15 minutes or until tender and brown. Drain chops and return them to panadd chili paste and hoisin sauce and cook for 2 minutes. Sprinkle with green onions and drizzle with rice vinegarserve with steamed rice and garnish with additional green onions if desired. Recipe is courtesy of Cargill Culinary Solutions

Heat oil in soup pot. Saute onion and ginger until onion is translucent and tender. Add carrots and saute for 5 minutes. Add stock and bring to a boil. Add curry powder and salt and pepper to taste. Simmer until carrots are tender. Transfer to blender and puree until smooth. Transfer puree to pot and whisk in coconut milk. Return to heat and bring to simmer. Serve topped with chopped nuts or coconut.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Peel potatoes and cut into 1-inch chunks. Place into a large baking pan and toss with olive oil to coat well. Sprinkle with garlic and paprika and toss again to coat evenly. Bake for 30 minutes or until tender but firm (do not overcook). Remove from oven and set aside to cool slightly. In a large bowl, combine potatoes with breadcrumbs, cheese, black pepper, salt and paprika. Spread mixture into an ungreased 2-quart baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes or until top is golden brown. Serve with grilled steak or chicken breast for a delicious main course meal.

In 3-quart saucepan cook fish fillet in boiling water 10 minutes or until done, drain. In saucepan melt 2 tablespoons of the butter over medium heat. Cook onion in melted butter 5 minutes or until softened stirring frequently. Add garlic soup mix to onions stirring constantly over medium heat 10 minutes or until thickened stirring constantly. Combine milk with tomato juice stirring constantly over low heat 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir into soup mixture stirring constantly. In small bowl mix remaining 1/2 cup of butter with 2 teaspoons flour stirring constantly over low heat 2 minutes or until melted stirring constantly stir mixture into soup mixture stirring constantly over low heat 5 minutes or until mixture is thickened. Remove from heat stir in fish fillet. Cook pasta according to package directions drain reserving 1 cup of pasta cooking liquid. Drain pasta and return to saucepan combine with fish fillet mixture stirring gently toss with 1 cup reserved pasta cooking liquid.

Spread 1/4 cup of butter evenly over 8 sheets of phyllo pastrybrush edges with melted butter. Place 1 sheet of pastry on a work surface and arrange remaining 8 sheets of pastry in a stack (1 sheet of pastry on top of the other 7). Lay a sheet of pastry on a work surface and cut into 12 (5 inch) squares. Fold each square into a triangle and place 1 square of phyllo onto a piece of wax paper on a baking sheet. Place 1 piece of ham on each triangle and top with a slice of cheddar cheese and 1/4 apple slice. Sprinkle a little bit of Ritz cracker crumbs on each tart and garnish with a little bit of butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until pastry is golden brown and cheese is melted.

Combine egg, milk and baking powder in a small bowlset aside. Spread egg mixture onto one slice of breadtop with bacon and cheese. Repeat with remaining bread slices. Heat a large skillet over medium-low heatlightly grease skillet with cooking spray or soften margarine. Cook sandwiches, turning once, until golden brown and cheese melts, about 5 minutes per side. Serve immediately.

Season chicken breasts with garlic powder, paprika and pepper. Place chicken breasts in glass baking dish. Pour milk over chicken. Place chicken in 425 degree oven for 15 minutes. Remove chicken and drain. Place chicken in food processor with breadcrumbs. Add grapeseed oil. Process for 20 seconds. Dip chicken in breadcrumb mixture. Place chicken back into baking dish. Cover with parmesan cheese. Bake for another 20 minutes. Serve with salad.

Season the meat with salt and pepper and place in a crock pot with all seasonings and garlic cloves. Place wine and water in the crock pot and cook for 6-8 hours or until tender. Add the carrots and mushrooms and cook for an additional 30 minutes. Serve with the sauce from the crock pot or make your own gravy.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, cook onion and garlic in oil until tender. Add bay leaf and curry powder and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in tomatoes, curry powder and cook over medium-low heat until heated through. Add chicken and cook, covered, for 8 minutes or until done (165 degrees f on a meat thermometer). Remove chicken and keep warm. Add coconut milk and lemon juice to pan and cook over medium-low heat until sauce thickens slightly. Return chicken and any juices to pan and cook over medium-low heat until heated through. Serve over rice or noodles.

Peel carrots and cut into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Place carrots into a baking dish and sprinkle with salt. Pour butter over carrotsplace dish into the preheated oven for about 30 minutes or until the carrots are tender but not browned. While carrots are baking, combine brown sugar, mustard, honey and parsley in saucepan. Cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Add remaining ingredients, stirring constantly with wooden spoon. Remove carrots from oventransfer to serving dish and pour sauce over carrots. Sprinkle carrots with salt. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the macaroni and cook according to package directions. Drain well and set aside. In a large pan over medium heat, saute the garlic in the oil for 1 minute. Add the breadcrumbs and cook for 1-2 minutes more. Add the zucchini and corn and cook for another minute. Add the cooked macaroni and stir well to combine. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the cheese until melted. Add the basil and toss to combine. Serve hot.

In a small bowl, combine honey mustard and horseradish. Spray a baking dish with garlic flavored non-stick spray. Set aside. In a large skillet or saute pan over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add mahi mahi and saute until done. While fish is cooking, mix salsa and cornstarch in a small bowl. In another small bowl, add pineapple chunk. Drain mahi mahi and remove from pan. Place mahi mahi in a serving bowl and top with pineapple chunk. Add salsa mixture to pan and bring it to a boil. Pour salsa over mahi mahi and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Spread graham cracker crumbs in an unbaked 9 inch pie pan. Blend 1 cup sweetened condensed milk with 2 eggs in a mixing bowl. Add 1/2 cup lemon juice and 1/2 cup lemon zestmix well. Pour into crust. Bake 45 to 50 minutes or until set. Cool slightly. Cut into 8 servings. Serve warm or cold.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add onion and cook, stirring occasionally until tender. Add rice. Cook 1 minute. Add broth. Increase heat to high. Cover, bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in parsley.
Cut biscuits into quarters. Cut 3 tablespoons of margarine into small pieces. Add brown sugar and almonds. Mix well. Spoon on cut biscuits. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes. Cool slightly.

Boil string beans for 3 minutes. Drain. Place in a large bowl and pour oil over the beans. Add salt and toss to combine. Add turmeric and cumin. Mix well. Set aside for 10 minutes. Drain any excess oil from the beans. Place the beans on a large baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes at 400 degrees. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Grease 9x5 inch loaf pan. In large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In small bowl, whisk together egg, buttermilk and light molasses. Set aside. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Remove from heat. Add walnuts to butter. Stir well. Let cool. In medium bowl, combine cooled butter with flour mixture. Add egg mixture and stir until just blended. Spoon batter into greased loaf pan. Sprinkle with raisins. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center of loaf comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Cool completely on wire rack. Yield: 12 servings.

Fry the bacon until crisp. Drain on paper. In a large skillet melt the butter with the bacon. Add the mushrooms to the bacon and cook over a moderate heat stirring occasionally for 10 minutes. Add the cabbage to the pan with 1 tablespoon of the bacon fat. Toss with the mushrooms. Season with salt and pepper. Add the spring onions. Cook over low heat until the cabbage is tender. Serve.

Brown the bacon and diced ham until crisp. Add onions and thyme leaves and saute until softened. Add cream of chicken soup, chicken noodle soup, milk and water. Simmer for 30 minutes. Add cooked eggs and green beans and simmer for 15 minutes or until tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine the potatoes with the broth and salt in a 2-quart casserole dish. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until tender. Stir the potatoes and add the cheddar cheese and creambake uncovered for 10-15 minutes or until cheese is melted and potatoes are tender.

Put coconut and brown sugar into a large bowl. Stir to moisten. Add vanilla and white sugar and mix. Make small balls of mixture and roll them in the sugar. Place them on parchment paper. Dot the tops of each ball with brown sugar. Place in the freezer for about 15 minutes. Remove from freezer and roll them in the granulated white sugar. Let them sit for about 10 minutes. Remove from freezer.

Prepare the pie crust. Crimp the edges. Bake the crust according to directions. Cut the chicken into bite-size pieces. Cook the chicken in a large skillet. Cook until cooked through. Drain. Add in the cream of chicken soup and milk. Cook until heated through. Add in the peas and carrots. Cook until heated through. Sprinkle with black pepper. Spoon the filling into the pie crust. Top with the remaining crust. Crimp the edges. Brush with egg. Bake the pie at 375 degrees for about 30 minutes or until the crust is golden.

Mix brown sugar and vanilla together. Beat in butter. Add baking soda, flour and rolled oats. Mix until a dough is formed. Roll dough to 1/2 inch thickness. Using a round cookie cutter, cut rounds from dough. Place rounds 2 inch apart on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Wash and peel new potatoes. Slice into 1/4 inch rounds. In large bowl toss potatoes with salt and hot chili powder. In non-stick frying pan heat 1 tbsp. Olive Oil. Add 3 to 4 potato rounds at a time and cook until crisp and golden brown about 2 minutes per side. Transfer to paper towels. Serve warm.

Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Cook onions and garlic until tender. Add beef and brown. Drain well. Transfer to a large bowl. Add the ketchup and brown sugar and stir well. Add the soy sauce and stir well. Add the vinegar and stir well. Add the mustard and stir well. Add the cayenne pepper and stir well. Place mixture back in the pan and cook over low heat for 10 to 12 minutes. Serve on toast.

Bring water just to boiling in a small saucepan. Add miso and soy sauce and cook over high heat for 1 minute. Add mushrooms and stir until they are almost cooked through (they should be cooked through if they are thin). Add tofu and stir until tofu is heated through. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 days and reheat when ready to serve.

In a large frying pan heat oil over medium heat. Add finely chopped onions and garlic to pan and cook for about 10 minutes stirring occasionally. Add beef mince and brown for about 3 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook for about 1 minute. Add dried herbs and cook for about 2 minutes. Add canned spaghetti in tomato sauce and stir until well combined. Add frozen peas and stir for about 2 minutes. Add cheese and stir until well combined. Pour mixture into an oven proof dish. Cover with breadcrumbs. Bake for about 25 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Pre-heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Cook the clams until they open up and remove them from the shells with a small spoon and place them in a mixing bowl with the almonds, olive oil, wine and lemon juice and zest and scallion and parsley and mix well. Put the clams in an ovenproof dish and bake for about 10 minutes until the clam juices have thickened slightly and the clams are very hot and baked through and tender.

Preheat grill to medium. Pat chicken dry with paper towels. In a shallow bowl, combine flour and salt. In another shallow bowl, whisk together water and red wine vinegar. Place remaining ingredients in a small bowl and stir. Dip chicken in flour mixture. Dip in water mixture and coat with the prepared mustard. Dip in prepared hot sauce mixture and coat. Grill chicken until golden and juices run clear. Serve.

Cut cucumbers into halves, then quarter them lengthwise. Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add cucumbers to watercook until crisp-tender, 3 minutesdrain. Transfer to large bowladd onion, bell pepper, lime zest, mint leaves, sugar and vinegartoss to coat. Chill 2 hours. Store in an air-tight container in freezer up to 3 months.

Wash the pears and cut them in half lengthwise. Remove the core from each pear half by cutting a small slice off the bottom of the pear then cutting around the core in a circle to remove it completely. Place pears in a baking pan with the cut side facing up. Slice the oranges in half lengthwise and remove the core from each half. Remove the pineapple from the can & cut it up in small chunks. Pour the fruit mixture into the pan with the pears & stir to combine. Add the sugar, cloves, cinnamon sticks & gingerroot to the pears. Let the pears cook for about one hour or until the pears are soft. Remove the cinnamon sticks & gingerroot & place the jam in a canning jar. Cover the jar & let it cool for a couple of hours before storing in the refrigerator or freezer.

Remove wax from brie round with a paper napkin. Wash brie round with warm soapy water. Dry with paper towels. Place brie on serving plate. Arrange pecans in a circle around brie. Sprinkle with brown sugar and drizzle with oil. Place brie on a plate or platter. Fill plate with crackers. Serve with wine or champagne.
Cut the celery ribs into 6 to 8 pieces. Place celery on a serving platter. Top each piece with a thin layer of almond butter. Sprinkle with salt. Garnish with dates.

Follow jello directions for a 1-pint package. When jello has set, add 1 cup of pineapple juice, 1 cup of water, 1 can of pineapple chunks and 1 cup of sliced mango. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.

Season pork chops with salt and pepper, then rub with the rosemary. Heat a grilling pan over medium-high heat until hot. Add oil. Grill chops until well browned on both sides, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer chops to a plate or platter. Combine the lemon juice, soy sauce, brown sugar, and salt and pepper in a small bowl. Pour sauce over the chops.

Combine vodka and diet 7-up in a pitcher. Place strawberries into a blender. Add sugar and ice. Blend until smooth. Pour into pitcher and top with strawberry slices. Serve. This drink is good with a splash of club soda. It is also good with pina colada mix. It is also good with frozen strawberries and a splash of coconut rum.

Cover the bottom of the casserole with semolina. Pour the water into the casserole. Bring to the boil stirring constantly. Reduce the heat to low, add the sugar and cinnamon. Cook for about 20 minutes stirring occasionally. Pour the mixture into a large bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and leave in the fridge for several hours. When ready to serve, pour the mixture into serving bowl. Serve with a sprinkling of cinnamon.

Combine cream cheese, peppers and parmesan cheese in food processor. Blend until smooth. Add sour cream and blend well. Transfer to an 8-inch square glass dish. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour before serving.

Pat fish dry with paper towel and place in baking dish. Combine mayonnaise, lemon juice, old bay seasoning and black pepperstir well. Place fish into dishpour sauce over fishstir to coat fish well with sauce. Cover dish with foilbake 10-15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with forkdrain well on paper towel before serving with rice or potatoes.
Mix all ingredients well in large bowl. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper. Let dry completely for 24 hours.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, heat oil until shimmering. Add garlic and saute 1 minute. Add shrimp and season with salt and pepper. Saute 2 minutes or until pink. Add rosemary and sherry. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 3 to 4 minutes or until shrimp is pink and tender. Sprinkle with hot sauce. Serves 4. Recipe courtesy of mccormick.

Fry garlic and onions in butter until translucent. Add sliced mushrooms. Cook for 1 more minute and set aside. In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook fettuccine pasta per directions. In a large skillet, saute swiss chard with a few tablespoons of water for a couple minutes or until tender. Add chard and garlic/onion mixture back to pot and add sour cream and low-fat milk, salt and pepper. Cook over medium low heat until heated through. Top with Parmesan cheese and serve with fettuccine and olives on the side.

In a large bowl, whisk together the egg whites with the salt and sugar. Add the lemon zest and vanilla extract. With an electric mixer at high speed, beat the mixture until stiff peaks form. Stir in the flour. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until lightly browned.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain well. Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add flourcook 1 minute. Gradually add milk, stirring constantly. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens and bubbles. Stir in onion and cook 2 minutes longer. Remove from heatstir in cheeses. Stir in macaroni. Season to taste. Let stand 20 minutes to thicken before serving.

Preheat a large skillet with a drizzle of olive oil. Sprinkle garlic cloves and crushed red pepper flakes with salt and place into the skillet. Place the chicken breasts on top of the garlic and season them with salt as well. Cook the chicken for 10 minutes on medium heat or until the chicken is done. You can add a little chicken broth to the skillet if you need to. Serve with rice or a side of your choice.

Cook pasta according to package directions then drain and rinse. In the same skillet used to cook pasta, heat butter and olive oil over medium heat then add onion and cook until transparent. Add ground beef and cook until done. Add cooked pasta and spaghetti sauce and simmer over medium-low heat for 10 minutes. Combine cottage cheese and Italian cheese blend in small bowl then mix with spaghetti sauce mixture and simmer over medium heat for 10 minutes. Add garlic and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over pasta.
Melt butter. Add powdered sugar and stir until smooth. Add coconut and chocolate. Spread on a foil-lined baking sheet. Let cool. Break into pieces.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a 13x9 baking dish with waxed paper. In a large bowl, combine the angel food cake mix, water, pudding, and lemon extract. Beat at medium speed until smooth. Pour mixture into pan. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator and loosen cake from paper. Remove paper. Spread lemon frosting over top. Cut into 60 pieces.

Mix all ingredients together with an electric mixer until blended. Place into an ice cream cone or small paper cone with ends snipped off. Garnish with parsley or paprika if desired. Serve with crackers.

Pre heat oven to 375 degrees. Unroll crescent rolls and separate into triangles. Place a triangle on a flat surface. Spread 1 tablespoon of whole berry cranberry sauce over triangle. Add a slice of brie. Add a pecan and a second slice of brie. Repeat with remaining triangles. Brush edges of dough with water. Fold in half and seal edges. Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Let cool. Serve with crackers.

Beat the eggs with a dash of salt and pepper in a bowl. Gradually add the mayonnaise, sour cream and lemon juice. Add salt to taste and sprinkle with sugar to taste. Fold in the fresh herbs. Spoon into individual ramekins or a 1 litre ovenproof dish, refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the chard in batches until tender. Drain in a colander. Set aside. Bring 1 1/2 cups water to a boil in a large skillet. Add the butter beans. Cover and cook over medium-low heat for 5 minutes. Drain. Stir in the chard. Add the olive oil to the butter beans. Season with hot pepper sauce to taste. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Bring water to a boil. Add lima beans. Simmer for 1 1/2 hours. Drain. Add olive oil to pot. Sauté the onions in the oil until tender. Add tomatoes, pinto beans, lima beans, brown sugar, salt and water. Cook for 1 hour over medium heat. Stir occasionally. Serve hot.

Clean and pat fillet dry. Season fillet with salt and pepper. In a shallow baking dish combine white wine, lemon juice and rosemary. Heat until bubbles form around edge of pan and remove from heat. Place fillet in baking dish. Top fillet with mushrooms. In a small bowl combine scallions and parsleysprinkle mixture over fish. Cover dish with foil and bake for about 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.

Bring a large pot of well-salted water to a boil over high heat. Add pasta and cook according to package instructions until tenderreserve 1 cup of cooking water. Drain pasta wellreturn to pot over low heat. Add olive oil, lemon juice, mustard, garlic, lemon peel, reserved cooking water and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally to combine seasonings with pasta. Stir in tomatoes and bell pepperscook over low heat another 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the feta and green onion. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Prepare cauliflower in boiling water for 10 minutes and drain. Peel and dice red bell peppers. Finely dice onion and celerymelt butter and sauté onion and celery in skilletadd diced bell peppers and cook until tenderadd broth and flour and cook over medium heat until mixture thickensadd dill weed and stir welladd cauliflower and simmer for 10 minutesadd imitation crabmeat and cook for 3 minutesadd half and half and simmer for 5 minutesstir in lemon peel and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Cut the bread into 1-inch cubes. In a medium saucepan melt the 6 tablespoons of butter. Add the bread cubes and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the apples and raisins. Sprinkle with the white and brown sugars and cinnamon. Cook over low heat for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Mash avocados thoroughly. Add salsa, mayonnaise and all other ingredients except for fresh chives. Mash well. Sprinkle with fresh chopped chives. Serve immediately and refrigerate if not serving immediately.

Peel potatoes, cut into quarters and place into a pot of water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cook until tender enough to pierce with a fork. Drain well. Meanwhile, melt butter over medium heat. Add chipotle pepper, adobo sauce, stock, brown sugar and salt to butter. Bring to a boil. Stirring constantly. Reduce heat to medium low. Add sweet potatoes. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Stirring occasionally. Mix together. Adjust seasoning to taste. Serve.

Combine gelatin and waterstir until dissolvedadd to sweetened condensed milkmix well. Stir in the coconutblend well. Fold in the slivered almonds. Place in individual serving dishessprinkle with decorator sugarrefrigerate until firm.

To make the sandwiches, heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the feta cheese and cook until it begins to melt. Remove from the heat. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Place the pita bread rounds cut-side down on the skillet and toast until crisp. Flip and repeat. Place the toasted pita bread rounds on a cutting board and spread the butter over the toasted side. Divide the feta mixture among the pitas. Top with the lettuce, tomato slices, cucumber and yogurt. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel and cut the parsnips into wedges. Toss the parsnips with the olive oil and season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to a large rimmed baking sheet and toss to coat. Roast until tender and browned, about 35 to 45 minutes. Meanwhile, peel and thinly slice the shallots. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add the shallots and a drizzle of olive oil. Season to taste. Cook until the shallots are softened and slightly browned. Remove from heat. Transfer the parsnips and shallots to a large serving bowl and toss to combine. Add the honey and season to taste. Top each serving with a sprig of fresh mint and a few sage leaves.

1 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). 2 Lay biscuits out in a 9 x 13 inch pan. 3 In a bowl, combine bacon, sour cream, salt, pepper and green onions. 4 Pour bacon mixture over biscuits and add cheese. 5 Crack eggs over the top of everything. 6 Bake for 45 minutes until cooked through.

In a large bowl combine Worcestershire sauce with egg whites and beat to blend well. Add salt and pepper. Add turkey and beef to the egg mixture and blend well. Stir in tomato sauce and oats to blend well. Place meat mixture into a loaf pan and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour 15 minutes or until done.

Boil water with salt and pepper and potatoes until potatoes are tender. Puree soup until smooth and creamy. Add milk and flour until thickened. Stir in cheese and ham. Add red pepper flakes if desired. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Fry bacon in a large skillet over medium heat 5 minutes or until crisp. Remove bacon with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain. Drain all but 2 tablespoons fat from panremove pan from heat. Coarsely chop bacon. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of the chili powder in the panstir to coat the pan. Melt 4 tablespoons of the butter in the pan over medium heatadd chicken breast halves to pancook 4 minutes on each side or to an internal temperature of 160 degrees F (71 degrees C). Remove chicken with a slotted spoon to a platekeep warm. Place half the bacon in the bottom of a 13 x 9 inch (33 x 23 cm) glass dishtop with half of the chicken breast halves. Stir in the remaining chili powder, chicken broth, cilantro, green chilies and garlic clovespour over the chicken. Cover with the
Mix all the meat mixture ingredients well. Fold in eggs. Press meat mixture into a loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour.

Wash and peel the potatoes. Cut potatoes into 1-inch cubes and boil until tender. Drain and cool for 10 minutes. Peel and dice the onion and saute in olive oil until tender. Grind cracker crumbs in food processor. Mix onion and potatoes with egg yolks and cracker crumbs. Shape into balls and flatten with fork. Heat oil in skillet and fry until brown on both sides. Serve hot or cold and enjoy!
Combine all the liqueurs and fill a tall glass with ice cubes. Top with soda water. Add the garnish.

Place the beef in the crockpot and add the water. Place the carrots around the beef and then place the stir fry sauce in a saucepan. Heat the sauce and then add the coconut milk. Add the peanuts and noodles and bring to a boil. Pour the stir fry sauce over the beef in the crockpot and cook for 6 to 8 hours. Serve over rice.

Rub the chicken breasts with the dried herbs. Dip them into the flour mixture. Then dip them in the eggs. Next roll them in the breadcrumb mixture. Place each breast on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Flip the breasts over. Cook for another 10 minutes. When they are cooked through, sprinkle with lemon juice. Serve with vegetables.

Remove mussels from shells if needed. Discard any broken ones. Place onions, garlic cloves, celery and parsley in steamer insert of a large saucepan over medium heat. Saute for 5 minutes or until vegetables are softened. Add white wine, bay leaf, lemon peel, salt and pepper. Cover with a tight fitting lid. Cook for 10 minutes or until all of the mussels have opened. Discard any unopened mussels. Serve the mussels with cooking liquid drizzled over the top. Serves 8.

Place water in small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heatadd berry gelatin and stir until completely dissolvedremove from heat. Add pineapple juice to berry mixturestir until gelatin is completely dissolved. Pour into a 9-inch round glass dish or plastic bowl lined with plastic wraprefrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight. Arrange pineapple slices around outer edge of berry mixturerefrigerate until ready to serve. If desired, garnish with blueberries and pineapple wedges before serving.

Place toast on a baking sheet. Top each slice with a small amount of tuna. Top tuna with 1/4 to 1/3 cup of milk. Drizzle with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with 1-2 tbsp. cornstarch. Drizzle with cold water. Bake at 375 for 5 minutes. Serve.

Mix 1 cup of sago in a bowl with enough cold water to cover them. Cover the bowl with a plate or a towel to prevent the sago from floating to the top of the bowl. Let it sit in a cool place for at least 1 hour or overnight. Peel bananas and cut into bite-size pieces. If using fresh bananas, just remove the peel. If using canned bananas, remove the liquid from the can before adding the bananas to the sago mixture. Heat a pan over medium heat. Add 1 inch of oil into the pan and heat until the oil is hot but not smoking. Add a handful of bananas at a time to the hot oil (do not overcrowd the pan) and fry the bananas until golden brown. Fry the bananas in batches until all the bananas are golden brown. Let the bananas drain on paper towels while you work on the sago. Add 1 cup of coconut milk to the sago mixture in the bowl. Add the bananas to the sago mixture along with the coconut milk. Fill a banana leaf with the

Prepare potatoes in a pot of salted water. Cook until tender and drain well. Melt butter in a large skillet. Add chopped green peppers and onion and sauté until tender. Sprinkle flour over mixture and cook stirring constantly until flour is lightly browned. Add milk and mustard powder and stir well. Cook until thickened. Add ham and cooked potatoes. Stir until all the ingredients are well blended. Spoon into a 2 quart baking dish and sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese. Bake in a 400 degree F. preheated oven until bubbly. Serve hot.

Dissolve sugar in water and add cream of tartar. Stir in food coloring if using it. If using a flavoring, put in a couple of tablespoons of the flavoring as well (lemon juice and zest work well). Heat until sugar is dissolved and mixture comes to a boil (about 225 degrees). Stir constantly so it doesn't stick to bottom of pan. When mixture boils up and is foamy, remove from heat and stir until sugar crystals form and candy is completely opaque (about a minute). Let stand in pan for a couple of minutes and then remove the candy to a shallow pan and cool until firm. Using the back of a spoon or a dowel stick, make a hole in the center of each lollipop and insert the stick.

Combine soy sauce, brown sugar and whiskey in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Dip salmon fillets into mixture. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve.

Heat boiling water over stove and mix with jell-o gelatin. Set aside. Lay a sheet of graham crackers on the bottom of a pie pan. Cover with strawberries and then the gelatin mixture. Top with ice cream then whipped topping. Chill in the refrigerator for at least two hours before serving.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch cubes (or use pre-cut French fries). Cook potatoes until just tenderdrain. Stir milk into potatoes until blended with potatoes (about 1 minute). Combine flour, baking soda and saltgradually stir into milk mixture. Stir in sausage. Spoon into 2 lightly greased 12-ounce custard cupstop with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 40 minutes or until set. Serve warm.

Cook tortellini according to package directions. Drain. Toss cooked tortellini in parmesan cheese until all tortellini are coated. Set aside. In small bowl mix together lemon juice, garlic cloves, olive oil, parsley and a pinch of salt & black pepper. Heat the sauce on medium heat for 5 to 7 minutes. Place tortellini in serving bowl. Top each tortellini with a dollop of sauce. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl, combine oil, garlic, herbs, lemon juice, peppercorns, poppy seed and salt. Marinate feta in mixture for at least one hour or overnight. Refrigerate, covered if necessary. Use as a dip or spread on bread or crackers.

Place a fine sieve over a bowl and place the vanilla bean into the sieve. Pour the heavy whipping cream into the sieve and let stand at room temperature for an hour. In a large mixing bowl whisk the cream and the vanilla until soft peaks form. Whisk in the powdered sugar. Stir in nutmeg. Transfer the mixture into an airtight container and refrigerate until ready to use.

Chop tomatoes into small pieces, put them in a bowl with salt, pepper, sun-dried tomato packed in oil, vinegar & parmesan cheese. Mix with fork until everything is evenly distributed throughout the salad.

In large saucepan over low heat, stir in soup and water and bring to a boil. Add macaroni and garlic salt. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Add the cheeses and green pepper. Cook and stir for 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Top with oregano leaves and serve.

Place the white vinegar and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and add the sugar and spices. Simmer until the mixture has reduced by half, about 20 minutes. Add the herring and simmer until the herring is pink and the liquid is syrupy, about an hour. Strain the liquid and store in sterilized jars. Refrigerate for up to two months.

Cut your bread in half. Spread mustard evenly over one side of each piece of bread. Top each with a thin layer of pastrami. Top with swiss cheese. Grill in a panini press until pastrami is warm. Spread butter evenly over pastrami side of bread. Cut in half and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly grease a 9x13 pan. Mix apples with brown sugar and cinnamon. Spoon about 1 Tbsp. of apple filling in the center of each wonton. Fold wonton wrapper in half. Place filled wontons in a lightly greased 9x13 pan. Bake 15-20 minutes until brown. Serve hot with powdered sugar.

Cut tomatoes in half. Peel onion. Slice the tomatoes and onion. Place the tomato halves in a 12-inch heavy skillet with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes. Drain the tomatoes. Return the tomatoes to the skillet. Dice the onion. Dice the garlic cloves. Heat the olive oil in a 10-12-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pork. Cook stirring occasionally until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes. Stir in the tomatoes. Add the onion and the water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer for 1 1/2 hours. Remove the lid. Stir the tomato mixture. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Continue cooking uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove the skillet from the heat. Season with the salt and the pepper. Sprink

Mix ground beef with soup mix, egg, cracker crumbs. Shape into 1-inch balls. Brown in oil. Add brandy to boiling wateradd ketchup, barbecue sauce. Heat until boilingadd meatballs. Reduce heatsimmer 15 min., uncovered. Sprinkle with parsley before serving. Makes 10 servings.

Combine all the dry ingrediants in a plastic bag. Add broccoli to the bag and seal. Shake to coat broccoli. Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Drain the broccoli from the bag. Add broccoli to the pan. Cook over medium heat for about 3 minutes. Turn the broccoli and cook for 2-3 minutes. Broccoli is done when the breading is crispy.

Melt butter in sauce pan over low heat. Add sugar and beat until fluffy. Add vanilla and eggs beating until light and fluffy. Add flour, cocoa and salt stirring until blended. Stir in chips, then drop dough by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 12-14 minutes or until set. Allow cookies to cool on cookie sheet for 2 minutes before transferring them to a wire cooling rack to cool completely.

Bring milk and water just to a boil in a large saucepan over medium heatgradually whisk in sugar and cook for 1 minute or until sugar is dissolved. Add eggs and whisk until eggs are blended. Add vanilla and saltwhisk well. Gradually whisk in flour until flour is incorporated and mixture is smooth. Pour into an ungreased 11x7x2-inch baking pansmooth top with spoon or rubber spatula. Bake at 375F for about 40 minutes or until custard is set and has pulled away from sides of pan and springs back when lightly touched with finger. Cool on wire rack for about 1 hour before serving. Serve with berries or chopped nuts if desired.

Melt the semisweet chocolate in a double boiler. Remove from heat. Stir in the white chocolate. Set aside. Prepare a 9x13 inch pan by coating lightly with cooking spray. Sprinkle the nuts and dried fruit onto the bottom of the pan. Place the chocolate mixture in a ziplock bag. Cut off the tip of the bag. Drizzle the chocolate over the fruit. Sprinkle with more nuts. Let cool completely. Break into pieces. Store in an air-tight container.

Cut bread into 1/2-in cubesplace on baking sheet. Brush with cooking spraysprinkle with pepper. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes or until toasted. Coolrub each toast cube with cut side of cucumber. Arrange on plattertop each with 1 Tbsp. blue cheese crumbles. Top each with 1 Tbsp. apricot spreadtop with 1 Tbsp. multigrain bread cubes. Sprinkle with 1 Tbsp. blue cheese crumblestop with 1 Tbsp. swiss cheese cubes. Sprinkle with fresh ground pepper.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, heat a large pan over medium heat. Add extra virgin olive oil. When oil is hot, add fresh garlic and red pepper flakes. Cook for 1 minute. Add fennel seed and saute for 1 minute. Add tuna packed in oil. Stir until tuna is hot. Season to taste with sea salt. Add tomato. Simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon zest and fresh parsley. Toss with pasta. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Prepare cake mix according to directions on the box. Mix in instant pudding mix. Fold in chocolate chips. Pour batter into a greased 10 inch bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees f. for 45 to 50 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. Remove cake from pan and cool completely. To prepare glaze: combine water and light fudge topping. Stir in sugar free powdered pudding mix. Mix well. Pour over the top of the cooled cake. Let set for 20 minutes.

Bake Brussels sprouts at 350 degrees for 45 minutes until tender. Cut slices of mushrooms lengthwise and then crosswise into 1/2-inch thick slices. Saute the mushrooms over medium heat for 2 minutes. Add 2 tablespoons lemon juice and 2 tablespoons mayonnaise. Toss until well mixedset aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brush 13x9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Arrange Brussels sprouts halves crosswise in the baking dish. Sprinkle with celery salt. Top with sliced mushrooms and almonds. Pour 1/4 cup mayonnaise over the top and mix well. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons Parmesan cheese. Bake 20 minutes until heated through and bubbly.
Combine all ingredients. Toss well until mixed thoroughly.

Preheat oven to 180c. Cream together biscuit, eggs and sugar. Add in melted butter. Mix. Stir in flour and cocoa. Divide mixture into two. Roll one part into a log and press onto the base of a greased 22cm round flan tin. Roll remaining portion into a log. Roll into 15cm round. Place on top of the first log. Bake for 25 minutes or until cooked. Cool in tin before turning out. Spread on top of the cake with icing sugar. Decorate with nuts and sultana. Serve.

Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water and add to flour mixture. Knead mixture until smooth and elastic and form dough. Cover with plastic wrap and allow to rest at room temperature for one hour and then into warm place for another one hour. Then divide dough into four pieces and make balls for each portion. Roll out dough to about one-inch thickness on a flour surface. Bring rolling pin to one side and cut out dough into twelve sections and shape into rounds or rectangles about six inches long and four inches wide. Bring pin to other side and press down and lift up to shape round or rectangle shape. Dip fingers into water and pat each piece on top so it has no bubbles and set on greased baking sheet for about thirty minutes. Heat oven to 425 degrees and bake for about thirty minutes or until golden brown.

Place grapes and cilantro into blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Add honey and lemon juice and blend again until smooth. Add oil and blend until well combined. Add salt and pepper and blend again until smooth. Pour into a jar and refrigerate up to one week.

Mix yeast and water in a small bowl and set aside to proof. In a large bowl, mix the remaining ingredients. In a small saucepan, heat the water to 110 degrees F (43 degrees C). Stir the proofed yeast into the mixture. Mix with a wooden spoon until blended. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 to 6 minutes. Place in an oiled bowl and turn to grease all sides. Cover with a towel and set in a warm place until doubled in size. Punch dough down and divide into 3 equal balls. Flatten and stretch each ball into a round bread. Place in greased bread pan. Cover with a clean dish towel and let rise for 30 to 45 minutes or until doubled in size. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Bake for 45 minutes. Makes 3 loaves.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix crumbs, peanut butter and butter until smooth. Spread evenly on ungreased 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake 20-25 minutes until set. Cool. Cut into bars.

Slice onion and garlic cloves and sautee them in olive oil over medium heat until translucent and soft. Add the sweet red pepper and cook until softened and slightly golden. Add the tomato sauce and cook until it reduces and thickens slightly. Add the eggs one at a time, and stir well to combine each egg with the vegetables and tomato sauce. Season with paprika and salt and pepper. Serve over hot cooked pasta, pita or rice.

Combine chili powder, ground cumin, ground thyme, sugar, salt and ground allspice in small bowl to form rub. Rub rub evenly over both sides of lamb chops. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Heat grill to medium-high heat. Cook lamb chops 3 to 4 minutes per side or to desired doneness, turning to baste occasionally with jelly. Serve with hot pepper jelly for dipping, if desired.
Beat in eggs. Stir in cheeses. Cook and stir until mixture is thick and cheese is melted.

Preheat a large skillet over medium heat. Brush the bottom of each slice of bread with butter. Place the slices of bread into the skillet. Cook for 2 minutes on each side or until lightly golden brown. Spread each slice of bread with 1/2 of the cheese mixtureadd a slice of ham and top with the remaining cheese mixture. Cook until the cheese is melted. Place each sandwich on a serving plate. Top with red onion slices and drizzle with ranch dressing. Serve with sliced tomato on the side.

In a large bowl combine the milk and soup mix. Stir in the cheese and the other seasonings. Spread the mixture on the slices of bread. Roll them up and place them in a 1-quart baking dish. Pour the vinegar over them and cover. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees. This is a great recipe to serve at a church function. It is easy and always a big hit.

Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Stir in the marshmallows and pumpkin pie spice. Cook over low heat until marshmallows melt and are well combined. Stir in the rice cereal and cook, stirring constantly until coated with butter mixture. Pour the mixture over a lightly greased 13x9 pan. Let stand at room temperature until set. Cut into squares and serve.

Cook ground beef in large skillet over medium heat until done. Drain. Add to pasta according to directions on package. Toss with lettuce, bell pepper, onion and tomatoes. Drizzle with dressing and season with Italian seasoning.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add trout fillets and cook until browned on both sides. Sprinkle lemon zest and garlic over trout fillets. Cook for additional 2 minutes. Add lemon juice and cook for additional minute or two or until thickened and fish flakes easily. Spoon over pasta or rice. Top with basil and Parmesan cheese.

Remove the outer covering from the rib-eye and cut into 2-3 inch pieces. In a glass bowl, combine orange juice, lemon juice and lime juice. Add the rib-eye pieces and the garlic. Marinate for at least 2 hours in the refrigerator. Remove from the refrigerator 20 minutes before grilling. Drain the rib-eye and pat dry. Place the rib-eye in a large skillet. Cook over medium heat until almost done, about 3 minutes per side. Pour 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil into a skillet over medium heat. When the oil is hot, add the cayenne pepper and stir until it begins to sizzle. Pour the sizzling pepper into the skillet with the rib-eye. Cook until the rib-eye is done to your liking. Serve with rice.

In a large bowl combine flour, beer, water. Dip chicken into egg yolk, then in egg whites. Dip chicken into flour mixture. Shake off excess. In a large frying pan heat oil over medium heat. Fry chicken until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve immediately.

Add all ingredients to crock pot. Stir well. Cover. Cook on low for 8-10 hours or high for 4-6 hours. Transfer contents of crock pot to soup bowls. Garnish with parsley, if desired. Serve with cornbread or biscuits.

Carefully cut the tops and bottoms off of the navel oranges and halve them lengthwise. Remove all the seeds from each orange half with a small spoon and set aside the seeds to dry for use another time. Scoop out the pulp into a bowl and discard the peel. Mix the pulp with the apple and grape filling and season with sugar and cinnamon to taste. Place the orange halves on a platter and fill with the apple and grape filling. Arrange the almonds around the edge of the plate and stick the whole cloves into the peeled side of the oranges. Serve chilled.

Wash lamb leg with cold water to remove blood and pat dry with paper towel. Place the leg in a large bowl and add enough water to cover it by at least 2 inches. Add garlic cloves and lemon peel. Add red currant jelly and enough water so that jelly is covered by water by at least an inch. Add gingerroot, mustard, pepper, lemon juice and salt. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 24 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Remove lamb from refrigerator 1 hour before cooking. Remove plastic wrap from lamb leg and place it on a large cutting board. Score the lamb leg so that it is easy to separate into two parts with a knife when cooked. Place lamb on a roasting rack that has been placed in a roasting pan that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Pour 1/2 inch of water in the pan and place lamb in the oven. Roast for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 250 degrees Fahrenheit. Continue

Dissolve gelatin in 2 tablespoons cold water. Add to 2 cups boiling water. Add to 1/2 cup cold water. Add strawberries. Allow to cool. Add to 2 cups boiling water. Add to 1/2 cup cold water. Add strawberries. Allow to cool. Place mixture in refrigerator until it thickens. Pour into pitcher. Keep refrigerated.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9 inch by 11 inch baking dish. Slice the bacon into thin strips and cook until done. Set aside on paper towel. Dice the tomatoes and zucchini into large pieces and mix them together with the cooked bacon. Combine the ricotta cheese with the cream cheese and stir with a fork. Mix in the grated mozzarella cheese. Fold in the zucchini and tomato mixture with the cream cheese mixture. Pour into the prepared baking dish. Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 45 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 20 minutes or until the top is golden and the cheese is melted. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Prepare the pesto. Place the lemon juice, garlic, cilantro leaves, olive oil, salt, crushed red pepper flakes in the food processor with the plastic blade attachment. Pulse until smooth. Set aside. Rinse fish under cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Place the fish in a shallow dish or baking sheet with sides. Pour the pesto over the fishgently pat the pesto into the surface of the fish with your hands. Bake in the oven at 350f for 20 minutes until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with the lemon wedges for squeezing over the top of the fillets just before serving.

Bring large pot of water to a boil. Add swiss chard and boil until tender, 2 - 3 minutes. Drain and cool slightly. In small bowl, stir together oil, vinegar and garlic and red pepper flakes and salt and pepper to taste. Toss with cooled swiss chard until well coated. Serves 4.

Follow package directions for making crescent dinner rolls. In small bowl, combine mayonnaise and next 2 ingredients. Spread half of mayonnaise mixture over bottom half of each crescent roll. Arrange 2 cups chopped broccoli over each crescent roll half. Top with half of slices of cheddar cheese. Roll up each crescent roll half jelly-roll fashion. Place seam side down and press to seal. Place seam side down and press to seal. Place on lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F for 18-20 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat skillet on medium heat. Melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add the ham and onion. Cook 2-3 minutes. Add the green bell pepper and cook until tender. Remove ham and onion from skillet. Add the mushrooms. Cook 2-3 minutes. Pour in the sour cream and cheddar cheese. Stir and heat through. Break the eggs into the skillet and scramble. Add salt and pepper. Turn the heat up to medium high. Cook scrambled eggs 2-3 minutes. Remove skillet from heat and sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and line cupcake tins. In a large bowl mix the cocoa powder and hot water. Leave for a few minutes to dissolve. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add butter substitute and stir until dissolved. Add self raising flour and baking powder and stir until combined. Add applesauce and juice of one orange and stir until combined. Divide mixture between cupcake tins and bake for about 35 minutes. Once baked allow to cool. To assemble the cakes melt the chocolate and place a teaspoon of cocoa mix into the centre of each cupcake. Drizzle melted chocolate over the top of the mixture and add a piece of orange rind. Refrigerate for about an hour before serving. Store any leftovers in the fridge for up to 5 days.

To prepare crust for graham cracker pie crust, use recipe directions that comes with your graham cracker crumbs or pie crust mix. Bake in a 9-inch pie plate as directed. Meanwhile, remove seeds and white pith from lemon and discard. Combine lemon juice and sugar in a blender or food processor and process until smooth and slightly thickened. Add tofu and egg white and pulse until blended. Pour into crust and refrigerate for 2 hours or until set. Spread with frozen light dessert topping just before serving.

Add tuna in water, mayonnaise, sour cream and curry paste to blender or food processor. Pulse until mostly blended but still has some texture. Add celery, apple and parsley. Blend until just mixed in well. Taste for seasonings.

Preheat grill. Peel sweet potatoes. Cut into 6 strips. Slice sweet onions in half. Cut into 6 wedges. Put oil in large bowl. Add sweet potatoes and sweet onions. Toss to coat. Put in large resealable bag. Shake until coated. Grill over medium-hot fire or broil 4-5 minutes each side. Mix together sugar, cinnamon, pecans and melted butter. Serve as a dip.

Remove sausage from casings. Cut into small pieces or crumble. Heat jalapenos in olive oil in the microwave or skillet until softened. In a skillet or pot over medium heat, saute sausage and jalapenos with chicken broth until the sausage is cooked through. Combine sausage mixture with cornbread muffin pieces, pumpkin, cranberries, sage and season with salt and pepper. Pour mixture into a 4 quart casserole dish or greased 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees F until lightly browned, about 40 minutes. Serve with your favorite gravy or sauce.

In a saucepan, combine the cocoa powder, sugar, ground cinnamon and nutmeg. Pour the water into a small bowl with a measuring spoon. Heat the mixture over medium heat until it boils. Remove from heat and whisk in the evaporated milk. Stir in the vanilla extract until well blended. Pour into an ice cream maker, and follow the manufacturer's directions for making sherbet. (If you don't have an ice cream maker, you can make this recipe with an electric mixer. Mix the ingredients together in a large bowl until well blended, then put it into a gallon plastic container with a tight fitting lid, then freeze for at least 4 hours before serving.)

Prepare an aluminum foil lined baking sheet and preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Sprinkle sea salt and freshly ground pepper over the fish. Place fish on baking sheet and drizzle with tequila liqueur. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and allow fish to cool for 5 minutes. Squeeze lime juice over the fish and sprinkle with lime wedges. Enjoy!

Combine milk and pudding mix in a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Whisk in jell-o until dissolved. Pour into the pie shell. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for several hours. Serve with whipped cream. Store covered in refrigerator.

Combine sugar and water in a large pot. Stir occasionally. Bring mixture to a boil for 15 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add orange tang crystals and fruit pectin. Bring mixture back to a boil for 2 minutes. Pour into molds and chill. To unmold, place mold into hot water for 1 minute and turn. Remove and let cool. To serve, add fruit juice of choice.
Pour the shredded hash browns into a greased 11x14-inch baking pan. Add the sausage and sprinkle flour over the top. Add milk and stir. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes.

Sift flour and salt together. Cut in shortening until crumbs are the size of small peas. Make a well in the center and add water. Mix until dough forms a ball. Knead a few times and roll out on a floured board. Cut into 16 rounds. Place rounds in a lightly greased muffin pan. Prick the rounds. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool. Mix instant vanilla pudding with milk. Fill the puffs and top with Cool Whip. Add a few drops of food color if desired. Drizzle with chocolate syrup. Serve immediately.

Cream together the butter and the sugar. Add the vanilla and almond extracts and beat until light and fluffy. Gradually beat in the flour and cornstarch mixture. Turn into a greased 9 by 13 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Cool before cutting into bars.

Blend sour cream with mayonnaise in blender, mix in green onion, horseradish sauce and seasonings. Divide mixture between 4 flour tortillastop each with 1/2 cup roast beef, 1/4 cup cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato and remaining 1/4 cup horseradish sauce. Fold tortillas in halfplace in 2 greased 10 inch skillets. Bake at 350f for 12 minutes or till heated through. Serve with potato salad or baked beans.

Combine the soy sauce and the oil in a small bowl and set aside. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the tilapia and saute until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Cook for about 3 minutes on each side. Remove the fish from the pan and place it in an ovenproof dish that is large enough to hold the fillets snugly. Top the fish with the sauce and bake at 400 degrees F for about 10 minutes. Add the green onion and pepper and stir to mix with the fish. Remove the fish from the oven and serve warm or at room temperature. Serves 4 to 6 people.

In a large pot over medium heat melt butter. Add minced garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Add bow tie pasta and broccoli. Cook for 2 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Drain. Transfer to a serving bowl. Sprinkle parmesan cheese over top.

In a large frying pan cook onions in butter for 10 minutes or until tender. Add garlic, tomatoes and tomato pureecook for another 10 minutes or until thickened. Add green pepperscook for 1 minute longer. Remove from heatstir in shrimp. Heat throughadd salt and pepper. Serve over cooked rice. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8 x 11 baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the oats, brown sugar, cinnamon and salt. In a separate bowl, beat together the eggs, milk, heavy cream and melted butter. Pour the wet mixture over the dry mixture. Stir to combine. Add the cut up apple slices. Bake for 35-40 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.

Sift flour with baking powder. Cut shortening into flour mixture until it resembles cornmeal. Gradually stir in milk. Turn dough onto lightly floured surface and knead about 10 times. Pat dough into 1-inch thick square. Cut into 3-inch squares. Drop dumplings into boiling soup. Cook for 15 minutes or until done.

Place milk and maple syrup in a 1-quart saucepan over medium heat and bring to a gentle boil. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, whisk together the yolks and cinnamon and nutmeg and season with a pinch of salt. When the milk comes to a boil, remove from the heat and pour half of it into the egg yolk mixture whisking constantly to temper the eggs with the hot milk. Stir the tempered eggs into the pan of hot milk and bring to a gentle boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Remove from the heat and stir in the pumpkin puree and pumpkin pie spice. Transfer to a small bowl or ramekin and divide the mixture among 4 or 6 small ramekins. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 3 hours or until set. To serve, unmold pots de crme using a small spatula and serve with a small dollop of whipped cream if desired.

Make the barbecue sauce by combining ketchup, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic clove, sugar and dry mustard. Heat barbecue to medium heat. Grill frankfurters for about 5 minutes. Place them directly onto the barbecue grill. Brush them lightly with the prepared barbecue sauce. Grill for 2-3 minutes longer. Serve each frankfurter with a dollop of American cheese.

Rinse the chicken breast. Dry with paper towels. In a bowl beat the egg. In another bowl combine the cornflour, soy sauce and some oil. Dip the egg covered chicken in the cornflour mixture. Heat a little oil in a frying pan. Cook the coated chicken for 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Drain. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Dice 4 of the garlic cloves. Preheat grill to medium heat. Drizzle oil onto a hot grill and add salmon fillets. Grill for approx 4 minutes, turn and grill for 4 more minutes. Meanwhile, in a small sauce pan combine the remaining 2 garlic cloves and the white wine. Bring to boiling point and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the honey and balsamic vinegar and bring to a boil again. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the dijon mustard and oregano and season with salt and pepper. Grill salmon fillets for a further 5 minutes. Drizzle glaze over fillets before serving. Serves 2.

Wash beets thoroughly to remove any dirt or debris. Cut beets into thin slices using a sharp knife or mandoline slicer. Toss with raisins, brown sugar, oil, lemon juice, salt to taste, and chopped parsley. Arrange beets and raisins on a platter or salad plate. Sprinkle with salt to taste. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 24 hours before serving.

Combine coleslaw mix and ginger into bowl. Add ground chickenmix well. Divide mixture into 3 equal portions. Shape each portion into 1-inch thick ovals. Place each oval on lettuce leaf. Place 2 ovals on each of 2 salad plates. Place 1 tablespoon of the remaining sesame seeds on each oval. Add 2 teaspoons of the remaining sesame oil to each salad plate. Add 2 teaspoons of the remaining sauce to each salad plate.

Bake a 9-inch graham cracker crust according to package directions. Make a chocolate pudding mix according to package directions. When pudding is mixed and has thickened add cream cheese to mix and stir well. Pour into crust and refrigerate for about 3 hours. Spread whipped topping on top and melt chocolate bars. Pour over pie and refrigerate for another hour. Enjoy.

In a small bowl, heat the chocolates and butter in a microwave until just melted. In a large bowl, sift together the cocoa powder and flour. Whisk together with the melted chocolate mixture. In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs and sugar until light and thick. Add the vanilla and beat until creamy. Whisk in the chocolate mixture until combined. Pour into a greased 9x9 inch pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until a tester inserted in the center comes out with a few crumbs clinging to it. Let cool completely before cutting into squares.

Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saute for about 5 minute. Add the soup and broth and cook until heated through. Remove from heat. Add the stuffing cubes and stir. Spoon the mixture into the stuffed turkey. Place the turkey on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350f for 45-60 minute or until the turkey is cooked through and the juices run clear. Serve on a sandwich roll.

Line 13x9 baking dish with plastic wrap. Fill dish half full with marshmallows. Pour hot coffee over marshmallows until dish is full. Cover with plastic wrap. Freeze overnight. Let thaw for 30 minutes then remove from pan. Using a spatula, carefully remove marshmallows from pan. Transfer marshmallows to a cutting board. Cut marshmallows into 1-inch squares. Place frozen marshmallow squares into an airtight freezer container. Top with a layer of whipping cream. Store in freezer. To serve, remove from freezer. Let stand at room temperature about 10 minutes. Top with a dollop of whipping cream. Garnish with shaved chocolate.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Place the rice in a large bowl. Add the water and cover. Let soak for 1 hour. Drain. Cook rice according to package directions. Place 2 cups of the rice in a greased 13x9 baking dish. Cover with the chicken. Top with soup and remaining rice. Pour 3 cups of water over top. Bake at 350° for 40 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream together sugar and margarine. Beat eggs lightly. Add to sugar mixture. Mix together flour, baking powder and ginger. Add to egg mixture. Pour half of batter into greased 9x5-inch loaf pan. Drop by spoonfuls orange rind over batter. Add remaining batter. Top with walnuts. Bake for 1 hour or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Let cool on rack.

In large skillet brown chicken over medium high heat in oil for 8 to 10 minutes or until no longer pink. Drain chicken and set aside to cool. Cut chicken into bite-size pieces. In large bowl combine onion with tomato sauce and mix well. Add tomato sauce to chicken. In large casserole dish combine prepared polenta with refried beans. Top with chicken mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

In a large roasting pan, combine squash and onion. Toss to coat with oil. Sprinkle with marjoram and garlic pepper seasoning. Roast for 20-25 minutes or until squash and onion are tender. Remove from oven and let cool. Add the potato to the roasting pan and toss to coat with oil. Sprinkle with marjoram and garlic pepper seasoning. Roast for 20-25 minutes or until potato are tender. Remove from oven and let cool. Add the brussel sprouts to the roasting pan and toss to coat with oil. Sprinkle with marjoram and garlic pepper seasoning. Roast for 10-15 minutes or until brussel sprouts are tender. Remove from oven and let cool. Arrange vegetables in a large serving platter. Season with seasoning salt and sprinkle with parsnip and dill. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream together 1 1/2 cups of butter and 1/2 cup of sugar until fluffy. Add egg and beat well. Add sour cream and beat well again. Add flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt and beat well until blended. Add bananas and walnuts and stir well again. Pour batter into a greased bread pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into center of bread. Cool for 10 minutes on a wire rack before turning out of pan.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine the eggs and sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Stir in the dates and the coconut. Add the walnuts and vanilla and almond extracts. Mix well. Spoon the mixture into the prepared baking sheet and spread out to the edges. Bake for 30 minutes or until lightly browned and firm to the touch. Let stand until cooled. Cut into 1/4 inch squares and store in an airtight container.

Heat the oil over medium heat. Saute the green chiles for about 2 minutes or until they soften. Add the cumin and stir for another minute. Add the green onions. Add the half-and-half. Whisk well. Add the cheese, one cube at a time. Stir until the cheese is melted. Add the cilantro. Stir well. Add the jalapeno. Stir well. Stir in the fresh cilantro. Serve with tortilla chips. Garnish with the cilantro leaf.
In a large bowl blend all together and then serve with crackers.

Boil hot dogs for a couple of minutes and then drain the hot dogs and let them cool off a bit. Slice the hot dogs in half and then take out the hot dogs and place the onions, bacon and pork and beans in the hot dog buns and then place the hot dogs in the bun and cover with the lettuce and then put the hot dogs in the refrigerator and let them cool off and then take out of the refrigerator and eat the hot dog and enjoy yourself and tell your friends how you made the hot dog.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse in cold water. In a large bowl, mix pasta with tomatoes, red kidney beans and pepperoni and dressing until well coated. Divide among lettuce leavestop with olives and cheese.

Cut quinces into 8 wedges. Place in a pot of water and bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Drain quinces, reserving liquid. Core quinces and cut into 1-inch slices. Return quinces to pot of reserved liquid and cook over medium heat until tender. Drain quinces. Return to pot. Add sugar and enough water to cover quinces by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil hard 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add rose water. Stir to dissolve. Add crystallized ginger. Place in sterilized jars and process in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes. (Note: Quinces can be peeled before boiling).
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and return to pot. Add butter, mushrooms, and half and half. Season to taste. Add pepperoni and stir to combine. Stir in Parmesan cheese and serve.

Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and onions and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in the broth and water. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until the tortellini is tender and the liquid is thickened slightly, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, stir together the sugar and salt. Add the cheese tortellini to the broth mixture and stir to coat the tortellini in the sauce. Add the tomatoes and heat through. Stir in the cheese and season with the sugar and salt mixture and the pepper to taste. Serve with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkle of paprika if desired.

Mix the brown and white sugars with the egg and brandy. Cream the butter and add the dry ingredients to the wet. Fold in the white chocolate chips and craisins. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto an ungreased cookie sheet and bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for about 10 minutes. Cool slightly before removing from the pan to wire racks. Enjoy!

Cut almonds into quarters. Toss with butter and rosemary to coat. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 300 degrees f until almonds are golden brown, about 15 minutes, stirring once or twice during cooking time. Remove from the cookie sheet and toss with brown sugar and salt to taste. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes to taste if desired.

Wash and dry the potatoes and carrot. Cut them into 1/2 inch pieces. Peel and cut the onions and parsnip into the same sizes as the potatoes and carrot. Toss all of the vegetables with 2 tsp dried Italian herb seasoning and 2 tsp salt and 1 tsp pepper. Put vegetables on baking sheet and bake them for 40-45 minutes at 400 degrees. Put the olive oil into a small frypan and add the garlic and let it cook until the garlic is golden brown and fragrant. Remove the pan from the heat and pour the mixture into the vegetables and mix well and let the vegetables sit for about 10 minutes to allow the flavors to blend together. This dish is very easy to make and is great to take to the next potluck.
Combine wine and onion in a 2 qt casserole. Cook until onion is tender. Stir in chili powder, prepared horseradish, red pepper and garlic. Add sirloin steaks. Cook over medium low heat until done.

Preheat oven to 350f., line sheet pan with parchment paper., wash sweet potato, pierce with fork in a few places., rub with 1 tsp olive oil., sprinkle with 1 tsp sugar., sprinkle with 2 tsp kosher salt., sprinkle with 1 tsp fresh ground pepper., wrap in tin foil and roast until tender, about 45 min., unwrap and rub with remaining 1 tsp olive oil., sprinkle with remaining 1 tsp sugar., sprinkle with remaining 1 tsp kosher salt., sprinkle with remaining 1 tsp fresh ground pepper., return to oven and roast until tender and lightly caramelized, about 5 min., serve warm.

Remove seeds from pickled jalapeno peppers. Cut jalapenos lengthwise in half and remove seeds from centers. Fill each half with 1 tablespoon of cream cheese and 1 tablespoon of shredded sharp cheddar cheese. Roll up peppers, starting with the wide end. Place each filled pepper in a 6-ounce microwaveable plastic container. Add 1 tablespoon water. Cover containermicrowave on High 2 minutes or until peppers are tender when pierced with a fork. Place 1 tablespoon pimiento strips on each of 4 plates. Arrange 2 peppers on each plate. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon green onion and drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the sauce. Yield 4 servings.

Heat blackberries in a pot over medium heat until they have burst. Set aside to cool slightly. In a large bowl combine the oats, pecans, sugar and butter. Mix in the blackberries. Pour into a greased baking pan. Bake in preheated oven at gas mark 5 until golden brown. Combine the blackberry liquid with the vanilla essence. Drizzle over the oatmeal before serving.

Cut zucchini and onions into 1/2 inch thick slices. Spray a griddle lightly with canola oil. Cook zucchini and onions until soft and tender. In a large bowl whisk together eggs and seasoning. Add zucchini and onions. Add dry bisquick and mix well with a spoon. Stir in oil until incorporated. Using a tablespoon scoop zucchini mixture onto a greased griddle. Brown pancakes 2 minutes per side. Place cooked pancakes in a warm oven to keep warm while making rest of pancakes.

Put grape gelatin in a bowl with boiling water. Stir until gelatin is dissolved. Add blueberry pie filling and pineapple. Cool to room temperature. Meanwhile, whip cream cheese until smooth. Add sour cream and beat until smooth. Stir together cream cheese mixture and blueberry mixture. Fold in walnuts. Pour into a 9x13 pan. Refrigerate overnight or until firm.

Place the butter, cocoa powder and vanilla extract into a large saucepan. Heat over medium heat until butter has melted. Stir to combine. Add sweetened condensed milk, continue to stir until mixture is smooth. Remove from heat. Whisk in the Grand Marnier. Pour into a container. Refrigerate until firm. Roll into balls. Dip balls into truffle mix. Roll in the truffle mix. Refrigerate until firm. Store in refrigerator for up to 1 week. Store covered. Keep refrigerated.

Remove the tough outer leaves of the cabbage. Quarter the cabbage, cut out the core and cut into 2 inch squares. Place the cabbage, along with the sauerkraut in a large pot. Add water to cover. Bring to a boil on high heat. Reduce heat to medium-high heat. Cover with lid. Simmer for 30 minutes. Add the onion, diced tomatoes and garlic. Season with salt and black pepper. Simmer until the cabbage is tender, about 15 minutes. Add the celery seed. Mix well. Simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the butter and brown sugar. Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve.

Wash dill pickles and cut into spears or slices if large. Mix all ingrediants and fill jars leaving 1/4 inch space at top. Put lids on jars and refrigerate for 3 weeks before eating. Yields about 3 cups
In a medium saucepan, bring peas and salt to a simmer. Stir in flour and cook stirring until thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in butter and cream until smooth. Stir in the pepper. Serve warm.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain potatoes. Cut them into small pieces. Put potatoes in a large bowl. Add cider vinegar. Pour enough cold water over potatoes to cover. Let potatoes stand covered for about an hour. Drain potatoes. Put potatoes in a large pot. Add 6 cups of water. Bring to a boil. Boil potatoes for about 35 minutes. Add oil. Boil until potatoes are tender. Drain potatoes. Cool potatoes. Drain potatoes. Add salt. Add pepper. Add sauerkraut. Add green onion. Add parsley. Add apple. Taste. Add salt if needed. Add pepper if needed.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Place potatoes in a medium bowl. Drizzle potatoes with olive oil. Sprinkle potatoes evenly with seasoned salt and ground black pepper. Mix well to coat. Sprinkle potatoes evenly with steak seasoning and dried herbs. Place potatoes in an even layer on a baking sheet.
