Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes are crisp and tender and start to brown on the edges. About 15 to 20 minutes.

Boil noodles until tender. Drain well. Combine butter, scallions, garlic cloves, brown sugar and soy sauce in a small saucepan over medium heatbring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 5 minutes or until butter is melted. Stir in noodlestoss to coat.

Mix together the mayonnaise and mustard and set aside. In a small bowl mix together the peanut butter and scallions. Add salt and cayenne and blend. In a medium bowl mix together the mayonnaise and mustard and slowly add in the peanut mixture. Add lemon juice and blend. In a large bowl combine bacon and white bread. Add peanut mixture and toss well. Wrap in foil and bake at 350 degrees for approximately 45 minutes. Slice open and serve with a spoon.

Cream the butter with sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add flour. Mix thoroughly. Pour into baking pan. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Frost with vanilla frosting.

Cut each loaf into six pieces. Slice the jalapenos in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and the membrane. Cut into four pieces and set aside. Cut each piece of scallion in half lengthwise and set aside. Heat a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add butter and garlic and saute until garlic is fragrant and butter has melted. Add in mayonnaise and stir until incorporated. Add in the cheese and stir until melted and combined. Add in the jalapenos and scallions and stir until combined and cheese is melted and bubbly. Add in the bread pieces and stir until the bread pieces are well coated with the cheese mixture and then place onto a platter or plates and serve immediately.

Cream together the butter and brown sugar. Add egg and beat well. Stir in vanilla. Add flour and baking soda. Stir in the chocolate and pecans. Pour the mixture onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 11 minutes. Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes. Transfer to wax paper. Let cool.

Saute onion soup mix and beef bouillon in 1/2 cup olive oil. When browned, add flour to form roux. Add broth slowly stirring constantly. Add steak. Stir until steak is tender. Add sour cream, wine and mushrooms. Season with salt & pepper. Cook on high heat for about 3 minutes or until thickened. Serve with fettuccine pasta.

Mix flour with baking powder and salt in medium bowl. Beat butter and brown sugar in large bowl with electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at time beating well after each addition. Beat in flour mixture. Mix in cranberries. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 375 for 10-15 minutes or until cookies are set. Bake one cookie sheet at a time. Cool cookies on baking sheet for 5 minutes. Transfer to wire rack to cool. Place white chocolate in a small bowl. Microwave in microwave safe bowl in microwave on HIGH (100%) for 1 minute. Remove and stir. If not melted completely, return to microwave and cook for an additional minute. Stir until smooth and creamy. Drizzle over cookies. Store in an air tight container.

Mix together the soy sauce, sugar and water in a large bowl. Place the drumsticks in the soy mixture and toss to coat. Let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 15 minutes. Combine the garlic and fresh ginger in a small bowl and rub on the drumsticks. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place the drumsticks in the oil and stir to coat. Cook 6 minutes turning the drumsticks every 2 minutes. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve.
Mix all ingredients except buns in a large bowl. Form into 6 patties. Grill over medium heat for 15 minutes on each side. Place patties on hamburger buns with onions and serve. Makes 6 servings.

Make a crust. Place graham cracker crumbs in a small bowl. Mix with melted butter. Press into a 9 inch pie plate. Bake for 5 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Allow to cool. In a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed beat the cream cheese and sugar for 2 minutes. Add eggs one at a time. Reduce speed to low. Add peanut butter. Blend until smooth. Add milk and pudding mix. Blend until smooth. Pour into pie shell. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Top with whipped cream if desired.

In a large skillet combine the ground beef and sausage and cook until done. Drain the fat from the meat and add to the cheese in a large mixing bowl. Add the shredded onions and the spices and mix thoroughly. Spread the meat mixture on the rye rounds and wrap tightly to form a cone shape. Cook the hankies in hot water until they float to the surface. Remove from the hot water and drain on paper towels. Serve with a dill pickle.

In a large saucepan melt the oil. Stir in the chili powder and chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add the tomato sauce and stir to blend well. Cook for another 3-5 minutes stirring constantly. Add the spices and the sugar and stir to blend well. Stir in the chicken broth and cook until the sauce starts to thicken and turn a deeper red color and the spices are well blended. Add the cayenne and simmer until ready to use in enchiladas or any recipe that calls for enchilada sauce.

In a large pot, bring 6 cups of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add noodles and cook until tender, about 12 minutes. While noodles cook, stir together brown sugar, black pepper, salt in a large bowl. Whisk eggs in a small bowl. When noodles are cooked, drain well and add to egg mixture along with oil. Transfer to a greased 2 qt baking dish and sprinkle with pecans. Bake uncovered in a preheated 325 degree F for about 45 minutes until set.

Preheat oven to 350. Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Stir in chocolate pudding mix. Divide batter into 10 6-ounce tube pan. Bake for 45 minutes. Cool 5 minutes and invert to cool completely. Frost with icing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 9x13 baking pan. Mix butter and sugar until fluffy. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Add vanilla. Combine flour, cocoa and baking powder. Add to egg mixture alternating with milk. Add salt. Pour into greased and floured pan. Bake 35-40 minutes. Cool.

In a large bowl mix bran, hot water and oil. Set aside 5 minutes. Add flour mixture alternately with water mixture. Add eggs one at a time. Fold in all-bran cereal. Spoon into muffin cups. Bake in a 375 degree oven 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 12 muffins.

Cream butter and sugar together until fluffy. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Sift in the flour and cocoa. Mix well. Stir in the oats. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 10 to 12 minutes. Makes about 4 dozen.
Preheat oven to 425 F. Mix all ingredients and pour into muffin tins greased or sprayed with cooking spray. Bake for 12 minutes or until golden brown.

In medium saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add flour and mustard powder and cook for about 3 minutes, stirring frequently. Gradually add water while stirring constantly until sauce becomes thick and smooth. Add brown sugar and stir until dissolved. Cook until it begins to boil and then cook over high heat for about two minutes until it is thick and bubbling. Remove from heat and add vinegar and raisins. Serve with fish.

Tear leaves from basil stalks into bite-size pieces. Grind black pepper and salt in a grinder or with mortar and pestle to season corn. Cut corn kernels from cob. Place corn kernels, red onion, roasted red pepper, apple cider vinegar, olive oil, basil, pepper, and salt into a large salad bowltoss gently to coat with dressing. Refrigerate 20 minutes for flavors to meld before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 f. In a large bowl, combine yogurt with 1/2 cup of milk. Whisk together eggs with remaining 1/2 cup milk. In a small bowl combine basil with salt and black pepper. Toss together. In a large skillet cook the onions until tender. Stir in tomato. Drain. In a 9-inch pie plate arrange 1 cup of the tomato mixture in the bottom. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup of the basil mixture. Top with 1/2 cup of the cheese. Place the 1/2 cup of the yogurt mixture over the top. Top with another 1/2 cup of the tomato mixture. Add remaining 1/2 cup of the basil mixture. Arrange 1/2 cup of the cheese over the top. Pour the remaining yogurt mixture over the top. Sprinkle with the remaining 1/2 cup of the cheese. Bake for 40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool for 5 minutes. Cut into 8 wedges.name

Heat olive oil and butter together in large pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 10 minutes until golden brown. Remove from the heat and allow onions to cool. Prepare risotto rice according to packet instructions and add to the pan with the onions along with the butter and olive oil. Once it has come back to the boil, add the vegetable stock and bring back to the boil before reducing the heat and cooking gently until all the liquid has been absorbed and the rice is soft and creamy (about 15 minutes). Stir through the peas and bacon and season with salt and pepper if necessary.

Melt 8 tablespoons of butter in a saucepan. Stir in brown sugar until dissolved. Remove from heat. Stir in oatmeal. In a bowl, whisk together 2 eggs with 1/2 cup of milk. Add to oatmeal mixture. Stir in 1 1/2 cups of brown sugar. Add 1/3 cup of baking powder. Mix until combined. Stir in remaining 3 tablespoons of butter. Spoon into a greased 8x8 glass baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Cool slightly. Sprinkle with a mixture of 2 cups of powdered sugar with 1 tablespoon of milk.

In a bowl, combine all ingredients except the lamb. Stir to dissolve the sugar. Add the lamb and rub into it with your hands. Set in the refrigerator for 8 hours or overnight. Place the lamb on the grill over medium coals. Cook for about 5 minutes on each side or until desired doneness is achieved. Let stand for 5 minutes before carving into portions.
In a small bowl combine cucumbers, vinegar, sugar and onion. Let stand at least 30 minutes or as long as 2 hours to allow flavors to blend. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Peel and grate carrots. Cook in 2 cups water for 10-15 minutes or until tender and soft. Drain. Place carrots in a large bowl and add evaporated milk and sugar. Whisk together until sugar is dissolved. Add eggs and whisk until blended and smooth. Add ginger and cinnamon and stir until well blended. Fill unbaked pie shells with the carrot mixture and bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until set.

Heat milk to boiling in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Remove from heat and add peanut butter. Mix well and add powdered chocolate mix. Stir well and add peanut butter powder. Add a splash of hot chocolate syrup for extra flavor. Garnish with whipped cream and sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Beat eggs until foamy. Stir in cheese until melted. Add mustard and season with salt and pepper. Pour egg mixture into 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle with bread crumbs. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes until golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Slice biscuits open and put butter on them. Put cheese on biscuit. Put pepperoni and bacon on cheese. Then put green pepper and onion on the bacon. Put tomato sauce on top and place under the broiler for 2 minutes. Watch closely.

Slice cucumber into half-moons. Add to a bowl and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt. Refrigerate for at least an hour. Remove from fridge and mix in chives and tomatoes. Let stand for another hour. Serve.

1.Cut pears in half and core. 2.Slice pears and lay flat. Sprinkle with sugar and lemon juice. 3.Lay blue cheese slices over pears. 4.Place blue cheese side down on a baguette. 5.Place pear slices and cheese slices on top of bread. 6.Wrap slices in foil and place in a preheated 350 degree oven for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Peel and finely dice the ginger. Peel and finely grate the garlic. Put the ginger and the garlic in a food processor and pulse until the ginger is finely minced. Pour into a bowl and set aside. In another bowl combine the soy sauce, rice vinegar and sugar. Mix well. Add the ginger and the garlic and stir well. Stir in the sesame oil. Place the sirloin tip in a small bowl and add the sauce to cover. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Thread the sirloin tip steak onto the skewers. Grill or broil. Sprinkle with chopped green onions and serve.
Mix mayonnaise with the green onions and garlic. Spread on the french bread slices. Sprinkle with the sharp cheddar cheese. Top each slice of bread with parsley and paprika.

In a large bowl beat eggs until light. Gradually add sugar. Add cream and beat until blended. Add cinnamon and beat until blended. Place bread cubes in greased 1-1/2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with sugar. Add half of the egg mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until set. Sprinkle with remaining sugar mixture. Bake for an additional 5 minutes or until sugar is melted.
Brown meat and onion in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain fat. Add potatoes to meat mixture. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Stir in flour and cook for 1-2 minutes. Add beer and cook until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in tomatoes and green chilies. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Meanwhile, make the cheese sauce. In a medium bowl, melt cream cheese and stir in the cheddar cheese. Stir in 1 1/2 cups sour cream. Season with salt and pepper. Remove the beer mixture from the fridge and stir in 2 cups sour cream. Fold in 1/2 cup black beans. Transfer to a large baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake for 5-8 minutes more. Serve with corn chips.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the shallots and garlic and cook until the shallots are tender. Add the curry powder and cook for 1 minute. Add the broth and bring to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the shrimp. Cook until the shrimp are pink and cooked through. Stir in the lime juice. Serve with sour cream. Top with freshly chopped cilantro. Serves 4.

Peel tomatoes. Cut tomatoes into 1/2 inch dice. Peel cucumber. Cut into 1/2 inch dice. Peel green onion. Cut into 1/2 inch pieces. Place all vegetables into a bowl. Add italian salad dressing. Toss. Add vinegar. Add salt & pepper. Add fresh basil. Mix well. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve.

Preheat oven to 325f. In a large bowl, beat tofu with an electric mixer until smooth. Add honey, vanilla extract, and cocoa powderbeat until smooth. Pour into a greased 9-inch square baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Spread cooled mousse on a plate or platter. Makes about 2 cups.

Make sure the tomato pulp is well drained and put in large pot with enough water to cover. Boil for about 15 minutes or until the pulp is tender. Strain and add the pectin and lemon juice and bring to a rolling boil. Cook about 2 minutes. Add sugar and cook until it's dissolved. Add the other flavorings and bring to a full rolling boil and cook about 1 minute or until it is thickened and clear. Pour into jars and process for 10 minutes in boiling water bath.

Crush the lime wedge between your fingers and rub all over the rim of the margarita glass. Dip the rim into the coarse salt. Fill the glass 3/4 full of ice. Add the water and concentrate. Stir well. Garnish with lime slice and enjoy.

Prepare the broccoli by draining and adding to bread. Grate cheese into the mixture. Stir in the rest of the ingredients. Mix well. Spray cookie sheet with nonstick spray. Spoon mixture into muffin tins. Bake in preheated oven at 375 for 20 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes. Serve with ketchup.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1-inch cubes. Put into stockpot and cover with water. Bring to boil and cook until tender. Drain and mash. Add milk and garlic powder. Stir in cheese and ritz crackers. Mix well. Add margarine and mix well. Pour into greased 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with grated cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Mix beef and onion together until beef is thoroughly mixed and is not pink. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in garlic. Place about one-fourth of beef mixture in center of each wonton wrapper. Fold over bottom edge of wrapper and press to seal. Moisten edges of each wonton with water. Heat about half of oil in skillet and brown wontons about 3 minutes on each side. Drain on paper towels. Place wontons in steamer basket and steam covered until wonton is done. Serve with rice and kikkoman soy sauce.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain potatoes. Dice onion. Dice potatoes into small pieces. Mix together potatoes, onion, cheese, mayonnaise and bacon in a bowl. Add red bell peppers and black olives. Serve as a side dish with hamburgers or hotdogs.

Preheat oven to 400f. Prepare two 9 inch pie pans. Have all ingredients ready. Roll out pie crust and place in one pan. Mix together flour and butter. Cut in 2-3 tablespoons of milk until crumbly. Press firmly on top of pie crust. Bring remaining milk to boil. Add lemon juice and sugar. Remove from heat. Cool slightly. Add egg yolks to cooled mixture. Beat until smooth. Stir in flour mixture. Pour into pie pan. Bake 20-25 minutes or until filling sets. Remove from pan and cool. Beat egg whites until stiff. Add sugar gradually. Spread over cooled filling and bake another 10 minutes. Cool before cutting. Garnish each slice of pie with a small piece of lemon.

Slice zucchini in half lengthwise. Slice each half into thin strips. Put zucchini in large bowl. Add mushrooms and green pepper. Combine olive oil and garlic. Drizzle over zucchini. Season with salt and pepper and add fresh parsley. Serve with spaghetti.
Slice corned beef thinly. Place on plate. Top with sauerkraut and swiss cheese. Spoon stone ground mustard over top and sprinkle with onions if desired. Serve on rye bread and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 325f degrees. Grease and flour a tube pan. Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and beat again. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Sift together flour and baking powder and add to creamed mixture alternately with evaporated milk. Bake for one hour and a half or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

Preheat the oven to 200C/gas 6. Peel the carrots and cut into 1cm thick sticks. Transfer to a roasting tray and toss with the olive oil. Sprinkle the dukkah evenly over the carrots and bake for 45 minutes until tender. Serve warm.
In small bowl combine yogurt and syrup. Stir well. Spoon into 4 paper-lined muffin cups. In medium bowl stir together coconut and whipped cream. Spoon over cherry mixture. Top each with strawberry.

Preheat oven to 375. In a 13x9 baking dish, place the fillets on the bottom of the dish. Top with the spinach, then the croutons. Top with the corn and cheese. In a small bowl, mix the tomatoes with the water and lemon pepper. Pour mixture over the top. Bake for 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spread the Crunchyx in an 8x8 pan. In a small saucepan, combine the butter and Karo syrup. Cook over medium heat until melted and smooth. Add the vanilla and stir. Remove the pan from the heat. Pour over the crispix. Sprinkle with the brown sugar. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and allow the mixture to cool. Stir the nuts and pretzels into the mixture. Cool completely before breaking into clusters.

In large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until tender. Add thyme, tomatoes, tomato paste, chicken stock, sugar and bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer 20-30 minutes. Add yogurt. Cook until thickened. Serve hot. To serve hot, place in cups. To serve cold, place in individual refrigerated soup containers. Chill. When ready to serve, pour into cups. Garnish with fresh basil.

Preheat oven to 400f. Clean fish and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in a baking dish and cover with lime juice and zest. Cover with sour cream and parsley and bake for 10 to 15 minutes. Serve with rice and vegetables.
Place scallions and tofu in bottom of crock pot. Add shitakes and soy sauce. Cover and cook for 5 hours on low. Remove lid and add miso. Stir well. Cook 15 minutes more.

Mix peanut butter cookie dough and 1 cup wheat flakes cereal with your hands until well mixed. Place on plate or baking sheet. Lay 1/2 cup peanuts on top of cookie dough. Mix 1/3 cup wheat flakes and 1/3 cup unbleached cane sugar together with your hands until well mixed. Sprinkle half of wheat flakes on peanuts and cookie dough and then sprinkle with the remaining unbleached cane sugar. Place cookie dough mixture into refrigerator for 1-2 hours (or overnight). Store leftover cookies in an air tight container or zip lock bag. Refrigerate for up to 2 weeks or freeze for up to 6 months. Let come to room temperature before serving.

Pour 3 cups of water into a large pot. Add all the other ingredients. Bring the pot to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes. Strain the tea into a serving pitcher. Serve warm or cool. For a sweeter taste, use more sugar or a little honey.

Melt butter in a pan, add flour stir until smooth. Add stock a little at a time stirring constantly until thickened. Add whiskey stirring until smooth, then add lemon juice and mustard stir until smooth. Add half-and-half stirring until smooth. Add steaks and cook until done (approximately 12 minutes). Pour sauce over meat. Garnish with sprigs of fresh chopped chives.

Roll crescent dough out and cut into circles. Place on a cookie sheet. Place parsley and onion flakes in food processor and pulse until chopped fine. Add mustard and lemon juice. Place swiss cheese in food processor and pulse until finely chopped. Place swiss cheese mixture on crescent circles. Add ham. Layer broccoli on ham. Place another crescent circle on ham. Spread butter on crescent circle. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes. Let cool 2 to 3 minutes before slicing.

Brown the meat in a large skillet over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add water and seasonings and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until the meat is tender and all liquid has evaporated. In a small bowl combine cornstarch and water and mix well. Add to the skillet and cook for 3 minutes or until thickened. Stir in the coconut, pineapple chunks and mandarin oranges and heat through. Serve over cooked rice and garnish with cashews and a few additional pineapple chunks if desired. Serve immediately.

Brown ground beef and ground beef in large stock pot. Add onions and green peppers and cook until tender. Stir in beans. Add tomatoes and seasonings. Simmer for about 20 minutes. Add pasta and cook until tender.

In a medium bowl, combine cream cheese spread and smoked ham. Stir in cheddar cheese. Mix in Ritz crackers until coated. Spread in a 2-quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika and serve.

Melt butter in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Remove from heat and pour into a large bowl. Stir in marshmallows until completely melted. Fold in rice krispies. Pour rice krispies mixture into a 9×13″ pan and spread evenly. Press down with a greased spoon so that it is about 3/4 inch thick. Sprinkle white chocolate chips evenly over rice krispies mixture. Sprinkle candy sprinkles evenly over rice krispies mixture. Let set at room temperature until set (about 2 hours). Place sticks into rice krispie mixture using a greased spoon. Let stand at room temperature until completely set (about 1-2 hours). Break rice krispie mixture into treats and serve!

In a large pot of salted boiling water cook potatoes until tender. Drain. In a large skillet over medium-high heat saute onion and garlic until softened. Drain tomatoes and reserve juice. Add tomatoes to onion mixture. In a small bowl dissolve bouillon cube with hot water. Stir into tomato mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Place potatoes in an ungreased shallow baking dish. Pour tomato mixture over potatoes. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Stir in the flour to make a roux. Cook for about 2 minutes. Add broth and stir to combine. Add tomatoes with juice. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add half-and-half and season with nutmeg and pepper. Add bacon. Cook for about 3 minutes.

Place boneless country-style pork ribs into the slow cooker. Sprinkle with brown sugar and generously with seasonings. Pour barbecue sauce over the ribs and then cover with the lid. Cook on high for 4 hours or until pork is tender. Serve warm.

Place the potatoes in a pot of cold water. Bring to a boil. Cook until tender. Drain. Keep warm. Cut the ends off the beans. Slice them into 1-inch rounds. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil and margarine over medium-high heat. Add the beans and the potatoes. Cook until tender. Add the tomato juice. Stir to combine. Add the parsley. Cook for 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the mint. Cook 1 minute more.

In large saucepan, bring a few inches of oil to 360f/180c (or use a deep fryer). While oil heats up, combine eggs, mayo, dijon mustard, thai chili paste, jalapenos, scallions, cilantro and pickled ginger with a whisk until well combined and mixture is smooth. Once oil is hot, add half of batter into oil, wait until it floats then flip with spatula to brown other side. Fry eggs until golden brown and transfer to plate lined with paper towels. Repeat until all eggs are done and serve.

Boil frozen green beans in chicken broth until tender. Drain and set aside. In a skillet cook bacon until crisp. Drain bacon grease from skillet and pour 2 tablespoons of bacon grease into the skillet. Add green beans back into the skillet and sauté the green beans until the bacon is heated through. Add the onion powder and sauté for one more minute. Serve over rice or bread of choice.
In a large fry pan brown chicken liver, onion and eggs with salt, pepper and seasonings. Chop meat. Add chicken fat to meat. Chill. Serve with crackers or toast points.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine the peaches and raspberries in a 2-quart casserole dish and pour the liquid from the fruit over the fruit. Sprinkle the flour and sugar over the fruit and mix well. Add the baking powder and cinnamon and mix well. Pour the eggs over the fruit mixture and blend well. Pour the butter over the fruit mixture and blend well. Place the casserole in the oven for 30 minutes or until the topping is lightly browned and the fruit is tender when pierced with a fork.

Bring water to boil. Add whole wheat spaghetti and cook according to package instructions (approximately 12-15 minutes). Drain and return to pot. Add olive oil and sauté peppers and garlic until tender. Add tomatoes and seasonings and cook until heated through. Add cooked spaghetti and toss to coat with sauce. Serve and sprinkle with cheese.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook for about 15 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain and let potatoes cool slightly. Place on a large platter and drizzle with garlic butter. Makes a great side dish for any meat or fish.

Cut avocados in half. Remove the pit. Scoop the flesh of the avocados into a bowl. Using a fork or potato masher, mash the avocados until they are smooth. Add salt and pepper. Stir in salsa. Squeeze lime juice over the mixture. Dice tomatoes. Toss with the avocado mixture. Serve with tortilla chips.

Add oil to a large frying pan over medium heat. Add onion and green chili pepper to pancook stirring often until softened about 10 minutes. Add lentils tomatoes, coriander and cumin seedcook over medium heat stirring often until lentils are tender and softened about 25 minutes. Serve with steamed rice.

Preheat oven to gas mark 4 / 375°F. Grease and line a 12 hole muffin tin. Mix the flour, ginger and baking powder together. In another bowl beat together the egg and butter with the sugar and lemon zest. Add the buttermilk and mix. Stir into the dry mixture. Spoon into the muffin holes and sprinkle with sugar. Bake for 25 minutes. Leave to cool for 5 minutes and then remove from the tin. Serve with butter.

Make a crepe by mixing 1 cup of flour with 1 cup of milk and 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1 teaspoon of baking powder. Whisk well and cook on medium heat for 1 minute or so. Then flip over and cook for another minute or so. Meanwhile cut up 1/4 of an yellow onion and 1/4 of 1 bell pepper into small chunks. Add 2 eggs and 1/2 cup of low fat cottage cheese and 1/2 teaspoon of salt and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper and whisk well. Then add your chopped veggies and cook on medium heat for 1 minute or so. Now add about 1 tablespoon of your crepe and roll it up like you would a crepe and repeat this with 3 more crepes. You can also use whole wheat pastry flour if you have that instead of plain flour. Put about 1/4 cup of your crepe mixture into each crepe. Then fold up and cook for about 1 minute or so and serve with some fresh chives. You can

Place peppers in food processorpulse until peppers are coarsely chopped but not pureed. Add butterpulse until butter is chopped but not pureed. Place in refrigerator for at least 1 hour before using. (The butter will keep up to 2 weeks in the refrigerator.) Makes approximately 1/2 cup.

Place dates and banana in blender and puree until smooth. Add the rest of the ingredients and blend until well mixed. Pour into pie plate and bake at 325 degrees for 40 minutes or until firm and brown on top.

-mix oil, garlic, green peppers and onions in a large skillet.-cook until soft.-stir in tomatos.-pour orange juice. -add paprika.-cook for 5 minutes.-season with salt and pepper.-add cod fish fillets.-cover with lid.-cook for 10 minutes. -add fresh parsley.-serve.-serve with rice.

Cream the butter and molasses until light and fluffy. Beat in the flour until crumbly. Add the ginger and baking soda and stir until well blended. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Flatten with fork. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Bring water to boil with salt added. Add rice to boiling water and cook 3-4 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool. In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove to paper towels to drain. Add oil to bacon drippings in skillet and heat over medium heat. Add the rice to the hot skillet and stir to coat the rice with the bacon fat. Cook and stir for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until the rice is lightly browned and the fat is absorbed. Add garlic powder and soy sauce to the rice, stir to combine with bacon fat. Remove from heat. Add the cooked egg to rice mixture. Top with green onions and serve immediately.

Melt butter and saute onion and mushrooms. Add cream and bring to boil. Stir in lobster and paprika and cook until heated through and thickened. Pour into bowl. Beat eggs with sherry and add to mixture along with 2 tbsp butter and stir well. Cook mixture for 5 minutes and stir until thick and creamy. Serve over toast and garnish with paprika and butter flavored cracker crumbles.
Combine all ingredients. Mix well. Refrigerate. Serve with your favorite Indian dish.

Place cauliflower florets on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. In a small bowl combine garlic cloves and basilset aside. In another small bowl combine Italian seasoned breadcrumbs and parmesan cheeseset aside. Remove cauliflower from oven and place on a cutting boardcool 10 minutes. Cut cauliflower into 1-inch piecesreturn to baking sheet and sprinkle with garlic mixture. Bake for 10 minutes. Drain on paper towelscool. Meanwhile make the breadcrumb mixture. Dip cauliflower pieces in breadcrumb mixture and place on a baking sheetbake 8 minutes. Serve warm with marinara sauce for dipping.

Cut brie into 4 equal wedges. Cut prosciutto into small pieces. Set aside. In a bowl combine brandy with 2 cups sour cream until dissolved. Add remaining sour cream. Add cream cheese and beat until smooth. Add brie wedges and stir to coat brie with sour cream mixture. Add parmesan cheese and pepper flakes to taste. Stir gently until combined. Place on serving plate with prosciutto pieces and green onion to garnish.

Combine the first four ingredients and blend well -- add tomatoes. Put this mixture on salmon fillets. Drizzle with melted butter and bake at 425 degrees for 12 minutes. Sprinkle the top with fresh parsley. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray muffin tins with vegetable oil. In a large bowl, combine sugar and applesauce. Beat in egg and bananas. Add flour and stir until combined. Fold in yogurt and chocolate. Spoon batter into muffin tins. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Makes 12 servings.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add beans and boil 3 minutes. Reduce heat to a low simmer. Add carrots, celery, celery leaves, olive oil, onion, salt, tomatoes, and pepper. Simmer until beans are tender but not soft. Remove from heat. Transfer to a large bowl. Add vinegar. Refrigerate 24 hours. Add salt to taste before serving.
Combine all of the ingredients in a large salad bowl or container. Mix well to combine. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Melt the butter with the garlic cloves over low heat. Remove from heat and cool for 10 minutes. Add cream cheese, lemon juice, oregano and parsleybeat until combined. Add the garlic-butter mixturebeat until smooth. Stir in the cheese and seasonings. Place 2 tablespoons of the cheese mixture on each half of the bread slices. Top each slice with 1 tablespoon of the boursin mixture. Wrap each sandwich with the bacon strips. Heat a large griddle or heavy skillet over medium-high heat until very hot. Cook sandwiches for 2 minutes per side or until golden brown.

Clean the round steaks and cut them into thin slices 1/4 inch thick. Place the round steaks and the tomatoes on a baking sheet. Sprinkle the steaks and tomatoes with the oregano and the parsley. Pour the olive oil over the steaks and tomatoes and sprinkle them with the salt and black pepper to taste. Bake the steaks and tomatoes for 1/2 hour, until the steaks are done to your taste and the tomatoes are soft and tender and the steaks are browned on both sides. Remove the steaks and tomatoes from the oven and cut each round steak into 4 strips and set aside. Transfer the tomatoes to a food processor or blender and blend them until you obtain a smooth purée. Pour the purée into a saucepan and simmer it for 2 minutes. Add the garlic to the tomatoes and simmer for another 2 minutes until the garlic is soft and the sauce is very smooth. Place 4 pieces of mozzarella cheese on each piece of round steak and add 2 tablespoons of the tomato sauce on

Heat oven to 250 degrees. Rub fillet with butter and salt and pepper. Wrap fillet tightly in foil. Place in a shallow roasting pan and roast for 15 to 20 minutes until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest portion registers 145 degrees. Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve.

In large bowl combine flour, oats, brown sugar and butter. Using pastry blender or two knives cut butter into flour mixture until mixture looks like coarse crumbs. Add blueberries and toss gently. In small bowl combine water and cornstarch. Add to blueberry mixture stirring just until moistened. Pour batter into buttered 1 1/2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with half of the remaining sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until set and top is golden brown. Let stand 15 minutes before serving.

Fry bacon and onions in a large skillet until bacon is crisp. Add green and red peppers and cook until tender. Add tomatoes and cook until heated through. Drain pasta and add to skillet. Toss in bacon mixture. Add jalapeno peppers and cook for 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Mix together cornmeal and salt. Add baking powder and baking soda and stir to combine. In small bowl, stir together fat free sugar free yogurt and nonfat sour cream until well blended. In large bowl of electric mixer fitted with paddle attachment, combine cornmeal mixture and yogurt mixture and beat until smooth. Reduce speed to low and add eggbeat until combined. Pour into greased 8 by 8 inch square baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Serve warm.

Bake uncooked hard boiled eggs in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. Remove and cool. Remove the egg from the shell. Slice each egg in half lengthwise. Place the egg halves on a bed of sour cream and mustard. Top each with onions and butter. Add the soup to the mixture and stir well. Fold in the cheese. Spoon into the egg whites. Top with paprika. Place in a 350 degree oven for 15 minutes.

Place roast and onion on bottom of crock pot. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Pour tomato sauce over roast. Stir in salad dressing mix. Cover and cook on low heat setting for 8 to 9 hours. Transfer meat to cutting board and shred. Return meat to crock pot. Add remaining tomato sauce and cook on low for 15 minutes. Stir well. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Line an 8x12 inch baking dish with aluminum foil. Grease foil with cooking spray. Slice bread into 1/2 inch thick slices. Place in baking dish. Top bread with ricotta cheese. Top with parmesan cheese. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with thyme leaves and chili flakes. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes in preheated oven.

Cook chicken in a 10-inch skillet over medium heat for 7 minutes or until done. Drain fat. Return chicken to pan. Stir in sauce. Bring to a boil. Cook 1 minute. Add noodles. Cook 3 minutes. Add broccoli. Cook 2 minutes or until heated through. Add cheesestir until melted.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Pat shrimp dry with a paper towel. Sprinkle them lightly with seafood seasoning. In a shallow bowl whisk together the flour and the eggs. In another shallow bowl whisk together the breadcrumbs and the milk. Dip each shrimp into the flour mixture then into the egg mixture then into the breadcrumb mixture and place them onto a plate. Make sure they are coated well with the breadcrumbs. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. When oil is hot fry shrimp until golden brown and cooked through. Drain well and serve.

Combine bread crumbs & prepared mustard. Mix well. Add beef. Mix well. Shape beef into patties. Place patties into baking dish. Pour beef gravy over patties. Add green onions to patties. Add horseradish to gravy. Add mushrooms. Bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes or until meat is done. Serve over mashed potatoes.

Combine water, oil and egg with muffin mix to make dough. Fold in blueberries & peaches. Spread dough onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Sprinkle lightly with brown sugar. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes.

Combine panko and sesame seeds in shallow dish and whisk together in a small bowl egg, garlic powder, salt and red pepper flakes in another small bowl. Dip chicken in egg mixture and then coat with sesame panko mixture pressing lightly onto surface of chicken pieces. Heat oil in large skillet and brown chicken in batches over medium heat about 10 minutes per batchturn occasionally.
Combine cream cheese, ranch dressing, milk, dried dill weed and cucumber. Blend until smooth. Serve with pita rounds or celery.

Preheat grill to medium. Combine whiskey, soy sauce and dark muscovado sugar in a small bowl. Whisk until sugar is dissolved. Brush steaks with mixture and season with salt and pepper. Grill steaks over medium heat for 6 to 8 minutes per side or until done.

In a frying pan over low heat, brown the soft bread crumbs, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in parsley and season with salt. To serve, arrange the eggs on a platter, top each with a spoonful of the bread crumb mixture and drizzle with the oil and vinegar.

Drain tuna in water and add creamed corn and chopped onion. Mix well with a fork. In a bowl add flour and add egg and beat well. Add tuna mixture to flour mixture and stir until just moistened. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Drop by teaspoonfuls into hot oil. Fry until lightly browned on both sides. Sprinkle with cheese and parsley before serving. Serve with a salad or potato chips.

Cook cauliflower in water 10 minutes. Drain well. Add frozen green peas. Place in blender. Blend for 1 minute. Pour into a bowl. Add cucumber. Add ranch salad dressing. Stir well. Add nonfat sour cream. Stir well. Garnish with dried dill weed.

Heat a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the sesame oil to the pan. Add the tofu and stir-fry for 4 to 5 minutes. Add the carrots and green onions and stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes. Add the soy sauce and stir-fry for another minute or until the carrots are cooked. Add the sugar and mirin and stir-fry for another 2 minutes. Remove from heat and serve.

Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Dip chicken in flour. Add enough butter and oil in large skillet. Heat to medium high. Brown chicken lightly in butter mixture. Remove chicken. Dip chicken in egg. Place chicken in skillet. Sprinkle with sliced ham. Cover and cook until chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with sliced cheese. Cover again. Cook until cheese is melted. Uncover and sprinkle with sage leaves. Cook until sage is wilted. Serve.

Mix the sugar and sour cream. Cook and stir over medium heat until the sugar is dissolved. Add the unsalted butter and cook and stir until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in the white chocolate. Pour into a greased and floured 13x9x2in baking pan. Spread to sides and refrigerate for at least one hour or overnight. Mix the marshmallow cream and the white chocolate together. Spread over white chocolate mixture. Sprinkle with walnuts. Refrigerate for at least an hour before cutting.
Stuff olives with 1 tablespoon cream cheese. Season with garlic powder, paprika, pepper and salt. Wrap each olve with a bacon strip. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.

Slice the rutabagas into quarters and then slice each quarter into 1/4 inch thick rounds. Peel and dice the carrots and shallot into equal sized pieces. Slice the garlic clove in half and rub it on both sides of each slice of rutabaga and carrot. In a large sauce pan heat 1 tablespoon of butter and sautee the rutabaga and carrot and shallot until softened and caramelized, about ten minutes. Season the vegetables with salt and pepper and stir in the cream and milk and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in half of the gruyere cheese and season with salt and pepper and stir in the garlic cloves and cook for another five minutes until cheese has melted and is golden brown. Remove from heat and place in an oven proof dish and sprinkle the remaining gruyere cheese over top. Bake for 10 minutes until the cheese has melted and is golden brown and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease 9x13 inch baking dish with shortening or cooking spray. Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Gradually beat in powdered sugar. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Beat in vanilla and chocolate chips. Crumble oreo cookies into small pieces. Stir in cookies and shortening until well mixed. Spread batter in baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until set. Cool 30 minutes then refrigerate several hours before serving.

Wash the tomatoes well and slice them in half lengthwise. Take a small spoonful of the coconut mixture and stuff it inside of the tomato halves. Top each half with a few raisins, garlic cloves and red pepper strips. Heat a small amount of the olive oil in a large non stick pan over medium high heat. Add the garlic cloves. Saute until fragrant about a minute or two. Add the raisins to the pan. Saute for another minute or two. Add the red pepper strips to the pan and saute for another minute or two until the pepper strips are just tender. Turn the heat down a bit and add the tomato halves cut side down to the pan. Cook for about 15 minutes on each side. While the tomatoes are cooking, mix the coconut together with the remaining garlic cloves, red pepper strips and the salt in a small bowl. Once the tomatoes are done cooking remove them from the pan to a serving plate. Drizzle the pan with a little of the remaining olive oil before turning the pan off. Turn the tomatoes over so they

In a large bowl combine the jerk rub and 1/4 cup mayonnaise. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Place in a 9 x 13 inch pan. In a small bowl stir together the cayenne and remaining mayonnaise. Add the roasted red peppers and bell peppers and toss to coat. Spoon the mixture over the top of the chicken. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Remove the chicken and spread the remaining mixture on the hamburger buns. Top each sandwich with Swiss cheese and serve.

In a saucepan or pan, heat olive oil until hot, then add onions and ginger. Cook until onions are softened (about 2 minutes). Add curry powder, cinnamon stick, cumin seeds and tomatoes with their juice. Cook on medium high for about 3 minutes or until juices have reduced slightly, stirring occasionally. Stir in the coconut milk, then the frozen peas. Cook for 10 minutes or until peas are tender. Serve hot with rice or naan bread. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9 by 13 inch baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the hash browns and the ham. In a medium bowl, combine the eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the hash browns and ham. Top with the shredded cheese. Place the baking dish in the middle of the oven. Cook for 45 minutes until the top of the bake is golden brown and the middle is set. Let cool for 15 minutes before serving.

Heat butter in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook 3-5 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in beef base and water to form gravy. Add beef stew meat to gravy in skillet. Bring to simmering over medium heat. Simmer 45-60 minutes or until beef is tender, stirring frequently to prevent burning. Cook egg noodles according to package directions in separate pot of boiling water. Drain and return to pot. Stir in tomatoes. Stir gravy and meat into noodles and add rosemary. Toss to coat noodles with gravy. Serve immediately.

For au jus, place onions and water in a large pan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Place roast beef in a ziplock bag. Add onion broth, garlic powder and mayonnaise to the ziplock bag. Seal the bag and shake until coated. Slice the beef into 1/4 inch strips. Preheat the oven to 375f. Spread garlic powder on the hoagie rolls. Spread provolone cheese on the rolls. Place the roast beef on the rolls. Slice the onions. Place half the roast beef on the rolls. Top with half the onions. Place the other half of the roast beef on the rolls. Top with the remaining onions. Serve the roast beef sandwiches with the au jus.

Cream butter and sugar together. Mix in flour and other dry ingredients. Make a well in the center of the mixture. Add chocolate and vanilla essence. Add coffee powder and mix with a spoon until it is combined. Cover the bowl and let the dough rest for 10 minutes. Roll out to a 1/4-inch thickness and cut into 2-inch squares. Bake for 12 minutes at 350. Let cool.

Spread 1 tablespoon mayo on one side of each tortilla. Place a slice of tomato on the mayo side. Fold the tortilla in half around the filling. Heat a griddle or nonstick skillet over medium heat. Place the tortilla folded side down. Cook until browned. Flip and cook until browned. Spray the other side with cooking spray and sprinkle with sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Flip and cook until browned. Serve with additional mayo and/or mustard on the side.
Remove skin from fish. Season with salt and pepper. Add shrimp soup, sherry wine and 2 tablespoons basil. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add parmesan cheese. Serve over rice.

On a large sheet pan bake 2 biscuits at a time for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Slice each biscuit in half and spread each half with pizza sauce. Top each with pepperoni and cheese. Place back in oven for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Peel carrot. Cut carrot in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds (optional). Cut carrots crosswise into 1-inch-thick slices. Place carrots in a large bowl and toss with butter, broth and lemon juice until coated well. Place on a platter and sprinkle with dill just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, mix together stuffing mix, tomatoes, pesto, water and artichoke hearts. Pour into a greased baking dish. Sprinkle with pine nuts. Bake until hot and bubbly. Yield: 4 servings.
Mix all ingredients except beef in a bowl. Rub all over beef tenderloin steaks. Grill over charcoal or broil. Serve with rice and green beans.

Clean the squid by removing the head and ink sac and then rinse thoroughly under cold water. Discard the tentacles and cut the squid into quarters lengthways and then thinly slice crossways into 1-inch-wide strips. Put the squid into a large mixing bowl and add the chickpeas and 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and mix well. Place the squid mixture into a large non-stick pan with a lid and place over a low heat for 10 minutes or until the squid is cooked through. Meanwhile, mix the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil with the garlic and red chili flakes and pour over the squid. Cook for 1 minute, or until the garlic is softened but not browned and remove the lid. Add the ginger and the lemon juice and stir well and then add the chickpeas and the coriander and stir through. Cook for a further 2 minutes and remove from the heat and serve with a garnish of the fresh coriander and some lemon slices.

Prepare strawberry jell-o according to package directions. In medium bowl combine strawberry jell-o 1 cup water. Fold in 1 cup Cool Whip. In large bowl combine pudding mix 3/4 cup water. Beat with electric mixer on high speed until thickened. Fold in Cool Whip. Pour pudding mixture into prepared pie shells. Top with strawberry jell-o mixture. Refrigerate 4 hours or until set. Top with remaining Cool Whip.

Preheat a large frying pan over medium heat. Add a tablespoon of the olive oil and sauté the bell peppers and onion until the bell peppers are tender and the onion is translucent. Place the cooked vegetables in a large bowl. Add the potato, egg substitute and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt and pepper. With a large spoon, mix the vegetables and egg substitute together until combined. Pour the mixture into the hot frying pan and cook until the eggs are cooked through. Sprinkle with parsley.

Peel carrots. Toss with water to cover. Set aside for 20 minutes. Drain. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Whisk in honey. Cook 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in carrots. Add orange juice. Cook 3 to 5 minutes or until carrots are tender. Stir in ginger. Stir in nutmeg. Season with salt. Add parsley flakes. Serve warm.

Slice each tomato into 8 wedges and arrange on plate. Slice onion and garlic. Heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add vinegar and bring to boil. Reduce heat and cook 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. Pour over tomatoes and onions. Toss gently to coat. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. Arrange basil leaves on top. Serve with bread.

Boil the black and kidney beans with onion and green pepper for 15-20 minutes. Add the garlic cloves and spices. Cook for another 10 minutes. Add the crushed tomatoes and let cook for 5 minutes. Fill tortillas with the mixture and roll. Serve with guacamole.

To make the chile syrup, combine dried ancho chiles with enough water to cover them in a saucepan and simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. Drain the chiles, reserving the liquid, discard the seeds, then puree with the apricot preserves until smooth. Whisk 1 cup of the syrup together with the lime juice, 1 cup of the sugar, and salt until the sugar dissolves. Keep the remaining syrup for another use or to serve with other dishes. To serve the chamoy, spread it over the cucumber in a bowl or serve it with lime wedges.

Cut bread in cubes. Combine cheese, milk and dry mustard in a bowl. Melt butter in a fry pan and saute onions until softened. Place cubes of cheese in a buttered dish and cover with sauteed onions and the bread cubes. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or until set.

Place chicken broth in a 3 quart saucepan and bring to a boil. Add rice & stir. Cover & reduce heat to low. Cook for 15 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in eggs & stir until cooked. Add lemon juice & serve.

Boil tortellini and dry bow tie pasta separately according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large bowl combine pepperoni, olives and green pepper and toss to coat with Italian dressing and salad seasoning. Drain cooked pasta and toss with salad mixture until combined and heated through. Serve warm or cold garnished with crumbled feta and cheddar cheeses and sliced fresh tomato if desired.

To make the crust, combine the graham cracker crumbs and granulated sugar together into a bowl and mix well. Place the butter into a small saucepan and melt over low heat. Stir constantly and add the melted butter to the graham cracker mixture and combine together. Add the condensed milk and stir again until the mixture is well blended and begins to come together. Press the graham cracker mixture into the bottom of a 10 inch tart pan or into a springform pan and refrigerate for 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F and make the filling. Combine the key lime juice and eggs into a small saucepan and whisk well to combine together. Add the lime zest and sour cream and mix well together. Pour the filling into the prepared crust and bake for 10 minutes at 300 degrees F or until the filling is just set around the edges of the crust (if the filling appears to be setting too quickly you can cover the top of the filling with foil and continue baking for an additional 10 minutes). Remove the pie from the

In large skillet combine ham and corn kernels and cook until heated through and tender. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl combine beans and next five ingredientsstir gently until combined. Stir in ham and cornset aside. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise and lemon juicestir gently until combined. Serve with tortilla chips.
Mix together garlic, lemon juice, soy sauce and honey. Marinate steaks in mixture for several hours. Grill on medium hot until cooked to your liking. Serve with rice.

Prepare unbaked 9-inch pie shell according to package directions. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add corn syrup, brown sugar and 1 tablespoon butter. Bring mixture to a boil for 2 minutes. Remove from the heatstir in 2 eggs. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 12 minutes. Cool on wire rack. In a saucepan, combine pecans, 1/2 cup sugar, 1 tablespoon butter and 1/2 cup corn syrup. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat. Boil for 2 minutes. Pour over cooled pie. Sprinkle with remaining sugar. Cool before serving.
Combine chicken breasts, soup, onion, garlic, celery, pepper and water in crock pot. Cook for 6 hours or until chicken is tender. Serve over rice.

Mix together eggs and sour cream in a small bowl until blended. Spread salmon over the bottom of a 9 inch round baking dish. Layer with the remaining ingredients in the following order: salmon, egg mixture, salmon, egg mixture and salmon. Cover with foil and bake at 350 for 40 minutes or until eggs are set. Serve immediately and enjoy!

Put the garbanzo beans, tahini and lemon juice in a food processor or blender with enough water to get a smooth paste. Season with the salt and pepper and pulse until the mixture is smooth. Add the olive oil and process until mixed. If needed, thin with more water. Taste and add more lemon juice and/or salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to a serving bowl and drizzle with hot chili oil and ground pepper.
Mix flour, salt and baking powder. Cut in shortening until crumbly. Mix in milk. Stir in egg. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto hot oil in a covered iron skillet. Cook until golden brown.

Cut eggs in half lengthwise. Gently remove yolks and add to a mixing bowl. Add olive oil, mayonnaise and mustard. Stir to blend. Fold in celery, capers, shallots and season to taste with salt and pepper. Spoon yolk mixture back into the egg whites. Sprinkle with fresh tarragon. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 24 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Make two 9-inch pie crusts. Roll out pie crust and place in a 9-inch pie pan. Pour egg mixture into pie pan and smooth out. Combine corn syrups and sugar and stir until sugar is dissolved. Pour mixture over pie crust and sprinkle with pecans. Bake at 350 degrees for about 55 minutes or until pie crust is golden brown. Let cool 20 minutes before cutting.

Wash scallops thoroughly under cold running water to remove any grit. Remove the coral and place scallops in a bowl with enough cold water to cover them by an inch or so. Sprinkle with a bit of salt and add the garlic cloves to the water. Let them stand for 15 minutes then drain off the water and pat the scallops dry with paper towel. Heat the butter in a small skillet over low heat until it begins to turn golden. Add the parsley and cook for 15 seconds more until the parsley is fragrant. Place the scallops in a buttered baking dish. Sprinkle with the garlic salt. Pour the parsley butter over the scallops. Cover with foil and cook for 10 minutes in a 375 degree oven. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the black pepper. Serve hot with rice or pasta.

Melt the butter and mix with the oatmeal. Add brown sugar and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Add eggs one at a time, blend well after each addition. Stir in the craisins. Roll into balls 1" diameter. Place on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375f for 12-15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9x13 pan with butter. Cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Add eggs one at a time until all are incorporated. In a separate bowl sift together all purpose flour, baking powder and baking soda. Add to creamed mixture until batter is smooth. Add vanilla. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Let cool completely before cutting into bars. Frost with nutella.

Split the rolls into 2 halves & place onto baking sheet. Brush the cut side of each half roll with olive oil. Layer the cheese slices & half of each meat slices on each half of the rolls & top with the tomato slices. Combine the dressing & water & spread the mixture over the top of each half roll. Bake at 375 degrees for about 10-15 minutes or until the cheese is melted & the bread is lightly browned. Remove & serve.

Cut lemons and oranges into quarters and place them into large glass pitcher or container. Add water until lemons and oranges are completely covered (about 4 quarts) and stir until all fruit is submerged (use a large spoon to break up larger pieces of fruit if necessary). Add sugar and stir until dissolved and then add citric acid and tartaric acid. Add more water if necessary to bring mixture to a boil (about 5-6 quarts total). Boil mixture until mixture is clear (about 20-25 minutes). Let stand for 2-5 hours or overnight (will thicken). Remove lemons and oranges from mixture with a slotted spoon and discard. Strain mixture through a fine mesh strainer and discard solids left in strainer. Fill clean bottles or containers with concentrate and seal tightly (do not use metal caps or rings). Refrigerate until ready to use (about 2 weeks). Add boiling water (about 5-6 quarts total) and stir until mixture is clear (about 5-10 minutes). Pour mixture into pitcher and add more lemons and oranges as

In a large bowl combine the sugar, flour and salt and stir with a wire whisk until well blended. Beat the eggs and mix into the dry ingredients with a wire whisk. Add the lemon zest and juice and beat until smooth. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool for ten minutes before serving.

Combine the flour, vanilla and pecans. Set aside. Beat the butter until creamy. Gradually beat in the Eagle Brand. Add the flour mixture alternately with the milk until all of the flour has been added. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Cool.
In a saucepan heat butter. Add cream and beef stock. Bring to boiling point. Add soy sauce and flour. Stir well. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Slice the bread and rub the cut sides of the slices with the garlic clove. Butter the bread and top each slice generously with beans and cheese. Grill or broil the slices until the cheese melts and the bread is crisp and golden brown on both sides. Serve warm.

Combine oil, lemon juice and vinegar in a large bowl. Add spareribs and coat ribs. Place in a large baking dish. Cook in the preheated oven 3 to 4 hours or until tender and browned. Brush with ketchup and barbecue sauce. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350F. Combine eggs and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Add milk and vanilla extract. Mix well. Add cornflour and nutmeg. Pour mixture into an unbaked pastry shell. Bake for 40 minutes until golden brown.
Mix cream cheese and vanilla with a mixer until smooth. Add in sugar and beat until smooth. Add in eggs one at a time. Pour into a greased pie plate. Bake for about 25 minutes.

Cook pasta according to package directions and drain. Meanwhile in a food processor, combine soymilk and onion powder and process for 2 minutes. Add salt and process until smooth. Add corn and process again for 2 minutes. Toss with pasta and serve.

Cut sweet potatoes in half lengthwise. Scrub the skins under cold water and place them cut side down on a baking sheet. Drizzle each half with about 2 teaspoons of the adobo sauce (or 4 tablespoons) and add about 1 teaspoon of the remaining adobo sauce to the cavity of each sweet potato half. Bake for 45 minutes or until the sweet potato is tender and the skin is browned. Remove from oven and sprinkle with the remaining 1 teaspoon of adobo sauce. Allow the potato halves to cool slightly then scrape out the flesh into a large bowl. (or a food processor or blender). Stir together the sweet potato flesh, chipotle chile and 6 tablespoons of the butter until smooth. Season with the remaining 1 tablespoon of adobo sauce and 1 teaspoon of the salt and stir again. Spread the mixture evenly over the bottom of the baking sheet (or in a small skillet). Place the baking sheet (or skillet) over medium heat and

Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Place french fries on foil-lined baking sheet and spritz with cooking spray. Drizzle with butter and garlicsprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown and crisp. Remove from oven and garnish with fresh parsley. Makes 6 servings.

Brush both sides of each fillet lightly with margarine. Place fillets on a broiler pan. Mix remaining ingredients together. Spread half of the mixture on each fillet. Broil fillets for about 4 to 5 minutes. Baste fillets every minute or two with some of the melted margarine.

Heat oil and ginger in a skillet over medium heat. Add pork and saute until brown on both sides. Pour wine over the pork and continue cooking until wine is reduced and pork is cooked through. Remove pork from pan and keep warm. Stir in soy sauce and add the mushrooms and continue cooking until mushrooms are tender. Increase heat to high and add the green onions and stir until they begin to brown. Add the sesame seeds and stir until they begin to pop. Add the pork back into the pan and stir until heated through. Serve with sesame seeds.

Sift together the flour and almonds into a large bowl. Add the butter and cream cheese to the flour mixture, mix until combined. Add the sugar and cream cheese until well combined. Spread into an unbaked 9-inch pie shell. In a small saucepan over low heat add the cherry pie filling and almond liqueurcook for 15 to 20 minutes or until slightly thickened. Cool. Pour the cherry filling over the pie filling mixture in the pie shellrefrigerate for 2 hours or until set. Top with whipped topping just before serving. Serve with additional whipped topping if desired. Refrigerate leftovers.

Combine orange juice, oil and soy sauce in a small bowl. Pour into a blender with garlic and ginger. Blend well. Stir in lemon juice and season with pepper. Dip fillets in sauce and place in a small baking dish. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Serve with steamed broccoli.

In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat. Add onion and sauté until translucent. Add ginger and stir until ginger is fragrant. Stir in cauliflower and broccoli. Cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Add lemon juice and zest. Cook until cauliflower is tender. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 325f. Grease and flour a 9x5 loaf pan. In a small bowl, combine sour cream and vanilla. In a medium bowl, beat sugar and butter with electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Mix in baking soda and sour cream mixture. Stir in bananas and mix well. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour or until top springs back when touched. Let cool in pan on wire rack.

Unroll crescent rolls. Cut each crescent roll in half. Spread each crescent half with 1 1/2 tablespoons of cream cheese. Spread each crescent with 1 tablespoon of cream cheese. Roll each crescent half around the 1 tablespoon of cream cheese to form a log. Place each log onto a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350f degrees for 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Mix 1 1/2 cups of powdered sugar with 2 tablespoons of milk. Brush each log with glaze mixture. Sprinkle each log with 2 tablespoons of powdered sugar. Place each log onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350f degrees for 10 to 15 minutes more. Remove from oven. Place each log in a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Top each log with 1/2 tablespoon of cream cheese. Bake at 350f degrees for 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Mix

Remove the scales from the trout and wash thoroughly. Rub the trout inside and out with the garlic cloves and seasonings. Trout can be stuffed if desired or leave as is. Wrap each trout fillet with one strip of bacon and secure the trout to the bacon. Secure the trout to a long piece of string and tie the ends of the string together. Hang the trout from the ceiling and place into a large pot of cold water. Bring the water to a boil and cook for 12 minutes or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily. Remove from the water and serve.

Cook chicken broth in a medium saucepan. Stir in tahini, soy sauce, honey, ginger and hot pepper sauce. Cook and stir over medium heat until heated through. Stir in cooked chicken. Cook and stir 2 minutes. Serve over cooked brown rice.

Saute sausage in hot skillet until it releases from pan. Set aside. In another skillet, heat oil. Add onion and saute until onion is soft. Stir in bread and sausage. Cook over medium heat until the bread is lightly toasted. Stir in eggs, dry mustard, salt and cheese. Pour mixture evenly into prepared pan. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.

Spray a baking sheet with pam or grease with olive oil. Place the peppers on the pan so that they fit comfortably without crowding. Sprinkle the top of the peppers with salt and pepper. Spray the peppers with pam or grease with olive oil again. Place the pan into the oven and roast for 35 minutes, turning once half way through baking time. Remove from the oven and drizzle the peppers with olive oil and vinegar. Cool and slice the peppers open to serve with fresh basil as garnish.

Sift flour with salt and pepper into a large bowl. Add baking powder and stir to combine. Cut in butter with a pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse cornmeal. Make a well in the center and add egg and milk. Mix until dough forms a ball. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 2-3 minutes, until smooth and elastic. Cut dough in half and roll each piece into a 1/2 inch thick rope. Cut each rope into 2 inch pieces and drop into boiling soup or stew. Cook about 5 minutes or until they float.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a small bowl, mix together the soup and sour cream until combined. Stir in the mayonnaise. Spoon the chicken mixture into the baking dish. Top with the frozen spinach. Sprinkle with the mild cheddar cheese. Bake in the preheated oven until the mixture is hot and the cheese is bubbly. Serve.

Heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Add spinach and cook for 2 minutes longer or until wilted. Stir in cumin and chickpeas and cook for 3 more minutes. Serve hot or warm with warm pita bread.

Prepare the crust according to package directionspress into a 9-inch pie plate and refrigerate until ready to use. In a medium bowl, combine the mascarpone cheese and the powdered sugar and beat until smooth. Beat the cream with the sugar until stiff peaks form. Fold the whipped cream into the mascarpone mixture until combined. Place 2 cups of the fruit into the crust. Top with half of the mascarpone mixture. Arrange the remaining fruit on top of the mascarpone mixture. Top with the remaining mascarpone mixture. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. Top with powdered sugar if desired.

Combine sugar, corn syrup, peanuts in a pan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until the mixture forms a soft ball. Remove from heat. Add vanilla and butter. Stir until butter melts. Add baking soda. Stir until mixture begins to harden. Drop by teaspoonful onto wax paper. Cool. Store in an airtight container.

In small bowl mix all ingredients together except the celery seed and splenda. Mix with spoon. Transfer to a medium sized bowl. Stir in celery seed and splenda and mix well. Serve with baked tortilla chips and tortilla crackers. Serves 2-4.

In a sauce pan heat milk until steaming. Add tapioca, sugar, salt and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low heat and add egg yolks slowly while stirring constantly. Cook 1-2 minutes. Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla. Transfer to a large mixing bowl. Chill in fridge for 15 minutes. Serve over ice.

Melt the butter and garlic clove in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the corn. Cook and stir until heated through. Remove from the heat. Stir in the cream cheese and sugar. Season with salt and parsley. Serve immediately.

In a skillet over medium heat add 1 tablespoon of butter and 1 cup of pumpkin puree. Add 3 tablespoons of flour to make roux. Whisk constantly for 5 minutes until it is lightly browned and slightly thickened. Whisk in 1 cup of milk and cook until thickened, 5 minutes more. Increase heat to medium high and add remaining pumpkin puree. Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes until thickened. Add 1 cup of milk, stirring constantly for 3 minutes until thickened. Reduce heat to medium low and add 1 cup of pumpkin puree with 1/2 cup of milkcook 5 minutes until thickened. Stir in 1/2 cup of Parmesan cheese and 1/2 teaspoon of nutmegcook for 2 minutes more. Cool slightlyadd remaining 1/2 teaspoon of nutmegcool. Add 1 1/2 cups of ricotta cheesecool completely. In a large bowl, beat 3 large eggs until foamyadd 1/

Scrub potatoes. Cut off ends of potatoes. Slice each potato in half. Remove as many seeds as possible. Dry potatoes. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry potatoes in hot oil until golden brown. Remove to paper towels. Sprinkle each potato with seasoning salt. Drizzle each potato half with malt vinegar. Drizzle potato halves with freshly ground black pepper. Sprinkle each potato half with dried oregano.

In a saucepan, cook white rice in the milk until the rice is tender. Strain out the rice through a strainer to remove the milk. Add sugar to the rice. Stir in the cinnamon, nutmeg and orange zest. Add a little more milk if the rice is too dry to hold its shape. Serve warm or cold.

Melt butter and cook onion and mushrooms for 5 minutes. Stir in stock and bring to a boil. Cook for 20 minutes stirring occasionally. Add garlic and simmer 5 minutes more. Stir in rice and cook for 8 minutes. Stir in tomato and herbs and cook for 5 minutes more. Serve over cooked rice or with cooked vegetables of your choice.

In a large bowl beat well 12 eggs and 3 tbs butter. Add 1/2 tsp chopped parsley and 1/2 tsp chopped chives. Sprinkle with pepper and fold in 10 oz deli ham and 1 lb cherry tomatoes. Cook in heavy skillet over low heat until eggs are set, stirring often. Remove from heat and sprinkle with grated cheddar cheese. Serves 4-6

Separate eggs. Beat yolks and sugar with a fork. Stir in flour, salt, milk and beef. Slice beef into strips. Melt butter in a large skillet. Add beef and stir fry until brown. Add onions and mushrooms and continue stirring. When browned, remove from heat. Pour beef mixture into the prepared pastry shell. Pour the beaten egg whites over the filling. Bake at 425 f for 45 minutes. Let cool and serve with sour cream. You can also use frozen berries or apples to make a fruit filling. The dough can be made ahead and refrigerated. Use a little oil to grease the pan. Roll out the dough to 1/4 inch thick. Cut out round pieces to fit the pan. Transfer to a baking pan and bake. After baking the shells, you can refrigerate them for 30 minutes and use them later. Or freeze them.

Rub chicken thighs with mustard, then sprinkle with paprika and fresh ground black pepper. Place thighs on a foil-lined jellyroll pan and broil on high until browned and cooked through. (about 8 minutes). Remove from broiler and let stand for a few minutes before slicing and serving with sauerkraut and swiss cheese.

Slice celery diagonally into 1-inch pieces. Mince garlic cloves. Dice onion into quarters. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp, about 5 minutesremove to paper towels to drain. In same skillet, cook celery and onion for 1 minuteadd garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in stock, parsley and salt and pepper to tastebring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to lowcover partially and cook for 15 minutes. Uncovercook until celery is tender and liquid has reduced slightly, about 5 minutes. Add butterstir until meltedserve with roast chicken or stew.
Add vegetables to broth and heat through. Just before serving, add tortellini, stirring well. Garnish with chopped green onions.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add ground beef and cook until browned and cooked through. Drain on paper towels and set aside. Add onions and peppers to same skillet and cook until onions are tender. Stir in rice and cook for about five minutes, stirring frequently. Add tomato juice and stir until rice is covered. Add bloody mary mix and stir to combine. Stir in beef and cook for about five minutes until heated through. Garnish with celery and green onions or toppings of your choice.

Heat oil over medium heat in large saucepan. Add onion and sauté until tender. Add shrimp and cook until pink and opaque. Add spiced rum and cook for 1 minute. Add cajun seasoning and stir to coat shrimp evenly. Add crushed tomatoes and bring mixture to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add thai curry paste and simmer for 10 minutes more or until slightly thickened. Add cooked jasmine rice and fish stock to mixture and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed by the rice. Transfer to 4 soup or pasta bowls and serve immediately with steamed vegetables and additional thai curry sauce on the side for dipping.

Beat the eggs in a large bowl until well blended. Add the pineapple chunks, ham slices, monterey jack cheese and cheddar cheese to the egg mixture. Pour the egg mixture over a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook until the edges begin to set and the omelet is almost set. Fold the omelet over the center to form a half circle, then slide the omelet onto a plate and cut it in half to serve.

Place 1 cup of water into a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in 1 cup of sugar. Let the sugar dissolve, then add the coffee and the milk. Stir until the coffee has dissolved. The cafe au lait should be lightly frothed when done. This is a wonderful drink to serve at breakfast or brunch.

Mash potatoes with bacon bits and garlic. Add enough milk to thin out slightly so that it coats potato and bacon bits well. Add enough shredded cheddar cheese so that there are some visible pieces in mixture (not completely melted). Sprinkle with chives.

Cook orzo as directed on package. Drain and rinse with cold water. Toss with zucchini and parsley. In a bowl, stir together the lemon juice, lemon rind, olive oil, salt and pepper to taste. Toss with cooked orzo until coated. Let stand for 10 minutes to develop the flavors before serving.
Coat beef with all spices. Marinate for 30 minutes. Grill as desired. Serve.

Remove eggs from their shells and slice horizontally, then remove yolks and add to a bowl with curry powder. Mash with a fork to form a smooth paste then add mayonnaise, garlic chives and coriander leaves to make a sauce for your wraps. In a separate bowl mix your ham with chopped garlic chives. On one end of each lavash bread take a layer of ham and spread with curry sauce, then add a slice of egg to the other end of each bread and roll up to make a wrap.

Rub chicken inside and out with half the thyme leaves, then all over with kosher salt and pepper. Place chicken on wire rack in shallow pan. Roast until cooked through (170 F), about 1 hour and 15 minutes (18 minutes per pound). Remove from the oven and baste with the remaining half cup of melted butter. Transfer the roasted chicken to a large platter and squeeze the juice of two lemons over it and season with more pepper and thyme, if desired. Serve immediately with lemon wedges for squeezing over the top of each serving.

In a large bowl combine peanut butter and brown sugar. Beat with an electric mixer until blended. Add egg whites and vanillabeat until light and fluffy. Add flour and baking powderbeat until blended. Stir in mini chocolate chipspour into greased 8-inch square baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely on a wire rack. Cut into 16 bars. Store covered at room temperature for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 1 month. Makes 16 squares.

Combine tomato sauce, barbecue sauce and brown sugar in a large bowl. Stir to combine. Add Worcestershire sauce and paprika. Place wings in the bowl and toss to coat. Place wings on a large baking sheet. Bake for about 30 minutes or until cooked through. Let wings cool for at least 30 minutes before serving. Serve with celery and blue cheese.

In a medium mixing bowl combine olive oil, vinegar, honey and salt & pepper. Whisk until well combined. In a separate small mixing bowl combine romaine and pomegranate seeds. Pour olive oil mixture over the romaine mixture and toss until lettuce is well coated with the dressing. Place romaine mixture on a platter or individual salad plates.
