Top with gorgonzola cheese in small balls or crumbled pieces, and with roasted pistachios in small pieces or crumbled as well. Serve immediately with additional dressing on the side.

In a small saucepan melt the butter over medium heat. The foam will rise up and the foam will rise up and the brown bits will settle down into the pan. When you see the brown bits start to sizzle and brown, turn the heat off. Add the nutmeg and the turmeric and stir until combined. Drain the pasta and toss with the sauce. To serve, top with the Gouda and the pine nuts.

Mix french dressing with water. Place boneless steak in large mixing bowl. Pour over dressing mixture. Add celery ribs. Add mushrooms. Add worcestershire sauce. Place in crockpot. Cook on low for 8 hours. After cooking, remove steak to a large serving platter. Drain dressing mixture into a large measuring cup. Add a few drops of vinegar to mixture. Add 1/3 cup of the dressing mixture to mashed potatoes. Add a few drops of vinegar to mixture. Add 1/3 cup of the dressing mixture to mashed potatoes. Add 1/3 cup of the dressing mixture to mashed potatoes. Add a few drops of vinegar to mixture. Add 1/3 cup of the dressing mixture to mashed potatoes. Add 1/3 cup of the dressing mixture to mashed potatoes. Add a few drops of vinegar to mixture. Add 1/3 cup of the dressing mixture to mashed potatoes. Add a few drops of vinegar to mixture. Add 1/3 cup of the dress
In a large bowl, mix flours. In a separate bowl, mix yogurt with apples. Mix wet ingredients with dry ingredients. Fill cups with batter. Bake at 375 degrees for 35 minutes. Makes 2 dozen.

Cook bacon and onions in medium skillet until bacon is crisp and onions are soft. Stir in green pepper and tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered 10 minutes. Add rice. Stir and cover. Cook 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. Brown and drain chicken breasts. In 13 x 9 baking dish arrange broccoli. Sprinkle curry powder on top. Drain broccoli and pour broth over broccoli. Cool to room temperature. Arrange on broccoli and top with mayonnaise mixture. Sprinkle with cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray pan with cooking spray. Season fillets with salt, red pepper, cuminset aside. Melt butter in skillet. Cook fillets in butter for 3 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with cilantro. Place pan in oven. Bake 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Place lemon slices on top of each fillet. Sprinkle with paprika. Garnish each fillet with lemon peel.
Bring apple cider to a boil. Add sugar and cinnamon sticks. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add ginger. Let stand for 30 minutes. Add tea bags. Let stand for another 15 minutes. Strain. Serve hot.

Combine the self-rising flour, whole wheat flour, oats and seeds together in a large bowl. Combine the beer and splenda brown sugar blend together until the sugar is dissolved. Add the liquid mixture to the dry mixture and mix together using a wooden spoon until well combined. Spray a loaf pan with cooking spray and pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Let the bread cool for about 15 minutes before cutting and serving.
Boil frozen vegetables. Add soup and simmer until tender. Melt the cheese. Serve over vegetables. Serves four.

In food processor, combine 1/3 cup oil with vinegar, shallots, salt, pepper. Add 1/2 cup pomegranate molasses. Process until smooth. Add 2 tablespoons oil. Process again. Gradually add greens. Mix to coat. Toss with chevre. Arrange on platter. Garnish with strawberry slices and walnuts. Drizzle with dressing.

In a large bowl beat eggs. Add milk. Add cheese. In a small bowl mash garlic and add to egg mixture. Mash potatoes. Add to egg mixture. In a large skillet cook onion and sausage. Add to egg mixture. Grease a baking dish. Pour egg mixture into dish. Bake at 350 degrees for about 35 minutes. Serve with fruit.

Preheat oven to 325f. Grease a 9x13 baking pan or cupcake tin. Prepare the box of chocolate cake mix according to the directions on the box and bake in the prepared baking pan or cupcakes according to the directions on the box. Set aside and allow to cool completely. Prepare the frosting by combining the mayonnaise with the granulated coffee and the eggs until smooth. In a separate bowl add the chocolate cake mix, water and cinnamon and stir until blended together. Fold the chocolate mixture into the frosting until blended together smoothly. Spread the frosting over the cooled chocolate cake and allow to cool completely. Then frost the top with the mini chocolate chips. Place the frosted top back onto the chocolate cake and serve.

In a skillet over medium heat heat oil and cook ground turkey until no pink remains. Drain and discard fat. Add tomatoes with juice and chili powder. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve with cornbread or tortilla chips and sour cream.

Whisk together Diana Honey Garlic Sauce, lemon juice, honey, lemon zest, salt, pepper, and hot pepper flakes. Brush salmon fillets with honey butter, then drizzle with lemon-honey sauce. Grill for 4 to 5 minutes per side until done. Top with fresh chopped chives.

Pound chicken to even thickness. Combine the flour, sugar and salt in a shallow bowl. Dip chicken in the flour mixture. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil and saute the green peppers and the onions until tender. Add the chicken to the skillet and saute for 1 minute per side. Add 1/4 cup of the chicken stock and stir well to scrape up the browned bits from the skillet. Add the hot chinese chili paste and stir well to combine. Continue to saute until the chicken is tender and the liquid has evaporated. Add more stock if needed. Add the olive oil and remaining stock to the skillet and heat over medium heat for 1 minute until the liquid is heated through. Reduce heat to low and stir in the soy sauce. Cook until slightly thickened. Serve over rice.

Combine sugar, milk and peanut butter until smooth. Stir in butter and vanilla until combined. Sift flour and salt together. Stir oats into flour mixture. Stir flour mixture into peanut butter mixture until combined. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes at 350 degrees. Let cool 2-3 minutes on cookie sheet before removing to wire rack to cool completely.

Wash and dry greens. Tear into bite-sized pieces. Place in large bowl and toss with apples and onions. In small bowl mix together vinegar, mustard and garlic. Whisk in water until blended. Pour over salad mixture and toss. Sprinkle feta on top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large pot bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Add polenta to water in a large mixing bowl. Stir gently. When water boils, stir polenta constantly until polenta is thickened. Add more water if necessary. Remove from heat. Add broth. Stir. Add herbs. Stir. Add cheese. Stir until cheese melts. Spoon into a lightly greased 1 1/2-quart baking dish. In a skillet brown sausage. Add to polenta. Add sliced red bell pepper. Spoon polenta mixture into baking dish. Top with sun-dried tomatoes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 30 minutes or until polenta is heated through.

Sauté onion in large skillet until tender. Add baked beans, applesauce, mustard, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, salt and baconstirring occasionally. Spoon into large baking dish. Cover. Bake uncovered 30 minutes. Serve.

Heat oil and fry onions gently until transparent. Add garlic and cook for another minute. Add wine and cook until evaporated. Add curry paste and cook for another minute. Add tomatoes and cook for another minute. Add prawns and cook for a further minute. Add coconut milk and ketchup and bring to a boil. Simmer for about 8 minutes or until prawns are just cooked. Add butter and flour and cook for another minute. Stir in the curry powder and cook for a further minute. Stir in the ketchup and serve.

In a large mixing bowl, combine rolled oats and flour. Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in baking soda and salt. Mix in apple filling. Add enough water to make a soft dough. Roll out 1/2 inch thick. Cut into squares and place in a greased 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 18-20 minutes.

Melt chocolate and rum. Mix eggs and sugar until well beaten. Fold in chocolate mixture. Pour into a 8-inch square pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Cool. Make whipped cream and fold in chocolate chips. Refrigerate. Unmold.

Place beans in large pot and cover with water by 2 inches. Add 2 pounds salt pork and 2 pounds ham bonecover with lid. Bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to lowcook until tender but not mushy, 2 to 3 hours. Stir beans occasionally to prevent beans from sticking to bottom of pot. Drain beansreturn to pot. Heat over medium heat. Mash beans with ham bone. Add salt to taste if desired.

In a medium bowl, mix together nonfat sour cream, reduced-fat mayonnaise, lemon juice, garlic clove, hot pepper sauce, worcestershire sauce, salt and black pepper. Add avocado slices and gently stir until well blended. Refrigerate until ready to serve with salmon fillets. Grill or broil salmon fillets for about 5 minutes on each side. Serve with avocado sauce.

Wash and dry grapes. Place them on a paper-towel-lined cookie sheet and freeze for 20 minutes. Put grapes into a blender and blend till smooth. Add tapioca and blend again for 15 seconds. In a small saucepan combine the grapes and sugar and stir until sugar is dissolved and syrup is clear. Simmer for 30 minutes and cool completely. (If you use a stainless steel or aluminum pot the syrup can darken slightly and the grapes will lose their vibrant color.) Heat oven to 425 degrees. Cut 2 pastry circles from dough and place 1 circle on a cookie sheet. Spoon 2 teaspoons of syrup into center of circle and top with grape puree. Carefully place second pastry circle on top of filling and seal the edges. Cut 4 ventilation slits into pastry and place on cookie sheet. Bake for 25 minutes or until pastry is golden brown. Allow pie to cool completely before serving.

In a food processor add garlic clove, mustard and vinegar. Process for about a minute and slowly add the oil and soy sauce and salt and pepper to taste. Set aside. To make the salad: Add salad greens into a large bowl. Drizzle with dressing and toss well. Taste and add more dressing if needed.

Beat shortening, sugar and eggs. Add potato. Gradually add flour. Sift together dry ingredients. Add dry ingredients alternately with milk. Stir in vanilla and spices. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375f for 8-10 minutes.

Bring water and chicken broth to a boil. Stir in bay leaves and salt. Add onion. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook until onion is translucent. Stir in carrot. Cook until carrot is tender. Stir in garlic cloves. Cook until garlic is fragrant. Add boneless skinless chicken breast. Cook until chicken is no longer pink. Add olive oil. Cook until oil is heated through. Add pasta. Cook until pasta is al dente. Drain pasta. Add pasta to broth. Serve.

Cook fettuccine according to package directions. Drain. In a medium saucepan, over medium heat, combine milk and cheeses. Heat until cheese melts. Add fettuccine and spinach to saucepan. Toss well and serve with chives.

Add vanilla sugar to the egg yolks and whisk until well mixed. Gradually add half-and-half while continuing to whisk. Next, add vanilla extract and heavy cream while continuing to whisk. Place the mixture in the ice cream machine and churn for 30 minutes. Pour into airtight container and place in the freezer until desired consistency is reached. If desired, add food coloring, either gel or paste. Color to desired shade of green or blue.

Cook ground beef in a skillet until no longer pink. Add diced tomatoes with the liquid and beef broth. Add italian seasoning. Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain well. Add macaroni to skillet. Add beans. Cook 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve.

Place pork tenderloin in slow cooker. Add water and dry onion soup mix. Pour in red wine and garlic. Sprinkle with soy sauce and fresh ground black pepper. Cook on low for eight hours or on high for four hours. Serve with rice and vegetables.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Grease an 8 inch square pan. Beat eggs with sugar, vanilla and milk. Add flour and baking powder. Fold in peanut butter and chocolate. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool in pan and refrigerate for 24 hours before cutting. Serve with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.
Coat fillet with flour. Beat egg with milk until well blended. Dip fish into egg mixture then dip into flour mixture. Fry until golden brown. Serve with tartar sauce.

Combine sugar & 2/3 cup of water in a pot. Stir with a whisk until sugar is dissolved. Stir in 1/2 cup of cold water. Cook over medium-high heat until mixture comes to a boil. Cook for 5 minutes without stirring. Do not touch. Stir in remaining water & continue to cook for 2 minutes without stirring. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla extract. Pour into a shallow pan. Let cool to room temperature. Freeze until firm. Serve.

Cream butter and sugar together with electric mixer. Add eggs and vanilla extract and mix until fluffy. Add flour, baking soda, salt and mix. Stir in chocolate chips. Form balls with hands and place on greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove and place on wire rack. Allow to cool completely. Makes 36 cookies.
Make ham and cheese sandwiches. Wrap each sandwich in a tortilla. Place on griddle. Cook until golden on both sides. Serve warm.

Heat water with garlic clove in a saucepan over medium heat for 10 minutes. Add potato and carrot and simmer until potato is tender, about 10 minutes. Whisk in the cream and bring mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes until the soup thickens slightly. Serve warm with crusty bread.
Spread a slice of bread with Miracle Whip Thick & Easytop with cooked chicken, bacon, tomatoes and lettuce. Sandwich together with another slice of breadserve.

Place all the herbs in a gallon zipperlock bag. Add the wine. Add the salt. Add enough water to cover the herbs completely. Close the bag. Place the herb mixture in a large pot. Add enough water to cover the herb mixture. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Let steep for 15 minutes. Remove herbs from solution. Let cool. Place the cool herb solution in the refrigerator for 12 hours. Add turkey to the refrigerator to soak overnight. Rinse turkey before cooking.

Melt butter in large saucepot over medium-high heat. Add onion and saute for about five minutes or till onion is softened. Add chicken stock, wine vinegar, wine, salt and pepper, bring to a boil. Reduce heat, add lentils and simmer for about ten minutes or till lentils are tender, add chorizo sausage. Cook for about five minutes or till sausage is heated through. Add chopped parsley and thyme to pot, stir well. Serve over rice.

Add 3/4 cup of beer to a small bowl. Stir in 1/2 cup of bisquick. Add 1 egg beaten with 1/2 tsp of sugar. Add a little more beer if needed. Pour batter into greased muffin tins. Bake 20 minutes at 400 degrees.

Cut carrot, celery and onion into small cubes. Slice potatoes into quarters. Cut the gammon steaks into small cubes. Heat butter in large pan. Add the carrot and celery and cook till soft. Add the onion and cook until soft. Add the cubes of gammon and cook until lightly browned. Add the carrot and celery and cook until soft. Add the cubes of gammon and cook until lightly browned. Add the cubes of gammon and cook until lightly browned. Add the potato and cook until soft. Add the chicken stock. Season with salt and freshly ground pepper. Cook until the mixture thickens. Add the cream and cook until thick. Add the marjoram and dill. Cook for 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt butter and sugar together. Add eggs one at a time. Add cocoa and vanilla. Sift flour and baking soda together. Add to butter mixture along with cocoa. Stir in Ghirardelli sweet ground and milk chocolate. Fold in walnuts. Add chocolate chips. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan and bake for 20 to 22 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

Preheat grill to high. Clean and dry the eggplant. Place eggplant slices on a grill pan and grill for about 3 minutes on each side. Meanwhile, toast the bread. When eggplant is done, assemble the sandwich by spreading the mozzarella on the bread. Top with eggplant and arugula. Spread the butter on the second slice of bread. Put the sandwich on the grill until the bread is toasted. Serve with extra arugula and sliced tomatoes if desired.

Melt butter in a 10x15 inch pan. Stir in flour and mix until smooth. Add brown sugar. Pour mixture over peach slices. Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg. Bake for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and top with cool whip. Let cool.

In large pan brown ground beef and drain off fat. Add water, chili powder, onion powder, garlic salt, ground oregano and cumin. Bring mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and cook for 3-4 hours. Add tomato sauce if desired. Serve with chips or cornbread.

Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Set aside. Place the scallops on a broiler pan in a single layer. Brush both sides of scallops with the lime mixture. Broil the scallops 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until the scallops are cooked through. Transfer the scallops to a plate. Skewer each scallop with a piece of tomato and place on a serving platter. Serve immediately. Serve with additional lime wedges.

In a small bowl, beat eggs lightly. Stir in milk. Add salt and pepper to taste. Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add pesto sauce. Cook for 2 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Stir in eggs. Cook until eggs are almost set but still runny around the edges. Spread 1/2 tsp butter on each slice of bread. Place tomato slices over butter on each slice of bread. Top with 1/4 cup cheese. Top with 2 eggs. Top each panini half with the other half of bread. Cook 3 to 4 minutes or until golden brown and cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. On a large cutting board, slice the pita bread into 16 pieces. Toss the pita pieces in the egg whites to coat lightly. Lay the pita pieces flat on a baking sheet and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 15 minutes or until crispy. Remove from the oven and cool. Once the pita pieces are completely cooled, rub them with the garlic cloves. Toss them in the olive oil. Sprinkle with parsley to taste. Serve warm.

Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. Whisk together the egg, milk, oil and vanilla extract until well combined. Add the flour mixture to the wet mixture in 3 additions alternating with the strawberries. Fold the flour mixture into the wet mixture. Heat a lightly oiled griddle over medium heat. Pour 1/4 cup batter for each pancake onto the griddle. Cook until the pancake is golden brown, about 2 minutes per side. Serve the pancakes warm with whipped cream.

Wash and pat dry squid bodies. Heat oil in a wok or a large saucepan to 360F. Dip squid in cornflour and then into seasoned oil and fry until golden brown on each side. Remove and place on a rack and keep warm. Sprinkle with sea salt and black peppercorns and serve hot with green onions and red chile.

Sprinkle salt and white pepper to taste on each fish fillet. Bake fish in a 400 degree oven for 10 to 15 minutes. Sauté 1/2 c of the crab meat with the almonds in a little butter. Place one fillet of fish on a serving plate. Drizzle mayonnaise over fish. Top with the crab/almond mixture. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.

Make the sandwiches by spreading a little bit of mayonnaise on each slice of bread, and laying on the bottom slice of bread, a slice of radish and some mixed sprouts, and then the top slice of bread. Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on the top slice of bread, and lay on the top of the sandwich the smoked salmon and then the chopped egg, seasoning with a pinch of salt and pepper and a dash of horseradish.
Sauté spinach leaves in butter until just wilted (do not overcook). Mix with shredded coconut and crushed or slivered peanuts. Season with a little salt and a little pepper.

Dust pork with seasoned flour. Heat a little olive oil and butter in a large frying pan. Fry the pork chops in batches for about 3 minutes on each side until cooked through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with homemade apple puree and rocket salad.

Slice shortcake into 2 inch pieces. Spray baking sheet with cooking spray. Dip shortcake pieces in reduced-calorie margarine. Thread strawberry slices onto skewers. Place shortcake pieces on baking sheet. Bake in preheated 350 degree F oven for 8 minutes. Cool slightly. Dip shortcake pieces in melted semi-sweet chocolate chips. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion and salt. Cook until onion is tender. Set aside and keep warm. Mix together lemon juice and oil in a small bowl. Rub lamb with mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Place lamb in skillet with onion. Cook over medium heat for about 15 minutes. Turn lamb over and continue to cook for another 10 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh thyme and serve with the onion and lemon wedges.
Beat cream cheese with electric mixer until smooth. Add garlic cloves. Beat well. Add feta cheese. Add figs. Mix well. Refrigerate. Serve with toasted bread.

Cut the cucumber into thin wedges. Peel the sweet red pepper and cut into thin wedges. Peel the sweet onion and cut into thin wedges. In a blender container combine cucumber, red pepper and red onion. Add the V8 juice and lime juice and blend together. Pour the mixture into a glass bowl. Add the garlic and blend together. Add the Tabasco sauce and blend together. Stir in the salt and stir. Stir in the cilantro and stir. Serve the gazpacho cold.

In a saucepan combine sugar, cranberries, wine and cinnamon stick. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat to low. Simmer uncovered 10 minutes or until cranberries pop. Remove from heat. Remove cinnamon stick and orange rind. Pour over ice cream or yogurt.

Cook sausage in a skillet until brown. Add celery and onions. Cook and stir until tender. Stir in water and noodle mix and cook until noodles are tender. Add rice and cook until tender. Stir in soy sauce and season with salt and pepper. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet brown the meat in the oil until lightly brown. Drain. Add the refried beans. Combine the taco seasoning and salsaadd to the meat. Pour the mixture into a crock pot. Add the cheeze whiz. Cook for 3 to 4 hours on high. Serve with the tortilla shells and corn chips.

Cut steaks into 1/2-inch pieces. Brown the steak and set aside. Cook pasta in large saucepan. Drain pasta and set aside. In large saucepan, bring water and bouillon cubes to a boil. Stir in vegetables and cook 2 minutes. Add steak and cook for 3-5 minutes. Add pasta and sauce. Heat through. Serve with shredded cheddar cheese.

Mix the cream cheese and butter together until smooth. Add the flour and mix until it forms a ball of dough. Wrap the dough ball in plastic wrap and chill it in the refrigerator for about an hour or more before using it to make your pie crusts.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place all ingredients in a large bowl. Stir until just blended. Spoon into greased or paper-lined muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and cool for 5 minutes. Remove from pan and serve.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, heat 2 teaspoons of the oil. Add the scallion and garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the shrimp and saute for 3 minutes. Add the remaining oil, tomatoes and basil to the pan. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the spirals to the pan. Add the peas and salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 3 minutes or until the pasta is al dente.

In a large skillet, cook green onions and stewed tomatoes with water until tender over medium heat. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add Tabasco and chopped tomatoes and cook 15 minutes more over low heat.

Preheat oven to 350F. Line 15x10x1 pan with foil. Spread crackers evenly over bottom. Melt condensed milk over low heatstir constantly until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in Skor chips, chocolate chips. Spread over crackers. Cool completely. Refrigerate overnight. Remove from pan. Cut into 24 squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine the flour, tapioca starch, parmesan cheese, egg yolk, butter, milk and mozzarella cheese cubes into a bowl and mix thoroughly until combined. Place a 2-inch ball of the dough mixture onto each cookie sheetform it into a ball using your hands. With a fork, pierce a hole into the center of each ball of dough. Sprinkle the tops with parmesan cheese. Bake for 45 minutes or until firmallow the balls to cool completely before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8 inch square baking pan. In a medium bowl combine the butter, ginger and vanilla wafer crumbsmix well. Press into bottom and up sides of pan. Bake for 15 minutes in preheated oven. In a large bowl combine cornstarch and 1/3 cup sugargradually add half and half. Stir in vanilla extract and vanilla wafer crumbs. Stir in sweetened coconut. Pour mixture into prepared panspread evenly over crumb crust. Bake for 25 minutes in preheated oven or until set. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack. Cut into squares and serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

Saute onion in olive oil in a 5 qt slow cooker over medium heat for 8 minutes. Stir in garlic clove for 1 minute. Stir in green pepper for 4 minutes. Stir in diced tomatoes, chili powder, worcestershire sauce and beef. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in red beans and salt and pepper to taste. Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or until beef is tender. Stir in macaroni for the last 30 minutes of cooking time or until macaroni is tender. Serve hot.

In a large soup pot heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the scallions to the pot along with the garlic cloves, green chilies and beans. Add about 6 cups of water (or as much as needed to just cover the beans). Bring to a boil then reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until the beans are soft, about 1 hour (add water as needed). Add the salsa to the pot and simmer until heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat and saute onions and summer squash until softened and tender. Add the zucchini and pepper and continue to cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes more. Add the tomato sauce and simmer until the sauce is reduced by half. Remove from heat and add the mozzarella and oregano to the skillet. Stir until the cheese is melted and the mixture is smooth and creamy. Pour the mixture into an ungreased 8x8 baking dish and bake for about 30 minutes or until the mixture is bubbly and the cheese is golden brown. Serve warm with crusty bread.

Preheat grill. Season pork with salt and pepper and grill until cooked through, about 15 minutes, turning once half way through cooking time. Meanwhile, mix together mustard, maple syrup and orange rind and set aside. When pork is cooked through and slightly pink inside, remove from grill and place on platter. Brush with mustard mixture and sprinkle with green onions and pepper. Serve with potatoes and fresh vegetables.
Squeeze tomatoes, and mix with mayonnaise. Add corn and lobster meat. Chop avocados. Add to mixture. Mix well. Add milk and seasoning. Serve cold on lettuce leaves.

Mix bread crumbs with parmesan cheese. Place zucchini in a single layer on a baking sheet. Dip zucchini in egg. Dip zucchini in bread crumb mixture. Place strips of zucchini in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake in 350f oven for 20-30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot with salad or steamed vegetables.

Bring water, orange juice and orange zest to a boil in a saucepan over high heat, stirring frequently until bubbles subside. Remove from heat and pour over couscouscover pan tightly with a lid or plastic wrap (to prevent steam from escaping). Allow to steep for 10 minutesthen remove lid or plastic wrap. Fluff with a fork and serve immediately with fresh orange slices as garnish.

Rinse your chickens under cold running water, pat dry. Place your chickens in a large pot with 2 cups of water. Add your lemon juice, ginger, cloves, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Cook for 30 minutes. Transfer to a roasting pan. Add olive oil. Roast for about 1 hour or until the juices run clear. Remove from oven. Let sit for 15 minutes before carving.

Pour hot water into mug and add chai tea bags. Stir to make sure the tea bags have been fully dissolved. Stir in whipping cream and caster sugar. Add chocolate syrup. Pour in ice cubes. Blend for 10 seconds until smooth. Serve and enjoy.

In a large bowl combine granulated sugar, cornstarch, salt and milk. Cook over medium heat until thickened stirring constantly, approximately 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in egg yolks. Set aside to cool to room temperature. In a small bowl, whip the butter until fluffy. Beat in the vanilla extract. Set aside. Place wafers on a large plate. Layer half of the bananas on top of the wafers. Spoon half of the pudding mixture on top of the bananas. Repeat layers with remaining bananas and pudding mixture. Sprinkle with whipped cream and drizzle with remaining vanilla butter. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and freeze for at least 4 hours or overnight. Let stand for about 10 minutes before serving.

Remove the bread from the package. Open the can of tuna. Spread the tuna on the bread. Cut the broccoli into small pieces. Place the tuna mixture in an oven-safe dish. Place the dish in the oven. Bake for 20 minutes at 350. Remove the tuna mixture from the oven. Remove the tuna from the bread. Place the tuna mixture in the oven. Bake for 5 minutes at 350. Remove the tuna mixture from the oven. Place the tuna mixture in the microwave for 1 minute at full power. Remove the tuna mixture from the microwave. Cut the tuna mixture into small cubes. Place the tuna mixture back in the oven. Bake for 5 minutes at 350. Remove the tuna mixture from the oven. Remove the bread from the package. Open the cheese. Cut the cheese into small cubes. Place the tuna mixture in the bread. Place the bread in the microwave for 30 seconds at full power. Remove the bread from the microwave. Top the bread with the cheese

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Peel and slice apples and set aside. In a large bowl, combine rolled oats and brown sugar. Stir in flour, cinnamon and nutmeg. Cut butter into small pieces and add to oat mixture. Stir until mixture is crumbly. Stir in apples and toss to coat. Place in a 9x13 baking dish. Bake for 35 minutes. Serve warm topped with whipped cream.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Trim the stems from the brussels sprouts and discard (or reserve them for another use). Rinse the brussels sprouts under cool water and pat dry with a paper towel. Place the brussels sprouts in a large bowl and toss with the oil until the brussels sprouts are well coated in oil (this should take about five minutes). Transfer the brussels sprouts to the baking sheet and season them with the sea salt and pepper. Roast the brussels sprouts for 15 minutes or until they are tender and golden brown (it will take longer if your sprouts are larger). Remove the brussels sprouts from the oven and add the lemon juice and toss well to coat (this should take about five minutes). The brussels sprouts will continue to roast and will become more tender and caramelized as the lemon juice evaporates off the sprouts (this can take anywhere from five minutes to twenty minutes). Once the brussels sprouts are done, remove from the oven and

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add beef tenderloin steaks and brown. Remove from pan and keep warm. Add shallot and sauté until softened. Stir in mustard and worcestershire sauce. Add beef tenderloin back to pan and cook 5 more minutes or until done. Serve with the brandy and whipped cream.

In large skillet brown steaks. Remove from pan. In same skillet brown macaroni noodles. Add tomatoes and soup mix. Stir to coat. Return steak to pan. Cover. Cook 30 minutes. Serve with stewed tomatoes over hot noodles.

In a food processor, combine all ingredients except bacon. Process 20 seconds to 30 seconds to desired spreading consistency. Spread on toasted bread slices. Lay bacon on bread slices before topping with cheese mixture. Serve immediately with crackers or chips.

Remove stems from mushrooms and discard. Place mushroom caps in a shallow baking dish or casserole pan. Sautee bacon pieces until crisp. Drain and crumble bacon into a small bowl and set aside. Mince one of the garlic cloves and add it to the bacon along with the butter. Saute until butter is melted. Add cream cheese, mushroom stems, remaining garlic clove, Worcestershire sauce and hot sauce to bowl with bacon. Stir until cream cheese is melted and blended. Spoon cream cheese mixture into mushrooms. Bake at 375f for about 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and mushrooms are cooked through. Serve hot with crackers or toasted bread.
Cook macaroni until tender. Drain. In a saucepan combine macaroni, butter, evaporated milk, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook until cheese melts. Serve hot.

Bake hash brown potatoes and vegetables as directed on package. When done bake in a 9x13 baking dish. In a large skillet brown chicken and onions. Pour soup over chicken. Pour over hash brown mixture. Bake uncovered at 350f for 30 minutes. Top with cheddar cheese and french fried onions.

Mix cream cheese with Italian seasoning, garlic powder, and bacon. Form into 24 equal balls. Place cheese balls on plate. Top each with walnuts. Place cheese ball on baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes. Flip cheese balls over with tongs. Cook for another 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Serve with crackers or bread. Mini cheese balls make great appetizers.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring skim milk, water and molasses to a boil. Add old-fashioned oatmeal and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until oatmeal is tender and creamy, about 5 minutes. Stir in ground ginger, cinnamon, cloves and vanilla extract. Remove from heat. Stir in olive oil. Serve warm with sugar and cinnamon on top for garnish.

Wash the yams. Cut each yam in half. Slice the halved yams lengthwise. Then slice each lengthwise slice. Place the sliced yams on a cookie sheet in a single layer. Melt the butter and the brown sugar together. Pour it over the yams. Next sprinkle the maple syrup over the yams. Next squeeze the lemon juice over the yams. Then sprinkle the lemon zest over the yams. Lastly pour the southern comfort over the yams. Then bake the yams at 425 for about 25 minutes. You can also make this recipe with sweet potatoes.

Take two hot dogs out of their packaging and lay them on a flat surface. Cut each in half. If you use a hot dog bun it will be easier to make each half into a dog shape. Place a half dog on a bun and wrap a piece of bacon around it. Place a slice or two of cheese on top. Bring the ends together to resemble a hot dog. Wrap in tin foil and bake for about 30 minutes in a 350 degree oven. Make sure to make an oven safe tray because if you bake them on a regular cookie sheet it will fall through and you will have to clean up a mess. You can also put them in a casserole dish and bake in a 325 degree oven for about an hour. The bacon will be done first so you need to check it every 15 minutes so it doesn't burn. You can also use hamburger meat instead of hot dogs. I make these for my kids when they go to college and they love them. I make them with ketchup and mustard on the bun. I have also made them with barbeque sauce

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook and stir until tender. Add mushrooms. Cook and stir until tender. Stir in wine. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in tomato soup. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in chicken thighs. Cook 15 minutes. Add thyme. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in remaining tomato soup. Cook 2 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Trim stem ends from brussels sprouts and cut in half lengthwise. In a small bowl stir yogurt until smooth. Add mustard and stir until blended. Add maple syrup and stir until combined. Season with salt and pepper. Add dill and stir. Melt butter in a large skillet on medium heat. Add brussels sprouts and saute until tender and browned. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Spoon yogurt mixture over brussels sprouts. Serve.

Combine all ingredients except tortilla chips and stir to combine well. Cover and refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours before serving. Makes about 6 cups of dip. Serve with tortilla chips. Serving size is 1/8 cup dip and 5 to 6 tortilla chips. Time does not include 2 to 3 hours for refrigeration.

Beat butter until fluffy. Add sugar gradually. Beat in eggs. Stir in dates. Add flour. Stir in vanilla and rice krispies. Drop batter by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees for 9 to 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Sprinkle with shredded coconut. Roll in pecans.

In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add chayote slices and fry until soft. Remove and set aside. In the same skillet, add onions and garlic and saut until golden. Add the chayote and cooked rice. Cook for about 10 minutes over medium heat. Add salt and pepper to taste and garnish with chives. Serves 6 to 8.
In a large bowl combine vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, ginger. Add cucumbers. Stir well. Refrigerate for several hours. Stir well before serving.

Wash lettuce leaves in water. Drain. Place lettuce leaves in a small bowl. Cut avocados in half. Scoop out avocado flesh into lettuce. Slice each avocado half into thin slices. Place avocado slices in center of lettuce leaves. Add tomatoes. Peel and devein eggs. Cut eggs in half. Place egg halves in the center of each avocado slice. Add alfalfa sprouts and dill. Combine mayonnaise and mustard. Drizzle dressing over salad. Salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with freshly ground black pepper. Makes 3 servings.

Prepare sauce. In small bowl whisk together fruit spread and vinegar. Stir in wine and rosemary. Brush pork with half of the sauce. Place pork in a shallow baking dish and bake 15 minutes. Turn pork over. Brush with remaining sauce. Bake 15-20 minutes longer or until meat thermometer inserted horizontally in center reads 145-150 degrees F (62-65 degrees C). Let stand 5 minutes. Transfer pork to serving platter. Remove and discard rosemary. Spoon sauce over pork and serve.

Boil new potatoes until fork tender. Drain water. While potatoes are cooking prepare your cream sauce. Melt butter in a sauce pan. Add dry mustard, cilantro, black pepper and salt. Stir in heavy cream. Once cream is hot add in the potatoes. Mix well. Garnish with shaved parmesan. Serve with a fresh salad.

Brown meat. Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is tender. Add tomatoes and chilies. Add seasoning and salt. Cook until meat is done. In a large skillet sprayed with cooking spray heat cooking oil over medium heat. Add eggs. As eggs start to set add about 1/2 cup meat mixture. Cook until eggs are set. Fill tortillas with eggs and meat mixture. Top with cheese. Place in a baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Combine cucumber, sour cream, yogurt, dill, garlic and salt in food processor or blender. Puree until smooth. Serve cool.

Rinse tomatoes, drain them well. Place them on an aluminum foil lined baking sheet with some of your favorite herbs (dried or fresh) such as basil. Sprinkle with some sea salt. Bake at 350 for 35-40 minutes depending on size of tomatoes until tender. Serve with freshly grated parmesan cheese or your favorite cheese.

Preheat oven to 375. Slice asparagus spears crosswise into 1/2-inch thick pieces. Place in large saucepan with 1 1/2 cups broth. Bring to boilreduce heat to medium. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until tender. Drain. Discard brothtransfer asparagus to 13- x 9-inch glass baking dish. Place in freezer until ready to use. In 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Whisk in flour until blendedcook 1 minute. Gradually whisk in milkbring to boil. Remove from heat. Stir in eggsreturn to low heat. Cook 1 minute or until slightly thickened. Remove from heatstir in sour cream, 1 1/2 teaspoons tarragon, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon ground red pepper, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Pour into prepared crustdot

In a large skillet, brown bacon and sausage over medium heat until sausage is fully cooked through and bacon is crispy. Add onion, celery and bell peppers and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Drain off fat and transfer to a 4-quart slow cooker (or a large pan). Add beans, barbecue sauce and steak sauce and stir to coat the meat thoroughly. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or on high for 4 to 5 hours. Transfer to a serving dish and garnish with crumbled bacon and chopped green onions. Serve with cornbread and/or potato wedges.

Soak black eyed peas over night or for at least six hours. In a large saucepan combine the soaked peas and water and bring to a boil. Simmer on low heat until tender. Drain and cool. Combine the peas and the oil and mix thoroughly. Form small balls of the mixture about the size of a walnut. Dip the balls into the flour and then into the beaten egg. Roll the balls into the bread crumbs and place on a greased cookie sheet and bake at 425 degrees F for about 15 minutes or until browned. Serve hot or at room temperature.

In a large non-reactive pan or skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat and saute the herring fillets for 5-7 minutes or until the herring is tender but not falling apart. Add the herring to the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the beater attachment (or the beaters by hand) along with the mayonnaise and dill. Add the herring mixture to the skillet, stirring constantly until the mayonnaise is heated through. Add the chopped dill just before serving. Makes about 4 servings of herring salad.

In medium saucepan, melt butter over medium heat until it sizzles and foams. Stir in onion and cook until translucent and softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in milk and bring to a boil. Add cornstarch and stir until mixture is thickened. Stir in cheese until melted and smooth. Add whiskey and stir until thoroughly combined. Taste and add salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm with dippers such as bread cubes, crackers, cauliflower florets, apples and potatoes.

Put onion into large frying pan with oil or butter. Fry for about 10 minutes until softened, then add beef sausages and curry powder. Cook for another 5 minutes then add baked beans and crushed tomatoes. Stir over a low heat for 10-15 minutes until thickened then serve with rice or mash. Season with salt and pepper as desired.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place garlic cloves and onion in a food processor. Add dill, poppy seed, parmesan cheese, butter, and 1 cup buttermilk. Pulse until blended. Pour mixture into a medium bowl. Add biscuits and toss until evenly coated. Spoon mixture onto a parchment-lined sheet pan. Bake 12 to 14 minutes or until browned. Cool 5 minutes before serving.

Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add the dry onion soup mix. Stir. Add the cream of mushroom soup. Stir. Reduce heat to a simmer. Add the chicken pieces. Cook over a low heat for about 45 minutes or until chicken pieces are thoroughly cooked. Serve over medium-grain rice.

Brown chicken breasts in a little olive oil. Add onion soup mix and water to cover. Cover and cook on high pressure for 12 minutes (make sure your cooker has a quick release valve). When done cooking remove chicken to a plate and cover with foil to keep warm. Reduce liquid to 1/2 inch in bottom of pot. Add a little more water if needed to cover noodles and add cranberry sauce and french dressing and cook for 4 minutes on high pressure or until noodles are done. When done cooking, add chicken back to pot and serve.

Place ground beef, onion and sweet peppers in a large skillet. Cook over medium heat. Drain well. Combine egg and butter. Stir into meat mixture until well combined. Fill a small bowl with the flour and place next to the stove. Dip each egg roll into flour to coat. Dip into beaten egg. Dip into flour again. Fold each egg roll into a triangle and place on a cookie sheet or jelly roll pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes. Turn over and bake for an additional 10 minutes.

Sprinkle both sides of the fish steaks with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Place oil in a frying pan and heat until hot. Add the sliced ginger and cook for 2 minutes, stirring often. Add the chili sauce and stir well. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring constantly and being careful not to burn. Place the fish steaks in the pan and cook for 2 minutes each side until just cooked through. Remove and set aside to allow the fish to rest for 5 minutes. Serve with fresh herbs such as fresh mint and fresh coriander.

Preheat oven to 180c. Grease and line two 20cm cake tins. Beat the oil with the yogurt until smooth. Add the sugar to the yogurt mixture until light and fluffy. Sift together the flour with the baking powder. Add the egg to the yogurt mixture one at a time. Add half the yogurt mixture to the flour mixture. Beat well. Add the remaining yogurt mixture to the flour mixture. Beat well. Spoon the mixture into the tins. Bake for 20 minutes until golden brown. Remove from the tins to a wire rack to cool. When cool, drizzle with the coconut and vanilla. Serve.

Take a biscuit and top with some swiss cheese. Place 1/2 of an onion on top. Top with some sausage. Place a dollop of basil on top. Bake in a 375-degree preheated oven until biscuit is brown on top and cheese is melted. Serve with a fresh tomato or a side salad.

Wash and tear the spinach into large pieces and saute it in a bit of olive oil with scallions until it is wilted and tender. Add the cooked rice and the dill and cook for a minute more. Add lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste. Mix well and shape the mixture into balls and roll the balls in breadcrumbs. Keep in the refrigerator until you want to fry them. Heat a bit of oil in a skillet and fry the rice balls for 2-3 minutes until the crumbs are golden. Serve with a lemon wedge.

Wash apples. Peel if desired. Cut into quarters. Put 1 tbsp apple juice in bottom of 9x13 pan. Place apples in pan. Add enough apple juice to almost cover apples. Place in oven until apples are tender. Remove from oven. Place 2 tbsp of sugar in bottom of pan. Put apples in pan. Mix remaining 2 cups sugar with flour. Cut butter into small pieces. Mix into sugar mixture. Pour mixture over apples. Bake for 30-40 minutes. Serve with ice cream.

Saute onions and garlic in butter until tender. Stir in flour until blended. Add milk and simmer until thickened. Stir in clams. Cook until clams open. Drain and reserve liquid. Add parsley and parmesan cheese and blend. Cook dry fettuccine according to directions. Drain and toss with clam sauce. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

Bring the milk to a boil. Remove from the heat and stir in the butter. Peel and wash the potatoes. Cut the potatoes into quarters and put in a large saucepan of boiling water. Cook until tender. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the potatoes and the remaining ingredients. Beat with a fork until smooth. Serve warm.

Trim off any wilted leaves from radicchio and cut in half or thirds. Place cut radicchio on a grill preheated to medium heat. Grill until radicchio is softened and lightly charred (about 10-15 minutes). Add a few tablespoons of olive oil to a medium bowl and whisk in honey and balsamic vinegar. Drizzle dressing over radicchio and toss to coat. Serve warm.
Beat the eggs with a fork. Dip the meat mixture in the eggs then in the bread crumbs. Place on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes.

Mix together olive oil, lemon pepper and salt in a large bowl. Add the orzo to the mixture and toss to coat. Add the water and stir until the orzo is completely coated with the mixture. Stir in the pork tenderloin. Add spinach and tomatoes to the mixture and gently stir. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Place the pork in the skillet and cook for 4 to 6 minutes per side or until the internal temperature reaches 160 degrees. Remove from the skillet and let stand 5 minutes before slicing. Serve with orzo. Top with feta cheese and olives.
Brush fillets lightly with egg white. Mix remaining ingredients and place over fillets. Bake at 400f for about 15 to 20 minutes or until tender and flaky.

Drain pasta. Put yogurt, garlic clove, fresh mint, salt and pepper in a blender. Blend until smooth. Put yogurt mixture back into a sauce pan. Add pasta. Bring to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Add salt to taste.

Mix soy sauce, orange juice and lemon juice together in small bowl. Place salmon fillets on greased grill rack. Brush each fillet with sauce and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill fillets 10 to 15 minutes or until done. Serve with lemon wedges. Fish can be served whole or filleted. Add lemon wedges and garnish with parsley.

Saute water chestnuts and onion in 1 tbsp of the melted butter. Add mixed vegetables. Season with salt, pepper, nutmeg and paprika. Fold in mayonnaise. Mix together the cracker crumbs, cheese and melted butter. Add cracker crumb mixture to the vegetable mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes or until bubbling. Serve hot.
Mix the corn chip crumbs and egg in a bowl. Coat the chicken breasts with this mixture. Bake for about 20 minutes. Serve with ranch dip.
Cook onion in olive oil until soft. Stir in salt, pepper, garlic and split peas. Add vegetable broth. Cook for 20 minutes. Blend curry powder to mixture.

Preheat waffle iron. In large bowl stir together baking mix, cinnamon and nutmeg. In another bowl whisk together eggs, milk and butter. Stir the wet ingredients into the dry. Stir in apples. Cook according to waffle iron directions. Serve hot.

1. Peel red cabbage. Cut into small pieces. Roughly chop walnuts.2. Combine red wine vinegar with sunflower oil. Salt to taste. Add chopped walnuts.3. Cook red cabbage for 15 minutes with salt & pepper. After 15 minutes add sugar.4. Stir cabbage well and let it cook for 10 more minutes.5. Combine applesauce with cranberry jam.6. Let salad rest for at least 30 minutes.

Melt the butter. Add the sugar. Cream together with the egg yolks. Add the milk. Mix in the vanilla extract and the vanilla wafers. Beat the egg whites to stiffness with cream of tartar. Fold the egg whites into the batter. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Cool and frost.

Mix all the dry ingredients together and mix the milk and eggs together. Add the liquid to the dry mix until you can form a ball of dough. Add the fruit to the dough after it has sat for a few minutes after mixing the dry and liquid together. Bake at degrees F for about an hour or until a toothpick comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 250f. Grease muffin cups or use paper liners. In a mixing bowl, combine the gluten-free flour, cornstarch, baking powder and xanthan gum. Whisk eggs wellstir into the dry mixture until just combined. Pour batter into muffin cups, filling 1/2 fullor use paper liners. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown on top.

Bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add 2 cups of potatoes. Boil 15 minutes. Add 2 cups of kale. Cook 10 minutes. Drain. Put into blender. Add 2 cups water. Blend until smooth. Pour into serving bowl. Add 1/2 cup vegetable oil. Stir. Add 2 cups water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir. Add 1/4 cup water. St

Melt butter and add parsley flakes. Add garlic and stir until fragrant. Pour over steaks and marinate 12 hours in refrigerator. Remove steaks from refrigerator and preheat oven to 425f degrees f. Sprinkle onion powder and salt on steaks and place on rack of oven proof baking dish (or foil on rack of baking dish) Bake steaks about 15 minutes, turning them over halfway through cooking time. Serve at room temperature.

Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a wok or large skillet. Add the onions, garlic, bell peppers and champignon mushrooms to the wok or pan and cook over medium heat until tender, stirring frequently with a wooden spoon or spatula. Remove the vegetables to a serving platter or bowl. Pour the remaining olive oil into the wok or pan. When the oil is hot, add the remaining olive oil. Add the wine to the wok or pan and cook until it is absorbed. Stir the soy sauce into the wok or pan and cook until it is absorbed. Stir the sesame oil into the wok or pan and cook until it is absorbed. Transfer the vegetables to the wok or pan and stir to mix with the sauces. Serve the stir-fry over rice.

Rub shrimp with turmeric and salt. Place in a medium bowl and toss with the chili powder, sesame oil and peanut oil. Thread shrimp onto bamboo skewers. Place skewers in a glass baking dish and refrigerate for 2 hours. Preheat a large skillet over medium heat. Pour 1 inch of oil into the skillet. Fry the shrimp until golden and cooked through. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm with a squeeze of lime juice.

Mix the rice, soup mix, beer and water in a saucepan and heat until boiling. Add the ground beef and cook until the meat is thoroughly heated. Stir in the flour, chili powder, green pepper, tomatoes, salt and pepper. Cook for five minutes longer over low heat. Pour into an ungreased casserole dish and bake for 25 minutes. Serve with corn bread or biscuits and gravy.

Rinse tomatoes under cold running water. Cut off stem ends and remove any seeds. Place tomatoes in a small bowl. Toss with 1/3 cup of the oil. Add remaining oil to a skillet. Add cumin seeds to hot oil. Let seeds pop. Add garlic to hot oil and saute until aromatic, about 30 seconds. Add remaining oil to tomatoes. Add lemon juice to tomatoes. Toss. Add salt and pepper. Let stand 10 minutes. Stir. Add turmeric. Add onion to oil in skillet. Add green onions to oil. Saute until onions are tender. Add parsley to oil. Add green onions to tomatoes. Toss. Serve.

Make a layer of onions on bottom of a large salad plate. Season with salt and pepper. Mix together mayonnaise and lemon juice. Layer tuna on top of onions. Add celery, tomato and tarragon. Dress the salad lightly. Add lettuce leaves as a garnish.

Saute mushrooms and onion. Drain mushrooms and onion. Stir in the flour and paprika. Slowly add the water. Cook on medium to medium-low heat for 10-15 minutes. Add the drained mushroom and onion. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir frequently. Add the drained sauerkraut. Cook on medium heat for 20 minutes. Serve over egg noodles. Recipe courtesy of mccormick.

The classic Czech method of frying chicken is to coat the chicken pieces in a mixture of flour and egg white and then fry them until golden brown. The chicken is served with a generous dollop of sour cream and a side dish of tart, sweet-and-sour sauerkraut. To prepare the chicken pieces for frying, mix 4 tbs. Flour with 1 tbs. Salt and 2 tbs. White wine vinegar. In a large mixing bowl, beat 5 egg whites until stiff. Add 1 cup of the flour mixture and beat again. Add 1 cup of oil to the remaining flour mixture and whisk until smooth. Dip the chicken pieces into the mixture and place them on a baking sheet to dry. Then fry them until golden brown. Serve the fried chicken with a generous dollop of sour cream and a side dish of tart, sweet-and-sour sauerkraut.

Clean and de-seed the green bell peppers. Place them on a baking sheet lined with foil. Place them face down on the sheet. Place them on the oven rack. Bake for 20 minutes at 375. After baking for 20 minutes turn the oven off. Let them sit there for 10 minutes. Take them out. Make the filling. Place 1/2 cup of the beef mixture into each bell pepper. Add a slice of cheese to each bell pepper. Place them back on the baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes at 375. Then serve them.

Make a creamy cheese sauce by mixing cream cheese with garlic and herbs. Pour in stock. Keep warm. Cut brie into thick slices. Heat some olive oil in a frying pan. Saut pan-fried brie until it starts to brown. Place brie slices on top of soup. Sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve with crusty french baguettes and a dollop of cranberry sauce.
In a small bowl combine chicken with garlic powder. Spread crust with butter. Place chicken mixture over crust. Top with salsa. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes.

Beat together the brown sugar, maple flavoring and egg whites until fluffy. Fold the pecans into the mixture. Pour into the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle with the bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes until brown.

Mix breadcrumbs, sesame seeds, caster sugar and Chinese five spice powder. Place the chicken breasts between two sheets of clingfilm and beat them with a meat hammer. Add the beaten egg to the breadcrumb mix. Dip the beaten breasts into the egg mix. Place the breaded breasts into a baking dish. Drizzle soy sauce over the breasts. Place the dish into the oven for about 12 minutes. Mix the lime and lemon juices together. Stir this into the soy sauce. Remove the breasts from the oven. Pour the soy sauce mixture over the breasts. Sprinkle the sesame seeds on top. Place the breasts into the oven for a further 10 minutes.

Wash and trim artichokes. Place in a steamer basket in a large pot with about two inches of water in the bottom of the pot. Cover with lid and steam for about 20 minutes or until artichokes are tender. Peel away tough outer leaves of artichokes. Cut in half lengthwise and remove fuzzy choke from center of artichoke halves. Rub the cut side of each artichoke half with the cut side of a lemon half. Dip in prepared mustard and then in mayonnaise. Serve with curry dipping sauce. Makes about 16 servings.

Mix butter and shortening in mixer until fluffy. Add powdered sugar and vanilla and almond extracts slowly while mixing until light and fluffy. Add meringue powder and continue mixing until all is incorporated. Add whipping cream and continue mixing until creamy and fluffy.

Melt butter. Mix paprika, orange zest, orange juice, scallions, salt, and pepper. Add tilapia fillet. Cook for about 5 minutes on each side. Pour mixture over fish. Top with orange slices. Serve with rice. Makes four servings.

Brown beef and salsa together until beef is fully cooked. Drain and place back into skillet. Add chili powder and mix well. Add frozen corn and green beans and mix well. Add rice and stir well to combine. Add cheese and stir until cheese is melted and blended evenly throughout mixture.
Combine softened cheese, pecans, mayonnaise and onion and garlic in blender container with tabasco sauce and blend well. Serve with crackers.

Mix self-raising flour and black pepper together with a pinch of salt. Make a well and pour in the water, mixing with a fork till a dough ball is formed. Roll into a ball and knead for five minutes on a floured surface. Roll out to about 1/2 cm thick on a lightly greased baking tray, spreading the sesame seeds over the dough. Bake for ten minutes at 180 degrees C/160 degrees C fan/gas 4 or until golden brown.

Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions and apple. Cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the ginger and mustard seeds. Cook for 1 minute. Pour in the cider. Simmer until reduced to 2 cups, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Fill a large bowl with cold water. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook the sausages for 5 minutes. Remove sausages from water. Place the sausages in the large bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Let sit for 10 minutes. Drain the sausages. Set aside. Remove the onion mixture from heat. Place the onion mixture in a blender. Blend until smooth. Add the onion mixture to a large saucepan. Add the sausages. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Serve warm.

Melt butter in small saucepan over medium heat. Remove from heat and add sugar and cocoa to melted butter. Mix well. Gradually add milk to mixture and heat to boiling. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract and spices. Add marshmallows and stir to melt and dissolve them in cocoa mixture. Pour into glasses and add whipped cream if desired.

Cream the white sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Add the milk and vanilla and beat until blended. Add the oatmeal and beat until the mixture is smooth and creamy in texture and turns a very light brown in colour. Add the salt and vanilla to the milk and beat until blended. Add the coconut and beat until blended. Add the baking soda to the butter and beat until blended. Add the flour to the butter and beat until blended. Place dough in a bowl or on a plate and refrigerate for 2 hours or until very firm. Roll the dough out and cut the dough into 3-inch-wide by 1-inch thick rounds (about 30 rounds). Place on greased baking sheets (or use non-stick baking sheets). Bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes or until the cookies are set (but not brown).

Combine 3/4 cup brown sugar, 1/4 cup water, 1/3 cup coconut milk, 1 cup shaved ice. Place in a glass bowl or dessert dish. Peel 2 oranges, cut into chunks. Drop into bowl, discarding peels. Pour 1/3 cup coconut milk over mixture. Cover with lid or plastic wrap to prevent evaporation. Place in refrigerator for at least 4 hours before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Bring chicken stock to boil. Stir shallots into stock. Add rice. Cover, reduce heat to low. Cook 45 minutes. Drain rice. Fluff with fork. Add butter to rice mixture. Stir butter into rice until melted. Add salt to taste. Makes about 2 1/2 cups.

Peel and cut onions and celery in half crosswise. Cook in a large skillet over medium heat until tender. Drain on paper towels. Melt butter in the same skillet. Add flour and cook over low heat for 2 minutes. Add milk and cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir in onions and celery and heat through. Stir in cheese and nuts. Pour into a 1-1/2-quart baking dish. Top with crumbled crackers. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes or until bubbly.

Grill chicken over medium-high heat 10 minutes turning occasionally. Combine remaining marinade ingredientspour over chicken. Turn chicken overgrill 10 minutes longer or until done. Serve with additional hot sauce if desired.

Form ground beef into meatballs and roll in breadcrumbs until coated well. Preheat oven to 425 degrees f and spray baking sheet with cooking spray. Bake meatballs for 25 minutes and let cool for 15 minutes. Meanwhile combine egg and water and beat until frothy. Stir in onion, thyme, salt and pepper. Spread on bottom half of bun and place meatballs on top. Top with remaining bun and serve.

In a medium saucepan, heat water and garlic over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Cook garlic and stirring until softened, 6-8 minutes. Add mussels to saucepan, cover and cook for 3-5 minutes or until shells open. Discard any unopened mussels. Remove garlic clove from pan (reserving liquid) and discard. Stir parsley into mussels. Pour mussels into a serving bowl and pour sauce over mussels. Stir cornstarch into reserved garlic liquidstir into sauce. Bring mixture to boilingboil and stir for 3-5 minutes or until thickened. Serve with mussels.

Preheat oven to 375°F. Sift together flour and salt. Add orange zest, orange juice and lemon zest. Cream butter and sugar. Add orange juice mixture. Add egg and beat until light and fluffy. Stir in dry mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake until firm and golden, 10 to 12 minutes. Cool for 2 minutes on cookie sheets. Transfer to wire racks.

Preheat the oven to gas mark 6. Sift together the flour and baking powder. Beat the margarine and sugar together until creamy. Add in the eggs one at a time. Add in the vanilla essence. Add in the flour mixture. Spoon into cases and bake for about 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease an 11x8x2 inch baking dish. In a large bowl, combine sweetened condensed milk with the milk chocolate chips. Microwave on high until the chocolate has melted. Stir the mixture until smooth. Pour into the prepared baking dish. Add the maraschino cherries (if desired), the miniature marshmallows (if desired), and the vanilla extract. Sprinkle with the walnuts. Bake for about 1 hour, or until fudge is set. Remove from the oven. Cool completely before cutting. Store fudge in an airtight container at room temperature. It will keep for up to two weeks.

Cook eggs in a pot of boiling water for 4 minutes. Drain in a colander and rinse with cold water. Place eggs in a casserole dish and top with feta cheese. Dot with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Clean and peel sweet potatoes. Cut each potato into quarters. Cook potatoes in a large pot of boiling water for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Transfer potatoes to a large bowl and mash. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Stir in milk and brown sugar. Bring mixture to a boil. Stir in nutmeg. Remove from heat. Pour over mashed potatoes and stir well. Pour into a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and ground nutmeg. Bake for 25 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm.

In medium saucepan over low heat, cook bacon until crispdrain on paper towels. Crumble bacon and set aside. In large saucepan over medium heat, bring 4 cups water to boilingadd leeks, cook 5 minutes or until tender. Drain. In large bowl combine 3 cups all-purpose flour, salt, 3/4 cup skim milk, and 6 eggsbeat on low speed of electric mixer about 2 minutes. Increase speed to mediumbeat about 6 minutes or until smooth. Add leeks, bacon, chicken, spinach, Parmesan cheese, and Cheddar cheesebeat just until combined. Using well-floured hands, roll gnocchi mixture into 1-inch ballsplace on lightly greased baking sheet. Brush with buttersprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake at 400 degrees F for 15-20 minutes or until lightly browned.

Preparationcombine eggplant with water in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain. Stir in vinegar and salt and pepper to taste. Mix in remaining ingredients. Serve at room temperature.

In large bowl, whisk together flour and seasonings until salt and pepper are evenly distributed and flour is incorporated into seasonings. Coat chicken breast halves with seasoning mixture. In large skillet or dutch oven, heat oil and butter over medium heat until butter is bubbling. Cook chicken for about 4 minutes on each side or until cooked through (about 8 minutes total). Transfer chicken to a plate and tent with foil. Pour oil and butter into a large bowl. Set aside. Place cream and champagne into the bowl containing oil and butter and whisk until combined. Add chicken back into the skillet or dutch oven and simmer covered for about 10-12 more minutes or until cream is thick and chicken is cooked through. Serve warm with fresh steamed vegetables or rice or potato.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f and spray a muffin tin with cooking spray. Sift together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder and baking soda in a medium bowl and whisk together the brown sugar and cocoa powder to make it super fine. Set aside. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Add the eggs one at a time and mix until incorporated. Add the vanilla and mix again until combined. Turn off the mixer and add the dry ingredients and the sifted chocolate chunks. Mix until incorporated and just until everything looks like it’s together. Divide the batter between the 12 muffin cups and bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of one of the muffins comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Let cool slightly and serve warm with coffee or tea.
Add water, arrowroot, cheese to boiling milk. Stir constantly until cheese is melted. Add molly mcbutter. Stir constantly until smooth. Add salt and white pepper to taste. Serve with pasta.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a non stick skillet with olive oil. Dip tenders in olive oil. Sprinkle with black pepper. Spread garlic powder in the bottom of the pan. Saute on medium high for 4 minutes or until browned. Add tenders to the pan. Flip after about a minute. Sprinkle with salt. Cook for another minute on each side. Spray a baking sheet with olive oil. Place tenders on sheet. Sprinkle with salt. Bake for about 30 minutes or until they are cooked through. Drizzle with honey. Spray with olive oil. Sprinkle with black pepper. Whisk together honey, vinegar and broth. Drizzle onto tenders.

Sprinkle salt and pepper over both sides of chicken breasts and set aside. Heat a large saute pan over medium heat and add 2 tablespoons of the chutney. Sear chicken breasts, cooking until just done (approximately 8 minutes). Remove from pan and place on a platter with a small dish of remaining chutney. Sprinkle with coriander and serve. Note: To prepare chutney glaze, combine chutney and remaining chutney in a small saucepan over low heat until warm and glaze consistency is reached.
Prepare all of the salad ingredients but the cucumbers. Dice cucumbers, add to bowl with the other salad ingredients and toss with the olive oil and lemon juice. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In large pot heat olive oil over medium heat. Add beef short ribs and brown on both sides. Remove beef and set aside. Add garlic and brown for about 1 minute. Add tomatoes and mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms are soft. Add marsala and cook until marsala is reduced by half. Add flour and stir into mixture until smooth. Add beef back into pot. Season with italian seasoning. Pour in 4 cups of chicken broth. Simmer for 2 hours. Add tortellini. Stir until they float to the top. Cook for another 10 minutes. Serve.

Cream together sugar and butter. Add egg and milk. Mix well. Add all-bran cereal. Sift together flour and baking powder. Add dry ingredients and mix well. Place 1 heaping tbsp. of batter on sheet of wax paper. Roll into 1-inch diameter logs. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350f for 10 minutes. Do not over bake. Let stand for 3 minutes. Remove cookies from cookie sheet. Place figs on 1 end of each cookie. Serve immediately.

Drain salmon and pat dry. Place salmon fillet on a broiling pan skin side down. Sprinkle salmon with salt and pepper. Broil 10 to 12 minutes or until salmon flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove from heat. Place salmon skin side down on a broiling pan. Broil 3 to 4 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from heat. Combine balsamic vinegar and water. Dip salmon fillet into the vinegar mixture. Sprinkle with more salt and pepper if desired. Broil 1 minute or until lightly browned. Remove from heat and serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees fahrenheit. Line 2 cookie sheets with foil. In a large bowl beat the egg white with an electric mixer on medium until foamyadd sugar gradually beating until stiff peaks form. Add pumpkin pie spice mix, ginger, nutmeg and cinnamon. Fold in pecans with a rubber spatula until completely coated. Drop by heaping tablespoons onto the cookie sheetsspace about 2 inches apart as the pecans will expand during baking. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour, or until pecans are light golden brown. Cool completely on cookie sheets for 10 minutesremove from pans with foil edgesplace on cooling rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container for 1 month or freeze for up to 3 months.

Combine water and saffron threads in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 5 minutes or until the threads are completely dissolved. Strain the liquid into a large bowl. Combine the oil, salt and couscous in the bowl with the saffron liquid. Toss until the couscous is completely coated with oil mixture. Cover with a clean towel or plastic wrap for 30 minutes to absorb the liquid. Stir in the raisins and mint leaves. Serve immediately.

Boil broccoli until soft. Drain and chop into small pieces. In a small bowl mix the orange juice and garlic and let sit for 5 minutes. Add broccoli and ginger. Toss and let sit. Heat sesame oil in a small pan and add the broccoli. Serve over rice or bread.

Place 3 cups broccoli coleslaw mix, 1/2 cup chopped red peppers, 1/2 cup chopped yellow peppers and 1/4 cup chopped scallions into a large bowl. Mix in 2 tablespoons slivered almonds and 2 tablespoons sunflower seeds. In a small bowl whisk together 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, 1 tablespoon sugar, 2 tablespoons oil. Pour over salad mixture. Add 3 cups hot boiled ramen noodles. Stir to coat noodles with dressing. Let sit for 10 minutes before serving.

Cook egg noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold water, then drain againset aside. Place tuna in a medium-sized mixing bowladd green onion, mayonnaise, celery, and seasoningsstir to blend wellthen add egg noodlesstir until evenly blended. Let chilled. Makes 4 servings.

Mix water and yeast in a large bowl and let it sit until it foams. Add 2 1/2 cups of the flour and mix. Add the rest of the dry ingredients and knead for 10 minutes. Grease a bowl and put the dough in it and cover it. Let it rise until it doubles. Punch down the dough and then let it rise again until it doubles. Divide the dough into 12 pieces and then roll each piece of dough into a ball. Flatten each ball and put a teaspoon of butter in the middle of the ball. Roll it up into a ball and then put a spoonful of sugar on top of the ball. Put the rolls on a greased baking pan and let them rise until they are about double in size. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 degrees.

Beat egg yolks with sugar in large bowl until thick and lemon colored. Stir in cold water and walnuts. Stir in soft breadcrumbs and baking powder and mix well. Add shortening and beat until soft and smooth. Fold in egg whites. Pour into a greased 9 inch square baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until top is lightly browned and cake is set. Sprinkle with powdered sugar before serving. Serves 8 to 10.
Place all chutney ingredients into a food processor and pulse until blended and smooth. Serve with chicken or pork.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add flour to butter. Cook until flour is golden. Add lemon juice and old bay seasoning. Slowly add light cream and cook until thickened. Add diced crabmeat. Add parsley just before serving.

Cut potato in half lengthwise and scoop out insides. Mash potato with fork. Spoon potato mixture into a bowl. Add sour cream, bacon bits, cheddar cheese and mix. Place potato halves on baking sheet. Spoon potato mixture into potato halves. Sprinkle with paprika and green onion. Bake at 400 degrees for about 10 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve with butter and green onions.

Put the berries in a saucepan with the water. Bring it all up to boil, stirring constantly. When the berries are soft add sugar and cinnamon. Simmer for about 2 minutes and the pectin will be ready. Put it all in a jar or small bowl and let it cool completely before sealing it up.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, toss potatoes and spinach with 2 tablespoons of olive oil and 1/4 teaspoon of the dried onion flakes. Season potatoes and spinach lightly with 1/4 teaspoon of the dried chives. Spread in 12-inch cast iron skillet. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile, in a small bowl whisk together the mayonnaise and yogurt. Season to taste with the vegetable stock powder and the remaining dried chives and parsley. Just before serving top the hot potatoes with the dressing mixture. Serve immediately.

Preheat broiler. Coat a broiler pan with cooking spray. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Lay prosciutto slices over top of chicken and sage leaves. Drizzle with oil and sprinkle with sherry. Broil until chicken is cooked through and prosciutto is crisp. Transfer chicken to a plate and let stand for 5 minutes. Serve.

Trim excess fat from ribs and discard. Place ribs in a large pan and season with salt and pepper to taste. In a small bowl, combine garlic cloves and rosemary. Squeeze lemon into bowl and add olive oil and pepper flakes to taste. Rub mixture onto ribs. Cook ribs, covered in pan with enough hot water to cover 3/4 of the way up the ribs, for 2 1/2 hours in the oven. Add more water to pan as needed to cover ribs. Remove from pan and transfer ribs to a shallow baking dish. Brush ribs with pan juices and sprinkle with remaining garlic-rosemary mixture and additional pepper flakes to taste. Cover and roast until tender, about 1 hour longer. Transfer ribs to a cutting board and let rest for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare barbecue sauce by combining all ingredients in a sauce pan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring frequently. Let sauce cool for 5 minutes

Mix mayonnaise, buttermilk, oil, hot sauce, and 1/4 cup of the Romano cheese until smooth. Mix remaining Romano cheese and basil togetheradd to dressing mixture and stir well. Cover and refrigerate until chilled. Serve as a dip with crackers or as a salad dressing with salad greens and tomatoes.
Toss romaine lettuce in a large bowl with vinaigrette and gorgonzola. Add walnuts and steak. Serve.

Slice plantains in half lengthwise. Scoop out the seeds. Drizzle the inside of the plantains with butter. Sprinkle with whole cloves & cinnamon sticks. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Bake 35 minutes until soft & tender. Melt butter & pour over plantains. Sprinkle with hot sauce. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cut squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Place squash halves, cut side down, in an ungreased 13 by 9-inch baking pan and pour water into the pan so that the squash are almost submerged (about 1 cup water). Bake in preheated oven until squash are tender, about 40 minutes. Meanwhile, whisk together eggs, milk and margarine in a small bowl and season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove squash from oven and drain water from pan. Place 1/3 cup cracker crumbs in bottom of pan. Top with squash halves. Spoon egg mixture into squash halves and sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Top with remaining cracker crumbs and bake in preheated oven until squash are heated through and crumbs are golden brown, about 15 minutes more. Sprinkle with celery salt and black pepper to taste. Serve warm or cold with steamed vegetables and a tossed salad of fresh fruit

Remove husks from corn and clean by removing any silk and wax that may be sticking to the husks. Brush corn with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and cumin seeds. Wrap in foil and place on a baking sheet in the preheated oven for about 35 minutes until tender when pierced with a fork. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly before cutting corn from the cob and removing the husks and silks. Place corn on a serving platter and set aside. In a small bowl combine the green onions and lime juice. Set aside. In a small bowl combine the sugar and cumin seeds and set aside.
