In a large bowl combine the corn with the bell peppers, green onion mixture and cumin mixture. Serve with the lime wedges on the side for squeezing over the corn mixture. Sprinkle with fresh cilantro before serving.

Place pie crusts on plate or plates. Arrange 12 fresh strawberries on each plate. Place 2 tbsp cream cheese in each plate. Put 1/2 cup white corn syrup in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Add 1/4 cup sugar. Stir until dissolved. Remove from heat. Add 1 tbsp cornstarch. Mix. Stir in water. Boil until thickened. Pour over the cream cheese. Add 1 tbsp powdered sugar. Stir until dissolved. Add 1 tbsp strawberry gelatin. Let cool. Add 1/2 cup cold water to a large saucepan. Place over low heat. Add 1/2 cup sugar. Stir until dissolved. Place 2 tbsp powdered sugar into a small bowl. Add 2 tbsp cold water. Stir until smooth. Stir into hot syrup. Pour over gelatin mixture. Stir until smooth. Let cool. Refrigerate until firm. Cut pie into wedges. Serve.

Cut off stems of brussels sprouts. Remove leaves. Rinse and pat dry. Cut in half. In a crock pot combine brussels sprouts with water. Add dijon mustard and season with black pepper. Cook 5 hours or until tender. Serve.

Cream shortening and sugars together until fluffy. Add crushed pineapple and vanillabeat well. Add eggs and beat well after each addition. Add salt and baking sodabeat well. Combine flour and baking powderadd to pineapple mixture alternately with sour milkbeat well after each addition. Drop from teaspoon on ungreased cookie sheetsbake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 5 minutes on cookie sheets before removing to wire racks to cool completely.
Bring milk and rice to a boil in a large saucepan. Add sugar and salt. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and cinnamon. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Stir until heated through. Serve warm.
Fill glass with cracked ice. Add orange juice to taste. Fill glass with apple juice to taste. Top with a splash of lemonade. Stir. Serve.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Stir in the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the pork and brown. Add the cider vinegar, apricot preserves and chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 15 minutes. Add the green and yellow peppers and pineapple chunks. Simmer 15 minutes longer. In a small bowl, whisk the cornstarch with 1/2 cup cold water to make a slurry. Whisk into the sauce. Simmer 10 minutes longer. Serve over rice or noodles.

Place ham in large pot and add enough cold water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook 30 minutes or until ham is very tender. Drain ham and reserve 2 cups of liquid. Rinse ham and pat dry with a paper towel. Cut ham into 1-inch cubes. Remove meat from bone and discard bones and skin. Add ham cubes and 1 1/2 cups of the reserved liquid back to the large pot along with the string beans and potatoes. Cover and bring mixture to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and cook 20 minutes or until beans are tender but still firm and potatoes are tender but retain some firmness and flavor. Add garlic, thyme and pepper and cook 1 minute. Stir in the olive oil and heat through. Serve.

Cut in butter till it is a coarse crumb. Mix milk and water in a bowl. Stir dry ingredients together. Add milk/water mixture and beat well. Place on floured board. Pat out to 1 inch thickness. Cut into rounds. Bake at 350f for 15-20 minutes.

In a small skillet, saute apple pieces in lemon juice until soft. Add cheddar cheesecook until cheese has melted. In a medium skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. On a clean plate, layer half of each tortilla with apple mixture, lettuce leaves, bacon pieces, mayonnaise and cheese. Roll up tortillas starting at wide end of each tortilla. Serve immediately with dipping sauce.
In a large bowl, combine shrimp, grapes and chives. Stir in mayonnaise and olive oil. Spoon over rolls.

In a saucepan, combine the low-fat milk and rum and bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat until the mixture is warm. Add the banana slices and allow them to infuse the liquid for about 1 minute until the banana is tender. Remove the pan from the heat and add the graham crackers and the cinnamon. Whisk the banana cream pudding mix into the warm liquid until the mixture is smooth and well-blended. Pour the mixture into a 9 x 13-inch pan and let cool before serving with a dollop of whipped cream and the raisins scattered on top.

In a saucepan or a skillet over medium heat add 3 tablespoons of oil. Once heated add the chili powder, orange juice, honey, lime juice, cumin, stirring constantly. Once chili mixture begins to thicken add the chocolate, stirring constantly until melted. Remove from heat. Add a small amount of water to the sauce. Use immediately. Serve over fish or chicken. Refrigerate leftovers.

Sautee the shrimp and onions with the garlic cloves. Add the soy sauce and the tomatoes. When they are cooked, add the cornstarch and water. Cook until the cornstarch has dissolved. Add the sugar. Let the mixture boil for a few minutes. Let the mixture cool. Then add the oil. Serve with white rice.

Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Cook beans for 4 minutes or until just tender but still firm. Drain and set aside. Heat oil over high heat in a skillet. Stir fry garlic and star anise for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add beans and stir fry for 1 minute or until beans are heated through. Stir in honey and soy saucecook and stir for 1 minute or until heated through and coating beans evenly. Stir in tabascocook and stir for 1 minute or until heated through and coating beans evenly. Stir in parsleycook and stir for 1 minute or until heated through and parsley is wilted. Serve immediately.

Wash potatoes and cut into quarters. Place in a baking dish with olive oil and seasoning. Cover with foil and place in a preheated oven for about one hour. Remove foil and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for about ten more minutes. Serve warm.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until translucent. Add ground beef and brown. Drain fat. Stir in BBQ sauce and pork and beans until heated through. Bake biscuits according to package directions. Top each with a tablespoon of pork mixture and a slice of cheddar. Sprinkle with paprika and bake until biscuits are heated through. Serves 4.

Cut apples into quarters. Put 2 quarters into each casserole dish. Slice orange into wedges and add to the casseroles. In the bottom of each dish put 5 whole cloves. Add 2 whole nutmegs and 3 cinnamon sticks. Place casseroles into the crock pot. Add 3 cups brown sugar and 1 cup apple cider. Place the casserole into the crock pot. Cover and set to low for 4 hours. After 4 hours add 1 cup apple cider and 1 cup brown sugar. Replace cover and set to low for 3 hours. After 3 hours add 2 cups apple cider and 2 cups brown sugar. Replace cover and set to low for 2 hours. After 2 hours add 1 cup apple cider and 1 cup brown sugar. Replace cover and set to low for 1 hour. After 1 hour add 1 cup apple cider and 1 cup brown sugar. Replace cover and set to low for 1 hour. After 1 hour add 1 cup apple cider and 1 cup brown sugar. Replace cover and set to

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease muffin cups or use paper liners. Mix flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt in a bowl. Whisk eggs and milk in another bowl until smooth. Add oil and mix well. Pour over dry ingredients and add half of the melted butter. Mix just until dry ingredients are moistened. Scoop into prepared muffin cups. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown and firm in the center. Let cool in pan for 5 minutes and brush tops with remaining melted butter.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add celery and onion and cook and stir until onion is tender. Stir in pork sausage and cook until browned. Stir in chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Combine the cheese and croutons and stir into the broth mixture. Simmer for 10 minutes or until the bread is tender and the cheese melts.

Combine the tarragon vinegar, cider vinegar, salt and pepper in a large mixing bowl. Add extra virgin olive oil to taste. Add crabmeat and toss gently to coat evenly with vinegar mixture. Combine the chopped chives with the crumbled melba toast and serve with the crabmeat hoezel as a garnish.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C). Slice carrots on a mandoline into long strips or julienne cut them with a knife and cut them into thin slices 1/4 inch thick. Place them in a 2 quart baking dish and cover them with honey and lemon juice. Sprinkle nutmeg and a bit of salt and pepper over the carrots and cook them in the oven for 30 minutes until they are tender and the honey has thickened. Serve at room temperature or warm.

Heat butter in a small nonstick skillet over medium-low heat. Add mushroomscook and stir for about one minute. Set aside. Heat butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add eggscook and stir until eggs are set. Remove from heat. Place mushrooms and eggs in a greased 10-inch springform pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Whisk together baking powder and milk. Pour milk mixture into springform pan and sprinkle cheese over top. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes or until a golden brown crust forms.
Cream together in the food processor until smooth. Serve with crackers or fruit.

Melt butter in large pot over medium heat. Add onions and carrots. Cook until softened. Add potatoes and milk and simmer 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and add bay leaf and thyme. Cook 15 minutes more. Remove bay leaf and thyme. Puree half the soup in blender until smooth and add back to pot. Stir in remaining potatoes. Serve hot.

Trim and quarter savoy cabbage. Cut onion into ¼ inch wedges. Heat 1 teaspoon of extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic cloves and fennel seeds. Cook for 1 minute. Add cabbage wedges to skillet. Cook cabbage for 2 minutes. Add onions to skillet and cook for another 2 minutes. Add 2 tablespoons of extra virgin olive oil to skillet. Add balsamic vinegar. Cook cabbage mixture for another 2 minutes. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Put the tuna into a food processor and blend to a smooth puree. Stir in the wheat germ and egg. Place in a bowl. Add the tomato juice and dill. Stir. Shape into 1 inch balls and dip each ball into the flour. Dip each ball into the egg mixture. Then dip into the bread crumbs. Heat cooking oil in a deep frying pan over medium high heat. Add the tuna croquettes. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until golden. Drain. Serve with hot sauce.

Heat olive oil to medium heat. Add sage leaves to pan. Saute until fragrant (about 2 minutes). Add chops to panbrown both sides for about 2 minutes each. Add rosemary leaves to pansaute for 2 minutes. Add pepper blend to panstir well to coat chops with pepper blend. Sprinkle chops with salt. Serve with rice or couscous. Serves 6 people.
Muddle all fruit in pitcher. Add ice and pomegranate juice. Add papaya nectar to taste. Stir well and serve.

Add 1 tbsp of olive oil to a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic granules and saute until fragrant. Add water to the skillet and bring to a boil. Add tomato paste to the skillet. Add tomatoes to the water. Add greens to the skillet. Saute until greens are tender. Drizzle balsamic vinegar to taste. Serve immediately.

Prepare sweet potatoes by boiling them in salted water for about an hour or until tender. Drain. Peel the sweet potatoes. Cut them in half. Place the sweet potatoes on a baking sheet. Drizzle the sweet potatoes with the olive oil. Add the shallots and salt & pepper. Roast for about an hour or until the skin is brown and crisp. Remove the skin from the potatoes. Add the parsley. Serve.

Season pork with soy sauce and sprinkle with ginger and brown sugar. Drizzle with sesame oil. Heat a grill or broiler on high. Broil for 8 minutes or until meat reaches a internal temperature of 160 degrees. Combine honey and sesame seeds and place on plate. Slice pork and serve with sauce.

In a large skillet, heat olive oil. Sprinkle chicken with black pepper. Add chicken to hot oil. Cook chicken until done. Remove chicken from skillet. Keep warm. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add onion. Cook onion until it begins to soften. Stir in garlic cloves. Cook for 1 minute. Add apple cider vinegar to skillet. Stir to dissolve. Add thyme leaves to skillet. Cook for 30 seconds. Stir in broth. Bring to a boil. Add chicken to skillet. Simmer 3-5 minutes. Serve.

Boil the potato until tender and drain well. Peel and dice the potato into cubes and add to a mixing bowl. Add the mustards, vinegars, shallots, oil, parsley, salt and pepper to the mixing bowl. Toss the potato cubes with the dressing until well combined and serve at room temperature.

Put one orange in a blender with two tablespoons of juice, two tablespoons of honey and 1/2 a cup of ice cubes. Blend for 1 minute or until smooth. Transfer to a glass and repeat with remaining oranges. Add grapes and strawberries to each glass. Garnish with kiwi fruits and mint leaves.
Remove corn husks and silks from corn. Place in a shallow baking pan. In a small saucepan melt butter. Add salt and herbs. Pour over corn. Bake at 375 degrees for 15-18 minutes. Serve with a knife.

Boil ziti pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. While ziti is cooking, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic until softened about 5 minutes. Stir in parmesan cheese and cook 1 minute more. Drain cooked ziti. Transfer into a large bowl. Add cottage cheese and eggs and blend with a fork until combined. Stir in cooked ziti and garlic mixture. Spoon into an 8x8 baking dish. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for 25 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serves 4

Beat eggs and add water. Stir in oats. Add onion. Add salt, pepper, thyme and rosemary. Add meat. Combine well. Spoon mixture into a loaf pan. Pour ketchup over meatloaf. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 45-50 minutes.

Season the chicken breast halves with salt and pepper. Dip chicken breast halves into flour seasoned with salt and pepper. Dip chicken into eggs and then into the fine breadcrumbs. Place the chicken in an 8" x 12" pan and brush with melted butter. Pour the cognac over the chicken and let it soak for 2 minutes. Spoon the cognac into a 1 cup measuring cup. Add cream and stir. Pour the sauce over the chicken and bake until the chicken is tender and the sauce is slightly thickened, about 30 minutes at 375 degrees.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Pat the salmon fillets dry with paper towels. Place the fillets skin side down in a shallow baking dish or baking pan. Sprinkle the top side with coarse salt and fresh ground black pepper. Pour the olive oil over the fillets and drizzle the top side with extra virgin olive oil. Bake the salmon for approximately 10 minutes or until the salmon is opaque and flaky. Serve with lemon slices on the side and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 375f. In a medium bowl combine 1 cup mozzarella cheese and 1/4 cup chopped bacon. With a sharp knife make a pocket on the inside of the chicken breast halves. Stuff the cheese mixture inside of the chicken. In a small bowl combine 1 beaten egg with the breadcrumbs. Coat chicken with egg mixture. Place chicken on a baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, cook ragu sauce with chicken broth according to package directions. Drain pasta. Toss pasta with ragu sauce and serve over chicken. Enjoy!

Add a little olive oil or melted butter into a large skillet and saute the shallots until they are translucent. Add the dill and saute another minute or so. Add the salmon fillets and cook until golden brown on both sides and just cooked through (about five minutes). Remove salmon from pan and flake into chunks and set aside on a plate. Add a little oil or melted butter and saute the shrimp until pink. Remove from pan and set aside on a plate. Add a little oil or melted butter and saute the pasta until al dente and drain very well. Add the fish stock and the white wine and bring to a boil. Add the salmon and shrimp and cook for about a minute or so to heat through and add the cream and stir well and add salt and pepper to taste. Add the pasta and stir until it is well coated with the sauce and serve immediately.

Place the turkey in a roasting pan. Season the turkey with salt and pepper. Place the turkey in the oven and roast the turkey for about 30 minutes or until the internal temperature reads 165 degrees Fahrenheit. Remove the turkey from the roasting pan and tent it with foil. Pour the apricot preserves in a medium sauce pan over medium heat and add the Kahlua. Bring the preserves and Kahlua to a boil, stirring constantly. Pour the Kahlua mixture over the turkey. Let the turkey rest for about 15 minutes before serving. Enjoy!

Combine the vegetable oil, shallots and chicken stock in a large sauce pan and bring to a boil. Add the tarragon vinegar and heat until simmering. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the light cream with the cornstarch and grainy mustard. Gradually add to the sauce and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes or until thickened. Remove the sauce from the heat and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cut the chicken breasts into thin strips and cook in the sauce for 5 minutes or until done. Sprinkle with dried tarragon. Serve over rice.
Combine all ingredients in saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until thickened (about 20 minutes). Chill well before serving.
Blend all ingredients except the tomatoes together. Add tomatoes last. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before using. Keeps several weeks. Serve with pasta salad.

Blanch the artichokes in a pot of boiling salted water for 30-60 seconds or until they are still bright green. Remove with a slotted spoon and plunge them into a large bowl of ice water to stop the cooking. Drain and pat them dry. Add the artichokes to a food processor and pulse until the mixture is finely chopped. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice and garlic. Add this mixture to the food processor and blend until combined. Season with fresh ground black pepper to taste. Toss with the freshly chopped parsley. Serve with crackers or thinly sliced bread.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add new potatoes, reduce to simmer. Cook until tender, about 10 to 12 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 450 degrees. Season chickens with salt and pepper. Place in a roasting pan. Arrange the potatoes around the chickens. Wash the asparagus. Cut the tough ends off. Pull the asparagus apart into pieces. Arrange the asparagus around the chickens. Rub the lemon zest over the chickens. Sprinkle the chickens with thyme. Drizzle the chickens with olive oil. Bake until golden brown, 40 to 50 minutes. Transfer the chickens to a serving platter. Squeeze the juice from the lemons over the chickens. Serve the chicken and potatoes with the asparagus.

Trim green beans ends and cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Slice radishes crosswise into thin rounds. Slice prosciutto into thin strips. Drizzle sherry over radishesset aside. Combine mustard, olive oil, lemon juice and chives in a bowlset aside. Combine green beans, radishes and prosciutto in a large bowldrizzle with dressing. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with cheeseserve at room temperature or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Mix soy sauce with honey in a small bowl. Marinate the chicken in this mixture for 1 hour. Heat the canola oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic cloves and saute for 1 minute. Add the seasoning to the skillet and saute 1 minute longer or until aromatic. Place the chicken in the skillet and cook 4 minutes on each side or until done. Thread the chicken, green and red peppers on skewers alternately. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side or until done. Serve warm with horseradish sauce.

Coat fish fillets with saltine crackers. In medium skillet, saute onion in olive oil until tender. Add garlic and Italian seasoning. Saute until fragrant. Add wine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook until wine has almost evaporated. Remove from heat. Add paprika and stir in cod. Bake at 350 fahrenheit for 20 minutes. Serve with parmesan cheese and crackers.
Mix all ingredients together. Let sit for a few hours before serving.

Preheat grill to medium heat. Lightly oil grill grate or grill pan. Place mushrooms on grate or in pan. Sprinkle with salt and place over heat on grill or grill pan until golden brown, 5 to 7 minutes. Turn mushrooms and continue cooking 5 to 7 minutes longer or until golden brown on second side and tender throughout. Place on serving platter and drizzle with green chili sauce. Sprinkle with cheese and grill until cheese melts, 1 to 2 minutes.

Melt white chocolate and 2 tablespoons of the milk in a saucepan over low heat. Stir until chocolate is completely melted. Remove from heat. Add remaining milk and the vanilla extract. Stir. Place hot chocolate in a large mug. Top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with orange nonpareils.

In a large saucepan on low heat, melt the butter. Stir in the evaporated milk and brown sugar. Cook 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add pecans. Continue cooking until thick. Pour into a greased 9 inch square pan. Cool slightly before cutting.

Combine all filling ingredients in a large skillet. Bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat to low and simmer until cabbage is tender. (30-40 minutes.) In a small bowl combine the cream cheese and butter. Stir in the flour until well blended. Roll out the pastry on a floured surface. Cut out a circle slightly larger than the pie pan. Place the pastry in the pie pan. Pour in the filling. Brush the pastry with the egg wash. Sprinkle with the salt and pepper. Cut a few slits in the top crust. Bake at 400 degrees F for 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown. (If the crust is browning too quickly place aluminum foil over the top.) Let cool for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Boil water in a large saucepan with baking soda until foam appears on top. Remove foam with a spoon. Add tea bagslet steep 5 minutes. Add lemon wedges and sugar. Pour tea into a pitcherlet cool to room temperature. Add cold water to fill pitcherserve over ice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together the butter, brown sugar and vanilla. Add boiling water. Add the flour and baking soda. Stir in the oats. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto cookie sheets. Flatten each cookie with the palm of your hand. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes.

Place chicken breasts in a large shallow baking dish. Drizzle marmalade over chickenrub marmalade mixture all over chicken. Sprinkle chicken evenly with thyme leaves. Pour chicken broth over chicken. Sprinkle brown sugar evenly over chicken. Cover dish tightly with plastic wraprefrigerate overnight. Remove chicken from marinade. Drain marinade from chicken into a bowlreserve marinade for another use. Discard thyme leaves. Preheat broiler on high heat. Place chicken on broiler rack coated with cooking spray. Broil chicken 4 to 6 inches from heat for 5 minutes on each side or until a thermometer registers 170 degrees f (77 degrees c). Top each chicken breast with marmaladebroil an additional 1 to 2 minutes or until marmalade bubbles slightly. Serve chicken immediately.
1. In a mug or small glass heat boiling water. Add 2 tablespoons of chocolate syrup and 2 tablespoons of milk. Stir. 2. Add 2 tablespoons of kahlua. 3. Add whipped cream and stir.

Combine soy sauce and juices in a small bowl and set aside. Combine remaining ingredients in a large resealable plastic bag and add shark steaks. Seal bag and marinate in refrigerator for 2 hours turning occasionally. Remove steaks from bag and place them in a shallow dish. Pour marinade over steaks and refrigerate for 1 hour. Grill over medium coals for about 7 minutes per side or until steaks reach desired doneness. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving with remaining marinade on side dish.

Combine bouillon and 1 cup chicken stock in 3-quart saucepan. Add turkey and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer 15 minutes. Add carrots, celery and onion. Cover and simmer 5 minutes. Add rice, tomatoes with juice and 1 cup stock. Bring to a simmer. Reduce heat and simmer 25-30 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in parsley and thyme. Serve with crusty bread.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heatadd onion, corn, oregano, pepper and tomatoescook 10 minutes, stirring frequentlyadd egg mixturecook until eggs are set, 5 minutestop with Swiss cheesecook until cheese meltsserve hot.

Cream together butter and brown sugar until light. Add yolks one at a time. Add vanilla. Mix well. Add flour one cup at a time. Mix well. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for about 10 minutes. Cool.
Cook rice as usual. Mix together sour cream and green onionsadd to cooked rice. Stir in pepper and black pepper to taste. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Add cider, molasses, cinnamon sticks, lemon juice and cloves to a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture begins to boil. Cook until mixture thickens slightly. Cool to room temperature. Serve warm.

Sauté onion, garlic and lemon rind in oil in large saucepan until tender. Stir in mushroom. Cook mushroom mixture, stirring constantly until mushrooms are tender. Stir in rice, stirring until rice is coated with oil. Add 1 1/2 cups stock. Cook over medium heat until stock is absorbed. Stir in wine. Cook until wine is absorbed. Add 1/2 cup stock. Cook until stock is absorbed. Repeat procedure until all stock is used. Stir in spinach. Cook until spinach is wilted. Stir in thyme. Cook for 1 minute. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer risotto to a serving dish.

Brown pork cubes in butter. Remove pork. Brown and crumble chicken cubes in same butter. Add potatoes, carrots, onion and tomatoes. Add seasonings. Cover. Cook 15 minutes. Add pork. Cook an additional 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Drizzle a little olive oil flavored cooking spray on a baking sheetrub the sheet with your fingers to coat it evenly with the spray. Place the beans in a large bowladd the garlic powder and red pepper flakes. Stir well to combine. Arrange the beans in a single layer on the baking sheetdrizzle with the olive oil spray again. Bake until the beans are golden brown, about 30 minutes, stirring twice during baking. Transfer the beans to a large serving dishsprinkle with sea salt to taste. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Peel and dice potatoes into small cubes. Boil the potatoes until tender. Drain and cool. Place in large mixing bowl with black beans and green onions. In a small bowl, stir together sour cream and freshly squeezed lemon juice until well blended. Add mixture to potatoes along with salt and fresh ground white pepper to taste. Mix well with potato mixture and chill in refrigerator for several hours before serving. Serve with mayonnaise and fresh chopped chives on top.

In large saucepan heat oil until hot and saute ham and mushrooms until tender. Add linguine and toss with ham and mushroomscook for about 2 minutes. Add mustard and heat until melted and stir in heavy creamadd salt and pepper to taste and toss with linguine and ham mixture. Pour into heated pasta bowltop with Parmesan Cheese and serve immediately.

In a large bowl beat the egg yolks with the melted butter and salt. Beat in the mashed potatoes slowly while stirring constantly. Place in a greased casserole and bake in a 350 degree oven for 50-60 minutes or until brown on top. Serve hot with a pat of butter.

Preheat oven to 375f. Trim stems from mushrooms and discardclean gills from mushroom caps. Cut caps into 1/4 inch thick pieces and set aside. Heat 2 Tbsp of olive oil in skillet over medium heatadd garlic clove. Cook for 30 seconds. Stir in tarragoncook 30 seconds. Stir in mushroomscook over moderately low heat for 5 minutes, until mushrooms are tender. Season mushrooms to taste with salt and pepper. Wash spinach in a bowl of cold waterdrain wellpat dry between towels. Arrange spinach in a large serving bowlseason to taste with salt and fresh ground pepper. Add mushroomstoss well. Drizzle over remaining 2 Tbsp olive oil and toss well to coat. Sprinkle tarragon over saladtoss gently to mix. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Heat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease 9x13 inch baking dish or 9 individual ramekins with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, whisk eggs with milk, pumpkin puree, vanilla, pumpkin pie spice and brown sugar until blended. Dip bread in mixturecoat completely. Arrange bread in baking dish or ramekinsbake until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean or bread is golden brown on top, about 20 minutes in a baking dish or 10 minutes in ramekins. Serve warm.

Melt butter in a large skillet. Add garlic paste and cook 1 minute. Add mushrooms, soy sauce, sugar, lemon juice & water. Cook 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add olive oil and stir in. Cook 2 minutes longer. Season to taste with freshly ground black pepper.

Place rump roast in crock pot. Add beef broth, condensed french onion soup, beer. Cook on low for 7 to 8 hours or until fork tender. Remove the rump roast from the crock pot. Remove the bones from the roast. Slice the meat and serve it hot on french rolls with melted butter.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine oatmeal, margarine and peanut butter in a large bowlmix well. Stir in vanilla. Add remaining dry ingredientsmix well. Stir in chocolate chips and nutsmix well. Spread mixture into an ungreased 15x10x1 baking pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until lightly browned around edgesstir every 5 minutes during last 5 minutes of baking time. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

Melt margarine in a 2-qt saucepan over low heat. Mix in wine, cinnamon, sugar, lemon juice and vanilla extract. Cover and cook over medium heat until apples are softened, 12-15 minutes. Pour into a bowl or individual dessert dishes. Let stand until cool, then refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with freshly whipped cream.

Peel potatoes and cut into cubes. Make a paste of coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chillies, salt and red chilli powder. Marinate potatoes with this paste. Add a little water to make it a paste. Add in egg. Shape into small kababs. Grill on an iron skillet with little oil or kadai. Serve with mint chutney.
Add hot water to cocoa powder in a mug and stir well. Add in other ingredients and stir again. Microwave for 1 minute on high. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare cake mix as directed on box. Bake as directed on box. While cake is baking prepare frosting. In large bowl mix milk with chocolate frosting. Once cake is completely cool remove the top layer of frosting with knife. Fill cake with chocolate frosting. Put back on top layer of cake. Put the cake in the refrigerator for about an hour to set. Put the top layer of cake back on. Put the cake back in the refrigerator for about another hour. When the cake is completely set take off the top layer of frosting again and place a serving slice on the cake. Serve.

In a small bowl combine paprika, thyme leaves, salt and pepper. Set aside. Place a large saucepan over medium heat. Add oil and heat until hot but not smoking. Add shrimp and cook until pink and firm, about 1 minute per side. Remove shrimp and place on a plate. Add garlic and scallion and cook for 1 minute. Add papaya and cook for 1 minute. Add the lime juice and simmer until the papaya is tender. Pour sauce over shrimp. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper and serve.

In a cocktail shaker combine lime juice, lemon juice, agave nectar, tequila and grand marnier. Add ice. Shake vigorously for 20 seconds. Pour mixture through a strainer over ice in a margarita glass. Garnish with lime wedge.

Cut onions into small dice. In a small bowl, whisk vinegar, worcestershire sauce and water together. In another small bowl, whisk together oil and tarragon vinegar. Toss onions with oil mixture. Divide lettuce among 4 plates. Divide onions among salad plates. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve.

Wash and scrub potatoes. Slice potatoes into 1/2 inch thick slices. Dip slices into beaten eggs. Dip slices into paprika and garlic salt. Place in heated oil. Fry until golden brown on both sides. Serve with ketchup.
Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into highball glass. Garnish with orange slices and cherries.

Cut steak into cubes. Toss cubes with pineapple, ginger crystals, brown sugar, black pepper and teriyaki sauce. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour. Grill or broil to taste. Serve with port wine sauce.

In a saucepan over low heat melt 1/2 cup of the margarine. Add all of the cones of piloncillo (3/4 cup). Add all of the cinnamon sticks. Slowly bring to a boil. Turn off heat. Stir in 1/2 cup of water. Allow to cool for 5 minutes. Add all of the remaining margarine. Stir in all of the raisins. Add all of the green onion. Remove from heat. Allow to cool for 5 minutes. Add all of the bread to a large mixing bowl. Add 1 1/2 cups of water to a small saucepan. Stir in all of the cheese until melted. Stir in all of the pecans. Pour over bread. Cover with plastic wrap. Allow to sit for 1 1/2 hours. Serve with additional water and additional cinnamon sticks.

In a pan over medium heat brown sausage. Add buttermilk to gravy. Cook until gravy has thickened. Add flour, cook until flour is no longer gritty. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over hot biscuits.

Combine orange juice and orange blossom water in a small bowl and set aside until ready to use. Cut strawberries into halves and place in a large bowl. Toss with orange juice mixture and sugar to taste. Refrigerate 2 hours before serving.
Combine oil, garlic, flour, and seasonings in crockpot. Add beef pieces. Add wine, soup, and chicken broth. Cook on low for 8-10 hours. Add mushrooms. Cook for additional 1-2 hours. Serve over rice.

Bring 1 quart of chicken broth to a boil in a large saucepan. Add 1 large chopped onion and 1 1/4 cups of pumpkin. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Add dry sherry and simmer 5 more minutes. Add remaining 1 quart of broth and bring to a boil. Add 1 cup of tomato paste and 4 cups of whole tomatoes. Simmer for 1 hour. Add 2 tablespoons of dried tarragon and 1/2 cup of heavy cream. Add 1/2 cup of freshly grated parmesan cheese and stir. Taste for seasonings. Can be served with a dollop of whipped cream or a sprinkle of freshly grated nutmeg.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. In a small skillet over medium heat, add the butter and the hazelnuts. Cook until the butter is foaming and the hazelnuts are lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Place the brussels sprouts in a roasting pan and drizzle with the butter and hazelnuts. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper. Drizzle with water. Roast until tender and golden brown, about 25-30 minutes. Sprinkle with freshly chopped parsley just before serving.

Preheat oven to 400f. Wash and dry the potatoes. Cut each in half lengthwise and then into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place on a baking sheet and sprinkle with salt and coriander. Toss to coat. Place the baking sheet in the oven and roast for about 30 minutes or until the slices begin to brown. Remove from the oven and toss the slices with the chili powder. Sprinkle with black pepper. Return the baking sheet to the oven and roast for an additional 5 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Remove and top with chopped fresh chives. Sprinkle with olive oil and serve with sour cream.

Prepare pork by scoring the skin and rubbing it with lime juice and salt. Wrap pork with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 8 hours. Preheat grill to medium-high. Remove pork from refrigerator and discard plastic wrap. Grill pork for 15-20 minutes. Let pork sit on grill for 5 minutes. Transfer pork to cutting board. Cut pork into thin slices. Cut away excess fat and gristle. Slice pork thinly across the grain. Thinly slice the scallions and the tomatoes. Slice the avocado into thin rounds. Shred the pork. Mix together salsa and lime juice. Place pork on a serving platter. Top with salsa mixture and avocado slices. Top with scallions and tomatoes. Serve with grilled tortillas.

Grate cheese in food processor or with cheese graterprocess until fine. Place in bowl and add herbs and sesame seedsmix well. Set aside. In small bowl beat eggs until foamy. Stir in winemix well. Set aside. Peel potatocut into small cubescook in boiling water until tenderdrain and cool. In small bowl mix cooked potato with egg mixture. Spread cheese in greased 1 1/2 quart baking dishplace mixture in center of cheeseform into ballsroll in sesame seeds. Bake 45 minutes at 375 degrees. Serve at once.

Mix cookie mix with egg and butter and mix well until smooth consistency. Divide dough into 1/2 cup balls. Roll ball between palms and flatten into 2 1/2 inch circle. Place on parchment lined cookie sheet 2 inches apart. Bake 8 - 10 minutes. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

Prepare grill for medium heat (about 400 degrees). Cut tuna steaks into 3 pieces and season with salt and pepper. Place tuna and pineapple chunks on a large plate and toss with juice of half the lime and a few turns of the grinder. Place tuna on the grill and cook for 3 minutes per side for rare (medium rare). Remove and cut pineapple into quarters and place on the grill for a few minutes. Place tuna and pineapple pieces on top of tuna and cook for a few more minutes until heated through and pineapple is soft. Cut tuna steaks into quarters and plate with pineapple pieces and cilantro sprigs and serve with rice and a side salad.

Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain bacon on a paper towel and reserve bacon grease in skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened and clear. Stir in cabbage and sugar and cook until wilted and tender. Add vinegar and salt and pepper to taste and cook until mixture is bubbly and thickened slightly. Stir in reserved bacon pieces and serve warm or cool and refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 4 servings.

In a 2-quart casserole dish, mix soup and milk over medium heat until hot. Stir in chicken and green beanscover and keep warm while preparing the biscuits. Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Cut each biscuit into 4 wedges. Arrange the wedges evenly in the casserole dish. Melt the butter and spread it over the wedges evenly. Sprinkle evenly with croutons. Sprinkle evenly with the mushrooms and cheesedot with lemon juice and mayonnaise. Bake, uncovered for 30 to 35 minutes or until crust is lightly browned. Serve hot with additional butter if desired.

Shave scallions and thinly slice radishes into half-moon slices. Whisk together creme fraiche and sugar. Add radishes and scallions to bowl and toss to combine. Taste and add more creme fraiche or sugar if desired.

In heavy saucepan cook onions and leek in hot oil over medium heat until tender (about 5 minutes)add apples and cook 5 minutes longer. Stir in broth, bay leaf and thyme. Cover and bring to a boil over high heatreduce heat and cook 15 minutes or until apples are tender. Stir in potatoes and evaporated milkcook 5 minutes longer or until potatoes are tender. In food processor or blender purée soup until smooth (mixture will be thick)return mixture to saucepan and stir in brie and season with salt and pepper. Heat throughserve sprinkled with chives or freshly chopped dill and thinly sliced pumpernickel bread.

In a large bowl, combine flour and salt. Using an electric mixer, beat egg yolks and water together until light and fluffy, then add the egg yolks and beat until the batter is very light and thick. With the mixer on low speed, gradually add the flour mixture and beat until smooth. Add the oil and beat until smooth and well combined. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least one hour or up to one day. Preheat oven to 425f. Bring a large pot of salted water to boiling. Cook the egg noodles according to the package directionsdrain and rinse with cold water. Meanwhile, unroll the dough and cut into four rectangles. Working one at a time, lightly dust the work surface with flour and roll out the dough into a rectangle about 1/8th-inch thick and 9 inches wide. Using a sharp knife, cut the dough into strips that are about 1/2-inch wide and long enough to go around the outside of the noodle container. Carefully wrap each strip around the container. Using your fingers, gently press the stri

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C. Grease a 20cm (8in) cake pan. Place 150g butter into a large mixing bowl with 300g brown sugar. Sift together 200g flour with 1 tsp baking powder. Whisk the egg yolks with the remaining butter until pale. Beat in the brown sugar mixture with a wooden spoon. Sift in the flour mixture. Beat in the egg whites until stiff. Spoon the mixture into the prepared pan. Spoon over 100g of jam. Sprinkle over the cinnamon. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes until golden brown. Serve warm with a dollop of whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. In a medium sized bowl combine flour and butter. Stir in eggs, salt and milk until a smooth dough forms. Place dough in a pie plate or a square baking dish. Place the broccoli in the dough in the center of the pan. Layer bacon over the broccoli. Top with the remaining cheese and onions. Bake for 1 hour or until set and golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Cut bread in half lengthwise. Lay flat side down in greased 11x7 baking dish. Layer ham & broccoli over bread slices. Mix eggs, milk & dry mustard togetherpour over ham & broccoli mixture. Cover with cheese slices. Bake at 350f for about 20 minutes or until eggs are set & cheese is melted.

Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish or a 9x9x2 inch loaf pan. Crumble 12 slices of bread and place in a large bowl. Pour milk over crumbles and let stand for 30 minutes. In a large bowl, beat eggs with sugar and brown sugar until sugar is dissolved. Stir in milk mixture and butterstir in vanilla extract. In a small bowl, stir together flour and nutmegsprinkle over bread mixture. Fold in pecans. Pour batter into prepared dish or loaf pan. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for 25 minutes more or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add the pasta and cook until al dente, stirring occasionally. Drain the pasta in a colander or strainer. Return the pasta to the pot or a large bowl. Pour in the half-and-half and the butter. Cook over medium-low heat until the sauce is bubbly and thickens slightly, 4-6 minutes. Remove from the heat and add the broccoli florets and the red pepper flakes, if usingstir well. Transfer the pasta mixture to a bowl and sprinkle with the cheeses and the basil. Toss well until the cheeses are completely melted and the sauce is smooth. Serve the pasta warm. Garnish with additional basil leaves if desired.

In a large skillet brown meat with crushed tomatoes, salt, pepper and garlic powder until meat is no longer pink. Drain fat from pan. Add beef broth. Add green bell peppers cut into 1 inch stripssimmer over medium heat until tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in cooked rice and Italian seasoning. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer until heated through about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Melt butter in 2-quart sauce pan over low heatcook and stir 30 secondsgradually add 1 cup flour, cook and stir 1 minute longergradually add 1 cup whole milkcook and stir 1 minute longergradually add remaining 1 cup flourcook and stir 1 minute longergradually add 1/2 cup whole milkcook and stir 1 minute longergradually add eggscook and stir 1 minute longercook and stir 1 minute longerremove from heatstir in saltcook and stir 1 minute longertransfer to blendercoverblend on high speed 1 minutepour into pancook 2 minutes longerblend on low speed 1 minutereturn to pancook 1 minute longerblend on low speed 1 minutepour into bowlrefrigerate 1 hour before serving.
Pour the water into a small pot and add the pumpkin. Cook until tender. Add the sugar and soy sauce. Cook for 5 minutes more and remove from heat.

Brown ground beef over medium high heat until it is no longer pink. Drain grease and add all remaining ingredients. Cook for 10 minutes over medium heat. Stir occasionally. Serve with hot dog buns or rolls.
Combine all vegetables and stir in dressing until well-coated. Cover and refrigerate at least 15 minutes. Serve cold. Toss with cooked rice. Makes about 1/2 cup.
Combine brown sugar, paprika, onion powder and salt in small bowl. Rub over chicken breasts. Place on broiler pan. Broil 5 minutes. Turn. Broil 3 to 5 minutes longer or to desired doneness.

Cook chicken and set aside. Dice onion and add to soup. Add in the chicken. Add the cream of mushroom and mushroom and cook on low for 2 hours. Add the green chilies and garlic salt and pepper. Add the rice. Cook on low until the rice is tender. Serve hot. You can also add a few handfuls of chopped celery to the soup.

Place fillet on a platter or platter-sized plate and sprinkle top with dill weed. Place zucchini and carrot on platter and surround fish fillet. Add lemon juice and lemon-pepper seasoning. Brush vegetables and fish fillet with lemon juice and lemon pepper mixture and place on top of vegetables in microwave safe dish. Cover and place in microwave and cook on high for 8 minutes. Remove and allow fish fillet and vegetables to stand for 5 minutes. Remove from platter and serve immediately. Serves one.

Remove the cod from its packaging. Wrap with plastic wrap or parchment paper. Place the wrapped cod on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Cover with cling film. Smoke with wood chips for 1 2 hours. To make parsley sauce, heat the oil in a saucepan. Add the onion and fry gently for 2-3 minutes. Add the flour and stir to blend. Add the milk slowly stirring all the time. Cook over a moderate heat for 2-3 minutes until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Put the cod on a plate. Pour over some of the parsley sauce. Sprinkle with some fresh parsley. Serve.

Sprinkle the fish fillets generously with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat a small amount of oil in a frying pan over a medium heat. Dip the fish fillets in the flour and shake off the excess. Pan-fry the fish for 1 minute on each side. Set aside. Bring a large pan of water to the boil. Drop in the spring onions and cook for 30 seconds. Drain well. Add the lemon juice and squeeze over the fish. Add the coriander and stir well. Arrange the fish fillets on a serving platter. Pour the sauce over the fish. Garnish each fillet with the scotch bonnet peppers. Serve.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain well and set aside. Meanwhile, stir the dressing and olives in a small bowl. Add the pasta to the dressing mixture and toss to coat. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and serve.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add rice. Cover. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Let stand covered for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Add salt. Transfer to a serving platter. Drizzle with vegetable oil. Serve warm.

Cut chuck roast into cubes about two inches square. Place roast in a large pot of cold water. Add soy sauce, rosemary, thyme, garlic powder, bay leaf, peppercorns, and one-half teaspoon of salt. Bring to a boil and cook roast for three to four hours until tender. Remove roast from brothshred meat with a fork. Place beef back into brothcook over a low heat until ready to serve. Serve with French rolls.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Season turkey with salt and pepper and brown in butter for about 2-3 minutes per side. Sprinkle turkey with soul seasoning and old bay seasoningadd broth and bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for about 30 minutes or until turkey is tender. Drain broth from pan and return turkey to pan. Add cornstarch mixture and cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Add cream and bring to a boilcook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Add parsley and cook until wilted. Serve with steamed rice.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the beef and drain. In a large bowl combine the cooked pasta and sauce. In a medium bowl beat the eggs and add the ricotta cheese. Add the parsley, mozzarella and parmesan and mix well. Spread half the spaghetti mixture in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Top with half of the remaining spaghetti mixture and half of the egg mixture. Repeat layers once more. Sprinkle the top with the remaining egg mixture and bake for 40 minutes. Serve hot.

Cut the rye bread in half and spread each side with a thin layer of cream cheese and blue cheese. Wrap each sandwich with bacon slices. Grill over medium heat for about 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown.

Cook the rotini according to the package directions. While the rotini is cooking, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the broccoli florets and sauté until crisp-tender. Set aside. Drizzle the chicken with oil. Sprinkle salt and pepper over the chicken. Sear the chicken until golden brown on each side. Remove the chicken from the skillet and cut into bite sized pieces. Set aside. Return the skillet to medium heat. Add the pasta and broccoli to the skillet. Stir in the chicken. Add the remaining oil and stir. Stir in the parmesan. Serve.

Slice the sweet onions in half lengthwise. Cut off the root end. Slice each half into 6 wedges and set aside. To make the potato filling combine the hash browns with bouillon granules and pepper in a medium bowl. Use your hands to form the mixture into 6 balls. Place one ball of potato filling in the center of each half of sweet onions. Fold up the sides of each half. Wrap each with 2 pieces of tin foil. Place them in the baking pan and bake them for 45 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for 5 minutes longer or until browned.

Melt butter in large saucepan set over low heat. Whisk in the cream. Increase the heat to medium-high, bring to boil whisking frequently. Reduce the heat to low, simmer for 1 minute then remove from the heat. Whisk in the lemon zest, juice, salt and pepper. Pour the lemon sauce into the pasta pot, then add the pasta. Stir to coat the pasta with the sauce. Place the pan in the sink then pour the hot pasta into the colander set over the bowl to catch any leftover sauce. When the pasta has finished draining, add it to the sauce pan with the remaining sauce to reheat. Divide the pasta among serving dishes, add the cheese and garnish with the fresh herbs.

For pie crust, combine flour, brown sugar, cinnamon and salt in a large bowl. Add cubed cold butter to flour mixture. Mix with a pastry blender or two knives until crumbs form. Add milk gradually until dough is formed. Roll dough into two ballsone for top crust and one for bottom crust. Wrap top crust in plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to use. Wrap bottom crust in plastic wrap. Refrigerate until ready to use. Heat oven to 425 degrees. Place apple slices in a 9-inch pie plate. Sprinkle with caramel flavoring. Sprinkle apples with peanuts. Top with pie crust. Bake until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Drizzle with powdered sugar.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Crack the eggs into a small bowl and place the bowl of eggs into the boiling water for 4 minutes. While the eggs are cooking, prepare your griddle or frying pan for cooking the eggs on the griddle or frying pan. Place the eggs in the pan when they are done cooking in the boiling water. Cover the pan and cook for about 2 minutes more or until the eggs are soft set. Top the eggs with shredded cheese and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve with salsa or sour cream and enjoy!

In a small bowl mix together the egg and water until the egg is combined with the water. Spread the mixture over the bread and place in the toaster or broiler. Cut the eggplant into thin slices and place on the panini press. Top with the tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Cook until the eggplant is tender and the tomatoes are cooked. Add the garlic and thyme to the panini. Top the panini with the parmesan cheese and put the sandwich in the toaster until the cheese is melted. Put the sandwich on a cutting board and slice it in half. Spread mayonnaise on the bottom half of the bread. Place the top half of the sandwich on top. Serve.

In a small bowl, whisk the horseradish with the lemon juice until smooth. Set aside. In the bowl of an electric mixer, combine the trout with the butter, cream cheese, sour cream, horseradish mixture, and the pepper and nutmeg to taste. With the mixer on low speed, mix until smooth, about 2 minutes. Transfer the mixture to an ovenproof dish. Garnish with chives before serving.

Slice cauliflower into florets. Dip into egg, then into crisco coated flour. Place on a baking sheet with a rack. Bake at 425 degrees for about 25-30 minutes until tender and golden brown. Serve with warm pesto sauce for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease cookie sheets. Cream butter in large bowl with sugaradd brown sugar. Mix well. Add eggs one at a time. Stir in vanilla. Sift flour with baking soda and saltadd to creamed mixture. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto cookie sheets. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes.

Cook ramen noodles according to package directions. Drain noodles. Rinse well under cold water. Toss noodles with cabbage. Mix vinegar, sugar, olive oil and salt in a small bowl. Stir well. Dressing should coat noodles. Toss with green onion. Sprinkle sesame seeds over noodles. Sprinkle slivered almonds over noodles. Serve cold.

In a medium saucepan on medium heat melt the butter with the canola oiladd the garlic, rosemary, thyme, salt, pepper. Cook for about 1 minute stirring constantly. Add the rotini pastastir for about 1 minute. Add the zucchinicook for an additional minute. Remove from heat and serve.

Wash potatoes thoroughly in cold water. Dry well. Slice potatoes in half lengthwise. Cut into 1 inch thick strips. Place potatoes in a single layer on a cookie sheet. Drizzle with 2 tsp. oil. Sprinkle generously with onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, salt and pepper. Bake 20-25 minutes, until tender. Serve.

In a bowl, combine soy sauces, orange juice and sesame oil. Place drumsticks in a shallow dish and pour soy mixture over drumsticks. Cover and marinate at room temperature for at least four hours or up to one day. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add oil. Add drumsticks and cook for 15-20 minutes turning occasionally until golden brown and cooked through. Serve with pancake syrup if desired.

Place pie shell into a baking dish. Preheat oven to 400. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Saute leeks in butter until tender. Add egg yolks one at a time to leeks and stir continuously. Add whipping cream to mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Fill pie shell with leek mixture. Sprinkle white cheddar cheese over leeks. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Sprinkle mace over top of leek mixture. Let cool before serving. Serves 4.

Rub salt and pepper on both sides of the pork chops. In a shallow dish combine the apple juice and apple cider vinegar and stir. Place the butter and apple juice mixture on one side of each pork chop. Roll the pork chop and seal the meat and juice mixture with your fingers. Place the pork chops on the grill and cook until the juices run clear, about 8-10 minutes per side. Serve with the apples on the side and drizzle each serving with the remaining butter and juices from the pan. Enjoy!

Fill a saucepan with water. Bring to a boil. Put sugar in a heatproof bowl. Add about 2/3 of the water to the sugar. Stir until sugar is completely dissolved. Put almonds in boiling water. Boil until almonds are tender. Add cinnamon. Drain almonds. Put in sugar mixture. Stir until almonds are coated with sugar. Drain almonds. Put in a shallow dish. Let cool. Store in an airtight container.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Add bell pepper and cook 2 minutes. Add onion and cumin. Cook 2 minutes longer. Add fish and cook 1 minute. Add orange juice and wine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer 2 minutes. Add pepper. Cook 1 minute longer. Stir in cilantro. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375f. Combine margarine, brown sugar, egg and vanilla in a mixer bowl. Beat until creamy. Add flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and oats. Stir until well combined. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown.

Sauté onion in butter in a saucepan. When the onions are translucent add the chicken stock, half-and-half cream and grits. Bring to a boil. Add cream cheese. Stir in salt and white pepper. Cook for 10 minutes or until grits are creamy. Remove from heat. Stir in the Parmesan cheese. Add the chopped green onions. Serve in the saucepan.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large skillet cook sausage until browned and crumbly. Drain. In a large pot combine sausage with water and 1 cup broth. Bring to a boil. Stir in rice and cook until tender. In another large pot combine remaining 3/4 cup broth, cream of mushroom soup and water. Bring to a boil. Add sausage mixture and cook until heated through. Stir in dry ranch dressing mix. Spoon mixture into a 13x9x2 inch casserole pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 20 minutes or until cheese melts.

Bring 1 inch of water to boil in a large pot. Add carrots. Cook over medium heat until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain the carrots in a colander. Mash carrots slightly. Place carrots in a large bowl. Add mashed carrots to the carrot mixture. Add eggs, breadcrumbs, instant minced onion, salt and ground black pepper. Stir well. Pour mixture into a buttered 2 1/2 quart baking dish. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Sprinkle ground cumin over the top of the souffle. Bake 10 minutes more. Serves 6 to 8.

Soak the dried beans in a large bowl covered with 2 to 3 inches of cold water for at least 8 hours or overnight. Drain the soaked beans. Put the soaked beans in a large pot. Add 8 cups of cold water. Add the sausage. Add the carrots, onions, basil, oregano, pepper, bay leaves. Cover the pot. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the beans are tender. Drain the soaked beans. Return the beans to the pot. Stir in the remaining 8 cups cold water. Bring the beans to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the beans are tender. Remove the sausage from the pot. Slice the sausage. Put the sausage in the bowl of a food processor. Pulse the sausage until the sausage is coarsely chopped. Transfer the sausage to a medium bowl. Mash the sausage. Season the mashed sausage with salt. Add the sausage to the pot. Add the peas to
Puree strawberries in blender or food processor until smooth. Add bananas. Add ice cream. Puree until smooth. Garnish with strawberries.

In a heavy pan stir together condensed milk, vanilla extract, salt, and coconut. Cook over a low heat until mixture is thickened. Pour into a greased 8 x 8 inch pan. Chill until firm. Cut into squares.

In a large bowl, combine the flour and sour cream and stir with a fork. Make a well in the middle. Stir the eggs and then add the baking powder and salt to the well. Stir until thoroughly mixed. Grease a 9x13 baking dish with oil and pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 40 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.
Cream shortening with sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Beat flour with baking powder. Add flour mixture to shortening mixture alternately with milk. Cook over hot water at 350 for about 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375F. Cream margarine and sugars together until light and fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla to mixbeat well. Add dry ingredients (flour, baking soda, salt), then oats to butter mixturemix well. Drop dough by heaping teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until cookies are firm to the touch and lightly browned around the edges. Cool on cookie sheet 5 minutesremove to cooling rack. Repeat with remaining dough.

Trim off any excess fat from the ham. Mix together the brown sugar, Dijon mustard and 1/4 cup mango chutney. Pour this mixture all around the ham. Place the ham onto a piece of foil. Pour 1 cup of orange juice into a small saucepan. Add the garlic cloves and 1/4 cup mango chutney. Cook for 15 minutes. Place the foil with ham into the preheated oven. Bake for 1 hour. Remove the foil. Place the ham back into the pan. Pour the garlic mixture over the ham. Cover the pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Turn off the oven. Allow the ham to sit for 15 minutes. Remove the ham from the oven. Squeeze the juice from the oranges onto the ham. Serve.

Boil the baby potatoes until tender. Drain. While they are still hot, toss them with the paprika and sugar. Stir in the oil-cured olives, salt and black pepper. Arrange the potato mixture in a large salad bowl. Add the garlic cloves and the juice of the lemon. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and toss well. Serve immediately. The recipe was submitted by jimmy robertson of houston. Texas.

To prepare the chicken, combine the cornstarch with the wine in a bowl. Add the chicken thighs to the bowl of wine mixture, cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. Heat the wok on high. Add the chicken to the wok and cook for about 1 minute. Stir fry the chicken for another 1 minute. Add the ginger, sugar and vinegar. Stir fry for another minute. Add the garlic chives and stir fry for another 1 minute. Turn off the heat. Serve with white rice.

In a large skillet over medium heat cook chicken until no longer pink. Add pasta sauce and simmer until heated through. Pour mixture into an 8x8 baking dish. Top with salsa and black beans. Place a flour tortilla in your hand. Spoon about 1/2 cup of the chicken mixture into the center of each tortilla. Fold the tortilla in half over the filling to enclose. Place burritos seam side down in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese and bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut into triangles and serve with sour cream.

Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a skillet with a tight fitting lid. Add the scallops. Simmer over low heat for 4 minutes. Remove scallops from the water and set aside. Add the butter to the water and stir to melt. Add the sweet pepper and onion. Cook until tender. Remove and discard the skin and seeds of the sweet pepper. In a small saucepan melt the butter. Add the garlic and cook until lightly browned. Add the white wine and cook until evaporated. Add the chicken broth and milk. Bring to a boil and simmer until thickened. Add the scallops and cook until the scallops are lightly browned. Remove from the heat and add the fresh parsley. Serve immediately.

Trim fat from sirloin steaks. Place in a skillet and cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes per side. Remove steaks from pan and keep warm. Saute onions in remaining fat until tender. Add sliced mushrooms and cook over medium heat until tender. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Stir in flour and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in beef stock and simmer until thickened. Add beef broth and worcestershire sauce and simmer for several minutes. Add steaks and simmer until heated through. Serve over rice and garnish with parsley.

In a large bowl, combine the beef, onion, garlic and seasonings. Shape into 24 meatballs and place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until no pink remains. Meanwhile, mix the egg and milk and pour into a small bowl. Dip each meatball into the egg mixture and then into the bread crumbs. Place back on the cookie sheet and bake an additional 10 to 15 minutes. Serve on a bed of pasta or zucchini noodles.

Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil. Salt the water. Add the spaghetti and cook according to the packet directions until tender. Drain. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil and garlic in a small frying pan. Cook until the garlic is soft. Add the red chili pepper and cook for 1 minute. Add the cherry tomatoes and cook for a further 2 minutes. Drain the capers and add to the sauce pan. Add the pasta and parmesan cheese and toss to combine. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 375. Unroll dough and press into 9×9-inch baking dish. Place apple wedges in dough. Sprinkle with sugar and butter. Pour Mountain Dew over top. Combine cinnamon and vanilla. Sprinkle evenly over dough. Bake until the rolls are golden brown and bubbly. Let cool on wire rack. Cut into squares. Top with vanilla ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two round 8 inch cake pans. In a large bowl whisk together spelt flour, cane sugar, baking powder and pure vanilla extract. In another bowl combine Ener-G with water and oil. Pour wet mixture into dry mixture and beat with an electric mixer on low speed until smooth. Pour into prepared pans and bake for 25 to 35 minutes. The sponge is cooked when it springs back when touched. Remove from oven and let cool in pan for about 15 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely on wire rack. Serve with your favorite berry compote.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13 baking pan. In a medium bowl combine the flour and sugar. Add the cocoa and baking soda. In a large bowl beat the cold water and Miracle Whip until smooth. Stir in the vanilla. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients. Mix well. Pour into baking pan. Bake 35 to 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place the beef into a blender and process until finely chopped. Set aside. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the onions and cook until tender. Remove from heat and add to the beef along with the capers, salt and egg yolks. Mix well. In a medium bowl combine the cream and pickled beets. Add to the mixture in the blender and process until smooth. Pour the mixture into a 9x13 inch casserole dish. Bake for about 35 minutes or until set. Let cool slightly before serving.

Bring water to boil. Add coffee and sugar to boiling water. Bring back to boil and then turn to low. Stir occasionally. When coffee is no longer boiling, turn to cold. Put into ice cube trays and place into refrigerator. Serve as desired. You can use this to make a pitcher of iced coffee if you prefer.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine cake mix, eggs, oil, water, cream of coconut, condensed milk, pineapple, vanilla, and whipped topping into a large mixing bowl until smooth. Pour into two 9-inch cake pans that have been greased with cooking oil. Bake for 30 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean when inserted into cake. Let cakes cool for 15 minutes before frosting. Combine shredded coconut with sweetened condensed milk until evenly mixed. Then frost cake with frosting. Garnish with more shredded coconut if desired. Let stand for 1 hour before serving.

Cook butter and cognac in a saucepan. Add lemon juice. Slowly add liver and stir in salt and pepper. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add onions and garlic. Stir in eggs and parsley. Add mixture to food processor and process until smooth. Put in a round glass dish and chill for at least 8 hours before serving.

Slice squash in half length-wise. Scoop out seeds from one half of the squash with a spoon. Reserve seeds for roasting later. Rub squash with oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and place cut side down in a pan of water. Cook over medium heat until tender. While the squash is cooking, melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until just starting to turn golden. Add the reserved squash seeds and cook for another minute or two stirring constantly. Remove from the heat and stir in basil leaves. Serve the squash with the butter squash seeds over the top. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Flour chicken breasts and salt and pepper to taste. Heat olive oil in skillet and cook chicken until browned. Remove chicken from pan and set aside. Dice mushrooms and cook them with butter. Add chicken and marshall wine to the mushrooms and simmer for 10 minutes. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and let simmer for another 10 minutes. Serve over pasta or rice.

Combine flour and margarinemix with meat until coated. Place meat in Dutch ovenadd water and tomatoesadd salt and pepper to taste. Cook on low heat for about 1-1/2 hours or until beef is tender. Add mushroom soupstir and heat through. Add cheese and serve.

In a small bowl whisk together the vinegar and the honey. In a large bowl toss the spinach with the pistachios and add the dressing. Add the orange zest and toss again. To serve, place the spinach mixture in a serving dish and top with the thinly sliced green onions.

Wash rhubarb. Place in food processor along with 2 cups of the water. Blend until smooth. Pour into a large bowl. Add remaining water. Blend with an electric mixer until smooth. Add sugar and lemon juice. Blend until combined. Pour into a 9 x 13 baking dish. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate until thickened, about 2 hours. Transfer to an ice cream maker. Follow manufacturer's instructions. Freeze according to manufacturer's instructions.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook the pasta as directed on the package. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and the cream. Add the pasta to the egg mixture. Stir to combine. Season with the salt and pepper. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Pour the egg and pasta mixture into the skillet. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the edges of the frittata start to set. Flip the frittata over to cook the other side. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the frittata is set and golden. Remove from the heat and transfer to a plate. Sprinkle the frittata with the cheese. Serve immediately.
Mix all together. Put in a loaf pan. Bake at 375 for 40 minutes. Easy Peasy.

Mix the maple syrup and soy sauce in a large mixing bowl until well blended. Place salmon fillets in a large plastic storage bagpour marinade over fish, close bag, turning to coat all sides. Marinate for 1 to 2 hours. Preheat grill or broiler. Drain salmondiscard marinade. Place salmon fillets on grill or broiler pan coated with cooking spraybroil or grill 3 to 4 minutes per side or until desired degree of doneness. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowlmix well. Drizzle over salmon. Serve immediately. You may also serve with rice or as a sandwich filling.

Combine the flour, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Cut the butter into small pieces. Using a pastry blender or two knives, cut the butter into the flour mixture until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Make a well in the center of the flour mixture. Add the cheese. Pour ice water into the well. Stir with a fork until the dough forms a ball. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead the dough until smooth. Transfer the dough to a lightly greased baking sheet. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate until firm. Roll the dough out to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut out 3-inch rounds. Place 1 tsp dates in the center of each round. Fold in half. Place the folded rounds onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Press the edges together. Cut 1/2-inch slits in the top. Brush with melted butter. Bake at 400 degrees f for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.

Melt almond bark in microwave for 30 seconds or until bark is softened. Drizzle over crushed graham crackers in pan. Crumble graham crackers. Set aside. In another pan melt chocolate frosting until smooth. Add almond extract and mix well. Pour over graham crackers. Top with chocolate kisses. Freeze for 30 minutes before serving. Makes 24.

Remove from refrigerator and take out hoisin sauce and garlic cloves. Place in a bowl and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, brown beef in oil until browned on all sides. Transfer beef to a 3 1/2 quart slow cooker. Add mushrooms to drippings in skillet and saute until mushrooms are browned and tender. Add mushrooms and hoisin sauce to beef in slow cooker and stir. Cook on low-heat setting 4-6 hours until beef is tender. Stir in cornstarch and stir until thickened slightly. Remove from heat and add scallions to beef mixture and stir to coat with sauce. Pour mixture into a 2 quart casserole dish and top with crushed potato chips. Bake uncovered at 350f until hot and bubbly 30 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place the chickens in a large roasting pan with the breast side down. Mix the flour with salt and pepper. Sprinkle over the breast side of each bird. Mix the corn flakes with the thyme, rosemary and marjoram. Sprinkle the corn flake mixture over the flour mixture. Drizzle the butter over the corn flakes. Place the birds in the preheated oven. Bake for 1 1/2 hours or until the juices run clear.

Melt the butter in a saucepan and add the onion and rice to the pan. Cook over medium heat until the onion is translucent and the rice is lightly browned. Add the chicken stock and salt and pepper to taste and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and cook the pilaf until most of the liquid is absorbed and the rice is cooked through, about 18-22 minutes. Serve with chicken, beef, or vegetables.

Cook bacon over medium-high heat in a large skillet until crisp and slightly browned, about 7 minutes. Transfer bacon to paper-towel-lined plate. Drain all but 1/2 Tbsp drippings from panadd onion and garlic clove and saute until onion is tender and translucent about 4 minutes. Add cooked chicken and stir until heated through. Stir in spaghetti, whipping cream and parmesan cheese and heat until cheese is melted and pasta is tender about 5 minutes longer. Stir in reserved bacon and season with pepper and salt to taste. Serve immediately and pass parmesan cheese at table.

Bring 4 cups of water to a boil in a large pot. Stir in the salt and the macaroni. Return to a boil and cook until the macaroni is tender, about 10 minutes. Drain in a colander. Meanwhile, melt 2 tablespoons of margarine in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in the heavy cream and cayenne. Bring to a boil and cook until reduced by half. Stir in the paprika and white pepper. Pour the reduced mixture over the macaroni. Stir until well coated. Pour the macaroni into a 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle the cheese over the macaroni. Cover the dish with foil. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until the cheese is melted and the top is browned. Uncover and cook for 5 more minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Cream together the instant banana pudding mix with 1 1/2 cups water. Add the eggs, oil and banana. Pour into a greased bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes. Remove from oven when it is done. Combine the cake mix with water. Spoon over the bananas. Sprinkle with pecans. Serve. This cake is also delicious with a cherry or apple filling.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9 by 13 inch baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the cake mix, eggs, oil and water. Stir until well mixed. Spread half of the cake mixture into the baking dish and spread half of the blueberry pie filling over it. Spread half of the raspberry pie filling over the blueberries. Spread the remaining cake mixture over the fruit and spread the remaining fruit over it. In a small bowl, stir together the brown sugar and the cinnamon. Sprinkle the brown sugar mixture over the top of the cake. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes and then cut and serve.

In a large pan combine all of the fruit juice ingredients with water and bring to a boil over high heat. Add the wine to the pan along with the cinnamon sticks and the cloves. Bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer. Simmer for 1 hour or until reduced to half the original volume. Pour into a large heat-proof container or glass mugs and let cool for several hours before serving to allow the flavors to blend. Store in the fridge for up to 1 week. Serves 6.
Mix meat mixture thoroughly. Roll meat mixture into 1-inch meatballs. In large saucepan sauté meatballs in ragu sauce and cook until done. Serve meatballs over spaghetti.

Place spinach in a colander and rinse under cold running water until water runs clear. Drain spinach in a towel to remove excess moisture. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heatadd sour cream and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in spinachcook for 1 minute, stirring occasionally. Transfer to a 1 1/2-quart casserole dishsprinkle with cheese. Cover dish with foilbake for 5 minutes. Remove foilsprinkle with breadcrumbsbake for 5 minutes more or until breadcrumbs are lightly browned.

Heat soup and milk together in saucepan over medium heat until heated through and slightly thickened. Stir mustard and old bay seasonings into soup mixture. Stir in lobster meat and heat until just warmed through, about 3 minutes. Place one-half cup soup mixture on bottom of each of six ramekinstop with sliced mushrooms. Heat remaining soup mixture until hot. Spoon over mushrooms and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese. Bake at 375 degrees F for about 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and lightly browned. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In large bowl, mix flour, sugar substitute and baking powder. In another bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. In another bowl, beat egg yolks until lemon colored. Add sugar substitute to egg yolksbeat until blended. Add egg whites, canola oil and zucchinimix well. Add dry ingredientsmix well. Pour into greased loaf pan. Bake for 45-55 minutes or until tester comes out clean.

Combine steaks and onion soup mix in large bowladd enough beef broth and beer to cover steaks. Cover and refrigerate overnight or at least 4 hours. Bring liquid to boil in Dutch ovenreduce heat. Cook 45 minutes or until meat is tender when pierced with fork, turning steaks occasionally. Drain. Preheat broiler. Place 2 slices bread in each of 6 shallow 10 inch baking pans or on rimmed cookie sheetsspread with 2 Tbsp. Onion and top each with 1/4 steak and 1 Tbsp. Onion. Broil 12-15 minutes or until steaks are browned on both sides and crusty on top. Serve on rolls with au jus and additional onion on the side.

Mix peanut butter and morsels in small bowl. In large bowl, beat butter until fluffy. Gradually add sugars and beat until fluffy. Add vanilla and beat until blended. Gradually add flour and beat until smooth. Stir in peanut butter mixture and stir until well combined. Drop rounded teaspoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until set. Cool cookies for 2 minutes on cookie sheet. Remove cookies and cool completely on wire racks. Store in tightly covered container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Slice a 2 pound loaf of french bread in half. Brush both halves with melted butter. Sprinkle both sides of both halves of bread with 1 teaspoon celery seed, 1 teaspoon garlic powder, 1 tablespoon parsley flakes. Place bread halves side by side on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Spread cheese evenly over both pieces of bread. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 45 minutes. Serve warm.

Cut 1 large head of broccoli into large florets. Place florets into a large bowl. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine garlic powder, onion powder and cayenne pepper.
