Pour over the florets. Toss to coat. Add olive oil and stir to coat. Spread broccoli evenly onto a baking sheet. Roast for 10 minutes. Stir. Roast another 10 minutes. Stir. Roast for another 10 minutes. Stir. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Return to the oven and roast until the cheese is bubbly. Let cool. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 325f. In a large bowl combine oats, almonds, brown sugar and cinnamon. In a separate bowl combine the oil, honey and vanilla. Mix well. Pour oil mixture over the oat mixture and mix well. Press mixture into a 13 x 9 inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. Cut into bars and serve.

Beat together eggs, mayonnaise, mustard, salt and chives with a fork or whisk until well blended. Spoon mixture onto each muffin half. Arrange cherry tomatoes or cucumber slices on top. Sprinkle with fresh chopped chives just before serving. Serve with salad leaves or crackers if desired.

Bake bacon and slice in half. Cook onions and celery. Clean mushrooms. Saute onions and celery with bacon. Stir in mushrooms. Saute garlic. Add chicken broth and seasonings. Add bacon and mushrooms to rice. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Uncover and bake until tender. Serve hot.

Crack the eggs into a large bowl and beat. Add milk and seasonings. Melt the sausage. Add to eggs. Mix. Pour into a greased baking dish. Top with bread. Bake at 350 for 30-45 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 9x9 inch baking pan, arrange the cod fillet. Spread the salsa over the fish. In a small bowl, mix the condensed broth and soup. Pour the mixture over the fish. Sprinkle the fish with the remaining salsa. Drizzle lime juice over the top. In a small bowl, combine the cilantro and the remaining ingredients. Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the fish. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

Squeeze out garlic from the skins and roughly mash. Place garlic in a small food processor or blender. Add olive oil, lemon juice and salt. Blend until smooth. Add yogurt and mint and blend until smooth. Serve with grilled meats and veggies.

Cut figs into quarters and place them in a heavy saucepan with port and red wine. Add orange rind and star anise. Bring to boil and then simmer for 5 minutes over low heat, stirring occasionally. Add brown sugar and cinnamon stick and simmer 10 minutes more. Remove cinnamon stick and orange rind and let mixture cool. Add whipped cream and sprinkle with almonds. Refrigerate overnight to allow flavors to meld. Serve chilled with freshly whipped cream and almonds sprinkled on top.

Cook manicotti according to package directions. Cut in half and place on a serving dish. Spread top of manicotti with 1/4 of each of the cheeses. Spoon a small amount of spaghetti sauce over each manicotti. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Mix together 3/4 of the ground buffalo meat with eggs. Add in ritz crackers. Mix together with the rest of the meat. Roll meat into meatballs. Fry meatballs in oil on medium heat. When meatballs are finished cooking, add the meatballs and some of the oil to a deep saucepan. Stir in mushroom soup and garlic powder. Cook on medium heat until thickened. Add in beef gravy and remaining meatballs. Stir until mixed. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Put pie shells in 9 inch round pans and bake for about 10 minutes until the sides of the crust are slightly browned. In a mixing bowl, combine the eggs with the brown sugar and beat well. Add the flour and stir until blended together. Stir in the chocolate chips and walnuts. Pour the chocolate mixture into the baked pie shells and bake for about 30 minutes until the filling is set and the edges of the crust are slightly browned. Serve warm with french vanilla ice cream for a delicious treat!

Cut butter into small pieces. Melt in saucepan over low heat until it turns a light golden color. Cool slightly (this can be done the night before). In a large bowl or a food processor, beat butter until very fluffy. Add sugar gradually while beating to make a soft dough. Mix in the cooled butter and be sure to scrape down the sides of the bowl or processor to ensure all the butter is incorporated into the dough. Add milk a little at a time until the dough is the consistency of thick pancake batter. Sift the flour into the batter then mix in the eggs one at a time. Fold in the blackberries to make the batter thick and stiff. Drop the dough on a cookie sheet by heaping teaspoons onto the sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes or until edges are brown.

In a crock pot combine chicken thighs, chicken stock and peanut butter. In a small bowl combine soy sauce and chili pepper. Pour over chicken and mix well. Add ginger and stir well. Add lime juice and fresh cilantro. Cook on low for 8 hours. Serve with rice and peanuts.

Cook the pasta according to the directions on the package. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a large bowl combine the pasta, broccoli, carrots, diced tomatoes, black olives and beans. Toss with the dressing. Serve and sprinkle with the cheese.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease 4 regular muffin pans. In large bowl beat bisquick, oats, sugar, milk and eggs. Mix well. Stir in oil, chocolate chips and walnuts. Spoon into greased muffin pans. Bake for about 20 minutes. Remove from pans immediately. Cool on wire rack.

Mix 2/3 cup of oats, pecan pieces and brown sugar in a large bowl. Stir in light corn syrup and margarine until well blended. In a large bowl, mix together corn syrup and baking soda. Add to oats mixture and mix well. Drop dough by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until set. Cool cookies on wire racks. Makes about 3 dozen.

Heat olive oil in a large pot. Add chopped onion and shallots. Cook until tender. Add dried thyme. Whisk together the flour and the broth. Gradually whisk the flour mixture into the onion mixture. Add soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Simmer until thickened. Add the melted butter. Serve.

Shave off a thin layer of the cabbage leaves to expose the cabbage. Peel the carrot and cut into thin strips. Peel the daikon radish and dice into small pieces. Peel the ginger and grate the root. Cut the green onions in half crosswise. Wash the cabbage leaves well. Lay them flat. Mix the carrots, daikon radish, ginger, green onions, chili peppers, whey, and salt together. Spread this mixture evenly over the cabbage leaves. Roll them up and tie them with kitchen string. Store them in a container. Let them sit for 7 days in a cool place before using.

Prepare hash browns according to package directions. In medium bowl mix onions and hash browns. In separate bowl beat eggs, milk and seasonings. Spray 9 x 13 baking dish lightly with cooking spray. Layer hash browns and onion in prepared baking dish. Add 1/2 of the egg mixture. Top with bacon. Repeat layers. Add remaining egg mixture and sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 for 45 minutes or until eggs are set. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

In a large bowl combine the sesame oil, ginger, garlic powder, onion powder, sesame seeds and soy sauce. Place the chicken breast halves into the bowl. Marinate at least 2 hours or overnight. Grill to desired degree of doneness. Serve with white rice.

Rub honey and lemon juice over chicken. Place hickory chips around bottom of roasting pan. Place chicken on chips. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast at 400 degrees for 1 hour or until done. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Whisk in the apple juice and bring to a boil. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in the cornstarch and cook for 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in the lemon juice and paprika. Stir in the cheeses and simmer over low heat until cheeses are melted. Serve with a variety of fresh fruits.

Peel and quarter carrots and potatoes. Slice onions. In soup pot heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and carrots and cook for 5 minutes stirring frequently. Add potatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 2 minutes stirring frequently. Add curry powder and caraway seed. Add vegetable broth. Bring mixture to a boil. Simmer for 15 minutes stirring occasionally. Transfer mixture to blender and puree. Return mixture to pot. Add salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with chopped parsley.

Chop bacon and cook until crisp. Remove from pan and set aside. Wash and dry broccoli and cauliflower and cut into 1/2 inch pieces. Cut celery into 1/2 inch pieces. In a small bowl combine the low-fat mayonnaise and low-fat sour cream. Add garlic powder and salt to taste. Place broccoli and cauliflower in a large salad bowl. Add bacon and chopped celery. Add the low-fat dressing and toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Prepare and drain vegetables. Sprinkle steaks with salt and pepper and dredge in flour. In a Dutch oven or soup pot, heat oil over medium heat. Brown steaks on all sides. Place steaks in crock pot. Pour vegetables and tomato juice over steaks. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours.

Place the spinach in the center of the plate and place the shrimp around the sides of the plate. Squeeze the juice of half of the lemon over the top of the shrimp and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Melt the butter in the pan and saute the shrimp until they are cooked and pink inside and the shells are translucent and opaque (about 6 minutes). Add the shrimp to the spinach and gently toss. Add the remaining half of the lemon juice and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Toss apples with brown sugar, cranberries and pecans. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup of brown sugar with 1/2 cup of quick-cooking oats. Add buttermix well. Place in bottom of 8x11-inch baking dish. Arrange apple mixture over the mixture. Drizzle with remaining brown sugar mixture. Bake 30 to 35 minutes.

Heat olive oil over medium heat and add leeks and celerysauté until tender. Add chicken broth and cauliflower and bring to boil and then simmer for about 10 minutes until cauliflower is tender and soft. In a small saucepan heat half and half over medium heat and add nutmeg and salt and pepper to tastekeep warm. In blender or food processor puree soup until very smooth and creamyadd half and half and blend or process until smooth and creamytransfer to soup pot and add cheese. Reheat to serve. Serves 4.
Mix together eggs, corn syrup, pecans and vanilla extract. Pour mixture into two prepared pie shells. Sprinkle with salt. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes until top is firm.
Mix together ground beef, cheese, broccoli, garlic powder, sour cream, milk and egg. Blend with bisquick. Shape into burgers or patties and fry until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Grease and flour 9 x 5 x 3 inch loaf pan. Beat 2 cups butter and 1 1/2 cups sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla extract. Add one egg at a time, beating until light and fluffy after each addition. Beat flour into sugar mixture alternately with 7-up soda. Stir in 1 1/4 cups chopped semi-sweet chocolate and 1 cup nuts. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 1 hour or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on rack for 5 minutes before removing from pan.

Sift flour and cornmeal into a large bowl. Blend in the salt, baking powder and sugar. In a small bowl, whisk the milk and oil together. Combine the corn and milk mixture and the eggs and then blend into the dry mixture. Pour the batter into a greased 8x4x2 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Let stand for 10 minutes before removing from the pan. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl whisk together flour and muesli. In a small mixing bowl whisk together melted butter, golden syrup and brown sugar. In another large bowl whisk together eggs. Add wet mixture to dry and stir to combine. Dough will be fairly sticky. Form dough into balls (about 30 grams each) and place on parchment lined baking sheets. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until tops are golden brown. Cool and enjoy.

Combine first five ingredients in a medium-sized bowl. Whisk until the honey dissolves. Add extra virgin olive oil in a steady stream while whisking constantly. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle over salad greens and garnish with fresh basil leaf. Serve at room temperature. Note: raspberry vinaigrette may also be prepared in a food processor or blender. To do so, add ingredients to the blender or food processor, cover and pulse until the mixture is smooth. Add a little more olive oil if needed.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line cookie sheets with parchment paper or grease with cooking spray. Mix brown sugar and butter together until well blended. Add baking soda, cinnamon, pure vanilla extract, salt and eggs until blended well together. Mix the oats, raisins, flour and baking soda together. Stir into butter mixture until well blended together. Drop dough by spoonfuls onto cookie sheets 2 inches apart. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 10 minutes or until lightly browned.

Preheat the oven to 350. Brush a large baking dish with olive oil. Cook ravioli according to package directions. Transfer to the prepared dish. Top with the butter and walnuts. Sprinkle with sage and black pepper. Cover the ravioli with the cheese. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve.

Spray large nonstick skillet with cooking spray. Heat oil in pan over medium heat. Dip chicken pieces in flour mixture. Add to hot oil in pan. Cook 5 minutes or until browned. Remove chicken from pan. Pour off excess fat. Stir in chili powder and salt. Bring broth to boiling. Add to pan. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 minutes. Return chicken pieces to pan. Add lime juice. Cook 1 minute or until heated through. Serve with sour cream. Sprinkle with cilantro.

In a small bowl, combine shallots and vermouth. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 24 hours. Remove shallots from liquiddiscard liquid. Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Sear chops on both sides for 2-3 minutes per side. Transfer to a roasting pan. Spoon shallots over chopssprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Bake 25-30 minutes or until cooked through (160 degrees f). Sprinkle chops with rosemary before serving.
Boil water with cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, nutmeg and clove. Add to coffee along with milk & sugar to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat broiler. Place onions in a nonstick skillet and saute over medium heat until tender. Set aside. Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. Place pasta in a large bowl. Add onions and remaining ingredients and toss to coat. Spread on a large platter. Broil 3 to 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese. Serve.

Put vegetables and turkey in a greased 2-quart casserole. In a separate bowl, mix together soup and bisquick. Pour this mixture over turkey and vegetables. Pour egg and milk over mixture and bake in 350 degree f oven for 40-45 minutes or until casserole is hot and a knife inserted in center comes out clean. Serve hot. This recipe may be doubled. Freeze leftovers.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Arrange the mushrooms on a wire rack set on a large rimmed baking sheet. Brush the mushrooms with the vinegar. Sprinkle the mushrooms with the pepper, 2 teaspoons of the salt, the sugar, the garlic, the herbs, the thyme, the oil, and the remaining teaspoon of salt. Roast until the mushrooms are tender and the liquid has evaporated, 20 minutes.

Blend the kale, almonds, shallots and garlic clove with the cheese until finely chopped. In a small pan over low heat, toast the almonds until fragrant and lightly browned. Transfer to a food processor along with the chopped kale mixture. Add the olive oil and blend. Season with pepper to taste and salt.

Mix sugar and evaporated milk in a sauce pan. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Cook for 2 minutes longer. Remove from heat and add margarine. Add chocolate chips. Stir until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in marshmallow creme. Pour into greased 13x9 pan. Sprinkle with nuts. Spread evenly. Cool. Cut into squares. Refrigerate.

Beat the sugar and brown sugar until creamy. Beat the shortening into the sugar mixture until smooth. Beat the eggs into the sugar mixture. Stir in vanilla extract. Sift flour, baking soda and salt into sugar mixture. Stir oatmeal into the flour mixture with the back of a spoon. Fold in the semi-sweet chocolate chips with a spoon. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet about 3 inches apart. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from cookie sheet to cooling rack.

Preheat the oven to 425f. Lightly grease the muffin tins. Whisk the eggs lightly and mix with the milk. In a large bowl mix the flour with the salt. Make a well in the centre of the mixture. Add the egg mixture. Stir gently until just combined. Spoon into the muffin tins. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve with steak.

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in garlic powder. Add milk and broth and bring to a boil. Stir in potatoes. Reduce heat and cook until tender. Stir in salt and pepper. Melt remaining 1 tablespoon butter and stir into hash browns. Stir in cheese. Spray a 9x13 baking pan with cooking spray and pour in hash browns. Bake for 20 minutes or until browned.

Place chicken legs on grill. Brush with butter. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Turn until browned on both sides. In a bowl, combine mustard, onion, parsley, curry powder, garlic. Pour over chicken legs. Place on grill. Brush with butter. Turn until browned on both sides. Serve immediately.

Place all ingredients except biscuits into a slow cooker. Cook on high for 3-4 hours or on low for 6-8 hours. When finished cooking, cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Place chicken into bowls or serve on plates. Spoon the broth over the chicken. Place frozen vegetables into the bowl or onto the plate. Place biscuits on top of the vegetables.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray baking sheet with cooking spray. Cut chicken breast tenders into bite-sized pieces. Place chicken in a large bowl. Add walnuts, garlic cloves, cilantro leaves, parsley leaves, salt, pepper, olive oil, lime juice. Stir gently to combine. Cover bowlchill in refrigerator for 2 hours. Spread chicken onto prepared baking sheet. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes.
Spread cream cheese on one side of each bread half, and on other sides spread italian seasoning mix. Top with bacon and cucumber slices. Sandwich together and serve with extra salad dressing.

In a large skillet over med-high heat, add olive oil. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add balsamic vinegar and stir. Add fresh basil leaves. Saute for 1 minute. Add salt to taste. Add red pepper flakes. Add black pepper. Add tomato. Add cheese. Remove from heat. Add pasta to the skillet. Toss to coat. Place on platter. Serve immediately.

In a deep skillet or saucepan over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add shallot and thyme and saute for 3 minutes or until tender. Stir in bay leaf and parsley. Add mussels and stir to coat. Add 3/4 cup (180 ml) dry white wine and cook for 2 minutes or until mussels are open. Discard any unopened mussels and add more dry white wine as needed. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve.

Roll out dough on floured surface to fit an 8 or 9 inch pizza pan or cast iron skillet. Spread about one half of each type cheese on half of doughsprinkle half of broccoli and half of pepperoni on cheese. Top with remaining cheese and broccoli and pepperonisprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and bake at 375 for about 20 minutes or until bread is cooked and cheese is bubbling and brown around edges. Remove from oven and cut into squaresserve warm or cold.
Prepare pie shell. Cut shortening into flour and salt. Mix well. Stir in orange juice. Roll out to make pie shell. Bake in preheated oven at 400 15 minutes or until set.

Boil farfalle pasta in salted water for 6-8 minutes or until tender but firm to bite. Drain pasta. Add green beans and new potatoes to pasta and toss to combine. Pour pesto into a large bowl and add in pasta and vegetables. Toss to coat. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over and mix to coat pasta and vegetables. Serve immediately.

Mix pork tenderloin with caesar salad dressingcoat pita breads with canola oil on both sides. Bake pita breads at 400 degrees until golden brown. While pitas are baking, add cucumber and red onions to salad bowl with ranch dressingtoss until well blendedserve on pita breads with pork tenderloin.

Season pork chops with salt and pepper on both sides and dust both sides with flour. Heat 1/2 inch of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add pork chops and cook until browned on both sides and no longer pink inside, about 10 minutes total. Transfer pork chops to a plate and set aside. Add butter and olive oil to same skillet and heat over medium heat. Add lemon peel and cook until fragrant about 15 seconds. Stir in breadcrumbs and cook until golden brown and crisp about 5 minutes more. Transfer breadcrumbs and oil mixture to a shallow bowl and add eggs, Parmesan cheese and sage leaves. Whisk until smooth. Dip pork chops in egg mixture then coat them in the breadcrumb mixture on both sides. Heat remaining oil and butter in skillet over medium heat and add pork chops. Cook for about 3 minutes then turn and cook another 3 minutes on other side until browned and heated through. Transfer pork chops to a serving plate and serve with pan juices

In a large saucepan over medium heat, warm the oil for about 2 minutes, then add the garlic and saute for about 2 minutes or until softened and just starting to brown. Add the tomatoes and the chili pepper flakes and stir for about 4 minutes or until the tomatoes are softened and starting to break down. Stir in the arugula and season with the salt and pepper and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 12 minutes or until the arugula is wilted and the liquid has thickened slightly. Drain the mixture in a fine-mesh sieve over a bowl. Toss the pasta with the tomato mixture and add the parmesan and mozzarella cheeses and toss until all the cheese is melted and the mixture is combined. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in pan. Add mustard seeds. When they begin to pop add asafoetida powder, cayenne and onions. Fry until onions become transparent. Then add tomatoes. Fry for 5 minutes. Add salt. Stir for 3 minutes. Then add hot red chili powder. Add more oil if necessary. Stir for 2 minutes. Serve hot.

Clean and pat dry chops and place on a large plate. Combine maple syrup and cumin and rub the mixture on the chops and place chops in a large resealable plastic bag. Add the paprika and cayenne pepper and rub the mixture on the chops in the bag. Add the black pepper and salt and rub the mixture on the chops in the bag. Add the olive oil and shake the bag until the chops are thoroughly covered in the mixture. Place chops in a large roasting pan and cook for about 2-1/2 hours or until cooked through and a meat thermometer registers about 140-145F (medium-rare). While the chops are cooking, peel the sweet potatoes and cut them into large chunks and place in a large roasting pan with the chops. Drizzle the potatoes with the olive oil and sprinkle them with salt and pepper and toss well with the oil and seasonings until the potatoes are well-coated with the oil and seasonings and the potatoes are about half covered in the oil and seasonings. Place the potatoes

Cut 1/3 inch off top of french baguette to expose crust. Toast until crust is golden brown and bottom is lightly browned. Rub inside of bread with olive oil. Place tomatoes and sliced green onions on baguette and sprinkle with coarse ground black pepper. Top with slices of roast beef and sliced green onions. Spread chive & onion cream cheese on baguette. Serve immediately. Serves 2 people.

Brown meat in a heavy skillet with oil and seasonings over medium heat until meat is no longer pinkdrain any grease and set aside. To make breadcrumbs, crush Italian bread into crumbs in a food processorset aside. In a mixing bowl, combine cracker crumbs and breadcrumbs and mix welladd seasoned turkey, onion and egg and mix wellshape into meatballs about 1/2 inch thick. Place meatballs on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake for about 15 minutes or until brown on topset aside on a wire cooling rack for about 10 minutes or until meatballs are cool enough to handle.

Mix brown sugar and syrup into a small bowl. Stir in oil and oatsmix well. Stir in chocolate chipsmix well and drop by teaspoonful onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until set. Do not over bake. Remove from cookie sheetcool on wire rack.

In a small bowl combine cider vinegar, brown sugar and salt. Stir in paprika and garlic. Place pork in a roasting pan. Rub pork with vinegar mixture. Bake at 275 for 1 hour or until done. Serve with steamed rice and vegetables.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add linguinecook until tender but still firm to bite, 8 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add prawnscook 1 to 2 minutes or until opaque, stirring occasionally. Add garliccook 30 seconds. Add chiliescook 1 minute or until chilies just begin to soften but do not brown. Add parsleycook 30 seconds or until parsley wilts slightly. Add lemon rindcook 15 seconds. Drain pastareturn to pot. Add prawns mixture to pastatoss to coat. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix meat and onions in a large bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs and half of the cracker crumbs. Add egg mixture to meat mixture. Combine remaining cracker crumbs with worcestershire sauce, ketchup and mustard. Mix well. Form into a 9 x 5 loaf. Pour liquid mixture into loaf and press down. Place loaf in 9 x 5 loaf pan. Bake 1 hour or until done. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve with cooked rice.

Spread cream cheese on a slice of bread. Add tuna and top with another slice of bread. Add green and red capsicum, margarine and spread another slice of bread on top of sandwich. Top with another slice of bread. To serve cut into slices with a sharp knife.

Cook the squirrel and mexicorn over medium high heat until done (about 40 minutes). Cool for 10 minutes then cut into cubes and set aside. Peel the onion and celery and dice into small pieces and cook over medium heat until tender (about 10 minutes). Stir in the beef broth and cook for another 10 minutes. Add the squirrel and mexicorn and cook for another 10 minutes or until thoroughly heated through. Add the black pepper and stir for another 10 minutes. Mix the cornstarch with a little water and stir into the mixture until thickened. Pour into a prepared pie shell and cook at 400 degrees for about 40 minutes or until the center is almost set. Makes 8 servings.

Peel and slice the eggplant. Place the slices on a sheet of parchment paper and sprinkle with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Wrap the parchment paper around the slices and bake at 350 degrees for about one hour or until very tender. Remove from the oven and cool completely. Place the eggplant, roasted garlic and vinegar into the bowl of your food processor. Pulse a few times to combine. Add the basil leaves and pulse several times. Transfer to serving dish and serve with crackers or toast points.

Mince garlic cloves and parsley. Place in a large mixing bowl with lemon juice and soy sauce. Whisk until garlic cloves are a paste with parsley and lemon juice. Add parsley and lemon juice mixture and marinate steak in a large mixing bowl in the refrigerator for at least two hours or overnight. Remove steak from the refrigerator and let sit at room temperature for one hour prior to grilling. Preheat grill or pan for medium heat and cook steak for about five minutes per side for medium-rare doneness or until desired temperature is reached. Season with salt and black pepper and serve with garlic herb butter or compound butter for an extra flavorful meal.

Preheat oven to gas 6. Grease a baking sheet. Melt butter with 250g brown sugar and the caster sugar. When bubbles appear remove from the heat. Beat in the egg. Fold through the corn flakes and nuts. Spoon onto the baking sheet and press firmly into an even layer. Bake for about 20 minutes until golden brown. Leave to cool for about 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

In a small saucepan, heat milk over medium heat until hot. Remove from heat. Place cinnamon stick and lemon rind in warm milk. Cover and let stand 15 minutes. Combine eggs yolks and sugar in bowl. Add hot milk mixturebeat until blended. Add ricecook 15 minutes over low heat. Stir in nutmeg. When rice is tender (25 minutes), add buttercook 1 minute. Ladle into bowls. Serve immediately. Top individual servings with whipped cream.

Mix flour, baking powder, salt and cinnamon. Beat egg whites until stiff. Add remaining ingredients. Pour into waffle iron. Cook according to manufacturer's directions. Top each waffle with a chocolate chip.

Wash and hull fruit and place into large stockpot. Bring to boil. Add dry pectin and lemon juice. Stir until dissolved. Add honey and stir until dissolved and thickened to desired consistency. Add fruit back into jars and seal with lids and rings. Place jars on rack of boiling water for 5 minutes to seal lids. Remove from heat and let sit undisturbed for 24 hours before storing in refrigerator.

In a large skillet heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook 2 minutes stirring frequently. Add apple and cook 2 minutes. Add vinegar and cook 2 minutes more. Remove from heat. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Cover and chill 2 hours. Serve with grilled meats.

Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl and blend thoroughly until smooth and creamy. Pour into pie shells and bake in a pre-heated 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven for 35 to 45 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center of the pie comes out clean. You can also use a 9 x 13 inch casserole dish and bake it for 30 to 40 minutes at the same temperature. Allow to cool for at least an hour before serving so the filling has a chance to set. Enjoy!

Peel peaches and cut into halves or quarters and remove pit. Mix all juice and sugar into a glass pitcher and let sit for at least 1 hour to let the flavors blend. Add peaches and stir gently. Refrigerate and serve over ice. This recipe works with any fruit juice and fruit.

Combine all ingredients into a saucepan and heat to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Place thighs into saucepan and cook for 10-15 minutes. Drain and serve over hot cooked rice with teriyaki sauce on the side for dipping.

Cook the meat and vegetables in a large skillet or pot until browned. Add tomato soup to skillet along with remaining ingredients. Stir well. Pour mixture into a greased 9x13 pan. Top with remaining cheese and bake at 350 degrees until hot. Let stand for about 5 minutes before serving.

Pour the graham cracker crust into a pie plate. Spread half the cream cheese mixture over the crust. Make sure to smooth out the top so that it's level. Then add half the sour cream mixture on top. Repeat this process once more. Then add half the sugar mixture on top. Finally add the last half of the cream cheese and sour cream mixture. Place in the oven and bake for 40 to 45 minutes until the filling is set. Allow to cool completely before serving.

Soak lentils overnight in enough water to cover by 1 inch in a large mixing bowl. Drain and rinse lentils well under running water and drain well again. Heat oil in a large heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat. Add the cumin and asafoetida, and saute for 1 minute. Add the garlic and the onion and saute for another minute. Add the turmeric and red chillies and stir for another minute or two. Add the drained lentils and the salt and cook, stirring frequently until the lentils have absorbed the oil and are soft and tender and the oil has separated from the lentils. Taste and adjust salt if needed. Add the garlic again and stir for another minute or two until the lentils are completely cooked. Serve with rice and garnish with chopped cilantro if desired. Serves four.

Bring peppermint tea bag and water to a boil in small saucepan on high heat. Remove from heat and let stand 5 min.add ice cubes and stir until melted. Add ice cubes and chocolate protein powder into blendercover and blend 15 sec.add low-fat plain yogurtcover and blend 30 sec.add flax seed oilcover and blend 30 sec.add ice cubes and dark chocolate chipscover and blend 30 sec.serve in glasses immediately.

Boil potatoes. Mash them with lemon juice and seasoning. Then add milk, eggs and applesauce. Mix well. Heat oil in a pan. Drop spoonfuls of potato mixture into hot oil. Fry on both sides until golden brown. Serve with applesauce.

Rinse rice in a bowl of water. Set aside. Place rice and water in cooker. Place cooker on high setting. Cook for 20 minutes. Stir rice and cook for an additional 20 minutes on high. Allow rice to sit for five minutes before serving. Stir in corn and peas and cook for an additional two minutes. Serve with grilled chicken breast.

Melt butter and heat in a frying pan. Place sweet onion in the pan and saute until golden. Remove from the pan and place in a small bowl. Sprinkle lightly with salt and set aside. Place 1 cup mango chutney in a small bowl. Slice the focaccia bread in half. Place the brie cheese cut side down in the center of the focaccia. Top the brie with the sweet onion. Place the top half of the focaccia on the cheese and top with the other half. Place the sandwich in a small baking pan and cover with foil. Bake the sandwich for 5 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for 5 more minutes. Slice the sandwich and serve hot.

Remove all the silverskin from the racks. Pour hoisin sauce and honey over the lamb. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Add the sesame oil and sherry. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Remove from the refrigerator and add the sesame seeds. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Remove the racks from the marinade and place in a roasting pan. Cover and roast for 10 minutes. Remove the cover and roast for another 10 minutes. Remove the racks from the oven and add the black beans and orange zest. Cover and return to the oven for another 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle the curry powder over the racks. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Grill over medium heat for 12 minutes. Serve.

Spread 1/2 teaspoon of cream cheese spread over each tortilla. Top with 1/4 cup of dried sweetened cranberries. Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of feta cheese. Roll tortillas into tight pinwheels. Arrange rolls in a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Lightly spray with cooking spray. Cover with plastic wrap. Let stand 1 hour at room temperature. Bake at 350 degrees f for 35 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a shallow dish, combine the margarine and soup. Heat in the microwave for about 3 minutes on high, until the soup is hot. Place the boneless skinless chicken breast between two pieces of wax paper and pound them thin with a mallet or rolling pin. Layer each chicken breast with a slice of cheese and a slice of ham. Place the chicken breasts in a lightly greased 9x13 pan. Pour the soup mixture over the top of the chicken. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and drizzle with melted margarine. Bake uncovered for 25-30 minutes or until the sauce bubbles and the chicken is done. Serve with a side of sour cream and garnish with parsley. Serves four.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Roll out pizza dough and divide in half. Place dough in a pizza pan and spread pizza sauce over the dough. Place pepperoni evenly over the sauce. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese evenly over the sauce. Place in the oven and bake for 15-20 minutes or until cheese is golden brown.

Prepare Italian dressing as directed on the package. Brush swordfish steaks with Italian dressing. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Preheat a broiler to high. Place steaks under the broiler and broil for 1 to 2 minutes on each side or until desired degree of doneness. Place steaks on a platter. Pour remaining dressing into a small bowlmix in wine. Stir in mustard and cream. Serve steaks with dill-mustard mixture on the side.

Preheat the oven to 200c/gas 6. Grease a 20cm/8in square cake tin with butter and line with baking parchment. In a food processor or with a handheld electric whisk, beat together the cream cheese and butter for 3-4 minutes or until pale, fluffy and creamy. Gradually add the flour and beat together to a soft dough. Tip the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently for a few seconds to bring it together. Flour your hands and roll out the dough to a 3mm/1/8in thickness. Cut out 24 squares with a 7cm/3in square cutter (or a small cup). Arrange the squares on the greased tin, criss-crossing the biscuits to fit the tin. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until pale brown. Allow to cool completely before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. For the topping, beat together the cream cheese and parmesan together in a medium bowl with a fork. Season with salt

In a large frying pan melt the butter and saut the garlic until golden brown. Add the scallions and saute for about a minute. Add the capers and tomatoes. When the tomatoes have broken down add the salmon fillets. Place the lid on the pan and cook over medium low heat for about 5 minutes. Check the salmon fillets and if the salmon is tender and flakes with a fork it is done. When the salmon is done remove from the pan and garnish with the chopped scallions. Serve over rice or with a side of sauted vegetables.

Cream the eggs and sugar. Add the salt and vanilla. Stir in the margarine. Add the apples and stir. Combine with the egg noodles. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Spread with apricot jam. Bake for about an hour. This is very easy and delicious. Enjoy.

Rinse rice thoroughly. Place rice in a large pot with enough water to cover by 2 inches over the rice. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer until the water is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Turn off the heat and let the rice stand covered for 10 minutes. Drain the rice and rinse with cold water. Place the drained rice back into the pot with 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heatstir until butter melts and rice begins to toast a bit, about 2 minutes. Pour the remaining butter over the ricestir until melted. Stir the tomatoes with their juices into the rice along with the chilesstir to blend well. Stir in the broth until it is well incorporated into the ricereduce the heat to low. Simmer the rice for 5 minutes until the chile flavor has infused the rice. Stir in the chopped cilantroseason to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving platter. Garnish with a pimento-stuffed green olive half, a piece of

In a large pot of boiling salted water cook spaghetti until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain pasta. In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add red onion, thyme, cherry tomatoes and reserved pasta water. Cook until onion is translucent and cherry tomatoes are slightly softened. Add spaghetti to skillet. Toss pasta with sauce to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve topped with pecorino romano cheese.

Separate tamales from corn husk. In 3- or 4-qt. slow cooker, place cornhusk in bottom to line bottom and sides. Add tamales, onion, tomato sauce, chili powder and 1 cup cheddar cheesestir to coat tamales with sauce mixture. Top tamales with remaining cheddar cheese. Covercook on low 6 to 8 hours or on high 3 to 4 hours until tamales are heated through, chili mixture has thickened slightly and cheese has melted. Serve with sour cream or avocado topping if desired.
Combine oatmeal and raspberries in a blender. Add honey and whiskey and blend until smooth. Add heavy cream and blend until smooth. Serve with a spoon.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add a generous amount of salt. Cook pasta until tender but firm. Drain. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add jalapenos and chilies. Cook for 1 minute. Add garlic. Cook for another minute. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet. Stir well. Add the cream cheese. Stir well. Add milk. Stir well. Add the grated cheese. Stir well. Season with salt and pepper. Top with the jalapenos. Serve hot.
Grill salmon fillets over medium heat for 4-6 minutes per side. Remove from heat. Drizzle with hoisin sauce and garnish with chopped scallions.

Bake potatoes in a microwavable dish for 10 minutes. Remove. In a bowl, mash potatoes with butter, soup and sour cream. Shape into balls. In a bowl, combine breadcrumbs with the onion. Add potatoes. Roll in breadcrumbs. Melt margarine in skillet. Add onion. Fry onion until golden brown. Add french-fried onions. Dip balls into breadcrumbs, then into melted margarine. Fry on each side until brown.

Melt crisco shortening and salt over low heat, remove from heat and stir in vanilla extractstir in icing sugar. In a large bowl whisk together heavy whipping cream and 3 tablespoons of the melted shortening mixture, whisk until stiff peaks form. Fold into the crisco mixture.

Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. In large shallow baking pan, combine flour and 3 tablespoons olive oil. Dip chicken in flour mixture. Place chicken in shallow pan. Cover with 3 tablespoons butter. Place in 400 degree F. oven for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, in saucepan, melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Whisk in flour. Cook over medium heat 1 minute. Gradually stir in chicken broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cook until thickened. Whisk in lemon juice. Season with salt. Serve chicken with sauce over cooked pasta. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large bowl, combine the flour, all-purpose flour, baking soda and salt. In a separate bowl, combine the yogurt, egg whites and vegetable oil. Add the wet to the dry and stir just until blended. Stir in the all-bran cereal. Spoon the batter into a greased or paper-lined muffin pan. Bake 20 to 25 minutes. Let cool in pan for 5 minutes. Remove to wire racks to cool completely.

Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain well and return to pot. Add oil and heat on medium-high until hot. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add spinach and stir until wilted. Add tomatoes and season with salt and red pepper flakes. Cook until heated through. Add prosciutto and stir until heated through. Sprinkle cheese and stir until cheese melts and coats pasta. Serve immediately.

Bring 2 inches of water to boil in large pot. Add potatoes to boiling water and cook for 5 minutes. Drain potatoes. Return potatoes to pan. Add olive oil. Add garlic cloves, salt and pepper. Cook until potatoes are tender. Drizzle with red wine vinegar. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Whisk together milk and corn kernelsplace mixture in medium saucepan over medium heat and cook 8-10 minutes or until kernels pop and sauce thickens slightly. Remove from heat and whisk in cornmeal, thyme leaves and 1/4 tsp kosher salt and 1/8 tsp black pepper. Pour into greased 8-inch square pan and bake 20 minutes or until golden brown and set. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 tsp kosher salt and 1/8 tsp black pepper just before serving. Serves 6-8.

Peel the onion. Cut into 1/2 inch thick slices. In a small pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. When it is hot, add the onions. Sear the onions for about 5 minutes. Then add the vinegar. Bring to the boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook for about 10 minutes stirring often. Add the marsala wine. Cook for another 5 minutes. Turn off heat. Strain through a fine mesh sieve. Serve warm with roast pork or duck.

In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add onions. Cook until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add pancetta and cook until crispy about 2 minutes. Add canned tomatoes with their juices, bring to a boilreduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes to 1 hour (or until thick). When sauce has reduced by half or more, stir in bucatini pasta. Cook according to package instructions until tender but still firm to the bite. Drain pasta welltoss with green onion and bocconcini cheese until combined. Season with freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve hot with additional grated Parmesan cheese for garnish.

Boil chickpeas till tender. Drain and cool. Peel and grate or finely chop the garlic and fry in oil till golden brown. Add onion and fry till golden brown and tender. Add grated garlic and fry till golden brown again. Add curry powder and mix well. Add chickpeas and stir till chickpeas are coated with oil and spices. Add tomato ketchup and hot pepper sauce and mix well. Stir till hot and serve with cooked rice and slices of lemon.

Beat eggs, sour cream, sugar and cream cheese together. Stir in vanilla. Add butter to frying pan. Heat butter over low heat. Add fruit preserves to eggs. Stir in butter and pour into frying pan. Cook on low heat until egg mixture is almost set. Do not overcook. Remove from heat. Serve with whipped cream on top.

Place rice in rice cooker according to manufacturer’s instructions. Add broth, water, and chicken. Cook according to manufacturer’s instructions. About 15 minutes before cooker is done add cabbage and green onions. Serve over cooked rice.

Melt butter in pan over medium heat. Sift flour into butter. Add broth and hot waterstir until smooth. Add cream and bring to boilcook for 1 minute. Add beer and stir until smooth and thickened. Stir in garlic powder and Worcestershire sauce. Cook and stir for 1 minute more. Remove from heatstir in cheese whiz and fresh chives. Serve with crackers or brown bread.

Place pine nuts in a food processor. Add basil and garlic and pulse until nuts are finely chopped. With the food processor running, slowly pour in the oil and water until you get a smooth paste. Add cheese and seasonings. Taste and adjust.

Cream shortening and sugar together. Add the egg yolks and beat until light and fluffy. Add the milk and beat. Add the flour mixture alternately with the milk mixture until all is incorporated. Stir in the vanilla and pecans. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool and frost if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut off stems from squash and cut in half lengthwise. Brush squash with melted butter. Place halves cut side up on baking sheet. Mix soup and nonfat sour cream in small bowl. Spoon into squash halves. Sprinkle stuffing mix over squash. Bake for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining sage and onion powder. Cut squash in half. Invert halves and remove squash from baking sheet. Sprinkle with grated cheddar cheese. Place halves cut side down on baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve.

Slice tomatoes into 1/2 inch wedges. Remove cores with a grapefruit spoon. Put tomatoes in a large roasting pan. Dice carrots, celery and onion. Add to tomatoes. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast until tomatoes are tender. About 1 hour.

Bring broth to boil in 2 quart sauce pan. Stir in orzo. Cook about 8 minutes or till orzo is done. Drain well. Stir in eggs, black pepper and parmesan cheese. Add lemon juice and stir well. Garnish with additional parmesan cheese if desired. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease 2-quart baking dish. Cut yellow squash lengthwise into 1/4 inch thick pieces. Dice onion. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add squash and onion. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in cream of broccoli soup. Add breadcrumbs, cheese, cajun seasoning, and pepper. Spoon into prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining breadcrumbs. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve with rice.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin pan. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour and baking soda. Add the eggs and oilblend well. Combine the flour mixture and the remaining ingredients in a large bowl and blend well. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling them about half full. Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.

Preheat grill. Clean and oil grill grates. Trim and discard ends from eggplant, zucchini and bell peppers. Cut eggplant lengthwise into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Brush cut side of eggplant with oil. Place eggplant on grill rack coated with cooking spray. Grill 1 to 2 minutes on each side or until tender when pierced with a fork. Place 1/2 of each bell pepper on grill. Grill 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Cut bell peppers crosswise into 1/2-inch-wide strips. Grill zucchini 5 to 6 minutes on each side. Cut zucchini lengthwise into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Clean grill. Place 1 slice of bread on grill rack coated with cooking spray. Grill 1 minute or until bread is toasted. Spread bread with mustardtop with 1/2 cup soft goat cheese. Place 1/4 eggplant on bread. Top with 1/4 zucchini

In large bowl whisk together soymilk and sugar. Add yogurt. Add eggs one at a time. Whisk well after each addition. In large bowl whisk together flour, vanilla extract, baking soda and salt. Add flour mixture to soymilk mixture alternating with the yogurt mixture until all flour mixture is incorporated. Add sliced peaches. Spoon batter into greased 9-inch ovenproof dish. Bake at 400 deg for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boiladd the angel hair pasta and cook according to package directions until tender. In a large pan over medium heat, saute the onion and garlic clove until the onion is tender. Stir in the chopped tomatoes and let them simmer for a few minutes. Drain the pasta into a colanderreturn it to the pot. Toss the pasta in the onion/tomato mixture. Stir in the chopped basil, chicken, parmesan cheese and red pepper flakes until well combined. Serve immediately.

Slice plum tomato and red onion thinly. Mix feta with red wine vinegar and a bit of extra virgin olive oil. Place sliced tomato and red onion on whole wheat pita bread. Place spinach and feta mixture on top of tomato and onion slices. Wrap pita bread and cut in half and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a 10" x 15" baking pan or glass dish with cooking spray. Beat eggs and add salt and pepper and beat again. Add melted butter and stir again until combined. Place pan in the oven and bake for 20 minutes or until eggs are set. Let cool for 15 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a Dutch oven or large pot heat 1 tablespoon of the cooking oil over medium-high heat. Add sausage and sauté until browned and cooked through, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and stir for 30 seconds. Add beans and broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and their liquid and simmer for 10 minutes more. Sprinkle oregano over mixture and stir. Add kale and sauté until just wilted. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer mixture to oven and roast until kale is tender and soup is thickened. Serve hot.

Prepare the fruit filling. To make the reduced fat bisquick mix, combine all the dry ingredients in the bowl of an electric mixer. Add skim milk and beat 1 minute. Pour into greased 6 cup or larger oval baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes at 375f. In a small skillet melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add sugar to melted butter. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes until sugar has dissolved. Add ginger to sugar mixture. Cook for 1 more minute. Add the blueberries. Pour the sugar mixture over the bisquick mixture. Bake for 10 minutes at 350f. Serve warm.

Cream butter and sugar in a mixer bowl. Add pumpkin puree and mix well. Add egg and mix well. Add flour, soda and cinnamon and mix well. Roll dough into balls. Place dough balls on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees F for 8-10 minutes. Makes about 2 dozen.

In a 4-quart slow cooker place the chicken breasts and pour the soup over the chicken breasts. Add the dry soup and cream cheese mixture to the slow cooker and stir until the cream cheese is melted. Stir in the onions and mushrooms and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and cook for 4 to 4 1/2 hours on low heat until the chicken is done. Serve topped with chopped parsley flakes.

In a small skillet over medium heat, cook the chicken breasts until cooked through. Transfer to a large bowl. In the skillet used for cooking the chicken, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the sliced bell peppers and onion and saut until tender. Add the sour cream to the skillet and stir until the sour cream has melted. Add the ketchup and hot sauce and stir. Transfer the sauce mixture to the large bowl of cooked chicken and stir to combine. Transfer to a 9x13 baking dish and top with the paprika and cumin. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve topped with fresh cilantro.

Cook beef and drain. Mix all the dry ingredients together. Add beef and milk and mix well. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake for 35 minutes at 350 degrees. Let stand for ten minutes before slicing.

Mix popcorn and crispix cereal in a large mixing bowl. Add nuts and brown sugar. Mix well. In a saucepan, melt butter and brown sugar. Add chili powder and cinnamon. Bring to boil. Add hot mixture to popcorn mixture and stir until well blended. Pour into lightly greased 12x17 inch pan. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes. Press lightly with fingers. Allow to cool before cutting into pieces. Store in airtight container. Makes 30-40 pieces.

Bring large saucepan of salted water to boil. Cook fettuccine as directed on package. Drain. Return to pan. Heat oil over medium heat. Add shrimp. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Stir in peas. Add carrots. Cook 3 to 4 minutes or until carrots are tender. Stir in red pepper. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until pepper is tender. Drain. Add fettuccine to pan. Toss to coat. Serve sprinkled evenly with grated Parmesan cheese.

Bring the orange juice and tapioca to a boil. Stir until clear and thick. Remove from heat. Add the carrots and bring to a boil. Cook about 2 minutes. Reduce heat and simmer until tender. Drain. Add the juice mixture to carrots. Toss to coat and add the lemon juice and butter. Gently stir in the honey. Garnish with fresh ginger.
Wash celery. Remove stems. Slice celery hearts. Toss with soy sauce. Add sugar. Stir in hot sauce. Pour into small bowls. Place on tray. Sprinkle with sesame oil. Refrigerate. Serve cold.

Cut each cutlet in half to make four pieces. Pat dry with paper towels. In a shallow dish combine mustard and rosemary. Season with salt and pepper. Place cutlets in mustard and rosemary mixture and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 15 to 20 minutes. Meanwhile prepare a hot grill or heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Grill cutlets for 4 to 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown and cooked through. Transfer to plates and serve.
Mix rice a roni and beef. Shape into meatballs. Brown in pan with butter. Add gravy mix. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Serve over rice.

In a large saucepan bring the stock to a boil and add the egg yolks whisking constantly. Cook until the mixture is thick. Remove from the heat. Add the cheese and nutmeg and stir until the cheese is melted. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour into individual serving bowls and garnish with fresh parsley.

Whisk together the honey, vinegar and oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add the almonds and toss. Arrange the arugula on a platter or plates. Drizzle with the vinaigrette. Sprinkle the arugula with the sliced sun-dried tomatoes. Shave the manchego over the salad. Garnish with fresh thyme sprigs if desired.

Pre-heat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Slice the zucchini lengthwise into thin slices. Spray the baking dish with cooking oil (or line with parchment paper) and arrange the zucchini slices evenly at the bottom of the dish. Chop the bacon into small cubes. Place the bacon cubes at the bottom of the dish between the zucchini slices. Season with ground black pepper and a few drops of fresh lemon juice. Place the garlic clove at the center of the bacon slices. Slice the leek into thin slices and arrange them around the garlic clove. Slice the red bell peppers lengthwise into thin strips and place them around the leek slices. Place the red peppers slices over the leek slices and arrange the slices so they overlap each other slightly. Slice the zucchini into thin strips and arrange them over the red bell peppers slices. Sprinkle the fresh basil leaves over the zucchini slices. Slice the egg into

In a large skillet, heat the oil and saute the onion until tender and golden brown. Add the garlic and saute for a few more minutes. Add the ketchup, cayenne and red pepper flakes. Add the vinegar and bring to a boil and cook for about 10 minutes or until thickened and the color becomes a darker red. Serve hot as a condiment for hot dogs.

Cut cookies into small pieces. Place in a 3-quart bowl, add chocolate chips to the mix. Pour 1 cup fruit juice concentrate over the cookie mix. Stir until cookies are covered. Fold in whipped topping and strawberries. Serve immediately or cover and store overnight in refrigerator. Yield: 18 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cook hash browns according to package directions. Melt butter in a 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle hash browns with paprika. Place 2 slices cheese over hash browns. Top with remaining hash browns. Sprinkle with half-and-half. Top with remaining cheese. Cover and bake 15 to 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting into squares.

Cream butter and peanut butter until light and fluffy. Add cream cheese and beat until combined. Add vanilla extract and beat until combined. Gradually beat in powdered sugar until frosting is smooth and creamy. Frost cooled cupcakes. Top each cupcake with an oreo cookie. Enjoy!

Preheat the oven to 350. Mix the sauce with the eggs. Add the remaining wet ingredients. Add the dry bread crumbs. Mix well. Put the lean ground beef in a large bowl and add all the wet mixture. Mix together thoroughly. Form the meat into two loaves and place in a large pan. Cover with foil and bake for approximately one hour. Remove the foil and brown the meatloaf under the broiler. Top with bacon crumbles. Return under the broiler for about 5 minutes. Remove the meatloaf from the pan and allow it to cool for at least 5 minutes. Then remove the meatloaf from the pan and place it onto a serving plate. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350F. Peel garlic and remove cloves from head. Rinse and pat dry with paper towels. Place cloves in a single layer in a 13 x 9 baking dish. Drizzle olive oil over garlic and toss to coat. Season with Italian seasoning and salt and pepper to taste. Roast until golden brown and tender, about 1 hour. Remove from oven and set aside to cool slightly. Meanwhile, heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heatadd oil to pan. Add tomatoes and cook until softened, about 3 to 4 minutes. Drain excess oil from pan with paper towel. Add roasted garlic to tomatoes and toss to combine. In a medium bowl, whisk eggs with milk until blendedadd flour and whisk until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add egg mixture to tomato mixture and stir until combined. Pour mixture evenly over roasted garlic and tomatoes in baking dish. Bake until center is set and lightly golden brown, about 30 to 35 minutes. Allow custard to

Cut cauliflower in half. Remove outer leaves of green chili and discard seeds. Remove tough end of green onion. Using a sharp knife cut into green onion cross-wise into 1-inch pieces. Remove root end of each piece. In a large bowl, combine cauliflower, green chili, green onions, salt, and mayonnaise. Add garam masala and paprika. Stir in shrimp. Place on lettuce. Garnish with cilantro leaves.

Preheat waffle iron according to directions. Mash potatoes and carrots. Add egg substitute and mix well. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Pour mixture into waffle iron. Bake according to directions.

Prepare pie shells. In a bowl combine sour cream, brown sugar, salt, nutmeg, eggs. Stir in brandy. Fold in pitted dates. Add nuts. Pour filling into prepared pie shells. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 45 minutes.
Melt chocolate in double boiler. Stir in milk. Stir in cinnamon. Pour into glasses. Serve hot.

In large skillet saute onions and garlic in olive oil. Add rice and water to rice. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook for 20 minutes or until water is absorbed. Add lentils and cook another 10 minutes. Add salt to taste.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place sliced carrot in the center of the bottom of the tomatoes. Layer with ricotta cheese. Add 1 tbsp. Olive oil over the cheese layer. Add 1 tsp. Italian seasoning. Layer with ground lamb. Top with the other tomatoes. Bake for 45 minutes or until juices are bubbly. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with toasted bread.

Melt butter. Add sugar and salt. Mix until blended. Add flour and vanilla. Mix until a dough is formed. Roll dough into 1 inch balls. Roll in powdered sugar. Roll in pine nuts. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 325 degrees for 20-25 minutes.

In a large skillet heat 1 tablespoon of peanut oil over medium-high heat. Add 1/4 cup of sliced gingerroot and cook for 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add sliced shiitake or crimini mushroom and cook until tender 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add green onions and cook for 1 minute. Add ramen noodle, soy sauce, sesame oil and cooking sherry. Stir fry for 30 seconds then add 1/4 cup of water and simmer for 1 to 2 minutes until mixture has thickened and noodles are tender. Add thinly sliced beef and cook for 1 minute then remove from heat and serve.

Rinse the chickens. Combine the chicken with all of the teriyaki sauce and the five spice powder. Place chickens into a large bowl. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least three hours or overnight. Remove chickens from the refrigerator. Place each chicken into a small pot. Add enough water to cover the chickens. Cover the pot. Bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook the chickens until the meat is tender, about 15 minutes. Drain the chickens. Rinse the chickens under cold water. Let the chickens cool. Combine all of the remaining teriyaki sauce with the cornstarch in a small bowl. Add enough water to the cornstarch mixture so that it is the consistency of heavy cream. Set aside. Place the chickens in a roasting pan. Place the roasting pan in the center of the pre-heated oven. Cook the chickens until the juices run clear when the chicken is pierced with a fork, about 25 minutes. Remove the chick

Slice the onions. Heat the oil over medium heat. Cook the onions until they are translucent. Then add the ground ginger, pepper, sugar and the cinnamon. Cook for about ten minutes. Add salt if desired. Pour over chicken or lamb.

Preheat oven to 425 F. Combine dry ingredients and mix well. Press firmly into bottom of a greased 11- x 14- x 1-inch baking dish or a 10-inch springform pan. Spread yam mixture evenly on top of crust and dot with butter. Bake until golden brown and set at 10-12 minutes. Remove from oven and immediately sprinkle berry mixture over hot filling. Return to oven and bake until bubbling and berries are hot (10-15 minutes more). Let cool slightly and garnish with marshmallows before serving warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt butter. Add corn and jalapeno. Cook over medium heat until corn is tender. Add milk and bring to boil. Add flour all at once and cook until mixture thickens and bubbles. Stir in cream cheese. Pour into greased 9x13 casserole dish. Bake for 15-20 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine blackberries and vinegar in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until berries begin to burst. Add sugar and cook until sugar dissolves. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Set aside. Spread a thin layer of smoked mozzarella cheese on bread. Top with smoked turkey. Add blackberry sauce. Top with sage leaves.

Cut the whole wheat into 1/4" pieces and set aside. Add the whole wheat and the flax seed meal together in one bowl. Combine the honey and olive oil together and add it into the flax seed and whole wheat mixture. Combine the yeast with warm water and stir it until dissolved. Add this into the mixture with the flax seed and whole wheat and stir it until it's combined. Pour 2 cups of the water into the flax seed mixture and stir it together. Let it rest for 2 hours and then add another 2 cups of water and stir it again. Put it into the bread pan and let it rise until it's doubled the size. Bake it for 40 minutes at 350 degrees fahrenheit and let it cool.

Puree watermelon in blender or food processor until smooth. Add raspberries. Puree again. Add orange juice to taste. Stir until blended. Pour into a bowl and freeze until firm. To serve, scoop frozen sorbet into a bowl or sundae glass or into a paper cone if serving at an ice cream shop. You may serve with or without the raspberry sauce (recipe below). Raspberry Sauce 1/2 cup raspberry juice 1/2 cup water 1/2 cup granulated sugar Directions:Combine ingredients in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heatcool slightly. Pour into a small saucepan to serve with the sorbet.

Combine pecans with granulated sugar, cinnamon, paprika, cayenne pepper and honey in a large ziplock bag. Shake until coated evenly. Place coated nuts in a bowl, pour oil over the top of the nuts in the bowl. Stir until coated evenly with oil. Bake for 1 hour stirring every 20 minutes until the nuts are completely coated in oil and brown.

In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the yellow onion, garlic cloves, lightly salted brown rice and adzuki beans. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions are translucent and the brown rice is tender but firm (about 25 minutes). Increase the heat to medium-high, add the coconut milk and season with fresh ground black pepper (about 10 minutes). When the liquid has reduced slightly, season with salt if needed, then serve the red beans in large bowls with fresh cilantro leaves garnish on each serving.

Prepare cake according to package directions. Cool. In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine graham crackers, sugar and butter. Cook until melted and smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in powdered sugar until combined. Cool to room temperature. Fold in pineapple. Spread half of graham cracker mixture in a 9x13 pan. Layer with bananas and half of whipped cream. Top with remaining graham cracker mixture. Spread remaining whipped cream. Sprinkle with nuts and maraschino cherries.

Wash lettuce leaves thoroughly. Squeeze out excess liquid. Cut lettuce leaves into square or rectangle pieces. Add carrot, zucchini and marjoram to lettuce. Sprinkle with pepper and margarine. Place fillets on lettuce. Moisten lettuce packets. Roll up tightly and tie with twine or string. Bake for 25 minutes or until fish is done.
Beat eggs in medium bowl until blended. Add cinnamon and saltbeat well. Stir in bananapour into greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until eggs are set.
Combine all ingredients except pork in the slow cooker. Cook on low for 8 hours. Transfer pork to a serving plate and serve with rice.

Bring a medium saucepan filled with enough water to cover the asparagus spears by about 1 inch over high heat to a boil. Add the asparagus spears. Boil until the asparagus is crisp tender but still bright green and just tender enough to be easily pierced with the tip of a knife. Drain the asparagus in a colander. Pat dry with paper towels. Transfer the asparagus to a serving platter or individual plates. Sprinkle with black pepper and olive oil. Wrap 2 pieces prosciutto around each spear. Lay 2 slices of goat cheese over the prosciutto. Arrange roasted red peppers around the asparagus. Serve.

Mix potatoes, flour, sugar, eggs, salt and butter together. Form into balls with about 2 tablespoons of dough for each ball. Dust the dumplings with breadcrumbs to prevent them from sticking to each other. Roll the dumplings in plum juice with a sugar cube, then roll them again in breadcrumbs to coat completely. Fry the dumplings for about 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Remove from oil with slotted spoon, then drain on paper towels. Serve hot with plum sauce on the side.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line pie crust with pastry or parchment paper. Combine applesauce, brown sugar, eggs, Crisco, lemon juice, lemon rind, salt, nutmeg, and cinnamon. Pour into pie crust. Bake for 45 minutes at 400 degrees until puffed and golden brown. Serve warm with a dollop of cool whip.

Combine oil, lime juice, garlic, cumin, chili powder and jalapeno pepper in a large bowl. Add flank steak and toss until well coated. Marinade in refrigerator 24 hours. Grill steak about 30 minutes per side. Add fresh cilantro just before serving. Serve with rice and sour cream.

In a slow cooker combine all of the soup except for the cheese. Cook on low for 8 hours. Just before serving stir in the cheese and then top with the tortilla chips. This is a very good soup and the kids love it.

In a pan, heat 4 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium heat. Add the squid and saute until they are lightly browned on both sides. Transfer the squid to a serving platter. Set aside. In a large saucepan or large Dutch oven, heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until tender but not brown. Add the crushed tomatoes to the saucepan. Break up the tomatoes with a spoon. Add the red wine to the saucepan. Bring to a simmer. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally for 15 to 20 minutes. Transfer the sauce to a food processor or blender. Add the remaining 3 tablespoons of the olive oil to the saucepan. Add the squid and the sauce to the saucepan. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Stir in the chopped parsley and serve.
Place yogurt in serving bowl and top with granola cereal. Add berries and banana slices to mixture and toss. Serve sprinkled with honey and cinnamon and garnished with mint sprigs.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cook egg noodles according to package instructions. Drain well. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add onions and cook, stirring occasionally until onions are softened. Add sage leaves. Cook until leaves wilt. Stir in cooked egg noodles. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake 5 minutes or until cheese melts.

Wash snapper fillets with cold water. Pat them dry with paper towels. In a 10-inch sauté pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil. Add snapper fillets skin side down. Season with salt and white pepper. Cook for 2 minutes or until crisp. Turn over and season with salt and white pepper. Cook for 30 seconds. Remove from pan. Drain fillets on paper towels. Squeeze lemon juice over fillets. Arrange fillets on serving platter. Spoon 1 tablespoon olive oil over fillets. Garnish with parsley, mint and cilantro. Serve immediately.

Peel potatoes, grate and rinse. Put potatoes in a colander and let drain for a few minutes. Put potatoes in a bowl. Add 1/2 cup flour and 3 tablespoons water. Mix together until thoroughly blended. Make 6-8 patties. Cook patties until browned on both sides in a skillet with 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Serve with a topping of sour cream or mayonnaise with lemon juice added for a little kick!

In a large pan heat a drizzle of oil. Add bacon. Cook over medium heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Add onions. Cook for 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Add water and vinegar. Cook for 5 minutes. Add sprouts and salt. Stir. Cover. Cook for 30 minutes or until sprouts are tender. Stir occasionally. Add mustard and cook for 5 more minutes. Serve warm.

Cut each potato in half lengthwise. Place potatoes on a baking sheet. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the oil. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon of the salt. Rub with sage. Broil potatoes in 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, heat 2 teaspoons of oil in a heavy large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onionscook for 1 minute. Stir in mushroomscook for 5 minutes. Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil. Add porkcook until browned on both sides. Add cream. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heatcook for 5 minutes. Stir in sage. Season with remaining 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Transfer potatoes to shallow bowls. Spoon pork mixture over potatoes. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Lightly grease an unbaked pie shell. In a large bowl, combine eggs, light corn syrup, apples and butter. Add vanilla extract and salt. Mix until combined. Stir in the macadamia nuts. Pour into crust. Top with morsels. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Beat eggs with milk in medium bowl until blended. Stir in flour, sugar and vanilla until smooth. Stir in cinnamon and salt. Stir in melted butter until blended. Stir in peaches. Spray griddle lightly with nonstick spray. Pour batter onto griddle to make 2-inch pancakes. Cook until browned on one side. Turn to brown other side. Serve with syrup.
Shake with ice and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with chocolate curls.

Place rice in a large saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook for about 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. In the same pan, saute the onions and green peppers in the oil for about 3 minutes or until tender. Stir in the tomato sauce and chicken bouillon. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Stir in the rice and cook for 3 minutes more. Serve hot.
Cook pasta to al dente. Drain. Add mayonnaise, buttermilk, garlic powder, black pepper, cucumber, sweet red peppers, scallions. Add pasta and toss. Refrigerate for 2-4 hours. Serve cold.

Brown beef in a large skillet. Drain and return to skilletadd remaining ingredients and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in 1 cup chopped pickles and 1/3 cup sliced tomatoes. Ladle into buns and serve with extra pickles and tomatoes. Serve with baked beans or coleslaw and corn on the cob for a complete meal.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 9x13 baking dish with butter. Peel onioncut into thin slicesset aside. In large saucepan, melt butter over medium-high heatadd onioncook 6 minutes, or until tenderset aside. Add ricecook 1 minute or until coated with butterdrain well. Add stockcook 18 minutes or until rice is tender. Remove from heatcool 10 minutestransfer to prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepperbake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes or until heated through. Yields 12 servings.

Melt butter over medium heat in a medium saucepan. Add onion and mustard seeds, cooking for 2 minutes. Add rice, stirring frequently for 1 minute. Stir in butternut squash, cooking for another minute. Add water, bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer for about 45 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Fluff with a fork. Add kosher salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or let cool for later consumption.

Preheat oven to 350f. In mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and sugar. Add coconut. Cream together butter and margarine. Beat in eggs. Stir in milk. Add dry mixture. Stir until combined. Press mixture into a greased 13 x 9 pan. Bake for 15 minutes. While still hot, spread raspberry jam evenly over top. Sprinkle with coconut. Let cool completely. Cut into squares.

Place all the shrimp in a large bowl. Pour soy sauce over the shrimp and toss to coat. Add pineapple pieces to the bowl. Set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet. Add shrimp mixture to the skillet. Add garlic cloves to the skillet. Cook 2 minutes or until the shrimp are cooked through. Sprinkle crushed red pepper flakes over the shrimp. Place green onions over the shrimp. Skewer the shrimp. Serve immediately.

Place chicken breasts in a shallow dish. Season with salt and pepper. Pour sweet chili sauce over top. Flip chicken and pour honey over top. Flip chicken and pour honey over top again. Sprinkle freshly grated fresh ginger over top. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place chicken breast skin side up in a baking dish. Pour 1/4 cup of lime juice over top. Bake for 18-20 minutes. Remove from oven and let rest for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with a fresh salad.

In a large saucepan, bring 2 cups of the half-and-half to a simmer over medium-low heatwhisk in the bouillon cubes until dissolved, then add the remaining 2 cups half-and-half. In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, the white pepper, the 1 tablespoon of sugar, the parsley, and the remaining 2 tablespoons of flourslowly whisk the egg mixture into the cream mixture until smooth. Heat the mixture until it just begins to simmeradd the corn and cook until the corn is tender but still crisp (about 30 minutes). Pour the corn into an 8-inch square baking dishtop with the butter. In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining 2 tablespoons flour with the remaining 2 tablespoons half-and-halfslowly whisk the sauce into the corn mixture until smooth. Bake for 15 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve hot or warm. Makes 6 servings.

Cook pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water following package directions. Drain and return pasta to pot. In a small bowl combine egg and cottage cheese. Whisk in sour cream. Pour mixture over pasta. Stir in salt and pepper and basil. Pour mixture into a greased baking dish. Sprinkle with grated cheese. Cover with foil. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes. Uncover and bake for additional 10 minutes. Serve.

Combine milk, bread, ground sausage, eggs, parsley, nutmeg, salt and pepper in a bowl and mix well. Form into balls about 1 1/2-inch in diameter. Roll in bacon to coat, then roll in flour to coat. Wrap each ball of sausage with a slice of hard-boiled egg, making sure to tuck the ends in underneath. Place eggs on a baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes before serving.

In heavy saucepan over medium heat, saute onion in butter until tender. Stir in garlic until fragrant. Add chilies and cook until just tender, about 5 minutes. Combine with cream in saucepan over medium heat. Stirring occasionally, bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until mixture thickens and is smooth, about 10 minutes. Season with cumin, salt, pepper, and lime juice. Serve with rice or with tortillas for burritos.

Cream sugar with butter until light and fluffy. Add anise powder. Sift flour with baking soda. Add anise mixture to flour mixture. Add water as necessary. Roll into balls. Place 1 inch apart on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 to 17 minutes or until done.

Place 1/4 cup evaporated milk in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in light brown sugar. Whisk in vanilla extract. Cook until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining evaporated milk. Pour into a large bowl. Stir in unsalted butter until melted. Whisk in white sugar. Set aside to cool. Place 1/2 cup icing sugar in a medium bowl. Whisk in irish cream until blended. Stir into cooled fudge. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. Roll into balls. Place in refrigerator. Store in an airtight container in refrigerator.
