Bake one side of the salmon fillet. Combine sour cream and prepared mustard. Brush the other side of the salmon fillet with sour cream mixture. Combine the onion and dill weed. Spread a layer of the onion mixture on the uncooked side of the fish. Combine mayonnaise and paprika and spread on the onion layer. Sprinkle with cheeses. Place the fish in a shallow pan. Bake at 400 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until done.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown ground beef. Drain. Add sauce. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Add macaroni. Cook until done. Top with cheese. Bake until cheese is melted. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and lightly flour two 9 x 13 inch baking pans. Sift together the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside. Beat butter and brown sugar in a large mixing bowl until light and fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla and beat well. Gradually beat in the cocoa mixture until well combined. Pour into the prepared baking pan. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes and remove from pan. Frost with the powdered sugar mixture.
Combine all spices. Store in airtight jar in a cool dry place.

In a large skillet over medium heat cook the chicken in the butter until browned and cooked through. Add the onion and cook until translucent and tender. Stir in the green chile, cream cheese and flour until combined and smooth. Add the broth and stir to combine and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook 5 minutes more until the cream cheese is melted. Meanwhile, place the flour tortillas in a single layer in the oven for 10 minutes to soften them up a bit. Fill each tortilla with 2 tablespoons of the chicken mixture and fold over. Place in a 9x13 inch casserole dish and drizzle with 1/2 cup of the whipping cream. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours. Heat the remaining whipping cream in a small saucepan over medium heat until simmering and the bubbles are just beginning to form around the edges of the pan. Remove from the heat and drizzle over the enchiladas and serve with additional hot cream

Cook the corned beef in a saucepan over medium heat. Add water to cover the beef. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until tender. Drain the corned beef. In a bowl stir together the lemon jell-o gelatin, water and vinegar. Add the corned beef. Pour the corned beef mixture into a 1-quart glass measuring cup. Add mayonnaise, green peppers, celery, onions, and salt. Chill thoroughly. Just before serving mix in the hard-cooked eggs. Spoon into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Refrigerate until set. Slice into wedges.

Remove feta from fridge 15 minutes before using. Slice feta into wedges. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Add feta and cook 3 minutes, turning once. Add 1/2 cup water and thyme. Cover and cook 3 minutes or until feta is heated through. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Serve over rice or with pita chips.

Boil pasta for 1 minute less than the package directions. Drain and rinse. Toss with carrot. In a large salad bowl, combine dressing and pasta. Stir in parsley and chives. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving. Serve at room temperature.

Clean and slice leeks and cut off all green ends. Peel and dice the cauliflower. Peel and slice the onions. Place leeks and cauliflower in a large pan. Add bouillon granules and water. Bring to a boil. Simmer for about 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in cream and salt and pepper. Remove the leeks and cauliflower and puree. Pour the puree into a bowl. Cut the parsley into fine slivers and add it to the soup. Pour into heated serving bowls and garnish with parsley. Serve.

Saute the mushrooms in oil for about 10 minutes. Remove them from the pan, keeping the oil. Add garlic and saute for a couple more minutes. Add the salt, chili powder and coriander to the mushrooms, tossing them well. Add the lemon juice and combine well. Add the besan flour and mix well. Add the water slowly while stirring constantly until you reach the desired consistency. Place the mixture back into the pan over low heat for a few minutes while stirring constantly until it thickens. Serve hot with a dollop of ghee.

Bring water to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan. Add sugar, tea bags, frozen lemonade concentrate, pineapple-orange juice concentrate. Return mixture to a boil. Stir occasionally for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Add ice. Serve over ice.
Puree all the ingredients together and shake well. Serve with oysters. You may also use this dressing for salad.

Boil water and pour it into a pitcher. Add mint leaves and ginger slices. Let it steep for a few minutes. Add lemon juice and honey and stir well. Pour into glasses and top each one with a few ice cubes and a lemon slice.

Bring 2 quarts of water to a boil. Add potatoes, salt and kielbasa. Reduce heat to medium high. Cover and cook 15 minutes. Stir frequently. Remove kielbasa. Add onion, garlic powder and dill. Cook 10 minutes. Add sour cream. Cook 5 minutes. Add flour. Cook 1 minute. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cut tortillas into wedges. Place tortillas in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Top with a small amount of refried beans and chicken. Top with a dollop of salsa. Sprinkle with cheese and a dash of cayenne pepper. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until tortillas are golden brown. Serve with guacamole on the side. Makes 8 servings.

In a small saucepan melt together the butter and corn syrup over medium heat, stirring frequently. When bubbles start to appear remove from heat and add marshmallows to mixture stirring to melt completely. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan to cool completely. In a bowl whisk together cocoa powder, vanilla, salt and baking powder. In another bowl whisk together eggs, sugar and brown sugar. Fold wet ingredients into dry until completely combined. Pour over cooled marshmallow mixture. Spread evenly with an offset spatula and allow to cool to room temperature. Cut into squares and store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to a week or in the refrigerator for up to a month.

Boil orecchiette according to package directions, drain and cool under cold water. Combine spinach, olives and mozzarella cheese with pasta and refrigerate overnight. The next day, toss together with red wine vinegar, olive oil and season with kosher salt and pepper to taste. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Prepare corn for grilling. Remove husk from corn. Toss corn in bowl with butter and seasonings. Place corn in husks and wrap tightly. Place in grill basket over fire. Cook until corn is tender and kernels pop.

Mix the cream cheese and sour cream together. In another bowl, mix the ham and onion. In a small bowl, mix the worcestershire sauce, butter and garlic powder. Add the worcestershire mixture to the cream cheese mixture. Mix well. Spread the ham mixture in a casserole dish. Pour the cream cheese mixture on top. Sprinkle pecans on top. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve hot.
Place apple pie filling into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Add yams. Mix in spices. Sprinkle with additional brown sugar. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until bubbling.

In a large bowl, combine the potato flakes with the garlic salt. Pour in the melted butter and stir with a fork until well coated. Pour into a greased 13x9 pan. Mix eggs with water. Stir in parmesan. Pour over the potato flakes. Bake for 30 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting into pieces. This makes a great side dish to any meal.

Blend broccoli florets, red bell pepper and onion in food processor until almost smooth, about one minute. In medium saucepan or Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat until hot. Add garlic clove and cook until aromatic, about one minute. Stir in broccoli mixture and cook until the broccoli is tender-crisp, about five minutes. Add the orange juice and bring mixture to a simmer. Add the tofu and cook for one minute. Turn off heat and add dijon mustard and cornstarch and mix until cornstarch is dissolved. Let mixture cool for two minutes and pour into a medium bowl. Pour into a bowl and cover and refrigerate for two hours or overnight before serving.

Cut chicken breasts into bite-size piecesadd to crock pot with chicken stock. Cover and cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 8 hours until tender. Stir occasionally. Add garlic powder, salt, pepper, oregano and garlic. Cook 30 more minutes. Serve over rice or noodlessprinkle with feta cheese if desired.

Heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic. Cook and stir until the onion is tender. Add the green beans and toss to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cook and stir for 2 more minutes. Add the vinegar and hearts of palm. Cook and stir for another minute. Add the sun-dried tomato and pine nuts. Cook and stir for another minute. Serve hot.

Cut potatoes into 1-inch cubes. Place in a large saucepan. Cover with water and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil 4 minutes. Drain and transfer to a bowl. Stir in sour cream, cheese and salt. Place potatoes in a 1-quart casserole dish and cover with foil. Bake at 400 degrees f for 15 to 20 minutes or until heated through. Serve warm.

Boil spaghetti until tender and drain thoroughly. Mix all other ingredients together in a large frying pan over medium heat. Cook until spaghetti is hot. Mix together well, serve with parmesan cheese on top of spaghetti.

In a large bowl, mix together the oats and honey. Then mix in the dried cranberries and pears. Transfer the mixture to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Place in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes. Allow to cool before cutting into bars.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add pierogi and boil until tender. Drain in a colander. Transfer to a baking dish. Add olive oil to a large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and onions and cook 5 minutes. Add the chopped tomato and cook 5 minutes longer. Add the drained pierogi and mix. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake 25 minutes.
Follow cake mix instructions for baking.

In a large glass bowl, mix together the flour, salt and pepper. Add steaks and coat with the flour mixture. In a large skillet brown steaks over medium heat on both sides. Add steaks to a slow cooker with onions celery and carrots and tomato sauce. Cook on low six hours or until meat is fork tender. Serve on buns with mashed potatoes and green beans.

In a small bowl whisk together the sherry vinegar, honey and mint. Season with salt and pepper. Toss with the baby spinach. In another bowl toss together the avocados and the cantaloupe. Arrange the spinach mixture and the fruit mixture alternately in a serving bowl. Drizzle with the dressing. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve.

Prepare crust according to package directions. Arrange peppermint patties in the unbaked pie crust. Pour the milk over the patties. Add frozen non-dairy topping. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add steak and cook, stirring occasionally for 2 minutes or until browned on one sideturn steak over and cook until browned on second side. Add soy sauce, water and vegetablessimmer for 3 minutes or until vegetables are tender-crisp. Stir in noodlescook for 2 minutes or until noodles are tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Stir together brown sugar, Dijon mustard, fresh dill, salt and pepper in small bowl until sugar is dissolved. Pour mixture evenly over salmon filletsbrush over fillets to coat evenly. Cover and chill 4 hours or up to overnight. Remove salmon from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking. Preheat grill to medium-high heat (400 degrees F). Grill salmon for about 10 to 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

In a small bowl, combine gelatin and water. Let sit until softened. Heat orange juice and vanilla extract. Stir to dissolve. Add gelatin mixture. Beat until thick. Add sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. Pour into parchment lined muffin cups. Chill until firm. Store at room temperature. Makes 24.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a medium saucepan. Add onioncook until softened, about 6 minutes. Add ricecook until well-coated with oil mixture, about 2 minutes. Stir in stockcover and cook until stock is absorbed, about 2 minutes longer. Stir in orange zestcover and cook until rice is tender and lightly browned at edges, about 2 minutes longer. Remove from heatlet stand for about 1 minute before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, toss together the mushrooms, garlic cloves, olive oil, salt & pepper, rosemary and sage. Transfer to a large baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Stir and return to the oven for 5-7 minutes. Transfer to a serving dish and garnish with fresh parsley and a drizzle of balsamic vinegar. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Remove frozen fish from packaging and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. While fish is baking prepare coleslaw mix. Tear up bagged coleslaw into bite size pieces. Place a handful of coleslaw mix into a bowl. Add enough mayonnaise to make the slaw moist. Mix thoroughly. Add russian salad dressing. Add cilantro. Add fish. Place fish tacos into heated flour tortillas. Add a dollop of slaw. Sprinkle with avocado. Top with some pico de gallo. Eat.

Mix together the herb seasoning and the milk. Place the tilapia fillets into a ziplock bag or container. Pour the milk mixture over the fillets. Place the fillets into the refrigerator for about an hour to marinate. Once the fillets have marinated, mix together the crackers and the parsley. Set aside. Preheat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Pour a thin layer of olive oil into the skillet. Once the skillet is hot, add the fillets into the skillet. Cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side or until the fish is flaky and opaque throughout the entire fillet. Once the fillets are cooked, remove them from the pan and garnish with the crackers and parsley. Enjoy!

In a large skillet over medium heat, stir butter and honey until smooth. Add lemon rind and heat 3 to 4 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove from heat. In a bowl, combine 2 cups flour, salt and milk. Add eggs to flour mixturestir well. Stir butter mixture into flour mixture. Drop by tablespoons onto a baking sheet. Bake 45 minutes or until popovers are golden brown. Sprinkle with pecans. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Cream the butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and vanilla extract and stir well. Add the flour and mix to combine. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop rounded teaspoonfuls onto a baking sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake at 350f for 12 minutes. Cool on the sheet for a couple minutes before removing to a wire rack to finish cooling.

Peel potatoes. Boil them in a large pot of salted water until tender. Drain them in a colander. Stir the potatoes with a rubber spatula until they are completely cool. Transfer to a large bowl. Add the butter, garlic cloves and salt. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher or a rubber spatula until smooth. Fold in the buttermilk. Serve hot.

Mix together bisquick heart smart mix and soymilk in a bowl. Add raisins. Add pumpkin. Mix well. Stir in cinnamon. Drop by tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes. Cool slightly before removing from cookie sheet.
Combine all ingredients into a food processor or blender. Blend until a smooth texture is achieved. Serve on bread as an appetizer or as a sandwich spread.
Cook hamburger and drain. Add remaining ingredients and cook over medium low heat until liquid is reduced and thickened.

Peel and quarter potatoes and place in large saucepan with enough water to cover potatoes by 1-inch. Add salt and vinegar and bring to boil over medium-high heat. Boil until potatoes are fork tender, about 15 minutesdrain. In a large bowl whisk together mayonnaise, cheese and green onionsfold in potatoes and season with salt and pepper. Serve chilled or at room temperature and garnish with bacon.
Cook potatoes in water until tender. Drain. In a saucepan add potatoes, milk, butter and salt and pepper. Mash well. Add blue cheese and mash some more. Serve hot.

Onion slices are cut into quarters. Place them on the grill. Cook until tender. Peppers are sliced. Place on the grill. Cook until tender. Place grill packets together on a serving plate. Sprinkle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.

In a 12 x 15-inch glass or ceramic pan melt butter over low heat until it is just beginning to brown. Remove from heat. Add pasta and stir to coat with butter. Add milk, mustard, turmeric, salt and pepper. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring often until mixture begins to thicken. Add cheese and stir until cheese is melted and incorporated into the pasta. Transfer to serving plattersprinkle with parmesan cheese if desired.

Bring water and salt to a boil in a saucepanadd the potatoes and cook until tenderthen drain and set aside. Melt the butter in the same pan and saute the shallots until tenderthen add the whipping cream and stir to blend. Add the potatoes and basilthen season with salt and pepper and serve.
Heat oven to 400 degrees. Stir together water & stuffing mix. Stir in chicken tenderloins & tomatoes with basil. Stir in mozzarella cheese. Put mixture into a 9x13 baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes.

Melt butter in skillet. Add scallops and cook until firm to the touch. Dip scallops into bread crumbs to coat lightly. Place in pan. Cook scallops until golden brown. Drain scallops on a paper towel. Serve scallops with fresh parsley garnish.

Heat butter in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onionsauté 5 minutes or until tender and golden brown. Stir in mushroomssauté 4 minutes. Stir in paprikacook 1 minute more or until paprika darkens slightly. Sprinkle with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Stir in cayenne pepper and stir until blended in. Stir in ricecook 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in sour creamcook 1 minute or until thickened slightly. Stir in dillcook 1 minute more or until heated through. Serve immediately with hot cooked rice or with mashed potatoes.

Preheat oven to 400F. Slice the baguette into 1/2 inch slices. Slice the garlic cloves in half lengthwise. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Place the baguette slices in the oven to toast for 10 minutes (watch them carefully to make sure they don t burn). Remove from oven and rub the toasted sides of the slices with the garlic cloves to release the garlic flavor into the bread. In the meantime, halve the tomatoes lengthwise so you can easily remove the seeds. Place the halved tomatoes, cut side down, on a baking sheet. Drizzle them with extra virgin olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Place the baking sheet in the oven for 15-20 minutes or until the tomatoes are tender when pierced with the tip of your finger. Remove the tomatoes from the oven and allow them to cool slightly (about 5 minutes). Halve the tomatoes lengthwise so you can easily

Toss all the ingredients together in a large bowl. Add more olive oil or lemon juice if needed for taste. Refrigerate for an hour or more before serving to allow the flavors to meld together. Serve cold with crackers or bread.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add parsley flakes and garlic clove. Cook for 30 seconds. Whisk in lemon juice and cook for 1 minute. Stir in paprika and cook for 1 minute. Add shrimp and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in cooked rice. Pour into a large shallow serving dish and sprinkle with paprika. Cover and microwave at high for 4 minutes. Uncover and stir. Microwave at high for 1 to 2 more minutes or until sauce is thick. Garnish with more paprika if desired. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 F. Spray a 2-quart casserole dish with cooking spray. In a large saucepan cook the noodles according to the package directionsdrain, reserving cooking liquid. Combine the cooked noodles, peas, soup, milk and onion flakes in the prepared dish. Sprinkle the seasoning salt over the top of the mixturestir well. Top the mixture evenly with the tuna and onions. Bake at 375 F for about 25 minutes or until heated through.
Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Drain off grease. Add sauce and pasta. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes. Top with cream cheese spread and parmesan cheese.

Trim chicken breasts of all visible fat and cut into 1-inch cubes. In large soup pot, heat oil over medium high heat. Add lemongrass, galangal and scallions, cooking until fragrant about 1 minute. Add chicken, broth, coconut milk, fish sauce, salt and pepperbring to a simmer. Reduce heat to medium lowcook until chicken is cooked through about 10-15 minutes. Stir in lime juicetaste and season with salt and pepper as needed. Ladle soup into bowls and serve with fresh cilantro.

Cream together margarine, sugar, jello gelatin. Add eggs. Stir in flour and baking powder. Fold in vanilla. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for about 12 minutes.

Brown bacon drippings in large fry pan with olive oil and add onion and green pepper. Cook until tender. Add corn and okra and stir for 1 minute until heated through. Stir in tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes stirring often. Add salt and pepper to taste. Spread in greased 9x13 inch pan and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and bake for 10 minutes at 350 fahrenheit. Serves 10.

Cut bananas in half. Slice one half of bananas lengthwise. Put them on a plate. Put banana slices in a shallow dish. Pour liqueur over sliced bananas. Let stand 15-20 minutes. Serve with a lemon wedge.

Wash beans with cold water (to remove any dirt) and pat dry with paper towel (to remove excess water). In a large sauce pan, add olive oilheat over medium heat. Add chopped onions and saute for about 3-4 minutes. Add garlicsaute for about 1 minute. Add chopped mushrooms (stems and caps)saute for about 5-8 minutes (until mushrooms have softened). Add beanssaute for about 5-7 minutes (until beans are tender). Add water chestnuts and italian seasoning (to taste). Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium lowsimmer for 3-4 minutes (until liquid has thickened). Season with salt and pepper to tastestir in parmesan cheese (to taste). Serve warm or at room temperature.

Slice garlic cloves in half. Place the shrimp in a bowl and toss them with the garlic cloves and the scotch bonnet. Set the bowl aside. Melt the butter in the frying pan and saute the shrimp and garlic for about 10 minutes. Pour the canola oil into the frying pan. Add the shrimp to the frying pan and saute for about 4 minutes until the shrimp are lightly browned and cooked. Stir in the lime juice and the thyme. Reduce heat and add salt to taste. Serve over steamed white rice.

Combine almonds, pepper, and 2 teaspoons barbecue saucesprinkle over chicken breast halves. Broil 10 minutes or until chicken juices run clear when chicken is pierced with fork. Remove chicken from oventop with remaining 2 teaspoons barbecue sauce. Cut 1 slice bread lengthwisespread each half with 1 tablespoon reduced-fat sour cream. Place 1 slice cheese on each half of breadtop with other slice of bread. Grill sandwiches over medium heat 3 minutes on each side or until golden brown.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Remove the stems from the lettuce leaves, trimming off the tough outer leaves. Finely chop the stems. Place in a bowl. Add the chopped shallots and the chicken broth. Season with thyme and sugar. Add the frozen peas. Set aside. Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the lettuce leaves to the pan. Cook until they are just tender, about 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate. Set aside. In the same skillet, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium heat. Add the remaining shallots. Cook until tender. Add the peas. Cook until the lettuce leaves are tender. Transfer the cooked lettuce leaves to a plate. Add the shallots and peas to the pan. Cook until the shallots are tender. Season with the lemon zest. Add the reserved cooked lettuce leaves. Cook until heated through. Place the lettuce mixture in a serving dish. Top with the chopped parsley.

Pre-heat the oven to 375F. Slice the brussels sprouts in half and place on a foil-lined baking pan (spray with cooking spray first). Squirt with a little lemon juice (this keeps them from browning). Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and sprinkle with garlic powder, ground black pepper, dried sage and a little salt (or just a pinch of each). Roast for about an hour or until tender (check them every 20 minutes or so). Serve warm or cold!
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine all ingredients. Beat egg yolks and mix with sugar. Stir in milk until mixture is smooth. Spoon into pastry shell. Bake for 10 minutes.
Mix all the ingredients and marinate the chicken for at least 2 hours. Put the chicken in the oven at 350 for about an hour.

Cut grapefruit, orange, tomatoes, green bell pepper, jalapeno pepper into 1-inch cubes. In food processor or blender, blend cilantro and peelings from grapefruit and orange. Add to salsa mixture. Stir sugar, salt, lime juice and water into grapefruit and orange juices. Add salsa mixture to juices. Taste to see if mixture is salty enough. If needed, add salt. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with chips.

Grease and line a loaf tin. Sift together the plain flour and salt and add to a bowl with the nuts, apples and lemon juice and zest. Beat in the brown sugar until well mixed. Whisk in the egg and vanilla essence and gradually add the melted butter until fully incorporated into the mixture. Stir in the sultanas and pour into the prepared loaf tin. Bake in a pre-heated moderate oven for about 40 minutes or until cooked through and golden in colour. Remove from tin and leave to cool on a wire rack before serving.

Whisk egg yolks in small saucepan set over simmering water. Add water and bring to simmer. Continue whisking until thickened slightly. Remove from heat. Add salt, cayenne pepper (optional), and melted sweet butter slowly while continuing to whisk. Beat until lightly thickened and smooth. Pour over cooked eggs or fish. Makes 1 cup.

Chop broccoli and place into a large serving bowl. Add mayonnaise, red wine vinegar, sugar, sunflower seeds, raisins, mushrooms and onion. Mix together gently. Sprinkle with bacon bits. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Heat pineapple preserves in the microwave at high power for two minutes or until heated through. Spread on pork roast and place in a casserole dish. Sprinkle with mustard and horseradish and add enough soy sauce to taste. Cover with foil and cook in the microwave on high power at one minute per pound or until pork is cooked through and tender, stirring every ten minutes or so until pork is tender. Remove foil about five minutes before pork is done and brown slightly on top in oven if necessary.

Preheat oven to 350. Sprinkle thighs with salt and pepper. Place thighs skin side down in a 13x9-inch baking dish. Pour sherry and soy sauce over the chicken thighs. Top with brown sugar and thyme. Roast chicken in preheated oven for 45 minutes or until no longer pink. Place chicken thighs on a platter and let stand 5 minutes. Discard the thyme sprigs. Skin the chicken thighs and discard skin and bones. Serves four.

Place all of the ingredients, except the chips into your crock pot. Cook on high for 5 hours or on low for 7 hours. Remove from crock pot. Stir. Reheat on stove top. Serve with chips. The washington post.

Peel and slice potato and place in a large pot. Add in water until just covered and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Drain and let cool. While the potatoes are cooking, slice the goat cheese into 16 equal pieces. Preheat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and 1 tablespoon of sweet butter. Add the garlic and thyme and cook for 1 minute. Add the scallions and cook for 1 minute. Add the potatoes and season with salt and freshly ground pepper. Cook for 3 minutes. Transfer mixture to a bowl and let cool for 10 minutes. Once cool, stir in goat cheese. Scoop mixture into 16 equal portions (about 1 ounce each). Roll each portion into a ball and place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until browned. Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes. Brush with remaining olive oil and sweet

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. In a large bowl beat together the butter and light brown sugar until smooth. Add the melted chocolate and stir until combined. In a second bowl combine the crumbled crackers, pecans and the remaining 1 cup sugar. Add the cracker mixture and the vanilla extract to the chocolate mixture and mix well. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or silpat and drop dough balls onto the sheet about two inches apart. Bake for about 12 minutes until the cookies begin to brown slightly and look dry on the surface. Cool completely and store in an airtight container.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Line 24 regular-size paper baking cups with cooking spray. Prepare the cookies according to package instructions and press one cookie into the bottom of each lined cup. Place 1 tablespoon of cream cheese in each cup. Stir together 2 tablespoons of sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of vanilladrizzle over the cream cheese. Fold in 1/2 cup of the sour cream. Top each cup with 1/2 tablespoon of the remaining sugar and 1/2 teaspoon of the remaining vanilla. Fold in the remaining sour cream and 1/3 cup of the chocolate chips. Spoon each mixture into the paper baking cups and smooth the tops. Place a cherry in the center of each. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until set. Cool in the pan for 15 minutes. Run a knife around the edges of each cake and remove from the cups. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

In a large slow cooker stoneware insert combine evaporated skim milk with water. Place the brown sugar twin in the slow cooker. Add the apple pie spice, maple syrup and oats. Stir to combine. Stir in apple pieces and raisins. Place the walnuts on top of the oatmeal mixture. Cover and cook on high for 4 hours or low for 6 hours. Serves 8. Delicious & dependable slow cooker recipes. Created for canadas kitchens.

Sauté onions in olive oil until soft. Add mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms have lost their liquid. Add curry powder to taste. Stir in potato flour until thickened. Add cream. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add sweet chili sauce. Serve over pasta.

Hard-boil eggs. Slice off egg shell and gently peal. Cut in half lengthwise. Cut a slit in each egg lengthwise and gently remove yolk. Slice eggs lengthwise and set aside. In a wok or skillet heat cooking oil. Add shallots and saute until fragrant. Add tamarind paste and stir until dissolved. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add eggs and toss gently. Add salt and mix until combined. Serve hot.

Prepare the teriyaki sauce by combining the teriyaki sauce, sesame oil, garlic, green onions and tomatoes in a small sauce pan. Bring the sauce to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 5 minutes or until the sauce is thickened. Set aside. Thread the beef onto the skewers. Coat the kabobs in the teriyaki sauce. Grill over medium heat for about 8 minutes per side or until the kabobs are cooked through. Serve the kabobs warm with rice on the side for dipping.

In a large skillet brown chicken in a little oil. In a small bowl combine orange juice with orange marmalade and soy sauce. In a large bowl combine cornstarch with 2 Tbsp. cold water and 1/2 tsp. salt. Stir in the orange mixture and pour over the browned chicken. Simmer until thickened. Pour over chicken. Serve hot.

In a large soup pot over medium heat, heat 2 tbsp. of the oil. Add the pork and cook until golden brown. Transfer the pork to a plate. In the same pot over medium heat add 1 tbsp. of the remaining oil. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the beans and broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer uncovered for 30 minutes. Add the sage leaves and cook for 2 minutes more. Add the pork and sauerkraut and simmer for 10 minutes longer. Add the polenta to the broth and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove the polenta from the heat and add the parsley. Season to taste with the salt and pepper. Serve.

Combine the milk powder, rice flour, almonds and cardamom seeds in a pan. Mix well and place over medium heat. Heat the mixture to the boiling point, stirring all the while. When the mixture begins to boil, reduce the heat to a simmer. Stir frequently for 20 minutes. Pour the hot mixture into a clean pan and add the sugar and ginger powder. Stir well. Pour into containers through a fine sieve. Let the milk cool for 2 hours before using.

In a large bowl combine rice-a-roni, marinated artichokes, green onions and green pepper. In a separate bowl whisk together mayonnaise and lemon juice. Toss with rice-a-roni mixture. Sprinkle with additional artichokes.

In a large skillet cook the bacon until crisp. Remove and drain on a paper towel. Drain off all grease from the skillet. Add the onion and cook until softened. Add the green beans and cook until tender crisp. Add the tomatoes, bacon bits and spices. Add water and cook for about 5 minutes until the beans are tender and the liquid is absorbed. Serve hot over rice or mashed potatoes.
Combine mayonnaise, sour cream, eggs, tuna and onion in a large bowl. Mix well. Stir in garlic powder. Layer on sandwich bread. Top with lettuce and tomatoes.

Remove skin from each breast half. In a large skillet brown both sides of each breast half in olive oil or butter. Drain on paper towel and set aside. In a small bowl, combine onion soup mix, sour cream & mushroom soup. Spread each breast half in greased 13 x 9 inch pan. Spoon mixture over breasts & sprinkle with basil. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until juices run clear when meat is pierced with fork. Serve with rice or potatoes or your favorite hot vegetable.

Place chicken breasts in a large saucepan and cover with 3 cups of water. Bring water to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook chicken breasts until tender. Drain the chicken and chop. Add chicken to the bowl of a food processor. Add the almonds, lemon pepper seasoning, garlic powder and mayonnaise and pulse to combine. Serve in a bowl. Garnish the chicken salad with a sprig of parsley. Serve immediately. Refrigerate leftovers.

In a large saute pan brown sausage and drain. Add onion and saute until tender. Add zucchini and saute until tender. Add noodles and carrots and mix well. Add molasses and catsup and stir until well mixed. Add worcestershire sauce and seasonings. Spread in a greased casserole. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until bubbling. Serve with applesauce.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add green onions, mustard, mayonnaise, breadcrumbs, red pepper, oregano, broccoli florets, cauliflower florets, cheddar cheese and parmesan cheese. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Transfer mixture to a 2-quart baking dish. Top with more cheese. Bake for 5 to 10 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and set aside. Slice sweet onion and garlic clove and place in sauce pan with potatoes. Cook until tender. Mix in butter and add chopped fresh dill weed. Serve hot or cold and enjoy!

In a small bowl combine the mild salsa and avocado and stir well. In a martini shaker add the lime juice and cayenne pepper sauce and shake well. Strain into a martini glass and add the salsa mixture and garnish the top of the shrimp with the onions.

To prepare crescent rolls. Unroll crescent rolls. Spread each roll with about 1 tbsp of butter. Sprinkle each roll with 1 tsp of cheese. Arrange sausage, bacon and hash browns onto crescent rolls. Top with another 1 tbsp of butter. Next add another 1 tsp of cheese. Roll each crescent roll. Place each roll seam-side down onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 450 for 10 minutes. Whisk eggs together with milk. Spoon egg mixture over each crescent roll. Sprinkle with another tsp of cheese. Bake at 450 for 10 minutes more or until cheese is melted. Let stand 2-3 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Mix together graham cracker crumbs and butter in a large bowl. Press into bottom of an ungreased 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Mix sweetened condensed milk, chocolate chips, maraschino cherries and coconut in a large bowl until combined. Spread over crustsprinkle with graham cracker crumbs. Bake 25 minutes or until firm in center. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack. Cut into bars. Serve.

Preheat the air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a large bowl with cooking spray. Place the popcorn kernels in a large bowl. Pour the vegetable oil and the sugar into the bowl and mix together. Add the salt and mix thoroughly. Pour the mixture into the air fryer basket and shake to coat the popcorn completely with the mixture. Place the basket in the air fryer. Cook for 8 minutes and shake the basket every 2 minutes. Remove the kettle corn from the air fryer and cool in the bowl. Once cooled, store in an airtight container.

In a food processor combine pine nuts, parmesan cheese, sun-dried tomato, garlic and olive oilpulse until all ingredients are combined and well mixed. Remove mixture and place on plate. Cook linguine according to package directions, drain well. In another pan melt butter and add basil leaves and black pepper to taste. Stir until butter is melted and leaves are wilted and combined with butter. Stir well and add linguine to the sauce. Stir and serve with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese and basil leaves.

Bring water to boil and add 1 ½ teabags of the green tea. Steep for 5 minutes. Remove tea bags and discard. Add the boiling water and lemonade concentrate to the teabags. Stir well to dissolve. Pour into glasses over ice cubes. Top with lemon and lime wedges. Serve.
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain potatoes. Peel potatoes. Place potatoes into food processor. Add crushed red pepper flakes, garlic cloves, milk and butter. Process until smooth. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Heat the olive oil and garlic together over medium heat until the garlic is softened. Remove from the heat and stir in the flour. Add the milk and stir until smooth. Stir in the salt and parmesan. Add the roasted pumpkin and stir. Pour the mixture into a gratin dish and bake for about 25 minutes. Stir and sprinkle with the sunflower seeds and the fresh parsley.

In a bowl, mix olive oil, garlic, parsley, crushed red pepper flakes and oregano with a fork. Add shrimp and toss gently to coat shrimp evenly with oil mixture. Place shrimp in a single layer in a 15 by 10 by 1 inch broiler pan. Bake in the middle of oven for 8 to 10 minutes turning over once during cooking time. Remove shrimp to serving platter and sprinkle with bread crumbs.

In a large bowl, mix together cream cheese and garlic. Add basil and stir gently. Stir in sun dried tomatoes and green onions. Add tomatoes and cheeses. Mix well. Transfer mixture into a shallow baking dish. Sprinkle mushrooms on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Serve with your favorite crackers.
Combine all ingredients into blender until smooth. Serve immediately.

Mix egg and milk together and beat until blended. Pour over pork chops and coat well with seasoned flour. Sprinkle with ground black pepper and place on baking sheet in oven. Bake at 375 degrees f. for 30 to 40 minutes or until done. Serves 4-6.

Preheat grill to medium-high. Remove stems from peppers and discard. Cut tops off peppers and remove seeds. Rub peppers with a little olive oil and season with 2 tbsp of the cumin and 2 tbsp of the anise seeds. Place peppers on a hot grill for 5 minutes per side. Meanwhile, pat tenderloin dry with paper towels. Sprinkle tenderloin with remaining 1/4 tsp cumin and 1/2 tbsp anise seeds. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and coat with the remaining 1 tbsp of anise seeds. Place tenderloin on grill for about 15 minutes total. Remove tenderloin from grill when it reaches an internal temperature of 160 degrees. Allow meat to rest for 5 minutes before thinly slicing. Arrange pepper slices on a platter and place meat slices on top. Cut peppers in half and place them on the platter. Sprinkle with cheese and serve.

Boil sweet potatoes and rice in a large pot with enough water to cover. Remove from heat and drain. Combine salt and sake. Pour mixture over potatoes and rice. Allow to cool. Refrigerate for 6-8 hours. Mix again and refrigerate for another 6-8 hours. Serve cold.

Boil carrots until tender. Drain. Mix hot pepper sauce with brown sugar and lemon juice. Toss carrots with butter and brown sugar mixture. Sprinkle with salt. Place carrots on baking sheet and sprinkle with raw brown sugar. Bake at 375 degrees f. for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Turn carrots. Sprinkle with more brown sugar. Return to oven for five minutes more. Remove and serve warm.

Cut potatoes in half lengthwise. Place potatoes in large bowl. Sprinkle potatoes with 1/2 teaspoon of the seasoning salt. Toss to coat. Place potatoes on lightly greased baking sheet. Sprinkle potatoes with remaining 1/2 teaspoon seasoning salt. Toss to coat. Bake in 350 degree oven 45 minutes or until tender. Serve with prepared horseradish sauce. Drizzle sour cream over potatoes. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper.

Combine all ingredients in a large heavy-duty pot. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil until cranberries pop and sauce thickens. Use immediately or refrigerate for up to a week. Makes about 3 cups.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground chuck in hot oil until browned. Add green pepper and tomatoescook and stir until vegetables are tender. Combine the mustard powder and the chili powder. Stir into the vegetables and cook for 1 more minute. Serve over cooked Basmati Rice.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Whisk together the sugar, flour, egg, butter, salt and baking powder. Mix well. Place peaches in a baking dish. Spoon batter over peaches. Bake 20-25 minutes or until brown. Sprinkle with fresh cinnamon. Serve warm.

Cream together shortening and butter. Add sugar gradually. Beat until mixture is smooth. Add vanilla. Add the dry ingredients and beat well. Roll dough into 1-inch balls. Flatten with your thumb. Roll dough balls in granulated sugar. Bake at 400 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes. Makes about 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Remove all but two garlic cloves from head of garlic, being careful not to break bulb in half. Rub each clove with olive oil and place in an ovenproof casserole or 9x13-inch pan with a tight-fitting lid. Sprinkle each clove with salt and pepper. Place in oven for 30 minutes to soften cloves without browning them (you should be able to squeeze garlic out of cloves easily). Cool slightly before removing cloves from pan and discarding themthey can also be used in garlic bread. In a large bowl, combine remaining ingredientsmix well. Add drumettes and toss to coat completely in marinade. Transfer to shallow baking pan coated with cooking spray or use a 9-x-13-inch glass baking pancover with foil. Bake 30 minutes or until golden brownremove foil to brown remaining 10 minutes. Serve immediately with celery sticks for dipping. TIP: For an easy way to prepare garlic for this reci

Place nectarines on a large piece of parchment paper. Sprinkle brown sugar and vanilla extract over nectarines. Wrap up nectarines tightly in the parchment paper. Place on a baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Remove from paper and drizzle with honey. Serve with a dollop of Greek yogurt.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta in colander. Add olive oil to pot with pasta and cook on low heat for 1-2 minutes. Add garlic to pot and stir for 30 seconds. Add cherry tomatoes to pot. Toss pasta around to coat with oil. Remove from heat and add fresh basil. Season with salt and pepper.

Bread and flour the pork fillets. Put into a pan and fry for about 15 minutes in ghee or oil until browned and cooked through. Put pork fillets in an oven proof dish and pour over the orange juice. Stir in the orange peel and brown sugar and pour over the pork fillets. Place in oven and bake for about 25 minutes or until tender. Serve with rice or potatoes.

In a large bowl, mix the marshmallows and melted butter until blended. In another bowl, mix the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt and set aside. In another bowl, combine the brown sugar and eggs and mix until well combined. Add the melted marshmallow and brown sugar mixture and the flour mixture to the egg mixture and mix until smooth. Fill muffin cups with batter and bake for 12-15 minutes or until the muffins are set and lightly browned on top and test with a toothpick inserted in the center of the muffin comes out clean.

Combine garlic and oil in large nonstick skillet. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Add crust. Cook 1 minute. Sprinkle with cheeses. Add herbs. Bake 7 to 8 minutes or until crust is golden brown and cheeses are melted. Cut into 8 pieces.

In medium pan over medium-low heat bring milk to boil. Reduce to simmer and add sugar. Cook for about 5 min stirring constantly till it thickens a little. Stir in ground almonds, rice flour and cardamom seeds. Simmer for few more min till mixture thickens. Stir in powdered ginger, remove from heat and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit (180 degrees celsius). Grease a loaf pan with shortening or butter or use a spray oil or wipe the greased pan with a paper towel to remove grease from the pan. Sift the flour and add the baking soda and salt to the bowl with the shortening and sugar and stir to mix well with a fork or spoon. Add the bananas to the mixture and stir well. Add the applesauce and eggs and stir well with a fork or spoon. Add the Splenda brown sugar blend and stir well with a fork or spoon. Add the mashed bananas and stir well with a fork or spoon. Pour the mixture into the prepared loaf pan and bake for about an hour in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and allow to cool in the pan for about 5 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire cooling rack and allowing to cool completely before slicing and serving.

Boil whole wheat pasta until al dente. Drain well. Heat olive oil in a pan. Add onions and garlic. Cook until the garlic is fragrant. Add eggplant and zucchini to pan and cook for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes. Bring to simmer and then add to pasta. Stir in oregano and basil. Add pasta and toss. Salt to taste. Serve with grated cheese.

Boil asparagus for 3 to 4 minutes. Drain. Boil carrots for 4 to 5 minutes. Drain. Cut asparagus spears into 1-inch pieces. Chop carrots into 1-inch pieces. Mix together with mayonnaise. Place 1/2 cup of the mixture in the center of 4 pieces of bread. Roll up and place in a 9 x 13-inch glass dish. Cover with foil and place in the refrigerator overnight. Prepare flounder fillets by pounding out with a meat mallet. Dip fillets into egg and dredge in seasoned dry bread crumbs. Place fillets in the center of each roll. Mix together mustard and tabasco sauce. Drizzle over fillets. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and flour a 9 x 13-inch pan. Whisk together the chocolate chips and margarine in a large bowl. Whisk together the eggs and sugars until well-blended. Add the chocolate and margarine mixture to the egg mixture and stir to combine. Whisk together the self-rising flour and salt in a medium bowl. Add to the chocolate mixture and fold in until just combined. Pour into the prepared pan and bake at 350 degrees f for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool before serving.

Melt butter in soup pot. Add leeks and cook for 2 minutes. Add potatoes to pot. Add celery salt. Add chicken stock. Add fresh spinach to pot. Cook for 5 minutes. Add more seasonings if necessary. Transfer to blender. Puree soup in blender. Transfer to soup pot. Add more seasonings if necessary. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Melt chocolate and butter in microwave or on stovetop in a large bowl. Stir in the eggs one at a time, making sure each is fully blended into mixture before adding the next one. Add vanilla and salt. Add dry ingredients all at once and stir until just blended. Fold in cups, reserving a few for the top of each brownie. Bake for minutes or until done and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool for about minutes then use a knife or a butter knife (or both) to peel the brownie off the pan onto a plate. It should come off fairly easily but may not if you use the butter knife. Serve with ice cream and enjoy! (You can also use other flavors of mini peanut butter cups.)

Place mussels in saucepan. Cover and steam for 3-5 minutes or until shells open. Discard any unopened mussels. Stir butter and cream into the steam mixture. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. Add parsley and stir well. Pour into heated serving dish. Arrange mussels on top. Serve immediately.

Make your pie shells. (See recipe below.) Pre-bake them in the oven. Remove from oven and let cool completely. Meanwhile make your margarita filling. Combine the margarita mix and egg yolks. Stir in the sweetened condensed milk and mix until smooth. Pour filling into the cooled crusts. Cover with the sweetened whipped cream and chill for at least two hours before serving. Store covered in refrigerator.

In a large saucepan or dutch over, heat oil. Add chicken breast, red pepper and garlic cloves. Cook until chicken is brown. Stir in the broth. Bring to a boil. Simmer 12 minutes. Stir in the asian vegetables. Simmer another minute or two. Whisk together lemon jello gelatin, cornstarch and 1 cup of chicken broth. Stir into chicken mixture. Cook 1 minute more. Transfer to a large serving dish. Drizzle with italian dressing. Serve.
Add 4 cups of water to a large saucepan with butter. Add bouillon cubes. Bring to a boil. Add rice. Bring back to a boil. Cover and reduce heat. Simmer 20 minutes. Transfer to a serving dish. Enjoy.

Add the shortening and butter to a large bowl and cut with a pastry blender or two knives until mixture looks like coarse cornmeal. Add the dry ingredients and cut mixture with pastry blender or two knives until well combined. Add the vinegar and egg yolk and cut until mixture begins to stick together. Sprinkle with ice water and continue to cut with pastry blender or knives until mixture begins to stick together. Shape the dough into a ball and place on a floured surface. Pat dough to 1/4 inch thick. Roll out dough to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Trim edges and place in pie plate. Fold under and crimp edges with a fork. Place pie on a cookie sheet and place in the freezer for 10 minutes. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Bake pie for 20 minutes. Remove from the pie plate to cool on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Heat olive oil and butter in skillet over medium heat. Add pork chops and cook until browned on all sides. Remove from skillet and drain excess fat from skillet. Add onion and garlic to skillet and saute until tender. Add pork chops back to skillet and sprinkle flour over pork chops. Cook for 3 minutes. Add apple juice and apple cider to skillet and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove pork chops from skillet and add to a greased shallow baking dish. Add dried cherries and cherry juice to skillet and cook for one minute to reduce by half. Pour sauce over pork chops and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake uncovered for 25 to 30 minutes or until juices run clear and pork chops are tender. Makes 4 servings.

In a mixing bowl combine cake mix, egg and oil. Pour half of the mixture into a greased 13x9 pan and press down firmly. Let stand for 15 minutes. Then add cool whip and spread evenly over the cake mixture in the pan. Spread the remainder of the cake mixture over the cool whip. Smooth it out and then add powdered sugar. Bake for approximately 25 minutes at 350 degrees F.

Add oil and garlic and cook until soft. Add onion and cook until soft. Add cumin, cayenne pepper and turmeric. Add canned chickpeas and cook until chickpeas are heated through. Add spinach and pimentos. Cook until spinach wilts. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 375. Lightly grease and flour 12-cup standard muffin tins or line with paper cups. In a large bowl, whisk together all-purpose flour, unsweetened cocoa powder, baking powder and ground cinnamon. Add salt and brown sugarwhisk to combine. Whisk in eggs and milk until combined. Fold in mini chocolate chips. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake until puffed and firm to the touch and a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Let cool in tins for 5 minutes before removing.

Soak limas in cold water for 30 minutes. In a large saucepan combine limas, water, sugar, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Add sesame oil. Cover again and simmer for 10 more minutes or until tender. Makes 4 cups. Serve warm.

Boil the new potatoes until tender. Drain well. Melt butter in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onions to butter and saut until tender. Stir in flour and salt. Add milk gradually. Simmer for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Stir in sour cream and vinegar. Pour over the hot new potatoes.

Cut cream cheese into chunks. Add kraft old english and kraft roka blue to cream cheese. Mix thoroughly. Add garlic powder and worchestire sauce. Form into balls. Roll in pecans. Refrigerate 2 hours. Serve with crackers.

Pat chicken dry with paper towels, rub with cut side of onion. Place in shallow dish. Mix together remaining ingredientspour over chicken. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Drain chickendiscard marinade. Grill or broil until done (about 45 minutes total).

Drain the chicken thighs well and pat dry with paper towels. Cut the thighs into small pieces about 1/2 -inch cubes and set aside. Heat the oil over medium heat in a wok or large skillet until hot. Add the chicken pieces and stir-fry until they are lightly browned, about 2 to 3 minutes. Transfer to a serving plate and set aside. Heat the oil again if necessary, add the basil leaves and chili peppers and stir-fry until the basil leaves start to wilt slightly, about 2 to 3 minutes. Pour the mixture over the chicken pieces. Stir well to coat the chicken with the basil leaves. Transfer to a serving plate and set aside. To the wok or skillet, add the fish sauce, oyster sauce, sweet soy sauce and enough water to come halfway up the sides of the wok. Bring to a boil and cook the sauces until the liquid is reduced by half. Pour the sauces over the chicken mixture and stir well to coat the chicken pieces with the sauces. Taste for seasonings. Ser

Melt butter in medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook garlic 1 minute. Add vidalia onionscook 3 minutes. Add blue cheese, mayo, sour cream and cream cheese. Cook 2 minutes or until sauce is smooth. Transfer mixture to serving dish. Tear bread into bite-sized pieces. Dip in blue cheese sauce.

In a saucepan, bring orange juice to a boil. Add couscous. Stir for 1 minute. Transfer to a large bowl. Add chickpeas, almonds, raisins. Stir to coat couscous well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a small saucepan, sauté the shallot and garlic in the oil. Add the red wine. Add the mussels. Cover. Cook over medium heat until the mussels open. Discard any mussels that have not opened. Add the tomato juice. Add the chorizo. Season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Simmer for about 5 minutes. Drain the mussels in a colander. Set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Stir in the reserved mussel broth. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the mussels. Sprinkle with the fresh parsley. Toss gently. Serve hot.
Boil cauliflower until tender. Drain and mash with garlic powder and oil. Mix in bisquick mix and parmesan cheese and form patties. Bake at 400 degrees for 35 minutes or until brown on top.

Slice the beef. Heat the oil in a pan and add the beef. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the green beans and mushrooms and cook for another minute. Stir in the garlicky black bean sauce and beef stock. Add the bean sprouts and stir-fry for 1 minute. Cook the noodles in boiling water for about 4 minutes or until just tender. Add to the beef and toss to mix. Serve with steamed rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Beat together margarine, sugar and orange juice until creamy. Add vanilla extract. Add to this mixture 1 egg at a time. Add 1 tbsp. of flour to mixture at a time. Mix until smooth. Place on wax paper. Roll out to 1/4 inch thick. Use a small cookie cutter to cut out shapes. Place on wax paper. Bake 8-10 minutes. Cool on wire racks. Melt candy coating according to package directions. Dip shapes into candy coating. Add a lollipop stick to the back of each shape. Let cool.

Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. While noodles are cooking, heat peanut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and red onion and saute for about 1 minute. Add brown sugar and stir for about 1 minute or until caramelized. Stir in the cabbage and carrot. Cook for about 1 minute. Add the chili sauce and soy sauce. Cook for about 1 minute or until heated through. Add noodles and stir until well combined. Serve immediately.

Prepare the peach pie filling according to the directions on the container or box and set it aside to cool. Place the frozen pie crust on a baking sheet and thaw in the fridge for at least 20 minutes before you prepare the filling. You can thaw it in the microwave if you like but be careful not to let it become soggy. Preheat oven to 350 degrees f and grease a 9-inch pie pan with butter or cooking spray. Spoon the peach filling into the crust and dot the filling with 6 tablespoons of butter. Mix the brown sugar and the 1/4 cup of flour together and sprinkle it over the top of the peach filling. Sprinkle the cinnamon over the top and bake for 40 minutes or until the filling is bubbling and the top is golden brown. Let it cool for a couple of minutes and then serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat broiler. Trim and discard woody ends from asparagus. Cut asparagus in half lengthwise if necessary to fit in the asparagus spears. Arrange asparagus in a single layer in a shallow 11 x 7 inch baking dish or shallow 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Drizzle the asparagus with the olive oil and sprinkle with the kosher salt and ground black pepper. Broil until the asparagus is tender and lightly browned, about 6-8 minutes. Remove from the oven and transfer to a platter. Sprinkle the cheese over the asparagus. Let stand for 1-2 minutes. Serve immediately. Garnish each serving with a lemon wedge.

Drain canned tuna well and place in large mixing bowl with canned corn. Add bell pepper, cucumber, tomatoes and parsley to mixing bowl along with olive oil, white vinegar, salt, and pepper to taste. Mix well using large spoon or spatula. Let salad marinate in the refrigerator for at least one hour before serving. Taste the salad while it's marinatingif you add too much salt or pepper at this time, it will be difficult to remove the flavor afterwards.

In a large bowl whisk together juice, water and egg. Add to a large bowl and mix in butter and sugar. Stir in salt and bread flour and active dry yeast. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead for five minutes or until smooth and elastic. Place dough in an oiled bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise for one hour in a warm place free of drafts. Punch down dough and divide in half. Roll dough into a long sausage shape and cut slices about two inches wide and four inches long. Twist dough and place in prepared pans with about three inches between slices. Cover and let rise for an additional one hour in a warm place free of drafts. Bake at 375 degrees for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool in pan for five minutes and remove from pans to wire racks to cool completely. While bread is baking, prepare the topping by melting butter and stirring in powdered sugar and vanilla extract and mix well.

In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until softened, about 4 minutes. Add the beans and cook for 5 minutes. Pour in the hot water. Cook for 10 minutes over medium heat. Add the salsa, sour cream, chili powder and season with salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve over brown rice.

Saute ham until brown. Add onion and cook until transparent. Add chicken broth and boil until liquid is reduced to about 1/4 cup. Add margarine and cook until melted. Add angel hair pasta and cook until tender. In a small bowl combine egg yolks with parmesan cheese. Add to pasta mixture and toss to coat. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 325f. Cut onion in half, then slice. In a large pot over medium heat add olive oil. Saute onion for 4-5 minutes then add carrots. Saute for 4-5 minutes. In a large bowl combine beans with 4 cups of the brothset aside. Place remaining broth into a bowl and add seasoningset aside. Add carrots to pot with remaining oil. Cook 2 minutes then add beans. Cook 1 minute then add seasoning. Cook 30 seconds or until heated through then add spinach. Cook 1 minute or until spinach is wilted. Sprinkle with pepper to serve.

Pour lime juice into a shallow dish. Add olive oil. Stir in white wine vinegar, garlic cloves, chili powder, salt and pepper. Stir well. Place shrimp into mixture. Marinate for 15-20 minutes. Thread shrimp and vegetables onto skewers. Grill over medium heat for about 10-12 minutes. Turning to coat with marinade. Serve hot.

Wash potatoes and slice into 1/4-inch thick rounds. In a cast iron skillet heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat until shimmering but not smoking. Add potatoes to skillet without crowding and cook, flipping occasionally until golden brown on both sides, about 8 minutes total. Transfer potatoes to plate lined with paper towels to drain. Add another 1 tablespoon oil to skillet and heat until shimmering but not smoking again. Add onion to pan and cook until softened and lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add another 1 tablespoon oil to skillet and heat until shimmering but not smoking again. Add swiss cheese to pan and cook until browned on both sides, about 2 minutes per side. Remove cheese from pan and set aside. Add butter to skillet and heat until melted. Add parmesan cheese to pan and cook until lightly browned, about 1 minute. Add potatoes to pan and cook until heated through, about 1 minute. Garnish with parsley and serve.

In a saucepan, combine 2 cups of the teriyaki sauce and the ginger. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir in the garlic and cayenne pepper. Continue stirring for 1 minute. Add the chicken. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the remaining 2 cups of the teriyaki sauce. Stir to coat the chicken. Pour the chicken into a 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with salt. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve with rice. Store leftovers in the fridge. Reheat in the microwave.

Saute onion until tender then add garlic clove and saute until garlic is golden. Add mushrooms and cook for 5-7 minutes or until tender. Add spinach leaves and saute for 1-2 minutes or until leaves are wilted. Stir in balsamic vinegar and salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or allow to cool. Refrigerate leftovers for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 3 months. Defrost in the refrigerator overnight before serving.

In a saucepan combine all the dry ingredients and mix well with a fork. Add the egg and water and cook over medium heat, stirring frequently until mixture thickens and coats the spoon. Pour into a large bowl and let cool completely. Stir in half and half and vinegar and blend well. Chill until ready to serve. Serve over cooked potatoes or pasta and garnish with black pepper and mayonnaise.

Bring apricots, water and orange juice to a boil. Cook 5 minutes. Add sugar. Cook 3 minutes more. Place apricot halves in a bowl. Pour warm syrup over apricots. Let sit 15 minutes. Transfer to a glass jar. Seal tightly. Store in a cool dark place. Makes about 6 cups.

Cut okra in half lengthwise (do not cut off ends). In a large pot of salted water, bring water to a boil. Cook okra for 5 minutes or until just tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. Remove stems. Set okra aside. In a large pot over medium heat add 2 tablespoons of oil and bring to a light smoking point (about 30 seconds). Add in spices, stirring constantly until fragrant about 1 minute (be careful not to burn). Reduce heat to low and add in yogurt, stirring constantly until bubbles subside about 2 minutes. Add in okra, stirring until okra is coated in yogurt mixture about 30 seconds. Salt and pepper to taste. Transfer mixture to a shallow serving dish (preferably glass or ceramic). Serve warm or cold with pita or tortillas.
Pickle the cabbage and eggs together, separate when cooled and chop each one into tiny pieces. Mix together with mayonnaise and serve as coleslaw.

Slice ham into 1/2-inch pieces. In a large skillet heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add ham pieces in a single layer and cook for 3 minutes on each side or until browned. Remove ham to a plate. Add garlic and onion to skillet. Cook until onion is soft. Stir in thyme leaves. Add ham back to skillet. In a large bowl beat together eggs until well blended. Add thyme mixture, parsley leaves, cheese, pepper and salt. Stir in ham mixture. Pour egg mixture into skillet. Cook over medium heat until almost set. Sprinkle with parsley. Transfer to a platter.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until tender. Stir in the flour and cook for 2 minutes. Whisk in the poultry seasoning, garlic powder and salt. Cook for 2 minutes. Whisk in the chicken stock and ranch dressing. Bring to a boil. Add the chicken to the skillet and simmer for 10-12 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a 13 x 9-inch glass dish. Pour the gravy over the chicken and cook for 20 minutes. Transfer the chicken to serving plates and garnish with additional herbs and lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 425f. Grease muffin cups or line with paper liners and spray liners with non-stick cooking spray. Mix applesauce, brown sugar and egg with apples and bananas and stir in flour mixture and melted butter. Fill muffin cups and bake for 20 minutes until golden brown and test with toothpick to check done-ness. Let cool and enjoy!

Mix all spices together in a small bowl. Place popcorn in a microwave safe bowl. Add spices to popcorn. Microwave at high for 1 minute. Stir popcorn occasionally. If it is not quite done microwave for 10 seconds at a time until done. Add butter to popcorn and stir until well mixed. Stir in the brown sugar, microwave for 10 seconds and stir until it is coated with the brown sugar.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, shortening and water. Mix well. Shape dough into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Divide dough into 2 portions. Roll out one portion on a lightly floured surface until very thin. Line a 9-inch pie pan with the dough. Crimp the edges. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Roll out other portion of dough into a circle large enough to cover pie crust. Place on top of pie crust. Trim any excess dough from the edges. Crimp edges of the dough. Cut vents in top of dough. Bake 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool for 30 minutes before filling.

Beat eggs, milk, flour, powdered milk (if using), salt and nutmeg together until smooth. Fold cheddar cheese into mixture. Spread mixture onto lightly greased cookie sheet (or 12-inch square baking dish). Top with chopped broccoli and green onions (optional). Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake 20-25 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before cutting. Serves 6-8.

Bring juice cocktail and dried apricot halves to boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat and simmer until apricot halves are tender and liquid is reduced by half. Remove from heat and add cranberries and sugar. Cook over medium heat until cranberries pop. Stir in gingerserve hot.

Combine flour, salt and pepper in a resealable plastic bagadd chicken pieces. Seal bag and shake to coat chicken with flour mixture. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil until hot but not smoking. Add chicken in batchesbrown on each side for about five minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Remove chicken from pan with a slotted spoon and set aside. Add mushroomssaute for four minutes or until tender. Pour off all but two tablespoons fat from pan. Add chicken brothbring to a simmer. Add chicken pieces, cover pan and cook over medium-low heat for ten minutes. Sprinkle with parsleyserve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a large bowl combine the ground beef and breadcrumbs. Add the eggs, onions, garlic, salt and pepper. Mix well. Form meatballs the size of golf balls and place on a lightly greased baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes. While the meatballs are cooking combine the hot sauce with the butter in a small pan and heat until melted. Remove from heat and stir in the honey. Stir the sauce into the meatballs just before serving and garnish with blue cheese dressing if desired. (adapted from buffalo meatballs recipe from the food network)

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds, thyme leaves, cayenne pepper and 1 cup water. Bring to a simmer. Meanwhile, fill a large pot half full of water. Add 2 tablespoons of the salt. Bring to a boil. Place the lid on the pot but leave a small opening. Shake the popcorn frequently. Once the liquid in the saucepan has come to a simmer, add the corn. Cook until all the kernels have popped. Remove from heat. Immediately add the popcorn to the saucepan. Stir to coat. Add the remaining 1 teaspoon of salt. Cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese. Transfer to a serving bowl.

Place potatoes in a saucepan of salted water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cook 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Discard any remaining water. Put potatoes in a large bowl. Mash with a potato masher or a fork. Add evaporated milk. Beat with a mixer for 3 to 5 minutes or until light and fluffy. Fold in butter. Add salt and sugar to taste.

Heat the olive oil in a large soup pot over medium heat. Add the carrot, celery, shallot and garlic to the pot. Cook for 5 minutes until the vegetables soften. Add the chicken to the pot and cook until the chicken is cooked through. Add the chicken base. Add the hot water to the pot. Bring to a boil. Add the cornstarch. Reduce the heat to a simmer. Add the cold water. Cook until the soup thickens. Stir in the salt and pepper. Serve with crusty bread.
Remove any silver skin from steak and trim away any excess fat. Rub with seasonings. Place steak in a 4-quart slow cooker. Cover with chile mixture. Cook on low for 7 hours or until meat is tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Bake sweet potatoes until tender, about 45 minutes. When cool enough to handle, remove skin and discard. Place potatoes in food processor and purée until smooth. Add butter and molasses and purée again. Season with salt. Serve warm. You may also serve cold.

Cook rice according to package directions in rice cooker or on stove top. Stir in soup mixture and water and cook for about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, melt butter in skillet and saute water chestnuts until tender. Add peas and stir for about one minute until heated through. Add soy sauce and stir until blended. Stir into rice mixture and heat through for about one minute. Serve hot.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine peach, honey, mustard, vinegar and water. Stir and bring to a simmer. Cook until peaches begin to break down, about 10 minutes. Remove peaches from pan with a slotted spoon and place in a bowl. Place chicken in marinade and refrigerate for at least an hour. Grill chicken over medium-high heat for about 10 minutes per side. Remove from heat and set on a cutting board. Brush chicken with marinade. Tear thyme leaves off stems and sprinkle over chicken. Squeeze garlic cloves from skins and spread over chicken. Serve with peaches on the side.
Boil water with garlic clove and onion. Add rice. Cook until rice is soft. Add chicken broth. Add parsley and parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Makes about 6 servings.
Chop tomatoes. Saute onion in a little olive oil. Add chopped tomatoes. Add zucchini. Saute until tender. Add sugar and salt to taste. Stir. Remove from heat.

Heat 2 tbsp of butter and 2 tbsp of oil over medium heat in a large saute pan. Add garlic and cook until golden. Add clams and white wine and cook 1 minute or until clams are open. Transfer clam mixture to a large serving platter and keep warm. Drain linguini in a colanderrinse with cold water and drain well. Return linguini to saucepan and add remaining 1/4 cup oil and 1 tbsp butter. Cook over medium heat until butter melts and oil is heated through. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds more. Add clam mixture and cook 1 minute more. Stir in half and half and cook 1 minute or until sauce thickens slightly. Remove from heat and stir in basil and parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Place linguini on platter and pour sauce over top. Sprinkle with cheese and serve.

In a small bowl combine vinegar, ketchup, honey, apricot nectar, garlic cloves, paprika and celery seed. In a medium bowl combine vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a small bowl combine the vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a small bowl combine vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a small bowl combine vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a small bowl combine vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a small bowl combine vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a small bowl combine vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a small bowl combine vinegar mixture with oil. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine vinegar mixture

Mix together cream cheese and shar pepper cheese. Add in taco seasoning. Whip in sour cream. Beat eggs and fold into mix. Pour into greased casserole dish. Bake for 40 minutes at 350 degrees. In oven at end of cooking time add salsa and guacamole to casserole. Bake for 5 minutes. Serve with sour cream and salsa for dip.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line 2 large baking sheets with foil. Brush both sides of thighs with oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place on prepared baking sheets and brush with oil again. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Remove thighs from oven and brush again with oil. Mix molasses and lemon juice together. Stir in worcestershire sauce and garlic. Brush over thighs. Return to oven and bake for another 10 minutes. Remove thighs and brush once again with oil. Sprinkle with lemon wedge. Serve.

Cook chicken and drain. In a large bowl mix mayonnaise, celery and onions together. Add drained chicken and celery seed. Season with salt and pepper. Chill for 2 hours. Add pecans. Top with a layer of shredded cheddar and place on a bed of potato chips. Garnish with lemon wedges. Serve with crackers.

Mix oil, egg and vanilla in bowl until well blended. Stir in buttermilk. Add sugar and cocoa powder and mix well. Stir in flour. Pour in prepared pan and bake for 25 minutes. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

Peel oranges and place into blender pitcher. Add ice. Blend until smooth. Pour into tall glasses. Add water to fill glasses to about 1/2 inch from top. Fill glasses to top with milk. Add coffee creamer to top of each glass to taste. Add sugar to taste. Stir to combine. Garnish each glass with a slice of orange. Enjoy!

Heat the oil in a Dutch oven or large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the green beans and cook for 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes and tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the curry powder and cook for 1 minute. Add 1/4 cup water and cook for 2 minutes. Add the next 4 ingredients. Cook for 10 minutes. Stir in the remaining water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Melt butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add pork chops and brown on both sides for about 10 minutes, or until browned. Add onions, garlic, chili flakes, sherry, cream, thyme and parsley and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 30 minutes, or until sauce is reduced by half. Serve over rice or with mashed potatoes.

First make the sauceIn a medium bowl, mix sour cream with chili powder, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Set aside. Next coat chicken in the sour cream mixture and put on a cookie sheet. Bake for about 25-30 minutes at 375 degrees Fahrenheit until golden brown. Meanwhile prepare the DoritosLay the Doritos on a cookie sheet and bake for about 8-10 minutes at 375 degrees Fahrenheit until they start turning golden brown. Next assemble the chickenSpread a layer of Doritos on a plate and top with a layer of chicken. Add another layer of Doritos and cover with cheddar cheese and mozzarella cheese. Broil the chicken until the cheeses start melting and bubbling. Serve immediately!

In a skillet melt oil over medium heat. Add bologna cubes and brown on all sides. In a large saucepan combine flour, milk, water and seasonings and stir until smooth. Add bologna cubes and stir until thickened. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles or rolls.

Cook the noodles in a large pot of boiling water until tender but not soft. Drain well. Place in a large bowl and add the chicken and chicken stock to the noodles to reheat. Add the sweet chilli sauce and fish sauce and stir well to combine. Stir through the coriander leaves and red capsicum and serve warm.
cut pita breads into pieces and toast on preheated grill. Slice cucumbers and tomatos. Spoon feta onto each pita bread and top with tomatos and cucumbers. Serve immediately.

Cut cactus into 1-inch-thick pieces. Remove seeds from jalapenos. Peel onions and cut into 1/2-inch-thick rings. In a saucepan, combine 1/4 cup corn oil with tomatoes and jalapenos. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add cactus and onions. Cook 5 minutes. Drain. In a saucepan combine cactus mixture and 1/4 cup corn oil. Heat over medium-high heat. Stirring constantly, cook until cactus is tender. Add Monterey jack cheese. Heat and stir until melted. In a bowl combine cactus mixture with tomato and onion. Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve hot with corn tortilla chips.
Cut pork roast into serving portions and set aside. In a slow cooker combine all other ingredients and cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours. Slice pork roast and serve with horseradish sauce.
