Wash leeks thoroughly and pat dry with paper towels. Toss leeks with olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste. Spread the leeks onto a roasting pan or baking sheet and roast for 30-40 minutes or until tender and browned in spots (they will be soft and translucent). Remove from oven and cool slightly. In the meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper to taste and place them on an oven-safe platter. Brush the top of the salmon with lemon juice and sprinkle with lemon zest and fresh dill. Lay the roasted leeks on top of the salmon fillets and drizzle them with olive oil and bake for 15 minutes or until salmon is cooked through. Serve immediately with steamed vegetables or your favorite rice or potatoes on the side.

Stir the gelatin into the milk over low heat until dissolved, stirring occasionally. Stir in the cream cheese and yogurt until blended. Cool slightly. In a large bowl, fold in the fruit and nuts and gently stir in the cooled gelatin mixture. Pour into molds and refrigerate until firm. Let stand at room temperature 15-20 minutes before removing from molds. If desired, garnish with whipped cream and sliced fruit before serving.

Boil sausage over medium heat until crisp. Drain well. Add chopped onion and apple. Stir to combine. Cut crackers into 1/2-inch rounds. Place 1/2 cup of sausage mixture on each cracker. Beat eggs until foamy. Add milk to the egg. Dip each cracker into egg mixture. Roll each cracker in crumbs. Place crackers on a baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Make the crust and press it into the bottom of the pan. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate. Dice the bananas and strawberries. Place the bananas in the pie crust and top with the strawberries. Mix together the cream cheese and the condensed milk until it is smooth. Pour the mixture over the fruit. Add lemon juice and vanilla to taste. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.

Mix all dry ingredients in a medium bowlmix well. Put the chicken in a shallow dishrub with mustard, honey, lemon juice mixturesprinkle with pecanscover and refrigerate at least two hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 350F degrees. Combine the breadcrumbs with the buttersprinkle over the chicken in the dishsprinkle with saltbake for 45 to 55 min until the meat is tender and the juices run clear when the meat is pierced with a fork. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Combine all stuffing cubes ingredients in a small saucepanbring to a simmer stirring occasionally. Cover and let simmer until thickened, about 5 minutesstir in the apricot jam. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature (about 25 minutes). Stuff pork loin roast with stuffing mixture. Place roast in an oiled roasting panpour chicken broth over roast to cover. Bake in preheated oven until pork registers 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), about 5 hours. Brush roast with apricot jam and balsamic vinegar before serving. Serve with warm potatoesdrizzle with apricot jam and balsamic vinegar to taste.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Grease muffin cups with butter or cooking oil. In a large bowl combine buttermilk, sugar, salt and orange and grapefruit zest. In another bowl beat egg. Add grapefruit zest to egg mixture. In a separate bowl combine flour, baking powder and baking soda. Pour buttermilk mixture into flour mixturefold in egg mixture. Place batter in muffin cups and bake for 30 minutes or until muffin springs back when lightly touched with the finger. Remove from oven and let cool on wire rack.

Peel the potatoes and cut into large chunks. Cook for 10 to 15 min. or until tender. Put potatoes in a bowl and mash with a potato masher or electric mixer until creamy and smooth. Stir in the bacon bits, sour cream, and shredded sharp cheddar cheese. Spoon into a baking dish, cover with foil, and bake for about 10 to 15 min. or until bubbly. Remove foilsprinkle with green onion tops and serve immediately.

Place lamb in crock pot with oil. Add vegetable juice, curry powder, salt and carrots. Cook for 1 hour or until tender. Add green pepper with remaining juice. Cook for 1 hour more or until tender. Add ricestir in broth and cook for about an hour or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.

Mix the flour and water in a bowl and stir until smooth. Add chicken broth and stir until smooth again. Bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes on medium high heat then reduce heat and cook for 2 minutes more or until thickened. Add salt and pepper to taste. Dice chicken into small pieces and add to the soup. Cook for another minute or two or until chicken is done. Mix the baking soda into the dumplings and drop into the soup. Cook for another minute or two or until dumplings are cooked through. Serve and enjoy!

Skin chickens and pound very thin. Place in a large baking dish or casserole dish with onion and sliced mushrooms. Top with red pepper slices. Top with tomatoes. Add dressing mixture over tomatoes and sprinkle with grated mozzarella cheese. Bake for about 45 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and cheese is browned. Serve with hot cooked rice or potatoes.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Unthaw puff pastry. Cut in half lengthwise. Spread curry powder on one side of each pastry. Lay 1 sausage patty on pastry, and roll up. Place seam side down in 11x15 inch pan. Brush with beaten egg. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden.

Heat oil in a large saucepan. Add onion and garlic. Cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add broccoli, bay leaf, broth, wine, water, and season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. Cook until broccoli is tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in sunflower seeds.

Preheat oven to 400f. Season rib eyes on both sides with salt and pepper and place on a heated grill pan or cast iron pan. Cook on each side for 2-3 minutes or until desired doneness. Transfer to a baking sheet to rest for 5 minutes. While steaks are resting, place mushrooms and garlic cloves into a blender or food processor and pulse until finely chopped. Heat olive oil and butter on medium heat until bubbly. Add flour and cook for 2 minutes stirring constantly. Whisk in marsala wine and beef broth until smooth. Cook for 5 minutes or until thickened. Add chopped mushrooms and rosemary and simmer for 10 minutes. Whisk together 1 cup marsala sauce and 1 cup beef broth. Add to 2 cups sauce and stir to combine. Serve sauce over steaks.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. In small bowl combine ground round, onion, teriyaki sauce and parmesan cheesemix well and form into 1 inch balls. Place each ball in ungreased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. In small bowl combine egg and bread crumbs. Place each meat ball in egg mixtureturn to coat. Place in prepared baking dish. In small bowl combine ground round and egg and bread crumbsmix well. Place 1/2 of meatball mixture on bottom of dishplace 1/2 of meatballs over meat mixture. Top with 1/2 of meatball mixturerepeat layering until all meatballs and meat mixture are used. Bake 25 to 35 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and salt and pepper to taste.

Mix together graham cracker crumbs and milkmix well. Pour into crust and refrigerate. Pour pudding into crust and refrigerate. Top with whipped topping. Chocolate frosting can be made with cocoa and milk.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl whisk together the vanilla instant pudding mix, milk and Cool Whip. In another bowl beat the butter until creamy. Add the light corn syrup to the butter mixture. Then add the powdered sugar. Add this mixture to the pudding mixture. Stir well to combine. In a 9-inch springform pan combine the club crackers, chocolate squares, butter, light corn syrup and vanilla. Mix well. Pour the pudding mixture over the chocolate/cracker mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes. Sprinkle powdered sugar on top. Let cool before removing from pan.

Preheat oven to 350. Cut yams in half lengthwise. Drizzle with oil. Sprinkle with cardamom and black pepper. Place yams on a cookie sheet. Bake for 45-60 minutes or until soft. Serve hot or warm with honey.

In a large bowl, whisk the almond meal, flour, salt and baking powder. Using a pastry blender or two knives, cut the cold butter into the flour mixture until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Make a well in the center of the flour mixture and add the honey. Add the water and stir with a wooden spoon until the dough comes together in a ball. Turn the dough onto a floured surfaceknead briefly. Divide the dough in half. Roll the dough into two discs, then wrap each disc in plastic wrap. Refrigerate the dough for at least 4 hours or until firm. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Flour a work surface. On a lightly floured surface, roll out one ball of dough into a round about 1 inch thick. Transfer the dough round to a lightly floured pie plate. Trim the dough edge with a sharp knife. Prick the dough bottom with a fork. Bake the dough round for 10 minutes or until it puffs slightly. Transfer the pie plate to a

Peel the carrots. Grate the carrots into a food processor. Add the garlic and ginger and blend until smooth. Add the stock and blend until the mixture is pureed. Add the salt and pepper and blend. Add the cream and blend until smooth. Add the fresh parsley and blend. Serve immediately.

In a bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, butter and cinnamon until blended. Press into the bottom of a nine-inch springform pan. In a medium mixing bowl combine cream cheese and skim milk. Beat with an electric mixer at low speed until smooth. Beat in the sugar-free banana cream pudding mix until blended and smooth. Pour into the prepared pan and chill for at least four hours or overnight. Serve with low-fat whipped cream or low-fat vanilla ice cream.

Melt together in double boiler. Remove from heat and add vanilla. Add rice krispies and corn syrup. Pour into trays and let cool. Peel off waxed paper and cut into squares. Store in airtight container.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil to skillet and brown chicken on both sides for about 10 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside. Add 1 tablespoon of oil to skillet if necessary and add onion, red pepper, green pepper, corn, chili powder, and black pepper to skillet. Cook until vegetables become tender. Place chicken on top of vegetables in skillet. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover skillet with lid and cook for 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Transfer chicken to a bowl and set aside. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook vegetables until they are cooked through for about 5 minutes. Stir in salsa until heated through. Serve chicken and vegetables over hot cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl combine 1 box of cake mix with 2 sticks of butter, 1/4 cup of oil and 4 eggs. Add in white chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Flatten each with a fork. Bake for 8 minutes or until golden brown.

Butter a large frying pan. Melt the butter and add the shallots and cook until soft. Add the wine and cook until almost evaporated. Add the pork tenderloin and cook until the pork is browned on both sides. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs on top and cook until browned. Serve with rice pilaf or other favorite side dish.

In a blender, combine coconut milk and water and blend until smooth. Add ice water and blend. Add pineapple jell-o and blend. Chill. Just before serving, whisk in angel food cake pieces. Serve with whipped topping and garnish with fresh mango and banana.

Cook bacon in large skillet over medium-high heat until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet with slotted spoondrain on paper towels. In same skillet over medium-high heat, cook fettuccine according to package directions. Drain. Stir in bacon, eggs and herb seasoning. Top with Parmesan cheese and fresh ground pepper. Serve immediately.
Sauté chicken in skillet until cooked through. Transfer chicken to plate. Add butter to pan. Add wine, reduce by half. Add maple syrup. Bring to a boil. Add chicken. Serve over rice.

Rinse and pat dry chicken. Place in a large resealable plastic bag with bell pepper and yellow onions. Add garlic clove and oregano. Shake well. In a small bowl, mix paprika and lemon pepper. Pour over all and shake again. Marinate for at least 1 hour. Remove from the bag and grill or broil until browned. Drizzle with lemon juice from the lemons. Serve over rice.

Bake pie crust as directed on package for two crusts. In a large bowl whisk together the ice cream and lemonade concentrate. Stir in the tequila and triple sec. Fill pie crusts. Refrigerate until firm. Serve.

Start off with a skillet for sausage. Add hash browns and sausage. Cook on med heat until sausage is done. Next start your other two pans with grease. Add pepper and onions to one pan and eggs and cheese to the other. Cook eggs and peppers until done. When everything is done assemble. Top with hash browns and cover with cheese. Place one egg on top and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place all three pans on plates. Serve and enjoy.

Combine flour and light Italian dressing in shallow dish. Place tilapia in dish and turn to coat both sides. In shallow saucepan combine broth and lemon juice. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in cream cheese until melted. Combine cheese mixture with flour mixture. Dip tilapia in flour mixture and coat both sides. Place on heated grill or broiler for about 3 to 4 minutes or until fish flakes easily. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.
Mix sugar, almonds and romaine in large bowl. Add strawberries, red onion, mayonnaise, milk, poppy seeds and vinegar. Toss lightly. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Remove stems from mushroom caps. Stuff with cream cheese. Place one piece of smoked salmon on each mushroom cap. Sprinkle with mustard powder. Bake in 375 oven for 10 minutes or until heated through. Serve hot.

Rub pork roast with salt and pepper. Place roast in crock pot. Add apple, onion and sage. Top with chicken broth. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or until pork is tender. Remove pork from crock pot. Shred pork and add to stew. Add brown sugar and apple cider to stew. Stir and cover. Cook on low heat for 15 minutes. Serve with cornbread.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spread pizza crusts with pizza sauce and top each with cooked chicken breast, sliced avocado and sauteed mushrooms. Top each pizza with a layer of monterey jack cheese and bake until cheese is melted, about 15 minutes. Cut and serve. Serves 4.

Heat a little oil in a large frying pan and saute onion until soft. Add zucchini and saute for a few minutes. Add tomatoes and stir occasionally until soft. Add red pepper flakes and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Combine butter, sugar, orange rind, and vanilla. Beat until light. Add flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Stir until well blended. Fold in dried cranberries and diced dried coconut. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto wax paper. Press to form balls. Dip tops into egg. Roll in coconut. Place in a single layer on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes. Remove from cookie sheet to wire rack to cool. Makes 4 dozen.

Brush crust with olive oil. Spread pizza sauce over crust. Top with shredded mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle with italian cheese blend and pepperoni. Arrange red bell pepper, green bell pepper, and onion over top. Bake in oven for about 15 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Let pizza cool slightly. Cut into squares and serve.

In a skillet heat peanut oil over medium-high heat and brown chicken on both sides. Transfer chicken to a plate and set aside. Add garlic and red chilies and saute over medium heat for 1 minute. Add chicken broth, crushed tomatoes, basil, cracked pepper and parsley and bring to a boil. Stir in cooked pasta and chicken and simmer for about 5 minutes or until pasta is tender. Stir in chives and serve with additional cracked pepper.

Sauté onion and mushrooms in butter over medium heat for 3 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Stir in ham and cook for 3 minutes more. Add soup and stir. Add noodles and heat through. Serve with sour cream and chopped parsley.

Preheat oven to 350. In Dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add bacon and cook until browned and crisp. Remove with slotted spoon and discard. Add onion and saute 5 minutes. Add beans and stir well. Add the molasses and bourbon. Stir well. Add the peaches. Simmer uncovered about 30 minutes. Stir in the apple juice and season with salt and pepper. Pour into casserole. Sprinkle with bacon. Bake 45-50 minutes until hot and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place pork tenderloin on a sheet pan and season with garlic salt, sage, coarse black pepper. Roast pork for 15 to 20 minutes. While pork is cooking, place sweet potatoes and pears in a large bowl and toss with olive oil. Add sage, salt and coarse black pepper. Place sweet potatoes and pears onto a baking sheet and into oven for 45 minutes. Once pork is done cooking and the sweet potatoes and pears are done cooking, remove from the oven and serve.

Cut each biscuit into halves and cut each half into thirds. Place one third of biscuit on serving plate and top with about a tablespoon of the dressing and sprinkle with cheese and seeds and nuts and then with another biscuit half and repeat with the dressing and seeds and nuts until you have a total of three biscuits per plate and dressing is used up. Serve immediately with hot tea.

Melt butter in sauce pan over medium heat until light brown. Add flourwhisk until smooth. Slowly whisk in heavy cream and sherry wine, whisking until smooth. Bring mixture to a simmer stirring frequently. Reduce heatcook and stir for about 2 minutes. Stir in salt, pepper and crabmeat. Remove from heatstir in cheese until melted. Pour mixture into shallow baking dishsprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake at 375f for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Combine the brewed coffee with molasses. Add the dark rum and whipped cream. Top with nutmeg.

In a large skillet cook beer and seasonings over medium heat until beer is reduced by half and thickens slightly. Transfer mixture to a blenderblend until smooth. Heat half of the beer mixture in the blender over medium heat until hot. Stir in refried beans. Transfer to a bowl. Add salsastir until smooth. Cover and let stand at room temperature for at least 2 hours or overnight. Heat remaining beer mixture in the blender over medium heat until hot. Stir in cheese. Transfer to a bowl. Stir in chopped cilantro. Cover and let stand at room temperature for at least 2 hours or overnight. Stir in 1/2 cup of the chopped cilantro. Transfer mixture to a slow cooker. Cook on low for 2 hours. Transfer mixture to a blenderblend until smooth. Transfer mixture back into the slow cooker. Cook on high for 1 hour. Heat remaining cheese mixture in the blender over medium heat until hot. Stir in chopped cilantro. Pour cheese mixture into the slow cooker. Cook for 1 hour. St

Cook tortellini according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Meanwhile, combine 2 tablespoons vinaigrette with 2 tablespoons olive oil. Mix together peppers and broccoli. Add cooked tortellini and toss with vinaigrette. Sprinkle with havarti cheese and serve warm. Serves 4.

Cream together 2 cups of white chocolate chips, 1/2 cup of orange juice and 1/2 cup of orange rind. Cream butter and sugar together. Add eggs one at a time. Add orange juice mixture. Mix dry ingredients with water. Combine dry and wet ingredients. Stir until just mixed. Pour into a greased 9x5 loaf pan. Bake 55 minutes at 350 degrees. Allow to cool. Mix 2 cups of white chocolate chips with 1/4 cup of orange juice. Mix well. Pour over top of cake. Cool. Store overnight before removing from loaf pan. Slice. Serve.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain well, reserving 1 cup of the cooking liquid. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, saute onion in 1/2 cup of the reserved cooking liquid in the skillet for 5 minutes or until onion is tender. Add garlic and cook 2 minutes longer or until garlic is tenderdrain. Cut hot dogs in half lengthwiseplace in a 10-in skillet over medium heat. Add remaining cooking liquid to the skilletcook and stir for 5 minutes or until hot dogs are hot. Drain wellplace in a bowl. Add sauteed onion to bowl along with the cooked macaronitoss gently to coat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 4 days. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat the broiler. Cut tofu in half and then cut in half again to make 4 quarters. Place all of the tofu pieces cut-side down on a baking sheet and broil for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cut the tofu into cubes. Put all of the dipping sauce ingredients into the bowl of a food processor and pulse until smooth. Serve with tofu cubes and crackers.
Mix all together in bowl. Spread onto tortilla chips.

Sprinkle salt and pepper onto chicken thighs. In small bowl combine lemon juice and molasses. Add garlic and Worcestershire sauce and stir well to combine. Brush lemon mixture over chicken thighsplace in 13x9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake 50 minutes or until chicken juices run clear when chicken is pierced with fork or until internal temperature reaches 165 degrees F (80 degrees C). Remove chicken from oven and sprinkle with lemon wedge before serving.

Preheat waffle ironcombine all remaining ingredients in a bowl and beat with a fork until well blended and smoothpour into waffle iron and cook according to manufacturer s instructionsserve with butter and syrup.

Sauté the ham and mushrooms in butter until tender. Add red pepper and onion. Cook until tender. Add milk and eggs beaten together with salt and pepper. Cook until eggs are set. Remove from heat. Cover and allow to set for about 2-3 minutes or until eggs are set. Serve over hot cooked rice or crusty bread. Top with shredded Cheddar cheese.

In a large bowl mix eggs and potatoes. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat and add onions and bacon. Cook until onions are translucent. Add bacon and cook for one minute. Add mixture to eggs and potatoes and whisk until everything is combined. Heat skillet over medium heat and pour egg mixture into skillet. Cook until edges are firm and pull back from sides of pan. Flip and cook for another 2 minutes or until eggs are cooked through. Serve with toast.

Melt neufchatel cheese in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add milkheat until cheese is melted. Whisk flour into milk mixture until blended. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thick. Stir lemon juice into cream sauce mixture. Add garlic powderstir until blended. Stir in grated tofu shirataki noodles. Cook until noodles are heated through. Sprinkle with dried chives. Season with fresh ground black pepper to taste.

Muddle rum, earl grey tea, pineapple juice, apricot liqueur, fresh lime juice, lemon juice and simple syrup with ice cubes. Strain into a punch bowl filled with ice. Garnish with sprigs of fresh mint.

Cook angel hair pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Toss with olive oil. Spread the pasta on a platter. In a small bowl whisk together the lemon zest and juice. Toss with the shrimp and asparagus. Arrange the pasta and the shrimp mixture on the platter. Sprinkle with cheese. Garnish with green onions. Serve immediately.

Prepare cooked brown rice according to package directions. Cool slightly. In a large bowl combine cooked brown rice with ground turkey, olives, raisins, green bell pepper and onions. Stir in dressing and adjust seasonings as desired. Serve chilled or at room temperature with fresh vegetables such as lettuce and tomato.

In large skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp, remove bacon with slotted spoon and set aside on paper towels to drain excess grease. Add butter to drippings in skillet and stir in spinach until spinach begins to wilt. Add alfredo sauce and stir until spinach is completely wilted. Add cooked bacon back to skillet with sauce mixture. Cook until heated through. In large pot of boiling water, cook fettuccine until tender but firm to the bite. Drain fettuccine and add to skillet with bacon mixture. Mix until blended. Add chicken to skilletmix to coat. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheesemix to blend. Serve immediately.

Prepare chicken as directed on package. Coat chicken breasts with olive oil and season with dried oregano, paprika, ground ginger, black pepper and cayenne to taste. Place chicken in a preheated skillet and cook over medium heat until internal temperature reaches 170 degrees f. Drain and serve immediately.

Combine pork, wild rice, onion and wheat germ in large bowl. Add eggs and beat well. Mix in parsley and pepper. Shape mixture into loaf. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 3 hours or until firm. Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly spray a 9x5x3 loaf pan with cooking spray and place pan on a baking sheet. Unwrap loaf and place on prepared pan. Cover loaf with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until firm enough to slice. Bake for about 1 hour or until heated through. Let stand for about 5 minutes before cutting into portions. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 350F and grease an 8 inch springform pan with butter or spray with nonstick cooking spray. Beat together the cream cheese and the stilton cheese and mix in the sour cream and sugar. Sift together the flour and the dry vermouth and fold into the cream cheese mixture. Beat in the eggs and vanilla and then fold in the butter and ginger snaps. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth with a spatula. Bake for about 1 hour or until the edges are set and the center is just about firm when you push lightly on the top of the cake with a finger. Remove from the oven and let cool for about an hour in the pan on a wire rack. Unmold the cake by loosening the sides with a thin knife and then removing the pan and transferring the cake to a serving dish. Serve warm or at room temperature with fresh fruit and/or a dollop of whipped cream if desired.

Preheat oven broiler. Place 3 tbsp of butter in a small saute pan over medium heat. Saute shrimp for 3 minutes or until they turn pink and opaque throughout. Set aside. Place a thin layer of butter on a piece of aluminum foil. Place shrimp in the center and fold foil around them to close. Place foil packets on a cookie sheet and place in oven under broiler for 6 minutes or until butter begins to bubble and shrimp are cooked through. Remove and place on a platter and serve hot.

Cook cannellini beans in boiling water for 15 minutes. Drain. Dice bell pepper. Mix together beans, bell pepper, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Place in serving dish. Add spinach. Pour Italian dressing over salad. Sprinkle cheese over the top.

Place flank steaks on grill. Season both sides of steaks generously with salt and pepper. Brush both sides of steaks with olive oil. Sprinkle with coarse ground black pepper. Grill for 4-5 minutes on each side. Transfer to plate. Combine the honey, soy sauce, garlic cloves and fresh rosemary. Pour over the steaks. Let stand for 15 minutes. Slice steaks thinly across the grain. Serve with warm tortillas.

Mix Chex Mix and Cheerios together. In a separate bowl, melt white chocolate chips and oil together until smooth. Pour chocolate mixture into Chex Mix mixture and stir to coat all of the Chex Mix and Cheerios. Drop mixture by spoonful onto waxed paper to cool. Store Chex O S treats in airtight container in refrigerator for up to 3 days.

Pierce potatoes all over with a fork. Bake in the preheated oven until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain off excess water. Cool for 15 minutes before cutting into wedges. Meanwhile, make the dressing by combining the sour cream, mayonnaise, mustard, relish and celery seed. In a large bowl combine the potatoes and dressing. Garnish with bacon bits, sour cream and cheddar cheese.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease 12 standard muffin cups. In medium bowl, beat butter until fluffy. Add sugar and beat until fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. In small bowl, stir together flour and baking powder. Add flour mixture to butter mixture alternately with buttermilk. Gently fold in blueberries. Spoon batter into greased muffin cups. Bake 20-25 minutes until golden. Cool in pan 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Heat oil in pan and fry onion until tender. Add curry paste and fry for about 2 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the chicken and cook until just done. Add the spinach and simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in the yogurt. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve with basmati rice.

Cook pasta according to package directions in a large pot of boiling salted water. Reserve about 1/4 cup of the pasta water before draining pasta. Return pasta to the pot and stir in the reserved water, basil, capers, salt and lemon juice until combined. Drain pasta well. Toss the pasta with the shrimp and serve warm or cold.

In a large skillet, brown the beef until done. Add onion and olives. Stir in tomato soup. Remove from heat and stir in the noodles and cheese. Pour into a greased 3 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with black pepper. Bake uncovered at 350 for 45-50 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Stir together cherries, sugar, flour, and spices. Pour mixture into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees until the filling is thickened (about 20 minutes).

Mix together eggs, oil, vanilla and sugar until well blended. Combine flour, baking soda and baking powderadd to egg mixture until combined. Add squash. Mix well. Pour into greased loaf pan. Bake at 350f for 1 hour or until done. Serve slightly warm. Yield: 1 loaf.
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with tortilla chips. Makes 2 cups.
Combine all the ingredients in a blender except for the cucumber and carrot. Blend until the mixture is smooth. Pour mixture into a large bowl. Add the cucumber and carrot. Serve with chopped onion.

Preheat grill to high heat. Sprinkle the pineapple with salt & ground pepper to taste. Place the pineapple chunks on the grill for 3 to 4 minutes per side. When pineapple chunks are lightly grilled on both sides remove from grill. Place the pineapple chunks on a serving platter. Grill the shrimp for 4 to 5 minutes on each side. When shrimp is lightly cooked remove from grill. Place shrimp on pineapple chunks on the serving platter and serve immediately.

Mix plain flour with some seasoned salt and pepper. Heat oil in a frying pan and fry the chicken pieces on both sides until golden. Remove and set aside. Sauté the chopped onion in oil until soft. Add the sherry and bring to the boil. Add the cream and stir together. Add the chopped thyme and return the chicken to the pan. Stir and heat through. Serve immediately.
Drain beans. Place all ingredients in a food processor. Blend until well mixed. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a 12 cup mini muffin pan with cupcake liners. Whisk together applesauce and vanilla. In a large bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Add sugar and beat until soft peaks form. In a separate bowl, whisk flour, baking powder and espresso powder until combined. Fold flour mixture into egg whites until combined. Pour half of the brownie batter into each liner. Bake 15 to 18 minutes until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Cool completely before storing.
In a large punch bowl, combine all punch ingredients and mix well. Serve over ice and garnish with pineapple.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, beat together butter and sugars until fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla extract and beat until combined. Add cocoa powder and beat again until combined. Stir in flour mixture and mix until combined. Stir in chocolate kisses and chips until combined. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake for 8 minutes or until cookies are set but still soft in center.

Heat a wok over high heat and add a generous amount of cooking spray. Crack eggs and beat lightly. Place eggs in wok and cook until white is cooked but yolk is still runny. Remove eggs with slotted spoon and set aside. Add bacon to the wok and cook until brown and crispy. Add cooked rice and saute until heated through. Add prawns and cook until pink and firm. Add green onions and cook until wilted. Add snow peas and cook until tender. Add soy sauce and stir to combine. Place cooked rice back in the wok and toss to coat with the cooked bacon and prawns. Transfer to serving plates and garnish with egg and green onion. Serve immediately.

Combine skim milk, splenda, lemon juice and baking powder in a large bowl. Mix to combine. Stir in biscuit mix until well mixed. Pour onto hot skillet coated with cooking spray. Cook until bubbles appear on the top. Cook until light golden brown on the bottom. Flip and cook until golden brown on the second side.

Place eggs in a pot of cold water. Bring to a boil then remove from the heat. Cover with lid and let stand for 12 minutes. Drain water. Peel eggs. Chop eggs into quarters lengthwise. In a large bowl mix mayonnaise, mustard, sour cream, lemon juice, zest, salt and cayenne. Add eggs to the mixture. Add chopped parsley.

In a medium bowl, combine cream cheese and sour creammix in Parmesan cheese and spring onions. Stir in ham and pineapple. Cover and chill for at least an hour before serving. Serves 8-10 as an appetizer or as a sandwich spread on crackers or pita bread.

Place turkey tenderloins in a lightly greased baking dish. Brush tenderloins lightly with melted butter. Stir in remaining ingredients except mandarin orange pieces. Pour over tenderloins and cover. Bake at 375 degrees for 1 hour. Bake uncovered 15 to 20 minutes longer or to desired degree of doneness. Remove tenderloins from oven and arrange mandarin orange pieces decoratively in the center of each tenderloin. Serve hot.

Cook butter in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium heat until melted and slightly browned around edges. Add green beans to hot butter and stir until coated. Sprinkle garam masala and salt evenly over green beans. Cook, stirring occasionally, until beans are tender and lightly browned in spots (about 5 minutes). Stir in tomatoes and cook until tender and mixture is thickened slightly (about 5 minutes). Serve hot or at room temperature.
Melt the butter in a large skillet. Add the onion and saute over medium-low heat until soft. Stir in the spices. Add the shrimp and chicken. Saute until shrimp is pink. Serve with rice or noodles.

Wash eggplants and slice. Set aside. Slice onions. Add sliced onions to pan with olive oil. Cook for 5 minutes. Add garlic to onions. Cook until tender. Add mushrooms. Cook until tender. Add eggplant to pan with olive oil. Cook for 5 minutes. Add tomatoes to pan with olive oil. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove pan from heat. Sprinkle parmesan cheese over top. Place pan in oven at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve with fresh bread.

In a large mixing bowl combine the pineapple, carrot, celery, pear, raisins and yogurt. Stir gently to blend. Cover and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours before serving to allow flavors to meld. Add the peanut butter just before serving. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Mix together flour and dry baking mixes in medium bowl. Set aside. Cream butter with sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Stir in orange zest and vanilla until combined. Add dry mixture to creamed mixture and stir until combined. Mix in cranberries and chocolate chips. Form dough into balls the size of a large walnut and place dough balls 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten dough balls with the bottom of a glass dipped in sugar or with the palm of your hand. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until light brown and set. Let cool and enjoy!

Season the pork loin with thyme and salt and pepper and brown in a hot cast iron skillet with vegetable oil. Remove the pork from the pan and set aside. Add the remaining oil and heat until shimmering. Add the cornmeal and cook, stirring constantly, until it is brown and fragrant, about 5 minutes. Transfer the pork and the cornmeal mixture to a large bowl and toss with the broth and all-purpose flour. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour and up to overnight. Remove the plastic wrap and transfer the mixture to a large saute pan with a lid. Heat the pan over medium-high heat until the mixture is hot and bubbling. Reduce the heat to low and cover the pan. Cook, stirring occasionally for about an hour and until the scrapple is no longer pink in the middle. Transfer the scrapple to a cutting board and allow it cool slightly. Cut into slices and serve warm or cold. This scrapple is best served with a spicy sauce. For the sauce, heat the oil in a small saute pan over
Saute corn and yellow squash in butter until soft. Stir in fresh parsley and season with salt and black pepper.

Combine egg white with cinnamon and salt. Add pecans and stir with a fork until well coated. Place in an even layer onto waxed paper and sprinkle with additional cinnamon. Let sit for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with additional sugar and serve.

Preheat oven to 400f. Wash asparagus. In a baking dish with a 1-inch depth, toss asparagus with oil, season with salt pepper and toss again. Place asparagus in a single layer into baking dish. Roast for 10 to 15 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with chives and serve.

Put butter into a large bowl. Add water and golden syrup. Mix to dissolve. Add sifted flour. Mix until it comes together. Divide into 12 portions. Roll into balls. Place in a greased baking dish. Add brown sugar. Bake for 40-45 minutes.

Cook shells according to package directions. Drain. Arrange shrimp on top of cooked pasta shells. Top with marinated artichoke hearts and caesar salad dressing. Garnish with chopped parsley and garlic slices. Serve immediately with frozen peas and carrots cooked according to package directions and drained. Add to serving plate. Top with cooked pasta shells.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add turkey, stirring to break up meat as it cooks, until meat is browned. Add mushrooms to skilletcook 5 minutes longer. Stir in soup and bring to boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 10-15 minutes or until turkey is cooked through. Add noodlescook 3-5 minutes longer or until tender. Stir in nonfat sour cream and parsley. Serve immediately with extra parsley sprinkled on top.

Place cream cheese, onion, mushroom stems and pieces, bacon and hot pepper sauce together in a bowl and mix well. Cut the crescent roll dough into triangles. Spread cream cheese mixture on the triangle side of each triangle and roll up tightly. Place on a baking sheet or dish and bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. In a medium bowl, beat together butter, brown sugar, egg, vanilla, and almond extracts until smooth. Stir in buckwheat groats until well mixed. In another bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, salt, and chocolate chunks until well blended. Stir wet ingredients into dry ingredients. Drop rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets 2 inches apart. Bake for 9-11 minutes or until cookies are firm to the touch and edges begin to brown slightly around the edges. Cool cookies for 5 minutes before transferring them to wire racks to cool completely.

Bake french fries according to package instructions. While the fries are baking, make the cheese sauce. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the flour and stir constantly for about 2 minutes. Slowly add milk and keep stirring until thickened. Stir in the cheese. Keep warm while the fries cook. Drain the fries and transfer to a serving dish. Pour the cheese sauce over the fries and garnish with additional cheese.

Peel and chop potatoes. Boil until soft and drain. Put potatoes into a food processor and blend. Put into a large pan with the onion and fry until soft. Add flour and make a roux. Add beef stock and bring to a boil. Add the blended potatoes and cook until thick. Add sausages and green apples. Cook until the sausages are heated through. Stir through milk. Season and serve.

Saute green chilies and onion in butter and cream cheese until tender. Stir in cream and cheese until melted. Add enchilada sauce. Heat through. Place enchilada sauce in a greased 9 x 13 pan. Dip tortillas in hot water for a few seconds. Fill with a small amount of enchilada sauce and top with cheese. Roll up and place in prepared pan. Bake in preheated 350 degree F. Oven for 35 minutes. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add eggplant and cook, turning occasionally, for about 10 minutes or until browned and tender. Drizzle with orange juice and cook for 30 seconds. Transfer to large baking sheet and roast for about 15 minutes or until browned and tender. Remove from oven and drizzle with orange miso glaze. Toss to coat evenly and serve warm or cold with crackers and a green salad or steamed rice or pasta.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray a 9-inch pie pan. Place apples in the bottom of the pan. In a small bowl mix 1/4 cup sugar, flour and 2 Tbsp of water. Spoon into the pie pan around the apples. Add the egg to the 1/4 cup sugar mixture. Whip the egg. Add vanilla sugar. Pour over the apples. Bake for 10 minutes or until the apples are soft. Serve warm or cool. Serves 6.
Mix all of these ingredients together with your ham. Brush over ham before you put it in oven. It is also good on top of ham after it is cooked.

Heat oven to 400 degrees and lay bacon slices on a cookie sheet. Place chicken breast on top of each slice of bacon and season with seasoning salt and pepper to taste and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Cook for about 35 minutes or until done and juices run clear. Let rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving with a side salad or pasta.

Sauté onion and green bell pepper in butter until tender. Add cream of mushroom and cream of chicken soup. Cook 3 minutes or until heated through. Stir in Ro-Tel diced tomatoes with peppers. Add cooked chicken and corn tortillas. Transfer to baking dish and top with cheese. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes or until heated through and cheese has melted. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine butter and soy sauce. In a large bowl combine noodles and chow mein mix. Pour butter mixture over noodles and toss well. In a shallow dish combine sesame seeds, chili powder and garlic salt. Sprinkle over noodles and mix well. In a separate dish combine dry mustard and chow mein seasonings. Sprinkle over noodles and mix well. Spread on waxed paper and place in refrigerator until serving time.
Cook rice according to package directions. Add broth and turmericstir. Add apricots and cranberriestoss until well combined. Transfer rice mixture to serving dish. Serve warm.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Season the pork chops with salt and pepper. Add pork chops and cook until browned on both sides. Add wine and cook until it reduces by half. Add mustard and cook for about 2 minutes. Pour in cherries and their juice. Place chops in the pan. Cover and cook for about 4-5 minutes or until a meat thermometer inserted in the thickest part registers 160F. Transfer pork chops to a serving platter. Drizzle with melted butter and serve with sauce.

Combine strawberry jell-o with water and stir to dissolve. Pour into ice cream mold with water. Chill for 3 hours or until set. Pour ice cream into mold and chill for 3 hours or until firm., store in freezer for up to 2 weeks. To serve, cut into cubes and place on plate with fresh strawberries.

Lightly salt and pepper pork chops. Heat 2 tbsp of the olive oil over medium heat. Add the pork and brown for about 3-4 minutes on each side. Drain. Add the remaining 2 tbsp of oil to the pan and saute the onions for 2-3 minutes. Add the bouillon cubes and water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the sour cream and stir. Toss pork chops with the sauce. Cook pork chops for 5-6 minutes per side.

Put cheesecloth in string bag. Tie securely at top and bottom with string. Add herbs to string bag. Gather ends of cheese cloth to make bag shape. Dry completely before using. To use: place bouquet garni in saucepan along with meat and vegetables. When you are finished cooking the bouquet garni can be discarded and the flavor of the bouquet garni will be retained in the finished foods.

Bring a large saucepan of salted water to a boil. Cook the pasta until al dente according to the package directions and reserve 1 cup of the pasta water. Drain pasta and reserve for later use. In a large skillet over medium heat saut the garlic cloves and the pepper until the garlic cloves are lightly browned and the pepper is softened but not mushy (this can take up to 15 minutes). Drain the pasta and return to the skillet, then add the olive oil and toss until the pasta is coated with the oil. Add the pasta water 1/4 cup at a time to moisten the pasta and allow it to cook down until it has absorbed the pasta water and the pasta is very soft. Toss in the egg and mix until it is fully incorporated and the pasta is a thick sauce and not a liquidy mess. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare pie crusts as directed on box. Place crusts in 9 inch pie pans. Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add the sweetened condensed milk and the creme de menthe. Beat well. Add food coloring. Pour into pie crusts. Refrigerate several hours. Top with whipped topping. (Serves 12 to 14)

Preheat crock pot on low for 2 hours or until noodles are tender (see package directions). Drain noodles in colanderreturn to pot. Stir in egg, sour cream, parmesan cheese, garlic salt and monterey jack cheeseblend with wooden spoon until cheeses are melted. Stir in spinachblend to combine. Top with french fried onions to serve. Serves 6-8.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until tender. Stir in the chicken breasts. Cook for about 6 minutes or until done. Remove from heat. In a large bowl, whisk together the poultry seasoning, salt and pepper. Add the milk to the chicken mixture. Add the cream of chicken soup to the poultry mixture. Stir together. Pour the poultry mixture into a 9x9 inch baking dish. Top with the almonds. Bake in the preheated oven for about 30 minutes or until heated through.

Boil chicken parts in a pot of water until cooked. Remove from water. Stir in soya sauce, water, sugar, ginger, garlic, onion powder and dry mustard. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Stir in the cooked chicken parts. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Season tenderloin with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add leeks and fennel seeds and saute for 5 minutes. Add apples and saute until tender. Remove from heat and set aside. Drizzle tenderloin with honey and sherry wine vinegar and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill or sear tenderloin for 6 to 8 minutes per side or until desired doneness. Serve with sauteed apples and leeks.
Put all the ingredients into a pan or bowl, stirring constantly until thick. Put on cake while hot. When it is cool, it will be hard to remove from the cake.

Cream Crisco and sugar together. Beat in egg. Mix together dry ingredients. Add to creamed mixture alternately with milk. Stir in chocolate chips and pecans. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased baking sheet. Bake 8 to 10 minutes.

Mix ground beef, evaporated milk, stuffing mix, 1 cup ketchup and 1 cup worcestershire sauce. Roll into 1 in meatballs. Place meatballs in 3 quart casserole dish. Cover with remaining 2 cups ketchup and 2 cups worcestershire sauce. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours or until meatballs are cooked through. Serve with mashed potatoes and vegetables.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Place oven rack on middle level. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook stirring occasionally until onion is tender. Stir in the cumin and season with salt and pepper. Add the pinto beans. Pour beans and remaining ingredients into a large baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir and serve.

Make the rice by putting rice, vanilla extract, and nutmeg into a medium sized pot. Add the amount of water specified by the package of rice. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover pot. Cook rice for 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and vanilla extract into large mixing bowl. Mix well. Make a well in the center of the mixture. Pour in the egg. Stir well. Pour rice into the center of the mixture. Stir until just incorporated. Form dough into small balls. Roll in powdered sugar. Heat the cooking oil in a deep pot to about 350 degrees. Fry balls about five to six at a time until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan. In a large bowl combine spice cake mix and apple pie filling (do not drain). Mix together with eggs. Stir in walnuts. Fill pan and bake for 50-60 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool and serve with ice cream.

Place a 10 inch cast iron skillet in a preheated 375 oven. Add the ground chuck. Cook on medium-low until browned. Remove to a plate. Add the bell peppers to the skillet. Cook 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Pour the cornbread mix into the skillet and add the eggs, milk, cream-style corn and cheese. Stir to combine. Add the ground beef to the mixture. Transfer the mixture to an 8x8 casserole dish. Cover with foil and bake in oven for 30 minutes. Uncover the casserole dish and bake for 10 minutes more. Let sit 5 minutes before serving. Serve with your favorite toppings.

Mix salt and olive oil in a small bowl. Add walnuts and stir to coat. Add parsley and orange and stir. Add garlic and stir. Add cheese and mix. Cook pasta according to package directions. When pasta is done drain it and add to the walnut mixture. Toss and add pasta to the walnut mixture. Stir to coat pasta. Add pepper and serve. Serving size: 1 cup. Calories: 563Protein: 21gCarbohydrates: 37gFiber: 4gFat: 30gSaturated fat: 6gCholesterol: 46mgSodium: 154mg.
Blend coconut milk with sugar and lime juice until well blended. Add coconut to blender and pulse to combine. Add the honeydew and pulse until smooth. Serve with crushed ice.
In a large skillet brown the beef. Stir in the pizza sauce. Cook 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Place the beef mixture on hamburger buns. Top with mozzarella cheese. Broil 2 minutes. Serve.

Prepare vegetables and place on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and season well with salt and pepper. Bake at 425 degrees for about 20 minutes until tender and slightly browned on the edges. While vegetables are roasting cook pasta as directed on package. Once the vegetables are ready top each serving of pasta with vegetables and top each serving with a slice of gruyere cheese to melt slightly. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add onion and cook until softened. Stir in anchovies and cook until melted. Add pasta and stir to coat with sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Toss. Serves 4.

Remove the stem from the top of the squash and scrape out the seeds with the tip of a spoon. Rub the squash with the cut side of the leek. Heat 1 tablespoon of butter in a sauté pan over low heat. Add the sage and leek and cook until tender, about 4 minutes. Add the squash and cook until tender, about 15 minutes more. Season with salt and serve hot or warm with crackers or bread.
Cook macaroni according to package directions. Stir in cheese. Remove from heat once cheese is melted. Stir in butter and salt and pepper to taste.

Combine butter and onion powder in small bowl, stirring with fork until butter is mixed with onion powder to resemble coarse meal. Spread butter mixture onto both sides of each chicken breast. Sprinkle with bouillon powder. Roll each chicken breast in parsley. Heat nonstick skillet over medium high heat until hot. Coat skillet with cooking spray. Place chicken in skillet and cook 3 to 4 minutes per side or until cooked through (165 degrees F). Serve hot.

Combine the ground beef and the onion and cook until meat is no longer pink and onion is soft. Drain any excess fat from the meat mixture and combine with the refried beans and the green chili peppers. Spread 1/2 cup of the beef and bean mixture on each tortilla then sprinkle 1/2 cup of the cheese over the meat mixture. Roll each tortilla up and place seam side down into the pan of enchilada sauce. Cover the pan and bake for 45 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place chicken on an ungreased broiler tray or cookie sheet. Coat chicken with olive oil. Sprinkle with minced garlic. Sprinkle with dried oregano. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper. Brush chicken with lemon juice. Place tray on center rack of oven. Cook for 30 to 45 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked. Let stand 5 minutes before carving.

Slice the eggplants in half lengthwise and remove the stems. Put the slices on a cookie sheet. Drizzle with a little olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for 20-25 minutes. Remove from the oven and drizzle with more olive oil. Sprinkle with crushed red pepper flakes. Roast for another 5 minutes. Place 1/4 cup of no-sugar-added marinara sauce on each slice. Top each with a slice of lowfat mozzarella and a slice of lowfat provolone. Bake in a preheated 425 degree Fahrenheit oven for 10-15 minutes. If you have leftovers, heat up the eggplants in the oven before serving. This is a great way to get the kids to eat eggplants!

In a medium skillet over medium heat, saute bacon until crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels. Add bacon drippings to skillet. Add onion and saute until tender. Add garlicsaute until fragrant. Add tomatoes with juice and wine to the onion mixture. Cook about 2 minutes or until thickened slightly. Stir in bacon. Bring mixture to boilstir in beans. Reduce heat and simmer for about 2 minutes or until beans are heated through. Stir in thymeseason with pepper and salt if desired. Serve over cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 x 13 pan with cooking spray or line with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, combine brownie mix with vegetable oil, orange juice, orange liqueur, egg, milk chocolate chips, white chocolate chips, and semi-sweet chocolate chipsmix with a wire whisk just until blended. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack before cutting into bars. Refrigerate up to 2 days before serving. Store tightly covered at room temperature up to 5 days or freeze up to 2 months.

Place two fried onions in the bottom of each canape. Place two mushroom pieces on the top of the onions. Place a dollop of mayonnaise between the two mushrooms. Top with a few pieces of mushroom pieces. Garnish with a piece of cheese. Serve.

In a small bowl combine rind and salt. Rub over steak. In a small bowl combine oil and pepperrub over steak. Heat a grill pan or cast iron skillet over medium-high heat. Add steakcook 6 to 8 minutes per side or until desired doneness.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan on medium heat until shimmers. Add carrots, celery ribs, onion and cook until onions are translucent. Add kale and cook until tender. Add zucchini, beans, tomatoes and vegetable stock, bring to a boil. Lower heat to medium and simmer until zucchini is tender and sauce is thickened.

Soak coconut in 1/2 cup of warm water for 20 minutes. Drain. Put drained coconut in a greased 8-inch square baking pan. Pour condensed milk over coconut. Dissolve cornstarch in 1/2 cup of water. Stir this in to the milk and coconut. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thick. Pour over coconut. Let cool. Cut into squares and roll in chopped nuts. Serve as a snack or dessert.

Preheat oven to 425f. Wash and pat dry the potatoes. Slice the potatoes in half and scoop out the insides. Place them skin side down in a baking dish and fill with sour cream. Sprinkle with roquefort and green onions. Drizzle with paprika and season with salt and pepper. Place in oven and bake for about 40 minutes or until golden brown.
Put all ingredients into a slow cooker. Cook for 6 hours or until vegetables are tender. Serve with rice.

Put all dry ingredients into a large mixing bowl. Make a well in the centre and pour in the egg, yogurt and milk. Stir until well mixed then gently fold in the melted butter. Heat some oil in a frying pan then pour in enough mixture for 5 pancakes. Cook on each side until golden brown then remove from pan and place on paper towel. Repeat until all mixture is used up. When all pancakes are cooked sprinkle with icing sugar.

Peel and core apples. Cut into quarters and remove seeds and core. Cut into thin slices and place in a bowl with sugar and water. Toss well and set aside for about an hour. Grease a pie plate with margarine. Stir flour and cinnamon together and add to the apples with a little bit of flour and mix well. Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a scoop of fresh whipped cream.

Remove the stalks of the fennel and cut the bulb in half. Peel the onion and cut it into quarters. Put the fennel and onion in a baking dish and pour over them 1/2 cup of olive oil. Place the fennel and onion in the oven and bake for 40 minutes. Remove the fennel from the oven and allow it to cool for a few minutes. Then put it on a cutting board and cut the fennel in half. Remove the onion and cut it into quarters. Put the fennel and onion into a baking dish and pour over them 1/2 cup of olive oil. Place the fennel and onion in the oven and bake for 40 minutes. Remove the fennel from the oven and allow it to cool for a few minutes. Then put it on a cutting board and cut the fennel in half. Remove the onion and cut it into quarters. Put the fennel and onion into a baking dish and pour over them 1/2 cup of olive oil. Place the fennel and onion in

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. In a large skillet, brown the sausage until cooked through. Stir in the bisquick mix, milk, eggs and cheese. Fill muffin tins with mixture. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes before removing from the tin.

Rinse escarole and pat dry with paper towels. Cut escarole in half and discard stems. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Dip each piece of chicken in flour, egg and then breadcrumb mixture. Place in hot skillet and brown about 2 minutes per side or until golden brown. Transfer to baking dish. Add escarole and simmer until tender about 8 minutes. Add the chicken broth and garlic and simmer for an additional 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Put oil in a deep dish casserole. Add garlic and cook until garlic is golden brown. Add soy sauce and broth. Add pork chops. Cover and cook in crock pot on low for about 6 hours or until done. Remove pork and shred. Add cornstarch and water to broth. Cook over high heat stirring until thick. Serve over rice.

Soak beans overnight in cold water. In the morning drain beans and rinse with fresh cold water. In a large pot combine 1/2 cup of the beans with the onion, the dry mustard, 1/2 tsp ground black pepper and the pure maple syrup (or molasses). Add the remaining beans (with the liquid) and the salt pork. Bring mixture to a boil over high heat, reduce heat to low and simmer for 6 hours or until beans are tender. Stir occasionally. Serve warm with a loaf of french bread. (Beans can be cooked ahead of time and refrigerated up to 3 days before reheating.)

Bring 1/4 cup hot water to a boil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in cocoa powder and salt and whisk until dissolved. Stir in sugar and butter until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract.

In a large saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and yellow bell pepper and cook until soft. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add quinoa and cook for 2 minutes. Pour in chicken broth. Bring to a boil then cover and reduce heat to low. Cook until liquid is absorbed. Add fresh basil and green bell pepper. Cook for 1 minute. Transfer to a large bowl. Add cooked quinoa and chicken. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Beat egg whites until frothy. Gradually add cream of tartar. Add splenda. Keep beating until stiff. Add salt. Add cornstarch. Add vanilla. Add cocoa powder. Add self raising flour. Beat until smooth. Grease muffin tin. Spoon batter into tin. Bake 180 degrees for 12 minutes.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat bring 1 cup water to a boil. Add the cinnamon sticks to the boiling water. Stir in the couscous. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer until the couscous is tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the olive oil. Fluff the couscous with a fork. In a small bowl stir together the currants, apricots and pistachios. Stir the couscous into the apricot mixture. Garnish the couscous with the mint leaves.

Cut the butter into small cubes. Add the gorgonzola and walnuts. Cut the fresh parsley into thin strips. Mix all the ingredients together in a medium bowl until it is well combined. Form it into a log shape with a spatula. Wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least one hour. It's better if you make this one day ahead. To serve simply unwrap the log. Cut it into 1/2 inch thick slices. Serve with steak. The gorgonzola will melt. It's nice with any type of steak. Serve with your favorite salad. Or make it for a steak sandwich.

Unroll the pizza dough and place it onto a lightly oiled baking sheet. Spread the garlic alfredo sauce evenly over the entire surface of the crust and top with a layer of frozen spinach. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and the grated parmesan cheese. Bake at 425 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Mix soup and mayonnaise and set aside. Combine chicken and vegetables and set aside. Fry onions in olive oil until brown and set aside. In a large saucepan brown chicken and remove from heat and set aside. Mix soup mixture and chicken together and put in large casserole dish. Layer onions and then cheese over soup mixture and cover with bread crumbs. Bake at 350 for about 20 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.

Season green onions with salt and pepper. Warm butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add green onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender. Whisk eggs. Heat vegetable oil in the same skillet. Cook bacon until crisp. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels. Lay flour tortillas flat on cutting board. Spread one-half of bacon on each tortilla. Add egg mixture to bacon. Top each with cheese and another tortilla. Cook in the same skilled until golden brown and cheese is melted. Flip to cook other side. Serve with sour cream.

Peel the potatoes and cut them in half lengthwise. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake at 400f for about an hour or until tender. Remove from the oven and brush the potatoes with melted butter. Sprinkle with grated cheese and tabasco sauce and return to the oven for about five more minutes. Remove the potatoes from the oven and place them on plates. Top each with a teaspoon of mayonnaise and a teaspoon of dijon mustard. Sprinkle with a garlic clove and nuts and serve hot.

Cut French bread into 1/2-inch slices. Spread butter over each slice. Peel garlic clove and cut into thin strips. Sprinkle each slice of bread evenly with garlic. Sprinkle each slice of bread evenly with fresh parsley. Place slices of bread onto a baking sheet and bake 5 to 7 minutes or until bread is browned and crisp.

Heat the margarine and the boiling water in a saucepan until the margarine is melted. Remove from the heat and stir in the baking soda. Add the dates to the saucepan and stir well. Pour the mixture into a greased 8-inch square baking pan. Bake at 375f for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes. Cut into 6 servings. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Slice bananas. Mash and combine with sugar. Stir in flax seeds and egg. Stir in baking soda, baking powder and salt. Mix in flour. Spoon batter into muffin tins. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes. Makes 15.
Cream the cream cheese until smooth. Add sugar to taste. Add pineapple. Stir well. Add bread crumbs or nuts if desired. Mix well. Use as filling for sandwiches or just spread on crackers or toast.

Melt the margarine in the microwave. Stir the chocolate pudding mix in with the margarine until it is completely mixed in. Add the eggs and vanilla extract to the pudding mix. Stir until everything is well blended. Pour the chocolate cream into the crust. Top the chocolate cream pie with the non-dairy whipped topping. Let chill for about an hour before serving. You can also add some chopped walnuts on top or chopped chocolate chips.

Peel potatoes, cut them into cubes. Boil potatoes till they are soft. Drain the water. Transfer it to a blender. Add curds and blend till smooth. Add mint leaves. Blend again. Transfer the mixture to a bowl. Add green chili and chat masala. Mix well. Add salt as per taste. Garnish with cumin. Serve.

Cut squash into 1-inch cubes. Spread crackers on a large plate. Dip squash pieces into the sour cream. Roll squash pieces into Ritz crackers to coat. Place squash on a greased cookie sheet. Drizzle with melted butter. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake at 350 degrees until tender. Let cool before eating.

Bring milk and eggs to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in sugar. Add gelatin and mix well. Add boiling water. Pour into large bowl. Refrigerate until set. Turn into 6 individual bowls. Whisk in liqueur. Top with cream. Sprinkle with chopped chocolate.

Stir together cream cheese, garlic powder, romano cheese, sweet red pepper and green onion with a hand mixer on medium speed until smooth. Fold in frozen spinach. Stir in medium cheddar and cayenne pepper. Spoon mixture into a 2 1/2 quart baking dish. Top with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 f for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with crackers or tortilla chips.

Remove the feathers from the chicken. Remove the wings. Using a sharp knife, cut the chicken into 2 or 3 pieces. Add the chicken pieces to a large pot along with the water. Cover the pot. Place over a medium flame. Cook the chicken until it is tender. Remove from the flame. Strain the chicken pieces. Place the strained chicken back into the pot. Add the green cardamoms. Cover the pot. Cook the chicken for about 15 minutes. Remove from the flame. Strain the chicken pieces once again. Set aside. Place the strained chicken back into the pot. Add the milk. Cover the pot. Cook over a medium flame until the chicken is tender. Remove the chicken pieces from the pot. Place the chicken into a bowl. Add the basmati rice. Cover the bowl. Microwave the bowl for 3 to 4 minutes. Add 3 tablespoons of the ghee. Heat the bowl in the microwave for 2 to 3 minutes. Serve the chicken with the rice. Sprinkle the remaining 3 tablespoons of g

In a large stockpot over medium heat, melt butter and add flour to make a paste. Whisk constantly to prevent lumps from forming. Gradually add milk and bring to a boil while whisking constantly. Boil 1 to 2 minutes until slightly thickened and remove from heat. Stir in potatoes and simmer about 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Add salt and pepper to taste and serve.

Preheat broiler or grill. Place mushroom caps on an ungreased baking sheet and brush with a little oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepperbroil or grill until soft and brown (about 10 minutes). Place the mushroom caps onto serving plates and top each with a dollop of goat cheese. Add sliced leeks and spinach and sprinkle with balsamic vinegar and more salt and pepper if desired.

Heat the oil over medium heat until shimmering. Add the ginger and stir fry until soft and fragrant about 30 seconds. Stir fry the rice until warm. Stir fry the red pepper flakes for about 30 seconds. Stir fry the pineapple until it is soft about 3 to 4 minutes. Add the rice and stir. Stir fry until the rice is warm and the pineapple is heated through. Add the soy sauce and stir to combine. Remove from the heat and add the green onions. Transfer to serving platter. Serve immediately. Prep time is an approximation.

Peel apples, remove core. Cut in half. Mix together apples, lemon juice, sugar. Add flour, nutmeg, cinnamon. Mix well. Layer apples in pie crust. Add second pie crust. Seal edges. Bake at 375 degrees for 50 minutes. Let cool. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

In a large mixing bowl combine firm bananas, strawberries, gelatin & 1/4 cup of cold water. Whisk until well blended. Place bowl in fridge for 15 to 20 minutes until slightly thickened. Add boiling water to strawberry banana mix & whisk until completely dissolved. Add light whipped topping & mix. Pour mixture evenly into 9x13 baking dish & refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Place angel food cake in serving bowl & gently invert onto strawberry banana mixture. Garnish with fresh strawberries & enjoy!
Mix whiskey, kahlua and grand marnier in a heated glass. Pour in hot coffee. Top with whipped cream.

Mix eggs with wheat flour until smooth. Add salt, butter and milk slowly until all the liquid is added. Fill greased frying pan with batter and fry until golden brown on one side. Turn with a spatula and fry on the other side. Fry until done (about 2 minutes). Serve hot with jam or fresh fruit and powdered sugar or syrup if desired. Makes about 2 dozen pancakes.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, add the white vinegar, soy sauce, white vinegar, and ginger. Stir until it starts to boil. Turn the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tablespoons cornstarch with 3 tablespoons water until smooth. Add to the saucepan and whisk until it thickens. Add the ground ginger to the saucepan. Stir until it thickens. Add the chicken to the saucepan. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the cayenne pepper. Stir until the sauce thickens. Serve.

Melt sugar and water in saucepan. Boil 5 minutes without stirringadd egg and continue boiling 2 minutes morestir in flour and vinegar and cook 2 minutes longerremove from heat and beat in whipped toppingadd pineapple and applestoss gentlytop with peanutschill and serve.

Snap asparagus spears into 4-inch pieces. Blanch in boiling water for 1 minute, or until tender. Drain. Arrange in 13 x 9 baking dish. Sprinkle with prosciutto. In small bowl, mix together melted butter, fresh breadcrumbs, and cheese. Spread mixture over asparagus. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Sauté the onions until softened. Add tomato paste to the onions and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes. Add the carrots and celery and cook another 2 to 3 minutes. Add the tomato juice and cook until the mixture reduces to about half. Add the plum tomato paste and cook another 2 to 3 minutes. Add the heavy cream and simmer until the mixture thickens slightly. Add the basil leaves to the soup. Season to taste with salt and white pepper.

In a large skillet brown beef in oil until no longer pink. Drain off fat. Transfer meat to a 2 quart casserole dish. In a small bowl combine pizza sauce, milk, egg and bisquick mix. Spoon mixture over meat mixture in casserole dish. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown.

In medium saucepan over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add garlic cloves. Cook for about 1 minute. Add red hot pepper. Cook for about 30 seconds. Add ground cumin. Cook for about 1 minute. Stir in dry roasted peanuts. Cook for about 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in coarse salt. Cook for about 30 seconds. Stir in chili powder. Cook for about 2 minutes. Taste for seasonings. Transfer mixture to a bowl. Set aside until ready to serve.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium high heat, heat canola oil. Add onion and garlic. Cook and stir until tender, about 2 minutes. Stir in cumin and salt. Cook and stir 1 minute. Add yogurt and hot sauce. Stir and cook until blended. Thread onto 6 (6-inch) metal skewers. Divide steaks and onion mixture onto skewers. Place on grill rack. Grill kebabs, covered, over medium heat for about 8 minutes. Turn and grill an additional 4-6 minutes or until desired degree of doneness.

Boil potatoes in lightly salted water until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain well in a colander and let cool enough to handle. When potatoes are cool enough to handle, cut into large cubes. Place potato cubes in a large bowl with 2 cups cold water. Add sliced onions, 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and black pepper. Cover bowl and refrigerate at least 8 hours or overnight. Drain potatoes well in a colander and transfer to a 4-quart slow cooker. Add 4 cups of water to slow cookerstir well to blend with potatoes. Cook on low for 6-8 hours or until potatoes are tender. Makes 8 servings. Serve warm with cornbread or biscuits.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain well. In a large salad bowl, combine macaroni, mayonnaise, chili powder, marinara sauce, sweet pickle relish and celerytoss well to coat evenly. Add the onion and olivestoss again. Serve immediately or cover and chill for up to 24 hours before serving.

In a large wok or heavy skillet over medium heat heat the oil until hot. Add the garlic and saut until it just begins to brown. Add the baby bok choy and saut until tender. Add the shiitake mushrooms. Stir in the sugar and cook until the sugar is dissolved. Add the chicken stock and fish sauce. Cook until the liquid is almost completely absorbed.

Preheat the oven to 425f. Rinse the shrimp. Place them in a large bowl and toss them with the lemon juice to prevent them from turning brown. In a large skillet or saute pan, heat the olive oil to medium heat. Add the shrimp to the pan. Sprinkle the shrimp with salt and pepper. Saute for 1 minute on each side. Transfer the shrimp to a broiler-proof dish. Place under the broiler until browned, about 2 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Peel carrots and cut into 2-inch pieces. Place carrots in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion to the butter. Cook, stirring constantly until the onion is softened. Stir the crushed pineapple into the pan along with brown sugar, honey, tarragon, salt, and black pepper. Pour the mixture over the carrots. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Combine dry cornbread mix, milk, corn oil and eggs. In large bowl mix together corn mix and all other ingredients. Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire rack. Makes 12 servings.

Mix together sugar, milk and salt in heavy saucepan. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil over medium heat and cook for 3 minutes without stirring. Stir until mixture forms a ball. Add vanilla extract. Pour into lightly greased 8 x 8 x 2-inch square baking pan. Chill until firm. Cut into squares.

In a large bowl, add shrimp, lemon juice, old bay seasoning and beer. Stir until combined well. Place a colander in a large pot or steamer basket over boiling water and add the shrimp mixture. Cover and steam for about 10 minutes until shrimp is pink and tender. Remove from steamer basket and drain on paper towel or plate lined with paper towels. In a bowl combine the white vinegar, water and kosher saltset aside. Once the shrimp is pink and tender, immediately transfer them into the white vinegar solution and let them marinate for 10-15 minutes until the shrimp is fully cooked. Transfer them onto a plate lined with paper towels. Sprinkle a little bit of salt on the shrimp if desired and serve warm.

In a dutch oven or soup kettle, saute the onions and garlic in a little oil. Add the carrots and celery. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Add vegetable bouillon granules. Add enough boiling water to cover vegetables. Increase heat to high and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes. Puree the soup with a blender. Add almonds and blend some more. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

In large skillet melt butter over medium heat. Add scallions, garlic, paprika. Season with salt pepper. Sauté for about one minute. Add scallops. Cook for about two minutes. Stir once. Add bread crumbs and sauté until golden brown. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375f and grease a standard muffin pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl, whisk together wheat flour, baking powder and salt. In a medium bowl, whisk together milk and egg whites until smooth and well blended. Add applesauce and whisk until combined and smooth. Fold in banana and kashi good friends cereal until evenly blended and stir in honey and mashed banana until just combined. Spoon batter into muffin pan and bake for about 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan and serving warm. Store in an airtight container in refrigerator for up to 4 days.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over low heat. Add onion and stir for a few minutes. Sift flour with baking soda and add to onion mixture. Stir for a few minutes more. Gradually add milk and simmer over low heat until thickened and bubbly. Add crushed tomatoes and herbs and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Cut each flour tortilla into 6 wedges. Lightly coat each wedges with nonstick cooking spray and place onto a cookie sheet. Sprinkle salt and chili powder over each wedges. Bake in preheated oven at 375 degrees F for 10 minutes. Turn wedges over and bake for an additional 5 minutes. Remove from oven and garnish with fresh lime wedges. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Beat eggs and sugar until smooth. Add cocoa. Beat until light and fluffy. Fold in coffee and coffee liqueur. Dip ladyfingers in coffee mixture. Arrange 2 ladyfingers on bottom of dish. Fill ladyfingers with filling. Layer remaining ladyfingers on top of filling and cover entire dish in filling. Refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight. Serve cold.

Heat vegetable oil in a large soup pot over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and onions and cook for about 5 minutes or until softened and translucent. Add the carrots and lentils and cook for about 2 minutes. Add V8 juice and water and bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until lentils are tender. Transfer mixture to a blender and add chili powder, cumin and oregano. Blend the mixture for about 30 seconds or until smooth, then return the blended mixture to the soup pot and reheat. Serve hot with shredded cheese and tortilla chips if desired.
Sprinkle chicken with garlic salt. Place chicken in cereal crust. Top with butter. Bake in 375 oven for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar. Drizzle with Sweet & Sour Sauce.
