Combine all ingredients in a pan. Bring to boil stirring frequently. Reduce heat to low and simmer 12 to 15 minutes. Serve.

Bring 4 cups water to boil in large saucepan. Add millet, cover saucepan and reduce heat to simmer. Cook until water is absorbed, about 10 minutes. Discard millet in food processor bowl. Add scallions, onion, garlic cloves and tomato pasteblend until smooth. Add 4 cups stockbring to boil over medium-high heat. Cook until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in frozen vegetablescook 1 minute longer. Stir in remaining 4 cups stock and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heatcook until thickened slightly, about 20 minutes. Discard garlic in food processor bowlblend soup until smooth. Stir in parsleyseason soup to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer soup to 11- by 7-inch baking dishsmooth top evenly. Set aside 1 cup soup for serving. Cover soup dishbake until set, about 20 minutes. Serve soup garnished with reserved soup.

Melt marshmallow cream in a small saucepan. Add sugar and stir until sugar is dissolved. Add salt. Whisk in water. Continue to whisk until mixture is thick. Pour onto a cookie sheet lined with wax paper. Spread into a 10-inch square. Sprinkle with salted pecans. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares.

Cook noodles in boiling water according to package instructions. Drain and place in greased baking pan. Pour cheeses and whipping cream over noodles. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Bake in 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. Serve with slices of cucumber.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Add olive oil to a large bowl. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Toss to combine. Add potatoes and toss to coat. Season with salt. Pour potatoes in a single layer onto a parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until potatoes are golden brown. Serve with aioli.
Blend all of the dip ingredients together until smooth. Add more worcestershire sauce to taste. Serve with tortilla chips.

Prepare bacon in advance and remove from pan after it has cooked and cooled. Peel and cut ginger into thin slices and set aside. Peel and chop onion. Peel and chop garlic cloves. Slice plum tomatoes and set aside. Heat oil and add ginger, onion, garlic and bacon and saut until onion is soft and bacon has browned. Stir in tomatoes and cook until tomatoes are soft and juicy. Add salt and pepper to taste and serve with toast.

Mix all of the meatloaf filling ingredients except the breadcrumbs. Spread the mixture into a 9x5 loaf pan. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the top of the meatloaf. Pour the milk over the breadcrumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Let rest 10 minutes before removing from pan. Serve with gravy if desired.

In a large bowl stir together sugar, cocoa and milk. In a small bowl stir together butter and corn syrup until blended. Stir into cocoa mixture until blended. Stir in vanilla and peanut butter. Press into 9 x 13 inch pan. Sprinkle coconut and oats over the top. Let set until firm. Cut into squares and serve.

Peel squash and cut into 3-inch pieces. Place squash in large saucepan with enough water to cover. Bring to boil over high heatreduce heat and cook until squash is tender. Drain squash. In food processor, combine cooked squash and onion. Process until pureed. Stir in corn and remaining filling ingredients. Transfer to large bowl. Chill until cool. Shape into 2-inch meatballs and place on cookie sheet. Bake 15 minutes in preheated 350f oven. Remove meatballs from oven. Add 1/3 cup sour cream to meatball mixture. Taste and adjust with more sour cream if desired. Refrigerate several hours before serving.

In a large mixing bowl combine margarine and broth. In a separate bowl combine all of the dry stuffing ingredients. Mix stuffing ingredients into broth. Pour into crockpot. Cook on low for 5-7 hours. Stuffing can also be prepared and frozen for later use.

Peel and slice onion and bell pepper and saute in butter until tender. Stir in chicken and cook until warmed through. Add barbecue sauce and stir. Heat flour tortillas until they are flexible and can be rolled around filling. Place a filling in each tortilla and roll up. Place quesadillas in a baking dish and pour remaining barbecue sauce over them. Cover and bake for 15 minutes. Remove from pan and garnish with chopped cilantro and serve.

Heat a large sauté pan over medium heatadd olive oil until shimmery. Season the pork tenderloin with salt and pepper on both sides. Add pork tenderloin to pan, making sure not to overcrowd the pan. Cook until meat is browned on both sides (about 6 minutes per side). Transfer pan to ovenroast until the internal temperature of the meat is 165 degrees f (about 5 minutes). Remove from oven. Slice pork into 6 medallions. Arrange the medallions on a platter. Spoon pan juices over the medallionsgarnish with figs. Serves 4.

Preheat broiler. In a large bowl, combine chicken pieces with salt and pepper. Drizzle with oil, and mix until coated. Arrange on a greased rimmed baking sheet in a single layer. Broil for about 8 minutes, until cooked through, turning once halfway through cooking. While broiling, in a small bowl, combine soy sauce with lime juice, stirring until well combined. Add to chicken and toss to coat. Transfer chicken to a platter or shallow bowl. Serve topped with lime wedges and sprinkled with cilantro if desired.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Stir in couscous. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Drain well. In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil lemon juice cilantro salt and pepper. Add the couscous. Add bell pepper tomatoes and fresh mint. Toss until well combined. Serve at room temperature.

Cook sauerkraut in large saucepan until tender. Drain well. Add brown sugar, oil, caraway seeds, salt and pepper. Heat until sugar dissolves. Serve warm with hot cooked noodles or potatoes. Yield: 3 cups. Nutrition Information per serving: 96 calories2g fat2g protein13g carbohydrate4g fiber382mg sodium26mg cholesterol93mg calcium6mg iron565mg potassium2mg niacin5mg vitamin A2mg vitamin C9mg iron4mg thiamin2mg riboflavin2mg folate252mg sodium13mg cholesterol236mg potassium2mg iron4mg niacin2mg vitamin A2mg vitamin

Combine the frozen raspberries with the water in a saucepan and cook over medium-high heat until berries burst and juice is released into the water. Stir in the white wine and cranberry raspberry juice and bring to a simmer. Add the sugar and spices and cook until the sugar dissolves. Remove from the heat and stir in the lemon juice and yogurt. Transfer to individual bowls and serve immediately.

Mix flour, salt & baking powder in large bowl. Cut in shortening with pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. In small bowl beat eggstir into flour mixture. Add milk & mix just until dough comes together. Turn out dough onto lightly floured surface. Divide dough in half. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into 1-inch squares. Place squares onto lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees F for 15 minutes or until light brown.

Melt margarine in a heavy-duty skillet. Whisk in flour until smooth. Stir in broth. Bring to a boil. Boil 5 minutes. Stir in soup. Add salt. Stir in worcestershire sauce. Taste gravy for seasoning. Serve immediately.

Beat heavy cream until it starts to thicken. Gradually add sugar. Dissolve gelatin in 1/4 cup boiling water. Add to cream mixture along with the vanilla and almond extracts. Chill thoroughly before using. Stir in sour cream, and top with raspberries. Refridgerate.

In a large bowl, combine sour cream and soup mix. Mix well with a large spoon. Mix in the cream cheese and blend thoroughly. Add cheeses and blend together with a large spoon. Add cracker crumbs and blend until combined with the other ingredients. Mix in the walnuts. Form into a ball. Place onto a tray that has been covered with aluminum foil. Refrigerate for at least two hours before serving. Serve with crackers. Serves 24.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x9 inch baking pan. Slice apples into quarters and remove seeds. Add apples to a sauce pan with 1/3 cup water. Bring to a boil and cook until apples are tender. Drain well. In a bowl combine flour, splenda, cinnamon and salt. Add in melted butter. Mix well. Add in apples and mix well. Pour into greased baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes until golden brown.

In a large bowl, lightly beat the eggs. Add the sour cream and shallots and mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Layer the bread with a few tomato slices and spinach leaves. Place a layer of tarragon shallot mixture on top of each sandwich. Serve.

Melt bacon grease in large skillet over medium heat. Stir in sauerkraut and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes or until desired consistency is reached. Stir in mayonnaise and horseradish. Stir in Swiss cheese until melted and bubbly. Serve hot with hot dogs or other sausages.

Trim fat from steaks. Skewer meat. Combine marinade ingredients and pour over meat. Marinate 30 minutes to 1 hour. Preheat grill. Cook meat to desired temperature. Remove from grill and keep warm. Combine butter, cognac and vinegar. Melt on grill and brush on meat. Serve with fresh blackberries.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a shallow baking dish. Break up the challah with your hands into large pieces. In a large bowl, beat eggs, sugar, vanilla extract, amaretto, and eggnog until well mixed. Stir in the raisins. Pour the bread mixture into the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until the center is set, about 45 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature. Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.

Saute pancetta over medium heat until crisp and browned. Add garlic cloves and tomatoes. Add dry white wine and reduce by half. Add whipping cream and basil. Simmer over medium heat until heated through and reduced by half. Toss fettuccini with sauce until pasta is coated and sauce is hot and bubbly. Serve immediately with parmesan cheese.

In large bowl, combine 1 can (12 oz.) sweetened condensed milk and 1 cup peanut butter. Mix well. Using small cookie scoop or teaspoonfuls of dough, shape into balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Chill for 30 minutes. Place 1 Hershey's kiss on top of each ball and press down slightly. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until set. Cool 10 minutes before removing from cookie sheet to wire rack to cool completely. Makes about 30 peanut blossoms.

Cut chicken drumsticks into large chunks. Place chicken into large pot with 4 cups of chicken broth. Bring to boil, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until chicken is fully cooked. Add butternut squash, potatoes, corn on cob, carrots and chicken broth to large pot with chicken. Cover, simmer for 10 minutes. Add hot sauce to taste. Stir rice into soup. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves.

Place a 9-inch deep-dish pie plate on a cookie sheet. Crush elderberries with your hands or a potato masher in a bowl to release their juices. Place elderberries in a bowl with sugar, flour, lemon juice and cinnamon. Mix well with a fork or your hands and then transfer to pie shell. If making a double crust pie, roll out pie crust for bottom crust and place it into pie shell. Roll out top crust and place on top of pie crust. Crimp edges together. Cut vents in top crust if desired. Brush top crust with melted butter. Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes then reduce heat to 350 degrees for 35 to 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown and juices are bubbling through vents.

Boil potatoes until tender. Peel and mash potatoes. Stir in the butter, cheese, onion, salt, and pepper. Stuff the shells with the mixture. Place on a baking sheet and bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) until golden brown. Serve with your favorite sauce or sour cream.

Preheat oven to 180c. Grease a 20cm square cake pan. Beat the butter until smooth. Gradually add the sugar then beat in the golden syrup. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the plain flour, cocoa, baking soda, mixed spice, nuts and chopped dark chocolate. Pour mixture into the prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Let the brownies cool in the pan for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

Mix together the milk and the breadcrumbs. Dip the fish fillets into the milk mixture and coat evenly. In a medium saucepan, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the thyme and the breaded haddock fillets. Saute for about 3 minutes. Remove from the pan and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve immediately.

Toast 1 slice of bread. Spread a layer of butter on it. Sprinkle with mustard. Place 1/2 cup of cheese over the butter. Put the second slice of bread on top. Press down to adhere the 2 slices of bread together. Cut into 4 wedges. Melt the remaining butter in a skillet. Stir in the remaining mustard. Sauté the rarebit until golden brown. Serve on toast with thinly sliced cucumbers.

Heat the oil in a small saute pan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and cook, stirring, for about 30 seconds. Add the garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Add the cauliflower and cook for about 10 minutes. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Serves 4.

Cut each breast into strips about 2 inches long. Dip into pickle relish (you can use 1/4 cup of hot sauce if you like it spicy). Chop celery into small pieces, mix with relish, salt, pepper, 1/2 cup of mayonnaise. In a small bowl mix remaining mayonnaise with 1/4 cup of hot sauce for a hot sauce/mayo mixture. In a large bowl combine chopped chicken with celery mixture. Add more hot sauce/mayo mixture as needed to make mixture moist enough to form a ball. (If needed, add more hot sauce). Form chicken mixture into ball shape to make a "burger" or into a loaf shape to make a "sub". Roll in breadcrumbs. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve on your favorite sandwich bread.

Combine flour with pepper and salt in a small bowl. Heat olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heatadd liver to skilletsaute for 2-3 minutes, or until liver is browned on all sidesreduce heat to medium-lowadd onionsaute 5 minutes or until tenderadd brothbring to a boilreduce heat to mediumsimmer 5 minutes or until gravy is thickened. Transfer to a bowlplace on a plategarnish with parsley if desired. Serve immediately with mashed potatoes or rice.

In a medium saucepan combine water and tuna and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 4 minutes, then drain and discard tuna. Add creamed corn, onion and broccoli to tuna mixture and cook for another minute. Reduce heat and simmer for 4 more minutes until vegetables are tender and liquid is reduced slightly. In a small bowl combine flour and milk and stir well with fork. Add flour mixture and salt and pepper and cook for another minute. Stir in cayenne pepper and cook for another minute.

Dressing. Place shallot, garlic cloves, and red wine vinegar in small food processor. Puree until smooth. With food processor running, slowly add olive oil to emulsify. Season dressing with Dijon mustard to taste. In a large bowl, mix lettuce with dressing until leaves are just wilted. Add radicchio to the lettuce mixture and toss to combine. Add cherry tomatoes and toss again until combined. Add shrimp to salad and toss to combine. Serve immediately or chill for several hours before serving to allow flavors to combine.

Combine frozen berries and water in saucepan. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Add remaining ingredients. Cook over low heat for 20 minutes. Add remaining ingredients. Cook over low heat for 20 minutes. Pour into a deep dish pie pan. Bake at 375f for 10 minutes.

Heat olive oil in large pot and sauté onions and ginger until soft and golden brown. Stir in garlic and cumin and cook for about 2 minutes more. Slice carrots and parsnips into small cubes and add them along with the vegetables already sautéed to the pot. Pour in enough chicken broth to cover the vegetables and bring to boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the vegetables are soft and tender. Puree the soup with an immersion blender and add the sour cream and coriander. Season to taste with sea salt and black pepper and serve hot with crackers and a slice of crisp bread.

In a large saucepan combine mustard with 1/2 cup lemon juice, 1/2 cup orange juice and brown sugarbring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to lowcook 1 minute or until sugar dissolves. Stir in 2 1/2 cups water, cornstarch and clovescook 3 minutes or until thickened. Stir in ham and reserved 1/2 cup juice. Place in a slow cookercover and cook 3 hours or until tender. Stir in remaining juicecook 20 minutes or until thickened slightly and heated through. Serve with biscuits or rolls. This can also be made on the stovetop by bringing to a boil over medium heat in a large saucepan the prepared mustard, 1/2 cup lemon juice, 1/2 cup orange juice and brown sugarcook 1 minute or until sugar dissolves. Stir in 2 cups water, cornstarch and clovescook 3 minutes or until thickened. Stir in ham and reserved 1/2 cup juice. Place

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Cut off woody ends of asparagusdiscard. Brush asparagus with some of the oilplace on grill. Grill asparagus for 2 to 3 minutesturn spears and brush again with some of the oil and grill an additional 2 to 3 minutes or until tender. Remove from heattransfer to a serving platter and sprinkle with parsleydrizzle with the vinaigrette.
Put all ingredients into a food processor and mix until well combined. Form into patties and grill or pan fry until browned and cooked through.

Bring large pot of water to boil. Cook orzo pasta in boiling water for 4-5 minutes. Drain. Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add shallot and garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Add ham and half-and-half. Cook and stir for 3-4 minutes or until the ham is heated through. Add the cooked orzo to the saucepan. Cook and stir for 2-3 minutes until hot. Add the frozen peas. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Stir in the Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Place the lamb and onions in a slow cooker. Add the thyme sprigs. In a small bowl, mix the tomato paste and the red wine. Pour the mixture over the meat. Cover the slow cooker and cook on low for 6 hours or on high for 3 hours. Add the parsley.

1. In a medium saucepan heat oil over medium heat. Add onions, celery, tomatoes, brown sugar and cider vinegar. Cook for about 15 minutes. 2. Add molasses, garlic, cumin, paprika and allspice. Cook for about 10 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat. 3. Stir in whole cranberries. Serve warm.

Bring chicken broth and cream of chicken soup to a boil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add cauliflower and cook for about 12 minutes or until cauliflower is tender crisp. Stir in half-and-half. Add ham and pepperheat through. In a small bowl, combine cornstarch and cold water. Add the cornstarch mixture to the cauliflower mixture and stir until thickened. Add chives and stir until blended. Serve hot.

Bring to a boil milk and tapioca. Stir until tapioca is dissolved. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until thickened, stirring occasionally. Stir in egg and vanilla and cook another minute or two until it is thickened. Pour into a mold or bowl to cool and serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Cut butter into small pieces and cut in half. Cut in half again. Place half of the butter in the bottom of a 6 or 8-inch pan. Add the biscuit mix into a medium bowl and stir in the butter until moistened. Spoon the biscuit mixture onto the prepared pan. Bake 12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the pan with a spatula. Turn the pan over onto a plate or cutting board so the biscuits slide out easily. Top with the remaining butter, half of the cheese and half of the sesame seeds. Top with the remaining half of the butter, the remaining half of the cheese and the remaining half of the sesame seeds.
Add eggs and oil to cake mix. Beat until mixed. Bake in 9x13 inch pan for 25 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool for 15 minutes before removing from pan. Makes 36 cookies.

In a large skillet on medium heatsauté the chicken breasts until done. Remove from heatdrain excess fat from chicken breasts and place in a large bowl. In a small saucepan on low heatheat the soup, tomatoes, corn & green onions until heated throughstir in the chicken breasts and stir until heated through. In a small bowlmix the milk with the cheesestir until blendedadd the mixture into the chicken mixturemix until smoothpour into a casserole dishcover with foilplace on a cookie sheetplace in the oven for 30 minutesremove from the ovenremove foilsprinkle the doritos over the chicken mixtureplace in the oven uncovered for about 10 minutesserve
Boil potatoes until tender. Cool slightly and mash with milk and butter. Mix with leeks and season with flour and salt and pepper. Pour into a pie plate and bake at 350 for about 35 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Grease 8 by 8 baking dish. In large mixing bowl combine water, brown sugar, flour, vanilla extract and baking powder. Stir in melted butter and then add the egg. Pour mixture into greased baking dish. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with whipped cream.

Sprinkle both sides of roast generously with salt and pepper, then coat with olive oil. Transfer to a rimmed baking sheet and rub roast all over with garlicsprinkle thyme and rosemary over roast, then cover tightly with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight or at least for 6 hours or up to 24 hours (see tip). Preheat oven to 275 degrees. Remove roast from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking to let it come to room temperaturediscard garlic. Place roast fat side up on a rack set in a roasting panbrush fat side of roast all over with olive oil, then rub lightly with your fingers to coat. Sprinkle roast generously with salt and pepper. Pour wine into roasting pan around roast. Roast until a meat thermometer inserted into thickest part of meat registers 140 degrees for medium rare (about 4 to 4-1/2 hours), turning roast every hour or so to baste it well all over (see tip). Remove roast from oven, tent
Mix together all the ingredients except pork. Marinade pork for at least three hours or overnight. Grill or bake pork for medium rare. Serves two.

Mix garlic powder and black pepper in a shallow dish. Dip chicken breasts or tenders in butter then press into seasoned corn flakes. Place chicken in a single layer on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake for about 30 minutes until golden brown.

Rub fillets with cooking spray and dust with salt and pepper. In a large skillet heat oil and saute garlic and basil with the tomatoes and onion until the mixture is fragrant. Place the fillets in the skillet and cover with the vegetables. Sprinkle with the lemon juice and parsley and cook over medium heat about 8 to 10 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.

Combine the walnuts, shallot, vinegar, walnut oil, extra virgin olive oil, salt and pepper into a medium bowl. Add the celery and dates into the bowl, stirring gently. Add the pecorino cheese and toss gently. Serve immediately or refrigerate for later use. This salad can be served with a slice of country bread as an appetizer or as a side dish. Pair with a red wine or a light white wine such as a pinot grigio or sauvignon blanc.

Bring brussels sprouts to a boil and cook for about 2 minutes or until crisp tender. Drain and cool slightly. Combine all remaining ingredients in a saucepan and cook on low for 2 minutes or until the sugar is dissolved. Add brussels sprouts and cook until the brussels sprouts are hot. Garnish with parmesan cheese if desired and serve immediately.

Season fish fillets with salt and pepper. Combine pine nuts, rolled oats, basil leaves, flat leaf parsley and thyme leaves in a bowl. Sprinkle over fillets. Place fillets on a flat surface and lightly dust with flour to coat. Heat vegetable oil in a frying pan until smoking hot. Place fillets in pan in a single layer (do not overcrowd pan). Cook for 2 minutes each side or until golden brown and cooked through. Drain on kitchen paper. Mix breadcrumbs with eggs in a bowl. Dip fillets in breadcrumb mixture and place on a plate to cool for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with seasoned herbs. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 250. Line a 9x9 cake pan with parchment paper. Place one scoop of ice cream in each section. Top each section with half of the peanut butter. Cover peanut butter with half of the banana. Cover banana with half of the ice cream. Sprinkle chocolate sauce over ice cream. Top with caramel sauce. Cover caramel sauce with chocolate sauce. Top with half of whipped cream. Cover whipped cream with half of peanut butter. Top peanut butter with half of banana. Cover banana with half of whipped cream. Cover whipped cream with half of caramel sauce. Cover caramel sauce with chocolate sauce. Sprinkle chocolate sauce over ice cream. Cover ice cream with whipped cream. Top whipped cream with banana. Cover banana with whipped cream. Sprinkle chocolate sauce over ice cream. Cover ice cream with whipped cream. Top whipped cream with peanut but
Bring vegetable broth to a simmer in a large saucepan. Add the cabbage and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

In a large skillet over medium heat, whisk eggs until combined. Gradually add water, whisking constantly. Cook eggs until thickened and lightly set around edge. Whisk scallions into egg mixtureseason with salt and pepper. Ladle egg mixture evenly over tortillas. Sprinkle with cheese. Wrap tortillas around filling. Serve immediately.
Peel beetroots. Cut them into large cubes. In a bowl mix vinegar and garlic. Slowly add oil to garlic mixture while stirring. Add beetroot cubes to bowl. Let sit for 1 hour before serving.

Bring milk to a boil in a saucepan. Remove from heat. Stir in cream cheese until melted. Stir in cinnamon. Pour into ice cream maker container. Freeze according to manufacturer instructions. Serve with cinnamon stick garnish.
Combine coffee liqueur, orange wedges, vodka, ginger ale and ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake well. Strain into 2 glasses filled with ice. Garnish with orange wedge. Serve immediately.
Put everything except the garlic in a slow cooker and cook for 3 hours. Shut the cooker off. Stir in garlic and serve with rice or noodles.

Mix the flour and salt and pepper in a bowl and set aside. Dip each steak into the flour mixture. In pressure cooker or other large pot, heat 1 tablespoon of oil and brown steaks on each side over medium heat about 3 minutes. Remove to plates. Add 1 tablespoon of oil to pot and saute onions and green peppers until tender. Add steaks and tomato juice to pot and cook on medium low heat until steaks are done to your liking. Serve over rice or noodles or serve as sandwiches.

Season the lamb with garlic powder and ketchup and rub it into the meat with your fingers. Sprinkle with a little worcestershire sauce and place on a rack in a roasting tin. Cook in a preheated oven at 140c/275f/gas mark 1 for 2 hours. When the lamb is done, remove from the oven and brush with some apricot jam and serve.
Puree mangoes with lime juice and zest. Stir in sugar until it dissolves. Add ice cream. Place mint leaves on top. Serve in martini glasses.

Bring a pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add potatoes and cook until tender when pierced with a fork, about 10 minutes. Drain potatoes well, then peel them. Cut them into 1/2-inch cubes and place them in a large serving dish or a 1-quart baking dish. Whisk together vinegar, mustard, oil, parsley, salt and pepper to taste, then pour it over potatoes. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Wash berries, remove stems if necessary (raspberries), and place in a large bowl. Add sugar, lemon juice & water. Stir well and let stand 30 minutes. Spoon mixture into freezer containers, leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Fill with hot water. Seal lids immediately and set aside 24 hours before removing air bubbles. Seal lids tightly before freezing. For 16 ounce jars, use 3/4 cup of berry mixture per jarfor 8 ounce jars, use 1/4 cup of mixture per jar. If jam is too thick, thin with water or lemon juice to desired consistency. Yield: 4 half-pints OR 8 pints (approximately 7 cups berries & 6 cups sugar) *if you want to use a sugar substitute, try using one cup sugar plus 1/2 cup Splenda to reduce carb countalso try using one cup brown sugar plus 1/2 cup honey to reduce carb count*if you want to increase carb count by using white sugar plus white fl

Combine meat and seasoning mixadd enough water to make 1 1/2 cups liquidheat to boiling. Stir until seasoning is dissolved and liquid is clear. Cook and stir over medium heat until beef is thoroughly heated and liquid is absorbed (about 10 minutes). Fill each taco shell with beef mixture and top with desired toppings (lettuce, tomatoes, onions and cheese). Serve with sour cream, if desired.

Preheat oven to 250F. Place tomatoes and garlic in a roasting dish. Add vodka and season with salt and pepper. Roast for 1 hour until soft. Transfer to food processor and blend until smooth. Pass through a fine sieve into a bowl and discard solids. Season with vinegar, basil, beetroot and horseradish. Heat oven to 300F. Add sugar and roast until slightly thickened. Transfer to small jars. Seal and store in fridge for up to 2 weeks.
Cut tangelo into sections and toss into a blender with strawberries and Splenda and ice cubes. Blend for about 60 seconds or until smooth and frothy. Serve and enjoy!

Wash tomatoes, cut off ends and remove seeds. Place in 2-quart saucepan. Add enough cold water to cover tomatoes. Bring water to boiling. Reduce heatcover and simmer 30 minutes or until tomatoes are tender. Drain. Slice tomatoes in half. Combine bacon and onion in 2-quart saucepan. Cook over medium heat until onion is tender. Remove from heatcool. Stuff each tomato half with cooked onion mixture. Place tomatoes on greased cookie sheet. Sprinkle each stuffed tomato half with 2 tablespoons breadcrumbs. Drizzle each stuffed tomato half with 1 teaspoon melted butter. Sprinkle each tomato half with parsley. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) until breadcrumbs are golden brown. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat the oven to 180c. Beat the butter, brown sugar and caster sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and vanilla essence. Sift the flour and salt together into a separate bowl. Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and beat until combined. Fold in the miniature chocolate chips. Drop heaped teaspoonfuls onto greaseproof paper lined trays and press each one down slightly with a fork to flatten slightly. Bake in the preheated oven for about 12 minutes or until pale golden brown. Leave to cool for a few minutes on the tray before transferring them onto wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat grill or grill pan on medium-high heat. Trim ends from zucchini and cut each zucchini lengthwise into 1/4-inch slices. Cut tomatoes into 1/2-inch slices or wedges. Brush grill with cooking sprayplace zucchini and tomatoes on grill rack and grill 4 minutes or until tender and grill marks form. Remove from grill and place on a serving platter. Sprinkle with cheese and serve immediately.

Cut a hole in the top of the ham and remove the rind. Place ham in a large baking dish. Mix mustard with the beer and pour over hamsprinkle with pepper. Cover with foil and bake at 325 for 3 hours. Remove foil last half hour of cooking time. Serve with maple glaze made by mixing 1 cup water with 1/2 cup sugarstir in 1/2 cup maple syrup. Bring to a boilreduce heatboil gently for 1 minute. Pour over hamsprinkle with additional black pepper.
Cook ground beef. Add remaining ingredients. Mix well. Press into a 9x5-inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until done. Serve with a side dish of your choice.

Combine flour, salt and pepper in medium bowl. Add margarine and cut in well. Add milk and mix. Pour batter over salmon and gently fold into salad greens. Pour over toast. Top with frozen peas. Serve immediately.

Combine gelatin and water and stir till dissolved. Place biscuits into a bowl and crush to fine crumbs. Pour over hot water. Add gelatin mixture. Stir till biscuits are soft. Set aside for an hour. Combine cream cheese with caster sugar. Stir till smooth. Beat cream till soft peaks form. Stir in cheese mixture. Fold in melted butter. Spoon mixture into a cake tin. Chill for an hour. To make cheesecake set over simmering water. Beat cream till soft peaks form. Stir into cheesecake mixture. Place over hot water till thickened. Stir till cheesecake is smooth. Stir through chocolate candy. Pour mixture over biscuits. Chill till cheesecake sets. To decorate cheesecake melt chocolate. Dip a teaspoon into chocolate. Spoon out drops onto cheesecake. Place in refrigerator for chocolate to set. Refrigerate cheesecake until serving.
Layer 4 tortillas with imitation crabmeat & cream cheese. Roll & place seam down in a 9 x 13 baking dish. Combine salsa with cheese & spread over rolls. Top with cheddar cheese & bake for 10 min.

Remove can of refried beans from fridge to warm up to room temperature. Prepare corn tortillas as you desire (I like them crisp) and fill with refried beans and cheddar cheese. Place on a baking sheet lined with foil and bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve with salsa on the side.
Bring soba noodles and water to the boil in a pan. Drain and rinse under cold water. Drain and return noodles to pan. Toss in the remaining ingredients and chill. Top with sesame seeds.

Pound chicken tenders with a meat mallet until about 1/4-inch thick. Mix together salt, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder and cayenne pepper. Dip chicken tenders into melted butter then dip into spice mixture. Coat chicken with seasonings on all sides. Place chicken on baking sheet. Bake at 350f degrees for 45 minutes. While chicken is baking prepare sauce. Melt 1-tablespoon butter and saute mushrooms. Add 1/2 cup heavy cream and 1/2 cup milk. Season with salt and pepper to taste. When chicken is done and sauce is ready pour sauce over chicken and serve.

Rinse and drain rice. Mix rice with achiote seeds in a large bowl. Pour oil in a pan on medium-high heat until it begins to shimmer. Stir in onion for 1-2 minutes then add in rice with achiote seeds. Stir to mix well. Bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer for 15 minutes. Cook uncovered for 30 minutes. Stir in water and salt then cook uncovered for another 15 minutes. Bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer for 15 minutes more. Stir in bacon then cook for 30 minutes more uncovered. Serve hot with meat and/or a fried egg on top.

In a large saucepan heat canola oil over medium heat. Add onion and saute until golden brown. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add carrots and brown rice to pan. Cook for 3 minutes until rice is coated with oil. Pour chicken stock over rice mixture and bring it to a boil. Reduce heat and cook for about 20 minutes until rice is tender. Stir in green chilies and lime juice. Serve soup with chips and salsa.

Slice polish sausage in 1/4 inch slices. Bake in 375 degree oven for 20 minutes. While sausage bakes, mix soup and milk in a bowl. Add prepared mustard, onion and sauerkraut. Heat in microwave for 3 minutes. In another bowl, mix noodles with soup mixture. Stir in cooked sausage. Spread mixture in 11x8x2 baking dish. Cover with swiss cheese. Top with bread crumbs and melted butter. Bake 20 minutes in 375 degree oven. Let stand 5 minutes. Cut into squares. Serve hot.

Place chicken in a 9x13 baking pan. Mix butter, salad dressing, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce, garlic cloves together. Pour mixture over chicken. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Cut potatoes in half lengthwise. Put in a large pot and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil and boil potatoes for 10-15 minutes. Remove from the heat and drain potatoes. Chop bacon into 1/2-inch pieces and saute until crispy in a large skillet. Add chopped onions to bacon and saute until tender. Add potatoes back to pan with bacon and onions. Add stock and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil and reduce heat and simmer for 20-30 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

Drizzle chicken with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook on medium to medium-high heat until cooked through and no longer pink. While chicken is cooking make the yogurt sauce by mixing plain yogurt with dijon mustard. When chicken is done, cut it into slices and spread the yogurt mixture onto each slice of english muffin. Place the chicken on top. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and parsley. Add some cayenne pepper if desired.

Pre-heat the oven to 425 degrees F. Place whole sweet potatoes on a foil-lined cookie sheet. Sprinkle with salt and cinnamon. Bake for one hour, or until soft and tender. Remove from the oven and allow potatoes to cool. Spoon sour cream and maple syrup into a small bowl and mix well. In a small bowl place pecans and melted butter. In another small bowl combine brown sugar and cinnamon. When potatoes are cool, place a small amount of sour cream in a small bowl and drizzle with maple syrup. Top potatoes with a small amount of brown sugar-cinnamon mixture. Place a spoonful of sour cream and maple mixture on top. Top with a small amount of crushed pecans. Serve warm.

Saute broccoli floret in olive oil and butter until tender. Remove broccoli florets and set aside. In a nonstick skillet, heat the olive oil and butter. Add the ham and green onions and saute for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the broccoli florets and saute for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside. In a large bowl combine the hash browns and egg substitute. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Spoon egg mixture into the skillet and lightly press down with a fork. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until egg is just set. Remove from heat and top with the broccoli and cheese. Garnish with chopped chives. Makes 1 serving. Calories per serving - 236.

Mix together egg and buttermilk. Add baking powder and soda and whisk until combined. Add remaining dry ingredients and mix until batter is smooth. Add unsalted butter and mix until butter is incorporated. Heat a griddle over medium-high heat. Pour batter onto hot griddle and cook until the pancakes are golden brown on both sides. Serve with butter and maple syrup.

Mix together the cheddar cheese and ranch dressing in a bowl and set aside. In another bowl combine the corn and black beans with the tomatoes and green onions and set aside. In a large salad bowl combine the romaine lettuce with the other ingredients and toss gently with the dressing until it is evenly distributed throughout the lettuce. Serve immediately and enjoy.

Cream butter & sugar together. Add milk & golden syrup. Whisk flour & baking soda together. Gradually add the dry ingredients. Beat for 1 minute. Add sultanas. Drop by teaspoonful on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 8-10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease and flour two 9x9x2 inch baking pan. Combine sugar, shortening and egg in a mixing bowl. Mix well with an electric mixer. Add milk and beat well. Add flour, baking powder and salt to mixture. Stir in blueberries. Pour mixture into prepared pans. Combine crumbs with melted butter and cinnamon. Sprinkle crumbs over top of batter. Bake for 50 minutes. Let cool. Serve warm. Enjoy!

Fry bacon grease in a pan. Add onions and cook until soft. Add garlic and cook a few minutes longer. Add whole tomatoes and cook until they are softened. Add water and season to taste with salt and pepper. Add ancho chili and chili powder and cook another few minutes. Add sugar. Serve over enchiladas.

In large bowl combine broth and butter over medium heat and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until butter is melted and broth is hot, about 1 minute. Pour in honey and cook until it is dissolved. Add paprika and black peppercorns and cook for about 2 minutes more. Combine honey mixture with parsley and add onions and stir. Bake in lightly greased 2 qt casserole at 400 for about 45 minutes until tender and lightly browned on top.

Put the dates and walnuts in a food processor and process until chopped. Put them in a bowl and add the almonds and salt. Mix in the wine and honey. Add the spices and mix thoroughly. Pour the dates into a dish and pour the wine and honey mixture over them. Serve at room temperature.

In a large saucepan or Dutch oven heat oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until tender and translucent, about 3 minutes. Add the beans and brothbring to a boil then reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Season the soup with cumin and salt and pepper to taste. In a small bowl stir together the sour cream and green onions until combinedset aside. Serve the soup hot and top each serving with a dollop of the sour cream mixture and a pinch of chopped cilantroserve immediately.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a 12-inch skillet over high heat. Add the garlic and gingerrootcook for 1 minute. Add the green beanscook and stir for 2 minutes. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil, the crushed red pepper flakes and the black bean sauce. Cook for 2 minutes. Transfer to a bowl. Sprinkle the green beans with the white sesame seeds.

Make the crust according to package directions using two 10 inch pizza pans. Meanwhile prepare the beef according to package directions. After crust has risen, remove from pans. Spread crust with the barbecued beef, then top with the red onion slices. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the pizza. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Serve with a side salad for a quick dinner any night of the week!

Cut bread into 3" squares. Top each square of bread with a slice of ham and cheese. Fold over each slice of bread and press the ends together to seal. In a large frying pan, heat 1 1/2 inches of cooking oil to 375 degrees F. Fry the sandwiches for about 30 seconds per side until golden brown. Serve on a napkin. Enjoy!

Prawns : Preheat grill or barbecue grill to medium-high heat. Thread prawns onto metal skewers, alternating with cherry tomatoes, shallots, coriander leaves, lime quarters and lemon quarters. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Grill prawns and vegetables, turning occasionally, for 10 minutes or until prawns are cooked through. Serve with Cous Cous : Bring 1 ½ cups water to a boil in a medium saucepan with a lid. Add 1 cup couscous and 1 tbsp oilsimmer for 5 minutes or until tender. Meanwhile, whisk ¼ cup water with ¼ cup juice from limes and zest from 2 limes in a small bowl to make a marinade. Place couscous in a large bowlstir in prawns, avocado and remaining juice from limes. Drizzle with marinade to coattoss to combine. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve immediately or cover with a damp cloth for

Wash chicken and pat dry. Cut into strips. Heat oil in large frying pan. Add chicken and cook until done. Add garlic cloves and cook 1 minute. Add brown sugar and cook until it gets caramelized. Add soy sauce and cook 1 minute. Add broth and cook 5 minutes. Add corn starch and cook until thickened. Add chicken broth, carrots and peas. Cook 2 minutes. Add cooked rice and broccoli. Cook until heated through. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly coat fish fillets with olive oil. Sprinkle each side of fillet with parsley, salt and pepper. Place fillets skin side down on foil lined sheet pan. Tuck garlic cloves inside fillets and sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 15-18 minutes depending on thickness of fillet. Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing over fish.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Cook asparagus for 4-5 minutes or until bright green and firm but tender. Drain the asparagus. Place the asparagus in a large bowl. Toss the asparagus with the strawberries, honey and lemon juice and oil to coat evenly. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

In a medium bowl combine the corn kernels and egg yolks. Stir in sugar and salt and set aside to marinate for 30 minutes. In another large bowl mix the flour, baking powder and salt together. Add the milk and mix well until smooth. Add the corn mixture and stir until just combined. In another large skillet add enough canola oil to reach 1/2 inch deep in the skillet and heat to 375 degrees F. Drop rounded tablespoons full of batter onto the hot oil and flatten slightly with the back of a spoon. Fry 2 minutes or until golden brown and flip. Drain on paper towels and serve warm or at room temperature with fruit chutney. Serve with a side salad.
Chop carrot, apple and cabbage into small pieces. In a large bowl combine all the dressing ingredients and mix well. Add cabbage mixture and toss. Serve immediately.

Mix together the sugar, salt, paprika, chili powder, garlic powder and black pepper in a bowl and rub onto spareribs. Put a rack in middle position and preheat oven to 325f. Roast ribs for 1 1/2 hours or until tender and browned. Sprinkle with ground allspice and serve with barbecue sauce if desired.

Combine flour, baking soda and saltmix well. Add butter to flour mixture and stir until crumbly. Add 3/4 cup of brown sugar and 1/2 cup white sugar. Stir well. Add 1 egg and 1/2 cup of peanut butter and stir well. Add 1 tsp of vanilla and stir well. Add 1 tsp of baking soda to the egg mixture and stir well. Add 1 cup of quick oats to the flour mixture and stir well. Stir in the egg mixture. Add 1 cup of chocolate chips to the flour mixture and stir. Drop by spoonfuls onto greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-18 minutes. Makes 14-16 cookies.

Preheat oven to 425f. Wash the potatoes. Cut the potatoes into 1/4-inch-thick wedges. In a large bowl, combine the potatoes with the garlic powder. Drizzle the olive oil over the potatoes. Sprinkle the red pepper on the potatoes. Place the potatoes on a baking sheet. Bake for 12 minutes. Remove the potatoes from the oven. Sprinkle the salt over the potatoes. Place the potatoes back on the baking sheet. Bake for 6 more minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat cream cheese and sour cream until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla. Beat well. In a separate bowl beat eggs and add to cream cheese mixture. Add cinnamon and mix well. Roll out crescent rolls into 8x8 inch pan and place in refrigerator to chill. Pour cheesecake mixture into pan and sprinkle with nuts and chocolate chips. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes and serve.

Chop onions into small cubes and sauté with olive oil. Add fresh chopped parsley, chives, and basil leaves to the pan and sauté for 2-3 minutes. Squeeze fresh lemon juice into pan (optional). Meanwhile, crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and add salt and black pepper to taste (1-2 tsp). Whisk eggs until lightly blended. Pour eggs into sautéed onions and stir gently until eggs are set and no longer runny (approx 5-6 minutes).

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Peel sweet potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Toss in orange juice and let stand 20 minutes. Drain potatoes and place on a foil lined cookie sheet. Drizzle with butter. Sprinkle with cranberries and brown sugar. Sprinkle with slivered almonds. Bake until potatoes are tender and browned.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease 8-inch square pan and set aside. Whisk together the eggs and half-and-half cream in large bowl. Sift the flour and spices together in another bowl. Stir the egg mixture into the flour mixture and mix well. Gently stir in the chocolate chips. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake in preheated oven until puffy and golden brown, about 20 to 25 minutes. Let the dutch baby cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Dust the top with powdered sugar and serve with fresh berries.

Brown bacon until crisp. Remove from heat and set aside on a paper towel. Saute onion with garlic until tender. Set aside. In a small bowl combine sauerkraut with 2 tablespoons of the bacon fat, paprika, sugar and lager beer. Set aside. Cut pork into 1/2-inch thick slices. Heat remaining bacon fat until hot but not smoking. Add pork and brown on both sides. Stir sauerkraut mixture into pork and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes longer. Add salt and pepper as desired. Serve with lemon wedges.

Combine the flours and baking soda and salt in a mixing bowl. Rub in the butter until it is in pea-sized pieces. Mix in the bran and the oats. Mix in the sugar. Whisk the egg and the buttermilk together and add it in with the flour mixture. Mix thoroughly. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead until it is smooth and elastic. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and roll out into a rectangle of about 1/4 inch thick. Brush with some of the buttermilk and fold in thirds. Roll out again and fold in thirds once more. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface. Roll out into a rectangle of about 1/4 inch thick. Cut into squares of about 1 inch. Transfer the squares onto greased baking sheets and bake for about 15 minutes until lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add in eggs one at a time. Add in bananas and mix well. Add in flour mixture and stir until just combined. Stir in nuts and pour into greased 9 by 5 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes. Let cool slightly before removing from pan. Enjoy.
Beat eggs. Beat in matzos. Heat butter and oil in a nonstick frying pan over moderate heat. Add matzos and cook until they begin to brown. Add the egg mixture and cook until set.

Slice tomatoes lengthwise and place in glass dish with extra virgin olive oil and basil and ground black pepper to taste. Cover and set aside at room temperature for at least 20 minutes before serving. You can serve with crackers or bread for a light meal.
Mix all the ingredients together and serve with crackers. If you prefer you can make individual pots of dip.

Pour 1/2 cup boiling water over the cornstarch in a medium bowl. Stir until cornstarch is dissolved. Gradually whisk in the cocoa powder and brown sugar. Pour the mixture into a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Boil for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and slowly whisk in the cold milk. Pour into four 1/2 cup measuring cups. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until firm. To serve, spoon about 1/2 cup of each mousse mixture into four bowls. Top each bowl with 1/2 tablespoon of the topping.

Trim stem ends of mushrooms. Slice stems into ¼ inch thick rings. Slice caps into ¼ inch thick slices. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute mushroom stems in olive oil. Add onion and saute for 5 minutes. Add spinach and stir. Cook until spinach has wilted and onions are translucent. Remove from heat. Stuff mushroom caps with spinach mixture. Place in baking dish. In a small bowl, combine blue cheese, balsamic vinegar and garlic. Spoon mixture over mushrooms. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until mushrooms are tender.
Mix all ingredients and cook until heated through. Serve with toasted rolls.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cook sweet potatoes in a shallow pan with water until just tender. Drain potatoes and return to pan. Add apple juice and brown sugar. Stir together. Season with salt and pepper and freshly ground black pepper. Stir in cranberries and cook in a 400 degree oven about 35-40 minutes, until tender. Serve warm.

Mix together lime juice, fish sauce, ground chicken and red onion in a bowl. Season with rice powder and chili peppers. Add mint leaf and green onion. Place lettuce leaves on a plate. Place a spoonful of chicken mixture in center of each lettuce leaf. Serve with sticky rice.

Combine egg, sugar and salt in a blender. Add coconut milk. Blend until mixture is smooth. Pour into punch bowl. Add pineapple juice. Add cream. Garnish with whipped topping. Top with maraschino cherry.

Brown the onions in 2 tbs butter over medium heat until tender and translucent. Add cabbage and carrots and sautee 15-20 minutes or until tender. In a small bowl combine 1/2 cup of the butter with brown sugar and soy sauce and cider vinegar and whisk together until well blended. Add the sugar mixture to the vegetables and stir to coat. Cook over low heat 5-10 minutes or until carrots are tender and the sauce thickens to a desired consistency. Add pepper to taste and serve hot with rice or noodles.

Peel the potatoes. Cut into 1/4-inch cubes. Cook the potatoes in a saucepan with boiling salted water over moderate heat until tender but not soft, about 20 minutes. Drain the potatoes in a colander and transfer them to a large bowl. Add the cheese and the other ingredients and mix thoroughly. Preheat the broiler. Lightly grease a large nonstick frying pan and preheat it over moderately high heat. Pour about 2 tablespoons of potato mixture into the pan. Form the mixture into a pancake shape and place the pan in the preheated broiler for about 3 minutes or until the edges are browned. Turn the pancake over and cook it for about 3 minutes more. Serve hot.

Place the chicken pieces in a large plastic bag. Mix together the mustard, lemon juice and seasoning. Pour the mixture into the bag and seal. Turn the pieces several times to coat with the mixture. Marinate for 1 hour or as long as overnight in the refrigerator. Place the chicken pieces in a large skillet coated with cooking oil. Cook over medium heat until done, turning occasionally. Serve hot or cold.

In a large saucepan bring broth to a simmer. Stir together flour and 1/4 cup cream cheese until blendedgradually stir into hot broth. Cook and stir for 2 minutes longerseason with nutmeg and pepper. Cook until thickened and bubbly. Stir in 1/4 cup Parmesan. Stir in remaining cream cheese and remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan until blended. Add cooked fettuccine and cooked broccoli, tossing until sauce is evenly distributed. Sprinkle with remaining Parmesan. Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley.

Cook pasta in boiling salted water until tender but firm, stirring occasionally. Drain and transfer to a 9x13 inch casserole dish or a 6 quart slow cooker. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat and add the green pepper and onion. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally until softened. Add the ground sirloin and cook until browned and the meat is no longer pink in the center. Sprinkle flour over mixture and stir. Add beef stock and tomatoes and tomato paste and bring to a boil over medium heat. Season with salt and pepper and stir in the cream cheese and cottage cheese until melted and combined. Add the cooked pasta and toss with the sauce in the pan. Pour into the casserole or slow cooker and cook for 10 minutes at 350 degrees or 4 hours on low. Serve warm.

Prepare an 8x8 pan with waxed paper. Melt butter over low heat. Stir in sugar. Add berries. Stir until berries have released their juices. Sprinkle with pecans. Whisk egg whites until soft peaks form. Spread a layer of egg whites over berries. Layer remaining wafers. Spread remaining egg whites. Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours. Invert onto plate. Top with whipped cream.
Mix cheeses together in a large bowl. Add spaghetti sauce to bowl. Add eggplant to bowl. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Serve hot. Serves 6.

Rinse the fish under cold water. Pat dry. Heat butter in a nonstick skillet over low heat. Add orange rind. When rind has turned golden brown and aromatic, add fish. Cook over medium heat 3-5 minutes on each side. Transfer to a baking sheet. Sprinkle fish generously with parsley. In a small saucepan over low heat, melt the butter. Add orange juice and cook until butter has melted. Pour mixture over fish. Bake in a 350-degree oven for 10 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cook sausage in large skillet over medium heat until browned. Drainset aside. Cook ground beef in large skillet over medium-high heat until browneddrain. Place 6 tortillas on bottom of ungreased 2-qt baking dishtop with meat mixture, salsa, and soup. Cover with remaining tortillasspoon on remaining meat mixture. Sprinkle with garlic powder and oreganotop with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 minutes. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Bring water to boil in large pot. Add green beans and cook 4 minutes. Drain. Transfer to large bowl with slotted spoonset aside. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and saute 1 minute. Stir in remaining ingredients and heat through. Drain on paper towels and serve with the green beans.

Combine meat, jalapeno pepper, garlic cloves and salt in a large bowl. Mix together using hands. Form patties. Grill over medium heat until done. Put cheese in a bowl with a little water to keep from burning. Grill cheese. Top each hamburger with jalapenos, then with cheese. Serve on buns with your favorite toppings.

Combine tuna and curry powder and mix well. Add olive oil and stir until tuna is covered. Add onion and mix well. Add crystallized ginger and mix well. Add mayonnaise and stir well. Add rice vinegar and stir well. Add dijon mustard and mix well. Add pecans and mix well. Add cayenne pepper and mix well. Serve with crackers or crackers and cream cheese.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add garlic and onions and cook 2 minutes stirring occasionally. Add honey and hot sauce and cook 1 minute stirring constantly. Add pineapple and cook 2 minutes or until pineapple is tender. Turn the heat to low and add the chili powder and lemon juice. Cook 1 minute or until slightly thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Place the chicken breasts into the skillet and coat evenly with the glaze. Cover the skillet and cook 5 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink inside. Serve the chicken over rice and enjoy!

Cook onion in oil. Add ground turkey. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Add water, tomatoes, soup, and cabbage. Cover and cook on low heat for 30 minutes. Stir occasionally. Salt and pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook chicken according to package directions. Drain and cool slightly, then shred chicken breasts. In a small bowl combine shredded chicken, salsa and taco seasoningset aside. Place 4 tortillas on a baking sheetspread about 1/4 cup of salsa mixture on each tortilla. Top each tortilla with 1/4 cup of shredded cheesesprinkle each with 1 tablespoon of sliced scallions. Top each with 1/4 cup of chicken mixturesprinkle each with 1 tablespoon sliced scallions. Top each with 1/4 cup of sliced scallionssprinkle each with 1/2 tablespoon sliced scallions. Bake for 5 minutes or until heated through and cheese is meltedlet stand 3 minutes before serving.

Saute zucchini in oil until softened. Remove from heat. In a bowl whisk eggs. Add zucchini, parsley, thyme, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper. Pour into an oven proof skillet. Place under broiler until top is golden.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Crumble the dried beef. In a medium sized bowl combine the cream cheese with the beef and seasonings. Add the green onion and pecans and stir to combine. Make balls with the mixture and place on a cookie sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes or until lightly browned.

In a medium saucepan, combine wine, juice, lemon slices, ginger, cinnamon stick and honey. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook until the liquid is reduced by half. Stir in ginger. Remove cinnamon stick. Pour into a heatproof glass carafe. Serve warm.

Sprinkle with salt to taste then add all other ingredients to taste. Mix well then serve with your favorite chips or crackers or on top of a taco or quesadilla. Can also be served as a salad dressing or used to top grilled chicken or fish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine flour and brown sugar in a medium bowl. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Set aside 1/3 cup of the mixture for topping. Place remaining crumbs into a 9x13-inch pan. Beat together egg and sugarstir in corn syrup and vanilla. Pour over crumbs. Dot with semisweet chocolate and pecans. Pour reserved crumbs over mixture. Bake 20 minutes. Remove from oven and top with remaining crumbs. Bake 15 minutes longer or until golden brown. Cool before cutting. Serve warm.

In a pan, put sugar and water and boil over a medium heat for about 15 minutes. Add alum. When sugar is dissolved remove from heat and add blossoms. Stir for about 10 minutes and pour into containers. If honey is not clear add a few drops of water to clarify. Store in a cool dark place. It will last about a year.

Put butter in a small saucepan on stove top and let melt over low heat. When the butter is nearly melted add garlic salt. Add paprika. Add pepper. Add lobster tails. Tail side down. Cook for about ten minutes or until opaque. Carefully turn tail over. Cook for another 5 minutes or until done.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix salt, pepper, extra virgin olive oil, dijon mustard and garlic together. Season rack of lamb with mixture. Sprinkle with bread crumbs and parmesan cheese. Place rack of lamb into a 10 x 13 glass baking dish. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve with a side of mashed potato.
Brown ground beef with salsa, vinegar, beans, rice and spices to taste. Serve with sour cream and salsa. Top with cheese.

Mix garlic, lime juice and zest, cumin, hot sauce, red pepper flakes, old bay seasoning, and shallots. Heat oil over medium-high heat. Add shrimp. Cook 1 minute. Add garlic mixture. Cook 2-3 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a small bowl, whisk together brown sugar, rice vinegar, chili paste, fish sauce, and hot sauceset aside. Mix together ground ginger, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and saltset aside. Dip chicken into the brown sugar mixture to coat, then into the seasoning mixture to coat completely. Thread chicken onto skewers. Place on a greased baking sheetbake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 25 minutes, turning skewers once after 15 minutes. Garnish with scallions to serve.
Mix meat and seasonings. Mix in egg. Add bread crumbs. Form into loaf. Bake at 350 degrees f. For about 1 hour. Can be frozen.

Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, pumpkin, raisins and water in bowl until well blended. Pour batter into 12 greased muffin cups or into a large muffin pan. Bake at 400 degrees F. for 15 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Remove from oven and cool on wire rack. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a baking pan with nonstick spray coating or line with waxed paper. Spray the vegetables with nonstick spray coating and sprinkle with fine dry breadcrumbs. Shake off any excess breadcrumbs. Spray with nonstick spray coating again. Arrange the vegetables in the prepared pan in single layer. Sprinkle with cheese and paprika to taste. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 35 minutes or until vegetables are crisp tender and golden brown. Pour reduced-calorie Italian dressing over the vegetables. Serve warm.

Dissolve jello and pudding mix in hot water. Add soda and stir well until the gelatin is completely dissolved. Refrigerate overnight. Remove from refrigerator and mix well. Pour into a 9x13 glass pan. Cool for 2 hours. Add the cool whip.

Cream together cream cheese and powdered sugar until well combined. Spoon mixture onto vanilla wafer biscuits and smooth the top with a knife. Top with a small spoon of preserves and refrigerate 1 hour until firm before serving.

Prepare cola by dissolving brown sugar in a quart of cola. Grill ribs over medium heat until browned and slightly charred. Remove ribs from grill. Combine the remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Pour half the cola mixture over the ribs. Reserve the remaining cola mixture. Arrange ribs in a roaster with the ends of the bones resting on the lip. Pour half the cola mixture over the ribs and reserve the remaining mixture. Cook in the oven for about an hour. After the first hour of cooking, baste ribs with remaining cola mixture and cook for another hour. Turn ribs over halfway through. Transfer ribs from roaster to a platter and baste with cola mixture. Transfer to an electric smoker for about an hour. Baste with cola mixture. Transfer to an electric smoker. Baste with cola mixture. Remove from smoker and baste with cola mixture. Transfer ribs to a grill for a few minutes just to brown and crisp. Serve with barbecue sauce.

Combine 1 c. brown sugar and 1 c. water in medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until sugar is dissolved and mixture comes to boil. Remove from heat. Add whole allspices & cloves. Add apple cider. Stir. Add remaining sugar and stir to dissolve. Bring to boil again. Remove from heat and discard spices. Serve warm. Sprinkle with orange wedge.

Melt butter and cocoa in saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in condensed milk. Cool to lukewarm and stir in nuts. Drop by tablespoons onto waxed paper or parchment paper and freeze until firm. Roll into balls and roll in sugar to coat. Store in refrigerator until ready to serve. Makes about 3 dozen.

Cut chicken breasts in half and season with salt and pepper. Spray 12 inch skillet with olive oil. Place 4 pieces of chicken in the skillet. Bake until cooked through and no longer pink in the center, about 25 minutes. Remove from oven and drain off any fat. Sprinkle each half with 2 teaspoons of parmesan and 1/4 cup part-skim mozzarella. Place the remaining 4 halves of chicken in the skillet. Sprinkle with the remaining 2 teaspoons of parmesan and 1/4 cup of mozzarella. Pour the pasta sauce over the top. Bake until the mozzarella is bubbly and the parmesan has browned and crisped slightly, about 10 minutes more. Serve with the pasta.

Preheat oven to 350F. In a large mixing bowl combine the flour, baking soda and cinnamon. Stir in the sugar. In a separate large bowl combine the eggs and sugar. Add the frozen strawberries and pecans and mix well. Pour the wet batter into the dry batter and stir until just combined. Grease a loaf pan and pour the batter into the pan. Bake for 60 to 75 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bread comes out clean. Let the bread cool in the pan for 15 minutes. Remove and cool completely before slicing. This bread can be frozen.

Prepare dinner rolls according to package directionslet cool. Meanwhile, beat cream cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper until smooth. Cut rolls into 1 1/2- to 2-inch piecesroll each piece into a ball. Spoon 1 tbsp cream cheese mixture into each balltop with mozzarella cheese. Roll each into a ball, then roll in bread crumbs to coat. Arrange 10 balls on greased microwave-safe platefreeze until firm. Preheat oven to 400unthaw 10 ballsplace on baking sheet. Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until golden browncool 5 minutes on wire rack. Meanwhile, prepare filling: beat eggs slightlystir in spinach, salt, and peppermicrowave on high 15 to 18 minutes or until eggs are just setlet stand 5 minutes. Arrange 4 balls on each serving platetop each with 1/4 cup egg mixturemicrowave on high 1 to 2 minutes or until eggs are he
Mix all together. Serve with crackers.

Beat eggs with the caster sugar until thickened and light in colour. Stir in the milk. Add suet to the mixture in a thin stream. Mix well. Sieve together the self raising flour and a little of the suet mixture into a large bowl. Make a well in the centre of the mixture. Add the eggs mixture into the well. Stir with a wooden spoon until well combined. Tip in the currants. Turn out onto a lightly greased board. Knead for a few minutes. Place the mixture into a 20cm cake tin with a removable base. Grease the sides of the tin with a little suet. Cover the cake mixture with a double layer of greaseproof paper. Cover with a tea towel. Place into a steamer over a pot of boiling water. Steam for 2 hours until firm. Remove from the steamer. Unmould. Dust with icing sugar. Serve with custard.

Remove the mussels from their shells, keeping them intact. Discard any mussels that are open. Heat oil and garlic clove in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add shallot and cook for 3-5 minutes. Pour wine into the saucepan and bring it to a boil over medium-high heat. Remove garlic clove from oil and add mussels to saucepan. Cook until mussels open (about 5 minutes), discarding any mussels that have not opened. Remove mussels from saucepan with tongs and transfer them to an ovenproof dish. Keep mussels covered with lid to keep warm. Strain liquid from saucepan into another saucepan. Bring liquid back to a low simmer over low heat (do not let it come to a boil). When liquid is reduced by half (about 10 minutes), remove from heat and set aside. Pour reduced sauce over mussels and serve with baguette slices, mixed greens, and white wine vinegar- extra virgin olive oil dressing on the side.

Combine cream cheese, cool whip, sugar, crushed pineapple in a large mixing bowl. Stir with a spoon until the sugar is dissolved. Pour into the crust. Place in the refrigerator until firm. Cut into slices.
Mix pork with sesame seeds and set aside. Prepare sauce by mixing brown sugar with soy sauce and vinegar. Pour the sauce over the pork and stir until coated evenly. Serve over cooked rice.
Put popcorn in bowl. In separate bowl combine butter, soy sauce, red pepper flakes and garlic powder. Pour over popcorn. Stir to coat. Add chunky peanut butter and stir until combined. Serve. Serve.

In small bowl combine apricot preserves, rosemary, 1 tbsp of chili-garlic sauce and 1 tbsp of dijon mustard. In separate bowl, combine brown sugar, 1 tbsp of chili-garlic sauce and 1 tbsp of dijon mustard. Place drumettes in a single layer in a large bowl. Drizzle preserves mixture evenly over drumettes. Drizzle brown sugar mixture evenly over drumettes. Bake for 20 minutes.

Dal can be eaten as a soup or as a side dish. Boil dal until thick. Add garlic, onion & mustard seeds. Saute for 2 minutes. Add curry leaves & cumin seeds. Stir for 30 seconds. Add coriander leaves & achar. Serve hot.

Prepare pastry shells according to package directions. Place one pastry shell in each of twelve 6-ounce muffin tins. Fill each shell with a mixture of turkey, apple, and cheese. Roll out another pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface. Cut into twelve (1-inch) circles. Place a pastry circle over each turkey mixture. Beat the egg with the coarse salt and brush over the pastry circles. Bake at 400 degrees f for ten minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately.

Mix all ingredients well and knead to form a soft dough. Roll out on floured board until it is 1/4 inch thick. Cut with a biscuit cutter or a drinking glass. Cook in a skillet with a little oil. Cook for 2 minutes per side. Serve with your favorite toppings.

Brown ground beef. Drain. In a large bowl combine ground beef, V8 juice and taco seasoning. Stir to combine. Add onion powder and kidney beans. Stir to combine. Transfer mixture to a 4 qt slow cooker. Add corn and tomato sauce. Stir to combine. Cover slow cooker and cook on LOW for 6 hours. When soup is done, stir in 1/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese. Top with the other 1/4 cup of shredded cheddar. Serve with chopped cilantro. Garnish with a lime wedge, if desired.
Beat pudding mix into cool whip until smooth. Fold in crushed pineapple. Gently fold in fruit cocktail, maraschino cherry, pistachios and mandarin orange. Chill for at least 3 hours before serving.

Mix brown sugar, margarine and corn syrup together until blended. Roll crescent rolls into a rectangle as wide as your baking sheet. Spread caramel mixture evenly over dough. Sprinkle evenly with cinnamon & pecans. Roll up dough jelly-roll style. Cut rolls into pieces of desired length. Place cut side up on baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 12 minutes at 425f. Serve warm.

Cook the egg noodles according to package directions and set aside. While the noodles are cooking prepare the casserole by sautéing the bacon in the skillet until crisp and then remove the bacon from the pan and add the egg to the pan and cook until the eggs have thickened and are no longer runny and remove and set aside as well. In a large skillet add the butter and melt it and then add the flour to the butter and cook until the flour begins to brown and then add the heavy cream and cook until the cream has thickened and has reduced slightly and then add the cottage cheese and continue cooking until the cheese has thickened and is hot and then add the egg noodles and cook until the egg noodles have softened and then add the bacon and the egg and stir everything together until well combined. Pour the casserole into a greased baking dish and bake at 375 degrees for about 30 minutes or until the top is golden and the casserole is hot and bubbly and serve hot.

Bring a pot of water to boil and add potatoes and onions and cook until tender, about 10 minutes or until fork tender. Drain and let cool slightly. While potatoes and onions are cooking, heat olive oil over medium heat in a skillet and add garlic and rosemary and saute until fragrant (about 2 minutes). Add potatoes and onions and season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat and let cool slightly then stir in the spinach and toss until wilted and combined. Meanwhile, season chicken with salt and pepper and cook over medium heat until cooked through and no longer pink (about 8 minutes). Serve chicken over potatoes and onions and garnish with lemon wedges if you like! (Note: Serves 4-6 depending on how hungry your family is!)

Combine all ingredients except chicken in medium bowl. Heat 2 tsp. of the olive oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chickencook 4 minutes or until browned. Add pineapple mixturecook 6 minutes or until chicken is done.

Rinse the cauliflower under cold water to remove any dirt. Trim the leaves of the cauliflower so that you have only the white part of the head left. Cut the cauliflower into 1-inch pieces so that you have about 2 cups of cauliflower. Place the cauliflower in a medium-size pot with enough water to cover it by 1 1/2 inches. Bring the water to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for about 3 minutes or until the cauliflower is tender. Drain the cauliflower, reserving the cooking liquid. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter. Add the cauliflower and cook, stirring occasionally, for about 15 minutes or until the cauliflower is softened, but not mushy. Add the garlic to the pan and cook for 1 minute more. Drain the cooking liquid from the cauliflower into the skillet with the cauliflower. Season the cauliflower with pepper and nutmeg to taste. Transfer the caul

Put the chicken in the slow cooker. Mix in the cream cheese and the salsa. Sprinkle with the taco seasoning. Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours. Remove from the slow cooker and shred with two forks. Pour the cooked rice into the slow cooker. Add the shredded chicken and stir to combine. Stir in the chili beans. Cover and cook on low for 10-15 more minutes. Serve with tortilla chips or on a bed of cooked rice.

Cook sausage and drain off excess grease. Set aside. In a skillet, over medium heat, fry eggs and sausage together until cooked through and eggs are done to taste. Spread English Muffin halves with sour cream and top with the sausage and egg mixture. Top with diced green chilies and shredded cheese. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine the olive oil, fresh lemon juice, garlic and salt and pepper. Whisk to blend. In a ziplock bag or large container add the turkey pieces and pour the marinade over. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove turkey and drain the marinade. Reserve the marinade for basting. Place turkey in a roasting pan and roast at 325 degrees for 3 to 3 1/2 hours until internal temperature reaches 165 degrees. Pour reserved marinade over turkey to baste and cook for an additional 30 minutes. Serve with a slice of buttered bread.

Combine water and teabags in a large pitcher. Steep for 5 minutes. Strain and discard teabags. Add orange zest and juice. Stir in sugar and grapefruit juice. Add ice and stir. Garnish with mint sprigs and serve over ice.

Cook pasta shells according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Place in a large bowl. Add the mayonnaise and vinegar and stir until blended. Add the broccoli florets, onion, golden raisins and bacon and mix well. Fold the pasta shells into the mixture and chill. Top with sunflower seeds. Makes 8 servings.

Prepare yellow cake mix according to package directions. Set aside. In a small bowl, mix pudding mix and eggs. Mix with cake mix. Spread the cake mixture in the bottom of an ungreased 9-inch square baking pan. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until cake springs back when lightly touched. Cool. Refrigerate. Spoon the pudding mixture over cake. Cut into squares. Store refrigerated.

Cut hamburger into small pieces. Cook hamburger with beansprouts, celery, onion in skillet until hamburger is cooked through. Mix in cream of mushroom soup, water and soy sauce. Pour over chow mein noodles in 10" x 14" pan. Top with more soy sauce and black pepper. Bake in oven at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until heated through. Serve warm.

Mix sugar and cinnamon in a bowl. Add bisquick baking mix. Cut in half cup of cold milk with a fork or pastry blender. Add enough remaining milk to form a soft dough that is not sticky. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface. Knead dough until smooth and elastic, about 6 to 8 minutes. Divide dough into 1 1/2-inch balls. Roll each ball between your hands to form a ball about 3/4 inch in diameter. Place balls on baking sheet, about 1 inch apart. Bake until lightly browned about 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Roll balls in melted butter or glaze with powdered sugar or icing.

The fruit should be washed, dried and peeled. The seeds should be removed from cherries and berries. Cut apples and pears into chunks and peel oranges and cut into segments. The fruit should be put into a large bowl. Cover with water and leave for a few hours. Meanwhile, make a syrup of 3/4 cup water and 1/3 cup white wine and add to fruit, along with a little vanilla essence. Add the potato flour and mix well until the fruit is thoroughly coated with the syrup. Pour the fruit into a greased dish or a greased roasting tin and leave for about one hour until it is cooked and the syrup is quite thick. When it is ready, put a little whipped cream on top and sprinkle with a few slivered almonds and serve hot or cold with freshly whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place chicken breasts into shallow bowlpour in breadcrumbs. Turn chicken to coat both sides with crumbs. Lay chicken in single layer on lightly greased baking sheet (or in a 9-inch square cake pan). Drizzle with melted butter and lemon wedge. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and herbs. Bake 30 minutes or until juices run clear when chicken is pierced with fork. Serve with lemon wedge. Makes 4 servings.

Prepare yellow cake mix and instant banana pudding mix as directed. Add eggs and stir. Stir in bananas. Add oil and water. Fold in walnuts. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 pan and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve with whipped cream.

In a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat, add oil. Cook ground beef until brown. Remove from heat. Add worcestershire sauce and seasonings. Stir until well blended.
