Stir in onions and cook until tender. Remove from heat. Stir in mushrooms. Fold ham slices into the beef mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Shape into four 1/3 lb. patties. Grill burgers until done. Serve on buns with the desired toppings. Serve with your favorite side dish.

Heat oil over medium heat in a large nonstick skillet. Add asparagus and cook until lightly browned and tender crispness is achieved. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Remove from heat and add soy sauce. Place natural almonds in a small bowl and crush with a fork. Place asparagus in a serving bowl and toss with crushed almonds.

Mix flour with salt in large bowlmake well in middle. Beat together in separate bowl eggs, water and vegetable oilpour into well in flour mixture. Stir with fork until combinedadd potatoes with mashed potato to well in dough mixturestir gently with fork until combined. Turn dough onto lightly greased surfaceknead dough for 5 minutes or until smooth. Divide dough into 4 equal piecesroll each into circle approximately 1/8-inch thickcut into 3-inch squaresarrange squares on greased baking sheetcover with clothlet rise for 45 minutes or until doubled in size. Preheat oil to 400f in large skilletfry perogies in oil for 4 minutes or until golden brown on both sidesdrain on paper towels.
Combine all salad ingredients in a large bowl. Stir in mayonnaise. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2-3 hours before serving. Taste for seasonings and adjust if necessary.

Bake shrimp in an oven at 400 degrees for 8 minutes. Warm tortilla chips in a 375 degree oven for 3 minutes. Place chips in a medium bowl. Add mayonnaise and mix well. Add cumin and stir. Layer with chilies, green onions and olives. Top with shrimp. Serve.

Combine water, stout, sugar and molasses in a large stock pot. Bring to boil. Stir in salt and black pepper. Remove from heat. Add sage leaves. Stir and cover with lid. Let stand until sage leaves are very soft. Add chops. Cover with lid. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 60 to 90 minutes or until chops are tender. Remove from pot. Transfer to serving platter. Drizzle with pan drippings. Sprinkle sage over chops. Serve immediately.

Combine mustard and maple syrup in a small bowl and stir to combine. Place salmon in a shallow baking dish and season both sides with salt and pepper and drizzle mustard maple mixture over salmon fillet and gently rub until evenly coated. In a small bowl combine the oil and the garlic and thyme and mix well and set aside. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Arrange spinach over the salmon fillets and sprinkle with the remaining salt and pepper. Place in the oven and bake until cooked through and the spinach is wilted and tender, about 20 minutes.

In a large skillet cook meat and seasoning. Stir in mushrooms and onion. Cook until vegetables are tender. Add tomato sauce and bring to a boil. Stir in cooked noodles and cheese. Cook until cheese is melted.

Place the rice in the rice cooker. Add the beef stock and let it cook for 10 minutes. Transfer the rice to a bowl. In a skillet cook the bacon and onion until tender. Add the garlic to the skillet. When the garlic is fragrant add the vegetables. Stir in the rice and soy sauce. Serve warm.

In a large mixing bowl, combine yellow cornmeal, all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Add eggs, milk, butter, and corn. Mix thoroughly. Heat skillet or griddle to medium-high heat. Drop by heaping tablespoons onto skillet or griddle. Cook 1 minute on each side. Serve hot.

Put the pork loin in the refrigerator and let it sit overnight covered in apple cider and salt and pepper. The next day cook the pork loin in butter in the same pot until done (about 1/2 hour) and then strain the apple cider from the pork and save it for another use. Melt the butter in the pot then add the onions and cook until tender (about 4 minutes) and then add the apple cider that was cooked out of the pork and cook until the mixture is heated through (about 4 minutes) then serve.

Mix sourdough starter with the butter. Add milk and stir until dissolved. Add the honey, salt, sunflower seeds, and stir until mixed. Add whole wheat flour and white bread flour. Mix until just combined. Form a ball. Place in a greased bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise until doubled. Punch down. Divide the dough into four parts. Form into loaves. Place on a greased baking sheet. Let rise until doubled. Bake at 425f until golden. Let cool before slicing.
Combine brown sugar and dry mustard in crock pot. Add prepared horseradish and cola and stir until blended. Add ham and cook on low for 8 hours or until tender. Serve hot.

Combine condensed soup, stewed tomatoes and milk in a large saucepan and bring to boil. Add rice and seasoning and stir in gently. Stir in shrimp and oysters and cook for about 2 minutes or until done. Remove from heat and add parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Wash and peel potatoes. Slice about 1/4 inch off the top of each potato so they sit flat. With the back of a knife or a spoon scrape out the potato insides. Place the potatoes on a cookie sheet and drizzle with the broth. Bake for one hour. While potatoes are cooking, cut the ends off the bulb of garlic. Peel the skins from the bulb and discard. Place the bulb in a large bowl and cover with water. Microwave on high for 6 minutes. Let cool. Peel off the outer skins of the bulb. Slice the garlic into small pieces and add to the potatoes. Stir in the sour cream and black pepper. Sprinkle with paprika. Place potatoes back in the oven for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven. Turn the oven off and let the potatoes sit in the oven with the door closed for at least two hours. After the two hours have passed remove the potatoes from the oven and cut into slices.

Put the chickpeas in a large bowl and pour boiling water over them and let soak for 12 hours or overnight. Drain the chickpeas and put them into a food processor. Add 2 tbsp of the olive oil and the garlic and process for about 30 seconds. Add the lemon juice and curry powder and process for another 30 seconds. Add the water and salt and process for 1 minute. Add the remaining 2 tbsp of olive oil and process until the hummus is very smooth. (If the hummus is too thick or not smooth enough, add more water or more olive oil.) Fold in the currants. Serve with crusty bread or vegetables.
Put all the ingredients into a mixing bowl. Whisk until smooth. Serve straight away or cover with cling film and refrigerate for up to 4 days.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a small bowl, combine ground beef and next 4 ingredients. In a large bowl, combine oatmeal, eggs, next 3 ingredients and ground beef mixture. Transfer to a 9x5-inch loaf pan. Bake in preheated oven until an instant read thermometer reads 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), about 45 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before serving.

Heat the oil and fry the onion and garlic until lightly browned and softened. Add mushrooms and peppers and cook for about a minute or until softened and fragrant. Add peas and tuna and stir for about a minute or until heated through and the peas are cooked. Add the soup and mix well to combine the flavours and heat through. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in the chopped fresh herbs and serve with the rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray an 8x8 baking dish with cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine the oats and wheat flour. In a larger bowl, combine the sugars, baking soda and cinnamon. Add the oat mixture and mix well. Stir in the jam. Fold in the butter. Pour into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown on top. Let cool on a wire rack. Cut into bars and serve. Store in an airtight container for up to one week.
In a small bowl combine cream cheese and mayonnaise and mix well. Stir in olives. Spread on celery. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve with crackers.

Place olive oil and garlic in a large pot and heat to medium. Add the meat. Brown for 5 minutes. Remove and discard garlic. Add the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until the meat is tender.

In a large saute pan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened. Add zucchini and cook until tender. Stir in the roasted peppers. Add chickpeas and stir in. Add salt and pepper. Add cooked couscous. Toss. Add lemon juice and basil. Toss until well combined. Serve over nicoise olives.

Season baby back ribs with kosher salt and black pepper. Place in instant pot. Add apple cider vinegar. Pour barbecue sauce on top. Cover with lid and seal. Set pressure to high and cook for 40 minutes. Let pressure release naturally. Serve with extra barbecue sauce.

Combine vinegar, brown sugar and tomato juice in a medium-large saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook for 3-5 minutes. Whisk in olive oil. Add the tomatoes and basil and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in feta. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Mix the egg whites with the salt and sugar in a large bowl until foamy and stiff peaks formadd the almonds and vanilla extract and fold in. Add the chocolate chips and fold in. Drop by spoonfuls onto the baking sheets. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) until the macaroons are golden brown, about 20 minutes per baking sheet.

Combine jello powder and water in large bowlstir until jello is dissolved. Add lemon juice. Fold in mandarin oranges and pineapple tidbits. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Meanwhile, mix orange sherbet and marshmallow in a small bowl. Fold in whipped topping. Fold orange sherbet mixture into jello mixture. Chill. Serve garnished with oranges.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Thoroughly coat frozen shrimp with olive oil and season with kosher salt and black pepper. Place in a baking dish and bake for 20 to 25 minutes. When shrimp is cooked and slightly browned remove from oven and place in a serving bowl. Whisk together all of the ingredients and serve with shrimp.

Cut the butter into the flour. Add the salt and sour cream. Add the blueberries. Put it all together and press it together in your hands to form a dough. Cut into 3 pieces. Roll each piece into a ball. Take the ball and press it with your fingers into a circle shape. Press each circle down a little bit. Cut the circles into triangles. Place the scones on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes.

Mix the dry mustard and vinegar in a small bowl and gradually whisk in the mustard oil. Add the salt and pepper and blend well. Add the egg yolk and whisk thoroughly, blending well after each addition. Add the Miracle Whip and stir until well blended and smooth.

Bake crescent rolls according to package directions. Cool completely. Unroll crescent rolls. Spread parmesan cheese on one side and dill weed on other side. Spread butter on parmesan cheese side. Roll crescent rolls up jelly roll style. Place crescent rolls seam side down in 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Spread cheese side up in baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 minutes.

Melt butter in a skillet on medium heat. Beat eggs with water and add to skillet. Cook until eggs are set on bottom and still runny. Top with crumbled bleu cheese and a dash of pepper. Sprinkle with fresh chopped chives. Add slices of green apple on top.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot over high heat. Add pasta and boil until al dente according to package directionsdrain. Return pasta to pot and add sauce and meatballstoss gently to coat well. Serve with Parmesan cheese if desired.
Add the lemon juice and honey to a pitcher. Fill pitcher 3/4 full with sparkling water. Stir well. Pour sparkling lemonade into citrus salt rimmed glasses. Garnish with lemon wedges.

Boil eggs until just set (1 minute less than your preferred time). Transfer to cold water to stop the cooking. Peel eggs and slice in half lengthwise. Remove yolk and mash with a fork. Add mayonnaise, sour cream, sun-dried tomato paste, shallots, hot pepper sauce, dijon mustard and salt & pepper to taste. Fill whites with yolk mixture. Garnish with sun-dried tomato slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place pork chops in a large shallow baking dish. Sprinkle with black pepper. Pour soup over pork chops. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until pork is tender. Top with sauerkraut and dumplings. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until dumplings are cooked through. Serves four.

Add olive oil to a crock pot. Add corn kernels and red bell pepper. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add chicken broth and baking potatoes. Add green onions. Stir. Cook on low for 6 hours. Add evaporated milk. Stir. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, combine margarine and both sugars. Beat in eggs, water, vanilla extract. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda. Stir flour mixture into egg mixture. Stir in oatmeal. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 2 1/2 dozen cookies.

In large non-stick skillet heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the capers to the heated oil. Add the rosemary to the skillet. Add the anchovies to the rosemary. Add the trout to the skillet. Cook the fish for 2-3 minutes per side. Add the lemon slices to the skillet. Add the white wine to the skillet. Cook the fish for another 2-3 minutes per side. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Cut pita breads lengthwise into wedges. Spread each wedge with about 1 tablespoon of cream cheesetop with cucumber cubes. Drizzle each wedge with Italian salad dressing mixsprinkle with lemon-pepper seasoning to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease an 8-inch pizza pan with cooking spray. In a bowl, combine corn muffin mix with water and mix until combined into a thick batter. Add meat and taco seasoning mix and mix until well combined. Spoon batter into prepared pizza pan and spread out evenly with back of spoon. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until cornbread is cooked through and golden brown. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before slicing and serving with sour cream and salsa.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Grease a 13x9 baking dish with butter. Melt the semi-sweet chocolate chips in a large saucepan over low heat. Pour the chocolate into a 13x9 baking dish. Whisk the half-and-half in a large bowl. Gradually whisk in the powdered sugar. Add the chocolate to the bowl. Whisk to combine. Bake for 15 minutes or until the top is set. Top the pudding with powdered sugar if desired.

Heat chipotle chiles with adobo in a small saucepan over medium heat until warmed through. Remove from heat and set aside. Place pork in large resealable food storage bag. Add chipotle chiles and adobo, garlic and allspice. Close bag. Turn bag to combine all the ingredients. Press out any air. Refrigerate at least 8 hours and up to 24 hours. Remove pork from bag and pat dry with paper towels. Preheat the broiler. Place pork in shallow baking dish. Broil about 4 inches from heat until browned about 10 minutes. Reduce heat and broil 10 minutes more. Serve warm.

Using a sharp knife, cut the top off the green onion. Remove the green end of the onion and any remaining white pith from the onion. Set aside. In a bowl combine the cream cheese and onion. In a medium bowl combine the jam and coconut. Stir to combine. Spread the jam mixture evenly over the cream cheese mixture. Sprinkle the shredded coconut evenly over the jam mixture. Serve immediately.

Peel potato and cut into small cubes. Boil potato cubes in a large pot of salted water for 15 minutes or until tender when pierced by a fork. Drain potato cubes and transfer them to a mixing bowl. Grind beef into small pieces in a food processor. Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Saute onion in oil for about 2 minutes, until onion is translucent. Add beef mixture to the potato cubes in the mixing bowl. Add the saffron and turmeric. Stir in eggs and mix well. Add the breadcrumbs and mix well. Fold in the onion mixture into the potato mixture in the bowl. Form potato mixture into 12 equal patties and place on a baking tray lined with parchment paper or a baking mat. Bake potato patties for about 30 minutes or until golden brown on the outside and tender when pierced by a fork on the inside. Remove from the pan and serve hot.
Boil sweet potatoes until tender. Drain and cool. Combine bacon and sweet potatoes. Add mayonnaise and mustard. Season with pepper and macadamia nuts. Fold in lettuce leaf. Serve cold.

Rinse chicken under cold water. Pat dry with paper towels. Place chicken in a resealable plastic bag with garlic cloves. Add 1/2 cup olive oilseal bag. Turn bag to coat chicken with oil. Refrigerate 24 hours. Discard garlic cloves. Bring chicken to room temperature 30 minutes before cooking. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Grill chicken 10 to 15 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Meanwhile, heat remaining oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in mustard. Gradually whisk in lemon juice. Remove from heatadd salt and pepper to taste. Grilled or broiled rosemary chicken is served with a rosemary sauce.

Make marinade by mixing all of the ingredients together. Pour marinade over chicken thighs and let sit at room temperature for 1 hour. In a large skillet, heat 1 tsp of cooking spray over medium heat. Sear chicken thighs on both sides until cooked through and juices run clear. Serve with lime wedge and green onion top.

Mix potato, shortening and water. Add flour, sugar, egg and yeast. Mix until soft dough forms. Turn onto floured surface. Knead until smooth and elastic (about 10 minutes). Shape dough into rollsplace in greased 9x13 baking pan. Cover with plastic wraprefrigerate until doubled in size. Punch down doughshape into 10 rolls (15x1 inch). Place rolls in greased 9x13 baking pancover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate until doubled in size. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 15 to 20 minutes or until done (test with toothpick). Brush with melted butter. (Can be made with pizza dough or bread dough.)

Fry the chopped onions in the butter until soft and translucent. Add the meat and fry until brown. Add the potatoes and stir in the flour. Add water and cook until the sauce thickens and the potatoes are soft. Season with salt and pepper and add the herbs. Serve with a garnish of finely chopped fresh mint.

Heat an outdoor grill to medium. Generously oil the grill grate. Grill hamburgers until browned on the first side. Remove to a platerepeat with the remaining burgers. Preheat broiler on high. Toast hamburger buns under the broiler until they are lightly golden. Brush the buns with water to moisten. Spread the top halves of each bun with brown sugar. Spread mustard on top of the hamburgers. Place the buns on top of the burgers. Place them under the broiler for 20 to 30 seconds or until the bottoms of the buns are golden. Cut the buns open and put the hamburgers inside. Serve.

Place the chicken breasts in a pan with a little of the oil and cover with a lid and cook gently in a pre-heated moderate oven for about 35 minutes or until cooked through. Meanwhile make the sauce by mixing together the mustard and peppercorns with the garlic and lemon juice and a little of the oil from the pan in which the chicken was cooked. Stir in the chives and then pour the sauce over the chicken breasts when they are cooked and allow the chicken and sauce to heat through before serving.

Slice bacon into 1-inch pieces. Drain well and crumble. Saute bacon over medium heat in large skillet until bacon is almost cooked. Add flour and stir until blended. Cook 2 minutes stirring constantly. Add green beans and bacon pieces. Cook 5 minutes until beans are crisp-tender. Stir in vinegar. Cook 5 minutes. Serve hot. Garnish with bacon bits.

In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic cloves and saut until golden brown about 1 minute. Add the shrimp and saut until pink about 1 to 2 minutes per side. Add the scallops and saut until golden brown about 2 minutes per side. Add the asparagus, sugar snap peas, lemon juice and wine to the pan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the cream to the panbring to boil. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer for 1 to 2 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Increase heat to highbring to boil. Remove pan from heatstir in the parsley. Spoon seafood over hot cooked pasta or rice.

In bread pan, add all dry ingredients except water and raisins. Cut butter into dry ingredients. In large bowl add water and raisins. Add to dry ingredients, mix well. Add raisins to dough, mix well. Put into bread pan. Let sit about 10 minutes till dough doubles in size. Bake at 325 for 50 minutes or until done. Let cool for 15 minutes before removing from pan. Cut into slices for serving or leave whole for sandwiches.
Add cherries to blender container and process until crushed. Add yogurt, milk, cocoa powder and honeyprocess until smooth. Divide between 2 glassestop with ice cubes if desired.

Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil. Salt water and add pasta. Cook until tender. Drain. Measure 1/2 cup butter into a small skillet and melt over medium heat. Add the egg yolk and cook until lightly browned. Add 1/2 cup cream and cook over low heat until thickened. Stir in 1 cup parmesan cheese and stir until melted. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Drain pasta and transfer to a serving dish. Stir in the alfredo sauce. Sprinkle with additional parmesan and a handful of fresh parsley. Serve.

Bring a medium-sized pot of water to a boil. Add broccoli floretsblanch until bright green but not softened (about 2 minutes). Remove from heat and drain. Transfer broccoli to a large bowl of ice water to cool. Drain again, then set aside. While broccoli cools, prepare sauce. Melt butter in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add garlic clovesaute until fragrant (about 1 minute). Add peppers and green onionssaute until softened (about 2 minutes). Add orange juicebring to a boil. Cook until reduced to about 1/2 cup (about 10 minutes). Add cornstarch mixturecook until thickened (about 1 minute). Add broccolitoss to coat with sauce. Serve immediately.

Season chicken with kosher salt and black pepper. Dip in ranch dressing. Roll chicken in buttermilk mixture and then roll in flour mixture (butter, bisquick). Place in single layer in greased baking dish and bake 20 minutes at 400 degrees or until golden brown. Serve hot.

Pour sweetened condensed milk into a large bowl. Add lemon juice, almond extract and cherry pie filling. Whisk until smooth. Pour mixture into a large dish or pan. Top with crushed pineapple. Freeze for at least two hours. Remove from freezer and allow to soften for about five minutes. Top with whipped topping. Serve.

Combine soy sauce and brown sugar in large saucepan over med-low heatstir until sugar dissolves. Bring to boil, stirring constantly. Boil 1 minute to dissolve peppercorns. Remove from heatadd butter and stir to combine. Combine olive oil with peppercorn mixture. Place steaks in shallow glass dishpour oil mixture over steaks. Cover tightly with plastic wraprefrigerate 1-2 days. Before cooking, remove steaks from dishdiscard oil mixture. Heat grill to high heatgrill steaks 10-12 minutes for rare or to desired doneness, turning occasionally. Baste steaks with glaze while cookingserve with lemon wedge. Makes 4 servings.

Mix graham cracker crumbs and butter together and press firmly in the bottom of a greased 9x9x2-inch pan. Melt chocolate chips with kahlua and brown sugar together until smooth. Spread over graham cracker layer and refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. In a large bowl beat together cream cheese and eggs until smooth and blended. Stir in vanilla and pour over chocolate layer. Refrigerate for at least two hours or until firm. Makes six barsserves eightcan be frozen.
Bring tea bags and boiling water to a boil. Remove from heat. Cool. Stir in sugar. Add ice cubes. Pour into two tall glasses. Garnish with lemon slices.

Clean the chicken pieces and pat dry. Rub the paprika on each piece of chicken and place them in the refrigerator for at least 24 hours or up to 4 days before using. Place the chicken on the rack of an aluminum sheet pan or on the rack of an aluminum roasting pan in the center of the oven. Bake the chicken until the juices run clear when the thickest part of the leg is pierced with the tip of a knife and the chicken is browned on top, 1 hour to 1 hour 10 minutes depending on the size of the chicken pieces. Meanwhile, heat the 1/4 cup of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until tender but not browned, about 5 minutes. Add the spinach in batches if necessary and saute until the spinach wilts, 1-2 minutes. Stir in the garlic and cook until fragrant but not browned, 30 seconds. Add the chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Cook until the spinach is very tender but not mushy

In a large pot over medium heat cook bacon until crispy. Remove bacon from pan. Add the beans to the pan. Stir in the beef broth. Cover pot. Simmer 1 hour. Stir in the onions and garlic. Add tomato sauce. Cover pot. Simmer an additional hour. Stir in the ham. Cover pot. Simmer 30 minutes. Stir in the bacon. Cover pot. Simmer 30 minutes. Add the tomato sauce. Cover pot. Simmer an additional hour. Remove from heat. Let cool. Transfer to a jar. Cover. Refrigerate. Makes 4 quarts. Serve cold.

For marinade, place the onion and garlic in a saucepan and cover with a little water. Cook for 5 minutes or until softened. Blend with the butter and set aside until cool. In a separate saucepan, bring the ketchup and vinegar to the boil, then add the lemon juice and worcestershire sauce, and boil for 2 minutes or until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the brown sugar and salt and simmer for 5 minutes or until the sauce is thick and slightly sticky. When the onion mixture is cool, add it with the ketchup and vinegar mixture. Add the chicken pieces and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight if possible. Heat the oil in a frying pan and cook the chicken for about 2 minutes on each side or until the meat is cooked through. Serve the chicken with the sauce.

In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Saute the onion and garlic for 3 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Add the barley and the soup and stir well to coat. Add the thyme and the salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the water and cook for 30 minutes more or until the barley is tender.

Heat oil in a wok over medium-high heat until a few drops of water splatter in the pan without sizzling or smoking. Add onion and garlic and stir-fry until fragrant and softened. Add kang kong and stir-fry for about a minute or until wilted and tender. Add chili pepper and stir-fry until fragrant and softened for a few seconds. Add water and soy sauce and stir-fry for about a minute or until kang kong is tender but retains some bite. Add basil leaves and stir-fry for a few seconds until wilted and fragrant. Add sesame seeds and stir-fry for about a minute or until seeds begin to brown and pop. Serve immediately with rice or as a side dish.
Mix pineapple juice, apples, raisins and sugar together. Place wooden sticks into applesauce mixture to make popsicles. Freeze for 3 hours or overnight before serving. Serve chilled.

Cook ground beef and diced green chilies until no longer pink. Drain grease. Mix in mayonnaise until well blended. Add water and stir until mixture is smooth. Stir in heavy cream and seasonings. Spoon into quiche dish and sprinkle with mexican blend cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or until set. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

Bring rice and 1 2/3 cups water to a boil. Reduce heatcover and cook 12 minutes or until tender. Drain and keep warm. Meanwhilecombine orange and lemon zest and juices, chicken bouillon granules and 1 1/2 cups water in small saucepanbring to a boil. Remove from the heatkeep warm. Drain and discard orange and lemon zest and juice mixture from riceadd to chicken bouillon mixture and stir until well blended. Cover and keep warm 5 minutes before serving. Top with green onions and serve with chicken or other meat of choice.

Roast red peppers under the broiler until charred and cool. Peel the charred skin from the red peppers and cut the red pepper flesh into strips. Place strips in a large bowl. Dice the feta cheese. Add the feta to the red pepper strips and toss to combine. Add the oil, oregano and jalapeno pepper. Stir to combine. Season with the sea salt and pepper. Serve with pita or crackers.

Crush wafers. Cream margarine, cream cheese until smooth. Blend in sugar. Add eggs, milk and vanilla. Blend well. Pour into crust. Bake for 20 minutes at 350. Sprinkle with macadamia nuts. Top with pineapple and kiwi. Serve chilled.

In a saucepan combine corn syrup and sugarbring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until sugar dissolves. Add soy sauceboil 2 minutes more stirring occasionally. Remove from heatstir in oil. Pour into a 9x13 inch pancool completely. Line 15x10x1 inch pan with wax paperspray paper with cooking sprayset aside. In a large bowl beat together butter and crispix cerealset aside. In another large bowl beat together egg whites until soft peaks form. Beat in soy sauce mixturefold in egg whites to crispix mixturestir in noripour into prepared panpress down lightly with your handscover with plastic wraprefrigerate 3 hours or overnight. Invert pan onto wax paperremove papercut into 1-inch squaresstore in an air tight container in refrigerator until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grate carrots. In a large bowl, combine grated carrots with dates, nuts, eggs, maple syrup, spices, and flour. Stir in water until the mixture is thick like a batter. Spoon batter into greased muffin tin cups. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes.

Cook udon noodles as directed on package. Drain noodles and rinse under cold water. Toss noodles with tamari, dark sesame oil, scallion, pea pods, red bell peppers, peanuts, sesame seeds. Toss with szechuan sauce. Serve.

Mix together lemon juice, lemon zest, salt and egg whites. Stir together light brown sugar and red pepper flakes. Stir into lemon mixture and pour over walnuts. Stir to coat and spread out on a sheet pan covered with foil to dry. Bake at 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) until the coating has hardened and the walnuts are crisp, about 25 minutes. Remove from the pan and toss with fresh rosemary leaves to garnish. Store in an air tight container.

Combine corn and cheeses. Heat oil over medium heat. Fry corn mixture until heated through and cheese is bubbly and golden brown. Add seasoning to taste. Serve with your favorite tortillas or crackers. Great for an after school snack or appetizer at your next party!

Melt shortening in the microwave or in a saucepan over very low heat until melted. Add graham wafer crumbs and stir well. Mix in sugar and cream cheese until mixture forms crumbly ball. Press half of the crumb mixture into the bottom of an 8-inch springform pan. Set aside. Beat together cream cheese, condensed milk and vanilla in large bowl. Add egg and beat until well combined. Stir in chocolate baking squares. Pour into crumb crust in pan and bake in preheated oven for 50 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool to room temperature. Pour cherry pie filling over top and refrigerate for 2 hours. Remove from pan. Sprinkle top of cheesecake with remaining graham wafer crumbs and serve. Makes 10 servings.

To prepare crusts, line a muffin tin with wonton wrappers and brush edges with oil. Fill with low-fat ricotta cheese, top with cherry pie filling and dust with powdered sugar. Refrigerate for 20 minutes before serving. Makes 12 tartlets.

Boil the noodles until tender. Drain and cool. Cut the green capsicum into thin strips and the red capsicum into half-moon shapes. Cut the spring onions into 1 cm lengths. Place the noodles in a large bowl. Add the green and red capsicums and spring onions. Add the oil and stir to coat the noodles. Add the garlic and the salt and mix together. Toss with the green onions and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix oat flour, oatmeal and salt. In large mixing bowl combine sugar and peanut butter. Add egg and vanilla extract. Stir to combine. Fold oat mixture into peanut butter mixture. Fold in raisins and bananas. Roll dough into balls and place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten dough balls and bake for 10 to 12 minutes.

Bring water to a boil and add orzo. Cook for about 10 minutes or until tender and drain well. Meanwhile, heat oil and cook garlic until it becomes golden brown, stirring occasionally. Add the zest and juice of the lemons and the black pepper and stir until fragrant and blended. Drain the pasta and toss it gently with the oil mixture and the parsley. Serve at once. Makes 4 servings.

Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a 4 quart pan. Add lentils and cook 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook covered 30 minutes. Add oregano and basil. Remove from heat and add salt and pepper to taste.

Soak garbanzo beans in water for 24 hours. Drain and add to a blender. Add olive oil and water and blend until smooth. Add lemon juice and blend until smooth. Add garlic cloves and blend until smooth. Add salt and blend. Add nutritional yeast and blend until smooth. Add sesame seeds and blend until smooth. Add tahini and cumin and blend until smooth.

Heat 1 tbsp. Butter in large nonstick skillet. Add onion & garlic powder. Saute over medium heat for 5-7 min. or until onion is tender. Stir in cheddar cheese. Cook for 2-3 minutes until cheese is melted. Top each tortilla with 1/3 cup onion mixture. Top each with 2 tbsp. roast beef. Roll tortillas up and place seam sides down in prepared pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 min. or until light golden brown. Serve with remaining cheddar cheese. Makes 6 servings.

Dip chicken pieces into seasoned flour. Place on a large plate. Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the chicken pieces in batches to the saucepan. Cook for 6-7 minutes on each side or until golden brown and cooked through. Remove from the pan with a slotted spoon to a paper towel-lined plate. Set aside. In a large saucepan, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the sour cream and mushroomsbring to a simmer. Stir in the remaining seasoned flourcook for 3 minutes. Add the sour cream mixture to the pan with the chicken. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in the paprika and cook for 30 seconds or until it dissolves. Stir in the reserved cooking liquid from the pan with the chicken until the sauce thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve with the cooked chicken on top of the sauce. Garnish with fresh parsley if desired.

Add 4 cups water to a large pot. Add 4 cups cranberries and 1 cup sugar. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until cranberries are soft and the liquid is reduced to 2 cups, 15 to 20 minutes. Strain liquid into a container or bottle through a fine sieve. Discard cranberries and their juice. Add 1 cup sugar and 1 cup vodka to the liquid and stir to dissolve the sugar. Transfer mixture to a glass or plastic container. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. This liqueur is also called "cranberry sauce". To serve, pour 1 to 2 tablespoons cranberry liqueur into a small glass and top with 1 ounce chilled champagne or sparkling wine and a cranberry half or 1 or 2 cherries.

Cut the dough in half, then roll out to the size of a piece of paper you might use to wrap a present. Spray a nonstick cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray and place the dough onto the cookie sheet. Sprinkle bacon and swiss cheese onto the dough. Mix together the eggs and onion powder. Pour the egg mixture onto the bacon and swiss cheese. Bake the dough in the oven for 10 minutes or until the dough is cooked through. Serve warm or cold. Yields 16 squares per serving.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and cook 5-7 minutes until softened. Add meatballs and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and apricots to skilletbring to simmer. Cook 2 minutes more. Add almonds and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes more. Stir in cilantro and serve over cooked rice or pasta.

Melt 2 Tbs. butter in a large skillet. Saute 1/4 cup minced shallots or scallions until tender. Stir in 1/3 cup minced mushrooms. Sprinkle with 1/2 tsp. flour. Add 3 Tbs. dry sherry. Simmer until thickened. Add 1/4 cup half & half. Stir in 3 Tbs. minced parsley. Toss with 30 scallops. Dust with 2 Tbs. flour. Saute in remaining butter until browned. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Peel turnips. Cut into quarters. Place on a sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil. Roast for 40 minutes or until tender. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Cut turnips into bite size pieces. In a large bowl combine turnips with sour cream and seasonings. Place mixture into a lightly greased baking dish. Bake at 375 degrees for 1 hour. Top with melted butter or light margarine. Serves 6.
Put ribs in slow cooker. Sprinkle with garlic salt and onion salt. Sprinkle with salt, oregano and lemon juice. Cook on low 6-8 hours or until tender. Add lemon pepper after 2 hours.

Peel potatoes and dice them into small pieces. Place in a large bowl. Add enough water to cover potatoes in water. Add white sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt to bowl. Stir together well with potatoes and place in slow cooker. Cover with lid and cook on low for about 2 hours or until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Transfer to a large baking dish and allow to cool to room temperature before covering with foil or plastic wrap and refrigerating until ready to eat. Before serving sprinkle with additional cinnamon if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine peanut butter, brown sugar, honey, light butter, vanilla extract and mix until well blended. Spread 1/3 of the peanut butter mixture evenly in the prepared pan. Sprinkle with half of the crispy rice cereal. Press with the back of a spoon to compact. Add 1/3 of the bran buds. Repeat layers once more. Press with the back of a spoon to compact. Press remaining 1/3 of the crispy rice cereal into the top. Cool completely before cutting. Store in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. In a small bowl, combine eggs and heavy creamset aside. In another small bowl, combine flour and baking powderset aside. In an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, beat together butter and sugar until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Add eggs and creambeat until well-combined, about 1 minute more. With mixer on low speed, add flour mixture in three batches until incorporated. Transfer to pastry-lined pie platescover loosely with plastic wrap and chill overnight (or up to 4 days). For topping, combine cheese, scallions, walnuts and butter in food processorpulse until blended and well-combined. Spread over chilled crustbake until golden-brown on top, about 45 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Beat egg whites and salt until frothy. Gradually add sugar, beating until soft peaks form. Add vanilla extract and beat until whites are shiny and very thick (this will take a few minutes). Add pecans and buttermix until pecans are evenly coated. Pour into greased cookie sheet and bake at 325f degrees for about 20 minutes or until cookies are lightly browned on top. Cool and store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a large bowl mix together stuffing mix and sour cream. Stuff each chicken breast with stuffing mixture and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

Mix cream cheese and swiss cheese together in a large bowl. Stir in mayonnaise and green onions and bacon. Spread on a serving platter. Cover and refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Garnish with paprika and parsley before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spray a shallow baking dish with cooking spray and set aside. In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, sauté onion and fennel in oil until tender, about 5 minutes. Transfer vegetables to the prepared baking dish. Place fish fillets on top of vegetables, skin side down. Bake until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 12 to 15 minutes. In the meantime, heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook until heated through, about 10 minutes. Increase heat to highcook until mixture thickens slightly. Sprinkle with pepper flakes and dill. Serve fish with vegetables on the side. Makes 4 servings.

In a saucepan combine the vinegar, soy sauce and water. Add sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until sugar dissolves. Add ginger and spices and cook until sauce thickens. Serve over meat and vegetables. Store in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.

Wash and scrub potatoes. Peel and cut into quarters. Place in a large bowl and toss with 2 tablespoons of the oil and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt. Place in a single layer in a large baking pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of the dried oregano. Pour 1/2 cup water into pan and bake at 400 degrees F for 20 minutes. Add 1/2 cup of the water and the lemon juice and bake for 10 minutes more. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of dried oregano and drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil. Bake for 5 more minutes.

Sauté zucchini and yellow squash with chopped onion in butter until tender. In a separate dish combine tomatoes with sugar, salt, pepper and oregano. Add vegetable mixture to tomato mixture and blend well. Pour into a greased baking dish and top with parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 35 minuets.

Mix creamy peanut butter with powdered ginger and seasonings in a small bowlspread mixture on both sides of chicken cutlets. Cover with corn flake crumbs and bake in a preheated 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven for 25 minutes or until golden brown and meat is cooked through.

Soak beans in water until soft. Drain. Rinse again. Combine with meat. Heat oil and lard together over medium heat. Add beans and meat. Add tomatoes and green onion. Simmer until liquid is gone. Add the rest of the spices. Cook another 10-15 minutes until sauce thickens. Serve.

Preheat oven to 225 degrees F (107 degrees C). Remove oven rack and place wire rack in bottom of oven. Coat an 8 quart slow cooker with cooking spray. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute 10 minutes. Add sirloin steaks and season with ground pepper and garlic salt. Cook 15 minutes until desired doneness. Remove steaks to cutting board. Cover and set aside. Stir broth and onion soup mix into oil in skillet. Cook until thickened. Pour mixture into slow cooker. Stir in tomatoes. Place sirloin steaks in slow cooker. Sprinkle with five-spice powder. Cover and cook 6 to 8 hours (or overnight). Transfer sirloin steaks to cutting board. Thinly slice across the grain. Serve on buns. Makes 8 servings.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute for about one minute. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add chicken and paprika and reduce heat. Cover and simmer until chicken is done, about 12 minutes. Pour off any liquid into another container and discard the onion and paprika. Heat cornstarch and water over medium heat until thickened and smooth. Add chicken mixture and simmer for about 3 minutes. Stir in sour cream and red pepper flakes and heat through. Serve chicken over rice with sauce on the side.

Melt 4 tablespoons of butter in a saucepan. Add chopped garlic. Stir in flour. Add milk and stir constantly until thickened. Season with salt and pepper. Add 1/4 cup grated Parmesan and 1/2 teaspoon seasoning salt. Stir until melted. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining butter and Parmesan. Serve over baked potato halves and top with additional Parmesan to taste.

Remove husks and silks from corn and place in a large pot of boiling water with 3 cups of cold water and a pinch of salt until corn is tender, about 15 minutes. Drain the corn and set aside. In a large saucepan melt 2 sticks of butter or margarine over medium heat. Stir in the half-and-half until completely combined. Add the corn to the saucepan and cook for 2 minutes. Serve hot with butter and salt to taste.

Boil potatoes in salted water until tenderabout 20 minutes. Drain potatoes and let cool. Slice potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop out flesh with a spoon. Mix potato flesh with bacon bits and rosemary leaves and place into a bowl. Add red onions and capers and toss with potato mixture. In a small bowl combine mayonnaise and minced garlicstir until well combined. Taste for seasonings and add salt and pepper if needed. Drizzle mayonnaise over potato mixture and stir until evenly coated with mayonnaise. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9 x 13-inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray and set aside. In a large bowl, cream together butter and icing sugar until well blended. Beat in eggs, one at a time. In a separate bowl, stir together flour, salt and rum. Stir into butter mixture alternately with the vanilla wafer crumbs (dough will be thick). Press dough mixture into prepared baking dish and bake for 15 minutes or until slightly puffed and golden brown. Cool completely on a wire rack and cut into squares. Melt chocolate and dip each square of dough into melted chocolate. Roll each square in crushed vanilla wafers to coat and place on a wire rack to set. Store in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week or in the freezer for up to 1 month.

Season both sides of steak with kosher salt and black pepper. Heat a large non-stick pan on medium heat for 1 minute and add the oil. Add steak and sear for about 4-5 minutes per side until desired doneness is reached and the outside is caramelized. Serve with your favorite side dish and enjoy!

Roll pizza crust into long log. Spread with spaghetti sauce. Sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan cheeses. Add pepperoni. Roll up. Cut into 1 inch slices. Arrange slices in greased 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 35 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve.

Remove corn from husks. Grill or broil corn until tender. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix butter and chile sauce. Set aside. In another small bowl, combine honey and garlic. Add salt to taste. Grill corn on a hot grill until slightly charred. Drizzle butter mixture on corn. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan or 10-cup mold. Mix flour, sugar, mayonnaise and orange juice in a medium-size bowl. Mix in 1 cup of whole berry sauce and orange rind. Combine milk and the remaining sauce. Stir into the flour mixture. Stir in eggs, then soda and vanilla. Fold in the remaining sauce. Pour into prepared pan. Bake 1 hour and 10 minutes to 1 hour and 20 minutes until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar. Store in refrigerator. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Mix dry onion soup mix, water and mushrooms together and place half of mixture on bottom of lightly greased 11 x 7 x 2-inch glass or ceramic dish. Arrange chops on top of mixture. Pour remaining mixture over chops. Cover and bake at 350 for 1 hour or until done. Serve with rice.

Combine soy sauce, hoisin sauce, garlic, cilantro, pepper flakes, honey and 2 tbsps oil in bowl. Whisk to mix well. Stir cornstarch into remaining 2 tbsps oil to make slurry. Brush wings with slurry to coat. Grill wings over medium-hot charcoal or gas grill until cooked through and lightly browned (about 3 minutes per side). Serve with sauce on side to drizzle over wings. Serves 6. Makes about 1 cup sauce.

Prepare all of your soup/stew ingredients according to your own recipe. Cook in pot or crockpot. Add pasta when nearly done cooking. Stir often to avoid sticking to the bottom of the pot or crockpot. Serve as your recipe calls for or enjoy it as is!
Layer wrap with mushrooms, onion and garlic. Top with pizza sauce and cheese. Sprinkle with sunflower seeds. Roll up and enjoy.

Sauté butter in large saucepan until melted. Add onions, garlic and chayote. Cook 3-4 minutes. Add zucchini and yellow squash. Cook 5 minutes more. Season to taste. Garnish each serving with chives or fresh cilantro.

In a medium pot over medium heat, bring 3 cups of water to a boil. Add olive oil and garlic cloves. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer 3 minutes or until garlic is lightly browned. Stir in green beans and simmer until beans are crisp tender, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

In a bowl beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gradually add sugar while whipping and beat until stiff and glossy. Add corn syrup and water. Whip until mixture is thick enough to hold a line drawn in it. Makes 2 cups.

Prepare cauliflower by removing the outer leaves. Cut cauliflower in half, then each half into small florets. Combine the florets with the olive oil. Mix in the seasoned bread crumbs. Mix in the parmesan. Combine the garlic salt and pepper with the cauliflower. Toss. Serve warm or refrigerate for later use.

Prepare the smoked turkey legs according to the package directions. Place the smoked turkey legs in a deep bowl. Toss the turkey with seasoning salt and barbecue sauce until the turkey is coated evenly with the seasoning and barbecue sauce. Bake the turkey legs at 375 degrees f for about 30 minutes or until the meat is tender and juicy and the skin is crisp and brown.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large bowl, cream shortening and sugars until light and fluffyadd eggs and vanilla and beat well. In a small bowl or in the bowl of a electric mixer with paddle attachment, combine flour, salt and baking soda. Add to sugar mixture and stir until just blended. Stir in rolled oatsstir in chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheetsbake in preheated oven for about 9 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

Add cubes to boiling water and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes. Add lentils and cook for about 20 minutes. Add more cubes if needed to maintain flavor. Serve with crusty bread.

Combine spaghetti sauce and salsa in a large pot. Add ground beef and cook until browned. Add italian turkey sausage and cook until browned. Stir in cream cheese and cook until melted. Add onion and cook until tender. Add oregano, and heat through. Serve with cooked spaghetti.

Cook hamburger in a skillet. Dont overcook. Cut into 1/4 inch thick slices and place on a cookie sheet in one layer. Place frozen french fries on top. Dont overcook the fries. Place cookie sheet in the oven and cook until the hamburger is done. Serve with ketchup and mustard. Makes a good snack or lunch.

Unwrap rolls. Brush with garlic butter mixture. Sprinkle with asiago cheese. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Place on large baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees F for about 12 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Yield: 6 servings.
Combine all in a salad bowlrefrigerate until serving timeserve in small salad bowls or individual ramekins for individual servingsgarnish with mint sprigs if desired.

Combine all of the marinade ingredients in a large bowl and mix thoroughly. Add the wings and toss in the marinade to coat them. Cover and refrigerate for at least several hours or up to overnight. Grill the wings on a medium heat for about 15 minutes or until browned and juices run clear when pierced with a fork. Serve with rice and stir-fried vegetables.

Brown 1 package of spam in 3 Tablespoons of oil. Drain and reserve the oil. Cook 1 lb. wide egg noodles in the reserved oil until al dente. Mix spaghetti sauce and soup together in a bowl. In a 9 x 13 pan layer spaghetti noodles, spam and sauce mixture. Sprinkle with grated Velveeta. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 to 50 minutes until hot.

Combine rice flour and gluten free baking powder in a large bowl. Make a well in the center. Pour in eggs and water. Mix well. Stir in water until a soft dough is formed. Turn dough out onto a floured board and knead gently. Roll out to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut out rounds with a biscuit cutter or a drinking glass. Brush rounds with egg white and roll in gluten free flour. Drop dumplings into a large pot of boiling water. Cook for about five minutes until they float. Remove from water with a slotted spoon and drain. Makes about twenty dumplings.

Heat the oil in a small nonreactive pot over high heat. Add the sambal oelek and stir with a wooden spoon to dissolve the sambal. Cook 1 minute more. Add the vinegar and salt and sugar and stir until the sugar dissolves. Add the garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant. Add the cornstarch and stir to dissolve. Cook 1 minute more. Add the water and cook until thickened. Set aside to cool.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease and flour two 9 inch round cake pans. In a large bowl, combine the cake mix, oil, pumpkin and 1 1/2 cups of water. Beat until smooth. In a separate bowl, beat eggs until fluffy. Gradually beat in the oil mixture. In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar and cinnamon. Sift flour into the cake batter. Fold in the flour mixture. Pour into the prepared pans. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pans 5 minutes. Remove from pans to cooling racks. Cool completely. Frost with the whipping cream cheese icing.
Prepare jell-o as directed. Cut fruit cocktail into chunks. In a large bowl, combine fruit cocktail chunks, cream cheese and whip. Serve in a large bowl. Garnish each serving with a dollop of whip.

Peel cucumbers. Remove seeds. Slice lengthwise into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Cut each slice into thin half-moons. Sprinkle cucumber slices with salt. Add sugar and vinegar to a large saucepan. Boil until sugar dissolves. Add pickling salt. Bring to a boil. Add cucumber slices. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 20 minutes. Drain in a colander. Rinse under cold running water. Pack cucumber slices in sterilized 1-quart jars. Add 1 teaspoon mustard seeds to each jar. Heat 1/2 cup water to boiling. Pour over mustard seeds. Add alum. Cover. Let stand 24 hours. Pack mustard seeds and alum with cucumber slices. Process 20 minutes in a boiling-water bath. Remove jars from bath. Let cool. Refrigerate. Makes 8 pints.

Combine eggs in a large pot and bring to a boil. Cook for 7 minutes. Remove eggs with a slotted spoon and cool. Drain water. Combine eggs with 1 cup of thin soy sauce and 1 cup of black soy sauce in a large bowl. Add garlic and cilantro and stir to mix. Stir in pork stew meat and marinate for 15 minutes. Drain. Place eggs in a small bowl and cover with thin soy sauce and black soy sauce mixture. Let marinate for 15 minutes at room temperature. Refrigerate up to 2 days. Serve cold with a sprinkling of black pepper.

Heat oil in large pot over medium heat and add the onion and celery. Cook until softened and transparent for about 5-7 minutes. Add the barley and cook for 1-2 minutes to coat the barley in the oil and onion mixture. Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Add kidney beans and potato and cook for 15 minutes or until barley is tender. Add herbs and salt and pepper to taste and cook for a few more minutes to allow flavors to develop.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large mixer bowl combine the cake mix and egg. Add water and stir to mix. Pour batter into 3 greased and floured 8x8 pans. Bake for 25 minutes or until wooden pick inserted into center comes out clean. While cake is baking combine the mango, butter and rum. Allow mango mixture to cool for about 15 minutes. Spread mango mixture evenly over cake. Cool cake for about 10 minutes and remove from pans. Place one layer on serving platter and spread with remaining mango mixture. Add remaining layers and spread with remaining mango mixture. Serve with whipped cream.

Blanch fish in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain. Pat fish dry. Combine all marinade ingredients in a bowl. Pour marinade over fish. Cover and marinate for 1 hour. Heat oil and saute garlic and ginger in a large saute pan until fragrant. Add fishsaute for about 3 minutes per side. Serve with rice. Garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place pie shells on a sheet pan in the oven for about 10 minutes to get them hot. Meanwhile, combine eggs and half-and-half. Whisk together until blended. Add salt and pepper. Stir in chives. Spread 1/4 cup half-and-half mixture into each pie shell. Top evenly with bacon. Cut each piece of jarlsberg into quarters. Lay each quarter flat on one side. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over the bacon. Top each pie shell with one quarter jarlsberg. Top each pie shell evenly with 1/4 cup half-and-half mixture. Place pie shells in oven. Bake for 45 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Place 3 cups of water in a 2 qt pan with 3 cups of chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add rice and cook for 15 minutes or until done. In another pan, add oil to 12 oz can of mushroom soup with mushroom stems and pieces. Saute in frying pan until tender. Mix water with soup in pan on stove until thickened slightly. Add milk to soup/milk mixture in pan on stove. Add onion soup mix to water/soup mixture in pan on stove. Add mushroom mixture to water/soup mixture in pan on stove. Add chicken to water/soup mixture in pan on stove. Simmer for 20 minutes or until chicken is done. Serve chicken over rice.

Stir together sugar and brown sugar. In a separate bowl stir together milk, cream, egg yolks. Heat sugar mixture until it boils. Remove from heat and add milk mixture. Stir until smooth. Pour into 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Place dish in a large pan of water. Fill pan with water to come halfway up sides of dish. Cover dish with foil and place in oven. Bake for 40 minutes or until custard is set. Cool completely. Meanwhile prepare topping. Mix together brown sugar, sugar, cocoa powder. Melt butter in a small saucepan. Stir together brown sugar mixture, butter mixture. Pour over custard. Bake for 15 minutes or until topping is set. Serve warm with ice cream.
Mix all together and use for salads, vegetables or any dish you like to flavor.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in marshmallows and popcorn. Heat mixture until marshmallows are melted and combined with the popcorn. Remove from heat. Stir in jello gelatin until completely dissolved. Stir in food coloring. Spoon mixture into molds. Refrigerate until firm. Serve cold.

Heat the bacon and onion together in a skillet. Set aside. Dip the liver in the flour. Heat the remaining bacon fat in the skillet. Add the liver and saute until lightly browned on all sides. Remove the liver to the onions and bacon. Stir together the wine vinegar and sour cream. Pour it over the liver and onions and heat to desired temperature. Stir the sugar and salt together and add it to the liver mixture. Heat through. Serve warm with a slice of toast.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray an 8x8x2-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Cut a piece of waxed paper to fit the baking pan. Cut a piece of aluminum foil the same size as the baking pan. Place the waxed paper on the bottom of the pan. Spray the waxed paper. Lay the aluminum foil over the waxed paper. Cut a piece of cheese into squares about 1 inch by 1 inch. Lay a tortilla chip across the cheese. Spray each chip. Place the cheese-chips in the baking pan. Sprinkle the corn kernels over the chips. Make sure the corn kernels are evenly distributed on each chip. Cut a piece of waxed paper the same size as the baking pan. Place it over the corn kernels. Spray the waxed paper. Lay the aluminum foil over the waxed paper. Cut the egg in half lengthwise. Place the egg halves on top of the waxed paper. Sprink

Cover ribs with water. Add ketchup, worcestershire sauce, chili powder, onion powder and hot sauce. Bring to a boil. Cover ribs. Put ribs in baking pan. Bake at 350f for about 2 hours or until tender. Serve.

Cut the lemon into thin slices and the zest from the lemon into small pieces and set aside. In a large bowl beat the flour, sugar, salt and cinnamon with a fork until combined. In a medium bowl beat the eggs and milk with a fork until well combined and add the vanilla extract. Add the egg mixture and beat until smooth. In a medium bowl combine the bread cubes with the lemon slices and zest. Dip each piece of bread in the egg mixture and coat with the bread and lemon mixture. In a large skillet melt the butter and heat over medium heat. Add the bread mixture in the skillet and cook over medium heat until both sides of the bread are golden brown and the lemon mixture is bubbly. Remove the bread and place it onto a plate and repeat with the remaining pieces of bread and lemon mixture. Serve warm with maple syrup.

Prepare an ice water bath and have ready an ungreased baking sheet. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment beat the egg whites on high speed until stiff peaks form. With the mixer on low speed gradually add the brown sugar and vanilla extract. Fold in the pecans. Using a rubber spatula spread the meringue mixture onto the baking sheet. Using your fingers spread the mixture in an even layer. Bake at 350 degrees for 65 minutes. Turn off the oven and allow the meringue cookies to remain in the oven for 2 hours. Remove from the oven and allow the cookies to cool completely. Remove from the baking sheet and transfer the cookies to an airtight container. Allow the cookies to come to room temperature before serving.

In a food processor, combine the cottage cheese and potatoes. In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg, sugar and flour. Add the egg mixture to the cottage cheese-potato mixture and stir to combine. Add the sour cream and the raisins. Form the mixture into 4 small patties. Place the patties on an ungreased baking sheet and brush the tops with egg. Bake for 25 minutes until firm and golden brown. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan, melt butter over low heat. Stir in flour until blended. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Gradually add beef consomme and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in prepared mustard, wine and Worcestershire. Bring to a boil. Cook for 5 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in green onions.

Preheat oven to 350. Line an 11x7x2-inch pan with parchment paper. Lightly grease with butter. Place 6 ladyfingers into pan. Drizzle espresso over ladyfingers. Beat 1/2 cup sugar with 1/2 cup mascarpone until smooth. Stir in 1/2 cup marsala and 1/4 cup espresso. Fold in 1/2 cup mascarpone. Layer 1/2 cup ladyfingers and 1/2 cup mascarpone mixture. Repeat layering until pan is full. Drizzle 1/2 cup espresso over top. Drizzle 1/4 cup mascarpone over top. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon chocolate and 1 teaspoon bittersweet chocolate. Refrigerate 3 hours before serving. Bring 1/2 cup espresso and 1/4 cup mascarpone to boil in saucepan. Remove from heat. Stir in 1/4 cup sugar. Cool. Dri

Pierce sweet potatoes a few times with a knife. Place on a baking sheet in the microwave for about 10 minutes on high power. Let cool for a few minutes before removing the skins. Cut potatoes into cubes. In a large bowl mix extra virgin olive oil and honey. Add salt, ginger, vinegar, orange marmalade and pepper. Whisk until well blended. Add potatoes and toss until coated evenly in glaze. Arrange potatoes on a baking sheet in a single layer, making sure each piece is well coated in glaze. Bake for 15 minutes in the pre-heated oven at 400°F. Check the potatoes after 10 minutes, stirring them gently to ensure they brown evenly and don't stick together. If you'd like them crispier, bake them for another 5 minutes. Remove from the oven when potatoes are browned, crisp and glazed evenly.

Season the ground beef and roll it into 1/2 inch balls. Place on baking sheet and bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes. Place the cheese on the bottom of the crescent rolls and top with the beef and french-fried onions. Roll the crescent rolls up and place on baking sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes at 350 degrees F until the crescent rolls are golden brown. Serve hot.
Put bologna slices on 1 slice of bread. Place egg slices on other slice of bread. Place bologna slices on top of egg slices on the bread. Top with gherkins and mayonnaise.

Prepare chocolate cake mix according to package directions. Grease a 9x13 pan with butter. Bake as directed. Allow to cool. Frost as directed on package. Place 1 tbsp. cherry pie filling in the center of cake. Place another cake layer over pie filling. Repeat with 2 more layers. Frost top of cake. Sprinkle with almonds.

Peel and chop sweet potatoes and steam until tender. Set aside. In a medium saucepan melt the butter. Stir in the sweet potatoes and add the water. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Add salt and cinnamon. Mash until smooth and creamy. Add the honey. Stir well and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Cook egg noodles according to package directions and drain. Meanwhile, brown ground beef in large skilletdrain fat and set aside. Saute celery and onion in skilletadd to beef with seasonings and brown for 2 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and heat to boilingreduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Pour into a lightly greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish and bake for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly.

Wash the rind well in warm water to remove dirt. Rinse again with cold water and pat dry with a clean cloth or paper towels. Place the watermelon rind in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally until softened, about 5 minutes. Drain in a colander and transfer to a bowl. Add the vinegar, sugar and salt to the pan, bring to a boil over medium heat until the sugar dissolves completely. Pour the hot liquid over the watermelon rind, being careful not to break the rind or the pickles will fall apart. Let cool for 15 minutes, then place the pickles in a large jar. Cover the jar with a tight fitting lid or plastic wrap and let the pickles stand for 1 day before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Season fish with salt and pepper to taste. Cook fish for 3-4 minutes per side. Serve with the olives and cherry tomatoes. Serves 6.

Cut the tenderloins into 1 inch pieces. Sprinkle with garlic powder, paprika and salt. Place in a shallow baking pan. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add the garlic, onion, tomatoes and wine. Cook over medium high heat for 3 minutes. Stir in the chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer. Cook for 4 minutes. Pour the sauce over the tenderloins. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until the sauce is bubbly. Serve with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees C (350 degrees F). Line baking trays with baking paper and set aside. In a medium-sized mixing bowl, cream butter, sugar together until light and fluffy. Add vanilla extract and mix through. Gradually add the eggs one at a time until well combined. Add plain flour, self-raising flour and mix until well combined. Stir through white chocolate chips and desiccated coconut. Divide dough into two equal parts and shape each part into a log on your baking trays. Flatten each log slightly with your hand. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Leave cookies on tray for 5 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Heat oil in a frying pan. Cook the onions for a minute or two until softened. Add the capsicum and cook for about three minutes. Add the cornflour mixed with a little of the stock. Stir constantly until the sauce thickens. Season with mustard and cook for another minute or two. Add the stock and bring to the boil. Add the tomatoes and cook for a minute. Add the cooked chicken. Remove from the heat. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve with rice or noodles. Serves four.

Cut off stems of brussels sprouts, leaving about 1/4 inch attached. Cut off bottoms of brussels sprouts. Cut each brussels sprout in half. Bring water to boil. Add brussels sprouts and cook until tender. Drain. Add brussels sprouts and 3/4 cup of the heavy cream in food processor. Puree until smooth. Add the remaining heavy cream. Season with salt and nutmeg. Transfer to a bowl. Cover. Refrigerate. Brussels sprouts can also be cooked in olive oil with lemon juice.

Add all crust ingredients to medium-sized bowl and mix well. Press crust mixture into bottom of 9-inch springform pan (9 inches diameter). Refrigerate at least 30 minutes and up to 24 hours or until firm enough to hold shape of pan without crumbling. Meanwhile, add gelatin and lime juice to boiling waterstir until gelatin dissolves and remove from heatstir in half-and-half and cream cheese until well blended. Add graham cracker crust mixture to cheesecake mixture and stir until blended. Pour mixture into prepared crust and refrigerate at least 1 hour or until firm enough to cut easily. Cover and refrigerate at least 6 hours or until thoroughly chilled. Remove cheesecake from pan and discard crust. Serve with lime wedge and whipped cream.
In large crock pot combine the hamburger, salsa and sour cream. Cook on low heat for 3 hours. Serve with tortilla chips.
In a 2 quart casserole dish combine the chicken and stuffing mix. Sprinkle with the soup and cheese. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Cut carrot into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Dice onions. Slice garlic cloves. Combine with carrot rounds on a sheet pan. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Toss with pickled jalapenos. Drizzle olive oil and white wine vinegar into pantoss to coat. Cover pan and marinate for 1 hour at room temperature or 1/2 hour in the refrigerator before serving. Toss with oregano and bay leaves before serving. Makes 12 servings.

Cut cod fillets in half. Place on plate. Pour lemon juice and water over each half. Sprinkle with paprika. Cover with plastic wrap. Microwave on high for three minutes. Let stand for one minute. Remove plastic wrap. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper and dot with butter. Cover with plastic wrap. Microwave on high for another three minutes. Remove plastic wrap. Cover with foil and microwave for one minute. Let stand for one minute. Dot with more butter. Cover with foil. Microwave on high for three minutes. Let stand for one minute. Turn fish over and microwave on high for three more minutes. Let stand for one minute. Serve.

Slice rye bread into 1-inch rounds. Brush with 1 tablespoon of the thousand island dressing. Place rounds on an ungreased baking sheet. Spread 1 slice of swiss cheese on each round. Top each cheese slice with 1/4 cup of the corned beef. Top each corned beef slice with 2 tablespoons of the thousand island dressing. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375. Lightly grease 13x9 inch baking dish. In bowl combine hash browns and cheese. In a small bowl combine soup and milk. Add cheese mixture and stir well. Transfer to prepared baking dish. Top with onion and cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with garlic powder and salt and black pepper. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In a large mixing bowl combine all ingredients. Stir until blended. Form into 6 round burgers. Place on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes. Serve on a toasted roll with your favorite condiments.

Coat chicken with Ranch dressingadd hot sauce if desired. Spread corn flake crumbs on cookie sheet. Dip chicken into corn flake crumbs and place on cookie sheet. Spread corn flake crumbs on cookie sheet as needed. Bake at 400 degrees for about 15 minutes or until chicken is done.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Brown ground beef in skillet. Drain fat. Mix all other ingredients together. Transfer mixture to a 2 quart baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes.

Brown hamburger meatdrain excess fat. Mix together all of the sauce ingredients. Spread sauce over bread slices. Top with hamburger meatspread bacon evenly over burger. Top with mushrooms and cheese. Wrap burger tightly in foil. Bake at 350 degrees f for 15 minutesremove from foil for another 5 minutes to brown top of burger rolls. Serve with au jus for dipping. Makes 3 servings. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------.

Bring orange juice, honey, ginger to a simmer. Add broccoli florets. Simmer until tender. Stir in cornstarch slurry. Simmer until thickened. Season with lemon juice. Drizzle with sesame oil. Top with sesame seeds.

Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about another minute. Add jalapeno and cook until softened, about another minute. Stir in brown rice and cook for another minute until the rice is lightly coated in oil and has separated from each other a bit. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender and water has been absorbed, about 35 minutes. Stir in tomato and ancho chile powder and season with salt to taste. Transfer mixture to a large baking dish and bake for about an hour or until rice is tender and lightly browned, stirring every 15 minutes or so. Let rest for about 5 minutes before serving. Serve warm or at room temperature with any desired garnish or accompaniments.

Heat the oil in a large skillet. Cook the beef and onion soup mix until the beef is tender. Add frozen vegetables. Cook for 10 minutes. Pour in the juice. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.

Put beans, garbanzo beans, tahini paste, garlic cloves, lime juice, water, extra virgin oil, sun-dried tomato, roasted red pepper, fresh basil leaves and cumin in blender and blend for a few minutes until it reaches a creamy consistency. Serve with fresh vegetables for dipping.

Cook lentils and water in a medium pot for 20-25 minutes or until tender. Add carrots and cook an additional 2 minutes or until carrots are softened. Stir miso and ginger into the lentil mixture and cook an additional 2 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Clean mushrooms. Dry with paper towel. In a large skillet brown mushrooms in butter over medium heat. Add sour cream. Sprinkle with flour. Stir. Add salt and pepper. Add dill weed. Cook 5 minutes or until thickened. Serve with dinner or as a side dish.
Remove seeds from papayas. Add to blender with water. Blend until smooth. Add lemon juice. Blend again until smooth. Add water until it reaches desired thickness. Add sugar to taste.

Combine the butter, cream cheese and milk in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heatstir in the sugar, vanilla and flour until smooth. Drop by spoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for about 12 minutes or until golden brown. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

Pierce potatoes several times with a fork. Place in microwave-safe bowl. Microwave 13-15 minutes. Let cool 10 minutes. Scoop out potatoes. In food processor or blender combine cream cheese& butter. Add sour cream and dressing mix. Mix until smooth. Fold in potatoes. Reheat in microwave until hot. Top with additional cream cheese mixture& chopped chives.

To prepare the fennel, trim the leaves off and slice the bulb thinly lengthwise (you can also slice the bulb crosswise). Transfer the slices to a bowl and drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Toss until well coated and spread out on a baking sheet. Roast at 450 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until tender. In a small skillet over medium heat, heat the oil with the onion and garlic and cook until the onion is soft and translucent about 10 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook until they begin to break down and release their juices. Add the white wine and simmer until reduced by half. Add the roasted fennel and the fennel fronds and cook for about 5 minutes or until the fennel is heated through. Sprinkle with the thyme and sage and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Saute onion in oil for about 10 minutes. Add paprika and salt and pepper to taste. Add water and cook until rice is cooked through. Add beans and stir until beans are heated through. Serve hot.

In a large stock pot, combine water, cinnamon sticks, bay leaves and cloves. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to a low simmer. Simmer for 2 hours. Remove the cinnamon sticks and bay leaves. Place the citrus in a blender and puree until smooth. Add the puree to the stock pot. Strain through a fine mesh strainer and pour into a clean container. Let the stock cool completely and store in the refrigerator for up to one month. Use as you would regular chicken stock.

Slice banana into 2 thicknesses. Place 1 layer of cookies under each banana slice. Drizzle vanilla pudding over each stack. Top each stack with 1 cup Cool Whip. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Serve with additional whipped topping if desired.

Cut apples into quarters. Peel and core clementines. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine apples, clementines, rice vinegar, brown sugar, lemon juice, zest and cinnamon. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cook 30 minutes. Mash apples. Cook 10 minutes more. Transfer mixture to a large bowl. Stir in garlic. Add more cinnamon as desired. Let cool. Serve with pork. Store in refrigerator.

Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface and cut into desired size pieces. Use a fork or sharp knife to poke holes in the dough. Place the dough on a parchment-lined baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the baking sheet and cool on a wire rack. In a large bowl, combine butter and cheese and mix with a hand mixer until smooth. Stir in the garlic and seasonings until well combined. Spoon the cheese mixture into a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip and pipe the mixture into the biscuits. Top each with additional Parmesan cheese and serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 275 degrees. Coat a 13 x 9 inch pan with cooking spray and set aside. In a large bowl, combine shredded cereal, walnuts, salt and honey. Mix in dried fruit and vanilla extract. Sprinkle with cinnamon and mix well. Transfer mixture to prepared pan. Bake until golden brown and crunchy, stirring every 10 minutes or so, about 45 minutes. Cool for about 1 hour before breaking up and serving.

Remove rind from feta. Place feta in a single layer in a glass baking dish. Brush top of feta with 2 tbsp. oil. Sprinkle with 1 tbsp. dried greek oregano. Season with freshly ground black pepper to taste. Bake uncovered in a 350 degree preheated oven for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Place on serving platter. Cut feta into 1-2 inch pieces. Serve with warm pita bread.

Clean the chicken and remove all visible fat. Place in a large dish. Combine mayonnaise, soup and milk in a blender and blend until smooth. Pour over chicken. Combine the cracker crumbs and almonds. Pour over the top of the chicken mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least 24 hours. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Bake uncovered for about 1 hour or until tender.
