Combine the potato chips, eggs and salt in a bowl and beat until blended. Pour over the top of the casserole. Bake for 15 minutes or until the topping is set. Let stand for about ten minutes before serving. Serve with green beans.

Fill a large bowl with water and add enough ice cubes to make the water cold. Submerge the asparagus in the water and let sit for 5 minutes. Drain well. Toss the asparagus with 1/4 cup olive oil and a pinch of coarse salt and black pepper. Place the asparagus in a serving dish and top with the tomatoes, scallions and parsley. Whisk together the remaining 1/4 cup olive oil and the red wine vinegar. Drizzle the vinaigrette over the asparagus.

Rub each orange with half of the olive oil, half of the white wine vinegar and some salt and pepper. Place oranges on top of lettuce leaves and sprinkle with remaining olive oil and vinegar. Place avocado on top of orange slices. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9-inch square baking pan. Peel clementines. Cut into 1/4-inch slices. Toss with sugar. Stir in almonds. Transfer to baking pan. In a separate bowl combine flour with baking powder. In a large bowl beat eggs with a fork. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Pour over clementines. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Serve warm or chilled. Makes 16 servings.
Boil new potatoes until tender. Drain them and transfer them to a large mixing bowl. Add butter and basil. Mash with a potato masher. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.
Blend all ingredients together in blender until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve.

Cut the top of the can off of the crushed pineapple and drain it well. Put it into a mixing bowl. Add the sugar and cinnamon. Mix until well blended. Spray an 8"x8" pan with non stick cooking spray. Cut the biscuit dough into small squares and put them into the pan. Cover with the pineapple mixture. Bake at 400 degrees for about 40 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and cool for about 5 minutes. Then cut into squares.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees F). Grease a 15 x 10 x 1-inch jelly roll pan with butter or cooking spray. In a medium saucepan over low heat, melt the butter with the brown sugar until smooth. Remove from the heatcool for 5 minutes. Beat the eggs until they are light and fluffy. Stir together the melted butter with the brown sugar until well combined. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, walnuts and saltset aside. In a large mixing bowl beat the egg with the brown sugar mixture until smoothgradually beat in the flour mixture. Stir in the chopped walnuts. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 30-35 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rackcut into 48 brownies.

Beat the whipping cream and yogurt together in a large bowl. Add the sugar and lemon juice. Mix well. Pour into a lidded container. Chill for several hours. Then add the yellow food coloring and the lemon peel. Store in refrigerator.

Combine gluten-free flour and salt in a mixing bowl. Set aside. In a separate bowl beat together butter, puree, white vinegar and milk. Fold wet mixture into flour mixture. Transfer to lined muffin tins or a greased cake pan. Bake in a preheated oven of 180 degrees C or gas mark 4 for 20-30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Makes 12 muffins or 1 large cake.

In a large saucepan, heat the butter over medium-low heat and add the garlic and zucchini, cooking until softened about five minutes. Add the carrot and onion and cook until softened, about five minutes. Add the broccoli and cook until crisp-tender and the vegetables are starting to turn golden about ten minutes. Drain off any liquid in the pan and reserve it for later. Add the broth and cook for one minute. Add the flour and stir until smooth. Cook for about three minutes or until the roux is light brown and no longer gritty in texture. Add the milk and bring to a boil. Cook for about three minutes or until the soup thickens slightly. Add the cheese and cook until it melts into the soup about two minutes. Stir in the cooked vegetables and serve immediately. Serve with sliced toasted bread and extra cheese for dipping!

Beat eggs and add skim milk and whisk. Then add flour and sugar and whisk until smooth. Add butter and whisk to make sure it is all incorporated. Cook pancakes and top with strawberries and whipped cream.

In a large soup pot over medium heat melt the butter. Add flour and cook for 1 minute. Whisk in the chicken broth, then add the chicken, carrots, celery, yellow onion, parsley and garlic. Bring it to a boil then reduce heat and simmer uncovered for about an hour until the chicken is falling off the bone. Strain the soup through a colander or sieve into the pot. Using an immersion blender or in batches in a blender purée the soup until smooth. Add more flour if needed. Taste for seasoning and adjust salt and pepper if needed. Serve hot.
Mix the flour with the dijon and lemon juice. Dip the shrimp in the egg and then in the flour mixture. Saute in butter until golden. Add the jalapeno and chives. Serve immediately.

Prepare pudding according to package directions, omitting vanilla. Stir in water and gelatinrefrigerate until set. Top with strawberries. Makes 8 servings. Nutrition Facts Per Serving (1/8 of recipe): Calories: 226 Fat: 2g Carbohydrate: 26g Fiber: 2g Protein: 6g
In a large bowl combine all ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Stir well. Serve over lettuce.

Bring water to the boil. Add 2 tablespoons of white pearl onions and 1 tablespoon honey. Simmer for 10 minutes. Set aside. Preheat grill to medium high heat. Mix together oil and papaya. Brush each piece of pineapple with 2 teaspoons of oil. Thread pineapple onto skewers. Grill for 2 to 3 minutes per side. Brush pineapple with remaining oil. Grill for 1 to 2 minutes per side. Place green peppers on skewers. Grill for 2 minutes per side. Remove all kabobs from heat. Drain pineapple and set aside. Add lime juice to white pearl onions and simmer for 30 seconds. Set aside. Cut each piece of chicken breast into 1/2 inch wide strips. Thread onto 16 skewers. Grill for 2 to 3 minutes per side. Serve kabobs over rice. Top with pineapple and white pearl onion salsa. Sprinkle with cilantro.
Peel and cut into pieces. Coat potato pieces in honey. Heat a skillet and coat the pan in oil. Place the sweet potato pieces in the pan and fry for 5 minutes.

Mix vinegar and worcestershire sauce. Marinate pork in mixture for at least one hour. Grill to desired temperature. Sprinkle salt and pepper on the chops before grilling. Sprinkle the rosemary on the top of the pork and grill until medium doneness.

Heat oil in large saucepan and fry bacon until golden brown. Drain on paper towel and set aside on plate. Cook zucchini and capsicum until tender in same pan adding garlic and cooking on medium heat for 4 minutes or until golden brown. Stir in grated cheese and bacon. Add eggs and stir gently until lightly scrambled. Add bacon and vegetables back into the pan. Pour mixture into pie dish and bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes or until golden brown and set.

Spread butter on both sides of bread. Place slices of cheese and ham on each slice of bread. Press sandwiches together using a sandwich press. Or place sandwiches between two sheets of wax paper and press with a heavy cast iron skillet or other heavy object. (Alternative suggestion: spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on both sides of bread before adding cheese and ham. )

Scrub potatoes under cold running water. Pat dry with paper towels. Using a sharp knife, cut each potato in half lengthwise. Cut each half into 1/2-inch thick slices. Place slices in a large bowl. Add milk and stir to coat. Sprinkle with paprika and season with salt. Toss to coat evenly. Arrange potato slices in a single layer on a foil-lined baking sheet. Drizzle with oil and sprinkle with peppercorns. Bake, stirring potatoes occasionally, until tender and golden brown, about 1 hour. Let potatoes stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve with hot sauce.
Mix egg with rice. Add sugar and cinnamon. Stir well. Add milk. Stir well. Pour into mold and refrigerate overnight. To serve, unmold and cut in wedges. Serve with berries.

Wash and dry the potatoes. Pierce with a fork. Bake in a 450 degree F oven for 1 hour. (Cool in the oven with the door slightly open.) Peel the potatoes and place them in a food processor. Add the melted butter, horseradish, heavy cream and salt. Puree until the mixture is smooth. Transfer the mashed potatoes to a bowl. Let cool completely. Taste and adjust the seasoning with more horseradish if desired. Keep in the fridge for up to 3 days. Before serving, reheat the mashed potatoes to desired temperature. Serve with steamed broccoli or grilled steak. (I like to serve with a drizzle of horseradish sauce on top.)

Cream butter and sugar. Add egg and beat well. In a separate bowl stir together flour and dry ingredients. Add to butter mixture. Add honey and stir until combined. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until golden.

Pour half of the blueberries into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle half of the cinnamon and half of the brown sugar over the berries. Repeat with the peaches and remaining cinnamon and brown sugar. Place the remaining blueberries and peaches in a large bowl and toss with the cornstarch. Pour the cornstarch mixture over the berries and peaches. Dot with the butter and bake for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown.
In a large bowl combine cream cheese and spinach. Stir in the pepper cheese and garlic powder. Serve with chips or crackers. Makes 8 cups4 servings.

Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the carrots, zucchini, celery, onion and tomatoes. Cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables begin to soften. Add the stock, lentils and bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover the pot and cook 15-20 minutes until the lentils are tender and the soup is richly flavored. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer the soup to a food processor or blender and puree until smooth. Return the soup to the pot. Add the parsley and lemon juice to taste. Serve immediately.

Pour vodka and rum into a shaker filled with ice. Shake and pour into a glass filled with ice. Pour cointreau and blue curacao over the back of a spoon into the glass and swirl around for about ten seconds. Fill with pineapple juice and stir. Garnish with orange slice and lime.

In a large soup pot melt butter. Add onions and garlic. Cook until onions are soft and translucent. Add potatoes and cook for another minute. Add milk and broth. Cook over medium heat for about 10-12 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Puree soup until smooth. Add cream and bring back to a boil. Add endive and cook until heated through. Season with salt and pepper and garnish with chives and dill. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 425f degrees. Put nuts in a 9x13 baking dish. In a mixing bowl combine olive oil with garlic salt. Pour mixture over nuts. Mix chili seasoning and hot chili powder into mixture. Cover with tin foil. Bake for 20 minutes, uncover and bake another 5 minutes. Stir nuts and pour mixture over again. Bake another 5 minutes. Stir nuts and pour mixture over again. Bake another 5 minutes. Stir nuts and pour mixture over again. Bake another 5 minutes. Stir nuts and pour mixture over again. Bake another 5 minutes. Stir nuts.

Peel the outer skin from the white onions, then cut them in half lengthwise, cutting them into smaller pieces as you go. Place the white onions in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the white onions, turning them occasionally until they are golden brown (about 45 minutes). Drain them well. Add the butter to the skillet (if you do not have enough butter, then add oil). Add the brown sugar and stir to dissolve the brown sugarcook for about three minutes stirring constantly. Add the Worcestershire sauce to the mixture in the skillet and cook for about two minutes, stirring constantly. Add food coloring (or use white wine or a touch of vinegar for a lighter color). Cook for two minutes more and stir constantly until the mixture is smooth. Add the white onions to the sauce (if the mixture is too thick to pour then add a little water). Mix the white onions well with the sauce and continue cooking for about five more minutes. Salt and pepper the mixture and cook for another five minutes. The sauce should coat the white onions lightly when you put a spoon in it and lift it out of the

Mix cream cheese, peanut butter and cream in small mixing bowl. Stir in marshmallow cream until well blended. Drop by teaspoonfuls into muffin cups coated with cooking spray. Refrigerate for about an hour until firm. Unmold and top with mini-chocolate chips if desired.

Melt the peanut butter and chocolate chips in a large bowl over hot water. Stir in powdered sugar and peanut butter chips. Pour into a waxed paper lined 13x9 pan and cool to room temperature. Chop the corn flakes in a food processor. Add them to the mixture and mix well. When cool, cut into squares. Refrigerate or freeze.

Cut squash into 1/2-inch rounds. Coat with oil and season with celery salt and black pepper. Bake at 400 degrees F for about 40 minutes or until tender and browned. Remove and serve hot with a dipping sauce of oil and vinegar mixed together with fresh basil and garlic salt.

Preheat the oven to 350F. Wash and dry the scallions. Melt the butter and oil in a skillet over medium heat. Saute the scallions until tender. Drain any excess liquid. Set aside. Mix together the crab meat, scallions and seasonings. Shape into two patties. Place the crab patties into a lightly greased 9 by 13-inch baking dish. Top each crab patty with one slice of Swiss and one slice of cheddar cheeses. Whisk together the eggs and half-and-half. Pour over the crab patties and top with breadcrumbs. Sprinkle the crab patties with paprika and season again with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes or until bubbling and golden brown. Serve with warm tortillas.

Cut grapefruit in half. Place halves on a baking sheet. Sprinkle each grapefruit half with soy sauce. Add juice, garlic and olive oil. Sprinkle with olive oil. Place chicken breasts in marinade. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours. Thread chicken breasts onto wooden skewers. Grill or broil chicken until juices run clear. Serve with skewers.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add brown onion and garlic and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in ginger and curry paste and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add sweet potato and cook until softened but not mushy, about 10 minutes. Add stock and bring to a boil. Add coconut cream and cook 5 minutes longer or until sweet potatoes are tender and liquid has reduced slightly. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Finely chop coriander leaves and stir into soup just before serving.

Cut melon in half lengthwiseremove seeds. Slice melon into 1/2-inch thick slices. Cut pineapple into 1/2-inch cubes. In a medium bowl combine melon, pineapple, red onion, serrano chili and honeydew juicestir until combined. Set aside to marinate for 1 hour at room temperature or 30 minutes in the refrigerator. When ready to serve, combine remaining salsa ingredients in a small bowl and stir to combine. To serve, scoop salsa into a small bowl and top with honeydew melon slicesgarnish with mint or basil leaves if desiredserve immediately. Makes 2 cups salsa.

Roast chicken. Peel chicken and cut in half. Brush with garlic butter then rub with annatto seeds. Place chicken in a 1-gallon zip top bag. Squeeze out air then add chili pepper flakes, lemon juice (1 cup) and lime juice (3 tbsp). Seal bag then massage to mix in all ingredients. Refrigerate for 10 to 15 minutes. Remove chicken from refrigerator 30 minutes before grilling. Grill chicken 30 minutes or until tender and juicy. Serve with lemon juice, chili pepper flakes, chopped garlic and chopped annatto seeds on the side for individual dipping.

Cut each slice of bread into thirds. Put one slice of bread in a bun-size bowl. Add the tomato soup and pineapple. Stir to mix. Divide the meat into 4 pieces. Layer 2 pieces of meat and 1 slice of pineapple and soup in each bowl. Serve immediately.

Mix beef with celery, onion and seasonings in a large skillet or sauce pan over medium heatcook 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and noodlescook 5 minutes more. Serve hot with cheese sprinkled over top if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine apples and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer apples until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and transfer apples to a baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the oats, brown sugar and granulated sugar. Stir in the flour and nutmeg. Stir in the butter and cut in with a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in coconut until coated with crumbs. Spread over apples in baking dish and bake for 30 minutes or until the topping is golden brown. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Bring water to boil, add cinnamon sticks, cardamom pods, 3 tablespoons of white rice, 4 cups hot water to a large saucepan over medium heat. Cover saucepan and bring mixture to a boil once more. Remove from heat and allow to rest for 1 hour. After 1 hour of steeping add peas, raisins and almonds to the steeping mixture and bring to a boil once more. Serve rice with meat dishes such as curry or with dishes such as curried goat or curried fish.
Cook orzo according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold water. Combine orzo with remaining ingredientstoss gently. Refrigerate for up to 24 hours.
Put all ingredients into slow cooker. Cook for 6 hours. Shred meat and serve with your favorite accompaniments. I serve this with white rice and fresh guacamole.

Melt butter over low heat. Add marshmallows and stir until melted. Add karo light corn syrup, vanilla extract, peanut butter chips and golden grahams cereal. Stir until evenly combined. Pour into lightly greased baking dish. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight. Cut into squares. Store in airtight container.

In a large pot bring water with rosemary and pepper to boil. Add celery and carrot. Cook for about 15 minutes or until carrot and celery are soft and tender. Add the chicken pieces and boil for about 25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and tender. In a medium bowl add the noodles and dried basil and stir to combine. In a large bowl add the cooked chicken and vegetables and stir to combine. Add the noodles and stir to combine. Taste the soup and if you like add more pepper or rosemary or chicken broth if you want it a little richer or more flavorful.

Remove skin and bones from cooked chicken. Cut into bite-size pieces. In large bowl, combine 2 cups of the soup and the water. Stir in chicken, black pepper and the remaining soup. Place biscuits in slow cooker. Pour chicken mixture over biscuits. Cover and cook on low for 5 to 6 hours. Stir chicken mixture once during the cooking period. Before serving, remove biscuits from cooker and place on heated platter. Spoon chicken mixture over biscuits.

Squeeze the juice from the lemons into a large glass and add the ice cubes. Add the gin and vodka and mix with a spoon to make sure the ice is covered with the alcohol. Pour the sparkling wine into the glass and garnish with a slice of lemon. Serves 2-3

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add brown sugar and pecans and cook until butter is melted and mixture is hot and bubbly, stirring frequently with a wooden spoon. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Press mixture firmly into a greased 11-inch by 17-inch baking dish and let stand at room temperature for 1 hour or until set. Cut into bars. Refrigerate until serving time.

Cook tortellini according to package directions. Drain tortellini and set aside. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add prosciutto and cook for 1 minute. Add artichoke hearts to skillet and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in parmesan cheese. Slowly add 1 cup of cream to skillet and cook 2 more minutes. Add remaining 2 cups cream to skillet and cook 2 more minutes. Add tortellini to skillet. Cook over low heat for 2 minutes. Add pepper to taste. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 13x9x2 inch baking pan. Prepare brownie mix according to package directions. Spread brownie batter evenly into prepared pan. Sprinkle nuts evenly over brownie batter. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack before cutting into bars. Store covered at room temperature up to 2 days. Makes 2 dozen brownies.

Peel the sweet potato and cut it into thick slices. Place the slices on a baking sheet and drizzle with the oil and salt and pepper. Roast the sweet potatoes for 30-40 minutes, until they are soft and golden brown on top. Once the potatoes are cooked through, take them out of the oven and leave to cool for a few minutes. Peel the onions and place them with a tablespoon of oil into a frying pan over a medium-low heat. Once the onions have softened, add the butter and a pinch of salt and pepper. Stir until the onions are golden brown, then remove the onions from the heat and set them aside. Once the potatoes are cool enough to handle, put them through a ricer or masher into a large mixing bowl. Add the caramelised onions to the sweet potatoes along with a dash more salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Mix all ingredients together in a shallow dish. Add pork to dish and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Grill pork to desired doneness. Serve with corn on the cob and a baked potato if desired.

Brush shrimp with garlic salt. Place in a shallow dish. Drizzle with melted butter. Sprinkle breadcrumbs over shrimp and place in a 375 degree oven for about 10 minutes or until golden. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and chopped parsley.

Preheat oven to gas mark 6. To make the base grease a large baking tray with margarine then spread the flour and brown sugar evenly over it with a palette knife. Place the pears, skin on in the middle of the flour mixture then top with the cashews. In a bowl beat together the margarine, golden syrup and egg until well mixed then add the water gradually. Pour the mixture over the pears then bake in the preheated oven for about 35 minutes or until the mixture is golden brown and the pears are soft. Allow to cool slightly then turn out onto a large serving plate then serve.

Cook pasta in boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, whisk together the vodka, cream, dill weed, salt & pepper. Place the pasta in a warm serving dish. Pour the vodka mixture over the pasta. Add the smoked salmon. Sprinkle the top with fresh dill. Serve immediately.

Bring water to a boil and add spinach. Cook until wilted. Drain and rinse under cold water. Sauté garlic and green onion in dark sesame oil. Add the spinach and toss. Drain the spinach and toss it back into the pan. Add low sodium soy sauce and sesame seeds. Cook for about 2 minutes. Toss again and remove from heat. Salt to taste. Let spinach cool. Then transfer spinach to a food processor or blender and puree. Serve cold.
Mix all ingredients together. Put mixture into buns.

Cook noodles in boiling water until tender. Drain. Dry noodles well on paper towels. Put noodles in an 11-inch by 13-inch baking pan. Melt the butter in a saucepan. Stir in the cinnamon. Add the raisins and sugar. Stir until raisins are coated. Cool mixture. Mix the egg yolks with the almond extract. Add to the raisin mixture. Stir in the milk. Beat egg whites until stiff. Stir egg whites into the mixture. Spread the mixture evenly over the noodles. Cover with foil. Bake at 375 oven for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake 30 minutes longer. Cool. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Top with powdered sugar.

Preheat oven to 400f. Mix milk and butter and add to flour mixture. Add eggs and egg substitute and combine. Fold in sugar. Pour mixture into 13x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar. Bake 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Warm oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add potatoes and cook 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add leeks and cook 3 more minutes. Add cooking onion and cook 2 minutes. Add white wine and cook 2 minutes. Add broth and cook 30 minutes. Blend 1/2 of the soup until smooth. Add blended soup to remaining soup. Stir in hummus and season with pepper. Serve garnished with parsley.

Steam rice. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and saut until soft. Add black beans and cook until warmed through. Add rice and chicken to pan and cook for 5 minutes. Serve rice topped with black beans and chicken. Top rice and beans with salsa and sliced bananas. Add fresh cilantro to individual serving bowls.
Cover bottom of slow cooker with a cup of water. Place chopped garlic cloves into the slow cooker. Add remaining ingredients and stir to combine. Cook on high for 3 hours. Serve with garnishes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt. In another bowl beat together mayonnaise and milk until smooth. Beat in egg whites until blended. Stir wet ingredients into flour mixture until just blended. Pour batter into two lightly greased muffin tins filling each one about 2/3 full. Bake in preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Allow muffins to cool slightly before removing from pan.

Drain the beans in a colander and rinse. Put beans in a large pot and add water to cover beans. Bring to a boil and then reduce to a simmer for 1 hour. Add the corn to the beans and cook for an additional 40 minutes. Drain the beans. In a skillet, sauté the onions in the margarine. Add the beans and corn to the soup and add the remaining ingredients. Mix well and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Let stand 15 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a souffle dish and dust with a little flour. Put butter into a large saucepan and set over medium heat. When butter is melted and foaming, add bitter chocolate and cook until smooth. Stir in eggs one at a time. Beat in sugar and salt. Stir flour into egg mixture. Pour into souffle dish. Bake for about 20 minutes or until a skewer inserted into center comes out clean. Serve at once.

Hearts of palm are sold in a can. When you open the can, you may have to drain off excess water. Use your fingers to separate the hearts from the liquid. Cook hearts in chicken stock. In a large bowl, whisk together the butter, flour and white pepper until the mixture has a smooth consistency. Add to the stock and bring to boil. Add the heavy cream and bring to boil again. Remove from heat and serve warm.

Cook the potato in water with oil until tender. Peel it and grate it or cut it into cubes. Put the grated potatoes or the cubes in a saucepan with the onion and pepper. Cook for 10-15 minutes. Put the lardons in another saucepan with the oil and heat it until the fat is hot. Put the potatoes in the saucepan with the lardons and cook for 5-10 minutes or until they are golden brown. Put the cooked potatoes in a casserole with the cheese and the white wine and cook it for 5 minutes. Serve with the lardons. You can also cook the lardons in the white wine with the peppercorns to give it a better taste.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt. Beat butter until fluffy. Stir in sugar gradually. Blend in eggnog, egg, walnuts, candied fruit and nutmeg. Fill greased 12 muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake for 25 minutes.

Place peaches in a saucepan with vinegar and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook 2 minutes then remove from the heat. Add soy sauce and ginger. Place greens on a salad plate. Arrange turkey over greens. Place peaches over turkey. Top with broccoli florets and cauliflower florets. Drizzle with peach syrup and serve immediately.
Mix dry ingredients. Stir in liquid. Drop by spoonfuls onto hot griddle. Cook until bubbles form on top and surface is dry. Flip and cook other side until golden brown. Serve with syrup of choice.
Add garlic to olive oil. Cook until garlic begins to brown. Add shrimp and cook until pink. Add seasonings and lemon. Stir in parsley.
Put all ingredients except milk into blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. If necessary add more oil. Add milk just before serving. Store refrigerated. Use on salads or vegetables.

Remove the stem from the capsicums and slice in half. Remove the seeds and slice into fine strips. In a mixing bowl combine all the ingredients. Mix well and pour into a glass dish. Cover with cling film and store in the fridge for at least an hour to allow the flavors to develop. Toss to mix before serving. Serve at room temperature.

Heat milk in large soup pot over medium heat until bubbles appear around edge. Stir in spaghetti sauce. Add cream cheese. Cook over medium heat until melted. Reduce heat to low. Cook until mixture thickens slightly. Add mushrooms and cook 1 minute longer. Remove from heat. Stir in Italian seasoning. Top with canadian bacon. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Cook covered until cheese melts. Stir in parmesan cheese. Serve with crusty bread.

Drain tuna and place in a medium bowl. Whisk together yogurt, whip and tuna. Add Italian dressing and mix well. Add pasta, vegetables and toss well. Sprinkle with cheese and salt. Place in fridge for 30 minutes before serving.
Mix all ingredients together in a saucepan. Cook until thick. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, sugar and salt. In another bowl, beat the eggs. In a third bowl, combine the butter and beer. Mix the dry ingredients into the wet ones with the beer. Pour batter into buttered bread pan or pans. Bake for 30 minutes or until bread is golden brown on top and sounds hollow when you tap the side of the pan. Let bread cool slightly before removing from pan to serve.

In a large bowl combine all of the vegetables. Add breadcrumbs, salt and pepper. Add in ground turkey. In a small bowl, combine maple syrup and Dijon mustard. Add to meat mixture. Pour into a greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until done. Serve with a side of mashed potatoes.

In a saucepan, combine condensed milk and lemon juice. Stir over low heat until heated through and smooth. Strain into a large glass or plastic dish and let cool completely. In a small saucepan, combine yogurt and strawberry. Heat to a simmer and simmer until heated through. Fold into cooled condensed milk mixture. Fold in blueberries and marshmallows. Place in freezer for 2 hours. Stir before serving and return to freezer for 2 hours before serving.

Drain tomatoes. Place tomatoes into a food processor or blender with red chili peppers, green onions, cilantro, cumin, garlic and salt. Blend until smooth. Pour salsa into a bowl or jar. Refrigerate. Serve with grilled meats.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Cut the tops from the tomatoes and scoop out the seeds with a grapefruit spoon. Place the tomatoes cut side down in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with oregano. Bake for about 20 minutes. Place the garlic clove in the center of each tomato. Bake for another 30 minutes. Remove the garlic cloves. Cool slightly. Add the tomatoes to a food processor with the garlic cloves. Process until smooth. Add the tomato juice. Process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.

Heat olive oil and garlic in large pot over medium heat until garlic turns slightly brown. Add celery, tomatoes and seasonings to the pot with pasta water or stock if needed. Bring to boil then add frozen peas. Simmer for about 20 minutes stirring occasionally. When pasta is done cooking add pasta to pot with mixture of veggies and stir well. Serve hot!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. In a large skillet, saute the pecans in butter over medium heat until toasted, about 4 minutes. Add onions and carrots. Cook until tender. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine breadcrumbs, pecans and spices. Add the eggs and mix well. Add the vegetables. Fold in the cottage cheese. Spoon the mixture into the prepared pan. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the pan and cool before slicing. Makes 8 servings.

In large skillet, cook onions and celery until tender. Stir in bread cubes. Mix together butter and parsley flakes. Pour over bread cubes and stir to coat. Add seasonings and chicken broth. Simmer for 5 to 6 minutes until bread cubes are tender. Makes about 4 cups.
Heat some extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the broccoli rabe and saute for several minutes. Add the garlic and saute until tender. Remove from heat and serve. Serves 8.

Combine flour, salt, pepper, and water in a large pan. Stir until blended. Stir in onions and celery until softened. Add green pepperstir until tender. Pour in mushroom soupstir to blend. Place steaks in panturn to coat. Cover and cook over medium heat for 1 hour or until tenderturn once during cooking time. Serve with rice or potatoes. Makes 6 servings.

Wash and trim the asparagus spears. Peel the bottoms and break the stems in half. Wrap asparagus in a clean dish towel and steam until tender. Remove from heat and cool. Combine the asparagus in a bowl with the parmesan cheese and the lemon juice. Toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper. Place asparagus on a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes or until crisp. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine salt and pepperflour and garlic. Toss chicken with the seasoning mixture. Melt butter in skillet. Cook chicken about 5 minutes on each side or until lightly browned. Remove chicken and keep warm. Pour out most of the fat. Add wine and bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer for 2 minutes. Add broth and thymesimmer for 1 minute. Add chicken and bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with the sage.

Heat oil in a large soup pot over medium heat. Add garlic, onions, celery, chickpeas, tahini, broth, and 1/2 teaspoon of sea salt. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes. Puree soup in a blender or food processor. Return to pot, add more water if needed to reach desired consistency. Stir in mint. Serve hot. Serves 4.

In a medium heavy-bottomed saucepan, heat oil over medium heat and stir in mustard seeds and ground turmeric. Add onion and garlic and cook for about 2 minutes or until onions are translucent. Add chilies and cook for 30 seconds. Stir in rice and toast for about 2 minutes or until rice begins to brown slightly. Stir in lemon juice and salt and bring to a boilstir in cashews and cook for 30 seconds more. Transfer rice to a bowl and fluff with a fork. Sprinkle with paprika and serve.
Add 1 cup boiling water to green tea bag and steep for 5 minutes. Add mashed banana, ice, orange juice concentrate and honey. Blend until smooth.

Peel and finely chop the baby beets and set aside. Slice the goats cheese into thin strips and set aside. Roughly chop the rocket leaves and finely chop the pine nuts and set aside. Slice the red onion into thin half moons and set aside. Drizzle the baby beets with the light olive oil and sprinkle over the lemon juice and caster sugar. Add the rocket leaves and toss gently to combine. Top with the goats cheese and pine nuts and toss to combine again. Serve immediately.

Mix cake mix according to package directions. Fold pudding mix & cool whip into cake batter & pour into a 9 x 13 x 2-inch baking dish that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (210 degrees C). Remove as much of the tough stem from asparagus as you can and cut into 2 or 3 inch piecestrim off woody ends of peppers. Put asparagus and peppers onto a cookie sheet and drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Place in oven and roast until peppers are tender and asparagus is tender, about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, melt butter and whisk in red pepper flakes and garlicset aside. When vegetables are done, remove from oven and drizzle onion mixture over themtoss to coat vegetables. Serve hotvegetables may also be served cold. This is a great way to use up leftover roasted vegetables.
Rinse and drain beans. In food processor or blender add all other ingrediants and blend. Serve with crackers.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9 x 13 inch pan. Combine the sloppy joe sauce and creamed potato soup in a large bowl. Place the frozen hash browns on the bottom of the greased pan. Top the hash browns with the meat mixture. Sprinkle the cheddar cheese over the top. Bake for 40 minutes, until the meat and the sauce are hot. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In a small bowl add espresso to water. In a separate bowl add heavy cream to corn syrup. Set aside. Melt dark chocolate in a double boiler or in a heatproof bowl over simmering water. Remove from heat. Add cream mixture to chocolate and stir until smooth. Pour into prepared 4- by 6-inch baking pan. Chill until set. Cut into 12 pieces. Store in refrigerator.
In a large skillet melt butter over medium heatadd shrimp, season with salt-free seasoningsaute for about 4 minutes or until opaqueadd fresh parsley just before serving.

Combine onions, soy sauce and garlic powder in food processor or blenderblend until smooth. Add sugar to onion mixtureblend until onions are completely dissolved. Add chiliesblend until completely dissolved. Pour into jarrefrigerate overnight. Store in refrigerator for up to two weeks.
Mix dry pancake mix and egg together. Add 7-up. Bake on greased griddle.
Mix sugar and cocoa in bowl. Add vanilla and oil. Stir until all is blended. Then add flour. Mix well and add eggs. Bake on greased sheet pan at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 20 minutes. Cool.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease or line 12 muffin tins. In a medium bowl, combine the raisin bran cereal with sugar. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda and fine salt. In a separate bowl, combine the canola oil with egg. Combine the dry ingredients with the egg mixturestir in the blueberries. Fill the muffin tins about half full. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean. Allow to cool for 5 minutes in the pan before removing.

Cut broccoli and cauliflower into bite-size pieces. Combine broccoli and cauliflower with sunflower seeds and raisins in large mixing bowl. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour to blend flavors. Serve in individual salad bowls or plates. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat grill. Prepare grill for medium-hot fire. Cut off ends of squash. Cut squash in half. Scoop out seeds and discard. Slice squash into 1-inch thick slices. Brush with olive oil. Sprinkle with garlic powder and ground pepper. Place on grill and cook for 15 to 20 minutes, turning occasionally. Arrange sliced onions around the outside of the grill. Grill until onions are tender. Remove from grill. Melt butter in small saucepan. Add garlic. Cook until garlic is lightly browned. Remove from heat. Brush each slice of squash with butter mixture. Place on grill again and continue grilling until tender. Remove from grill. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Place chicken breasts between two sheets of wax paper and pound until an even thickness is achieved (about 1/2-inch thick). Mix all of your seasonings together into a bowl and coat each chicken breast with the seasonings. Dip each breast into egg and then into bread crumb mixture. Place each coated breast onto a greased cookie sheet (or an oven-safe pan). Repeat with remaining chicken breasts. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 40 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink inside. (Chicken will be golden brown outside.) Let cool for at least 10 minutes before removing from pan or cutting into strips. Makes about 10-15 strips of chicken.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut apple in half and core out stem and seeds. Slice apple thinly. Melt butter in a small saucepan over low heat until butter is melted and begins to bubble and foam slightly around edges. In a large bowl combine eggs and cream and whisk until smooth and well blended. Add salt and pepper to taste and beat again until all lumps are gone. Heat a 12-inch non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and melt butter into hot pan until butter sizzles when sprinkled with water. Pour in egg mixture and spread evenly into a 1/4-inch-thick layer with a spatula and allow to set for one minute. Set oven rack to broil position and place skillet on rack. Broil for 4 minutes or until edges are lightly golden and top is set. Remove skillet to a cool burner and sprinkle apple slices evenly over omelet and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle brie cheese on top and place skillet back on st

To prepare the bread, toast 2 slices of bread on a hot griddle or in a toaster. Remove from the heat and rub each piece of bread with one teaspoon of oil. Set aside. Beat eggs in a large bowl. Add water. Whisk. Stir in 2 teaspoons of the hot pepper sauce. Season the eggs to taste with the kosher salt. Pour the mixture over the bread. Top the bread with the remaining 2 teaspoons of the hot pepper sauce. Sprinkle each bread slice with 2 tablespoons of the goat cheese. Sprinkle each slice evenly with one teaspoon each of the sweet butter and the pesto sauce. Top each slice with a basil leaf. Place the bread on a hot griddle or in a toaster and cook until the cheese melts and the bread is golden. Top each slice with two sun-dried tomatoes and a few drops of the pesto sauce. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 325. In large bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until light. Add sour cream and vanilla and beat until fluffy. Pour into crust. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Remove from oven and cool for 10 minutes before adding Cool Whip topping. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Remove the wings and legs from the chicken and discard (save the wings and legs to make stock). Remove the giblets and save for stock making. Remove the neck and discard. Stuff the cavity with garlic and thyme. Dust the whole chicken with dry bread crumbs and the corn on the cob with the same mixture. Combine the margarine with the mustard and vinegar and brush the entire outside of the chicken and corn on the cob with the mixture. Sprinkle cayenne pepper on top and place in the refrigerator for 4-6 hours. Remove from refrigerator and heat the grill to medium and cook for approximately 40 minutes or until the juices run clear. Serve with steamed vegetables and rice or potatoes. This is also good with a salad.

Sift powdered sugar into a small mixing bowl. Pour in the coconut milk. Add vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon of the preserves. Beat together using a hand mixer. Add more coconut milk if desired. Add coconut oil. Frosting can be made 2-3 days in advance. Keeps in fridge for up to 3 days. Makes about 1/2 cup.

Melt butter on medium heat in a large saucepan. Add onion, garlic and flour and stir for five minutes until mixture is brown and bubbly. Add chicken broth to mixturestir for two minutes. Add potato, carrots and cooked chickenbring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Simmer for 10 to 12 minutesstir occasionally. Add basilsimmer for an additional minute. Serve with parmesan cheese sprinkled on top.

In a pot on medium-low heat, combine the cream and tomatoes and simmer until the tomatoes are tender. Add the garlic and simmer for 3 minutes until it softens. Remove from the heat and strain the cream through a fine mesh sieve into a blender, discarding the solids. Place the sun-dried tomato and the pine nuts into the blender with the cream and blend until the nuts are well incorporated into the sauce (do not over-process). Add the olives and the gnocchi and simmer until the gnocchi is tender and the sauce has thickened slightly (about 5-7 minutes). Remove from the heat and add the spinach and stir until it is completely wilted. Season with salt and pepper to taste and remove from the heat. Serve warm, topped with Parmesan.

Cook the green beans until tender in boiling salted water. Drain and plunge into ice water to prevent the beans from overcooking. Drain. Heat the oil in a skillet. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the drained beans to the skillet. Cook over low heat for 1 minute. Add the vinegar and basil. Cook for 1 more minute. Add salt and pepper. Stir in the scallions. Serve warm.

Whisk eggs in bowl. Season with salt and white pepper. In small skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add chopped onions. Cook until softened. Add mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms are tender. Add egg mixture to skillet. Cook over low heat until eggs are set. Sprinkle with mustard powder. Serve immediately.

Cook rutabaga in large pan of salted water until tender, about 30 minutes. Drain the rutabaga well in colander. Put rutabaga in a food processor along with fine breadcrumbs and process until coarsely chopped. Grease a 2-qt baking dish with butterset aside. In small bowl combine milk, egg yolks, salt, and sugar. Add rutabaga mixture to eggs and stir until combined. Pour into the prepared baking dish and bake until top is firm and lightly browned, about 45 minutes. Let cool slightlycut into squares and serve.

Brown stewing beef in frying pan with oil and onion soup mixadd a little water if necessary. Put beef in casserole dish. Sprinkle with flouradd cream of mushroom soup and sliced mushroomscook until beef is tenderadd sherry winecook until thickened and serve over cooked rice or egg noodles.

Prepare rice according to package directions. Cube pork tenderloin and brown in bacon drippings. Add soy sauce and ginger. Stir well to coat pork. Place pork and cooked rice on a large serving platter. Add tomato sauce and pineapple tidbits to drippings. Stir well. Spoon over pork and rice. Pour over red wine vinegar and brown sugar. Serve.

In large mixing bowl stir together flour and yeast. Make a well in center and pour milk into well. Stir milk into flour with wooden spoon. Gradually beat in enough water to make soft pliable dough. Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic. Cover bowl with plastic wrap. Let rise until doubled in size. Punch down dough. Divide into four portions. On lightly floured surface roll out each portion to 12-inch circle about 1/4-inch thick. Place on pizza pans. Cover loosely with plastic wrap. Let rise until doubled. Bake at 400 degrees fahrenheit for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat warm olive oil until hot. Add zucchini and garlic, cook until zucchini begins to soften. Add salt and pepper to taste and stir to coat. Transfer mixture to a bowlset aside. In a small bowl combine dill, parsley, mint, rosemary, thyme, and 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese. In a 5-qt slow cooker combine zucchini mixture with remaining 1 cup crumbled feta cheese and chopped herbsstir to combine. Add enough water to cover by 1/2 inchcover with lid. Cook on high for 2-3 hours or until zucchini is tender when pierced with a fork. Serve hot with additional chopped fresh herbs as desired.

Preheat oven to 400F degrees. Clean potatoes and pat dry with a paper towel. Cut a slit lengthwise down each potato to expose the flesh inside. Toss potatoes with olive oil, worcestershire sauce, shallot, salt, pepper, rosemary, and thyme until potatoes are well coated. Place potatoes on a lightly oiled baking sheet and roast 45 minutes to 1 hour or until tender when pierced with a knife.
Cut each biscuit into thirds. Place 2-3 tablespoons of meat mixture into each biscuit. Top with mustard, catsup and cheese. Bake at 350 for 8-10 minutes or until cheese is bubbly.

Combine green onion, soy sauce, chicken stock, sake, sugar and mirin in a small sauce pan and bring it up to a boil while stirring constantly. Turn heat down to a simmer for about 10 minutes or until thickened a little. Remove from heat. Place skewers in a large resealable plastic bag with about a half cup of the marinade in the bag with each skewer. Close the bag and shake well to coat the skewers well with marinade. Refrigerate for about 30 minutes before grilling the skewers on a gas grill or electric grill pan over medium heat for about 4 minutes on each side or until done. Serve with additional sauce if desired.
Combine all ingredients except the cheese into a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Add the cheese until desired consistency is reached.

Heat a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the oil and then add the ground turkey and cook until browned. Drain off any fat. Add the onion and cook until softened. Add the garlic powder and stir well to combine. Add the tomato sauce, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Stir in the cabbage and cook until the cabbage has wilted. Transfer to a greased baking dish and sprinkle with the oregano. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Brown ground beef in a skillet over medium heat. Drain fat. Stir in fajita seasoning mix and rice. Cook until heated through. Heat tortillas in microwave according to package directions. Fill with ground beef mixture. Add avocado slices, lettuce, diced tomato, and cheese. Roll up tortillas. Serve immediately.

Fry steak until brown on all sides. Remove from pan and place on a plate to keep warm. Add enough oil to coat the pan. Sauté carrots, celery, onion, garlic until soft. Add tomatoes to the pan and let simmer until thickened slightly (about 10 minutes). Remove pan from heat and stir in tapioca (or cornstarch). Return to heat and bring to boil until thickened slightly. Add steak and black pepper to taste and serve. This is a great recipe for a family get-together.

In a small saucepan, bring the lemon juice to the boil with the horseradish. Add the tart apple, bring back to the boil again and simmer until the apple is soft. Remove from the heat and leave to cool for about 10 minutes until the mixture thickens slightly. Stir in the sour cream or double cream to the mixture then season with the salt and sugar to taste. Serve as a dip with bread sticks.

Rinse rice in a fine mesh sieve under cold running water until water runs clear. Place rice in a large bowl. Add enough cold water (about 3 cups) to cover rice by 2 inches. Soak rice in cold water for about an hour. Drain rice. Transfer rice to a rice cooker and cook until tender. Transfer rice back to bowl. Add soy sauce. Combine well. Rinse onion in cold water. Drain. Chop finely. Add chopped onion. Stir well. Combine tuna fish and mayonnaise. Stir well. Stir in rice mixture. Refrigerate for 1 hour. To serve, spread rice mixture evenly over 6 squares of nori. Place one piece of pickled ginger on each sheet of nori. Arrange cucumber slices crosswise over rice. Place 1 piece of canned tuna over cucumbers. Roll each sheet of nori tightly around filling. Cut each roll in half diagonally. Serve immediately. Store in refrigerator in tightly covered container for up to 24 hours. Yield: 6 rolls.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add onion and saute until soft. Add mushrooms. Cook until soft. Add bacon. Cook until bacon is done. Add soup. Heat thoroughly. Add chicken and cook until done. Drain. Add remaining ingredients. Cook until thickened. Serve.

Cook rigatoni according to package instructions. Drain. Mix all the ingredients together except cheese. Place in an ungreased 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle top with cheese. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes.

Stir together soy sauce, cornstarch, and water in a small bowl until cornstarch dissolves. Place broccoli florets and cauliflower florets in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade over vegetablesseal bag. Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. Drain vegetablesdiscard marinade. Remove stems from scallionscut crosswise into thin strips. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hotadd carrots and water chestnuts. Cook and stir 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add vegetablescook and stir 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add broccoli and cauliflowercook and stir 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add scallions and garliccook and stir 1 minute or until crisp-tender. Sprinkle with salt and peppertoss gently to coat.

Bring orange juice to a simmer over medium heat, then add tea bags. Let steep for 5 minutesremove tea bags. Add sugar, mint leaves, lemon juice and water to orange juice mixturestir until sugar is dissolved. Serve warm or chilled.

Place 10 strawberries, hulls removed, into food processor or blender. Puree strawberries until smoothset aside. Pour remaining strawberries into blender or food processor containerpulse until finely chopped. Set aside. Place cream cheese, powdered sugar and 4 tablespoons whipped cream into blender or food processor. Process until cream cheese is smooth. Fold in chopped strawberriesset aside. Place remaining whipped cream into large bowlbeat until soft peaks form. Fold cream cheese mixture into whipped cream. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving. Makes 16 servings.

Spread the mayonnaise mixture on one side of the bread. Top with the cream cheese mixture. Top with the shrimp and the fresh dill. Top with the yogurt mixture and the cucumber. Cover the sandwich and refrigerate for about an hour. Then remove the sandwich from the refrigerator and cut into 24 pieces. Serve on a small plate. Serves two.

In a medium sized glass jar, combine almonds and 1 1/2 tsp. garlic salt. Shake well. Place in refrigerator for 3 hours. Remove from refrigerator. Remove garlic salt. Add olive oil. Shake well. Place almonds in refrigerator for 2 hours. Remove from refrigerator. Place almonds in airtight container.

In the bottom of your crock pot place the meatballs. Cook them on low for about 4 to 6 hours. Stir occasionally to make sure they don’t burn on the bottom. While meatballs cook, make the sauce. Place meatballs on bottom half of the rolls then cover with sauce and top with cheese. Place on a cookie sheet for about 10 minutes to melt the cheese on top of the rolls.

Spread butter on one side of each pita bread rounds. Sprinkle garlic powder over both sides of each pita bread round. Sprinkle Parmesan over both sides of each pita bread round. Press to form a triangular shape. Bake at 350 degrees until golden brown, 7-12 minutes.

Beat eggs until foamy. Add brown sugar, vanilla extract, and butter. Gradually add pecans. Beat in flour. Spread mixture into 1/2 inch thick layer on waxed paper. Roll truffles into balls. Melt dark or semi-sweet chocolate and dip truffles into melted chocolate. Place on waxed paper. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Refrigerate.

Prepare cranberry sauce according to package directions. In a 2-quart baking dish, arrange berries in a single layer. Sprinkle flour evenly over cranberries. Sprinkle brown sugar evenly over flour. Cut cold butter into small pieces and add to the cranberry mixture. Press butter into the mixture with your hands until it is evenly distributed. Cut butter into small pieces and add to the cranberry mixture. Press butter into the mixture with your hands until it is evenly distributed. Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with ice cream. Serve with a scoop of ice cream.

For the crumble, combine the sugar with the mango pulp, pears, gingerroot and all-purpose flour in a large bowltoss to mix. Set aside. For the crumb topping, place the flour into the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment and mix until the flour is evenly coated with the butter. Add the brown sugar and pulse until the mixture resembles coarse bread crumbs, about 30 seconds. Place the pecans into the crumb mixturepulse to combine. Sprinkle the crumb mixture evenly over the mango mixturepat gently to combine. Place the crumble mixture onto the center of the prepared baking sheet. Bake for about 35 minutes or until the crumble is golden brown. Serve warm with ice cream or yogurt.

Bring water and salt to a boil. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta. Dissolve cornstarch in milk. Bring to a boil. Add cream cheese and mushroom. Cook over low heat for 2 minutes. Add cooked pasta and scallions. Heat through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Place rice and water in a medium saucepanbring to boil. Cover with lid and turn off heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Drain wellfluff with fork. Place cauliflower florets and onion in a large skilletcook over medium heat until tender, about 8 minutes. Stir in mushrooms and cook 1 minute longer. Add cauliflower mixture to ricemix well. Combine eggs, tomatoes, salt, pepper and paprika. Stir into rice mixture. Pour into a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dishtop with cheese. Bake 30-35 minutes or until bubbly around edges and cheese is melted. Serve warm with additional salsa on the side if desired.

1. Wash and peel the potatoes. Grate them on a box grater into a mixing bowl. 2. Add onion and season with salt and pepper. Let sit for 5 minutes to soften slightly. 3. Add potatoes and season with salt and pepper. Stir well and let sit for 5 more minutes. Add chives. 4. Whisk the egg and the egg white together. Add to the potato mixture and stir. Let stand again for another 5 minutes. Add the flour and stir well. 5. Heat the canola oil in a large skillet to medium heat. 6. Using your hands, form the potato mixture into small balls and drop into the oil. Fry on each side until golden brown. Drain on paper towels.

Add romaine lettuce, red onion and pomegranate seeds to a salad bowl or serving dish. In a bowl, whisk mayonnaise with sugar and milk until smooth. Add vinegar gradually until desired tartness is achieved. Whisk well until smooth. Drizzle dressing over salad and toss well to coat. Sprinkle with poppy seeds before serving.

Cream sugar and egg. Mix in orange juice. Add bisquick. Pour into greased 9 x 5 inch loaf pan. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar and chopped nuts. Bake at 350 degrees for 45-50 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes and remove from pan. Mix in cranberries. Cool. Yields 12 servings.

Place fish fillets in shallow greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Cut 12 or 14 whole garlic heads in half lengthwise, remove and discard the green tops, and place each half in a 1/2 cup of water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heatreduce heat to a simmer. Simmer for 30 minutes. Remove pan from heat and cool for 15 minutes or until garlic is cool enough to handle but still warm. Squeeze out as much liquid as possible from each head. Discard liquid. Place head halves in a single layer on a foil-lined large cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes or until lightly golden. Place garlic heads in a single layer in each fillet pocket (cut sides up). Sprinkle each fish with 2 teaspoons of butter and 1/4 teaspoon of lemon juice. Place fish in prepared pan. Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes or until done (internal temperature 145 degrees
Cut beans in half lengthwise. Heat oil in a wok or skillet over medium heat. Add beans. Cook for 5 minutes. Add vinegar, soy sauce, garlic and cook for 5 more minutes. Drizzle with sesame oil.

Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in sugar. Cool slightly. Beat in eggs. Stir in almond extract. Sift together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Stir in the cooled butter mixture. Stir in the chopped white baking chocolate. Chill the dough for 1 hour. Shape the dough into 1 inch balls. Roll in the slivered almonds. Place the cookies on an ungreased baking sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake at 350 degrees f for about 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Refrigerate the cookies in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks. Makes about 36 cookies.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line two cookie sheets with foilspray foil with cooking spray. Cut zucchini into 1/2-inch thick slicesplace on prepared cookie sheets. Sprinkle zucchini with breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, seasoning salt, and garlic powderdrizzle with 1/2 teaspoon oilbake 15 minutes, turning once halfway through baking. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 teaspoon oilbake 5 minutes longer or until zucchini are tender when pierced with tip of sharp knife. Serve warm with ketchup.

Bring balsamic vinegar to a boil. Add orange peel to vinegar. Reduce heat to low. Add cranberries. Cook for 10 minutes. Stir in orange juice. Add powdered sugar. Heat to boiling. Add cinnamon. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Blend all ingredients together with ice in blender. Pour into tall glass with crushed ice in bottom. Garnish with orange slice if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Slice garlic in half lengthwise and rub the cut side of each clove all over one side of each pizza crust. Spread each piece with mayonnaiseseason with oregano. Top each with sliced onionsprinkle each with cheese. Bake until golden brown (about 15 minutes). Cut into wedges and serve.

Cut the bacon into 1/8-inch thick slices. Heat the olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat until shimmering. Add the bacon and sauté until browned but still crisp, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, arrange the snap peas on a baking sheet in a single layer (don't crowd them) and sprinkle them with salt and pepper. Roast until the peas have a little char but are still bright green and very crisp, about 10 minutes. When the bacon is done, transfer it to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Place the peas on individual plates and top with the bacon. Sprinkle the sliced shallots on top of the peas and serve immediately.

Wash and core the apples and cut into quarters, then peel off the skins. Put the apples and water into a saucepan and bring to the boil. Remove from the heat and add the mint leaves and the red currant jelly. Stir and allow to cool. Put the mixture into a blender and blend to a smooth consistency. Add the red currant vinegar and the caster sugar to taste. Add salt and pepper to taste and serve warm or cold.

Melt butter in an omelette panadd onions and cook until tender but not brown (about 10 minutes). Beat eggs with milk until well mixed, then add to pan with artichoke hearts, green olives and salt and pepper to taste. Cook until firm but still moist (about 5-6 minutes). Lift omelette with a large platefold omelette over plate to prevent spilling and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a medium bowl mix together breading ingredients except butter and evaporated milk. In another large bowl mix together butter and evaporated milk until blended. Place each piece of chicken in buttered bowlroll in breading and place in a 9x13x2 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with paprika and sage and drizzle with butter mixture. Bake for 20 minutes in oven. Turn over and broil on both sides for 5 minutes or until done. Serve with gravy from drippings in baking pan. Makes 6 servings.

In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic cloves. Cook 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add popcorn. Toss with a large spoon until coated. Sprinkle with herbes de provence. Stir until evenly distributed. Transfer popcorn to a large bowl. Serve immediately.

1. Prepare the vegetables. Finely chop the zucchini and green capsicum. Grate the carrot. Slice the leek. 2. Preheat the oven to 170C. Grease 16 muffin cups. 3. Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat and cook the leek until softened. Add the zucchini and cook for about 5 minutes. 4. Stir the grated carrot into the pan. Cook for about 3 minutes. 5. Add the spinach to the pan and cook for about 1 minute. 6. In a medium-sized bowl beat together the eggs, feta and sour cream. Add the cooked vegetables and parmesan to the mixture. Season to taste. 7. Transfer the mixture to the prepared muffin cups. Place in the oven and cook for about 20 minutes. 8. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Prepare your filling according to package directions. Fill each coconut half with filling. Place on foil-lined cookie sheet. Place cookies on the middle rack of your preheated oven for 10 minutes or until edges just begin to brown. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour 2 (9×5 inch) loaf pans (or use silpat or parchment paper). In a large bowl, combine flour, baking soda and baking powderset aside. In another large bowl, whisk together applesauce, bananas, eggs and vanilla extractset aside. In a small bowl, whisk together water and saltset aside. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream together the butter and sugars until well mixed. Add flour mixturebeat at low speed until just combined (do not over mix). Add the banana mixturebeat at low speed until just combined (do not over mix). Divide batter evenly between the prepared loaf panssmooth tops with an offset spatula or knife. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes or until the bread is golden and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean (do not over bake!). Cool in pans for 10 to 15 minutes before removing bread from pans

Wash potatoes and cut in half. Peel and dice green pepper and onion. Cook onions in butter until soft. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Mix in green peppers and onions. Stir in beer and beef broth. Pour into a 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Cut squash in half lengthwise, scoop out seeds. Place cut-side down in a large baking dish. Cover dish with tin foil and bake 30-45 minutes or until flesh is tender when pricked with a fork. Cut squash in half lengthwiseremove seeds. Scoop out flesh into a bowl. Place squash halves cut side up in a medium baking dish. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add tomatoes and zucchini to pancook 5 minutes or until zucchini is tender-crisp. Stir in tomato sauce and season with salt and pepper. Spoon sauce into squash halves. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake 10-15 minutes or until sauce is bubbly and cheese is melted. Cut squash in half lengthwise to serve. (Note: if you prefer your squash not so dry, add about 1/4 cup water to sauce

Slice asparagus lengthwise and place in a crock pot. Top with soup. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and cook on low for 3 to 4 hours or until asparagus is tender. Serve over hot buttered saltine crackers.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Wash and dry the potatoes and slice into wedges. Place wedges onto a baking sheet and season with the garlic salt and paprika. Add the butter and stir with a fork until the potato wedges are evenly coated with the butter and the paprika mixture. Bake for about 30 minutes until the potato wedges are golden brown and crispy. Serve with steak or with grilled meat and vegetables.

Dice tomatoes. Drain off tomato juice and reserve juice for another use. In a heavy skillet, cook the beef for about 10 minutes, turning it occasionally until it is browned. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside. In a large saucepan, saute the garlic in the oil until the garlic is lightly browned and tender. Add the reserved tomato juice and simmer for about 10 minutes or until the sauce is reduced and thickened. Add the beef and oregano and cook for another 5 minutes. Stir in the reserved tomatoes and pepper sauce and cook for another minute. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot with bread or pasta of your choice.

In a skillet over medium heat, saute the garlic and shallots until softened. Add the onions and cook for about a minute. Add the tomato paste and stir constantly for about a minute. Add the tomatoes and green chilies, breaking them up with a wooden spoon. Cook for about a minute longer. Add the cumin and saute for a few more seconds. Pour in the broth and add the cod and frozen spinach. Cook for about 7 minutes until the spinach is thawed and the cod is fork tender. Serve with rice or tortillas and enjoy!

In a large bowl combine lettuce and eggs. In a small bowl combine olive oil and lemon juicewhisk to blend. In a small bowl combine salt, pepper and dillblend well. Toss dressing into lettuce mixture. Serve.

Pour cornbread mix into a greased 9x5 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 1 hour or until done. Cool, cut into cubes and set aside. In a large bowl combine mayonnaise with all other dressing ingredients except cornbread cubes. Add cubes and toss thoroughly. Let stand in refrigerator until ready to serve.

Drain and rinse chickpeas. Transfer to food processor. Add garlic and pulse until smooth. Add tahini and pulse until smooth. Add lemon juice and cumin and pulse until smooth. Stir in tomatoes and green onions. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to serving dish. Sprinkle with parsley and serve with pita chips.

Combine orange juice and soy sauce in saucepan and heat over medium heat until hot. Stir in garlic and let cook for 1 minute. Add green pepper and cook for another minute. Remove from heat and add scallops and zest and juice of one orange. Cover and let stand for about 10 minutes before serving over cooked rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Sift together the flour and cocoa powder in a work bowl. Stir in the baking soda and salt. In another bowl cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat the eggs into the butter mixture and mix well. Stir the vanilla into the butter mixture until well mixed. Fold the dry mixture into the butter mixture until well combined. Drop the dough by the teaspoons onto the prepared baking sheet and bake for about 12 minutes, until the cookies are set and the edges are firm. Cool on the baking sheet for about 10 minutes and then move to wire racks to cool completely.

Sift powdered sugar and salt together into a large mixing bowl. In a saucepan, heat the butter until melted and add the mint extract and water. Stir in the butter mixture and beat until smooth. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper and roll into balls.

Cut the bread into half-inch slices and brush with olive oil. Add lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Bake at 375 degrees f until golden brown. Remove from the oven and cool on a rack. Clean the bread and rub it with garlic cloves and chives and parsley and dill.

To toast bagels, place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake in preheated 450 degree F oven for about three minutes or until golden. Cool slightly. To make the cream cheese spread, mix together the cream cheese, green pepper, tomatoes, onion salt and pepper. Spread onto toasted bagels with tomatoes. Wrap turkey bacon around bagel halves. Arrange bagels and bacon on serving platter.

In small saucepan heat butter over low heat. Remove from heat. In small bowl combine egg whites, salt and sugar. Add butter and stir until blended. Pour onto wax paper. Spread into a rectangle about 3/4 inch thick. Sprinkle almonds over top. Bake at 400f for 10 minutes or until golden. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Let stand for 30 minutes. Cool completely. Break into pieces.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Clean and chop chorizo. Place chopped chorizo into a sauté pan and add olive oil. Cook chorizo for 5 minutes or until browned. Meanwhile, toss together cannellini beans and cherry tomatoes. Slice red onions and add to the beans and tomatoes. Add the sherry vinegar and honey to the chorizo and cook for 5 more minutes. Toss the beans and tomatoes with the chorizo and cook for 5 more minutes. Place the beans and tomatoes onto a platter or individual bowls. Sprinkle with freshly cracked black pepper and serve.

Fill clean 1-qt. jars with cucumber slices and 1-inch layer of salt. Repeat. Cover jars with lids and let stand at room temperature for 48 hours or in the refrigerator for 72 hours. Strain. Refrigerate.

In a medium saucepan over low heat melt butter and add to a large mixing bowl. Add brown and white sugar and mix to combine. Add in pecans and stir to combine. Add in crackers and mix to combine. Add in vanilla extract and mix to combine. Spread onto a baking sheet and press down to form a cookie-like shape and flatten out to 1/8 inch thickness. Bake at 325 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and cool for 5 minutes. Add in white and semi-sweet chocolate chips and mix to combine. Place back into oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until the chocolate is melted and the cookies are shiny. Let cool for 10 minutes then remove to a cooling rack to cool completely before serving.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain. Cool. Peel potatoes. Cut into cubes. Peel eggs. Cut into halves. Mix with potatoes. Toss with dressing. Refrigerate overnight. Just before serving, add onion and pickles.

Prepare chilled graham cracker crust according to package directions. Combine water and jello in small saucepan. Stir in cold water. Bring to boiling. Stir in ice cube. Boil 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in cool whip. Spoon jello mixture over graham cracker crust. Chill 2 hours. Serve.
Brown meat and drain. Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Stir until thickened. Pour over hot pasta. Serves 6.

Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a 5 quart or larger Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and saute for 3 to 4 minutes until onions are translucent. Whisk in 1 3/4 cups of the all-purpose flour and saute for 2 minutes. Whisk in 6 cups of reduced-sodium chicken broth and bring to a boil. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, whisking constantly. Add 2 cups half and half and 2 cups of frozen broccoli. Cook over medium-high heat for 2 to 3 minutes or until broccoli is tender crisp. Whisk in remaining half and half and frozen corn. Bring to a boil. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until corn is tender crisp. Season with salt and pepper. Melt remaining 2 tablespoons of butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Saute and drain sliced scallions. Serve chowder with sliced scallions. This recipe can be easily doubled or tripled.

Bring water and tea bags to boiling in medium saucepan over medium heat. Remove tea bags and set aside to cool. In a large pitcher combine water and tea bagsrefrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight. In a blender or food processor combine frozen cranberry juice and club soda. Process until blended and smooth. Strain juice through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcherdiscard solids. Stir tea into juice mixtureserve immediately or refrigerate for up to 24 hours. Refrigerated tea can be served over ice or at room temperature.

Preheat the oven to 375f. In a large pot of water, combine bouillon cubes, water and bay leaf. Bring to a boil over high heat. Add the flour and stir until dissolved. Cook until the flour is completely dissolved and the mixture is clear. Add the pork chops, reduce heat to low. Cook 10 minutes or until just tender. Remove the chops from the pot with a slotted spoon. Place on a baking sheet. Place in the preheated 375f. oven until the pork is cooked through, about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, cut the potatoes into cubes and place them in the same pot with the remaining liquid. Cook until potatoes are tender. Add the onion. Cook until tender. Remove the potatoes to a plate with a slotted spoon. Add the pork chops back to the pot. Add the potatoes and onion back to the pot. Cover the pot. Bake for 25 minutes.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Cut top of crabs off, leaving the legs attached. Place crabs, shell side down, in a small baking dish. Place a garlic clove on top of each crab. Put crabs into the oven until shells are bright red on top, about 8 to 10 minutes. Remove crabs from oven. Heat olive oil and butter until liquid and bubblyremove from heat. Stir in red pepper flakes and remaining garlic clove. Combine juice from one blood orange with the olive oil mixture. Strain through a sieve to remove all seeds from orange rind. Place crabs on serving platter, shell side downspoon oil mixture over the crabs. Serve with parsley sprinkled over each crab.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Cook macaroni according to package directions in a large saucepan in enough salted water to coverdrain well. Meanwhile, cook and drain ground beef and onion in another large saucepandrain well. Combine drained macaroni and beef in a large casserole dish. Stir in spaghetti sauce and cheesesprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Bake in preheated oven until bubbly, about 15 minutes.

Combine sausage, onions, eggs, sugar and milk. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Sprinkle cornmeal mix over sausage mixture. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 40 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Let stand for 5 minutes before removing from pan. Combine cream-style corn and cheddar cheese. Spread over cornmeal cornbread. Cut into squares and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine flour, baking powder and salt in a small bowlset aside. Beat butter and sugars in a large bowl with an electric mixer on high speed for 2 minutes or until smooth and creamy. Beat in egg and vanilla until blended. Stir in chocolate morsels and walnutsset aside 1/2 cup chocolate mixture for topping. Add half of flour mixture to butter mixturebeat just until moistened. Repeat with remaining flour mixture and chocolate mixture. Pour batter into a greased 9 inch pie plate. Sprinkle with reserved 1/2 cup chocolate mixture. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 20 minutes before serving. Enjoy!

Wash the green beans and pat them dry with a paper towel. Dip in flour and then into the sour cream mixture until well coated. Lay on a baking sheet and bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes or until lightly brown on the edges. In a small saucepan, melt the Velveeta cheese over medium heat. Stir until smooth and well mixed and then pour over the green beans. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and enjoy!

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Remove from heat and add graham cracker crumbs. Stir in coconut, chocolate chips and walnuts. Press firmly into a greased 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish. Melt sweetened condensed milk in a small saucepan over low heatset aside to cool slightly. Pour sweetened condensed milk over the graham cracker mixture in the pan, spreading evenly with a spatula. Refrigerate for about 30 minutes until set. Cut into barsstore refrigerated in a covered container up to 1 week.

Season taquitos with chili powder and 2 tsp. cornstarch. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Place taquitos in hot oil until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Place taquitos on a platter. Spoon a tablespoon of enchilada sauce into a shallow glass bowl. Dip chicken taquitos in enchilada sauce and place on a 24x13x2-inch baking dish. Top with 2 cups evaporated milk and 1/2 cup sour cream. Sprinkle with cheese and serve. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Place all of the stuffing cubes in a 15-by-10-inch baking pan and add the water and butter. Stir until well combined and add enough stuffing to fill the pan. Bake stuffing until golden brown and slightly crispy on top, about 20 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk together the yogurt and milk and set aside. Rinse chicken under cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Place chicken breasts skin-side-down on a clean work surface and season with salt and pepper.
