Spread 3 tablespoons of yogurt mixture evenly on each chicken breast and top each with 1 stuffing cube. Place breasts in a baking dish and cook until golden brown on top, 20-25 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare peaches by halving and slicing each half into 6 wedges. Transfer chicken breasts to serving plates and top with peaches and cinnamon sugar. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Prepare cake according to package directions with yellow cake mix. Cool completely. Spread cake with whipped topping. Place mandarin oranges around cake and arrange over cake in a circle, starting at the center of the cake and working outward to the edges of the cake. In a large bowl combine pudding and milk. Stir until blended. Serve immediately over cake.
Place an english muffin in a muffin pan. Make a well in the center. Crack an egg into the well. Top with cheese and bacon. Place in a 400 degree oven for 10-15 minutes. Remove and enjoy!

Saute ground turkey, onion and garlic in a skillet until meat is no longer pink and onions are translucent. Add frozen tater tots and green beans and cook until heated through. Add cream of celery soup and season with salt and pepper. Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes. Top with swiss cheese and bake for an additional 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Enjoy!

Pour 1/2 cup sugar into a large mixing bowl. Sift flour over sugar. Whisk egg yolks with 1/3 cup water until pale yellow. Slowly whisk sugar mixture into eggs. Add liqueurs, whipping cream and chocolate. Place cherry pie filling in prepared pie crust. Pour half of egg mixture into pie. Sprinkle with gelatin. Pour remaining half into pie. Chill pie for 4 hours. Top with whipped topping.

Cut off tops of tomatoes and remove seeds with a spoon. Cut tomatoes lengthwise into 1/2-inch slicesdiscard cores. Place tomatoes in a baking dish. Spoon 1/2 cup cottage cheese into each tomatotop with 1/2 teaspoon cocktail sauce. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes or until tomatoes are tender. Sprinkle with chervil and serve warm with crackers or pita chips.

Grease a 20cm (8in) sandwich tin with low-fat butter. Cream together the flour and sugar with a wooden spoon until well blended. Add the milk gradually until the dough is soft but not sticky. Turn the dough onto a floured surface. Roll it into a sausage shape about 1.5cm (1/2in) thick. Cut the dough into 10 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a ball and place in the prepared tin. Press the balls down with your fingers to make little rolls. Place in a preheated oven at 180c (350f) for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the filling. Put the jam into a small saucepan with the butter. Bring to a simmer. Remove from the heat. Spread over the base of each roll. Place the rolls on a baking tray. Bake for 10 minutes. Leave to cool for 5 minutes before removing from the tin. Eat while still warm.

Beat butter and sugars in large bowl with electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add vanilla pudding mix and beat until well mixed. Add eggs and beat well. Slowly add flour mixture and beat just until flour mixture is incorporated. Pour into prepared pans and bake 30-35 minutes or until cookies are done. Cool completely. Place white chocolate chips in medium microwavable bowl. Microwave at high 30-40 seconds. Stir with a spatula. Place in refrigerator for 5 minutes. Drop chocolate chips into the batter. Stir with spatula. Drop batter onto baking sheets and place in freezer for 15 minutes. Place baking sheets into refrigerator and freeze for 2 hours or until firm. Remove from freezer and peel off baking sheets. Place cookies in airtight container and freeze up to 3 months. To thaw, remove from freezer and place at room temperature for 24 hours.

In a small bowl combine pork, vinegar, wine and garlic. Place mixture in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Add butter. Stir in sugar. Cook until lightly browned and thickened. Serve immediately. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion until tender. Stir in rice. Cook 2 minutes or until rice is lightly toasted. Add stock. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, stirring occasionally, until liquid is absorbed. Add more stock as needed. Cook 18 to 22 minutes or until rice is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in spread. Add asparagus. Stir until well combined. Transfer to a shallow baking dish. Top with lemon peel and lemon juice. Bake 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 13x9 inch casserole dish with cooking spray. Cook the bacon in a skillet until crisp. Drain the bacon on paper towels. In the same skillet cook the sliced mushrooms until tender. In a mixing bowl whisk together the flour and the cream. Stir in the mushrooms, green peas, bacon pieces, salt, pepper and chives. Pour into the prepared casserole dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Cover and cook for an additional 30 minutes. Uncover the casserole dish and continue to cook for 10 minutes.

Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic clovescook 2 minutes or until garlic is golden brown. Add soy sauce, hoisin sauce, dark sesame oil, chili-garlic sauce and cook 1 minute or until mixture boils. Add steaks to hot skilletcook 3 minutes on each side or until done to your taste. Remove from skilletsprinkle with parsley and toasted sesame seeds. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine rhubarb, 1/2 cup brown sugar and strawberry gelatin in a 9-inch square baking dish. Pour mixture into a 13 x 9 x 2 baking dish. Combine flour, brown sugar and butter in a medium bowl. Cut butter into flour mixture until mixture is crumbly. Sprinkle crumb mixture over rhubarb mixture. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. Cut into bars. Top with white chocolate chips.

Bring the water to boil in a pot. Add the tomatoes with their juices and reduce heat to a gentle simmer. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and the juices have reduced slightly. Stir in the onions and garlic, and cook until the garlic is softened. Add the jalapeno and the fresh herbs. Cook just until the flavours blend. Transfer to a blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Add more water as needed to reach the desired consistency. Season to taste with lemon juice and hot sauce. Refrigerate and serve cold.
Mix all together in a microwaveable bowl. Cook on high for about three minutes. Let stand for about two minutes. Spread on wax paper. Let cool. Store in an airtight container.

In saucepan, melt margarine and saute garlic and onion in it for 1 minute. Stir in clams and crushed red pepper flakes. Cook for 1 minute or until clams open. Stir in milk and add clam juices to mixture. Cook for 5 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened. Stir in basil and season sauce with pepper to taste. Pour over pasta and serve immediately.

First slice the mushrooms in half. Put half of your bread crumbs on a plate and put half of your butter in a skillet. Put a mushroom cap in each of your skillets. Cook them for about 2 minutes on each side. Now take half of your cream cheese and half of your parmesan cheese. Mix them together. Put a little bit of butter in another skillet. Cook it for 1 minute. Put half of your bacon in it. Take half of your mushroom cap and put a little of your cream cheese and parmesan cheese in it. Now put the bacon and cheese inside of the mushroom cap. Take a fork and push the cheese inside. Next take some more butter and put it on top of it. Cook it for 1 minute. Now take 2 slices of bacon and put them on top of the mushroom. Now put your mushroom inside of your skillet and cook it for 2 minutes. It should be golden brown. Take it out and enjoy.

Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat until melted. Add carrots and celery and saute until softened, about 5 minutes. Add thyme and salt and pepper and saute until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add turkey gravy and stir until warmed through. Arrange bread slices on a baking sheet and brush with butter. Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on one side of each slice of bread. Divide turkey mixture and carrot mixture evenly among bread slices and top with another slice of bread.

In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat bring water to a boil. Add currants and cherries. Cook until currants pop and cherries release their juices. Add sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Cook until mixture is thick. Stir frequently.

Heat vegetarian ground beef over medium heat. Add vegetable oil to pan if needed to prevent sticking. Add chopped onions. Cook until onions are translucent. Add kidney beans and beef broth. Cook on medium heat until liquid is reduced by half. Stir in tomato sauce. Add cumin, chili powder and seasoned salt. Cook on medium heat until sauce thickens slightly. Add ground beef. Cook on low heat until beef is heated through. Serve hot over rice or toasted whole-wheat bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Arrange the chicken in a large casserole dish and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in refrigerator for 1 hour to marinate. Meanwhile, cook rice according to package instructions. When the rice is done cooking, add it to the casserole dish with the chicken and stir gently so that the rice and the chicken are well coated with each other and with the seasonings. Add the mushrooms and soup and stir gently again. Arrange the green chilies around the dish and top with the shredded mozzarella cheese. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the rice is tender and the cheese is melted and browned. Serve immediately with the chopped tomatoes garnish and some chopped parsley for color and flavor.

Preheat oven to 375. Lightly grease a baking dish. Whisk eggs, egg whites and milk together. Add honey and vanilla extract. In a separate bowl, combine raisin bread cubes with cinnamon. Pour egg mixture over bread cubes. Bake for 40-45 minutes. Let cool before serving.

Cut tomatoes and artichokes into small pieces and place in a mixing bowl. Add garlic cloves and mix well. Add mayo and mix well. Place a slice of french bread and layer tomato and artichoke mixture. Place a small amount of romano cheese on the bread. Enjoy.

Combine caramel topping and dark chocolate chips and cook over low heat until melted. Set aside and add butterscotch schnapps. Mix well and then add ice cubes. In a large glass combine ice cubes and liquor mixture. Top with baileys irish cream and top with light cream.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. In large bowl stir macaroni and cottage cheese together with egg and sour cream until well blended. Stir in paprika, salt and pepper to taste. Spoon into a greased 2 quart baking dish and sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until heated through and cheese is bubbly and browned.

Boil the fish fillets in the water for 10 minutes. Drain the water. Cook couscous in the boiling water for 5 minutes. Then fluff the couscous with a fork. Mix the couscous with the flour and the salt. Put the fish fillets in the olive oil. Mix the salsa with the green olives. Put the fish fillets in the oven for 15 minutes. Serve the fish fillets with the couscous mixture. Enjoy.

Combine soymilk, margarine and sugar in 1 1/2 quart saucepan. Cook and stir over low heat until margarine is melted and sugar dissolved, stirring occasionally. Simmer 10 minutes or until margarine is melted and mixture is hot throughout. Stir in salt. Pour into a 1 1/2 quart jar or canning jars (wide mouth preferred). Store in refrigerator or freezer.

Cream the sugar and butter together and beat in the eggs. Add lemon myrtle and honey. Sift together the flour and baking powder and add them to the mixture along with the milk and the figs. Mix together and turn onto a lightly floured surface and roll out to about 5mm thick and cut into rounds. Place on a greased baking tray and bake for 12-15 minutes or until cooked and golden.

Dried apricots can be found in health food stores and some supermarkets. Combine all of the ingredients in a pan, bring to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly before filling the pastry.

Peel and cut butternut squash into 1/2 -inch pieces. Place in a large saucepan with 4 cups of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low heat and simmer 35 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside. In a small bowl, mix together butter and sour cream. Add half of squash and mash until mostly smooth. Add remaining squash and continue to mash until all squash is smooth and no large chunks remain. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Mix together all dry ingredients. Cream sugar and butter. Add egg. Add sour milk. Stir in dry ingredients. Pour batter in greased 10 x 15 pan. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Let cool 10 minutes before removing from pan. Frost with powdered sugar.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Combine raisins and sherry in a bowl and let stand until soft. In a large bowl combine eggs, sugar and cream. Stir in the almonds and spices. Add the raisin mixture and stir gently. Pour into a greased 1 1/2 quart casserole and bake for 45 minutes. Serve with whipped cream.

Wash and dry the eggplant and slice lengthwise into 1/2 inch thick pieces. Remove the seeds with a teaspoon. Drizzle with olive oil and bake on an ungreased cookie sheet for about 35 minutes or until tender and browned. Place in a colander and let cool. In a blender combine the garlic clove, olive oil and lemon juice. Blend until smooth. Place eggplant in a food processor and add the garlic mixture. Blend for about 2 minutes. Place in a mixing bowl and add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in the feta cheese and pesto. Spoon into an oven safe dish. Place in the oven and bake at 350 degrees for about 10 minutes until hot. Serve with fresh tomatoes and sprinkled with fresh thyme.

Slice tomato and red onion very thin. Heat oil and add onion. Sautee onion until soft. Remove and set aside. In same oil, sautee tomatoes until soft. Remove and set aside. Combine oil, lemon juice and salt and pepper. Mix tomatoes and onion together. Place tomato mixture on hamburger bun. Sprinkle with fresh basil. Serve immediately.

Mix butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the other ingredients and mix thoroughly. Drop by rounded spoonful onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes. Let cookies cool. Melt white chocolate chips and drizzle over cooled cookies. Sprinkle each cookie with a few pieces of a candy cane. Yield 6 dozen.

Mix soy sauce with 1/4 cup lime juice and 1/4 cup water in a small bowl. Add the garlic and ginger and mix well. Stir in the thyme. Stir in the remaining lime juice and water. Place the salmon in a shallow dish and pour the lime mixture over the fillets. Marinate for 1 hour. Preheat broiler. Brush the salmon with cooking spray. Place the salmon on a broiler pan. Broil for 10 minutes. Turn the salmon. Broil for 5 minutes more or until the fish flakes easily with a fork. Sprinkle the fish with the remaining lime juice. Serve with lime wedges.

Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp and brown. Remove bacon from pan and drain on paper towels. Drain off all but 1 tbsp of grease from pan. Add lettuce and green onion and cook over medium-high heat for about 2 minutes. Add bacon and toss. Add sugar, vinegar and pepper and toss until coated well with the sugar and vinegar mixture. Serve hot or cold.

Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion soup mix and cook for 3 minutes or until browned. Add the beef and cook until browned. Stir in the potatoes and cook for 2 minutes longer or until the potatoes are tender. Place the beef mixture in the middle of the buntop with cheese slices and mushrooms.

Preheat oven to 350F. In a 9x13 baking dish, place the beans and pour in the olive oil. Add the onions and the garlic and mix together. Bake for 20 minutes. Add the molasses and the tamari soy sauce and mix. Bake for another 10 minutes or until the liquid has evaporated. Stir and add more olive oil if needed. Sprinkle the dry mustard over the beans and stir. Bake for 5-10 minutes more. Serve warm.

Combine the egg whites with a pinch of salt in the top of a double boiler over boiling water. Beat with a handheld electric mixer until the egg whites hold a soft peak. Beat in the sugar, corn syrup, water and vanilla. Beat until stiff and glossy. This frosting is not as sweet as most recipes and is best used for decorating.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta. Place pasta, pesto mix, tomatoes, olives, and cucumber into large bowltoss to coat. Add olive oil and stir to coat. Add cooked chickenmix well. Serve.

Place the pita breads on a cookie sheet and drizzle with oil. Grill them until slightly brown and crisp on each side (a few minutes per side). Remove from grill and sprinkle with lime and chili flakes. Serve immediately with dip of choice.

Boil potatoes in water until cooked. Cut potatoes in half. Slice mozzarella cheese into half inch slices. Brush potatoes with olive oil and sprinkle salt and pepper. Place potatoes and mozzarella cheese onto baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until potatoes are brown and cheese is melted. Sprinkle salted peanuts onto potatoes and serve immediately.

Soak red beans and lotus seeds overnight. Drain and rinse. Add beans and lotus seeds to large saucepan and cover with 2 inches of water. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 1 hour 30 minutes. Add vanilla extract and pearl tapioca to beans and simmer 2 hours 30 minutes. Add water to the beans and tapioca if necessary to keep it from boiling over during the last 1 hour of cooking time. Pour beans and tapioca into blender and puree with 1/2 cup of the liquid. Return beans and tapioca to pot and stir to combine. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low and simmer 15 minutes. Serve beans hot with rice balls and drizzle with syrup and sesame oil.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a small bowl, mix together the cookie crumbs, butter, cream cheese and powdered sugar until well combined. Press half of the mixture onto the bottom of an 8 x 8 inch (20 x 20 cm) pan coated with cooking spray. Spread the rest of the cookie mixture evenly over the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Set aside to cool completely. In a medium saucepan, heat the milk over medium heat. Add the chocolate chips and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in the peanut butter until smooth. Add the chocolate mixture to the prepared pan and spread to the edges of the cookie layer with an offset spatula. Refrigerate for 30 minutes until the fudge is firm. Remove the pan from the refrigerator and top with the chopped chocolate chips and chopped peanuts. Refrigerate for 1 hour before cutting into squares to serve. Keep in the refrigerator for

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a skillet. Remove from heat before it becomes smoking hot. Dice kielbasa into 1/2-inch chunks. Saute until brown. Remove from pan. Pour out the rendered fat. Mix pizza sauce and kielbasa into a bowl. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta and toss together with the pizza mixture. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over top. Makes 4 servings.

Pour the milk into a heavy saucepan. Bring to boiling. Remove from heat. Stir in honey. Cool to lukewarm. Stir in egg yolks. When cool enough to handle, beat in whipping cream. Pour into ice cream maker and follow manufacturer's instructions. Fold in bananas and walnuts. Freeze 4 hours or overnight.

Cover chicken breasts with buttermilk ranch dressing. Set aside for at least 30 minutes. In a medium bowl combine garlic, olive oil and savory. Whisk in seasonings. Place chicken in a grilling pan coated with cooking spray. Brush with olive oil. Grill chicken until no longer pink in center. Serve with grilled vegetables and a green salad.

Place cilantro, garlic, jalapeno and soy sauce into a blender with one cup of water. Blend on high speed for about 2 minutes or until smooth. Heat vegetable oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Season halibut with salt and pepper and sear on both sides for about 2 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Spoon pesto over halibut on each plate. Top with potatoes that have been cooked in boiling water for about five minutes or until fork tender. Serve halibut with pesto immediately over potatoes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 teaspoons of extra virgin olive oil. Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper. Place salmon fillets in skillet. Cook for 5 minutes or until golden brown. Drain off excess oil. Transfer to a 1-1/2-qt glass baking dish. Drizzle with lemon juice. Spread zucchini and squash over salmon. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake 5 to 7 minutes or until zucchini is tender. Top with tomatoes. Sprinkle with basil. Serve with lemon wedges.

Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add potato chips to pan and cook for 2 minutes until crispy. Add salmon fillets to pan and cook for 2 minutes until seared on both sides. Add dijon mustard and brown sugar to pan and cook until bubbly and thickened. Remove from heat and add white balsamic and white wine. Spoon into serving dish and garnish with sesame seeds and fresh dill sprigs. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Heat oil and butter together over medium heat until butter melts and the mixture is foamy. Add the onions and thyme and cook until the onions are soft and translucent and the thyme is fragrant but not burnt. Season with salt and black pepper. Transfer the onions to a large bowl and toss with the butter and oil mixture until well coated. Place the onions in a shallow baking dish and bake for 40-50 minutes until golden brown and caramelized. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. In a large pot over medium heat, heat olive oil and saute onion until translucent. Add beef and sausage and brown. Add wine and cook until most has evaporated. Add tomatoes and cook until mixture thickens slightly. Season with kosher salt and fresh ground black pepper. Add veal and continue cooking until meat is tender and sauce is thick. Add hot red pepper flakes if desired. Serve over pasta with grated pecorino romano.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drainset aside. In medium bowl, combine cucumber, green pepper, cheese, dressingtoss gently to coat. Transfer to large bowladd pasta. Toss gently. Makes 4 servings.

In a small saucepan, saute the garlic, red pepper flakes and basil in the butter over medium heat. Stir in the spinach and heat until wilted. Drain in a colander. Return sauce to pan. In a large skillet, cook chicken until no longer pink. Drain. Stir in cooked fettuccine. Add spinach mixture. Stir in parmesan cheese. Top with tomato slices. Serve immediately.

Preheat grill. Oil grill and place focaccia loaves onto grill. Close lid and grill for 2 minutes. Remove grill lid and flip focaccia over onto a cutting board. Remove bread from grill. Place slices of bacon onto a cookie sheet lined with foil and place into oven until crisp. Remove from oven and drain bacon. Drizzle olive oil over the top of each focaccia loaf. Spread with a thin layer of scamorza cheese. Place spinach leaves and slices of crisp bacon onto the focaccia. Serve immediately.

Peel and slice the potatoes. Slice the bell peppers. Slice the garlic cloves. In a large bowl combine the potatoes, bell peppers, garlic cloves, coriander, ras el hanout and the sea salt. In a large saut pan add the olive oil and then heat on medium. Once the pan is hot add the spiced potatoes. Cook the potatoes until they are softened but not mushy. Once the potatoes are cooked add the flaked sea salt and the red chili pepper flakes. Cook for about another minute. Add the red bell peppers and garlic cloves. Cook for another minute. Once the vegetables are cooked add the lemon juice and the zest. Mix everything together and then serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Season duck breasts with salt and pepper to taste and place on a baking sheet. Bake duck breasts for 10 minutes or until cooked through (do not overcook). Remove from oven and allow to cool. In a saucepan, combine the raspberries, vinegar, water and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook for 30 minutes or until the raspberry mixture has thickened slightly and the berries have broken down and become jam-like. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool slightly. Meanwhile, place the duck breasts in a large bowl and drizzle with the raspberry sauce. Toss to coat and sprinkle with the cinnamon and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature with your favorite salad and a crisp sauvignon blanc. Pair with a crisp sauvignon blanc or other white wine with a touch of sweetness and acidity.

Mix 1/2 cup warm water with yeast. Stir in 2 1/2 cups flour. Stir in 1 tsp salt. Knead. Beat with a wooden spoon or a hand mixer until the dough is smooth and elastic. Set in a warm place and let rise until doubled in size. Punch down the dough. Divide into 4 parts. Shape each part into a 16-inch rope. Braid. Set aside. In a mixing bowl, combine 1/2 cup olive oil, 1/2 cup sugar and 1 1/2 tsp black pepper. Mix well. Set aside. In a saucepan, melt 1/2 cup butter. Stir in 1/2 cup brown sugar. Cook over low heat until mixture is slightly thickened. Remove from heat. Add 3 tbs of the oil mixture. Add 1/2 cup flour. Mix well. Add the remaining oil mixture. Stir in the braided dough. Continue stirring until the dough is smooth. Divide the dough into 4 equal parts. Form each part into a

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add green beans and cook until tender. Drain. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the onion in the oil until tender. Add the cream of mushroom soup and cook until heated through. Stir in the green beans. Sprinkle in the Velveeta cheese, stirring until melted. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Prepare a baking sheet by lining it with non-stick cooking spray or a light dusting of flour. In a large mixing bowl combine the eggs and the cornflake crumbs. Add the pecans, sugar, salt and black pepper and stir to mix well. Dip the drumsticks into the egg mixture and then coat with the cornflake crumb mix. Place the coated drumsticks in the prepared baking sheet and then in the oven and bake for 15 minutes or until the drumsticks are browned.

Spread butter over 1 side of 1 slice of breadsprinkle with lemon juice, Worcestershire, garlic salt, 1/4 cup of crabmeat, 1/2 teaspoon of chives. Top with second slice of breadbutter top of sandwich. Broil 2 minutes or until golden brown.

Prepare pie crust according to package directionscrumbles on bottom and sides of pie shell. Pour cream cheese into pie shellcover with sugar and milk. Sprinkle with coconutset aside. Combine Cool Whip and almond extractspread over coconut layerchill until serving time.

Wash eggplants and pat dry. Slice eggplants lengthwise and then crosswise. Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add eggplant and saute until golden brown. Remove from heat and drain on paper towel. Mix together all remaining ingredients. Spread in shallow dish and refrigerate.
Mix mayonnaise and anchovies in medium bowl. Add capers and cucumbers. Mix well. Add remaining ingredients. Mix well.

Brown steaks in olive oil until browned on both sides and medium rare inside. Drain oil from pan and return steaks to pan. Add soup and onion soup mix and stir until onion soup mix has dissolved. Add noodles and cook until noodles are tender and drain well. Remove steaks and set aside. Add remaining soup and mushrooms and continue cooking until mushrooms have softened slightly and onion soup mix has dissolved. Serve steaks with gravy over the noodles.

Cook noodles according to instructions on box. While noodles are cooking prepare sauce by mixing alfredo sauce and spaghetti sauce together. After noodles have cooked and drained put them into a 9x13 baking pan. Add half the alfredo sauce and then add 1/2 of the mozzarella and 1/2 of the parmesan. Add half the spaghetti sauce and then add rest of the noodles. Repeat with sauce and noodles. Finally add the rest of the alfredo and the rest of the mozzarella and parmesan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Serve and enjoy.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook green beans and carrots until crisp tender. Drain well. Meanwhile melt 1 tsp butter in a small saucepancook and stir onion in butter over medium heat for 2 minutes or until tender. Stir garlic and seasonings into onion mixturecook for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Stir mushrooms into onion mixturecook for 1 minute or until mushrooms release liquid. Drain beans and carrots welladd them to onion mixture with remaining 1 tsp butter. Cook for 3 minutes over medium-low heat or until heated throughstir occasionally. Serve warm with favorite recipe for pot roast or turkey dinner.

Mix the mustard, balsamic vinegar, maple syrup, salt and black pepper in a small bowl. Brush fish with the glaze and bake at 400 degrees f for 35-40 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

Soak beans overnight or at least 12 hours. Drain beans, rinse under cold running water to remove any extra soaking water. In a medium saucepan, add beans, garlic cloves, onion, salt, and pepper to 1 1/2 cups of water. Bring to a boilreduce heat to a simmercook until beans are tender but still retain their shape, about 45 minutes. Drain and transfer beans to a large bowl with a slotted spoonset aside. In a small bowl, whisk together red wine vinegar, olive oil, parsley, sugar, salt, and black pepper until well combinedadd to beans along with corn. Toss beans until coated with the dressingcover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 3 days. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

In a shallow dish combine creole seasoning, all purpose flour and water. Place pork chops in the seasoning and coat both sides. In a large skillet over medium heat heat the oil. Brown pork chops in hot oil. Add onions and saute until tender. Serve over rice.

Cut off ends of asparagus & break stems into pieces. Cook asparagus in boiling salted water about 5 minutes. Drain well. Place asparagus on buttered baking sheet & bake about 10 minutes. In mean time beat egg lightly with 2 tbsp water. Add asparagus & stir gently until well coated. Place on baking sheet & bake until browned. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Sauté onion in butter over medium heat until tender. Add brown sugar and flour and stir until mixture thickens slightly (about 3 minutes). Add stock to mixture in pan and bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes until thickened. Add salt and pepper to taste. Place bread slices on bottom of a large soup tureen or individual bowls and ladle soup over bread slices. Place parmesan cheese on top of each bowl or soup tureen and top with a sprig of fresh parsley. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine all dry ingredients. In another bowl, mix liquid ingredients. Add liquids to dry and stir. Fold in zucchini and nuts. Spoon batter into 2 greased 9 x 5 x 3 inch loaf pans. Bake for 50 minutes or until wooden pick inserted into center of bread comes out clean. Cool in pan for 5 minutes. Remove from pans and cool on wire rack.

Combine miso, sake and 1/2 cup hot water in bowl. Stir well to dissolve miso completelyset aside. Heat oil in skillet until hot but not smoking. Add steaks and cook until browned on one side, about 2 minutes. Turn steaks over and add miso mixture to pan. Cook until reduced by 1/3 to 1/2, about 5 minutes. Stir steaks to coat with saucecook until meat is done to taste. Transfer steaks to platter, sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve at once.

Melt butter and chocolate over low heat. Remove from the heat and stir in rum and sour cream until blended. In a large bowl, toss bananas with the sauce until evenly coated and gently place on a sheet pan coated with nonstick spray. Refrigerate until set before serving.

Bring half-and-half to a boil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Gradually whisk in sugar and cornstarch until smooth. Stir in milk and cook until thickened and bubbly. Remove from the heatstir in peanut butter until smooth. Stir in vanilla extract until well blended. Pour into 4 bowlstop with whipped cream and chocolate curls.

Roll out dough. Spread with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Layer with cheese and pineapple. Bake on pizza stone for 10 minutes. Remove from stone and sprinkle with onion and prosciutto. Roll up pizza and slice into rounds.
Mix turkey and beef together in a large bowl until well blended. Add bread crumbs, eggs yolk, salt and pepper. Mix well. Form into kebabs. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 30 minutes.

Bring broth and water to a boil and stir in pasta. Cook for 8 minutes or until tenderdrain well. Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heatcook onion and garlic until tender. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually stir in cream of mushroom soup and milkcook for 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir in tuna and cheesecook over medium heat for 10 minutes or until cheese melts. Stir in macaroni and mix wellstir in the breadcrumbs. Place a greased baking dish on a cookie sheetpour the pasta mixture into baking dish and dot top evenly with butter. Bake for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Makes 6 servings.

Cut apples in half. Core and cut in half again. Place in a baking dish. Mix the sugar and cinnamon and sprinkle evenly on the apples. Mix flour and oats together and sprinkle over the apples. Sift together the remaining dry ingredients. Cut in the butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Pour over apples and stir gently. Bake at 350 degrees for about an hour.

In a large pot, heat the butter over medium heat and add the potatoes and salt and pepper. Cook and stir the potatoes until tender but not mushy, about 10 minutes. Add the green and red bell peppers and cook for 5 minutes more. Add the chili powder and cook and stir until blended well and the potatoes are tender. Add the fresh chopped chives and serve hot.

Remove the stems from the peppers. Cut out the seeds and membranes. In a small bowl, combine the cream cheese and garlic sausage. Using a pastry bag with a large star tip or a small spoon, stuff the peppers with the cream cheese mixture. Place the peppers on a serving platter and drizzle with mayonnaise. Garnish with the green onions.

Combine coleslaw mix in large bowl. Add almonds, sunflower seeds, and toss. Add butter. In small saucepan over medium heat melt butter. Add ramen noodles and green onions. Cook for 2 minutes. Add to coleslaw mixture. Combine all dressing ingredients in small bowl. Whisk well to blend. Pour over coleslaw mixture and toss. Let stand at room temperature 30 minutes before serving.

Preheat the oven to 180c (fan) 200c (conventional). Grease and line a 20cm (8in) square cake tin. Melt the margarine and sugar in a small saucepan over a gentle heat. Stir in the vanilla essence. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool slightly. Whisk the eggs and egg whites together in a large bowl. Add the gluten-free yogurt and mix until just combined. Add the cooled margarine mixture and stir until combined. Whisk the polenta with some of the orange juice until smooth. Fold the polenta mixture into the batter and mix well. Pour the batter into the prepared cake tin and smooth the top. Sprinkle with the desiccated coconut and orange rind. Bake for 25-30 minutes until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Meanwhile, strain the orange juice. Brush the warm cake with a little of the orange juice and sprinkle with the remaining desiccated coconut. Cool the cake in the tin for 10

In a large skillet cook shrimp in olive oil over medium heat until opaque throughout. Add the Key Lime juice, creole seasoning, garlic powder. Bring to a boil. Cook for 2 more minutes. Serve over rice. You can also make this in a crock-pot. Just cook everything except for the shrimp. Add shrimp 10 minutes before serving. Serve over rice.

Soak the watercress briefly to soften the leaves. Stir the tahini paste into the miso until it forms a creamy paste. Stir the miso paste into the soy sauce until the consistency is that of a creamy dressing. Stir the tahini into the dressing. Chop the watercress into bite size pieces. Place the watercress into a large salad bowl or serving dish. Pour the miso dressing over the watercress, tossing with a spoon. Serve immediately or chill for about 15 minutes before serving. Serve with crackers or slices of crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Unroll the dough rolls and separate into 12 pieces. Spread 1 teaspoon of brown sugar over each piece. Roll each piece and place seam side down into a greased muffin pan. Spread 1/4 cup of butterscotch pudding mix over each and sprinkle with chopped pecans and a little more brown sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Allow rolls to cool for 15 minutes before removing from pan.

Cook egg noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large mixing bowl, combine egg noodles, sour cream, cream cheese, kosher salt and pepper. Mix together until well combined. Fold in chili and cheddar. Pour into greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining cheddar. Bake until heated through and top is golden brown. Let cool before serving.

In a pot of water boil the chicken. When the chicken is almost cooked, remove the meat from the pot. Set aside. Put the rest of the water into the pot. Boil. When the water has come to a boil add the garlic. Add the soy sauce, peppercorn, vinegar and salt. Put the meat into the pot. Bring to a boil. Cook for 3-5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Put the meat on top of the pineapple tidbits. Pour the pineapple syrup over the meat. Let the meat stand for about 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Cut bananas in half and place in food processor. Blend until bananas are mushy (you may have to do this in batches). Add vanilla extract and coconut oil to the food processor and mix well. Add coconut to mixture. Transfer to large mixing bowl. Add rolled oats, almond meal, coconut, cinnamon, sea salt and baking powder to food processor and pulse until mixture is crumbly. Pour crumb mixture into banana mixture in large mixing bowl. Mix with hands until everything is combined well. Scoop dough onto cookie sheet with about 1 inch space between each cookie. Bake for about 12-15 minutes or until cookies are golden brown around the edges. Let cookies cool for 10 minutes before removing from cookie sheet. These cookies will last for about 5 days in an air-tight container in the refrigerator or about 2 weeks in the freezer. Store in the freezer in an air-tight container for up to 3 months. To thaw in the refrigerator over night for

Bring to a boil 2 1/2 cups of water with 1 tablespoon of butter with 1/2 teaspoon of curry powder in a large pot or Dutch oven. Add 1 head of cauliflower broken into large florets. Cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain water from cauliflower into a bowlreserve broth from cauliflower in pot. Add 3 cups of broth from cauliflower to pot. Add 2 cups of water to cauliflower broth in potadd 2 teaspoons of butter with 1/2 teaspoon of curry powder to cauliflower broth in pot. Add 1 head of chopped green cabbage to pot with cauliflower brothadd 1/2 head of chopped red cabbage to pot with cauliflower brothadd 2 tablespoons of chopped celery to pot with cauliflower brothadd 1/2 of a chopped yellow onion to pot with cauliflower brothadd 1 1/2

Remove all skin from the salmon fillets. Season salmon with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Place fillets on a foil-covered baking sheet. Combine the garlic with 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 1/8 teaspoon of pepper. Rub garlic mixture onto the salmon fillets. In a small bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of butter with 1/4 teaspoon of lemon juice. Rub the garlic mixture onto the salmon fillets. Place the foil-covered baking sheet in the oven and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven. Place the lemon slices on each salmon fillet. Serve with a lemon wedge. Serves 4.

Mash avocados in medium bowl. Add garlic salt. Stir in cottage cheese until smooth. Add lemon juice. Taste and add more garlic salt if desired. Spoon into tortillas. Layer with taco sauce, salsa, cheddar cheese, sprouts, and tomatoes. Roll up.

In a medium saucepan, saut onions in butter until tender and translucent. Stir in basil and season with salt and pepper. Add orange juice and bring to a boil. Add snap peas and carrots and stir. Reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender. Stir in fresh parsley and orange zest and season with salt and pepper. Serve over rice or in a lettuce leaf.

Prepare prawns as per packet directions. Drain & set aside. In large saucepan with lid heat oil over medium heat & sautee garlic until fragrant- about one minute. Add pumpkin & stir until golden brown- about 2-3 minutes. Add lime juice & chilli & stir until heated through- about one minute. Add prawns & stir until heated through- about one minute. Add baby spinach & stir until heated through- about one minute. Remove from heat & toss with pumpkin mixture & season with fish sauce & chicken stock. Serve over prawns & sprinkle with chilli pepper jam & chilli flakes- if desired.

Peel turnips. Cut turnips into 1-inch cubes. Cut potatoes into 1-inch cubes. Pour milk into a large bowl. Add yogurt. Add turnip cubes. Toss to coat. Pour in bread crumbs. Add onions. Sprinkle with pepper and salt. Cover. Let stand at room temperature for 4 hours. Drain turnip mixture. Place in a lightly greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with dried parsley. Bake uncovered for 40 to 50 minutes or until tender. Serve with melted butter.

Mix mayonnaise and cheeses in a small bowl until smooth. Place on top of sourdough loaf. Cut loaf in half. Spread cheese mixture on each half. Roll up loaf halves and place on a foil-covered cookie sheet. Brush tops with melted butter and bake in a preheated 350 degree fahrenheit oven for approximately 10 minutes or until crisp and golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch (23 x 33 cm) baking dish. In a large bowl, stir together the flour and the sugar. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. In a separate bowl, beat together the vinegar, oil and water. Pour the wet ingredients into the well in the dry ingredients. Add the crushed pineapple and the apples. Toss together. Spread the mixture evenly in the prepared dish. Sprinkle the peanuts evenly over the top of the salad. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven, until the salad is set. Cool completely on a wire rack. In a small bowl, beat the whipped topping until soft peaks form. Spread the whipped topping evenly over the top of the salad. Let stand until firm. Cover and refrigerate until serving time.

Peel potatoes, boil them with salt in water until almost cooked. Drain them in water then mash them with a fork (or potato masher) in a large bowl until they are completely cooked. Heat olive oil in a pan on medium heat with cumin and cilantro seedswait until they sizzle (30 seconds). Drain them in paper towel then add them to potatoes in pot. In another pan put water in it and put it on fire, wait until it boils then add lemon juice (1/2 cup) to it. Pour it in potatoes then add harissa to it. Mix all together then add salt to it (1/2 tsp).

Place the brisket in a large pot. Add the stout, brown sugar and water. Bring to a boil. Cover the pot. Reduce the heat to low. Cook the brisket 2-3 hours or until tender. Remove the brisket from the pot. Shred the meat. Place the meat in a 5-6 quart saucepan. Add the potato and carrot. Stir in the Guinness stout. Cook for 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Serve over rice. Makes 12 servings.

Prepare bread for toasting. Brown ground beef and onions in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sour cream and Worcestershire sauce and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add tomato and bell pepper and cook for 2 minutes more, stirring frequently to break up the tomatoes. Place the top of the sandwich on the bottom half of the bread and spread with the cooked beef mixture. Sprinkle the cheese over the top of the sandwich and broil for 1 to 2 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve hot.

Heat 1/2 tablespoon of the oil in a large pan over medium-low heat. Add 1/2 of the zucchini (and any squash blossoms) to the pan. Cook for 2 minutes or until golden brown. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining zucchini (and squash blossoms). Clean the pan. In the same pan over medium heat, add the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of oil. Add 1/2 of the zucchini (and any squash blossoms) to the pan. Cook for 2 minutes or until golden brown. Transfer to a plate. Clean the pan. In the same pan over medium heat, add 1/4 cup of the chickpea flour. Add 1/4 teaspoon of each of the spices (garam masala, curry powder) and salt. Cook for 2 minutes or until fragrant. Slowly add the remaining 1/2 cup of chickpea flour. Add 1/3 cup of water and cook for 3 minutes. Add 1/2 of zucchini (and

Spread softened cream cheese onto angel food cake slices with a knife or small spatula. Spoon pie filling onto each slice of angel food cake, reserving some of the pie filling for decorating later. Dip a small knife into the remaining pie filling so that some of it is still attached to the knife blade. Dip the knife into the softened whipped topping (enough to get some of the topping attached to the blade) and swirl it over the top of the cake slices to make pretty designs. Serve immediately or freeze up to 1 week. The whipped topping will not freeze as firmly as the cream cheese layer but it will not melt and the cake will still be delicious after thawing. To thaw, place the pan of cake in the refrigerator overnight.

Rinse fillets under cold running water. Pat dry with paper towels and place in an ovenproof dish. Spoon a little soy sauce over fillets. Place ginger slices, soy sauce and sesame oil into a small bowl, mix well and drizzle over fillets. Cover dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate 12-24 hours. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bake in preheated oven 8-10 minutes depending on thickness of fillets. Serve with steamed vegetables or rice. Garnish with green onion.

Beat egg whites until frothy. Add cream of tartar and salt. Beat until frothy again. Gradually add sugar. Add cocoa and coffee. Fold in coconut. Drop by teaspoon onto greased baking sheet. Bake for 40 minutes at 350.

Bring water to boil. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in raspberries and kirsch. Place into ice cube trays and freeze. Once frozen, remove cubes from trays and store in freezer until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut pork chops in half or thirds depending on thickness. Coat chops in olive oil and salt and pepper to taste. Place on baking sheet in oven until lightly browned on both sides. Remove from oven and add apples to pork chops in pan and sprinkle with garlic. Pour white wine over chops. Place pan in oven until meat is cooked through, about 25 minutes.

Cut head of cabbage in half. Slice each half in half again. Cut each half in half again. Cut each half into thirds. Cut each piece into thirds again. Place cabbage in a large bowl. Sprinkle with salt and sugar. Place in refrigerator for several days. Drain well. Add remaining ingredients and toss. Refrigerate. Makes approximately one pound.

In a medium bowl, combine the buckwheat flour, all-purpose gluten-free flour, baking powder, salt and sugar. In a small bowl, combine the milk and the egg whites. Add the milk mixture alternately with the oil until well blended. Pour the batter into a greased 9x5x3-in. loaf pan. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake at 350f for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool 10 minutes before removing from the pan.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add chorizo and cook until browned and crisp, about 5 minutes more. Add celery and garlic. Cook until garlic is softened, about 3 minutes more. Add lentils and cook until they start to sizzle. Add chicken stock, thyme sprigs, red wine vinegar and salt & pepper. Bring to a boil then reduce heat and let simmer until lentils are tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in red wine vinegarseason with salt & pepper. Serve hot.

In a blender add the kiwifruit and passion fruit. Blend until smooth. Add the lemon juice and zest. Blend well. Add the water and sugar. Blend well. Pour into 12 x 12 inch glass dish. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Remove from the refrigerator and allow to come to room temperature. Using a spatula, loosen the sides of the sorbet. Then pour the sorbet into 12 serving dishes. Allow to set for 1 hour at room temperature. Then refrigerate. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream.

Cream butter with sugar until light and fluffy. Add honey and beat until fluffy. Add the dry ingredients slowly, beating until well mixed. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets. Bake at 400 degrees for about 8 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.

Combine hazelnuts, dried apple, raisins and honey. Set aside. Whip the eggs and sugar together until thick and lemon colored. Add vanilla. Incorporate flour mixture. Fold in nuts. Spoon batter into a greased 10x15 pan. Bake at 400f for about an hour or until a tester inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool cake. Frost cake with lemon frosting.

Place some refried beans in the bottom of the tortilla then add the chilies and sprinkle some garlic powder over top and a little cumin. Roll up the tortilla to enclose the filling. Heat in the oven at 375f for about 10-15 minutes. You may need to wrap them in tin foil to prevent them burning as they may stick to the tray. If you have no oven you may microwave for 2 minutes. Serve with extra cumin for those who like extra spicy flavours!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat the yogurt in a large bowl until smooth. Stir in the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Stir in almonds. Spoon the batter into a greased loaf pan. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the bread comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Heat oil in wok or large skillet on high heat. Add pork stirring occasionally until brown on all sides. Transfer to slow cooker. Add garlic cloves, gingerroot to skillet and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant. Add broth, soy sauce, water and stir to combine. Add pork to cooker and stir in noodles. Cook on high for 20 minutes or low for 40 minutes or until noodles are tender. Add carrot and red bell peppers to cooker. Cover and cook 10 minutes or until carrot is tender. Garnish with fresh spinach leaves just before serving.

Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add the onions and saute until softened and golden brown (about 15 minutes). Add the mushrooms and saute until tender (about 5 minutes). Add salt and pepper and the half-and-half (heavy cream). Stir well until sauce thickens. Add the dry sherry and stir until blended. Serve over pasta.

Defrost rolls (not thawed) and preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Slice rolls lengthwise (with sharp knife) into 1/3 thick slices (not completely through). Place rolls cut-side down on a baking sheet, then brush with melted butter (use a pastry brush). Sprinkle each roll with garlic powder and onion powdersprinkle with fresh parsley if desired. Bake rolls 10 to 15 minutes until golden brownserve warm.

Rub steak with worcestershire sauce mixture and season with salt and pepper. Grill steak about 6 minutes per side for rare or 8 minutes per side for medium. Let rest 10 minutes on cutting board and serve warm.

Cut the refrigerated buttermilk biscuits in half. Place one-half of each biscuit on a dinner plate. Top each half of the biscuit with 1/2 tablespoon of the dressing. Sprinkle each half of the biscuit with 1 tablespoon of shredded parmesan cheese. Place 1 tablespoon of poppy seed mixture on each biscuit half. Serve immediately.

Cream butter and sugar. Add bananas and beat until smooth. Add the starter. Stir in the eggs. Mix the dry ingredients. Add to the creamed mixture. Fold in nuts. Pour into well greased and floured loaf pan. Bake in preheated oven at 350f. for 1 hour. Cool in pan for 10 minutes and remove from pan and cool on rack.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Slice eggplant lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place on nonstick aluminum foil lined rimmed baking sheet. Sprinkle with pepper and garlic powder. Drizzle with olive oil. Roast for 15 minutes. Turn eggplant and continue roasting for 15 more minutes or until eggplant is tender. You may also roast the eggplant in the oven for 30 minutes without the olive oil for a crispier texture. Use slices in pasta dishes, soups or stews. You may also spread on toast topped with cheese or use as part of an appetizer platter.
In a large bowl, combine broil and onion. Put beef and onion into a crock pot. Put stewed tomatoes and wine into the crock pot. Put on the lid. Cook for 4 hours on low. Serve.

Put the roasted peanuts in a food processor or blender with the garlic, onions, red curry paste and fish sauce. Blend until smooth. Gradually add coconut milk and blend to incorporate. Add lime juice. With the food processor running, slowly add the palm sugar until dissolved. Transfer to a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the chicken stock until the sauce thickens slightly. Remove from the heat. Transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with lime wedges. Serve with your favorite protein.
Mix dry ingredients together. Add wet ingredients to dry and mix. Pour into loaf pan and bake at 400 degrees for 40 minutes or until tester comes out clean.

Combine dried fruit and glace fruit in a bowl. Add port wine and stir until blended. Add cream cheese and stir until blended. Add orange rind and poppy seed and mix well. Put mixture in refrigerator and chill for 1 hour. Roll out chilled cream cheese mixture on plastic wrap to desired thickness. Roll up in plastic wrap and chill again for 1 hour. Remove plastic wrap and slice rolls in 1/2 inch thick pieces.

Combine salt and beer. Stir honey, dry mustard and lemon juice into beer mixture. Place sparerib racks into beer mixture. Cover and marinate for 4 hours. Drain. Place ribs on grill. Grill for 15 minutes. Turn racks and grill for 15 more minutes. Cover and grill 20 minutes more.

Preheat oven to 180C. Place bread slices into a large ziplock bag. Add pasta sauce and basil to the bag. Push out excess air from bag. Place fish into the bag. Add parmesan cheese to bag. Press out air from bag. Carefully seal bag. Gently squeeze to press out air. Place into oven proof dish. Pour 250ml boiling water over the bag. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve with steamed vegetables. 2p each.
Trim green beans of tough ends. Wash beans, drain well. Combine beans with remaining ingredientstoss gently. Refrigerate several hours before serving.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and sauté until translucent (about 4 minutes). Add mushrooms and red bell pepper and sauté for another 2 minutes. Add garlic cloves and sauté for another 2 minutes until garlic is fragrant. Add chicken breast and salt and pepper and sauté for 4-5 minutes or until done. Combine mustard and sour cream and add to chicken mixture and simmer until chicken is cooked through. Garnish with parmesan cheese and serve warm.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook corn in large saucepan of boiling water until corn is tender-crisp, 3 to 5 minutes. Drain. Add butter to corn. In a blender or food processor, purée corn mixture, onion, rosemary, turmeric, cornmeal, heavy cream, and black pepper until smooth, about 30 seconds. Pour into a large bowl and stir in remaining 1/2 tablespoon of butter until incorporated. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 4 hours.

Cut fish into 4 x 1-inch pieces. Heat oil in a saucepan on medium-high heat. Add fish and cook for about 4 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Add cumin seeds and curry leaves and cook for 1 minute. Add garlic and green pepper and cook for about 2 minutes more or until fragrant. Add coriander leaves and cook for 1 minute or until leaves turn deep green and soften. Add turmeric and curry powder and cook for about 1 minute more. Remove from heat and let cool for about 10 minutes. Whisk in lemon juice and coriander chutney and toss with fish. Serve hot or cold on a bed of lettuce leaves and tomato wedges or with rice and naan (Indian bread). Makes about 4 servings.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Meanwhile saute onion and red pepper with vegetable oil until tender. Add broccoli florets and cook 3 minutes. Stir in mustard and water. Add cream of chicken soup. Stir to combine. Add cooked pasta and chicken. Stir to combine. Bake for 30 minutes at 350. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

Mix 1/4 cup of hot sauce with 1/4 cup of buttermilk and 1 tablespoon of dijon mustard in a bowl. Add 1/4 cup of hot sauce to 1 cup of buttermilk and 1 teaspoon of dijon mustard in another bowl. Stir and set aside. Dip each piece of chicken in one of the hot sauce/buttermilk mixtures. Shake off excess. Dip in corn flakes mixture and shake off excess. Place coated pieces in a large bowl with remaining corn flakes mixture. Cover and marinade for 10 to 15 minutes. Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Spray skillet with cooking spray. Cook chicken for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until done.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with foil. Slice sweet potatoes in half lengthwise. Toss with 2 tablespoons of the butter and season with 1 teaspoon of the salt and 1 teaspoon of the pepper. Layer sweet potatoes in a single layer in the prepared pan. Combine the apple pie filling and the remaining 2 tablespoons of the butter in a small bowl and spread evenly over the sweet potatoes. Roast for 20 minutes or until the filling is hot and the potatoes are tender. Top with the cranberry sauce and apricot preserves. Bake for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cook spaghetti according to directions. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl combine soup and milk. Stir in tuna and noodles. Cook over medium heat until heated through and mixture is well combined. Combine the soup mixture with remaining cheeses. Pour mixture into a buttered 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake until heated through and top is lightly browned. Cool slightly before serving.

In a large bowl, combine the first eight ingredients and beat with a heavy spoon until well blended. In a separate bowl, beat the egg and stir into the batter. Fold in the rum and nutmeg. Fill greased muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake at 400 for about 10-15 minutes or until done (use toothpick in middle to determine doneness).

Wash strawberries and cut into 1 inch pieces. Toss strawberries and cointreau together. In a small saucepan combine the cream and the dark chocolate. Cook over low heat stirring constantly until melted. Remove from heat and whisk in the strawberries. Chill for 30 minutes before serving.

In a medium bowl toss together orange segments, avocado, onion and jalapenos. Add olive oil and lime juice. Mix well. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with remaining olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Place on a plate. Grill mahi mahi fillets for 5-7 minutes on each side. Place fillet on top of salsa. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a food processor, add oil and sugar and process until light and fluffy. Add flour and process for 1 minute. Add eggs, one at a time and vanilla extract and process for 30 seconds. Transfer batter to baking sheet and smooth into an 8 x 10 inch rectangle. Bake for 20 minutes until edges are golden brown. Cool completely and cut into 2 x 2 inch squares. Roll each cookie into half walnut pieces and place 1/4 inch apart on a parchment paper lined baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes until light golden brown. Cool on a wire rack.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium-high heat and saute apple and onion until tender, about 5 minutes. Add red cabbage and saute until cabbage has softened and is bright red and purple. Dissolve flour in vinegar and wine in a separate bowladd to cabbage and stir to blend well. Add sugar and seasoning and continue to cook and stir until thickened. Remove from heat and keep warmserve hot.
Stir together strawberries, juice and zest. Set aside. In small bowl stir together yogurt and sugar. Add yogurt mixture to strawberries. Stir in liqueur. Serve immediately.

Mix butter and sugar together in mixing bowl and mix on medium-high speed for several minutes until light and fluffy. Add eggs and beat until incorporated. Add vanilla extract and beat again until combined. Add flour and beat until combined with no lumps remaining. Add baking soda and salt and beat until combined with no lumps remaining. Fold in Rice Krispies and chocolate chips and mix well with spoon or large spatula. Drop batter by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for about 12 minutes or until golden brown.

Beat cream cheese in bowl until smooth and fluffy. Add pineapple, pecans and peppers. Beat well. Add seasoning salt and beat again until well mixed. Roll and shape into ball shape. Place on wax paper and refrigerate for at least an hour or overnight.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8 inch square baking pan with butter (optional). Whisk together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder and salt in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachmentset aside. Combine the light corn syrup and egg whites in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachmentbeat for 3 minutes. Reduce the speed to low and add the flour mixture and vanillabeat for another 3 minutes or just until the flour is incorporated and the dough is smooth and elastic in texture. Transfer the dough to the prepared panpress the dough into the pan and smooth the top with the back of the spoon. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the cookies are puffy and the tops are just barely set in the center. Transfer the pan to a wire rack and let cool completely before cutting into squares. Store cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days.
In blender combine green tea, honey, banana and berries. Blend until smooth and slushie consistency is reached. Serve immediately.

Combine water, beer, brown sugar and cornstarch and heat to boiling stirring constantly. Stir in sausage pieces and vinegar. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes or until thickened and sauce coats the sausage. Stir in mustard and horseradish. Serve over hot cooked noodles or rice.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray. In large bowl, beat pumpkin puree, evaporated milk, eggs, sugar and salt with electric mixer until fluffy. Beat in cake mix. Fold in pecans. Pour mixture into baking dish. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake 45 minutes. Cool. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Top with whipped topping.

Wash and shave cabbage with the tougher outside leaves removed. Slice finely. In a large bowl, add cabbage and toss with vinegar and pepper. Slice carrots and green onions and add to cabbage. Toss with salt and pepper. To make dressing, whisk together vinegar, oil, and sugar. Pour over cabbage and toss. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cook pasta shells according to package directions. Drain. Spray a 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray. Place chicken breasts in baking dish. Cover with cooked pasta shells. In a large bowl, mix together mushroom and chicken soup. Pour mixture over shells. Mix together butter, onion soup mix, french-fried onions. Pour mixture over shells. Sprinkle mild cheddar cheese evenly over shells. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes until heated through. Serves 8.
Preheat oven to 375. Wash and dry the potatoes. Place potatoes in an 11x7 baking dish. Mix the ranch dressing and sour cream. Pour over potatoes. Sprinkle with bacon bits and cheese. Bake for 1 hour.
Cream together strawberry preserves and cream cheese. Unroll each dinner roll and spread with strawberry mixture. Roll up each roll. Serve with strawberry sauce.

Spread peanut butter on one side of each slice of bread. Place banana slices in a single layer in a shallow pan. Layer the slices of bread peanut butter side down over banana slices. In another shallow pan, beat together eggs, milk and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Pour the egg mixture over sandwiches. In a small saucepan, bring water to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook toast until golden brown.

Mix all the fruit and vegetables together in a large bowl or container. Add the yogurt and mix well with the fruit and vegetables. Add the coconut and marshmallows and mix well. Cover and refrigerate overnight for the flavors to blend together.

Prepare a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer. Add flour, sugar and cranberries. Set aside. In a small mixing bowl combine baking powder and salt. Add oil, vanilla and almond extracts. Set aside. In a large mixing bowl beat eggs until foamy. Add dry mixture. In another large mixing bowl beat together oil and sugar until creamy. Add in eggs and vanilla and almond extracts. Add dry mixture and beat until smooth. Add in cranberries and chocolate. Drop dough by heaping teaspoons onto baking sheets. Bake until lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Cool on wire racks.
Blend all together in a blender. Pour mixture into a glass. Garnish with whipped cream.

Heat barbecued pork and barbecue sauce in a saucepan over medium heat. Meanwhile, in another saucepan melt 1/4 cup butter. Add 2 cups flour tortillas and heat until soft. Place tortillas on a plate. Top each tortilla with barbecued pork and a sprinkle of cheese. Close tortilla and place in a non-stick skillet coated with cooking spray. Cook on one side for 1-2 minutes and until browned. Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes. Serve with barbecue sauce and garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and green onions.

Clean artichokes by removing the tough outer leaves and fuzzy choke and trimming away any yellow leaves with a sharp knife. Split the artichoke in half and discard the fuzzy choke. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the artichokes and cook for about a minute and a half. Drain and transfer to a bowl of ice water to cool. Peel the artichokes and cut them into quarters. In a large skillet heat the olive oil over medium heat and add the garlic and saute until softened. Add the lemon juice, wine and parsley and cook until reduced by half. Add the artichokes and toss to coat with the lemon juice mixture and season with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer the artichokes to a serving platter and serve.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water. Combine pasta and remaining ingredients. Toss well. Chill for at least one hour.

1/3 cup milk1/4 cup bread crumbs2 slices cheddar cheese2 tablespoons prepared mustard1/4 teaspoon salt2 sausage links2 cups biscuit dough1/2 cup milk, room temperature 1/2 cup butter1/3 cup bread crumbs, plus more for sprinklingMustard for servingSlice sausage into 1/2-inch thick rounds. Dip each one into milk to moistendredge rounds in bread crumbs and mustard. Place each sausage on a buttered biscuitroll up and secure with toothpick. Place sausage rolls in a single layer on a baking sheetfreeze until firm, about 2 hours. In medium bowl, stir bread crumbs, milk and butter until well blendedspoon into pastry bag fitted with a large round tip. In large skillet, heat butter over medium heat until sizzlingadd sausage rolls. Cook until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towelssprinkle with more bread crumbs as desired. Ser

Put figs and sugar into a preserving pan. Pour in enough water to cover the figs and boil gently for 30 minutes or until tender. Add lemon juice to taste. Remove from heat. Cool. Pour into sterile jars. Seal while hot. Store in a cool dark place. (Make sure that they are not stored in a place that will get below 50 degrees F.)

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut squash into wedges and rub with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Arrange squash wedges on a baking sheet. Bake until tender but not mushy, about 45 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the sage, thyme and rosemary in a small bowl. Add the vinegar and a teaspoon of the olive oil and stir. Grill the sausage over medium heat until done. Spoon sausage onto the squash wedges. Top each with a few drops of the herb and vinegar mixture. Serve warm.

Cook bacon in a pan over medium heat until it's golden brown and crispy and then remove from pan with a slotted spoon and set aside on a paper-towel lined plate. Cut up the cooked bacon and set aside for later. Drain off any grease from pan and put a few drops of beer into pan and then add a couple of hot dogs and cook them for about a minute or so over medium heat until they begin to brown slightly and then flip them over and cook another minute or so until they are brown all over. Add a few more drops of beer and cook for about a minute or so until hot dog is just barely browned and then remove from pan and place on a paper-towel lined plate. Repeat with remaining hot dogs and beer and bacon and beer and hot dogs and beer and bacon and beer until you have used up all six hot dogs. Place the hot dogs in a medium size skillet or pan and top with spicy brown mustard and then place a few slices of sweet onion and bell pepper on top and then cover with a lid and cook over medium heat until hot dogs are thoroughly heated

Heat oil in medium skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook 10 to 15 minutes or until onion softens and brown bits begin to form on the bottom of the pan. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Transfer onion to small bowl to cool slightly. Stir together plums, dates, sugar, red chile, lime juice and tamarind paste to taste in large bowlstir in onions. Let stand 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld. Spoon into serving dish and serve with meat or fish. Keep refrigerated for up to 1 weekbring to room temperature before serving.

Cut the french beans in half, wash them well and put in a pan with a little butter and cooked onions for about 10 minutes until softened but not coloured. Add a little tomato puree and stock and bring to the boil then simmer for about 20 minutes or until the beans are tender. Season with pepper and salt then serve with parsley leaves sprinkled over the top.

Combine sausage meat, soup, milk, nutmeg in a 3-qt casserole dish. Cook over medium heat 10 to 15 minutes stirring occasionally until thoroughly heated. Remove from heatstir in chicken breasts. Coverbake in a 350 degree oven 20 to 25 minutes or until chicken is cooked throughuncoversprinkle with cheesebake 5 minutes longer.

Rinse chicken pieces well. Cut lemons into quarters and squeeze juice over chicken pieces. Drizzle with oil and seasoning. Place chicken pieces into roasting pan or baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done. Remove from oven and serve with rice or pasta.

Dice bacon into 1-inch pieces and fry in a large frying pan over a medium-high flame until crisp. Set aside and keep warm. Peel the garlic and cut in half crosswise. Slice the yellow onions thinly. Heat 1 tablespoon of the butter in a frying pan over a medium-high flame. Add the bacon, garlic and yellow onions and sauté until golden brown, about 8 minutes. Add 2 cups of chicken broth and bring to a boil. Simmer until reduced by half and thickened slightly, about 10 minutes. Add the brussels sprouts and return to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in remaining 1 tablespoon of butter until melted. Season with salt and pepper and serve hot with a piece of crusty bread.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 18 muffin cups. Combine the flour, baking powder, cinnamon and sugar in the bowl of an electric mixer. Add the egg and yogurt and mix at low speed until combined. Add the vegetable oil and beat until the mixture is smooth. Stir in the bananas and mix just until combined. Fold in the maple syrup. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups filling them about three-quarters of the way. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center of the muffins comes out clean.

In a small bowl mix soy sauce, sugar, red wine vinegar, vegetable oil and garlic. Set aside. In a small bowl mix ginger with ground ginger. Set aside. In another bowl mix brown sugar with the rice. Set aside. Place 4 boneless skinless chicken breasts in a baking dish. Add 2 tablespoons of the soy/vinegar mixture. Marinate for 1 hour. While marinating, prepare rice. In a small saut pan over medium heat cook the garlic clove until brown. Remove from heat. Drain the marinated chicken breasts. Place chicken breasts in the same baking dish. Add 1 tablespoon soy mixture. Place rice under the breasts. Dot with 1 teaspoon garlic. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350f. Wash and dry piquillos. Cut tops off piquillos and remove seeds. Cut piquillos in half lengthwise. Place tuna on each half. Mix together parsley, green onion and 3 tbsp sherry vinegar. Spoon mixture over tuna. Place in a baking pan and bake for 20 minutes. Remove from pan and serve.

In a sauce pan, add butter. Melt the butter. Add flour stirring until smooth. Slowly add milk stirring until smooth. Cook for a few minutes. Stir in the sherry wine, paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook for a few more minutes. Stir in the haddock fillets. Place in a baking dish. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake for 20 minutes. Uncover. Sprinkle with paprika. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve.

In a small skillet heat 2 Tablespoons of the olive oil over medium heat. Add the shallot, garlic, wine and rosemary to the skillet. Cook over medium-low heat for 5 to 8 minutes or until the shallots are tender but not browned. In a small bowl combine the tomato paste, molasses, 1 teaspoon of the oil, the remaining 2 teaspoons of rosemary, 1/2 teaspoon of the oregano and the lemon zest. Set aside. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Rub the chicken all over with the remaining 2 teaspoons of olive oil. Sprinkle the chicken with salt and pepper to taste. Thread 2 or 3 pieces of the rosemary on each of the skewers, alternating with pieces of chicken, and thread the skewers together. Place the skewers on the grill rack. Grill for 5 to 6 minutes on each side or until done. Serve the chicken with the sauce.
Slice lemons into quarters and add them to the water with the dates. Bring to a boil then simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and allow the lemons to cool for 30 minutes before serving.

Prepare pasta according to package directions. In a food processor or blender combine sun-dried tomatoes, pine nuts, rocket and basil. Add oil and blend until combined. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Place pasta in a large serving bowl and drizzle with sun dried tomato mixture. Top with grated parmesan cheese. Makes 6 servings.

Peel and boil the potatoes. Once they are cooked, cut them in half and put them on a plate. Open the hot dog and scoop out the meat. Put the meat in the middle of each potato. Make sure there is enough meat to cover the potato. Slice the garlic clove in two and add them to the potato. Add some mustard to the potato as well. Mix the potato and mustard together. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve.

Bring bottled water to a boil in a pan on high heat. Put eggs in pan and cook for 12 minutes (3 1/2 minutes per side). Put eggs on a plate in the refrigerator and cover with a towel to cool them off quickly (they can be eaten at room temperature). Crack eggs onto a plate and use a fork to crush yolks until they are well mixed with whites. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve.

In a large saucepan combine water, tea bags, salt and 2 tbsp. of oil. Bring to boil. Remove from heat. In small bowl combine remaining 1 tbsp. of oil, couscous and mint. Add to boiling water. Stir until all is well coated. Cover pan. Remove from heat. Set aside 10 min. Fluff couscous. Remove tea bags. Toss raisins and almonds. Serve couscous mixture in bowl. Top each serving with raisins and almonds. Garnish with mint.
Combine all salad ingredients in a large bowl. Toss with olive oil and garlic. If using steaks cut them in small pieces. Add steaks to salad before serving. Serves 4.

Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. Beat in corn syrup. Beat in salt and cream of tartar until stiff glossy peaks form. Add vanilla. Beat until glossy. For swirling, beat on low speed until smooth. Frosting will set quickly. If necessary, refrigerate until it can be spread on cookies or other baked goods.

Bring chicken broth to a boil in a large stockpot. Add tortellinicook 4 to 5 minutes or until tender. Drain tortellini in a colander. Add tomato to broth along with beans. Simmer 10 minutes. Add basil and vinegar. Stir in tortellini with broth. Stir in cheese. Add salt if desired. Sprinkle with fresh parmesan cheese before serving.

Mix milk, brown sugar and salt in a large bowl. Add oil and yeast and mix thoroughly. Add eggs and stir well. Add flour and stir until well mixed. Stir in cinnamon and nutmeg. Put batter in a 2-quart pan. Set aside until doubled in size. Grease hot griddle lightly with oil. Pour batter onto griddle and cook until golden brown. Flip and cook other side. Serve hot.

Dissolve yeast, warm water and sugar in a large bowl. Let sit until the mixture begins to bubble. Stir the yeast mixture until it is foamy. Add salt and flour. Knead until dough is smooth. Place dough on a lightly floured surface and knead for 5 minutes. Shape dough into a ball. Place the ball into a lightly greased bowl. Cover with a damp cloth. Let rise in a warm place until doubled. Remove the dough from the bowl and shape into 20 long ropes. Let rest for 10 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brush a baking sheet with oil. Arrange the ropes on the baking sheet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes until golden. Serve warm. You can make this the day before and bake the breadsticks the next day.

In a small bowl, combine the oil with the water. In a 10x15 baking dish, place the pork tenderloin with skin side down. Sprinkle with salt. Place the tenderloin in the baking dish. Bake for 35 minutes at 400 degrees F. Meanwhile in a 10x15 baking dish place the pork-flavored ramen noodles. Place the broccoli florets around the ramen noodles. In a small bowl combine the red bell peppers, green onions, soy sauce and parsley. Set aside. In the bowl of a food processor combine the pork tenderloin with the red bell peppers. Process until smooth. Pour the pork mixture over the noodles. Spoon the green onions over the noodles. Place the pork tenderloin in the center of the dish. Bake for 10 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve with a green salad.

Combine all of the juice and sugar. Combine all of the dry ingredients. Whisk the juice mixture and the dry ingredients together. Whip the egg whites with a hand mixer until stiff and fold into the grape mixture. Pour into a grape juice glass and serve.
