In large skillet brown green beans in olive oil. Add water, onion, parsley, garlic, fresh mint, oregano leaves, salt & black pepper. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

Prepare carrots by peeling, cutting in half lengthwise and scraping out seeds. Place carrots in bottom of greased souffle dishes. Combine all other ingredients in large bowlbeat well. Pour batter over carrots and bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 35 minutes. Serve warm topped with powdered sugar if desired.

In a skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add almonds and saute until light brown. Add mint leaves, stirring until leaves are slightly wilted. Add snow peas and saute until snow peas are bright green. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Roll out pizza dough into 1 large square. Spoon turkey breast over dough. Sprinkle with pesto sauce. Top with provolone cheese. Roll up dough. Cut into 2-inch pieces. Place in greased baking dish. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before removing from pan.

Brown the ground beef until no longer pink. Remove the meat from the pan. Add the other ingredients to the beef fat. Cook until the beef is done. Add the beef to the remaining mixture. Bake in a greased 2-quart casserole dish.

Melt the butter and keep it warm over low heat. Stir the powdered sugar into it until it is fully combined and smooth. Add the salt and the milk and mix it in gently with a spoon. Add the vanilla and mix it in until fully combined. You can make a thinner frosting by adding more milk or a thicker one by adding more powdered sugar. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for a few days. It can also be stored in the freezer for up to a month.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large bowl combine cheerios with brown sugar. Mix with a wooden spoon until coated with sugar. Add whole wheat flour, baking powder and baking soda to cheerios mixture. Add banana chunks and mashed banana, stir to combine with cheerios mixture. Stir in nonfat milk and vegetable oil. Add egg white and stir to combine. Spoon batter into muffin cups that have been greased with nonstick cooking spray or butter. Bake 15-20 minutes until a toothpick inserted into muffin comes out clean. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl combine oil, banana and salt. In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients to the dry. Stir until all the dry is moistened. Stir in the chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 10 to 12 minutes. Cool. Makes 5 dozen.

Cut bread into 8 slices. Butter each slice. Beat the egg with the milk. Dip each slice of bread in the egg mixture. Place slices of bread in a greased 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Cook in a preheated 325f oven for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately.

Bring 3 cups of water to boil on stove top. Add salt and orzo pasta to water. Cook on low heat until pasta is tender but still firm. Drain and rinse with cold water to stop cooking process. Butter a 9 x 13 pan. Place drained orzo pasta into pan. Melt butter over low heat to prevent burning. Add blue cheese to the butter and stir until melted and combined. Add parmesan cheese to the blue cheese mixture and stir to combine. Stir in walnuts and remaining blue cheese. Transfer to refrigerator for at least one hour to firm up. Serve cold or at room temperature with additional grated parmesan if desired.

Cook macaroni in boiling salted water until al dente, drain and set aside. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute. Add beef and brown and cook until no longer pink. Add soup and milk and bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in macaroni and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes more. Transfer to a greased 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese and bake until bubbly and golden brown, about 15 minutes more. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serves 8-10.

Peel potatoes. Cut them in half lengthwise. Put them into a large pot. Add enough water to cover. Boil until tender. Drain. Cut kumara in half lengthwise. Peel. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise. Stuff each potato half with a piece of kumara. Put potatoes in a casserole dish. Heat oil in a large frying pan. Brown potatoes over high heat. Flip them over. Brown on the other side. Serve hot.

Remove the garlic cloves from the head. Finely chop the cloves and parsley. Place all ingredients in a jar and shake well. Allow the mayonnaise to rest overnight at room temperature. Strain through a fine mesh sieve and season to taste. Store in a glass jar in the refrigerator.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook potatoes until tender. Drain potatoes and peel. Cool. Chop potatoes. In a large bowl, beat eggs. Add potatoes and remaining ingredients. Season with salt and pepper. Stir until thoroughly mixed. Refrigerate for at least an hour. Serve with crackers.

Bring 1 quart of water to boiling. Add bouillon granules. Return to boiling. Add couscous. Cover pot. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Fluff couscous with fork. Add mushrooms. Stir. Cover again. Cook for 5-10 minutes or until tender.

Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and carrot. Cook for 3 minutes until softened. Add the mushrooms. Cook for 5 minutes until softened. Stir in the stock. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the mustard. Add the potatoes. Cook for 10 minutes until tender. Stir in the soy sauce. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in the cornstarch. Cook for 1 minute until thickened. Stir in the pepper. Season with salt. Serves 4.

Preheat grill. Place a nonstick grill pan over medium heat. Spray the pan with cooking spray. Place 2 of the chicken breasts in the grill pan and cook for 5 minutes. Turn the chicken breasts over and continue to cook for 5 minutes. Place the remaining 2 chicken breasts in the grill pan. Cook for 5 minutes. Sprinkle the yogurt over the chicken breasts and add the honey, cumin, and mustard. Marinate for 15 minutes. Preheat the grill. Place the marinated chicken breasts on the grill. Close the grill lid. Cook for 10 minutes. Turn and cook for 5 more minutes.

Wash and pat-dry potatoes. Slice and then brush with olive oil and rub with garlic powder and salt and pepper. Roast in preheated oven for 25-40 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden brown. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and black pepper and bake for another 2-4 minutes or until cheese melts. Serve immediately with sour cream or yogurt dip.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Butter the chops with 1 tablespoon of the mustard. Sprinkle with the orange zest. Bake for 15 minutes or until done. Meanwhile, make the glaze--------. In a small saucepan, combine the jam and raspberry vinegar. Cook and stir until the jam begins to dissolve. Remove from the heat and add the remaining 1 tablespoon of the mustard and the orange juice. Brush the chops with the glaze and return to the oven for 10 minutes more or until the glaze is bubbly. Serve with your favorite side dish.

Cook thin spaghetti as directed. Drain. Meanwhile, melt 3 tablespoons of the butter in a 2-quart saucepan. Add garlic and onions. Cook until tender. Add scallops and shrimp. Cook 1 minute. Drain. Add remaining butter and Worcestershire sauce. Cook until scallops are opaque. Add remaining sauce to pasta. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Serve immediately.
Pour blood orange juice into a pitcher. Add orange juice. Stir in white sugar until dissolved. Stir in club soda. Pour into glasses. Top with ice cream and orange slice.

Pour the beans into a large bowl and mash with a fork until the beans are well combined but still chunky. In a separate bowl, combine the butter with the leeks and mushrooms. Mix the beans and leeks together and season with dried mustard and salt and pepper and set aside for at least half an hour while you prepare the pastry crust. In another bowl, combine the eggs with the mustard and season with salt and pepper and set aside for at least half an hour while you prepare the pastry crust. Place the pastry in the freezer for ten minutes, then roll out and line a pie dish with it. Pour the beans and leek mixture into the pie dish and spread evenly. Combine the eggs with the breadcrumbs and sprinkle the egg mixture over the beans and leek mixture in the pie dish. Bake for approximately forty-five minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the eggs are set. Remove from the oven and let rest for five minutes before serving.
Combine all ingredients in a food processor and process until smooth. Serve immediately with tortilla chips.

Pour oil into large skillet over medium heat. Add pork chops and cook about 4 minutes per side or until meat is no longer pink inside. Remove meat from skillet and set aside. Add carrots and snow peas to skillet and cook about 8 minutes or until tender crisp. Add flour and cook about 1 minute or until golden brown. Stir in chicken broth and lemon juice. Cook for about 1 minute. Add meat back into skillet and cook until heated through and coated in sauce. Serve over rice or noodles.

Sprinkle pork tenderloin with seasoning salt. Place tenderloin in a gallon-size resealable plastic bag. Add sherry to bag. Add garlic and cumin. Seal bag and turn to coat pork. Marinate 6 to 12 hours. Preheat grill or broiler. Drain pork. Combine cornstarch and 1/4 cup water. Stir until smooth. Brush pork with cornstarch mixture. Dip pork into beaten eggs. Coat pork in crushed cornflake crumbs. Place pork on prepared grill or in a shallow pan on rack in oven. Grill or broil 7 to 9 minutes for medium-rare. Turn pork over. Grill or broil 7 to 9 minutes longer for medium. Drain pork. Combine cornstarch mixture and 1/4 cup water in a bowl. Stir until smooth. Serve pork with green peppers and onions. Serve on a bed of cooked brown rice.
Cut meat into strips and brown in hot oil. Add remaining ingredients and simmer for 15 minutes or until broccoli is tender.

Heat a medium nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add olive oilsauté garlic for 30 seconds. Add tomatoes, pickled jalapeño, chili powder and cayennesauté 5 minutes. Add tuna fish, beans and season with salt and peppercook 5 minutes or until tuna fish is heated through. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Beat in the eggs one at a time until combined. Beat in the vanilla extract until combined. In a medium bowl, sift together the flour, baking soda, salt and cocoa powder. Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and mix until the dough is combined. Roll the dough into 2 Tablespoon sized balls and place them 2 inches apart on a nonstick baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes until the cookies are firm. Let them sit for 5 minutes before removing them from the pan using a metal spatula. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before storing in an airtight container for up to 7 days or in the freezer for up to 3 months.
Pour everything except corn into the crock pot. Cook on low for 6 hours or high for 4 hours or until chicken is tender. Stir in the corn at the end and serve with corn chips for dipping.

Cook beef and onions until tender. Drain. Add seasonings, beans and tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Stir in ravioli. Cook until tender. Serve with extra cheddar. Makes 12 servings. Serve with rice or tortillas.

Preheat oven to 350f. Sift flour and salt together. Cream butter with margarine. Add sugar. Add eggs and blend. Add flour mixture. Add bananas. Fold in nuts. Pour into 2 greased loaf pans. Bake about 1 hour. Makes 2 loaves.

Cook noodles according to package directions and drain. Crumble sausage and add to onions. Add frozen spinach and cook until liquid is released and spinach is thawed. Stir in cream of mushroom soup and cook for 1 minute. Combine ricotta and eggs. Stir into noodle mixture. Sprinkle with tarragon and marjoram. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Peel and cut the beets into quarters and place them in a glass jar. Combine white vinegar, white sugar, and powdered allspice in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and stir. Pour hot liquid over beets and seal jar. Store in a cool place for 2 weeks.

Place the peppers under the broiler for about 10 minutes until blackened on all sides and slightly charred inside. Place the peppers in a paper bag and seal for at least 5 minutes to steam. Remove the peppers and peel off the blackened skin. Cut the peppers into strips and set aside. In a small saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat and add the garlic and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the balsamic vinegar and capers and heat through for about 1 minute. Add the peppers and basil and toss to coat. Serve the peppers at room temperature or warm.

Mix bread crumbs, almonds, garlic powder and seasonings. Press into pork tenderloin to coat both sides. In a shallow bowl mix egg white and water together and set aside. Heat oil in a large saut pan over medium heat. Dip pork in egg mixture then coat with crumb mixture and place in pan. Brown on both sides. Place pork in a baking pan and pour sauce over top. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes or until cooked through. Serve over rice or pasta.

Combine first 4 ingrediants and mix well. Dip both sides of chicken breast halves in mixture. Place in 9 x 13 x 2 baking dish. Bake at 375 degrees 40-50 minutes. Turn breast halves over and bake 5 minutes more. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Makes 4 servings.

In a small bowl stir together the chili powder, paprika, garlic, salt, dried oregano, cumin, black pepper and oil. Rub the mixture on to the pork chops. Cover the chops with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Grill the pork chops for 6 to 7 minutes per side. Brush the chops with lime juice and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine flour, milk and granulated sugar in a saucepan over medium-low heat and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until mixture boils. Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla extract to mixture and mix with wire whisk until butter melts and mixture is smooth. Cool slightly and pour into 8-inch square panspread evenly with a spatula to level and smooth surface. Cool completely. Remove from pan and cut into 24 piecesplace pieces on waxed paper.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan (or two 8x4-inch loaf pans). Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy, add eggs one at a time, beating until blended after each addition. Stir in vanilla, then gradually add flour mixture alternating with buttermilk until combined. Stir in bananas, then fold in walnuts. Pour into prepared pan(s) and bake for 1 hour or until done (test with a toothpick). Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing bread from pancool completely. Store in airtight container for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 1 month.

Cut baguette in half. Spread olive oil on each side. Lay each half cut side down on a baking sheet. Sprinkle each half with a thin layer of prosciutto. Lay each half cut side down on a baking sheet. Spread each half with fig jam. Add a thin layer of neufchatel cheese on each half. Sprinkle each half cut side down on a baking sheet. Season each half cut side down on a baking sheet. Sprinkle each half cut side down on a baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Spread fresh ground pepper on each half. Serve immediately.

Mix 2 cups of whole wheat and rye flours in a large bowl. Add 1 tsp. of yeast and 1/2 tsp. of caraway seeds and stir well. In a separate bowl combine 1 cup of the whole wheat and rye flours with 3/4 cup of water and 1 tsp. of yeast. Add 3/4 cup of natural applesauce. Stir to mix. Add this mixture to the first bowl and mix well. Add 2 1/2 cups of water and 1 tsp. of yeast. Stir to mix. Add 1/2 cup of natural applesauce. Mix well. Gradually add 1 cup of whole wheat and rye flours and mix. Add 1/4 cup of water and 1 tsp. of yeast. Mix well. Gradually add 1 cup of whole wheat and rye flours and mix well. Add 3/4 cup of water and 1 tsp. of yeast. Mix well. Gradually add 1/2 cup of whole wheat and rye flours and mix. Add

In a large bowl, mix together the ham, cheese, onions, and apple. Stir in the bisquick mix. Stir in milk and pepper to taste. Pour into a pie shell and bake for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with fresh sliced tomatoes.

Cut the tops off the green chilies. Scoop out the seeds and discard. Drain the green chilies and pat them dry with paper towels. Place the chilies in a baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the cream of mushroom soup and sour cream. Stir well. Add the green chilies and stir until the mixture is well blended. Place the chilies in the oven and bake for 45 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve with the top removed from the green chilies. Serve with tortillas.
Combine lettuce, gorgonzola crumbles and walnuts in a bowl. Top with a slice of chicken breast and add a dollop of dressing. Serve immediately.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef and cook until no longer pink. Drain and cool. In a large bowl, combine the beef with the cottage cheese and the remaining ingredients. Mix well. Transfer to a 13x9 inch baking dish. Bake 30 to 40 minutes or until a thermometer inserted into the center registers 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with your favorite vegetables.

Prepare potatoes. Cut them into small pieces. Boil them in a large pot of water. Cook until tender. Drain the potatoes. In a large pot melt the fat-free margarine. Add the potatoes and milk. Stir constantly until mashed. Add salt and pepper. Remove from the heat. Stir in the parsley and scallions. Add the thyme. Taste. Add more seasonings as desired. Serve hot.

Pour sweetened condensed milk into 8-inch baking dish or 9-inch springform pan. Melt chocolate chips in microwaveable bowl using 1/2 cup of the milk as liquid. Mix with the chocolate chips in the 8-inch pan or in a mixing bowl in the springform pan. Pour the remaining milk into the bowl with the chocolate chips and mix with the chocolate chips until all is combined. Spread over the sweetened condensed milk in the baking dish or springform pan. Sprinkle with salt. Pour in cherry pie filling over the top of the chocolate mixture. Slice almond extract in half and use to flavor the chocolate mixture in the baking dish. Fold almond extract into the chocolate mixture in the springform pan. Bake in preheated oven at 325 degrees for about 20 minutes or until the top of the chocolate mixture is set. Cool for about 30 minutes or until the chocolate layer is firm enough to cut into slices. Place chocolate layer in free

Combine all filling ingredients and mix well with electric mixer until fluffy. Roll out the pastry dough to 1/8 inches thickness on a lightly floured surface. Cut into desired shapes with pastry cutter or knife. Spoon the filling into the pastry rounds. Cover with another round of pastry dough to form a half moon shape. Pinch the edges with your fingers to seal the pastry rounds together. Place on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper or wax paper. Brush the tops with an egg wash of egg whites and water mixed together. Bake at 375 degrees F. for about 25 to 35 min. or until pastry is golden brown. Let cool. Dust with confectioner's sugar if desired.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a medium saucepan combine rice with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Add rice and milk and stir. Stir in sugar and butter. Pour into a 13 x 9-inch baking dish and bake for 15-20 minutes.

Brown the pork chops in the oil until brown on both sides. Drain and place the chops in a 9x13-inch baking dish. In a small saucepan, dissolve the bouillon cube in a cup of hot water. Pour over the pork chops and pour enough cold water to cover the chops by 1/2 inch. Cover the dish tightly and bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until tender and the liquid is almost evaporated. Serve pork chops over rice or noodles or with vegetables.

In a 2 quart sauce pan over low heat, melt butter. Stir in flour until blended. Cook for 1 minute. Gradually stir in milk. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Add cream cheese and cook and stir 2 minutes more. Stir in 2 cups of the potatoes and 2 cups of the broccoli. Transfer to a greased 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Top with remaining potatoes and broccoli. Combine breadcrumbs and remaining 1/2 cup of the cheese. Sprinkle over top. Bake at 350 for 35 to 45 minutes or until bubbly and lightly browned. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Mix ground beef with soft breadcrumbs. Add spices and seasonings. Shape into balls- using half an egg to help hold the meatballs together. Place meatballs in a baking dish. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake meatballs for 20 minutes. Serve with tzatziki sauce.

In a large skillet brown the ground beef, onions, mushrooms, and bacon. Drain off the grease. Stir in the worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, salt and pepper until blended. Transfer to a large bowl or the crock of a slow cooker. Mix in the bread crumbs until well blended. Form 6 patties with your hands or hamburger rollers. Place patties on lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until done. Serve on rolls with cheese slice. Serve with salad or steamed vegetables.

Mix all the dry ingredients. Beat the eggs in a separate bowl. Add eggs to the dry ingredients and mix well. Add the coconut. Pour mixture into a 9 in. Pie pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes. Let cool 10-15 minutes before slicing. Serve warm.

Combine the oil, apricot jam, vinegar, and 1/3 cup of the soy sauce in a small bowlseason with salt and black pepper. Place the chicken, plums, and red onion on a large piece of foildrizzle with some of the dressing. Fold the foil to make a packetplace on a baking sheet and seal. Transfer to the ovenbake for 30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Cool for 10 minutesdiscard the dressing packets. Remove the chicken from the foilcut the packets open. Place the couscous on a large plattertop with the chicken. Drizzle the remaining 2 tablespoons of the soy sauce over the chickentop with the almonds and plum slicesserve immediately.

Preheat your oven to 350 degrees. Mix together dry ingredients. In a separate bowl whisk together eggs, butter and water. Pour wet ingredients into dry and mix until thoroughly combined. Pour into muffin tins. Bake for approximately 20 minutes. Serve with butter or cream cheese.

In a large bowl combine marshmallow fluff and peanut buttermix well and fold in ritz crackers and coconut flakes. Stir until evenly mixedadd chocolate chips and stir until evenly coated with peanut butter mixture. Place mixture into the refrigerator for about half an hour until mixture is firm enough to handle and form ballsroll into balls and place on a wax paper lined cookie sheet and refrigerate for about one hour to allow balls to firm up furtherstore in an air tight container for up to two weeks.

Rinse and pat dry the potatoes. Toss with 1 t. Olive oil and 1 t. Seasoning salt. Place a large sheet of parchment paper on a cookie sheet. Arrange the potatoes on the paper. Dice the garlic cloves and rub them over the potatoes. Toss with 1 t. Olive oil. Sprinkle with thyme. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup parmesan cheese. Bake for 1 hour at 400 degrees. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with 1/4 cup parmesan cheese and fresh parsley. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400f grease muffin cups. In large bowl combine brown sugar and butter with electric mixer on low speed until well mixed. Beat in egg until light yellow. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, salt and oatmeal. Stir flour mixture into butter mixture until well mixed. Fold in buttermilk until well mixed. Spoon batter into muffin cups filling 2/3 full. Bake for 15 minutes until golden brown. Serve warm.

Melt the velveeta cheese in a sauce pan over low heat and stir until smooth and thickened. Add in the milk and cayenne pepper and stir until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and whisk in the paprika. Add in the lobster tails and sweet red pepper and heat through. Serve with french bread.

Prepare the wings. Put the wings in a large bowl and pour the sake over the wings. Mix in the mirin and the soy sauce and the lemon. Marinate for a couple hours at least. In a large pan add the oil and saute the spring onions until they are soft. Add the chicken wings and cook until the chicken is done. Serve with the steamed rice.

Apples should be peeled and cored. They should be quartered and cut into eighths or quarters. Put into a very large pot along with one cup of apple juice and cover with 3 or 4 inches of water. Place pot over medium high heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook at a gentle simmer until apples are tender. Strain the liquid into a large bowl through a jelly bag. (You can also use a strainer lined with cheesecloth.) Discard solids. Measure liquid and add enough apple juice to make 2 quarts. Heat juice until hot. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Add spices and stir until well mixed. Add apples. Bring to a boil and cook until thick. Add more liquid or sugar as needed to get desired consistency. Pour into sterilized jars. Seal. (See my post about canning for information about sterilizing jars.)

Melt butter and sugar in top of double boiler over hot water. Remove from heat. Stir in sliced almonds and sesame seedscool. Roll graham crackers in mixture and place on wax paper-lined cookie sheet. Chill for two hoursstore in air-tight container in refrigerator.

Mix flour, milk and egg in a large bowl. Add cream cheese and beat with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Add honey and vanilla and beat until well blended. Add baking powder and beat until incorporated. Pour into 2 lightly greased 13 x 9-inch baking pans and bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Turn onto cooling racks and cool for about 15 minutes before spreading with a knife or fork. Invert onto waxed paper and cool completely before decorating with powdered sugar and candied orange peel or sprinkles and drizzle with honey if desired.

Cut celery into small pieces and place in a large saucepan. Add the water and butter. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat and simmer until celery is tender. Add flour and cook for one more minute. Add milk. Bring to a boil while stirring constantly. Simmer for five minutes. Stir in the black pepper. Place the smooth peanut butter in a blender. Add half the hot celery mixture and puree until smooth. Pour the pureed mixture into the remaining celery mixture. Cook over low heat until thickened and bubbly. Stir in the peanut butter. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve with crusty bread.

Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and carrot. Saute until the onion is soft. Add the dried sherry and stir. Add the tomatoes and mushrooms and continue to saute for 5 minutes. Add the green peppers and continue to saute. Add the veal chops. Pour the sauce over the chops and cook until done. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Place ribs in crockpot. Pour soy sauce, ground ginger, cornstarch mixture, cider vinegar, sugar, water, salt, dry mustard and fresh ginger over ribs. Cook for 5 to 8 hours. Serve with rice and green salad. We also have used this recipe for chicken as well as beef.

In large bowl, combine paprika, salt, cinnamon, cumin, pepper and mix well. Add chicken to bowltoss to coat well. Place chicken on broiler pan coated with cooking spray. Broil 5 minutes. Remove from broiler. Turn chicken overbrush with maple syrup mixture. Return to broiler 5 minutes. Brush with remaining mixturebroil 2 minutes. Combine remaining maple syrup mixture and mustarddrizzle over chicken.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together molasses, brown sugar and vinegar. In a medium mixing bowl combine the flour, baking soda and ginger. Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture and mix together. Add the egg and mix until the dough is smooth. Place the dough on a floured surface and knead it for 5 minutes. Roll the dough out to 1/8 inch thick. Using a sharp knife, cut the dough into circles about 3 inches in diameter. Place the cookies on a cookie sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes. The cookies will be firm to the touch when they are done. Transfer the cookies to a wire rack to cool.

Preheat broiler. In small skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add seasoning and cook 1 minute. Stir in parsley flakes and thyme. Add paprika and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in onion powder and seasonings. Brush both sides of fillets with seasoning mixture and place under broiler for 5 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve hot.

Brown ground beef with onion and garlic clove in a large skillet or pot over medium heat until beef is cooked and onion is tender. Drain fat from skillet. Add barbecue sauce and stir until heated through. Add macaroni to skillet and toss to coat with barbecue mixture. Cook macaroni according to package directionsdrain well and return to skillet. Stir in cheese until cheese melts and blends with barbecue mixture. Sprinkle with pepper and serve with buttered crackers or bread.

Place cube steaks in a large pan and add enough water to cover. Add salt and pepper. Bring water to a boil then turn heat down to low. Cook until water has almost evaporated. Drain well. In a small saucepan melt butter. Stir in pepper. Bring mixture to a boil then remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice. Drizzle pepper sauce over steaks. Serve with rice or potatoes.

Preheat oven to 400f. Trim brussels sprouts by removing any yellow outer leaves. Cut sprouts in half. Transfer brussels sprouts to large bowl. Add olive oil. Toss to coat. Transfer to a 9 x 13 baking dish. Add thyme, oregano, pine nuts and season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar. Roast in preheated oven for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Transfer to platter. Garnish with fresh thyme sprigs. Enjoy!

Heat the oil in a large heavy pan. Add the curry paste and cook for a minute. Add the coconut milk, the chicken, eggplant and kaffir lime leaves. Bring to a boil. Add the fish sauce, brown sugar and hot chilli. Cook until the chicken is cooked through. Season the curry to taste. Serve with jasmine rice.

Stir dry cereal and oatmeal into large bowl with 2 cups boiling water. Add cold water and stir with wire whisk until dry mixture is softened and slightly moistened. Add roasted peanuts and raisins. Stir in vanilla and honey until moistened. Shape into small balls using moistened hands. Roll balls in peanut butter until coated. Place balls on lightly greased cookie sheet or foil-lined baking sheet. Sprinkle lightly with powdered sugar or cinnamon-sugar. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool slightly before serving or storing in tightly covered container.
Put pineapple, honey and rum into blender or food processor. Puree for 1 minute or until smooth. Pour into martini glasses and garnish with fresh passion fruit and pineapple wedge.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease the sides and bottom of a lightly sprayed 13 x 9 inch (33 x 23 cm) baking dish. In a large bowl combine the peanut butter and butter until light and fluffy. In another large bowl beat the brown sugar and white sugar until blendedbeat in the eggs one at a time until blended after each addition. Stir in the vanilla and beat until blended. Mix in the flour, baking powder and saltadd the peanut butter mixture and stir just until blendedstir in the chocolate chips (optional). Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish and spread evenly. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a tester inserted in the center of the bar comes out clean. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. Cut into bars and serve.

In a medium bowl combine the buttermilk and 1 cup of the cheddar cheese. Stir in the sage and garlic powder. Add the sausage to the bowl and stir until well mixed. Form the sausage into 1/2 inch thick patties. Dip the patties in the remaining cheddar cheese. Place the patties on a plate and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to firm up the sausage. Grill the patties over medium heat for 6 minutes per side or until browned and cooked through. Serve hot with toasted bread or crackers.

Cut up the sweet potatoes into small pieces. Add to the water that the parsnips were cooked in. Bring to a boil. Cook for 15-20 minutes or until soft. Drain. Transfer to a food processor or blender. Add the parsnips. Add evaporated milk. Blend until smooth. Add salt and nutmeg. Add a little more milk if the mixture is too thick. Serve with grated chives.

Boil carrots in water with raisins for 5 minutes. Drain carrots well in a colander. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add brown sugar and cayenne pepper to the buttercook and stir for 1 minute or until brown sugar dissolves. Stir in carrots. Cook for 10 minutes or until carrots begin to soften. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.

Beat cream cheese until fluffy. Gradually beat in brown sugar, pineapple yogurt and pecans. Fold in crushed pineapple. Spoon into a greased muffin tin. Cover and freeze until firm. Let stand at room temperature about 30 minutes before serving. Makes about 12 servings.

Remove leek tops. Cut leek into 1-inch-wide coins. (Discard tops.) Melt butter in large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add leeks. Cook until softened. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add vegetable broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and cook 15 minutes. Add heavy cream. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Cook 5 minutes longer. Serve with grated Gruyere cheese.

Combine chicken broth, pineapple juice and brown sugar in a large crock pot. Add boneless chicken. Cover. Cook 3 hours or until tender. Stir in soy sauce. Cook 10-15 minutes longer or until sauce thickens. Serve immediately. Serve over rice.

Prepare brownie mix according to package directions (I used a box mix). After baking brownies, remove from pan and cut into squares. Melt the butter and brown sugar together and then pour over the brownies, making sure each brownies is well coated in the caramel sauce. Sprinkle with pecans and bake at 425 for about 10 minutes. Let brownies cool on a wire rack and then serve with ice cream.

Whisk egg yolks and sugar to a foamy mixture. Stir in milk and vanilla. Cook over moderately low heat stirring constantly until thickened and coats the back of a spoon. Remove from heat and add orange zest. Pour into individual serving glasses and bake until top is brown. Serve warm.

Mix brown sugar with cornstarch in a small saucepan. Gradually add the coffee. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring constantly until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heatcook and stir for about 2 minutes or until mixture thickens. Remove from heatstir in soy sauce, vinegar and hot sauce. Stir in butter until meltedset aside.

In a medium saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the barley and cook for 5 minutes. Add celery and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the onions and cook for 8 minutes. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Cook for 30 minutes. Stir in the salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Stir in the cream and the flour. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, sift together 2 cups of flour, baking powder and salt. Add to it shortening and blend until mixture is crumbly. In a small bowl, beat together egg whites and vanilla until stiff. Stir into dry mixture. Add milk and blend gently until moistened. Pour batter into a 9x13 baking dish. Bake 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cake comes out clean. When cake has cooled completely, spread frosting over it and decorate as desired.
Cook egg noodles in boiling salted water according to package directions. Drain. Transfer to a large bowl. Toss with butter and herbs. Season with salt and pepper. Makes about 2 cups.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the ham and season with salt and pepper. Remove the ham from the skillet when it is cooked through but still juicy. In the same skillet, saute the leeks in butter for about 5 minutes until tender. Remove the leeks from the heat and set aside. In a 4-cup muffin tin (or similar-sized baking pan), crack the egg into each compartment, dividing them evenly between the pan. Sprinkle each egg with 1 teaspoon cheddar cheese. Place the pan on the baking sheet. Place the skillet with the leeks on the baking sheet. Bake until the whites of the eggs are set and the yolks are soft, about 10 minutes. Transfer the skillet with the leeks to the ovenbake until the leeks are tender, about 10 minutes longer. Place the baking sheet on the counter and remove the skillet with the leeks from the ovenset aside. Divide the tomato slices evenly between

Cook artichokes in boiling salted water for 15 minutes until just tender. Drain. Combine cheeses in a bowl. Stir in artichokes, mayo, garlic clove and salt and pepper to taste. Transfer to serving dish. Serve with crackers or chips. Serves 8.

Wash pork shoulder roast and pat dry with paper towel. Rub the roast all over with salt and pepper. In a large pot melt 1 stick of butter over medium heat. Add onion soup mix and water. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until onions are tender. Remove onion mixture from heat and set aside. Place roast in a 13x9 roasting pan. Pour 1/2 of can of Pepsi over roast. Pour onion mixture over roast. Sprinkle roast with cream of mushroom soup. Cover pan and bake for 30 minutes. Remove roast from pan and place on a carving board. Thinly slice roast and serve.

Boil potatoes until soft. Drain and cut into small cubes. Place potatoes in a 9-inch square baking dish. Cover with sauce. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees until heated through, about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, steam broccoli until tender. Drain. Cut broccoli into small florets. Arrange broccoli and green pepper over potatoes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake until mozzarella is melted.

Combine shrimp and bacon in a large bowl. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine the horseradish, mayonnaise and scallions. Fold in the shrimp mixture. Spoon into a baking dish. Top with a mixture of the almonds and cayenne. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve with crackers.

Place oats in a bowl. Combine water, peanut butter, cocoa powder in a bowl. Add to oats. Mix thoroughly. Top with cinnamon. Let stand 5-10 minutes for oatmeal to thicken. Microwave 30 seconds for extra hotness.

Combine ketchup and vinegar in heavy saucepan. Stir in sugar, mustard and hot sauce until smooth and heated through. Do not boil. Stir in onions and garlic and remove from heat. Add pepper and serve at room temperature.

Remove the tenderloin from the refrigerator. Pat dry. Sprinkle generously with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Using the flat side of a meat mallet or a rolling pin, pound the tenderloin until about 1/2 inch thick. Set aside. Place the sour cream, Dijon mustard, herbs and garlic cloves in a small bowl. Mix well. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the extra virgin olive oil. When the oil is hot, add the tenderloin. Cook until browned on both sides. Pour the herbed sour cream mixture over the beef and stir until the beef is coated. Reduce the heat to low. Cover the pan and cook until the beef is tender, about 10 minutes. Uncover the pan and add the parsley. Turn the beef to coat the other side. Cook for about 2 more minutes. Cut the tenderloin into 6-8 pieces. Serve.

Cut up onion into very thin rings. In a large sauté pan or skillet, sauté onion until it is just translucent. Add pomegranate molasses, pomegranate seeds, walnuts, sugar, spices and salt. Bring to a simmer. Add the fryer chickens. Cook for about 15 minutes. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook for about 30 minutes. Transfer chickens to a serving platter. Pour sauce over chickens. Serve with rice.

Mix water, sugar and lemon zest in a large pot. Bring mixture to boil while stirring. Remove from heatstir in lemon juice. Pour mixture into ice pop moldslet stand until the mixture is slightly thickened, about 1 hour or until the mixture is the consistency of thin pudding. Place sticks in molds and freeze until firm. Serve at once.
In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the milk, sugar and vanilla. Cook until the sugar has dissolved. Pour into cups and freeze. Before removing from freezer place popsicle stick in cup.

Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Stir in flour. Whisk constantly until smooth. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook until thickened and bubbly. Stir in cheese. Cook 3 to 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Season with salt and paprika. Stir in cayenne. Makes about 2 cups.

Combine marinade ingredients in a plastic food storage bag and add salmon fillets. Seal bag and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, but no more than 24 hours. Meanwhile, preheat grill to medium-high heat. Cook salmon fillets until cooked through and flakes easily with a fork. Sprinkle sesame seeds and scallions over cooked fillets before serving. Serve hot or at room temperature with freshly cooked rice or pasta.
Boil potatoes for 15 minutes or until very soft. Drain and mash with milk and butter. Add flour and salt and stir. Put into a casserole dish. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream the buttermilk, egg whites, sugar and vanilla extract together for 2 minutes. In another bowl combine the raisin bran cereal, flour, salt and baking soda. Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture and mix until just combined. Fold in the raisins. Into a greased muffin tin spoon the batter. Bake for about 20 minutes. Serve warm.

Lightly salt and pepper the lamb. Dip in a mixture of flour and eggs. Then coat the lamb with breadcrumbs. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. When hot, add the lamb and brown on both sides. Remove to a plate. Add wine to the skillet and reduce to a syrup. Add the lamb and simmer 10 minutes or until tender. Serve hot.

Melt a little oil in a frypan and brown the kangaroo meat lightly. Add the kangaroo to a large pot and add all of the rest of the ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce to simmer and leave for 1 hour with the lid on. Transfer to a blender or stick blender and blend until it is smooth. (Alternatively, you can process in a blender until smooth.) Season with salt and pepper and serve with your favourite pasta or with a slice of toast with butter topped with a slice of parmesan cheese. Serves 6 people.

Place cooked chicken breast on one slice of bread. Top with mayonnaise and celery. Add pistachios and coriander. Place another slice of bread on top and cut into sandwiches. Serve with butter and salt and pepper.

Saute flounder fillets in a nonstick skillet in butter until done. Combine almonds with lemon juice to form a paste. Sprinkle almond paste over fish fillets. Add white wine and stir to coat fish with paste. Season with lemon pepper. Serve fish with rice or potatoes.
Heat butter and oil on medium heat. Dip spring roll sheets into butter. Lay bananas on sheet. Roll to cover bananas. Dip chocolate into butter. Dip ends of banana roll into chocolate. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan melt 4 Tablespoons margarine over medium heat. Add the flour and cook and stir for 2 minutes. Stir in the onion and cook for 1 minute. Gradually add the chicken broth and cook and stir for 5 minutes. Stir in the milk and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in the broccoli and cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the cheese. Stir until the cheese is melted and serve.

Cook onion and mushrooms in butter until tender. Add carrot, thyme, broth and potatoes. Cook until potatoes are tender. Add turkey and cook until heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.

Prepare cabbage by removing leaves from stem end, leaving about 1 inch of the stem intact to hold the leaves together. Rinse the cabbage in cold water to remove any grit, then pat dry with paper towels. Place cabbage leaves in a single layer on a clean work surface, working with 8 to 10 leaves at a time. Remove the center core from the top of each leaf with a paring knife or a spoon. Place a pat of softened butter on the top of each leaf (about a quarter-teaspoon per leaf). Heat the canola oil in a skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Place leaves in the skillet and cook until the underside of the leaves are well browned and crisp, about 3 to 4 minutes per side (the leaves will be cooked in batches). Transfer leaves with tongs to a plate lined with a clean kitchen towel and sprinkle with half the garlic cloves and half the red wine vinegar, turning the leaves to coat evenly with the seasonings. Let cool slightly before serving on plates. Season with the remaining garlic cloves and

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat. Add rice and cook until tender but firm, 15-20 minutes stirring occasionally and adding more water if necessary. Meanwhile heat oil in a large pot over medium heat add the garlic and saute until fragrant about 30 seconds add the onion and cook until soft about 5 minutes stirring occasionally add the tomatoes and cook until they just start to break down about 10 minutes add the basil and pepper and cook until fragrant about 30 seconds add the rice and stir gently for 2 minutes add the stock bring to a boil cook uncovered until the rice is tender about 10 minutes stir in the zucchini and cook until tender 4-5 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Cook broccoli in large skillet until crisp tender. Set aside. In medium bowl combine soup and milkstir in broccoli and eggs. Pour into 1-1/2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese crackers. Bake 20 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and top with horseradish. Bake 5 minutes more or until bubbly and cheese is melted.

Mix together flour and salt. Dip patties in beaten egg. Dip in flour. Place patties in casserole dish. Pour gravy over patties. Bake at 400f for 20 minutes. Flake bacon, add to gravy. Remove patties from casserole dish. Top each patty with Swiss cheese. Place patties in casserole dish. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Bake 10 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Place potatoes in a large pan and cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook until tender, about 20-30 minutes, drain and let cool. Once cool enough to handle, add potato to a large bowl and mash with a potato masher to desired consistency. Add flour, olive oil, salt pepper, Italian seasoning and garlic powder and mix well with your hands until dough is formed. Roll dough out to about 1/4 inch thick and cut with a gnocchi cutter or knife. Cook gnocchi in salted water for about 4-6 minutes or until they rise to the surface of the water. Drain and toss with your favorite sauce or seasoning.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Roll out pie crust to 1/8 inch thickness. Cut out six 5-inch circles and place one on each of six baking sheets. Divide chicken and ham between circles. Top each with 1/4 cup cheese. Crack an egg into each circle and pour 1/2 cup milk over eggs. Sprinkle 1/4 cup flour over each circle and top with another circle. Press crust together. Using a fork, poke holes in each circle and brush tops with butter. Bake 30-35 minutes until crust is lightly browned. Let cool. To serve, place a round cookie cutter 2 3/4 inches in diameter on top of each pie. Cut out circle. Repeat with other circles. Transfer cut circles to a serving platter and top with chilled sour cream.

Cook ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain. Stir in barbecue sauce, tomato sauce and water. Cook and stir over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add macaroni and cheese. Cook and stir for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top with lettuce and tomatoes. Serve hot.

Place 6 pork loin chops in a large skillet and sprinkle with 1 t soy sauce and 1 t dry sherry. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes on each side or until chops are lightly browned. Remove chops from pan and reserve pan. Add remaining soy sauce, 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup mirin to the pan. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minutereduce heat to low and add scallions and ginger and cook for 2 minutes or until softened and tender. Add pork chops to pan along with remaining 1/4 cup of mirin and cook for 1 minute or until heated through. Remove from heat and stir in rice vinegar. Serve with steamed rice.

In a large nonstick skillet heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and ginger and saut for 30 seconds. Add the scallop and snow peas to the pan. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until scallop is opaque and cooked through. Add the reduced-sodium chicken stock, soy sauce and cook for 2 minutes more or until scallop is cooked through. Add the green onion. Cook for 2 minutes more or until the snow peas are tender-crisp. Serve over rice.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and bell pepper and saute until tender. Add corn kernels and peppers. Add squash and zucchini. Remove skillet from heat. In a large bowl, whisk together milk and egg substitute. Whisk in cheese until melted. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet. Cook over medium low heat until set, about 5 minutes. Top with chopped green onion and serve.

Mix flour and sugar. Make a well in the center and add the rest of the dry ingredients. Stir in the egg and light cream. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Cool in pan. Spoon ice cream over the top and cover with marshmallows. Return to oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and place a plate over the pan. Lift the pan off of the plate and turn upside down. Serve immediately.

In a medium sauce pan cook bacon until crispremove bacon and reserve bacon fat in pan. Saute onion until tenderadd spinach and cook until spinach wiltsadd bacon back into pan and cook together until heated throughstir in milk, flour and salt and pepper and heat until thickenedpour into a buttered baking dish and cover with cracker crumbs and dot with butterbake for 20 minutes.
Open your bagel and spread some avocado slices on it. Add cooked bacon. Then add sun dried tomatoes and red onions. Finally put some monterey jack cheese.

Combine yogurt, herbs, lemon juice, pepper and garlic in a medium bowl. Spread mixture on meat slices. Wrap each slice in 2 layers of plastic wrap or tin foilrefrigerate 2-4 hours. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing. Cook on medium-high heat for 5 minutes per side or until doneserve hot or cold.

Cook the noodles in boiling water until tender, then drain and return to the pot. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat and add the noodles, tossing them occasionally until coated and heated through. Meanwhile, in a small bowl whisk together the milk and the flour until smooth. Whisk in the pepper and a little of the cheese and then pour into the skillet with the noodles. Cook, stirring until the cheese melts and the sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Toss the cooked pasta with the sauce and serve immediately.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Stir in mushrooms and garlic. Cook and stir until mushrooms are tender. Pour soup into skillet. Cook and stir until heated through. Stir in mushroom soup mixture. Bring to boilingreduce heat. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in beef and 1/4 cup of the whipped topping. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until beef is heated through. Sprinkle with pepper. Spoon over cooked egg noodles. Serve with remaining topping. Sprinkle with remaining topping. Makes 4 servings.

Combine olive oil and dressing in large bowl. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add garlic and chicken breasts. Toss to coat. Marinate for 30 minutes. Grill or barbecue chicken according to preference. Serve with salad.

In medium saucepan, combine corn with 1 1/4 cup water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Drain and cool slightly. In small bowl, combine cream cheese and 1/4 cup of the cream. Blend in pepper and whisk in remaining 1/4 cup cream. Fold in corn. Transfer to serving bowl. Sprinkle with pepper. Melt butter. Drizzle over corn.

In a large bowl beat eggs until thickened and foamybeat in flour mixture and yogurt. In another bowl beat buttermilk and vanillawhisk into yogurt mixture. Pour batter into a large skillet coated with cooking sprayheat to boiling. Turn 2 to 3 timescook until bubbles form on surface and pancake is golden brown. Top each serving with a few sliced strawberries and a small dollop of yogurt.

Open the cinnamon rolls and unroll. Place a apple half inside of each. Sprinkle ground cinnamon on the apple halves and roll the cinnamon rolls back up. Place rolls in a pan and pour the glaze over. Bake in a preheated 375 F oven for about 15 minutes until the rolls are golden and the glaze is bubbly. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Cream together butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add vanilla. Add flour and salt and mix until a ball is formed. Knead a few times on floured surface to make smooth dough. Divide dough into two balls and shape into logs about 1-inch thick. Wrap each log with wax paper and refrigerate for an hour. Preheat oven to 325 degrees and remove dough from refrigerator and slice dough into 1/4-inch thick rounds using a sharp knife. Place cookies on baking sheets about 1/2-inch apart. Bake until golden about 15 minutes for small cookies and about 20 minutes for large cookies. Cool on wire racks. Store cookies in airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

Cut the heads of cauliflower into quarters. Cut a cross in the center of each quarter. Place the cauliflower quarters into a large saucepan of boiling water for 2 minutes. Remove from water. Cool. Peel the cauliflower. Cut each quarter into 1-inch pieces. Cut the bacon into small pieces. Toss the cauliflower pieces with the bacon. In a large bowl, mix together the mayonnaise and sugar. Add the cauliflower mixture. Chop the onion. Toss the chopped onions into the cauliflower mixture. Place in a glass dish or in individual salad plates. Cover each layer with a slice of iceberg lettuce. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Cover with another slice of iceberg lettuce. Chill for 2 hours.

Preheat broiler and put a small amount of oil in an oiled broiling pan. Season steak generously with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Place steaks in pan. Pour 4 tablespoons of butter into another small pan. Cook until the butter melts. Add the shallots and cook over moderate heat for 1 minute. Add the Worcestershire sauce. Cook over moderately low heat for 2 minutes. Whisk in the vinegar and cook over moderately low heat for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Brush the sauce over the steaks. Broil steaks for 4 minutes per inch of thickness. Let rest for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place all the herbs in the bottom of a small roasting pan. Sprinkle salt evenly over the herbs. Drizzle the olive oil evenly over the herbs. Rub the lamb chops evenly with the olive oil and herbs. Place chops on the roasting pan. Roast for 25 minutes. Turn chops over and roast for an additional 25 minutes until the chops are done. Serve immediately.

Steam sweet potatoes in a steamer basket in a large pot of boiling water over medium heat, covered, until tender, 12-15 minutes. Meanwhile, heat a large saucepan of salted water to boiling over medium-high heat. Add broccoli florets and cook until tender but still crisp-tender, about 4 minutes. Drain well. Combine chickpeas, green onions (if using) and curry powder in a small bowlset aside. Drain sweet potatoes (if using) and broccoli (if using). Transfer sweet potatoes (if using) and broccoli (if using) to a large bowladd chickpeas (if using), green onions (if using), sour cream, lemon juice, mustard, honey, salt and pepper. Whisk until combined.

Mix together first 4 ingredients until well blended. Spray baking sheet with vegetable cooking spray or line with parchment paper. Drop by spoonful onto baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown and baked through. Let cool and store in refrigerator or freezer for later use.

In a bowl or container mix flour and powdered milk. In another bowl cream the margarine and sugar. Add egg yolks and beat until mixture is smooth. Add dry mixture and mix well. Divide dough into four equal parts. Shape each into a ball. Flatten each ball into a rectangle about one and a half inches wide and five inches long. Place them one by one onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Place the baking sheet onto a cold surface. Sprinkle each rectangle of dough with some flour. Press down lightly then cover the rectangles with a flat surface. Place a heavy object over the dough and leave for at least one hour or until dough turns hard. Uncover and cut dough into small pieces. Roll the dough into balls. Roll them into small rounds. Then flatten each round into a rectangle about one and a half inches wide. Roll the rectangles again until they are about five inches long. Repeat the process of rolling the dough into small rounds and flattening them. Wrap each round tightly and roll them into small balls. Arrange the balls on a baking sheet. Bake at 4

Blanch red chili and onion in 1 cup hot water for 30 seconds. Drain. Heat vegetable oil in heavy pan over medium-high heat. Add chili-onion mixture. Stir-fry 1 minute. Add shrimp paste. Stir-fry 2 minutes. Add gingerroot. Stir-fry 2 minutes. Add brown sugar. Stir-fry 2 minutes. Add red chili. Stir-fry 2 minutes. Add beef. Stir-fry 2 minutes. Add scallions. Stir-fry 1 minute. Add green beans. Stir-fry 2 minutes. Pour into 8x12-inch baking dish. Cover dish with waxed paper. Refrigerate overnight. Remove cover. Spoon into serving dish. Serves 4-6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 1 1/2 quart round casserole with cooking spray. Stir together the butter, sugar and banana in large bowl. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Stir in buttermilk. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt. Add to banana mixture. Gently fold in blueberries. Pour batter into prepared casserole. Bake for 50 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Let stand 10 minutes before removing to cooling rack. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan, combine water and corn. Bring to a boil. Add salmon and cook for 10 minutes or until done. Drain and discard corn. Add potatoes and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender. Meanwhile, heat butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook and stir for 5 minutes or until tender. Add dill weed and pepper and cook and stir for one minute. Add onion mixture to potatoes and continue cooking and stirring until heated through. Stir in cream. Serve over rice or crackers.

Combine almond meal, cocoa powder, sea salt and agave in a bowl. Stir in water until it forms a dough. Add cocoa nibs. Spoon mixture into a greased 8 x 8 baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

Cook frozen ravioli according to directions. Drain ravioli reserving 1/4 cup pasta water. Toss ravioli with tomatoes and spinach in large skillet. Stir in feta cheese. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Cook until spinach is wilted and feta has softened. Stir in reserved pasta water until sauce coats pastadrizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with oreganotop with olives and serve at once.

Boil water for 5 minutes. Add corn and cook for 10 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, melt butter over medium heat. Add mustard, worcestershire sauce and horseradish. Bring to a boil. Season corn with salt and pepper. Place corn on grill. Brush corn with sauce. Turn corn often to avoid sticking. Grill for 12 to 15 minutes or until tender. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Clean asparagus and trim off the ends. Coat a large baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Add asparagus to the baking sheet. Drizzle olive oil over asparagus. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add olive oil to pan. Add onions and mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add garlic powder and cook for 1 minute more. Remove from heat and pour over asparagus. Sprinkle cheese over asparagus. Bake for 10 minutes more. Remove from oven and serve.

Prepare cornbread mix according to package directions and bake in greased muffin pan or 9x13 pan. Cool and crumble into small pieces. In a medium bowl, combine corn, cornbread crumbs and remaining ingredients. Mix until well blended and set aside. In a greased 8x8 baking dish, layer corn and cornbread mixture. Cover and bake at 350 degrees until hot and bubbly. Serves 6 to 8.

Combine first 3 ingredientsblend well. In a nonstick skillet melt butter over medium heatadd bananas and cook 3 minutes or until tender. Reduce heatadd yogurt mixture and cook until thickened and bubbly, stirring constantlycook 1 minute more. Spoon onto platestop with chopped pecans. Makes 4 servings. Nutrition information per serving: Calories 287, Protein 17g, Carbohydrates 38g, Fat 15g.

Heat oil in a large pot on medium heat. Add onions. Cook until onions are soft. Add beef. Cook until beef is no longer pink. Add ketchup, chili powder, garlic powder, hot red pepper flakes. Cook until liquid reduces. Add red wine vinegar. Serve on hamburger buns.

Prepare the angel food cake according to package directions, or use an angel food pan that is at least 10 inches in diameter. Cool completely before cutting into 1-inch slices to make about 12 cups. In a large bowl combine the gelatin with 1/2 cup boiling waterstir to dissolve gelatin completely. Cool to room temperature. In a large bowl combine the whipped topping with 1 cup of the cooled gelatin mixturebeat until soft peaks form. In a large bowl combine the remaining gelatin mixture with the strawberriesstir to blend. Fold in the whipped topping. Spoon the strawberry mixture into the angel food cupscover with the angel food cake slices. Freeze at least 1 hour before serving.

Brown bacon crumbles in skillet until crispdrain on paper towel. Cook elbow macaroni in large pot of boiling salted water until tender but firmdrain in colander. Combine macaroni and bacon in large bowlstir in cooked chicken. Melt butter in skillet over medium-high heatsauté onion until tender. Stir in soupcook over low heat until hot, stirring occasionally. Stir in sour creampour over macaroni mixturestir well. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 10-12 minutes or until hot in centertop with crispy french fried onions.

Place whole plum tomatoes on a cookie sheet with cut sides down. Sprinkle with coarse salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil. Roast for 25 minutes at 350f. Sprinkle with fresh thyme leaves. Serve warm with bruschetta or on top of pasta or salad.

In a large slow cooker combine the onions, black beans, kidney beans, corn and tomato sauce. Add the tomatoes and green chilies and stir well. Add the taco seasoning and chicken and stir to coat. Cover and cook on low for 5-6 hours until the chicken is done. If you are using an electric slow cooker cook on high for 2 hours. Serve with tortillas.

Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet. Add chorizo and cook until browned and crumbly, about 5 minutes. Add onions and bell peppers and cook until vegetables are tender and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add chickpeas and cook until heated through, about 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over cooked rice and garnish with freshly chopped parsley.

Potatoes are washed and peeled. They are sliced into thin slices. Potato slices are soaked for an hour in water. After that the potato slices are placed on a towel to remove excess water. Potato slices are then fried until golden brown. Once they are done frying, they are removed and set aside. Eggs are whisked with salt. Flour is sifted. Once the potato slices are dry they are rolled out and cut into rectangles. One half of the potato slices is filled with bacon and onions. The other half of the potato slices is filled with a mixture of flour and eggs. Both halves are then rolled and placed on a pan. The filled potato slices are rolled and placed on a pan. They are baked for about an hour until golden brown. Once they are done baking they are removed from the oven. They are placed on a towel to remove excess oil. The Swedish Kroppkakor is served warm.
Blend all of the ingredients together. Form into patties and fry.

In a large bowl beat together the peanut butter, carob powder and honey until well mixed. Fold in the coconut and nuts. Spoon into a 9x13 inch pan lined with parchment paper. Refrigerate until set. Cut into 1 inch squares and serve.

Saute garlic in olive oil in a large non stick skillet. Add tomato and saute for 2 minutes. Add kalamata olives and dill and saute for 1 minute longer. Add pasta to the tomato mixture and stir to combine. Add shrimp to the pasta and saute for 2 to 3 minutes longer. Sprinkle with feta cheese. Serve immediately.

Place almonds in single layer in shallow pan or pan fitted with dehydrator tray. Sprinkle with salt. Add oil or butter. Roast at 275f until almonds are light golden brown, turning once. Transfer almonds to food processor or blenderpulse until crumbly. Add oil or butterpulse until smooth. Add salt and cayenne pepperpulse to combine. Transfer mixture to small bowlstir in rosemary. Store in airtight container in refrigerator or freezer.
Fill glass with ice cubes. Add mint leaves, green tea bags, agave nectar and lime juice to ice cubes. Top with lime slice. Serve and enjoy.

Beat egg yolks and sugar in a small bowl until mixture is pale yellow. Beat in cocoa. Mix in vanilla extract and cherry extract. Beat in flour. Set aside. Beat egg whites in a medium bowl until soft peaks form. Gradually beat in sugar until whites are stiff. Fold one-fourth of whites into egg yolk mixture. Fold in remaining whites. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes at 375 degrees. Cool 2 minutes. Roll in coarse sugar.

Soften the manioc starch in warm water and then beat in the sunflower oil. Next add the milk and the eggs to the manioc starch and beat well. Add the parmesan and mild cheddar cheeses and mix well. Transfer the mixture to a pastry bag and then pipe onto the cookie sheet. Bake in the oven for about 20 minutes or until golden. Let the cookies cool for about five minutes then cut into small slices. Serve warm.

In a large soup pot, heat olive oil over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add chicken breasts and cook until browned on all sides. Add broth and water, bring to a boil over high heat. Once boiling, reduce heat to a simmer and cook chicken for about 8 minutes or until cooked through. Remove chicken from pot with a slotted spoon and place in a shallow baking dish. Set aside. Add pasta to pot with chicken broth mixture and cook until penne is al dente (about 10 minutes). Add chicken back to pot along with can of diced tomatoes with garlic and olive oil. Bring soup back to a boil then reduce to a simmer for about 5 minutes to thicken soup slightly. Stir in corn and season with Italian seasoning to taste. Ladle soup into bowls and serve with shredded Parmesan cheese on top.

Combine soy sauce, vinegar, garlic and pepper in a medium bowl. Add flank steaks to marinate for at least two hours or preferably all day or longer. Remove steaks from marinade and pat dry with paper towels. Discard marinade. Grill steaks until desired doneness (I like them medium rare). When ready to serve, cut flank steak into thin slices against the grain. Serve with a fresh green salad and potatoes or rice pilaf.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly spray a 12 cup muffin pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine wheat bran, soy flour, splenda sugar substitute, baking powder, eggs, heavy cream, banana extract and club soda. Mix until well combined. Add in macadamia nuts. Fill prepared muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake in preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Let cool in pan.

Cut the sweet potatoes in half lengthwise. Put them in a baking dish. In a saucepan combine half-and-half, orange juice, brown sugar, butter, orange zest, coriander, salt, ginger and honey. Cook over medium-low heat for 10 minutes. Stir constantly. Pour over sweet potato halves. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees. Let cool. Serve.

Cook the pasta according to the package directions. Cook the chicken in the microwave for 8 to 10 minutes. Stir the frozen vegetables into the pasta. Drain the pasta. Stir in the alfredo sauce, dried basil leaves. Season with pepper. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet, over high heat, warm the oil. Add the shallotscook stirring occasionally for about 5 minutes. Add the garliccook stirring for about 1 minute. Add the asparaguscook for about 3 minutes. Add the brothcook until the asparagus is just tender. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the lemon juiceseason with the salt and pepper. Serve over cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Lay asparagus spears out in a single layer on a cookie sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill for 7 to 10 minutes or until tender. Remove from grill. Toss asparagus with garlic cloves. Place asparagus back in the grill for 5 minutes or until garlic is browned. Squeeze half a lemon over asparagus. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes or until translucent. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add chicken and cook for 5 minutes or until no longer pink in the middle. Add tomatoes and lemon juice. Bring mixture to a simmer. Reduce heat to a gentle boil. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add water. Increase heat to medium. Boil for 5 minutes. Add red pepper flakes and cook for 2 minutes more. Stir in penne and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in cilantro. Serve hot.

Make mango jam by chopping mangoes into 1" cubes and placing them in a large pot with enough water to cover them by at least a couple of inches. Add the chile pepper and ginger and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about an hour or until the mangoes are very soft. Take off the heat and let the mixture cool for a half an hour or so. You can blend the jam if you like or leave it as is. Then take the pulp from the pot and place it in a food processor with the lemons and juice and zest of one lemon and the sultanas and brown sugar and balsamic vinegar and process the mixture until it is smooth and spreadable. Pour the mixture into a heat-proof bowl and put it in the refrigerator for at least 12 hours or so, until it has set up into a spreadable jam. The jam can be stored in the refrigerator for about a month before it starts to get a little moldy.

Prepare a large skillet with sesame oil and peanut oil. Heat skillet over medium heat. Add shiitake mushrooms, scallops and baby bok choy. Cook stirring frequently until tenderabout 15 minutes or until scallops are cooked through (about 5 minutes). Add ginger and garlic and stir fry for 1 minute. Add baby peas and cook for 1 more minute. Add lime juice and stir to incorporate. Taste and add salt and pepper if needed. Serve hot over rice or noodles. Serves 4.

Toast bread. Butter each side. Cut cheddar cheese into small pieces. Place on butter side of each slice. Place slices of bread on each other with cheddar cheese side down. Top with chilies. Place on a preheated grill. Turn when bottom is golden brown. Serve with fruit. Makes 2 servings.

In a small bowl combine the vinaigrette, pecans and cream cheesemix well and set aside. Pat salmon dry with paper towels and sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper. Spread vinaigrette mixture on both sides of salmon and roll up tightly. Lay each roll lengthwise on a piece of foil and tie with butcher string so that the salmon rolls are snug and secure. Place fish on a rack set over a baking sheet and bake at 375 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Meanwhile prepare the wine mixture by combining the wine and parsley and set aside. When the fish is done remove the foil and place on a serving platter. Pour wine mixture over fish and serve immediately.

Bring water to boiladd ginger, peppercorns, fennel seed, cardamom seed, cloves & tea leaves (steep 5 min). Add black tea leaves (steep 5 min). Strain tea leaves & honey. Whisk well & add to hot water with milk & ginger. Bring to boiladd cream (if desired) & remove from heat.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small saucepan on the stove top, combine the brown sugar and cream cheese and cook on low heat until it is smooth and creamy, stirring often. Remove from heat and add the vanilla extract and caramel ice cream topping to the saucepan. Stir well to combine. Meanwhile, in another saucepan on the stove top, combine the toffee pieces and walnuts and cook on low heat until toffee is golden brown and walnuts are coated with toffee and very lightly toasted. Spread the caramel sauce onto the bottom of an oven-proof casserole dish or pan and arrange the apple slices on top of the caramel sauce. Top with the toffee and walnut mixture and spread evenly over the apples. Place the casserole or pan on a rack in the preheated oven and cook for about 20 minutes or until the apples are soft and the topping is golden brown. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream or both!

Preheat oven to 350f. Cook and drain artichokes. Chop into small pieces. Chop onion and garlic. In a large bowl mix together artichokes and chopped onion and garlic. Add mayonnaise and cream cheese and mix well. Add chopped parsley and paprika. Add 1 cup of the shredded spinach. In a 2-quart casserole dish layer half of the spinach and 1 cup of the artichoke mixture. Top with 1 cup of the parmesan cheese. Layer 1/2 of the remaining spinach and 1 cup of the artichoke mixture. Top with remaining 1 cup of parmesan. Bake at 350 for 25-30 minutes.
Rim your glasses with salt. Pour the blood orange juice into a glass with a shot of triple sec. Add tequila. Garnish with orange wedges. Serve with salted limes or lime wedges.

Melt bacon over medium heat in a large saucepan. Add celery and onion and saute over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add flour and stir until flour is light brown, about 2 minutes. Add clam juice gradually while stirring. Cook for 2 minutes. Reduce heat to low and stir in half-and-half, 1 cup at a time until thoroughly mixed. Add clams and white pepper. Cook for 2 minutes or until clams are heated through. Serve with bread.

Preheat oven to 350f. Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add macaroni and cook until tender but firm. Drain. Add tomatoes. Heat to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook 5 minutes. Add ground turkey. Cook until turkey is no longer pink. Add onions and cook until onions are softened. Stir in tomato sauce. Season to taste. Spoon into a 2 quart casserole. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with light cheese whiz. Bake 5 minutes longer. Serve.

In a food processor or mixer fitted with a dough hook, pulse flour, cheese, salt and paprika to combine. With processor running, add cold water by the tablespoon until dough holds together into a ball. Transfer dough to a bowlcover and chill for 30 minutes. On a floured work surface, roll dough to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut with 2-3-inch round cookie cutter to make 10-12 rounds. Gather scraps and reroll dough. Brush tops of rounds with melted buttersprinkle with paprika. Bake 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on rack 10 minutes. Store cooled wafers in an airtight container up to 1 week. Makes 10-12 cookies.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place tenderloin in an ovenproof skillet and rub with oil. Sprinkle with cornstarch. Place in oven and cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from oven and turn meat over. Mix apple sauce and apple pie spices together and spoon over tenderloin. Sprinkle with brown sugar and ground cinnamon. Place back in oven and cook until sauce is thick and tenderloin is cooked through, about 10 more minutes. Serve hot with mashed potatoes and fresh peas and carrots.
Cook 8 ounces of beef in large skillet until browned. Drain fat from beef and return beef to skillet. Stir in remaining ingredients and bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer for 5 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 200 degrees C and lightly grease a baking tray. Place all the ingredients in a mixing bowl and mix well. Shape into 20 small burgers and place them onto the prepared baking tray. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with your favourite herbed mayonnaise. You can make your own by combining equal amounts of mayonnaise and herbs.

Mash the hard boiled eggs with the miracle whip, vinegar, salt, pepper, mustard and celery. Chop the green pepper and onion very fine. Mix the green pepper/onion with the egg mixture and pour into the serving container. Place the mixture into the fridge for 30 minutes before serving so it will set up nicely for you.
Cut cauliflower in half. Steam until done. Spread mayonnaise on one half and mustard on other. Sprinkle cheese on each half. Place cheese sides together. Cut into slices and serve.

Prepare the stuffing mix according to the package instructions. Melt butter in 11x15x2 2-quart casserole dish. Saute the onion and summer squash together until tender about 5 minutes. Combine the squash/onion mixture and the stuffing mix together and pour into the casserole dish. Pour the cream of chicken soup over the stuffing mixture and sprinkle the carrots evenly over the top. Bake uncovered 45 minutes at 400 degrees. Sprinkle with sour cream and enjoy!

Sauté onion and ham in a frying pan over medium heat with 2 tablespoons of oil until golden brown. Add eggs to pan one at a time and cook until firm. Sprinkle parmesan cheese over ham and eggs for garnish. Serve immediately with toast or crackers.

Add all ingredients into a large mixing bowl and mix together using an electric mixer for about 1 minute or until mixture is smooth and creamy and well combined. Pour mixture into the crust and spread evenly into the crust using an electric mixer until mixture is spread evenly into the crust and is level with the top of the crust. Place crust into a large freezer safe container and freeze for at least 2 hours before serving. If desired, decorate with whipped cream and chocolate chips before serving or garnish with fruit for a festive look. Serve with fruit and/or whipped cream and/or chocolate chips for extra garnish if desired.

Combine water, cinnamon sticks, sugar and frozen orange juice concentrate in the slow cooker bowl. Cover slow cooker and cook for 2 hours or until cranberry juice is hot. Stir in lemon juice. Serve hot in mugs with orange slices.

Cook ground turkey in large fry pan until browned. Drain fat. Add onion soup mix. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add chili powder and seasoning. Stir until well blended. Add crushed tomatoes and beans. Simmer for 45 minutes or until beans are tender. Serve with your choice of toppings. I like to add half an avocado.

In a large saucepan combine broccoli & cheese rice mix, boiling water, chicken and garlic powder. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes. Stir in frozen broccoli.
