Cook 3 minutes more. Spread the mixture into an ungreased 2 quart baking dish. Top with lowfat cheddar cheese. Bake for 30 minutes or until hot.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Slice a lengthwise slit in the top of each egg. Brush lightly with melted butter. Place on a cookie sheet. Mix together the spinach leaves and oil. Spoon this mixture over the eggs. Season generously with sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Sprinkle evenly with parmesan cheese. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until a knife inserted in the thickest part of an egg comes out clean. Serve warm.

Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Remove from heatcool slightly. Stir in brown sugar until dissolved. Stir in evaporated milkbring to a boil. Boil 1 minute longerremove from heatstir in vanilla. Stir in powdered sugar until well blendedbeat with electric mixer until smooth. Frost cooled cake or pies. Store in refrigerator until ready to use.

Prepare 2 large bowls. Place all fruits and nuts in one bowl and set aside. Pour sugar and salt into another bowl and stir to combine. Add heavy cream to bowl with fruits and nuts and mix well. Add salted cream mixture to the fruit mixture and stir to combine. Pour into a 9x13 pan and place in the refrigerator for 20 minutes. Mix together marshmallows and cranberry sauce and drizzle over the top. Let sit for 30 minutes. Serve with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

Chop 1 medium yellow or white onion and saute in 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until the onion is tender and translucent. Add 1 tsp garlic powder and 2 tsp cumin. Add the meat and continue to saute over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until the meat is no longer pink. Add 2 cups of tomato sauce and 1/4 teaspoon of both ground coriander and cumin and 2 tablespoons of chopped fresh cilantro and 1 tsp of hot sauce. Simmer for 10-15 minutes or until thickened slightly and serve with tortillas and cheese and lettuce and salsa and sour cream.

Melt butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, garlic, pepper and hot sauce to the melted butter in the skilletbring to a boil. Add shrimp and cook for three minutes until the shrimp is pink. Sprinkle with the parsley. Serve with French bread for mopping up the sauce. Serves 8-10.

Melt butter in a large skillet. Stir in Worcestershire Sauce and catsup. Add pecan halves. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until nuts are lightly browned. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper to taste. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

For the onions, melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened and translucent. Add sea salt and dry cider and bring to simmer. Cook onion for about 20-25 minutes until most of cider has evaporated and onions are very soft. Reduce heat to low and cook for another 10 minutes until onions are completely caramelized. While onions are cooking, prepare beef stock. In large soup pot over medium heat, add beef stock and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and add onion mixture. Simmer for about 10 minutes until onions are infused into stock. In another large pot over medium heat, melt butter in saucepan. Add flour to butter mixture and whisk constantly for about one minute until smooth. Slowly add beef stock and bring to boil, stirring constantly until sauce thickens slightly (about two minutes). Taste and adjust seasoning as needed with sea salt and fresh ground black pepper. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer until sauce thickens slightly (about two more minutes). Taste
Boil tea leaves with honey and basil leaves. Allow it to cool down. Strain the water and keep the basil leaves. Mix the tea water with the basil leaves. Add little honey and sugar and serve.

Slice sweet potatoes lengthwise into 1/8-inch thick strips. Toss with olive oil and seasonings. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray and arrange sweet potato strips in an even layer. Sprinkle with more of the seasonings. Bake for 15 minutes. Turn sweet potato strips and bake for 5 more minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.

Combine all of the above and coat shrimp well on both sides with marinade. Refrigerate for 2 hours or more. Grill shrimp until pink. Serve with lemon wedges. Serving Size 3 oz Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 167 Calories From Fat 10 % Daily Value * Total Fat 10g 15 % Saturated Fat 1g 5 % Cholesterol 20mg 7 % Sodium 367mg 15 % Total Carbohydrate 1g 1 % Dietary Fiber 0g 0 % Sugars 1g Protein 23g 46 % * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs.

Put all of the ingredients in the food processor except the cilantro. Pulse until smooth then add cilantro and pulse until well combined. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 5 days. Makes 3 cups of salsa.

Start by making the soup. In a large soup pot, saute the beef and carrots in the oil for about 5 minutes or until beef is browned. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 20 minutes. Add the broccoli and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the noodles and simmer for about 10 minutes or until they are soft. Serve warm in a bowl. While you are waiting for the soup to be done, make the sauce. In a small bowl, whisk together the sour cream and the teriyaki sauce. Serve the soup over the noodles and sprinkle with the sour cream sauce. To make this semi-homemade, you can use a jar of teriyaki sauce and leave out the sour cream. Or you can use a jar of sour cream and leave out the teriyaki sauce. Either way, it is still delicious and easy.

Steam spinach until wilted. Drain. Fill a pot with water and add lemon juice. Bring to a boil. Add spinach and boil for 3 minutes. Drain. Sautee spring onions in oil. Add spinach. Sautee for 2 minutes. Add rice. Sautee for 3 minutes. Add dill. Sautee for 3 minutes. Add spinach. Sautee for 3 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Sautee for 1 minute. Add water. Stir. Cover. Cook for 12-15 minutes. Stir occasionally. Top with lemon juice. Serve hot.

To make the pie crusts, place a sheet of puff pastry in each of two 8-inch round pans. Prick the bottom with a fork and bake at 400F for 15 minutes. Let cool. For the filling, beat the cream cheese with the margarita mix until smooth. Fold in the whipped topping. Spoon into the pie crusts. Top with frozen strawberries. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes. To serve, top with whipped topping and strawberries. Makes 2 pies.

Rinse lentils. Put them in a saucepan with water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 20 to 30 minutes until tender. Drain. Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add onions. Cook until softened. Add lentils and couscous. Stir in water and salt to taste. Cook until heated through. Stir in cumin and cayenne.

Cook pasta according to package directionsdrain well. In large bowl, mix all other ingredients welladd cooked pasta and toss until well coated. Refrigerate covered for 4 hours or overnight for best flavor. Makes 8 servings.

Place the olive oil and garlic in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook until fragrant. Add the mushrooms and cook until golden. Sprinkle the wine and continue cooking until the wine is reduced. Add the parsley and cook for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms to the ovenproof serving bowl. Add the garlic and wine mixture to the bowl and toss to coat. Bake for 10 minutes until the mushrooms are lightly browned. Serve hot.

In a saucepan combine soy sauce with rice wine. Stir in garlic and lemongrass. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Simmer for 3 minutes. Add cinnamon and bird chile. Cook for 1 minute more. Strain through a fine sieve. Pour sauce into a heatproof container. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and add peanut oil, sugar and salt. Cover and let steep for about an hour before serving.

In large skillet cook sausage over medium heat until browned. Drain fat. Remove sausage from skillet. In same skillet saute onions until tender. Stir in celery. In small bowl mix bread crumbs with sage, marjoram, salt, and pepper. Add to skillet. Stir until evenly moistened. Spoon stuffing into turkey. Place turkey breast side down on rack. Add broth to skillet. Bring to boil. Pour broth over stuffing. Bake turkey uncovered 15 minutes at 450 degrees. Remove turkey from oven. Place butter pats under turkey breast. Return turkey to oven. Bake 15 minutes or until done.

Butter a 2-quart baking dish. Cut bread into cubes and place in a baking dish. Butter bread cubes with butter and sprinkle with sugar. Put lemon peel and ground cinnamon into a small bowl and mix with 2 tbsp sugar. Cut the apples in half and core them. Dip them in the cinnamon and sugar mixture and then coat them with a thin layer of apricot jam. Place apples in the baking dish. Pour the rum over the apples and bring to a simmer over low heat. Cook for 5 minutes. Fill baking dish with apples. Add a layer of bread cubes. Add a layer of whipped cream. Repeat this step with more bread and more whipped cream. Add a layer of apples and a layer of bread. Continue this process until all the apples are used up. Then fill the baking dish with bread crumbs. Bake until golden brown at 400 degrees f for 30 minutes. Let cool for 20 minutes before serving.

In a small saucepan combine the egg yolks with the sugar. Stir over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Bring the mixture to the boiling point. Remove from the heat. Add the vanilla extract and cocoa powder. Stir until the cocoa powder is dissolved. Add the mascarpone cheese. Blend well. Pour the mixture into a 2 quart baking dish. Chill until set. Just before serving, add the heavy cream. Fold gently until combined. Spoon the pudding into individual dessert dishes. Sprinkle each serving with a few hazelnuts. Serve immediately.

Beat eggs with water and a few pinches of salt and pepper in a large bowl until blended well. Put in a shallow pan and place in oven with a pan underneath to catch drippings. Bake for 10-15 minutes until set.

In a medium size bowl place salmon. Remove skin and flake with a fork. Add to bowl along with other ingredients except pecans. Mix with a fork until smooth. Garnish with pecans. Serve with crackers or vegetable chips.

In a small saucepan over medium heat melt margarine. Add ginger and cook until softened. Add orange marmalade and orange juice and stir to blend. Add mustard and tabasco sauce and cook over low heat for about 15 minutes or until thickened. Add salt and pepper to taste. Place chicken breasts in shallow baking dish and spoon 1/2 cup sauce over each breast. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 to 45 minutes or until chicken is done.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Spray baking dish with cooking spray or grease with butter. Roll out pastry dough to fit dish or pie plate. Place into baking dish. Peel apples& slice into thin pieces. Mix apples with sugar, cinnamon, and flour. Pour into prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with butter. Bake for 45-60 minutes or until apples are soft. Serve with ice-cream or whipped cream.

On a piece of foil, place a graham cracker. Top with a marshmallow. Top with a piece of chocolate and a raspberry. Repeat. Make as many as you like. Wrap in foil and place in a bowl. Heat a large skillet over low heat. Add foil packet. Heat for about 1 minute on each side until the marshmallow is melted. Let sit for a few minutes and enjoy.

Cook chicken in boiling water until tender. Remove chicken and allow it to cool. Once it is cooled cut it into small cubes. Mix all the ingredients except the parsley in a medium mixing bowl. Stir to combine. Place 1/2 cup of the mixture in each of the biscuit cups. Sprinkle the top with parsley.

Mix lemon juice with oil, butter, parsley, onion powder, garlic clove, wine, salt and pepper. Set aside. Melt butter and add parsley. Set aside. Trim fat from chicken. Season with paprika. Heat large skillet over medium heat. Spray with cooking spray. Brown chicken on all sides. Set aside. Place chicken in large resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade over chicken. Close bag. Turn bag over a few times. Marinate 15 minutes. Drain chicken. Place chicken in skillet. Cook until no longer pink. Serve over rice.

Cut tomatoes lengthwise in half. Scoop out tomato meat, leaving 1/2-inch shells. In saucepot cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from fat, reserving fat for sautéing the onions. Remove bacon from pan. Sauté onions until softened. In 1-quart baking dish combine tomato meat, bacon, onions and cracker crumbs. Stir well. Add broccoli, accent seasoning and salt and pepper to taste. Add enough broth to moisten stuffing lightly. Pour over tomato shells. Cover with foil and bake at 350f for 1 hour. Serve hot.

Prepare the tuna mixture by combining all the ingredients and mixing thoroughly. Cut the spring roll wrappers in half and soak in cold water for a minute or two until they are pliable. Lay out a piece of spring roll wrapper on a flat surface and place a dollop of the prepared tuna mixture in the center of the wrapper (about a tablespoon). Fold the bottom of the wrapper over the top and then roll the mixture up into a spring roll. Repeat with the remaining mixture and wrappers and place the spring rolls on a lightly greased baking sheet and refrigerate for half an hour before frying. To fry the spring rolls, place a couple inches of peanut oil into a frying pan and heat it until the oil is shimmering. Gently drop the spring rolls into the oil and fry until golden brown (about 1 minute per side). Remove the spring rolls from the oil and serve warm with your favorite dipping sauce.

In large microwave-safe bowl, combine brown sugar, corn syrup, peanuts and butter. Microwave at high for 1 minute. Stir well. Microwave again at high for 1 minute. Stir again. Microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 3 minutes. Stir again. Microwave for 3 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 4 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 1 minute. Stir well. Microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 1 minute. Stir well. Microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 2 minutes. Stir well. Microwave for 1 minute. Stir

Cover sauerkraut with water. Bring to boil over medium high heat. Add bouillon cubes and simmer until tender and liquid is gone. Remove bay leaves from sauerkraut. Discard bouillon. Add paprika and caraway seeds. Simmer uncovered until sauerkraut is tender. Cover and keep warm until ribs are ready. Place ribs on grid over medium high heat and season with pepper. Cook until ribs are browned on all sides. Pour sauerkraut over ribs and cover and cook until ribs are tender and sauerkraut is warm. Serve with hot sauce or ketchup.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, stir together canola oil and ginger. Add chicken. Cook 3 minutes. Add onions, garlic and soy sauce. Cook and stir 4 minutes or until mixture is thickened. Drain chickenset aside. In a small bowl, stir together vinegar and sugar. Stir into ginger mixturecook 2 minutes. Stir in scallions. Serve chicken with sauce.

Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the yellow onion, green bell pepper, minced garlic cloves, rotel, pinto beans, white rice and chicken broth. Stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Cover the pot with a lid. Simmer for 30 to 40 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine pineapple, 1 cup brown sugar and butter. Mix well. Place half of the biscuits in the bottom of a 13-by-9-inch baking dish. Place pineapple mixture over the biscuits. Cover with remaining biscuits. Bake 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with whipped topping if desired. Store any remaining pineapple in the refrigerator. Serves 10.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add catfish and season with salt and pepper. Cook 1 to 2 minutes per side or until fish is cooked through. Sprinkle with flour and cook 1 minute. Add pecans and cook 1 minute more. In a small bowl whisk together lemon zest and juice. Whisk into pan and cook 1 to 2 minutes. Drain fish and serve. Garnish with lemon wedge.

Wash clams thoroughly under cold running water. Drain well. Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add bacon. Cook until bacon is golden brown and crisp, about 5 minutes. Stir in the onion and cook until softened, about 5 more minutes. Stir in the butter, add clams and their juices. Cook for about 5 minutes or until clams open. Pour clam mixture into a large soup pot or crock pot. Add water. Cook over medium heat for about 15 minutes or until heated through. Add cooked rice and cook another 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Remove from heat. Stir in peas. Transfer mixture to a blender and puree until smooth. Serve hot or warm with crusty bread.

Heat the oil over medium heat in a large saucepan until it begins to shimmer. Add the onion and cook until it begins to soften, about 5 minutes. Stir in the curry powder, cumin, cayenne pepper, couscous and broth and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low-medium heat and simmer until the couscous is tender, 5 to 10 minutes (depending on the type of couscous). Stir the couscous gently to avoid clumping, adding more broth if necessary. Season with salt to taste. Serve with grilled vegetables or lamb chops.

Sauté garlic in oil until lightly golden brown. Add broccoli florets, carrot and cook for 2 minutes. Add vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Add pasta, peas, salt and peppercook 12 minutes or until pasta is tender. Remove from heatstir in parmesan cheese. Serve immediately with additional grated parmesan if desired.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. In a medium saucepan, combine the sugar, cornstarch and saltwhisk to combine and set aside. In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and whisk in the flourcook, whisking constantly until the mixture is smooth and thickened. Add the chocolate and cook, whisking constantly until the mixture is smooth and thickened. Remove from the heat and whisk in the egg yolks one at a time until smoothpour the chocolate mixture into the saucepan of chocolate mixture. Cook over medium-high heat, whisking constantly until the mixture thickens and is hot. Remove from heat and whisk in the vanilla extract and milk until smoothpour into the prepared pie shell and bake for 20 minutes or until set. Cool completely before refrigerating overnight or for at least 6 hours before serving. Makes 8 servings.
Mix together all ingredients except cinnamon and clove. Add these last two at end of mixing. Roll to about 1/4 thick and cut with 3" cookie cutters and bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes.
Mix margarine and sugar substitute in large bowl until creamy. Add vanilla extract and water. Stir in flour and egg white. Roll balls in peanuts. Place onto waxed paper. Refrigerate until firm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Lightly grease baking sheet. Slice bread in half and toast for about five minutes until golden brown. In a medium pan over medium heat add olive oil, garlic and onion. Cook until onions are translucent and garlic is fragrant. Add avocados and lemon juice and cook for two minutes. Transfer to toasts and top with eggs and cheese. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Melt a bit of butter and brush onto toast. Serve immediately.

Brown mixed vegetables with oil and butter. Remove from heat and add to bottom of crock pot. In another bowl, combine soup mixes with enough water to make 1 1/2 cups of liquid. Add to crock pot and stir. Add cooked chicken to mixture and stir to combine. Add 1/2 cup of chicken broth and 1/2 cup of sour cream to mixture and stir to combine. Add 1/2 cup of cooked rice and stir to combine. Place crescent roll dough on top of mixture and crimp edges together with fork to seal. Place crock pot lid on and cook on low for 5 to 6 hours or on high for 3 to 4 hours. Serve with additional sour cream and optional additional broth as desired.

In a small bowl mix together mayonnaise and fresh parsley. Place a lettuce leaf on a plate. Arrange the chicken pieces over the lettuce and top with artichoke hearts. Place a small dollop of the mayonnaise mixture on the plate. Garnish with sliced kalamata olives and a hardboiled egg.

Pierce chicken with a fork. Heat butter in skillet. Add vegetables to skillet. Cook about 5-7 minutes. Remove vegetables to platter. Place chicken on top of vegetables. Sprinkle with seasoning salt and tarragon. Heat through in the skillet. Serve.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook tortillas in the hot oil on both sides until golden. Keep warm in the oven. In the same skillet over medium heat melt the butter. Add the chicken, mushrooms and cheddar cheese. Cook for 3 minutes. Place the cooked chicken mixture on each tortilla. Fold in half and press together to seal. Sprinkle the cheese on top. Cook for 5 minutes or until golden. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

Combine mayonnaise and salt and pepper to taste in small bowl. Combine tilapia and onion in large baking pandrizzle with mayonnaise mixture. Bake in preheated 400 degree oven for 20-25 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve hot.

Dissolve the orange jell-o in boiling water. Stir in the orange juice and water. Pour into shot glasses and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Before serving, add the vodka and the Triple Sec. Stir to combine. Serve with a long spoon. Makes about 20 shots.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add macaroni and cook 8 to 10 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add asparagus and cook 3 to 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add ham and cook 5 minutes. Stir in the chives. Stir in the macaroni and milk. Season with salt and pepper. Top with the sliced chives. Enjoy.
Mix all ingredients in crock pot except corned beef. Cook on low all day. Put corned beef in crock pot in evening and cook all night until beef is tender.

In a large bowl combine the rolled oats, brown sugar and salt. Add the butter and cut it in using a pastry cutter. Beat the egg lightly in a small bowl and stir it into the flour mixture. Stir in the vanilla. Press the mixture into the bottom and up the sides of the pie pan. Sprinkle the walnuts over the crust. Place the pan in the refrigerator while you make the filling.

Preheat oven to 375. Spray a 9-inch-square baking dish with cooking spray. In a large skillet over medium heat, combine the tuna in water, cheese, cottage cheese, eggs and onion flakes. Cook for 10-12 minutes or until thickened, stirring constantly. In a small bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. In a large bowl whisk together chicken bouillon, worcestershire sauce and hot water. Whisk in flour mixture. Add to tuna mixture and whisk until combined. Pour into prepared dish. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until set. Serve hot.

Bring a small amount of water to a boil in a small saucepanadd eggs and cook for 7 minutes until hard-boiled. Remove from heatdrain water from pan. Peel eggscut into quarters lengthwiseplace in a small bowl. In a large bowl, combine spinach, garlic, vegetable oil, vinegar, salt and peppertoss to coatserve topped with egg.

Heat extra virgin olive oil over medium heat in skillet. Season the salmon with salt and cracked black pepper. Place salmon fillets skin side down into skillet, gently press down to make sure fillets are flat. Cook for about four minutes on each side or until cooked through. Meanwhile, combine all marinade ingredients into blender or food processor and pulse until well blended. Remove salmon fillets from skillet to plates and spoon ginger lime marinade over top of salmon fillets. Sprinkle with chopped fresh herbs if desired. Serve immediately.

Sift together flour salt into a large bowl. Make a well in the center of the mixture. Add water. Using your fingers mix until combined. Pour in the oil and mix again. Form the mixture into a ball. Divide the dough into thirds. Roll each section out into a flat disk about 1/4 inch thick. Cut each disk into 4 squares. Place a small amount of sesame seeds in the center of the square. Fold the corners up and then fold the opposite corners in. Using the tip of your finger or a small sharp knife, make a hole in the center of each triangle. Place the triangles onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Brush the tops of each pastry square lightly with water. Cover the triangles loosely with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 24 hours. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Bake the triangles for 12 to 15 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown. Serve warm.

Mix flour, mustard and milk. Stir together with a whisk until smoothset aside. Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heatadd butter and carrot, and sauté until golden brown, about 5-7 minutes. Add garlic and stir until fragrant, about 2 minutes longeradd ham and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes longer. Cook noodles according to package directionsdrain and rinse with cold water. Add cooked noodles and peas to the skillet with the carrot mixtureadd the flour mixture and stir until incorporated. Serve immediately with a dollop of sour cream and a sprinkling of parsley.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a large skillet, brown ground round with onion and green chilies over medium heat until meat is cooked through and onions are translucent. Drain excess fat and add cream of mushroom soup and enchilada sauce. Bring to a boil and simmer until sauce thickens slightly. In a large bowl, beat milk and corn tortillas until soft. Add 1/4 cup of the meat mixture and stir until well blended. Spoon mixture on tortillas and roll up tightly. Place seam side down in a 9x13 inch glass dish and cover with 1/2 cup enchilada sauce and 1/2 cup cheese. Repeat with remaining enchiladas until dish is full. Bake for 15 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.

Stir sourdough starter and add all other ingredients. Mix thoroughly. Knead thoroughly by hand for at least 5 minutes. Place in greased bowl and let rise for approximately one hour. Punch down dough and place on lightly greased baking sheet. Shape into a rectangle and cut in half. Roll each half into a rope approximately four inches in diameter. Arrange in a circle on baking sheet. Allow to rise for approximately one hour. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15 to 20 minutes. Makes two loaves.

Pre-heat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 12-cup muffin pan with butter. Sift together the flour and baking powder. Set aside. In a large bowl, beat together the sugar and butter until fluffy. Add the egg and beat until light and fluffy. Add the flour mixture and beat until combined. Add the ricotta and milk and beat until fluffy. Spoon the batter into the muffin cups and bake 15-20 minutes. Allow to cool for 2 minutes before removing from the pan. Frost with confectioners sugar if desired.

Bring 1 1/2 cups of water to a boil in a saucepan. Stir in cream of chicken soup and onion. Add rice, celery carrots and green peppers. Cook, uncovered for 45 minutes or until rice is tender. Drain. Layer in a 9 x 13 inch pan. Top with cooked chicken. Bake 30 minutes. Serve hot.
In a small bowl mix together brussel sprouts, margarine and lemon juice. Sprinkle with salted cashews and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Season steaks with salt and pepper and place in shallow dish. In another dish, combine the butter and salsa. Dip the steak into the salsa mixture and place in baking dish. Pour wine over steaks. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with a baked potato and salad.

In a large casserole or Dutch oven, saute the chicken in the butter until it is golden brown. Stir in the wine and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 1 hour. Stir in the parsley. In a small bowl, combine the mushrooms with the paprika. Stir the mushrooms into the chicken mixture. Season with the pepper and the salt. Cover the casserole or Dutch oven. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove the lid and bake for another 10 to 15 minutes, or until the sauce is thick. Serve with rice or bread.

Cook red potatoes and drain. Combine ground beef, onions, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, water, salt, pepper, and sage. Mix well. Pour 1/2 of the beef mixture into a 9 by 13 baking dish. Top with diced potatoes. Pour the rest of the meat mixture over the top. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Let stand for 10 minutes. Top with green onions if desired. Serve with a fresh garden salad.

Mix together the brown sugar, honey and butter in a small saucepan. Add the hot water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Lower the heat to low and cook for about 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir in the salt. Cool slightly. Stir in the rum and rum flavoring. Pour over your favorite ice cream. You can also pour this sauce over carrots or potatoes. Serve at room temperature.

Saute onion and green onion in butter until softened. Add carrot and continue sauteing until tender. Add chicken broth and simmer for 10 minutes or until carrot is tender. Stir in mushrooms and simmer for 5 minutes more or until mushrooms are softened. Stir in beef broth and add Durkee onions. Cook for 5 minutes more or until tender. Stir in green onions and season with salt and pepper. Serve with chopped chives on top if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat oil in skillet over medium heatsaut panadd mushroomsgreen onionred peppersauteadd baby spinachsauteadd basiladd salt and peppercook until wiltedadd ricotta cheesecook for 4 more minutesadd eggscook for another 5 minutesadd parmesan cheesecook for another 5 minutesremove from heatadd butterstir until butter is meltedpour into greased 9x9 glass baking dishbake in preheated oven for 25 minutes.

Place peaches in a glass bowl or other container. Sprinkle with sugar. Cover with sauternes wine or sweet white wine or orange liqueur. Marinate in refrigerator for 6 to 24 hours or overnight. Serve over ice cream or cake.

Heat tortillas as directed. Place tortillas between 2 sheets of aluminum foil. Place in a 400 degree oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and allow them to cool for 5 minutes. Top tortilla with mini marshmallows and mini chocolate chips. Close foil tightly and place in a 400 degree oven for 5 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Repeat with remaining tortillas.

Mix flour and salt together and set aside. In a large mixing bowl, combine the egg yolk and milk. Gradually add the flour mixture to the milk mixture and stir until combined. Place the mixture into a pastry bag fitted with a small tip and pipe the mixture on the prepared pans. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a pie comes out clean. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan and removing the bottoms of the pans (if desired). Dust with powdered sugar and serve warm or at room temperature.

Melt the butter. Stir in the peanut butter and graham cracker crumbs. Mix the milk and powdered sugar. Pour the peanut butter mixture into an 8x8 pan. Pour the milk mixture over the crumb mixture and smooth with a rubber scraper. Sprinkle the milk chocolate chips over the top. Let set in the refrigerator for a few hours. Remove from pan.

Cook macaroni in boiling water according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, combine cottage cheese with eggs in a medium bowl. Add 1/4 teaspoon of the oil and the garlicmix well. Add macaroni and stir to coat with the egg mixture. Pour mixture into a buttered 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with remaining cracker crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until golden brown on top. Serve with salsa. Makes 6 servings.

In skillet heat canola oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and cook until soft. Add minced garlic and cook 2 more minutes. Add flour and cook for 2 more minutes. Add cumin, 1/2 cup pork stock, dried oregano, green chile, and black pepper to pan. Bring to a boil. Stirring constantly cook for 5-10 minutes until slightly thickened.

Combine lemon juice and orange juice in a small bowl. Set aside. In a small pot over medium heat, add sugar and 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil and stir until the sugar dissolves and mixture is clear. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Whisk in peppercorns and mint leaves until they are thoroughly combined. Slice strawberries and place them into a small bowl. Pour half-and-half mixture over the fruit and mix until fully combined. Serve over ice with lemon juice mixture drizzled over the top.

Preheat oven to 375. Season prawns with salt and pepper. Drizzle with oil, garlic and butter. Place prawns on a baking sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes until the prawns turn pink. Transfer to a platter. Drizzle with garlic-infused olive oil and serve. To make the garlic infused oil, place 4 large cloves of garlic in a small glass jar. Pour the olive oil into the jar. Place in the refrigerator for 3 days. Remove the garlic cloves from the oil. Reserve the infused oil for future use. To make the chili bean sauce, combine the chili beans with the olive oil in a small saucepan. Cook over moderately low heat for 10 minutes. Transfer to a small container. Reserve for future use.

Mix all ingredients except almonds and chocolate chips in a heavy saucepan over low heat until blended and smooth. Remove from heat and add almonds and chocolate chips. Stir until chocolate chips are melted and almonds are coated with the chocolate mixture. Pour into a greased 9x5x3 pan and refrigerate for at least one hour before cutting. Store in the refrigerator. This will keep for a couple of weeks if kept refrigerated but will be best if made fresh for each serving.

Bring 2 quarts water to boil in heavy large pot. Add 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Add green beans. Return to boilreduce heat to low. Simmer, covered, 4 minutes. Drain. Add 1/2 tablespoon oil to potadd green onions. Cook 2 minutes. Add green beans to pot. Add 1/2 tablespoon each of oil and bacon. Cook 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Makes 6 servings.
Puree bananas. Blend in rum and lemon juice. Fold in whipped topping.

Heat vegetable oil in large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add the garlic and stir until fragrant (about 1 minute). Add the shrimp and cook until they turn pink (about 3 minutes). Add the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper and continue cooking for about 1 minute. Transfer the shrimp onto plates and top with butter. Serve with rice or potato.

Cook pasta as directed on package. Drain and rinse with cold water. Add avocado and garlic and blend until smooth. Add tomatoes and cilantro and blend again. Add lemon juice and parmesan and blend well. Pour over pasta and toss. Serves 4.

Rinse chicken breasts under cold water and pat dry with a paper towel. Clean and dry the grill surface by wiping it with a moist paper towel. Grill the chicken breasts 5 minutes per side over high heat or until done. Grill chicken for 3 to 4 minutes per side over high heat if you like it rare or cook 6 to 7 minutes if you want it well done. Remove from the grill and let the chicken rest 5 minutes before serving to allow the juices to redistribute throughout the chicken. Thinly slice the chicken breasts against the grain and arrange them in individual bowls. Combine the curds in a small bowl with the coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chilies, gingerroot, olive oil and salt to taste. Spoon the dressing over the chicken. Serve at room temperature with toothpicks for dipping.

Boil potatoes until soft in a large pot of water. Drain potatoes and return them back into the pot and add vinegar and oil. Cook for a few minutes more until the potatoes are hot and the oil has emulsified into the vinegar and oil. Stir a few times while cooking and serve in a bowl with salt on top of the chips and a side of vinegar and ketchup.

In a large bowl combine mandarins oranges, pineapple tidbits, marshmallows, coconut & cherries. In a separate bowl combine sour cream, nuts & maraschino cherries. Pour fruit mixture over nuts & cherries. Serve immediately or chill for up to 2 hours. (Note: For a more traditional fruit salad, substitute mandarins oranges for cherries.)

Combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder and baking soda in medium bowl. Stir in oil, vinegar and water until well blended. Stir in vanilla extract. Mix in eggs one at a time until incorporated. Mix in enough flour mixture so batter is thick and well blended. Pour into greased and floured 9-inch round or square baking panbake at 375 for about 35 minutes or until wooden pick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack about 10 minutes before serving. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Melt butter in heavy large saucepan over medium heat. Saute brown onions and garlic in butter until tender. Add flour and stir 1 minute. Gradually add eggs and stir until combined. Gradually add tomato sauce and stir until combined. Cook over medium heat 5 to 10 minutes. Cook fettuccine according to package directions and drain. Toss fettuccine and sauce together in large bowl and add basil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

In a medium pot bring orange juice to a boil. Add water and ground nutmeg, stirring well to dissolve the nutmeg and the salt. Add the oatmeal and bring to a boil again, then reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes until the oatmeal is tender and the juice is absorbed. Serve hot with chopped banana and chopped dates over it.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in sugar. Mix in cornmeal, baking powder and salt. Add in eggs. Stir in whipping cream and vanilla. Gradually add in flour. Cook over low heat stirring constantly until thickened. Stir in butter. Remove from heatstir in cheese. Spoon into a 2 quart casserole dish. Top with cheese. Bake at 350f for 30-40 minutes or until golden brown on top. Serve warm.

Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well with a wooden spoon or with your hands. Transfer to a jar and let marinate for at least an hour before using. Note: The longer this marinade sits the stronger the flavor will be. The marinade can be used as a salad dressing and with grilled meats and fish as well as a dipping sauce for vegetables and appetizers such as fried calamari and tempura vegetables. Serve with a crusty bread.

Cut artichokes in half and place in a bowl of cold water to keep the leaves intact. Place spinach in a separate bowl of cold water until ready to use. Place artichokes and water into a food processor and blend until smooth. Drain and set aside. Drain spinach and place into processor. Add remaining ingredients and process until smooth and blended. Pour into serving dish and refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve with crackers or crostini.

Bring milk to a boil over medium-high heat in a large saucepan. Add rice and salt and boil for 5 minutes over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until rice is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed, 45 minutes to 1 hour. Stir in sugar and butter and cook until butter melts and sugar dissolves, about 3 minutes. In a small bowl, beat egg with 2 tablespoons Grand Marnier until blended and frothy. Add to rice mixture and cook, stirring constantly until mixture thickens and is creamy, about 2 minutes longer. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Let cool for 15 minutes before serving. Sprinkle top evenly with Grand Marnier and serve warm.

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling water until al dente. Drain and run under cold waterdrain well and keep warm. Heat oil in heavy large skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking, add garlic and cook 30 seconds, stirring constantly. Add spinach and season with salt and peppercook until wilted, stirring occasionally. Add olives and lemon juice and toss until well combinedseason with salt and pepper if necessary. Add lemon rind and toss gently until spinach is hot. Stir in pasta and toss gently until pasta is well coated. Transfer to platter, sprinkle with parsley and serve. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Prepare the cornbread stuffing mix according to the package instructions. Crumble the ham pieces in the prepared stuffing mix. Stir in the spinach. Spoon the mixture onto the flour tortillas. Roll up the tortillas. Place the ham rolls in a greased baking pan. Brush the rolls with butter. Sprinkle the rolls with paprika. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes. Top each roll with sour cream and cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer.

Bring the vegetable stock to the boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the quinoa and cook for a further 5 minutes. Drain and set aside. Place the cherry tomatoes in a bowl and add the chickpeas and haloumi cheese. Add a few mint leaves and drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Season to taste. Sprinkle with remaining mint leaves and serve.

In mixing bowl cream together the vegetable oil and unsweetened chocolate. Add sugar and beat until light. Add eggs one at a time. Add flour and beat again. Add baking powder and vanilla. Roll dough into balls about 1 inch in diameter. Roll balls in the cocoa mixture. Place balls about 3 inches apart on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with confectioner's sugar. Let stand until all the sugar melts and forms a glaze. Makes about 24 cookies.

Heat the butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion soup mix and cumin powder and cook until fragrant. Add the pork and brown on all sides. Pour in the jellied cranberry sauce. Add the mustard. Pour in the beef broth. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat. Cover and simmer for one hour.

Preheat oven to 350. Cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time and add vanilla extract. Mix in flour and cocoa until well combined and flour is incorporated and the batter is not dry. Add baking soda and salt and beat well. Stir in the peppermint patties and fold in the chocolate chips. Drop by spoonfuls onto greased baking sheets about 2-1/2 inches apart. Bake 10-12 minutes or until the edges are set and the centers are still moist.

Melt butter in a pan. Add the shallot and saute for 30 seconds. Add the rice and chicken broth and bring to a boil. Simmer for 20 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and let it stand for 5 minutes. Add the zucchini and bacon and stir. Sprinkle with the cheese. Serve.

Mix the seasonings together in a small bowl. Sprinkle the seasonings on both sides of the steak and press into the meat. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add the steak and cook for 3 minutes. Turn the steak over and cook another 3 minutes. Remove the steak from the pan and set aside. Add the onion to the pan and saute until translucent. Add the pizza sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Return the steak to the pan. Cover and cook on low for 15 to 20 minutes or until steak is tender. Remove the steak from the pan and slice. Place the slices of steak on the bottom of each pizza crust. Cover with mozzarella cheese. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 10 to 15 minutes or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle the top of each pizza with Parmesan cheese. Serve with desired side dishes.

1. Place the shrimp in a large mixing bowl. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper to taste. 2. Add the lemon juice and freshly minced garlic to the bowl. 3. Add the dijon mustard to the bowl. 4. Add the parmesan cheese to the bowl. 5. In a small skillet add the butter with the dried red chili flakes. 6. Place the shrimp into the skillet. Cook for 4 minutes. 7. Remove the shrimp from the skillet. Place the shrimp back into the bowl. Add the lemon butter mixture to the shrimp. 8. Sprinkle with freshly chopped parsley to taste. 9. Serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a frying pan. Add the chilli peppers. Fry for 5 mins. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the prawns. Stir in the parsley and garlic. Toss to coat. Drain well. Season with salt. Transfer to a plate. Serve at room temperature.

Combine fruit with sugar and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir in pectin and return to a boil. Stir constantly for one minute and remove from heat. Pour jam into hot sterilized jars and seal immediately with lids and rings. Cool and store in cool dry place. Refrigerate after opening and use within three months.

Wash apples. Core them. Peel if you wish. Place apples in a large bowl. Add sugar. Stir to coat. Place bowl in microwave. Heat apples for about 2 minutes. Stir. Heat for another 2 minutes. Stir. Heat for another 1-2 minutes. Stir. Microwave for 30-60 seconds more if necessary. Cool for 5 minutes before serving. Serve warm or cool. Top with fresh lemon juice. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Add salt if desired.

Combine apple juice, apple sauce and mint leaves in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and salt. Pour into a 9x9-inch baking dish. Cover dish with plastic wrap. Freeze for 1 hour. Unwrap dish from plastic. Break up ice crystals with back of a spoon. Refreeze for 1 hour. Repeat process 4 times or until mixture is slushy. Serve granita immediately.

Cook ham in hot skillet until browned. In a separate skillet saute green and red peppers with onion and garlic in oil. Roll up ham steaks in crescent rolls. Spread jam on each crescent roll. Roll up each ham steak into the crescent rolls. Place on baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Peel sweet potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch slices. Place potatoes into a large bowl and toss with oil, 1 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp pepper. Place potatoes on cookie sheet and bake at 400 for 1 1/2 hours or until tender. Remove from oven and cool slightly. Place potatoes into large bowl and add sugar and eggs, beating well with an electric mixer. In another bowl, combine flour, brown sugar and pecans and add to potatoesmix well. Spray 1 1/2 qt baking dish with pam. Pour sweet potato mixture into dish and sprinkle with 1 tsp vanilla extract and cinnamon. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until set. Makes 8 servings.

Put all ingredients except the tamari into a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth. Taste and adjust seasonings. Add the tamari to the blender or processor. Blend again. Toss the dressing with the vegetables.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Combine the honey and water in a large bowl. Stir in the yeast and let stand until foamy. In a large bowl combine the flour and salt. Add the yeast mixture and stir until combined. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 7 minutes. Place dough in an oiled bowl and let rise until doubled in size. Punch dough down and shape into a ball. Place dough in greased loaf pan. Cover and let rise until doubled in size. Bake in preheated oven for 35-40 minutes or until loaf tests done.

Beat eggs and sugar with fork in a bowl until light and fluffy. Mix in milk and vanilla. Add butter and heat mixture over low heat until butter melts. Add salt and cooked rice. Remove from heat and stir in raisins and cinnamon. Pour into a buttered baking dish. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Bake at 350 degrees for about an hour. Serves four.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. In a bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a separate bowl, add the egg and sugar and beat together. Add the butter and beat until the butter is incorporated. Add the buttermilk and beat until combined. Add the poppy seeds and almond extract. Add the dry mix to the wet mix and fold until just combined. Divide the batter between 18 muffin cups. Bake for 18-20 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Makes 18 muffins.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place the fillets on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Brush with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 15 minutes or until firm. Remove from oven and top with feta cheese. While fillets are baking, boil spinach for about 2 minutes. Drain and set aside. Toss the pasta with the tomato sauce and the baby spinach. Top each fillet with about 3/4 cup of pasta mixture. Serve immediately.

Cream together poppy seed and 3/4 cup of the sugar. Add remaining 1/2 cup of the sugar, honey, vanilla extract, egg yolks and egg whites. Sift together flour and cinnamon. Add to other mixture. Add butter. Mix well. Chill. Roll out dough 1/8 inch thick. Cut in desired shapes. Bake at 350 degrees for 5 to 7 minutes.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain potatoes, cut in half and let cool. In a large bowl, combine mayonnaise, cheese, mustard and dijon mustard. Mix in potatoes and onion. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

Cook white kidney beans according to the package directions. Add olive oil to the bean mixture and stir well. Add balsamic vinegar and stir well. Mix together. Serve with pita bread and assorted crudites.

Slice french bread in half horizontally. Spread each half with 1 tbsp of the tomato soup. Place the slices of beef on the bread. Sprinkle each with 1 tbsp of the cheddar soup. Place the other slice of bread on top. Cut diagonally into 4 piecesserve immediately.

Melt butter in a saucepan. Add the milk and sugar. Heat to a boil. Remove from heat and add the peanut butter and vanilla. In a bowl combine the oatmeal and the chocolate chips. Pour the butter mixture onto the bowl containing the oatmeal. Mix well. Drop by teaspoonful onto wax paper. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Makes 3 dozen cookies.

Combine 4 cups of stuffing mix and broth in a large bowl. Add carrots, onion and garlicset aside. Combine sour cream and soup in another large bowlset aside. Prepare chicken according to package directionsdrain. Remove stuffing from pouches and place in a large bowl. Combine with stuffing mixtureset aside. Place squash in a large bowladd butter. Microwave on HIGH 4 to 5 minutes or until tenderdrain. Stir in stuffing mixtureset aside. Heat oven to 350f. Place 2 cups stuffing mixture in a 1 1/2-quart baking dish coated with cooking spraytop with 1 1/2 cups squash mixturetop with 2 cups stuffing mixture. Bake 35-40 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat the broiler. Season the pork chops with salt and pepper. Place the chops in a roasting pan. Pour the cream of mushroom soup over them. Place under the broiler until the liquid has reduced to almost nothing. Flip the pork chops over. Continue to cook until the pork chops have browned.

Season chicken with salt pepper and garlic powder. Dip in flour. Heat oil in heavy pan or Dutch oven. Brown chicken. Add potatoes in same pan. Add onion garlic and spices to chicken and potatoes. Add chicken broth. Bring to boiling over medium heat. Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender about 30 minutes. Stir occasionally. Remove chicken from pot. Pull meat off chicken and cut chicken meat into chunks. Add meat back to pot. Heat through. Serve with rice.

Wash eggsthen cook them in boiling water for 15 minutes. Boil nuggets in hot oil for 12 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Remove chicken nuggets from oil with paper towelsthen cool on rack. Cut eggs in half lengthwisethen cut each egg into 4 pieces. Mix together mayonnaise, chicken nuggets, eggs, salt, black pepper, and sugar in large bowlthen place on serving plattergarnish with parsley sprigs, if desired. Makes 16 servings.

In the bowl of your electric mixer, beat the egg whites on medium speed until frothy. Add the cream of tartar, salt, vanilla extract, and food coloring. Continue mixing on medium speed until stiff peaks form. Using a teaspoon or small cookie scoop, drop the mixture onto the wax paper. Roll them into balls. Sprinkle with superfine sugar. Place a mini chocolate chip on top of each ball of dough. Roll the balls into the melted chocolate. Place on the wax paper. Let the balls set for 10 minutes. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 425f. In a bowl, combine panko, peanuts and coconut. In another bowl, combine sesame dressing and ginger. Spray a large sheet pan with pam. Place salmon fillets on pan. Brush with sesame dressing mixture. Sprinkle with panko mixture and place in the oven until done. (30 minutes) Serve with rice and steamed veggies.

Cook ground beef in skillet with onion until browned. Drain the fat out of the skillet. Stir in tomatoes, mashed potatoes and season with salt and pepper. Add water if needed to keep the potatoes from sticking. Pour the meat mixture into an unbaked pie pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 40-45 minutes or until cheese is bubbly. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving.

In a small mixing bowl combine egg whites and brown sugar. Whisk until combined. Add vanilla extract and combine until all sugar is dissolved. Divide pecans into 4 small bowls. Add 1 tablespoon of the mixture to each bowl. Divide pecans between 4 small muffin cups and add the remaining mixture. Place the muffin cups into the freezer. Once pecan halves are set, gently remove from muffin cups and serve.

Heat bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp, then remove bacon to paper towels to drain. Add celery and onion to bacon drippings and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add carrot and potato chips to onions and continue cooking until potato chips are crispy and vegetables are tender. Add black eyed peas and prepared mustard and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add barbecue sauce and cook for an additional 5 minutes until peas are tender but still slightly firm. Add green pepper to pan and cook for an additional minute or two to soften pepper. Serve with potato chips on top and serve with a roll and your favorite dinner side dish.
Put all liquid ingredients in blender and blend until smooth and creamy. Pour into serving glasses and top with whipped cream and ground nutmeg.

Put the eggs into a bowl, add the sugar to the eggs and stir well. Add the cream to the eggs and sugar and stir well. Whisk the dark chocolate into the cream/egg mixture. Pour the mixture into the serving bowl (you can use a serving bowl or glasses) and refrigerate overnight. Serve cold.

Combine flour with salt and pepper. Gradually whisk in chicken stock. Bring to boil in large saucepan. Simmer until mixture thickens slightly. Add butter and whisk to blend. Stir in peas. Cook 5 minutes longer or until butter is melted. Drain peas. Sprinkle with mint. Place lettuce leaves on plates. Spoon peas onto lettuce leaves. Top with warm vinaigrette. See serving suggestions in recipe description.

Prepare beets for roasting by removing all the leaves from stem end and washing thoroughly (leaves may be reserved for salad). Remove skin from beets and cut into large wedges. Place wedges in roasting pan with enough water to cover. Place leeks and garlic cloves around beets, drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and fresh rosemary and bay leaves to taste. Roast for approximately 45-60 minutes or until tender. Remove leeks and garlic cloves when beets are done and reserve for use in another recipe. Beets can be roasted with skin on or off.

Heat olive oil and brown ground beef over medium heat. Drain beef. Add condensed cream of mushroom and milk. Mix well. Stir in boiling water and vegetables. Simmer about 10 minutes or until beef is tender. Stir occasionally. Add potatoes. Cook over low heat for about 45 minutes. Do not let boil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add sour cream if desired.

Combine flours and salt in a large bowl. Add butter and cut in until it forms pea-size pieces. Add egg and blend until well combined. Add broth and whisk until mixture forms a ball. Flour hands and work surface. Roll dough into balls about the size of a golf ball. Gently drop dumplings into the simmering broth. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Uncover and cook until dumplings float. Serve with a green vegetable.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a rolling boil. Add potatoes and cook 10 minutes, or until just fork tender. Drain potatoes well. Add sausage to the pot with enough hot water to cover by 1/2-inch. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook 10 minutes. Add potatoes, onion, tomatoes, and hot sauce to the sausage mixture. Reduce heat to low. Cover skillet & cook 5-7 minutes or until potatoes are tender and sausage is cooked through. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese & cook 3-5 minutes longer or until cheese melts. Transfer hashbrown mixture to a serving platter.

In a small bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Stir in sugar and let stand 5 minutes. Beat in milk and egg. In a large bowl, combine flour and salt. Beat in yeast mixture. Gradually beat in remaining flour. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead 5 minutes. Place in greased bowl of a bread machine and follow manufacturer's instructions. Let rise until doubled. Punch down and shape into a ball. Place on a greased cookie sheet and top with garlic and butter. Bake at 400 for 15-20 minutes. Makes 2 loaves.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place the carrots in a roasting pan and drizzle with the honey and oil. Season with salt and pepper. Place the bacon on top. Roast in the preheated oven until tender.

Cook ramen noodles in boiling water according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, in a small bowl whisk together sugar, oil, vinegar, green onion, almonds and sunflower seeds. Stir in broccoli slaw mix. Sprinkle with remaining almonds and green onion. Top with ramen noodles.

Preheat grill. In a large bowl, combine brats and onion and toss to coat with seasoned salt and garlic powder. Set aside. Heat grill to medium-high. To assemble, place 1 brat on each bun. Spread 1 tbsp. of cheese on top of each brat and sprinkle with 1 tbsp. of onion. Grill for 5 minutes until brats are cooked through and cheese has melted. Serve.
Split muffin in half. Place egg in center of muffin. Top with cheese and butter. Close muffin. Place in a frying pan until egg is cooked. Flip muffin over. Serve immediately.

Bring water and whole milk to boiling in large saucepan. Stir in grits. Return to boil. Reduce heat. Cook uncovered 10 minutes or until thickened and tender. Stir in cheese and butter. Remove from heat. Stir in hot sauce and season with salt and pepper. Serve.

In a large pot bring bouillon to a boil. Add mushrooms. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes. Stir in flour. Cook 1 more minute. Stir in wine. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook about 5 minutes. Stir in salt and pepper. Serve over cooked noodles.

In a large saucepan place the cocoa and the hot water and stir over medium heat. Stir until the cocoa dissolves. Then add the salt and the sugar and stir for a minute or so. Add the vanilla and stir. Continue cooking for about 10 minutes or so. Make sure the mixture is boiling and stirring constantly. Cool for about an hour and then pour into the desired size container. This recipe makes about 3 cups of syrup and will keep for several months on the pantry shelf if kept cool. It may thicken some over time so stir and thin with a little water if needed.

Combine 1 cup hot water and 1 cup ice water in a large bowlstir in gelatin until dissolved. Stir in peppermint extract and 1 cup ice cream until combined. Stir in remaining ice cream until almost smooth. Divide mixture between 4 bowls and top with chocolate sprinkles and remaining 1/2 cup ice cream.

Cook bacon in a skillet until crispy. Remove from pan and set aside on paper towel lined plate. Set aside bacon grease in pan. In a small bowl, combine sugar and vinegarset aside. Cut tortellini into small piecesplace in medium bowl with reserved bacon drippings. Add mayonnaisetoss well. Add broccolitoss again. Add sugar/vinegartoss. Sprinkle with raisins, sunflower seeds and red oniontoss again. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving time.

Cut the bacon into 1/2-inch pieces and cook it until it is crispy. Add the ham hock to the pan and brown it. Then add the onions and cook until they are translucent. Add the garlic and cook until it is soft. Add the sugar and the cayenne pepper and cook for 30 seconds. Add the parsley and the salt and stir well. Add the beans and potato and cook until the vegetables are tender. Serve.

Cook the sausage until it is just done. Mix the cracker crumbs with the milk. Beat the eggs with the salt and pepper. Combine the sausage, the cracker mixture and the egg mixture. Divide the mixture into 2 pieces. Roll the mixture into a rectangle, about 10 by 16 inches. Spread the apple across the rectangle. Roll up the mixture. Slice the ring into 1/2-inch thick rounds. Place the apple ring rounds on a baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes. Serve with a green salad.

Cut okra into one-inch pieces. In large skillet saute onion and green pepper in oil and butter until tender. Stir in okra and season with salt and pepper. Pour in tomato sauce. Bring to a boil. Cover and bake at 325 degrees for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with cracker crumbs. Bake another 15 minutes or until bubbly.

Heat a little olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the zucchini and saute for 3-5 minutes. Stir in the mushrooms and cook for another 5 minutes or until softened. Add the rest of the ingredients except the egg whites. Whisk the egg whites. Pour the egg whites into the skillet. Cook until firm. Serve.

Cut the orange into 24 pieces (quarter the orange) and arrange the slices on the plate. Dice the onion into 1/8 inch pieces (24 pieces) and place on top of the orange. Dress with red wine vinegar to taste, salt to taste and pepper to taste. Garnish with the basil leaves.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add vinegar or white wine to water. Reduce heat to a simmer. Drop in eggs gently. Cook for 30 seconds. Remove eggs with a slotted spoon and place on paper towel to drain. Peel eggs. Place eggs on a serving plate. Place a dollop of plain yogurt on each egg. Spoon a generous amount of picante sauce over yogurt. Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Serve.

Boil the chicken breasts in water for about 20 minutes. Drain off the water. Once the water is gone take the cooked chicken out of the water. Chop the cooked chicken. Mix the chopped cooked chicken with the celery and green onions. Add in the mayonnaise. Mix to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Sear short ribs on all sides in a Dutch oven or other heavy pot. Remove. Add oil to pot. Add onion and garlic. Cook until onion is softened and garlic is golden brown. Return short ribs to pot. Add wine and stir well. Add tomatoes and broth. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer. Cover and cook for 2 hours. Remove short ribs to a cutting board and cool. Skim fat from sauce. Add rosemary. Simmer for 15 minutes. Return short ribs to sauce and simmer for 1 hour. Serve with mashed potatoes or rice.
Put all ingredients into a large bowl. Mix well. Chill and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Melt butter in a 9-inch square baking pan or similar dish. Add apples, brown sugar and cinnamon sugar. Stir to coat evenly. Sprinkle cereal over fruit mixture. Pour egg mixture over all. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with whipped yogurt or ice cream if desired.

Spread mayonnaise over 2 slices of bread. Spread cheese over 2 more slices of bread. Arrange sausage, olives and pepper evenly over cheese. Place 2 pieces of bread with cheese on top. Cut diagonally across sandwich to form triangles. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heatadd onions, and sauté for about 5 minutes, or until translucent. Stir in flour until incorporatedwhisk in broth, white wine, cilantro stems (discard leaves), salt, pepper, and garlicbring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium lowcook for about 5 minutes, or until slightly thickened. Meanwhile, heat oil in a skillet over medium heatadd chicken, and sauté for about 5 minutes per side, or until cooked throughtransfer to a plate. Stir coriander leaves and juice into saucereturn chicken to saucepancook for about 5 minutes, or until heated throughgarnish with cilantro leaves.

In a skillet, cook green beans in boiling salted water for 2 minutes or until tender crisp. Drain and keep warm. Meanwhile, in a large skillet cook chicken breasts in hot oil over medium heat for about 2 minutes on each side or until donedrain and keep warm. In a bowl, combine the soup with the mayonnaise and lemon juicestir in the curry powder and blend well. Pour the mixture into a shallow 11x8x2 inch baking dish. Layer the green beans and cooked chicken on top of the sauce. Sprinkle with cheese and bake at 350 degrees F for 25 minutes or until heated through and the cheese is melted and golden.

In a large pot on medium heat add 2 tbs oil and a tablespoon or two pop corn. Once the corn pops add remaining oil and popcorn. Once the corn pops add remaining oil and popcorn. When the corn is done remove from heat and pour into a large bowl and add chili powder and lime juice and salt and stir until evenly coated. Serve immediately or store in airtight container for a week.

Brown meat, fat and flour together. Add boiling water and soy sauce. Cook for about an hour over medium heat until tender. Add mushrooms and onions. Cook for 5 minutes. Add celery. Cook for another minute or until celery is tender. Add bean sprouts. Cook for another minute. Serve hot.

Place the butter into a small saucepan and heat gently to soften the butter. Add the curry powder and stir to combine. Add the lemon juice and heat to a simmer. Turn off the heat and whisk in the salt and extra virgin olive oil. Stir in the shallot and set aside to cool slightly. Wrap the asparagus spears with a paper towel and rub the towel to dry them. Trim the ends of the spears and discard. Brush the asparagus with the curry butter and roast for 8 minutes or until just tender and brown at the tips. Serve immediately with your favorite bread or crackers.

Cook rice according to package directions. Drain. Add oil to skillet. Cook onion over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add rice to pan. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in lemon juice, lemon rind, turmeric, salt, and pepper. Add water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover pan, and simmer until rice is tender. Stir in cilantro. Serve immediately.

Mix all ingredients together in a bowl until well mixed. Place parsnips in a roasting pan in a single layer. Pour mixture over parsnips, mix gently with a spoon. Bake at 350 degrees F for about 45 minutes or until parsnip is tender. Let cool for a few minutes before serving or using on sandwiches or other foods.

Combine crabmeat and Miracle Whip in a mixing bowl. Fold in cheese until well blended. Heat a skillet over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Brush tortillas lightly with olive oil on both sides. Divide crabmeat mixture between tortillas. Sprinkle olives over crabmeat mixture on each quesadilla. Place quesadillas on a heated baking sheet and bake for 5 minutes or until crisp and heated through. Serve immediately with sour cream on the side.

Slice the zucchini thinly and add them to a bowl with the olive oil. Salt and pepper them. Toss them around in the bowl to coat them with the oil and salt. Add the garlic and green onions and toss again. Wash and dry the scallops. Cook them in a skillet with a little butter. When cooked through and opaque, take them out and set aside. When the scallops have cooled a little add them to the zucchini mixture. Add the tomatoes and parmesan. Toss it all together and serve.

Slice the kale lengthwise into 2-inch sections. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onions and cook until the onions are softened and light brown. Add the kale and seasoned with salt and pepper. Cook until the kale is wilted and tender. Pour the balsamic vinegar over the kale and toss until it is well coated. Sprinkle the almonds over the top and serve.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Slice the potatoes thinly. In a large bowl toss the potatoes with the olive oil and season well with salt and pepper. Place on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes or until fork tender. While the potatoes are roasting, heat the garlic and rosemary in a pan until fragrant. Sprinkle the potatoes with the garlic and rosemary. Serve.

Fill tomatoes with a mixture of crabmeat, mustard, mayonnaise and seasoning. Heat chili sauce in a microwaveable bowl for about 2 minutes to warm it. Place a spoonful of the crabmeat mixture into each tomato. Serve with a dollop of the chili sauce. Serves 4.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Season spareribs with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine marmalade and orange juice. Pour half the liquid over the spareribs and place in a 9x13 inch glass baking dish. Repeat with remaining ribs and juice. Cover with plastic wrap and let stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Meanwhile, preheat a grill to medium-high heat. Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and onions and saute until softened and fragrant. Stir in soy sauce. Add spareribs to the pan and saute for 6 minutes. Add stock and vinegar and bring to a boil. Transfer to the prepared baking dish. Cover and bake for 25 minutes. Remove the plastic wrap and drizzle the remaining marmalade mixture over the ribs. Cover with foil and continue baking until tender, about 35 minutes more.
Mix all ingredients together. Pour into a greased 8x8 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. This makes 8 servings.

Drain salmon and flake. Combine flaked salmon with the rest of the ingredients. Mix well with an electric mixer. Pour into a small bowl or ramekin. Refrigerate for about 2 hours. Serve with crackers or a piece of crusty bread.

In medium skillet over medium-high heat cook bacon till crisp. Remove from pan with slotted spoon and set aside on paper towels to drain. Add pepper bacon to pan with sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil. Cook stirring until tomatoes are heated through. Drain sun-dried tomatoes from oil then set aside to cool. Meanwhile prepare pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat from package directions. Drain pasta then return to pot with remaining oil. Add sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil along with bacon and pesto sauce. Cook stirring till pasta is coated with pesto. Add 1/4 cup shredded romano cheese stirring until cheese melts and mixture is thoroughly combined. Season with black pepper to taste. Garnish with remaining cheese if desired. Serve with extra cheese if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a mixing bowl, beat condensed milk and whole milk until thickened. Stir in eggs and vanilla. Combine cereal and condensed mixturestir until crumbly. Fold in melted butter. Pour into two (8 inch) square baking pans coated with cooking spraytop with additional crushed corn flakes. Bake for 35 minutes or until set. Cool in pans on wire racks. Cut into squares and enjoy!

Steep tea leaves in boiling water for about 5 minutes. Add mint and ginger root. Allow mixture to steep for about 30 minutes. Strain and add sugar and ice cubes. Add sliced fresh peaches and serve over ice.
In a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients. Mix until well blended. Spread onto crackers or spread on tortilla chips for dipping.

Heat the oven to 350f. Line a 13 x 9 inch baking pan with wax paper. Spray the paper lightly with non-stick cooking spray. In a large bowl combine the cake mix, margarine and eggs. Beat until smooth. Add the sweetened condensed milk and vanilla. Beat until well mixed. Fold in the pecans. Pour half the batter into the prepared pan. Top the batter with half the toffee. Pour the remaining batter over the toffee. Sprinkle the remaining toffee over the top. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until the top is lightly browned. Cool completely in the pan.

In a bread machine with a dough cycle, put the water, oil, lemon juice, brown sugar, salt and yeast into the pan in that order. Put the bread flour and dry milk powder in a mixing bowl. Sprinkle yeast over flour. Add dry yeast to flour mixture in bread machine. Add apricot pieces to the mixture in bread machine. Set bread machine to dough cycle. Let bread machine mix for about 30 minutes until dough is smooth. Place dough in a greased bowl. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in size. Punch dough down. Place dough in greased bread pan. Let rise until doubled in size. Bake at 375 degrees f for 40 to 45 minutes or until bread is brown. Remove from pan while still hot. Cool on a wire rack.

Wash and pat dry chicken. Sprinkle curry powder inside. Stuff chicken with garlic. Sprinkle salt, pepper and cayenne on top. Put in a large pot. Add enough hot water to cover. Cook at a low temperature for 2 to 2 1/2 hours or until done. Add onion. Cook until tender. Add remaining ingredients. Cook until thick. Serve over cooked rice.

Melt butter over medium heat. Add shallot and garlic. Cook until softened. Add chicken stock and whipping cream. Cook over medium heat until sauce is slightly thickened. Stir in white wine and chili powder. Cook until sauce is reduced by half. Taste and adjust seasonings with salt and pepper. Add brie and cook until brie is softened. Serve immediately over pasta.
Trim and cut green beans into 1-inch pieces. Place them in a large bowl. Add remaining ingredients and toss well. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.

Preheat grill. Slice 4 pieces of bread and place on grill. Slice 4 eggs. Place on top of bread and cook 4 minutes on each side. Remove from grill. Set aside. Melt 4 ounces semisweet chocolate and 4 ounces peanut butter in double boiler over simmering water until smooth. Stir in powdered sugar. Place egg yolks on plate. Stir in yolks to temper. Add chocolate mixture and stir until smooth. Fold in whipped egg whites. Spread chocolate mixture over eggs. Cover and refrigerate at least one hour. To serve, slice slices of bread. Spread each slice with a thin layer of peanut butter and top with an egg.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease muffin tin. In a large mixing bowl sift together the flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda. Whisk in the butter until it resembles coarse meal. Whisk in the buttermilk until just combined. Fill muffin tins. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly before removing from tin. Store in refrigerator or freezer.

Slice the celery and onion. In a large skillet, melt the butter. Add the celery and onion. Cook on low heat for about 45 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add the salt and pepper to taste. Add the tomatoes. Cook for another 20 minutes. Add the cabbage. Cook for another 20 minutes. Turn off the heat. Stir in the green pepper. Serve warm.

Bake hash browns according to package directions for 15 minutes or until done. Meanwhile in skillet cook onion in margarine over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add peas and cook 2 minutes or until tender-crisp stirring occasionally. Mix in soup with milk. Bring mixture to boil stirring occasionally. Stir in hamburger. Simmer 5 minutes or until hamburger is cooked through stirring occasionally. Stir in hash browns and onion. Top with cheese and french-fried onions. Bake 10 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Serve.
Saute onion and celery in oil. Add ground beef. Cook until browned. Drain. Add pasta and onion soup mix. Stir in cheese. Pour into a greased 2-qt baking dish. Cover and cook 45 minutes at 350f.

Boil 10 minutes 4 black tea bags in 2 cups of water. Cool. Place in a large pitcher and add 5 cups of water and 1 cup of sugar. Refrigerate for at least an hour to let tea flavors meld. Chop up about 5 yellow cling peaches. Add them to the pitcher and refrigerate for at least an hour.

Cut avocado in half crosswise. Using a spoon, remove the flesh and place in a bowl. Add the plum tomatoes, onion and feta. Squeeze lemon juice over the mixture. Mix together gently with a fork. Drizzle with Italian dressing. Serve with crackers.

In a small bowl combine the honey, cider vinegar, 2 tablespoons of whiskey and the thyme. Brush salmon fillets with the mixture. In a small bowl combine 2 tablespoons of the remaining whiskey with the lemon zest. Brush the top of the fillets with the mixture. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook salmon fillets skin side down for 3 minutes. Turn fillets over. Cook 2 minutes more or until done. Spoon remaining whiskey over top of fish.
Remove ends from marrows. Cut them in half lengthwise. Put them in a glass bowl. Squeeze in half the lemon. Add oil, garlic and salt to taste. Stir to mix. Leave for 20 minutes before serving.

Put sugar and flour in a large saucepan and stir over medium heat until dissolved and sugar is clear. Remove from heat and stir in milk and water. Add butter and stir until melted and mixture is smooth. Remove from heat and add vanilla and salt and eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Pour into prepared pie shells and bake at 350 for about 10 minutes or until set and golden brown on top. Let cool and refrigerate before serving.

Cook pasta in boiling salted water until al dentedrain and transfer to a large serving bowl. Meanwhile, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add whipping cream and cook until bubbly. Stir in parmesan cheese and salt and pepper. Pour sauce over pasta and stir to combine. Sprinkle with additional grated cheese. Serve immediately.

Place all ingredients except taco seasoning mix in crock potmix well. Cover with lidcook on LOW 8 hours. Stir in taco seasoning mixcook 1 hour longer. Serve with sour cream if desiredgarnish with fresh cilantro.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Rinse and pat dry the chicken legs. Transfer to a large bowl and toss with 3/4 cup of soy sauce and 1/4 cup of honey. Add the green onions and toss again. Transfer the chicken to a 9x13-inch baking dish and top with 2 tablespoons of toasted sesame seeds. Pour the remaining soy sauce and honey over the chicken and sprinkle with cornstarch. Roast for 45 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. While the chicken is cooking, combine the remaining honey and hot chili sauce. Stir until smooth and set aside. Remove the chicken from the oven and coat each drumstick with the honey glaze. Return to the oven for 5 minutes to finish. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium heat brown ground beef with onions. Drain and set aside. In a large saucepan over medium heat melt butter. Stir in garlic. Add ground beef, crushed red pepper flakes and marinara sauce. Simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Stir in beef stock and salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in parmesan cheese. Taste for seasonings.

Cut avocados in half and remove pits. Scoop out avocado flesh and add to a large bowl. Slice tomatoes into half moons and add to bowl. Add shrimp and spring onions. Squeeze lime juice over top. Add minced garlic and chili sauce. Stir to blend. Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve immediately.

Cut brie into quarters. Place on platter with apple slices, pear slices, raisins and pecans on top. Pour apple juice over all the fruit to cover about 1/4-inch deep. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 4-24 hours. When ready to serve remove plastic wrap. Slice and serve with crackers or bread.
Slice the bread. In a bowl combine cheese with bacon and mayonnaise. Spread onto the bread. Top with celery salt and ground red pepper. Broil until cheese melts. Top with freshly chopped chives.

In a large bowl, sift together the flour, sugar and baking soda. In a smaller bowl, beat together the milk and eggs.
