Stir the wet mixture into the flour mixture and mix just until all the dry ingredients are moistened. Pour batter into a large skillet and heat on medium heat. Drop batter by the spoonful onto the hot skillet. Cook for about 30 seconds on one side and then flip. Continue to cook until they are golden brown. Serve with butter and syrup.
In a large bowl, mix all the ingredients and form the mixture into patties. Grill patties and top with a slice of smoked cheddar cheese.

Cut the jalapenos in half lengthwise and remove seeds (you can do this by cutting a small slit in each one). Cream cheese with panko breadcrumbs. Dip jalapenos in the mixture and then roll in seasoning salt. Drop on a baking sheet lined with wax paper. Refrigerate until firm. Form into balls. Bake at 400 degrees until golden brown.

Trim and slice 3 lb vidalia onions in half. Set aside. Heat 1 tbsp unsalted butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Saute the slices until tender. Sprinkle with 2 tbsp flourcook 1 minute. Add 2 cups beef broth and 2 cups dry white winecook 2 minutes. Add 2 cups reduced-sodium worcestershire sauce and 2 tbsp of minced garliccook 1 minute. Add the vidalia onions and 2 cups beef brothcook 2 minutes. Place 16 french bread slices on a 9x13-inch pan. Add the broth mixture and sprinkle with 1/2 cup romano cheese. Cover and cook on low for 3 hours. Remove from heatsprinkle with remaining romano cheese and 1 tbsp butter. Serve immediately.
Bring water to boil in kettle or tea pot. Add boiling water to tea bags. Let steep for 2 minutes. Add sugar to taste. Pour into ice-filled glasses. Add more ice if desired.

Combine the pork chops with the tomato soup, peas, onions and salt. Cover with aluminum foil and bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove foil and brown the pork chops. Serve with hot sauce or brown gravy.

Cream butter and cream cheese together. Stir in sugar and vanilla. Add flour and stir until a soft dough is formed. Roll out 1/2 inch thick and cut out cookies. Place 1 kiss in center of each cookie. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan.

Combine sour cream, parmesan cheese, lemon juice, onion and salt in a small bowl. Set aside. Sprinkle grouper fillets with liquid hot pepper sauce and paprika. Place fillets in an 8 x 8 inch lightly greased baking dish. Spoon 1/2 of the cheese mixture over each fillet. Bake at 350f for 10 - 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with parsley. Makes 2 servings.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken. Cook and stir chicken until thoroughly cooked and no longer pink. Drain. Stir in soup. Stir in corn. Cook and stir until thoroughly heated. Serve warm with tortillas and cheese.

Grease 9x13 pan. Layer mashed potatoes on bottom of pan. Layer bacon over mashed potatoes. Layer eggs over bacon. Season eggs with salt and pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes to 1 hour, until eggs are set.

Cook tortellini according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Heat olive oil and garlic in small skillet. Stir in caesar salad dressing and cook until hot. Divide pasta among 4 serving plates and top with caesar sauce. Sprinkle each with parmesan cheese and garnish with cherry tomatoes and olives. Serve immediately.

Roll out the dough into a 16" x 24" rectangle. Spread mozzarella cheese on one half of the rectangle. Top with ham. Roll up the dough and place seam side down. Place the rolls on a pizza pan. Bake at 400f for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and top each roll with provolone cheese. Place the genoa salami on top of the provolone cheese. Bake for an additional 5 to 8 minutes or until cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Top each roll with swiss cheese and capicola. Sprinkle parmesan cheese on top. Crack eggs into a small bowl and beat until well blended. Place eggs on top of pizza. Bake for an additional 5 to 8 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with fresh lettuce.

Bring a large pot of water to a boiladd salt to taste. Place fish in a large bowl or baking pansprinkle with curry powder. Combine lime juice, pepper and green pepper in a small bowl. Pour over fishtoss to coat. Add oil to boiling waterheat to boilingadd green pepper mixture to fishcover tightlysteam for 10 minutes. Serve hot with rice and vegetables.

In large saucepan combine gelatin and cold waterstir well. Cook over medium-low heat until gelatin softens. Stir in coconut flavoring and allspice. Stir in fat-free cottage cheeseremove from heat. Coverrefrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Using sharp knife, cut mango and banana into thin slicesplace in small bowls. Stir 1/2 cup yogurt into gelatin mixturespoon into 8-oz. plastic containers. Coverrefrigerate for 3 hours or until set. Just before serving, stir remaining yogurt into gelatin mixturespoon over fruit slices. (If gelatin mixture thickens, stir in more yogurt.)

In medium bowl combine all marinade ingredients. Brush all over chicken breast halves and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Lightly grill over medium heat 4 to 5 minutes per side or until cooked through and no pink is left.

Mix breadcrumbs, eggs, salt and black pepper together. Mix parmesan cheese into bread crumb mixture. Coat steaks with breadcrumb mixture. Place steaks into oven proof skillet. Place skillet into oven and cook for about 10 minutes or until done to your liking. Meanwhile, mix spaghetti sauce into mozzarella cheese. Take skillet out of oven and pour sauce mixture over steaks. Cover with foil until ready to serve.
Mix all the dry ingredients together. Add milk and whipping cream. Mix well. Bake at 350f for 35 minutes.

Add one cup of water to a large pot and add salt and pepper to taste and bring to boil over medium-high heat. Once boiling add one frozen bag of simply potatoes traditional mashed potatoes and cook for about ten minutes. While potatoes are boiling chop up three garlic cloves into small pieces and add them into a small sauce pan with one tablespoon of butter over medium-low heat and saute until soft and fragrant. Once potatoes have finished cooking mash them up and add chicken broth and taco seasoning mix until combined and stir in garlic and remaining two tablespoons of butter and stir until combined. Once potatoes are done remove from heat and let cool for about five minutes so that you can handle it easier while you remove shrimp from frozen bag and peel and devein them. Place shrimp in a large bowl and add one tablespoon of cumin and one teaspoon of taco seasoning mix and mix until combined and set aside. Once potatoes have cooled add shrimp and mix until combined. Place potatoes and shrimp in two greased individual casserole d

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Slice the bread into about 1/4 inch slices. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in the oven for about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, place roasted garlic cloves in a small dish. Cover with olive oil. Put in the microwave for about 20 seconds. Remove from microwave. Carefully squeeze the garlic out of it s skin into a small bowl. Add the garlic to the roasted garlic. Drizzle with olive oil. Place in the fridge for at least 1 hour. In a small bowl mix together the asiago cheese, romano cheese, parmesan cheese, basil, tomato. Place tomato mixture in the fridge for at least 1 hour. Place the bread in the oven. When done take the bread out. In a small bowl mix together the tomato mixture. Spread the mixture on the bread. Serve with the roasted garlic.

Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil over high heat. Add the linguine. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 8 minutes or just to al dente. Drain. In a large frying pan over medium-high heat add olive oil. Add green onion and cook for 30 seconds. Add parsley and cook for a minute. Add lemon juice. Season with salt and ground pepper. Add the pasta. Toss with the lemon juice mixture. Add asparagus. Cook for about a minute. Add shrimp. Cook for about a minute. Add parmesan. Serve.

Bring 3 cups of water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add wild rice and cook over medium heat until water is absorbed. Remove from heat. Drain. In a medium saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add carrots, green onions, and cook until carrots are tender. Add rice. Stir in 1/4 cup of the wine vinegar. Add remaining oil. Stir in remaining vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. Add raisins, pecans and honey. Toss until all is coated.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Peel and seed the pumpkin. Cut it into 1 inch cubes and add to the boiling water. Cook until tender and drain. Peel and finely mince the garlic. Reserve 2 tbsp for the gnocchi. Finely grate the rind of the lemon and reserve for the sage butter. Dice the pumpkin flesh and the potato. In a large mixing bowl combine the pumpkin, potato, eggs, parmesan cheese and butter. Add the garlic and the lemon rind and mix well. Stir in the flour to form a soft dough. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough into a long tube about 1 inch in diameter. Cut the tube into 1 inch pieces. Roll each piece into an 1 inch round. Gently dip each round into the milk and then the flour. Dip the floured pieces into the pot of boiling water and remove with a slotted spoon. Cook

Combine water and sugar in a pan. Place over medium-high heat and bring to a boil. Add the cocoa and cinnamon sticks. Stir constantly until the mixture is thickened and boiled. Remove from heat and pour mixture into a large bowl. Add the milk and pure vanilla extract. Stir. Pour into mugs. Top each cup with whipped cream and a sprinkle of cinnamon.

Place a large skillet over medium heat and spray with nonstick cooking spray. Sprinkle the chicken with the louisiana hot sauce and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook until the chicken is cooked through, about 3-5 minutes per side. Cut the cooked chicken into strips and set aside. In the same skillet, heat the canola oil over medium heat and sauté the onion until tender. In a large bowl, mix the onion, mayonnaise, hot sauce, and blue cheese together and season with salt and pepper to taste. Divide the chicken and the onion mixture between the flour tortillas and fold the tortillas into wraps. Serve with lettuce on the side to add as desired. Serve with celery sticks and ranch dressing on the side for dipping.

In a large saucepan over medium heat combine the onions and peaches and cook until softened. Add the brown sugar and cook for 2 minutes. Add the golden raisin and crystallized ginger and cook for 1 minute. Add the vinegar and cook for 1 minute. Add the mustard seeds and cook for 1 minute. Add the flour and cook for 1 minute. Add the cider vinegar and cook for 1 minute. Add the mustard seeds and cook for 1 minute. Add the cinnamon and clove and cook for 1 minute. Remove from the heat and transfer the mixture to a 4 quart slow cooker. Cover and cook on high for 1 hour or on low for 4 to 6 hours. Transfer to a food processor or blender and puree until smooth. Pour into a 1 quart jar or bowl and store in the refrigerator.

Melt butterscotch chips and peanut butter over low heat until smooth. In a separate bowl, beat egg white until frothy. Add powdered sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. In a large mixing bowl, combine melted chips, peanut butter and butterscotch chips and rice krispies and fold egg whites into mixture and stir until well blended. Pour mixture into greased cookie sheets and bake at 375f degrees until set and lightly browned about 15-20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Whip eggs until frothy and add honey and vanilla. Sift flour and salt. Add butter and whip until butter is melted. Add milk and flour mixture. Mix until smooth. Pour into 9-inch pie pan and bake 50-60 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan. If desired, decorate with coconut.

Cut onion in half and place in large bowl. Peel garlic and crush. Combine garlic and onion with 1 cup water and let sit for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, wash and dry cabbage and cut into 1-inch strips. Add cabbage to bowl with garlic and onion. In a small bowl combine soy sauce, sesame oil and remaining water. Pour over cabbage mixture and let stand for 20 minutes. Drain cabbage mixture in a colander and discard liquid. Place cabbage in serving dish and garnish with chopped green onion and sesame seeds. Serve with steamed rice.

Combine maple syrup, pecans, butter and sugar. Add egg and stir. Add cake flour and baking powdermix well. Add milk and stir until combined. Pour into greased cake pan. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 55 to 60 minutes.
In a large skillet over medium heat add bacon and walnuts to the skillet and saute until bacon is brown and walnuts are toasted. Add broccoli and saute 2 minutes. Serve over rice or in a salad.

Prepare chicken breasts by removing skinrub with mustardseason with curry powder and place in a casserole dish. Bake chicken at 425 degrees for about 45 minutes or until juices run clear when chicken is pierced with a fork. Serve chicken with sauce.
In a food processor, pulse garlic and basil until finely chopped. Add broth and pine nuts and pulse until finely chopped. With processor running, gradually add cheese until well combined.

Bring 3 cups water and 1 cup milk to a boil in a large saucepan. Gradually whisk in the orzo pasta. Reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered until pasta is tender and liquid is absorbed, 8 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons butter. Add the garlic and onion soup mix. Cook and stir until onion is softened. Stir in the peas. Add the hot pasta mixture to the saucepan and stir to coat the pasta with the sauce. Remove from heat and stir in the Parmesan cheese. Toss to coat.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowlset aside. Cream the butter and sugar together in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment until light and fluffy. Add the egg and mix until combinedset aside. In another large bowl, combine the flour mixture and the orange zest. Add the flour mixture and the egg to the butter mixture and mix until combined. Stir in the orange juice and cranberries and mix until combined. Form the dough into balls and place on baking sheets lined with parchment paperbake for 9 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove the cookies from the oven and immediately press the dark chocolate chips into the top of each cookie with the flat side of a spoon. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 24 cookies.

Mix together the ras el hanout spice mix and 1 tbsp of the butter. Rub the mixture all over the chicken. Heat the rest of the butter and oil in a pan over medium heat and add the onion and a pinch of salt. Cook for 5 minutes, or until the onion is softened and translucent. Add the chicken stock cube and water and bring to the boil. Add the chicken and reduce the heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, bring a saucepan of water to the boil and add the rice. Cook for 10 minutes until tender. Drain well and return to the pan. Add the apricots and pistachios and mix well. To serve, divide the chicken and rice between two plates and garnish with flat leaf parsley.

Mix vegetable oil and cornmeal. Place in a shallow bowl. Dip hot dogs in mixture. Wrap hot dogs in paper towels and place on skewers. Place skewers in the cornmeal mixture. Turn skewers over to coat well. Fill a deep fryer with oil. Heat oil to 350 degrees F. Fry hot dogs until golden brown. Drain hot dogs on paper towels. Dip into the barbecue sauce. Serve on a stick.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Mix sugar and flour. Add vanilla. Cut margarine into small pieces. Mix together. Add eggs. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until firm.

Combine mangoes, red onions, red pepper, ground salt and brown sugar. Whisk until well blended. Place pork tenderloin on grill and grill for 4 minutes. Remove from grill and let rest 10 minutes. Slice pork to 1/4 inch thick strips and serve over rice or potatoes with mango salsa.
Mix all the ingredients together in a large bowl. Chill before serving.

Combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt in a large bowl. Stir in syrup until well blended. Mix in egg whites until a sticky dough is formed. Roll tablespoon-sized balls of the dough in powdered sugar. Place on ungreased baking sheets and flatten with the palm of your hand. Bake in a preheated 375f oven for 6-7 minutes or until lightly browned. Transfer cookies with a spatula to a wire rack.

In medium sized pot heat butter over med heat add artichokes & onion. Saute until tender add chicken stock & simmer until artichokes & onion are tender add parsley & salt & pepper to taste simmer until all is combined add fettuccine & stir add heavy cream & simmer until all is combined serve & enjoy!

In a small bowl, combine the radishes and scallions in the olive oil and vinegar mixture. Add the garlic and season with salt and black pepper to taste. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine the arugula with the radishes and scallions. Divide the greens among four salad plates and arrange the radishes and scallions on top of the greens. Drizzle with the mustard vinaigrette and garnish with kalamata olives.

Preheat the oven to 350. Prepare a 9x5 inch loaf pan by lining the bottom with wax paper. In a medium bowl, beat the sugar and butter until light. Add the mashed banana and beat until smooth. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Stir into the banana mixture. Add the coconut and nuts and stir to combine. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake until a cake tester inserted into the center of the bread comes out clean, about 1 hour. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Remove from the pan and let cool completely on a wire rack.

Fill a large pitcher with water. Add the zest of 2 limes, 1 tablespoon sugar and 1 tablespoon mint leaves. Let it steep for about 30 minutes. Strain out the mint. Add the lime juice from 1/2 lime to the pitcher. Add the rum, stir gently, and add ice. Fill glasses with ice. Pour the rum mixture into the glasses, top with club soda. Garnish with fresh mint leaves.

In large bowl cream butter and sugar. Stir in egg and vanilla until light and fluffy. Add flour and baking soda and stir until mixed. Roll dough into balls and place on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 12-15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Brown steak on both sides. Transfer steak to an ovenproof dish or a roasting pan (if using a roasting pan, spray it lightly with non-stick cooking spray). Arrange onions around steaktop with sliced mushrooms. Pour 1 cup water into skillet over medium heat. Stir in garlic salt. Gradually add 1 cup cream of mushroom soup to the skillet, stirring constantly until it thickens slightly. Pour over steak mixturesprinkle with parsley flakes. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until a meat thermometer reads 160 degrees for medium-rare meat. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Serve steak and rice together with 1 cup broth.

Whisk together olive oil and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Peel and dice 1 navel orange into 1-inch cubes and 1 red onion into 1-inch dice and combine with the dressing and toss well. Add 1 cup orange juice and toss again and add 2 cups of the orange juice and toss again. Remove from refrigerator and allow salad to come up to room temperature, about 15 minutes. Add the mint leaves and toss again and allow the salad to rest at room temperature for 10 minutes before serving. Combine the orange juice and the olives and set aside until needed. Toss salad with dressing and arrange on platter. Add olives and serve.

For the crust, preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Roll out one pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish. Crimp the edge of the pie dish. Prick the bottom of the dough all over. Place the dough into the preheated oven for 8 minutes. Remove and set aside. Make the filling: In a large mixing bowl combine the pudding mix and milk. Beat with a wire whisk. Mix in the peanut butter. Spoon the pudding mixture into the pie crust. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. For the topping, beat the cream and whipping cream together. Spread over the pie. Top with the cool whip. Return to the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving. Store leftovers in the refrigerator.

Heat 3 tablespoons of avocado oil in a large soup pot. Add garlic powder. Sauté on medium heat for 1 minute. Add half of the broth and half of the avocados and stir. Add the remaining broth and half of the lime juice. Add half of the lime slice and salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add remaining avocados and lime juice and simmer for 2 more minutes. Top with remaining lime slice. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Slice the bread into 8 even slices. Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a frying pan. Cook bread until golden brown on both sides. Cut cheese into small cubes. Slice bacon into very thin strips. Heat the remaining butter and fry the bacon until crisp. Add the mushrooms and cook until tender. Remove from pan and keep warm. Cut the eggs into half. Beat 1 egg together with 1 tablespoon of cream and 1 teaspoon of chives. Pour the filling into each bread slice. Add the bacon and mushrooms. Top with the tasty cheese. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes or until the quiche is puffed up and golden brown. Serve immediately with fresh chives.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease 15 x 10 x 1 1/2-in. baking pan or line with waxed paper. Combine graham cracker crumbs, butter and sweetened condensed milk in medium bowl. Stir until blended. Press onto bottom of prepared pan. Bake 15 minutes or until light brown. Cool completely. Combine condensed milk and chocolate chips in medium bowlstir with whisk until smooth. Stir in white chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls over crumb layerswirl with knife. Sprinkle with coconut, nuts and butterscotch chips. Bake 20 minutes or until light brown. Cool completely before cutting into bars. Makes 24 bars.

Trim the asparagus. Blanch asparagus in boiling water for 1 minute. Remove and immerse in ice water. Drain. Place asparagus in a large bowl. In another bowl, whisk together honey, soy sauce and rice vinegar. Pour dressing over asparagus and toss well. Sprinkle with black pepper and chopped walnuts.

Put the vinegar in a large pot with the garlic and bring to a boil. Remove the pot from heat and add salt and alum. Let cool for one hour. Add dill to pickle jars. Pour hot brine over dill. Place lids on jars. Store in a cool place for one week.

Preheat oven to 375 f. In a large bowl, combine baking mix with 1/2 cup of butter. Using a pastry blender cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add cold water gradually and blend in with fork. Add cheese and stir with fork. Mix in garlic powder, onion powder and parsley. Turn onto a floured board and knead lightly. Roll out 1/2 inch thick. Cut into rounds using a biscuit cutter. Place biscuits onto ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten each biscuit slightly with a floured finger. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove biscuits from oven and brush tops with remaining 1/4 cup of softened butter. Bake an additional 2 to 3 minutes or until tops are golden brown. Serve immediately.

Mix butter, brown sugar and apple butter until light and fluffy. Add flour and baking soda. Stir in oats and almond extract. Stir in enough milk to make a stiff dough. Turn dough out on a floured surface and roll out to a 1/4-inch thickness. Using a sharp knife cut out rounds of dough and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 375f for 10 minutes. Makes 18 bars.

Rub salt and pepper over all sides of pork. Sprinkle with sage and thyme. Place pork in roasting pan. Pour cider over pork. Place in cold oven and roast at 275 degrees f for about 1-1/2 hours. Remove pan from oven and place pork in warm place until tender. Remove from roasting pan. Slice pork crosswise into thin strips. Return pork to roasting pan. Add apples and simmer in cider until tender. Serve with apple sauce.
Cook pasta to package directions. In a small bowl, toss together oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Pour over pasta. Toss with parsley. Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.

In large resealable plastic bag combine all ingredients except chicken wings. Place chicken wings in plastic bag with marinade. Seal bagshake to coat wings evenly with marinade. Refrigerate 2 hours, turning once. Drain marinade from wingsdiscard marinade. Grill wings 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with dipping sauce.

Add crushed pineapple and brown sugar to bowl of biscuits and stir until blended together. Press dough into greased muffin tins until all sides are even and smooth. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden brown and baked through. Cool for 5 minutes and then remove from muffin tins and serve warm or cold with jam or butter.
Combine all ingredients in medium bowl. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes.
Cook potato and turnips in water until tender. Drain. Mash potatoes. Add butter and cream. Stir in seasonings. Serve hot.

Heat oil in saucepan over medium heat. Cook tortellini until al dente. Drain and set aside. In a large saucepan over medium heat melt 1/2 cup of the butter. Add the tortellini, tossing to coat with the melted butter. Add the tomato juice and chicken broth. Cook until the tortellini are heated through. Add the diced tomatoes. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of the butter and the basil. Cook until melted. Stir in the cream. Cook and stir for 5 more minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Ladle soup into bowls. Sprinkle with shaved Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Melt butter and oil together in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions and salt. Cook until tender. Add flour. Stir until it turns golden brown. Add beef broth. Stir until onions are cooked through. Stir in whiskey. Add salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Serve warm.
Dry roast seeds until golden brown. Stir in cajun seasoning and paprika and salt to taste. Toss with butter and cook for another minute or two until seeds are coated with butter and seasoning. Serve.

Carefully slice the sweet potatoes in half and remove the pits from the blueberry pie filling. Place the potatoes in the bottom of the pan and fill each potato half with blueberry filling and sprinkle with walnuts and brown sugar. Place the cherries on top and pour the syrup over the cherries and sprinkle with pecans if desired. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream and cherries for garnish. Serves 6-8.

In a medium saucepan heat sugar and corn syrup over medium heat until mixture begins to bubble around the edge of the pan. Add water and cream of tartar and bring to a boil. Boil 5-7 minutes without stirring. Stir in peppermint extract and food coloring (if using). Cook 5 minutes more or until mixture holds its shape when dropped from a spoon. Pour into prepared pan and allow to cool completely in pan before cutting into peppermint candies. Store in airtight container in a cool, dry place.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spoon flour into dry measuring cupslevel with a knife. Place flour, 1 cup of the sugar, and the salt in a large bowlstir well. Add eggsbeat lightly. Add ricotta cheese, asiago cheese, parmesan cheesebeat well. Add spinach, 2 tablespoons of the bread crumbs, basil, and 2 teaspoons of the pepperstir just until combined. Spoon into prepared piecruststop each with 1 tablespoon of the remaining bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 to 60 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center of each pie comes out clean. Cool 15 minutes. Cut each pie into wedges. Serve at room temperature.

Pour 2 cups water and 2 cups sugar into a saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook until the sugar dissolves. Remove from the heat and add the evaporated milk and apple sauce. Place the rum and honey in a small saucepan and stir over low heat until the honey dissolves. Strain the rum mixture into the sugar mixture. Place in a blender and puree until smooth. Strain through a fine mesh strainer and pour into a freezer container. Freeze until firm. Serve at room temperature.

Add sourdough starter to milk and let stand overnight. Add 1/4 cup of sourdough starter to 3 cups of flour. Add 1/4 cup milk and stir. Add eggs and honey and stir. Let sit for 30 minutes. Add 1/4 cup flour and stir. Add 1 cup milk and stir. Add 1/4 cup flour and stir. Add 1/2 cup milk and stir. Add 1/2 cup flour and stir. Add 1 cup milk and stir. Add 1/2 cup flour and stir. Add 1/2 cup milk and stir. Add 1 cup flour and stir. Add 1/4 cup flour and stir. Add 1/4 cup milk and stir. Add 1/4 cup flour and stir. Add 1/2 cup milk and stir. Add 1/2 cup flour and stir. Add 1 cup milk and stir. Add 1/2 cup flour and stir. Add 1/2 cup milk and stir. Add 1/2 cup flour and stir. Add 1 cup milk and stir. Add 1/2

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine all the ingredients. Mix well. Fill the 6-cup muffin pan with batter. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean.

Cut chicken into 3-4 pieces (breast and thigh). In a bowl combine hoisin sauce, plum sauce, soy sauce and garlic. Pour in chicken piecesmarinate at least 1 hour. Add cornstarch to plum sauce and stir to mix. Stir cornstarch mixture into marinade. In large crock pot place marinade with chicken pieces. Cover crock potcook on low for 3-4 hours or on high for 2 hours or until chicken is tender. Serve over rice with cucumber salad or Asian slaw.

Place pineapple, vinegar, sugar and spices into a large pot and bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until fruit breaks down and mixture thickens to desired consistency (about 1 hour). If mixture becomes too thick during cooking, add 1-2 tbsp of water to thin to desired consistency. Transfer mixture to sterilized jarsseal tightly and process in boiling water for 15 minutes.

Remove mushrooms stems. With the tip of a knife scrape off the brown gills. Cut the remaining mushrooms into halves. In a large mixing bowl combine the cream cheese, imitation crabmeat and garlic. Mix well. Fill the mushrooms with the mixture. Sprinkle with garlic powder and parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Serve with salad.

Combine kool-aid, pectin and sugar in medium saucepanstir in water. Bring to a boil over medium heatboil for 1 minute. Pour into prepared jars and seal with lids. Process for 10 minutes in boiling water bath canner.

Preheat solar cooker to 350 f. Whisk together dry ingredients. Stir in yogurt until just mixed. Stir in water until dough is the consistency of pancake batter (add more water if needed to reach desired consistency). Transfer dough to hot solar cooker. Cover solar cooker to retain heat. Bake for approximately 25 minutes or until golden brown in color. Let cool to room temperature before cutting into servings.

Cook quinoa in medium saucepan according to package instructions. Rinse thoroughly in a strainer. Transfer to medium bowl and set aside. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and onion and saute until softened about 2 minutes. Add spinach and saute until wilted. Add spinach mixture to quinoa along with feta cheese and toss to coat.

Drain tofu. Crush tofu with a fork or your hands until it resembles scrambled eggs. Place tofu in a bowl with eggs, cream cheese, onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne, dry mustard, paprika, salt and pepper to taste. Mix well with an electric mixer on low speed until smooth. Pour mixture into lightly greased 9-inch-square baking dish or 9-inch pie plate or 8-inch round casserole dish. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until firm to touch. Stir in parmesan cheese 5 minutes before serving.

Pre-heat the broiler and coat a baking dish with butter. Place the raisins in a small bowl and cover with the rum. Set aside. Pre-heat the oven to 325 degrees. Slice the bread into half-inch thick rounds and pat them dry with a paper towel. In a large mixing bowl, beat together the eggs and the non-fat milk. Add in the brown sugar and vanilla. Stir in the raisins. Stir in the salt and the ground cinnamon. Put the bread in the dish and pour the egg mixture over the bread. Sprinkle the bread with the brown sugar. Place the dish on a baking sheet and put under the broiler for about five minutes. Remove from broiler and serve warm.
Drain chicken of excess fat and place in a shallow pan with the dressing and sauce. Cover with foil and bake at 350 for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until tender. Serve over rice or mashed potatoes.

Preheat grill or broiler. Cut each chicken breast in half and season each piece with salt and pepper. Place the chicken on the grill or under the broiler. Cook for about 10 minutes or until done. Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, combine mayonnaise, honey and rum. Heat over medium-low heat. Cook for 3 minutes or until mixture is hot. Pour sauce over chicken breasts. Serve.
Process all ingredients in a food processor until smooth and creamy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine spinach, sour cream, cream cheese and garlic powder. In another bowl mix whole wheat bread crumbs with salt and pepper. Mix the spinach mixture with the whole wheat bread crumbs. Stuff chicken breasts with filling. Place in baking dish and bake for 30-45 minutes or until cooked through.

Mix together prepared mustard, mustard and Tabasco sauce in a small bowl. In a large resealable plastic bag, combine egg white, yellow cornmeal, flour, salt and pepper. Seal bag and shake to coat fish fillets. Pour oil into a large skillet to 1-inch deepheat to medium-high. Dip fillets in prepared mustard mixturedrain excess. Dip fillets in cornmeal mixturedrain excess. Place fillets in hot oilfry 1-1/2 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm with your favorite dipping sauce.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Rub salmon fillet with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic and seasoning. Place on the grill and cook until lightly browned on one side, about 2-3 minutes. Turn and cook 3-4 minutes more. Drizzle with the remaining olive oil. Serve warm with your favorite side dish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and line an 8 inch round pan. In small bowl, combine flour and baking soda. In large bowl, beat eggs until foamy. Gradually add sugar, beating until light. Beat in applesauce until combined. Stir in chocolate chips and orange juice. Spoon batter into prepared pan. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of melted butter. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and cool 10 minutes. Invert pan on serving plate and remove pan. Cool completely. Place orange slices around the outside of cake. Drizzle with remaining melted butter and dust with powdered sugar.

Using a sharp knife, split a mini powdered sugar doughnut in half. Place half of a split doughnut on a plate and top with a scoop of ice cream. Place another split mini powdered sugar doughnut on top of the ice cream and cover with a scoop of hot fudge and a dollop of whipped cream. Top with a cherry. Repeat with remaining split mini powdered sugar doughnuts. Serve immediately.
In a large bowl, mix cheese with garlic and seasonings until blended and smooth. Stir in beer until cheese is melted and blended. Serve with crackers and pretzels.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Cook bacon in the butter until crisp. Remove from heat and set aside on a paper towel. Drain all but 1 tablespoon of grease from skillet. Add cream cheese and cook over low heat, stirring constantly with a spatula until the cream cheese is melted. Stir in the half-and-half. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Heat through slowly and do not allow to boil. Serve warm with crackers.
Blend all ingredients together until smooth and creamy. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Grease a 9 by 5 by 3 inch loaf pan. In a large bowl, mix cornmeal, flour, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt together. In a small bowl, mix together yogurt, oil, milk, egg substitute and vanilla extract. Add yogurt mixture to flour mixture and fold in to make sure all the flour is incorporated in to the batter. Spoon batter in to the prepared pan, making sure batter is evenly distributed. Bake for 1 hour 30 minutes or until cake is golden brown and springs back when touched in the centre. Remove from oven, let cool completely. Icing: In a bowl, mix together jam, confectioner's sugar, and enough water to create a spreadable consistency. Spread icing on top of cooled cake before serving.

Preheat oven to 180c. Grease and line a loaf pan. In a large mixing bowl beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs and then mix in the banana and vanilla. In a separate bowl mix the dry ingredients. Add to the banana mixture. Fold in the walnuts. Pour into loaf pan and bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Combine bisquick mix, milk and cheddar cheese. Stir together until combined. Drop by teaspoonful onto ungreased cookie sheets or into greased muffin tins. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown on bottom. Cool for 1 minute then remove from cookie sheet and enjoy!

In a large pot over medium heat add butter and bacon. Cook until bacon is crisp. Add carrot and onion. Saut 3 minutes. Add water and lentils. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes or until lentils are tender. Season to taste with marjoram, dried parsley and parmesan cheese. Serve.
Blend milk and cornstarch in a bowl, and then add remaining ingredients except parmesan cheese. Cook and stir until thickened. Reduce heat and add parmesan cheese and stir until cheese is melted.

In a 4-quart or larger slow cooker, layer the ground turkey and rice, then top with the coleslaw mix and tomato soup mixture. Pour the spaghetti sauce over all. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and cook on low heat for 4-5 hours or on high for 2-3 hours. Serve immediately or store in refrigerator for up to 3 days. Reheat in crock pot and serve over rice or noodles if desired.

In a large saucepan, heat the broth to a boil over high heat. Add the carrots and salt to the broth in the panthen bring to a boil again. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 to 35 minutes or until the carrots are tender when pierced with a knife. In the last minute of cooking time, add the sugar to the carrots in the panthen add the dill weed to the pan. Remove the pan from the heat and drain the carrots in a colander. Pour off the broth from the carrots. Transfer the carrots to a large bowl and add the butter to the broth in the panthen pour the butter over the carrots in the large bowl. Chill the carrots at least 2 hours before serving.

Place chicken breast halves skin down on cookie sheet and coat with butter and teriyaki sauce. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until done. In saucepan add orange marmalade and water to garlic. Bring to boil and pour over chicken while still warm. Serve hot or cold.

In a large skillet or dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and celery. Sautee until the onions are translucent. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Add the rice, parsley, and salt. Cook until the liquid is absorbed. Cover and cook over low heat for about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the peas and carrot. Serve immediately. If you need to cook ahead for a party or other reason, cook the rice as directed. Stir in the remaining ingredients and let cool. Refrigerate or freeze. When ready to use, bring to a boil and cook as directed.

Marinate steaks in a bowl for 1 hour or more in old bay seasoning, light brown sugar, garlic powder, onion powder, ground cumin. Heat a grill or grill pan to medium. Grill steaks until desired doneness. Serve with your favorite grilled vegetables.
Put cabbage, carrot, green pepper in the food processor. Add the remaining ingredients. Process until smooth. Can be stored in freezer for 3 months. Bring to room temp before using.

In large bowl beat egg yolks and butter with electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy. Gradually add sugar and beat until smooth. Add flour and beat until well combined. Pour in sherry and beat until blended. Add cinnamon and beat until combined. Place 12 rounds of puff pastry on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Using a pastry brush, spread a thin layer of filling over each round. Roll up each round as if making a jellyroll. Place rolls on cookie sheet. Repeat with remaining pastry and filling. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Immediately remove from cookie sheet and cool on wire rack. While wreaths are cooling prepare glaze. In small bowl combine powdered sugar and milk until well blended. Add cinnamon and beat until smooth. Drizzle glaze over wreaths.

Bring chicken stock to a boil. Stir in rice. Cover. Reduce heat to low. Simmer about 20 minutes until rice is tender. Stir in lemon juice. Remove from heat. Beat eggs until well blended. Stir eggs into rice mixture. Sprinkle with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve with chopped fresh dill.

Wash romaine lettuce. Cut into bite-sized pieces. Peel orange halves. Slice orange into bite-sized pieces. In a large salad bowl, combine lettuce with orange slices, cashews and radishes. Pour mayonnaise over mixture. Add seasoned rice vinegar. Sprinkle with gingerroot. Sprinkle white pepper over salad.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Lightly coat a 13 x 9-inch baking dish with cooking spray or olive oil. Place squash halves cut side down in a single layer in baking dish. Sprinkle squash halves with red pepper flakes and black pepperdrizzle with olive oil. In small bowl, combine garlic and parsleyrub over squash halves. Bake 45 minutes or until squash is tender. In large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add onionsaute 5 minutes or until onion is tender. Add garliccook 30 seconds longer or until fragrant. Transfer onion mixture to bowl. Sprinkle each squash half with 1/4 cup Parmesantop with onion mixturesprinkle with saltdrizzle with juice from zest of lemon halfsprinkle with lemon zest. Bake 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

Crumble ramen noodles in large bowl. Add green onions and stir in coleslaw mix. Add sunflower seeds, almonds and rice wine vinegar. Stir in enough oil to moisten. Add remaining oil and toss well. Serve at room temperature.

Combine the sun-dried tomatoes, olives, garlic, red pepper flakes, cheese and basil in a small bowl. Stuff the endive spears and set aside. Drizzle with the olive oil and sprinkle with the pine nuts. Grill the spears for 3 minutes on each side or until tender. Transfer to a platter and drizzle the vinaigrette over the spears. Sprinkle the basil over the spears and serve.

Bring a kettle of water to a boil. Add tea leaves and whole cloves. Let the tea steep for 5 minutes. Strain into a tea pot. Add sugar to taste. Add the juice of oranges and lemon. Serve hot with a slice of lemon.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan with butter. Beat the sour cream and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Blend in the flour and the dry ingredients until mixed well. Fold in cherries and chocolate chips. Pour batter into pan. Bake in preheated oven for 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the pan and cool for 5 minutes. Turn the pan upside down and place a plate over the top of the loaf pan to loosen. Invert the loaf onto the plate. Serve and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 350f. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute shallot for 1 minute. Add chicken broth and wine. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until reduced by half. Add artichokes. Cook until softened and browned. Remove from heat. Add chicken and stir until cooked through. Stir in green chiles and seasoning. Set aside. In a 3 quart baking dish, combine the remaining soup with milk. Season with salt and pepper. Add artichoke mixture. Gently fold to combine. Top with spinach and parmesan. Bake covered for 30 minutes. Uncover. Bake 15 minutes longer or until mixture is bubbly and browned.

Wash mint leaves in cold water. Pat dry with paper towels and remove stems. Place mint leaves in a cocktail shaker with 6 lime wedges and muddle until bruised. Add simple syrup and rum to the shaker with ice cubes. Cover shaker with plastic wrap. Shake vigorously until well chilled (about 20 seconds). Strain into a high ball glass over crushed ice. Fill glass with club soda and garnish with lime wheedge.

Combine 1/2 cup butter, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/3 cup corn syrup, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda and 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar. Set aside. In a large pan on medium-high heat combine 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/2 cup margarine. Cook until margarine is melted. Add 1/4 cup corn syrup. Stir until combined. Add brown sugar mixture to the soda mixture. Stir until smooth. Add popped corn, maple flavoring and nuts. Stir until coated. Bake at 300 for 35-40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wash and dry sweet potatoes. Place in a 1 1/2 to 2 quart crock pot. Top with brown sugar and butter. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Add orange juice and water. Add pecans. Sprinkle with salt. Cover and cook on high for 3 hours. Serve hot. Can be prepared a day in advance and refrigerated or frozen.

Melt the chocolate and the butter over a double boiler. Remove from heat and add the sugar and vanilla. Add the flour and mix in well. Stir in the chocolate chips and butterscotch chips and mix well. Pour into a greased 9 inch square pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.

In a large bowl cream butter and sugars together. Beat in egg. In a separate bowl combine dry ingredients. Add dry mixture to the wet mixture. Add vanilla extract. Drop dough by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 12 minutes or until golden. Cool for two minutes on cookie sheet. Transfer cookies to wire rack. Cool completely.

In a large bowl combine cream cheese and cheddar cheese. Add ham, garlic powder, liquid smoke and onion powder. Stir until all is mixed together. Roll mixture into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Unwrap ball. Roll in shredded almonds. Serve with crackers. Refrigerate after serving. This can be made two days in advance.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Pierce each sweet potato with a forkplace on a baking sheet. Bake until tender when pierced with a fork, about 1 hour. Remove from the oven and let cool slightlyslice each potato into 1/4-inch thick slices. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over medium heatadd onion and cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Add mushroomscook until tender, about 2 minutes longer. Add thyme leavescook until fragrant. Season with salt & pepper. Remove from heattransfer mixture to a serving dishspoon potato slices on top. Serve hot with lemon wedges.

Spread butter evenly over one side of each slice of breadspread cheese evenly over the other side of each slice of bread. Top each slice of bread with a slice of ham. Place two sandwiches, butter side down, between two sheets of heavy-duty plastic wrap. With a meat mallet or heavy rolling pin, press sandwiches until flattened to about half an inch thick. (You may need to rewrap the sandwiches in plastic wrap and repeat the pressing step.) Grill the sandwiches, butter side down, over medium-high heat for about 4 minutes or until the cheese melts. Remove the sandwiches from the grill and serve immediately. (Note: If you are using a grill pan, use a nonstick or well-seasoned cast iron grill pan.)

Cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add dry ingredients to butter/sugar mixture. Combine until dough is formed. Roll out dough onto lightly floured board. Cut into 2-inch squares. Place biscuits onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes at 425 degrees F. Let cool 3-5 minutes before removing from cookie sheet. Makes 2 dozen.

In a large bowl beat the eggs and sugar together until frothy. In a medium bowl beat the whipping cream until soft peaks form. In a small bowl whisk the bourbon, cognac and rum. In a large pitcher combine the egg mixture and the cream mixture. Stir in the bourbon mixture. Add the milk. In a small bowl whisk together the nutmeg and a few drops of red food coloring. Stir the red food coloring into the eggnog mixture. Serve warm with a maraschino cherry in the bottom of each glass. If you want to make your eggnog a little boozy just add more alcohol.

Combine brown sugar and ketchup. Rub mixture all over pork chops. Place chops on broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from heat 15 minutes turning after 6-7 minutes. Remove chops from broiler pan to a plate. Serve with vegetables.

Boil frozen broccoli florets for 3 minutes then drain well. Combine all other ingredients except cheez-it crackers in large bowl. Pour into baking dish. Sprinkle cheez-it crackers on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 min or until cheez-it crackers are lightly browned and mixture is bubbly. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350f. Heat a large skillet over medium heat & add olive oil. Add apple and sauté until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 30 seconds more. Add parsley and sage and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds more. Transfer mixture to a large bowl and let cool slightly, about 5 minutes. Add turkey and sauté until no longer pink, about 5 minutes more. Transfer to bowl along with apple mixture and stir to combine. Form mixture into 4 patties. Place patties on a parchment lined cookie sheet and brush with egg wash. Sprinkle patties evenly with salt, pepper and crushed red pepper flakes. Bake turkey patties until browned and no longer pink inside, about 20-25 minutes. Serve with your favorite breakfast condiments.
Place a frozen vegetable in a bread roll. Sprinkle with light mayonnaise, pepper and black pepper. Top with a slice of tasty cheese and a boiled egg. Serve.

Bake potatoes 45 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool potatoes. Peel potatoes and cut into fries. Preheat oven to 375f. In a large bowl, combine potatoes and remaining ingredientstoss to coat. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 25 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with additional Italian seasoning.

Peel and dice potatoes and place in a saucepan of cold waterbring to a boil. Simmer for about 15 minutes or until tender and drain in a colander. In a large bowl, combine potatoes with soymilk and margarine and season with salt and pepper. Mash until smooth and creamy. Serve hot or cold. : recipes that are easy and healthy

Clean and slice 3 medium to large yellow or sweet onions. In a large nonstick skillet, melt 4 Tbsp. (1/2 stick) unsalted butter over medium heat. Add onion slices in a single layer and sprinkle each slice with 1/4 tsp. all-purpose flour and a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook slices until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Add 1/2 cup milk and cook until slightly thickened. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to a serving dish and serve.

Beat eggs and sugar until light. Mix in salt and milk. Combine flour and baking soda. Stir into egg mixture. Heat butter in frying pan. Pour batter into frying pan and cook on medium heat until bubbles form. Turn with spatula and cook until pancake is golden brown on both sides.

Preheat oven to 350 F. In a medium bowl, combine 1 1/4 cups bread cubes with 1/4 cup half-and-half. Let stand 5 minutes. In a small bowl, combine 1/4 cup cream cheese with 1/4 cup half-and-half. Stir in 1/2 cup maple syrup and salt. In a large bowl, mix 3 cups bread cubes with 1 egg. Stir in cream cheese mixture. Pour into a greased 9x13-inch baking pan. In a small bowl, beat 2 eggs with 2 teaspoons half-and-half. Stir in 1/4 cup sugar and 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon. Pour over bread mixture. Bake 40 minutes or until knife inserted into center comes out clean. Let stand 5 minutes. Cool 15 minutes. Spread with 1/4 cup whipped cream. Sprinkle with 2 Tbsp. chopped walnuts. Let stand 15 minutes before serving.

Slice sweet onion into paper thin slices. Cut goat cheese into small cubes. Slice tomatoes into paper thin slices. Mix together the olive oil and vinegar. Add salt and pepper to taste. Place sliced tomato on the bottom of a large bowl. Top with sliced sweet onions. Cover with cubes of goat cheese. Add a dollop of the olive oil mixture to the top. Sprinkle with the basil leaves and drizzle with the remaining olive oil mixture.

Mix hamburger and all other ingredients except cheese and peppers together until well blended. Divide into four equal parts and form patties. Grill or broil until done to preference. Place cheese slices and roasted peppers over each patty and serve immediately.
Combine all the biscuit ingredients in a large bowl. Pour into a greased 9-inch round baking pan and bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 450f. Spray a sheet pan with cooking spray. Slice brussels sprouts in half. In a large bowl whisk soy sauce, sesame oil and ginger. Add brussels sprouts and toss to coat. Transfer brussels sprouts to the prepared pan. Roast for 10 minutes. Whisk oil and water together. Pour over brussels sprouts and roast until tender and golden brown, about 15 minutes longer.

Heat olive oil and saute the onions and garlic until translucent, approximately five minutes. Add the orzo and cook for another two minutes, stirring constantly. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cover tightly for approximately ten minutes or until the orzo has absorbed all the liquid and is soft but not mushy. Stir in the parmigiano-regrano and serve immediately.

Cut the chicken breast halves lengthwise into four pieces. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and onion. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened. Add the pepper and chilies. Cook, stirring frequently, for three minutes. Add the lemon juice. Place the chicken in the skillet. Cook three minutes on each side or until done.

Prepare the broccoli by cutting out the stem and leaving the florets intact. Then cut the florets in half. Steam the broccoli until it is tender. Meanwhile, cut the tomatoes in half. In a small bowl combine the ginger root with a teaspoon of water. Heat the oil in a frying pan on medium heat and add the ginger. Cook for 5 seconds then add the broccoli and tomatoes to the pan. Cook for 3 minutes then add the garlic and red pepper. Cook for 2 minutes more. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl, combine the egg yolks and 2 cups of the sugar. In a small bowl, whisk the remaining 1 cup of sugar and cocoa together. Gradually stir the cocoa mixture into the yolk mixture. Add the salt and the cornstarch and whisk until smooth. Gradually add the milk to the yolk mixture and whisk until smooth. In a small bowl, stir the vanilla into the remaining 2 tablespoons of milk. Pour the egg mixture into the pie shell and bake for 15 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees. Bake until the filling is set and the pie is firm to the touch, about 45 minutes. Serve at room temperature.
Prepare and brown onions and apples. Combine with remaining ingredients. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes. Serve with roast or pork chops.

Cut peppers in half and remove the seeds and white membrane inside the pepper. Place on a foil lined cookie sheet and broil until tender. Drizzle the dressing on the peppers and roast for about 15 minutes. Set aside until the peppers are cool enough to handle. Remove the seeds and white membrane from the peppers and discard. Slice the peppers into strips and set aside. Cook pasta according to directions on box and drain well. Melt butter in a large skillet and add the peppers and onions to the pan and saut until tender, stirring frequently. Add the cream and bring to a simmer and add the Italian dressing and bring it back up to a simmer and add the pasta and stir together until well combined and the sauce has thickened. Toss with the parmesan and serve.

Line an 8 x 8 pan with waxed paper. Combine graham cracker crumbs and butterscotch chips. Press firmly into pan. Melt chocolate chips and condensed milk together. Pour over graham cracker layer. Let cool. Crumble walnuts over chocolate layer. Refrigerate for one hour. Remove from pan. Cut into small squares. Store in refrigerator.

Prepare jiffy corn muffin mix according to package directionsgrease muffin tins or use paper cupsadd ham and swiss cheesemix with eggs and mustardfill cups and bake according to muffin mix directions.

Mix brownie mix according to package directions. Press into an ungreased 13x9-inch pan. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 12 to 14 minutes or until brownie is set. Cool. Cut into squares. Place 1/2 cup of frosting into a small bowl and microwave on high for 15 to 20 seconds or until softened. Spread frosting on 1 side of each square. Sprinkle with walnuts and chocolate chips. Refrigerate 1 hour or until set. Makes about 3 dozen.

Cut the zucchini in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds. Slice the zucchini into 1/4-inch slices. In a large skillet over medium heat, warm 1/2 cup olive oil. Add zucchini to the skillet. Cook until they are lightly browned. Add 1/2 cup olive oil. Add garlic. Cook until fragrant. Add the remaining 1/2 cup olive oil to the skillet. Cook until the zucchini is tender. Serve hot.

Cream together butter and golden syrup, beat well until light and fluffy. Gradually beat in flour and ground ginger until well blended. Shape dough into two balls. Flatten each ball on a floured board and roll out until about 1/2-inch thick. Cut into 3-inch circles using a biscuit cutter or drinking glass and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool on rack and serve warm or at room temperature.

In large bowl combine flour and salt. In small bowl combine butter and cream cheese. Add butter mixture to flour mixture and stir with a fork until blended. Add cream and stir just until dough forms and pulls away from sides of bowl. Turn dough out onto lightly floured surface and gently knead dough until smooth. Roll dough out between sheets of waxed paper until it is about one-half inch thick. Cut dough into rounds with a 2-1/2 inch cutter and place on greased cookie sheets. Bake at 425 degrees for about 12 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot with butter and jam or jelly.

Heat butter and olive oil together over medium-low heat in a large skillet. Add the onion and garlic and saut for about a minute and half until they become translucent and the garlic is lightly browned. Add the butternut squash and saut for a few more minutes until the squash is softened but still firm. Sprinkle with a little bit of salt and a few fresh thyme leaves and cook for another few minutes. Add the cream and bring the mixture to a simmer. Cook for about a minute or two until the mixture is thick and creamy. Serve hot.

In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine sugar, lemon zest, lemon juice, milk and cream. Stir until sugar dissolves. Bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally and cook 2-3 minutes until thickened slightly. Remove from heatstir in salt. Pour through a fine sieve into a shallow dish. Cover with plastic wrap, pressing directly onto surface of ice cream mixturerefrigerate 2 hours or overnight until very cold but still soft. Using an electric mixer, beat until stiff peaks formfreeze according to ice cream maker manufacturer's instructions.

To make blueberry ice cream, stir 1/3 cup blueberries into 1-1/2 cups cream. Freeze 2 hours. To make strawberry ice cream, stir 1/3 cup strawberries into 1-1/2 cups cream. Freeze 2 hours. Remove 1/2 cup ice cream from each freezer. Freeze remaining ice cream for later use. To serve ice cream pie, line an 8-inch pie plate with pastry. Freeze. To assemble pie, put 1/2 cup blueberry ice cream into pastry-lined pie plate. Put 1/2 cup strawberry ice cream over blueberry ice cream. Put 1/2 cup blueberries over strawberry ice cream. Put remaining 1/2 cup strawberry ice cream over blueberries. Put remaining 1/2 cup blueberries over strawberry ice cream. Top with remaining 1/2 cup whipped cream. Serve immediately. To serve pie later, freeze pie in pan and serve in wedges. Store any leftovers in freezer.

Slice each radish lengthwise into thin rounds. Place slices on a clean work surface and sprinkle with salt and pepper. With a sharp knife, slice each radish into paper-thin rounds. Place each slice of cream cheese on a slice of bread. Place a radish round on top of each cream cheese slice and a few pieces of chopped chives on top. Place on a serving platter or individual serving plates. Garnish with a sprinkling of coarse salt if desired.
In a cocktail glass or Collins glass, pour vodka over ice. Top with Midori melon liqueur. Slowly top with lemonade. Garnish with a lemon twist. Serve.
Pour all ingredients into a large saucepan or soup kettle. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in brandy. Serve in mugs or glasses.

In large saucepan, sautee the asparagus, onion and garlic in the vegetable oil. Add the vegetable broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to a simmer for 10 minutes. Put asparagus in a food processor. Process until smooth. Add the soymilk. Mix. Add the soy sauce. Mix. Add the dried basil. Mix. Season with salt and pepper. Pour the soup into a blender. Process until smooth. Pour into a large bowl. Place in the refrigerator for 2 hours to blend the flavors. Serve warm.

Sauté sliced sweet onions in butter. Add brown sugar. Cook until tender. Add meatballs. Pour mushroom beef gravy over meatballs. Add water to gravy as needed. Cook meatballs in gravy until heated through.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl, combine cream cheese and mayonnaisestir until well blended. Add jalapeno peppers and cheesesstir until combined. Place jalapenos in a single layer on cookie sheetbrush with oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 5 to 7 minutesturn peppers and brush with oil. Bake another 5 to 7 minutes until peppers are tender and beginning to turn golden brown. Remove from oven and place on serving platteradd dip and serve with crackers.

Put all the ingredients into the blender container and blend until smooth (about 45 seconds). Pour the mixture into the bowls, top with sliced fresh avocado and serve with French baguettes cut in half, olive oil and black pepper to taste.

Combine buttermilk, mustard, honey and herbs in large bowl. Add chicken breasts to marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours and up to 24 hours. Drain chicken. Grill chicken breasts on broiler pan or outdoor grill until no longer pink in center. Serve immediately.

Cut pound cake into 1/2-inch cubesplace in 1-gallon Ziploc freezer bag. Add bananas and strawberriesseal bag. Freeze at least 4 hours or up to 3 months. To serve, place in glassestop with cool whip & pudding mix.

In a medium saucepan over low heat, combine sugar and light brown sugar and stir until sugar dissolves, about 1 minute. Add salt and corn syrup and bring mixture just to a boil, stirring constantly. Continue boiling mixture for about 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in evaporated milk and butter until butter is melted. Add vanilla extract and stir in pecan halves and stir until they are well coated with pralines.

Drain the beans and place them into a large salad bowl. Add the garlic, green onion, tomatoes and parsley. Add the puree. Add the olive oil and season with salt and fresh ground black pepper to taste. Toss. Serve at room temperature or slightly warmed.
Mix all cake ingredients until batter is smooth and thick. Bake in preheated oven according to pancake mix package directions. Serve warm with butter or whipped cream.

Preheat your grill to medium high heat. Place corn cobs on grill and cook until kernels just start to turn translucent. Brush corn kernels with a mixture of 1 tablespoon of lime zest and 1 teaspoon of lime juice and 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne pepper. Sprinkle with kosher salt and continue to grill for 3 to 5 more minutes. Transfer to a platter and serve warm.

Grill the peppers until blackened and softened. Remove from heat and place peppers skin-side down on a large plate to cool slightly. Remove the stems from each pepper. In a small bowl combine the mayonnaise and cream cheese. Spread about a tablespoon of the mixture inside each pepper. Top each pepper evenly with the cheese mixture. Top each pepper evenly with cheese mixture, then the sourdough bread slice evenly with cheese mixture, then the cheese mixture again. Top the sandwiches with tortilla chips (if desired) and serve immediately.

Heat oil and butter in skillet over medium-high heat. Add carrots. Cook until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Add apple juice to pan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer until carrots are tender. Stir in slivered almonds. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to serving platter. Sprinkle with garlic chives.

Cut the lemon in half and squeeze half the juice into a small saucepan. Put the remaining lemon halves into the pan and add the lavender flowers. Bring the pan to a simmer and poach the chicken for 5 minutes. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside. Pour the stock into the pan and bring it back to a simmer. Stir in the butter and shallot. Bring the pan back to a simmer and whisk in the cornflour. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir the creme fraiche into the pan. Add the remaining lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Return the chicken to the pan and simmer for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with lavender flowers. Serve.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix thoroughly using your hands until all ingredients are evenly distributed.
Beat butter and almond flour together until smooth. Add stevia and salt. Blend in vanilla extract and egg. Drop by spoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f. for 10 to 12 minutes.

Bring the oatmeal to the boil in water or stock and simmer until tender. Drain the oatmeal and then return to the saucepan with the cream. Stir over low heat until the oatmeal is thoroughly heated through. Stir in the honey, whisky and the raspberries. Serve the oatmeal hot or cold.

Season chicken with salt and pepper. In a 9-inch square glass baking dish put 2 slices of bread. Spread with 1/2 cup margarine. Spread 1/2 cup of cream of mushroom soup over the bread. Layer 3 slices of chicken over the soup. Spread with remaining 1/2 cup of margarine. Add 1/2 cup of milk. Top with 1/2 cup of mushroom soup. Spread with remaining 1/2 cup of margarine. Layer 3 more slices of bread over the margarine. In a small bowl combine 1/2 cup of sherry wine with 1/4 cup slivered almonds. Pour over the bread. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes. Serve.
Combine all ingredients except for shrimp in a blender or food processor until smooth. Refrigerate for about 1 hour or until cold. Stir in shrimp before serving.

Toss asparagus with cooking spray, garlic cloves, thyme, saltspread on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 425 for 20 minutes or until asparagus is crisp tenderremove garlic cloves from pan with tongs before serving.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a small bowl, beat the eggs until frothystir in the mustard and cajun seasoning. In a large bowl, mix the cod, relish, onion, breadcrumbs, parsley, thyme and celery salt togetherstir in the egg mixture until well combined. Shape into 12 cakes about 2 inches thick and 3 inches wide. Coat the cakes lightly with cooking spraybake for 15 minutes or until golden brown on top.

Wash blueberries and put in large bowl. Add sugar and stir. Let sit for 2 hours. Add lemon juice. Cook blueberries until they pop. Add liquid pectin. Boil until it is thick enough to put a spoon in it. Pour in jars. Let sit overnight before storing in the refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Slice French bread into 1 inch thick slices. Lay bread in single layer on greased cookie sheet. Brush tops with butter. Bake 10 minutes. Meanwhile, slice onions into thin slices. Add onions to beef broth and bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook 45 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Place 3 slices bread in each soup bowl. Add 1 cup onion mixture to each bowl. Top with 1 1/2 ounces each of provolone and muenster. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon each swiss and teriyaki. Place in oven for 5 minutes. Serve with additional swiss and teriyaki.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix together broccoli, cheez whiz, soup and water chestnuts. Add in minute rice and cracker crumbs. Bake for 45 minutes. Serve with a salad or bread.

Combine soy sauce and honey in small bowl and mix well. Add oil and lime juicemix well and set aside. Combine remaining ingredients in large zip lock bagadd marinade and mix well. Marinate chicken for 1 hour at room temperature or 20 minutes in refrigerator. Grill chicken 6 minutes per side or bake at 375 for 25 minutes or until cooked through.

Cream sugar and butter together. Add vanilla and bananas (mashed) and mix well. In separate bowl combine flour with baking soda, add dry mixture alternately with milk to creamed mixture. Add nuts at end. Pour into greased loaf pan (1/2 full). Bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for 45 - 60 minutes or until brown.

Combine cake mix, pudding mix, oil and sherry in a large mixing bowl. In a separate bowl combine eggs, nutmeg, cinnamon and vanilla extract. Mix cake batter until well blended. Pour batter into a greased 12 inch bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for 1 hour or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool cake in pan for 15 minutes before removing from pan to serve warm or cool. Serve drizzled with cream sherry.
Place all of the fruit in a bowl with yogurt and vanilla bean. Stir well with a fork until mixed together. Add sugar to taste. Serve with fresh mint leaves garnish.

Preheat oven to 450f. Place salmon fillets on a foil-lined baking sheet and rub with cajun seasoning. Bake 15-20 minutes. While salmon is baking prepare broccoli by washing and chopping into 2-inch pieces. Heat olive oil and a small amount of water in a frying pan on medium-high heat and add broccoli. Cook until broccoli is bright green and tender and most of the water is evaporated. Season with salt and pepper to taste and add golden raisins and lemon juice to taste. Serve the broccoli with the salmon on top.

Mix eggs, honey and olive oil together in a bowl. Stir in flour, baking soda, vinegar and walnuts. Pour into a greased loaf tin. Bake for 35 minutes at 180c until cooked through. Leave to cool before slicing into squares or round cakes.

Mix sausage meat with spring onion, minced meat and thyme. Mix minced meat with sausage meat and 1 teaspoon of flour. Add parsley. Form mixture into balls and fry in oil until golden brown. Drain on paper towel. Meanwhile, mix pineapple with 2 teaspoons of lemon juice and 2 teaspoons of brown sugar. When sausages are done, remove to paper towel. Add pineapple and cook for 2 minutes. Serve on toast with a fried egg on top.
Mix dry ingredients. Stir in eggs, milk and lard. Bake on lightly greased griddle. If you dont have a griddle you can use a frying pan. Cook 1-2 minutes on each side.

Beat sugar-free lemon gelatin and sugar-free lemonade-flavored drink mix until blended in medium bowl. Gently stir in reduced-fat cream cheese until blended (do not over mix). Spread into crust-lined pie platerefrigerate until set, about two hours. Garnish with graham cracker crumbs if desired. To serve: Serve in small portions with reduced-fat whipped topping.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Cut carrots into sticks about 3 inches long. Place carrots and parsley in small bowl. Drizzle orange juice concentrate over carrots and parsley. Add brown sugar and stir until evenly coated. Place carrots on prepared baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until tender. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and raisins. Beat together the butter, maple syrup and sour cream. Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture. Fold in the raisins. Fill muffin cups two thirds full. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Makes about 16 muffins.
Cream together peanut butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add in egg and vanilla extract. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 7-9 minutes. Cool and enjoy!
Put coffee into blender. Add a half cup of milk and half a cup of kahlua. Add a half cup of vodka and half a cup of chocolate syrup. Blend for a minute and serve immediately.

Dip shrimp into lemon juice to coat completely. Thread 4 shrimp onto each kebab stick. Dip each kebab stick into wine and then into mince garlic. Dip each kebab stick into steak sauce to coat completely. Sprinkle generously with coarse ground black pepper. Cook on grill or broiler for 3-4 minutes or until cooked through. Serve immediately.

Boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Remove potatoes from water and dry thoroughly with paper towels. Cut potatoes into eighths. Toss potatoes with oil, salt and pepper. Transfer potatoes to a large baking dish and spread out in an even layer. Bake until potatoes are tender and starting to brown. Remove from the oven and add onions and peppers. Return to the oven and continue cooking until the vegetables are tender. Add tomatoes and basil and cook until the tomatoes are soft. Serve hot with grated parmesan cheese.

Mix the anchovies and garlic with a tablespoon or so of the olive oil and set aside. Combine the tomatoes and olives with the remaining oil. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Place the pastry sheet on a lightly greased cookie sheet and trim to 1 inch larger than the cookie sheet. In a food processor or blender puree the onions. Mix the onion puree with the shortening and the flour. Knead to form a ball. Divide the dough in half and form 2 discs. Roll out the discs between sheets of plastic wrap and place them on the cookie sheet. Spread the onion puree mixture on top of each disc. Put the anchovy mixture in the center. Spread the tomatoes and olives over the anchovy mixture. Roll the pastry edges over the filling. Cut a small slit in the center of the pastry top. Bake for 15 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.

Preheat oven to 160 degrees. Grease and line 10 x 8cm baking pan. Whip eggs and sugar for 2 mins or until pale and thick. Add butter and beat again for 1 min. Add flour and mix through. Add melted chocolate. Stir until combined. Pour mixture into pan and press down evenly. Sprinkle chocolate chips over and bake for 25 mins or until firm to touch. Allow to cool slightly before removing from pan. Cut into squares to serve.

Combine garlic, rosemary, thyme and salt in a small bowl. Stir in oil and worcestershire sauce. Pour over meat and marinate for 6 hours. Brush with oil mixture and grill. Serve on baguette with horseradish sauce.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Coat pork chops in low sodium soy sauce, add fresh ground black pepper on each side of chops. Heat vegetable oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add pork chops cook for about 10 minutes until browned on both sides. Remove from skillet place in the preheated oven for about 10 min to finish cooking. Meanwhile bring a large pot of water to boil. Add rice noodles cook for about 3 minutes or until tender drain in a colander rinse well under cold water place in large mixing bowl add onion cabbage paprika hard-boiled egg green onions. Add pork chops to mixing bowl toss together. To serve place noodles on large plate top with pork chops cabbage mixture garnish with green onions.
Slice english muffin in half. Spread with miracle whip light. Add thinly cut red onions and tomato. Top with cooked crisp bacon and fresh basil. Enjoy.

Mix the vegetable oil, vinegar, mustard, worcestershire sauce, dry mustard, cayenne, and tabasco sauce. Place the steak in a glass container or in a zip top bag. Pour the mixture over the steak. Seal the container or close the bag. Shake the container or zip top bag to make sure the mixture is coated evenly. Marinate at least 3 hours. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. Drain the marinade from the container or zip top bag. Place the steak in a glass dish or a shallow roasting pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Flip the steak to the other side. Bake for 5 more minutes. Remove the steak from the oven. Let the steak sit for 10 minutes. This will allow the juices to redistribute evenly. Slice the steak. Serve with steamed vegetables.

Heat a large frying pan over a medium heat and add the oil. Brown the pork chops on each side for about 2 minutes. Set aside. Add the onions and carrots to the pan and saute for another 2 minutes. Add the mushrooms and celery. Cook for another minute. Stir in the tomatoes and wine. Bring to a simmer and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the garlic. Turn down the heat and add the pork chops. Turn the heat up and cook for another 2 minutes. Stir in the salt and pepper and cook for a further minute. Pour the mixture over the pork chops. Cover the pan with a lid or a piece of foil and cook in the preheated oven for about 15 minutes or until the pork is cooked through. Check the temperature with a meat thermometer and remove from the oven when the meat reaches an internal temperature of about 140 degrees F. Allow the pork to rest for 5 minutes before serving. Serve with mashed potatoes and green beans.

Cut cauliflower in half. Cut broccoli in half. Cut the stalk from the cauliflower and discard it. Place the broccoli and cauliflower in a large bowl. Add the garlic and 2 tsp oil to the bowl and toss to coat. Place the bowl in the refrigerator until ready to cook. Clean the mushrooms. Remove the stems from the mushrooms. Discard the stems. Set the caps aside. Heat 2 tsp oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the broccoli and cauliflower. Cook and stir until the broccoli and cauliflower are tender-crisp. Add the garlic and the mushroom caps to the skillet. Cook and stir until the mushrooms are tender-crisp. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Makes 6 servings.

In a large skillet over medium heat melt butter. Add onion and bell pepper and saute about five minutes. Add cream of mushroom and celery soup. Bring to boil. Stir in shrimp and Rotel tomatoes and cook about three minutes. Add rice. Cook two more minutes. Remove from heat. Serve over white rice.

Cook spinach according to package directionsdraincool slightlysqueeze out excess liquid in a paper towelchop. Melt 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large saucepan over moderate heat. Add onioncook 5 minutesstir in tomatoes with their liquidseason with 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and pepperbring to a boilcook 5 minutes longerstir in chiliesremove from heatcool to room temperaturecoverrefrigerate up to 2 days (canned tomatoes may be used instead of fresh).
