Preheat broiler with rack set 5 inches from heat sourceheat remaining 2 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over moderate heatadd spinachcook 1 minute or until wilteddrain wellstir in cheesescook 5 minutes or until mixture is smoothseason with salt and pepperremove from heatstir in sour creamset aside to cool slightlyseason with remaining 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Melt butter in a small skillet over moder

Bring water to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heatstir in sugar, cinnamon stick and lemon slices. Return to a boilremove from heat. Stir in blueberriesreturn to a boilcook 5 minutes or until blueberries are tender and the liquid thickens slightly. Stir in lemon wedgestir to dissolve lemon wedge. Serve immediately, topped with yogurt.

Preheat oven to 350f. Wash potatoes. Using a large sharp knife, pierce the skin all over the potato. Place in the microwave for 6 to 8 minutes. When potatoes are done, drain off water. Peel them. Place in a large bowl. Add evaporated milk, sour cream, butter, salt and pepper. Mash. Add enough milk to achieve desired consistency. Add more or less milk as needed. Makes about 4 cups.

Crack the egg into a bowl. Add milk and stir to combine. Add cheese and whisk until melted. Toast bread. Top with cheese mixture. Add bacon and tomatoes. Top with second piece of bread. Microwave for 1 minute and 30 seconds. Cut in half and serve.

Heat cream or hot water to a simmer in a small saucepan. Stir in peanut butter until smooth. Remove from heat. Add cocoa and whisk until smooth. Add marshmallow creme and stir until combined. Serve with crackers and roasted marshmallows.

Soak overnight. Drain. Cover with water. Add bacon. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until beans are tender. Stir in onion, garlic, tomato paste, spices & seasoning. Simmer for about an hour. Add water if necessary.

Toast bread round until golden brown on both sides. Rub tomatoes with a little of the shallot. Finely chop tomatoes with a little of the shallots. Squeeze tomatoes to remove seeds. Place chopped tomatoes into a bowl. Add the chopped shallots. Add the basil. Add the garlic. Add the lemon juice. Add the salt. Add the pepper. Add the extra virgin olive oil. Mix the ingredients well. Set aside for 5 minutes. Serve with bread round.
Cut steak into thin strips and marinade for at least 2 hours before grilling.

Melt margarine in a medium pot over medium heat. Saute onion and add curry and turmeric. Add rice and broth. Simmer uncovered for 40 minutes or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Stir in pepper and lemon zest. Serve warm.

Remove the seeds and membranes from the red & green bell peppers. Slice the peppers into thin strips. Place them in a bowl. Add the sugar & vinegar. Cover & let stand for 1 hour at room temperature. Drain the peppers. Discard the sugar & vinegar. Add the celery seeds. Place the drained peppers & celery seeds into a jar. Add enough hot water to cover the peppers. Let stand for 1 week. Remove the seeds. Place the relish into a bowl. Add the reserved water. Stir. Taste. Add more water if desired. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Clean broccoli and cut in half. Place on baking sheet lined with foil. Sprinkle with kosher salt and granulated sugar. Grill until brown on both sides. Serve.

Brown ground beef and green and sweet red peppers in skillet. Drain and rinse the corn from the water. Add all ingredients to the skillet. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover and cook for 15 minutes. Uncover the skillet. Stir the tamales occasionally for 10 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat a grill or broiler. Prepare mushrooms by first removing the stems and gills. Dip the stems in hot water and then use a knife to separate the gills from the caps. Cut the caps into quarters. Place the mushrooms caps and onions on the grill or broiler and cook until the mushrooms are tender. Meanwhile, cut a slice from the loaf of bread and rub the cut side with garlic and oil. Place the bread cut side down in the grill or broiler and cook until it becomes toasty. Remove from the grill or broiler. Brush the cut side of the bread with the oil mixture and then toast it again until it is golden brown. Remove the sandwiches from the grill or broiler and top each with some of the mushrooms.

In a shallow dish mix mustard and ham. Dip asparagus spears in ham mixture and arrange in greased 11 x 7 x 2 inch baking dish. In another shallow dish mix flour with milk. Dip rolls in milk mixture and then in bread crumbs. Arrange rolls on top of asparagus spears. Dot each roll with butter. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 425 degrees F for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.

In large skillet saute onion and garlic in olive oil over medium heat about 5 minutes. Add turkey and brown 5 minutes. Add beans and tomatoes and simmer 10 minutes. Add spices and simmer 10 minutes longer. Serve with corn tortillas.

Combine shortening and margarine in large bowl. Cream with electric mixer until light and fluffy. Blend in boiling water, baking powder and salt. Stir in enough flour to make dough firm but not crumbly. Knead until smooth and elastic. Roll out dough on lightly floured surface into 15 inch circle. Transfer dough to ungreased 12 inch fluted tube pan. Seal edges with wet fingers. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350. Bake 30-35 minutes or until golden brown and filling is set. Let stand 10 minutes before removing from pan. Cool. Drizzle with melted butter.
Pour boiling water into teapot. Add tea bags and let steep for 10 minutes. Add water and sugar. Stir in lemon juice and orange juice. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Slice eggplant very thin and place in a large bowl. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Place on a baking sheet and bake at 400 degrees F for 25-30 minutes or until tender. When cool enough to handle, dice eggplant and put in a large bowl. Add miso to boiling water and stir to dissolve. Add to eggplant and toss well. Add water and vinegar and stir well again to incorporate all ingredients. Add ginger and scallions and taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Serves 8 as a side dish.

Combine all the miso glaze ingredients in a small bowl or measuring cup. Pour the mixture into a small container such as a mason jar with lid. Place the lid on the jar and shake vigorously for at least 10 minutes. Set aside or refrigerate for up to 2 weeks. Prepare the cod fillets by rinsing with cold water and pat dry with paper towels or clean dishcloths. Season the fish with salt and pepper on both sides. Heat the vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat for 2 minutes. Place the fish in the hot skillet skin-side down, and cook for 2 minutes or until the skin is light golden brown. Turn the cod fillets skin-side up and pour the miso glaze over them. Cook for 30 seconds or until the glaze starts to brown. Turn the fish over and let the glaze caramelize for 30 seconds. Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

Slice rye bread in half lengthwise. Spread 1 tablespoon prepared mustard on each piece, then layer turkey, sauerkraut, and cheese. Cover sandwiches with remaining bread halves. Heat in a 350 degree oven for 10-12 minutes or until bread is toasted and sandwiches are hot. Serve with 2 teaspoons fat-free thousand island salad dressing.

Fill a large pitcher with about six cups of ice cubes and add all of your fruit and spices and teabags into the pitcher as well. Fill it up with cold fresh water and let it sit overnight or until the next morning. Pour into cups and add some lemonade or pineapple juice and garnish with some ice cubes or fresh fruit.

Hull strawberries, slice in half lengthwise and place in a bowl. Add milk, pudding mix and 1/2 cup whipped topping. Gently stir together until combined. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or until set. Meanwhile, whisk together remaining 1/2 cup whipped topping and almond extract in a bowl until smooth. Spoon cream cheese filling into strawberries. Serve on individual plates with remaining whipped topping drizzled over top. Yield: 8 servings.

Beat eggs slightly. Place tortilla on plate. Spray pan with vegetable spray. Melt butter over medium heat. Pour egg mixture onto pan. Cook until almost set. Fold up tortilla onto egg mixture. Place tortilla on plate. Fold over tortilla. Sprinkle with cheddar. Top with monterey jack. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Dice one pound fatback into 1/2-inch cubes and place into baking dish. Drizzle 1/2 cup milk over pork and sprinkle with one teaspoon flour. Drizzle 1/2 cup milk over pork again, sprinkle with one teaspoon flour and cook for 45 minutes until pork is tender. Drain excess fat from pan, then return pan to oven for 30 minutes to make gravy. Pour off fat from gravy pan and set aside until cool. Add flour, 2 cups milk, 1/4 cup water and seasonings. Cook until gravy is thickened and smooth. Pour into serving dish and sprinkle with remaining flour. Stir well and drizzle remaining 1/4 cup milk over gravy. Stir well until gravy is smooth again. Serve hot.

Melt butter over medium-high heat in an oven-proof skillet. Add garlic. Cook 1 minute. Add cabbage and saute for 5 minutes. Add water. Cover. Reduce heat to low. Cook for 5 minutes. Uncover. Cook for 15 minutes or until cabbage is soft. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with buttered toasts.

Place nuts in food processor and process for 2 minutes. Add agave and vanilla and process for 1 more minute. Place nut mixture in small bowl and refrigerate until firm. Remove from refrigerator 10 minutes before serving to soften slightly. If mixture is too thick to spread thinly, add more agave and process until smooth. Spread on bread or crackers. Sprinkle with sea salt.

Remove the skin from the chicken and cut into bite-size pieces. Place the chicken into the slow cooker pot and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add the soups, sour cream, dill weed, garlic, and Italian seasoning. Stir until blended and cook on low for 6-8 hours. When ready to serve, add the potatoes and cook for an additional two hours on low. Serve over rice.

Mix provolone cheese, marinara sauce and parmesan cheese together. Spread mixture over a slice of bread. Add a layer of turkey and another slice of bread. Spread butter over the second slice of bread and then place in a panini press. Cook until bread is toasted.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until golden. Add brussels sprouts and cook until tender. Add red pepper flakes and lemon juice. Cook until most of the liquid has evaporated. Add balsamic vinegar and brown sugar. Toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper.

Brush corn lightly with olive oil and grill until charred and tender. Remove from grill and soak corn in milk for at least 15 minutes. Grill corn again for another 2 minutes. Drizzle butter over the grilled corn. Sprinkle generously with salt and pepper. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Melt the butter over medium heat in a large saucepan. Add the brown sugar and water and bring to a boil. Remove from the heat, add the ginger and sea salt, stirring until the sugar has dissolved. Pour the glaze into a large shallow baking pan that has been lined with aluminum foil. Make sure the foil hangs over the side of the dish so that the nuts can be dipped in the glaze without touching the sides. Spread the almonds on the prepared sheet pan and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. Remove the almonds from the oven and add the dried fruit to the glaze. Stir until the fruit is coated evenly with glaze. Return the almonds to the oven for 5 to 10 minutes more or until the fruit is tender and the almonds are slightly browned. Remove the almonds from the oven and drain any excess glaze by dipping the al
Combine all the ingredients with ice and shake until chilled. Pour into martini glasses and garnish with pear slices or crystallized ginger.

In a large saucepan combine the lime juice, wine vinegar, shallots and chilies with 1 cup water and bring to a boil. Add the remaining water and season with salt and sugar and simmer for about 20 minutes. Cook until the mixture thickens slightly. Add the vegetable oil and cook for about 30 minutes until the oil coats the back of a spoon. Transfer the mixture in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to a week or in the freezer for up to 3 months. Reheat in the microwave before serving.

Clean and trim meat. Season with salt and pepper. Cut into strips and place in crockery bowl. Add onions, fresh garlic and barbecue sauce. Toss well to coat meat. Marinate meat for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients. Heat oil in large skillet on high heat. Add meat and saute for 5 minutes. Pour remaining mixture into pan. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Transfer meat to serving platter. Pour sauce over meat and serve.

Wash wingspat dry with paper towelsplace wings in large zip-top plastic bagadd salt and pepperseal bagrefrigerate at least four hours or overnightdiscard marinade when ready to cook. Preheat oven to 425f. Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heatadd wingscook and stir until browned on all sidestransfer wings to large bowladd remaining marinadetoss to coattransfer wings to shallow baking panbake uncovered at 425f for 16-18 minutesremove from pansprinkle with gingerdrizzle with remaining marinadetransfer wings to serving plattersprinkle with sesame seedsserve with soy dipping sauce.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large skillet over medium-high heat combine the oil with the apples, sweet potatoes, brown sugar, granulated sugar, and cinnamon. Cook until the apples are tender and the potatoes are lightly browned. Remove from heat and stir in dried cranberries. Place the potatoes mixture into a greased 1-quart baking dish. Drizzle the topping mixture over the top. Bake uncovered for 35 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Prepare brownie mix according to directions on box. Pour brownie mixture into greased pan. Top with marshmallow creme. Spread creamy peanut butter over marshmallow creme layer. Sprinkle with rice krispies. Top with semi-sweet chocolate chips. Refrigerate 1 hour to set. Cut into bars.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in onion and garlic cloves. Cook until onion is tender. Stir in the flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually add the milk and cook, stirring constantly. Bring mixture to a boil. Cook and stir for 1 minute or until thickened and bubbly. Stir in cottage cheese and cook for 3 minutes or until cheese is melted and mixture is thick. Remove from the heat. Stir in the spinach. Fold in the eggs and season with salt and pepper. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef until browned and no pink remains. Drain well and set aside. In a large saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heatsaute garlic until tender. Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. Stir in crushed tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes until slightly thickened. Stir in meat and season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and cook for 10 minutes until meat is tenderadd pasta sauce and stir well to blend. Preheat oven to 375f. In a large bowl, combine ricotta cheese and 1 cup mozzarella cheesestir to blend. Spread 1/4 cup of meat mixture in a 13x9-inch baking dishtop with 1/3 cup ricotta mixture and 1/3 cup of meat mixture. Repeat layerstop with remaining ricotta mixture and remaining 1/3 cup meat mixture. Cover with foil and bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until a thermometer inserted in the center of the

In a bowl, combine the red bell pepper, garlic and ginger. Mince garlic and ginger with a chef's knife. Peel garlic and ginger and discard skin. Dice the garlic and ginger. Add the oil and shrimp and stir. Cook on medium high heat until the shrimp are pink. Add the red chili oil and stir. Add salt and pepper. Cook until heated through. Place shrimp in a serving dish. Garnish with chives and lemon and lime juice. Serve.

Wash and dry sweet potatoes. Cut off ends and cut into 1/2-inch slices. Arrange slices in single layer on an aluminum foil lined jellyroll pan. Drizzle with maple syrup and sprinkle with lemon juice and salt. Bake at 375 degrees for 45-60 minutes or until tender. Let cool for 10 minutes. Serve immediately with butter.

Mix flour, salt and pepper in a resealable bag. Coat each fillet with 1/4 cup of the flour mixture. Heat 1 inch vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook fillets in oil in batches for 1 to 2 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Drain on paper towels. Place fillets on a platter. Cover with foil. Keep warm in a 250 degree F. oven until ready to serve. Meanwhile, combine remaining 1/4 cup flour, butter and lemon juice in a small bowl. Stir in 1/2 cup water. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt. Set aside. Melt the remaining 1/4 cup of butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Add the lemon-butter sauce. Bring to a simmer. Simmer until thickened, about 2 minutes. Stir in the chopped parsley. Pour over the snapper. Serves 4.

Mix all the dry ingredients together. Add water until it's a soft dough. Knead for a minute or two until the dough is smooth and elastic. Put in a bowl. Cover and let rest for 10 minutes. Roll dough out onto a floured surface. Cut into four pieces. Roll each piece out into a circle about 4 inches in diameter. Put about 2 teaspoons of feta on each. Roll each circle up jelly-roll style. Place on a hot griddle. Cook until bubbly and brown. Turn each one over. Cook until brown on the other side. Serve hot.

Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the ham and continue cooking for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the egg substitute. Add the fresh tomatoes and cook for 1 minute. Layer 1 tortilla on top of the egg mixture. Sprinkle with the mushrooms and cook 1 minute. Spoon 1 cup of the cheese on top. Sprinkle with 2 tbsp of the salsa. Top with the remaining tortillas and sprinkle with the remaining 2 tbsp of the salsa. Cook until golden and heated through. Fold in half and serve.

Make crust. Preheat oven to 425f. Peel lemon. Cut off the ends of the lemon. Use a sharp knife to cut off the peel. Remove as much of the pith as possible. Cut lemon in half. Cut each half crosswise into thin strips. Juice lemon. Combine lemon juice, sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook, whisking constantly, until sauce is thickened. Stir in lemon strips. Place strips in pie crust. Spoon blackberries over strips. Place remaining pastry over top crust. Trim excess. Seal edges. Cut several vent holes in top crust. Bake 35 to 40 minutes.

Rinse brussels sprouts well. Cut off and discard any yellow or brown leaves. Place brussels sprouts in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat and then reduce to a simmer. Cook for 3 minutes and then drain. Fill a large skillet with 1/4-inch of water. Place a clean 18-inch piece of parchment paper over the skillet. Place brussels sprouts on the parchment paper and sprinkle with kosher salt and pepper. Wrap the parchment paper around the brussels sprouts and twist tightly to close. Place 1-inch slices of bacon around the top of each parchment bundle. Cover with another piece of parchment paper and twist tightly to close. Place bundles seam side down in a preheated 325 degree F. oven for 1 hour.

Melt the white chocolate in a double boiler. Stir in the cream and rum. Remove from heat and stir in the coconut. Stir in the macadamia nuts. Put into the fridge for at least 30 minutes. Use a melon baller to form small balls. Place into the fridge for another 30 minutes. Dip the balls in the melted chocolate. Roll in the coconut.

In large skillet over medium heat, cook onions until tender. Add chili pepper, hot pepper sauce and cook over medium heat until hot. Place tortilla on flat surface. Spread half of the mixture over tortilla. Cover with another tortilla. Spray with cooking spray. Roll up burrito. Place seam side down in baking dish. Cover with foil. Bake at 375f for 25 minutes or until heated through. Remove foil. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake for an additional 5 minutes or until melted.

Preheat oven to 425 F. Place cherry tomatoes, halved or quartered if theyre large and add them to a baking dish or roasting pan with extra virgin olive oil and garlic cloves. Roast tomatoes for about 20 minutes until they soften and caramelize slightly. Place pesto in a bowl and add extra virgin olive oil and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper and stir until combined. Place fish fillets in pan and season with salt and pepper and top with roasted tomatoes. Bake for about 12 minutes or until fish is flaky and cooked through. Top with lemon wedges and enjoy!

Cook pasta according to package directions using a large pot of boiling salted water. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water for later. Drain pasta and return it to the pot with the reserved pasta water (if needed). Place spaghetti in a large baking dish. Place chicken in the baking dish and set aside. In a medium bowl, combine mushrooms and next 4 ingredients. In a large skillet, cook and stir mushroom mixture in hot oil on medium heat 4 minutes or until tender and slightly browned. Stir in cream of mushroom soup and cook until heated through, stirring constantly. Add mushroom mixture to the spaghetti mixture in the baking dish. Gently stir to combine the pasta with the sauce. Sprinkle with cheese and cook until cheese melts and the mixture is hot and bubbly, about 3 minutes. Top with sour cream and serve immediately.

In a glass container combine the salmon steaks, garlic cloves and juice of one lemon. Add paprika, sugar and salt and pepper to taste. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Remove garlic cloves and discard. Place salmon steaks on a platter. Drizzle with the marinade and serve. You can add additional dill.

Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Stir in flour and salt until blendedgradually add milk and water. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Stir in Velveeta cheese and cook until melted. Stir in potatoes and ham. Pour into a greased 2-qt. shallow casserole. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes or until heated through.

Slice pork chops into thin slices and place into a bowl and add 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup vinegar. Set aside and let soak for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons of the vinegar and 1 tablespoon of sugar over medium heat until sugar dissolves and mixture begins to boil. Set aside to cool. Drain soaked pork chops and pat dry with paper towels. In a bowl add remaining vinegar and sugar and add pork chops and coat well. In a pan add 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup vinegar to the pan and bring to a boil. Once boiling add 1/2 cup cornstarch and 1/2 tsp ginger and stir to combine. Once cornstarch is dissolved add pork chops and stir to coat well and bring to a boil for 2 minutes. In a skillet add 1 tbsp of vegetable oil and 2 tbsp of vinegar and bring to a boil for 1 minute or until mixture thickens and begins to coat the back of a spoon

In a large pot heat the hamburger to the point where it is a little browned. Remove from heat. In a separate saucepan add tomato paste and water. Bring to a boil. Add spices (cumin, chili powder) and mustard. Boil for about 5 minutes. Add to meat. Serve hot.

Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Marinade the chicken in the mixture for at least two hours in the refrigerator. Grill or broil the chicken for five minutes per side or until done. Serve with couscous or rice and fresh veggies.

Remove skin and seeds from tomatoes and cut into halves or quarters as desired. Place tomatoes in a shallow dish and sprinkle generously with salt and pepper. Put in preheated 450 degree oven for about ten minutes, until the skins are blistered and beginning to crack and split. Remove from oven and place tomatoes on paper towels for five minutes until cool enough to handle. While tomatoes are cooling, melt butter and stir in basil and sugar to tasteset aside. When tomatoes are cool enough to handle, squeeze excess liquid from tomatoes and coat inside and out with butter mixtureplace in a shallow baking dish. Return dish to preheated oven and bake until tomatoes are tender, about fifteen minutes. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add onioncook for 2 minutes or until tender. Stir in shredded hash browns and cream of chicken soup. Bring mixture to a boilcook for 10 minutes or until slightly thickened. Spray 13x9 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Spoon hash browns mixture into prepared dishtop with bacon bits, cheddar cheese and dry ranch dressing mix. Bake at 350 degrees F for 25 minutes or until heated through. Top with chopped parsley just before serving if desired.

Wash split peas. Place in large stock pot or large slow cooker. Cover with vegetable broth. Add onion. Cover. Cook on high for 2 hours. Stir in carrots. Add water. Cover. Cook on low for 4-5 hours. Stir in salt and pepper. Transfer to serving bowls. Serve warm.

In a small bowl mix together the mayonnaise and sour cream. Whisk in the pickle juice, buttermilk, salt and dried parsley. Add the onion powder, garlic powder and pepper. Taste and adjust seasonings. Mix well. This dressing will last for 1 week in the refrigerator.

Cut dinner rolls in half. Spread butter on rolls. In a small bowl combine brown sugar and worcestershire sauce and mustard and pour into rolls. Add ham and cheese to rolls. Roll up and place seams side down on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes until golden brown.

In small saucepan over low heat, combine butter and corn syrup. Stirring constantly with a wooden spoon or wire whisk, bring to a boil. Cook until butter is completely melted and mixture is smooth and shiny, 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in water and salt. Add pecansstir until coated. Spread pecans in a single layer on prepared cookie sheet. Bake in preheated oven 325 degrees f for 15 minutes or until pecans are lightly browned. Makes about 2 cups.

Peel pumpkin and remove seeds. Cut pumpkin into 1/2 inch thick slices. Slice green onions in half lengthwise. Heat canola oil in wok. Add sliced pumpkin and cook over high heat until tender. Add green onions and garlic. Stir until fragrant. Add fish sauce and chicken stock. Stir evenly then braise over low heat for 5 minutes. Add pumpkin preserves. Stir until evenly mixed. Season with sugar and pepper. Use a large pair of chopsticks to toss the pumpkin. You can always add whatever you want into this dish, it is very very versatile.

Combine cayenne and lemon pepper in a shallow dish. Dip catfish fillet in spices on all sides and shake off excess. Heat a cast iron skillet over medium heat. Melt butter in the pan. Place fillet in pan and cook until lightly browned on both sides, about 10 minutes total cooking time. Serve with Italian salad dressing on the side.

Cook the chicken. Shred the cooked chicken. In a small bowl mix together the soup and poultry seasoning. Stir in the shredded cooked chicken. In a small bowl combine the Bisquick and milk. Pour the Bisquick milk mixture into the shredded cooked chicken mixture. Mix well. Stir in the frozen vegetables. Pour into a greased casserole dish. Sprinkle parsley flakes on top. Bake uncovered at 350f for 20 minutes.

Pour beer into a greased 8-inch square baking pan. Combine flour and sugar in a large bowl. Cut in 1/3 cup softened butter with a pastry blender or a fork until the mixture is crumbly. Stir in beer mixture. Spread over top of bread mixture in pan. Bake for 45 minutes at 375 degrees or until golden brown. Cool slightly before serving. Serve with your favorite beer cheese dip!

Cream together 1/2 cup butter, 1 cup granulated sugar in large bowl. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add vanilla extract. Sift together flour, baking powder and baking soda. Stir flour mixture into butter mixture. Add 1 cup of sour cream. Drop 1 tablespoonful of mixture onto greased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 until cookies are set (about 14 minutes). Cool slightly. Fill each cookie with 1 tablespoonful of fudge frosting. Place cookies face down on wire rack. Spread 2 tablespoons of fudge frosting over cookies. Drizzle with 1/4 teaspoon of caramel topping. Place under hot broiler until topping is bubbly.

In a large saute pan over medium heat add olive oil. When hot add cashew nuts. Cook about 2 minutes. Stir in snow peas. Cook about 2 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add orange peel. Cook about 3 minutes. Drain. Serve immediately.

Place cod fillets in a large saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil then cook for about 10 minutes. Drain fillets and set aside. In a skillet, heat the oil and cook the onions until golden brown then add the chives. Add white wine and lemon juice, then bring the mixture to a boil and cook for about 2 minutes. Add cod fillets and season with salt and pepper. Simmer for about 15 minutes or until cod fillets are flaky and white.

Remove skin from chicken and pat dry with paper towels. Whisk together dijon mustard and 1/3 cup teriyaki sauce. Brush chicken with mustard mixture. Place chicken on a broiler pan. Bake for 20 minutes on one side. Turn over and brush with remaining teriyaki sauce and broil for 10-15 minutes more or until done. Remove from broiler and brush with more teriyaki sauce. Let stand a few minutes and serve. You can also make this recipe in the crockpot. Add all ingredients to slow cooker. Cook on high for 4 hours or low for 6 hours. -- I think that a lot of the flavor comes from the mustard.
Combine wine, oil, herbs and spices in a plastic bag. Add pork and coat well. Marinate in refrigerator for at least several hours. Cook over medium heat in a covered pan until pork is done.

Sift flour, baking soda and salt into a large bowl. Cream butter and brown sugars together until light and fluffy. Add white sugars and vanilla extract. Beat in eggs one at a time. Beat in flour mixture alternately with pudding mix. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-15 minutes. Cool on wire racks.

Press tofu to remove moisture. Slice onion into paper thin slices. Slice apple into paper thin slices. Chop pecans. In a food processor, add tofu, onion, apple, pecans and curry. Pulse until mixture is finely chopped and incorporated. Add salt and pepper to taste. Spread on a sandwich roll. Garnish sandwich with dill weed and cayenne pepper.

Mix water and cinnamon in a 9x13 baking pan or individual ramekins. Mix butter and sugar together and add to apples. Mix flour and brown sugar together and add to apples. Place apples in baking pan and bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Serve warm with ice cream and cider.
Combine mayonnaise with champagne and vinegar. Stir in cooked chicken and apple. Toss with lettuce and feta.

Melt white chocolate in a microwave safe bowl in the microwave at 30 seconds intervals for a total of 2 minutes. Mix the chocolate with peanut butter and spanish peanut. Place the rice krispies in the bottom of a large plastic bowl or Tupperware container and press down hard with your hand to flatten them a little bit (this helps them hold the shape of the container better). Pour the chocolate mixture over the rice krispies. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Once the mixture has set, remove it from the fridge and cut it into squares.

Mix together flour and paprika in a shallow dish or zip lock bag. Dip each breast into melted crisco and then into flour mixture until well coated. Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Place breasts into a baking pan and cook for 35-40 minutes at 425 degrees, until browned and cooked through. Serve warm.

Bring water to boil in a large sauce pan over high heat and add eggsboil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and crack eggs into a strainer. Rinse eggs under cold water to stop cooking. Drain well. Add oil to pan, then heat over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in tomato pastecook until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes. Add tomatoes, chili powder, turmeric, salt, and cilantrobring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low. Stir in eggs until fully cooked, 1 to 2 minutes more. Serve over rice or roti.

Place the potatoes in a slow cooker and add enough water to cover. Cover and cook on low for 4 to 5 hours. Drain the potatoes and return them to the slow cooker. Add the garlic and caraway seeds. Season the pork with salt and pepper. Sprinkle the pork with the sauerkraut and place it in the slow cooker. Cover and cook 3 to 4 hours until the pork is tender. Slice the pork and serve with the potatoes and sauerkraut.

Remove the husks from the tomatillos. Roast the tomatillos directly over an open flame or under a broiler for about 15 minutes, or until the skin is charred all over (be careful not to burn the husks). Place the tomatillos in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap (this will allow the fruit to steam). Let stand for about 30 minutes, or until cool enough to handle. Peel off the husks of the tomatillos. Cut the tomatillos into quarters. Place in a blender with the jalapeno pepper, garlic cloves, cilantro leaves, lime juice, sugar and salt and puree to a smooth consistency. Slowly stream in the olive oil while the blender is running so that the salsa thickens slightly. Serve at room temperature with tortillas or use as a sauce for grilled fish or meat. Store in the refrigerator for up to one week or freeze for up to three months.
Cream together butter and sugar. Stir in vanilla. Add oats. Press mixture into an ungreased 8x8x2 pan. Cool. Cut into squares. Refrigerate. Makes 36.

Put the chocolate and spread into a heatproof bowl set over a pan of barely simmering water until melted and smooth (don't allow the mixture to boil). Remove from the heat and stir in the cream until smooth. Transfer to a piping bag fitted with a star-shaped nozzle and pipe into 6cm balls on a tray lined with non-stick baking paper. Sprinkle with the almonds and place in the fridge until firm (about one hour).
Combine cooked chicken with remaining ingredients in crock pot. Cook on low for 8 hours.

Clean and trim the asparagus. Cut off the woody tips and discard. Cut off the root ends. Blanch the asparagus in boiling water for 30 seconds. Drain and rinse the blanched asparagus with cold water. Transfer the cooked asparagus to a large bowl. Drizzle the sesame oil over the asparagus and toss to coat. Add the lemon juice to the sesame oil and season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat the asparagus with the vinaigrette. Serve the asparagus topped with the sesame oil vinaigrette.

To make the coconut coffee mix 1/3 cup coconut milk with 1/3 cup sweetened coconut and heat in microwave just until hot. Pour into a glass. To make the iced coconut coffee mix 2 cups coconut milk with 2 cups sugar and heat in microwave just until hot. Pour into a glass and let cool. Add 1/4 cup coconut coffee to a tall glass filled with ice. Pour over 1/4 cup iced coconut coffee. Add 1/4 cup coconut milk. Repeat with 2 more layers. Add 1/4 cup coconut coffee to top. Garnish with sweetened coconut and serve immediately.
Cut focaccia rolls in half and spread mayonnaise on bottom half. Spread pesto sauce on top of mayonnaise and top with sliced tomatoes and fresh mozzarella.

Heat oil and onion in a large stock pot over medium heatcook for 4 minutes or until onion is tender and translucent. Increase heat to high and add garlic and stir constantly for 2 minutes or until garlic is golden. Increase heat to high and add boiling water, chicken stock cubes and zucchinireduce heat to medium and cook for 15 minutes or until zucchini is tenderstir occasionally. Increase heat to high and add evaporated milkcook for 5 minutes or until heated through and thickened slightly. Stir in basil and season with salt and pepper to tasteserve immediately.

Cream butter and shortening together. Stir in honey and beaten egg. Stir in orange rind, flour, baking powder and soda and orange juice. Fold in chopped walnuts and pour into greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or till light brown. Serve with butter and honey.

Heat oil in a large sauce pan over medium heat. Saute the onions and garlic until soft. Add the basil and bay leaves and saute another 3 minutes. Add the red wine and cook for 3 minutes. Add the brown gravy mix and cold water. Bring to a boil. Add sliced mushrooms. Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes. Remove bay leaves. Add the meatballs and cook for 5 minutes. Remove bay leaves.

Preheat the oven to 400. In a medium bowl mix all dry ingredients. In a large bowl whisk together all wet ingredients. Add to dry mixture and mix until just combined. Drop by teaspoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until browned. Let cool for 1 minute and then transfer to a wire cooling rack. Let cool for 5 minutes and then transfer to a wire cooling rack. Store in an airtight container.

Sprinkle flour on steak and add butter. Cook on medium heat until steak is brown on both sides. Add onions and saute until onions are soft and clear. Add the bell peppers and cook until tender. Add green chiles (if desired). Add the tomatoes and cook until tomatoes begin to break down. Stir in the garlic and cumin. Stir in the beef stock or water. Season the stew with salt and pepper. Cook on low heat for about 2 hours or until stew is thick and bubbly. Remove from heat and serve.

Spread the cream of mushroom soup in the dough. Layer ham, veggies, and mozzarella. Roll up dough. Place in 13x9 baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing. Serve warm.

Whisk soymilk and raisins together in large bowl. Whisk in flour and baking powder. Fold in apples. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Lightly coat pan with cooking spray. Pour batter by large spoonfuls onto pan. Cook until large bubbles appear on surface and pancake is golden brown around edges. Flip pancake and cook on other side until golden brown. Serve with maple syrup.

Melt butter in a small sauce pan over low heat. Add wasabi powder and chives and heat for another minute. Remove from heat and stir in freshly grated black pepper. Add freshly grated black pepper to taste. Serve with freshly baked scones or biscuits.

In a large saucepan cook bacon until crisp. Remove to a paper towel lined plate. Drain drippings from the pan. Saute shallot in drippings until tender. Stir in green beans. Cook over medium heat until green beans are tender-crisp. Stir in bacon and vinegar. Cook 3-4 minutes. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serves 4.

Boil rice in large sauce pan for about 5 minutes. Drain and set aside. In medium sauce pan over medium heat add coconut cream, curry paste and a bit of water. Mix well and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes or until thick. Add salmon fillets and green beans. Heat through. Serve over rice and garnish with fresh cilantro.

Crush graham crackers in food processor. Add 1/2 cup cream cheese & pulse until mixture is well blended. Add flour & pulse to combine. Add sour cream & vanilla & blend until well mixed. Stir in egg whites. Pour into greased 8-inch springform pan. Place in freezer for 1 hr. Beat 3 egg whites to firm peaks. Gently fold in 1 cup powdered sugar. Spread over cheesecake. Refrigerate 4 hrs. Invert pan & remove sides. Slice & serve. Top with strawberries if desired. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Wash and dry pears. Remove the seeds of the pears. Peel pears. Arrange pears on a plate. Pour milk into the pan and add nutmeg and vanilla essence. Heat the mixture and add pears. Let it boil. Remove the pears from the pan and set them on the plate. Bake the pears for about 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place beets in a small dish with 1/2 inch water. Bake until tender when pierced with a fork, about 60 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly until you can handle them. Cut off and discard beet greens and reserve beets for another use. Peel and chop beets and add them and remaining dressing ingredients to bowl with arugula and frisee. Toss gently and serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium heat, brown ground chicken in oil. Add mushrooms and cook for 1 minute. Add zucchini and cook for 3 minutes or until zucchini is crisp-tender. Stir in hot salsa and cook for 1 minute. Stir in green and red bell peppers. Cook for 1 minute or until tender-crisp. Stir in flour tortillas and cook for 3-4 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat well. Add flour mixture alternating with milk mixture to form a thick dough. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350f for about 10 minutes or until edges are browned. Cool on cookie sheet for about two minutes before removing cookies to wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat the grill on high. Place the chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water. Allow the chocolate to melt and then whisk until smooth. Remove from the heat and add the sugar and cream. Whisk until smooth and add the Grand Marnier. Whisk until the mixture thickens. Divide the mixture between four dessert bowls and refrigerate for at least one hour until set. Meanwhile, cut the strawberries into thin slices and place in a bowl with the sugar. Toss until the berries are well coated. To serve, scoop the mousse from the bowls and spoon onto serving plates. Top with a spoonful of strawberries and a few twigs of mint.
Whisk together all the mustard. Whisk in brown sugar and honey. Next whisk in vinegar. Whisk in salt and pepper. Let the mixture stand for a few minutes. Stir again before using.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut baguette in half. Brush each half with olive oil and salt and pepper. Place on baking sheet and bake in oven until crispy. Top each half with a slice of tomato. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Top with a slice of mozzarella cheese and a handful of basil leaves. Place back in oven for 3 to 5 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Prepare rice as directed by package directions. Chop broccoli and melt butter in a large pot. Add broccoli and saute until tender but crisp. Combine broccoli with soup and stir. Pour 1 1/2 cups soup mixture into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Top with 1/2 cup rice mixture and sprinkle with 1/2 cup Velveeta cheese. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until bubbly and top is golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In food processor bowl, place all ingredients except asparagus. Process until mixture is smooth. Bring 6 cups water to boil in saucepan. Add asparagus and return to boil. Cook for 3 minutes. Drain asparagus in colander and plunge into cold water. Drain again. Toss with dressing. Serves 8.

In a small saucepan over medium-low heat, heat the oil. Stir in the garlic. Cook for about 2 minutes or until garlic is fragrant. Add the soymilk, nutritional yeast, all-purpose flour, oregano, salt, and peppercook for about 10 minutes or until the sauce thickens and turns a golden color. Stir in the nutmeg.

Open up a bag of Doritos. Pour ranch style beans into bag. Pour in ground beef. Add onion. Add cheese. Add tomatoes. Add lettuce. Close bag. Shake until mixed. Open bag. Pour beans into a large bowl. Pour in bag contents. Add catalina dressing. Stir until thoroughly mixed. Enjoy!

Cut bread into four pieces. Spread mayonnaise on each slice. Arrange tomatoes on each slice. Salt and pepper each slice of bread. Layer half of the provolone cheese on each slice. Add the turkey to each slice of bread. Sprinkle with basil leaves. Place turkey on one slice of bread. Place the other slice of bread on top. Spread chutney on each slice of bread. Butter each slice of bread. Grill the sandwich on medium heat until the cheese melts.

Spread rye bread with reduced-fat mayonnaise. Top with reduced-fat swiss cheese, corned beef slices and slices of cabbage. Sprinkle with dijon mustard. Spray bread with nonstick cooking spray on both sides, then place on heated grill pan for 5 minutes per side or until golden brown.

Combine the Crystal Light Raspberry Drink Mix, cranberry juice cocktail, orange juice and freshly squeezed limes in a pitcher. Stir until dissolved. Add club soda and stir until thoroughly blended. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Add orange and lime slices. Serve. This non-alcoholic sangria recipe makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 350. In a medium saute pan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add shallots and saute until soft and translucent. Add pork chops and saute until browned. Add mustard and saute 2 minutes. Add cream and lemon juice. Bring to a boil then add water and bring to a simmer. Stir and cook for 10 minutes. Pour mixture over pork chops and sprinkle with capers. Bake in oven for 20 minutes.

Mix lean ground beef, ground sausage, celery, onion, saltines, eggs. Put in a pan. Add 1/4 cup of the tomato sauce. Mix in the brown sugar. Add mustard. Add the worcestershire sauce. Mix. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Serve hot.

Place egg substitute into a large bowl. Add vanilla extract, ground cinnamon and skim milk. Whisk until blended. Place margarine into a large skillet. Heat margarine until it is hot. Dip french bread into egg mixture, turning to coat both sides. Add to skillet. Cook until both sides are golden brown. Serve with maple syrup.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine tuna, water and corn niblets. Stir in green chilies and black olives. Stir in onion. In a separate bowl combine the sour cream and enchilada sauce. Season with salt and pepper. In a medium bowl combine the cheese blend and stir well. Spread a 1/2 cup of the cheese mixture down the center of each tortillas. Spoon a 1/3 cup of the tuna mixture over the cheese. Fold the tortillas and place seam down in a 2 quart baking dish. Pour the remaining cheese blend over the enchiladas. Pour the enchilada sauce over the cheese blend. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Bake for 25 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. Serve with iceberg lettuce.

Bring vegetable broth to a boil in a large sauce pan. Add cauliflower and red onion to boiling broth. Cook on low heat until cauliflower is tender. Remove cauliflower from broth with a slotted spoon. Add garlic cloves to broth. When cauliflower is cool enough to handle, remove garlic cloves. Remove vanilla pod from its stem. Add vanilla pod to broth. Add cream to broth& stir. Bring soup to a boil. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Serve warm.

Prepare the cake mix as directed on box and bake in a greased 9 x 13 pan according to package directions. Meanwhile, stir together applesauce, egg beaters and cinnamon until well blended. Pour apple mixture into cake pan while cake is still warm. Cool cake completely before cutting into squares to serve with coffee or tea.

Trim fish of fins and head, leaving tail intact. Season fish fillets with salt and pepper. Stir together cumin, lemon juice, olive oil, and 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Brush all sides of fillets with mixture. Cut bell pepper lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Cut mushroom caps into 1/4-inch-thick rounds. Thread fish onto skewers with pepper and mushroom rounds alternating as desired. Place skewers in a shallow pan, cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes to marinate. Cook skewers for about 2 minutes per side over a medium-hot grill or broil 4 to 6 inches from the broiler until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

Mix dry ingredients. Beat together shortening and brown sugar. Blend in water and vanilla. Stir in eggs and milk. Blend. Pour into three greased 9x5x3 inch pans. Bake 45 minutes at 350 degrees. Mix 1/4 cup butter and 1/2 cup brown sugar. Spread over cake and sprinkle with marshmallows.
Prepare seasoning mix. Mix together breadcrumbs, oregano, thyme, cayenne and tabasco. Place fillets in a 9x12 baking dish. Spread seasoning mix on top. Bake at 450 for 20-25 minutes.

Mix all dry ingredients. Separate cake mix into two bowls. Add orange juice and zest to one bowl and oil and eggs to other. Blend dry and wet mixtures until just combined. Pour into greased and floured pan and bake for 40 minutes at 350 degrees. Let cool 10 minutes then remove from pan and cool completely. Once cool, dust with almonds.

Boil baby carrots until tender but still crisp (about 12 min.). Drain and rinse with cold waterdrain again. Butter a 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish. In a saucepan over medium heat melt butteradd onion and cook 3 minutes or until softened. Add carrots and cook 4 minutes or until heated through. Remove from heatsprinkle with cheese. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Place bread crumbs on a plate and roll carrots in crumbs to coatplace carrots on top of cheese mixture. Bake 3 to 4 minutes or until cheese is melted and carrots are heated through. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a small bowl combine salt, parsley, italian seasoning, pepper and lemon juice. In a large bowl combine oil cooking spray with the cod fillets. Dip the cod fillets into the lemon mixture. Place the cod fillets in a 9x13 inch glass pan. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve with rice or your favorite side dish.

Put all of the ingredients except the coconut into a large bowl or the bowl of an electric mixer. Beat until stiff peaks form. Fold in the coconut. Drop by teaspoons onto wax paper or parchment paper. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until firmly set.

Remove clams from shell. Mash clams with a fork. Add potatoes, green onions, egg, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Form mixture into small balls. Dip into beaten egg. Roll in fine breadcrumbs. Place on greased baking sheet. Dip in oil. Bake at 400f for 10 minutes.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain the potatoes, then cool. Place the potatoes in a large bowl. Add white wine vinegar, white sugar, salt, celery seed, green onions and hard-boiled eggs. Stir until well-combined. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.
Slice white bread thickly on one side. Spread one side with peanut butter. Flip it over and spread with butter. Then sprinkle with sugar. Broil 2-4 minutes on each side or until sugar melts slightly.

Fold puff pastry in half (so you have a triangle) then fold in the sides. Place a piece of salmon in the centre then place a few sliced almonds around the edges. Brush the edges of the triangle with pesto sauce. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with a tomato salad.

Bring water to a boil in a large pot and add the ravioli and diced tomatoes. Boil for about six minutes or until cooked through and tender. Stir in garlic and let simmer for two minutes. Pour in spinach and stir until completely wilted. Add a dash of salt and pepper and stir in cheese and parmesan cheese. Serve over hot cooked pasta.

Slice tomatoes in half. Remove seeds and set aside. Heat oil and margarine in a large skiled over medium high heat. Add sliced onions and saute until soft. Add garlic and saute 1 minute longer. Stir in flour and saute 1 minute more. Add tomato halves and saute until they begin to soften. Pour in wine and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of pan. Add chicken broth and bring to boil. Stir in tomato paste. Cook until slightly thickened. Stir in parsley and season to taste with salt and pepper. Crack eggs into 12 small bowls. Spoon tomato mixture into baking dish. Divide eggs among tomato mixture. Top with cheese. Bake at 350f until eggs are firm and cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Mix breadcrumbs, ginger, horseradish and seasonings in a shallow dish. Place salmon fillets in the breadcrumb mixture, coating both sides well. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry salmon fillets, about 3 minutes each side or until golden brown. Serve hot.

Mix the paprika, garlic, thyme, salt and pepper together in a bowl. Pour over the oil. Rub the fillets with the mixture and place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Bake eggs in a single layer on a baking sheet at gas mark 4 for 20 minutes. Crack the shell and remove the yolk. Mix the egg yolks and mustard in a bowl. Stir in the vinegar and paprika. Whisk in sugar until dissolved. Add the melted butter. Pour the egg mixture into a 9 x 5 inch baking pan. Refrigerate for 2 hours until set. Peel the eggs and remove the yolks. Stir the egg yolks with the Worcestershire. Spoon the egg yolk mixture into a pastry bag fitted with a star tip. Pipe into the egg white halves. Garnish the eggs with paprika.

Layer half the croissants with half the turkey, cream cheese, and marmalade. Top with pecans. Cover with remaining half of croissants. Cover croissants with cranberry sauce. Top with remaining turkey, cream cheese and marmalade. Top with lettuce leaf.

Sprinkle seasoning on each side of steaks. Heat oil in skillet. Brown steaks on both sides. Add onion and mushrooms. Cook until softened. Add soup and water. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat, simmer for 10 minutes. Serve on top of hot buttered noodles or rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 10 inch tart pan with pastry crust. Mix together all filling ingredients and pour into crust. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until set. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Top each tart with a dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkling of cherry pie filling and chocolate curls.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease an 8x4-inch loaf pan. In large bowl combine cornmeal, soy flour, oat flour, baking powder, and splendamix well with a fork. Stir in eggs, milk, corn oil, cream cheese, and salt until well mixed. Spoon batter into prepared pan. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Let cool completely before removing from pan.

Preheat oven to 375f degrees. Grease a 9 x 9 pan with butter or cooking spray. In a large bowl, cream together margarine, sugar until light & fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until well blended after each addition. Add vanilla & chocolate chipsmix well. Add flour mixture, alternating with buttermilk & stirring well after each addition until combined. Pour batter into pan & bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack & cut into bars to serve.

1. Bring water, ginger, sugar, lime juice to a boil. Remove from heat. 2. Remove ginger with slotted spoon. Strain mixture into a pitcher. 3. Let mixture cool. 4. Pour mixture over cucumber cubes in a bowl. Stir in basil. 5. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours. 6. Pour mixture into martini shaker. Add ice. Shake well. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a basil sprig. (1/2 cup cucumber cubes per person)

Melt 2 cups of the brown sugar in a large pot over medium heat. Add the milk and bring to a boil. Remove from the heat and stir in the butter. In a small bowl combine the pecans with the remaining 1/2 cup of brown sugar. Stir the pecans into the boiling sugar mixture. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Pour over a sheet of waxed paper. Press down to make the mixture into a flat disc. Remove the waxed paper and cut into 3/4-inch squares. Let cool. Store in an airtight container.

In a large skillet combine the dry soup mix and dill weed. Add the butter and heat until the soup mix is dry and browned, stirring constantly. In a large bowl combine the chicken with the soup mixture and mix well. Pour the mixture into a greased 9 by 13-inch baking dish and sprinkle with sour cream. Bake at 425 degrees for about 20 minutes or until chicken is tender. Serve hot.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook 3 to 4 minutes or until tender. Add zucchini and squashcook 4 to 6 minutes or until tender. Add vinegarcook 30 seconds or until liquid is almost evaporated. Stir in thyme. Serve warm.

Combine all fruit and juice in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat and stir. Add pectin and stir until dissolved. Boil gently for 1 minute. Stir in sweetener. Stir frequently until jam thickens and boils for 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat and skim off foam. Spoon into 6 half-pint jars and seal. Process in boiling water bath for 10 minutes. Let cool and store in refrigerator.

Batter: Whisk together flour and milk in a mixing bowl. Whisk in mustard, creole seasoning, and egg until batter is smooth. Marinate the fish in creole seasoning. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Dip the fish into the batter then drop into the hot oil. Fry the fish until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with pancake mix for dipping.

To make marinated artichoke hearts, place artichoke hearts in a medium bowl and cover with water. Stir in salt and let stand for 30 minutes. Drain. Place artichokes in food processor. Add egg and heavy cream. Process until artichoke mixture is smooth and creamy. With machine running, slowly add mayonnaise. Process until blended. In another medium bowl, toss asparagus and artichokes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with foil. Place franks onto the baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Remove the franks from the oven and spread apricot preserves onto the cocktail franks. Spread orange marmalade onto the franks. Place the franks into the oven and roast for an additional 20 minutes. Remove the franks from the oven and drizzle mustard onto the franks. Serve hot. These smokies will not last long!

Wash and scrub sweet potatoes with a brush under running water and pat dry with paper towel. Cut the sweet potato in half and scoop out the potato into a bowl. Add all the other ingredients and stir until all the potato is coated in the brown mixture. Place potatoes in an ovenproof pan with sides. Bake for about an hour at 350 degrees Fahrenheit or until potatoes are cooked through and lightly browned around the edges. Serve warm or cold. Store in air tight container in the fridge for up to two weeks or in the freezer for up to four months.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time and beat well. Combine flour and salt and add to creamed mixture alternating with milk. Beat well and stir in peaches and cinnamon. Fill greased and floured 12 cup muffin pan 2/3 full. Bake for 15-18 minutes. Cool in pan 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely before frosting. Frost with 1/2 cup frosting recipe and sprinkle with additional cinnamon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees and grease and flour 9-inch bundt pan. Stir together cake mix, sour cream, sugar and oil until blendedbeat in eggs one at a time until smooth. Pour into prepared pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes or until wooden pick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes before turning out onto wire rack. Let cool completely. Sprinkle with poppy seeds. Serve with glaze or ice cream.

In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender. Add the tomato puree and cook for 2 minutes more. Stir in the vodka and cook until it is absorbed by the tomato puree mixture, about 2 minutes more. Add the cream and bring to a simmer. Add the ham and cook for 2 minutes more. Add the tomato puree mixture to a large pot of salted boiling water and cook for 10 minutes more or until tender. Drain the pasta well, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid. Toss the pasta with the tomato puree mixture until well combined. Stir in the cooking liquid until the pasta is tender yet still firm to the bite, about 3 minutes more. Add the tomato puree mixture to a large pot of salted boiling water and cook for 10 minutes more or until tender. Drain the pasta well, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid. Toss the pasta with the tomato puree mixture until well combined. Stir in the

Peel zucchini and slice into thin rounds. Place in medium bowl. Sprinkle with Italian seasoning. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and toss until zucchini are coated with oil mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in a single layer in the pan. Cook over medium-low heat until zucchini are tender and start to caramelize, about 8-10 minutes. Remove from heat and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil flavored cooking spray. Add the onion and curry pastesauté 2 minutes or until onion is tender. Add chickencook 4 minutes or until done. Stir in rice and brothcover and cook 12 minutes or until rice is tender. Fluff rice with a forkset aside. In a small bowl, mix tomatoes, coriander and yogurt until blended. Stir into rice mixturesprinkle evenly with almonds. Garnish with tomatoes if desired. Serve warm or at room temperature. Serve over a bed of lettuce or vegetables for a complete meal.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a large bowl, toss the chicken wings with the soy sauce. Place the wings in a large baking pan. Roast for about 20 minutes or until the chicken wings are crispy and browned. Place the wings in a large bowl. Toss the wings with the teriyaki sauce. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Bake for another 20 minutes or until the chicken wings are cooked through.

Cook carrots in boiling water until tender. Drain and add butter and brown sugar. Stir until carrots are coated. Remove from heat and stir in pineapple. Pour cornstarch over pineapple mixture. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly until thickened. Pour into baking dish. Sprinkle with cinnamon and bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 9 x 13-inch baking pan. Line bottom of pan with graham cracker crumbs. Add coconut, chips and 3/4 cup of the milk. Mix well. Press firmly into pan using bottom of a glass or measuring cup. Bake 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Stir together condensed milk, peanut butter chips and remaining milk. Pour over cooled crustsprinkle with peanuts. Bake an additional 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat the grill or griddle to medium-high heat. In a small bowl, mix the oil with the garlic cloves. Place the mushroom caps in the bowl to coat with the oil/garlic mixture. Sprinkle with sea salt & black pepper. Place the mushroom caps on the prepared grill or griddle. Cook the mushrooms for 4 to 5 minutes, until browned. Set aside. In a small bowl, whisk together the breadcrumbs, cheese, sherry wine and herbs. Toss the mushrooms with the breadcrumb mixture. Transfer the mushroom caps to serving plates. Serve warm.
Mix all ingredients together with a fork. Shape into 3 inch balls. Put balls in refrigerator for 24 hours. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Clean potatoes well. Cut into halves or quarters and remove most of the potato flesh. Toss in oil and season with salt and pepper. Place in a baking dish and pour over half a cup or so of oil (or water). Bake in 425 degrees F oven for 45 minutes or until tender. Fill each potato half with a teaspoon or two of garlic clove finely chopped and minced to taste. Top each with a teaspoon or two of Worcestershire sauce. Bake in same oven until potatoes are cooked through. Sprinkle with chopped scallions or parsley if desired. Serve with butter if desired.

Prepare graham cracker crust according to package directions. Pour condensed milk in a bowl and stir in lemonade concentrate and food coloring. Pour into graham cracker crust. Bake in a preheated oven at 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) until set. Chill in fridge until ready to serve. Top with frozen whipped cream. Sprinkle with poppy seeds.

Saute onions in a large skillet until soft. Add flour and stir until blended well. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil stirring constantly over medium heat until thickened. Stir in cooked ham, tomatoes, sherry and seasonings. Cook 5 minutes longer. Stir in cheese until melted. Serve hot with crackers or rolls. Makes about 4 servings.

Melt butter and brown sugar together and set aside. Combine oats, self-raising flour and walnuts in a large bowl. Add the chocolate chips and stir through. Make a well in the middle and pour over the melted butter and brown sugar. Mix until combined. Pour onto a greased baking tray and press the mixture down slightly. Bake at 180 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until the mixture is lightly browned. Cut into slices to serve.

Brown bacon in a skillet until crisp, remove and drain on paper towel. Pour 1/2 cup of olive oil in skillet on medium heat. Add bacon and garlic to skillet. Cook for 2 minutes. Add crushed tomatoes to skillet. Cook for 3 minutes. Remove skillet from heat. Add bacon and garlic to skillet with 1 cup of pasta water. Cook for 3 minutes over medium heat stirring until heated through. Add 1 1/2 cups pasta to skillet with tomato mixture. Cook for 2 minutes. Add remaining pasta to skillet with tomato mixture. Cook for 2 minutes over medium heat, stirring until heated through. Drain pasta in colander. Return skillet to heat. Add pasta to skillet with tomato mixture. Cook for 1 minute over low heat stirring constantly to coat pasta. Add tomato mixture to skillet with pasta. Cook for 2 minutes over low heat stirring constantly to coat pasta. Add spinach to skillet with pasta mixture. Cook for 2 minutes stirring constantly to coat pasta. Drain past

Blend all the ingredients (except dried fruit) together in food processor or blender for 2 minutes. Add dried fruit last and pulse for another minute or two. Place the mixture in a pan and bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Allow to cool before cutting into bars and storing in an air-tight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10x15 pan. Sift together flour and saltset aside. In a medium bowl, combine brown sugar and eggsbeat until well blended. Stir in flour mixture, oatmeal, vanilla extract, and coconut. Stir in chocolate chips. Spread batter evenly into prepared pansprinkle chips over top. Bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack before cutting bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Dip chicken tenders into flour and season with salt and white pepper. Dip into melted butter and then into olive oil. Brown in oven proof skillet or dutch oven over medium heat. Sprinkle with dry marsala wine and pour over mushrooms. Cook until chicken is done and mushrooms are tender. Place chicken over mushrooms and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Blend eggs, bologna, salad dressing, sweet pickle relish. Spread on bun. Top with lettuce.

Crack eggs into a large bowlbeat lightly. Pour into a 2-cup glass measuring cup. Slowly stir in milk and beat with a fork until blended and frothy. Fill a large resealable plastic bag with a whole egg whiteseal bag tightly. Snip a tiny bit off one bottom corner of the bagcarefully squeeze white over the surface of egg mixture. Sprinkle parsley over egg mixturegently stir in parmesan cheese. Add cooked bacongently stir until blended. Spoon mixture into a 2-quart rectangular baking dish coated with cooking spraysprinkle with cheddar cheese. Cover and chill 1 hour or until set. Cut into 48 (1/2-cup) servingsgarnish each serving with a sprig of parsley. Serve with crackers or toast points.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut the chicken thighs into large pieces. Combine the olive oil and onions in a large skillet and sauté over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove the skillet and pour in the red wine. Return the skillet to medium heat and cook until the wine is mostly evaporated. Add the gingerroot and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the chicken pieces and mix to coat with the wine. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove the skillet to a baking sheet and put in the oven for 30 minutes. Remove the skillet and mix in the spices. Return the chicken to the skillet and cook for 15 minutes. Place the skillet back in the oven for 15 minutes. Remove the skillet and serve hot.

Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Add the flour and stir with a wooden spoon. Cook for 1 minute. Slowly add the mushroom liquid and the red wine. Cook for 2 minutes until the wine is reduced. Add the worcestershire sauce and cook for 1 minute. Add salt and black pepper. Stir in the filet mignon. Pour the mixture over the tomatoes and serve.
To prepare dressing: In a small bowl combine all ingredientsmix well. To make coleslaw: In a large bowl combine all ingredientstoss well. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours to blend flavors.

Pour boiling water over tea bags and steep for five minutes. Strain tea into pitcher filled with ice cubes. Fill a large pitcher halfway full with ice cubes. Stir in juice until diluted then add tea. Stir in sugar substitute until dissolved, add mango juice, mint leaves, lime juice, and stir again.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Saute the garlic and onions until tender. Add flour and stir to coat the onions and garlic in the flour. Cook for a few minutes. Add water and stir to incorporate. Add salt and cayenne pepper to taste. Add the sweet potato and stir well. Cook until the sweet potato is tender. Serve.

In a large bowl, add the beans and potatoes. Drizzle with vinegar and extra virgin olive oil. Season with mustard powder, sea salt and black pepper. Add the tomatoes and capers and olives. Gently toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Prepare yellow cake according to package directionscool completely. Spread 2/3 of pumpkin pie filling on bottom of caketop with 1/2 of cake mix mixture (or use 1/3 cake mix mixture and top with 1/3 pumpkin pie filling). Repeat layers twice moretop with remaining pumpkin pie fillingfrost top and sides of cake with remaining pumpkin pie filling mixture. Sprinkle with walnuts before serving if desired.

Cut zucchini in half lengthwise and then cut each half into thin slices. Arrange zucchini in an even layer in a shallow bowl or pan. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon black pepper and 1 tablespoon chopped mint leaves. Toss to combine. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Serve immediately. Garnish each serving with 2 sprigs of mint, if desired.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter with oil. Add chicken breastscook about 5 minutes on each side or until juices run clear. Meanwhile, combine ranch dressing mix, parmesan cheese and corn flakesspread mixture evenly on one-half of each bread slice. Place chicken breasts on breadcover with remaining bread slices. Place sandwiches on a cookie sheetbroil about 2 minutes or until cheese melts.
Melt butter and golden syrup together in a saucepan. Add porridge oats to saucepan. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve with butter.
In a large bowl beat together margarine and sugar. Add eggs and beat well. Add remaining ingredients and mix until blended. Bake 12-15 minutes or until light brown. Cool and remove from pans.
Mix the cheeses. Spread mayonnaise on top half of 8 bread slices. Spread with cheese mixture. Sprinkle with spring onion. Top with remaining bread halves. Sprinkle with salt & pepper.

Heat milk in microwave for 30 seconds. Add sugar and cocoa powder and whisk until smooth. Add peanut butter and whisk again. Add dark chocolate and mini marshmallows. Whisk again until combined. Pour into cups. Serve with marshmallows.

Bring large pot of lightly salted water to boil over high heatadd linguine and cook until tender but firm to bite, about 8 minutes. Drain and return pasta to pot. Meanwhile, melt butter over medium heat in large skilletadd green onions and saute until softened and slightly brown, about 3 minutestransfer to bowl and set aside until ready to use. In same skillet over medium-high heat, add sesame oil and soy saucecook until soy sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened, 2 minutesadd garlic powder and gingercook 2 minutes longerstir in pasta and green onions.

To prepare the caponata, stir together all the ingredients until well blended. Set aside until ready to use. To make the wraps, spread a tortillas with one tablespoon of the spreadable cheese and top with one tablespoon of the roasted pepper hummus, one tablespoon of the caponata and one tablespoon of the mushrooms. Wrap each tortilla around the filling and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Cream together sugar and oil. Add eggs, one at a time beating well after each addition. Sift dry ingredients together and add to creamed mixture alternately with applesauce. Stir well after each addition. Add walnuts and fold into batter. Pour batter into two greased and floured 9-inch round cake pans. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 35 to 40 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Allow to cool 15 to 20 minutes before removing from pans to cooling racks to cool completely.

In a large pot heat bacon over medium-low heat. Cook until bacon is crispy. Remove bacon from pan. Drain bacon on paper towels. Set aside. In the same pot add the onions to bacon drippings. Cook over medium heat until tender. Add chopped mushrooms to the pan. Cook 4-5 minutes. Add potatoes and cook 5-6 minutes. Add broth to pot. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add cream of mushroom soup. Stir to combine. Increase heat to medium-high. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to medium. Cook 10-15 minutes. Add milk. Cook 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls. Garnish with bacon bits. Serve with cornbread.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large skillet on medium heat saute onion and garlic for 4 minutes. Add ground meats and cook for 6 minutes. Add eggs and continue to saute 2 minutes. Add ketchup and cook 2 minutes. Drain well. In a large bowl combine meat mixture breadcrumbs and cheese. Place a sheet of foil on a cookie sheet. Lay the meat mixture on the foil and top with the crumb mixture. Wrap meat loaf completely. Place in the preheated oven and cook for 60 minutes. After 60 minutes check the meatloaf and if the crumbs are not cooked to your liking continue to cook for 15 to 20 minutes. If the crumbs are cooked to your liking you can now place the meat loaf into the preheated oven and cook for an additional 20 minutes. Let meatloaf rest for 15 minutes before serving.

In a small skillet over medium-high heat sauté green beans in 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil for 3 minutes or until they are tender-crisp. In a large pot over medium-high heat sauté chicken in 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil for 5 minutes or until lightly browneddrain chicken and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat sauté red bell pepper in vegetable oil for 2 minutes or until tender-crispdrain pepper and set aside. In a large bowl combine pasta, chicken, peppers and green beansstir in teriyaki sauce and low sodium chicken broth. In a small skillet over medium-high heat sauté garlic in vegetable oil for 2 minutes or until lightly brownedstir into pasta mixture.

Combine ginger and garlic with salt and sugar and cook until soft and tender in a medium saucepan. Add vinegar and oil and bring to a boil. Blend with a hand blender or in a food processor and stir until smooth and well combined. Toss with the tomatoes and onion and coriander leaves and serve on the side with grilled meat or fish.

Cut aubergines into thin slices and fry them with olive oil and a few slices of onion until golden brown. Add tahini and garlic cloves and cook for a few minutes, then add the lemon juice and seasoning. Blend and add hot vegetable stock. Pass through sieve and serve with a few drops of olive oil and freshly chopped parsley.

Preheat broiler. Place garlic cloves on a piece of aluminum foil. Drizzle with oil and broil about 10 minutes until tender. Remove from heat and allow garlic to cool for about 10 minutes before peeling and squeezing the cloves. To make sandwiches, cut the crusts off the bread and butter the inside of each slice with margarine. Layer each sandwich with spinach, brie and garlic. Toast the sandwiches in the broiler until the brie is melted and golden. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan or stockpot combine broth and noodles and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes stirring occasionally. Add carrot, corn and saffron and heat through. Add celery and onion and saute for a minute or two. Add chicken and bring back to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered for about 5 minutes or until the noodles are done. Taste and season with salt and pepper if needed. Transfer noodles and vegetables to a large serving bowl. Serve hot.

Brown bacon in a large skillet. Add onion. Cook until tender. Add pork and beans. Pour root beer over the beans. Add barbecue sauce, garlic and dry mustard. Simmer 20-30 minutes. Add tabasco sauce. Serve over cornbread.

Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, whisk together all-purpose flour, cornstarch, soy sauce, garlic powder, ginger powder, red pepper flakes, olive oil, 1/4 cup of water, 1/4 teaspoon of salt, and a few grinds of pepper. Stir until combined. Stir in brussels sprouts. Transfer to a lightly greased 11 x 14-inch baking dish. Bake until crisp and golden brown, about 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Brown pork with oil. Add curry paste and coconut milk. Bring to a boil. Add corn kernels. Simmer 15 minutes. Add fresh peas. Simmer 5 minutes. Add lime rind and basil. Cook another 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Adjust seasonings with fish sauce and brown sugar. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray pie shell with nonstick cooking spray. Bake pie shell for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Combine cheese, 1 egg, cream and dressing mix. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 25 minutes or until set. Remove from oven. Top with remaining cheese. Cut into wedges. Serve.

Combine beef and black pepper in a large bowlset aside. Stir together water and mustard seedsadd to beef mixture. Add salt and cayenne pepperstir until well blended. Divide meat mixture into two equal portions. Shape into 12-inch-long loaves. Place on a rack in a large shallow pan. Bake at 350 for 35-45 minutes or until a meat thermometer reads 160. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 2 loaves.

Melt butter in small saucepan. In large bowl with mixer at medium speed beat butter with sugar until creamy. Add eggs one at a time until light in color. Add dry mixture, melted butter, milk, buttermilk. Mix until smooth. Let batter rest 10 minutes. Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto heated waffle iron. Cook until golden brown. Serve with butter. Makes 3-4 waffles.
Sprinkle steak with chili powder and brown sugar. Heat pan with a little olive oil over medium heat. Cook steak 5-7 minutes each side. Combine remaining ingredients. Pour over steak before serving.
