Cut chicken breasts in half horizontally and place in 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Combine remaining ingredients in small bowl and pour over chicken. Bake at 375 for 30 to 40 minutes or until done. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serves 6.
Make the deviled egg filling by combining all the ingredients in a bowl until well combined. Spoon the filling into the hollowed out eggs. Garnish with the fresh dill, if desired. Enjoy!

Combine italian seasoning, sugar, garlic powder and onion powder. Stir into warm milk. Stir together eggs, canola oil and margarine. Add to the milk mixture and stir. Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Add this to the milk mixture. Add cheese and stir. Spread mixture over the bottom of a greased 15x10x1 pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Let set 5 minutes and cut into squares.

Beat eggs until thick. Add sugar and orange extract. Add flour and beat until incorporated. Fold in butter until mixed thoroughly. Drop batter by teaspoonfuls onto parchment paper that has been sprinkled with powdered sugar. Bake at 425 degrees F for 7 minutes or until lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Roll out dough to fit two 9-inch pie shells. Prick dough bottoms with fork and line the bottoms with foil. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and discard foil. Place 1/2 cup granulated sugar on bottom of each pie shell. Arrange apricots on top of sugar. In a small saucepan combine almonds, breadcrumbs and walnutsheat over medium heat just to toast lightly. Remove from heatcool. Beat together egg yolk, butter, remaining granulated sugar and 1/2 cup flourstir in almond mixture, cooled apricots and 3/4 cup fresh bread crumbs. Spoon into pie shells. Bake for 30 minutes or until set. Remove from ovencool on wire racks.

Wash the spinach leaves well. Squeeze out excess water with your hands. Heat a little olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant - about 30 seconds. Add spinach to the pan and sauté for about 2 minutes, until the spinach wilts and releases some of its liquid. Add salt and pepper to taste. Increase heat to high and cook for 1 or 2 more minutes to reduce the spinach liquid. Add tomatoes, toss and cook for about 5 more minutes until the spinach is cooked down to the consistency you prefer. At the end add the parmesan cheese. Mix well until melted. Serve hot or cold.

Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Place the biscuits on a flat surface and spread half of the garlic mixture over the top of each biscuit. Sprinkle with 1/2 cup of the parmesan. Roll up the biscuits and place seam side down on the baking sheet. Bake at 425 degrees for 10 minutes. Spread the remaining garlic mixture over the biscuits. Sprinkle with the remaining parmesan. Roll up the biscuits again and place seam side down on the baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutes longer. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the fresh parsley. Serve warm.

Rinse wild rice under cold running water until the water runs clear. Place the wild rice, onion, salt, pepper and 1 cup of the broth in the bottom of the crock pot. Stir to coat all the rice with broth and cover the crock pot with the lid. Cook on low for 6 hours, stirring every 2 hours. If there is still too much liquid after 6 hours, remove the lid for 15 minutes and stir again. Add the remaining broth (1 cup), dried thyme leaves and the mushrooms and cook for another 15 minutes on low. Serve with your favorite chicken dish or vegetables.

In saucepan melt 6 ounces butter over medium heat. Stir in the ale and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until ale is reduced by one third, 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in the dry mustard and cayenne pepper. Stir in the cheeses until cheeses are melted and spread is smooth. Stir in pecans and parsley. Transfer to serving dish. Let cool to room temperature. Serve with crackers or fresh vegetable sticks.

In a medium bowl toss all ingredients. Marinate for 30 minutes at room temperature or in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Drain and toss with the honey. Grill over medium heat or broil for about 10 minutes. Serve warm with dipping sauces.

In a large bowl combine sour cream and hot sauce and whisk until combined. In another large bowl whisk together the eggs, green chilies, cheese and bacon bits until well combined. Pour the sour cream mixture over the egg mixture and mix well with a large spoon. Pour mixture into an ungreased 9x13-inch glass baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Cover with foil and bake for about 45 minutes or until egg mixture is set and no longer jiggly. Serve with tortillas and tomato salsa on the side if desired.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees f. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper or wax paper. Arrange apples on cookie sheet and bake until soft and slightly browned on edges. Set aside to cool. In a large bowl combine grapes, marshmallows and yogurt. Add apples and toss to combine. Sprinkle nuts and orange segments on top and top with lime juice and zest of 2 limes. Refrigerate until serving time.

Wash and dry green beans. Cut ends off and discard. Cut into bite-sized pieces. Place in a large bowl with tomatoes and onions. Season with salt and black pepper. Mix with a fork to combine. Add vinegar and olive oil and toss until coated. Add fresh basil and feta cheese and toss to combine. Taste and adjust seasonings if needed. Refrigerate salad for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld. Makes 8 servings.

Prepare a large pot of water for boiling. Peel the kale off the stems and chop. Peel the potatoes and cut them into chunks. Place the kale into the boiling water. Cook until the kale is tender but still has a bite to it. Drain the kale in a colander. When the potatoes are done boiling, drain the potatoes and place them into a bowl. Mash the potatoes until they are smooth. Drain the kale. Finely chop the kale. Add the chopped kale to the smoothed potatoes. Add the butter into the kale-and-potato mix. Mix the sour cream into the mix. Add the milk to the mix. Add the salt to the mix. Mix the colcannon until all of the ingredients are well-mixed. Serve the colcannon immediately.
In a small bowl mix mirin and miso. Place fillets on a greased broiler pan. Drizzle with glaze. Broil 4 to 6 minutes. Turn and broil until glaze is golden. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 375f. Melt butter in a large skillet. Add chocolate chips and stir until melted. Remove from heat. Add sugar to skillet. Stir until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat. Add eggs one at a time, beating after each egg is added. Stir in vanilla. Sift together flour and baking powder. Add flour mixture to chocolate mixture. Pour into a greased 13-in. x 9-in. baking pan. Bake at 375f. for 22 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack 5 minutes. Remove from pan to wire rack. Cool completely. Meanwhile, heat marshmallows in a microwave-safe bowl in microwave for 30 seconds. Stir. Heat again for 30 seconds. Stir. Continue microwaving at 10 second increments until melted. Drizzle marshmallow mixture over cooled cake. Sprinkle

Preheat oven to 220C/425F/Gas 7. Grease a 20x30cm/8x12in rectangular casserole dish with oil. Put the flour in a bowl. Add the baking powder and mix in the polyunsaturated oil. Make a well in the middle. Pour in the milk. Whisk to a smooth batter. Spoon into the casserole dish. Place the sausages in the dish in a single layer. Spoon over the tomato sauce. Cover with foil. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove foil for last 10 minutes. Serve.

Cook macaroni according to package directionsdrain well. Add vegetables and bacon pieces. Stir together and mix well. In separate bowl whisk together eggs, milk and seasonings. Add mixture from the bowl to the macaroni mixture. Stir well. Pour into a 1 1/2 quart casserole dish or other greased baking dish. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown on top. Serve warm!

Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over low heat. Stir in the sugar and bring to a boilboil for 1 minute. Add the chocolate and milk, whisking constantly until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and salt. Serve hot over ice cream or fresh fruit. Store in the refrigerator and reheat before serving.

In a large stockpot over medium heat, combine the stock and ginger. Add the salmon and bring to a simmer. Add the baby bok choy and cook just until tender, about 2 minutes. Add the red pepper flakes. Transfer the salmon and stock to a blender. Puree until smooth. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Divide the soup among bowls. Sprinkle the lime juice over each serving and garnish with the coriander leaves. Serve immediately.

Melt butter and sauté scallions and ginger for about 2 minutes. Add onion and sauté until soft. Add rice and sauté for a couple of minutes. Pour in broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until liquid is absorbed. Add snow peas and sesame seeds and sauté for a couple of minutes. Add salt if needed. Serve over rice.

Preheat broiler. Steam broccoli until tender-crisp. In a large bowl combine broccoli, soup, mayonnaise, eggs, Tabasco, onion, cheddar cheese, butter, herbed bread crumbs until well blended and mixed thoroughly. Pour into an ungreased 2 quart baking dish or individual baking dishes. Sprinkle top with additional herbed bread crumbs if desired and place under broiler for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Brush mushrooms with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic powderbroil until browned on all sides. Stuff mushrooms with cream cheese mixture, pressing mixture down with a spoon. Top each mushroom with a slice of Swiss cheeseplace under broiler until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Cut each chicken breast into four pieces. Mix breadcrumbs with cheese, garlic, paprika, pepper, salt, parsley and parmesan cheese. Dip chicken pieces into melted butter. Coat chicken pieces with breadcrumb mixture. Place chicken in a large baking dish and bake in preheated oven until chicken is tender, about 40 to 45 minutes.

Preheat BBQ to medium. Thread the prawns on the skewers. Mix the lime juice, honey, soy sauce, vegetable oil, jerk spice, hot pepper sauce and salt and pepper. Dip the prawns in the marinade. Grill for about 3 minutes on each side or until cooked. Serve immediately.

Bread the flounder fillets with the breadcrumbs, cheese and parsley. Spread them out in a 9x13 inch baking dish. In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon zest with the lemon juice. Pour the mixture over the fillets. Drizzle the oil over the dish. Season with the salt and pepper. Bake at 400 for 15 minutes. Serves 4. 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243444546474849505152535455565758596061626364656667686970717273747576777879

Bring water to boil in a large saucepan. Add lemongrass, lime leaves and shrimp. Bring back to boil then simmer for 3 minutes. Strain broth, discarding lemongrass and lime leaves. Return broth to saucepan along with tomatoes, mushrooms, chili peppers, fish sauce, lime juice and chili paste. Cook 2 minutes then add shrimp back to pot along with coconut milk. Cook for 5 minutes then serve hot.

Form beef mixture into eight 3-inch hamburger patties. Brush each patty with egg and press into breadcrumbs on a lightly floured surface. Brush patties with oil and season with seasoning salt and pepper on both sides. Grill or broil hamburgers 8-10 minutes on each side or until well-browned and cooked through.

Boil broccoli florets in salted water for about 5 minutes until crisp tender. Drain well. Heat butter over medium heat until melted. Add broccoli to pan and toss gently for about 3 minutes until heated through and coated in butter. Set aside in a warm place to cool slightly. In a small bowl mix vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper. Slowly add oil to vinegar mixture while whisking. Pour over broccoli and toss gently until well coated. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 5 quart (4 liter) slow cooker with cooking spray or rub with butter or margarine. Cut the pork roast into 1 1/2-inch cubes. Place the pork roast in the slow cooker. Mix the gravy, sweet potatoes, diced tomatoes, bell pepper, onion, frozen peas, bay leaf, thyme, hot sauce and water together in a bowlpour over the pork roast. Cover the slow cooker with the lid or put the slow cooker lid into the slow cooker. Cook the pork roast in the slow cooker for 4 to 5 hours or until the pork roast is tender enough to shred with two forks. Shred the pork roast with two forks or use a fork or potato masher to break up the meat into small chunks. Stir the pork roast into the slow cooker gravyserve the pork roast with the gravy over rice or noodles if desired.

Preheat oven to 350. Lightly grease an 8 x 8-inch pan. In a large bowl, combine all of the dry ingredients. In a separate large bowl, beat eggs, brown sugar, corn syrup, cooking oil and dark brown sugar. Stir in the dry ingredients until just mixed. Fold in chocolate chips. Spread in the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Let cool in the pan before slicing.

Wash and core peaches. Place in a large saucepan with lemon juice and cook for about 10 minutes or until the peaches are soft and juices are running. Remove from the heat and purée peaches in a blender or food processor (this makes about 2 cups of peach purée). Stir in the sugar and nutmeg and bring to a boil on the stove top for about 10 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly. Pour into sterilized jars and seal tightly.

Peel pears and cut into quarters. Cut out core with a melon baller. Cut quarters into half-moons. Cut away peels of pineapple. Cut pineapple into quarters. Lay pineapple slices on the bottom of a medium-sized baking dish (8x8). Sprinkle with salt. Arrange pear slices on top of pineapple. Layer with crushed pineapple. Sprinkle with salt again. Drizzle with honey. Sprinkle with additional salt, if desired. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine rice and water chestnuts in a large bowl. Stir in mushrooms and buttermix well. Spread in a greased 11x7x2-in. baking dish. Bake at 375 for 30-35 minutes or until tender and heated through. Dot with slices of french onion soup and serve warm.

Cream butter with brown sugaradd eggs one at a time. Add vanilla and self rising flour until combined into a batter. Grease cookie sheet with cooking spraydrop by teaspoonfuls on cookie sheetbake at 350 for 12 minutes.

Combine soup, chicken and vegetables in a slow cooker. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook, covered, on low heat for 6 to 7 hours or until vegetables are tender. Stir in noodles. Cook uncovered for 20 to 30 minutes or until noodles are tender. Serve hot.

Heat 1 tbsp of butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. When melted add 1 tbsp of sugar and 1 tbsp of salt. Cook for 1 min. Then add 1 tbsp of water and 1 cup of frozen peas. Cook for 2 minutes until slightly softened. Add 1 tbsp of butter, 1 tbsp of sugar, 1 tbsp of salt, 1 tbsp of water, 1 cup of fresh mushrooms. Cook for 4 minutes or until softened. Transfer to bowl and serve warm or cold.

Season trout with salt and pepper. Place fillets in baking pan. In small bowl, combine apple juice concentrate and dijon mustard. Pour mixture over fish. Stir in vinegar and paprika. Cover pan tightly with foil and place in preheated 400 degree oven for 20 minutes. Uncover and cook for an additional 10 minutes until fish flakes easily with fork. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2 quart casserole dishset aside. In a bowl, whisk the egg yolkset aside. In another bowl, beat the egg white until frothyset aside. In a medium saucepan, heat the sugar substitute in 3/4 inch of water over medium-high heat until dissolvedadd the egg yolk and pumpkin pureecook for 2 minutesremove from the heat. Stir in the evaporated milkmix well. Pour the mixture into the prepared casserole dishset aside. In a medium bowl, whisk the egg white until thick but not stifffold the egg white into the pumpkin mixture. Transfer the pumpkin mixture to a 1 1/2 quart baking dishplace in the preheated ovenbake for 50 minutes or until the custard is set and firm throughoutlet cool for 15 minutesrefrigerate for 4 hours or overnight. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Combine egg, salsa, seasonings. Mix well. Form into patties. Preheat skillet on medium high heat. Brush skillet with oil. Cook patties for about 10 minutes turning frequently. Combine cheese and breadcrumbs. Spread about 1 tablespoon of cheese mixture on each patty. Cook 2 minutes more or until cheese is melted. Serve on buns.

In a saucepan over medium heat bring water to boiling point with the milk. Remove from heat and add the sugar-free french vanilla cafe instant coffee, stirring until dissolved. In a large bowl beat the egg yolks until foamy and blended together. Slowly add the coffee mixture to the eggs, stirring constantly until thickened. Pour into individual glasses. Top with whipped cream and add a few berries.

Saute the onion in the olive oil. Add the ground sirloin and stir until all the meat is browned. Add the tomato sauce, diced tomatoes and the beans. Stir until all the meat is completely covered. Season to taste with the salt and pepper and the chili powder. Cook over a low heat until the meat is tender and the juices have evaporated. Place a layer of cooked spaghetti over the top of the meat. Top the spaghetti with the cheese and allow the cheese to melt. Top the cheese with a layer of sour cream and serve. Serve as a meal or as a topping for hot dogs and hamburgers.

Preheat oven broiler. Season both sides of steaks with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil and garlic in a small skillet over medium heat. Add steaks and cook 2 minutes per side for medium-rare. Transfer steaks to a plate. Add oregano, thyme and red pepper flakes to the skillet and cook 1 minute, stirring. Add tomato paste and cook 1 minute. Add 1 cup of the tomatoes and cook 2 minutes. Pour sauce over steaks. Broil 4 minutes. Transfer steaks and sauce to a serving platter. Top with remaining tomatoes.

Cover a 10x13 inch baking dish with plastic wrap. Press 1/2 cup of the low-fat vanilla ice cream into the bottom of the baking dish. Arrange the pine nuts on top of the ice cream. Top with one of the low-fat chocolate ice creams and alternate layers of low-fat vanilla ice cream and the chopped dried fruit and glace cherries. Cover with plastic wrap and freeze for at least 8 hours. When the ice cream is ready to serve, remove the plastic wrap and let stand at room temperature for about 15 minutes. Slice the ice cream cassata into 1 inch slices and serve.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Add the ham hocks, onion, carrot, celery, bay leaf, thyme, parsley, pepper and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Cook for 30 minutes. Add the beans (drained) and 8 cups of the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer for 30 minutes. Add kale. Simmer for 10 minutes. Remove ham hocks from the broth. Shred ham hocks. Place ham in a bowl with the remaining 3/4 cup of broth. Strain bean/broth mixture. Add ham to the bean mixture. Stir in the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Season with black pepper. Serve with parmesan sprinkled on top.

Cut steaks into 1-inch cubes. Season with salt and pepper. Brown meat cubes in a hot pan with olive oil. Remove from heat add brandy to deglaze pan. Stir cream into sauce and pour over steaks. Sprinkle with Roquefort cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or till cheese is melting.

Rinse and trim asparagus spears and place on a foil-lined cookie sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Roast for 10 minutes at 350 degrees. While asparagus is roasting, mix together 1/4 cup of parmesan and 1 tbsp of butter in small bowl. When asparagus is done, drizzle with lemon juice and toss with parmesan mixture. Sprinkle with fresh chives and serve warm. Serves 2-3.

Beat egg and milk until well blended in a medium bowl. Add flour, baking powder, and salt and stir well with a fork. Stir in the melted butter and the sugar until well mixed. Fold in the blueberries and cranberries until they are coated in batter. Spoon batter into a greased 9 x 13 glass baking dish or cast-iron skillet and bake at 350F for 40 minutes or until a cake tester comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes then remove from pan and cool completely on a wire rack.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Brush the spaghetti squash with the extra virgin olive oil and place the squash halves face down into a roasting pan with about 1/2-inch of water. Roast for 40 minutes. While the squash is roasting, cook the yellow sweet onion and garlic clove for about 10 minutes until soft and translucent. Squeeze the garlic clove out of its skin and discard. Dice the yellow sweet onion and set aside. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook for about 20 minutes stirring occasionally until the tomatoes have broken down and the sauce has thickened slightly. Remove the squash from the oven and allow the squash to cool enough to handle and then scoop out the flesh from the skin. Set aside and discard the squash skin. In a large bowl combine the cooked squash with the yellow sweet onion and tomatoes and the feta cheese, black olives and basil leaves and toss to combine. Transfer to a serving platter and top with the crumbled feta

Drain meat from can. In a skillet cook meat until browned. Add onion and taco seasoning. Drain. Pour meat mixture into a 9-in. x 13-in. baking dish. Layer with tomato sauce, whole kernel corn. Spread with baking mix. Mix milk and eggs together. Pour over corn mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake, uncovered at 350° for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve with hot sauce if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease cookie sheet. In a large bowl beat butter until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla. Mix well. Beat in egg. Stir in flour, baking powder and soda. Mix until a soft dough forms. Divide dough into two portions. Roll each portion into a ball. Roll out each ball to a thickness of 1/4 inch. Cut cookies with cookie cutters. Place on a cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.
Blend all ingredients except flax seed until smooth. Add flax seed. Pour into glasses.

Stir together all of the above and bake at 375 for an hour. This recipe is very flexible. Add your favorite veggies and meat if you like. I add green and red peppers and pork sausage to make a dynamite.

In a small sauce pan over medium heat heat canola oil to 365 degrees F (180 degrees C). In another bowl whisk together lime zest, lime juice, salt, and pepperpour into pan with hot oil. Stir frequently until mixture is thickened and coats back of spoonremove from heat.

In large bowl, combine flour, cornstarch, baking soda and salt. Add water and stir until a smooth batter forms. Place fish fillets in batter and coat both sides evenly. In nonstick skillet or large frying pan over medium heat, heat oil and butter until hot and bubbly but not smoking. Place battered fish fillets into skillet or pan and cook about 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown and cooked through.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 glass pan with butter or non-stick cooking spray. In a large bowl, mix together butter & brown sugar until smooth. Add eggnog & vanilla. Whisk together flour & baking powder then add to butter mixture along with pecans & cinnamon. Stir to combine then pour batter into prepared pan & bake for 35-40 minutes or until cake tests clean with a toothpick inserted into it. Allow cake to cool for 5 minutes before removing it from pan & serving it warm or at room temperature.

In a saucepan over low heat, melt chocolate chips with whipping cream for about two minutes. Stir constantly until chocolate is completely melted. Pour into a shallow serving dish or individual serving cups (I used silicone baking cups). Garnish with whipping cream or chocolate shavings if desired.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Cook pasta according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, melt 2 Tablespoons of the butter in a large skillet. Add the broccolini and cook until bright green and tender, about 3 minutes. Add the remaining 2 Tablespoons of butter and the ricotta cheese to the pan. Cook over low heat until the butter melts and the cheese is melted and smooth. Stir in the cooked pasta and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with the zest and thyme and serve.

Melt butter in a sauce pan with a lid. Add lemon juice and let it come to a boil. Add garlic and herbs to boiling butter/lemon juice mixture. Add the shrimp and bring to a boil. Cover with lid and cook for 3-4 minutes. Check for doneness by testing a shrimp with a fork. If it is tender it is done, if not cook for an additional 2 minutes and check again. Drain the shrimp and remove from the shell. Serve with boiled potatoes and a salad for a complete meal.
Finely chop gingerroot and garlic. Mince wasabi. Mix oil, wine and sugar in blender. Add ginger and garlic and blend. Add wasabi and blend again. Dressing may be refrigerated for 1 to 2 days.

In a large pot over medium heat, combine rhubarb and 1 cup granulated sugar. Cook until rhubarb is soft and mixture is thick enough to stand in a spoon. Stir in the crushed pineapple and maraschino cherries. Cook over low heat for 15 minutes. Pour mixture into 8x8 inch square pan. In a small bowl combine 2 cups of hot rhubarb mixture with the strawberry gelatin. Stir until the gelatin dissolves. Pour over rhubarb mixture. Refrigerate until firm. Store in the refrigerator or freeze.
Toss cabbage and carrots with skim milk and mayonnaise. Stir well and refrigerate 1 hour. Add salt and pepper to taste. Just before serving stir in buttermilk and vinegar and lemon juice.

Cut cheese into cubes. Add to dry ingredients. Add enough milk to make a stiff dough. Form into rounds. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 425f oven for about 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with jam.

Place berries in a colander and rinse with cold water. Drain well. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine boiling water and gelatin. Stir until dissolved. Remove from heat. Add fruit to the gelatin mixture. Mix well. Pour into 6 (1/2-cup) molds or a 1-quart casserole dish. Refrigerate until firm, about 4 hours. Cut into bars.
Mix goat cheese, eggs and thyme together. Add ground turkey to mixture. Mix well. Form mixture into patties. Cook burgers until no longer pink. Serve on buns.

In a large bowl, combine 1 cup flour with 1 cup water. Stir in seasonings. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight. In a slow cooker, combine 1/2 cup oil with chicken. Add seasoned flour mixture. Cover. Cook on low for 4 hours or on high for 2 hours. Add green and red peppers, onions, corn, salsa and cover. Cook on low for 2 hours or on high for 1 hour. Serve with warmed tortillas. Serve with sour cream on the side.

Melt butter in a large skillet. Add chopped parmesan cheese and cook until melted. Add whipping cream and simmer. Add mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes. Add green onions. Cook for 1 minute. Add salt and pepper and frozen peas. Cook for 5 minutes. Drain pasta and place in skillet. Add ham and toss together. Serve with additional peas.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Peel and slice sweet potatoes and place in a large pot filled with water and one tbsp of butter and cover with a lid and bring to a boil. Boil for 10 minutes then drain and set aside. In another pot, add one tbsp of butter and melt over medium heat, add sugar and stir until dissolved, then add sweet potato slices and stir until well coated with the butter and sugar mixture. Stir in eggs and beat until well blended and pour into a greased 9 x 12 inch pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the top is golden and set. Allow to cool for 15 minutes before cutting into squares. Pour the remaining butter over the top and sprinkle with pecans and drizzle with the glaze (see recipe).

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare dinner rolls according to package directions. Meanwhile, mix pudding mix with 1 1/2 cups cold milkset aside. Drizzle margarine over bottom of 13x9-inch baking dish. Arrange rolls on top of margarinedrizzle with remaining 1/2 cup milk. Sprinkle with nuts and cinnamon. Pour pudding mixture over rolls. Drizzle with remaining margarine. Bake 40 to 45 minutes or until golden brown. Top with more nuts if desired. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Cook shrimp until pink. Peel. Cut potatoes into large pieces. Drain. Place potatoes in large bowl. Add celery, pickle relish, shrimp. Add dressing mix. Stir. Add eggs. Fold in potatoes. Combine sour cream, mayonnaise. Add to shrimp mixture. Stir to coat. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate 1 hour. Serve cold.

Combine tomato and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for about 2 hours. Combine milk and tomato liquid in bread machine pan and add remaining ingredients. Set bread machine on dough setting and press start. After dough is done rise and place in greased loaf pan. Let rise in a warm place for about 45 minutes or until doubled in bulk. Bake at 375 for 40 minutes or until loaf tests done.

Combine buttermilk and garlic into a mixing bowl. Add chicken breasts. Allow to marinate for at least an hour. Drain the marinade out of the bowl. Pat the chicken dry with paper towels. Dip the chicken breasts into the flour mixture. Then dip the floured breasts into the cornmeal mixture. Roll the breasts to coat with the cornmeal mixture. Put a nonstick skillet on the stove with about an inch of vegetable oil in it. Fry the chicken breasts over medium heat. Cook for about 4 minutes on each side. Flip the chicken breasts over when it gets cooked on one side. Cook for another couple of minutes. Keep the heat at a medium to medium high temperature.

Melt butter in a 9 x 9 inch square pan over medium heat. Add chopped brownies. Pour caramel on top of brownie mixture. Melt hot fudge on top of caramel. Pour over caramel and fudge mixture. Add ice cream to top of fudge mixture. Top with whipped cream and drizzle caramel and hot fudge over top. Place pan in freezer for one hour. Serve with a long spoon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix butter, creamy peanut butter and brown sugar in a large mixing bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Add granulated sugar and egg and mix until smooth. Combine half of the baking mix and toffee pieces in a large mixing bowl. Mix until well combined. Add to creamy peanut mixture and stir until combined. Place cookie dough on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Press dough into an 8 inch circle. Use a knife to cut circle into 12 wedges. Place dough on a cookie sheet and press into an 8 inch circle. Use a knife to cut circle into 12 wedges. Press one toffee piece into the center of each wedge. Brush with milk. Sprinkle with cocoa and roll in powdered sugar. Bake for 12 minutes. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before removing from cookie sheet. Dip one side of a toffee piece into the Nutella and place on a wedge. Dip the other side of the toffee piece into the Nutella and place on top of the

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt 8 ounces of the butter in the microwave. Beat together 1 cup of the sugar and the melted butter. Add the eggs and beat again. Sift the dry ingredients together and add them to the batter along with the semi-sweet chocolate and the nuts. Spread the batter into a 9×13-inch pan and bake 20-25 minutes. Cool completely before cutting.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Slice banana and nectarines. Place on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Sprinkle with honey. Bake for 10 minutes or until the fruit begins to soften. Allow fruit to cool. Lay a tortilla flat. Sprinkle with some cheese. Place a scoop of fruit down the center of the tortilla. Add another tortilla top. Roll tortilla up. Place the wrapped tortilla on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Cut apple into thin slices. Layer apple on bottom half of bread. Spread half of creamy peanut butter on bread. Place apple slices on top of creamy peanut butter. Sprinkle preserves over apple. Place bacon on apple. Place butter on top of apple. Place top slice of bread on. Cover loosely. Microwave on high for 30 seconds. Repeat for 2 more seconds if needed.

Season both sides of each fillet with salt and pepper. In a shallow bowl, mix together flour, cornmeal, parmesan cheese and parsley. In another shallow bowl, beat egg and lemon juice together. Dip each fillet in egg mixture and then roll in cornmeal mixture. Place fillets in a single layer in a lightly greased 13-by-9-inch baking pan. Sprinkle with almonds. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until flaky and golden brown. Serve immediately.

Rinse rice under cold water. In medium saucepan cook rice until almost tender. Drain. Meanwhile in food processor or blender, puree mangoes. Add juice, onion and sea salt. Blend until smooth. Cook chicken in skillet with ginger and garlic. Add puree. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add lime juice. Cook until heated through. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 400f. Butter the inside of a small baking dish and place a layer of feta in it. Next layer the ricotta. Follow with the garlic clove and dill. Finish with a layer of feta and a layer of parsley and scallion. Pour lemon juice over top. Bake until bubbly and browned on top. Let cool. Serve with crackers and fresh vegetables.

In a large saucepan over medium heat bring the orange juice and vinegar to a boil. Add raisins and stir to coat. Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes. Stir in cranberries and orange zest. Cook until raisins are soft and sauce is thick. Stir in the ginger and walnuts. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and cool. Refrigerate until needed.

In a chilled glass, pour coffee liqueur over ice. Add chocolate liqueur and swirl. Fill the rest of the glass with coffee. Add more liqueur if you wish. Drizzle with white sugar. Add whipped cream. Sprinkle chopped almonds and chocolate shavings over top. Serve immediately.

In a bowl, dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Let cool for 5 minutes. Add water to ice cubes to make 1 cup. Add gelatin mixture to coffee. Stir well. In a separate bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Add sugar and beat until fluffy. Stir in the whipping cream and eggs. Fold the coffee mixture into the cream cheese mixture. Spoon into 8 dessert cups or small bowls. Refrigerate for 30 minutes or until set. To garnish, add a coffee bean.

Preheat the oven to 350f. In the bowl of an electric mixer beat the egg whites with the vanilla until stiff. In another bowl beat the sour cream with the sugar substitute until thick and light and foamy, about 5 minutes. In a third bowl mix the flour with the baking powder and soda and fold into the sour cream mixture. Pour into a greased and floured loaf pan and bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes to 1 hour and 20 minutes. Let cool on rack for 15 minutes before removing the cake from the pan. Serves 12.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease 8 x 8 x 2 inch baking dish with margarine and set aside. Combine flour and margarine in large bowl and blend with electric mixer until well mixed. Add evaporated milk, milk, sugar and eggs and beat until well blended. Stir in vanilla. Pour half mixture into prepared baking dish and top with vanilla wafers. Spoon in bananas and top with remaining batter. Bake 40 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with whipped cream if desired.

Preheat the oven to 450f. Boil the potatoes in salted water for 10 minutes until tender. Drain well and allow to cool slightly. Whisk together the flour and 2 tbsp of oil in a large shallow bowl. Add the potatoes and toss. Add the garlic and sage and toss again. Lay the potatoes out on the prepared baking sheet in a single layer and drizzle over the remaining oil. Sprinkle with salt and freshly ground black pepper and toss again. Bake for 25 minutes until the potatoes are golden and crispy. Sprinkle over the remaining sage and serve.
In a small bowl mix together flour and seasonings. Dip chicken in seasonings and brown in oil. Remove chicken to a baking dish. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 20 minutes or until tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a small bowl, mix breadcrumbs with seasoning. In another bowl mix tomatoes and oregano. Dip chicken in oil. Dip chicken in egg mixture. Dip chicken in breadcrumb mixture. Place chicken on rack in ungreased baking dish. Spread breadcrumb mixture on top of chicken. Top with ham slices. Bake for 15 minutes or until chicken is done. If desired, add cheese slices on top of ham. Return chicken to oven for an additional two minutes or until cheese melts.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook and stir garlic in hot oil until tender. Add beans and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes or until crisp-tender. Remove from heat. In a small bowl, combine seasoned with ground beef. Form into 1-inch meatballs. Add 1/2 cup water to skilletstir. Cook meatballs over medium heat for 6-8 minutes or until browned. Drain meatballs on paper towels. Stir cooked meatballs into bean mixture. Add walnut pieces. Cook and stir over medium heat for 3-5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in egg noodles. Covercook for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Wash rice in cold water. Rinse well. Place in 2 quart saucepan with 2 cups of water and 1 teaspoon of salt. Bring to a rapid boil over high heat. Cover pan. Reduce heat to low. Cook 15 minutes or until rice is tender. Drain rice. Place in large serving platter or individual serving dishes. Heat olive oil in small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in green onions. Cook until tender. Stir in pepper and lime juice. Stir in rice. Stir in chili powder, oregano and salt to taste.

Cut asparagus into 2 inch pieces. In a small bowl mix together vinegar, sugar, soy sauce and water. Set aside. In another small bowl mix together vegetable oil, sesame seeds, ginger and cumin. Dip asparagus in oil mixture, then coat with vinegar mixture. Serve immediately.

Bring 3 cups water to a boil in large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in wheat berriesreturn to boil, then reduce heat to lowcover saucepan. Simmer 1 hour or until wheat berries are tender, stirring occasionally. Drain well in colanderreturn to saucepanadd hot water to wheat berries. Bring to boilreduce heat to lowcook 10 minutesdrain. To the wheat berries add the poppy seed, honey, sugar, water, walnutsstir well to combine. Coversimmer 30 minutesstirring occasionally. Remove from heatlet stand 1 hour or until slightly thickenedstir well. Serve warm.

Spread a thin layer of cream cheese spread on each slice of whole wheat bread. Top each slice with turkey. Top each with a slice of white bread. Cut each sandwich in half diagonally. Cut each half in half again to make four triangles.

Cook the brussels sprouts according to package instructions. In the meantime heat the oil in a sauce pan and saut the onions until they are translucent. Add the flour and whisk until blended. Add the mustard and continue whisking until smooth. Stir in the vinegar, sugar and worcestershire sauce and heat until slightly thickened. Pour the sauce over the brussels sprouts and serve immediately.

Melt semisweet chocolate in a double boiler over a simmering pot of water. In a large bowl, beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add flour and beat until combined. Fold in chocolate. Pour batter into a lightly-greased 9x13-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack.
Cut ham into 1-inch slices. Place ham into a shallow baking pan. Top with preserves and nectar. Sprinkle with mustard and cloves. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour and 10 minutes. Serve.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Brown ground chuck. Add chopped onions and cook for a few minutes. Add tomato sauce, water, seasonings, and bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and cook for another 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, oil, and seasonings. Stir eggs into chili mixture and continue to stir. Drop mixture by spoonfuls into a greased 9 x 13 baking dish. Cover dish with foil and refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Bake in a preheated oven for about one hour or until a fork inserted in one of the tamales comes out clean.

Brown pork chops in a large skillet in olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. In a saucepan combine the broth with the pineapple preserves. Bring to a boil and reduce the heat to low. Stir in the creole mustard, vinegar and brown sugar until well blended. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve with the pork chops.

Place arugula in a large mixing bowl and toss with lemon juice, mustard, salt & pepper until leaves are coated. Gradually add oil while tossing until leaves are moistened. Arrange arugula on four plates. Top each plate with a slice of goat cheese, a small handful of grapes, capers and a sprinkle of salt & pepper.
Clean and slice your mushrooms. Sautee mushrooms and onion together. Remove from heat and blend flour and milk together and add to pan with mushrooms and onions. Stir and serve.

Combine the coconut and cereal in a large bowl. Melt the butterscotch chips and nuts together. Pour over the cereal and coconut mixture and mix thoroughly with a wooden spoon or spatula until all the chocolate chips and butterscotch chips are melted and evenly distributed throughout the mixture. In a small bowl combine the cocoa and the sweetened condensed milk. Whisk until smooth and blended. Pour the cocoa mixture over the coconut mixture and mix until the coconut is evenly coated. Place the mixture into a 9 x 13 greased pan and press evenly into the pan with the back of a spoon. Refrigerate until firm or freeze for 1-2 hours. Remove from refrigerator or freezer and cut into 36 bars.

Spread olive oil on one side of each bagel and place bagel on grill pan or cast iron skillet. Grill for about one minute or until lightly golden. Turn bagels over to grill second side for about one minute or until golden. Remove from heat and place on plate or platter to keep warm while you prepare the toppings. Melt provolone cheese on one side of each bagel half. Add one slice of turkey to each half of bagel. Spread with hot sauce. Arrange onion slices on turkey slices on top of cheese on each bagel half and sprinkle with salt to taste. Serve immediately with hot sauce on the side for added flavor.

1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Prepare a cookie sheet by greasing it or lining it with parchment paper. 2. In a medium bowl, combine the sweetened condensed milk, the coffee, the vanilla extract, and the coconut. Using a wooden spoon or a mixer on low speed, beat in the slivered almonds. (You can also do this with an electric mixer.) Stir until everything is well blended. The dough should be fairly stiff. 3. On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough into a ball. Divide the dough into two balls, one slightly smaller than the other. 4. Put one ball of dough on the cookie sheet. Using the palm of your hand, flatten the dough into a circle that is 3 inches in diameter. 5. Put a heaping teaspoon of the filling on the flat dough. Gather the dough over the filling into a ball. Moisten the edges of the ball of dough. Shape the ball into a cone. 6. Place the cones on the cookie sheet

Pour apple cider into a large punch bowl. Add lemon and sugar and stir to dissolve. Add ginger ale and stir to combine. Chill at least 30 minutes. Serve over ice. Garnish with apple slices and candied ginger.

Melt butter in microwave. Add salt and sugar. Stir in peanut butter. Beat in milk. Stir in oats. Add vanilla extract. Dissolve instant chocolate mix in hot water. Stir chocolate mix into peanut butter mixture. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for about 12 minutes.

Combine the flour, salt, pepper and oregano in a zip-top plastic bag. Place chicken breasts in the bag, shaking the bag gently to coat the chicken evenly. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add the chicken and cook 5 minutes or until browned on all sides, turning the chicken over halfway through cooking. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside. Add another tablespoon of olive oil and the sliced mushrooms to the same skillet over medium-high heat until the mushrooms are golden brown in spots, 4 to 5 minutes. Remove the mushrooms from the skillet using a slotted spoon. Add the chicken broth and lemon juice to the skillet and bring the mixture to a boil. Cook 2 minutes or until the liquid is reduced by about one-third. Place the chicken back in the skillet and cover the skillet. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the chicken from the skillet and transfer it

In large bowl beat cake mix, eggs and oil together by hand or electric mixer at medium speed for 2 minutes or until well mixed. Beat in water. Pour into two greased and floured 10 inch tube pans. Bake at 350f degrees for 40 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center of cake comes out clean. Cool in pans 10 minutes before removing to wire rack. Place one layer on serving platter. Spread each layer with about half of the sweetened condensed milk. Place top layer on top of filling. Frost sides and top of cake. (If you want to make the cream cheese filling instead of the sweetened condensed milk filling you must use a 9 inch round pan instead of a 10 inch round pan. Bake as directed above. After removing from pans place one layer on serving platter. Spread each layer with about half of the cream cheese filling. Place top layer on top of filling. Frost sides and top of cake.)

Combine the butter, dried dill and garlic in a small bowl and mix well. Set aside until ready to use. Place fillets skin side down on a baking sheet. Brush each fillet with half of the butter mixture and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 20 minutes or until fillets are cooked through. Turn fillets over and brush with the remaining butter mixture. Bake for 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown. Serves 4.

In a small saucepan over low heat, combine sugar, corn syrup, water and cream. Stir until sugar dissolves. Increase heat to medium. Bring to a boil. Stir in butter. Boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add vanilla. Pour mixture into fondue pot or shallow heatproof dish. To serve, heat fondue pot over medium heat until hot. Dip cake into hot fondue. Dip cake in chocolate. Serve immediately. Makes about 1 cup fondue.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add fettuccine and cook until tender. Drain and toss with olive oil. Set aside. Heat 2 tablespoons of the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shallot and garlic and sauté until tender but not browned. Stir in mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms are tender. Stir in white wine and cook until almost evaporated. Stir in tomatoes and cook until heated through. Stir in the spinach and cook until wilted. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and stir in fresh basil. Add half of the fettuccine to the skillet. Stir to mix. Transfer to serving dish. Top with remaining fettuccine. Sprinkle with goat cheese. Serve immediately.

Cook chicken breast in a pan with garlic until it is cooked. Add taco seasoning. Stir it until it is all incorporated. Add heavy whipping cream. Add this mixture to pasta while cooking it. Stir it until it is all incorporated. Serve immediately with parmesan cheese sprinkled on top.

Preheat oven to 350. In a blender mix together eggs, sugar and butter. Blend for 2 minutes. Add flour and salt and blend again for 2 minutes. Pour mixture into greased pie plate. Bake for 45 minutes. Cool. Make filling. Mix together coconut, vanilla and nutmeg. Spread onto cooled pie. Refrigerate until firm. Slice and serve.

Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Add the garlic and stir-fry for a minute or two. Add the napa cabbage. Stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes. Sprinkle with a little more oil and salt and stir-fry for another 2 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375f. Butter a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. In a small bowl combine the coffee with the sugar. In the bowl of an electric mixer with the paddle attachment beat the eggs for 1 minute. Beat the bittersweet chocolate and the coffee-sugar mixture into the eggs. Stir in the sifted flour. Pour batter into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Remove the cake from the pan. Dust with powdered sugar.

Bring water and spaghetti to boil in large pot over high heat. Cook spaghetti according to package directionsdrain. Place spaghetti in large bowlset aside. Melt butter in large saucepan over medium heatstir in brown sugar and next 4 ingredients until blended and sugar is dissolved. Stir in meat and next 3 ingredientscook over medium heat until meat is no longer pink, stirring occasionally. Pour into greased 11x7x2 inch baking dishstir in spaghetti. Top with cheese and bake at 350 degrees f for about 30 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with salad if desired.
Combine pineapple juice, orange juice and kalamansi juice in a pitcher or punch bowl. Add rum and stir. Pour over ice and serve immediately. This punch is best served in tall glasses over ice.

Mix peanuts and raisins with condensed milk. Place in a shallow pan and let stand for at least an hour or until mixture has thickened and cooled. Pour chocolate over the mixture and spread to form a thin layer. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares with a sharp knife and serve.

Rinse lettuce well in cold water. Remove root end of cucumber. Cut in half lengthwise. Scrape seeds from cucumbers. Thinly slice. Place romaine lettuce in a large salad bowl. Top with cucumbers. Sprinkle with feta cheese. Pour dressing over salad. Toss until all lettuce is evenly coated. Chill at least 1 hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 180c. Grease a 20cm springform cake tin. Dissolve brownie mix in water. Pour into cake tin and bake for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Cream together cream cheese and sugar. Add vanilla and beat until light. Add sour cream and eggs and beat until smooth. Spoon mixture over brownie mixture and place in oven for 40 minutes. Cool before removing from tin. Serve with whipped cream.
Puree avocado in a blender or food processor. Mix in the remaining ingredients. Garnish as desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl with an electric mixer beat butter until fluffy. Gradually add in granulated sugar. Add in egg one at a time. In a separate bowl mix flour, baking powder and salt. Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients. Mix until just combined. Fill cupcake liners 2/3 of the way. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing. In a medium bowl combine yogurt, lemon zest and lemon extract. Fill cupcakes.

Add all the ingredients to a large slow cooker or stove top pot. Cover with cold water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 8-10 hours or until the meat falls apart. Remove meat from bones. Strain broth through a fine mesh strainer to remove any solids. Keep the broth refrigerated for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 3 months. Serve as needed.

Cook sweet potatoes in boiling salted water until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and cool. Cut sweet potato in half and scoop out the insides of each half. Place the potato skins on a baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for 10 minutes. Set aside and let cool. Mash potatoes and add garlic cloves and ginger, mix well together. Place wonton wrapper on flat surface and add a little filling in the center of the wrapper. Bring wrapper edges together and pinch together at the top of the ravioli. Place ravioli on baking sheet and brush with egg white and bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for 10 - 12 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with pesto sauce or other sauce of choice.

In a small bowl, mix together onion, thyme, and garlic. In a large saucepan, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for a minute. Stir the onion mixture into the butter mixture and cook for a minute or so, then add the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for five minutes or so. Remove from the heat and add the chicken breasts. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, combine the water and cinnamon sticks. Bring to a boil and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in the sugar and cornstarch and cook until thickened. Remove from heat and let cool. Strain through a sieve and discard cinnamon sticks. In a bowl, whisk the egg yolks with the heavy cream. Stir into the hot rhubarb mixture. Stir in the wine. Let cool and then pour into a shallow 2-qt. Baking dish. Freeze until firm. Cover with foil and freeze until ready to serve. To serve, unmold and cut into slices. Garnish with lemon slices.

Bring the peas to boil with a large amount of salted boiling water. Cook until tender but not mushy. Drain the peas. Rinse with cold water. Meanwhile, heat the butter and the onion. Cook until tender. Stir in rice. Add wine. Stir. Add enough boiling chicken stock to cover the rice. Add the peas. Simmer over low heat, covered, until rice is done. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Heat oysters in a small saucepan with the milk. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes or until shells open. Remove and discard any unopened oysters. Discard the liquid from the pan. In a food processor or blender, add the oysters and process until smooth. Add milk and margarine and process until smooth. Heat the oyster mixture in a medium saucepan. Add the white pepper and salt. Bring to a boil. Boil for 5 minutes. Add parsley and serve.

Make a 1 inch thick layer of turkey in the bottom of a 9 x 13 glass or ceramic dish. Add a layer of tortillas. Spread 1/4 cup of the cheese evenly over the tortillas. Add a layer of vegetables. Repeat layers of turkey, tortillas and cheese. Top with a layer of salsa. Sprinkle with spices. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes until hot and bubbly. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Heat 1/2 cup boiling water over medium heat and stir in miso and 1/4 cup shiitake mushrooms. Let dissolve for 30 seconds and then remove from heat. In a small pan saute 1/4 cup shiitake mushrooms and scallions in 2 tbsp of sesame oil and 1 tbsp of butter over medium heat. Once the shiitake mushrooms are softened add to miso mixture and add 1 tbsp of sesame oil and 1 tbsp of butter to the soup. Pour soup into 6 bowls and top with 2 ounces tofu cubed and 1 tbsp of sesame oil and 1 tbsp of butter.

In a medium bowl whisk together the mayonnaise and olive oil. Add the lemon juice and garlic and season to taste with salt and cumin seeds. Cut the tips off the asparagus and slice each stalk in half lengthwise. Add to the mayonnaise mixture and toss to coat. Grill the asparagus over a charcoal fire until tender and just a bit charred in spotsabout 10 minutes total cooking time. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add garlic and onion, stirring occasionally for about 2 minutes until onion is translucent. Add spinach, cover pan with a lid, stir occasionally until spinach wilts (about 3 minutes). Stir in bread crumbs until evenly distributed. Remove lid and add salt, pepper, nutmeg. Cover again and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in tomatoes (whole, not diced) until heated through (about another minute). Top with grated parmesan cheese.

Peel carrots and boil until tender but not mushy. Drain and reserve liquid for other recipes. Combine butter and flour until blended. Add carrots and boil until thickened and carrots are tender. Season with salt and pepper and dill weed. Combine light cream and broth and add slowly until desired consistency is reached. Serve with meat dishes and breads.
Combine all ingredients except crabmeat in bowl and mix well. Chill. When ready to serve, sprinkle with chives and top with crabmeat. Serve with crackers or chips. Great for parties!

In a large wok or skillet heat a couple inches of peanut oil to 350 degrees f. Fry chicken until browned and cooked through about 2-3 minutes per side. Remove chicken to a platter with a slotted spatula and drain well. Set aside. In a small bowl combine 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1 tablespoon honey, 3/4 teaspoon hot red chili peppers, 3 tablespoons distilled white vinegar, 1 teaspoon freshly minced garlic. Set aside. Return 2 tablespoons soy sauce to the wok or skillet along with 1 tablespoon honey and 1 teaspoon hot red chili peppers. Whisk together with a wire whisk to dissolve honey. Add 1 teaspoon distilled white vinegar and whisk to dissolve vinegar. Add 1/4 cup soy sauce and 1 teaspoon hot red chili peppers and whisk together to dissolve soy sauce. Place chicken back in wok or skillet

Grind pecans. In small bowl combine pecans and flour. In large bowl beat butter until light and fluffy. Gradually add sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add pecan mixture and beat well. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Roll into balls. Roll in superfine sugar. Store in refrigerator.

Add oil to a skillet and heat over medium-high heat. Add carrots and onions. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Add turkey kielbasa and brown. Add sauerkraut and cook for 5 minutes. Add mustard and white wine. Cook until sauerkraut has softened. Add sugar and caraway seeds. Cook for 1 minute. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 180C. Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil. Carefully place eggs in a pan of boiling water. As soon as the water boils again, turn off the heat. Cover the pan with a lid and allow the eggs to stand for 10 minutes. Transfer the eggs to a bowl of cold water. Peel the eggs when they are cool. Place the eggs in a glass bowl. Peel the spinach and finely chop the leaves. Place the spinach in a bowl. Add the yoghurt, olive oil and French mustard. Stir well until the dressing is smooth. Add the chopped spinach and stir. Season to taste. Put the eggs in a large saucepan. Pour the dressing over the eggs. Cover the saucepan with a lid. Place the eggs in the oven. Cook for 10 minutes. Serve hot with salad.

Microwave or steam the clams in their shells for about 5 minutes or until they open. Discard any that do not open. Chop the clams and set aside. In a large saucepan, melt the butter and stir in flour until it is golden brown. Slowly whisk in half-and-half and bring to a boil, stirring constantly for about a minute or two until it starts to thicken. Add the onion and celery and cook for about 5 minutes or until tender. Add potatoes and clams and bring back to a boil for a few minutes or until hot and tender. Add salt and pepper to taste and stir in sugar. Serve with corn or sourdough bread.

Pre-heat oven to 350f. Grease a baking dish. In a medium size bowl, combine the minute rice and corn. In a small bowl, whisk the egg. Add the egg and stir to combine. Add the salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Pour mixture into the greased baking dish. Bake at 350f. for about 45 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand about 5 minutes before serving. Serve with a sprinkle of parmesan.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut tomatoes into halves or quarters. Remove the seeds from the chili beans. Place the tomatoes on a cookie sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast until soft. Remove from the oven. Scoop the flesh from the tomatoes into a bowl. Discard the skin and the seeds. Place the roasted tomatoes in a blender or food processor. Add the chili beans. Blend. Set aside. Heat a large soup pot over medium heat. Add the oil. Add the onions and garlic. Cook for 3 minutes, or until tender. Add the chili beans mixture. Add the chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the small white and black beans. Cook for 3 more minutes. Cut the corn tortillas into strips. Drop them into the soup. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the shredded cheese. Cook for 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Melt butter into pan. Add shrimp, bourbon and heavy cream, stirring constantly over medium heat until shrimp are pink and firm throughout. Season with salt and pepper. Increase heat to medium-high heat and add tomato paste and stir until smooth. Add lemon juice and stir until incorporated. Add heavy cream mixture to shrimp mixture. Stir until mixture is smooth. Stir in pecans until pecans are lightly browned. Remove from heat. Stir in chives until combined. Serve immediately.

Put the roasted peanuts in a food processor or blender and pulse until it is a fine paste. Add the peanut oil and pulse again until it is smooth. Heat the peanut oil in a small pan over medium heat and add the garlic and cook for about 30 seconds then add the chilli paste and stir until fragrant about 30 seconds add the broth and tomato paste and cook until slightly thickened about 5 minutes. Add the sugar and the peanut butter and cook until the sauce thickens and the sugar dissolves about 3 minutes more. Add the hoisin sauce and the reserved roasted peanuts and stir until combined. Let cool and serve with the fresh spring rolls.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Pour 1/3 cup of the pudding mix into the dish. Add the next 3 layers like this: 1/3 cup pudding mix, 1/3 cup cake mix, 1/3 cup pudding mix. Repeat until all of the pudding mix has been used. Pour the remaining 1/3 cup of pudding mix over the top of the cake. Pour the water over the top of the pudding. In a small bowl beat the eggs with the sour cream. Pour this over the pudding. Pour the vegetable oil over the pudding. Cover the dish tightly with foil. Place the dish in the crock pot. Cook for 2-1/2 hours at high. Serve with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Trim off the ends of the eggplant and cut it in half lengthwise. Use a spoon to scoop out the seeds from the eggplant. Place the eggplant flesh on a baking sheet lined with foil, cut side down. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove the eggplant from the oven when it is tender. Place it on a cutting board with the flat side down. Slice it into 1/4-inch-thick slices and place them on a serving plate. Bring 5 cups of water to a boil in a large pot with a lid on top. Lower the heat to a simmer. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, salt and pepper to taste, garlic powder to taste, basil leaves, parsley, and the diced tomatoes. Add the eggplant to the boiling water. Cook for 30 seconds to 1 minute so the eggplant will become more tender and easier to eat when combined with the sauce. Drain the eggplant in a colander over a bowl to catch the juices. Transfer the

Saute onion and garlic in oil until tender. Stir in salsa and tomato sauce and bring to boil. Reduce heat and add beans and corn. Cook until hot. Shred cooked chicken and add back to pan. Add cilantro and serve with brown rice and yogurt.

In a skillet saute onions and mushrooms in butter over medium heat for 5 minutes or until tender. Add vegetable broth and tomato puree. Bring to a simmer over medium heat and cook for 10 minutes or until thickened. Add cornstarch mixture stirring constantly until thickened. Add salt, pepper and tabasco sauce to taste. Simmer until thickened. Makes 6 cups.

To prepare marinade, combine all ingredients except steak in a food processor or blender until smooth. Pour mixture over steak in a glass container, cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for at least one hour, preferably overnight. When ready to cook, preheat grill or broilercook steak to your preference on hot grill or in the broiler. Remove from grill or broiler and let stand for 1 minute. To serve, remove steak from plastic wrapplace on flat metal tray. Top with peanuts. Broil or grill until peanuts are golden brown. Serve on platter with peanuts.

Rub the fillets with flour and salt and pepper to taste. In a shallow bowl, beat egg and milk. Dip fillets into egg mixture and then coat with flour mixture. Fry in deep fat or frying pan until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side. Serve with lemon wedges and tartar sauce and/or tartar sauce.

Preheat the oven to 300 degrees. Line a large sheet pan with parchment paper or a non-stick cookie sheet. Place the pecans in a single layer on the sheet pan. Drizzle the honey over the pecans and toss gently with a rubber spatula to coat all the nuts. Bake until the honey is bubbling and the nuts are coated with a thick caramelized glaze, about 30 minutes. Toss the nuts in the pan to make sure they are coated evenly with the honey. Cool the nuts completely on the pan before breaking apart or storing in an airtight container for up to a week.
Cook chicken until no longer pink and tender. Add cream cheese, hot sauce and ranch dressingstir until blended. Serve with Frito scoops and celery.

Boil potatoes in water until tender. Drain well. Mash potatoes with sour cream. Add salt & pepper to taste. Mix in butter. Spread mashed potatoes into a 2-quart baking dish. Cover with foil. Bake at 325 degrees for 20-30 minutes. Add frozen spinach to mashed potatoes. Fold in cheddar cheese. Spread into baking dish. Sprinkle with dill seed. Top with chives. Bake at 325 degrees for 20-30 minutes longer or until heated through. Serve with a salad.

In a large saute pan over medium-high heat, saute onions and garlic until soft. Add cauliflower and cook until tender. Add tomatoes and cook for about 5 more minutes. Add snow peas and cook for another 2 minutes. Add stir fry sauce and stir for 1 minute. Add imitation crab and stir fry for 2 to 3 minutes. Add red cabbage and cook for another 2 minutes. Add soy sauce to taste and serve.

In the food processor grind the garlic cloves. Mix in the olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Add the mustard and blend. Pour over the bacon. Add the salad leaves and red onion. Top with avocado and tomato. Season with salt and pepper. Mix well. Serve immediately.

Prepare chicken breasts as desired. Dice chestnuts into small pieces. Add slices of chicken breast and water chestnuts to a bowl. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil and 1 chopped garlic clove. Toss to coat. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a small skillet over medium-low heat. Add the ginger and stir until fragrant. Add the chili-garlic sauce and stir to coat. Add the cilantro and stir to combine. Set aside. Toss together the chicken mixture with the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil. Add the cilantro mixture and toss to coat. Wash and dry lettuce leaves. Spread a little teriyaki sauce on each leaf. Place a few tablespoons of chicken mixture in the center of each lettuce leaf. Fold the sides in to enclose the filling. Serve with additional sauce on the side.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Peel and quarter potatoes and arrange in a single layer in a large bowl. Add enough cold water to cover. Bring to a boil and cook for 15 minutes. Drain. In a large saucepan melt the butter over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes. Add the cream and milk and bring to a simmer. Add the peas and potatoes and stir to coat. Place the potatoes and peas in a lightly greased 1 1/2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Pour sauce over all. Bake for 40-50 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Garnish with fresh chives or parsley.

Peel the vegetables and cut into 1/4-inch sized cubes. Slice the onion. Add vegetables, carrots, and onion to a large pot over medium heat. Cook until vegetables are tender and onion is translucent. Add vegetable stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cook until vegetables are tender. Add red beans with liquid. Bring back to a boil. Season with salt. Simmer soup for 10 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Boil the chicken in water with salt added until cooked. Slice the chicken breast into 3 cm thick slices. Heat the oil in a wok or frying pan. Add the sliced celery with leeks. Slice the cooked chicken into 5 cm x 2 cm slices. Add the cooked chicken to the pan. Cook until the chicken is golden brown. Pour in the soy sauce. Add salt to taste.

Remove the tenders from the bag and cut into serving pieces. Dip tenders in buttermilkcoat with cornflakes. Place on a nonstick cookie sheet and bake at 350f for about 15 minutes or until golden brown and done.

Place couscous and 2 cups boiling water in medium saucepan. Cover and simmer 5 minutes or until tender. Let stand 5 minutes before fluffing with fork. Stir in tomatoes and green onions. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice and cilantroseason with salt and fresh cracked pepper.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Sprinkle salt and pepper on both sides of the fillets. Dip fillets into flour. Sprinkle with paprika. Saute onion in butter until soft. Add fillets to pan and saute 1 minute each side. Remove fillets to a 2 qt. baking dish. Saute onions in butter for 3 minutes. Add wine and scrape up any bits. Pour over fish. Cover dish and bake 20 minutes. Sprinkle with sour cream and bake 10 more minutes. Serve with rice and salad.

Boil water, sugar and salt. Put peanuts into boiling water to soften them for 5 minutes. Drain peanuts and put them into a bowl. Pour honey over peanuts. Add oil and mix to coat peanuts. Pour mixture into a 9x13 inch baking pan lined with foil. Bake for 1 hour at 300f. Let cool 2 hours before serving.

In a shallow dish combine the sour cream and cheese. Dip the fish fillets into the sour cream mixture. Place in a baking dish and season with salt and pepper. Melt the butter and pour it over the fillets. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until flaky and tender. Serve with cooked rice.

Saute onion in 1 tablespoon butter in a 10-in. skillet over medium heat for 8-10 minutes or until tender. In a large bowl combine Bisquick baking mix, tuna and eggs. Add sauteed onions and remaining 3 tablespoons butter. Stir in milk and 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper to taste. Pour into a 9-in. pie plate and bake at 400 F. for 20 minutes or until set and golden brown. Serve with extra onions and desired toppings.

Remove avocado from skin. Slice avocado into quarters. Scoop out avocado meat using a large spoon. Place avocado meat in a bowl. Add tomatoes. Slice red onions. Add to bowl. Add cumin. Add kosher salt. Stir. Add feta. Add olive oil. Stir. Add red wine vinegar. Stir. Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve.

Sauté peppers in oil. Add garlic. Saute until soft. Add in sausage. Cook until sausage is done. Stir in parma rosa sauce mix. Add in milk. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add in cooked pasta. Stir until well mixed. Add in cheese. Remove from heat. Serve with fresh parsley.

Break up the frozen waffles into small pieces. Mix all the ingredients in a large bowl and whisk until smooth. Pour mixture into a large pan and bake for 1 hour or until it is set. Allow it to cool. Serve with vanilla ice-cream.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large bowl, cream butter and brown sugar. Beat in eggs one at a time until smooth. Stir in molasses. In a small bowl whisk together flour, ginger, cinnamon, cloves and sea salt. Whisk flour mixture into egg mixture until blended. Place dough by heaping tablespoons onto a cookie sheet, leaving about 1 1/2 inches between cookies. Bake 13 to 15 minutes until set. Cool on cookie sheet for 2 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
Cream butter and sugars together. Add egg and blend. Add in the dry ingredients. Roll into 1-inch balls and place on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 9-11 minutes.
Combine all the ingredients except the bread in a bowl and mix well. Add the mixture to the pita breads and serve with a garnish of your choice.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees. In large bowl combine oats with coconut. Add cinnamon and salt. Mix. In small bowl stir together oil, honey, maple syrup. Pour over oat mixture. Add nuts. Pour mixture into shallow baking pan. Bake stirring every 20 minutes until golden. Spread into 8x8 pan. Let cool. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Combine flour and baking powder in large bowlcut in butter until crumbly. Stir in the salt, pepper and garlic powder. Mix in the milk until dough forms. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Roll dough to 1/2-inch thickness. Cut into 2-inch rounds. Place on greased baking sheets. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned.

Preheat the microwave for about two minutes on high. Pour beans into a microwave safe bowl. Microwave for about five minutes on high or until beans are hot. Add salsa and stir until everything is well combined. Add scallions and cheese. Stir until cheese is melted. Serve immediately. Serves four.

Bring 2 cups of water to boil in a saucepan. Add wheat berries and cook for about 45 minutes, stirring occasionally until tender. Transfer wheat berries to blender or food processor with garlic cloves. Add olive oil to the wheat berries in the saucepan, then add shiitake mushrooms. Cook for about 5 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally. Add wine to saucepan along with the cooked wheat berries. Cook for about 5 more minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Transfer mixture to blender or food processor with 2 cups of broth. Blend until smooth. If soup is too thick add more liquid (vegetable broth or water). Add kale to soup and simmer for about 3-5 more minutes until heated through. Serve with additional salt and pepper if desired.

Wash strawberries well and slice lengthwise into half. Sprinkle with sugar and lemon juice. Set aside for one hour. Drain juice off of strawberries. Place strawberries into blender with the heavy cream. Blend until smooth. Pour into a shallow baking dish or plastic container and freeze for 8 hours or overnight. Scoop out into serving dishes and serve.

Boil eggs until hard boiled. Remove from heat and plunge into cold water to cool. Peel and cut into quarters. In a medium bowl, combine eggs, Miracle Whip, mustard and sugar. Gently fold in potatoes. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place oil in large pot. Add onion and saute over medium heat until onion is translucent. Add broth and chicken to pot. Bring to a boil. Add spaghetti and meatballs. Cook for about five minutes. Sprinkle with pepper. Turn off heat and place lid on pot. Let stand for about five minutes. Ladle soup into bowls. Sprinkle with spinach and serve.

Place the kosher salt and black pepper in a shallow dish. Place the garlic in a small bowl. Rinse the rosemary and pat dry with paper towels. Remove the leaves from the stem and chop coarsely. Combine the rosemary and the chopped garlic in the small bowl. Heat the extra-virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Rub the salt and the pepper all over the beef tenderloin and sprinkle with the garlic and rosemary. Add the tenderloin to the hot skillet and cook for 4 minutes. Turn the tenderloin over and cook for 4 more minutes. Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook until the meat is very tender and the juices run clear, 15 minutes more. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Slice the roasted tenderloin diagonally into ½-inch-thick slices. Serve with the pan juices.

Cook the ground sirloin in a skillet with extra-virgin olive oil until browned. Drain the excess oil. Add the chopped yellow onion to the skillet. Cook until the onions are translucent. Stir in the chili powder. Pour in the beef stock. Cook for an additional two minutes. Stir in the mustard and ketchup. Bring to a boil. Add the elbow macaroni to the skillet. Cook until the pasta is soft. Stir in the cheddar cheese. Add more beef stock if necessary. Cook until the cheese is melted. Serve in bowls. Top with the additional cheddar cheese.

Soak chickpeas overnight. Drain water from beans and place in large pot with water and leeks and garlic cloves. Cook until beans are tender. Remove leeks with slotted spoon and set aside. Add spinach to the pot. Cook until tender (about 5 minutes). Drain liquid from beans and spinach. Remove leeks from pot. In another skillet, melt butter and sauté leeks until tender and translucent. Add the beans and spinach back into the pot with the leeks and herbs. Add water to cover. Simmer 15 minutes or until beans are tender (or pressure cook for 15 minutes). In separate skillet, sauté the croutons over medium heat with olive oil until crisp and brown. Serve warm soup with croutons.

Mix all ingredients except butter together well. Make a well in the center of the batter and add the butter. Stir to combine. Cook on a hot griddle or frying pan for about 2 minutes or until brown on each side. Serve hot.

Wash and hull the strawberries and bananas. Slice the bananas and strawberries into thick slices. Blend the coconut milk, water and rum in a blender and pour into a punch bowl. Add the strawberries and bananas. Pour in grenadine. Serve over ice cubes.

Sprinkle chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add butter to melt in skillet. Add onion, bell peppers, green bell peppers and cook until tender. Pour in cream of chicken soup and bring to a simmer. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until soup is heated through and begins to thicken. Remove from heat. Toss spaghetti in a large bowl to coat with oil. Place in a 9x13 baking dish. Top spaghetti evenly with the sauce mixture from the skillet. Top with mushrooms and cheeses. Bake for 30 minutes or until cheese is bubbly. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.
In a large pitcher combine all the liquid ingredients. Stir well to combine. Add ice and chill for 1 hour before serving. Pour into glasses and serve.

Mix margarine and peanut butter in medium bowl. Add powdered sugar. Mix well. Drop by teaspoons onto waxed paper. Place in refrigerator until firm. Melt chocolate chips. Dip each bar into chocolate. Allow excess chocolate to drip back into bowl. Place on waxed paper. Repeat with remaining bars.

Bring 1 1/2 cups water to a boil in a small saucepan. Add the rice and cook for 5 minutes. Drain the rice. Heat the butter and the 2 tablespoons water in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the celery and the onion and saute until tender. Stir in the broth and bring to a boil. Add the rice and simmer until the liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Stir in the raisins and pecans. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

In a large saucepan combine nonfat milk and berries. Bring berry mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Remove from heatcover and let stand for about 5 minutes or until berries are thawed. Add milk mixture and the oatmeal to a blenderblend until smooth and creamy (about 1 minute). In another blender combine yogurt and wheat germ until smooth. Pour oatmeal mixture into four bowls and top with wheat germ mixture and banana slices. Drizzle with honey and serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine chocolate chips, pine nuts and red chili powder. Place in a microwave safe bowl. Melt chocolate in the microwave for 1 minute. Stir until smooth. Add condensed milk to chocolate mixture. Stir until smooth. Pour into greased 13x9-inch pan. Refrigerate for one hour before cutting.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a shallow baking dish or large bowl, mix together the buttermilk and cornflakes until well combined.
