Place the chicken breast filets into the buttermilk mixture and let sit for about 5 minutes. Drain the chicken and pat dry with a paper towel. In a small bowl, mix together the bread crumbs and seasonings. Dip the chicken into the breadcrumb mixture and place onto parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and crispy on the outside.
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Spray with cooking spray. Beat eggs. Add spinach. Stir in oregano. Pour into skillet. Top with feta cheese. Cook until set. Cut into wedges.

Blanch brussels sprouts by boiling them for 10 minutes. Remove with slotted spoon to cold water bath to stop cooking process. Pat dry with paper towels. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Add sprouts to pan. Saute for about two minutes. Add salt and butter. Saute another three minutes or until butter is melted. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Serve immediately with crackers or toast points.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foilspray foil with cooking spray. Divide pizza dough in halfroll each out to 12 inches in diameter. Place one dough circle on prepared baking sheetspread with cornmeal. Top with marinara saucetop with 1/4 cup mozzarella cheesetop with 1 cup sour creamtop with 1/2 cup scallopstop with 1/2 cup bacon. Top with remaining 1/4 cup mozzarellatop with remaining 1/4 cup scallopstop with remaining 1/4 cup bacontop with remaining 1/4 cup sour cream. Top with remaining 1/4 cup mozzarellatop with remaining 1/4 cup scallopstop with remaining 1/4 cup bacontop with remaining 1/4 cup sour cream. Top with remaining 1/4 cup mozzarellatop with remaining 1/4 cup scallopstop with remaining

Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain. Return pasta to pot. Add the raisins, and toss. Set aside. Heat butter and oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute garlic and spinach until spinach is wilted. Add the pine nuts and toss with spinach and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside. Heat pasta in saucepan over medium-low heat. Add spinach mixture and cook until warm. Drain any excess liquid. Place pasta in a bowl. Add prosciutto and toss. Sprinkle with cheese.

Whisk egg whites and salt until frothy. Add sugar gradually while whisking. Add vanilla and continue whisking until stiff glossy peaks form. Fold in dates and walnuts. Using a pastry bag or a spoon, pipe onto baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake at 250f for 1 hour or until crispy. Let stand on baking sheet for 30 minutes.

Wash and dry the blueberries and slices of peach. In a 2 quart wide mouth canning jar or 4 pint wide mouth jars place the blueberries and slices of peach. In a 4 cup measuring cup add the pectin and sugar and mix until sugar is dissolved. Add the pectin and sugar mixture to the jars and stir to combine with the blueberries. Wipe the rims of the jars with a clean damp paper towel. Screw on the lids of the jars. Process the jars in a boiling water bath for 10 minutes. Remove from the boiling water bath and let the jars cool. Once they are cool remove the lids and check to make sure the seals are good. If the seals are not good, replace the lids. Store the jars in the refrigerator or freeze.

Mix gelatin into 1/4 cup boiling water. Stir in powdered sugar. Set aside. Cut each strawbery in half. Set aside. Mix cake mix in large bowl. Stir in eggs, water and oil. Add in gelatin. Stir until well mixed. Divide batter in two. Spread half of batter in 9 x 13 pan. Top with half of the strawberries. Spoon half of the remaining batter over berries. Top with remaining strawberries. Spoon remaining batter over berries. Sprinkle the remaining powdered sugar. Cover pan and refrigerate 30 minutes. Cut and serve.

Place corn, creamed style corn and noodles into a greased casserole dish. In a skillet over medium heat, saute onion and carrot in a little bit of butter until tender. Add to casserole dish. In a separate skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Whisk in cornstarch. Gradually whisk in broth. Bring mixture to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Whisk in sour cream. Pour into casserole dish. Sprinkle with saltine crackers. Bake, uncovered, at 375 degrees fahrenheit for 30 minutes. Top with parmesan cheese. Bake 3 to 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.

Brown ground beef, ground chicken and hot sausage together in a large skillet. Drain excess grease from the meat. Add the stewed tomatoes to the meat. Add the red beans, onion, seasoning mix and water. Simmer for 20 minutes. Stir occasionally.

Cut zucchini into thin rounds and potato into thin slices and boil with water for a few minutes. Meanwhile boil the tomato paste with the chicken stock until it reduces to about half a cup and add the cornflour dissolved in some water until it thickens. Remove the vegetables from boiling water and put into a deep plate or bowl. Then add the reduced tomato paste and mix with the vegetables. Add some salt and pepper and pour a few eggs with the beaten yolks. Stir everything and put the mixture into the fridge for about two hours and then you can bake it in the oven for about half an hour at 220 C (425 F).

In a large skillet over med high heat, brown chicken breasts. Add salt and pepper to taste. Drain fat. Remove chicken from pan. Stir in soup, paprika, and green beans. Cook for about 20 minutes. Spoon mixture into foil packets. Add a teaspoon of margarine to each packet. Seal and bake for 30 minutes.
Cook farro according to package directions. Combine all salad ingredients in large bowl and toss with farro.

Bring broccoli to a boil in a large pot of water with 2 tablespoons oil and 1 teaspoon salt over high heat, stirring occasionally until bright green and crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Drain and set aside. Meanwhile bring water to a boil in a large pot of water with 1 teaspoon oil and 1/2 teaspoon salt over high heat and cook ramen noodles until al dente according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold running water until cool enough to handle. Cut into 1 inch pieces and set aside. In a large bowl toss broccoli and ramen noodles with remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons oil and lemon juice until coated. Add honey, pepper and salt and toss to coat evenly. Garnish with peanuts and serve at room temperature.

Whisk together mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, sour cream, mustard, fines herbes and salt & pepper in blender until smooth. Gradually add oil in thin stream while blender is running until emulsified. Add parsley and blend until chopped but not pureed.
Combine fruit with coconut and juice. Stir in ginger and mint. Refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a bowl, combine ground chicken, breadcrumbs, buffalo wing sauce, diced green chilies and carrot. Stir in blue cheese and garlic powder. In another bowl, whisk together eggs and season with salt and pepper. Mix the buffalo wing mixture and the egg mixture together. Stir in parsley. Form into a loaf and place in baking dish. Bake for 50 minutes in the preheated oven. Let stand for 5 minutes before slicing. Serve with green salad.

Place a large skillet over medium-high heat. Dice ham into 1/2-inch pieces. Place ham into skillet. Cook until meat begins to brown. Add onion to skilletcook 4 to 5 minutes or until tender. Add apple butter to skillet. Cook 2 minutes. Add apple juicecook 1 minute. Add cornstarch mixture to skillet. Cook 1 minute or until thickened. Spread apple mixture onto ham. Sprinkle with apple butter. Yields 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a large bowl combine brown sugar and flour. Add pecans and butter. Stir well. In another bowl combine mashed sweet potatoes and sugar. Add vanilla and salt. Whisk together. Add egg and stir to combine. Pour sweet potatoes into brown sugar mixture. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Cut baguette into 1-inch thick slices. Spread each slice with a thin layer of olive oil. Heat a panini grill or a small frying pan over medium-high heat. Put 1 slice of baguette on the grill. Top each slice with a thin layer of tomato, a sprinkle of garlic, a leaf of basil and a slice of cheese. Grill on both sides until cheese is melted. Serve on a plate. Drizzle each toast with a little more oil.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Cut chicken tenders into 3 pieces each. Place pieces in a bowl and add salt and pepper to season. In large skillet brown chicken pieces in 1 1/2 cups of hot vegetable oil over medium-high heat for 6 to 8 minutes or until golden brown. Drain chicken on paper towels to remove excess oil. Cut chicken pieces in half crosswise to make 4 pieces of meat per chicken tender. Place 4 pieces of chicken in a casserole dish with lemon marmalade on the bottom of the dish. Place one chive on each piece of chicken. Cover with 1/2 cup of chicken broth. Top broth with lemon juice and dried lemon peel. Place chicken pieces in oven and bake for 10 minutes or until heated through.

In a large skillet or saucepan over medium-high heat, heat the oil and melt the creole seasonings. Add the chicken breast halves and brown on all sides about 5-7 minutes per side. Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and pour the soup into the skillet. Bring the soup to a boil then reduce the heat and simmer while stirring for about 5 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Meanwhile in a blender or food processor blend the lime juice and sour cream into a creamy consistency. Pour the sauce over the chicken and serve. Serving suggestion : Serve over rice or noodles. Also good with steamed vegetables. Or serve with a side salad.

Mix sugar and corn syrup in a large heavy bottomed pot. Stir over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Add nonfat milk and bring to a boil. Boil until mixture reaches soft ball stage. Remove from heat and add cocoa powder. Stir until cocoa powder is dissolved. Stir in vanilla extract. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 pan and spread into an even layer. Cool completely. Cut into squares.

Peel and quarter apples and place them into a large saucepan with the butter and caster sugar. Cook gently until the apples are soft and the mixture has thickened. Serve warm with a dollop of Greek yogurt or cream and sprinkle with a little cinnamon and nutmeg if desired.

Cook the sausage until browndrain. Remove from casingsset aside. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Mix biscuit mix according to package directions. Add sausage, onion, eggs, milk, salt, paprika. Mix well. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with a dollop of sour cream.

Slice zucchini into 1 inch rounds. Slice eggplant and red peppers into thin rounds also. Slice green tomatoes into rounds and quarter onions. Toss together with garlic and oil in medium bowl. Season with black pepper. Bake in lightly greased dish at 400 for 15 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with cheese before serving.

Prepare beef chuck roast in large crock pot. Add salt and pepper and garlic powder to taste. Cook on low heat for 8-10 hours or until done. Let stand 15 minutes. Shred cooked beef and serve with tortillas. This can also be used for chili or as a filling in burritos or tacos. It is delicious!
Place rhubarb in a pan and add water. Bring to a boil and cook until rhubarb is soft. Put in a blender or food processor and purée. Pour into bowl. Add strawberry, vanilla and yogurt. Mix well.

In a large pan over medium heat, heat olive oil until shimmering. Stir in the onion and cook for 1 minute or until softened. Stir in the garlic cloves, chopped tomatoes, olives (drained) and a generous pinch each of celery salt and cumin seed. Bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, then cook for 20 minutes or until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in honey to taste. Pour into a food processor or blender along with 1/3 cup olive oil and blend until smooth. Pour into a bowl. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow flavors to develop. To serve, transfer pate to a serving bowl and sprinkle with parsley. Garnish with a lemon twist and serve with breads or crackers.
In a small bowl combine the cheeses and mayonnaise. Add the remaining cheese ball ingredients and mix well. Roll into a ball and serve with crackers.

In a medium sized sauce pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add oats, oat bran and brown sugar. Stir together and cook until golden. Remove from heat. Stir in oil, honey, salt. Transfer mixture to a 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Press down firmly. Bake at 350 degrees f for 10 minutes. Remove pan from oven. Sprinkle cocoa nibs over top. Cool completely. Store bars in airtight container.

Mix the cake mix according to instructions. Fill each cup to half full and place in freezer. Remove and place one oreo on top of each cake. Place back in freezer for an hour or so. Remove from freezer and top each cup with half cup of pudding. Return to freezer for an hour or so. Remove from freezer and place one oreo on top of each cake. Top with whipped topping if desired. Return to freezer until ready to serve. (This is great with ice cream. )
Mix all ingredients together. Form into patties. Heat skillet to med-hot. Fry patties. Turn to brown both sides.

Cream butter and sugar. Add bananas. Mix until fluffy. Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Mix well. Stir in milk. Pour batter into a 9x5x3 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Let cool. Sprinkle with walnuts before serving.

Blend sour cream, pepper and cheeses in a small bowl until smooth. Pour into a small saucepan over low heat and stir constantly until warm and smooth, about 2 minutes. Stir in butter and heat through.

In a large mixing bowl, combine warm water, shortening and vinegar. Let stand for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally to dissolve shortening and break down any large lumps of shortening. Add gluten and dissolve gluten. Add whole wheat flour and sugar and mix well. Stir in salt and 1 cup of flour to make a soft dough. Let dough stand for 20 minutes to rise. Combine 2 cups of whole wheat flour and 2 tablespoons of gluten to make a dusting surface. Turn dough on to dusting surface and knead dough until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Transfer dough to a greased bowl and turn to coat with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Cover with a kitchen towel and let rise in a warm place for 2 hours until doubled in size. Punch dough down and turn onto lightly greased surfacedivide dough into 2 pieces and shape each piece of dough into a loaf about 1 1/2 inches high and 15 inches longplace loaves on a greased sheet pan. Let rise

Heat the vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pork chops and cook 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook 2 minutes. Turn the pork and cook 1 minute. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Stir in the brown sugar and chili pepper flakes. Place the skillet in the slow cooker. Add the cornstarch and cold water to the broth and stir until dissolved. Cook on low 6-8 hours or until the pork is tender. Transfer to a serving plate. Serve with a dipping sauce. Serves 4.

Peel carrots and cut them into large cubes. Peel celery ribs and cut them into small pieces. Peel and finely dice leeks and discard the dark green parts. Peel butternut squash and cut it into small cubes. Cut off the hard core of each leek and slice thinly. Peel and finely dice shallot. Melt butter in large soup pot or Dutch oven over low heat. Sauté leeks and shallot until softened (about 10 minutes). Add carrots and celery ribs and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in squash and cook for 15 minutes more or until squash is tender but still holds its shape. Stir in broth and bring to boil. Simmer 15 minutes more or until carrots are tender and broth is reduced by half. Grind ginger using a mortar and pestle or microplane grater and add to soup with salt and pepper to taste. Cool soup for 10 minutes and purée with an immersion blender until smooth and creamy (or purée soup using a blender and then return to soup pot). St

Spread pesto sauce on one side of each slice of the pita bread. Sprinkle with grated or shaved parmesan or romano cheese. Top with slices of tomato and a pinch of freshly cracked black pepper and sea salt. Roll up the bread and slice into rounds. Place the slices on a tray and bake for about ten minutes.

Boil the ramen noodles in hot water. When the noodles are almost tender drain. Meanwhile, prepare a dressing using the soy sauce, sugar, vinegar, garlic cloves, oil, and half of the sesame seeds. Mix the ramen noodles, green onion, cabbage, almonds, the remaining sesame seeds, and the dressing. Mix thoroughly. Serve immediately.

Bring the water to a boil in a sauce pan and add the tapioca pudding mix and orange gelatin. Whisk until the gelatin is dissolved. Then add the vanilla pudding mix and mix well. Divide the pudding mixture among 6 individual serving dishes. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. Top with mandarin oranges and frozen whipped topping.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt 1 stick of salted butter in microwave for about 30 seconds. Stir in 1 cup of light brown sugar. Add 2 tsp of almond extract. Combine with 3 cups of saltine crackers. Press mixture into a 13 x 9 pan. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into 12 bars. Drizzle with milk chocolate. Makes 12 servings.

Separate chicken breasts into individual cutlets and place on baking sheet. Drizzle with butter and sprinkle with mushrooms and shallots. Season with salt and pepper and top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 12 to 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and chicken is cooked through. Serve with rice and a green salad.

Prepare potatoes according to package directions. Drain potatoes. Meanwhile, melt butter in 11x15 baking dish. Stir in cheese until melted. Stir in potatoes. Sprinkle with pepperoni. Cover dish with foil and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with oregano and garlic salt. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes more or until potatoes are crisp. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Whisk together sweetened condensed milk, egg whites, coconut, almond extract, salt and cream of tartar in a medium bowl. Add remaining coconut and stir well. Fill a pastry bag fitted with a plain tip halfway full with macaroon mixture. Pipe small circles onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until set. Let cool. Store in airtight container.

In a large bowl combine ham and pork. In a separate bowl combine all other ingredients except water and mustard and mix together. Drain meat and add to dry ingredients and mix together. Fold in water and mustard and mix together. Put 1 tablespoon of this mixture into each cupcake pan. Bake at 350 degrees F (180 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes or until done. Let cool and serve.
Mix sugar, flour, eggs, prepared mustard, vinegar and bouillon in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat stirring constantly. Boil 1 minute. Remove from the heat. Stir in the butter. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Prepare a large baking dish by coating it with nonstick cooking spray and dusting it with the taco seasoning mix. Season the chicken breasts with the taco seasoning mix and place the breasts in the prepared dish. Pour the evaporated milk over the chicken breasts and top with the cream of celery soup and cream of chicken soup. Sprinkle with the chopped green chilies and the shredded cheese and then top with the tortilla chips. Bake for about 30 minutes or until the chicken breasts are fully cooked and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Peel and cut brussels sprouts in half lengthwise. Saute in a large skillet over medium heat in olive oil. Stirring occasionally add brussels sprouts and onion soup mix. Cook until brussels sprouts are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Remove skin from ham. Rub ham with brown sugar. Place ham in roasting pan. Add 1/2 cup of apple cider and 1/4 cup of honey. Cover with foil. Bake in 325 degree oven until a meat thermometer reads 150 degrees. Remove from oven and uncover. Brush ham with liquid smoke. Spread mustard over ham. Sprinkle with remaining brown sugar. Bake in 325 degree oven until glaze is bubbly. Allow ham to rest 10 minutes before serving. Serve with apple and cranberry relish.

In a large bowl combine 2 cups rolled oats and 2 cups all-purpose flour. Add 1/2 cup each of brown sugar and flour, 1 teaspoon each of cinnamon and ginger and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. In a small bowl cream together 1/2 cup of butter and 1/4 cup honey. Add apples and toss. Pour butter mixture into dry mixture and mix well. Pour into greased 8x12x2 baking pan and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Cool and cut into squares.

Boil potatoes for about 10 minutes until tender. Drain potatoes and place in a large bowl. Add the garlic powder, cheddar cheese soup mix and milk. Stir together until combined. Heat oil in a large skillet and add the smoked sausage. Cook sausage until no longer pink. Add the potatoes and stir. Cook over medium heat for about 4 minutes. Add the green onions and stir. Cook for an additional minute. Serve.

Combine nonfat milk and 1/2 cup of water in saucepan. Bring to a boil. Whisk in 1/2 cup of flour, salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat until thickened, stirring frequently. Stir in the cheese and remove from heat. Stir in the mayonnaise and cream cheese. Chill for 2 hours. Makes 2 cups.

Prepare angel food cake according to package directions. Cool completely and crumble. In a large bowl combine gelatin and sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix. Stir in the crumbled cake. Fold in the strawberries. Spoon into a serving dish. Cover and refrigerate until serving time. Top with cool whip and strawberries.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a small bowl mix together the balsamic vinegar and oil. Place the broccoli florets and garlic clove into a roasting pan with the oil and vinegar mixture. Toss until evenly coated with the oil and vinegar mixture. Spread broccoli florets and garlic clove onto the pan and bake for approximately 35 minutes until the broccoli is tender when pierced with a fork. Sprinkle with black pepper and oregano and serve.

In a small saucepan over low heat melt butter. Remove from heat and whisk in cocoa powder. Stir in powdered sugar and vanilla. Add milk. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat and pour mixture into 9x13x2 inch baking dish. Spread evenly with spatula. Let cool. Top with pecan halves. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Cut into squares and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease and flour a bread pan. Mix flour with salt and set aside. Cream butter with brown sugar and beat until fluffy. Add eggs and mix until well blended. Add flour mixture and mix. Pour into pan. Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes or until done.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place flour, salt and pepper in a shallow dish. Dredge chicken halves in flour mixture and shake off excess. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chickencook and turn until chicken is golden brown and heated through, about 10 minutes total. Transfer chicken to a baking dishpour remaining barbecue sauce over chicken in baking dish. Bake until sauce is bubbly and thickened, about 15 minutes more. Just before serving, whisk cornstarch with remaining barbecue sauce until smooth. Add gingerwhisk well. Pour over chickenbake until sauce is thickened and bubbly, about 10 more minutes. Serve with rice or noodles and steamed vegetables.
Peel potatoes and boil until tender. Drain potatoes and mash until smooth. Add butter, blue cheese, garlic salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Prepare an ice water bath by filling a large bowl halfway with ice and water. Set aside. In a large, nonreactive bowl, add the oil and heat over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Add the onion and cook until soft and translucent, about 4 minutes, stirring frequently. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the green bell pepper and tomato and cook until the pepper softens, about 3 minutes. Add the thyme and parsley and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the okra and cook until the okra begins to soften and the mixture begins to thicken, about 3 minutes. Stir in the cayenne pepper and salt and pepper to taste. Serve the Creole Okra warm or at room temperature garnished with fresh parsley.

Cook the ground beef patties according the directions on the package. Let them cool for a bit then put them in the refrigerator until you are ready to assemble the burger. In a small bowl combine the sour cream and the crushed garlic. Place the cucumber in a bowl and add the juice of half a lemon. Then add the sour cream mixture. Slice the tomatoes. Cut the pita bread in half and lightly butter both sides. Heat the grill on medium heat and then place the pita bread directly on the grill. Cook until the bread begins to get brown. Add the butter to the grill and then place the tomatoes directly on the grill for about 3 minutes. Remove from the grill and put the tomatoes and the cucumber in a bowl. Let the pita bread cool. To assemble the burger put one pita half on a plate. Add a lettuce leaf then add the tomato. Then place the ground beef patty in the middle. Add a slice of the feta cheese and then add the other half of the pita bread. Serve.

Preheat oven to moderate heat (180c). In a blender, combine the water and tomato juice. Add the other ingredients and blend until smooth. Place the meatball mixture in a large bowl. Add the tomato mixture. Mix well. Form into meatballs and place them into an oven-proof dish. Cover and bake for about 40 minutes. Remove from the oven. Let the meatballs stand for about 10 minutes before serving. Serve the meatballs hot with the sauce. Serves about 6.

Pat tilapia fillets dry. Sprinkle fillets with salt & pepper. Place fillets skin side down in a 9 by 13 baking dish. Spoon pesto sauce over fillets. Arrange diced tomatoes over top of fillets. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over fillets. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Slice bread into 12 slices. Beat eggs with milk. Mix in bread crumbs. Dip bread into egg mixture then into breadcrumbs, place on cookie sheet and bake for about 10 minutes at 375F/190C. Remove from oven when golden brown. Meanwhile, slice mushrooms thinly and cook in olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. In a large frying pan melt about 1/2 inch of oil over medium heat. Add a little olive oil to coat pan. Fry mushrooms until tender, about 5 minutes. Add sage to pan, stirring for 30 seconds to 1 minute. In a small bowl mix marinara sauce with mozzarella cheese to make a dip for mushrooms. Fill each pocket with a small amount of mozzarella cheese dip. Place mozzarella filled bread in hot oil and fry on both sides until golden brown. Serve with marinara sauce on side.

Preheat oven to 300f. Trim excess fat from roast. Rub roast with oil. Heat a large heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Add roastbrown on all sides. Remove roast to a large bowl. Add oil to the pot. Add garlic to the oilcook until fragrant. Stir in the parsley. Add roast to the pot. Pour tomatoes over roast. Cover tightly. Bake 3 hours or until roast is tender. Stir tomatoes occasionally. Transfer roast to a serving platter. Pour sauce into a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add the tomato paste. Cook 10 minutes or until sauce is thickened. Stir in the fresh parsley. Serve the sauce over the roast.

Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl until blended well. Form into patties. Dip fritters in batter and then into bread crumbs. Fry in hot oil for 3-5 minutes until golden brown and cooked through.

Melt vegetable oil in a large pan. Sweat onions until translucent. Add sausage and cook until browned and cooked through. Add floury potatoes and saute until lightly browned. Add hot stock and mustard and simmer until potatoes are tender (about 20 minutes). Season with salt and pepper. Serve with cheese grated on top.

Mix together the whole wheat flour, cinnamon, baking powder and baking soda in a bowl. Cut the cold butter into small pieces and add to the bowl with the dry mixture. Use your hands to rub the butter into the mixture until it resembles coarse meal. Mix in the honey. Then add the sugar gradually to the mixture. Use a mixer with a paddle attachment to beat the mixture until well combined. Turn the mixture out onto a well-floured surface. Knead the mixture about 5 times to form a soft dough that is smooth. Shape into 12 balls (about 1 1/2 inches in diameter), and place on a cookie sheet lined with wax paper. Use a fork to press a crisscross pattern into the top of each ball of dough. Flatten the tops of the cookies slightly with your palm. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the cookies are lightly browned around the edges. Transfer to a rack to cool.

Roll dough out to about 1/4 inch thickness. Spread alfredo sauce all over dough. Layer crabmeat, green onions, mushrooms and bacon. Sprinkle with seasoning and cheese. Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. Enjoy.

In a large mixing bowl add the lettuce and pears. In a small bowl combine the vinegar, oil, mustard and sugar and pour over lettuce mixture. Add salt and pepper to taste. Toss thoroughly to coat lettuce evenly.

Spray the inside of a muffin tin with nonstick cooking spray. Place cream cheese into a small bowl and microwave for 30 seconds to soften. Mix in mayonnaise until smooth. Fold in cheddar cheese until combined. Stir in egg substitute until combined. Fold in the jalapenos. Spoon the mixture into the muffin cups. Sprinkle the tops of the poppers evenly with the corn flake crumbs. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and cool for 5 minutes. Serve immediately. Makes 12.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large bowl, combine peanut butter and cream cheese until well blended. Add powdered sugar and beat until well mixed and smooth. Beat in milk until well blended. Pour into a large baking dish and spread evenly. Bake for 18 minutes or until mixture is light brown on top and center is set. Cool slightly before spooning into individual dessert cups. Top with a dollop of whipped topping and sprinkle with peanuts for garnish if desired.

Wash the leaves well. Take two banana leaves. Dry it on the hot pan. Then cut the banana leaves into two halves. Put some mustard oil in a pan. Add chopped green chillies. Let it cook. After the green chillies start releasing oil, add the fish. Put the pan on high heat. Add some black mustard seeds and red chili powder. Put the leaves over the fish. Add turmeric powder and some salt. Mix the contents of the pan. Let it cook for 5-6 minutes. Remove the banana leaves. Serve hot.

Place the sea bass in a large bowl with all the other marinade ingredients except for the vegetable oil and stir well to combine. Marinate at room temperature for about 10 minutes. Heat a large skillet with 1 inch vegetable oil over medium heat. Sauté the sea bass for about 10 minutes, until cooked through. Remove from heat and drain on a paper towel. Season with salt. Heat another tablespoon of vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Saute the onion until softened for about 5 minutes. Saute the celery for about 2 minutes. Saute the serrano chili for about 1 minute until softened. Remove from heat and transfer to a blender with all of the marinade ingredients except for the sea bass. Blend until smooth. Pour into a large bowl and stir well to combine. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 24 hours. Remove sea bass from marinade and drain on a paper towel. Return sea bass to marinade to coat well. Heat a large skillet with 1 inch vegetable oil

Season ribs with salt and pepper to taste. Place ribs on the bottom of a 6-quart pressure cooker and pour beer over them. Add enough water to cover ribs plus 1 inch. Place pressure cooker on a stove burner and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Skim off foam that rises to surface of liquid. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer until ribs are tender when pierced with a fork (about 1 hour). Add barbecue sauce to ribs and cook for an additional 15 minutes on low heat. Serve ribs with barbecue sauce on the side for dipping.

Brown ground beef with onion and green pepper. Add tomato sauce. Bring to boil. Add seasoning salt and pepper. Add cream-style cottage cheese. Add cream cheese. Pour into greased 1-qt. Baking dish. Add medium noodles. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 40 to 45 minutes.

Brown pork chops in corn oil over medium heat in fry pandrain on paper towel. Prepare sauce by adding the soup mix with water in fry pan and cooking on low until thickenedadd brown sugar and worcestershire sauce and stir wellpour sauce over pork chops and serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 400. In a shallow dish, beat eggs. In a separate shallow dish combine breadcrumbs and parsley. Dip chicken in eggs. Dip in breadcrumbs. In a large skillet over medium heat, brown breaded chicken on all sides. Place chicken in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Bake at 400 for 30 minutes. While chicken is baking, make honey mustard sauce. In a small bowl, mix together ketchup and honey. In a large bowl, stir together sour cream and mayonnaise. Add honey mixture to sour cream mixture. Stir in parsley. Serve sauce with baked chicken.
Put all ingredients in large bowl and toss to coat. Chill until serving time.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Melt butter in skillet. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Remove garlic from skillet with slotted spoon and place on a cookie sheet. Dip each oyster in bread crumbs and place on cookie sheet along with garlic. Dip each oyster in skillet with melted butter then place each in a separate cupcake pan lined with foil. Pour sherry over each oyster. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle each oyster with grated parmesan cheese.

Slice mushrooms in half. Sautee mushrooms in butter until brown. Remove from pan. In a small saucepan combine cheese and milk. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add to mushrooms. Add breadcrumbs, parsley, basil and parmesan cheese. Stir until well combined. Spoon mixture into mushroom caps. Top with green onions. Place back into saucepan and cook on medium low for about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with pepper. Serve with fresh parsley.

In a large skillet brown chicken and season with salt and pepper. Drain any excess fat. In a large saucepan melt butter over medium heat. Stir in cream of chicken soup and half-and-half cream. Stir in tarragon. Bring to a boil. Add pasta. Stir in cooked chicken. Add parmesan and paprika. Cook over low heat 8 minutes. Serve in a deep casserole.

Toast 4 slices of bread on one side only. Spread 2 tablespoons of olive oil on each slice of bread. Add 2 slices of bread to a hot pan on medium-low heat, butter-side down for 2 minutes. Turn the bread over and cook another 2 minutes, until golden brown. Remove the bread slices from the pan, place on a baking sheet or plate and allow to cool completely. Place the onions in a large skillet with a drizzle of olive oil over medium heat. Cover the pan and cook the onions for 20-30 minutes until golden brown. Once the onions have browned, add the remaining 3 tablespoons olive oil and 4 slices of butter to the pan (the pan should be almost filled). Cook the butter until it has melted completely, about 3-4 minutes. Once the butter has melted, add the bread slices (buttered-side up). Toast the bread until it is golden brown for another 4-5 minutes. Remove from the pan and place on a cutting board. Cut each slice in half diagonally (so the entire slice
Place pork loin in crock pot. Sprinkle with apple juice. Add apples, brown sugar, ginger, salt and pepper. Cover. Cook on low 6-8 hours. Makes 6 servings.

Prepare stuffing as directed on package. In saucepan of boiling water, cook bacon until crispremove bacon from pan and reserve bacon fat in pan. In same pan, saute garlic and mushrooms until softenedremove to bowl with stuffing. Add quail to fat remaining in pan and saute until golden. Remove quail from pan and place on platter. To drippings remaining in pan, add hazelnuts and ale. Cook until hazelnuts are golden and liquid is reduced by half, about 5 minutes. Stir in reserved bacon fat and remove from heat. Place stuffing mixture and cooked quail in an ovenproof baking dish. Pour sauce over mixture. Bake in preheated oven until stuffing is cooked through, about 35 minutes. Serve with whole wheat bread.

Put a layer of refried beans on top of the tortilla chips. Then add some cheese on top. Put a layer of salsa on top of that. Add another layer of cheese on top of the salsa. Add another layer of beans on top of the cheese. Add another layer of cheese on top of the beans. Add another layer of beans on top of the cheese. Repeat this step until all of the cheese is used up. Put the nachos in the oven for 10 minutes until the cheese has melted.

Melt the butter over medium heat in a saucepan. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add rice. Season with salt and pepper. Add sour cream and stir until the rice is coated. Remove from heat. Stir in the cheeses and green chilis. Serve. This is very good with some black olives as well.

Cut off any fat or gristle from the thighs and cut into bite-sized pieces. Dip each piece into the egg and then into the bread crumbs (use about half the amount you would for regular fried chicken). Heat oil in a wok or large frying pan until very hot (about 360 degrees). Dip the pieces into the oil and fry until golden brown (about 30 seconds on each side). Drain on a paper towel-lined plate and serve hot.

Brown bacon in a pan over medium heat. Place chicken in a 3-qt. slow cooker. Add bacon, seasoning salt and pepper. Pour in cream of chicken soup. Cook, uncovered on high for 2 hours or until chicken is tender. Stir in mushrooms and cook, uncovered, for 30 minutes more. In a small bowl, combine the parmesan cheese and parsley. Stir into soup mixture. Sprinkle with swiss cheese. Cover and cook until cheese melts. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Mix together water and gelatin. Add ice cubes and yogurt and stir well until gelatin dissolves and yogurt is thickened. Pour into individual glasses and refrigerate for at least two hours or until set.

Wash the spinach thoroughly in cold running water. Cut off the stems. If the leaves are big cut in half lengthwise. Drain well and place in a large bowl. Mix in the soy sauce, sesame oil, green onion, sesame seeds, sugar and salt. Serve immediately.

Mix sausage and onion together. Heat the oil in a large skillet. Drain sausage mixture. Add sausage mixture to skillet. Cook for 5 minutes until sausage is cooked. Add corn kernels. Mix flour tortillas into the mixture. Stir well. Pour into a large baking dish. Make an egg mixture by beating the eggs with whole milk. Pour the egg mixture over the flour mixture. Sprinkle cheese on top. Bake at 375 degrees for 40-50 minutes. Sprinkle with scallions. Serves 4-6.

Peel and slice chayotes. Remove seeds. Cut into slices and place in baking dish. Layer onions and cheese over slices. Cover with eggs and season with salt and pepper. Cover with bread crumbs and dot with butter. Bake at 400 degrees for one hour.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 13-by-9-inch baking dish or two 9-inch baking dishes. In a large bowl, combine all dry ingredients and mix well with a fork or whisk. In a medium bowl or measuring cup, combine pie filling with juice and mix well with a whisk or fork. Combine the dry and wet mixtures and mix with a fork or whisk. In a small bowl or measuring cup, whisk together all of the ingredients and set aside. In a large bowl or measuring cup, whisk together the egg and milk and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter and sauté the orange sections and cherries. Once the cherries and oranges are well coated with the butter, remove from heat and pour them into the baking dish(es). Pour the batter into the baking dish(es) and gently spread the batter with a rubber spatula or wooden spoon to cover all of the fruit. Place the cobbler(s) into the oven and bake for

Melt butter in small skillet over medium heat. Add Worcestershire sauce, fresh lemon juice, garlic powder and black pepper. Cook 1 minute. Add shrimp. Cook 3 to 5 minutes or until shrimp are pink. Remove from heat. Stir in Tabasco sauce. Serve with lemon.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Cream together the butter and sugar until smooth and fluffy. Add egg and beat well. Sift together the flour, baking powder and soda and salt and add to butter mixture. Blend well. Add buttermilk and stir until smooth and batter will pour easily from spoon. Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes at 400 degrees or until golden brown on top and bottom. Cool for 2 minutes on cookie sheet and then transfer to wire rack to cool completely. Mix together the powdered sugar and milk and drizzle over the top of the warm pancakes. Serves 6-8 people.
Cut bread into 6 slices. Brush each slice of bread with the melted butter, then sprinkle with cinnamon sugar mixture. Broil 4-5 minutes until golden brown. Serve immediately with butter.

Dice potatoes and peel onion, mince garlic and chop onion. Place in a large saucepan with water and bring to a boil. Cook potatoes and onion until tender. Drain and cool slightly. While potatoes are cooling mix soup with paprika and pepper in a medium bowl. Add sour cream and stir well. Spread each slice of bread with one tablespoon of soup mixture and top with one slice of cheddar cheese. Place a slice of potato on each cheesy bread slice. Roll up and place in a shallow baking pan. Pour remaining soup over bread slices. Cover pan with foil and bake at 350 for approximately 15 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with paprika if desired. Enjoy!
Place chips on serving platter or individual serving bowls. Top each chip with scallion and salsa. Spread beans over chips. Top with cheese and guacamole. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x5 loaf pan. Beat eggs with sugar until thick and light yellow (about 2 minutes). Stir in oil and vanilla extract. In another bowl combine flour, salt, cinnamon, nuts and bananasstir into egg mixture until just blended. Pour batter into greased loaf pansprinkle top with chopped nuts. Bake for 55 to 60 minutes or until cake tests done (a toothpick inserted into center should come out clean). Cool cake 10 minutes before turning out of pan onto wire rack to cool completely.

Rinse beans. Put in small saucepan. Add oil and vinegar. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer for 30 minutes. Drain. Add tuna. Add onion. Add garlic cloves. Chop fresh parsley. Add to tuna mixture. Mix well. Serve cold.

In large saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add the orzo pasta and cook for about two minutes. Add the broth and bring to boil. Once boiling, add the rosemary and the chicken. Reduce heat. Cook for about ten minutes. Add the zucchini and tomatoes and cook until chicken is done. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with your favorite side dish.

Sauté bacon in large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet and reserve for serving. Add onions and green beans to bacon drippings in skillet and sauté until tender and onions are transparent. Add vinegar and sugar and simmer until sauce thickens and beans are tender, about 30 minutes. Serve beans warm or at room temperature.
Season the chicken with the garlic salt and pepper. Dip the chicken in the honey. Place the chicken tenders and drumsticks on a wire rack set over a baking sheet. Bake for 35 minutes or until tender.

Preheat oven to 350f. Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a large skillet and brown chicken on both sides. Add remaining oil and saute onion until tender and translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in corn and peas and season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and stir in the soup and stuffing mix until blended. Spoon mixture into a 9x13 baking dish and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until heated through and bubbly. Serve with extra Parmesan cheese on top.

Cream together margarine and sugar. Add molasses to melted margarine mixture. Stir in water. Add flour and mix until smooth. Add baking soda. Blend in 2 Tablespoons hot water. Bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes.

Heat the milk and cream in a small saucepan. Remove from the heat and add the vanilla bean. In a medium bowl, whisk together the cocoa powder, brown sugar and bittersweet chocolate. Add this mixture to the warm milk mixture. Whisk until the chocolate is completely melted. Add the fleur de sel and whisk again to dissolve. Pour into mugs. Sprinkle with marshmallows. Serve hot.

Put two graham cracker crusts on a 9x13 pan and press to fit the pan. In a saucepan, dissolve gelatin in cold water. Heat to dissolve gelatin. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and pour over crusts. Cool and refrigerate. Meanwhile, in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed, beat heavy cream and sugar until stiff peaks form. Beat in brandy. Beat in chocolate liqueur. Pour whipped mixture over gelatin layer. Refrigerate until set. Cut into 16 squares.

In a food processor, grind the fennel seed to a fine powder. In a large bowl, stir together the ground pork, fennel seed powder, salt and pepper. Make patties by hand and place on a foil lined cookie sheet. Sprinkle with maple syrup and drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until browned and cooked through.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix together the ground beef and dry bread crumbs. Mix in the onion, pepper and salt. In a large bowl combine the beef mixture with the broth and egg. Mix together. Form mixture into patties about 1 inch thick. Put in casserole and pour about 1 cup of water in the bottom of the casserole. Cook in 350 degree oven for about an hour. While the patties are cooking mix the mushrooms with water and cornstarch in a saucepan. Cook until the mixture thickens. When the patties are done and the liquid is almost absorbed into the patties take the patties out and spoon the mushroom sauce over the patties. This is an easy recipe to make for a meal that is easy to eat on the go.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook, stirring often, until softened, about 3 minutes. Add orange zest and juice and cook until zest is golden and liquid is reduced slightly. Add wine and cook until almost evaporated. Stir in cream of mushroom and cook until thickened. Add salt and pepper and stir until blended. Add pork chops and cook until browned. Transfer chops to a baking dish. Pour sauce over chops. Sprinkle chops with parsley. Bake until chops are fork tender, about 20 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. In a large bowl, whisk together the sugar, eggs, pumpkin puree, oil, flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon and clove. Mix until blended. Pour the batter into a greased 13-by-9-inch glass baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Serve warm. ( can be made with a 9x13-inch pan. )

Cut oranges in half and juice. Squeeze juice from oranges into a small bowl. Add the remaining orange juice and lemon juice to the bowl. Stir in the mustard and salt. Whisk in the olive oil. Drain lettuce and scallions and place them in a large bowl. Toss the salad with the dressing. Toss in the avocado. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Serve.

Combine frozen pea pods and water chestnuts in a 11/2-quart microwave-safe glass dish. Heat butter in a small saucepan. Add soy sauce and stir until dissolved. Add cornstarch and stir. Bring to a boil stirring constantly. Cook and stir for 3 minutes. Stir in ginger and pepper. Pour over peas and water chestnuts. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Cover and cook in the microwave on high for 3 minutes. Remove from the microwave and stir. Cook and stir for 2 minutes longer. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Cut cabbage into bite sized pieces and set aside. In a large bowl combine the oil, green chilies and onion. In a small bowl combine the garlic cloves, salt, and spices. Add the spice mixture to the oil mixture and stir. Add the cabbage and stir. Add the tuna and stir. Serve warm.

Melt butter in a large skillet. Add onion and garlic and saute over medium heat until onion is soft. Add mushrooms and wine. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer until mushrooms are tender and liquid has almost evaporated. Stir in sage. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

In a large pot or Dutch oven bring bacon and onion to a simmer over medium heat. Stir occasionally until onion is soft. Drain bacon reserving bacon grease and onion to serve on the side. Add pork and beans, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce and molasses to bacon and onion. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook until thickened and heated through approximately 15 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the mustard and reserved bacon grease and onion. Serve over hot cooked white rice or cornbread or with a biscuit.
Blend all the ingredients in a food processor. Transfer to a glass jar and refrigerate. It will keep for 1 to 2 weeks. Serve with pasta.

Heat butter and olive oil in a heavy pan over medium heat until hot. Add garlic and shallot and cook until softened, about 30 seconds. Add mushrooms and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Add green beans and cook until crisp-tender, about 10 minutes. Add stock and cook until liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and black pepper and serve immediately.

In large soup pot heat 2 tbsp. Oil over medium heat. Add sausage and cook 8-10 minutes or until browned. Add onion and cook 3-5 minutes. Add beans and stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes. Add collards and cook 5-10 minutes more. Stir in the vinegar and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve garnished with french bread.

Preheat a large skillet to medium heat. Cook bacon until brown and crisp. Set bacon aside on paper towels to drain. Add butter to bacon drippings in skillet. Add in chopped garlic and stir for 2 minutes. Add in chopped scallions. Cook for 1 minute. Add in eggs. Cook for 2 minutes. Add in cream. Season with salt & black pepper. Add in parmesan cheese. Toss to combine. Add in chopped basil. Toss to combine. Add in chopped flat-leaf italian parsley. Toss to combine. Garnish with additional chopped basil. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add celeriac and butter beanscook until tender and starting to brown, about 5 minutes. Stir in stock and bring to boilcook until reduced by half. Add remaining ingredients and bring to boil over high heatcook until celeriac is tender and butter beans are tender and creamy, about 15 minutes.

In large bowl combine yeast, water, sugar and salt. Stir well. Gradually add flour. Stir until well mixed. Turn dough onto floured surface. Knead dough 10 minutes or until smooth and elastic. Place dough in greased bowl, turning to grease top. Cover with cloth. Let rise until doubled in size. Punch down dough. Divide dough in half. Shape each half into ball and place each ball on greased cookie sheet. Spray dough with canola oil. Sprinkle each ball with salt, pepper and rosemary. Roll dough into logs about 10 inches long and 2 inches in diameter. Bake at 400 degrees F for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with garlic spread.

Sautee garlic and onion in a frying pan. Add mushrooms & tomatoes in puree, tomato puree & hamburger. Cook for 10 minutes then add ketchup & tabasco sauce. Add oregano & cook for 10 more minutes. Serve over pasta with a sprinkling of parmesan cheese & basil leaves.

Split the english muffins open. Spread butter on both halves. Cut cheddar and feta cheese into small pieces. Place english muffin halves face down in a non-stick skillet. Add butter to the skillet and heat until melted. Place eggs, cheese and black pepper in a small bowl. Pour egg mixture over english muffin halves in skillet. Cook until eggs are done. Remove english muffin halves and place on a plate. Serve immediately.

Remove prawns heads. Wash prawns under running water. Peel off the shells. Clean prawns. Take a pan. Heat 2 tbsp. Oil in it. Place prawns in the pan. Saute them on high flame till they turn red. Remove the prawns from the pan. Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilli paste and turmeric powder in the pan. Saute the paste on high flame for a few seconds. Add red chilli powder and salt. Mix well. Add the prawns. Cook on high flame for 3-4 minutes. Serve hot.

Wash and dry the chicken well with paper towels. Dip the chicken pieces in the flour mixture and set aside. In a skillet over medium heat melt the butter and add the garlic and cook for about 2 minutes or until tender and translucent. Add the garlic powder and salt and pepper and stir for about a minute. Remove from heat and set aside. Heat the oil in a skillet and fry the chicken in batches until golden brown and cooked through, about 4 minutes on each side. Remove from the oil and place on a paper towel lined plate to drain. Dust with the corn flake crumb mixture and bake in a preheated 425 degree oven for about 15 minutes or until golden and crisp. Serve hot with your favorite vegetable.

Bake Vidalia onions in 350 degree oven for about 15 minutes or until soft. In a greased skillet melt butter. Add onion. Stir in sour cream. Remove from heat. In a large bowl combine sour cream mixture, corn, skim milk and corn muffin mix. Mix well. Add eggs. In a greased skillet combine muffin mix batter with onions. Cook over medium heat for about 15 minutes or until brown. Sprinkle with dill weed. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes or until lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl beat eggs. Add butter and sugar. Blend until well incorporated. Add flour, vanilla extract, prune baby food. In a separate bowl stir together the black beans with milk. Add the milk mixture to the egg mixture. Stir in the cocoa. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 25-35 minutes. Serve with a dollop of cool whip or a cup of ice cold milk.

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowlbeat with a whisk. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Dip bread in battercoat both sides. Fry bread until golden brown. Transfer to a baking sheet lined with foil. Repeat with remaining bread. Transfer bread to a 9x13-inch baking dish. Pour custard mixture over bread. Bake at 350f for 45 minutes or until custard is set. Serve with maple syrup.

Cook tortellini according to package instructions, drain well. Place into a large mixing bowl. Add mayonnaise, cream, crabmeat, lemon juice and seasoning to taste with salt and pepper. Stir well until cream sauce is combined evenly with tortellini. Cover tortellini with plastic wrap and chill for several hours before serving. Serve cold.

Place all the ground almonds and sugar into a saucepan and add the brandy. Heat the mixture and stir for a few minutes until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is thick. Add the eggs and beat together. Gradually add the egg yolks and beat until you have a smooth mixture. Pour this mixture into a greased bowl and put it in the refrigerator. After half an hour, take it out of the fridge and stir the mixture. Once it has thickened it is ready. Roll the mixture into little balls and dust with powdered sugar. Place in a greased baking tray and bake in the oven for about 35 mins at a temperature of around 35 degrees.

In a large bowl combine 2 1/2 cups of the brown sugar, 1 tablespoon each of the kosher salt and cayenne pepper, and the paprika. Add the pork ribs to the bowl. Toss gently to coat. Place the ribs on the grill and cook for 1 hour. Turn the ribs and continue to cook for 1 hour more. Transfer the ribs to a platter. Serve immediately.

Slice bread in half. Spray each half with cooking spray. Place bread in a 9 x 13 pan. In a small bowl combine the butter and maple syrup. Stir to combine. Set aside. Place bacon in a shallow baking dish. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 15-20 minutes or until crisp. Cool. Chop bacon. Set aside. Break eggs into a small bowl. Whisk eggs. In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, bacon, salt, and pepper. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the mixture into each bread half. Top with remaining bread halves. Place in oven for 15-20 minutes or until eggs are set. Let stand for 5 minutes. To serve, spoon maple syrup mixture over tops.

In a large bowl, combine the whole wheat flour and all-purpose flour. Add the warm water and oil and stir well with a wooden spoon until a soft dough is formed. Knead the dough on a floured surface until smooth and elastic. Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel and let rise for about 30 minutes until doubled in volume. Punch the dough down and divide it into 6 equal pieces. Flatten each piece into a 1/2-inch-thick disk. Dust a baking sheet with flour. Place the dough on the sheet and flatten it gently with your hands to 1/4-inch thick. Cook the flatbreads on the baking sheet for 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Transfer the flatbreads to a wire rack and let cool.

In a heavy saucepan over medium heat melt butter. Add water, salt, pepper and garlic. Simmer until thickened, 4 to 5 minutes. Add brown sugar, cayenne pepper, maple syrup and fresh thyme and cook until carrots are tender, 12 to 15 minutes. Drain vegetables and serve.

Bring water and grape juice to a boil in a large saucepan. Add raisins and prunes and cook until prunes begin to pop, stirring occasionally. Add lemon juice and sugar and cook over medium-high heat until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes to thicken slightly. Add tapioca and salt and cook until tapioca is completely dissolved and fruit is tender but firm, about 5 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in cinnamon. Serve hot or cold. Top each serving with a dollop of sour cream or whipped cream if desired. Makes 6 servings.

Pour water into a large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Stir in sugar. Cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Pour gelatin into a small bowl. Pour 1/4 cup boiling water over gelatin. Stir until dissolved. Pour gelatin mixture into sugar mixture. Stir over low heat until thick. Remove from heat. Add vanilla extract. Pour into a greased 8-inch square baking dish. Let stand 4 to 5 hours or until firm. Using a large knife, cut into 16 squares. Place on wax paper. Roll in icing sugar. Refrigerate until firm. (Store in refrigerator.) Makes 16.

Pour bourbon over pork. Add honey, prepared mustard, and dried tarragon. Marinate for 30 minutes. Thread the pork onto skewers. Grill over high heat until done. Place the skewers on a platter and keep warm. Place the peaches and sweet potatoes on a platter. Drizzle with bourbon and the juice of half a lemon. Place the skewers on the platter. Serve immediately.

Saute onion and green peppers with ground beef until tender. Stir in salsa. Pour in can of beans and water. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add sour cream and green onions. Makes about 12 servings. Great for lunch!

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Spray baking dish with cooking spray. Dip fish fillet in butter then place in baking dish. Sprinkle bread crumbs, garlic powder, parmesan cheese, romano cheese over fish. Bake for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve.
Remove frozen okra from package and place in bowl with salad dressing. Toss well. Serve in individual bowls on top of lettuce and walnuts.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Mix all of the dry ingredients together and then stir in the corn. Make a well in the center of the corn mixture and add the eggs and then the cheese. Stir until combined. Pour oil into a large skillet to a depth of 1/2 inch. Heat oil over medium heat. Drop 2 tbspful of batter into skillet and cook until golden brown on both sides. Remove from skillet and drain on paper towels. Makes 10 to 12 corn fritters. Serve with syrup. Serves 4 to 6.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add prepared mustard and stir. Add brown sugar and dry onionsimmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add remaining ingredients and heat through. Serve over beef, pork or chicken. Serves 6.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add crumb cake mix and brown sugar to pan. Cook 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in milk and vanilla until smooth. Stir in cocoa powder until smooth. Remove from heat. In a large bowl, beat eggs and oil until blended. Gradually add to crumb mixture. Stir in cheese. Pour into a greased 13" x 9" baking pan. Bake 20 min. Cool 5 min. Top with powdered sugar.

Preheat the oven to 350. Grease a bread pan with butter. Add the butter to the bread pan. Peel the bananas and cut them into chunks. Add the frozen cranberries to the bread pan. Mix the eggs with the sugar. Add the vanilla extract and the butter. Whisk the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt together. Add the flour mixture to the bread pan. Pour the milk over the bread pan. Bake the bread for 45 minutes. Let it cool completely in the pan. Remove the bread from the pan. Frost with the glaze.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Melt butter in skillet and saute onion and garlic for 2 minutes. Add cheese and stir until melted. Mix in prepared horseradish and prepared mustard. In a small saucepan melt 1 cup beer over medium heat until it is just hot. Remove from heat and stir into cheese mixture. Stir in parsley and stir. Remove from heat and add to a serving dish. Sprinkle with freshly chopped chives. Serve warm.

Mix softened butter and cream cheese until light and fluffy. Add sugar gradually, mixing thoroughly after each addition. Beat in almond extract and vanilla. In separate bowl, sift together flour and almond mealgradually add to creamed mixture alternating with milk. Roll out to 1/8-inch thicknesscut into 4-inch circles. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool 1 minute on cookie sheetremove to wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350f. Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, egg and vanilla in large mixer bowl until light and fluffy. Add flour mixturebeat until well mixed. Shape dough into 1-inch balls. Flatten each ball into a disk. Roll in pecans. Dip disks into white chocolateplace on ungreased baking sheets. Bake 12-15 minutes. Cool 1 minute on baking sheets. Transfer cookies to wire racks to cool completely.

Wash potatoes. Prick potatoes with a fork. Rub with olive oil. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove potatoes from oven. Combine curry powder, pepper, onion powder, lemon juice, dill, salt. Drizzle over potatoes. Bake another 20 minutes.

Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. Add green curry paste and stir-fry until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the chicken and stir-fry until cooked through. Add the coconut milk and fish sauce and simmer until slightly thickened. Stir in the sugar and kaffir lime leaves. Add eggplant and bamboo shoots and cook until tender. Add basil and red chili peppers and stir-fry until fragrant. Add the cooked chicken and serve.

Wash the aubergines in a pan of cold water. Drain the aubergines well (dry them with a tea towel or paper kitchen roll). Cut the aubergines in half lengthways and then in half again so they are in quarters (see picture). Season the aubergines with salt. Heat a large amount of oil in a heavy-bottomed pan. Dip each aubergine half into the seasoned flour first, then into the batter. Fry the aubergines for 5 minutes on each side in the oil until they are golden brown and crisp. Drain the aubergines on kitchen paper. Serve hot with a fresh salad and some dipping sauce such as a minted yoghurt sauce or tahini sauce.

Cook the rice in the stock to which you have added curry powder to taste (2 or 3 teaspoons). Place the rice into the base of a pie dish. Place tomatoes in the centre of the rice. Cover with the breadcrumbs to form a crust. Sprinkle with grated cheese and bake in an oven at 180C/350F/gas 4 for about 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

Peel and boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain and return potatoes to pan. Add milk and cream cheese. Mash until desired consistency is achieved. Add salt and pepper to taste. Top with chopped chives.

Heat a skillet with extra virgin olive oil and saute garlic for 1 minute. Add shrimp. Cook for 2 minutes. Add lime juice and oregano. Cook for 3 minutes. Toss with angel hair pasta. Top with parmesan cheese.

Heat 1 tablespoon butter and sauté the sliced onions over medium heat until translucent. Add the garlic cloves to the pan. Add salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Set aside. Meanwhile, whisk 6 eggs with 3/4 cup milk. Heat 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large ovenproof pan over medium heat. Pour the milk-egg mixture into the pan. Sprinkle the top with a little salt. Cook over moderate heat until the eggs set around the edges. Place the pan in the oven. Bake for 10 minutes. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon grated cheddar cheese over the top. Return to the oven. Bake until the top is golden brown. Sprinkle remaining 3/4 cup grated cheddar over the top. Return to the oven. Bake until the top is golden brown. Let the frittata sit for 5 minutes before cutting. Serve with sour cream. Serve with crusty bread.

Form 4 equal sized patties with ground beef. Cook each patty on the grill for 4 to 6 minutes per side. In a small bowl combine 1/4 cup old bay seasoning with 1/2 cup pretzel crumbs. Form into 4 equal sized patties with ground beef. Cook each patty on the grill for 4 to 6 minutes per side. In a small bowl combine 1/4 cup old bay seasoning with 1/2 cup pretzel crumbs. Place the patties on the roll. Spread the pretzel mixture on top of each patty. Place the roll bottoms on the bun top and serve.

Preheat the oven to 200c/180c fan/gas 6. Cut the bread into squares and place in the oven for 5 minutes. Remove and coat each slice with melted butter. Spread each slice with a layer of grated cheese. Heat oil in a frying pan and fry the bread slices for 1-2 minutes on each side until golden brown. Place on a plate lined with kitchen paper. Make a well in the centre of each bread slice and crack an egg into it. Sprinkle with a little flour and salt. Using a rolling pin, gently roll the bread slice around to make the egg white even. Dip the egg white into the bread and place on a baking tray. Bake for 5 minutes. Flip the egg white and bake for a further 5 minutes. Repeat with the remaining egg whites. Meanwhile, cut the chicken fillets into strips. Dip the fillet strips into the flour and shake off the excess. Place the fillet strips on a tray lined with kitchen paper. Heat the remaining oil in a frying pan and

In large bowl with mixer, beat cream cheese until fluffy. Add butter, sugar, vanilla sugar and light cream. Beat until creamy. Add eggs one at a time. Mix well. In large bowl with mixer, beat 1 cup cream cheese with noodles until well blended. Add farmer cheese. Add egg mixture. Turn into 9x13 pan. Sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar. Pour plum filling over cream cheese mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.
Bring water to a boil. Remove from heat. Place tea bags in water and let steep for 15 minutes. Remove tea bags and stir in sugar and lemon juice. Serve over ice.

Peel and cube the potatoes into small pieces. Place in large pot and cover with water. Add a pinch of salt. Bring water to a boil and cook for about 15 minutes until potatoes are soft. Drain water and set aside. Melt butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened. Add the potatoes and the stock and milk. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Cover and simmer for about 10 minutes until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat and stir in the remaining butter. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Heat oven to 220c/425f/gas 7. Put mushrooms on a baking tray and drizzle with olive oil, thyme, caster sugar and lemon juice. Roast for 10 minutes or until tender. Cool slightly. Put green beans on a baking tray with a little olive oil, thyme leaves and a drizzle of lemon juice. Roast for 10 minutes or until crisp tender. Cool slightly. Put spinach leaves on a baking tray with a drizzle of olive oil. Roast for 8 minutes or until wilted. To serve, place mushrooms on a large platter with some of their liquid. Arrange green beans on top of mushrooms and arrange spinach leaves on top of green beans. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
In a large skillet brown ground beef and onion with oil. Add pepper flakes to taste and diced tomatoes. Cook till heated through. Pour into buns and serve with extra sauce.

Trim off the ends of the garlic cloves. Heat a saute pan over medium heat. Add oil. Add garlic cloves and saute until lightly browned. Add salt, pepper, thyme and savory. Add fingerling potatoes and saute until tender. Remove garlic cloves and serve. Serve with grated Parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut squash in half lengthwise. Scrape out seeds. Brush cut sides with oil and place in an ungreased 9x13 pan. Cut onions and carrots into small pieces and mix in a bowl with the soup and sour cream. Fill squash shells with mixture. Sprinkle each shell with chicken stove top stuffing mix. Bake for 30 minutes.

Squash should be cut to make 10 servings. Place squash in a 4-quart saucepan and add enough cold water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until squash is tender but still firm. Drain well. Place squash in a large bowl. Add evaporated milk and eggs. Stir well. Add cinnamon and honey and stir well. Pour filling into unbaked shells. Bake at 350 F for 45 minutes or until knife inserted into center comes out clean.

Pour juice cocktail and tequila into a blender. Blend until smooth. Pour into an ice cube tray. Freeze. When frozen, remove from the tray and place in a large freezer safe plastic bag. Seal the bag and place in freezer for several hours. To serve, insert a popsicle stick in the bottom of the frozen cube and place in the freezer until ready to serve.

Sprinkle pork with salt and pepper and brown in 2 teaspoons of butter in ovenproof skillet. Drain off excess fat. Transfer meat to a baking dish and cover with flour, butter and onionbake for 25 to 30 minutes at 375 degrees or until meat is tender. Place in warm oven 15 minutes before serving. Drain apples from cider. Put in skillet with pork juices from baking dish. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add mushrooms, cider and apple juice. Cook for 2 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Put into serving dish with pork. Serve with pan juices as gravy.
Peel beets and thinly slice. In a large bowl, mix beets with vinaigrette dressing. Add mixed greens. Sprinkle with ground black pepper. Top with walnuts and goat cheese. Serve chilled.

Melt the butter and 2/3 c. of the sugar together in a saucepan over low heat. Add the corn syrup and stir until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter. Pour onto a silpat lined sheet tray. Spread into a rectangle about 2x8 inches. Sprinkle with the corn flakes. Press down with your hands and then refrigerate until hard. Break into pieces and store in an air tight container.

Melt the butter in a saucepan. Stir in the chili powder and cinnamon. Add the salt and cayenne. Cook for 3 minutes. Peel and slice yams. Place the yams in a baking pan. Cover the yams with the butter mixture. Bake at 400 for 45 minutes.

Sift flour and almonds into a large mixing bowl. Set aside. Cream butter and icing sugar in an electric mixer until creamy and smooth. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Fold in the dry ingredients with the mixer and add lemon rind and stir through. Turn mixture onto a lightly floured surface and roll out to about 1/2cm thick. Using a 3cm round cutter or cookie cutter, cut out 25 circles of friand dough. Place the circles onto a baking tray lined with baking paper. Brush each circle with egg white and sprinkle with a little icing sugar. Bake friands in the oven for 15 minutes or until golden brown and firm to the touch. Allow to cool slightly before transferring them onto a wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm or cold with butter and jam.
Wash and peel potatoes. Slice in 1/4 inch thickness. Toss in oil and season with old bay seasoning and salt. Spread out on cookie sheet. Bake at 425 degrees for 20 - 25 minutes or until golden brown.

Prepare deep dish pie shell and fill with your favorite fruit. In a small bowl combine sugar and flour. Stir in cinnamon. Sprinkle over fruit. Top with remaining fruit. Bake in 450 degree oven for 10 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 375 and bake an additional 30-40 minutes or until fruit is tender. Cool before serving. Makes 8 servings.

Peel and cut potatoes into 1-inch cubes. Boil in water for 15 to 20 minutes or until potatoes are fork tender. While potatoes cook, heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add potatoes and sauté until all are coated. Add cumin, cinnamon and water and bring to a boil. Simmer 10 minutes. Stir in crushed tomatoes and simmer another 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Remove roast from refrigerator 30 minutes before cooking. Combine onions, potatoes, onion soup mix, cornstarch and salt and pepper to taste in crock pot. Add beef. Cover and cook on high for 3 hours. Transfer meat to platediscard vegetables. Skim any fat from liquid. Stir cornstarch into liquid until dissolved. Add dry red wine and stir to blend. Cover and cook on high for 1 hour or until gravy is thick. Serve gravy with beef. Reheat beef and vegetables in microwave before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Wash potatoes with a mild soap such as dawn. Peel potatoes. Cut potatoes into large chunks. Boil potatoes 10 to 15 minutes. Drain potatoes. Let potatoes cool. Mix potatoes with cream cheese. Add milk. Add onion salt. Stir well. Mix in paprika. Mix in fresh ground pepper. Place potatoes on cookie sheet. Brush with butter. Bake potatoes for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Garnish potatoes with chopped parsley.

In a saucepan over medium heat, cook sausage and drain on paper towels. Stir in broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and stir in cream and sausage drippings. Simmer until gravy is thickened and slightly reduced. Stir in bouillon and season with pepper and salt. Melt butter over medium heat in skillet. Stir in Wondra and blend well. Pour over gravy and serve warm with biscuits or corn muffins.

In a small bowl whisk together the mustard, oil, lemon juice, salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Set aside. Rinse cabbages, bell peppers and snow peas under cold running water to remove dirt. Drain well. Slice cabbages into 1/4-inch thick rounds using a sharp knife or mandoline. Chop bell peppers into thin strips using a sharp knife or mandoline. Chop snow peas into thin strips using a sharp knife or mandoline. Transfer to a bowl. Whisk the dressing to distribute the oil and lemon juice through the vinaigrette evenly. Drizzle the dressing over the cabbage mixture and toss to coat well. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to allow the flavors to marry. Just before serving toss with the crumbled blue cheese to taste. Serve with a fork or chopsticks.

Dissolve sugar in water in a large glass. Cut lychees in half lengthwise and remove pit. Add to the syrup. Squeeze the lime juice and add to the syrup mixture. Add the sparkling wine to the syrup mixture and stir until the sparkling wine is dissolved and the lychees are covered in syrup. Transfer the lychees to the serving glasses. Garnish each with a slice of lime. Serve chilled.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly coat a baking dish or a sheet pan with cooking spray. Place the chicken in the pan and sprinkle evenly with the shallots and mushrooms and half of the thyme and salt and pepper and then top with the mozzarella and sprinkle evenly with the remaining thyme and salt and pepper. Bake in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve and garnish with the parsley or chives.
Combine all ingredients. Stir to blend. Pour into a 2-quart casserole. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and cool slightly. Serve warm.

Cut celery stalks in half and wash thoroughly. Put celery in salted water and bring to a boil for 15 minutes. Drain celery in colander and pat dry with paper towel. Butter inside of 11 x 7 inch baking dish and place celery in bottom of baking dish in one layer. Top with thinly sliced ham. Cover with cheese and cover with breadcrumbs to prevent cheese from sticking to baking dish. In medium bowl, whisk together cream and flour until smooth and stir in chicken broth. Add cream mixture to melted butter in small saucepan and bring to a boil over low heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and slowly pour mixture over celery and ham in baking dish and cover with foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and cook 15 minutes longer until celery is tender and top is golden brown. Serve with salad or rice casserole.

Preheat grill. Rub salmon with oil, salt and pepper and place skin-side down on grill or broil in oven (350 degrees) for 10 minutes or until almost cooked through (check internal temperature with a meat thermometer to be sure). Remove from grill or oven and let rest for 5 minutes before serving. Meanwhile, place rosemary and lemon slices in a large resealable plastic bag with lemon juice, marsala wine and capersseal bag and shake to coat. Place salmon on foil-covered baking sheet and top with caper mixture. Grill or broil 2 to 3 minutes or until salmon is fully cooked through (internal temperature should be 145 degrees). Remove from grill or oven and serve with lemon slices and caper mixture.

Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and ginger and sauté until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the jalapeno and sauté for another minute or so. Add the tomatoes and sauté until they soften, about 10 minutes. Add salt and sugar to taste. Add a teaspoon of water if too thick and stir until it's smooth. Transfer to a blender and process until smooth and creamy. Set aside. In a pan, heat some water and add enough salt so that it's almost salty enough to cook rice. Add a teaspoon of fenugreek leaves and boil for about two minutes. Remove from heat and add cream to the pan and mix well. Add the malai to this mixture and mix well. Add the paneer and mix well with a spatula. Keep aside to marinate for about a half an hour before serving. This is a wonderful appetizer with rice crackers and other snacks or with a sandwich as a main course. The malai can be prepared a day or two before you serve it to make life easier for you. You can also free

Cook brown lentils in boiling water for 25 minutes until tender. Drain. Roughly chop red onions. Remove skin from cucumber. Cut cucumber into 8 wedges. Mix with lentils. Add tomatoes to mixture. Finely chop mint leaves. Stir in mint leaves. Squeeze lemon juice over salad. Add olive oil. Taste salad and add more lemon juice or olive oil if desired. Cook halloumi in a large frying pan until golden. Drain halloumi. Serve salad topped with halloumi. Brush halloumi with 2 tablespoons of plain flour. Fry in a large frying pan until golden. Serve with salad.
