Pour 1/2 cup maple syrup and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract into a bowl. Add 1 cup water to a medium saucepan and bring to boiling over high heat. Add rice to boiling water and stir to combine. Cook for 2 minutes or until water is absorbed into rice. Remove from heat. Stir in maple syrup mixture and cinnamon, allspice, nutmeg and cranberries. Place tofu slices over top. Cover with foil and place into 375 degree F (190 degree C) oven to warm for 40 minutes or until tofu is heated through. Serve topped with almonds. Serve warm.

In small saucepan over medium heat, bring sugar and 1 cup water to simmer. Add gingersimmer 2 minutes. Stir in fruitsimmer 5 minutes or until juice begins to run clear. Serve warm or cold. Store in refrigerator for up to 3 days.

Prepare black bean garlic sauce by combining all ingredients in a blender or food processor until smooth. Heat the oil and sesame oil over medium-high heat. Add the cabbage and cook for about 5 minutes until softened. Add the scallion to the cabbage and cook for 1 minute more. Add the black bean sauce to the cabbage mixture and cook for 2-3 minutes until heated through and combined well. Serve immediately.

Bring water to boil in saucepan. Add ginger and steep for 5 minutes. Pour through fine mesh strainer into cup or thermos. Stir in honey to taste. Serve immediately or chill overnight for a cold and flu tea to drink the next day. Add lemon juice to taste if desired.

Place ham in 4-qt. slow cooker. In small bowl, combine brown sugar and mustard. Pour over ham. Pour 1 can (12 oz.) of cola over ham. Add 1 can (12 oz.) of cola. Cook 3 hours. Let stand 5 min before slicing.

Saute the bacon and kielbasa until crisp. Remove to paper towel to drain. Cut the potatoes into quarters and boil until fork tender. Place the potatoes and bacon with the kielbasa back into the pot and stir in the flour and the caraway seed. Simmer for 5 minutes and then stir the cider vinegar and sour cream into the potato mixture until blended. Stir in the cabbage and cook for 25 minutes until tender and serve with hot bread.

In large skillet, saute apples and onions over medium heat until tender (about 10 minutes). Meanwhile, combine all dry ingredients and cut in butter until mixture is crumbly and clumps together. Stir in apples and onions and apple juice. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes stirring occasionally. Cool completely before serving. Refrigerate leftovers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a blender or food processor, blend tofu, oil, maple syrup, salt, vanilla extract until smooth. Pour into a greased 1-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with walnuts. Bake in preheated oven for about 40 minutes or until set.

Dust halibut steaks with salt and pepper and then dip them in butter. Place steaks in a shallow baking dish and top each steak with a scallion and a couple of drops of worcestershire sauce. Roast at 450 degrees for about 15-20 minutes depending on thickness of steaks or until they reach an internal temperature of about 145 degrees. Serve with parsley and lemon wedges on the side as a garnish.

In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, green onions, pickle juice, vinegar and sugar. Season with salt and pepper. In a large bowl, combine coleslaw mix and the chicken. Pour the mayonnaise mixture over the coleslaw and toss. Serve on slider buns. Top with barbecue sauce.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat olive oil. Add yellow onions and saute until tender but not browned. Add frozen white corn. Pour fat free sodium free chicken broth over corn mixture. Add fresh rosemary leaves. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the salt and white pepper. Serve hot.

Remove the tails from the scallops, season with salt and freshly ground pepper and sautee them lightly in a small amount of olive oil on a medium heat for 2 minutes. Add the scallops to a large bowl along with the remaining olive oil and sauteed garlic, add the juice of one lemon, 2 tablespoons of vermouth and a handful of freshly chopped basil leaves. Serve immediately or keep refrigerated until ready to serve. To serve, place a handful of cherry tomatoes on the plate and spoon the sauce around the scallops. Finish with a pinch of freshly chopped basil leaves.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Season the chicken with dijon-style mustard, mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, and ritz cracker crumbs. Place the chickens in a baking dish and pour the marinade evenly on top. Bake the chicken in the oven for 15 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from the oven and transfer the chicken to a platter. Let the chicken sit for 10 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to mix and the juices to settle back into the chicken.

In large skillet over medium-high heat add oil. Sauté red onion until golden. Add garlic, bell peppers, zucchini. Stir occasionally. Add tomatoes. Stir to coat. Add salt and pepper to taste. Simmer covered for 20 minutes. Stir occasionally. Serve.

Heat the oven to 350F (180C). Put the onion and garlic into a large, heavy-based saucepan and cook over a moderate heat for about 5 minutes until softened but not browned. Add the beans, thyme and bay leaves and enough water to cover by about an inch. Bring to the boil then simmer until the beans are tender and have absorbed most of the water (about an hour). Strain and discard the thyme and bay leaves. Season and add the olive oil and black pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350F. Grease or flour a baking sheet. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Add the flour mixture and blend until combined. Pour the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Roll out to 1/2-inch thickness. Cut into 1-inch squares and place on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Mix well. Pour into graham cracker pie crust. Refrigerate for a few hours. Serve with fruit.

Sort through black-eyed peas and discard any that have shriveled. Place peas in a large saucepan and cover with water. Bring the water to a boil over medium heat. Cook the peas until just tender but still firm. Drain the peas in a colander and set aside. Remove the peas from the heat. Peel the garlic cloves and mince the garlic. Place the garlic and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a blender. Add the peanut butter and blend until smooth. Add the sage, vinegar, and cayenne pepper. Add the cooked black-eyed peas and the remaining salt and pepper. Blend until smooth. Serve with crackers or pita bread.
Brown celery and onions in oil. Add rice. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Stir in corn and remaining ingredients. Cook 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Spray a 12-muffin tin with cooking spray. Using a 1/4-cup measuring cup, fill each muffin cavity with a dollop of butter and 1 teaspoon of egg mixture. Sprinkle each with a pinch of paprika. Top with a slice of ham and 1/4 cup shredded cheese. Set muffin tin into a roasting pan filled with 1-inch of boiling water and bake for 15 minutes or until egg mixture is set and cheese is melted. Top with 1/4 cup chopped green onions for garnish, if desired and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place steaks on rack of broiler pan. Brush with olive oil. Place garlic cloves on top of steaks. Sprinkle with brown sugar and soy sauce. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon harissa. Sprinkle with thyme. Cook on broiler pan 6 to 8 minutes or to desired degree of doneness.

In a large bowl combine evaporated milk, meat and oats. Mix well. Form into meatball sized portions. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes. While meatballs are baking prepare sauce. In a small saucepan combine catsup, brown sugar, onion and liquid smoke. Stirring constantly, bring to a boil. Simmer for about five minutes until thick. Pour sauce over meatballs.

Soak dill pickle spears in water until tender, about one hour. Drain pickles and discard soaking liquid. Dissolve sugar in waterstir in cherry drink mix and pickles. Cover and refrigerate at least one hour and up to two days before serving. These pickles are best served cold.

In a saucepan with a candy thermometer over low heat add the unsweetened chocolate and sugar and stir until melted. Remove from heat. In another saucepan add the coffee and salt. Bring to boil. Remove from heat. In another saucepan with a candy thermometer add the milk. Bring to boil. Remove from heat. In a blender combine the cream with the unsweetened chocolate mixture. Add the boiling coffee mixture and the hot milk mixture. Blend until smooth. Pour into a large bowl and add the whipping cream. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.

Beat eggs with a fork. Add butter and flour. Add garlic salt and parsley flakes and beat well. Put 1/3 of the mixture in the center of each crescent dinner roll. Sprinkle with onion salt. Roll up and press seams to seal. Place rolls in an ungreased 13-in. x 9-in. baking pan. Cover with foil and bake at 350 F. for 20-25 minutes. When done, sprinkle with french-fried onions.

In a large saucepan, saute the bacon until crisp over medium heat. Remove from the heatdrain on paper towels. Stir the onion into the hot bacon fat until tenderadd the remaining vegetables. Saute until tenderstir in the soup and milk until heated through. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Ladle into individual bowlsgarnish each serving with chives. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.
Saute onions and celery. Add carrots. Saute 5 min. Add peas. Saute 2 min. Add stock. Bring to boil. Reduce to simmer for 5 min. Add salt and pepper. Makes 8 cups.
Whisk together the vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper. Whisk in the olive oil. Toss with arugula and fennel. Toss with lettuce. Sprinkle with mint. Serve.
Mix together cake mix and water and pour into cupcake tins. Bake according to package directions and let cool completely. Top with frosting and enjoy!

Prepare and cut pork tenderloin into 1-inch thick steaks (see notes). Place steaks into a shallow glass dish and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. In a food processor or blender, combine the chipotle peppers and garlic cloves with the lime juice and blend until smooth and creamy. Transfer the mixture to a serving bowl or platter and set aside to let the flavors blend for at least 20 minutes. Grill pork tenderloin over medium heat for about 10 minutes per side, depending on the thickness of the cuts. Remove pork from heat and let rest for 5 minutes before serving with strawberry-avocado salsa (see notes). Serve with corn or flour tortillas on the side and garnish with scallions and cilantro.

Spray foil with nonstick cooking spray. In the center of each tortilla, place about 1/3 cup chopped spinach and spread with about 1 tablespoon mayonnaise and about 1 tablespoon cream cheese. Roll up and place seam side down on prepared foil. Spread each with about 1 teaspoon each mayonnaise and sour cream. Sprinkle with onion flakes and bacon bits. Drizzle with Tabasco sauce. Roll up again and place seam side down on prepared foil. Fold foil to form a double envelope around roll-ups. Wrap foil tightly around rolls to hold in moisture. Place on baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees f for 15 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Unwrap foil. Serve with hot sauce on the side.

Cut tortillas into 6 triangles and set aside. In large skillet over medium heat, saute onion in oil until soft. Stir in taco seasoning mix, cheese, and cottage cheese until cheese is melted. Pour over 1/2 of cooked noodles. Spoon 1/2 of chicken mixture over noodles. Cover with remaining 1/2 of cooked noodles. Spoon on 1/2 of picante sauce. Sprinkle with olives and cheese. Cover pan with foil and bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake 10 more minutes or until cheese is melted. Garnish with cilantro if desired.

Cut strawberries in half and set aside. Place a small amount of black decorating gel on a piece of wax paper. Flip the paper over and place a small amount of gel on top of that. Place a piece of red licorice on top of that and then place a mini chocolate chip on top of that. Repeat until all the gel and licorice is used up. Place each mouse on a piece of wax paper and use a toothpick to stick a small amount of cheese on each mouse. Place slivered almonds on top of each mouse for ears. Refrigerate until firm.

Wash and trim the ends of the asparagus. Place in a baking dish. Combine the olive oil and lemon juice in a small bowl. Season with the salt and pepper and pour over the asparagus. Bake at 350 for about 15 minutes or until asparagus is tender. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese and broil for 5 minutes until the cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a baking sheet. On a large rimmed baking sheet, arrange the potatoes in a single layer. Spray with cooking spray. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until tender. Cut into wedges. Mix mayonnaise and parsley. Spread mayonnaise mixture evenly over the top of the wedges. Top with cheese and tuna. Bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve.
Mix all of the ingredients together except the noodles. Cut noodles into 1 inch lengths. Boil noodles. Stir noodles into the other ingredients. Add more cottage cheese if needed.

Mix honey, butter, mustard together. Add chicken pieces & curry powder & cayenne pepper. Mix well. Marinate for at least 1/2 hour. Place chicken pieces in a shallow baking pan. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F. oven for 30 minutes or until done.

In a medium saucepan, heat the beans and water to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to a simmer. Simmer for 10 to 15 minutes until the beans are tender. Drain the beans. In a large bowl, combine the beans, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, mustard and garlic powder. Stir in the hot dogs. In a medium bowl, combine the cornbread mix with the buttermilk. Mix until blended. Pour the cornbread mixture into an 8x8 inch greased pan. Bake for 15 minutes. Top with the hot dog mixture. Bake for another 10 minutes. Serve warm with chips or celery.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine all of the dry ingredients. In a separate bowl, combine the eggs and milk. Add to the dry mixture and combine. Press mixture into a 9x13 pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the pan and cool. Slice into bars and store at room temperature.

Melt the butter and brown sugar in a heavy saucepan over medium-low heat and stir constantly until the mixture boils and a candy thermometer registers 260 degrees F (soft ball stage). Stir in the evaporated milk and cook until mixture boils again and the candy thermometer registers 278 degrees F (hard ball stage). Remove from heat and stir in the marshmallow creme and the butterscotch chips. Stir in the almond brickle chips and the pecans and refrigerate for several hours until the fudge is firm and cold. Store in airtight container in refrigerator.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the rice and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Add the broth and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low and cook until the liquid is absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from the heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and season with the salt. Set aside. Add the coconut milk and the cilantro to the rice. Stir and season with pepper. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Transfer the rice to a serving dish and serve. Top with peas and cashews.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C). Season chicken breasts on both sides with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Place chicken breast halves in a single layer in a large, shallow baking pan. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour or until juices run clear when thickest part of chicken is pierced with a fork. Add 1 1/2 cups of water to slow cooker. Add wild rice to slow cooker. Cook on low for 6 hours or until rice is tender and cooked through. Add chicken to slow cooker, stirring to coat chicken with wild rice mixture. Stir in lemon juice. Cook on low for 10 more minutes or until chicken is heated through. Stir in parsley just before serving.

Boil pasta according to directions on package. Drain well. Meanwhile, brown hamburger in skillet and drain well. Put cooked pasta in bottom of 9x13 pan. Layer with hamburger mixture, tomato sauce and tomato paste. Sprinkle with oregano and parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until heated through. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving. Serve with Italian bread if desired.

Drain a can of chicken broth into a small bowl. In a mixing bowl, mix the egg with a fork. Add the pork rinds and garlic to the egg. Mix well. Add the broth and seasonings to the egg mixture. Mix well. Dip the chicken breasts into the egg mixture and then into the breadcrumb mixture. Bake in a pre-heated 350 degree oven for 35 minutes. Serve with your favorite side.

Combine water and tea bags in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add sugar and baking soda. Stir until dissolved. Let mixture stand for 10 minutes. Serve over ice. For a stronger tea, add more tea bags.

Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add sake and ginger and bring to a boil, stirring constantly until liquid evaporates and ginger is fragrant. Add shrimp and stir until shrimp is cooked through (about 1 minute). Add mushrooms and cook until mushrooms are cooked through (about 3 minutes). Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add soy sauce and stir to coat shrimp and mushrooms with soy sauce mixture. Add tomatoes and cook for another minute until tomatoes are just softened. Stir in rice and cook until heated through. Remove from heat and serve immediately over rice.
Melt butter and cook onions and celery until soft. Add bisquick and mix well. Add tuna and milk and cook for 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Bake crusts for 8-10 minutes or until lightly golden. Let cool. Beat butter with granulated sugar until light and fluffy. Add flour and beat until smooth. Add eggs one at a time, beating until smooth. Mix in vanilla extract. Fold in buttermilk. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until golden. Let cool completely. Beat remaining butter with granulated sugar until light and fluffy. Fold in chocolate morsels. Spread evenly over pie filling. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight. Serve at room temperature or cold.

Cream together margarine and sugar. Mix in eggs and vanilla. Add flour and baking powder and soda. Add zucchini and carrot. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheets and bake at 425 degrees for 12-15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease a 9 x 13 pan. Blend together the flour, Crisco, salt and sugar. Mix well. Mix together the fruit. Add to the batter mixture. Pour mixture into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 400 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes. Let cool before cutting.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Heat olive oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add the yellow onions and cook for 15 minutes. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute. Pour the cooked onions into a shallow baking dish and sprinkle with 2 teaspoons of kosher salt. Place the dish into the oven for 25 to 30 minutes. Remove the dish from the oven. Whip the sour cream with the chevre and chives. Transfer the caramelized onions to the bowl of sour cream mixture. Taste and adjust seasoning with additional salt if desired. Serve warm with chips or vegetables.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Cream the butter and vanilla extract together. Sift the flour and soda together. Add to the butter mixture alternating with the milk. Stir in the pecans. Drop by tablespoons onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes until golden brown.

Dissolve yeast in warm water in large mixing bowl. Add sugar, salt, milk and butter. Mix well. Add enough flour to form a soft dough. Knead on well-floured surface until dough is smooth and elastic. Place in greased bowl and allow to rise until doubled in bulk. Punch down dough and knead again. Roll dough into balls. Place on greased cookie sheets. Allow to rise until doubled in bulk. Bake at 400f for about 10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.

Place flour in a small bowl. Add broth and stir with a whisk until smooth. Add cornstarch. Stir until blended. Add preserves and vinegar and stir until blended. Transfer mixture to a shallow baking dish. Arrange the chicken in the dish. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Bake at 375 for 40-50 minutes. Serves 6.

Peel potatoes. Cut into 1/4-inch thick slices. In a large bowl, stir together butter and flours until crumbly. Season with salt and pepper. Add potatoes and toss until completely coated. In a medium saut pan, cook potatoes over medium heat until golden brown on all sides. Transfer to a bowl. Add half-and-half to saut pan. Add thyme leaves, nutmeg and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Add potatoes to half-and-half mixture and simmer until potatoes are just tender. Add to potatoes to saut pan. Cover and bake in preheated 350 degree oven until potatoes are tender. Remove from oven. Top potatoes with cheese. Place in oven until cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Combine sugar and flour in medium bowlgradually add milk, stirring with whisk until smooth. Beat butter with electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy. Add vanilla extractbeat until blended. Gradually add sugar mixture to butterbeat until blended and spreadable.

Mix white cake mix according to package directions. Beat eggs. Add eggs, oil, sprite to cake mix. Bake according to package directions. When cake is cool, mix pistachio pudding mix with milk. Add cool whip to pudding mixture. Frost cake with frosting. Sprinkle with chopped pistachio nuts.
Combine peach nectar and the juices in a large pitcher. Stir in the rum and sugar. Stir in the wine and serve over ice cubes in large punch bowl. Makes about 1 gallon of punch.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook the rice according to package directions and drain. Stir together condensed cream of celery soup and water in large bowl. Add rice and cooked chicken pieces. Stir in scallion. Pour into an ungreased 11x7x2 baking dish. Top with longhorn cheese. Bake 30 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Place 2 cups angel food cake in serving dishes. Top with 2 cups crushed pineapple. Combine 1 cup pineapple juice and 1 cup water. Stir in 1 cup instant pudding mix. Pour over crushed pineapple. Top with 1 cup Cool Whip. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Top with strawberries.

Cut asparagus spears at an angle about 1 inch above the bottom of the spear and then trim the bottoms of the spears at an angle for easy holding by hand. Place 3 spears in each hand and fold together. Place 3 spears on a serving plate and place 3 prosciutto slices on top of the bundle of spears, overlapping each slice slightly. Place 1/3 cup of olive oil in a small bowl and whisk with the lemon juice to emulsify. Drizzle each bundle with about 1 teaspoon of the oil mixture and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Peel bananas. Cut them into 1/2 inch slices. In a saut pan melt dark chocolate. Dip bananas into dark melted chocolate. Place banana slices on toasted bread. Melt Amarula cream. Drizzle Amarula cream over bananas. Sprinkle walnuts over bananas. Bake bananas at 350 degrees F. until they are soft. Serve warm.

Bring a medium pot of water to a boil. Add green beans to the pot of water. Boil green beans for 3-4 minutes. Remove green beans from water using a slotted spoon. In a medium pan heat butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic clove to the butter. Add green beans to the pan along with the stock. Bring green bean mixture to a boil. Remove green bean mixture from the heat. Once the green bean mixture has cooled down add the parmesan cheese and parsley. Stir the green bean mixture to combine. Add the light cream. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine. Serve warm.

Whisk cornstarch with 1 tablespoon cold water in small bowl. Set aside. In a small saucepan over medium-high heat, add the remaining 1 tablespoon of cold water. When the water comes to a boil, add sugar. Cook, stirring until sugar dissolves. Add soy sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add garlic clove. Simmer for about 3 to 4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove garlic. Add ginger. Simmer for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove ginger. Add vinegar. Simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Whisk cornstarch mixture into sauce. Whisking constantly, bring sauce to boiling. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add pineapple. Stir to combine. Brush chicken with sauce. Bake 350 degrees for about 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Serve.

Pop popcorn as directed. Melt butter, brown sugar, vanilla and baking soda together. Dump popcorn into a 9x13 pan. Pour over popcorn. Microwave uncovered on high 3 minutes. Remove from microwave and stir. Microwave 3 more minutes. Let stand for 1 minute before serving.
Mix all ingredients except bacon together. Pour into a 13-by-9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle bacon pieces over top. Bake 45 to 50 minutes at 350 degrees F. Top with crumbled bacon.

Blend banana with yogurt. Whisk in egg until smooth. Add cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder and water. Whisk until combined. Add flour. Whisk until blended. Heat a nonstick griddle over medium heat. Grease griddle with cooking spray. Spoon batter onto hot griddle. Cook until golden brown on both sides. Serve with powdered sugar.

In a large saucepan or dutch oven over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the sun-dried tomatoes and cook for 3-5 minutes until softened. Stir in the shrimp and cook for 5-7 minutes until the shrimp is pink and opaque. Remove the shrimp from the saucepan and set aside. Stir in the pesto sauce and cook for 2 minutes. Add the cooked pasta and stir well to coat. Stir in the whipping cream and chicken broth. Add the shrimp back into the saucepan and stir well to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Cook broccoli in boiling water. Drain and set aside. Melt 2 tbsp of butter in a small sauce pan. Sauté potatoes. Add broccoli. Season with salt & pepper. Set aside. Whisk eggs and water. Melt remaining 2 tbsp of butter in large bowl. Pour in eggs. Season with salt & pepper. Add potato mixture. Stir gently. Transfer to an oiled 8 x 8 pan. Bake 30 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Return to oven and bake 5 minutes more. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Serve with warm bread.
Combine flour and salt and pepper. Mix water and mustard to make a batter. Add flour mixture and mix. Add tomato and olive oil. Pour into a lightly oiled pie pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Cut bagels in half and spread each half with the mixture of mayonnaise and lemon juice. Mix all the ingredients for the shrimp salad, place on top of the bagel half and sprinkle with swiss cheese. Serve with the lemon wedge on the side for extra zip!

Heat oil in wok or large skillet over high heat. Add cashews. Stir-fry until golden brown. Add red chile and garlic. Cook for 1 minute or until fragrant, stirring constantly. Add pork fillets. Stir-fry about 10 minutes or until pork is tender and browned. Remove from heat. Remove pork from pan with slotted spoon. Drain excess oil from pan. Stir in soy sauce. Add greens and lime juice and zest to pan. Cook for 1 minute or until greens are slightly wilted. Add rice. Stir-fry until coated in sauce. Add papaya. Stir-fry until papaya is tender-crisp, about 2 minutes. Add pork. Stir-fry until pork is heated through, about 1 minute. Serve immediately over brown rice.

Melt the butter in a small pan over low heat. Add the lime juice and lemon juice and stir constantly until the mixture is thick and smooth. Season the sauce with salt and pepper and stir until the salt dissolves completely. Transfer the sauce to a small bowl and set aside until ready to use. In a large nonstick pan over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon of the butter. Add the yolks and whisk constantly until the sauce is thick enough for you to see the backs of your spoon and it is beginning to form a light golden color and thicken slightly, about 5 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat and slowly add the hot red pepper sauce, a little at a time, while whisking constantly. Add the orange juice and whisk until combined and the sauce is glossy and thick enough for you to see the backs of your spoon again and it is beginning to form a light golden color and thicken slightly, about 5 minutes more. Pour the sauce into a small bowl and season the sauce with salt and pepper and stir until the salt dissolves completely. Transfer the sauce back

Heat a large pot of water to boiling over high heat. Add green beans and cook until just tender, about 2 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer green beans with a little cooking liquid into a large bowl of ice water for about 2 minutes until cool. Drain and pat dry with paper towels. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the mushrooms in the butter until tender and golden, about 4 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute longer. Add the heavy cream and bring to a boil over medium heat. Add the green beans and simmer until heated through, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and parsley to taste. Serve hot. This would be a wonderful addition to a holiday menu!

Peel eggs. In a small bowl, stir together flour and mustard. In another small bowl, blend together half-and-half and salt. In a large saucepan, melt butter. Stir in flour and mustard mixture. Gradually stir in half-and-half mixture. Stir in pepper and paprika. Bring to a simmer. Remove from heat. Stir in eggs. Serve at once. Store unused eggs in refrigerator.

Peel the peaches. Cut the peaches into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Place the peaches in a bowl. Combine sugar and ice wine in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to boil then pour over peaches, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Let sit for 10 minutes. Drain the peaches into a bowl of cold water then drain again. Serve with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream. Makes 4 servings.

Prepare hamburger as desired. Brown the ground beef in skillet. Drain the meat and add the soup and green beans. Mix well. Divide the mixture into 12 individual casseroles or dishes. Bake in the oven at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 15 minutes or until heated through. Remove from the oven and top each serving with 2 tater tots.

In large pan over medium-high heat add olive oil and onion. Saute until onion is translucent, about 8-10 minutes, stirring frequently. Add bell pepper, garlic, cumin, chili powder and saute another 4-5 minutes. Add tomato, thyme, black pepper, salt and black beans. Simmer covered until beans are tender but not mushy. Serve over rice or tortillas.
Preheat oven to 350f. Whisk together eggs, milk, salt and pepper. Dip matzo in egg mixture. Place on greased cookie sheet. Brush top of matzo with butter. Bake for 15-20 minutes.

Trim ham of any excess fat or skin. Place ham in a baking pan with a lid. In a small bowl, combine mustard, sugar, salt, beer, apple cider vinegar, and bay leaves. Pour mixture over ham. Sprinkle with peppercorns if desired. Cover pan with lid and place pan in oven for 3-4 hours at 300f degrees. When ham is done baking, uncover pan and check ham with a meat thermometer. Ham is done when internal temperature is 150f degrees or higher. Remove ham from pan and serve warm with your favorite sides.

Peel rutabaga, turnip, potato. Peel the skin from the rutabaga if desired. Boil in enough water to cover for 20-30 minutes or until tender. Remove the potatoes from the water. Drain the turnips and rutabaga. In a large bowl combine the rutabaga, turnips and potatoes. Add the butter, cream and season to taste with salt and freshly ground pepper. Mash until smooth. Serve hot.

Preheat oven 350f. Heat oil and butter in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add garlic and onion and saute until softened, about 5 minutes. Add squash and cook until tender and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Stir in corn and green chilies and cook 2 minutes more. Transfer mixture to 8 x 8 inch baking dish. Top evenly with grated cheese and bake until cheese melts and browns on top, about 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Mix butter and sugars in large mixer bowl until smooth. Add in vanilla and egg, beat until smooth. Add in dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Add in pudding mix and stir until combined. Fold in chips and place on parchment lined cookie sheets, leaving enough room for them to spread. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the edges turn golden brown. Let cool for a few minutes before moving them from the cookie sheet onto a wire rack and then onto a plate. Serve with a scoop of your favorite ice cream and a big smile!

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Brush the tortilla with olive oil. Place it on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until the tortilla is crisp. Lay the hummus on 1 side of the tortilla. Top with the deli chicken. Arrange the spinach, artichokes, and roasted peppers on top. Fold the tortilla over. Serve with your favorite sandwich toppings.

Preheat skillet over medium heat until hot. Add vegetable oil to the skillet. Cook sausage in skillet until browneddrain on paper towel. Add onion, mushrooms, and sausage to skillet and cook until onion is translucent and mushrooms have softenedabout 5 minutes. Remove from skilletset aside. Add hash browns to skillet and cook until brownedstirring occasionally. Remove from skilletset aside. Add eggs to skillet. Cook until whites are setstirring occasionally. Fold eggs over hash browns and top with sausage mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover pan tightly with lidplace pan in the ovenbake until cheese is melted and eggs are cooked throughabout 10 minutes.

Clean and trim stems of mushrooms. Chop pecans and place in shallow bowl with blue cheese crumbles. Remove mushroom stems and discard. Fill each mushroom cap with a small amount of half& half mixture and place in shallow bowl of blue cheese mixture and gently press pecans and blue cheese into mushroom caps. Place mushroom caps onto a greased 15x10x1 inch jelly roll pan and bake in a preheated 425 degree oven for 20 minutes or until heated through.

Trim off any excess fat from chicken thighs and place chicken into a large oven proof pot. Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper. Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add potatoes and cook until browned on all sides, 5 to 7 minutes per side. Transfer potatoes to a bowl with cold water and set aside. Place chicken into pot with oil and heat over medium-high heat until it is browned on all sides. Transfer chicken to bowl with potatoes. Add onions to pot with oil and garlic cloves and cook until onions are browned and tender, 7 to 9 minutes. Transfer onions to bowl with chicken and potatoes. Pour wine into pot, scraping pan with wooden spoon to deglaze pot. Pour wine into pot with onions and garlic cloves. Add sumac and salt to taste and cook until wine reduces to a syrup, about 15 minutes. Return chicken to pot and add potatoes back into pot as well. Cover pot with lid and cook in oven until chicken

Preheat oven to 350. Place 1 cup of water in a saucepan. Add in vanilla pudding mix. Stir constantly over low heat until pudding thickens. Stir in milk. Pour into 8-cup glass baking dish. Let cool. Dip vanilla wafers into cooled pudding and place over top. Cut bananas in half lengthwise and arrange over pudding. Cover and refrigerate. When ready to serve, whip together cool whip and cream cheese until fluffy. Top bananas with whipped topping.

Boil pasta according to package directions. While pasta is boiling, place sauce, cream cheese and cheddar cheese into a mixing bowl, mix well. Drain the pasta when it is finished cooking. Add the vegetables and the pasta back into the pot with the sauce mixture. Mix well and serve hot.

Marinade. Whisk together all the marinade ingredients and pour into a large plastic bag. Add spareribs and seal the bag. Turn to coat the ribs in the marinade. Refrigerate for 24 hours. Cook. Preheat a grill to medium-high heat. Drain and discard the marinade. Thread ribs onto soaked skewers and grill for 5 minutes per side. Serve with fresh herbs and/or lime wedges.

Drain the salmon. Heat the olive oil in the skillet. Add the salmon. Cook until the salmon just begins to turn color. Sprinkle the fish with salt and pepper. Turn the fish. Cook for 2 more minutes. Meanwhile heat the broth. Place the salmon on a bed of parsley. Pour the broth around it.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place the eggs and milk in a large bowl and beat thoroughly. Add the maple syrup, cinnamon, and vanilla extract and beat again. Dip the bread in the egg mixture and place in the oven for 10 minutes or until the bread is golden brown. While the bread is cooking, chop the carrots and sweet potatoes into small cubes or dice. In a small bowl, mix the oil and powdered sugar and set aside for dipping. Serve the French toast with the carrots and sweet potatoes and the dipping oil. Enjoy!

In large saucepan, mix soup, milk and honey. Add frozen vegetables and cook until vegetables are tender. Add cooked chicken. Place in baked pie crust. Top with pie crust. Bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees and continue baking for 20 minutes. Serve warm.

In a large bowl combine all ingredients except chocolate chipsmix well. Form into 1-inch ballsroll in chocolate chips. Place balls 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten to 1/2-inch thickness. Bake at 400 degrees for 8-9 minutes or until lightly browned.

Heat oil in large saucepan. Add onion and cook over medium heat until translucent. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute. Stir in tomato paste, tomatoes and potatoes. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Add broth and pepper. Cook until thickened. Stir in milk. Add basil. Cook until heated through. Makes 2 cups.

Cut broccoli into small florets. Combine oil and mustard in a small bowl. Pour over broccoli and toss to coat. In a small bowl mix the paprika and cayenne together and sprinkle over broccoli. Place broccoli on a greased cookie sheet and sprinkle with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Broil for about 20 minutes or until tender and slightly crisp.

Boil shrimp until tender. Drain shrimp and cool. Cut shrimp into 1/2-inch cubes. In a food processor blend onion, lemon juice and curry powder. Add mayonnaise and blend. Add shrimp and parsley. Blend until mixture is chunky. Spoon into a serving dish. Cover and refrigerate.

Melt marshmallows in 1/2 cup water and set aside. Melt copha in microwave. Line baking tin with greaseproof paper. Combine chopped marshmallows with 1/2 cup icing sugar in a bowl. Add the melted copha and stir until combined. Add the remaining icing sugar and mix until combined. Pour mixture into greased baking tray and refrigerate for 1/2 hour. Remove from refrigerator and add maraschino cherries and desiccated coconut. Press the remaining marshmallows onto the rocky road mixture. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares and serve.

In a large bowl cream butter and corn syrup together. Add sugar and cinnamonmix well. Add pecans. Spread mixture over a baking sheet. Bake at 225 degrees for an hour. Stir every half hour. Stir in salt. Cool. Store in airtight container at room temperature.

Remove the necks from the chicken and place them in a 3-quart pot. Add the garlic cloves and bay leaves. Add the whole black peppercorn and soy sauce. Pour in the water and vinegar. Bring to boil and then simmer for 45 minutes. Drain and rinse. Pat dry with paper towels and cut into pieces. Place the pieces into cold water to stop the cooking process. Then place into the hot oil and fry at 450 degrees for 15 minutes. Drain on paper towels and serve with your favorite dipping sauce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place a large baking dish or 8-inch square pan in oven and set aside. In small bowl, combine reduced fat sour cream and low fat milk. Add eggs. In large nonstick skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon butter. Add scallionscook 2 minutes. Add eggscook 5 minutes or until eggs begin to set around edges and soft-set in center. Transfer eggs to prepared baking dishsprinkle with paprika. Top with cheese. In small bowl, combine remaining butter with mustard. Spoon over eggssprinkle with salt. Bake 8-10 minutes or until eggs are nearly set and top is lightly browned. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In a large saucepan bring 1 cup water to a boil. Add plums and cook 2 minutes. Add jalapeno peppers and simmer 2 minutes. Add cranberries and cook until they burst. Stir in vinegar and sugar. Cook over medium high heat until it just boils. Add ginger and cook 30 seconds. Add cumin and whole cardamom pod. Cook 5 minutes. Add kaffir lime leaves and remove from heat. Pour into sterilized jars and seal.

Cream butter with white sugar in medium bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in egg until well combined. In another medium bowl, stir together orange juice concentrate, orange zest and flour until well combined. Add flour mixture to butter mixture in three additions, stirring until combined. Stir in grape-nuts until just moisteneddo not overmix. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten tops with bottom of measuring cup dipped in flour. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until cookies are lightly browned. Cool 2 minutes on cookie sheetremove to wire rack to cool completely.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until tender. Add the beef. Season with salt and pepper. Cook the beef until brown, stirring occasionally. Stir in the flour until the beef is coated. Add the chicken soup and water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the cream of chicken soup and sour cream. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the mushroom and cook for 2 more minutes. Serve over rice.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onions and hamburger. Cook and stir until brown. Meanwhile, put the sloppy joe mix in a bowl. Stir in the tomato sauce. Pour the tomato mixture over the hamburger. Cook and stir over medium heat for 10 minutes or until heated through. Serve with a bun. Serves 4.

Place hazelnuts and egg whites in a food processor and pulse until coarsely ground. Add remaining ingredients and pulse until well combined. Transfer mixture to a bowl and mix by hand. Form dough into 12 equal portions and roll each portion into a ball. Roll each ball in sugar and place 2 inches apart onto a baking sheet. Bake until lightly browned. Serve warm with tea.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown onions in a little olive oil in a heavy saucepan. Add condensed soup and milk. Cook slowly over low heat until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in tuna and mushrooms. Stir in parsley and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook in a 2 quart casserole dish in a 350 degree oven for 15 to 20 minutes. Meanwhile cook the noodles according to the package directions. Add noodles to the casserole dish just before serving. Makes 4 servings.

Peel butternut squash. Slice squash lengthwise into 1/2-inch slices. Place butternut squash in a large saucepan with garlic cloves. Cook on medium heat until squash is tender and garlic is tender, about 30 minutes. Drain excess liquid from squash slices. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Mix yellow squash with sugar and pour into 9x13 inch baking dish. Pour eggs over squash. Sprinkle with onions. Pour water on top. Cover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Cool, and cut in half. To assemble, spread rolls with butter. Place cut squash in center of each roll.

Brown beef and bacon in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook until beef is done. Drain. Mix in beans with juice and seasonings. Transfer mixture to a 9x13" baking dish. Bake for 2 hours at 225 degrees.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown beef stew meat in vegetable oil. Drain fat from pan. Add 1 1/2 cups beef broth to panbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 15 minutes. Mix flour with 2 cups beef broth. Stir flour mixture into beef in pan. Cook and stir until gravy thickens. Add mushroom soupheat through. Stir in potatoes. Coversimmer 20-25 minutes or until tender. Add carrots. Cook and stir 1 minute. Serve with biscuits.

In a large bowl, combine egg, milk, cheddar cheese, oats, onion and salt. Stir in beef until well combined. Transfer meat mixture into an ungreased loaf pan (or 8-oz ramekins) shape into a loaf or round shape. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until done (test with a toothpick). Serve with prepared mustard on top if desired. Makes about 16 mini meatloaves.

Remove the skin from the ham. Dip the ham in the oil, then in the orange juice mixture, then into the barbecue sauce mixture (orange marmalade). Place in a foil pan on a baking sheet and bake at 325 for 1 hour. Pour the honey over the ham during the last 15 minutes of baking. Remove from oven when done and brush with the chives before serving.

Crumble graham cracker into medium bowl, add melted butter, sugar, and cinnamon. Stir until crumbly. Press mixture into the bottom of pie pan (9 x 2 1/2 inches). Spread with vanilla ice cream. Freeze until solid, about 1 hour. Pour hot magic shell over ice cream. Sprinkle with maraschino cherries and peanut butter cups. Freeze until serving time.

Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Add milk and cocoa. Heat until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and set aside to cool for 5 minutes. Sift flour with bicarbonate of soda& cocoa together. Add to cocoa mixture& stir to combine. Stir in eggs and almond essence. Add almond meal to batter& fold in. Pour into a greased cake tin and bake for 30 to 35 minutes until cake is firm to touch& tester inserted comes out clean. Dust with icing sugar if desired. Serve with whipped cream if desired. Store in air-tight container in fridge for up to 1 week.

In blender or food processor combine lemon juice, honey, yogurt, oil and 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and pepper until smooth. In large salad bowl combine spinach leaves with cucumbers and onion. Pour yogurt mixture over salad and toss gently to coat.

Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl and knead until elastic. Add in 2 to 4 cups of flour (depends on how much moisture is in the air and how much the dough is stretching) until it is no longer sticky. Let rise in a greased bowl for 2 hours or until doubled in size. Then punch down and let rise for another hour. Divide dough into 8 equal parts and shape into balls. Roll each ball out to a 9 to 10 inch circle and place on a greased pizza pan or stone. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise for 30 to 45 minutes. Preheat pizza stone or pan in 400 degree oven for 15 to 20 minutes. Drizzle oil over the dough and sprinkle with flour. Cook 8 to 10 minutes or until dough is golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 days.

Place all of the ingredients in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to boil and simmer until the rice is cooked through. The soup should be thickened to the consistency of pudding. Add more cream of chicken soup if you prefer it thinner.

Muddle the mint leaves into the brown sugar. Pour the pineapple juice into the glass. Pour the rum into the glass. Pour the brown sugar mixture on top. Add the pineapple chunks to the glass. Stir all together. Add crushed ice to glass. Garnish with mint leaves.

To make the dip, add the coconut cream and red curry paste into a pan and heat gently, then add the crabmeat and fish sauce and bring to a simmer. Blend the egg with the water and add to the mixture. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes over medium heat until the egg is cooked. Stir in the spring onions. Serve immediately with rice crackers.

Cream butter and brown sugar together until fluffy. Add eggs and beat well. Add lemon juice and zest and beat until well mixed. Add flour and pecans and mix until well combined. Drop by teaspoonfuls on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on cookie sheet for 1 minute then transfer to wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat grill to medium high heat or heat coals in a charcoal grill to medium heat. Remove husks from corn, making sure to remove silks as well. Clean corn with a damp cloth to remove any remaining silks. Rub corn with olive oil or melted butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place on grill for 10-15 minutes depending on the size of the ears of corn. Grill corn until kernels are tender and slightly browned. To make the seasoning sprinkle each ear of corn with 1 teaspoon each of dried thyme, dried oregano, garlic powder, onion powder and paprika. Sprinkle with salt and ground red pepper to taste. Sprinkle with ground black pepper as well. Place ears of corn on the grill with the husks on and close the grill lid. Cook corn for about 10 minutes or until corn is tender when pierced with a fork. Remove corn from grill, husks and all, onto a platter and serve hot with melted butter for dipping.

Unroll crescent rolls and separate. Spread each triangle with a slice of ham, cheese and a slice of cooked chicken. Place the other triangle over the first to form a triangle. Bake at 375 degrees for 12-15 minutes until lightly browned.
In a large bowl, combine all of the ingredients. Mix well and form into 6 patties. Grill to desired doneness or broil. Serve with buns and toppings.

Slice bread and toast. Spread with butter. Cut each chicken breast into 6 pieces. Mix chicken with celery and onions. Add olives. Mix mayonnaise with 1/4 cup sour cream and 1/4 cup salad dressing. Spread this mixture over bread. Cover with cheese. Add lettuce and tomato. Serve sandwiches open-faced.

Slice cauliflower into florets. Place florets in large bowl. Marinate with mayonnaise mixture. Cover & refrigerate for 2 hours or until chilled. Add avocados & seasonings. Toss well. Chill for 1 hour before serving.

In a large bowl beat eggs. Add milk, sour cream and butter to eggs. Add pancake mix to eggs. Grease waffle iron. Spoon 1/3 of batter into waffle iron. Lay a piece of bacon on top. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Close waffle iron. Cook according to manufacturer's directions. Serve immediately.

Place chickens in a roasting pan. Remove chicken neck and giblets from the cavity. Sprinkle the chicken with salt and pepper. Stuff the chickens with a lemon slice and a bay leaf. Insert a whole garlic head in each cavity. Place the chickens in a preheated 400°F (200°C) oven for 1 hour. Reduce heat to 350°F (180°C) and cook for another hour and a half to two hours until juices run clear. Meanwhile, combine the ketchup, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce and lemon juice in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat for about ten minutes until reduced by half. Remove the garlic from the chickens and discard. Serve the chicken with the barbecue sauce.

Boil water in a pot and cook udon noodles as per instructions on package. Meanwhile, boil potatoes until done. When potatoes are done, mash with a potato masher, then add olive oil and rice vinegar. Season with salt and pepper and add green peppers and onions. Serve on a plate and place the noodles on top.

Brown the ground beef. Drain. Add the spaghetti sauce and mozzarella cheese and stir to blend. Place uncooked pasta in a 9x13 pan. Pour the meat mixture over the pasta. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Serve with bread and salad.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray or butter. Cut bread into cubes. In a bowl combine eggs, milk, vanilla, cinnamon and raisinswhisk to blend well. Dip bread cubes into the egg mixture to coat all sides. Place cubes into prepared baking dish. Pour remaining egg mixture over bread cubes. Cover dish with foil and bake for 45 minutes or until egg is set. Remove foil from casserole dish and continue baking for 10 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Serve with warm maple syrup on the side. Yield: 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees F. Place meringue powder in a small bowl and add 1/2 cup of cream of tartar. Whisk together until powder is incorporated and no lumps remain. Add salt and sugar to the meringue powder mixture and whisk until combined. Whisk in vanilla extract. Place egg whites into the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment and start whipping at high speed. Pour sugar and cream of tartar mixture into the egg whites slowly and continue to whip until stiff peaks form. Fold in 1 cup of chopped nuts and 1 cup of chopped semi-sweet chocolate. Line baking sheets with parchment paper and place meringue mixture by heaping tablespoonfuls onto the baking sheet. Flatten meringue cookies with the palm of your hand until about 2-inches in diameter. Bake for 50-55 minutes or until firm to the touch. Let cool completely on the baking sheet. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

Put the milk and 1/2 cup of the cream in a saucepan and heat to a simmer. In a bowl combine the yolks and the remaining 1/2 cup of cream. Whisk the cornstarch into 1/4 cup of the milk and add to the yolks and cream. Cook the mixture over moderately low heat, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, for 5 minutes. Stir in the vanilla and remove from the heat. Pour the mixture into the hot milk and whisk quickly to combine. Serve warm.

Bring the sugar and corn syrup to a boil over high heat. Cook without stirring until the mixture is light amber (about 5 minutes). Remove the pan from the heat and add the water and salt. Stir well to dissolve the sugar crystals. Whisk the egg whites until they hold soft peaks. Stir the whites into the sugar syrup. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the vanilla extract, stirring with the whisk to combine with the egg whites. Immediately pour the mixture into a greased 8-inch square pan (I used 11 x 7 x 2-inch). Let the fudge cool until just warm to the touch (about 2 hours). Loosen the edges of the fudge with a sharp knife and place the pan on top of an upside-down bowl to release the fudge. Cut into squares and serve warm or cool. Store fudge at room temperature for up to 2 weeks or freeze for up to 3 monthslet fudge thaw before serving.

Preheat oven to 425f. Heat oil. Saute garlic, tomatoes, basil, oregano, red pepper flakes, salt for 2 minutes. Add cooked rice to saute. Mix well. Spread rice mixture into a greased 13x9 baking dish. Top with artichoke hearts and crumbled feta cheese. Bake for 15 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Break eggs into bowl of stand mixer or large bowl. Add salt and pepper to taste. Using whisk attachment or wire whisk beat eggs for 2 minutes on medium speed until they are fluffy. Add oil. Beat on low speed for 1 minute. Pour egg mixture into hoagie rolls. Place hoagie rolls on baking sheet. Sprinkle with cumin. Broil until edges begin to brown, about 1 minute. Cut sandwiches into quarters or eighths and serve with salsa on side.

Combine all ingredients. Form mixture into four 4-inch burgers. Shape each burger with your hands into a patty. Heat a grill or a grill pan on medium high heat. Place burgers on grill for 8 to 10 minutes or until cooked through.

Slice and chop yellow squash and green pepper. Place both vegetables on a lightly greased baking sheet in single layer and season with salt and pepper. Bake at 350 for about 45 minutes or until tender. Drain excess oil and serve with margarine and fresh onion.

Melt the chocolate chips in a large bowl over a pan of boiling water. Add the rice chex and stir until all the chocolate is melted and the rice cereal is coated. Pour the mixture onto a greased cookie sheet. Using a knife, swirl the mixture together to make a marble pattern. Sprinkle the powdered sugar over the top. Allow the cereal mixture to cool and then break into pieces. Keep refrigerated.

Warm the olive oil and butter in a small pan. Add the shallot and onion to the pan and saute until soft. Add the thyme and bay leaves and stir for a minute or two. Add the wine and water to the pan and bring to a boil. Add the mussels to the pan and cover. After 2 minutes check the mussels for openness. Remove the mussels that are open and place them in a bowl. Discard any mussels that do not open. Pour the remaining mussels and the cooking liquid into a serving dish. Spoon the creme fraiche into a small bowl and stir until smooth. Stir the creme fraiche into the mussels and serve immediately.

Boil water. Add gelatin and stir. Add mini marshmallows and pecans. After 2 minutes of boiling, add pineapple. After 3 minutes of boiling, add coconut. After 4 minutes of boiling add the cottage cheese. After 5 minutes of boiling add the cool whip. After 6 minutes of boiling add the cherry. Serve warm.

Sprinkle prawns with oil. In a large skillet, saute onion in oil until tender. Add prawns. Saute until just opaque. Stir in dry white wine. Stir in garlic. Stir in paprika. Stir in parsley. Add salt and pepper. Serve warm.
Brown chicken breasts in the butter. Add mushrooms. Pour soup over all. Sprinkle paprika over all. Bake at 350f. for about 30 minutes or until done. Serve over rice or noodles.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add pasta to the pot of boiling water, stirring occasionally. Cook for 8 minutes or until pasta is tender but still firm to the bite. Drain pastareserve 1 cup of the pasta water. Meanwhile, bring a medium saucepan of water to a boil over high heat. Add garlic to the boiling watercook for 15 seconds. Transfer garlic to a small bowl of cold water to stop the cooking process. Drain garlicset aside. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook red pepper and green onion in hot oil for 1 minute or until tender-crisp. Add chicken breasts to the skilletcook for 3 minutes on each side or until done. Transfer chicken to a plate. Add bell peppers and garlic to the skilletcook for 3 minutes or until tender-crisp. Stir in dressing, soy sauce, and reserved pasta water. Cook for 1 minute or until sauce is hot. Drain pastaplace in

Salt and pepper chicken legs, place them in large pot or skillet, add vegetable oil. Sear chicken legs on each side until golden brown. Add 1 tbs mixed spice to oil, add tomatoes, zucchini and brown onion and cook for 5 minutes. Add 2 cups chicken stock powder to tomato mixture and cook for another 5 minutes. Add couscous and cook for 5 more minutes. Add parsley and lemon zest to couscous mixture. Pour mixture into large bowls. Garnish each bowl with chicken leg on top. Serve immediately with warm breads or pita.

Wash potatoes well in a pot of cold water. Cook until potatoes are tender to a fork. Cut into cubes. Mash potatoes with a hand mixer or a food processor. Add sour cream and salt and pepper to taste. Add green onions and mix in. Add spinach and cheese to mixture. Mix well. Place in a greased 9 x 13 baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Cook ravioli according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in garbanzo beans and cook until tender. Add squash and cook until tender. Add tomatoes and cook until heated through. Add spinach and thyme and cook for 2 minutes. Add pasta to sauce and toss to coat. Season with pepper and serve immediately.

Combine all the ingredients except the red pepper flakes in a medium bowl and whisk together. Add the flakes last. Taste and adjust seasonings. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve immediately. Store in the refrigerator.

Heat olive oil in large stockpot. Add garlic and onion. Cook until soft. Stir in tomatoes and beef. Cook until meat is browned. Stir in seasoning and beef bouillon. Bring to boil. Add potatoes and cook 10 minutes or until tender. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut off stems of brussels sprouts, discard. Rinse well. Drain. Toss in oil. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for about 25 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake an additional 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Melt butter. Whisk in garlic. Drizzle over brussels sprouts. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve warm.

In a large bowl combine fries and steak seasoning. Spread evenly onto a cookie sheet. Bake for 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Spread cheese evenly over fries and bake for 3 more minutes. Remove and sprinkle green onions and bacon bits over fries. Bake for another 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine chocolate almond bark and German chocolate. Stir to coat. In a small bowl combine semi-sweet chocolate chips and peanuts. Stir to coat. In a separate small bowl stir together roasted almonds and almond flavoring. Place both chocolate/peanut and almond/flavoring in separate crockpots. Heat on low for 4 hours. Stir each mixture occasionally. Makes about 100-110 clusters.

Combine all of the ingredients except for the pecans in a food processor. Process until the mixture forms a ball. If the mixture is too soft, refrigerate for 30 minutes to firm it up before shaping it into a ball. Shape the ball into a ball by hand or use a melon baller. Place the pecans around the ball for decoration. Serve on crackers or celery sticks.

Preheat broiler to high. Remove any packaging from hen. Place hen breast side down in shallow dish. Pour 3/4 cup chicken broth into dish. Mix together mango chutney, mild curry powder and apricot jam. Add mixture to chicken. Place chicken in baking dish. Pour remaining chicken broth into baking dish. Bake in preheated broiler for 15 minutes. Turn hen breast side up. Broil for 8-10 minutes or until no longer pink. In the meantime, mix together the green onions, peanuts and lime juice. Serve hen garnished with the green onions.

In a large sauce pan heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Brown meat and onion until the meat is brown on all sides. Remove meat from pan and set aside. Add all other ingredients except spaghetti to pan. Simmer about 15-20 minutes. Stir in meat. Add spaghetti noodles to sauce pan and cook noodles according to package directions. Serve over spaghetti noodles.
Shake all of the ingredients together. Pour into a glass filled with ice. Garnish with a cherry. Serve and enjoy.

In a large bowl mix all sauce ingredients together until blended and smooth. Place wings in large plastic bag and pour marinade into bag. Seal bag tightly and shake well to coat wings with sauce. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes for wings to marinate thoroughly. Remove wings from marinade and discard marinade. Place wings on baking sheet with sides and bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until wings are heated through and coated with sauce. Serve with celery sticks or carrot sticks for dipping.

Toast the rye bread. Thinly spread the mustard over the toasted bread. Then spread the sliced dill pickles on top of the mustard. Then add the thinly sliced onions to the pickles. On top of the pickles add the pastrami. Then add the sliced havarti cheese over the top of the meat. Add the broth to the bottom of a small sauce pan (do not cover). Add the rye bread to the hot water and allow to soak for 2 minutes. Drain the bread. Add the sliced pickles to the bottom of the rye bread. Then add the pastrami and top with the cheese. Place the rye bread sandwich into the oven until the cheese is melted (about 2 minutes). This sandwich is very good. The rye bread is wonderful. The pickles are very good. The pastrami is wonderful. The havarti cheese is wonderful. The dill pickles are wonderful.
Peel and dice potatoes. Peel and thinly slice onions. Cook potatoes and onions together with bacon grease until tender. Add buttermilk and cook until thickened.

Cut avocado in half and remove pit. Scoop out of avocado halves. Place in a mixing bowl with lime juice, cumin and garlic powder and mash together. Spoon mixture into mozzarella cheese-filled jalapenos. Place bacon on a large cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. Remove bacon and fill jalapenos with mashed avocado mixture and top with bacon.

Mix together the mayonnaise with the parmesan. Place crust on a cookie sheet and spread the mayonnaise mixture in the crust. Sprinkle the crust with the ritz crackers. Add the tomatoes and top with the bacon. Season with pepper and fresh basil. Bake in pre-heated oven at 325 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Soak the beans overnight in 5 cups of water. Drain the beans the next day and add them to 3 cups water with bouillon granules. Bring to boil, then simmer for about 1 hour or until beans are very tender. Drain beans in colander, then rinse with cold water to cool them down slightly. Drain the beans again. Transfer the beans to a large pot along with the remaining water and beans. Add the oil to the pot and then the onion. Cook over low heat for about 10 minutes, until the onion is soft and translucent. Then add the spices. Cook for another 3 minutes then add the beans with the water. Bring to boil then lower the heat to simmer until the beans are very soft and the flavors are well blended, about 45 minutes to 1 hour. If the mixture is too dry, add more water. To serve, place about 3/4 cup of the bean mixture in each warmed tortilla on a plate. Top with salsa (to taste) and shredded cheese. Roll up the tortillas and enjoy with

Preheat oven to 350f. In large bowl, beat together cream cheese and sugar until well blended. Add lowfat milk and vegetable oil. In separate bowl, combine egg and all-purpose flour. Add to cream cheese mixture. Stir in chocolate chips. Spoon into greased muffin cups. Bake 15 - 18 minutes or until toothpick inserted near centre comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pan to wire rack. Yield: 12 muffins.

To make the infused oil, combine all of the ingredients in a jar, and cover tightly. Shake the jar well. Refrigerate for 1-3 days. Strain the spices from the oil and discard. Pour the oil into a clean jar. Keep refrigerated. To use, drizzle a little oil onto a hot skillet to flavor or saute vegetables. Or add oil to a pan of boiling vegetables to flavor. Pour oil over salads to flavor. Drizzle oil over fish or chicken for a great flavor. Sprinkle lemon zest over fish or chicken before grilling.

Combine the cauliflower, imitation crab meat, celery and green onions in a medium sized bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together the Miracle Whip and the vinegar. Add the dressing to the cauliflower mixture and stir to combine. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Serve with crackers or bread. This is a great recipe to use leftover cooked cauliflower.
Mix dry ingredients. Stir in buttermilk and milk. Cook in a greased 13x9-inch baking pan at 400 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine rice mix and water in 3-quart microwaveable casserole. Microwave on high 7 minutes. Drain. Stir in salsa. Place kielbasa in casserole. Microwave uncovered 10 to 12 minutes on high. Remove kielbasa and cool slightly. Remove and discard fat and skin. Cut into 1-inch slices and place in casserole. Stir in onion and bell pepper. Microwave uncovered 10 to 12 minutes on high. Stir in red pepper. Microwave 2 minutes on high. Microwave 1 minute on high. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Make two 9-inch double-crust pie shells. Add brown sugar and all-purpose flour to a large bowl and mix well. Add tart apples and butter. Mix well. Add cinnamon and fresh cranberries. Mix well. Spoon into pie shells. Bake for 30 to 45 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with whipped cream.

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Add sliced onion. Saute until softened. Add sliced chorizo sausage. Cook until sausage is browned. Drain grease. Place sliced buns on plate. Top each with a slice of chorizo sausage. Pour salsa over sausage. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve.

In a large skillet over medium heat cook sausage and dry vegetable mix stirring occasionally until sausage is browned and vegetable mixture is soft and liquid has cooked off. Transfer cooked mixture to a 9 in. x 9 in. x 2 in. baking pan. Stir together bisquick baking mix and milk. Pour over sausage mixture. Bake at 350 degrees F for 35 to 40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center of the quiche comes out clean. Let cool for 10 to 15 minutes before serving. Serve with salsa and sour cream.

Spray a large nonstick skillet with cooking spray and set over medium-high heat. Add prosciutto and sage leaves to pan and cook 1 minute or until prosciutto is crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place tilapia fillets in pan and cook 2 minutes or until almost cooked through. Flip and cook 2 minutes more. Remove from pan and drain on paper towels. Serve with prosciutto and sage.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion flakes and cook until softened. Stir in the flour. Cook for a few minutes, then stir in the tomatoes with the tomato liquid. Stir in the green chili pepper. Add enough water to cover. Stir in the cilantro. Cook until the vegetables are tender. Season with salt. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside. Combine black beans, agave nectar and 1 cup water in a blender and process until smooth. Pour into a large bowl and whisk in the self-rising flour, egg white and vanilla. Stir in the cocoa powder and baking powder until incorporated. Fold in the chocolate chips. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake for 25 minutes. Let cool in the pan for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack. Store at room temperature or refrigerate for up to 5 days. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.
Puree apples in food processor or blender. Stir in lemon juice. Add sugar gradually. When sugar is dissolved add apple juice. Add food coloring to taste. Serve in paper cups or bowls.

Season chicken thighs and artichoke hearts with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken thighs and artichoke hearts. Cook and stir until browned. Add vermouth and cook until liquid evaporates. Pour in condensed soup. Add mushrooms and cook until mushrooms are tender. Place in casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for one hour.

Mix seasoning and pepper. Dip pork in mixture and coat well. In a skillet heat oil. Brown pork on both sides. Drain off excess oil. Add onions to skillet. Cook until onions are tender. Sprinkle with flour. Stir in wine and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil. Stir in broth and pork. Simmer until pork is tender. Makes 4 servings.

Combine all meat and seasonings and form into meatballs. Place one meatball on the center of each wonton skin and fold over to enclose meatball. To fry, heat oil in a large fry pan on medium heat and fry 4 at a time until golden brown on both sides. Serve with picante sauce or salsa and warm tortillas for dipping. Makes 24 to 30 wontons.

In a small saucepan, heat oil over low heat. Add onion, mushrooms, bell peppers, tomato and garlic. Cook stirring often until soft. Add scallopscook over low heat until scallops are cooked through. Remove from heat. Remove garlicdiscard. Drain scallops on paper towels. Heat sour cream until slightly thickened. Combine sour cream with scallopsgarnish with mango salsa. Serve with tortillas for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Prepare chicken flavored stuffing mix according to package directionsset aside. Peel the squashcut in halfremove seedsslice into 1/4 inch slices. In a sauce pan, melt the butteradd the squashsaute for 5 minutesadd the onionsaute for 2 more minutesadd the maple syrupsaute for 1 minute moreremove from heatstir in the cream of chicken soupadd the stuffingstir to mix well. Spoon into a greased 13 x 9 inch baking dishsprinkle with the Parmesan cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned on top. Serve warm or at room temperature. Yield: 6 servings

Cut a garlic clove in half. Peel the scallion and finely chop. Coarsely chop the basil leaves. Puree the yogurt with the mayonnaise in a small bowl until smooth. In a small bowl combine the vinegar with the garlic, scallion and basil. Puree in a food processor or blender until smooth. In a large bowl stir the yogurt mixture into the vinegar mixture. Stir in the shrimp and peas. Cook the pasta shells according to package directions until al dente. Drain well and toss with the shrimp mixture. Sprinkle with the chopped basil leaves.

In a large bowl mix soup, milk and potatoes until well blended. Spray a 2-quart casserole dish with cooking spray. Spoon mixture into the prepared dish. Bake uncovered at 350 for 25-30 minutes or until heated through and topping is bubbly. Sprinkle with cheese and broil for 2-3 minutes or until cheese is golden brown. Serve hot.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the pasta until tender. In a small bowl, stir together the parmesan cheese and butter until the butter is melted. Drain the pasta well. Return the cooked pasta to the skillet. Mix in the parmesan mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately or chill for several hours and serve cold.

Melt the butter in a sauce pan. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add the crabmeat and cook until heated through. Add the breadcrumb and parsley. Stir in the cream. Mix in the lemon thyme and the dry white wine. Season with salt and pepper. Place in the fish cavity. Stuff the remaining filling under the skin. Place the fish on a rack in a roasting pan. Pour the sauce over the fish. Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove the fish from the oven and allow it to cool for 5 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a medium bowl, combine salsa and mayonnaise. Season tilapia fillets generously with seasoning salt. Dip each fillet into salsa mixture. Place fillets on a baking sheet and top each fillet with a slice of cheese. Bake fillets for 10 minutes in a preheated 350-degree oven or until cheese is melted and fillets are cooked through.

In a large pot or kettle of water boil the corn. Drain well and place in a large bowl. Place the popped corn in a large pan over low heat. Add the brown sugar and the bourbon and stir to melt the sugar and evaporate the alcohol. Add the corn syrup and stir to combine. Add the salt and baking soda. Place the corn in the caramel mixture and stir to combine. Place the pan in the oven and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and stir. Add the butter and stir to combine. Return to the oven and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Stir again and remove from the oven. Let the caramel cool for 30 minutes before serving. (You can also make the caramel 12 hours in advance and store in a covered container in the refrigerator until ready to serve.)

Sift together the flour and the sugar into a large mixing bowl. Combine the oil and margarine and stir into the flour mixture. Beat the egg into the flour mixture until smooth. Add the vanilla and salt. Stir the baking powder into the cream of tartar. Sift together into the flour mixture and stir well into the batter. Drop from a teaspoon onto waxed paper about 2 inches apart and allow to dry overnight. Dip tops of cookies into the glaze and roll lightly to coat evenly.

Boil macaroni until tenderdrain and set aside. In the same pot over low heat, melt butter and add salt and macaroni. Cook for about 1 minute, then add evaporated milk and Velveeta cheese and stir until cheese is melted and blended. Serve in bowls and top with chopped green onions and bacon bits!

Melt butter in a sauce pan over medium heat. Add noodles and saute for 2 minutes. Remove from pan and drain. Place ramen noodles and broccoli in a bowl and toss with soy sauce and red wine vinegar. In another bowl, add walnuts and toss with sugar and vegetable oil. Toss noodles and vegetables with walnuts and serve.

Mix dry ingredients. Add milk. Blend in egg and melted butter. Fold in oil. Heat skillet or griddle over medium heat. Pour or scoop batter onto hot skillet. When bubbles begin to form on top of pancake, turn over. Continue cooking until bottom is light brown. Flip over. Serve immediately. Makes about 4 pancakes.

Melt chocolate and butter together. Pour into a large mixing bowl and add the dry ingredients. Mix well with a spoon. Add milk a little at a time and continue to mix. Drop onto cookie sheet, bake at 350 f for about 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Cream cheese, margarine & whipped topping should all be softened before mixing together. Then mix in powdered sugar to make frosting. Mix in pudding mix according to directions on package. Fold in crushed oreos. Layer mixture in a cake pan. Add milk to the cake mix to thin to the desired consistency. Pour over cake mix. Refrigerate until set.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease an 8-inch square baking dish. Make cake mix according to package directions using water instead of milk for an extra moist texture. Fold mini marshmallows into cake batter. Pour batter evenly into prepared baking dish. Bake 20-25 minutes or until cake is set. Let cool 10 minutes before serving. Sprinkle chopped pecans over top.

Combine garlic cloves and 1/2 cup of the soy sauce in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cook over moderate heat until the garlic is tender. Cool. Combine the cooled garlic mixture, the remaining 2 cups of soy sauce and the honey in a blender or food processor. Puree until smooth. Stir in the remaining 3/4 cup barbecue sauce. Transfer to a saucepan. Add the remaining 2/3 cup barbecue sauce. Bring to a boil over moderately high heat. Reduce the heat to moderately low. Stir in the wings. Cook gently until the sauce is bubbling.
Combine all ingredients except salt. Cook over medium heat until thick. Add salt to taste.

Heat oil in pan over medium heat. Add onion, bell pepper, tomatoes, cilantro, garlic clove, tomato paste, bay shrimp, lemon juice, coconut milk and bring to boil. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until shrimp are cooked. Serve over rice.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine vinegar and sherry. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Add oil and whisk to combine. Add herbs and whisk to combine. Add black pepper to taste. Transfer mixture to small bottle and refrigerate for up to 4 weeks.

Mix all the dry ingredients together. Put it in a large bowl and mix well. Add the raisins and nuts and mix again. Then add the melted butter and the melted peanut butter. Mix until well combined. Spread into a greased cookie sheet (or use a sheet of wax paper) and flatten it with your hands. Cook until lightly golden and then remove from the oven and let cool for a minute or two before cutting into squares and removing from the sheet.

Cook macaroni in boiling water. Drain. Melt butter and blend in the flour. Gradually add milk and continue to stir until mixture thickens. Stir in cheeses and seasonings. Pour into a greased casserole and bake at 375 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375f. Slice 1/2 cup of tomatoes into 8 slices. Spread each slice of cheese with butter. Place one slice each of cheese and tomato on each slice of bread. Place 1 slice tomato on each slice cheese and cover with another slice of cheese. Place the sandwiches on a greased baking sheet. Bake for approx 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove to a cutting board and allow to cool slightly. Cut each sandwich into 3 or 4 pieces and serve.
