In a large skillet over medium heat add olive oil. Add pearl onions and saute until tender, about 2 minutes. Add vinegar, sherry wine and bring to a boil. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Remove lid and sprinkle with sugar and fresh thyme. Continue to cook until the liquid evaporates and the onions caramelize. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot or warm. Serve with toasted bread and crisp vegetables.

Brown bacon in a 10-inch skillet. Remove bacon from pan. Add oil to bacon drippings in pan. Saute onion & green pepper until tender. Add rice. Cook and stir until coated with oil. Add water & tomatoes. Cook & stir until liquid is absorbed. Stir in bacon, jalapeno peppers & seasonings. Cook until liquid is absorbed. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Bring water to a boil and stir in sugar and rosemary. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes or until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and stir in lime juice and ice. Pour mixture into a tall glass and garnish with lime slice.

Slice sweet onions in half lengthwise. Arrange cut side up in a shallow baking dish. Combine butter with 2 tablespoons of the parmesan cheese. Drizzle over the cut side of the onion halves. Season with salt and pepper. Bake at 400 degrees for 45 minutes. Serve as a side dish.

Season steak with salt and ground black pepper. Add steak to a large skillet. Cook on medium-high heat for 5 minutes on each side or until browned. Add onions to skillet. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Add cream of mushroom soup. Cook and stir for 2-3 minutes or until mixture is heated through. Serve steak with reduced-sodium brown gravy mix. Stir gravy mix into skillet. Cook 1 minute longer or until mixture is thickened.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add in the brown and white sugars. In another bowl, mix together the oil and vanilla extract. Add the soymilk and vegan chocolate chips. Stir to combine. Add the wet ingredients into the dry and stir until everything is incorporated. Roll the dough into balls and place into an ungreased 9x13 inch pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Let cool before removing from pan.

Beat eggs. Add milk and sugar. Add flour. Mix well. Heat oil in a deep frying pan or wok. Drop batter by tablespoonful into hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with syrup or honey.

Mix soy sauce, vinegar, ginger and garlic in small saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil. Stir in Asian chili sauce and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat and cool. Slice flank steak into 4 pieces. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Combine rice vinegar mixture and sesame oil. Brush on both sides of steak. Grill or barbecue as desired. Garnish with scallions and sesame seeds.

Melt together white sugar and brown sugar in a heavy saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in cocoa powder. Stir in corn syrup and sour cream. Add butter and mix until butter is melted. Set aside. Place vanilla extract and walnuts in a small bowl. Heat in microwave for 30-45 seconds or until melted. Stir into cocoa mixture. Stir in enough boiling water to make a pourable mixture. Pour into 9x13 in pan and chill for 30 minutes. Cut into 60 bars.

Chop the spring onions into small lengths. Slice the garlic cloves into thin slivers. In a small bowl mix together the rice wine, soy sauce, palm sugar and black pepper. Set the steak aside. Heat the oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat. Add the steak to the pan and sear for 2 minutes each side until golden brown. Remove the steak from the pan. Add the spring onions to the pan and cook for 2 minutes until slightly softened. Add the garlic slivers. Pour the marinade over the meat and cook for 1 minute. Place the steak back into the pan with the spring onions. Cook for 2 minutes. Serve with steamed rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheet with shortening or non-stick cooking sprayset aside. Place flour, baking powder and cinnamon in large bowlwhisk to combine. In another bowl, beat butter with 1/4 cup raw sugar until light. Stir in sour cream until light and fluffy. Stir dry ingredients into the wetmix well until smooth. Place blueberries and cranberries into the battermix gently. Place batter on prepared cookie sheet by rounded teaspoons 3 inches apart. Bake 14 minutes or until golden browncool on wire rack.

In a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat, add oil. Cook lamb steaks until golden brown on both sides. Remove from pan. Add water and soy sauce to pan. Add lamb steaks. Simmer, uncovered over low heat 45 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter. Sprinkle with oyster sauce and garnish with green onions.

Mix yellow cake mix with eggs. Spread in an ungreased 13x9x2 pan. In small bowl combine mandarin oranges, cool whip and crushed pineapple. Spread on top of cake mixture. Sprinkle with pudding topping. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Cool and frost with cool whip and mandarin oranges.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook the pasta until al dente. In a medium saucepan, heat margarine over medium heat. Add garlic cloves, garlic salt and basil. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the roasted red peppers. Cook for 5 minutes more. Add the cooked pasta to the saucepan. Add the asparagus. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the thyme, oregano and salt and pepper to taste. Toss well.

Combine rolled oats and orange zest in medium bowl. Add cinnamon and dried tart cherries. Pour in skim milk and whisk to combine. Bring to boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for about 12 minutes or until thick and creamy. Remove from heat. Add brown sugar and whisk until blended. Serve warm. Top with freshly grated cinnamon and a dollop of cream if desired.

Preheat the oven at 350F degrees. Grease a square pan. Add the dry cake mix, walnuts, butterscotch pudding mix in a mixing bowl. Add the water until it is a thick batter. Add the eggs one at a time. In a separate bowl mix the oil with water. Add the oil water mixture into the dry mixture. Add the apples and raisins. Pour batter into the greased pan. Bake for approximately 28 minutes. Let cool. Cut into squares.
Mix stuffing and sour cream together. Mix all other items together and place in a 2 quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

Melt butter in 2-quart saucepan over low heat. Add mushroomscook and stir until mushrooms are tender. Add wine and bring to boilcook 3 minutes or until liquid has evaporated. Stir in worcestershire sauce. Cook 1 minute more. Add the bouillon cubes and bring to boilcook 1 minute longer. Serve hot or refrigerate up to 1 day for cold mushrooms.

Drain macaroni and add to boiling milk. Cook and stir for 3 to 5 minutes or until macaroni is tender and milk is absorbed. Stir in dry mustard, salt, and pepper. Cool for a few minutes and add cheddar cheese and frankfurters. Mix well and stuff in a hot frankfurter casing. Cook in a pan of boiling water for 4 to 5 minutes or until the casing is firm and the frankfurters are heated through. Serve hot.

Cut cauliflower in half. Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add cauliflower heads. Blanch for 4 minutes. Drain cauliflower. In a small bowl whisk together mayonnaise, dried onions, prepared mustard. Place cauliflower in a shallow 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Pour sauce over cauliflower. Sprinkle cheese over cauliflower. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake for 20 minutes. Uncover. Bake for 5 more minutes. Let cool for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat toaster oven to 375 degrees. Place canadian bacon on english muffin. Place a slice of cheese on top of canadian bacon. Crack an egg and place it on top of cheese. Place in toaster oven and cook for about 15 minutes. Turn once or twice to ensure even cooking.

Cook pasta as directed on packagedrain well. Put butter into a large pot over medium heat until melted. Whisk together eggs, milk, hot sauce and seasonings until well combined. Whisk in cheese until smooth. Stir in drained pasta. Cook uncovered over medium heat until mixture thickens and pasta is cooked through. Season with additional pepper if needed. Serve hot. Enjoy!

In a saucepan combine water and apple juice. Add oats and bring to a boil. Stir and reduce heat to low and cook for 5-7 minutes. Stir in cinnamon and dried apples. Cook for an additional minute. In a small bowl combine flax seed oil and water. Whisk together. Add the flax seed mixture to the oats. Cook for an additional minute. Remove from heat. Stir in maple syrup and walnuts. Serve warm.

In a deep skillet heat bacon until crisp and drain on paper towels. Add bacon drippings and butter and saute onion and garlic until tender. Add carrots and saute for about 5 minutes. Stir in brown sugar and salt and pepper to taste. Cover and cook over medium heat for about 20 minutes until tender. Serve hot with bacon on top.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook penne according to package instructions. Drain cooked pasta in a colander. While pasta is cooking, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion to pan and saute for 5 minutes. Add artichokes to skillet along with chicken breast. Cook for 5 minutes until chicken is fully cooked. Add in diced tomatoes. Add cream to saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil. Add in pesto sauce. Reduce heat to medium. Stir in pesto sauce and cook for 3 minutes. Add cooked pasta to saucepan. Toss until everything is well combined. Add in grated cheese. Serve immediately.
Blend 1 1/2 cups bananas with 1 cup strawberries in blender. Add 1 cup orange juice. Blend. Blend in 1 cup vanilla ice cream. Serve immediately.

Cream butter and sugars until light and creamy. Beat in vanilla extract and eggs. In another bowl mix together baking soda and saltgradually add to creamed mixture. Stir in flour just until moistened and blended well. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts and pour into a greased and floured cookie sheet. Bake at 375° for 11 minutes or until lightly browned and set. Cool for a few minutes before removing from cookie sheetscool completely on wire racks before storing in tightly covered containers.

Prepare barbecue sauce by combining 2 Tbsp. seasoning salt, 2 Tbsp. lemon juice, 1 Tbsp. water and 4 Tbsp. barbecue sauce. Place ribs in a large roasting pan. Pour barbecue sauce over ribscover tightly. Bake at 325 for 2 hours. Uncoverbrush ribs with remaining barbecue sauce. Bake an additional 1 hour.

Mix 1 cup of Splenda with 1 cup of water until dissolved. In a blender or food processor, puree 1/2 cup of cream cheese until smooth. Add 1/2 cup of water and blend until smooth and creamy. Add 1/2 cup of cream cheese to the boiling water and mix to blend well. Add the water mixture to the blender and blend until smooth and creamy. Add 1 1/2 tbsp of Splenda and blend until smooth and creamy. Add 2 tbsp of gelatin and blend until smooth and creamy. Pour into a 8 or 9 inch springform or other round cake pan and place in the refrigerator until firm. Refrigerate for 6-8 hours or overnight to set firm before serving. This recipe also freezes very well and can be served as an ice cream substitute with no-sugar-added whipped cream, sugar-free fruit and nuts, or sugar-free candy sprinkles on top.

Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C). Grease and flour a 13x9-inch pan. In a large bowl combine all the dry cake mix ingredients and mix well. In a small bowl combine the vegetable oil, water and eggs and mix well. Stir the dry mix into the wet mix and mix well. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the centre comes out clean. While the cake is baking prepare the caramel sauce. Melt 1 1/2 cups (375 mL) of the caramel ice cream sauce in a saucepan over medium heat until smooth. Pour caramel over cake when it is almost done baking and spread evenly over the top and sides of the cake. Allow the caramel sauce to set for 10-15 minutes before assembling the bars. For the cookie dough layerin a small bowl combine the refrigerated white chocolate chip macadamia nut cookie dough with 1/3 cup (7

Cook the ramen according to package directions. Set aside. In a large saucepan over medium heat, add the vegetable oil and butter and when the butter is melted add the wild mushroom. Cook until they are tender. Add salt and pepper according to taste. Stir in the ramen noodles. Cook until the noodles are tender. Garnish with chopped scallions. Serves 4.

Prepare sourdough bread according to package directionscut bread in half and remove center portion to make room for filling. Spread one half of bread cut side down in a greased 10 x 15 baking dishspread cheeses over bread and sprinkle with garlic and peppertop with remaining bread half and press down firmly to secure in place. In a small bowl, whisk egg and water together and pour over bread and cheese mixturesprinkle bread and cheese mixture evenly with cumin and parmesan cheese. Bake 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and bread is golden brown. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine all ingredients except pork chops. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Pour mixture over pork chops and spread to cover. Sprinkle with garlic powder and seasoning salt. Place pork chops in an ungreased 15 x 10 x 1 baking pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until meat thermometer reaches 155 degrees F.

In large bowl combine rice with olive oilmix well. Set aside 1/4 cup rice for garnish. In 12-inch skillet stir-fry chicken over medium heat 6-7 minutes or until donedrain. Stir-fry peppers 2-3 minutesstir-fry mangoes 30-60 seconds or until heated throughstir-fry papaya 30-60 seconds or until heated through. Stir-fry peanuts 2-3 minutes or until goldendrain. In large salad bowl combine rice, chicken, vegetables, peanuts, peanut sauce, papayatoss well. Serve on lettuce leaves with reserved rice mixture on side.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine egg and salt and pepper to taste. Dip pork tenderloin into egg mixture. Coat with breadcrumbs. Place pork into 13 X 9 baking dish. Pour spaghetti sauce over pork and sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan cheese. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and continue baking until meat is tender and sauce is bubbling. Serve with pasta or rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease or paper-line 12 muffin cups or use paper muffin liners. In medium bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and salt. In another medium bowl, combine egg, brown sugar, granulated sugar, fat free sour cream, buttermilk and butterstir to blend. Add wet ingredients to drystir just until moistened (batter will be thick). Spoon batter into prepared cupssprinkle with blackberries. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Serve warm. Makes 12 muffins.

Add jalapenos to the blender along with the mayonnaise. Blend until well combined. Stir in the jalapeno juice, garlic powder, sugar, paprika, cumin, and salt. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Cut crescent rolls into 6 slices. Unroll each slice. Spread sausage on each piece. Put onion in each. Add mushrooms. Place one slice of cheese on each. Beat eggs. Spread on top of mushrooms. Place another slice of cheese on top. Fold up each crescent. Spoon into an ungreased 9x13 pan. Cover with foil. Bake for 25 minutes at 350 degrees fahrenheit. Remove foil for last 15 minutes.

Mix dry yeast and sugar in a cup of lukewarm water in a small bowl and let stand 5 minutes. In a large bowl combine warm water (105 to 110 degrees), 1 tbsp sugar, yeast mixture and salt. Add 4 cups of flour and mix well. Add remaining flour slowly until dough forms and pulls away from the side of the bowl. Knead on lightly floured surface until dough is smooth and elastic. Dust surface with flour and cover bowl tightly. Let rise until doubled in size (about 1 hour). Punch down dough and divide into 4 equal parts. Roll out dough into balls and place into greased bowls. Cover and let rise until doubled (about 30 minutes). Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes.

In a soup pot heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Sautee the onions and garlic. When they are soft add the chestnuts. When the chestnuts start to brown add the tomatoes. Cook until the tomatoes break down. Stir in the chicken stock. Next add the chorizo. Cook until the chorizo is cooked through. Add the parsley. Serve the soup. Makes 6 to 8 servings. Serve the soup with crusty bread.

Cut the cream cheese into small cubes and place in a large mixing bowl. Add cheddar cheese and ranch dressing mix and mix with a large spoon. Form into a ball and place on a serving platter. Sprinkle pecans on top and serve with crackers or veggies.

In a bowl combine crumbs and butter until blended. Press into bottom of a greased 13x9 pan. Bake for about 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Let cool completely. In a bowl with a mixer beat cream cheese and sugar until fluffy. Beat in the strawberry jam and stir well until blended. Fold in the cool whip and strawberries. Spread over crust and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Refrigerate at least two hours or overnight. Garnish with additional strawberries before serving. Makes about eight bars.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease the pie crust. In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese with an electric mixer until it is fluffy. Beat in the sugar until well combined. Add the egg and beat well. Add the vanilla extract and mix well. Pour the cheese mixture into the pie crust. Cover the crust with pecans. In a small bowl, beat the eggs until blended. In another small bowl, mix the corn syrup with the sugar. Pour the egg mixture over the pecans. Bake in the preheated oven until the filling is set, about 45 minutes. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream.

Place a roasted chicken breast into a large plastic container and set aside. Slice two cloves of garlic in half horizontally. Place each half inside the cavity of the chicken. Wash the lemon and cut off the ends. Place the lemon in the cavity of the chicken. Remove the back of the lemon and wipe out the inside with a paper towel. Place the lemon in the cavity of the chicken. Fill the cavity with fresh thyme. Pour olive oil over the top of the chicken. Place the lid on the container. Place the container in the refrigerator overnight. Remove the container from the refrigerator the next day. Place the container in a large stock pot. Add white wine to the stock pot. Cover the container with aluminum foil and place in the oven for 30 minutes. Remove the container from the oven and place on a platter. Remove the garlic and lemons from the cavity. Serve the chicken with a side of vegetables.

In a large saucepan melt butter and brown sugar over medium heat. When butter is melted and sugar is dissolved, slowly add corn syrup and water. Stir until mixture begins to boil. Add popped corn and stir until all corn is covered. Pour into greased 13x9 pan. When cool, cut into squares.

Make pumpkin pie crust. In a large bowl, combine all the pumpkin pie filling ingredients except the carnation evaporated milk. Mix well. Place filling in a deep dish pie shell. Top with carnation evaporated milk. Bake at 350 degrees for 45-50 minutes. Serve warm.

In a large glass bowl, blend tofu with 2 cups of water until smooth. Set aside to soften for about 30 minutes. In a medium saucepan, bring 1 cup of sugar and 3/4 cup of water to a boil over medium heat. Stir in tofu mixture until combined. Stir in chocolate shavings and cinnamon. Pour into individual bowls and chill for at least 3 hours before serving. Top with more chocolate shavings if desired.

Peel, core and slice apples into thin wedges. In a saucepan over medium heat, melt the canola oil. Add apples and lemon juice, cinnamon and sugar. Cook, stirring occasionally for about 10 minutes or until apples are tender. Pour into a greased souffle dish or 8-9-inch square glass casserole dish. Beat eggs until thick. Stir in potato starch until blended. Pour into the prepared dish and spread out evenly over apples. Sprinkle with kosher salt. Bake for about 25 minutes or until lightly browned on top. Serve with ice cream or whipped cream.

Place apple pie filling in the bottom of a baking pan or casserole dish. Spread the nutmeg, cinnamon sugar mixture over the top of the apple pie filling. Place the biscuits on top of the cinnamon sugar mixture. Drizzle the butter all over the biscuits. Bake at 375 for about 20 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown and the filling is bubbly.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat and add garlic and green onion. Saute until fragrant (about five minutes). Add cream and wine and bring to boil. Add chopped parsley and cook for five more minutes. Remove from heat and pour into cleaned mushroom caps or shells. Place the mushroom caps or shells in an oven safe dish and fill them with the butter and garlic mixture. Place in an oven set at 425 degrees for ten minutes or until the butter is bubbling. Remove from the oven and garnish with chopped parsley and serve with your favorite bread and wine. You can find snails at your local farmer's market or at specialty grocery stores (such as Whole Foods) or on the internet at www.escargot.com and www.escargotmeals.com .

Pour broth into a large saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes or until reduced by half. Add coconut milk and simmer for another 10 minutes or until reduced further. Add ginger and garlic and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 minute or until fragrant. Add broth mixture and bring to a boil over high heat. Add spinach and stir until wilted about 2 minutes. Stir in shallot and cilantro and simmer for another minute or until spinach is very tender. Remove from heat and stir in the coconut milk, soy sauce and chili sauce. Ladle soup into bowls and garnish with additional cilantro if desired. Serve with a fresh garnish of lime wedges and additional chili sauce at the table.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heatadd garlic cloves and cook for about 1 minute, stirring frequentlyadd pork loincook about 10 minutes turning onceadd dry rub seasonings and stir until pork loin is brownadd figscook for about 2 minutesadd honeycook for about 5 more minutesremove pork loin from skillet and let rest for 10 minutesplace pork loin into roasting panadd pine nutsheat oven to 400 degrees Froast pork loin for 20 minutesremove pork loin from roasting pantop pork loin with cheese and basilplace pork loin back into roasting panheat oven to 350 degrees Froast for 20 minuteslet pork rest for 10 minutesserve with desired sauce

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large bowl combine flour, baking powder and saltset aside. In a small bowl beat sugar and coffee granules until blended together. Add eggs to coffee mixture and beat well. Add milk and blend until well mixed. Add coffee mixture to flour mixture and stir until just combined. Fold in chocolate chips and walnuts. Spoon batter into paper lined or greased 12-cup muffin tins. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes in the pans before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Grease bottom and sides of 9 x 5 inch loaf pan. In medium bowl with wire whisk beat sweetened condensed milk and evaporated milk. Whisk in eggs and sugar until smooth. Add flour and baking powder and whisk until blended. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Invert onto wire rack and cool completely. Frost with low fat buttercream frosting.

Stir corn syrup, margarine and water in a large saucepan over medium heat until margarine is melted. Cook and stir until mixture comes to a boil. Add peanuts and baking soda. Boil and stir for 2 minutes. Stir in sugar. Boil and stir until mixture reaches soft ball stage (250f). Boil 1 minute more. Pour onto a greased cookie sheet. Let cool for 15 minutes. Break into pieces and store in an airtight container. Yield: 8 cups.

Bring milk to the boil. Add flour to make a paste. Cook the pasta for a few minutes. Pour the boiled macaroni into the pan with the flour-milk mixture. Cook for a further minute. Tip off the heat. Add the cheese. Stir to melt the cheese. Serve sprinkled with a little chopped fresh parsley.

Preheat a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the oil and heat until shimmering. Add the spaghetti sauce and stir until smooth. Pour 2 inches of sauce into a large shallow dish. Add potatoes to the saucepan and toss to coat in sauce. Add the potatoes to the shallow dish and top with cheese curds. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake 10 to 12 minutes.

In a large bowl beat together butter and condensed milk. Add flour, nuts and vanilla extract. Mix thoroughly. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool for 2 minutes on cookie sheet before removing to wire rack to cool.

Brown the ground beef in a skillet and then drain. Add the onion and taco seasoning and cook for 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes and the green chilies and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in the water. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer. Cover and cook until the tomatoes have broken down. Stir in the kidney beans. Cook for 15 to 20 minutes or until the beans are tender. Add salt and pepper to taste and serve. This chili is good with cornbread. I make this for dinner one night and then serve it the next day with cornbread for supper.

Preheat grill or grill pan over medium heat. Brush top round steak with olive oil and sprinkle with gluten-free soy sauce and dried thyme. Grill steak about four minutes per side. Let rest for five minutes before slicing thinly against the grain. Serve with vegetables of choice on the side.

In a large heavy based saucepan with a lid over medium heat add the extra virgin olive oil and the sliced garlic. Saute garlic for 1 minute. Add the zucchini and mushrooms. Sweat the zucchini and mushrooms for about 5 minutes, stirring regularly until they have softened. Add the sun-dried tomato and the vegetable broth and bring to the boil. Add salt and freshly ground pepper to taste. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add the fresh basil and stir for 2 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a blender in batches and puree until smooth and creamy. Add the mixture back into the saucepan and re-heat. Serve over pasta.

Add tuna to pesto sauce and toss to coat. Cut the bread into slices and spread with mayonnaise. Layer the tuna salad over the bread. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cut the red onion and celery into small pieces and layer over the tuna salad. Cut the olives into small pieces and layer over the other vegetables. You can make these sandwiches up to 24 hours before serving. To make sandwiches, cut the crusts off the bread and place the two pieces together and put the sandwiches in the fridge. When ready to serve, cut the sandwiches in half and serve with lettuce leaves and tomato slices.

In a large skillet over medium high heat add vegetable oil. When oil is shimmering add green onions and garlic. Saute 1 minute. Add mushrooms. Saute 3 minutes. Add bok choy. Saute 3 minutes. Add 2 tablespoons of water. Cover and cook 2 minutes or till tender. Sprinkle with crushed red pepper flakes. Serve over rice. Add a dash of soy sauce if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 13 x 9 pan. Place 1/2 cup of egg mixture on each 1/3 of the noodles and cover with noodles. Place 1/2 cup egg mixture on 1/3 of the noodles. Place noodles in pan. Bake 30 minutes. Cover with remaining egg mixture and bake another 30 minutes. In a medium bowl, beat the 1 cup sugar with the margarine until the sugar is dissolved. Add the brown sugar and lemon juice. Spread on top of the casserole. Sprinkle corn flake crumbs on top. Bake 10 minutes. Serve warm.

In a small bowl combine sugar and cocoa. Stir in milk and vanilla. Add egg and stir until blended. Pour into greased 2-cup mug and microwave at full power 1 to 2 minutes or until lightly browned. Stir and microwave an additional 15 seconds. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cook mashed potatoes as directed on package. Meanwhile, cook ground turkey as directed on package. Drain well. Add vegetables to ground turkeystir to coat. Spread into greased 2-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with cheesedrizzle with gravy. Coverbake uncovered for 25 minutes. Uncoverbake an additional 25 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.

Thaw the hash browns and put them in a large skillet. Cook the hash browns with butter and onion until cooked. Stir in cream of chicken soup and stir until heated through. Add the cheddar cheese and corn flakes. Stir to combine. Serve with sour cream.

In a shaker or mixing glass, muddle the lime juice, mint, and sugar. Add ice and shake well. Strain into a tall glass with ice. Top with vodka and Chambord. Garnish with fresh mint sprig and raspberries.

Brown meat, add diced tomatoes with juice. Add broth. Add mixed vegetables. Add water if needed. Add soup mix. Add frozen vegetables. Add hot pepper sauce. Add seasonings. Heat thoroughly. Add small shell pasta. Cook until tender. Serve hot.

Prepare and steam broccoli until tender. Drain and place in a large bowl. Cut bacon into small pieces and place on top. Add red onion and dried cranberries. In a separate bowl, combine mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar. Add to bowl with broccoli and toss. Chill at least 2 hours. Serve with crackers.

In a large pot, combine the milk, sugar, green cardamoms, saffron threads, cottage cheese, flour, rose water, pistachio nuts. Stir to combine. Over low heat, bring to a boil for 15 minutes. Add the cottage cheese cubes and stir until the cottage cheese is melted. Transfer to a greased container and refrigerate for 3 hours or overnight to set. Roll the mixture into 1 1/2 inch balls (you should get about 12 balls). Serve cold, with a chilled mint sauce on the side if desired. Store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

Whisk together the cream cheese, sugar, vanilla extract and eggs. In another bowl beat the milk with the nutmeg. Dip the bread into the milk mixture then drain on paper towels. Spoon about 1/3 cup of the cream cheese mixture over each slice of bread. Arrange the blueberries over the cream cheese. Place the bread in an oven proof dish. Pour the remaining cream cheese mixture over the top of the bread. Sprinkle with the sugar. Place the dish in the oven for about 15 minutes or until the top is golden brown.

Cook orzo pasta in boiling salted water until tender, drain. Combine pudding mix and water in large bowl. Stir until blended. Add drained orzo pasta. Fold in remaining ingredients. Refrigerate 2 hours. Top with frozen whipped topping.

Brown the bacon until crispremove from skillet. Drain excess fat from bacon onto paper towel. Place bacon strips on paper towel and pat dry. Set aside. Add butter to the same skilletmelt over medium-high heat. Add onioncook until tender. Add peascook until heated through. Add peas and stir in heavy cream, salt and pepper. Cook for 1 minute. Add cooked tortellinitoss gently. Cook for 1 minute more. Stir in baconcook for 1 minute more. Top with shredded Parmesan cheese before serving.

Saute onion in margarine until tender. Stir in flour and cook 30 seconds. Gradually stir in chicken broth and bring to boil. Add creamed corn and corn and heat through. Stir in red bell pepper and hot pepper sauce. Sprinkle with cheese.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray a baking dish lightly. Cut each chicken breast in half horizontally. Spread thyme evenly over chicken breasts. In a large bowl, mix together the milk, pepper, garlic powder, red pepper flakes, salt and pepper. Mix well. Pour into baking dish. Place chicken breasts over milk mixture. Pour remaining milk mixture over chicken. Bake for 1 hour or until a meat thermometer reads 170 degrees. Sprinkle each breast with a little grated Parmesan if desired.

Saute the onion and green pepper in olive oil. Add in the zucchini and yellow squash. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add in the tomatoes and continue cooking for another 3 minutes. Stir in the brown sugar and the cooked rice. Place all ingredients in a crock pot. Cook on high for 2 hours. Enjoy!

Heat oil in large skillet. Add onion and seasoning. Cook on medium heat until tender. Drain. Mix cream of chicken soup with milk. Add beef. Cook on medium heat. Pour beef mixture into tortillas. Roll and place seam side down in greased 9x13 baking dish. Pour chili mixture over enchiladas. Cover and bake at 350 for one hour. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake until cheese is melted. Serve with green onion dip.

In a large pot boil green beans for about 5 minutes or until tender. Drain off excess water from beans. Add onion, dill and mint into pot of green beans. Sprinkle salt and black pepper on top. In a frying pan add 2 tbsp olive oil and onion, garlic cloves, black pepper and salt into pot of green beans. Sautee onion until tender. Add 1 tbsp olive oil into pot of green beans and stir in stewed tomatoes. Add 1 tbsp olive oil into frying pan. Stir in feta cheese and stir until feta is melted. Pour feta into pot of green beans along with other vegetables. Stir gently in pot for a few minutes until mixture is blended together. Transfer mixture into serving dish or individual plates for serving.
Mix ice cream, brandy, kahlua and nutmeg in blender until smooth. Serve.

Boiling the salmon in fish stock, in a non-reactive pot, for about 5 minutes makes it easy to poach. It will taste like it was cooked in butter! Let salmon cool, remove skin with a slotted spoon, skin side down, and pat dry with paper towels. Poached salmon is easy to slice paper-thin for fancy appetizers or for a quick bite with a salad. To make cucumber sauce, combine sour cream with lebanese cucumber and white wineseason with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Puree with a stick blender until smooththin with extra virgin olive oil if necessary. Fresh tarragon makes this dressing special! Serve with potatoes steamed in chicken stock.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Melt brown sugar and butter together until blended in microwave or on the stove top. Combine chocolate chips and nuts. Stir together to mix thoroughly. Place on waxed paper& refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm& then cut into small pieces for serving. Store them in a covered container until ready to eat.

Soak wooden skewers in water for 15-30 minutes before using. Heat olive oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add the red bell pepper, garlic and thyme leaves and saute for 3-4 minutes, until softened but not browned. Remove the garlic with a slotted spoonset aside for later use. Add the remaining vegetables, the lemon juice and the rosemary leavessaute for 3-4 minutes until the vegetables are tender but not browned. Add the mushroomssaute for 3-4 minutes until the mushrooms are tender and browned. Place the kabobs on the grill rack over medium-hot coalsgrill for 2-3 minutes per side or until the mushrooms are tender but not browned. Transfer the kabobs to a serving plattersprinkle with the reserved garlic and the black pepper. Serve immediately with the sauce, if desired.

Boil water and chili powder together. Add soup. Add sausages. Add potatoes. Add water to cover. Cook for one hour. When done drain. Melt butter. Melt cheese. Mix breadcrumbs with butter. Spread butter over cheese. Sprinkle cheese over casserole. Sprinkle crumbs over cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about an hour.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add cabbage and bacon. Cook 3 minutes, or until cabbage wilts. Reduce heat to medium-lowadd garlic and cook 1 minute, or until garlic turns golden-brown. Stir in tomatoes and cook 1 minute, or until heated through. Sprinkle cabbage mixture evenly over tortillasroll up tortillas and place in a greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Top with cheesesprinkle with onion. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted.

In a saucepan, brown the ground beef with the onions. Add the cream cheese and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly, then add the mushroom soup and cream. Bring the soup mixture to a boil then add the milk. Cook for 5 minutes, then add the catsup, salt and pepper. Pour the mixture into an 8x8 baking dish. Top with biscuits (canned or homemade) then pour remaining soup mixture over the biscuits. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. If desired, place a few shrimp over the biscuits before serving. You can use other meat if you prefer.

Prepare a double boiler and set it over simmering water. Melt chocolate and cream cheese in boiler. Stir with a whisk until smooth. Remove from heat and add vanilla and powdered sugar. Blend well with whisk. Fill a piping bag fitted with a large star tip with truffle mixture. Pipe truffles onto wax paper. Let set until firm. Roll truffles in ground nut for decoration. Store truffles in refrigerator.

Spread a 9 x 13 pan with butter. Place a sheet of yellow cake mix into the pan. Bake according to package directions. Remove the cake from the oven and sprinkle brown sugar over the cake. Spread cherry syrup over the brown sugar. Sprinkle with nuts. Arrange cherries around the cake. Flip the pan over onto a serving platter. Cool slightly and remove the cake from the pan. Garnish with whipped topping. (Cake can be made in advance.)

Preheat oven to 180°C / Gas Mark 4. Line a roasting tray with baking parchment. Mix together plain flour and seasoning. Dip chicken pieces in batter and transfer to tray. Place in preheated oven and cook for approximately 10 minutes. Remove from oven and coat in maple syrup and mustard. Return chicken pieces to tray and place back in oven until golden brown. Remove from tray and coat in orange juice and zest. Return to tray. Bake for a further 10 minutes.

Pat salmon fillets dry with kitchen paper and season with salt and pepper. Heat some sunflower oil in a frying pan over a medium heat until it is hot but not smoking. Lay fillets skin side down in pan. Cook for 2 minutes on each side until golden brown. Transfer to a plate to keep warm while you make the tartare creme sauce. Put spinach in a blender with a little water. Puree until smooth. Put spinach, creme fraiche, lemon juice, capers and salt and pepper in a food processor and blend until smooth. Add parsley leaves, then pulse until finely chopped. Pour sauce over salmon fillets and serve at once.

Drain the chickpeas. Place them into a food processor or a blender. Add the onion, garlic, parsley, coriander, cumin and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Blitz until smooth. Slowly drizzle in the olive oil until you achieve a thick batter. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Scoop tablespoonsful of batter onto baking trays. Flatten with wet hands. Fry the falafel in a little canola oil until golden brown on both sides. Transfer them to a baking tray lined with kitchen paper. Keep warm until ready to serve. Serve with a tahini or hummus dip.

Place the cabbage in a large bowl and sprinkle with the caraway and sea salt. Cover and let stand at room temperature for a day and a half, stirring occasionally with a fork or your hands (do not add water). Strain off the juice (reserving the juice) and discard the cabbage leaves, which can be saved for later use as a wrap for sandwiches or burritos. The cabbage juice can be used as a flavorful replacement for water in other recipes and for soaking beans and grains prior to cooking. If you are using the juice for soaking beans and grains and you want them to be extra tender and digestible, add 1 teaspoon of whey (from unpasteurized milk) for every cup of beans and grains. Place the juice in a glass jar in your refrigerator for up to a week. It will keep for up to two weeks in the freezer (you can even freeze it in ice cube trays!). If you are using the juice as a flavorful replacement for water in other recipes and you want them to be extra tender and dig

Prepare beets by boiling until tender. Peel the skin and cut into small cubes. Combine with roasted cashew halves, garlic and cheese in a food processor. Blitz until smooth. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with lemon juice just before serving. Serve with crackers or raw vegetables.

Bring milk and jalapenos to a simmer in a saucepan over medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 25 minutes to infuse flavors. Remove jalapenos and garlic and place them in a blender with 1 cup of the milk. Add the remaining milk and the white processed cheese. Process until smooth. Serve warm.

Boil macaroni until tender. Drain well in a colander. Beat egg with milk until blended. Stir in breadcrumbs, cheese, milk mixture, nutmeg, salt & pepper. Dump macaroni into the sauce and stir until well coated. Pour into a greased 9 x 13 pan. Top with breadcrumbs before baking at 350 for 15 min or until breadcrumbs are brown & cheese is melted. Serve hot.
In a salt rimmed glass pour tequila. Then add pineapple juice, lime juice and cointreau. Add hot sauce. Stir until combined. Add ice and stir again. Garnish with pineapple wedge.

Slice french bread into 3/4 inch slices. Place bread in a 13 x 9 baking dish. Combine dressing and butter and stir well. Pour over bread. Sprinkle lightly with garlic powder. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Serve warm.

Wash potatoes. Cut into 1/4 inch slices. Cut each slice in half. Place in a single layer in a lightly greased 13x9 inch pan. Drizzle with oil. Bake at 350 for 30 to 40 minutes, or until tender. Stirring occasionally. In a large skillet, saute onions in oil until tender. Stir in turmeric. Cook and stir for 30 seconds. Add the potatoes. Cook over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in the garlic. Cook and stir for 1 minute.

Preheat oven to 350. In a small bowl combine yogurt and baking soda. Set aside. In a medium bowl mix brown sugar and eggs. In a large bowl mix flour, baking powder and salt. Add yogurt mixture to brown sugar mixture. Add oil and stir. Add flour mixture to wet mixture. Stir in blueberries. Fill paper-lined muffin cups to 2/3 full. Bake at 350 for 18 to 20 minutes. Serve warm.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chops and brown on both sides. Add paprika and stir until chops are lightly browned and paprika is fragrant, about 1 minute. Add garlic powder, salt and pepper, and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Pour orange juice over chops and stir until chops are well coated. Place chops in a large baking dish and set aside. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, whisk together orange marmalade and vinegar and bring to a simmer until sauce thickens and reduces slightly and coats the back of a spoon, about 5 minutes. Add brown sugar and cook until sauce thickens slightly and is reduced by half, about 5 minutes more. Pour sauce over chops and bake in the preheated oven until chops are cooked through and sauce is slightly thickened and glazed over the pork, about 30 minutes more.

Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add shallot and garlic. Cook until softened. Add vodka and cook for 3 minutes. Add parma rosa sauce mix and milk. Bring to a boil. Cook for 4 minutes or until thickened. Add light cream and cook for 3 minutes. Add parmesan cheese and cook for 1 minute. Add penne pasta and cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cream the butter and sugars in a large bowl. Add in the rum and sour cream. In a small bowl, combine the almond extract and sifted flour. Add the flour mixture and eggs to the bowl with the rum mixture. Add the baking soda and salt. Stir in the mashed bananas. Pour into a well-greased 12 x 4 inch loaf pan. Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Check the center. It should be done by then. Allow the bread to cool before slicing. It can be served with a dollop of whipped cream. Or with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Place all ingredients in a crock pot and stir well. Cover and cook on high for 6 hours or low for 10 hours. Serve with tortillas and sour cream.
Brown the celery and onion in the oil until tender. Combine remaining ingredients and stir into celery mixture. Pour into casserole dish and bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray 9x13 pan with non stick cooking spray. Place hash browns in pan and set aside. In a small bowl, mix together cream of mushroom soup, thyme and 1 cup of the shredded cheeseset aside. In a skillet over medium heat brown the ham until browned on each side. Place ham in the prepared pan. In a small bowl mix together sour cream and onionset aside. In a bowl mix together hash browns, ham, mushroom soup mixture, sour cream mixture and remaining shredded cheese. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve hot garnished with french fried onions if desired. This makes a great breakfast casserole also.

Prepare potatoes and carrots in boiling water. Cook for 10-12 minutes. Drain. Peel and dice the potatoes. Melt the butter in a skillet. Add the potatoes and carrots. Cook until tender. Add the mushroom soup and milk. Add the corn. Stir and cook for 5 minutes. Add the cheese and cook until melted. Add the seasoning.

Combine the tomato, basil, balsamic vinegar and oil in a small bowl. Set aside. In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine the chicken breasts and broccoli florets with the water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, covered for about 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and broccoli is tender. Meanwhile, cook the couscous according to package directions (usually about 10 minutes). In a bowl, whisk the vinegar mixture together with the garlic clove and season with salt and pepper. Serve the chicken and broccoli over the couscous with the salsa and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Mix pumpkin with sugar and corn syrup. Cook until thickened. Remove from heat and add milk. Cook over low heat until thickened. Remove from heat and cool. Beat margarine and vanilla. Add pumpkin and stir well. Pour into 8x8x2 inch pan. Cool until firm. Cut into squares. Store in air tight container.

Preheat oven to 375f. Put broccoli florets into 3-quart casserole dish or similar sized baking dish. Whisk matzo meal with butter until well combined, about 1 minute. Pour over broccoli and mix to coat evenly. Sprinkle with dry parsley flakes, lemon zest, thyme, salt and black pepper. Bake until golden brown and tender about 1 hour.

Cut bratwurst into 1 1/4 inch pieces and place in a mixing bowl. In a small bowl mix together the soy sauce, apple juice concentrate, mustard. Pour mixture over bratwurst pieces. Put onion, red and green peppers in a separate bowl and coat with oil mixture. Thread bratwurst pieces and vegetables alternately onto skewers. Grill over medium heat for 8 minutes, turning skewers frequently. Serve with toothpicks or with a fork and knife.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a standard 24-cup muffin tin with paper liners and set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, 1/4 cup sugar, baking powder and 1/4 teaspoon of salt until combined. In a smaller bowl, whisk together milk and butter and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the flour mixture with the remaining 1/4 cup of sugar and the eggs and mix well with a rubber spatula (do not over mix) until smooth. Fold in the butter-milk mixture just until combined (do not over mix). Fill the prepared muffin cups 3/4 full with batter and gently press batter down to create a fluted edge. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the centre comes out clean. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, cook the blueberries in the 1/2 cup of water and the remaining 1/2 teaspoon of sugar over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for 5 to 6 minutes or until

Preheat oven to 400 f. Grease and flour a 10x15 baking pan. Cream butter and sugar together. Add eggs and beat well. Add sour cream and vanilla and beat well. Add flour and baking powder alternately with milk, stirring after each addition. Fold in brown and white sugars and cinnamon. Pour into prepared pan and bake for about one hour in preheated oven. Let cool before serving.
In a mixing bowl combine all the crust ingredients. Mix with a spoon until well combined. Flatten the dough into a 9 inch pie pan. Bake at 400 degrees for 12 minutes or until light brown.

Preheat grill or grill pan. Place the chicken breasts on the grill. Grill the breasts for about 5 to 7 minutes per side or until cooked through and no longer pink. Remove and tent with foil. While the chicken is cooking, add the olive oil and the lemon juice to a medium sized bowl. Add the oregano and the garlic salt. Stir well to combine. Add the feta cheese to the bowl and toss to mix. Remove the feta from the bowl and set aside. To make the tzatziki, combine the yogurt and the lemon juice in a medium sized bowl. Stir well to combine. Add the remaining feta to the yogurt mixture. Stir to combine. Transfer to a serving bowl and cover. Brush the grilled chicken breasts with some of the remaining olive oil and sprinkle with some feta. Serve the grilled breasts with the tzatziki sauce and the remaining feta.

Brown chicken breasts in 2 tbsp. of oil in a skillet over medium heat. Once browned add onions, garlic and chili peppers. Add 2 cups of water to pan. Stir in chili salsa. Place chicken breasts in a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Pour broth mixture over chicken. Cover pan with foil. Cook for 30 minutes. Sprinkle chicken with cheese. Cook for an additional 10 minutes. Serve with cooked rice.

Boil the shrimp in salted water until just barely cooked (don't overcook). Drain the shrimp and remove the shells and heads and set aside. Melt the butter in a large skillet and add the shrimp and garlic and cook until just done. Melt the butter in another skillet and saute the pimentos. When the shrimp are done saute the onion in the same skillet until tender. Mix the cream of mushroom soup and the mayonnaise together in a bowl and add the sauteed onions and pimentos and cooked shrimp. Salt and pepper to taste. Pour mixture into an 8 x 11 x 2 glass baking dish and cover with slices of cooked hard boiled egg and sprinkle with the slivered almonds and the bread crumbs. Bake for 25 minutes at 425F or until bubbly and golden brown. Serves 8 to 10.

Cut potatoes in half and place in slow cooker. Add onion and raisins. Sprinkle potatoes and onion with cumin and salt. Cover and cook on low heat setting for 5 hours or high heat setting for 3 hours. Add stew meat and cook until tender. Add tomatoes and chickpeas. Stir in fresh cilantro. Makes 6 servings.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add the ground beef and saute until cooked through and browned. Drain well. Stir in the tomato soup and salsa. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-lowcook 5 minutes more. Place 1/3 cup of the cooked meat mixture onto each of the tortillasroll up, and place seam side down into the heated skillet. Top with cheesecook until cheese is melted and golden brown on top of the tortillas. Serve immediately.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the potatoes and cook until tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Add the fennel and celery and cook until softened, 15 to 20 minutes. Stir in the cooked chicken and olives and cook for 5 minutes. Add the chopped herbs and season with salt and ground black pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
In a medium bowl, combine all the salad ingredients. In a small bowl, whisk together the dressing ingredients. Pour dressing over the salad and mix until well combined. Serve immediately.
Mix dressing in a bowl with coleslaw. Add onion. Mix well. Serves 4 to 6 people.

Prepare the ancho chilies by removing the seeds and veins using a sharp paring knifefinely chop the remaining flesh into small pieces. In a small bowl combine the chopped anchos with the garlic cloves, onion slices and light brown sugarseason with cider vinegar to tasteset aside. In a small non-stick frying pan heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heatadd the salmon fillets and cook for about 4 minutes on each side or until golden browntransfer to platessprinkle with chopped cilantro. Top with the ancho sauceserve immediately.

Combine the soup mix, bouillon cube and mushrooms in a large pot. Place the meat in the pot and cover with cold water. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for one hour. Drain the meat. Set aside. Place the meat in a large roasting pan. Add the roasting pan contents in the slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 12 hours. Remove the meat and set aside. Skim and discard fat from the roasting pan. Add the roasting pan contents in the slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours. Remove the meat and set aside. Skim and discard fat from the roasting pan. Add the roasting pan contents in the slow cooker. Cover and cook on high for one hour. Remove the meat and set aside. Skim and discard fat from the roasting pan. Add the roasting pan contents in the slow cooker. Cover and cook on high for one hour. Remove the meat and set aside. Skim and discard fat from the roasting pan. Add the roasting pan contents in the slow cooker. Cover and cook

Boil potatoes in salted water until soft. Peel and mash potatoes. Add green beans. Fry bacon. Drain bacon on paper towels. Add bacon to potato mixture. Add garlic cloves, lemon juice and salt. Stir well. Serve warm or cold.

Combine corn starch and water. Mix well. Set aside. Heat oil and butter in deep frying pan. Brown chicken. Remove from pan and place on paper towels. Dip chicken into egg mixture and then into corn starch mixture. Place chicken back into oil and brown both sides. Serve with french fries.

Mix all of the ingredients except for the flank steaks in a large bowl. Set aside. Place flank steaks in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour in marinade and seal. Place bag in refrigerator and marinate for 24 hours. Grill or broil for 7-9 minutes on each side. Enjoy.

Place fish in large pot with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes. Add onion. Cook for 10 minutes. Add tomato puree. Cook for 10 minutes. Add potatoes. Cook for 20 minutes. Drain fish. Add fish to pot. Add vinegar. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add salt to taste. Serve with crusty bread.

Bring orange peel and grape juice to a boil. Add brown sugar and mustard. Cook for 10 minutes. Cool slightly. Combine brown sugar mixture and olive oil. Rub mixture all over ham. Sprinkle ham with whole cloves. Sprinkle with pepper. Bake ham for 20 minutes per pound or until tender. Remove from oven. Let stand 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Clean and devein prawns and cut them into rounds. Marinate prawns for about an hour. Preheat grill or broiler. Arrange prawns in a single layer on a lightly greased grill pan or broiler pan. Brush with sesame oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook prawns for about two minutes on each side or until just cooked through. To serve, thread prawns on a metal skewer and garnish with cilantro and lime. Serve with the dipping sauces. Makes 4 servings.

Cream butter and sugars in electric mixer bowl until light and creamy. Beat in egg until well mixed. Add mint chocolate chips, corn syrup, salt, baking soda, cinnamon. Stir just until blended. Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned around the edges. Cool on cookie sheet 2 to 3 minutes before removing to cooling rack to finish cooling completely. Yield: about 4 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cook rice a roni according to package directions. Place rice in a greased 9x9 baking dish. Spread 1/4 of cooked asparagus evenly across rice layer. Top with 1/4 cup turkey pieces, 1/4 cup cooked egg whites and 1/2 of finely minced garlic clove. Repeat layers once more with asparagus, turkey pieces, egg whites and garlic cloves. Beat remaining egg white until stiff peaks formgently fold in egg yolks and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese. Pour mixture over rice layer. Bake until top is lightly browned, 30 minutes. Let stand 15 minutes before cutting into squares. Serve with additional cheese if desired.

Bring water to a boil. Cook macaroni until tender. Drain well. Melt butter in a pan. Add flour. Stir and cook for a couple of minutes. Add milk. Stir in the mixture and bring to a boil. Add Velveeta cheese. Stir until cheese is melted. Add cream cheese. Stir in sharp cheddar cheese. Season with white pepper. Serve.

Prepare pie crust according to package directions. In large bowl, beat cream cheese with sugar until fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Stir in vanilla. Stir in pecans. Spoon mixture into crust. Place on cookie sheet. Sprinkle carmel candies over crust. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes. Cool before serving. Top with mini chocolate chips.

Spread 1/3 of cherry pie filling into bottom of 8 or 9 inch square pan. Sprinkle 1/2 cup of Bisquick over top of cherry mixture and then sprinkle with 1/2 cup of sugar. Sprinkle 2 Tablespoons of butter over top and then 2 teaspoons of vanilla. Spoon over rest of cherry mixture. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and celery. Cook until the onions are tender. Add pork and cook until done. Add soy sauce and beef broth. Cook until the sauce thickens. In a large bowl, mix cornstarch and water. Add the cornstarch mixture into the sauce and cook until thickened. Add the pork and vegetables. Garnish with bean sprouts.

Prepare grill for medium heat cooking. Cook burgers until done (about 10-12 minutes). Top with salsa and cheese. Heat tortillas on grill for 30 seconds on each side or until heated through. To assemble quesadilla, place lettuce, bell pepper slices and burger on bottom half of tortilla. Place top half of tortilla over burger and roll up. Serve quesadilla immediately with sour cream on side.

In a 9 x 13 baking pan combine macaroni, tomatoes, green peppers, onion, dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar, and extra virgin olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 40 minutes at 350. Stir every 10 minutes. Before serving top with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350f. Wash the chicken breasts and pat dry with paper towels. Heat the oil in a large skillet or pan until hot. Sprinkle with cumin, salt and pepper to taste. Add the chicken to the hot skillet and cook about 5 minutes per side, or until done. Place the chicken onto plates or baking dishes to cool slightly while you prepare the refried beans. Heat the salsa with the refried beans until warm (do not boil or the beans will get too soft). Place the salsa into the same dishes as the chicken with the beans. Place into the preheated oven and bake for about 15 minutes or until the beans are heated through. Serve immediately with sliced avocados or sour cream if desired.

In a large skillet with lid, saute onion and green onion until tender. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute. Stir in quinoa and vegetable stock. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered for 15 minutes. Add the cooked and cooled quinoa to a mixing bowl. Add the mushrooms and combine. In a small bowl, whisk together the remaining ingredients and combine with the quinoa mixture. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve warm.
Mix all of the meatball ingredients in a bowl with your hands. Shape the mixture into meatballs. Place on a large baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve with rice or rocket leaves.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9x13 inch pan or two 8 inch round cake pans. Beat together 1 cup butter and 2 cups white sugar until light and fluffy. Add in eggs and vanilla and beat until fluffy again. Slowly beat in flour, baking powder and salt until well combined. Stir in brown sugar and chocolate chunks and fold in chocolate toffee pieces. Pour batter into prepared pan(s). Bake 30-35 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely in pan on wire rack before icing.

In a large bowl, blend together flour and sugar. Add eggs one at a time and beat well after each one. Add oil and beat again. In a small bowl combine baking soda and salt and add to batter. In a third bowl place frozen strawberries and mash them with a potato masher or your fingers until they are completely crushed and mushy. Stir the strawberry mixture into the batter and combine well. Pour batter into two greased and floured 9x5 inch loaf pans and bake at 350 for about 1 hour or until bread tests done with a cake tester or toothpick. Let cool completely before removing from pans and cutting into slices or serving whole. This recipe is from my aunt who shared it with me and I have shared with all of you. I hope you like it as much as I do!

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Combine shortening and eggs. Sift together the baking soda, flour, salt, vanilla and sugar. Add the dry ingredients and stir. Add the raisins and walnuts and mix. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto greased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool on rack.

Mix corn in a large bowl. Beat eggs, half-and-half, sour cream, flour, baking powder, and baking soda in a small bowl. Pour into the corn mixturemix well. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat skillet with cooking spray. Pour or scoop batter onto skilletcook for about 3 minutes or until browned. Flipcook an additional minute or until browned. Serve with butter, maple syrup, or jam.

In a small pot combine the eggs and the ranch salad dressing. Cook until the egg white is cooked to your desired consistency. Set aside until cool. In a medium bowl combine the cooked eggs and the cream cheese. Season with the paprika and the salt and pepper. Mash with a fork until blended. Spoon mixture into a piping bag with a large tip. Pipe mixture into the egg whites. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve.

Cut the steak into bite sized pieces and put them in a large bowl. Add the barbecue sauce and mix well. Put the steak pieces on a lightly greased broiler pan. Put the steak pan under the broiler until the steak pieces are browned on all sides. Turn the flank steak pieces over with a spatula and broil for an additional 45 seconds. Put the steak pieces on a serving platter and drizzle them with the remaining barbecue sauce. Serve the flank steak with the hot sauce and mustard and the prepared lemon wedges.

To make the sauce, put the coconut cream into a large pan and bring it up to the boil. Simmer for 10 minutes. Meanwhile grate the kaffir lime zest into the pan. Add the sugar. When the sugar has dissolved, add the bird's eye chiles. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add the fish. Cover. Turn the heat to low. Cook for 10 minutes. When the fish is cooked through, remove from the heat. When the coconut cream sauce has cooled down slightly, remove the kaffir lime zest. Blend the sauce together with the raspberry vinegar. Stir in the raspberries. Serve with the cooked fish. To make the paw paw salsa, core the paw paw. Cut into thin rounds. Put in a large bowl. Add the raspberries. Stir in the lime juice. Tear the mint leaves over the top. Toss. Serve with the fish.

Saute the potatoes in the corn oil with the salt and paprika. Cook until tender. Add the garlic and hot red peppers. Add the fish fillets and cook until done. Place in a serving dish. Add the fresh coriander. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a 9-inch pie plate with a single sheet of Oreo cookie dough. Bake for 5 minutes until cookie begins to brown. Remove from oven. Take a scoop of coffee ice cream and place in the middle of the cookie crust. Take a chocolate bar and place on top of the ice cream. Next take another scoop of ice cream and place on top of the chocolate bar. Add another cookie layer. Repeat the layers until you have reached 5 layers of ice cream. Next take an oreo cookie and place it on top of the ice cream. Place in freezer for 2 hours. Once the pie has been frozen for 2 hours. Take out of the freezer. Place a cutting board on top of the pie and flip over. Remove the pie from the cutting board. Cut into 16 slices. Serve with hot fudge sauce.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Cook in large pot of boiling salted water until tender. Drain potatoes and transfer to a 3 quart casserole dish. Mash potatoes with 1 cup of the milk and 1/2 cup of the butter. Beat in the remaining milk and the remaining 1/2 cup of the butter. Season with the salt and pepper. Stir in the pesto sauce and the pine nuts. Spread potatoes in an even layer over the bottom of the casserole dish. Top with remaining potatoes and pine nuts. Spread 1/2 cup pesto sauce over the top of the potatoes. Bake for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Pour 1/2 cup cider into small saucepanadd cornstarch and stir well to dissolve. Bring to boil over medium heat, stirring constantly until cornstarch is completely dissolved. Add cheddar cheesecook 1 minute over medium heat stirring constantly. Reduce heat to low and cook 5 minutes while stirring occasionally. Stir in dry mustard, worcestershire sauce, cayenne pepper, butter and remaining cider. Cook 5 minutes more over low heat while stirring frequently. Serve with cubed bread.

In a large skillet over medium heat, stir together oil and almondscook and stir until almonds are lightly browned, stirring frequently, about 20 minutes. Remove from heatstir in pepper and salt until well coated. Place on a sheet pan to cool completelybreak up almonds into desired shape and size.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook onion in the hot oil until it begins to soften. Add pork chops to the pancook for 3-4 minutes on both sides or until browned. Stir in broth, jelly, ginger and cornstarchcook for 1-2 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Serve over hot cooked rice or noodles.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease an 8x8x2 inch baking pan. Place all of the dry ingredients into the mixing bowl. Make sure all the flour is mixed together well. In another mixing bowl, mix together all of the wet ingredients. Pour the wet mix into the dry mix and stir to combine. Pour the mixture into the baking pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Cool and cut.

In a large bowl combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. In a small bowl stir together melted butter and eggs. Stir wet mixture into dry. Add white sugar and stir until combined. Fold in maraschino cherries. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until cookies are set. Let stand for 1 minute before removing from pans. Cool completely on wire racks. Dip tops of cookies in melted chocolate. Roll in powdered sugar to coat.

Cook noodles according to package directions and set aside. Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the green onions and garlic and cook 1 minute. Add noodles and the remaining ingredients and cook 4-5 minutes more until heated through.
Mix sugar and dates. Add salt, eggs, flour and nuts. Place in buttered tins. Bake in 350 degree oven for 10 minutes. Let cool. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray an 8x8x2 inch pan with cooking spray. Prepare cake mix according to package directions (omit raisins). Meanwhile, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into cake batterpour into prepared pan. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool completely on wire rack. Frost with your favorite frosting recipe. (You can substitute cool whip for frosting if you prefer.) Serve immediately. Makes 16 servings.

Bring 2 cups water and macaroni and cheese mix to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-lowcook 2 minutes. Add broccoli and onion to macaronicook 2 minutes. Stir in the remaining 2 cups water and the milk. Cook 1 minute. Add the condensed cheddar cheese soup and ham. Stir until cheese is completely melted. Stir in salt and pepper.

Cut beef into 4 to 6 pieces and place in a 3 to 4 quart slow cooker. Add the potatoes and carrots. In a small bowl, combine horseradish and salt and pepper to taste. Add to slow cooker. Pour in enough water to cover. Cover and cook 4 to 5 hours on low. To thicken the gravy, add cornstarch mixed with water to the liquid in the slow cooker and stir until it is dissolved. If desired, add a dash of prepared horseradish. Serve hot.

In a saucepan over low heat, stir together the oats, brown sugar, cocoa powder, vanilla sugar and coffee. Continue stirring until the oats are well coated. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter until fluffy. Add the chocolate mixture, then beat until smooth. Add the flaked coconut. Wet your hands with cold water and form into balls. Roll balls in coconut. Place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for about 8-10 minutes.

Put tortilla chips on a plate and add some ranch salad dressing. Add a layer of black beans and some more ranch dressing. Then add lettuce and some more ranch dressing and a layer of deli chicken. Add a layer of cheese and then some more ranch dressing and some more lettuce and top it off with some more cheese and tomatoes and more ranch dressing.
Cook pasta until done. Drain. In large skillet brown hot dog with onions and celery. Add tomato soup. Cook 10 minutes. Add pasta to skillet. Cook 15 minutes. Add corn. Cook 5 minutes. Mix well.

Cut the meat into bite size pieces. Heat oil in a wok. Add the meat and brown well. Add the coconut milk, garlic and ginger. Bring to a boil. Add the curry paste. Simmer for 3 minutes. Add the green chili. Cook for 1 minute. Add the lime juice. Turn off the heat. Add the cilantro and serve.

In a large saucepan, brown the turkey breast by heating olive oil in the pan. Brown the turkey over medium to high heat until cooked thoroughly. Remove from pan with slotted spoon and set aside. In the same pan, melt the butter and add the celery and water chestnuts. Cook until tender, approximately 2 minutes. Remove from pan with slotted spoon and set aside with the turkey breast. Drain all fat from the pan. In the same pan, melt the butter and saute the onions until tender, approximately 2 to 3 minutes. Drain any fat that rises to the top of the pan. Add the soup, broccoli mix, milk and chicken broth to the pan. Bring to a boil. Add the turkey breast and celery and water chestnuts back to the pan. Simmer for approximately 30 to 40 minutes until broccoli is tender. Stir frequently to prevent sticking to the pan. When done, mix the mayonnaise into the soup mixture until smooth. Stir in the turkey breast and celery and water chestnuts. Serve with rice

Place chicken thighs in small saucepan with water to cover. Bring to boil over high heat and cook for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and drain well. Dry chicken thoroughly with paper towels. Heat butter in skillet over medium heat. Saute chicken thighs for about 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove chicken from pan. Add cream of chicken soup to the pan and heat to boiling. Boil for 1 minute. Stir in egg noodlescook for 1 minute. Stir in chicken. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

In a bowl combine the pudding mix with milk. Stir in white chocolate baking squares. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Remove from fridge and fold in cool whip. In another bowl, add orange liqueur and pound cake crumbs. Pour half of pudding mixture into a 9 x 13 inch dish. Place half of pound cake crumbs over pudding. Spoon half of strawberries over pound cake. Pour half of orange liqueur over strawberries. Add 2/3 of white chocolate baking squares. Add remaining pudding mixture. Add remaining pound cake crumbs. Add remaining strawberries. Spoon remaining white chocolate baking squares over strawberries. Chill until ready to serve.

Saute the onions in the oil until they become translucent. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the cumin and cook until the mixture becomes fragrant. Add the black beans and cook until tender. Add the salsa. Simmer for five minutes. Add the lime juice and salt to taste. Mix the yogurt into the mixture. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cook bacon and drain. Mix bacon and butter in a small pan over low heat and keep warm. In a small pot on high heat bring 4 cups water to a boil. Cook tater tots for 5 minutes. Drain and place on a baking sheet. Pour boiling water over tater tots. Place tater tots back into oven. Add cheese and bacon to tater tots. Bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle chives on top. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the garlic and sauté until fragrant but not browned, about 2 minutes. Add the shrimp and sauté until pink and just cooked through, about 3 minutes. Add the rice and toast it in the butter and garlic for about 2 minutes. Pour in the stock and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Season with salt and pepper. Just before serving, stir in the dill. Serve immediately.

Make marinade. Combine all ingredients in blender. Blend until smooth. Put pork chops in a resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade over pork. Turn bag to coat. Refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Remove pork from marinade. Drain marinade from bag. Cook pork over medium heat until no longer pink inside. Add the green onions during last 5 minutes of cooking. Serve with your favorite potatoes or rice.

Dredge pork chops lightly in flour. In a large skillet, brown pork chops in oil and set aside. In the same pan, saute onion and garlic until tender. Deglaze the pan with the ketchup. Add the honey mustard and lemon herb seasoning. Cook until the mixture thickens. Remove pork chops from the pan. Add the pork chops to the pan along with the pepper. Coat the pork chops with the honey mustard mixture. Cook about 2 minutes or until pork chops are thoroughly cooked. Serve immediately.

Preheat the grill to medium high. Wash and trim beef ribs removing excess fat. Rub the ribs on all sides with the beer. Place ribs on the grill and cook for 10 minutes. Add the tomato sauce to the grill and cook for 2 more minutes. Flip the ribs and cook for an additional 20 minutes. Serve ribs with the tomato sauce. Garnish with basil.

Chop cabbage. Combine oil and vinegar in a small bowl. Add cabbage and toss to coat. Toss in scallions and nuts. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve immediately or refrigerate and serve later. Makes 4 cups.

Wash the onions. Put them in ice water. Drain. Peel them. Cut them up into small pieces (or grate them). Put the onions in a large glass bowl. Add the vinegar, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper. Mix with your hands until the salt has dissolved. Put the mixture into a blender or food processor. Blend for 2-3 minutes on high speed until the mixture is smooth. Transfer the mixture into an airtight jar or container. Cover it with plastic wrap. Let it sit for 1 hour before serving. If it is too hot, let it sit for 2 hours. Serve as a side dish with steaks and pork chops. Or use it as a sandwich spread or burger bun spread with grilled onions. It can also be used as an enchilada sauce.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut ham into 1/2-inch cubes. In large bowl, combine ham cubes with dijon mustard, worcestershire sauce, poppy seeds. Let sit 10 minutes. In smaller bowl mix all dry ingredients. Add to ham mixture. Add all wet ingredients. In large bowl combine ham mixture with dry mixture. Add swiss cheese. Cut rolls into quarters. Cut each quarter into six triangles. Spoon 1 tbsp of mixture onto each triangle. Top each with a slice of ham. Bake 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Rub the pork loin all over with the orange juice, honey mustard, dijon mustard, cajun seasoning, salt & pepper. Place pork loin on the grill and cook for about 1 hour and 40 minutes. When the internal temperature reaches 160 degrees f., remove from grill and tent with foil to keep warm. When serving, slice pork loin thinly across the grain. Serve with grilled vegetables of your choice.

Pound tenderloin to tenderize it if desired. Season meat with salt and pepper to taste. Splash olive oil over meat. Sprinkle in garlic powder and oregano leaves. Stir in mustard and honey until well blended. Place meat in shallow baking dish or roasting pan. Bake at 350f for 20 to 30 minutes, or until meat reaches 140f internal temperature. Allow to rest for 5 minutes before cutting to serve. Serve hot or cold.

Prepare a 9 x 13 pan by spraying with cooking spray. Cut broccoli and corn into small pieces. Place a layer of Ritz Crackers into the bottom of the pan. Layer half of the chicken and broccoli mixture over the crackers. Top with the other half of the chicken mixture. Sprinkle Velveeta Cheese over the top. Top with a layer of Ritz Crackers. Pour the cream of mushroom over the top. Sprinkle the pimiento and mushrooms on the top. Bake for 35 minutes at 350. Let sit for 10 minutes before serving.
Heat sesame oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add green beans and cook until tender (about 10 mins). Remove from heat and add garlic. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes. Serve.

In a large non-stick skillet over medium heat, warm oil until it just begins to shimmer. Add cashews and cook for 6 minutes, stirring often. Add chili powder, cumin, 2 tablespoons sugar and 1 teaspoon crushed pepper flakes. Cook for 4 minutes more. Remove from heat and add lime juice. Stir to coat cashews. Sprinkle with remaining sugar. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place sweet potatoes in a large bowl and toss with olive oil, paprika, cinnamon and salt to taste. Place on rimmed baking sheet and roast until tender and golden brown. About 45 minutes or until tender. Transfer sweet potatoes to a large serving bowl and toss with brown sugar to coat evenly. Serve hot.

Slice the kumara lengthwise into thin wedges. Toss with the seasoning and olive oil until well coated. Grill on hot coals. Grill on each side until tender. Arrange on serving dishes. Top each wedge with mustard and lime juice. Serve as desired. Serves 4.

Heat oil in a large sauce pan. Add the sliced onion and celery. Saute for 5 minutes. Add carrot and saute for an additional 5 minutes. Add the diced red bell peppers. Saute for 3 minutes. Add the broth and rice and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer covered until the rice is tender. Add the frozen peas and cook for 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Cut bread into two halves. Spread mayonnaise over each side of one half of bread. Break egg into a small bowl and whisk lightly. Add enough water to make it runny without forming bubbles (this will make the egg easier to spread). Spread egg evenly over mayonnaise with spoon, leaving an inch or two of bread uncoated on each half of the sandwich. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Lay bacon slices diagonally across sandwich, so that the edges meet at the bottom of the sandwich. Press sandwich together firmly and gently. (If the bacon is not firmly adhered to the sandwich, it will slip as the egg is spread.) Place sandwiches between wax paper or plastic wraprefrigerate for several hours or up to 2 days to firm the sandwiches. Preheat oven to 350° F (175° C). Place sandwiches on ungreased cookie sheet(s). Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until the bread is firm to the touch. Remove from the oven and
Boil corn in hot water until tender. Drain water. Add butter and sugar. Mix. Let cool. Refrigerate until ready to use in casseroles and soups. Freeze.

Wash and drain the beans and add to a large salad bowl. Toss with 1 tablespoon dressing and 1 tablespoon chopped parsley.
