Place salmon on top of the beans, top with 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes and 1/2 cup red onion and 1/2 cup cucumber slices and 1/2 cup salad leaves. Dress with the remaining dressing and chopped parsley and serve immediately.

Mix garlic with parsley leaves. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with coarse black pepper. Season with dried thyme. Toss to coat. Marinate in refrigerator for at least 6 hours. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Remove duck breasts from marinade. Brush with olive oil. Season with dried rosemary. Place duck on a rack on a rimmed baking sheet. Bake until golden brown, about 25 minutes. Let rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Pound the pork chops slightly to make them more tender and flatter. Heat a small amount of oil in a pan and cook the pork chops for approximately 5 minutes until brown. Remove the pork chops from the pan and set aside. Dice the yellow onion and saute in the pan until tender. Add the garlic and saute a couple of minutes. Add the stewed tomatoes and mushroom soup and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 30 minutes. Add the pork chops and simmer for another 15 minutes. Serve hot.
Pour rum into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until well blended and ice is completely frozen. Pour into glass and garnish with strawberries and sherbet.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and return pasta to pot. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil until hot. Add garlic and cook for 2 minutes or until softened. Add spinachcook until wilted. Add pasta to skillet along with the olives, feta cheese, pine nuts, nutmeg and salt and pepper to taste. Toss to combine. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Melt butter in a large saucepan. Add cocoa powder to butter and stir until melted. Stir in brown sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Stir in vanilla. Sift together flour & baking powder. Add to cocoa mixture. Mix in pecans. Pour batter into an ungreased 13x9 inch baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool. Spread pecans in pan & top with cooled pecan pie. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 9x9x2 inch baking pan. In large bowl, combine cake mix, sour cream and 1 cup water. Mix well. Pour batter into pan. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Cool completely. In small bowl, combine powdered sugar and 2 tablespoons milk. Stir until smooth. Spread on top of cake. Cut banana in half. Slice banana and arrange on top of cake. Drizzle with remaining 2 tablespoons milk. Refrigerate until serving time.

Preheat oven to 375. Cream together the sugar and flour. Mix in the baking soda. Add in the water. Add the banana, mayo, cinnamon, salt and walnuts. Pour into a greased 9×13 pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes then remove to a wire rack to cool completely.

In a small bowl combine yeast and milkset aside. In a large mixing bowl combine unbleached flour and whole wheat flourblend. Add yeast mixture to dry mixture and beat for 2 minutes at medium speed with a heavy duty mixer. Gradually add flax seed and salt. Add honey and beat for 1 minute. Add vinegar and beat for 30 seconds. Add warm water and beat until combined. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled. Punch down dough. Shape into a ball. Place on greased cookie sheet and let rise for 15 minutes. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes.

In a large saucepan combine water and lemon juicebring to a boil. Stir in cornstarch mixture and stir until dissolved. Add sugar and stir until dissolvedremove from heat and add ground ginger and pepper. Cook and stir over medium heat for two minutes. Stir in soy sauce and chicken wings. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until chicken is tender and sauce is thickened.
Cook peppers in boiling water until tender. Drain. Puree peppers. Add peas and orange rind. Add rosemary and salt and pepper. Melt butter and stir into pepper mixture. Serve warm.

In a large pot of cold water, boil 6 eggs until hard boiled. Set aside. Strain the pot of water into a pot of cold water until all the water runs clear. Add flour to the cold water mixture, mix well. Add eggs to the flour mixturemix well. Add vegetable oil to the eggs and flour mixturemix well. Add salt, black pepper, and dill weedmix well. Drain excess water from eggs and flour mixture. Add the eggs and flour mixture to the pot with the cold water mixturemix well. Bring to boilcook until thickened -about 5 minutes-. Serve with butter, fried potatoes or fried cabbage. Makes 6-8 cups. Serves 12-15 people.

Bring 1/2 cup of water and 1/2 cup of green beans to a boil in a medium saucepan. Cover and simmer 3 to 5 minutes or until bright green beans are tender. Drain beans and set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and saute for 3 minutes or until tender. Stir in chicken broth and vinegar and bring to a boil. Stir in brown sugar and season with pepper. Cook for 1 minute or until sauce thickens. Add beans and toss to coat with sauce. Serve.

Cover head of garlic with oil and place in 300 degree oven for 30 minutes or until clove is soft. Allow to cool slightly then peel garlic clove out of the skin. In blender or food processor, blend together mayonnaise, sour cream, garlic, oil, salt, and pepper until smooth. Serve over meat or vegetables.

Preheat oven to 200 degrees c. Spray a 23cm square cake tin with oil. Slice 1 onion very thinly. Slice 1 zucchini very thinly. Slice 10 rashers of cooked bacon very thinly. Sift 1 cup self raising flour into a large bowl. Add 1 teaspoon of salt. Mix in 1/2 cup oil. Add eggs 1 at a time. Mix in 1 cup milk. Add the bacon, zucchini and onion. Spread in tin. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Check with skewer to see if cooked. If not cooked turn oven down to 180 degrees c. Cook for another 20 minutes.

Remove skin from salmon fillets and place in shallow baking dish. Combine mustard and lemon juice and mix well. Set aside. Melt butter in small saucepan and stir in honey until dissolved. Pour mixture over salmon fillets and marinate for about an hour. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Place fillets on a baking sheet and coat with breadcrumb mixture. Bake for about 12 minutes or until salmon is flakey and golden brown. Sprinkle with parsley and serve with salad and potatoes.
Mix together velveeta cheese, cream cheese, sour cream, hormel chili. Serve with chips.

Prepare the filling. Place 2 pieces of plastic wrap on work surface. Place 1 slice of cheese in center of each piece of plastic wrap. Place 1 slice of meat in center of cheese. Top each meat slice with 2 tbsp of salsa. Place another slice of cheese on top. Top each of these with another 2 tbsp of salsa. Place another slice of cheese on top. Fold each half of plastic wrap over filling and press to seal. Place each empanada in the prepared pan. Repeat with remaining filling and pie crusts. Bake at 375f for 30-35 minutes until golden brown. Let stand 2 minutes before removing from pans. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly coat a large baking dish with extra virgin olive oil. Add the artichokes to the prepared baking dish. In a small bowl combine the parmesan cheese and lemon juice and then pour over the artichokes. In a large bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over the artichokes. Bake for 45 minutes or until heated through. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Garnish with parsley and red pepper flakes.
Combine refried beans, green chilies, four cheese blend, and beef tamales in a large bowl and mix thoroughly. Serve with tortilla chips or pita bread for dipping.

In a small saucepan combine wine, shallots, garlic, salt and fresh herbs. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat. Add mussels. Cover pan with foil. Let stand 10 minutes or until mussels open. Discard any mussels that do not open. Place mussels in a 9-inch oven-proof skillet. Add wine mixture. Cover pan. Bake 5 minutes. Remove lid. Add butter. Cook 2 minutes more or until butter is melted. Sprinkle parsley over mussels. Serve at once. Makes 4 servings.

Beat the eggs with the mustard until smooth and creamy. Add the white pepper and salt and beat well until incorporated. Gradually add the vinegar and oil and beat until smooth and creamy. Adjust seasonings to taste with salt and pepper. Pour half of the vinaigrette into a small jar and set aside for later use. Add the remaining vinaigrette to the lettuce and toss well. Divide the greens among four plates and top with the reserved vinaigrette and the chives.

In a cocktail glass, pour pineapple juice to the top. Add rum. Stir until rum is completely mixed. Pour pina colada drink mix into the glass. Top with strawberry puree. Mix again. Pour pineapple juice into the glass. Let it flow like lava. Enjoy!

Slice kumara into 1/4-inch discs. Place discs in an oiled baking dish. Drizzle kumara with olive oil. Season with sea salt. Roast for 30 to 45 minutes or until golden. In a large bowl toss romaine lettuce with cherry tomatoes. Add roasted kumara discs to bowl. Add pine nuts. Top salad with radishes and freshly grated Parmesan. Dress with balsamic vinegar. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. In a large saucepan combine the broth and the grits. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Stir in the cheeses and continue cooking for 5 minutes. Stir in the cream and hot sauce and cook until the grits are tender. Season to taste and stir in the eggs. Pour into a greased 2 quart casserole. Sprinkle with the paprika. Bake 25 minutes or until the top is golden.
In a mixing bowl mix together mayonnaise, sour cream and seafood cocktail sauce. Add fresh ginger and sugar. Blend together. Add Tabasco sauce to taste. Makes 12 cups.

Remove the stems and any tough ribs from collard greens. Wash in cold water. Pat dry. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the green onion whites and sauté for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the collard greens and sauté for 2 minutes. Add the water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium low and cover. Cook for 5 minutes or until the collard greens are tender. Uncover and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes. Add the cream cheese and garlic clove. Simmer for 3 to 5 minutes. Add the rice and milk. Simmer for 3 to 5 minutes or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Add the salt and black pepper. Serve hot.

Mix together the cream cheese, sour cream and mayonnaise. Add the worcestershire sauce and kielbasa. Mix well. Add milk and parmesan cheese. Chop up the green onion and mix. Transfer to a bowl. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees fahrenheit. Combine cream cheese with sugar until smooth. Add key lime juice and key lime zest. Combine with whipped cream to create a cream mixture. Make the cookie dough by combining all the ingredients in a bowl together. Place a piece of cookie dough in the bottom of a tart pan with removable bottom. Add the cream mixture to the top of the cookie dough in the tart pan. Bake at 325 degrees for 25 minutes or until the cream mixture is set and the top of the tart is golden brown. Let cool completely before removing from tart pan. Serve with whipped cream.

Remove stuffing from the bird or container. Divide the meat among the phyllo packets. Add gravy if desired. Place 1/2 teaspoon of butter in each phyllo pocket. Fold the edges of the phyllo dough up and over the meat. Seal the packets by crimping the ends with a fork. Bake 25 to 30 minutes in a 350 degree oven. Serve hot.

Pour tequila into a shaker half filled with ice. Add triple sec. Shake well. Pour into a glass filled with ice. Top with limeade concentrate. Garnish with a lime. Optional: sprinkle some salt on the outside rim of the glass.

Soak the lentils overnight or cook them for 20 minutes. Prepare the tomato sauce. Meanwhile boil the rice and macaroni until both are cooked. In a skillet, saute the onions in olive oil. Add the garlic, and tomato sauce. Season the sauce with salt, pepper and red pepper flakes. Add the rice and lentils to the sauce. Cook for 10 minutes.

Melt butter in large pot over medium heat. Add onion and cook 5 minutes or until soft. Stir in goat meat and cook 5 minutes. Stir in red chili powder and cumin and cook 5 minutes more. Stir in flour and cook 1 minute. Stir in broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook 30 minutes or until meat is very tender. Stir in cream. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice.

In a medium saucepan bring 2 cups of water to a boil and add bouillon cubes. Simmer until tender. Drain and rinse well. In a large bowl combine the barley and beans with the water. Add the dressing and toss well to coat. Add the green onions and toss again. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Clean red peppers and remove seeds and pith. Cut them into strips and mix into a small sauce pan with the other ingredients. Cook over low heat until the sugar is dissolved and the peppers are tender.

Drain canned beans and place them in the bowl of a food processor. Add lemon juice, garlic powder and salt. Process until beans are smooth. While processor is running, drizzle oil in slowly. Process for about 1 minute or until very smooth. If using hot sauce, add to taste. Serves 6 to 8.

1) Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Remove skin from salmon fillets. Place fillets in a large shallow casserole dish coated with cooking spray. Pour 1 cup water into a shallow bowl. Dip a pastry brush into water. Brush tops of salmon with water. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, spinach, ricotta cheese mixture, feta cheese mixture and lemon juice mixture. Bake for 15 minutes or until salmon flakes easily with a fork. Cool for 5 minutes before serving.

In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine flour, ground ginger, ground allspice, salt, sugar and margarine on low speed for about 20 seconds until combined. Add applesauce and molassesbeat until well mixed. Shape the dough into balls about an inch-and-a-half acrossroll the balls in granulated sugar. Place the balls on ungreased cookie sheets about three inches apart. Bake at 350 degrees for about 10 minutes or until golden brown on the bottoms. Let cool on sheets for several minutes before transferring cookies to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 10 inch springform pan. In a large mixing bowl, combine rhubarb, strawberry gelatin, sugar, and cinnamonmix well with a fork. In a large bowl, combine yellow cake mix, water, and oilmix well with a fork. Pour batter into pan. Top with rhubarb mixturecover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. In a large bowl with an electric mixer, beat cream cheese until creamy. Stir in sour cream, whipped topping, flour, sugar, salt, and vanilla. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic cloves and saute until tender. Add mushrooms, stirring frequently. Saute for 5 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Add flour and stir 1 minute. Gradually whisk in wine. Bring to a boil. Cook 1 minute or until slightly thickened. Reduce heat to low. Gradually whisk in chicken broth. Increase heat to medium. Simmer 8 minutes or until slightly thickened. Stir in chicken. Heat through. Stir in heavy cream. Cook 1 minute. Transfer to a greased 3-quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until a thermometer inserted in the thickest portion of the chicken registers 180 degrees. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake 5 minutes or until bubbly. Serve.

Peel onion. Cut in half lengthwise. Cut each half into thin half-moons. Cut each half-moon in half again. Peel carrots and cut into large matchsticks. Core cabbage. Cut in half lengthwise. Cut each half lengthwise into four strips. Cut strips crosswise into quarters. Cut each quarter crosswise into thin matchsticks. Place onion, peppers, carrot, cabbage, apple cider vinegar, sugar, salt, black pepper in a large bowl. Whisk in olive oil. Cover tightly with plastic wrap or airtight lid. Refrigerate at least 2 hours. Serve.

Prepare a griddle to medium heat and heat a griddle pan. Mix the tomato paste and molasses together. Slice bread and brush with butter. Top each slice with 1/4 cup sliced plum tomatoes and 1/4 cup sliced red onion. Spread half the tomato mixture over each slice. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup cheddar cheese. Place bread slices sandwich side down and grill for 2 minutes. Flip and grill for another 1 minute. Flip again and grill for 1 minute more. Place 1/4 cup sliced fresh cilantro leaves and 1/4 cup cheddar cheese over each slice. Grill for 2 minutes. Flip and grill for another 1 minute. Flip again and grill for 1 minute more. Place sandwiches in griddled pan and grill for 1 minute. Flip and grill for another 1 minute. Serve immediately.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, for 7-9 minutes, or until tender but firm to the bite. Drain pasta and place in large bowl. Whisk together mayonnaise, dill and pepper until combinedstir in bell peppers and olivesadd pasta and toss to coat. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Mix eggs and sugar together. Whisk milk until foamy. Pour milk mixture over eggs. Add cinnamon, vanilla and salt. Pour into bread. Freeze. To cook, thaw completely. Place frozen bread slices in 350f oven for 35 minutes.

Beat extra-large eggs with extra-large egg yolks. Add half-and-half and sugar and beat until thick and shiny. Fold in raisins. Place croissants in a lightly greased 13-in. x 9-in. or 2-qt. baking dish. Pour half-and-half mixture over croissants. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Bake at 325-350 degrees F for 40-45 minutes or until set. Serve warm. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut 1/2 cup ham into 1/4" dice. Cut bread rounds into 4" squares. Place ham pieces on a cookie sheet. Mash cream cheese until smooth. Stir in 2 tsp. onion juice. Stir in 1/4 cup flour until blended. Stir in 1/4 cup milk until blended. Stir in 1 beaten whole egg. Stir in 1/2 tsp. salt. Spoon cream cheese mixture evenly onto bread rounds. Sprinkle each round with 1/4 cup ham. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes. Yield: 1 dozen.
Put in a French press 1/3 cup ground coffee and cold water. Let sit for about 10 minutes. Strain coffee. Add sweetened condensed milk and vanilla extract. Serve over ice.
In a medium bowl combine all the ingredients. Stir to blend. Store at room temperature in an airtight container.

Combine corn and rice in a large bowl. Mix in creamy butter and stir until evenly coated. Stir in salt and pepper. Put into a 9x13-inch baking pan. Sprinkle with paprika and red pepper. Bake at 350f for 35-45 minutes or until rice is tender. Remove from oven and let stand 5 minutes before serving.
Combine apple cider with lemon juice. Salt to taste. Pour tequila into each glass. Top with apple cider. Pour triple sec. Stir. Garnish with lemon slice.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line a 9x9-inch baking dish with aluminum foil. Place fish in the dish. Coat with olive oil and season with salt. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. In a small bowl combine salsa with lime and cilantro. Spread over fish. Return to oven for 5 more minutes. Serve with a green salad.

Preheat oven to 350 f . In a small bowl, combine egg whites and dry milk powder. Beat to stiff peaks with an electric mixer on high speed or by hand with a whisk. Add vegetable oil in a thin stream to the egg whites while beating until combined. Add food coloring. Fold in egg whites using a large metal spatula to form an even color throughout the batter. For a more natural looking egg substitute, you can add a small amount of carrot juice. This will give the egg substitute a more orange hue.
Mix all together. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 9 x 13 inch pan. In a large bowl, combine milk and egg. Add egg whites and beat until foamy. Stir in butter, sugar, and spices. Add bread and toss. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 1 hour. Serve warm.
Place all in a slow cooker on low for 5-6 hours. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease an 8 or 9-inch square baking dish. Place canola oil in a large bowl or liquid measuring cup. Add soymilk and whisk. Stir in maple syrup. Add flours, baking powder, kosher salt. Whisk till smooth. Add soymilk mixture. Stir till no dry spots remain. Pour into baking dish. Bake 35-45 minutes or till golden brown. Cool in pan 5 minutes. Cut into 12 squares. Serve warm.

Cook chicken. Dice. Combine chicken with pesto sauce. Cook farfalle pasta according to package directions. Drain. Combine pasta with chicken mixture. Add roasted red peppers and olives. Top with parmesan cheese. Enjoy.
Blend all ingredients together. Serve with fresh strawberries for garnish. Enjoy!

Remove chicken from refrigerator and poultry seasoning. Rinse chicken breast halves and pat dry. Place chicken in a 13x9 inch baking dish. Spoon stuffing mix into chicken. Pour soup over chicken. Pour milk over chicken. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake at 350 degrees f. for 45 to 60 minutes. Chicken is done when meat is tender and juices run clear.

Place all the ingredients except the marshmallows into the microwave safe container of your choice, mix well, microwave on high for 3 to 5 minutes or until hot (do not boil), stir well, serve immediately with miniature marshmallows.

Prepare your pan by melting 1/2 cup margarine in it. Mix 1 1/4 cups sugar and 1/2 cup light corn syrup together in a large saucepan. Gradually add 1 cup milk. Stir in remaining 1/4 cup light corn syrup. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 1/2 cups milk and the pumpkin. Add the vanilla. Stir in the remaining sugar and corn syrup. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add the margarine. Add the pumpkin. Stir in the cinnamon and allspice. Pour into the melted margarine and spread into 2 greased 8x8-inch pans. Cool and cut into squares. Makes 24 servings.

Put chicken in crock pot. Pour applesauce over chicken. Sprinkle with spices. Cover. Cook 4 hours on low. Check for doneness. When done, shred chicken. Add applesauce to desired consistency. Season with salt if needed. Enjoy!

Unroll crescent dinner rolls and press perforations to seal. Spread 1 tablespoon of cream cheese on each of 16 crescent triangles. Place 1 tablespoon of deviled ham on each of 16 crescent triangles. Top each triangle with 1 tablespoon of shredded onion. Place 2 triangles of each kind on a greased 15 x 10 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Makes 16 squares.

Combine the flour, cinnamon, baking powder and salt in a medium bowl and mix well with a fork. Make a well in the center and add the sugar and the egg yolks. Mix with a fork and then gradually stir in the oil and milk. Beat the egg whites and fold into the batter. Grease a waffle iron and pour in 2/3 cup batter for each waffle. Cook 5 minutes or until golden brown and serve with butter and syrup if desired.

Spread soft fresh goat cheese over crust. Top with crumbled cream cheese and garlic clove. Scatter plum tomato slices and yellow sweet pepper slices over cream cheese. Sprinkle with ground black pepper and fresh basil. Bake in the preheated oven for approximately 8-10 minutes or until crust is golden brown and filling is melted and bubbling. Serve warm.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add green bell peppers and mushrooms. Cook for 3 minutes. Add soup mix and cook for 1 minute. Add tomatoes. Simmer for 15 minutes. Pour into an 8x8 inch baking dish. Sprinkle brown sugar on top. Pour orange juice over mixture. Mix well. Add chicken. Place in the oven for 45 minutes.

Prepare orange cake mix following directions on box. In a small bowl, combine oil and eggs, mixing well. Stir oil mixture into cake mix until blended. Spoon batter into 10 greased muffin cups. Bake at 375 for 18-20 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from cups to wire rack to cool completely. In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine butter and brown sugar. Stir constantly until mixture is smooth. Remove from heatstir in orange juice and vanilla. Cool slightly before drizzling over cookies. Sprinkle with pecan halves before serving if desired.

Preheat oven 350 degrees fahrenheit. Slice each tomato half into 4 wedges. Squeeze out the seeds from the tomato. Place tomato wedges on bottom of a 2-quart casserole dish. Dip bread cubes into melted butter and arrange on top of tomatoes. In food processor or blender, combine onion, sugar and tabasco sauce. Puree until smooth. Pour over bread cubes and tomatoes. Sprinkle with basil, bacon, saltine crackers and cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until cheese is melted.

In a small bowl, combine 1 cup nonfat milk, cinnamon and whole wheat couscous. Microwave on high 2 minutes. Stir well. Remove from microwave. Add 2 more cups nonfat milk. Microwave on high 5 minutes. Stir well. Let stand 10 minutes. Add chopped pear. Serve warm.

In small skillet, cook eggs and spinach in butter until spinach is tender. Spread prosciutto slices on bottom half of each slice of bread. Arrange tomatoes in each slice. Pour eggs mixture evenly over tomatoes. Sprinkle cheese over top. Place tops on sandwiches. In 12-inch nonstick skillet, cook sandwiches 5 minutes over medium heat or until browned. Cut sandwiches in half. Serve.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the coconut milk and almond butter. Add the shrimp, chicken stock, diced tomato, and unsweetened applesauce to the saucepan, season to taste with salt and pepper. Bring the sauce to a simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in the chopped basil, remove from heat, and serve hot. Serves 4.

Preheat oven at 325 degrees F. Mix dry ingredients together in a medium size bowl. Beat egg yolks in a small bowl. Add dry ingredients gradually to eggs until a thick batter is formed. Add orange juice and olive oil. Add dried fruits and nuts. Pour batter into two greased 9x13 inch baking dishes or one greased 9x13 inch baking dish and a round glass baking dish (approximately 4 inches deep). Bake for one hour or until golden brown on top. Serve slightly warm or cold.

Heat butter and bacon together on medium-high heat. Add leek and saute until tender. Add cream and reduce to low heat. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add pasta to sauce. Cook until pasta is tender. Top with grated Parmesan and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large saucepan heat 4 tablespoons of the olive oil over medium heat. Add the carrots, onion and celery. Cook for 1 minute. Add flour. Cook for 1 minute. Slowly add the chicken broth. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, cook the rice according to package directions. Shred the chicken breast. Stir the chicken into the soup. Heat the remaining oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Stir in the rice. Cook until heated through. In a small bowl combine the 1/2 cup of cream with the seasoning. Stir into the soup. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve with the rice sprinkled on top.

Season the beef generously with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a very large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the beef and sauté until browned, about 10 minutes. Transfer the beef to a plate. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of the oil to the skillet. Add the garlic and onion and sauté until softened. Add the tomato sauce and stir to combine. Stir in the beef. Cook for about 5 minutes. Stir in the green onions. Serve with a green salad.

Open tuna and scoop out about half of the tuna. Add tuna to mayonnaise and stir until smooth. Stir in relish. Spoon tuna salad onto bottom half of two slices of bread. Top with lettuce. Top with cheese and other slice of bread. Enjoy!

Cut the fillets in half if necessary to make them even thicknesses. Combine the egg with the remaining seasoning and beat it until thoroughly blended. Dip the fillets into the batter and fry in hot oil for about two minutes on each side or until golden brown. Serve on a bed of rice or baked potatoes and top with lemon slices and dill weed.

Mix egg whites and sugar in a bowl until stiff peaks form. Spread half the egg whites into the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate. Sprinkle ritz crackers on top and set aside. Mix pecans with half the whipping cream and pour over the cracker layer. Top with the remaining egg whites and sprinkle with the remaining half of the whipping cream and pecans. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool. Refrigerate and top with a little german chocolate for a special treat!
Pour all liquids into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

Combine yogurt and orange juice concentrate in blender. Add bananas and lime juice and blend until smooth. Stir in sticks and refrigerate for at least a couple hours until smoothie sets up. Store refrigerated until ready to eat. To serve, insert sticks into smoothie and serve immediately or freeze for a few minutes for easier removal of sticks.

Place roast in slow cooker. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and toss with paprika. Sprinkle with dried oregano. Place the onions and garlic in the bottom of the crock pot. Pour the wine and water over the meat. Cook on low for 7-8 hours or on high for 4-5 hours. Serve with steamed vegetables and mashed potatoes.

Cut okra pods in half lengthwise with scissors or a knife. Cook okra pods in a skillet or pan on medium-high heat for about 5 minutes or until the okra is tender when pierced with a fork. Drain okra pods in a colander or sieve to remove excess liquid. Place okra pods in a bowl or airtight container with 1/4 cup butter, 1/2 cup water, 1/4 cup lemon juice, salt to taste. Cover the okra pods with plastic wrap or a lid to prevent butter from coming to the surface. Chill at least 4 hours to allow flavors to meld. Serve on warm toast or crackers with a dollop of sour cream or yogurt, if desired.

Cut pineapple into chunks (leave skin on) and place in a 9x13 baking dish with 1/4 cup water. Place dish in preheated 350f oven for 20 minutes (or until pineapple is tender). Remove pineapple and allow it to cool slightly. Meanwhile prepare batter as directed on package for yeast dough (or use pizza dough). Pour batter over pineapple in baking dishsprinkle with coconut flakes (optional). Bake for 45-50 minutes or until golden brown (dough will rise during baking). Makes 1 loafserves 8-10.

Peel and core apples. Slice apples and cut into quarters. Place into a large bowl. Add walnuts. In a small bowl, mix mayonnaise and lemon juice together. Add to apples. Sprinkle with lemon zest and mint. Toss salad. Add honey as desired.

Place 2 1/2 cups crumbs in bottom of 9-inch pie plate. In a blender or food processor, combine remaining crumbs and 1/3 cup butter. Pulse until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Spread mixture in bottom of pie plate. In a large bowl beat 2 cups whipped topping and milk until well blended. Pour over crust. Spread remaining 1 1/2 cups whipped topping over mixture. Garnish with whole mint candies. Freeze 4 hours or until firm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 2 9 inch round cake pans and line bottoms of each pan with wax paper. In medium bowl, whisk flour and sugar together until well combined and set aside. In large bowl, cream butter and chocolate together until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. Add flour mixture to chocolate mixture alternating with Grand Marnier and orange juice mixture. Pour into prepared pans and bake for about 35 minutes or until cakes spring back when touched lightly. Cool in pans for 5 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely. Frost cake as desired. Store in refrigerator. To serve, top cakes with additional Grand Marnier and orange juice mixture if desired.

Drain diced tomatoes in a strainer or colander. Add onion, green chilies, black olives, vinegar, garlic salt, olive oil, salt and pepper. Stir in salsa mix. Serve salsa over chips. Store remaining salsa in an air tight container in the refridgerator for up to one week or freezer for up to four months.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat vegetable oil. Add garlic clove, ginger, red pepper flakes, stirring occasionally for 1 minute. Add in cooked rice, light soy sauce, crushed pineapple in syrup, green onions. Stirring occasionally for 3 minutes or until the rice is thoroughly heated. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in small saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and mustard powder and cook and stir until blended and smooth. Gradually add milk stirring constantly until thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more over medium heat. Add cooked ham, egg and toast. Toss with fork and serve immediately.

Beat cream cheese with sugar until smooth. Add sour cream and continue to beat until creamy. Add vanilla extract. Spread cream cheese mixture evenly in a 9 inch springform pan. Top with cool whip. Garnish with fresh strawberries. Refrigerate for 4 hours. Remove from springform pan. Store in refrigerator. This is a good recipe to make a day or two ahead of time.
Spread rye bread with mayonnaise and dijon mustard. Top with swiss cheese and dill pickles. Layer pastrami over cheese. Spread butter on both sides of bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch pan with margarine. Melt shortening, margarine and butter with caramels until smoothstir until melted. Stir in evaporated milk until melted. Pour into greased pan. Sprinkle crispy rice cereal on top of caramel mixturepress down firmly with spoon or palms of hands. Bake for 30 minutes in preheated oven. Stir mixture occasionally with a spoon or palm of hand. When mixture is set, pour melted chocolate chips on top of caramel mixture. Stir gently until chocolate has melted into mixturepress down firmly with spoon or palm of hand. Place pan in refrigerator for about 1 hour or until set. Remove from panbreak into pieces with spoon.

Cut cabbage in half lengthwise. Cut each half in half again. Cut each half in half again. Cut each half into 1/4 inch slices. Cut each slice into 1/4 inch strips. Place cabbage in a large bowl. Add carrot, green bell pepper, red onion and celery seed. Mix well. Add sugar, vinegar and 1/2 cup of water. Mix well. Add 1/2 cup of oil and mustard. Mix well. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. To serve garnish with chopped walnuts and dried cranberries.
Mix peanut butter and granulated sugar in bowl. Stir in egg. Add flour and mix thoroughly. Drop by teaspoons on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 12 minutes.
Add milk to flour to make batter. Dip cheese in batter. Fry in hot oil until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with salsa.

Place turkey fillets in a shallow dish and sprinkle flour on them. Dip in beaten egg and dredge in the flour again. Melt the butter in a heavy pan and add the oil and cook the fillets over moderate heat for about 6 minutes on each side. Remove and keep warm. Saute the onions until soft. Stir in the sage and cook for a minute or two. Add the wine and boil off the alcohol for about a minute. Add the stock and boil until reduced by half. Add the asparagus tips and the juice of half a lemon and cook until the asparagus is tender and the sauce is thickened. Add the sour cream and serve over the turkey fillets.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Beat egg slightly. Beat vegetable oil, granulated sugar and egg together well. Stir in almond extract. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in mincemeat. Roll dough into balls about 1 1/2 to 2 inches in diameter. Place balls 2 inches apart on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes. Makes about 2 dozen.

In a large skillet over medium heatbrown beef and onion. Stir in taco sauce, refried beans and cream of mushroom soup. Cook 5 minutes or until hot. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Top with taco seasoning and salt. Bake 25 minutes. Top with sour cream and cheese. Return to the oven 5 minutes or until the cheese melts. Serve with tortilla chips.

Wash the cucumbers well. Peel the cucumbers. Slice them lengthwise into thin rounds. Put them into a glass dish. Put the parsley into a blender or food processor. Add the caraway seed. Process the parsley until finely chopped. Add the vinegar. Season with salt & pepper. Pour the liquid over the cucumbers. Cover and refrigerate for at least 12 hours. Garnish with the chopped parsley.

Clean asparagus and snap off the tough ends. Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Grill or broil asparagus for about 7 minutes. Cut pita bread in half. Pull apart each pita half and place on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle with tomatoes and dried basil. Sprinkle with crushed red pepper flakes and season with salt and pepper. Place grated parmesan cheese on each pita half. Broil until cheese is melted and pitas are crisp. Serve with asparagus.
Mix all together, serve in highball glasses, garnish with cherries.

Add water to slow cooker. Place onions in slow cooker. Sprinkle with cloves. Cover. Cook on low heat setting until tender but not mushy about 8 hours. Drain onions and discard liquid. Place beef into slow cooker. Pour sauce over meat. Cover with lid. Cook on low heat setting until tender about 8 to 12 hours. Serve with cooking liquid if desired. You may also like to serve this with rice or potatoes on the side if desired.

Mix together margarine and marshmallows. Press into a greased 13 x 9 pan. Sprinkle with chopped peanuts and raisins. Spread rice krispies on top. Melt chocolate chips and add to rice krispies. Cool completely before cutting.
Sauté mushrooms and onions until tender. Add spinach and sauté until wilted. Season with salt and pepper and garlic.

In a large skillet cook the beef over medium heat until brown and cooked through. Drain and add tomatoes and garlic. Simmer for a few minutes. Add beef broth and stir in the pasta. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Serve over hot cooked noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 8x4-inch loaf pans with shortening or cooking spray. Combine flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. Stir in applesauce, nonfat milk, and vanilla until smooth. In a small bowl, combine boiling water with light brown sugarstir until brown sugar is dissolved. Stir boiling water mixture into batter just until blended. Pour batter into pans. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until a wooden pick inserted in the center of cake comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.

Wash and peel the bananas. Slice them into thin slices. Place in the refrigerator. Make the shortcakes following the box directions. Spread 2 teaspoon of the sugar evenly on top of the shortcakes. Top the shortcakes with sliced bananas. Cut strawberries into thin slices. Arrange on top of the bananas. Drizzle the remaining 1 teaspoon of sugar evenly over the strawberries. Serve immediately.

Combine cream cheese and milk in a small bowl and microwave until cheese is melted, 30 seconds to 1 minute, stirring after 30 seconds. Combine grape juice and honey in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally. Cook until slightly thickened, 2-3 minutes more. Remove from heat and let stand 10 minutes. Whisk in brown sugar and cool completely. Whisk in pecans. Combine with cream cheese mixture and garnish with green grapes.

Wash ears of corn. Remove husks and silk. Brush corn with butter and sprinkle with salt and sugar. Place corn upright on grill over medium heat for 20 to 30 minutes turning occasionally until corn is tender. Wrap corn in foil and serve.

Bring water and bouillon to boil. Stir in celery. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove celery. Drain. Blot celery with paper towels. Place in large bowl. Melt margarine in skillet. Stir in parsley. Pour over celery. Chill for one hour. Combine cheese with milk and add to celery. Toss. Pour over celery. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Chill for two hours. Serve.

Crusts: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly grease bottom and sides of 2 pie plates. Roll out one crust into a 12 inch circle. Place in pie plate. Repeat with second crust. Bake crusts for 10 minutes until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Caramel Pecan Pies: Combine sugar, butter, eggs and caramel in a medium bowl. Beat on medium speed until blended. Stir in pecans. Spoon filling into crusts. Bake at 325 degrees for 55-60 minutes or until set. Cool 10 minutes before serving. Refrigerate leftover pie.

Clean mussels. Set aside in small pot with fish stock over medium heat to boil for about 5-8 minutes or until shells open. Remove mussels from shells. Discard any that do not open. Put shells into a large saucepan along with tomatoes, white wine, olive oil and anise. Cook over medium heat until liquid is reduced by half and shells are heated through. Stir in mussels. Cook until shells open fully, about 5 minutes more. Stir in garlic and onions. Remove from heat and serve in shallow bowls with bread or toasts.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add pasta and cook until al dente (tender but firm). Drain well in a colander. Meanwhile in a large skillet over medium heat, heat the extra virgin olive oil until hot, but not smoking. Add the onion, sweet red peppers, and red pepper flakes. Sautee until tender but not browned, about 5 minutes. Add the diced tomatoes with their juice, dried oregano, and a couple of pinches of salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes or until the liquid is reduced by about one-half. Add the drained pasta to the skillet and toss with the sauce. Sprinkle with basil sprigs, toss, then serve topped with grated Parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Mix all ingredients together in a bowl. Spread mixture into pre-baked pie shells (9-inch). Top with puff pastry and brush with egg wash. Bake for 20 minutes or until puff pastry is golden brown.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, melt 1 tablespoon of the butter. Whisk in the flour until blended. Gradually whisk in the hot broth. Cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes or until thickened. Add the carrots, green onions, ham and remaining 1 tablespoon of butter. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Whisk in the cheese until melted. Stir in the parsley. Season with black pepper to taste. Serve hot.
Place bagel in a sandwich press and lightly toast. Spread a layer of cream cheese. Add a few pieces of bacon and a dollop of preserves. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce and worcestershire sauce. Mix in the garlic cloves, lemon juice and black pepper. Pour the mixture into a small glass dish and set aside for about 1 hour. Preheat the grill or broiler on high heat. Place the pork tenderloin in the glass dish and pour the soy sauce mixture over the top of the pork tenderloin. Cover the dish and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or up to 24 hours. Remove the pork tenderloin from the refrigerator and prepare the grill or broiler. Grill or broil the pork tenderloin for about 12 minutes or until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the pork registers at least 145 degrees Fahrenheit. Let the pork tenderloin rest for about 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

Season chicken breasts on both sides and dust lightly with flour. Dip in egg then coat in bread crumbs. Fry chicken in oil until golden brown. Set aside and drain excess oil on paper towel. Pre heat broiler. Heat butter in skillet over medium heat until hot. Add onion and cook until tender about 3 minutes. Add chicken and cook about 8 minutes turning once or twice. Add tomatoes and avocado and cook for about another minute or two until chicken is thoroughly cooked and heated through. Place one slice of ham and one slice of swiss cheese on each chicken breast. Place on baking sheet and broil about 3 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve warm with salad on side.

Prepare the fillet for the fish Veronique by dredging the fish fillet in the flour and then the egg and then the bread crumbs. Place the bread crumbs on the fillet. Bake the fillet for about 10 minutes at 400 degrees fahrenheit or 200 degrees celsius and then serve with grapes and lemon juice and soft margarine and chicken stock and black pepper.

In a large saucepan combine the apples, sugar, lemon juice and rind. Bring to boil over moderately high heat. Cook until the apples are softened, about 30 minutes. Transfer to a blender and purée the mixture until smooth. Strain the sauce through a fine-mesh sieve. Combine the applesauce with cinnamon stick, nutmeg, allspice and clove. Serve warm.

Mix warm water, yeast, and 1/2 cup of the sugar. Add the salt, butter, egg and the remaining 2 cups of flour. Mix until smooth. Knead the dough until it is smooth. Add additional flour as necessary. Form into a ball. Place in a greased bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let rise about 1 hour in a warm place. Punch down the dough. Divide into two balls. Roll each ball into a rectangle about 18 inches long by 6 inches wide. Spread 1/2 cup softened margarine over each rectangle. Roll each rectangle tightly into a log. Cut each log into 8 pieces. Place the rolls on a greased baking sheet. Cover the rolls and let rise until doubled. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-15 minutes. Brush rolls with melted margarine.

Prepare cauliflower by cutting off all leaves and trimming. Cut cauliflower into small florets. Add them to a bowl and place them in cold water. Add red bell pepper and parsley to the cauliflower. Drain cauliflower. Add the greek olives, capers and red bell pepper to a blender. Add the wine vinegar and the olive oil and blend. Add the seasoning and blend again. Add the seasoned cauliflower and red bell pepper to the blender. Blend again. Pour into a serving dish and serve.

In a large bowl, cream the butter and 2 cups of the sugar until light and fluffy. Combine the lemonade mix, the egg and the extractsstir into the creamed mixture. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, the baking powder and the baking sodaadd to the creamed mixture. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350f for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spread almonds on a baking sheet. In a small saucepan over medium heat combine maple syrup, oil and salt. Stirring constantly bring to a boil. Pour mixture over almonds. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until almonds are golden brown. Cool.

Drain the egg noodles and rinse well under cold running water. Stir the noodles into the cottage cheese mixture to coat thoroughly and pour into the baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and bake for 10 minutes longer or until the top is golden and bubbly. Serve hot.

Beat eggs with milk. Sift salt, pepper and parsley together. Add to egg mixture with beaten green peas and onions. Fill greased molds to top. Bake at 350 f for 30 minutes. Serve warm with buttered toast.

Preheat the oven to 350F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan. In a medium bowl combine the sugar and shortening and beat with an electric mixer until the mixture is fluffy. Beat in the egg and milk and then add the cornflake crumbs and mix well. Stir in the flour, baking powder and orange extract. Stir in the nuts and pour into prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

In your crock pot add water and dressing mix. Place chicken and cream cheese over the dressing mix. Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours or until chicken is tender. Remove chicken and shred. Stir mushrooms into broth and return chicken and broth to crock pot. Cook on low for 30 minutes or until heated through.

Remove orange peel from orange. Slice orange into segments. Remove stems from apples. Slice apples into thin wedges. Cut celery into 1 inch pieces. Peel lettuce leaves. Toss lettuce leaves in bowl. Add oranges, apples, celery. Mix mayonnaise and cinnamon in small bowl. Drizzle cinnamon mixture over salad.

Mix sauerkraut with caraway seeds and onion. Place ribs on bottom of 2-qt. casserole. Spread sauerkraut mixture over ribs. Pour tomatoes over sauerkraut. Sprinkle with granulated sugar. Cover and cook on LOW 5-6 hrs. or until tender. Makes 6 servings.
Mix honey, milk and ground spices in a saucepan. Bring just to a boilremove from heat and steep for 10 minutes. Strain and pour over coffee in mug.
In large salad bowl combine all ingredients. Toss to coat. Drizzle light raspberry vinaigrette dressing. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut chicken into strips and put into large bowl. Pour sour cream on top and mix well. Put chicken into tortillas and roll into tight little bundles. Put into greased 8 x 8 pan and bake 10-15 minutes. Sprinkle cheese on top and bake an additional 10-15 minutes until cheese is melted and golden brown. Serve immediately or let rest 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add pork chops and cook 6 minutes or until browned on all sides. Stir in apples and onion. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in apple juice and bouillon granules. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in cream and cook 5 minutes or until pork chops are tender and sauce is thick. Stir in thyme and season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to an 8x8 baking dish. Bake in preheated oven 15 minutes. Serve pork chops with sauce.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. In a large skillet melt 2 tablespoons of butter. Add onion, green peppers, tomato sauce, water and worcestershire sauce. Cook until vegetables are tender. Add beef and continue cooking until done. Add macaroni to skillet. Cook 5 to 7 minutes until heated through.

Prepare for cooking. Slice lamb into strips. Place lamb in a slow cooker with olive oil. Add onions and garlic cloves to slow cooker and cook on low until onions are tender, 3 hours. Add coriander powder, whole cardamom pods and cook on low for 2 hours more or until lamb is tender. Add sweet potato cubes, hot water and cook on low for 1 hour or until sweet potato is tender. Remove cardamom pods before serving.

Beat together the cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth. Add the ham, onion and mustardblend well. Shape into a ball and chill for at least two hours. Place the ball on a serving platter. Garnish with parsley. Serve with crackers. This recipe yields 18 servings.
Cook beef and drain. Mix all ingredients together except baked beans. Add beans. Stir well and bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 2 hours.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x9 cake pan lightly with shortening and dust with flour. Peel the yams and slice the ends off of each one so that you have evenly sized disks. Cut the yam disks into quarters. Dip the yam quarters into the melted shortening so that they are lightly coated on both sides. Place in the prepared pan and bake for 45-60 minutes until lightly brown on top. While the yams are cooking, melt the butter in the microwave and add the honey. Stir to mix well. Pour the honey mixture over the yams when they are done cooking in the oven. Sprinkle the black pepper over the yams and serve warm. These are great served as a side dish with your holiday dinner!

Mix ground beef and onion and place in a greased loaf pan. Sprinkle with bacon bits and then with the cheese. In a small bowl mix the beef broth with the flour and season with salt and pepper and pour over top. Bake in a 350 oven for 30 minutes or until meat is cooked through and cheese is melted and browned. Serve with your favorite side dishes.

Cream butter and brown sugar together until light and fluffy. Beat in egg until well blended, then stir in vanilla. Combine flour, cocoa and salt. Gradually stir into creamed mixture until well blended. Mix in coconut. Stir in baking soda and baking powder. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 deg for 8-10 minutes or until just set. Cool on wire rack. Melt butter in small saucepan over medium heat. Add icing sugar and stir until smooth. Drizzle over cookies when cool. Makes 36 cookies.

Preheat oven to 325. Lightly grease an 8×8 pan. In medium bowl beat margarine and vanilla wafer crumbs until crumbly. Stir in semi-sweet chocolate chips and walnuts. Press half of crumb mixture into bottom of prepared pan. In medium saucepan combine sweetened condensed milk and water. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Pour over crumb mixture. Sprinkle with flaked coconut. Press remaining crumb mixture over filling. Cut into bars. Bake 20 minutes or until top is firm.

Place the oranges in a small saucepan with water to cover. Add the brown sugar. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Simmer until the oranges are tender and the liquid is reduced to a syrup. Discard the orange peels. Transfer the oranges to a food processor. Add the syrup, orange juice, salt and cinnamon sticks. Process until smooth. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a serving bowl. Serve warm.

Put the chicken into a large pot with enough cold water to cover it by about an inch. Bring the water to a rolling boil over high heat, then skim off any scum that forms on the surface. Reduce the heat so that the chicken cooks at a low simmer. Cook until the meat is very tender and the skin has been rendered translucent, about 2 hours. Drain the chicken very carefully with a slotted spoon into a colander set over a bowl. When cool enough to handle, remove the meat from the skin and discard the skin and bones. Cut the meat into large pieces. Put the chicken pieces back into the saucepan. Pour the vinegar over the chicken piecesdiscard the peels from the garlic cloves and add them along with the garlic to the saucepan. Cook the garlic over low heat until tender but not brown, about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the peanut oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Stir the soy sauce into the oilpour the mixture over the chicken pieces. Cover the pan tightly

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly spray a 9 x 13 pan with nonstick spray. Combine flour and splenda in a large bowl. Mix in pumpkin puree until just blended. In a separate bowl beat egg whites until stiff. Fold pumpkin mixture into the egg whites. Add baking soda and spices. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool. For the frosting, combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Frost cake when cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream butter and soup in bowl. Add milk and cream of mushroom soup mix and mix well. Add flour and mix well. Add seasoned chicken thighs and mix well. Pour into a 9 x 13 greased pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for 35-40 minutes or until done. Serve hot with rice or potato and salad.
Crush blackberries in blender. Add water. Blend until berries are liquefied. Add remaining ingredients. Blend until smooth. Serve over ice.

In a medium bowl mix together dried bread crumbs, eggs, lemon juice, margarine, dill weed and parsley flakes. In a separate bowl, cut up mushrooms, discarding stems. In a large saucepan with 2 inches of oil in it fry mushrooms until golden brown on both sides. Remove from oil, drain on paper towels. Combine stuffing mixture with mushroom caps and cheesestuff mushrooms completely with stuffing mixture. In a small saucepan heat oil over medium heatbrown stuffed mushrooms until golden brown. Remove from oildrain on paper towels. Place mushrooms on serving platterserve at once. Serves 8-10 persons.

Place rice mix in a large saucepan and cover with 1-1/2 cups cold water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to a simmer. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, for 20 to 22 minutes or until rice is tender and water is absorbed. Drain rice. Place celery ribs, onion, butter and soup in a blender or food processor. Process until smooth. Pour mixture over rice. Stir in mushrooms. Season with salt and pepper. Place hens in a large resealable plastic bag. Add milk to bagseal bag. Turn bag to coat hens. Place hens in a large shallow baking dish. Add stuffing mixture. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon flour. Cover dish with aluminum foil. Bake at 350 for 1-1/2 to 2 hours or until hens are cooked through. Let stand 15 minutes before serving.

Cook the hamburger. Drain. Add the salsa, taco seasoning and the desired amount of salad dressing. Stir. Top with the tortilla chips. Bake for 15 minutes at 350. Top with cheese and bake for another 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with lettuce and tomato.

Place cauliflower florets in a food processor bowl fitted with a metal blade and pulse until crushed into small pieces. Place crushed florets in medium bowl and sprinkle with garlic salt. Add mayonnaise mixture and mix well. Garnish with chopped cilantro if desired. Serve immediately.

Wash and dry the jalapenos. Cut a slit in the length of the jalapeno and remove the seeds. Fill with a mixture of the cheese and cilantro or mint. Close the jalapenos by placing a toothpick through the opening to hold them shut. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Jalapenos will keep for a couple of weeks in the refrigerator.

Place chocolate and butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir until chocolate melts. Remove from heat and stir in the cream cheese and vanilla extract. Stir in the powdered sugar and cocoa until well-blended. Pour onto a cookie sheet and use a spoon or a melon baller to make about 40 small balls. Roll balls in chopped nuts. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours until firm. Serve with your favorite dipping chocolate.

In a large saucepan combine the sugar with the basil leaves, strawberries and oranges. Place over medium-high heat, bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat, let stand for 5 minutes. Strain mixture through a strainer into a pitcher and serve with a spoonful of ice cream.

Cream together shortening, milk and sugar. Sift dry ingredients together, then add to shortening mixture. Mix until it has the texture of cookie dough. Roll dough out 1/4 inch thick on floured board or waxed paper. Cut with a 3-inch round cutter. Place on lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees F for 8-10 minutes or until lightly brown.

In a large bowl, combine olive oil and vinegar and stir. Add basil and toss. Place bocconcini into bowl and toss to coat. Place rocket onto serving plates and add cherry tomatoes. Add a dollop of the basil oil and a piece of bocconcini. Dip toothpicks into the oil and use to thread the cheese onto the rocket. Serve and enjoy!
Place cherries and ice in blender. Add sake. Blend until smooth. Pour into tall glasses. Garnish with slice of lime. Serve over ice.
In large pot brown the meat and stir in the water and ketchup. Add potato, carrots and onion. Simmer covered for 1 hour. Add the cabbage. Simmer covered for 45 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Cream together the butter and sugar. Add the molasses and eggs. Add the flour and other spices and mix well. Drop onto greased cookie sheet and flatten. Sprinkle the sugar crystals over the cookies. Bake for about 10-12 minutes at 400 degrees. Cool before eating.
Bring water to boil in large saucepan. Add apple juice. Add all herbs. Boil gently for 4 minutes. Turn off heat and steep 15 minutes. Remove herbs. Pour into glasses and serve hot.

Rinse and drain walnuts. In a saucepan, combine walnuts, vinegar and sugar. Cook over medium heat and stir until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and set aside. Place mixed greens in a large salad bowl. Arrange strawberries and zucchini on top of greens. Slice eggs and lay on top of salad. Drain shrimp and arrange over salad. Drizzle dressing over salad. Sprinkle with feta and walnuts.

Preheat oven to 425. Prepare grill to medium high heat. Coat 9x13 pan with nonstick cooking spray. In 10x14 nonstick baking dish, combine pineapple juice, worcestershire sauce and soy sauce. Add sugar to taste. Place chicken in marinade. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. Bake at 425 for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Coat with cooking spray. Top with pineapple slices. Bake an additional 15 minutes or until heated through.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. In a large mixing bowl, combine the brown sugar, gluten-free soy sauce and butter. Dab the chicken in the sauce mixture. Place the chicken in a roasting pan. Roast for 1 hour. Serve with rice.

Combine soy sauce, garlic cloves, brown sugar, pepper and salt in a bowl. Add water until mixture measures 1/2 cup. Add green onion. Pour marinade over steaks. Marinate for 45 minutes. Grill steaks over high heat for 5-6 minutes per side. Serve with green onions on top.
Place ham in shallow baking pan. Combine clove, bay leaf, mustard and brown sugar. Sprinkle over ham. Pour beer over ham and bake at 350 degrees for 2 1/2 hours.

Combine all ingredients except pears in a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat until thick. Reduce heatadd pears. Cook until pears are tender. Add a little water if necessary to thin the sauce. Serve hot or cold. If desired, add a little more juice to thin the sauce.

Combine cracker crumbs and butter. Mix well. Press into bottom of pie shell. Bake until golden brown. Cool. In a bowl, beat heavy whipping cream and milk until stiff peaks form. Fold in brown sugar and orange zest. Beat in chocolate. Spread over graham cracker crust. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Refrigerate until firm. Beat whipped topping with sweetened whipped cream until stiff. Spread over chocolate layer. Garnish with orange zest.

In bowl mix flour with baking soda and set aside. In another bowl mix margarine with sugar and oil then add to flour mixture and stir in well. In another bowl beat tofu with electric mixer until creamy and add to flour mixture and beat well. Add oil and vanilla extract and stir well. Stir in chocolate and cocoa powder and beat well. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean.
Saute onions and garlic in olive oil until tender. Add tomatoes, string beans and zucchini. Stir in dill. Cook until the vegetables are tender. Stir in okra. Season with salt and pepper.

Peel and grate potatoes. In a large pot on medium heat add oil. Once oil heats add mustard seeds. Once seeds pop add all the rest of the spices and stir until aromatic. Once the spices are fragrant add the grated potatoes and stir until the potatoes are coated with the spices. Add enough water to cover potatoes and stir until it comes to a boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and let cook for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Stir in cilantro and serve.

Place chicken breast in a large zip-top freezer bag. Pour barbecue sauce into bag. Seal bag. Marinate in refrigerator overnight. Preheat grill. Drain and discard marinade. Place chicken and remaining ingredients in a 13- x 9-inch baking dish. Fold up long sides of dish and tuck in ends. Place dish in center of grill. Cook 20 minutes or until chicken is done.
Mix all of the ingredients together. Cook on medium heat for about 20 minutes until the gravy is thick.

Sift together the first 8 ingredients and stir in the shortening and raisins until combined. Stir in the peach jam and oats until a soft dough forms and the raisins are evenly distributed throughout. Form the dough into balls and place them 2 inches apart onto a greased cookie sheet. Flatten slightly with the palm of your hand and sprinkle with a few grains of salt. Bake for 10 minutes or until the cookies are lightly browned around the edges and spring back when touched.

Cook pasta shells according to package directions. Meanwhile prepare sauce by combining cottage cheese, lemon juice and dill. Drain pasta and place in large serving dishes. Place scallops in sauce mixture and mix well. Spoon mixture into pasta shells and place on serving plates. Top with celery and onion. Pour dressing over shells.

Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened, about 10 minutes. Add water, bell peppers, hot peppers and tomatoes. Season mixture with salt. Bring mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until onions are tender. Serve over rice or pasta.

Wash rice and place in a 2 quart saucepan. Cover rice with water and bring to a boil. Cover, lower heat to medium-low and cook for 30 minutes or until tender. Drain rice and let cool slightly. In a saucepan over medium heat heat 1 tablespoon oil and saute onion and green pepper until tender (about 5 minutes). Add rice to onion mixture and stir in broth and water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heatcook 5 minutes, then reduce heat to low and simmer covered until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender (15 minutes). Stir in parsley and oregano and let stand until liquid is absorbed (5-10 minutes).

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Peel the potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch rounds. Put the potatoes in a large bowl filled with cold water. Soak for 15 minutes. Drain. Place in a 2-quart casserole dish. In a bowl combine the butter, sour cream, cream cheese, green onions, salt and pepper. Pour over the potatoes. Cover and bake for 20 minutes. Top with Parmesan cheese. Bake for 5 minutes longer. Let stand 5 minutes.

Cut biscuits into quarters. In small bowl, stir together oil, granulated sugar and cinnamon. Dip biscuits into mixture. Fry doughnuts until golden brown. Dip into powdered sugar. Dip into cinnamon. Repeat. Serve warm.

In small bowl combine vinegars and shallot. Season with salt and pepper. Whisk in olive oil. In large bowl combine tomatoes, basil sprig, and fresh basil. Season with salt and pepper. Toss with dressing. Garnish with basil sprig.

In a large bowl mix together the flour and caster sugar with the butter. Using your fingertips or the back of a spoon rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add the buttermilk and mix together with the back of a spoon until the mixture comes together into a ball. Flatten out the ball and cut into 8 pieces. Roll each piece into a ball and place on the baking sheet. Brush the top with milk and sprinkle with caster sugar. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes until the biscuits are golden brown in color and firm to touch. Remove from the oven and brush with milk again and then sprinkle with caster sugar. Allow the biscuits to cool on the tray before transferring them to the serving plate and serving with clotted cream and preserves.

Peel and devein shrimp and pat dry. Place shrimp and crabmeat in a bowl and add minced garlic and butter. Add panko and mix well to coat shrimp and crabmeat. Drain off excess butter and season with lemon juice and pepper to taste. Fry shrimp and crabmeat in oil for about 2 minutes on each side. Drain on paper towels. Serve immediately on a bed of rice with green onions on top and a squeeze of lemon juice.

Preheat oven to 425f. Stir together biscuit mix, parmesan cheese, garlic powder and milk until soft dough is formed. Roll the dough into 1 inch thick cylinders. Dip each cylinder in melted butter. Place the cylinders on a baking sheet with the seams facing out. Bake for 12 minutes or until golden. Cool for 5 minutes. Cut each cylinder crosswise into 6 slices. Serve with marinara.

Preheat oven to degrees. In a small bowl whisk together egg and vanilla. In a large bowl with an electric mixer beat butter until soft. Add sugar and beat until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla and beat until just combined. Add cornmeal and mix well. Add baking powder and salt and mix until combined. Stir in flour until well combined. Drop dough by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 15 minutes or until cookies are lightly browned. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from cookie sheet. Cool completely. Store in an airtight container in a cool place.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Beat together the flour and sugar with the baking soda and salt until well mixed. Whisk together the whole milk and vegetable oil until smooth. Whisk in the vanilla extract. Add the liquid mixture to the dry mixture. Beat until smooth. Bake for about one hour.
Cook pasta as directed. Drain and toss with butter. Add ham and remaining ingredients. Mix well. Serve immediately.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain in colander and let cool. Transfer potatoes to a large bowl and mash with milk, butter, salt and pepper. Transfer mixture into a medium bowl and stir in asiago cheese and scallions.

Combine the vinegar, orange juice, oil and sugar in a small bowl. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Whisk well. Toss salad greens with snow peas and grapes. Pour dressing over salad and toss to coat. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve.

Prepare pie crusts according to package directions. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute ham, bell pepper, green onion and onion in oil until ham is cooked through. Set aside in a large bowl to cool. In a large bowl beat eggs with half-and-half until blended. Beat in ham mixture until combined. Pour mixture into unbaked pie crusts. Sprinkle with shredded Swiss cheese. Bake at 425 degrees F for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F and bake until pie crusts are lightly browned. Let stand for five minutes before serving.

Peel potatoes and slice them into thin wedges. Toss with garlic cloves and dried oregano and season with salt and pepper. Place in a large pot and cover with water. Add beef stock and bring to a boil. Turn down heat to low-medium. Cover with lid. Cook until potatoes are tender, about 12-15 minutes. Drain the potatoes in a colander and let cool for 5-10 minutes. Strain any liquid in the colander. Transfer the potatoes to a serving dish. Add a few more drops of olive oil and drizzle with lemon juice. Sprinkle with oregano and serve hot.

Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add red onion and cook until softened, about 8 minutes. Add yellow squash and yellow bell peppers and cook for about 10 minutes. Add red bell peppers. Cook for about 5 more minutes. Add salt and pepper. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings.

Mix butter and caster sugar in bowl. Beat in egg. Gradually add flour. Add boiling water. Stir in passionfruit syrup. Pour into baking dish. Bake at 180C for 15 minutes or until done. Serve warm or cold.

Slice zucchini into 1/4-inch rounds. Slice shitake mushrooms. Heat butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushroomssaute 5 minutes or until tender. Add zucchini and saute 5 minutes or until tender. Drain. Stir in soy sauce. Sprinkle with garlic salt.

In large mixing bowl, combine eggs and butter. Add flour gradually and beat until smooth. In heavy skillet heat oil over medium heat. Pour batter into hot oil, 1/4 cupfuls. Cook until bubbles form on top. Turn and cook until bottoms are golden brown. Flip and cook until golden brown on other side.
Mash avocados. Add chopped tomatoe and jalapeno. Mix all together. Add lemon juice and mix. Add chopped cilantro. Serve with crackers. It is really good.

In large nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium heat until just smoking. Add cumin seeds and red bell peppercook for 30 seconds or until fragrant. Add snow peascook for 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add red chili peppercook for 1 minute or until heated through. Sprinkle with kosher salt and fresh ground black pepper.

Combine oats, honey, salt, flour and baking soda in a large bowl. Mix thoroughly. Add butter and blend. Add buttermilk and mix thoroughly. Dough will be soft and sticky. Turn out on a floured board or counter and knead until the dough is firm. Roll the dough out to about 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into desired shapes with cookie cutters. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for about 8 minutes or until golden brown on bottom. Remove from cookie sheet immediately after baking and cool on wire rack.
Place pork chops in slow cooker with all ingredients except the liquid smoke. Cook on low for about 6 hours or on high for about 4 hours until pork is tender. Serve with baked potatoes.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. In a large pan over medium heat cook bacon until crisp. Remove from the pan and set aside. In the same pan cook the chopped mushrooms until tender. Add the chopped potatoes and cook until tender. Add the sliced onion. Cook until tender. Pour in the eggs, season with the salt and pepper. Mix well. Place the frittata into the preheated oven until the eggs are firm. Sprinkle the top of the frittata with the cheese and fresh rosemary. Serve warm.

Slice each tomato in half from top to bottom and discard stems. Spread 1 tablespoon mayonnaise over each half. Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon of mustard over each half. Add 1/4 teaspoon of oregano and salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon of parmesan cheese over each half. Place tomatoes in a shallow baking dish or a lightly greased baking pan with sides and bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees or until tomatoes are softened slightly. Sprinkle with additional cheese. Broil for 1 minute or until cheese melts. Sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley if desired and serve warm.

Sauté the garlic and onion in olive oil for 2 minutes then add the chopped mushrooms, season with salt and pepper, add the flour and buttermilk and mix well then finally the eggs. Make 6 to 8 pancakes on a large greased frying pan and serve with maple syrup and a sprinkling of fresh chives on top.

Sprinkle chicken with salt. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken until golden brown. Add the soup and milk. Cook until the chicken is cooked through and the liquid has thickened. Stir in the cheese and basil and garlic powder. Cook for 1 minute more. Serve with pasta or rice.

Mix buttermilk, molasses, egg, cinnamon, nutmeg, soda, butter and salt in large bowl. Add remaining ingredientsbeat 5 min on medium speed with electric mixer, scraping down sides often. Turn out onto lightly floured surfaceroll to 3/8 thickness. Cut with 2-inch round cutter. Place 2 inches apart on lightly greased baking sheets. Cover with plastic wraplet rise in warm place 30 min to 1 hour (until doubled). Bake at 425 for 12 min or until golden brown.

Mix spices and salt with oil and rub it on each side of salmon fillet. Heat oil and add salmon to pan and cook for about 3 minutes on each side or till done. Place salmon on a plate and keep aside to cool down. Cut salmon fillet into small pieces and set aside. Wash spinach and chop it roughly. Cook spinach and drain out excess liquid. Add spinach to the salmon and mix it gently. Place salmon on serving plate and garnish with sliced tomatoes. Serves 4 to 5.

Brown the beef and onion together, until meat is fully cooked. Add garlic cloves, chili-garlic sauce, beef broth and red pepper flakes- stir until well combined. Add spinach and mushrooms- cook until spinach is wilted. Top with sour cream- serve immediately.

Put the beef into the crock pot. Cook on low for about 8 hours. Drain the beef well. Thin the chili sauce with some water until it is pourable. Put the beef back in the crock pot and add the sauce. Cook on low for another hour. When the sauce is warm (it will be thick), spread it over the buns. Put the beef over the sauce and top with the pickles. Makes 4 sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut bread into 1/2 inch cubes. Place bread cubes in a plastic food storage bag. Add garlic, thyme and oregano. Shake to coat. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add bread cubes and fry until browned. Set aside. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. Place bread cubes on baking sheet. Sprinkle with poultry seasoning. Bake for 20-30 minutes until bread cubes are crunchy. Sprinkle crispy bread cubes with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Wash and pat dry the potatoes. Place them on a rimmed baking sheet. Toss them with the olive oil, salt and pepper. Bake them for about 30 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork. Remove the potatoes from the oven and set aside to cool slightly. In the same oven, melt the butter. Add the brown sugar and whisk it until it is completely dissolved. Add the lemon zest and juice and stir to combine. Whisk in the hot water and stir until the glaze is smooth. Add a few drops of hot water if it gets too thick. When the potatoes are cool enough to handle, cut an X on the top of each one. Then scoop out the center of each potato. Arrange the potatoes in a small roasting pan. Fill the cavities with the glaze. Roast the potatoes in the oven until the glaze is a nice brown, about 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Melt the sugar and cream in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add the chopped up semisweet chocolate to the pan. Stir with a wooden spoon until smooth and then let cool for 5 minutes. Pour into mugs or jars and top with toasted marshmallows!
Place hot dogs in bun, layer with prepared mustard, ketchup and chili. Top with relish and cheese.

Wash the beets and pat dry with a paper towel or clean dishrag. Place beets in a baking dish and pour melted butter over the beets in the dish. Add honey and ground ginger and stir gently. Roast in a preheated oven at 375 for about an hour. When done, remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving.

Place butter and sugar into a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until the mixture reaches a temperature of about 100 degrees celsius (375 degrees fahrenheit). Remove from heat and stir in water and rice bubbles until well combined. Pour into a greased pan and refrigerate until firm enough to cut into squares. Store in an air-tight container in the refrigerator for up to three weeks.

Cut potatoes in half lengthwise. Slice each half into 4 wedges. Place wedges in a shallow pan. Pour olive oil over potatoes. Sprinkle with garlic powder and salt and pepper. Pour butter over potatoes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 20 minutes or until tender.
Stir all the ingredients together in a bowl. Roll into small balls and place on lined baking sheet. Refrigerate for 10-15 minutes to firm up. Store in the fridge.

In a large bowl beat sugar and eggs together until thick and lemon-colored. Stir in flour and next 7 ingredients (through mandarin oranges). Spread mixture evenly over nuts. Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack and serve.
Combine vodka, pineapple juice and cream of coconut in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until chilled. Pour into a highball glass and garnish with lime slices.

In a medium bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar and mustard. In a large bowl, combine broccoli, baby spinach, red onion, bacon bits, raisins. Pour dressing over vegetables. Stir gently. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Serve cold. Refrigerate any remaining salad. This salad is delicious over a bed of lettuce. Also delicious served over fresh pasta or a sandwich.
Slice whole wheat bread in half and spread mayonnaise on bread and cheese on top of mayonnaise and place on grill for 2 minutes on each side or until cheese is melted. Cut in half and serve.

Combine chicken broth and water in a medium saucepanbring to a simmer. Combine couscous and 2 tablespoons of the cumin and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium heat. Add 1/4 cup of the couscous mixture to the hot oilcook, tossing constantly with a fork or spatula until coated with oil and heated through.
