Repeat with remaining couscous mixture and oil. Pour the broth into a heatproof bowl or pitcher. Add the remaining cumin and the peppermint tea bag. Let stand 10 minutes. Stir in the raisins. Transfer the couscous to a serving bowl or platter. Pour the broth mixture over the couscous. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon of slivered almonds. Serve hot.

Slice French bread in half. Spread each side with cheese. Slice red onion thinly. Arrange on cheese slices. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with vinegar. Sprinkle with herbs. Sprinkle with olives. Sprinkle with ham. Place on baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes.
Mix all ingredients together. Add cream cheese when mixture is almost mixed. Bake in greased pan at 400 degrees for 10-12 minutes. When brown remove from oven. Cool and cut into squares.

Cut pineapple into 1/4 -inch slices. Place on grill over medium heat for 4 minutes per side or until grill marks appear. Combine brown sugar and butter. Brush pineapple slices with brown sugar mixture and then rub with cut sides of mint and basil leaves. Sprinkle with rum and grill for 2 minutes. Serve with vanilla ice cream.
Beat eggs, sugar, salt, vanilla. Beat butter and milk. Add flour, baking powder. Pour batter into a greased and floured pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes.

Combine the butter and the white sugar and spread over the top of the breasts. In a separate bowl, combine the sweet onions, the parsley, the lemon pepper and the garlic salt. Put the breasts into the slow cooker and pour the lemon juice over the top. Add the mixture of the sweet onions. Cook on high for 4 to 5 hours or low for 7 to 8 hours. Serve with a side of rice.

Mix together first four ingredients. Blend together egg whites and splenda sugar substitute. Mix egg white mixture with the flour mixture. Add nonfat milk. Mix well. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold into flour mixture. Spread into a 13 x 9 baking pan. Bake 25 minutes. Cool. Spread fat free cream cheese on top. Chill for one hour. Makes 14 servings.

Spread the cheese over the slices of bread. Mix the mayonnaise and chopped onion together. Put a slice of cheese and a shrimp on each toast. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Place under the broiler until the cheese is melted and the shrimp is cooked. Serve immediately.

In a large mixing bowl, whisk the dressing ingredients to combine. In a smaller bowl, toss the red onion and greens together with 2 Tbsp of the dressing. Arrange the greens on 4 plates or in a large shallow salad bowl. Top each serving with 1/4 of the plum tomatoes. Spoon over the dressing. Serve.

Clean the fish and marinate it in a mixture of turmeric, ginger-garlic paste and lemon juice for at least half an hour. Drain the fish and coat it with oil and black pepper. Heat enough oil in a pan or kadai for frying the fish and deep fry the fish on low flame till golden brown and crisp from both sides. Transfer to a plate and serve hot with onion and tomato sauce or with ketchup or green chutney or mint chutney on the side.

Combine honey, lemon juice, curry powder, prepared mustard in large saucepan. Whisk in remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover. Simmer for 20 to 25 minutes. Bake uncovered 15 minutes or until chicken is done. Serve with cooked rice or pasta.

Peel potatoes and boil them in a large pot of salted water until tender. Drain. Dice the salmon and set aside. Mix together all of the hash ingredients except for the scallions. When hash is cool enough to handle, form a ball with your hands and pat into a 9x13-inch pan. Cook until browned. Serve with scallions for garnish if desired.

Cook konbu in water for 3 minutesdrain. Combine remaining ingredients except pasta. Bring to boiladd pastacook for 10 minutes. Add konbucook 1 minuteadd meatcook 1 minuteadd other ingredientscook 1 minute. Serve on soup plates. Drain pasta. Serve over soup. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Prepare cheesecake mix according to package directions. Spread cheesecake mixture into 4 small glasses or ramekins. Pour cherry pie filling into glasses. Top cherry pie filling with cheesecake mixture. Garnish with lemon rind and almonds. Store in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Heat oil and garlic in a large frying pan over medium heat. Sprinkle pork with salt & pepperadd to pansaute until brown on both sides. Transfer pork to a baking dishkeep warm. Add wine to panbring to a boilcook 1 minute. Add potatoescook 8 minutes or until tender. Add butter to pancook 1 minute or until melted. Stir cabbage into pancook until wiltedsprinkle with salt & pepper to tastetoss to coat. Pour sauce over porksprinkle with cheesecover. Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 5 minutes or until cheese melts. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Brush the chicken with the mustard mixture. Dip the breadcrumbs in the egg. Dust the chicken with the breadcrumbs. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken. Cook for 4 minutes on each side. Sprinkle the lemon juice over the chicken. Reduce the heat. Cover and cook for 2 minutes. Place the chicken in a bowl. Let the chicken stand for 15 minutes. Thinly slice the brie. Place the cheese on the top of the chicken. Serve.

In a medium bowl, combine breadcrumbs, cheese, ancho chile powder, saltset aside. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add oilheat until hot. Dip chicken in eggsdrain. Dip chicken in breadcrumb mixturecoat well on all sides. Place on a sheet pan coated with nonstick spraybake at 450 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden brownset aside for 5 minutes before servingserve with honey mustard or ranch dressing for dipping.
Mix well and put in a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for about 15 minutes.

Rinse the lamb and pat dry with paper towels. Cut the lamb into a single piece to make it easier to prepare and carve. Season with salt and pepper. Heat a large skillet over high heat and add enough oil to coat the bottom of the skillet. Heat until hot. Place the lamb on the hot skillet and sear on all sides. Remove the lamb from the skillet and place on a rack in a roasting pan. Add the garlic to the hot skillet and cook until it is golden brown. Remove the garlic from the skillet and add the butter. Cook the butter until it is bubbling and add the mint jelly. Cook for about a minute and then pour the sauce over the lamb. Place the lamb in the oven and cook for about 4 minutes per side. Remove the lamb from the oven and let it rest for about 5 minutes before carving.

In large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium heat, heat oil until shimmering. Add onion and sauté until translucent, about 2 minutes. Stir in ketchup, cider vinegar, brown sugar, salt and Worcestershire saucebring to a boil. Add dried chipotle powder and dried oreganostir to dissolve. Reduce heat to medium-lowsimmer until onions are softened, about 10 minutes. In slow cooker or large Dutch oven over medium heat, combine barbecue sauce, ketchup, brown sugar, honey, vinegar and saltbring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer until onions are softened, about 15 minutes. Remove onions to a large bowl with a slotted spoonlet cool slightly. Discard liquid from onions. In large Dutch oven over medium-high heat, brown ribs on all sides until well seared, about 30 minutes. Transfer ribs to slow cookeradd onions to Dutch ovenadd chicken broth and bring to a boil

Wash the dandelion greens and place them in a large salad bowl. Heat the bacon drippings in a large skillet over medium heat until hot. Add the dandelion greens and dry mustard and cook until the greens have wilted and are tender, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with vinegar and cider vinegar. Serve immediately.

Combine chicken bouillon with water and add sugar to make a thick paste. Add garlic powder. Bring mixture to a boil. Add cider vinegar and stir until the mixture thickens. Add olive oil. Stir until blended.

Preheat oven to 180c fan-forced. Combine chocolate chips and condensed milk in a medium saucepan over medium heat until melted. Remove from heat and stir through oats and rice bubbles. Divide mixture into 24 equal-sized portions. Press mixture into prepared baking paper-lined muffin pans or small tins until mixture is 1cm thick. Bake for 15 minutes or until firm to touch. Remove from oven and leave to cool for 10 minutes before removing from tins. Refrigerate until required to use. Store covered at room temperature for 2 weeks. Makes 24 bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut brie cheese in 1/2 inch cubes. Put pecans in food processor until fine. Combine pecans with brown sugar in a small bowl. Place brie cubes on top of tart shells. Drizzle whiskey over brie and top with pecans. Bake for 8 minutes or until brie cheese is melting.

Heat olive oil in a 3 quart pan. Add meat and onion. Cook until meat is brown. Add mushrooms. Add garlic. Add diced tomatoes. Add seasonings. Cook until thickened. Add red wine vinegar. Add cheese. Serve.

Cook barley according to directions on package. Drain and set aside. In small bowl combine the remaining salad ingredients and set aside. In a separate bowl whisk together all the vinaigrette ingredients. Toss the cooked barley with the vegetables and dressing until well blended.

Add water to the pot, onion, celery tops and parsley. Bring to a boil for 2 minutes. Reduce to a simmer for 45 minutes or until the lobster shells are soft. Strain the mixture through a sieve to remove the lobster shells. Return the mixture to the pot. Add white wine. Add Old Bay seasoning. Return to a boil. Add the lobsters. Cook until tender. Remove the lobsters from the pot. Add the lobster base to the sauce. Add the lobster meat. Cook over moderately low heat for 15 minutes. Add the butter. Stir. Cook until the sauce is thick.

Crush graham crackers and mix with butter and 1 cup sugar in a food processor or by hand until the mixture resembles wet sandpress into a 12-cup greased mold (pie dish). Bake for 10 minutes or until set and edges are golden brown. Meanwhile, beat egg yolks and 2/3 cup sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer for 3 minutes or until thick and pale in color (mixture will begin to lighten in color and thicken). Pour sweetened condensed milk into a large bowl and add margarita mixwhisk with a spoon until combined. Pour margarita mixture into graham cracker crust and chill for 2 hours or until set. Garnish with lime wedge and serve.

Cook onion and garlic in butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in tomatoes. Cook 3 minutes. Stir in shrimp and cook 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in brandy and red wine. Add 1 cup each cheese and half-and-half and stir. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 375 degrees F. for 20 minutes. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Remove stems from cherry tomatoes and tear in half. Place in an ovenproof dish. In a small bowl mix together breadcrumbs with fresh herbs. Sprinkle over the cherry tomatoes. Drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes. Serve.

Marinate beef steak for at least 1 hour or overnight. Prepare sauce by blending all sauce ingredients in a blender or food processor. Serve with steak skewered onto wooden skewers. Garnish with cucumber and coriander.
Spread hummus on one side of bread. Slice avocado. Arrange slices of tomato on hummus. Place on bread. Add avocado slices on top of tomato. Sprinkle with salt. Place another slice of bread on top.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Bake stuffed shrimp in oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.

Trim asparagus. Break off tipsdiscard tips and chop remaining asparagus in half diagonally. Place in a small bowl with asparagus tips. Add hearts of palm, oil, vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper. Toss to coatset aside. Combine cherry tomatoes and remaining oil in a medium bowltoss to coat. Spoon asparagus into a bowltop with tomatoes and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve at room temperature.

Cream shortening and brown sugar with an electric mixer at medium speed until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat well. Add rind of one whole fresh lemon and beat well. Gradually add flour and all dry ingredients alternately with the hot water. Stir in the juice of the zest of 1 whole fresh lemon and the grated rinds of 4 more lemons. Drop by teaspoons onto greased baking sheets. Sprinkle with additional grated rinds. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes. Cool cookies on pan 3 minutes. Remove to cooling racks. Makes 5 dozen.

Dip cube steaks in flour mixed with salt and pepper. Dip in hot oil frying pan until lightly browned. Drain and place steak between two slices of french bread. Drizzle with Worcestershire sauce and a mixture of mustard and lemon juice. Add hot water and stir until combined and serve.

Put hot dogs in boiling water for about 4 minutes. Meanwhile heat chili sauce and heat chilis. Place hot dogs in hot dog buns. Put chili sauce on buns. Place a piece of hot chili pepper on each hot dog and sprinkle with cheese. Serve with lettuce on bun.

Cover each paper cup with a pastry bag fitted with a star tip and fill with cream cheese mixture. Freeze for about 2 hours or until firm. Unmold onto dessert platesplace cherry pie filling and pineapple chunks around each cup.

Spread mayonnaise on both sides of slices of bread, then spread on each slice of cheese. Place slices of cheese on top of the slices of mayonnaise-spread bread. Place sandwiches on grill pan. Close grill pan. Cook until cheese has melted and bread begins to toast slightly (about 2-3 minutes). Remove from grill pan. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl stir together the vinegar and honey. Add the olive oil and whisk to blend. Add mustard and stir to blend. In a large bowl combine the spinach and fruit. Pour the dressing over the spinach and fruit and stir gently to coat. Let stand at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before serving.

Melt butter in a large skillet. Add zucchini and tomatoes. Cook, stirring occasionally until zucchini and tomatoes are tender. Remove zucchini and tomatoes from pan. Add garlic and cook until garlic is fragrant. Add basil and cook until basil is tender. Crack the eggs into the pan. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until desired level of doneness. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from pan and serve.

In a large bowl, whisk together egg whites, flour, baking powder, salt, baking soda, and sugar. Add butter until mixture is smooth. In a separate bowl, whisk together buttermilk and vegetable oil. Pour buttermilk mixture into the flour mixture while whisking. Stir until all lumps are gone. Cooking the pancakes. Heat a griddle or frying pan over medium heat. Add about 1 tablespoon of oil or butter to the griddle. Drop about 1 1/2 tablespoons of batter onto the pan. Cook until bubbles form, about 30 seconds. Flip the pancake to cook other side. Serve hot with jam or syrup.

Heat olive oil over medium heat add onion garlic cook until onion is translucent add tomatoes, fennel seed, salt, pepper and sugar cook for an additional 5 minutes add beans add parsley cook an additional 5-6 minutes serve hot.

Combine sugar and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add cranberries and cook until tender and bouncy. Add apples and cook until apples are tender. Stir in orange and lemon juices. Add raisins and walnuts. Cook until heated through. Cool and refrigerate for at least an hour.
Melt butter and saute garlic and onions until golden brown. Add broccoli and saute until tender. Stir in cayenne and broth and cook until broccoli is tender but not soggy.

Cut the bread into cubes. Melt butter in a 13x9-inch baking dish. Place the cubes of bread into the butter and coat thoroughly. Pour the maple syrup over the bread and stir to coat. Place the baking dish into the oven. Bake at 350 degrees F for 35-40 minutes or until the bread is a rich brown color. In a bowl, combine the eggs, half-and-half and brown sugar. Whip the mixture until it is well combined. Remove the baking dish from the oven. Place a piece of bread on top of each serving plate. Pour the maple syrup mixture over the bread. Garnish with pecan halves.

Peel eggs and remove yolks. Place yolks in a mixing bowl. Add mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, salt, sugar, and paprika. Stir until well blended. Spoon yolk mixture into a pastry bag fitted with a large plain tip. Pipe yolk mixture into egg whites. Garnish with paprika. Serve.

Mix broccoli, tomato slices and monterey jack cheese in large bowl. Pour milk over mixtureset aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl whisk together flour and saltstir into milk mixture. Pour into a greased 11 by 7 inch baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes or until set. Remove from the oven and sprinkle the top of the casserole with the cheddar cheese. Return the casserole to the oven for another five minutes until the cheese has melted. Serve warm. Makes eight servings.

Bake potatoes in 350 degree oven for 60 minutes, or until done. Cut in half lengthwise, scoop out flesh and discard. Place flesh side down on a paper plate. Combine corn flakes and paprika. Sprinkle mixture evenly over potato halves. Drizzle melted butter over potato halves and sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake for 5 minutes. Serve warm.

In large saucepan cook crisp rice in boiling water 5 minutes. Drain. In large bowl combine rice with remaining ingredients. Mash until blended. Form into 24 (2-inch) patties. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook patties 3 minutes on each side or until done. Serve with dipping sauce.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl combine bananas, sugar and vegetable oil. In a separate bowl combine flours and spices. Add flour mixture and stir to combine. Stir in the almond milk. Pour the batter into muffin tins and bake for 18-25 minutes or until cooked through. Makes 12 muffins.

Cream the margarine and brown sugar together. Add the sugar and vanilla. Mix in the eggs and the flour. Add the baking soda and mix. Fold in the chocolate chips and drop by teaspoonful on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown.

Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat and cook the bacon until crisp and the fat is rendered. Add the onion and celery and cook for 1 minute, then add the flour and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in the chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and add the potato and corn. Simmer for about 15 minutes or until the potato is tender. Blend in the milk and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with croutons.

Melt butter and sugar in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Add water. Bring to a boil. Add chocolate chips. Remove from heat. Stir in walnuts. Pour onto a waxed paper-lined baking sheet. Let stand until cool. Break into pieces.
In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the garlic and spinach in the oil for about 5 minutes. Add the soy sauce, vinegar, sugar and sesame seeds. Cook 2 more minutes.

Mix ginger powder garlic powder soy sauce orange juice honey in a small bowl until smooth. Place salmon fillets skin side down in an ungreased grill pan over medium-high heat 2 to 3 minutes per side. Spoon marinade evenly over salmon. Cover grill pan and cook until fish flakes easily with a fork 10 to 12 minutes. Place salmon fillets on a plate and garnish with green onion.

In a large saucepan, add water and salt and bring to a boil. Add rice and butter and stir until butter melts and rice is well coated with butter and water. Reduce heat and cook covered for about 12 minutes or until liquid has been absorbed and rice is tender. Remove from heat and place in serving bowl. Serve hot with a pinch of salt.

Mix sugar, evaporated milk, butter and marshmallow cream together. Cook on medium heat until mixture begins to bubble. Stir constantly. Remove from heat. Add chocolate chips. Stir until chocolate is completely melted. Stir in vanilla. Pour into a 9x9 pan that has been greased with cooking spray. Chill for about 1 hour. Cut into bars. Makes 24 bars.

Soak almonds overnight in water to cover. Drain and discard water. Drain almonds again in a colander and let stand in a cool place until dry but not brittle. Place almonds in a food processor with salt and oil and pulse until chopped to desired consistency. Add honey and process until smooth and creamy, scraping down sides as necessary.

Preheat oven to 375F. Cream shortening and sugar together and add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Sift together the flour and baking powder and stir into the beaten mixture. Stir in the vanilla and milk and add nuts. Pour into greased and floured cake pans or tube pans and bake for approximately 25 minutes or until done. (Note: Cakes made with pecans and walnuts can be frosted with maple syrup and chopped nuts after they are baked.)

Peel and pit the peaches. Cut into slices 1/4-inch thick. Mix the raspberry liqueur with 1 cup of water. Add the peaches to a pan with a tight-fitting lid. Pour in the liqueur mixture, cover the pan tightly, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer, cover the pan again, and cook until the peaches are tender (about 15 minutes). Let the peaches cool for 10 minutes, then remove from the liquid. Remove any skins or pits from the peaches and discard them. Place them in a bowl with 1/2 cup of the syrup and toss to coat. Refrigerate until serving time. To serve, spoon a dollop of whipped cream onto a plate. Place 4-5 peach slices on top of the cream. Pour a few drops of chambord into a shot glass or small saucer. Dip a toothpick into the chambord, then into the raspberries to create a swirl effect. Arrange a few raspberry swirls around the edges of each plate of cre

Preheat the oven to 350f. Prepare a baking sheet by spraying it lightly with cooking spray. Place shrimp in a large bowl. Combine the lemon juice, butter, garlic, worcestershire sauce, lemon pepper seasoning, red pepper and parsley in a small bowl. Pour the mixture over the shrimp. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the shrimp are done.

Remove tough ends of asparagus and peel if necessary. Cut asparagus into thirds. Place asparagus in baking pan. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place in oven and bake for 20 minutes at 375 degrees Fahrenheit or until tender and golden brown. Serve with lemon wedges on the side for squeezing over asparagus.

Beat eggs in a large bowl until blended. Stir in sugar, salt, cinnamon and vanilla. Heat milk over medium heat until steaming. Gradually add egg mixture to milk mixture. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon. Stir in brandy. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand until eggs are cool. Stir in nutmeg. Chill until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Butter a 8 inch round cake pan and line the base with parchment paperdust with flour. Beat the almonds and granulated sugar together with an electric mixer until the mixture resembles coarse breadcrumbs. Beat in the eggs and lemon zest and mix until evenly combined. In a separate bowl, combine the cinnamon and salt and mix together. Add the dry mixture to the wet and beat until well incorporated, about 1 minute more. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth out the top with a spatula. Bake for about 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Serve warm or at room temperature with whipped cream or ice cream.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Remove brie cheese from its wrapping and place rind side down in a round 4-inch (10 cm) glass baking dish. Place in the oven and bake for 8 minutes. While cheese is heating, mix together apricots, preserves, almonds, cranberries and sugar in a small bowl until well blended. Spread mixture in a 4-inch (10 cm) round dish or glass baking dish. When cheese has finished baking, remove from the oven and add the apricot mixture to the center of the cheese. Return to oven for 2 minutes or until apricot mixture has warmed through slightly. Let cool for about 5 minutes before serving. Serve with crackers or toasted baguette bread. (Note: brie cheese should be firm to the touch but not rock hard.)

In a food processor combine garlic, basil, pine nuts, cheese and lemon juice. Blend until smooth. Add olive oil and blend until smooth. Adjust seasonings with salt and pepper. Use immediately or cover and refrigerate for up to 4 days.

Heat extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté the onions until they are transparent. While the onions cook, brown the ground beef in the oil that has dripped off the onions. When the onions are done and the beef is browned, stir in the ketchup, Southern Comfort, brown sugar, Dijon mustard and salt. Cook on medium heat for about 5 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally so that the sauce doesn't stick to the bottom of the pan. When the sauce is done cooking, serve on a bun or in a bowl. This is one of the most delicious comfort foods you'll ever taste! Serve with a side salad of fresh lettuce or a slice of tomato if desired.
Bring tomatoes to boil in saucepan. Add potatoes, onions, milk and salt. Bring back to boil. Reduce heat and simmer about one hour. Add seasoning.

Mix poultry seasoning with ground turkey. Form into four patties. Place one patty on each slice of bread. Top each patty with a slice of blue cheese. Close the sandwiches. Grill the burgers on medium heat for about 3 minutes per side.
Blend all ingredients together. Serve immediately.

Cut the bottoms off the rolls and set aside. Spread the bottoms with butter and place a portabella mushroom cap on each. Season with garlic salt and sprinkle with brie cheese. Fold the uncut sides of the rolls over the mushrooms and brie. Place the rolls seam side down and brush with egg wash. Bake at 400 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large shallow bowl add bread crumbs, cheese, oregano, rosemary, basil, salt and pepper. Mix well. In a medium bowl whisk together eggs and buttermilk. Dip chicken into egg mixture then dredge into bread crumb mixture. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 30 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 165 degrees.

In a large pot heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add ground sirloin and cook until browned. Add bacon. Add heinz ketchup and onion soup mix. Cook for 2 minutes. Add pork and beans. Stir in white Karo and brown sugar. Stir in ground cumin. Cook until bubbly. Serve. Serves 4.

Brown ground beef with onion and garlic salt in skillet over medium heat until beef is cooked and onion is tender. Add tomato sauce and chili powder and heat through. Drain macaroni and add to the beef mixture. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Top with Parmesan cheese and serve.

Trim excess fat from roast. Place roast in large deep-sided pan. Pour oil over roast. Add green chilies and 2 tsp. taco seasoning mix. Turn roast to coat with oil and seasonings. Sprinkle with 1 tsp. salt and 1 tsp. sugar. Pour in 2 cups water and 2 cups bouillon. Cover and cook over medium-high heat until meat is tender (125f to 130f), about 1 hour. Add 1 tbsp. flour to remaining 1/4 cup of water. Stir to blend. Add to roast mixture. Cook and stir until gravy thickens. Serve with corn bread.

Cut off the tough ends of the rhubarb and then peel off the outer skin of the stalks leaving only the tenderest bits of the stalk and discarding the hard woody bit. Slice the rhubarb into 1-2 cm pieces and put in a large saucepan. Add the water, sugar, cornflour and lemon juice and bring to the boil over medium heat. Turn the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and add the chicken pieces to the saucepan and cover with a lid to let the chicken cook through in the rhubarb liquid for 30 minutes. Remove the chicken and serve hot with rice or mashed potatoes or serve cold and eat it as a chilled dessert. You can also make this in the oven by roasting the chicken in the oven for 30-40 minutes at 180C/350F until cooked through and then simmer the rhubarb and water with the rest of the ingredients as above and add the chicken after the 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine the first 6 ingredients in a medium bowl and mix well. Pour into a 9-inch pie shell and bake for 45-55 minutes or until set and golden brown. Cool completely before slicing. Refrigerate any leftovers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix apples with sugar substitute. In a bowl combine flour with cinnamon and nutmeg. Cut in margarine until crumbly. Mix apple mixture into flour mixture. Pour into a pie shell. Bake for 20 minutes.

In a nonstick skillet or wok over medium heat, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil. Add the asparagus and stir until slightly crisp-tender. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the liquid is almost gone. Add the asparagus back into the pan. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil and the soy sauce. Stir until combined. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Mix flour and cornmeal and set aside. In a separate bowl mix together the sugar and margarine. Add in the eggs and honey. Stir in the milk and salt. Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture and beat until batter is smooth. Pour batter into a greased 8 inch square pan and bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 to 25 minutes.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and cool. Peel potatoes and slice into 1/2-inch thick slices. Place potato slices into a large bowl. Add butter. Mash potatoes and butter together using a potato masher. Add potato starch and salt. Mix well. Form mixture into balls. Flatten each ball of potato mixture with a fork and place each flat ball of potato mixture into a greased mini muffin pan. Bake at 425 for about 10 minutes or until golden. Fill each puff with a few pieces of chopped cooked bacon and a slice of cheese. Bake an additional 3-4 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

In a skillet over medium heat, brown ground turkey. Drain the meat. Stir in ginger and soy sauce. Add garlic and green onions and cook until tender. Transfer to a bowl and stir in hoisin sauce and sesame oil. Divide meat among 4 hamburger buns. Top with pineapple chunks.

In a small bowl mix orange juice and orange marmalade together. Add to the chicken. In another small bowl mix garlic powder and thyme together. Sprinkle over the chicken. Place the chicken in a baking dish. Bake at 375 for about 45 minutes. Chicken is done when it's no longer pink inside.

Place potato and cabbage in crock pot and cover with water. Cook until potatoes are soft. Meanwhile combine soup and seasoning in a large bowl and set aside. Brown pork in a large skillet with a little oil. Remove pork and set aside. Add onion to the skillet and cook until tender. Add pork and cook until all the juices run clear. Add seasoned cream soup to the crock pot and stir in pork and onion. Stir in water and cabbage/potatoes and place in crock pot. Cook on low for 8 hours or on high for 4 hours or until pork is tender. Serve over rice or noodles and garnish with green onion.

In a large saucepan melt the butter over medium heat. Add the shallot and garlic to the pan and sauté for about 1 minute or until softened. Add in the artichoke hearts and sauté for an additional minute or two. Add in the stock, milk, basil, pepper, salt and bring it all to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low and simmer for about 10-12 minutes or until the artichoke hearts are tender. Add in the crouton cubes for the last minute of cooking. Serve with a grated cheese on top or a dollop of sour cream or yogurt on the side for a creamy texture. This is a great vegetarian option for a comfort food dish on a cold winter evening. Serves 4-6.

Break biscuits into pieces. Place them in glass or plastic container. Melt chocolate and mix with ice cream. Add to glass or plastic container with biscuits. Add mint leaf. Serve with mint sauce or mint ice cream.

Preheat oven to 425f. Peel garlic. Place in a microwave-safe glass dish. Add oil and microwave on high for 2 to 3 minutes. Drain. Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cook until potatoes are tender when pierced with a fork. Drain. Place potatoes in a large bowl and mash with garlic. Add butter and milk and mash until smooth. Add remaining ingredients and mash until smooth. Place in an oiled 8x8 pan. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden. Top with cheese if desired.

Put sun-dried tomato in oil and heat until hot. Set aside. Spray a large nonstick pan. Cook catfish until brown, about 2-3 minutes per side. Add spinach to pan. Cook 2-3 minutes until wilted. Put catfish in pan. Add sun-dried tomato to pan. Coat catfish with 1/4 cup of sauce. Sprinkle with cheese. Cook 5 minutes.

Place the meatballs in a shallow casserole. Sprinkle brown sugar over the meatballs. Cook over medium heat until the sugar melts. In a small bowl combine cornstarch with 2 tablespoons water. Add to the casserole. Stir until thickened. Add the vinegar and cook until slightly thickened. Add soy sauce to taste. Top meatballs with green peppers and onion. Cook covered over medium heat for 1 hour. Serve over cooked rice.

Heat 2 tablespoons sesame oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add scallions and ginger to pan. Stir-fry 30 seconds. Add chicken broth, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, mushrooms and cucumbers. Simmer 5 minutes. Remove scallions with a slotted spoon and discard. Add rice vinegar. Stir to dissolve. Serve hot.

In a saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Remove from the heat. Add the lemon juice and zest. Add the nutmeg, cinnamon stick and ginger. In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar, butter and rum. Stir into the hot water mixture. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Mix onion and tomato in a large bowl. Beat eggs, milk and seasonings together in a small bowl. Add crab meat and fold into eggs mixture. Pour into the onion mixture. Fold in cabbage. Fill each corn tortilla with a scoop of the mixture. Roll and place seam side down on a baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutes. Serve with ranch dressing.

Rinse garbanzo beans and drain well. Place beans in food processor with water. Process until smooth. Transfer to medium bowl. Stir in tomato sauce and feta cheese. Add oil mixture to garbanzo bean mixture. Stir to combine. Spoon into tortilla bowls. Serve with cilantro garnish. Garnish with lime slices to serve.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Whisk eggs with milk, salt and water in a small bowl until blended. Dip bread in eggs and place in the skillet with the butter. Cook until golden on both sides and puffed in the centers, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate and serve hot with syrup or butter and jam.

In a bowl combine pears with 1 cup cranberries and 1/2 cup sugar and toss well to coat the pears. In a medium bowl combine the brown sugar with the cornstarch and the remaining 1/2 cup cranberries and the water and mix well. Pour the pear mixture into a 13 x 9 pan and pour the sugar/cornstarch mixture evenly over the pears. Sprinkle with oats and salt and dot with butter. Bake for 50 minutes at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Let the cranberry crumble cool for 20 minutes before serving. Makes 10 servings. Serve with ice cream or whipped topping for a delicious dessert treat.

In a sauce pan or deep frying pan heat oil to 350 degrees. Place peanuts in a bowl and pour in hot oil. Fry for 2 to 3 minutes until golden brown and remove to a plate. Sprinkle with garlic salt and red pepper flakes and serve warm or at room temperature.

In a large saucepan melt the bacon fat over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until tender. Add the broth, potatoes and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook for 30 minutes. Add the velveeta cheese and sour cream. Cook uncovered until the cheese is melted.

Saute onions with garlic and olive oil until tender. Add thyme and smoked sausage and cook until sausage is done. Add white wine and cook until wine is reduced by half. Add broth and bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer until white beans are tender. Stir in cooked chicken pieces and parsley. Serve hot with crusty bread or rice and a green salad.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the herbs, salt & pepper & cook until the herbs are fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add the eggs to the hot herb mixture & stir until the eggs are just scrambled, about 2-3 minutes. Serve the eggs with warm baguette slices & a sprinkling of the fines herbes.

Saute onions in butter until transparent. Add beef broth. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Add salt, garlic powder to taste. Place french bread cubes into soup bowls. Top with cheeses, swiss and mozzarella. Place bowls on a cookie sheet to catch any spills and put under broiler until cheese is bubbly.

Boil eggs for 6 to 7 minutes. Allow to cool for 15 minutes before halving. Scoop yolks from whites. Add mayonnaise and Dijon mustard to yolks. Add garlic salt and mix well. Fill whites with yolks. Sprinkle with roasted almonds and parsley. Serve.
Stir frozen orange juice concentrate and carbonated lemon-lime beverage into orange sherbet. Pour into a punch bowl and add pineapple juice. Garnish with orange slices and serve.
Wash lemons and oranges. Slice oranges and lemons into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place in blender with ice cubes. Add water and blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and garnish with orange wedges.

In a large skillet, brown the chicken breast and drain. Add the mexican seasoning and mix to coat. Add the rotel and hot water and bring to a boil. Add the bouillon and bring to a boil again. Add the drained black beans and the chopped fresh cilantro. Reduce heat and let simmer for 10 minutes. Add the shredded cheese and sour cream. Serve with tortilla chips.
Brew coffee. Add milk. Pour coffee and milk into blender. Add chocolate syrup and ice. Blend until smooth. Pour into glass.

Combine chicken breasts with italian dressing. Toss to coat. Let stand for at least 30 minutes. In a large bowl combine chicken and oregano. Toss to coat. Transfer to a 9 x 13 x 2 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve immediately.

Cut ham into cubes and place in large casserole dish. Pour soup over ham and add milk and bread crumbs. Cover and bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes. Uncover and bake 15 minutes more or until browned.

In large saucepan over medium heat saute onion and minced garlic in 2 tablespoons of butter for about 2 minutes. Add the chicken and cook about 2 minutes per side until golden and cooked through. Add wine and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 10 minutes until liquid reduces and thickens slightly. Add heavy cream and stirring constantly cook about 2 minutes until hot and thickened slightly. Add chicken back into the sauce and simmer until heated through (about 2 minutes). Cook pasta according to package directions and drain. Return cooked pasta and sauce back into saucepan and mix well to combine. Add chopped parsley and stir until incorporated. Place into a 1-1/2 quart casserole dish and top with grated parmesan cheese. Bake at 425 degrees for about 15 minutes or until cheese is bubbly and golden brown.

Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Stir until well blended. Spread into an 8-inch square baking dish. Press firmly with the back of a spoon. Coverrefrigerate overnight. Cut into 16 bars or squares.

Peel the pears, onions and red bell pepper and chop. Peel the green bell pepper and cut into small squares. Combine all the vegetables in a large bowl. Add the sugar and salt. Toss to coat. Put the relish in a glass jar. Pour the vinegar over the top. Close the jar. Shake the jar to mix the relish. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Serve with your favorite meat or sandwich.

Melt the butter in the bottom of an 11x11 inch pan. Add the onion and the garlic. Saute until soft. Combine the flour and the chicken broth in a bowl. Whisk in the milk. Pour the mixture into the butter mixture. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in the basil. Simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat. Season with salt and pepper. Add the parmesan cheese. Mix until melted. Transfer the sauce into a 2 cup measuring cup. Refrigerate until cold. Transfer the sauce into the refrigerator. Serve cold. Refrigerate leftover sauce. Freeze for up to 2 months.

Put the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook until it turns golden brown, about 8 minutes. Stir occasionally. Meanwhile, put the sugar snap peas in a bowl of ice water. Drain, then dry them on paper towels. Toss the pecans with the butter. In the pan, add the sugar snap peas, pecans, salt and pepper. Mix everything together. Let cool. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. In a small bowl mix together the eggs and milk and beat well. In a small bowl mix together the bread crumbs and butter until crumbs are coated in butter. In a large bowl mix together the bread crumbs and butter until crumbs are coated in butter. Place the bread on the baking sheet. Spread the butter mixture on one half of each slice of bread. Place a slice of cheese on each piece of bread. Make sure the sandwich is lined up with the edge of the baking sheet. Pour the egg mixture over the bread. Flip the sandwiches over so the egg mixture is on the top. Bake for 15 minutes or until the eggs are cooked and the sandwiches are golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 2 quart casserole with vegetable oil cooking spray. Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain and return to casserole. In a large sauce pan, combine Alfredo sauce and 1 1/2 cups cheese. Cook and stir over medium heat until cheese is melted and sauce is hot. Pour sauce over macaroni in casserole. Sprinkle with 1 1/2 cups cheese. Bake uncovered in preheated oven for 20 to 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve with crisp Italian bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel tomatoes. Cut out the stem end of each tomato. Slice tomatoes in half horizontally. Sprinkle each half with salt. Arrange tomato halves cut side up in an ovenproof dish. Bake until tender. Remove from oven. Remove stem ends of onions. Peel onions. Cut onions in half. Remove half of each onion. Set aside. Place remaining onions in a large pot with 1/4 cup water. Bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook onions until tender. Set aside. Clean white bread. Cut bread in half. Butter each half. Spread butter on one side of each bread half. Place bread on a baking sheet. Butter side down. Bake until golden brown. Remove from oven. Cut each bread half diagonally into 2 triangles. Place triangles on a plate. Place one slice of cheese on each piece of bread. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon chives. Top with one tomato half. Top with a slice of on

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and sauté until tender. Stir in garlic until fragrant. Add rice and sauté 2-3 minutes. Add vermouth and stir until rice has absorbed alcohol. Stir in chicken broth and simmer until all liquid is absorbed. Stir in whipping cream and continue to cook until risotto is tender. Fold in parmesan cheese and remove from heat. Serve immediately.

Form beef into small meatballs and place in a 13 x 9-inch glass baking dish. Mix egg and 3/4 cup milk together. Pour over beef. In a separate bowl, combine taco seasoning and 1/2 cup of milk. Pour mixture over beef. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until done.
Mix all ingredients except chives in large bowl. Shape into 2-inch balls. Chill at least 1 hour. Roll in chives.

In a shallow pan add shrimp to beer. Bring to a boil, boil until pink, remove from heat. Strain shrimp. In large bowl combine flour, baking powder, salt, black pepper, shrimp. Stir well to blend. Form into patties. In skillet add 2 tbsp butter heat over medium heat until butter just begins to brown, add patties. Cook for 4 minutes per side. Serve hot.

Combine flour and baking powdercut in margarine until crumbly. Add sugar and eggsstir until well mixed. Combine chocolate and corn syrupheat until melted and blended well. Add vanillastir in chocolate mixture. Add walnuts and stir well. Pour into greased muffin cupsbake at 375 degrees for 18-20 minutes.

In food processor or blender blend the beans until they become a thick paste. Add the lemon juice, salt and black pepper and process again for another 1-2 minutes. With the blender running slowly drizzle the olive oil into the blender with the bean mixture until the consistency is desired. Add garlic cloves if desired.

In a small saucepan, melt butterscotch chips with the butter over low heat, stirring constantly until smooth (do not boil). Remove from heat and stir in chocolate chips until smooth. Pour into a shallow pan lined with waxed paper. Sprinkle with granola cerealpress lightly with the bottom of a heavy spoon or measuring cup. Add walnutspress lightly with the bottom of a heavy spoon or measuring cup. Cover with waxed paperrefrigerate until set. Cut into squares.

Boil potatoes until tender, about 25 minutes. Drain and return potatoes to warm water. Stir in butter and milk. Let potatoes sit for about five minutes. Stir in salt and parsley. Add Manchego cheese and melt over medium heat. Serve immediately.

Combine marinade ingredients in a large zip top plastic baggie. Add mahi mahi and shake to coat fish completely. Refrigerate 24 hours or longer to marinade. Remove fish from marinade and discard marinade. Thread pineapple and bell peppers onto 6 soaked wooden skewers. Dip skewers in olive oil flavored cooking spray. Grill fish 5 to 6 minutes per side or broil 3 to 4 minutes per side or until fish is opaque and flakes easily with fork.

Cut apples into eights. Mix apples with oats, lemon juice, brown sugar, cinnamon and pecans in a baking dish. Pour melted butter over apples. Bake apples at 350 f for 15 minuts or until apples are tender. Serve with ice cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8 x 11-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Stir together the flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, cinnamon and margarine until crumblyset aside. In another large bowl, beat together eggs, cream and vanilla until blendedstir in peaches. Combine dry mixture with peach mixturespoon into baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes or until topping is lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan. Cream together the butter and shortening. Add sugar and mix well. Add eggs one at a time until well blended. Add vanilla and almond extract. Sift together flour and salt. Add flour mixture to butter mixture alternating with milk. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes until lightly browned and springy to the touch. Allow to cool completely before removing from pan.

Combine sugar, cornstarch, water and cinnamon stick. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Add orange juice. Remove from heat. Combine cherry juice with cornstarch. Add to soup mixture. Cook and stir until thick. Pour into bowls. Garnish with cherries.

Prepare chips according to instructions on potato bag (boil then bake). When almost done, add 1 tsp of vinegar and 1/2 tsp of salt and pepper. Sprinkle top of chips with paprika (optional). Serve in cone-shaped napkins or waxed paper cones (orange, blue or green). Serve with curry ketchup (recipe below). Serves about 15.

Preheat oven to 400F. In a bowl mix brownie mix according to directions. In a small bowl mix together cherries, cornstarch and water. In another bowl mix together egg, oil and water. Pour brownie mix into greased 9x13 pan. Pour cherry mixture over brownie mix. Sprinkle chocolate chips on top of the cherry mixture. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 375f. Peel, core and cut pear in half. Drizzle with butter. Sprinkle with 2 teaspoons sugar. Bake for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Combine arugula, parmesan cheese, and walnuts. Arrange on plate. Cut baked pear in half. Top with dressing made from white wine vinegar and 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil. Top with roasted pear halves. Sprinkle with remaining 1 teaspoon sugar. Serve immediately.

Place rice and water in a glass microwaveable bowl. Add butter. Cover and microwave on high for 15-17 minutes or until water is absorbed and rice is tender. Fluff with fork. If desired, add 1/4 teaspoon of salt and stir well. Serve immediately.

Place whipping cream in a large bowl and beat until soft peaks form. Add Kirsch and almond extract and beat until well combined. Melt the chocolate and honey together and add the mixture to the whipping cream. Continue beating until lightly frothy. Serve warm over fresh fruit, strawberries and pound cake.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, saute garlic and basil in butter for about 5 minutes or until fragrant and soft. Add alfredo sauce and heat through. Cook spaghetti according to package directions and drain. Return pan with sauce and butter to medium heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add chicken and pepper and simmer until chicken is cooked through and no pink remains, about 5 minutes. Drain pasta and transfer it to a serving bowl. Top with sauce and chicken and sprinkle with basil leaves before serving. Serve hot or warm with additional basil leaves on top for garnish, if desired.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the green beans and cook for about 5 minutes or until they are tender crisp, stirring occasionally. In a small bowl whisk the egg whites until frothy. Add the walnut pieces and salt & pepper. Remove the green beans from the skillet with a slotted spoon. Place them in a large serving bowl and pour the egg mixture over them. Mix lightly. Garnish with the walnut pieces.

Preheat oven to 450 F. Combine dijon mustard, maple syrup and balsamic vinegar in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Place salmon fillets on baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray. Pour maple-mustard mixture over salmon fillets. Bake for 10 minutes or until salmon flakes apart easily with a fork.
Peel and cut sweet potatoes into thin slices. Toss with honey vinaigrette. Season with salt & pepper. Chill. Top with fresh rosemary. Serve.

Add the dandelion flowers and 8 cups of water to a pot on the stove and bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Once cooled, add the lemons and vanilla bean. Pour into 1/2-gallon sterile bottles and seal. Let cool completely and store in a cool dark place for 2-3 months. After 2-3 months it will be ready for bottling.

Mix together Dijon mustard, black pepper and rosemary in a shallow dish. Pat pork dry with a paper towel and season with salt and pepper. Place pork in dish and turn to coat all sides with seasonings. Refrigerate pork for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place pork in a roasting pan and place pan in oven. Cook uncovered for 45 minutes. Turn pork over and roast for 15 minutes longer. Remove pork and let stand for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

Put dried prunes and apricots in crockpot. Add ginger and brown sugar and sprinkle with cinnamon and honey. Pour light beer over all. Cook on high for 4 hours. In the last 30 minutes of cooking add the roast. Cook on low for 2 to 2 1/2 hours or until the meat is tender. Remove meat from crockpot. Remove prunes and apricots. Place meat on platter and drizzle with pan gravy. Serve with your favorite potato and vegetables.
Pour milk and pudding mix into a large bowl. Mix well. Add the sweetened condensed milk and whipped cream. Fold in vanilla wafers. Refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Serve with strawberries.

Rinse chicken under cold water and pat dry. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste, inside and out. Heat butter and olive oil over medium heat until butter is melted. Add shallot and saute until tender. Add chicken to hot pan. Cook for 10 minutes turning over once halfway through the cooking time. Add wine and lemon slices to the pan and continue cooking for 5 minutes or until chicken is done. Cover pan with aluminum foil to keep warm until ready to serve. Serve with lemon slices on the side and the juice on the table.
Bring water to boil. Add tea bags, stir 10 seconds. Remove from heat. Let steep for 5 minutes. Add sugar, lemon wedge. Add sparkling cider. Mix well. Serve immediately.

Halve the bananas lengthwise. Peel the strawberries. Place the bananas, strawberries, orange juice and lemon juice into a blender. Process until smooth. Stir in the milk. Freeze. Pour into individual bowls. Garnish with a banana slice. Serve.

In medium saucepan heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until softened about 5 minutes. Add crushed red pepper flakes and cook about 1 minute longer. Add crushed tomatoes, oregano and cooked garlic to large saucepan and simmer 15 minutes over low heat. Stir in salt to taste.

Take 100 grams of yeast and dissolve it in 300 ml of warm water with 100 ml of sugar. Leave it to activate for 5 minutes. Mix it with the eggs and 500 g of flour. Knead well. Set it aside for 30 minutes. Divide it into 30 parts. Roll them out to 25 cm circles. Take one part of the dough, place it between your palms and pull it to form a long thin spiral. Roll it over itself and make sure it is tightly twisted to form a long tube. Now cut the tube into 2 cm pieces. Fry them in oil for 5 minutes until golden brown and crispy. Drain them and enjoy!

Follow box directions for white cake mixset aside. In large bowl combine pudding mix and milkstir until blended. Fold in the strawberriesrefrigerate for 45 minutes or until pudding thickens. In separate bowl combine peaches with sugarset aside. In a large glass bowl layer half the cake, pudding mixture, fruit, half the cool whip mixture and half the slivered almondsrepeat layers. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours or until ready to serve. Sprinkle top of trifle with remaining slivered almonds.

Preheat the oven to 400. Spray a 9-inch pie pan with cooking spray. In a bowl mix together the cottage cheese, spinach, tomatoes, eggs, canola oil, garlic salt and black pepper. Pour into the pie pan. Bake at 400 for 35 minutes or until the edges are brown. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Rinse and drain kidney beans. Melt sour cream in microwave. Add salsa. Stir in chili powder, salt, and cumin. Taste for seasoning. Fold in beans. Stir in cheddar cheese. Microwave 1 minute. Stir. Microwave 30 seconds more. Stir. Serve with chives sprinkled on top.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onions and garlic to skilletcook until tender about 3 minutes. Stir in cumincook for 1 minute moreadd beanscook for 2 minutes morestir in red pepper flakescook for 5 minutes more or until beans are heated through. Garnish with chopped cilantro.

Place a large roasting pan on a rack in a 350 degree F. oven. Lightly grease roasting pan with nonstick spray. Salt and pepper beef to taste. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms, onion, garlic powder, and 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Cook 5 minutes. Add 3/4 cup of sliced mushrooms to a baking dish. Add wine to mushrooms in baking dish. Set aside. In a 5-quart saucepan over medium heat, cook 3/4 cup mushrooms with remaining 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms. Add spaghetti sauce. Cook 2 minutes. Add wine. Add beef to mushroom mixture. Cover with lid. Cook 45 minutes or until beef is tender. Add pasta. Cook 5 minutes. Mix cooked pasta with sauce. Top sauce mixture with mushrooms. Serve.

Bring 4 cups cold water to a boil. Stir in pearl tapioca and cook 10 minutes or until tender. Drain and return to pot. Stir in remaining 1 cup of cold water and 1 cup milk. Stir in remaining milk and cream. Bring to boil and cook until thick. Remove from heat. Whisk together remaining 1/4 cup cold water and the sugar until dissolved. Stir into pudding mixture. Stir in lemon juice and zest. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Prepare a 9-inch pie plate with the crusts. In a saute pan, brown the sausage for a few minutes until lightly browned. Stir in the broccoli and rosemary. Cook until the broccoli is tender. Stir in the heavy cream. Set aside to cool. In a large mixing bowl beat the eggs with the cheese blend until combined. Add the broccoli mixture, black pepper and salt. Pour the filling into the prepared crust. Bake for 40-45 minutes. Let cool for about 10 minutes before serving. Serve hot.

Peel the potatoes, onions, bell peppers and cut into 1/2 inch thick slices. Lay them on the foil with the skins facing down. Mix together the barbecue sauce with the tabasco sauce. Drizzle the mixture on top of the sliced potatoes. Roll the foil up into a cylinder shape. Place the foil on a baking sheet. Spray the foil with non-stick cooking spray. Bake for 20 minutes. Unwrap the foil to check on the potatoes. If they're not done yet, wrap them back up for another 5 minutes.
Slice cabbage thinly. Place in bowl with pepper. Dress with vinegar, oil, salt and pepper. Toss well. Serve at room temp.

Mix together first five ingredients for stuffing. Set aside. Preheat oven to 375f. Place chicken breast halves in a 9x13 dish and stuff each half. Lightly dab the tops of the breasts with egg. Dust both sides of each breast half in flour. Melt butter in a large skillet. Dip each breast half in egg and dab in flour again. Dip in egg again and dab in almonds. Place the breasts in the butter and brown them for 2-3 minutes per side. Transfer the breasts to a baking dish. Pour the lemon juice and 1/2 cup water in the skillet and bring to a boil. Cook the stuffing until tender. Add the remaining 1/2 cup water and simmer for 1 minute. Pour the stuffing over the chicken and bake for 15-20 minutes. Serve chicken breasts and stuffing separately.

Rinse cod filletspat dry. Place fillets in a shallow baking dish. In a small bowl, mix sage, salt, pepper. Place fillets in dishsprinkle herb mixture over fillets. Coverbake 20 minutes. Combine sour cream with 1/2 cup cheesespread on fillets. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 10 minutes longer.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a small bowl, mix together sugar and egg. Stir in milk. In a large bowl, combine the dry ingredients. Add egg mixturestir well. Spray a cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Roll dough into 1-inch balls. Place on cookie sheet 2 inches apart. Bake for 9 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 16 cookies.

Cook noodles according to package directions. While noodles are cooking, thaw and drain vegetables if they are frozen. Heat a large skillet over medium heat for cooking chicken breasts. Cook chicken breasts until done to your liking. While cooking the chicken breasts, mix together the butter, half-and-half and ranch dressing mix in a small bowl until combined well. Add the noodles, chicken, vegetables and cheese to the large skillet with the chicken breasts in it. Stir together until the cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Cook macaroni to al dente and drain. Toss with chicken and broccoli. Make the honey mustard dressing by combining all the ingredients. Toss with the macaroni mixture. Serve with lettuce leaves and chopped almonds.

Trim the cabbage and cut into quarters. Slice the apples into wedges. Place the cabbage and apple wedges in a large saucepan. Add the sugar, breadcrumbs, and butter. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover and cook for 40 minutes. Remove from heat and uncover. Add the cinnamon. Stir and serve.

Melt the butter over medium heat in a large skillet. Add the ginger and onions and cook for about five minutes or until tender and transparent. Stir in the soy sauce and the sugar and mix until dissolved. Cook and stir for one minute longer. Remove the mixture from the heat and add the garlic salt and mix well. Set aside and keep warm. Preheat oven to 425f and place the chicken wings on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for about ten minutes until crispy and browned. While the wings are cooking, pour the liquid from the skillet into a small bowl and add the Accent Seasoning and mix well. Remove the wings from the cookie sheet and brush them with the mixture. Place the wings back in the over for two or three minutes until the mixture is bubbling and browned.

Prepare pastry dough according to instructions on package. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). In a large skillet brown beef over medium-high heat until no longer pinkdrain well. In a large saucepan sauté onion in butter until tenderadd beef, mushrooms, beer and stockbring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer until beef is tenderstir in salt and pepper to tastecool. Roll out pastry dough into a 12-inch round on a lightly floured surface. Place pastry in a 9-inch deep-dish pie platetrim edges. Spoon beef mixture into pastrydot with butter. Place pastry edges over beef mixturecrimp edges with a fork to seal. Bake in preheated oven until crust is golden brown, 30 to 35 minutes.

Cook pasta until al dente according to package directions. Drain. In large skillet over medium-high heat, heat oil until shimmering. Add tomatoes, olives, garlic, basil and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes soften, about 4 minutes. Drain. Add tomatoes, olives, garlic, basil and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes soften, about 4 minutes. Drain. Add pasta to skillet with tomatoes. Toss well. Serve immediately.

Mix all ingredients except sour cream. Form into a loaf and place in a lightly greased baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until a thermometer reads 160 degrees. Remove meatloaf from the oven and brush with sour cream. Sprinkle with paprika. Let stand 10 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray an 8x8-inch glass baking dish with cooking spray. In large bowl, combine pumpkin with evaporated milk, eggs, white sugar, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice, salt and cake mix. Stir until well mixed. Spoon mixture into prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with pecans. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until center is set. Cool in pan on wire rack for 1 hour. Serve warm or chilled. Store covered in refrigerator for up to 3 days. Makes about 6 servings.
Wash and cut carrots in half. Combine with brown sugar and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Put in a nonstick pan and cook over medium heat for 10 minutes, stirring often. Serve warm.

Mix flour and beef consomme. Season beef with steak seasoning. Slowly add water to beef mixture. Cook over low heat until thickened. Remove from heat. Thinly slice roast beef. Layer sandwich rolls with meat, cheese and vegetables. Pour consomme over sandwiches. Serve.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Melt the butter in a large pan. Add the leeks and onion. Cook the vegetables on low heat for 5 minutes or until they are soft but not brown. Add the potato and cook for 5 minutes longer. Pour in enough boiling water to cover the potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to the boil and cook until the potatoes are soft. Transfer the potatoes to the bowl of a food processor. Puree the potatoes until smooth. Add the stock and milk. Process until smooth again. Add the cream. Transfer to a heavy pan. Cook on low heat for 5 to 10 minutes. Season with salt and freshly ground pepper.

Brush both sides of bread with 1 tablespoon oil. Layer bread with prosciutto slices and roasted red peppers. Top with provolone and another slice of prosciutto. Brush top with 1 tablespoon of oil. Place sandwiches on a heated panini press or grill pan. Cook until bread is golden and provolone is melted. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400. In large bowl beat butter, brown sugar and egg. Combine flour, ginger, allspice, cinnamon and cloves. Stir into butter mixture. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned.

Slice sausage into small pieces. Add to pan. Add onion to pan. Add tortellini to pan. Pour tomato sauce over everything. Cover pan. Cook on low 10 minutes. Uncover pan. Stir tortellini. Cover pan. Cook on low 10 minutes longer. Serving size is 1.5 cups.

Heat bacon fat in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Peel potatoes and cut into large pieces, about 1 inch wide. Peel onions and cut in half, then in half again lengthwise. Add potatoes and onions to fat in skillet. Cook slowly for 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Remove potatoes from skillet and drain off fat. Sprinkle potatoes with salt and pepper. Set aside. Heat bacon fat again in skillet over medium heat. Stir in cheddar until melted. Stir in potatoes and onions until thoroughly coated with cheddar mixture. Pour mixture into a greased baking dish or casserole dish. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 35 minutes or until golden brown on top. Serve hot with your favorite cornbread or biscuit.

Bring water and olive oil to a boil. Add vanilla and salt. Reduce heat to a simmer. Add rolled oats and stir. Remove from heat. Stir in cornmeal and whole wheat flour. Pour mixture onto waffle iron. Cook according to manufacturer's directions.

Clean mushrooms and cut into bite size pieces. Dice the celery and add to a large bowl with mushrooms. Add lemon juice and oil and toss with a large fork until well combined. Add the remaining ingredients and toss again to coat with the dressing. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving to allow the flavors to blend. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Preheat grill or broiler on high heat. In a medium bowl, mix shrimp with butter, garlic, red chili pepper flakes, mustard and parsley. Grill or broil shrimp for approximately 2 minutes per side or until done. Serve over rice or pasta with additional parsley for garnish.

Beat eggs until frothy. Add sugar and beat until stiff. Add cream. Beat well. Add dark chocolate and beat until smooth. Pour into ice cream maker and process according to manufacturer's instructions. Transfer mixture to a container and freeze until solid. Serve with fresh fruit or berries.

Drain pineapplereserve juice. Slice bananas in half lengthwise. Core each half, then slice crosswise into thin slices. Place bananas in a 3-quart panadd crushed pineapple. Sprinkle with sugarstir to blend. Add reserved pineapple juicestir well. Add pectin. Bring to a full rolling boil over medium heatboil for 1 minute. Remove from heatcool. Stir in vanilla. Ladle into 8-ounce canning jars or other 4-cup jars. Seal. Process 10 minutes in a water bath canner. Makes 8 pints.

Mix water and yeast. Add sugar and mix well. Add flour and mix until mixture comes together. Knead for 6-8 minutes. Place dough into a well-oiled bread pan. Cover and let rise for 1 hour. Punch down and place in fridge. Let rise again. Form into loaf shape and bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Let cool for 15 minutes. Remove from pan and let cool.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place potatoes in greased 2-quart casserole dish. Drizzle butter evenly over potatoessprinkle with flour. Bake 25 minutes or until potatoes are tender when pierced with knife tip. Let cool slightlydrain liquid from potatoes in casserole dish into bowlreserve liquid for another use (see Note). Whisk together potato mixture, milk, sour cream, green onions, salt and pepper in medium saucepan over medium heatcook 10 minutes or until heated through, stirring frequently. Place one-fourth of soup mixture into 6 soup bowlstop each serving with one-fourth of cheese, half of bacon bits, half of chives, and half of potato mixture from saucepan. Repeat layers twice more to serve 6 servings. Serve immediately. If desired, stir in some of the reserved potato liquid before serving to make soup more creamy. The potato liquid can be used to make mashed potatoes or for another use. Note: If you prefer the soup

Put oil into a large heavy pan over a medium heat. Brown the sausages until cooked. Remove from pan. Place potatoes into pan. Add butter and sausages. Add bouillon cube to water. Add water to pan. Cover. Bring to a boil. Add parsley and oregano. Cook for a further five minutes. Add potatoes. Add butter to potatoes. Cook for a further ten minutes. Add more water if necessary. Stir in salt and pepper. Cook for a further five minutes. Serve with parsley.

Mix rolled oats and wheat germ together. Add honey and vanilla extract. Mix in walnuts and sunflower seeds. Stir in the oil. Press down into a 13 x 9 baking dish. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Cut into 1/2 inch squares.

Preheat the oven to 300 degrees f. On a rimmed baking sheet, combine the cashews and the rosemary. Drizzle the oil over the cashews and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake until golden brown and toasted, about 20 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl and toss with the brown sugar and cayennecontinue to toss until the cashews are evenly coated. Serve warm or at room temperature. Store the roasted cashews in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or in the freezer for up to 3 months.

Remove and discard stems and seeds from the chiles. Put in 1 qt water and bring to boil. Remove, cover and let stand until softened, about 45 minutes. Puree the chiles with the rest of the seasonings until smooth. Put the pork in a large pot and add enough water to cover. Add the chile mixture. Add the apple and cook for about 30 minutes or until meat is tender. Drain and remove bones. Chop the pork into small pieces. Add the cream of mushroom soup and mix well. Serve with the potatoes and sauerkraut.

Peel potatoes. Cut into cubes of desired size. Dice eggs into equal pieces. Combine potatoes and eggs in a large bowl. Add enough boiling water to cover potatoes. Let stand for about an hour or until potatoes are tender enough to mash. Mash potatoes using a masher or a fork. Place in a large bowl, cover with a clean dish towel and refrigerate until cool. Drain the water from the potatoes using a colander. Put potatoes in a large bowl again. Dice boiled eggs into small pieces and add to potatoes. Chop green peas into small pieces and add to potatoes as well. In another bowl, mix mayonnaise with lemon juice. Pour the mixture over the potatoes and stir until potatoes are coated with mayonnaise mixture. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes about 3 cups.

In large sauce pan, heat cooking oil and add garlic and chili paste until fragrant and garlic is lightly brown. Add ground black pepper and fresh mint leaves and cook until mint is fragrant and garlic is light brown. Remove from heat and rub lamb with mixture and allow to marinate for at least 1 hour in refrigerator. To grill, preheat grill to high heat and cook lamb over direct heat for about 10 minutes per side or until desired doneness is reached. Let meat rest for about 10 minutes before cutting into slices and serving with your favorite sides and sauce if desired.

Peel and cut yams into bite size pieces. In a large saucepan add yams and enough of the broth to cover the yams. Bring to a boil over medium high heat. Cover and simmer until yams are tender. Drain yams reserving about 1 cup of the cooking liquid. Return yams to the saucepan and add the remaining 2 cups of broth and reserved cooking liquid. Reduce heat and simmer until most of the liquid is absorbed. Add the ginger and cinnamon and stir to blend. Stir in the honey and heat until dissolved. Remove from heat and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Place sweet potatoes in a large baking dish. Drizzle butter and honey over the top. Bake for 40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Meanwhile in a small bowl combine lemon juice and cinnamon. Drizzle this mixture over the potatoes. Serve.

Preheat the grill for medium heat. Peel the garlic. Crush the heads of garlic with the back of a large chef's knife. Remove the rosemary and sage leaves from their stems. Place the head of rosemary and sage on a cutting board and slice horizontally. Chop the leaves into fine pieces. Mince the sage and rosemary. Slice the basil and marjoram and discard the stems. Place all the chopped herbs into a small bowl. In a large bowl whisk together the butter and herbs until well combined. Season with freshly ground black pepper. Serve with grilled meats and fish.

In a saucepan over medium-low heat, combine the chocolate, semisweet chocolate and instant coffee granules. Whisk in the whole milk and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to a low simmer and whisk until the chocolate is dissolved. Whisk in the creme de cacao and vanilla extract. In a chilled mixing bowl whip the heavy cream until stiff peaks form. Fold the heavy cream into the hot chocolate mixture. Pour into chilled martini glasses. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with peppermint candies.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease an 8x8-inch square baking pan. In a medium bowl stir together the graham cracker crumbs, chocolate chips and baking powder. In a small saucepan over medium heat melt the butter. Add the sweetened condensed milk and bring to a boil stirring constantly for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the graham cracker mixture. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool in the pan on a wire rack for 20 minutes. Using a sharp knife cut into bars. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Makes 16 brownies.

Bring 2 cups of water and yellow corn grits to a boil in a large pot over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally. Cook until grits are tender and the liquid has been absorbed. Stir in the pecorino romano and butter. Cook until butter melts and grits are thoroughly combined. Serve immediately.

In small bowl mix mustard and herbs. Sprinkle over salmon. In medium bowl combine breadcrumbs and spices. Coat salmon fillets with breadcrumb mixture. Place fillets on baking sheet. Sprinkle salt and pepper over salmon. Melt butter. Dip fillets in butter and then coat again with breadcrumb mixture. Bake 10 minutes. Reduce heat and bake 8 minutes longer. Sprinkle more parsley over salmon.

Prepare yogurt as directed on package. In small bowl or jar combine yogurt, garlic clove, olive oil, and season with salt and black pepper. Add potatoes to yogurt mixture and toss. Serve immediately with fresh herb leaves.

Bring a large pot of water to boil for the pasta. In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter into the garlic cloves until they are golden brown. Add the mushrooms and the pesto sauce. When the mushrooms are tender, remove the garlic cloves and add the half-and-half, salt, black pepper and the pasta. Cook until the pasta is tender to your liking then serve with grated Parmesan cheese on top.

Place ground beef in a Dutch oven over medium high heat. Cook and stir until browned. Add onion and waterbring to boil. Cover and reduce heatcook 10 minutes. Stir in ketchup and worcestershire sauce. Add salt and hot dogs. Cook 10 minutes longer. Serve with hot dog buns.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place bread crumbs on cookie sheet and bake for 25 minutes until lightly browned. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before coarsely crushing with your fingers into fine crumbs. Place crumbs and butter into small mixing bowl and beat together until smooth. Add sugar and mix well. In a medium bowl, mix together cabbage and seasonings. Spoon butter mixture into a small serving dish and top with cabbage mixture. Serve at room temperature.
Separate the romaine lettuce leaves. Add artichokes & hearts of palm to bowl. In another bowl, whisk together all the dressing ingredients. Toss the vegetables with dressing until coated. Serve warm.

Pound garlic cloves, vinegar, mustard and brown sugar in a small dish until smooth. Place in a large resealable plastic bag along with chicken breast halvesseal bag tightly. Refrigerate overnight (about 8 hours). Discard marinade. Lightly oil grill rack. Grill chicken 15-20 minutes or to an internal temperature of 165f (breast is done when it no longer wiggles when the thickest part is pierced with a knife). Brush chicken breasts lightly with oil and grill for 3 minutes on each side or until browned. Sprinkle chicken evenly with salt, pepper and 1 tsp each of lime juice and lemon juice.

In a large bowl combine the flour, sugar and baking powderadd the milk and butter and mix well. Stir in the berriespour into a greased 9-inch square baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 40 to 45 minutes or until the juices are bubbling and the crust is brown. Serve warm with ice cream.

Boil spaghetti for about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic clove. Cook for about 1 minute. Add shrimp. Cook for 2 minutes. Drain spaghetti. Add spaghetti to skillet with garlic clove. Toss. Add lemon juice. Toss. Add veal. Cook for 3 minutes. Season with red chili pepper. Add fresh parsley. Toss. Serve.
Combine all ingredients in large bowllet marinate at least 1 hour or up to 24 hours. Serve at room temperature with chicken or fish.

Sprinkle chicken with soy sauce, sake, sugar and mirin marinade in a shallow bowl and leave to marinate for 30 minutes to 1 hour before skewering on wooden or metal skewers (bamboo skewers will burn). Grill over a medium-high heat for 2 - 3 minutes on each side until golden brown. Serve with lemon wedges to squeeze over.

In a large soup pot, heat 2 Tbsp. of olive oil over medium heat. Sauté onion and garlic until softened and translucent. Add the butternut squash and cook until tender. Add carrots and celery and sauté until tender. Add ginger, broth and seasonings. Bring soup to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Blend soup in batches. Return blended soup to the pot and heat through. Stir in the sour cream and serve.

Add olive oil to a large saucepan. Add onion and cook over medium heat until onion is soft. Add carrots and cook for 5 minutes. Add ground turkey, thyme, salt and pepper. Cook for 10 minutes until ground turkey is brown. Add flour and cook for 1 minute. Add chicken broth and tomato paste and cook for 10 minutes until broth thickens. Pour mixture over mashed potatoes. Bake for 20 minutes until top is golden brown.

Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil. Add the calamari and cook for 3 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain and pat dry with kitchen paper. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a pan with the garlic clove until hot but not smoking. Add the pepper and cook for 1-2 minutes until tender but still bright green in colour. Add the chicory leaves in small batches, stirring them in with the back of a wooden spoon to wilt them slightly, then transfer them with the peppers to a plate in the fridge. Squeeze over the lime juice and toss with the coriander and basil leaves. Stir in the olive oil, season with salt and pepper. Mix the calamari with the chicory leaves and serve with the dressing on the side.

Prepare noodles according to package directions. Drain. In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, heat 1 teaspoon of the oil. Add the beefcook and stir for 3 to 5 minutes or until browned. Transfer to a large bowl. Stir in the broth and peanut sauceseason with the soy sauce and pepper. Transfer the noodles to the bowl. Add the broccoli and green onions. Toss to combine. Top with the chopped peanuts.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Dip the steaks first in the milk to remove any salt or seasoning that might adhere to the outside of the fish. Dip the steaks in the flour to coat on both sides.
