Dip the floured steaks in the egg and then back into the flour again to coat on both sides. Sprinkle with paprika. Place the floured steaks in the skillet. Cook the steaks for 3 to 5 minutes on each side or until golden brown on both sides. Transfer the steaks to a plate and set aside. Grease a baking dish with cooking spray. Place the parmesan in the prepared baking dish. Place the fish steaks on top of the parmesan. Pour the milk over the fish steaks. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Bake in the preheated oven until the fish steaks flake easily with a fork and the parmesan is melted, about 15 minutes.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Add butter to a large fry pan. Add tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Cook over medium high heat until most of the liquid has evaporated. Add pasta. Toss until coated with butter. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve immediately.

Prepare steaks by coating with olive oil, salt and pepper. Pan broil steaks. Let rest for 5 minutes. Slice steaks and place on platter. Pour sauce over steaks. Sauce can be made by mixing balsamic vinegar and dijon mustard and simmering for 5 minutes. Sauce can be made a day ahead and refrigerated. Simmer for 5 minutes before pouring over steaks.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat. Add the garlic, rosemary and onion and saute until fragrant. Add the stock to the pan, cover the pot and bring to a boil. Turn off the heat. Let stand for a few minutes. Strain the jus through a colander into a bowl. Season the jus to taste. The jus can also be served warm over cooked meats or fish. It is also delicious as a sauce for steamed mussels.

Prepare a pot of boiling salted water. Add a generous handful of chopped garlic. Add curry powder to the oil and cook until fragrant. Add the garlic and the chopped onions. Cook until softened. Add the chopped roma tomato and the chickpeas. Cook until the chickpeas are tender. Add the remaining roma tomato and the chopped broccoli. Cook until tender. Add the ketchup and the broth. Cook until the curry stew is hot and bubbling. Add the Tabasco sauce and salt. Serve with a dollop of plain Greek yogurt.
Heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and celery and saute until translucent. Toss in frozen peas and celery leaves, salt and pepper, stirring frequently until warmed through.

Cook the macaroni according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet saut the onion and tomatoes with olive oil until tender. Stir in the chili powder. Cook for 2 minutes more. Stir in the macaroni mix until coated. Transfer to a casserole dish and sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 375 degrees f for 35 minutes or until bubbly. Serve with a salad of fresh greens or cottage cheese or a fresh vegetable salad.

Heat olive oil and butter in skillet over medium high heat. Saute the onion and zucchini until the onion is translucent. Add garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Add fresh mushrooms and saute until mushrooms are tender. Stir in the spaghetti sauce and bring to a boil. Cook pasta according to package instructions. Drain and add to skillet and stir to combine. Top with shredded mozzarella cheese. Place the skillet under broiler until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Remove the stem end from the jalapeno. Using a sharp paring knife, make an "X" at the top of the jalapeno to remove the seeds and the membranes. Discard the seeds. Cut the jalapeno crosswise into 1/2-inch thick strips. Place the jalapeno strips and onion into a blender or food processor. Add the garlic cloves. Puree until smooth. Add the avocados, lime juice, salt. Blend until smooth. Serve.

Chop broccoli florets. Remove tough stems from floretsdiscard stems. Set broccoli florets aside. Chop basil leaf finely. Clean garlic clovecrush garlic with side of chef's knife. Heat olive oil over medium heat until oil is hot but not smoking. Add pine nutssaute 2 minutes until lightly browned and fragrant. Add garlicsaute 1 minute. Add chopped broccoli floretssaute 2 minutes until broccoli is tender but still crisp. Add parmesan cheesesaute 30 seconds until cheese melts. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heatstir in fresh basil leaf until basil is folded through mixture. Place mixture on plattertop with pine nuts.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Mix together the mashed banana, egg and milk in a large bowl. Add the vegetable oil and white flour and beat well. Stir in the baking soda and baking powder. Fold in the blueberries and pour into muffin tins. Bake for about 20 minutes. Enjoy!
Cut bread in half and toast. Spread mayonnaise and old bay seasoning evenly over both sides of bread. Layer bread, sliced tuna, onion, sliced tomatoes and provolone cheese on each side of sandwich.
Snap off tough ends of asparagus. Toss with asparagus. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar, soy sauce and butter. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Wash and scrub carrots and pat dry. Place carrots in a large bowl. Add the olive oil and toss to coat. Sprinkle carrots with the salt and pepper and toss to coat. Pour the honey over the carrots and toss again. Roast carrots in the oven for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven and toss again. Add the lemon juice and zest to the carrots and toss again. Serve warm.

Melt butter in a large saucepan. Cook ground beef and onion until meat is cooked and onion is tender. Drain grease. Add all other ingrediants and stir. Simmer for 30 minutes. Serve over rice. You can substitute a 15 ounce can of diced tomatoes and green chilies for the green chilies. Serves 6.

In large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat brown ground beef until no longer pink. Drain and add onions to pot. Sauté until onions are soft. Add tomato soup and water to pot. Add rice. Cook until rice is tender. Add cabbage. Stir until well combined. Cover with lid. Place in preheated 325 degree oven for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir in sour cream. Cover with lid again. Return to oven for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir in cheese. Cover again. Place back in oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Stir in parsley. Serve hot.

Cook frozen corn according to package directions (I recommend cooking corn in the microwave). Add butter and corn. Stir in cream cheese. Salt and pepper to taste. Transfer corn mixture to a greased shallow pan and spread evenly with a spoon. Let it cool for about an hour before serving. (Can be made ahead and refrigerated up to several days.)

In a large bowl dissolve yeast with water in a large bowl. Add sugar, salt, flour, egg and oil to yeast mixturebeat well. In a separate large bowl combine milk with 4 teaspoons sugarstir until sugar dissolves. Add milk mixture to yeast mixturebeat well. Transfer to a large bowl coated with cooking spraycover with plastic wrap, and let rise in a warm draft-free area until doubled in size (about 1 hour). Punch down doughturn out onto a lightly greased surfaceknead until smooth and elastic (about 10 minutes). Divide dough into 12 portionsroll each portion into a ballplace in a greased 13- x 9-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Cover with plastic wraplet rise in a warm draft-free area until doubled in size (about 30 minutes). Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet coated with cooking spray over medium heatcook and stir mushrooms until tender (5-8 minutes). Uncover bunsbake at

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl combine pecans, almonds and walnuts. In a small bowl combine maple syrup and oil and mix well. Add to nut mixture and stir to coat. Combine herbs and spices and sprinkle over coated mixture. Toss until all nuts are coated. Place on cookie sheet and bake 20-30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool and store in an air-tight container. Makes 4 cups.

Cook potatoes in boiling water for 30-45 minutes or until tender. Drain water and mash potatoes. Heat a large pan over medium heat with a little bit of cooking oil or butter. Add chopped onions and saut till soft. Add curry paste and cook for 1 minute. Add potatoes and mix well. Stir in coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Cook till sauce thickens and potatoes are tender. Remove from heat and stir in sugar. Add chicken and cook for 2 minutes. Serve over rice. (i didn t have fish sauce so i substituted with a little soy sauce and a little rice vinegar.
Put dates in food processor or blender. Add apple juice and pulse until blended. Add cinnamon. Pour into jar. Store in fridge. Use to drizzle on toast and fruit. Enjoy.

Add the water and honey to the pan and stir to dissolve. Add the lemon juice. Place the ginger into a strainer and press to remove as much liquid as possible. Add to the hot water and bring to boil. Turn the heat to low and add the lemon rind. Add the grated cloves. Stir occasionally and cook until the ginger is soft. Remove the pan from the heat. Stir the cream of tartar into the boiling water and add to the ginger mixture. Stir until it thickens. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a large bowl cream the butter with the brown sugar until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Mix in the granulated sugar and beat until fluffy. Beat in the egg and vanilla extract until well blended. In a separate bowl, combine the flour with the baking soda and salt. Gradually add the flour mixture to the butter mixture until blended. Stir in the chocolate chips (and walnuts if desired) until combined. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until cookies are lightly browned around the edges. Let cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutesthen transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

Heat milk in microwave for 1 1/2 minutes. Stir. Stir in sugar, cocoa powder, cornstarch and salt. Bring to a boil. Stir in egg yolk. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Pour into popsicle molds. Top with chocolate. Freeze for 3 hours.

Preheat oven to 350f. Butter an 8-by-8-inch baking dish. Place cornmeal in a large bowl. Add butter and whisk until butter is dissolved. Add the milk and stir until smooth. Add 1/4 cup shredded cheese. Pour into prepared dish. Bake for 45-55 minutes or until set. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl mix together broccoli and soup. Add salt and pepper to taste. Spread potatoes into the bottom of a 9x13 pan. Layer broccoli mixture over the potatoes. Sprinkle cheese over the top. Bake for 35 minutes or until potatoes and broccoli are tender. Garnish with paprika and garlic powder. Serves 8.

Melt the butter over medium heat and add the onion and garlic. Saute for 3 minutes. Add the celery and cook for another 3 minutes. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the broccoli and cook for about 3 minutes. Add the flour and whisk. Add the milk and cook until thickened. Taste and season with pepper. Add the velveeta cheese and stir until melted.

In large saucepan, cook onions and garlic with oil over medium heat for 10 min. or until soft. Add tomatoescook and stir for about 20 min. or until tomatoes are broken down. Season with pepper and dried red pepper flakes. Stir in chickencook and stir for 8 min. or until chicken is cooked through. Stir in parsleycook and stir for about 1 min. or until wilted. Yield: 6 servings.

Combine the butter with the cracker in a small bowl. Crumble the cracker into the bowl with the butter to make a coarse mixture. Spread the mixture onto a plate or board. Put the cod fillets in a shallow dish or baking pan and drizzle each fillet with butter flavored cracker mixture. Sprinkle fillets with parmesan cheese. Top with oregano, basil and garlic powder to taste. Bake at 375 degrees for about 12-15 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

Prepare your oranges by removing any seeds from the centre of the fruit, cutting into slices about a quarter inch thick and then slice each piece into quarters. Then simply thread a whole clove through each quarter of orange. Place orange slices in a bowl of ground cinnamon or sprinkle a little onto each slice before threading it with a clove. Use a piece of ribbon or string to tie each pomander neatly and then hang on the tree or where you'd like the citrus aroma to be. They are great on the dinner table as well as the tree!

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9-inch square baking dish. Peel apples and cut them into quarters. Place apple quarters in the baking dish and sprinkle with cinnamon and raisins. In a small saucepan, combine the lemon juice and dark brown sugar and bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook for 3 minutes or until the mixture thickens slightly and the cinnamon is dissolved. Pour over apple quarters and let cool. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan over medium-high heat combine the water and cereal and cook until cereal is tender and water is absorbed and thickened slightly (do not boil). Remove from heat and stir in the orange juice. Pour cereal mixture over apple quarters and stir to combine. Bake in preheated oven for about 40 minutes or until the apples are tender and the topping is bubbly and golden. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Hard-Boil Eggs - Place eggs in a large saucepancover with water. Bring to a boil over high heatcover pan and cook for 9 minutes. Draincool under cold running water. Peel eggsdice into small pieces. Combine Eggs with Celery - In a large bowl, combine egg and celeryadd mustard, salt and pepper to taste. Stir in mayonnaisecover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook hash browns according to package directions. Drain and place on baking sheet. In a large saucepan melt butter over medium heat. Add cream of chicken soup and bring to a boil. Pour soup mixture over hash browns. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and corn flakes. Bake for 30 minutes or until hash browns are heated through and topping is melted.
Open package of frozen spinach. Add cream cheese to the spinach. Stir until smooth. Stir in garlic and parmesan cheese. Refrigerate until serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat oven safe fry pan over medium heat. Add orange liqueur to pan. Add mincemeat mixture to pan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook 15 to 20 minutes or until thickened. Spoon mincemeat into prepared tart shells. Sprinkle with fresh orange segments. Bake until crust is golden brown, about 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Cut the top off the loaf. Remove the bread and save. Stir the mayonnaise and garlic together. Layer half the bread pieces in a large bowl. Add the artichoke hearts and half the mayonnaise mixture. Layer the remaining bread pieces. Add the remaining mayonnaise mixture. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Spread the mixture over the bread. Serve.

Cut pork into serving size pieces. Place in a large bowl. In a blender or food processor, mix vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, garlic and water. Pour over meat and stir until pork is evenly coated. Cover and marinate 12-24 hours in the refrigerator. Drain off any excess liquid. In a large fry pan over medium heat, saute pork with cooking oil. Cook until pork is no longer pink. Season with pepper. Sprinkle with chopped green onions. Serve hot.
Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on the hoagie roll. Add slices of roasted turkey breast and deli roasted beef. Top with slices of salami and cheese.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add walnuts and cook until golden brown, about 4 minutes. Add broccoli florets, carrots, snow peas, soy sauce and sesame oilcook until broccoli florets are crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in rice. Arrange tortillas on an ungreased baking sheet. Place 1/4 cup cooked rice mixture in center of each tortillastop evenly with 1/4 cup walnut mixturefold tortillas over filling. Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 10 minutes or until heated through and tortillas are crisp. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Prepare a baking sheet by placing a cooling rack over a sheet of foil. Make the dough. Roll out the dough into a large rectangle. In one corner of the dough, place a strip of sausage. Work your way around the dough, adding more sausage as you go. Keep layering the sausage around the dough. When you get to the end of the dough, top the sausage with a strip of pizza dough. Brush the pizza dough with some melted butter. Sprinkle with five cheese blend. Bake for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. While the monkey bread is baking, prepare the pizza sauce. Place the pizza dough in the pan. Pour about half of the pizza sauce over the dough. Layer the pizza dough with cheese. Cover with remaining pizza sauce. Top with parmesan cheese. Sprinkle the barbecue seasoning over the top. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven. While it's baking, prepare
Dip fish fillets in french dressing. Place on baking sheet. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Top with french-fried onions and parmesan. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.

Cut potatoes into large chunks. Boil potatoes in a large pot until tender. Drain water and set potatoes aside. Heat butter in a large frying pan. Saute celery leaves and onion in butter until tender. Add potatoes and parsley flakes and saute until golden brown. Stir in white flour and parmesan cheese. Stir in 1 cup of milk and 1 cup of water. Bring to a boil and cook for a few minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Mix in 2 more cups of milk and 1 cup water and bring to a boil. Pour into a 2 quart baking dish. Top with 2 cups of cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes.

In a large pot combine first 5 ingredients. Cover and cook on low heat 2 hours or until carrots and celery are tender. Add dried split peas. Add cold water and 2 cups chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered 30 minutes or until split peas are tender. Add remaining 3 cups chicken broth. Simmer uncovered 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Wash ducks. Season with salt & pepper inside & out. Place ducks in roasting pan with neck end up. Sprinkle celery seed over ducks. Pour boiling water over ducks, cover & roast in preheated oven for approx an hour until done (depending on duck size). Let cool & remove skin & meat from bones. Keep ducks warm in a large pot with lid on top. Remove neck & keep in pot. Keep ducks warm until ready to serve. In the mean time heat sauerkraut in a pot with sherry wine until heated through & smooth. If sauerkraut is too thick just thin down with some broth or water. Drain off liquid from ducks & serve ducks with sauerkraut on the side & lemon slices on each side. Serve with rice pilaf & salad.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a large skillet cook corn over medium heat until lightly browned. Cover and cook for 3 minutes. Uncover, stir in green onions. Transfer to a 2-quart baking dish. In the same skillet brown sausage. Drain sausage. Mix sausage, eggs and buttermilk in small bowl. Pour sausage mixture over corn. Top evenly with cheese. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

Remove the skin of the eggplants then cut them in to slices. Heat some oil in a pot then add the onions and cook until they are soft then add the eggplants and the tomato paste and stir until it is well mixed then add the kashk and some water to make it soft add the dried mint then serve in a dish.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Line two muffin cups with paper liners. In a large mixing bowl combine flour, graham cracker crumbs, brown sugar and baking soda. Make a well in the center of the dry mixture and add egg, buttermilk and oil. Mix well. Stir in chocolate chips and marshmallows. Divide batter evenly between the muffin cups. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean. Allow to cool for 10 minutes in the pan before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut squash lengthwise and scoop out the seeds. Place squash halves cut side down on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until tender when pierced with a fork. Meanwhile cook the mushrooms and peppers in hot oil about 5 minutes or until tender. Drain peppers and mushrooms. Cut into thin strips. In a small jar combine the dressing ingredients, shake well and refrigerate. Combine squash, peppers mushrooms, green onions and tomatoes. Serve with dressing to taste.

Cut onion into thick slices and sauté in butter until translucent. In a sauce pan, add the onions and add the steak to the pan. Sprinkle the steaks with salt and pepper. Cook the steaks until medium rare. Remove steaks from pan and add onions to the pan. In a small bowl mix 2 Tablespoons of the beef broth with the red wine and lemon juice. Pour the mixture over the steaks and add the mushrooms. Cover the pan and cook for 15 minutes. Remove the lid and add the sour cream. Stir the sour cream until it is incorporated. Add the rest of the beef broth and stir well. Serve over hot egg noodles.

Spread mayonnaise on one muffin half. Place green onion in mayonnaise in a line across one muffin half. Place a generous amount of crabmeat on muffin half. Place another muffin half on crabmeat to form a sandwich. Top with cheddar cheese and chili powder. Bake at 350f for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with a dipping sauce of mayonnaise and sriracha sauce.

Saute garlic and onions in olive oil until tender. Add in spices and stir to coat. Add diced tomatoes with their juices. Stir in 2 Tbs of tomato paste. Add in tomato sauce and stir until combined. Add salt and pepper to taste. Let cool for 15 minutes. This will thicken up as it cools.

In saucepan combine orange peel, orange juice, dried cranberries and fruit and wine. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Add chicken broth, dried fruit and orange juice mixture. Add cornstarch dissolved in 1/2 cup of cold watercook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until sauce thickens. Stir in green onion. Transfer sauce to serving bowlcool slightly. Cut chicken into serving piecesreturn to saucepan. Heat over medium heatcook for 10 minutes or until heated through. Add orange sauce to panheat through.

Combine flour and baking powder in a large bowl. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in sugar and eggs. Beat in cottage cheese and egg. Add milk and stir until well combined. Spoon batter into a 13x9-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350F for 20 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted into center comes out clean. Spoon fruit preserves over batter. Dot top of casserole with butter. Sprinkle with salt. Bake 10 minutes longer or until golden brown. Serve.

Heat chocolate in a double boiler until melted and smooth. Stir in almond extract. Pour into a 9x13 pan. In a small saucepan on medium-low heat, whisk together the milk, coffee and nutmeg. Keep warm. Meanwhile, whisk 1 cup of the chocolate into the milk. Stir in the remaining chocolate. Pour over the chocolate layer. Refridgerate 2-4 hours. Serves 8.

Mix flour, sun dried tomato, parsley and a pinch of salt in a bowl. In another bowl add low-fat milk and a pinch of salt. Gradually add dry ingredients into the bowl with the wet ones, until a soft dough is formed. Roll the dough onto a lightly greased surface, until it is about 2mm thick. Cut the dough into rounds with a circular cutter (about 5cm diameter). Place onto a lightly greased tray, with 2cm space between each one. Bake at 180 degrees for 15 minutes until golden brown.

Cook peas in chicken stock. In another pot, boil potatoes in water. Drain potatoes and put into the stock with the peas. Melt butter in skillet and saute garlic and onions. Add the flour to the pan and cook for 2 minutes. Slowly add the stock mixture and cook for 5 minutes. Add the parmesan cheese and salt and pepper to taste. Serve the soup with croutons.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Melt butter in the microwave. Line a cookie sheet with foil. Place crackers on the cookie sheet. In a small bowl mix the butter, chocolate chips and walnuts. Using a fork and a spoon spread the butter mixture evenly over the crackers. Bake for 15 minutes. Let cool completely and then remove the foil. Store in an airtight container. These will keep for weeks.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in the beef until brown. Add salsa and stir until combined. In a large bowl combine the remaining ingredients and mix well. Add the beef mixture and stir until combined. Fold in the egg whites. Form meatloaf mixture into two patties and place in an ungreased 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 400f for about 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350f and continue to bake for another 30 minutes. Serves two.

Wash the potatoes, cut into large pieces and steam them until soft for about 20 minutes. Put the potatoes in an ovenproof pot and cook them over medium heat for 10 minutes until tender. Then add the bacon and cook until it is golden brown and crispy. Peel and finely dice the onions and fry them with the bacon for 5 minutes. Add the broth and bring to the boil. Lower the heat and add the potatoes and parsley and cook for 15 minutes more. Add the sage leaves and cook for 1 more minute. Add the olive oil and cook for 1 more minute until the sage leaves are crispy and the potatoes are cooked through. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve warm with warm bread or fresh focaccia bread.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add meat and brown until done. Add seasonings and brown for a few more minutes. Add tomato sauce and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 3-5 minutes until sauce thickens. Serve over buns.

Mix dijon mustard with garlic clove. Brush the lamb rib chops with the mustard mixture. Place in a shallow baking pan. Bake at 500 degrees for 15 minutes. Turn the chops over. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Bake an additional 5 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven. Spoon the balsamic vinegar over the lamb chops. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Garnish with fresh basil.

Press tofu using a tofu press for 15 minutes or until it has released enough liquid for you to get your thumb into the center. Once pressed, place tofu in a large bowl and cut into cubes. In a large bowl, combine the mayonnaise and tofu. Stir in the umeboshi plum paste. Stir in the herbs, garlic and pepper. Pour into a shallow glass bowl or container and refrigerate several hours until the flavors blend. Serve with crackers or vegetables.
Cook bacon and celery together. Cook hamburger and onion together. Mix all together and form into patties and cook until done. Add some tomato soup before serving if desired.

Heat 1 T of olive oil in large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add fries & cook until lightly browned, stirring frequently, about 5 minutes. Stir in soup & bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Cook 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in salsa & cook 1 minute or until heated through stirring constantly. Stir in sour cream & jalapenos & cook 1 minute or until heated through stirring constantly. Top with sliced jalapenos & serve immediately. Serve with tortilla chips if desired.

Spray a large skillet with cooking spray and heat it over medium heat. Add chicken and saute until golden brown on both sides. While chicken is cooking, prepare stuffing mix according to package directions, adding sour cream and soupstir in mushrooms. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside on a platter. Spoon stuffing into skillet and stir well. Simmer for about 1 minute or until thoroughly heated. Spoon onto a platter or onto individual plates and place chicken on top of stuffing mixture. Serve hot or warm with additional sour cream if desired.

Melt butter and add the garlic salt and onion. Cook until onion is soft and translucent. Stir in worcestershire sauce and add the crabmeat. Cook for a couple of minutes and stir in mayonnaise. Then add the brie cheese and stir until the cheese is completely melted. Next stuff the mushrooms with the crab mixture and serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet with cooking spray or line with parchment paper. Sift together the flour and baking powder into a large mixing bowl. Add baking soda and cinnamon and sift together again. In a separate mixing bowl beat the yogurt, honey and vanilla until smooth and creamy. In a separate bowl beat together the sugar and butter until light and creamy in texture. Add in the raisins and stir. Make a well in the center of dry ingredients and pour in yogurt mixture. Stir together until dough is formed and transfer dough onto a lightly floured surface. Knead dough until smooth and elastic in texture (about 1 minute). Roll dough out on a well lightly floured surface into a circle about 12 inches in diameter. Brush with melted butter and sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar (optional). Slice dough into wedges and place wedges onto baking sheet about an inch apart from each other. Brush with melt

Place macadamias and dried pineapple in food processor and pulse until combined into fine crumbs. Place in bowl and add remaining cheese, cream cheese and fresh mint. Set aside. Heat oil in large nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Cook curry powder and onion for 1 minute. Add peas and continue cooking for about 1 minute longer or until softened. Stir in Camembert and pineapple mixture, and cook until Camembert is completely melted and mixture is well combined and bubbling. Spoon into ramekins or small serving dishes and serve immediately.

Brown chicken breasts in oil over medium-high heat until cooked through. Drain and remove from pan. In a saucepan, stir soup, sour cream and milk until smooth and well blended. Add the almonds and bring to a boil. Stir in chicken and cook over a low heat until heated through. Serve over rice and top with cheese and chopped almonds.

Prepare fava beans by removing the ends and discarding. Place in a large pot of water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook until tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain. Add olive oil and garlic. Stir until garlic is fragrant. Stir in spinach and fava beans. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 4 souffle dishes with butter or spray with cooking spray. Combine eggs, half of potato mixture and half of bacon. Stir to combine well. Divide egg mixture evenly between 4 souffle dishes. Top with remaining bacon, cheese and honey. Bake 20-25 minutes or until firm to touch and knife inserted comes out clean.

Combine flour and honey in a bowl. Season with salt. Dip duck breasts into buttermilk and drain. Dip breasts into flour and dredge evenly. Place a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add oil. Place breasts in skillet and cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side or until golden brown. Transfer to a platter and keep warm. Serve with cooked brown rice.
Toast the bread slices lightly. Place the butter on one slice. Lay the cream cheese on top. Spread the dill on top of the cream cheese. Lay the salmon on top. Finish with the other slice of bread.

Trim fat off bacon. Cut into strips. Slice onion. Peel and slice carrot. Cut potato into pieces. Place bacon strips in a single layer on a large cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels. Place 1/2 cup of the bacon fat in a large skillet. Saute onion over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add carrot and cook 5 more minutes. Stir in cream of chicken soup. Cook 5 minutes more. Pour into a slow cooker. Place chicken breasts in the slow cooker. Add 1/2 cup of the bacon fat. Add potatoes. Add garlic. Cover with the Swiss cheese. Cook on low for 4-6 hours. Serve with potatoes and bacon on the side.

Wash and dry chiles. Remove stems and seeds if you choose to remove them. Add cheeses and fill with salsa. Bake in 400 degree oven for about 30 minutes. Serve with sour cream and salsa for dipping and garnish with green onions if you like. This is a great dish to serve with rice and beans as well. Serve with warm tortillas if you like too. This recipe makes 32 chile rellenos. You can use this recipe to make stuffed jalapenos if you like or stuffed bell peppers if you prefer.

Bake egg noodles according to package directions. Drain and keep warm. Meanwhile, cook frozen vegetables in 2 cups water for 6 minutes in a medium saucepan. Drain and set aside. Combine tuna and soup in large bowl. Add noodles. Mix in melted cheese and vegetables. Pour into a 13x9-inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until bubbly. Top with french fried onion rings.

In a large pot, bring 1 quart of the water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the sugar, corn syrup, salt, butter and baking soda. Continue to cook until the mixture reaches 235 degrees F (113 C). Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13-inch pan. Stir in vanilla. Pour the remaining 1 quart of water into a large bowl. Add the peanuts and stir to coat them with the water. Pour the peanuts over the hot sugar mixture. Stir to coat. Let the mixture harden for 30 minutes. Pour onto a greased cookie sheet. Let cool for 1 hour. Break into pieces. Store in a tightly sealed container at room temperature for up to 3 weeks.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cook asparagus in boiling, salted water for 3 minutes. Drain. Set aside. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add green onions, oregano and thyme. Cook about 3 minutes or until tender. Stir in tomatoes. Add asparagus. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in parmesan cheese. Remove from heat. Spoon mixture into a greased 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with pepper. Bake 25 minutes or until hot. Serve.

In a large bowl combine the red wine vinegar, dijon mustard, sea salt, extra virgin olive oil and edamame and stir to combine. In a small bowl toss the red onion, celery and parsley together in a bowl toss in the edamame mixture to coat. Serve at room temperature. This is an awesome appetizer.

Cook peas according to package directions, until al dente. Whisk sour cream with dill weed, chives, curry powder and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Fold into cooked peas. Place salad greens on plates. Top with pea mixture. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 1 day before serving.

Heat a large pan with olive oil and saute asparagus until tender. Meanwhile, prepare curd by combining all ingredients in a large saucepan and bringing to a simmer (over medium heat) stirring constantly for about 5 minutes or until it thickens up into a nice custard like consistency. Remove from heat and set aside to cool a bit before using. When asparagus is ready to serve sprinkle with coarse salt and pepper to taste. Place a generous amount of lemon curd in the middle of each asparagus spear (or serve it on the side). Garnish with a chopped garlic clove and a tiny bit of grated ginger if desired. Enjoy!
Combine skim milk and peanut butter in a bowl. Whisk until peanut butter is dissolved. Stir in cool whip and sugar free instant chocolate pudding mix. Serve with fresh strawberries.

Wash and slice zucchini. Dice onion. Sauté in a large skillet until tender. Add zucchini. Cook until zucchini is tender and most of moisture is evaporated. Stir in mushrooms and tomatoes. Cover and cook for 20-30 minutes. Season with garlic powder and cumin.

Blend eggs, light corn syrup and vanilla together in bowl. Add sugar and butter and beat until fluffy. Add pecans and stir into mixture. Pour into pie shell and bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until center is set and top is browned, about 40 minutes. Serve warm or cold. Serves 8 to 10

Mix all the ingredients except the egg in a large bowl to make the meatballs. Form the meat into small meatballs about the size of a ping-pong ball. Coat a large skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium heat. Cook the meatballs until browned on all sides and heated through (about 10 minutes). In a small bowl mix the egg and water together and add to the meatballs in the skillet. Cook the meatballs for about one more minute and serve immediately with a side of pasta (or rice) and a salad.

Heat a large sauté pan over medium heat and add a glug of oil. When hot, add the figs with a pinch of salt and pepper and cook until they just begin to soften, about 3 minutes. Add the rocket and toss with the figs until wilted and tender, about 1 minute more. Remove from the heat and drizzle with a glug of oil and toss with a pinch of salt and pepper. Divide the figs among plates and top with a slice of gorgonzola and a strip of prosciutto.

Boil tortellini until tender. Drain well. Mix artichoke hearts, tomatoes, olives and broccoli in large bowl with dressing. Add cooked tortellini, sprinkle salami on top of each kabob stickserve with pita bread and tortellini salad.
Mix together thoroughly. Bake at 375 degrees for 20 minutes or until done. Serve hot. This is a great coffee cake to make for your family or friends.

In a small bowl, combine mustard, molasses and vinegar and stir to blend. Pour over salmon and let marinate for 20 minutes. Preheat grill or broiler. Drain salmon and grill or broil 10 to 12 minutes or until desired degree of doneness is reached. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve with steamed broccoli, if desired.

Soften the butter and brown sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Mix with sweetened condensed milk. When the mixture begins to bubble add the golden syrup. Cook until the mixture is very thick and then pour into a tray. After a few minutes of setting, slice into bars. Then add the white chocolate and vanilla to taste. Once combined spread the mixture into a greased pan and let cool. Then cut into squares.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add noodles and return to boil. Cook for 1 minute. Drain and return to pan. Add butter and melt. Add eggs, salt and black pepper. Pour over noodles. Top with parmesan cheese and parsley. Serve.

Combine the meat, onion, parsley and mint and mix well. Shape into 18 small patties or 6 larger ones. Thread the patties onto bamboo skewers and marinate overnight. Preheat your grill or broiler on high heat. Grill or broil kebabs 10-15 minutes until browned on both sides.

Mix pork stuffing mix with 1/4 cup hot water in large bowl. Stir in sausage and next 6 ingredients in bowl until blendedadd remaining hot water and mix well. Stir in tomato sauce and spoon into greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Serves 12-16.

Peel and grate potatoes into a bowl. Squeeze out the excess juice. Add eggs, salt and butter. Mix well. Spread into a baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes or until golden. Let it rest for 10 minutes before serving.

Combine all dry ingredients in a large bowl. Blend in molasses and buttermilk until a sticky batter is formed. Stir in raisins until evenly distributed throughout the batter. Spoon batter into prepared pan and bake for 60-75 minutes or until a tester inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan.
Drain and mash avocado and blend it with remaining ingredients in food processor until smooth and creamy. Serve with vegetable sticks or tortilla chips. Makes about three cups of dip.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt. Cut butter into flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs. Add honey, milk and stir until a dough ball forms. Turn out onto a floured surface. Knead lightly a few times. Shape dough into 2 1/2-inch balls. Place balls 1 1/2-inches apart onto a greased baking sheet. Brush tops of dough with milk. Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until scones are golden brown.

Crack eggs into medium bowl and add vinegar and mustard. Whisk until well blended. Add mayo and whisk again. Add mustard powder and whisk until blended. Add pepper and paprika and whisk again. Refrigerate for at least one hour for flavors to blend together and eggs to set up. Spoon into individual serving cups and garnish with paprika and black pepper.

Melt the butter and sugar together in a saucepan. Add the milk. Bring the mixture to the boil. Take off the heat and pour the mixture into a bowl. Beat the eggs with a little of the hot milk to make a smooth batter. Whisk the cocoa into the remaining milk and add this to the batter. Sift together the flour and the baking powder and the baking soda. Fold the dry ingredients into the batter. Pour the mixture into a greased cake tin and steam for approximately 30 minutes. Allow to cool and then cut into portions.

Season squid pieces with fine salt and capers and then coat in plain flour. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Shallow-fry the squid pieces until golden brown and crispy. Drain and serve immediately. Serves 4.

In a small skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp and browned, 6 to 8 minutesdrain on paper towels. In a medium bowl, beat the egg yolks with 1 tablespoon water until foamybeat in the bacon and the remaining 2 tablespoons water. In another medium bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks formfold into the bacon mixture along with the zucchini and onion. Spray the bottom of a 13x9x2-inch baking dish with cooking sprayset aside. In a medium bowl, toss the pasta with the remaining 1/3 cup water until well blended. Place 2/3 of the pasta into the prepared dishtop with 1/3 of the ricotta mixture and 1/3 of the bacon mixture. Repeat layers two more timescover with aluminum foil and refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight before serving. Top each serving with 1 tablespoon of the chives.

Mix berries with sugar. Put the blueberries into a small bowl. Mix the cornstarch with 2 tablespoons water. Stir into blueberries. Cook over low heat for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Pour into pie shell. Pour the mixture into the prepared pie shell. Cover with top crust. Cut vent into crust. Mix egg with sugar. Brush over crust. Bake for about 20 minutes.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add the mushrooms and cook for about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, combine the silver beet and nutmeg in a large bowl. Add the softened onion and mushrooms and combine. In a separate bowl whisk together the eggs and milk until well combined. Add the milk mixture and the swiss cheese. Place the mixture in a greased pie dish. Bake for approximately 1 hour at 180°C. Serve with a side of mashed potato or rice.

Saute the onions and garlic in vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat for 10 to 15 minutes. Add the rice and stir constantly until the rice begins to turn opaque and to smell toasted. Stir in the seasonings and mix well. Add the tomato sauce and chicken broth. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until the liquid has been absorbed, about 20 minutes. Add additional tomato sauce and chicken broth as needed. You can add additional taco seasoning. It will make the rice spicier. Serve. This is a very simple recipe that I found at zaar. I have added a few additional seasonings. I like it.

In a large soup pot add 1-3/4 cups of water and bring to boil. Add onion flakes and seasonings to water and stir to blend. Add tomato juice and stir until dissolved and seasonings are blended. Add hamburger and cook until hamburger is cooked and water is reduced to 1 cup. Stir in the remaining 1-1/2 cups of water and add the frozen vegetables. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in the rice and cook 2 minutes more until rice is tender and water is absorbed. Stir in the tomatoes and seasonings. Cook 2 minutes more until hamburger is cooked through. Stir in the remaining 1-1/2 cups of water and add the rice. Cook 2 minutes more until rice is tender and water is absorbed. Stir in the tomatoes and seasonings. Cook 2 minutes more until hamburger is cooked through. Serve with sour dough bread or cornbread. Serves 4 to 6 people.

Cook tortillas as you normally would. Crumble tortillas into small pieces. Heat oil in a large skillet. Add corn tortilla pieces. Fry until golden brown. Stir in green chilies. Sprinkle with cumin. Stir in tomato sauce. Fold in eggs. Cook until eggs are set. Top with cheese. Serve with a dollop of sour cream. Serving Size 4

Preheat griddle or frying pan to medium high heat. Beat eggs in large bowl until frothy. Add milk, sugar and saltbeat well. Add flour and baking powderbeat well. Stir in oats. Heat 1/4 cup butter in heavy pan or on griddlepour 1/4 cup batter into pan. Brown on both sides. Serve with maple syrup. Yield: 12 cakes.

Sprinkle salmon fillets on both sides with salt and pepper. Heat garlic oil in a large skillet or grill pan over medium high. Add salmon and cook until just opaque (about 4 minutes per side). Meanwhile, place water and herb cheese in a small skillet. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce to a simmer and cook for about 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Remove from heat and stir in the cherry tomatoes and dill. Serve the salmon with the herb cheese sauce.

Dry roast the almonds at low heat (250 degrees) for 15-20 minutes. Cool and grind to a paste. In a heavy pan add the sugar and whole milk to make a syrup. Add the almond paste and cook till the mixture thickens to a soft ball stage (118 degrees). Now add the ghee and cook for another 5 minutes. Pour into greased tins and let it cool. Remove from tins and cut into squares. Badam burfi is a traditional Indian sweet. The word burfi comes from the Hindi word for candy.

In a large soup pot or Dutch oven heat oil. Add onion and saute over medium-low heat until tender. Add the flour and stir to blend. Add broth. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until thickened. Add the garlic & herb salad dressing mix. Stir until the dressing is dissolved. Add the chicken and beans and cook until heated through. Stir to blend. Top with chopped parsley. Serve with crusty bread.

In a medium saucepan with a lid, bring the chicken broth to a boil. Remove from heat. Add the couscous to the broth. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Add the garlic clove, green onion, cilantro and saffron. Toss to combine. Transfer to a serving dish. Sprinkle with additional cilantro. Serve with a side of roasted garlic butter for dipping.

In a large bowl, whisk together brown sugar and butter. Beat in eggs. Whisk in vanilla extract. In a separate bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt. Stir dry ingredients into brown sugar mixture just until combined. Press into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake in 350 degree oven for 25 minutes. Meanwhile in a small bowl stir together heavy cream and peanut butter. Cool baked crust for 10 minutes. Spread cream mixture evenly on top of warm crust. Refrigerate until completely set. Cut into bars. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 days. Or freeze up to 3 months.

Cream butter, brown sugar together. Place slices of pineapple into the bottom of a 2.5 quart Dutch oven. Pour butter mixture into cake pan. Spoon cake mix on top. Pour oil on top of cake mix. Fill Dutch oven with water up to halfway. Put lid on. Heat on high for 30 minutes or until cake is done. Let cool for 20 minutes. Place serving dish on top of Dutch oven lid. Remove lid. Let cool 20 minutes. Serve.

Bake fish in a dish according to directions on package. Pour mushroom soup into a small saucepan and add onion and lemon juice. Cook on low heat until onions are transparent and soft. Remove from heat and stir in cheese until melted. Pour sauce into baking dish and top fish with sauce and cheese. Bake in oven according to fish package directions.

Bring wine and 1/2 cup water to boil in a medium saucepan. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Add salmon fillets and cook for 6-8 minutes or until salmon is just cooked through (don't overcook). Remove salmon from poaching liquid and cool on a plate. Squeeze lemon juice over salmon and sprinkle with parsley and salt. Serve with lemon slices and sauce poured over top.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 4-cup souffle dish with butter. Mix the sugar and syrup with the butter until smooth. Beat together the egg and the water. Sift together the flour and the baking powder and add to the butter and sugar mixture. Add the egg mixture and beat for about 10 seconds. Pour into the prepared dish and bake until the top is lightly browned and a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean. Makes 4 servings.

Follow directions on package for preparing phyllo pastry. Remove phyllo pastry from package. Cut each sheet into 6 equal squares. Place 4 sheets of phyllo pastry on work surface. Brush each sheet lightly with margarine. Spread 2 tsp. of splenda sugar substitute on one side of 4 sheets of phyllo pastry. Place a peach slice on top. Place another 2 sheets of phyllo pastry on top of the peach. Brush the top 2 sheets with margarine. Spread 1 tsp. of splenda sugar substitute on the top sheet. Place a blueberry on top. Place another 2 sheets of phyllo pastry on top of the blueberry. Brush the top 2 sheets with margarine. Spread 1 tsp. of splenda sugar substitute on the top sheet. Place another 2 sheets of phyllo pastry on top of the blueberry. Brush the top 2 sheets with margarine. Spread 1 tsp. of splenda sugar substitute on the top sheet. Place a blueberry on top. Place the remaining 2 sheets of phyl

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wash zucchini. Cut each lengthwise into 3 inch long spears. In a large bowl combine zucchini spears and 2 TBSP olive oil. Sprinkle on some lemon zest and season to taste with salt and pepper. Drizzle remaining 2 TBSP olive oil on top. Bake in oven for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle tops of zucchini spears generously with grated parmesan cheese. Serve.

Put the sweetened condensed milk in a saucepan and cook over low heat until the chocolate melts and the mixture is smooth (about 20 minutes). Put the peppermint extract and food coloring in a small bowl and stir until the food coloring is thoroughly mixed in with the peppermint extract. Pour the condensed milk mixture into the container of an ice cream maker and freeze according to the manufacturers directions. Once frozen, transfer the mixture to the refrigerator and freeze for at least two hours until it is firm enough to scoop into cones or other ice cream cups (or longer if you like). Serve with mini chocolate chips and additional green food coloring if desired. You can also make this without an ice cream maker by freezing the condensed milk mixture in a freezer safe container or by stirring it over the freezer until it is firm enough to eat with a spoon.

Bring beef stock to a boil in a medium sized sauce pan. Add dried wild mushrooms. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in butter and onion. Simmer uncovered for 5 more minutes. Add cornstarch and salt/white pepper. Mix in sour cream and fresh parsley. Cook 5 minutes more. Serve hot.

Soak dried beans overnight. The next morning, cook beans in large pot of boiling water with 1 cup chicken stock. Reduce heat to low and simmer until tender. About 1 1/2 hours. Drain and reserve cooking liquid. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in large skillet. Add onion and sauté until softened. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant. Add tomato sauce. Cook until warmed through. Add drained beans and reserved liquid. Add carrots and spinach. Cook until spinach is tender. Add thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to serving bowl. Cut andouille sausages into 1 inch pieces. Add to beans. Toss to coat. Serve with toasted bread.

Combine ketchup, honey, soy sauce and garlic in a bowl. Place pork chops in shallow pan. Brush both sides of pork chops evenly with honey mixture. Sprinkle evenly with salt and pepper. Heat grill to medium-high heat. Place pork chops on preheated grill. Cook pork chops until tender, approximately 30-35 minutes. Turn pork chops over halfway through cooking. Serve immediately.

Chop onion and saute in oil until tender. Remove from pan and set aside. Cut chicken into cubes and brown in oil. Remove from pan and set aside. Combine soup with onion and heat until boiling. Place chicken and onion in greased 3 qt casserole and cover with soup mixture. Top with Doritos and Velveeta cheese slices. Bake in preheated 375 oven for 20-25 minutes until heated through and cheese is melted. Serves 8.

Remove wings from the refrigerator and allow them to sit on the counter for an hour before cooking. Place onion and garlic in the bottom of the crock pot. Add wings and other seasonings. Place on high for 6 hours. Serve with honey mustard.

Wrap waffle-shaped french fries in a paper towel. Warm fries in the microwave for 2 to 3 minutes. Sprinkle fries with cheese. Place fries in a 9x13 pan. Add black olives, refried beans, and salsa. Microwave for 3 minutes. Serve topped with sour cream.

Pound chuck steaks to tenderize them a bit. Season with salt & pepper. Melt butter over medium heat. Add steaks & cook for approximately five minutes on each side or until browned & tender. Remove to a plate & drain grease from pan. Add onions to pan & saute for a few minutes. Add tomato ketchup & Worchestershire sauce & cook for a minute or two more. Add the steaks & the juices that have been drained from them to the sauce mixture & cook for approximately five minutes. Add water & lemon juice & cook until desired thickness is reached (I like mine thick). Serve.

Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Place turkey tenderloins into the baking dish. Combine the marmalade, orange juice, and ginger and stir to mix well. Pour over the tenderloins. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake for 10 more minutes or until cooked through. Sprinkle with the worcestershire sauce. Serve with your favorite baked vegetables and gravy.
Combine soup and cheese in a large bowl. Add ham and noodles. Pour mixture into a 13x9 inch baking dish. Top with sour cream and onion and green pepper. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes.
Combine all salad dressing ingredients. Place sliced peaches in large salad bowl. Top with slivered pecans. Pour dressing over salad. Mix gently. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Serve immediately.

Brown chicken in skillet or wok with olive oil or butter over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until brown on one side. Place chicken in a medium sized bowl with all other ingredients except for cornstarch slurry. Stir to coat evenly. Pour chicken mixture into a 2 quart baking dish coated with cooking spray. Stir in cornstarch slurry until thickened slightly. Bake 15 minutes at 350 degrees f. Serve with rice or noodles.

Cut brussels sprouts in half and cut off stems. Saute bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove to paper towel. Add onion and saute until tender. Add brussels sprouts and saute for 3 minutes. Add bacon and caraway seed. Saute for 1 minute. Add salt and freshly ground pepper. Saute for 1 minute. Transfer to serving dish.

Melt chocolate chips in small sauce pan over low heat. Add butter to chocolate and stir until chocolate is smooth. Add corn syrup and vanilla to chocolate mixture and stir until smooth. Add powdered sugar to chocolate mixture and stir until well blended. Add crispy rice cereal and stir until cereal is coated with chocolate mixture. Spread mixture over wax paper to cool. When cooled, break into pieces and roll into balls using hands or small spoon. Roll balls into chopped pecans to coat evenly. Place onto wax paper and refrigerate for 5 minutes. Melt chocolate chips in small sauce pan over low heat. Dip balls into chocolate mixture until covered evenly. Place on wax paper again to cool. Roll in chopped pecans once more to coat evenly. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a skillet heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until translucent, about 2 minutes. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Add beans and salsa and stir until well combined. Pour mixture into slow cooker. Add broth, sausage and cilantro and stir to combine. Cook on low 8 hours. Top with parsley and pepper. Serves 6-8.

In a large bowl, combine the crescent rolls with the sugar, egg and vanilla. Spread the cream cheese evenly over the crescent rolls and sprinkle with cinnamon. Roll up the crescent rolls and place them seam side down in an ungreased 10x15 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until the crescent rolls are golden brown. Makes 24.

Combine water, half-and-half and cheddar cheese in medium saucepan over low heat until cheese is melted. Remove from heat. Add grits to cheese mixture, stirring constantly until grits are well combined and have a creamy texture. Season with white pepper to taste and serve hot. If using a nonstick pan for serving grits, add butter to pan before adding grits. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Slice squash and saute with onion and cumin in oil until softened. Add broth and seasoningsbring to boil. Cook until thickened and flavors have blended. Add yogurt and heat through. Serve hot with cornbread on the side.

Pour 1 cup milk into 1-1/2 quart shallow glass bowladd pudding mix. Beat on low speed with electric mixer until well blended. Gradually beat in remaining milk. Fold in Cool Whip. Spoon mixture into 2 quart casserole dish. In small saucepan, mix brown sugar with water until smooth. Cook over low heat until mixture is caramel colored. Pour caramel syrup over pudding mixture. Cover casserole dish. Chill at least 4 hours. Just before serving, cut apple wedges into 1/4 inch slices. Arrange apple slices on top of pudding. Sprinkle with roasted peanuts and mini marshmallows. Makes about 18 servings.

Mix together all the seasonings and set aside. Grill the steaks on a medium-hot grill for about 4 minutes a side. Remove steaks from grill and let rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving on skewers with your favorite dipping sauce.
Dip pork chops in egg whites and dab in bread crumbs. In a nonstick skillet sauté chops in olive oil for about 4 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Serve with fresh vegetables and/or rice.

Heat the lardons in the oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat until golden. Transfer the lardons with a slotted spoon to a plate. Add the carrots and baby onions to the saucepan and cook until softened. Add the garlic and cook for a further minute. Pour in the stock and bring to a simmer. Add the chicken and thyme and bring back to the boil. Cover the pan and simmer for about an hour and a quarter. Uncover and add the potatoes. Cook for about 10 minutes until tender. Season with pepper. Sprinkle with the parsley and serve with the lardons.

Heat oil in a large skillet. Add onions and saute over medium heat until onions are tender. Add garlic and cook for 2 more minutes. Add flour. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in the cumin seeds. Add tomato sauce. Stir in beets, water and salt. Cover. Simmer for 20 minutes or until beets are tender. Serve over rice.

Combine water and steaks in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender. Drain steaks. Place steaks back into pan. Add mushroom and barbecue sauce. Cook and stir over medium-low heat until thoroughly heated.

Preheat the oven to 400f. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper. Cream the shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the molasses and beat until well combined. Add the egg and beat until well combined. Sift together the flour, baking soda and spices. Gradually add to the shortening mixture and mix until combined. Form the dough into two balls. Roll the balls out into two 1-inch thick rectangles. Cut the rectangles into 3-inch squares. Place the cookies onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks for 2 minutes before removing from baking sheets. Store in an airtight container.

Wash the beans. Peel the garlic clove and chop finely. Crush the ginger root. Heat a pan over medium heat. Add the ghee and the spices. When the spices are fragrant (about 30 seconds), add the beans. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes and 2 cups of water. Bring the water and beans to a boil. Add a little more water if necessary. Once the beans are soft (about 15 minutes), add the coriander and garlic. Cook for another 10 minutes. Turn off the heat and add a little more ginger. Serve hot.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain. Add broccoli and onions to the pan. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the water and milk. Cook for 6 to 8 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Stir in the sausage. Add the seasoning to taste. Heat through. Stir in the butter. Serve with a sprinkling of parmesan cheese.

Toast hamburger buns. Scoop out insides. Spread inside with mayonnaise. Lay a slice of tuna over each hamburger bun. Cut up celery and onion. Place a slice of cheese on top of each tuna slice. Layer with green olives. Sprinkle with pepper. Place lid on each bun and serve.

Mix flour, baking powder and salt together. Add shortening and stir until crumbly. Stir in the sugar. Add the milk slowly to make a stiff batter. Heat a griddle or skillet. Drop about 1/3 cup of batter onto the hot griddle. Cook on both sides until golden brown.

Beat egg well with a hand beater until thick and creamy. Add sugar gradually and beat well. Add vanilla essence and beat well. Brush one side of bread slices with butter and put 1/3 of jam on one of the bread slices and spread with egg mixture to cover bread evenly. Place the other slice on top of the first one. Cut into 6 even slices. Serve with coffee or tea.

Preheat oven to 450f. Line large baking sheet with foil. Spray foil with cooking spray. Arrange zucchini in one layer on foil. Drizzle with 2 teaspoons olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast 30 minutes or until zucchini is tender. Transfer to bowl. In food processor, combine 2 tablespoons olive oil, zucchini, onion, garlic, yogurt and remaining 1 teaspoon olive oil. Process until smooth. Stir in parsley. Season to taste. Spread evenly on baking sheet. Roast 15 minutes or until hot. Serve warm.

Boil macaroni in water in a pot until tender. Drain. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add flour to melted butter, whisking constantly. Gradually add milk to flour mixture. Cook and stir until thickened. Add mustard and cook until thickened. Stir in the macaroni. Add cayenne to taste. Stir in cheese until melted. Serve.

Beat eggs, cream, orange zest in medium bowl until blended. Set aside. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat until bubbles form around edges, swirling occasionally. Pour in egg mixturecook and stir until eggs are almost set, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepperremove from heat. Serve immediately or keep warm on warm plate in 200 degree oven for up to 1 hour.

In a large slow cooker or Dutch oven, place the ham hocks and beans. Add water to cover by 2 inches. Add the onion and garlic powders. Add the beef broth and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and cook on high for 5 hours or low for 10 hours. Serve with rice.

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Add leeks and cook until tender. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Add celery and cook until tender. Add corn and cook until tender. Add soymilk and stir until mixture begins to boil. Stir in shiitake mushrooms. Reduce heat to medium low and cook until shiitake are cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Prepare 24-hour ahead. Into medium bowl, combine cherry preserves, liquid honey, red wine vinegar, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, ground cloves and salt. Stir to blend. Set aside. Remove ham from packaging. Place ham into deep pan. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least 24 hours. In uncovered pan, heat cherry glaze to boiling on medium-high heat. Remove pan from heat. Brush glaze over ham. Let stand 10 minutes. Heat pan to boiling. Cook ham 3-4 minutes on each side. Let stand 5 minutes. Cut ham into 1/2-inch thick slices. Serve with cherry glaze.

Heat water in the microwave. In a small bowl, mix together the milk and yeast. Add the yeast mixture and the oil. Stir well. Add the flour and salt. Mix until the dough forms a ball. Turn the dough onto a floured surface. Knead for about 10 minutes or until the dough is smooth. Cover the dough and let rest for 10 minutes. Pinch the dough into a ball and knead again. Grease a bowl for the dough. Place the dough in the bowl and cover. Let the dough rise until it doubles in size. Roll the dough into a large rectangle. Spread the mozzarella cheese across the rectangle. Sprinkle the parmesan cheese and the peperoni slices across the rectangle. Roll the dough up tightly and slice it into quarters. Lay a pizza crust out flat and roll a pinwheel in the middle of the crust. Place the pinwheel in the baking dish and repeat with the rest of the dough and the cheeses and peperoni. Cover the dough and let rise again. B

Preheat oven to 400. Place tomato slices and red onion on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast until tender, about 20 minutes, turning occasionally. While tomato and onion are roasting, place corn in bowl and add remaining ingredients and toss to coat. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Rinse and pat dry fish fillets. Place in a glass baking dish. Sprinkle each fillet with 1/2 teaspoon of cumin and 1/2 teaspoon of caraway. Rub mixture into fish. Sprinkle with paprika. Place remaining cumin and caraway in a small bowl. Stir in olive oil, lemon juice, tomato puree and garlic. Brush this mixture all over fish. Bake at 325 for 15 minutes. Serve with Arabic bread.

Place potato flakes in a large shallow dish and mix with seasoning salt. Place 1 cracker in each of 6 shallow dishes or pie plates. In a small bowl, beat egg lightly. Dip chicken in egg mixturedrain. Coat chicken in flour mixture. Dip chicken in potato flakes mixture to coat. Fry chicken in hot oil in large skillet on medium heat 10 to 15 minutes or until golden and crisp. Drain on paper towels. Serve with rice.

Slice zucchini into 1/2 inch rounds. Sprinkle both sides with salt and place on a tray that has been lined with a clean cotton dish towel or paper towels. Set aside at room temperature for 15 minutes or so. Meanwhile, prepare the batter. Mix the eggs with 2 tablespoons of water until the eggs are completely blended. Then add the peanut oil and mix until it is smooth. Then add the cornmeal and sugarmix well. When the zucchini is ready to fry, remove from the refrigerator and place into the batter. Coat each zucchini slice completely with the batter. Heat the oil in a deep skillet until it is hot but not smoking (350-360f). Fry the zucchini 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown on both sides. Remove to a paper towel lined tray or pan to drain. Continue the process until all the zucchini slices are coated with batter and fried. Serve immediately with a side of ketchup or hot sauce if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Slice artichokes in half lengthwise. Beat two eggs. Place bread crumbs on shallow dish. Season with salt and pepper. In separate shallow dish mix lemon juice with remaining 1/4 cup oil. Dip each half artichoke into beaten egg. Dip each half into bread crumbs. Place each artichoke half on lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until light brown. Sprinkle each with 1/2 teaspoon lemon-oil mixture. Serve with lemon wedges.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add the bean sprouts and cook for 2 minutes or until tender. Drain the bean sprouts in a colander and set aside. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat the oil. Add the mushrooms and red bell pepper and saute for 3-4 minutes or until the vegetables soften. Add the bean sprouts and cook for 1 minute. Add the soy sauce, garlic powder and white pepper. Remove the skillet from the heat. Add the eggs to the skillet and whisk until the egg white is completely mixed with the vegetables and soy sauce. Cook for 3-4 minutes or until the eggs are lightly cooked. Fold in the scallions and remove the omelet from the skillet and place on a plate. Cover the omelet with plastic wrap and let stand for 5 minutes. Cut the omelet into 4 wedges and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 6-cup souffle dish. Cut whole wheat bread into small cubes and place in a blender. Add eggs and egg whites. Process until smooth and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the remaining bread cubes, nonfat milk and cream cheese. Add to egg mixture and stir. Add spinach and asparagus and stir again. Spoon the mixture into the prepared dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake in the preheated oven for 35 minutes. Sprinkle with the chopped chives and the smoked salmon. Bake for another 5 minutes and serve.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Toss with remaining ingredients. Let stand 30 minutes. Chill. Toss with lettuce.

Mix all of the dry ingredients together. Heat the oil in a fry pan over medium heat. Dip the oysters in the egg and then in the flour mixture. Fry until brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.

In large pot bring mung beans and 4 cups water to boil. Add turmeric and cumin. Cook for 3 minutes. Add remaining 6 cups water. Bring to boil. Cover and reduce heat. Simmer 25 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add salt and ground coriander. Add mustard seeds and fry until golden. Add onions and cook until softened. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add tomatoes and cook until sauce thickens.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl, combine oil and coffee. In a large bowl, combine cake mix and oil mixture. In a separate bowl, combine eggs and brown sugar. Pour egg mixture into cake mix. Fold in coconut and walnuts. Pour batter into a greased and floured 15x10x1 baking pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire rack. Cut into squares and serve warm.

Pour ice and milk into a 9x9 inch dish and let it stand for 5 minutes. Add chocolate ice cream and smooth it out with a spoon. Add chocolate syrup to cover ice cream. Add mint extract and peppermint patties. Put in freezer to firm up and serve.

In a large bowl, toss shrimp with italian dressing and old bay seasoning to coat evenly. Transfer to a large resealable plastic bagadd bay leaf and fresh dill sprig. Close bag securely, squeezing out any airseal bag. Refrigerate 2 hours or up to 1 week. Remove shrimp from bag, discarding bay leaf and fresh dill sprigreserve marinade for another use. Transfer shrimp to a medium bowlgently toss with reserved marinade, about 5 minutes. Heat reserved marinade to a simmer over medium-high heat in a small saucepanreduce heat to lowsimmer 10 minutes. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heatcook shrimp in oil 1 to 2 minutes per side or until donetransfer to a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oilsprinkle with salt to taste. Serve with reserved marinade.

Melt the butter over medium heat in a sauce pan. Stir frequently until the butter is completely melted. Cool the butter to lukewarm temperature. While the butter is cooling combine 2 cups sugar with cocoa powder. Sift the sifted mixture into the cool melted butter. Stir until completely smooth. Whisk together the egg yolks and vanilla and add to the mixture while continuously stirring. Whisk the egg whites until frothy and add to the mixture while continuously stirring until completely blended and smooth. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Frost the top of the cake with a thin layer and then let it set before frosting the top again for a thicker layer. Top with sprinkles or other decorations as desired.

Combine the shredded coconut and sweetened condensed milk in a mixing bowl and stir with a rubber spatula until well blended. Mix in the flour and stir until blended. Drop the dough by small spoonfuls onto the wax paper. (I used a small ice cream scoop) Roll into small balls. Place on the wax paper. Using a toothpick or a small knife, make a small indentation in the middle of the ball. Place miniature M&M Baking Bits in the hole and press down. Place in the refrigerator and chill for 20 minutes or until firm. Place on a sheet of wax paper or a silpat liner on a cookie sheet. Bake in the preheated 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven for 15 to 18 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on the cookie sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a cooling rack.
Melt sugar in large pan. When melted, remove from heat. Stir in marshmallow cream and chips. Pour into greased pan. Sprinkle with pecans. Cool. Cut into squares. Refrigerate if desired.

Brown beef over medium heat with oil until brown and crisp. Transfer to a large casserole dish and set aside. Saute the bell pepper and onions in the same pan and set aside. Stir in the stock and bring to a boil and reduce until the liquid is reduced by half. Add the browned meat and vegetables and heat through. Stir in the tomatoes and thyme and add salt and pepper to taste. Bake for 45 minutes and serve with rice or mashed potatoes.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add oil. Saut garlic until golden. Stir in livers, mushrooms and bacon. Cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes. Add stock and wine. Cook for 10 minutes or until tender. Add balsamic vinegar. Cook for 1 minute. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Mix the oil and vinegar together in a large bowl and toss with the meat and onions. Place in an oven proof dish and cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle the meat with the tamari and brown sugar and cook for 10 minutes more or until the meat is done to your liking. Sprinkle with pepper before serving.

Heat oil in large saucepan. Saute the onion, leek, celery, zucchini, capsicum, pumpkin until soft. Add the tomatoes with the liquid. Add the spices. Simmer for 20 minutes. If the sauce becomes too thick add a little water. If it is too thin add more tomato paste. You may need some more water. Stir in the parsley.

Sprinkle chicken breast with seasoning. Place in center of each piece of foil and add carrot and onion and sprinkle with seasoning. Fold foil to enclose and seal the packet. Place packet on grill over medium high heat and cook for 12 to 14 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center. Remove from grill and allow to rest for 2 to 3 minutes before serving. Serve with mayonnaise and lemon slices and basil leaves.

Melt butter over medium-high heat in skillet. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Gradually add evaporated milk while stirring constantly. Increase heat to medium-high and bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until sauce thickens, about 3 minutes. Add cheese and stir until melted. Season sauce with salt and pepper. Serve pasta tossed in sauce topped with parsley.

Boil rice in enough water to cover until tender. Drain well. Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add peppers, garlic and seasoning to butter. Stir often until peppers are tender. Add rice to peppers. Serve hot with chicken.

Preheat a grill. Drizzle with Italian dressing. Grill the eggplants over high heat until grill marks appear on all sides. Place the roll on a cutting board and remove the outer casing. Wrap the bottom half of each roll with a slice of the grilled eggplant. Place a slice of tomato and a slice of mozzarella on each roll. Wrap and serve.

In a large saucepan, combine sugar and corn syrup over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Add butter and continue cooking until mixture begins to boil and butter melts. Remove from heat and add nuts and vanilla. Stir nuts into caramel mixture until well coated and remove to wax paper to cool. Stir in nuts until well coated and remove to wax paper to cool. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week or freeze for up to 3 months. Makes 1 pound of brittle.

Melt butter in pan. Add garlic and mushrooms to pan and fry until golden brown (approx. 4 mins). Remove mushrooms from pan. Toast ciabatta bread in toaster until lightly golden brown (approx. 5 mins). Place butter, ketjap manis, salt and pepper in pan and fry until fragrant (approx. 2 mins). Place mushrooms and butter mixture on bread. Sprinkle with chives. Serve immediately.

Saute onion in olive oil in skillet over medium heat for 3-5 minutes until soft. Add broccoli floretscook until crisp-tender. Stir in chicken broth. Bring to boilingcook 3 minutes. Stir in orzo. Cover. Cook 3 minutes or until orzo is tender. Stir in salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Serve immediately. Serving Idea: Serve with baked chicken.
Mix all together and serve over rice.

To make the marinade, place all the marinade ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Add the meat and combine. Leave in refrigerator overnight or for a minimum of 8 hours. Preheat barbecue or grill. Brush meat with marinade. Grill until cooked through.

In a small bowl mix together all the marinade ingredients. Place pork chops into a glass baking dish. Pour marinade over pork. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Grill pork chops over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes. Turn over to brown evenly. Remove from grill. Slice pork chops. Serve hot with steamed rice. Enjoy!

Melt butter in saute pan over medium heat. Add shallot and garlic cloves, saute until softened. Stir in fresh lemon juice, salt and pepper. Cook until butter is golden brown. Add shrimp to pan and saute until shrimp is pink. Place shrimp on plates. Top shrimp with sauce from pan. Sprinkle parsley on top of sauce and garnish with lemon wedge. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Brush shrimp with sherry mixture. Grill shrimp over hot coals. Cook shrimp 2 to 3 minutes per side. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients in blender. Blend until smooth.

Cut beets into quarters. Place in a large pot. Cover beets with water. Bring water to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour. Drain beets. Cut beets into quarters and remove greens. Toss greens with garlic and water. Cover and cook until greens are tender. Drain greens and toss with beets and remaining garlic. Season with salt and lime. Serve.

Clean fishpat dry. Combine coriander, onions, salt and pepper. Brush fish with half of coriander mixture. Place trout in 12 x 17 baking pan. Spread remaining coriander mixture over fish. Place lemon slices over fish. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Serve fish on lemon slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut bread into small pieces. Spread bread in ungreased 13 x 9 baking dish. Top with broccoli. In a large bowl, combine eggs, milk, butter, sugar and seasonings. Pour over broccoli and bread. Bake for 30 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Serve with a small amount of topping if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In small mixing bowl, combine strawberries, 1 tablespoon sugar and 1/4 teaspoon ground pepper. Set aside. Place remaining sugar and 1/4 teaspoon ground pepper on rimmed baking sheet. Set aside. In heavy 4-quart saucepan, melt 1/3 cup butter over medium heat. Cook until foaming begins. Add strawberry mixture and cook until bubbly and slightly thickened, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and cool completely. In medium bowl, beat vanilla ice cream and remaining 1/4 cup brown sugar until softened. In separate medium bowl, beat remaining 1/4 cup butter until light and fluffy. Gradually beat in cooled strawberry mixture. Spoon ice cream into 4 dessert bowls. Top with 1/4 cup brown sugar mixture. Top with vanilla wafers.
Blend milk and pudding mix in blender for 2 minutes. Add ice cream and blend another minute or two. Pour into two glasses. Top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with pumpkin pie spice. Serves 2.
