Saute sausage in large saucepan over medium heat until browneddrain well. Add oil and garlic and saute 2 minutes. Add onion and tomatoes (with juice) and saute 5 minutes longer or until onion is tender. Stir in pepper flakes and pasta and heat through. Sprinkle mozzarella evenly over pastatop evenly with parmesan cheese and parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Stir in flour and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Gradually stir in milk and curry powder and seasonings and cook for 3-5 minutes or until thickened and bubbly. Stir in 2 cups shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes or until shrimp are done. Transfer mixture to 2 1/2 quart baking dish and top with cooked rice and 1 cup breadcrumbs. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle remaining 1/2 cup breadcrumbs over and return to oven for 5 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly. Serve with remaining shrimp.

Preheat oven to 350f. In large sauce pan or skillet, brown carrot and celery ribs with 1/4 cup of the vegetable oil over medium heat for 5 minutes or until softened. Transfer vegetables to colander to drain. Wipe out pan or skillet and heat remaining vegetable oil over medium heat for 1 minute or until hot. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more or until fragrant, stirring frequently. Add carrot and celery ribs and zucchini and cook 1 minute longer or until zucchini is just softened. Stir in lentils and cook 2 minutes longer or until lentils are heated through. Stir in ground sirloin and cook 2 minutes longer or until meat is just heated through. In medium bowl, stir together eggs, ketchup and worcestershire sauce. Add to lentil mixture and stir until well combined. Transfer to a 9x5 loaf pan coated with nonstick cooking spray. Cover loosely with foil and bake for 50 minutes or until meatloaf is no longer p

In a large bowl or container, combine vinegar, olive oil, and seasonings. Stir well with a fork until fully combined. Add tomato, beans, onion, cucumber, and bread slices to vinegar mixture. Toss well until all ingredients are well coated. Season with additional salt and pepper if desired. Serve chilled or at room temperature on a bed of arugula if desired. Garnish with basil leaves before serving.

Hard boil eggs in a pot of water for 8 minutesdrainpeelhalve eggs lengthwise. In a small bowl mix together mayonnaise, sour cream, curry powder and cayenne pepper. Fill each half of the eggs with the mixture and top with chutney. Sprinkle eggs with paprika before serving.
Bring water to boil. Add sugar and potato starch. Continue boiling for 5-10 minutes. Remove from heat. Add cranberries. Stir well. Serve hot.

In a large bowl whisk together sweetened condensed milk, cocoa powder and the low-fat milk. Whisk in vanilla extract. Pour mixture into popsicle molds. Place in freezer for 2 hours or until firm. Enjoy.

In a large skillet over medium heat, combine olive oil, onion, garlic cloves and diced tomatoes. Cook 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add lemon juice and brown sugar to mixture. Cook 1 minute longer, stirring frequently. Stir in oregano and salt & pepper to taste. Place chicken thighs in sauce mixture. Cover and simmer 20 minutes or until chicken is tender. Add kalamata olives during last 5 minutes of cooking time. Serve over rice or noodles.

Season beef steaks with salt and pepper and pan-fry until browned. Set aside. Place broth and water in a large saucepan and bring to a boil. Add noodles and cook according to package directions. Add steaks and cook for 3 minutes. Remove steaks from pan and slice. Stir in the vinegar and the soy sauce. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the ginger and garlic. Cook for 30 seconds. Stir in the frozen vegetables and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the steaks and cook for 1 minute. Add the noodles back into the pan and cook for 1 minute. Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with green onion.
Melt butter in a saucepan. Add oil. Sauté garlic. Add water. Bring to a boil. Add asparagus. Cook until tender. Add balsamic vinegar. Stir in tofu. Add thyme. Simmer until heated through. Serve.
Wash potatoes. Cut in half. Dip in milk. Dip in egg. Roll in seasoned bread crumbs. Place in pan with 1/2" of oil. Fry until golden brown. Remove to paper towels. Serve with hot sauce.

Cut puff pastry into 20 triangles. Mix brown sugar, cinnamon and pecan pieces. Place 1 tbsp brown sugar mixture in the center of the triangle of puff pastry. Fold over the dough to make a triangle. Pinch the edges of the pastry to seal the ends of the triangle, leaving the opening exposed for filling. Place the triangle on the baking sheet. Brush the open end of the triangle with egg yolk to help the cookie rise while baking. Bake for about 10 minutes until the puff pastry is puffed and golden brown. Let the cookies cool for about 5 minutes before serving. Makes 20 cookies.

Combine the yeast and 1 cup of the flour in a large bowl. Stir in the warm water. Stir in the remaining flour until dough forms. Turn dough out onto a floured board. Knead until smooth. Transfer to a greased bowl. Cover with a damp cloth. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk. Punch dough down. Divide the dough in half. Roll each half out on a lightly greased surface until it is about 10 inches long by 4 inches wide. Roll up each piece of dough, starting at one end. Pinch the ends to seal. Place rolls on a greased cookie sheet. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk. Bake in a preheated 375 degree oven for 12 minutes. Let cool. Remove the bread from the pan. Melt the white chocolate in the microwave. Dip the cooled bread into the chocolate. Place back on cookie sheet. Sprinkle with nonpareils. Let dry. Refrigerate. Yields 2 breads.

Combine the peanut butter, light corn syrup and sugar in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and add the butter. Stir until the butter is melted and the mixture is smooth. Stir in the corn flakes and rice krispies until they are coated. Pour the mixture into a 9 x 13 pan. Spread evenly and sprinkle with the chocolate frosting. Let the bars set for 1 hour. Then cut into bars. Yield 2 dozen bars.

Grill steaks over medium heat, approximately 3 minutes on each side. Remove steaks from grill and let rest for at least 5 minutes. Place steaks on plates and top with fresh rosemary and garlic salt. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with black pepper and cayenne pepper. Serve with tomatoes and kaiser rolls on the side.

Drain beans and put them in a food processor along with the pesto and lime juice. Blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside. Using a paring knife, make two slits in the top of the baguette. Spread beans on baguette and top with cheese. Broil until cheese melts. Serve immediately.

Cook tortellini according to package directions. Drain. Mix tortellini and peas in a bowl. Stir in soup. Add milk and cooked chicken. Stir in vegetables. Chill until ready to serve. To serve, sprinkle each serving with shredded cheese.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease an 8x4x2 1/2 loaf pan or a 9x5x3 loaf pan. In a large bowl cream together the oil and sugar until well mixed and sugar is dissolved. Add in the baking soda and soured milk and beat until well mixed. Add in the flour and salt and beat until well mixed and there are no lumps. Add in the bananas and walnuts and mix together until well combined. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 55-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes before turning out of the pan onto the wire rack and cool completely before cutting into pieces and serving.

In a pan over medium heat, sauté 2 cloves of minced garlic in 1/4 cup of olive oil. When the garlic becomes golden brown add a few dashes of vodka. Allow to cook for 30 seconds. Add 1 can of diced tomatoes with juice. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons of fish bouillon. Add 2 cups of heavy cream. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons of minced tarragon. Bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer. Add 1 cup of dry penne pasta. Cook until tender. Remove from heat. Add 1/4 cup of butter. Add 1/4 cup of Parmesan cheese. Stir until blended. Serve.

Cut the vidalia onions into thin rings. Combine water and honey. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add onions to liquid. Cook covered for 20 minutes. Uncovered for 20 minutes. Place butter and spices into liquid. Cook covered for 10 minutes. Uncovered for 15 minutes. Stir before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut English muffin halves in half again (4 squares). Spread half of the sour cream on each of the 8 squares of muffin. Layer asparagus on one half of each square of muffin. Layer ham on top of asparagus. Sprinkle with onion pieces. Layer half of the cheese on top of ham. Sprinkle with dijon mustard and black pepper. Top with remaining cheese and square of muffin on top. Bake for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Wash and cut collard greens into 3 inch pieces. Place in large pot of water with 1 tbsp salt. Cook until tender (about 20 minutes). Drain well. In separate large pot of water, bring to a boil 2-3 pork neck bones. Add greens and cook for 20-25 minutes. Add onions and garlic to greens and continue cooking for 10 minutes longer. Add chicken broth and pepperoncini peppers. Simmer for 30 minutes. Add water if necessary to keep greens covered by liquid. When greens are tender add juice from pepperoncini peppers. Serve with vinegar or lemon juice.

Melt margarine in large saucepanstir in flour until well blended. Gradually add milk, stirring constantly. Bring to boilcook and stir for 2 minutes. Remove from heatstir in cooked turkey and peas. Spoon into lightly greased 1-1/2 quart casserolesprinkle with salt and pimiento. Bake at 350° for 20-30 minutes or until heated through.

In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk and cream cheese until well blended. Stir in vanilla and spices. Coat croissants with butter and place in baking pan. Pour egg mixture into pan over croissants. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30-40 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with fresh berry sauce.

Peel and core green chilies. Slice and remove stems. Cut into 1/2 inch wide rings. Cook eggs in large skillet over medium heat until whites are set and yolks are still runny. Drain. Place 1/2 cup of eggs in a greased 15x10x1 inch jellyroll pan. Place a layer of green chilies around eggs. Top with remaining eggs. Sprinkle garlic powder and pepper over eggs. Sprinkle cheese over eggs. Bake at 350 F for 20 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting. Serves 24.

Preheat the oven to 300 degrees. Mix the brown rice flour, almonds, cinnamon and salt in a large bowl. Mix in the maple syrup and oil. Then mix in the applesauce. Add the jam and mix until thoroughly blended. Place the dough on a cookie sheet. Bake at 300 degrees for about 20-25 minutes. Cool slightly before removing from the cookie sheet.

Melt the butter and saute the garlic and onion over low heat until soft. Add the can of whole tomato with liquid and the baking soda and sugar to the skillet and simmer over medium heat until it thickens. Add the basil and red pepper flakes if desired.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and transfer to a large bowl. Toss pasta with the remaining ingredients. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In a large skillet cook asparagus in olive oil for 5 minutes or until tender. Remove and set aside. In a large pot of boiling water cook pasta for 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl combine pasta and asparagus. Mix in goat cheese and lemon peel. Add salt and pepper and toss with parmesan cheese. Serve hot.

Fold a sheet of phyllo pastry in half and then half again so that you have four layers. Place four layers side by side on your serving dish. Place the second sheet of phyllo pastry over the first sheet. Repeat the folding process with the remaining sheets of phyllo pastry to create eight layers on the dish. Repeat with the remaining phyllo pastry sheets to create another eight layers on the dish. Place the remaining spinach on top of the phyllo pastry and season with the olive oil, onion, salt and pepper. Sprinkle the feta cheese over the spinach and add the eggs on top of the feta cheese. Fold the ends of the phyllo pastry over the eggs and use the butter to seal the phyllo pastry together. Place the baking dish into the oven for about 40 to 45 minutes or until the top of the phyllo pastry begins to turn golden brown.
Combine soy sauce brown sugar. Add sesame oil. Rub mixture over short ribs. Grill ribs for 25 to 30 mins. until tender. Serve with lettuce leaf and sticky rice. Add a dollop of red miso.

Rub kasseri with salt. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add salt-rubbed kasseri to pan. Cook 4 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Remove from pan. Sprinkle with oregano. Place kasseri in a bowl. Add the ouzo to the pan used for frying. Slowly pour the ouzo over the kasseri. Serve with pita bread and tomatoes. Serve with pita bread and tomatoes.
Preheat a large skillet and sautee brussels sprouts and carrots in the skillet until tender. Stir in butter and lemon peel. Add dijon mustard and salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Cut pork into 3/4 inch cubes. In 12 inch skillet brown pork over medium heat 5 to 7 minutes or until browneddrain. In same skillet brown green pepper over medium heat 4 to 5 minutes or until tenderdrain. In 1 1/2 qt saucepan heat oil over medium heatadd onion and green peppercook 5 minutes or until tenderdrain. In 3 qt saucepan brown potatoes over medium heat 7 to 10 minutes or until tenderdrain. In same skillet brown pork over medium heat 3 to 5 minutesdrain. In same saucepan brown green pepper over medium heat 4 to 5 minutes or until tenderdrain. In same skillet brown potatoes over medium heat 7 to 10 minutes or until tenderdrain. In same skillet brown pork over medium heat 3 to 5 minutesdrain. In same saucepan brown green pepper over medium heat 4 to 5 minutes or until tenderdrain. In same skillet brown potatoes over medium heat

Mix together the margarine, peanut butter, graham wafer crumbs, sweetener, chocolate chips in a food processor until thoroughly combined. Add soymilkprocess until thoroughly combined. Place a small amount of mixture into each paper cup (about 1/3 cup). Top with chopped nuts if desired. Place in freezer until solid, 2 hours or overnight.

Combine all marinade ingredients in a plastic bag or a large bowl. Add chicken. Marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Thread chicken on 15 skewers. Grill on a lightly oiled grill or broil on a lightly oiled broiler pan. Grill or broil 6 to 8 minutes or until done. Serve with warm naan or flat bread. Serve warm or cold.

Peel and cube the potatoes and cut the courgette and aubergine into thick slices. Toss together and add the tomatoes. Drizzle over the stock cube and season with salt and pepper. Bake for about 30 minutes or until the potato and courgette are tender and golden on top and the aubergine is softened through. Scatter the chives over the top of the vegetables and sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake for a further 10 minutes until the cheese has melted and the vegetables are golden on top. Serve hot.

Melt the butter and stir in the sour cream. Stir in ketchup and tomato paste. Season with the mustard and pepper. Stir in the Tabasco and worcestershire. Mix in the grated cheeses. Melt in the oven at 200f for about 4 minutes. Serve with steaks or veal.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute the sausage until cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Meanwhile, cook the pasta according to package directions until al dente, drain well in a colander and rinse under cold running water. Set aside until ready to use. Reduce the heat under the sausage skillet to medium-low. Stir the saffron into the cream and add it to the skillet along with the drained pasta. Cook until the sauce thickens and the pasta is tender, about 10 minutes. Season the sauce with salt and pepper and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Garnish with fresh parsley if desired and serve immediately. Serves 4-6.

Cut biscuits in half. Mix brown sugar with heavy cream. Spoon half the cream mixture into a 9 by 13 inch baking dish. Top with half of the biscuit halves. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Spoon remaining cream mixture over biscuits. Top with remaining biscuit halves. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown. Serve warm.

Put chickpeas in blender and add water to cover by 1 inch. Blend until chickpeas are liquefied. Add remaining ingredients except parsley and blend until smooth. Add parsley and blend until smooth and well combined. Serve with pita chips. You can add salt to taste at the end if needed.

In a large bowl combine all dry ingredients. Make a well in center of flour mixture. Place warm water in well. Add yeast and sugar. Stir with finger. Gradually add flour to form soft dough. Knead dough on floured surface until smooth and elastic. Place in greased bowl. Turn dough to coat with oil. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled in size. Punch dough down. Divide into four equal pieces. Shape each piece into ball. Place dough balls on greased baking sheet. Cover with damp towel and let rise until doubled in size. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Brush each dough ball with olive oil. Combine all remaining ingredients in small bowl. Stir to blend. Spread herb mixture evenly over dough. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Line a 9x9 in (23x23 cm) baking dish with foil. Melt the butter in the microwave. In a large bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, coconut, butterscotch chips, chocolate chips and condensed milk. Press half of the mixture into the baking dish. Top with the rest of the mixture. Press the walnuts into the mixture. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool. Cut into 1 1/2 in (4 cm) squares.

In a large heavy skillet, saute the onion over medium heat for about 10-12 min or until softened. Stir in the garlic, curry powder, red wine, tomato paste and cook for about another minute or two. Add the lamb mixture and saute for about another minute or two. Stir in the cumin and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Wash the black beans, put them into a pot with water and cook for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain the beans and set aside. Meanwhile, cut the onions, bell peppers and garlic clove into 1/2-inch-thick slicespeel the garlic clove if necessary. Place them in a Dutch oven along with a can of diced tomatoes (or 2 1/2 cups of tomato juice), 3 cups of water, oregano and salt. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Add the black beans to the tomatoes/vegetables mixture, and stir to combine. Simmer for 15 minutes or until the beans are tenderadd more water if necessary to prevent sticking. Taste to determine if more salt is needed. Serve with rice if you like.

Slice zucchini in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds & discard. Place zucchini halves on greased cookie sheet. Slice onion & place in halves. Slice tomatoes & place on top. Sprinkle with parsley & season with salt & pepper. Drizzle with butter & sprinkle with salt & pepper. Bake at 375 for about 20 minutes or until zucchini is tender & apples are soft. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Slice zucchini, potatoes, peppers, and onion and place them on a large baking sheet. Drizzle olive oil and balsamic vinegar generously on vegetables and sprinkle garlic on top. Bake for 45 minutes or until vegetables are browned and tender. Serve!
Slice zucchini into rounds. Salt and pepper. Drizzle with oil. Mix. Season with thyme and tomatoes. Cook pasta. Mix zucchini and pasta. Add parmesan. Toss to combine.

Heat butter in a skillet. Cook pork chops to desired doneness. Place pork in a baking dish. Add corn and potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with minced garlic. Bake until potatoes are tender. Serve.

In a small sauce pan over medium heat heat 1/3 cup of olive oil and garlic clove, until garlic is fragrant and slightly golden. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. Meanwhile, cut an onion in half and slice into thin rings. In a small bowl whisk together olive oil and 1/4 cup of olive oil, sugar, rosemary and coarse sea salt and set aside to combine. On a lightly floured surface roll out pizza dough until about 1/2 inch thick and then cut into 12 rounds. Place one round on a baking sheet and spread with one quarter of onion slices and then drizzle with rosemary oil mixture. Place in preheated oven and bake for 15 minutes until golden brown and puffed up. Repeat until all pizza dough is finished. Serve warm.

Put frozen mixed vegetables and mushroom beef gravy into crock pot. Add frozen corn and tomatoes. Add meatballs. Pour water into crockpot. Sprinkle dried basil and garlic powder over everything. Cook on low for 6 hours. Turn crockpot on high for the last 30 minutes. Garnish with mozzarella cheese before serving.

In a skillet over medium heat, add olive oil and chicken and brown on all sides. Meanwhile, heat broth and add to pan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add cashews and garlic and cook for about 1 more minute. Stir in sour cream and dijon mustard and cook for another minute or so to combine. Remove chicken and put on serving platter. Stir in red bell pepper and snow peas and cook for about 1 more minute and remove from heat. Serve chicken over vegetables. Garnish with chopped green onions if desired. Serve over rice for a complete meal.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cook fusilli according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, saute onions and garlic in 1 tablespoon oil until tender. Add chicken and saute until golden brown and cooked through. Add spinach and cook until wiltedremove from heat and set aside. In a small saucepan, bring remaining oil to a simmerwhisk in cream and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and whisk in flour to form a rouxcook for 1 minute. Add chicken mixture to roux along with 1 cup of cheesecook until sauce thickens, about 1 minute. Stir in remaining cheese until meltedset aside. To assemble, cook pasta in boiling water for 8 minutesdrain and toss with chicken mixture and remaining sauce. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and serve immediately.

Beat together the eggs, breadcrumbs and cheese. Dip the cutlets in the mixture and then fry them in hot oil (375f) for 2 minutes on each side. Drain on paper towels and serve with a side of tartar sauce.

Put carrots into a large pot of cold water and bring to boil over medium heat. Cook until tender. Drain in a colander and run cold water over the carrots to stop the cooking process. Drain and let cool to room temperature. Add 2 teaspoons of the oil, the ginger and honey to the carrots and mix well. Add the lemon and orange juice and mix well. Stir in the remaining oil and then the carrot mixture with the rest of the raisins and the walnuts and ginger and mix well. In a small bowl mix the sour cream and salt and add to the carrot mixture and stir until blended. Serve chilled. Refrigerate in a covered container if making ahead of time.
Sauté onions and green beans in olive oil. Add water and vinegar and bring to a boil. Simmer until tender. Serve over rice.

Heat water to boiling. Stir bouillon cube into water. Place textured vegetable protein in 8X8 baking dish. Pour hot water over top of textured vegetable protein. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes, or until softened. Drain water from textured vegetable protein. Stir mashed potatoes into textured vegetable protein. Form mixture into 12 pieces. Roll each piece of textured vegetable protein mixture into baked potato chips. Place 8 pieces of textured vegetable protein mixture on parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Place 4 pieces of textured vegetable protein mixture into freezer-safe container, and freeze until firm. Thaw in refrigerator for 20 minutes before serving. Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.
Spread pizza sauce evenly over each pizza crust. Cover with pizza cheese. Sprinkle with pizza crusts. Broil until cheese melts. Serve with pizza dipping sticks.

Bring 2 cups water to a boil. Add 4 to 6 pieces of fresh ginger and 1 teaspoon of cayenne pepper. Bring to a boil and immediately remove from heat and allow to steep for 5 minutes. Strain ginger out and add sweetener of choice and serve. This tea is great for upset stomachs and is also very good for colds. The ginger helps to loosen congestion and the sweetener helps to soothe the throat. Drink 3 to 4 times daily or as needed until symptoms are gone and the tea has been consumed for at least 4 days.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a small bowl, mix together the oil, vinegar and herbs and spices. Place vegetables in a roasting pan and toss with oil mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste and roast for 40-45 minutes until vegetables are tender and carrots are cooked through.

Mix cookie mix according to package directions for cookies. Roll balls of dough into small balls. Roll balls into peanut butter. Place balls on wax paper and press 1 star cookie cutter into each ball. Bake at 350 for 9 minutes. Allow to cool. Melt 1/2 c. semisweet chocolate and 1/2 c. peanut butter. Drizzle chocolate over cooled cookies.

Brew coffee and add 3 tbsp of hot water. Add unsweetened cocoa and cinnamon stick and stir until dissolved and then add sugar and stir again until dissolved. Stir in remaining hot water and stir in heavy cream and milk. Serve hot in cups with whipped cream.
Brown pork sausage with onions. Drain fat. Add the flour to the drippings. Add milk gradually until a thick gravy consistency is reached. Add sage, hot sauce, nutmeg, seasoning and salt. Serve.

Boil potatoes and sweet potatoes in separate pots. Drain. Add butter and milk. Mash potatoes and sweet potatoes together. Add salt and nutmeg. Mix well. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and sour cream. Serve warm.

In a large pot, add water, 3 large pieces of chopped ginger (about 2 ounces total), 4 tea bags of green tea, 1/2 cup of sugar (or to your liking), 3 lemons. Heat on medium-high. Bring to a boil. Let boil for 1 minute. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover. Let simmer for 30 minutes. Remove tea bags. Let cool. Remove the 3 lemons. Using a strainer, pour the tea through a strainer into a pitcher. Add the sugar. Stir to combine. Let cool. In a blender, puree the remaining 1/2 lemon. Add to the tea mixture. Stir. Add the lemon balm. Stir. Chill. Pour into glasses.

In medium mixing bowl, combine flax seed meal, whole wheat pastry flour, baking powder, salt, and sugarblend well. In separate bowl, mix milk, egg, egg whites, and vanilla extractblend well. Make a well in center of dry mixturepour wet mixture into well. Beat until combined with a spoondo not over beat batter. Heat nonstick skillet over medium heatcoat with cooking spray. Drop 1/4 cup batter onto hot skilletcook 2 minutes until setturn over with spatulacook 2 minutes until set. Serve with maple syrup. Makes 18 pancakes.

Peel potatoes. Cut into 1 inch pieces. Place in pot with enough water to cover the potatoes. Bring to boil over medium heat. Cover pot tightly. Cook until potatoes are tender when pierced with the tip of a knife. Drain potatoes. Combine potatoes with apples. In medium bowl combine mustard and olive oil. Add mustard mixture to potato mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Add 2 cups of the sauerkraut. Add cooked bacon. Fold in remaining sauerkraut. Arrange in buttered casserole dish. Top with green onion. Bake at 350f for 30-45 minutes or until apples are soft.

Place polenta in a large saucepan. Stir in boiling water. Simmer over medium heat for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add margarine and stir until blended. Pour onto a large cookie sheet or baking pan. Cool until set. Cut into squares. Sprinkle with herbs and salt. Store in an airtight container.

Combine rice and boiling water. Bring mixture to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in salt, lime juice and zest. Serve with lemon herb butter. Butter shallow bowl. Squeeze lime juice into bowl. Sprinkle with salt. Cut lime zest into small pieces. Press lime zest into salt. Stir mixture. Add rice and mix well.

In a large bowl combine flour, milk, chicken broth and mustardmix well. Add chickenstir until well coated. Pour into a greased 13-by-9-inch baking dishtop with broccoli, corn flakes and Parmesan cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until heated through, about 20 minutes. Serve with additional cheese sprinkled on topgarnish with parsley.
Mix all of the ingredients together in a bowl. Roll into small balls and leave in a cool place. The sweets will keep for several days in an airtight container in a cool place.

Preheat oven to 350-degrees. Grease a 10 x 15-inch baking dish. Cream the margarine and sugar in a bowl until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Add the vanilla, liqueur, lemon zest and salt. Mix well. Combine the flour and baking powder. Add to the batter. Stir in the milk to make a batter that is a bit loose. Pour into the prepared dish. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes or until golden brown. Cool. Cut into squares to serve.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease a 9x13 baking dish with butter. In a medium mixing bowl combine butter with 2 tablespoons lemon juicereserve remaining 1/4 cup juice for later use. Add artichoke hearts to butter mixturestir until artichokes are coated with butter mixture. Place artichokes in prepared baking dishsprinkle with seasoned stuffing mix. Pour remaining butter mixture over artichokes in baking dishtop with fish fillets. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes or until fish is cooked through and crumbs are golden brown. Serve with reserved 1/4 cup juice on side for dipping fish fillets.

Cook chicken in 1 inch of water. Add green chilies and 1 cup of the broth to pan and cook chicken for 20 minutes. Add cream of mushroom soup and cream of chicken soup to pan. Cook for 2 minutes more. Pour mixture into a 13 x 9 baking dish or 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with tortillas. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Bring a large saucepan of water to boil. Add the green beans and cook until just tender about 3 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook until softened. Add the beans to the skillet along with the peppers. Cook until the onions begin to turn golden and the peppers are softened. Stir in the lemon juice and lemon zest and season with salt and pepper to taste.

In a small bowl, mix vinaigrette with 3/4 cup of water. Toss with lettuce greens, tomatoes and red onions. Spoon onto four 6-inch hot dog bunstop each with half of a boneless, skinless chicken breast. Spread mayonnaise over cut side of bread, then top with pesto.

Cut pineapple into small cubes. Squeeze the pineapple in a cheesecloth or a large piece of muslin over a bowl until all the pineapple liquid is extracted. Add the skim milk, pineapple juice and coconut extract to the muslin in the bowl. Stir in rum flavoring and artificial sweetener. Serve over crushed ice with a pineapple wedge garnish.

Place bottom round roast into crock pot. Sprinkle roast with dry red wine and kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Add onion and carrot to pot. In a small bowl mix worcestershire sauce and dijon mustard. Pour mixture over roast. Cover and cook on low setting for 6 to 8 hours. Remove roast from crock pot and place onto a cutting board. Allow to rest for 20 minutes. Thinly slice roast and serve.

Put artichoke hearts into small glass bowl. Add sour cream to artichokes. Add to artichokes, the rest of the ingredients. Mix well. Chill for 1 hour before serving. Serve with raw vegetables or raw crackers.
In a saucepan heat ghee. Add mushrooms and sauté. Add water and bring to a boil. Add rice. Stir in spices. Continue to stir and cook for about five minutes or until rice is done.

Mix together pork and beef in a bowlseason with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Divide mixture into four equal portionsform each portion into a ball. Place in a shallow dishcover and refrigerate at least one hour to firm up. Roll each ball in a pie shell. Beat egg whites to stiff peaksgarnish with parsley. Bake at 350f 20-30 min or until set.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain meat completely. Stir in water, hamburger helper mix for beef pasta, dried basil, salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil stirring frequently. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until pasta is tender. Meanwhile, prepare vegetables according to package directions. Stir vegetables into beef mixture. Cover and simmer for 3 minutes or until heated through. Stir in diced tomatoes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley just before serving. Makes 3 to 4 servings.

Remove the mango's skin and cut it in half. Scoop out the flesh and place it in a large glass pitcher. Add cold water and lime juice. Mix well. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Serve over ice with a slice of lime and a sprig of mint.

In a large bowl combine whole wheat flour, water, extra virgin olive oil. Mix until a dough forms. Add flax seeds. Knead dough for 10 minutes. Place dough on a floured surface. Roll dough out to about 1/4-inch thickness. Place dough on a non-stick baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove bread from oven. Cool slightly before cutting.

Preheat the oven at 350F. In a bowl combine all the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, beat butter and sugar together for 1 minute. Add eggs and beat until combined. Add dry ingredients and beat until combined. Fold in sour cream. Pour into a greased 9x5x3 loaf pan and bake for 30 minutes. Let cool in pan for 15 minutes then transfer to a wire rack for an additional 20 minutes before slicing.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold water. While pasta cooks, prepare chicken in a large skillet. Heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and chicken. Cook for 5 minutes or until done. Add tomatoes, broccoli and Italian dressing. Cook for 5 minutes. Add cooked pasta. Sprinkle with mozzarella and parmesan cheeses. Toss. Serve.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, saut bacon until crisp. Add 3 cups of chicken broth and bring to a boil. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in grits slowly. Return to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook covered 5-6 minutes or until tender. Stir in chiles and cheese. Bring to a boil stirring often. Cook uncovered 1 minute more or until cheese melts. Serve immediately with grated cheddar cheese if desired.

Brush flounder fillets with lemon juice. Drizzle each fillet with olive oil. Sprinkle with tarragon and dried parsley. Place fillets in a shallow baking dish. Bake at 375 degrees for about 20 minutes. Pour sour cream and chives over fish and sprinkle with parsley.

Remove crust from bread. Brush lightly with olive oil. Sprinkle with oregano and garlic powder. Add provolone and tomatoes to fillings and top with more provolone if desired. Place tomato and provolone side by side on bread. Place bread with filling on grill (or broiler) for 1-2 minutes on each side till bread is toasted and filling is warm and melted. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cream together margarine and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and saltstir into creamed mixture just until blended. Stir in coconut and nuts. Shape dough into balls about 1 1/2 inches wide. Roll balls in coconut. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until set. Cool for 2 minutesremove from cookie sheet. Dip the tops into the sweetened condensed milk until the cookie is covered with the milk, then dip into the nuts. Arrange cookies on waxed paper to cool completely.

Wash blackberries and place in blender or food processor. Add sugar and coffee. Blend to a smooth purée. Pour into pitcher. Add half-and-half to taste. Add water to thin if necessary. Serve over ice. Garnish with whole blackberries.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Peel kabocha squash, remove seeds. Cut squash into cubes. Place in baking dish, drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Roast squash for 30 minutes. While squash is cooking, in small saucepan over medium heat, saute onion until translucent. Add garlic cloves and cook for 1 minute. Add spinach leaves. Cook until spinach is wilted. Transfer mixture to blender. Add 2 cups of squash liquid. Blend until smooth. Transfer to soup pot. Add water. Bring to simmer. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with crusty bread.

In a large saucepan, heat oil. Add garlic, onion and tomatoes. Cook over moderate heat for 5 minutes. Add all the bell peppers. Cook over moderate heat for 5 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Cook over moderate heat until vegetables are soft. Remove from heat. Stir in cilantro and parsley. Let cool. Serve with crackers.

In skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Sprinkle pork chops with salt and pepper. Place pork chops in pansaute 1 minute per side. Remove chops from pan. In saucepan combine all other ingredientsheat over medium heat until bubblyremove from heatstir in pork chopsplace chops in pan with saucecoverbake at 350f. for 20 minutesuncoverbake 5-10 minutes more until tender. Serve over rice.

Cook the beans in a pot of boiling salted water until just tender about 20 minutes drain. Transfer the beans to a blender or food processor and process until smooth. Add the broth and 2 teaspoons of the cumin and cayenne to the beans in a medium-size saucepan over medium heatbring to a simmer. Stir in the half and half and sour creamcook until heated through. Transfer to a bowl and stir in the scallions.
Combine boiling water with jello. Stir until jello dissolves. Cool jello mixture. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Chill. Serve.

Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper, and cook them in a large pan of hot oil until brown on both sides. Remove from the pan with a slotted spoon and let them drain on paper towel for at least 5 minutes. Whisk together the mustard and cayenne. Set aside. Remove the skin from each thigh with your fingers (or a kitchen shears) and discard it. Place thighs in a large bowl and cut into quarters. Mash the thighs with a fork to break them down even more. Put the mixture back into the bowl. Stir in the reserved mustard mixture and gently mix with your hands so that it coats each piece of chicken evenly. Divide between 6 serving plates and garnish with chopped parsley if desired. Serve with your favourite dipping sauces!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease and flour two 9x5-inch loaf pans. In large bowl, combine cake mix, poppy seeds, orange juice, oil and eggs until well blended. Pour into prepared pans. Bake for 1 hour. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pans. Cool on wire rack.

Melt butter in heavy large skillet. Stir in sugaradd pecans. Cook over moderately low heat, stirring constantly, 2 minutes or until pecans are toasted and mixture starts to darken. Stir in graham crackers. Stir in vanilla. Transfer to shallow pan. Cool. Break pecan mixture into pieces. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350F. Butter a 10-inch skillet or cast iron pan. In a large bowl whisk eggs with granulated sugar and flour until smooth. Whisk in half-and-half and set aside. Cut pears in half lengthwise. Combine pears with the remaining cranberries. Place pears in the prepared skillet. In a medium saucepan heat 1/4 cup of the butter and 1 tablespoon of the granulated sugar over medium-low heat until the butter melts. Whisk in the remaining 1/4 cup of granulated sugar and bring to a boil. Pour the syrup over the pears. Spoon the half-and-half mixture over the pears. Place a circle of parchment paper over the pears. Spoon the reserved egg mixture on top of the pears. Sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon of granulated sugar and cinnamon. Bake until the pears are tender and the top is puffed and golden, 45 to 55 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Serve warm.name

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease a 9x13 baking dish. Place the cake mix in a large bowl. Combine the sweetened condensed milk, cream of coconut and cherry pie filling. Stir into the cake mix. Pour into the prepared pan. Bake for 35 minutes. Spread whipped topping evenly over cake. Sprinkle with chopped walnuts. Let cool for 10 minutes then cut into bars.

Saute onions and beef until meat is no longer pink. Drain. Add relish and cook 5 more minutes. Stir cornstarch into 1/4 cup water. Add to meat mixture. Stir until thickened. Add seasonings and sugar and stir. Spoon into crescents and bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until lightly browned.

Preheat the broiler. Brush the cut sides of the eggplant with the oil. Place the eggplant, cut sides down, on a broiler pan. Broil for about 15 minutes or until the skin is blackened. Transfer the eggplant to a plate. Let cool for a few minutes. Peel the eggplant. Place the peeled eggplant in a large mixing bowl. Add the garlic, lemon juice, feta cheese, parsley and cilantro. Stir until well blended. Serve.
Place chicken on a broiler pan. Pour French dressing over chicken. Sprinkle onion soup mix over chicken. Pour cranberry sauce over chicken. Broil for 10 minutes.

Combine all dry ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Cut in grapeseed oil until mixture is crumbly. Stir in vanilla extract and agave nectar and set aside. Peel and slice peaches into thin wedges and place in a greased baking dish or casserole dish (I used a casserole dish and just set it on top of a piece of wax paper). Combine the lemon juice and water and pour over fruit and stir gently. Pour the dry mixture over the fruit and stir until evenly distributed. Bake at 350 until the fruit is tender and the top is browned and bubbly, about 40 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

In 4-qt. Dutch oven, heat milk over low heat until very warm but not hot (115-120 degrees F). Meanwhile, break up crackers into pieces and place into liquid. Stir until crackers are completely broken up. Add sugar. Stir again. Add vanilla and coconut. Cook over low heat about 15 minutes, stirring frequently. When thickened, remove from heat. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat the oven to 250 degrees. Lay out your fritos in an even layer on an aluminum foil covered cookie sheet. Pour the granulated sugar evenly over the fritos. Pour the white corn syrup over the fritos. Then, put the peanut butter in the microwave and heat until it is soft. Spoon the softened peanut butter over the fritos. You will also want to press it into the fritos. Place the cookie sheet in the preheated oven and cook for 45 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool. You can keep them in an air-tight container in the fridge for up to one week.
Dissolve orange jell-o in boiling water according to package directions. Add juice and vanilla ice cream. Refrigerate until set. Serve in individual cups.

Combine yeast and water and let rest for 5 minutes. In large mixing bowl add whole wheat flour and olive oil and mix. Stir yeast mixture into flour and mix until dough forms and pulls away from sides of bowl. Knead dough 10 minutes in large mixing bowl. Add honey and eggs and mix well. Add salt and knead for an additional 5-10 minutes. Let rise 1 hour covered with towel. Bake at 450f for 20 minutes until brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine all-purpose flour, monterey jack cheese, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add buttermilk and beat with an electric mixer on low speed 10 seconds. Beat in eggs. Beat on low speed about 20 seconds. Stir in melted butter. Turn onto a floured surface. Knead gently 6 times. Shape into a 9-inch circle. Place circle onto a greased baking sheet. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes. Remove from baking sheet to a wire rack and cool completely. Serve warm.

Cut off kernels from ear of corn and place in a bowl. Slice off tops of pepper and remove seeds and membranes, then slice into strips and add to corn. In medium bowl or jar, combine butter with honey and lime rind and stir until blended. Pour butter mixture over corn mixture and toss until corn is evenly coated. Grill corn on barbeque or grill pan, turning occasionally until corn is tender and kernels have puffed open and are charred in spots (about 10 minutes). Sprinkle with salt to taste and serve with squeezed lime wedges over top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cut bell peppers in half lengthwise. Remove the core and seeds. Mix breadcrumbs, crabmeat, celery, green onion, garlic and cayenne pepper. Spoon mixture evenly into bell peppers. Place in a casserole dish. Pour margarine over stuffed peppers. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 25 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the chopped garlic and cook until fragrant but not browned. Add the chicken breasts to the pan. Cook until golden brown. Add the chili sauce and bring to a boil. Add the tomatoes and green chilies with their juices and simmer until the chicken is cooked. Add the tomato sauce. Simmer until the sauce thickens slightly. Add the beans. Bring back to a boil. Add the onion. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add the corn. Cook until the corn is soft. Serve with rice.

Combine 3 tablespoons of coconut milk in a small bowl with the red curry paste. Whisk in creamy peanut butter until well combined. Set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until golden brown. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add curry mixture and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the chicken and cook until cooked through. Add remaining coconut milk. Stir in sugar. Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in fish sauce. Stir in cornstarch mixture until smooth. Serve.
Beat cream cheese until smooth. Add whipping cream and icing sugar. Stir until well combined. Add vanilla extract and blend. Serve with fresh fruit.

Heat olive oil in large frying pan. Saute red bell peppers and onions for 1-2 minutes. Stir in corn kernels and saute for 10 minutes over low heat until corn is tender and lightly golden. Add 1/2 teaspoon chili powder and fresh cilantro and cook for 1 minute more stirring constantly. Serve hot as side dish or as topping for tacos, burritos, enchiladas, pizza and pasta.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Boil potatoes until tender (about 15 to 20 minutes). Drain potatoes, reserving 1 cup cooking liquid. Let potatoes cool until they can be handled. Cut each potato in half lengthwise. Remove and discard peel. Slice each potato half into 1/4 inch thick rounds. Place in a single layer in a baking dish. Place butter into a small saucepan over medium high heat. Cook butter until melted and foamy. Add garlic and rosemary. Cook until garlic is fragrant. Stir in milk and cook until milk is heated through. Pour milk mixture over potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle potatoes with remaining rosemary. Bake in preheated oven until potatoes are tender and lightly browned (about 45 minutes).

Combine butter and sugar in bowl of electric mixer. Cream until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add flour, baking powder and baking soda and beat again until just combined. Fold in cinnamon and vanilla. Form 2 1/2-inch balls of dough. On a lightly floured surface, roll each ball to 12-inch circle. Place 1 tablespoon dried cherries in center of each circle. Fold dough over cherries to form half-circle. Pinch ends closed to seal. Place 1/2 teaspoon almond slivers on each sealed half circle. Place cookies on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 9-10 minutes until edges of cookies are lightly golden. Let cookies cool on sheet about 5 minutes before removing to wire rack.

In large bowl combine all meatloaf ingredients except cheese. Mix well with hands until meat is evenly distributed throughout mixture. Form mixture into 2 patties with hands to make 2 inch thick patties. Place patties in greased 11 x 7 baking dish. Top with ham and broccoli. Sprinkle with cheese and bake in preheated oven for 1 1/2 hours or until done. Let cool 5 minutes before serving.

Rinse turkey. Place turkey breast between two pieces of plastic wrap. Pound gently with mallet or rolling pin to tenderize. Pat dry with paper towels. In a large bowl, combine all glazing ingredients. Place turkey breast breast side down. Pour glazing mixture over turkey. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least 6 hours or overnight. Let turkey come to room temperature before cooking. Preheat oven to 400f. Place turkey breast on rack in shallow roasting pan. Roast until an instant-read meat thermometer reads 170f when inserted into thickest part of breast. Let turkey rest for at least 20 minutes. Cover with foil. Carve turkey breast. Serve with maple glaze.

Combine cornstarch, sugar and salt in small saucepan. Mix together milk and non-fat milk until well blended. Stir cornstarch mixture into milk. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Add vanilla and chocolate. Pour into individual dessert dishes or molds. Chill for 30 minutes. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9x13 pan. Mix cake mix as directed in pkg. In large bowl, beat butter until light. Add water. Beat until creamy. Add egg and vanilla. Pour into greased pan. Bake 20 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Spread coconut over bottom. Chop chocolate. Sprinkle over coconut. Let stand until chips soften. Stir. Melt chips over low heat until soft. Stir in butter. Spread over cooled layer. Cool 1 hour. Lift out of pan. Cut into bars. Makes 48 bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 9x13 baking dish. In large bowl beat butter and 2 cups of the flour with electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds. Beat in egg yolks one at a time. Add remaining flour mixture alternately with 2 cups of the milk. Beat until well blended. In another bowl beat egg whites until stiff. Fold egg whites into batter. Pour into prepared dish. In small bowl beat the pudding mix with milk. Add a small amount of the batter to the pudding mixture. Fold in Cool Whip. Spoon over batter. In small bowl beat the cream cheese with the remaining flour. Fold into pudding mixture. Spoon over batter. Drizzle chocolate syrup over the top. Refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. Sprinkle with nuts before serving.

Beat egg whites until foamy. Add cream of tartar and continue to beat until whites are stiff peaks form when beaters are lifted up. Add almond extract and continue to beat until whites are stiff and glossy. Fold in sugar gradually to make sure it is incorporated completely before adding more. Fold in almonds. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheet about 1 inch apart. Bake at 275 for 20 to 25 minutes or until cookies are firm and dry to the touch. Cool for 20 minutes before removing from baking sheet. Makes about 36 cookies.

Mix all of these together. Form into a log. Refrigerate for at least an hour. If you are using a log, slice it thinly and use it on roasted meats or vegetables. If you are using a container or tub of butter, slice it thinly as desired. Use on bread or toast.
Bring the water and sugar to a boil in a small pan. Add the geranium leaves. Simmer for 10 minutes. Pour through a strainer and discard the leaves. Add the lemon juice. Serve immediately.

Fold the spring roll wrappers into thirds. Place the bananas and the cinnamon sugar into the center. Roll the wrap into a tube. Fold the ends of the wrap together and secure with toothpicks. Deep fry the rolls. Drain and enjoy!
Saute the garlic cloves and cherry tomatoes in the oil for a few minutes until soft. Add sugar, salt and pepper. Stir in fresh basil and serve over thin spaghetti with fresh basil leaves on top.

Place a layer of the instant lemon pudding on bottom of glasses or cups. Top with a layer of the mandarin oranges and the pineapples. Add a layer of the fruit cocktail and repeat the layering process. Top with whipped topping or sour cream. Serve chilled.

Bake chicken breasts in oven according to package directions. Slice chicken into bite size pieces once cooked. In a food processor or blender, combine the marinated artichokes, olive oil, garlic cloves and chicken broth. Blend until smooth and creamy. In another food processor or blender, combine the white wine and oregano. Blend until smooth. Place pasta in pot of salted boiling water according to package directions. Cook pasta until al dentedrain well in colander and place in serving bowl or individual bowls. In same pan over medium heat, add the blended white wine mixture to sauce pan. Bring to simmercook for 2 to 3 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Add blended marinated artichoke mixture to sauce panbring to simmer. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until sauce thickens. Stir in cooked pasta and chickencook for 2 to 3 minutes or until chicken is heated through. Top with feta cheese and serve.

Bring a large saucepan of chicken broth to a boil. Add the celery, yellow onion, garlic salt and white pepper. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes. Discard the bay leaf. Puree the mixture in a blender. Return the pureed soup to the saucepan. Add the velveeta cheese and jalapeno pepper. Cook the soup over low heat until the cheese is melted. Pour the soup into a bowl. Top with a dollop of sour cream. Serve with flour tortillas.

Remove the meat from the bone of each roasting chicken. Cut the meat into small cubes. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the onions, garlic, ginger, berbere, and chicken stock. Simmer for 40 minutes. Stir in the cubed chicken meat. Simmer until the meat is tender. Season with salt. Cook the eggs in a saucepan of boiling water. Drain the eggs after the cooking time. Remove the eggs from the water. Let cool for a few minutes. Peel the eggs. Cut the eggs in half lengthwise. Add the eggs to the stew. Serve over rice.

Peel plantains and cut into 1/2 inch slices. Fry on both sides until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Combine black beans with a 1/2 cup of water and heat. Mash beans with a fork. Stir in sugar. Spoon about 1/4 cup of the mashed beans on the top of each plantain. Fold over each slice of plantain and press edges firmly to seal. Heat a skillet with 1 tablespoon of oil. Fry rellenitos until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with rice.

Combine preserves, olive oil, vinegar and dijon mustardseason to taste with salt and pepper. Whisk to emulsify. Heat a small amount of canola oil in a saute pan over medium heat. Add scallion and saute until soft. Add chicken breast halves and sear until golden brown. Add raspberry preserves mixture and stir to coat. Remove from heat. Serve chicken topped with raspberry preserves mixture and raspberries. Serve with fresh lettuce leaves for wraps.

Cut beets into thin wedges and place on a platter or individual serving plates. Place a few sweet onion wedges around and between beets. Drizzle with olive oil and season with pepper and salt and chives and drizzle with raspberry and balsamic vinaigrette. Makes a pretty presentation for a summer dinner party or picnic.

Preheat grill. Combine all ingredients in a small mixing bowl. Add enough salad oil to make 1/2 cup of sauce. Stir well. Brush steaks with sauce. Grill over medium heat for 6 to 8 minutes on each side. Serve.

In a large mixing bowl combine cake mix, eggs, flour, sour cream and sugar. Beat with an electric mixer for about 5 minutes. Pour into greased 9×13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan.

Peel potatoes. Boil potatoes in water with 1 tsp. salt for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool. Dice potatoes. Heat butter in a large saucepan. Add potatoes. Saute over medium heat until tender. Add onions. Saute until tender. Add water and cook until boiling. Cook over medium heat until potatoes are tender. Add half-and-half. Cook over medium-low heat until heated through. Add cheese. Stir until melted. Stir in bacon. Season with salt and pepper. Serve topped with bacon crumbles.

Put the carrot and apple into a food processor and blend until fairly smooth. Put the sultana and apricot into a large bowl with the water and apple juice and stir. Stir the sugar into the carrot and apple mixture. In a large bowl, mix the self raising flour and baking powder together. Add the sugar mixture and beat until the mixture has a dropping consistency. Fold in the banana and stir. Spray a loaf tin with cooking oil and pour the mixture into it. Bake at Gas Mark 4 for about 1 hour or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Leave the loaf to cool on a wire rack. You can eat this immediately or wrap it in plastic wrap and freeze it. When you want to eat it, defrost it on the kitchen worktop for a few minutes and then warm it for 15-20 minutes in the microwave. Don't forget to put a piece of foil over the top before you microwave it as it will get quite hot.

Dust fillets with salt and pepper on both sides. Place in a 12-inch skillet and add wine and lemon juice. Let simmer 2 minutes. Remove from heat and drain off any liquid. Place fillets on a buttered sheet pan and dot with the butter and sprinkle with slivered almonds and fresh parsley. Place in a 350 degree oven and cook 5 to 7 minutes or until flaky and opaque throughout. Serve immediately with a side salad and fresh bread.

In large bowl combine pork chops with sage and onion. Pour apple cider over chops coating completely. Place chops in a large crock pot or slow cooker. Cover with apple juice. Add rice to apple juice. Cover rice with chops and juice. Cook on low 4 to 5 hours or on high for 2 to 3 hours or until meat is done. Serve pork chops over rice.

Heat 1 Tbs oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add lemongrass and stir to coat with oil. Add garlic and stir for 1 min. Add bird's eye chiles and kaffir lime leaves. Cook for 1 min. Add tofu and cook for 10 min. Add coconut milk and stir. Add cabbage and fish sauce and cook for 5 min. Add basil leaves and cook for 5 min. Serve over rice.
Mix garlic and herbs together. Sprinkle on pork. Drizzle with olive oil. Roast pork for 2 to 2 1/2 hours at 325f.

Beat eggs with 3/4 cup sugar. Add pumpkin and cinnamon. Mix well. Add cornstarch and stir to blend. Add rye whisky and stir. Pour into prepared pie crusts. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until set. Cool completely. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.
Cream together cream cheese and sugar. Fold in key lime juice. Fold in cool whip. Pour into graham cracker pie crust. Refrigerate for 4 hours before serving.

Wash and dry the strawberries. Place the strawberries on wax paper. Melt the white chocolate wafers. Dip the strawberries into the melted white chocolate wafers. Dip the strawberries into the semi-sweet chocolate chips. Place the strawberries onto wax paper. Sprinkle with nuts. Refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut tomato into halves and place in a shallow roasting pan. Drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle with minced garlic and crushed red pepper. Sprinkle with fresh basil and toss to coat. Place in oven and roast for 30 minutes or until softened and lightly brown.

Saute garlic cloves, onion, ground beef, carrot, spinach and tomatoes together for 5 minutes or until meat is fully cooked through. Drain off excess liquid from saucepan with a strainer or coffee filter. Place drained saucepan back on stove on medium high heat. Add crushed tomatoes to the meat mixture. Stir and bring to boil for 2 minutes. Drain macaroni according to package instructions then add to saucepan with meat mixture. Stir to combine well. Serve immediately with salt and pepper to taste.
Place the yogurt and 1/4 cup of green onions into a food processor. Mix to combine. Add the ketchup and curry powder and blend until smooth and combined. Serve with chips or vegetables.

Season the rib roast with the olive oil and garlic. Heat the olive oil in a pan on medium heat and cook the meat for about 2 minutes per side. Allow the meat to rest for about 20 minutes and serve with baked potatoes.

Combine 2 cups of boiling water with the baking soda in a large bowl. Mix well and set aside to cool. When cool, add the molasses and stir well. Add the flour and sugar and stir well. Add the shortening and salt and mix well. Pour the mixture into a 9 inch glass pie dish. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees f.
Mix all ingredients in a large punch bowl. Pour over ice and serve.
In small bowl combine basil, mayo, dijon and seasonings. Spread evenly over 1 side of each tortilla. Layer roast beef on tortillas with tomato and lettuce. Fold sides of tortillas over filling.

Mix the ground elk with the pesto sauce, the parmesan cheese, the egg, the plain breadcrumbs, the garlic powder and the red pepper flakes and season with the salt and the pepper and shape into meatballs.

Spray a shallow 8-inch square baking pan with cooking oil spray. In a medium mixing bowl, stir together the breadcrumbs and the taco seasoning mix until well combined. Beat the egg in a small mixing bowl with a fork until combined. Add the egg to the breadcrumb mixture and stir until blended. Place the boneless skinless chicken breast on a cutting board, and cut into 8 (1-inch) strips. Place the chicken strips in a large resealable plastic baggie. Add the picante sauce to the chicken strips, seal the baggie, and shake well to coat. Remove the chicken from the baggie, place on a plate, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes before deep-frying. In the meantime, place the breadcrumb mixture into a shallow 8-inch square baking pan. Heat the butter in a deep-frying pan over medium-high heat until bubbling, approximately 1 to 2 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the chicken nuggets by rolling each chicken strip in

To make the kabouli - in a large heavy saucepan heat the ghee over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally for 10 minutes. Add the spices. Stir in the chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Add the chicken. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Uncover and cook for 15 minutes. Remove the chicken to a serving platter. Keep warm. To make the rice - in a saucepan bring the water to a boil. Add the rice. Stir once. Cover. Cook for 5 minutes. Uncover. Fluff with a fork. Set aside. To make the kabouli - in a large heavy saucepan heat the ghee over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally for 10 minutes. Add the spices. Stir in the chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Add the chicken. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Uncover and cook for 15 minutes. Remove the chicken to a serving

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine corn and rice chex. In a smaller bowl combine pretzels, almonds, brown sugar, butter, light corn syrup, baking soda. Pour pretzel mixture over corn and rice. Stir to coat. Spread mixture on a lightly greased sheet pan. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven. Let cool for 10 minutes. Stir in dried cranberries. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Boil pierogies for 5 minutes. Drain then fry them in butter. Then put them in a baking dish with water and cover with foil. Bake in oven for 20 minutes. Then add chopped onion and bake for another 20 minutes uncovered. Serve hot with sour cream.

Wash blueberries. Drain well. In a blender or food processor, purée blueberries and grape juice. Set aside. In a large saucepan over low heat, add rind of lemon to grape juice-blueberry mixture. Add blueberry mixture to saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, for 10-15 minutes or until blueberry mixture is thickened. Add cornstarch mixturecook and stir 2-3 minutes or until thickened. Serve warm or chilled. Garnish, if desired.

Beat margarine in large bowl until fluffy. Add brown sugar substitute and sugar substitutebeat well. Add eggs and vanillabeat well. Sift together flour and baking powder. Add to brown mixturemix well. Stir in crushed canned pineapple. Drop by teaspoonful onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 400f for 8 to 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place pie shells in baking pan(s). Beat eggs with electric mixer until they are thick and pale yellow. Add the remaining ingredients (except the corn) and beat well. Pour into prepared crusts. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until golden brown and a knife inserted into the center of the quiche comes out clean. Let cool for 10 minutes before serving. Top with fresh corn.

Cut squash in half lengthwiseremove seeds. Scoop out pulp from inside squashplace pulp onto cookie sheet with sides. Sprinkle with saltadd sugar, honey, buttermix wellplace squash halves back over pulpplace back into microwave for 15 minutes at 850 wattscheck after 10 minutesremove from microwave when cooked. Squash should be soft enough so that the spoon can easily go through the squash. Let rest 5 minutesserve with butter or maple syrup.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine brown sugar, corn syrup and 1/3 cup water. Bring to a boil stirring occasionally. Add cream, butter and vanilla. Cook stirring constantly until mixture boils. Boil gently for 5 minutes. Stir in scotch whiskey. Remove from heat and pour into a heatproof container. Cover and let stand for a couple of hours to allow flavors to develop. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Cook potatoes and carrots until tender. Cool slightly. Drain beans and rinse. Combine beans, potatoes, carrots, green beans, peas, pickle, tomatoes. Combine mayonnaise, vinegar, parmesan cheese. Mix with salad.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling waterstir in rum and sweet-and-sour mix. Line mini molds with paper straws. Pour mixture into molds. Refrigerate until set. Unmold. Dip into sugar-sprinkled melted white chocolate.

Slice cabbage into thin strips. Slice carrots into thin slices. Slice onions. In a small bowl combine fish sauce, sugar, rice wine vinegar, lemon juice, freshly ground black pepper. Whisk until sugar dissolves. Add chicken to large bowl. Pour dressing over top. Let marinate at least 2 hours. Add cabbage, carrots, onions. Marinate at least 2 hours. Toss with dressing before serving.

Cream together oleo and powdered sugar until smooth. Add eggs one at a time and beat well. Add the sugar and lemon juice. Add flour and baking powder and beat well. Pour into a 10x15 pan that has been sprayed with Pam. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30-35 minutes. Let cool.

Melt butter over medium heat. Add onionssaute until softened. Add green peas and cook until heated through. Add frozen Boston lettuce. Cook and stir 5 minutes longer or until tender. Add corn and green onions. Stir to combine. Pour chicken broth over vegetables. Add salt and fresh ground black pepper. Bring to boilreduce heat. Simmer soup until vegetables are tender. Stir in sour cream. Serve with sprinkled parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) Place squash in a large bowlcover with boiling water. Let stand for 15 minutesdrain. Beat squash with butter in a food processor or blender until smooth. In a large bowl, beat together flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and sugar. Add squash mixturebeat just until combined. Stir in eggsbeat just until combined. Pour into a greased 8 inch square baking pan. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

In small pan cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Drain on paper towel. Remove fat from pan. Over medium heat, melt garlic clove in butter until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir into bacon and drippings, along with the miracle whip and milk. Cook over medium heat until the liquid is reduced to about 3/4 cup, whisking constantly. Transfer to a bowl to cool. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Stir in the cheeses until melted. Serve warm.

Shake tequila, triple sec and 4-6 ounces of water in a cocktail shaker with ice until thoroughly mixed. Strain mixture into a glass filled with ice cubes. Garnish the rim of the glass with salt. Serve in glass with a wedge of fresh lime to squeeze in.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets with cooking spray or line with parchment paperset aside. In a medium bowl with an electric mixer, beat the egg whites and lemon rind at medium speed for about 2 minutes or until foamyset aside. In another medium bowl with an electric mixer, cream the butter, brown sugar and lemon juice at medium speed for about 2 minutes or until light and fluffyset aside. In a large bowl with an electric mixer, cream the vegetable oil and brown sugar at medium speed for about 2 minutesadd the egg whites and beat at high speed for about 1 minute or until the batter is thick and creamyadd the vanilla and beat for about 30 secondsadd the dry ingredients and beat on low speed just until combinedfold in the crispy rice cerealdrop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto the cookie sheets. Bake for about 10 to 12 minutes or until the bottoms are lightly browned and the tops are set. Cool on

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Stir in zucchini, corn and red peppers. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir in onion, garlic and parmesan cheese. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir in bacon. Spoon into a lightly greased 2 quart baking dish. Bake 30 minutes or until hot. Serves 4.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. In a large mixing bowl, combine macaroni, mayonnaise, green onions and pepper. Sprinkle with salt. Toss well to coat. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. To serve, garnish with crushed tortilla chips.

Drain cranberries. Mash cranberries with fork or potato masher. Add sugar and mix well with fork. Add orange juice and lemon juice. Stir with fork until mixed thoroughly. Pour into a clean jars. Refrigerate 24 hours before serving.

Mix ground turkey with ranch dressing mix. Mix egg with garlic cloves and worcestershire sauce. Add to turkey mixture and season with salt and pepper. Form mixture into 6 patties. Cook on an oiled grill or skillet 4 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Serve with your favorite salad.

Rinse rice in a fine-mesh sieve until water runs cleardrain. In a 3-qt. saucepan, bring water and saffron threads to a boil over medium-high heatremove from heatlet stand for 10 min. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter until foamingcook for 1 minute or until foam subsides. Add ricecook for 3 minutes. Add saffron-infused waterbring to a boil over medium-high heatcook for 1 minute or until liquid is absorbed. Add 1 cup waterbring to a boil over high heatcook for 1 minute or until liquid is absorbedadd another cup of waterbring to a boil over high heatcook for 1 minute or until liquid is absorbedadd another cup of waterbring to a boil over high heatcook for 1 minute or until liquid is absorbedadd another cup of waterbring to a boil over high heatcook for 1 minute or until liquid is absorbedadd another cup of waterbring to a boil over high heatcook for

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and onions and saute for 4 minutes or until the onions are golden brown and tender. Add the ground beef and the next 5 ingredients to the pan. Cook for 10 minutes or until meat is browned and the garbanzo beans are tender. Add the tomato juice and waterbring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender. Remove from the heatadd salt and pepper to taste. Serve the mixture garnished with sour cream and green onions if desired.
Form into 4 patties. Spray an ungreased skillet with cooking spray. Heat pan over medium heat. Cook burgers in the hot pan for 4 to 5 minutes per side. Top with green onions.

Preheat oven to 425F. Peel and core apples. Cut apples into 1/2 inch slices. Place apples in a large bowl. Sprinkle cinnamon and sugar over apples. Mix to combine. Arrange apples in a large baking dish. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and drizzle olive oil over apples. Return to oven for another 10 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare phyllo pastry. Unroll phyllo pastry and cut into 12 pieces. Place 1 piece of phyllo pastry on the work surface. Brush lightly with olive oil flavored cooking spray. Place an apple slice on the phyllo pastry. Top apple slice with 2 more pieces of phyllo pastry. Brush top piece of phyllo pastry with olive oil flavored cooking spray. Repeat with remaining 11 pieces of phyllo pastry. Sprinkle icing sugar over phyllo pastry. Return to oven and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for
Place applesauce and all other ingredients in crock pot. Cook on low setting for 8 to 10 hours. Stir occasionally. Serve warm. Store in a glass jar in the refrigerator or freezer.

Combine milk and water in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add dry milk powder and cornstarch. Stir to dissolve cornstarch. Increase heat to medium-high. Cook 5 minutes stirring constantly. Stir in sugar and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook 2 minutes stirring constantly. Stir in chocolate chips. Cook for 2 minutes more stirring constantly. Serve hot in mug. Sprinkle with chocolate whipped cream. Garnish with cookie.

Heat oil in a large skillet and add the chicken. Season with the onion soup mix. Cook over medium heat until the chicken is cooked through. Add the tomatoes and the garlic. Cook for another 5-7 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the cooked pasta. Cook for another 2-3 minutes to blend all the flavors.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees f. Cut the garlic cloves in half and squeeze out the garlic. Place the garlic halves in a small skillet over medium heat and cook until golden brown. Remove and set aside. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the butter and allow it to melt. Once melted, add the sourdough bread cubes. Toss to coat the cubes with the butter. Add the thyme and toss until the thyme is fragrant. Add the garlic and toss. Add the olive oil and toss to coat. Place the bread cubes in a single layer onto a large rimmed baking sheet and season with black pepper. Sprinkle the Parmesan cheese over the cubed bread and season again. Bake for 8 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and set aside.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan. In a small bowl combine 1/2 cup milk with eggs. In a large bowl combine 1/2 cup milk with 1/2 cup bread cubes. Dip broccoli florets into the egg mixture, then the bread mixture. Arrange broccoli on bottom of baking pan. Sprinkle with half the cheddar cheese. In a small bowl combine brown sugar and 2 tablespoons flour. Sprinkle on broccoli. Top with remaining bread cubes. Pour milk mixture over bread cubes. Sprinkle with remaining cheddar cheese. Bake for 30 minutes.

Melt the chocolate over low heat. Remove from the heat and stir in the flour and brown sugar. Mix in the milk. Place the cinnamon sticks in the bottom of a large heat-proof bowl or pitcher. Pour the hot chocolate mixture over the cinnamon sticks. Mix in the vanilla and stir to blend. Serve with whipped cream and a dash of cinnamon.

Wash sweet potatoes. Peel, cube and cook in a saucepan until tender. Drain. Place sweet potatoes in a bowl. Mix remaining ingredients. Pour over sweet potatoes. Mix together. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees f for 45 minutes.
Cook bacon in a skillet until crisp. Set aside. In a saucepan cook onion until tender. Add beans and remaining ingredients. Cover and simmer on low heat for an hour. Serve over rice.

In a large bowl, cream together cream cheese and sugar until fluffy. Add cocoa powder and whisk to combine. Add egg and almond extractwhisk to combine. Add crackers to the bowl and stir to combine. Place pie shell into a 9-inch pie plate or pan. Spoon filling into crust. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. Top with Cool Whip if desired. Serve with a dollop of whipped topping. You can also top with chopped pecans.

In medium saucepan combine flour and saltgradually add milk to make batter. Cook over medium heat stirring until thick. Remove from heat. In blender or food processor, purée vegetables. In medium bowl beat eggs. Stir in egg and vegetable mixture. Fold in chicken. In a 9-inch square pan layer chicken mixture alternating with potato mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until heated through.

Heat the oil in a small pan over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for about 2 minutes or until fragrant and browned in color. Add the ginger and cook for another minute or so. Add the sugar and vinegar and bring to a boil, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon until sugar is dissolved. Add the sauce ingredients and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and cook for about another 5 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Transfer the sauce to small sterilized jars or bottles and seal immediately. Store in the fridge and use within 6 weeks of opening.

Combine 1/2 cup broth and stuffing cubes in slow cooker. Add apricots, onions and balsamic vinegar. Cook for 4-5 hours. Meanwhile, combine apricot jam and remaining 1/2 cup broth in a saucepan. Cook and stir until thickened. Pour into crock pot. Add pork loin roast. Cook 1 more hour. Serve with broth.

Preheat oven to 450. Place pizza dough on a baking sheet lined with foil or parchment paper. Spread barbecue sauce over dough and top with red and yellow bell peppers and chicken. Sprinkle with monterey jack cheese. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden. Serve immediately.

Rinse spinach in a large bowl under cold running water. Drain well. Add lemon zest to oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook stirring occasionally until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add spinachstir to coat. Cook 1 minute. Stir in garlic. Cook 1 minute. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over rice.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place pizza crusts on baking sheets. Brush each with pesto sauce. Top with pizza toppings. Bake for about 15 minutes or until crusts are golden brown.

Cut watermelon into chunks. Cut apples into large chunks. Cut green pepper into chunks. Put all vegetables into blender or food processor with basil leaves. Process until smooth. Add 1/2 cider vinegar and seasonings to taste. Pour into glasses. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Place chicken breasts between two pieces of plastic wrap. Pound with a meat mallet to about 1/4-inch thickness. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Drizzle oil over chicken. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place chicken on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink. Cool. Remove skin and discard. Cut into strips. In a large bowl, combine almonds, celery, red onion and mustard. Add chicken strips. Drizzle mayonnaise over mixture. Toss. Refrigerate for 2 hours or up to 2 days.

Slice potatoes into 1/4-inch rounds and season with 2 tsp. of salt and 1 tsp. of pepper. In a heavy large pot heat 2 tbsp. of olive oil until it is very hot. Add the onion and garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the potatoes and cook for 4 to 5 minutes or until they are just tender. Add the chorizo sausage to the pot and cook until the sausage is light brown. Add the clamato juice and chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add the collard greens to the pot and cook until they are just tender. Add the shrimp to the pot and cook until the shrimp are just opaque.
