Serve the clamato caldo verde with warm tortillas and chopped cilantro. Serves 4 to 5.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees and place rack in middle position. Whisk flour, baking powder and salt together in bowl. Using an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment (or in a bowl by hand), beat butter until light and fluffy (about 2 minutes). Beat in shortening until well combined and mixture is light and fluffy. Beat in sugar until light and fluffy (about 3 minutes). Beat in egg and vanilla until well blended (about 1 minute). Beat in flour mixture alternately with corn syrup until dough comes together in a ball. Turn dough out onto lightly floured surface and gently knead for about 1 minute or until dough is smooth and elastic (do not overwork dough). Shape dough into 1-inch balls and place 2 inches apart on baking sheets lined with parchment paper (do not flour sheets). Bake until edges are lightly browned and cookies are set (about 12 minutes). Transfer cookies to cooling racks and let cool completely (about 30 minutes).

Bring vinegar to a boil. Add harissa and cook for 2-3 minutes. Turn off heat. Place eggs into boiling water. Cook until whites are cooked. Remove eggs and place into hot oil. Cook for about 1 minute. Serve on toast.

In a large pot or saucepan on medium heat, heat olive oil. Add onion and saute until soft and translucent. Add pumpkin and carrot. Season with rosemary. Cook for 15 minutes. Add water and bring to a boil. Add chicken stock and bay leaves. Cook until pumpkin is tender. Blend mixture until smooth and creamy. Serve with skim milk powder.
Melt the chocolate and butter together over low heat until smooth. Stir in the sugar. Stir in evaporated milk and vanilla. Serve warm or cold. Store in an airtight container.

Pre-heat the oven to 425f. Wash and cut potatoes into quarters lengthwise. Place into a large, deep ovenproof baking dish. Drizzle with butter and sprinkle with herbs. Salt and pepper potatoes. Bake uncovered for about 45 minutes or until tender. Serve. Can also be placed under a very hot broiler for a few minutes to brown.

Roast the arm roast in the oven at 300f. Bake for an hour. Remove roast from oven. Turn oven up to 400f. Slice the roast and serve hot. Serve the vegetables as a side. The au jus is a gravy that you can use to top the meat. You can also put the gravy in a gravy boat and serve the meat on a plate. The onion gravy is a side that you can serve with the meat and vegetables. The mushroom gravy can be used for dipping the bread or for topping the meat and vegetables.

Combine all of the spices in a small bowl. Coat the pork chop with the spices. In a small pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the brown sugar and the apple juice. Cook until the sugar is dissolved. Add the pecan halves and cook for 30 seconds. Drizzle the pecans into the brown sugar mixture. Pour the sauce over the chops. Place the chops in the refrigerator overnight. The next day, preheat the grill or broiler. Place the chops on the grill or under the broiler. Cook until the internal temperature is 160 degrees. Serve with the sauce.

In a large saucepan, combine pineapple juice, cranberry juice, orange slices, ginger, whole allspice, cloves, cinnamon sticks and brown sugar. Stir to dissolve sugar. Bring to boil. Reduce to simmer. Add blood orange. Stir frequently until cranberries pop and juice is thick. Strain into pitcher. Serve warm. Serves 6.

Boil water. Add potatoes. Cook till tender. Drain. Dice potatoes and place in large bowl. Add oil and heat in a saucepan. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes. Add to bowl. Heat garlic and cayenne in oil. Add to bowl. Heat oil. Add hot dogs. Cook till hot. Remove from oil and add to bowl. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Mix well. Form into 12 balls and place on plate. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve with sour cream. Or...Boil potatoes. Drain. Cut into cubes. Add oil. Heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes. Add hot dogs. Cook till hot. Drain. Add potatoes. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve. Or...Boil potatoes. Drain. Cut into cubes. Add oil. Heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes. Add hot dogs. Cook till hot. Drain. Add potatoes and hot dogs. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve. Or...Boil potatoes.

In a saucepan over med heat, combine ketchup and water. Add garlic powder, onion powder and black pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 15 minutes. Add salt and tabasco sauce to taste. Let stand for 5 minutes. If too thick, add more water.

Cook rice according to package directions. Dice tomatoes into small cubes. Mix ground beef, onion, salt, garlic salt, worcestershire sauce and rice together. Place mixture into a greased casserole dish. Top with tomato cubes and cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes or until brown on top. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Combine vinegar, brown sugar and 1 cup water in a large bowl. Add apples and cabbage to the vinegar mixture and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Serve tossed with 2 Tbsp oil and salt and pepper to taste.

Wash and cut squash in half lengthwise. Brush cut side with melted butter. Place squash in steamer basket and cover with a piece of foil. Place over boiling water and cook 10 minutes or until squash is tender. Add onion and cook 10 more minutes. Serve squash with onion.

In large bowl combine flour, cayenne pepper and saltmake a well in center. Pour butter into wellmix until crumbly. Stir in cheese and pecansmix well. Place mixture on lightly greased cookie sheetform into 1 1/2-inch ballsroll each ball in pecans. Bake at 350 degrees f for 8 to 10 minutes or until firm to the touch.
Mix all the ingredients and place in crockpot cook on low for 8 hrs or high for 4 hrs. Serve with rice and beans and green salad.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Unroll crescent dough. Separate into 4 rectangles. Press into greased muffin tins. Put a teaspoon of sausage in each muffin. Top with a teaspoon or so of zucchini and tomatoes. Sprinkle with half a teaspoon each of onion soup mix, brown sugar and salt. Fold up crescent dough. Crimp edges with fork. Brush tops with butter. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heatadd onions. Cover, reduce heat to low, and cook until onions are softened, about 5 minutes. Uncover panincrease heat to medium-high. Add stockbring to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally, 25 to 30 minutes or until onions are very softremove from heat. Stir in bay leafdiscard bay leaf. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve onion soup in bowls accompanied by French bread slices topped with Parmesan cheese.

Put butter, brown sugar and chips in a bowl and microwave for 1 minute. Stir until smooth and pour over crackers. Let cool and then add nuts or toffee pieces and candy sprinkles and raisins or mint if desired. Let cool completely and then put chocolate coating over crackers and store in fridge or freezer until ready to eat.
Prepare tomatoes according to package directions. Place on a microwave-safe plate. Season with salt and seasoning salt. Add garlic powder. Microwave uncovered on high for 4 minutes or until tender.

Heat some oil in a wok. Stir fry the pork fillets in the oil for 2 minutes. Add the oyster sauce, honey, water, ginger and bok choy. Stir fry for another 4 minutes. Add the coriander leaves. Serve hot.

In a large bowl combine all sauce ingredients. In a large frying pan over medium heat, heat canola oil. Add chili powder and stir fry vegetables for 3 minutes. Add noodles to frying pan. Stir fry for 3 minutes. Add sauce mixture. Toss to coat noodles. Cook over medium heat for 3-5 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup roasted peanuts. Serve immediately. Top with remaining 1/2 cup roasted peanuts.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and green onion. Cook until tender. Add broth and bring to a simmer. Add chard. Cook until chard is tender. Stir in pasta. Cook until al dente. Season with pepper and salt.

Sauté green peppers and onions in hot butter. Add water chestnuts. Stir in soup and sauterne. Lay chicken in casserole. Add mushroom. Sprinkle with thyme. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Uncover and bake at 350 degrees for another hour. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve with rice and vegetables.

Heat the butter and the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the sausages and brown for about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and onions and saute for about 3 minutes until softened. Add the peas and the potato and stir well to combine. Add the milk and the sausage liquid and simmer for about 5 minutes stirring occasionally until the peas are tender and the sausage is heated through. Serve in a bowl with a sprig of thyme or basil and a good dollop of ketchup or mustard. This makes a great meal served with a green salad and a crusty roll.

Add olive oil to a pan over medium heat. Add cumin and garlic powder. Sauté until fragrant. Add chili powder, sea salt, ground black pepper, crushed red pepper flakes. Add chickpeas. Cook 5 to 8 minutes until tender. Serve warm.

In large skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat. Stir in bread cubes until well coated with melted butter, about 4 minutes. Add apples and bananastoss to coat with melted butter. Cook until apples are softened and browned slightly, about 10 minutes. Transfer to 13x9-inch baking dish. Stir together sugar, salt, cinnamonsprinkle over fruit mixture. Cover tightly with aluminum foilbake at 350 degrees until bubbly and apples are tender when pierced with fork, about 25-30 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat broiler with rack set 4 inches from heat source. Place oil in a nonstick skillet over medium heat and add tuna steakscook 3 minutes on each side or until done. Transfer tuna steaks to a foil-lined rimmed baking sheet. Coat with salt and pepper to taste. Add the garlic to the skilletcook 30 seconds or until fragrant. Pour in the tomatoesbring to a simmer, stirring frequently until tomatoes have broken down slightly and thickened slightly. Pour the tomato mixture over the fish steaks on the baking sheet. Broil 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve immediately with lemon wedges on the side.

In a bowl, mix together the sugar and eggs. Add the coconut milk and mango. Mix well. Add the flour and baking soda. Mix well. Add the sour cream and the vanilla essence. Mix well. Pour the mixture into a greased loaf pan. Sprinkle the walnuts and the coconut flakes over the top. Bake for 45-60 minutes. Let it cool before removing it from the loaf pan.

Peel potatoes and cut into quarters lengthwise. Place potatoes in a large saucepan and add cold water to cover. Bring pot to a boil and cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain potatoes and return to saucepan. Let cool for 5 minutes then add heavy cream and butter and salt and pepper to taste. Mash with a potato masher and serve hot.

Unroll cinnamon rolls on cutting board and cut into 12 pieces. Place a piece on plate and put pie filling over it. Then put pecans and blueberries over the filling and then put the next piece on top and repeat with 2 more rolls so you have 4 rolls with filling in between them. Sprinkle brown sugar on top of rolls and then sprinkle brown sugar on top of cinnamon rolls then take the rolls and put them in the freezer for 10 minutes. Take rolls out of the freezer and place them on the plate and sprinkle the rolls with brown sugar then put the cream cheese frosting over the rolls and put it in the fridge to chill then serve and enjoy!!

Remove stems and pits from avocados. Slice avocados in half around the pit and twist them in opposite directions to remove them from the shell. Using a sharp knife, cut each avocado half into 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick wedges. Place avocado in a bowl. Mash with a fork and add garlic cloves and lemon juice. Add chopped tomatoes and cilantro. Mix well. Add salt and pepper to taste. Place in small bowl or other serving dish. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper for extra spice. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees fahrenheit. Brush cod fillets with extra virgin olive oil on both sides and season with salt and freshly ground pepper. Place fillets in a baking dish. Remove rind from lemon halves, discard pith and cut lemon crosswise into four wedges. Place lemon halves on top of cod fillets. Brush lemon halves with extra virgin olive oil from both sides. Sprinkle with thyme. Arrange cherry tomatoes on top of fish fillets and surround with pitted black olives and capers. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Roast cod for about 15 to 18 minutes until fish flakes easily with a fork. Remove from oven and place fish fillets on serving platter with cherry tomatoes, pitted black olives and capers and drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve immediately.

Preheat broiler. In a large bowl combine paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, thyme, salt, lemon zest, olive oil and 1 cup of the lemon juice. Pour the mixture into a shallow glass or ceramic baking dish large enough to hold the fish in a single layer. Place catfish fillets in the dish. Pour remaining 1/2 cup lemon juice over the top. Cover the dish. Place under broiler for 4 minutes. Turn the fish over. Cover again. Broil an additional 3 to 4 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) Grease a cookie sheet or line with parchment paper. Sift together the flour, sugar, salt, and sesame seeds in a large bowl. Add the margarine to the flour mixture and combine it with the blender until it is completely incorporated. Add the vanilla extract to the cookie dough and stir until combined. Take about one heaping tablespoon of dough, roll it into a ball, then roll it in your hands to form a ball. Place the balls of dough onto the cookie sheet. Make an indentation in each ball of dough with your finger or a teaspoon to hold the strawberry preserves inside the ball of dough. Put the strawberry preserves in the indentation you made in each ball of dough. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until they are a golden brown color.

Prepare yellow cake according to package directions. Let cool completely on wire rack. Prepare pudding as directed on package. In large mixing bowl beat butter and sugar. Beat in margarita mix and pudding mix. Beat in eggs one at time until combined. Pour pudding mixture over cooled cake. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Frost with buttercream frosting.

Blanch red peppers in boiling water for 5 seconds. Remove from water and drain. Combine peppers with the oil and vinegar in a blender. Add the salt substitute and blend. Pour mixture into a sealed plastic bag and refrigerate. To use, empty mixture into a salad spinner and spin. Pour dressing into a glass container and refrigerate. To serve, drizzle dressing over salad.

Wash and dry strawberriesremove stems. Dice and mix with blueberries and raspberries. Sift dry tapioca into a mixing bowl. Gradually add sugar and mix well. Add berries to tapioca mixture and toss. Fill each pastry shell with mixture. Cut butter into small cubes and mix with sugar. Dot each pie with butter/sugar mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until berries are tender. Serve at room temperature.
Combine chicken, apples, raisins, mayonnaise and curry powder in mixing bowl until blended. Add salt and pepper to taste. Makes 4 cups.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add asparagus to the water and cook until tender. Drain the asparagus. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the leek to the skillet. Cook until the leeks begin to soften. Add the bread crumbs, sage, gorgonzola, and 1/2 cup of the Parmesan. Cook until the gorgonzola has melted. Transfer the mixture to a blender or food processor. Add the cooked asparagus. Blend until smooth. Pour into a saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir in the whipping cream. Season the sauce with salt and pepper. Cook for 30 minutes. Transfer the sauce to a blender. Add the remaining Parmesan. Blend until smooth. Reheat over medium heat. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour the gorgonzola sauce over the asparagus. Sprinkle with the remaining Parmesan.

Preheat oven to 425. Place yams in a large baking dish. Slice bananas and set aside. Combine rum and brown sugar and pour over the yams. Bake for 30 minutes. Mix the lemon juice and crushed pineapple in a small bowl. When the yams are done, mash the yams with a potato masher. Combine the mashed yams with the bananas, add the lemon juice mixture and rum. Place in a serving dish and sprinkle with macadamia nuts. Serve hot.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta, stirring occasionally until tender but still firm to bite into. Drain well and return pasta to pot. Add ham, mushrooms, butter, sherry, green onions, pecans and parsleymix well. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes or until heated through. Serve.
Saute broccoli florets and peppers over medium heat. Add soy sauce and lemon juice. Cook for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and add toasted sesame oil. Serve immediately.

Cook ravioli in boiling water until al dente. Drain in a colander. To assemble, place a lettuce leaf on each of 8 salad plates. Top with 1/3 cup ravioli. Add 1/4 cup carrots, 1/4 cup tomatoes, 2 green onions, 1/4 cup broccoli florets, 1/4 cup pea pods, and 2 tablespoons of reduced-calorie Italian dressing.

Core and slice apples and pears. Place in a large saucepan with water to cover. Bring to a boil then add lemon juice and apple juice concentrate. Cook 15 to 20 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool in refrigerator. Place in food processor with ground cinnamon, ground mace and nutmeg. Puree to a chunky consistency.

In medium bowl, combine cream cheese, sugar, almond extract. Mix well. Stir in enough pie filling to make 2-inch layer. Press 1 cup of pie filling in bottom of 9x13-inch pan. Cut each crescent roll into 6 slices. Place 6 pieces in center of pie filling. Top each slice of crescent roll with 1 tbsp of the cream cheese mixture. Place remaining crescents atop cream cheese mixture. Fold ends of crescent rolls toward center. Repeat procedure until all crescent rolls are used. Combine flour, brown sugar, butter. Cut in shortening with pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal. Press into bottom of ungreased 10x15-inch pan. Sprinkle sliced almonds over top. Bake at 400 for 10 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool completely. Cut into bars. Refrigerate 2 hours.

Add lemon juice to water in a small bowl. Add strawberries to liquid. Let strawberries macerate for about 5 minutes. Add sugar substitute to strawberriesstir until dissolved. Add gelatin mixture to strawberriesstir. Let stand at room temperature for 5 minutesstir again. Add cornstarch to strawberry mixturestir until combined. Pour mixture into 3-cup glass canning jars with tight-fitting lidsrefrigerate 2 hours before serving to allow gelatin to set completely.

Combine boiling water, tea bag and sugar into a heatproof pitcher and steep for about 10 minutes. Remove tea bag and pour tea into glasses and top with ice cubes and club soda. Top with frozen lemonade concentrate and fresh strawberries.

Bring water to boil over high heat. Reduce to medium heatadd milk. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in oats. Add cherries & pecans & butter. Reduce heat to lowcook for 25 minutes or until oats are tender & liquid is absorbed. Stir in brown sugar & cinnamoncook for 2 minutes or until sugar dissolves completely. Remove from heatstir in vanilla extract. Transfer to 10 x 5 x 3 inch pan. Cool for 2 hours before serving.

Cook the chicken in boiling water for 10 minutes and drain the water with cold water. Take out the chicken and chop the chicken in big pieces and set aside. Cook the chickpeas in boiling water for 2 minutes and drain with cold water. In a bowl mix the chopped chicken with chickpeas. In another bowl mix the chopped red onion with cherry tomatoes and baby spinach with olive oil and lemon juice and mix well. Add the cherry tomatoes and baby spinach to the chicken and chickpea mixture and mix well and add the chopped flat leaf parsley to the mixture and mix well and serve immediately.

Place fish in a shallow pan or baking dish large enough to hold fish in one layer. Pat fish dry with paper towelsseason fish with salt and pepper, and rub with oil. Scatter onions over fishscatter garlic over fish. Add capers with vinegar over fishadd tomatoes over fishadd dill over fish. Roast fish, turning once or twice, until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 12 minutes. Serve with rice pilaf, pasta, or sauteed vegetables.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a large bowl mix olive oil, salt, pepper and maple syrup and toss well. Place parsnips in a large bowl and toss in dressing until they are coated evenly. Pour onto a large baking sheet in a single layer (or in batches) and roast for 15 minutes. Turn and roast another 15 minutes or until they are tender and golden brown.

Combine all the ingredients in a medium size sauce pan and bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and add freshly ground pepper to taste. Allow to cool. Refrigerate for several hours. Add ice to chill.

In a bowl mix together the berries and 1 tablespoon of the sugar. Set aside. In another bowl combine the mascarpone and the whipping cream. Beat until smooth. In a bowl combine the remaining 1 tablespoon of sugar and the vanilla. Whisk in the whipping cream mixture and stir until combined. In 4 glasses layer the berries mascarpone mixture and then berries. Drizzle powdered sugar over the top of the berries and garnish each parfait with a sprig of mint.

Melt butter in medium saucepan. Sprinkle flour over butter. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly with a whisk until mixture forms a paste. Add milk gradually, whisking constantly to prevent lumps from forming. Continue cooking over medium heat, stirring constantly with a whisk for 2 minutes or until sauce thickens slightly. Remove from heat. Add nutmeg. Beat egg substitute into sauce. Stir in Parmesan. Season with salt and pepper.

In a large saucepan melt butter over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the water and rice and stir to combine. Add the frozen peas and carrot. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Stir in the salsa and cook for another 5 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Fluff the rice and serve.

Mix beef and pork together. Form into 2-inch meatballs. Fry meatballs until brown. Remove from fry pan and drain on paper towels. Mix egg with breadcrumbs. Roll meatballs in breadcrumb mixture. Fry meatballs again until brown and drain on paper towels again. Place meatballs in a casserole dish and cover with water. Cook 1 to 1-1/2 hours, until meatballs are tender. Serve with gravy and potatoes.

I like to use 12 inch flour tortillas. Spread cheese evenly over one tortilla. Next, spread vegetables evenly over cheese. I use red and yellow bell peppers and chopped onion. I also use chopped mushrooms. Next, add chicken and/or beans and spices. I like to use hot sauce and garlic. Cook over stove top until tortilla is browned and cheese has melted. Flip the tortilla and cook until second side is browned.

Slice olives. Cut cheese into rounds, place olives on top of the cheese round and sprinkle with flour and cayenne pepper. Roll dough around olives and place on a baking sheet. Brush with melted butter and bake at 400 degrees F for about 20 minutes until golden brown. Enjoy!

Prepare the bitter melon by removing the stalks from the ends of the melon with a sharp knife or paring knife. The stem end of the bitter melon is where the stems attach to the melon. Cut down the middle of the bitter melon lengthwise so that the two sides are separated into sections. Then with the paring knife, cut the bitter melon into thin strips. Heat the oil in a large pan or wok and add the peanut oil. When the oil begins to shimmer, add the eggs, stirring constantly until they are cooked to the desired doneness (soft or hard). Remove the eggs from the pan with a slotted spoon and set them aside on a plate lined with paper towels to drain the excess oil. Return the oil to the pan and add the bitter melon strips, stirring constantly until they are lightly browned on all sides. Add the soy sauce and white pepper to the bitter melon mixture in the pan and stir until the bitter melon is coated with the sauce. Serve immediately on a platter with the eggs on top.
Heat the soup in a saucepan or microwavestir in the shredded cheese and sour creamstir in the butterstir in the cracker crumbsbake in a greased 2-qt casserole at 375 degrees for 25 minutes.

Peel cauliflower and potatoes and cut into small pieces. Saute in butter until light brown in color. Add eggs and season with salt and pepper and cayenne pepper to taste. Place in a casserole dish and top with slices of gruyere cheese. Bake in a 375 degree oven for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a small bowl mix together flour, cornmeal, baking powder, salt, eggs, milk and oil. In a separate bowl mix together creamed corn, whole kernel corn and sugar. Mix creamed corn mixture into the flour mixture to make a thick batter. In a frying pan heat oil over medium-high heat. Drop batter by heaping tablespoons into hot oil (they will spread). Fry until golden brown. Turn fritters over using a slotted spoon and fry on other side until golden brown. Drain on a paper towel-lined platter. Makes approximately 36 fritters. Serve with honey or brown sugar dipping sauce or fruit preserves.

In a small bowl, combine honey, soy sauce, turmeric powder and chili powder to make the marinade. Add chicken wings to the marinade and marinate overnight. If you’re doing this the day of the event, marinate for at least one hour. Bake at 350°F for about 30-35 minutes until the chicken is crisp and cooked through (internal temperature of chicken should be about 165°F). Sprinkle the ginger root over the wings just before serving to add a little extra zing!

Cream the margarine and brown sugar in a large bowl until fluffy. Mix in the granulated sugar. Add the eggs and honey and beat well. Combine the flour and baking soda and stir into the mixture. Fold in the vanilla and the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets and bake for about 12 minutes.

Cut corn from cob & discard husks & silk. Grill or broil corn 8-10 minutes or until tender. Brush corn lightly with melted butter & sprinkle lightly with salt & chili powder. Sprinkle cayenne pepper evenly over corn. Grill or broil 1 minute or until pepper is hot & bubbly. Serve corn as soon as possible to get best flavor & texture. (Or serve it as leftovers.)

Preheat oven to 400 degrees and spray a 9x13 baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. Melt 6 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet over medium heat and saute chopped onions for 15 minutes. Add salt and cayenne and saute for another 5 minutes. In a large bowl, combine onion mixture with 3 cups shredded cheddar cheese and 6 cups mashed potatoes. Pour mixture into prepared baking dish and sprinkle with remaining shredded cheese. Pour 1 cup milk into a liquid measuring cup and add soup and 1 teaspoon saltmix well and pour over casserole. Sprinkle with parsley and bake for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch pieces. Place potato pieces in a large mixing bowl. Toss with 1 tbsp of the olive oil. Add sea salt and fresh ground pepper. Sprinkle 1 tbsp of dry white wine evenly over potatoes. Toss until well coated. Place potatoes in a greased 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle with fresh thyme leaves. Bake in preheated oven until tender when pierced with a fork. Serve hot or warm.

Combine all-purpose flour, cream of wheat, paprika and salt in shallow dish. Stir beer in a bowl until foam subsides and batter is thickened slightly. Dip shrimp in battershake off excess batter. Deep-fry shrimp in batches in large deep skillet over medium-high heat until golden brown, turning once or twice with tongs or a slotted spoon. Drain on paper towels and keep warm. Serve shrimp with duck sauce and coconut shavings on a bed of iceberg lettuce leaves and/or with rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Slice squash in half, scoop out seeds, then brush generously with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Place squash in a greased baking dish. Cover with sliced onion. Bake until tender. In a large bowl combine breadcrumbs and butter then mix in eggs until well blended. Season with salt and pepper. Top squash with breadcrumb mixture then bake until golden brown. Remove from oven, top with cheese then place sliced bacon on top. Return to oven until cheese has melted. Remove from oven and serve.

Add raspberries and sherry to a blender with 1/2 cup of the olive oil and 1/4 cup of the whipping cream and blend on high until smooth and purple in color. Add the rest of the olive oil and whipping cream and continue blending until smooth and purple in color. Add the salt and blend well. Chill and serve.
Combine sugar and wine vinegar with Grand Marnier. Drizzle over clementines. Serve with low-fat vanilla yogurt and mint sprig garnish.

Mix all ingredients together in a blender. Pour batter into a well greased 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve with steamed broccoli or spinach.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, combine beans, tuna and onions in a medium bowl. Add dressing to taste. Combine with the cooked pasta. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Peel potatoes and slice 1/4 thick. Cook potatoes until tender. Drain. Return to pan with butter and oil. Stir in shallot. Stir in chicken until well coated. Add tarragon. Mix until well blended. Transfer to a greased 9-inch springform pan. Bake 30 minutes. Meanwhile make a roux by melting butter and stirring in flour. Add chicken stock slowly. Cook 10 minutes. Stir in remaining ingredients. Pour into pan with chicken. Bake 30 minutes. Let stand 15 minutes. Serve with extra tarragon.

Cook pasta according to package directions. In large skillet or saute pan with lid, saute olive oil on medium heat, add garlic salt and saute for about 30 seconds. Add pesto sauce, sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, kalamata olives, rosemary leaves, and red pepper flakes. Stir frequently for about 5 minutes until sauce thickens slightly and is warm. Drain pasta and add to pan with sauce. Stir to coat pasta evenly with sauce. Sprinkle with cheese if you like. Cover pan with lid and let sit for about 1 minute or so for the pasta to absorb some of the sauce. Serve immediately. This is great if you want a quick pasta dish.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a baking dish with cooking spray. Slice the chicken breasts into thin strips. Dip each strip in the egg then in the breadcrumbs. Place each strip into the baking dish. Pour the olive oil over the breadcrumbs. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the chicken from the oven. Place the chicken into a large skillet. Add the broth, lemon juice, parsley and lemon slices. Cook over medium heat until the chicken is tender. Serve over rice or pasta.
Mash avocado. Add mayonnaise. Stir in the garlic powder, salt and pepper. Stir in the paprika and fresh parsley. Add lemon juice. Serve on crackers or bread.

Combine yolks, mustard and vinegar in a food processor. Process until smooth. Add oil in a thin stream. Process until smooth. Add sugar and pepper. Process until smooth. Stir in dill. Heat oil to 350 degrees. Dip herring fillets in egg and then in batter. Fry in batches in hot oil. Drain on absorbent paper. Serve with dill pickle and dill sauce. Dill sauce: Mix mustard mixture and 2 cups boiling water. Stir in remaining ingredients. Simmer 10 minutes. Stir in pickle juice. Serve with dill pickles.

Cut chicken into 1/2-inch thick strips. In medium skillet over medium heat cook chicken in butter until done. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Assemble chalupas by spreading 1/2 cup chicken on each tortilla. Top each tortilla with 2 Tbsp. cheese. Fold each tortilla. Place in heated pan and cook 2 minutes on each side or until cheese melts. Serve with sour cream.

Cream butter and sugars together. Add flour and baking soda, mix well. Add peanut butter. Add egg and vanilla. Scoop the dough into balls about one inch in diameter. Roll in granulated sugar. Bake for 11 - 13 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from cookie sheet. Store in air-tight container.

Combine warm water and sourdough starter in a large bowl and let rest for about 1 hour or until thickened. Add flour, sugar and saltbeat until smooth. Stir in baking soda. Shape dough in a roundcut in half. Form dough ballsplace on greased baking sheets. Cover with towels and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size. Bake at 375 degrees for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Cut the potatoes into 2 inch pieces. Place them in a large bowl and add the flour. Toss to coat the potatoes. Pour the oil into the bowl with the potatoes and toss again. Place the potatoes in a roasting pan and cook in the oven for 45 to 60 minutes. Turn them over after 30 minutes. When the potatoes are done, transfer them to the bowl with the remaining oil and toss. Salt to taste. Melt the butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant. Add the thyme leaves and bay leaves to the potatoes and toss. Transfer the potatoes to the serving platter. Put the garlic on the potatoes. Sprinkle with freshly ground pepper. Serve hot.

Cut celery and onion into bite size pieces. Cut bacon into small pieces. Saute celery and onion in bacon fat over medium heat until tender. Add tomato and cook for 2 minutes. Drain off excess grease. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add cooked bacon and stir well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over pasta. Top each serving with 1/4 cup shredded parmesan cheese.

Prepare flatbread according to package directions. Lay out on baking sheet. Spread flatbread with pizza sauce. Top with spinach, goat cheese, artichoke hearts and tomatoes. Sprinkle with pizza seasoning. Bake according to flatbread directions. Let cool slightly before cutting into pieces. Serve.

Mix chicken pieces with flour seasoning to coat. Heat 1/4 cup butter over medium heat in a large skillet. When the butter is hot but not smoking, brown the chicken pieces on both sides. Place the chicken pieces into a large casserole dish coated with non-stick cooking spray. Melt remaining butter over medium heat in the same skillet used to brown the chicken. Cook the shallots and garlic in the butter until softened but not brown (about 5 minutes). Add the white wine, stirring occasionally until the wine has reduced slightly (about 3 minutes). Add the shallot mixture to the casserole dish with the chicken pieces. Pour the cream over the chicken and season with salt and white pepper to taste. Cover the casserole with a tight fitting lid or aluminum foil. Bake for 30 minutes at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) until the chicken is cooked through (about 175 degrees F).

In a large saucepan over medium heat saute shallot and mushrooms in cooking spray until tender. Add quinoa. Cook and stir for 5 min or until heated through. Stir in broth. Cook and stir for 10 min or until quinoa is tender. Stir in evaporated milk, salt and pepper. Cook and stir for 3 min or until heated through. Stir in dill.
Cream cheese with milk until smooth and creamy. Stir in nuts and spread on celery. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Cut onions in half and place on the bottom of a greased slow cooker. Put cooked rice in bottom of slow cooker. Mix beef with bacon and cocktail franks. Layer this mixture on top of the cooked rice. Add diced tomatoes on top of the layer. Mix cream and the monkey brains. Pour the mixture on top of the diced tomatoes. Mix in salt and pepper. Cover and cook on low for 7 hours. If you are using fresh monkey brains you will need to cook on high for 4 hours.

Prepare graham cracker crust according to package directionspress into the bottom and up the sides of a greased 13 x 9-inch pan. Cool completely on a wire rack before filling. Beat together cream cheese and strawberry jam until smooth. Fold in whipped topping until well combined. Spread evenly into the crust and refrigerate for at least 3 hours or until set. Top with lemon pie filling and strawberries before serving.

Boil spaghetti according to package directions and drain. Meanwhile, peel and remove avocado pits and cut avocado in half lengthwise and scoop out flesh with spoon into medium bowlmash with fork or potato masher until smooth. Add lemon juice and salt and pepper to tastemix well. Set aside. In small saucepan, heat oil over medium-low heatadd garlic and saute for about a minute or until softenedremove from heat and stir in chopped parsley and pepper. Stir into avocado mixture and mix wellmix in olives and reserved spaghetti. Serve immediately.

Rinse shrimp and pat dry with paper towels. Dip shrimp in flour. In a small bowl combine mustard and beerset aside. In a large non stick skillet cook shrimp in hot oil over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until shrimp turn pink. Dip shrimp in the beer mixture to coat. Place shrimp on skewers. Serve.

Soak cod steaks in milk for 30 minutes before cooking. Prepare mayonnaise by combining the mayonnaise with tarragon, lemon juice, salt and dried breadcrumbs to taste. Add more mayonnaise as necessary. Dip the cod steaks into the mayonnaise then dust lightly with flour seasoned with salt and pepper. Place the steaks in a pan of boiling oil over medium heat and cook for about 3 minutes on each side until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter with the oil. Add the leeks and cook until softened and translucent, about 8 minutes. Add the stock and cider and bring to a boil. Stir in the vegetables and cook until tender and just golden. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer the mixture to a 10 x 10-inch casserole dish and cover with foil. Transfer to the oven and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 2 hours. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and discard the bay leaves. Stir the potatoes and return the mixture to the casserole dish. Cover with foil and transfer to the oven and cook until tender and golden, about 1 hour. Top with the thyme and serve. Serves 8.

Heat the soup according to package directions. Drain. In a large bowl combine the taco seasoning mix with 1/2 cup water. Add the meat and stir until thoroughly blended. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Drain tater tots. Add tater tots to pan, cooking 3-5 minutes until browned. Add meat mixture, corn mixture. Stir until heated. Fold in cheddar cheese. Spoon into a 9x13 inch glass or ceramic dish. Sprinkle with crushed taco chips. Bake 30-35 minutes or until hot. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Stir together water, cinnamon, nutmeg and sugar in a small bowl. Mix in the apples. Transfer to a baking pan. In a small bowl whisk together the butter, brown sugar and flour. Stir in the water mixture. Pour over the apples. Sprinkle the crumb mixture evenly over the apples. Bake in the preheated oven for about 40 minutes or until the apples are tender. Serve warm. Serves 8.

Cook fettuccine according to package directions. Drain. Melt butter and cheeses in saucepan. Stir in garlic powder. Stir in tomatoes. Cook on low heat for 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in cooked fettuccine. Top with fresh basil leaves and serve.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add ham hocks and bring to a boil for 20 minutes. Add onion. Add green beans to watercook for 3 minutes. Add potatoescook for 12 minutes. Add seasoning salt and pepper to taste. Remove ham hocks from pot and remove meat from boneset meat aside. Return beans to pot. Add potatoescook for 3 minutes. Return ham to pot and add cooked beans to potcook for 1 minute. Remove beans from pot and set aside. Add 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid back to potcook over high heat for 30 seconds. Add beans back to potcook for 3 minutes. Serve with ham hocks on side.

Bring water and chicken broth to a boil in a large saucepan. Add onion. Cook and stir for 3 minutes. Add frozen broccoli. Cook and stir for 4 minutes. Stir in milk. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in mashed potatoes and butter. Season with salt and nutmeg. Serve hot.
1. Brown ham in a fry pan. 2. Spread the ham on the buns. 3. Add 1/4 cup ketchup and 1/2 tsp worcestershire to each sandwich. 4. Top each sandwich with 1/4 cup of coleslaw.

To make the chia seed pudding, combine yogurt, milk and chia seeds in a large bowl and stir well until combined. Add berries and stir again until well combined. Refrigerate overnight or up to 4 hours or until mixture thickens and chia seeds absorb all of the liquid. To make the oatmeal, combine oats and milk in a large microwave-safe bowl. Microwave for three minutes on high and then stir. Repeat microwaving in one-minute increments until oats are tender. Add yogurt mixture and stir until combined. Top with raspberries and enjoy!

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine all of the sauce ingredients except the rosemary and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened and slightly reduced, 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Transfer sauce to a blender and puree until smooth, about 30 seconds. Strain the sauce through a fine-mesh sieve and transfer it back to the saucepan over medium heat. Return the sauce to a boil and cook until reduced by half, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the rosemarytransfer to an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 1 month. Makes 1 cup.

In a large bowl mix together hamburger and taco seasoning. Add taco sauce and stir. Refrigerate for at least one hour. Remove from refrigerator and combine all the remaining ingredients. Serve with tortilla chips and iceberg lettuce. Makes 32 servings.

Wash mushrooms and slice off stems. Remove stems and chop and save. Clean mushroom caps. Brush each cap with olive oil. In a large skillet over medium heat cook chopped mushroom stems and onion in butter until mushrooms are soft. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine the bread crumbs and parmesan cheese and mix well. In another medium bowl combine the eggs, parsley and soy sauce and mix well. Stuff each mushroom cap with the bread mixture and place in a greased 9x13 casserole dish. Cover and bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Makes 12.

Bake biscuits according to package directions. Remove biscuits from oven and cool slightly. Cut each biscuit horizontally in halfset aside. Combine celery and onion in a large bowl. Stir in butter until blendedset aside. Stir together mayonnaise and dry mustardset aside. In a small bowl combine tuna and dill weedset aside. Spread mayonnaise mixture on the bottom of a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Spoon tuna mixture onto the mayonnaise mixture. Spoon cheddar cheese over tuna mixturetop with a biscuit half and sprinkle with celery mixture. Bake uncovered at 350f for 15 minutes until hot and bubbly.

Melt semi-sweet chocolate chips and unsweetened chocolate in a double boiler or in a heat-proof bowl set over hot water. Remove from heat and stir in butter and vanilla extract. Add salt to taste if desired. Stir in mini marshmallows and stir until melted and smooth. Stir in nuts if desired and pour into a pan for cooling. Store in fridge or freezer for 20 minutes before using as frosting on cake or other desserts.

In large bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Gradually add milk, beating until cream cheese is completely blended. In medium bowl, mix instant pudding mix and milk until soft peaks form. To make ladyfingers, dip fingers one at a time into water until barely moistened all over. Dip fingers into batterdrain briefly on paper towels. Place fingers on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for about 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Meanwhile, prepare coffee. In large bowl beat cream cheese until smoothgradually add powdered sugar, beating until smooth. Beat pudding with milk until soft peaks form. In small bowl, beat whipped topping until fluffy. To assemble, place ladyfingers on bottom of serving dishtop with half of pudding mixture. Repeat layering with remaining ladyfingers and remaining pudding mixturetop with chocolate. Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. Makes 20 servings.
Heat oil and garlic cloves over medium heat. Add bacon. Remove garlic cloves. Add shrimp. Add tomatoes, green peppers, salt and pepper. Cook 5-10 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Prepare 2 loaves of stale bread by cutting each loaf into 6 equal pieces and place them in a large bowl. In a small bowl, mix together apple and dried cranberries. Place 1 tbsp of apple mixture on top of each bread piece. Whisk together the egg and granulated sugar, then add the vanilla extract and milk and beat until combined. Pour the egg mixture over the bread pieces and soak them until the bread is softened, about 15 minutes. Transfer the bread pieces to a 9-inch square baking dish and press them together to create a flat layer. Sprinkle the cinnamon over the bread and drizzle it with the melted butter to coat it evenly. Bake until the bread is golden brown and the sauce is bubbling, about 40 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature. You can make this recipe using one loaf of bread and one or two slices of apple for each servingthe sauce will be less concentrated and the baking time will be longer.

Preheat oven to 180c/350f/gas 4. Sift the flour and cocoa into a bowl and rub in the butter until you have breadcrumbs. Make a well in the centre of the mixture and pour in the milk and vanilla essence. Stir with a fork until you have a sticky dough. Turn onto a floured surface and roll out into a rectangle about 25cm long and 10cm wide. Cut into 2cm wide strips and place them on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Beat the egg white and water together with a fork and brush the tops of the strips of dough with the mixture and sprinkle with the chocolate chips. Bake for 15 minutes or until the scone strips are golden brown.
Mix dry ingredients. Add applesauce and water. Bake at 350f for about 10 minutes.

Dukka is a popular spice blend used in middle eastern food. It is a wonderful blend of nuts, seeds, spices, and salt. Use it as a topping for hummus or tabbouleh. It is also a wonderful blend to use in baked goods like pumpkin bars or sweet rolls. It can be used as a seasoning for meat or poultry, or even in vegetable dishes like eggplant.
Mix cranberry juice, brown sugar, cloves, cinnamon sticks, and white zinfandel wine in a punch bowl. Serve over ice. Add a little sparkling apple cider for a refreshing bubbly effect. Makes 6-8 cups.

Fill a large container or pitcher half full of ice. Pour the frozen lemonade concentrate over the ice. Squeeze lime juice over the mixture. Add lime wedges. Stir. Pour into a tall glass. Top with carbonated lemonade. Serve immediately.

To a saucepan add cranberry sauce and stir in cornstarch. Add light brown sugar and stir until dissolved. Add condensed milk and lemon juice. Cook over medium heat stirring constantly. Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add egg yolks. Stir well. Pour into a 9" pie pan and chill. Pre-bake pie shell for 5 minutes at 425. Remove from oven and pour the filling into the pie shell and return to the oven and bake for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Take each hot dog bun and place one slice of cheese on each of the buns, top each slice of cheese with some of the tuna. Top each bun with pickle slices, onion slices, the rest of the tuna and then the remaining cheese. Place buns face down on the grill and cook on medium high for 3 minutes on each side or until the cheese is melted. Remove from the grill and allow to cool for 10-15 minutes before serving.

Prepare the taco seasoning mix according to package directions. Saute ground beef with taco seasoning mix in large skillet until meat is brown and cooked through, about 7 minutes. Add refried beans, salsa and cheese to meat mixture in skilletheat through. Pour meat mixture into greased 2-qt baking dishtop with salsa, lettuce and tomatoes. Cover with foilbake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until heated through. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a medium saucepan over medium heat cook the carrots in the broth for 10-12 minutes or until the carrots are tender when pierced with a fork, adding the gingerroot for the last minute of cooking time. In a large bowl mix the cooked carrots with the remaining ingredients and toss well until well coated. Transfer the carrot mixture to a serving dish and sprinkle with the nuts and raisins. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes about 4 cups.

Place soy sauce, honey and sherry in a small bowl and mix well with a wire whisk until blended. Put vinegar and garlic in a small jar with a tight-fitting lid and shake until blended. Pour vinegar mixture into the soy sauce mixture and shake well. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Coat each salmon fillet with half of the soy sauce mixture and cook for 3 minutes on each side or until done to desired doneness. Serve with lemon wedges and steamed vegetables such as asparagus or broccoli on the side for dipping in the soy sauce mixture left in the skillet.

Drain cottage cheeseblend with tomatoes and a pinch of salt. Spread 1 cup cottage cheese mixture on 8-grain bread slicestop with mushrooms. Brush 1 side of bread slices with margarineplace bread slices, margarine side down on baking sheetbroil 2 to 3 minutes or until browned. Cut bread slices diagonally into 1/2-inch-thick stripstop each strip with 1/4 cup cottage cheese mixturesprinkle with Parmesan cheesebroil 3 minutes or until cheese melts.

1. Cut broccoli into medium-sized florets. Thinly slice celery and onion. Combine broccoli florets with celery and onion in a large bowl. 2. Mix mayonnaise, lime juice, cumin, chili powder, sugar, salt, freshly ground black pepper in a small bowl. 3. Pour dressing over salad. Toss until combined. 4. Crumble raisins into salad. 5. Garnish with fresh mint. Serve.

Cream the eggs and sugar with a pinch of salt and vanilla extract. Dissolve the bread in a little milk and add the dry mixture and beat thoroughly. Put into a greased frying pan and cook till done. Dip in jam and roll in icing sugar and serve hot. These doughnuts are very easy to make and delicious to eat. The recipe can be used for sweet or savory doughnuts as well as using different jams and icings.

place english muffin halves on bottom of baking dish or pan. spread tomato sauce over muffin. sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. layer pepperoni. layer mushrooms. bake at 400 degrees f (200 degrees c) for 10 to 12 minutes or until crust is golden brown. muffins can also be baked for 5 minutes prior to topping with tomato sauce and cheeses to make them extra crisp.

Mix sweetened condensed milk and lime juice in a small saucepan over medium heat. Heat until combined. Remove from heat. Stir in cool whip until mixed. Transfer to 9 inch springform pan. Place in freezer for 1 hour. Top with red food coloring and raspberry. Place in freezer for 1 hour. Remove from freezer and place in refrigerator for 1 hour. Slice and serve.
Place the cottage cheese, egg white, cream and sugar into a blender. Process until smooth. Pour into 4 serving glasses. Garnish with chopped strawberries and serve immediately.
Mash bananas in a large bowl. Add honey and mash again. Add coconut, butter, lemon juice. Fold in vanilla. Serve immediately or refrigerate overnight.

Drain and crisp chicken. Flake and set aside. Prepare corn tortilla. Place tortilla on bottom of casserole dish. Top with corn tortilla. Top with olives. Top with green chili salsa. Top with cream of mushroom soup. Top with cream of chicken soup. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 40 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg yolks and beat until smooth. In a separate bowl combine flour and strawberry preserves. Combine with butter mixture and add pecans. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Let cool completely. Roll in powdered sugar.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk flour into butter and cook for 2 minutes. Stirring constantly. Slowly pour tomato juice into the roux and continue to stir. Reduce heat and cook for 2-3 minutes more. Add salt and pepper to taste and stir in brussels sprouts. Cook for 15 minutes. Serve with shredded cheddar cheese.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Scrub potatoes well with a vegetable brush or sponge. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise then in half crosswise. Place potatoes in a single layer in a large roasting pan or baking dish. Brush potatoes with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle with Dijon mustard then sprinkle with oregano. Roast in preheated oven 45 to 50 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender. Remove from oven and serve hot.
Combine tomatoes, celery ribs and lemon slices in a serving bowl. Pour over tomato juice, add olive oil, lemon juice, celery salt, worcestershire sauce and cayenne pepper. Toss gently and serve.

Pre-heat oven to 425F degrees. Place chicken on roasting pan with all the seasonings and cook for 1/2 hour or until done. Meanwhile, sauté onion and green bell peppers in olive oil until softened and tender in a skillet over medium heat. Remove and place onion and green bell peppers on top of chicken and bake for another 1/2 hour until done. Serve with your favorite sides.

Put chicken in a large pot on medium heat with olive oil. Sprinkle garlic clove over chicken and add lemon juice to chicken. When chicken is done, remove chicken from pot and place on a plate to cool down. When chicken is cooled, remove chicken skin from chicken breast. Shred chicken breast into small pieces or cut into small pieces and discard skin. Set aside until ready to use. Add lemon juice to pot over medium heat. Add dried oregano to pot and stir to mix. When oregano is well mixed into pot, add garlic clove to pot and stir to mix. Cook chicken backs to chicken backs until liquid is absorbed into chicken backs and chicken backs are hot. Add chicken to pot when it is ready to be added to pot. Stir chicken pieces into pot. Add chicken backs to pot once chicken backs are done cooking. Once chicken backs are done cooking, add chicken breast to pot once chicken backs are done cooking. Cook chicken breast in pot until chicken breast is heated through.

Add chicken broth to large saucepan with the granule. Cook according to directions on the package of the noodles. When the noodles are done add the peas and carrots. Mix the cream of mushroom soup with the milk then add the soup mixture to the noodles mix well. Stir in the chicken. Cook on medium heat for 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in the cheese and cook until the cheese melts. Stir in salt pepper to taste. Enjoy.

Preheat your oven to 180 degrees celcius. Prepare a 12 hole muffin pan and lightly oil it. Remove the skin from the beetroots and grate them. Sift the flour into a bowl and stir together with the baking powder. Add the grated beetroots and sultanas. Add the egg and beat lightly with a wooden spoon. Stir together with the buttermilk and butter. Finally stir together with the parmesan cheese and the fresh thyme leaves. Spoon into the prepared muffin tins and place them into the oven. Bake for 20 minutes or until risen and golden. Serves 12. Screamingly good food.

Mix flour and salt in small bowl. Gradually beat in sour cream until smooth. Beat in butter until incorporated. Transfer to a shallow dish. Working with one egg at a time, dip egg in batter and then in hot oil (325 degrees F.) until golden and cooked through (about 2 minutes). Drain oil and place egg in paper towel to drain. Repeat with remaining eggs. Serve with chopped chives and toast.

Cook pasta according to package directions using 6 cups boiling water, adding pasta to boiling water stirring gently to prevent sticking. Cook according to package directions adding pasta to boiling water stirring gently to prevent sticking. Drain pasta reserving 1/2 cup cooking liquid to add to sauce during last minute of cooking. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and saute 1 minute stirring constantly. Add mushrooms and cook stirring occasionally until tender 8 to 10 minutes. Add bacon pieces saute 2 minutes until crisp remove from pan with slotted spoon leaving fat in pan add sunflower seeds stirring constantly to prevent burning. Add tomato paste cook stirring constantly for 2 minutes stirring constantly until tomato paste is completely dissolved. Add sun-dried tomatoes stirring constantly until tomatoes are well blended with oil from sunflower seeds. Add parmesan cheese stirring until cheese is completely melted stirring constantly. Add pasta to sauce with 1/2 cup reserved cooking liquid stirring to coat pasta with

Cut steak into 1-inch thick strips. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Dip a clean paper towel in canola oil to coat skilletswirl to coat the pan evenly. Sear steak in the hot skillet for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until browned. Drain on paper towels to remove excess fat. In a medium bowl, mix together the chopped celery, bell pepper, Worcestershire sauce, diced tomatoes, onion, sliced mushrooms and Tabasco sauce. Place the steak back into the hot skillet. Pour the mixture over the steak. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until heated through and the sauce thickens slightly.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Prepare crust according to package directions. Meanwhile, prepare filling by mixing together all remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Pour into prepared crust. Bake for 25 minutes at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Cool completely. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before slicing. Makes 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a medium bowl stir together the brown sugar and butter. Stir in the oatmeal and flour. Pour the brown sugar mixture over the peaches. Place peaches in a lightly greased 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle with the cinnamon. Bake for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm.

Combine pineapple, sugar, tomatoes, vinegar, onion, soy sauce in blender or food processor. Process until smooth. In a small bowl stir cornstarch into water until dissolved. Pour into pineapple mixture and stir. Simmer for 10 minutes over low heat stirring frequently. Serve over meat or vegetables.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place the onion in a bowl and add the water. Microwave for 3 minutes on high or until tender. Drain onion and set aside. Remove the stems from the portabella caps and discard. Cut caps into halves. Remove the gills from the portabella caps. Brush the portabella caps with the olive oil. Season the portabella caps with the feta and Parmesan cheeses and the garlic salt. Place the portabella caps in a 13x9-inch baking dish. Fill the caps with the onion, egg mixture and spinach mixture. Place a slice of Swiss cheese on each portabella cap. Sprinkle with the stuffing mix and a dash of paprika. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until heated through. Serve warm.

In a small bowl mix rice and bouillon cubeadd water and mix well. Add garlic powder and cuminmix well. Stir in onion and cayenne and chili powdermix well. Bring mixture to a boil in a rice cookercover and cook as directed by manufacturer's instructions. (Note: I cooked this at high for 30 minutes). (Note: I cooked this at high for 30 minutes).

In a bowl, combine all the ingredients except oil. Whisk until well blended and smooth. Slowly stream in the oil. Transfer to a sealable container and refrigerate until ready to use. Tip: This makes a wonderful dressing for shrimp and steak salads or stir-fried noodles or rice.

Place a slice of bread on a piece of wax paper on a plate or trayspread the bread with about 1 tablespoon of butter and place another slice of bread on top of itpress the sandwich down so that the cheese will be pushed between the two pieces of bread. Put the sandwiches in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight to allow the cheese to melt inside the sandwiches. Grill on a flat surface for about 1 minute on each side or until golden brownserve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 2 loaf pans. Sift together dry ingredients. In a separate bowl, beat together wet ingredients. Add wet to dry. Mix well. Pour into pans and bake for 50 to 55 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes and then turn out onto wire rack to cool completely.

In a large skillet with a tight-fitting lid, cook shrimp in butter until just cooked through. Add pepper flakescook for a minute or two. Add white wine. Covercook on low heat for a few minutes. Adjust seasoning. Serve over rice.

Remove fish from refrigerator and pat dry with paper towels. Rinse fish under cold running water and pat dry again. Heat oil and sesame oil in wok over medium heat. Add garlic and gingercook and stir 1 minute or until fragrant. Add fish, skin side downcook and stir for about 30 seconds. Turn fish over and add soy sauce and rice wine. Cover and cook for about 3 minutes. Transfer fish to a platter and keep warm. Add vegetable oil and sesame oil to wok and heat over medium high heat. Add iceberg lettuce and stir-fry 1 minute. Add chicken stock and bring to a simmer. Cook for about 20 minutes. Return fish to wok and simmer 1 minute. Transfer to serving bowl and sprinkle with white sesame seeds.

Combine apricots, all-purpose flour, walnuts, sugar, cardamom, cinnamon and cloves in a medium-sized bowl. Cream butter, brown sugar, vanilla, and egg together until light and fluffy in a large bowl. Pour into the apricot mixture. Stir well and spoon into a greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake for 1 hour at 350F or until lightly browned on top and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack for at least 3 hours before cutting into bars. Store in refrigerator.

Slice zucchini lengthwise. Remove the seeds and discard. Brush with butter and place on aluminum foil on the grill. Cook until tender. While zucchini is cooking, melt parmesan cheese and whisk in basil. Mix with a fork. Place cooked zucchini into boats. Fill with parmesan basil mixture. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Prepare hash browns according to package directions. Cook ham until no longer pink. Set aside to cool. Beat eggs, milk, salt, pepper into a large bowl. Layer hash browns in bottom of 9x13 inch baking dish, then ham on top of potatoes, then cheese on top of ham. Pour egg mixture over the top of all the layers. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30-45 minutes or until set. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
Prepare pudding according to package directions. Stir in milk and tapioca. Add bananas and refrigerate. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream if desired.

Pour water into a large saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to maintain a gentle boil. Stir in semolina and cook 3 minutes without stirring. Stir in lingonberries and cook 3 minutes longer. Stir in salt and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand 10 minutes. Whip until smooth.

Cut asparagus into 2-inch lengths and place in a medium saucepan of boiling water over high heat for about a minute to blanch. Drain and rinse well under cold water. Pat dry with a paper towel. Place asparagus in a large bowl and toss with the oil, lime juice, fish sauce and pepper flakes. Taste and adjust the seasoning as necessary with additional lime juice and pepper flakes. Add the red onion and coriander and toss well. Let sit for about five minutes before serving with the lettuce leaves on top of each salad.

Cut each slice of bacon into 1/2-inch strips. Wrap a water chestnut around the bacon strip, leaving enough bacon sticking out at both ends to secure it with a toothpick. Roll the bacon and water chestnut strip together to form a spiral around the toothpick. Drizzle with chili sauce and mayonnaise and sprinkle with brown sugar. Serve immediately.

Brush each breast with olive oil. Sprinkle both sides with flour, salt and pepper. In a large skillet over medium heat saute the pine nuts in the olive oil until golden brown. Place chicken in the skillet and cook until golden brown. Remove the chicken from the skillet. In the same skillet over medium heat melt the gruyere cheese stirring constantly until melted. Remove from the skillet. To the chicken in the skillet add the pesto sauce and the green onions. Divide the pesto mixture equally between the two halves of the chicken breasts. Place the pesto stuffed chicken breasts in the skillet with the gruyere cheese mixture. Cover the skillet. Cook for 4 minutes or until the internal temperature of the stuffing reaches 160 degrees F. Remove from the skillet and let rest for 2 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9 inch pie pan. Mix graham cracker crumbs and butter. Press into pie pan. Bake 5 minutes. Mix marshmallows and milk. Pour mixture into graham cracker crust. Top with chocolate candy bars. Top again with whipping cream. Refrigerate 2 hours. Garnish with chocolate curls. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a small bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, xanthan gum and salt. Add butter and vanilla soy milk to dry mix. Beat until combined. In a large bowl, whisk together eggs and egg whites. Stir in dry mix. Fold in banana chips and dried apricot. Spoon batter onto a parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake 20 minutes. Cool slightly. Serve warm. Makes 6-8 scones.

To make the pie crust, combine the graham cracker crumbs and butter in a large bowlmix thoroughly. Add a little water and stir until the crumbs are moistened but not sticky. Press the crumb mixture firmly into the bottom and sides of a 9-inch pie plate or pan to form a crust. Bake the crust at 350 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until it is a golden brown and firm to the touch. Remove from the oven and cool. To make the filling, combine the pecans, coconut, butter and cream cheese in a large bowl and mix thoroughly until it is all blended together. Add the sweetened condensed milk and mix until everything is well blended together. Fill the pie crust and chill for several hours until firm. Serve with the caramel ice cream topping and the cool whip topping. Sprinkle some of the caramel ice cream topping over the pie if desired and serve with a spoon for scooping up the filling.

Pound chili powder, cumin, salt, brown sugar, pepper and crushed garlic into a paste in a small bowl. Spread the rub onto the pork chopslet stand at least 30 minutes or refrigerate overnight. Grill pork chops on a charcoal grill or on a gas grill that has been preheated to high. Brush the chops with vegetable oil. Cook the pork chops over medium heat for 10 to 12 minutes on the first side or until well browned. Flip the chops over and cook on the second side for about 10 minutes or until done. Remove the pork chops from the grill and let them rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Wash fennel well under cold water, removing any brown spots. Cut fennel bulb into quarters lengthwise, then cut each quarter into slices widthwise so you have a long oval shape. Toss with olive oil, balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard, salt and pepper. Place slices onto a preheated grill until charred. You can also grill this indoors if necessary. When grilling, make sure the fennel is turning brown. Take it off the grill when it looks to be cooked through. Eat it with a simple vinaigrette of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard, salt and pepper. Or you can serve it with a dijon mustard sauce or bbq sauce as a side dish to your favorite meal.
Blend all ingredients together. Transfer into a bowl and chill in fridge.

Cream together butter, peanut butter, sugars and vanilla. Sift flour with baking soda together with salt. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet mixture. Stir in the chips. Drop by teaspoons onto a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 9 to 11 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Combine flour and remaining dry ingredients in another bowl. Stir flour mixture into creamed mixture until blended. Pour into two greased 8 x 4 inch loaf pans and bake 50 - 60 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack. Frost with frosting or glaze if desired.

Combine marshmallows and sour cream in a medium saucepan over low heatcook and stir until smooth. Fold in fruit cocktailmix well. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours to blend flavors. Top with mandarin oranges and marshmallows if desired.

Preheat broiler. Spray large baking sheet lightly. Place fries in single layer on baking sheet. Sprinkle fries lightly with cilantro. Broil 3 to 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Drizzle fries with olive oil. Sprinkle lightly with kosher salt. Broil 2 to 3 minutes or until crisp. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place tilapia in a baking dish. Sprinkle with garlic powder and lime juicedrizzle with olive oil. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve fish on a bed of steamed green beans with a lemon wedge for garnish.

Prepare hash browns according to package directions. Drain. Place in a greased 9 inch square cake or glass baking dish. Spread with cheese. Top with ham slices. In a small bowl, combine soup and mustard. Spread over ham. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Beat egg substitute with a whisk. Add cream of mushroom soup mixture and mustard. Pour over mixture in dish. Sprinkle with pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until set. Let stand for a few minutes and then cut into bars.

Preheat oven to 425f. Lightly coat potato with olive oil on both sides. In medium bowl, mix together 3 cloves minced garlic, red pepper flakes, flat leaf parsley, salt and pepper until well combined. Place potato on parchment paper-lined baking sheet and spread garlic mixture over potato. Bake in preheated oven until golden brown on both sides, about 35 minutes. Serve immediately with chopped parsley sprinkled over the top.

Combine all ingredients in a resealable plastic bag. Add the chicken breast halves. Seal the bag and shake until well coated. Place the chicken in a shallow pan in a preheated oven at 400 degrees. Cook for 15 to 20 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165 degrees. Serve with rice or your favorite side dish.

Preheat skillet over medium heat. Grease pan with nonstick spray. In a bowl, combine whole wheat flour, baking powder and peanut butter. In another bowl, combine soymilk and banana. Whisk until smooth. Fold in peanut butter mixture. Pour batter by scant 1/4 cupfuls onto pan. Cook until bubbles begin to form and bottom is golden brown. Turn over and cook for 2 minutes more. Top each pancake with about 1/4 cup chopped walnuts and 1/4 cup chopped banana. Serve with maple syrup.

Spread out cashews on a large plate. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 10 minutes or until cashews are lightly toasted. Cool completely. In a large bowl combine the cashews and remaining ingredients. Mix well. Toss with fresh parsley.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Brown meat with onion and bell pepper in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain fat from skillet. Add garlic to skillet and cook until tender. Stir in tomatoes, tomato sauce, corn, macaroni, parsley and spices. Simmer 30 minutes or until macaroni is tender. Makes 8 servings.

Take orange juice and add cinnamon sticks. Add vanilla extract. Stir constantly until mixture coats cinnamon sticks. Pour mixture into a tall glass. Place ice cream on top. Stir to combine. Serve with whipped cream.

Rinse and pat dry chickens. Place in a baking pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine lemon juice, olive oil, paprika, oregano and 1 clove of minced garlic. Pour over chickens and sprinkle with remaining clove of minced garlic. Bake at 375 degrees for 90 minutes. Baste every 15 minutes. Serves 6 to 8.

Bring to boil 2 cups water, 1/2 cup sugar, yellow onion, garlic clove. Simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat, add cucumbers, dill weed. Simmer 2 hours. Transfer to clean glass container. Allow to cool. Add 1 cup white vinegar. Allow to cool. Pour into clean glass container. Allow to cool. Cover. Refrigerate 1 week. Serve with soda crackers.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Cook over medium heat for 15-20 minutes, stirring constantly. Serve warm with whipped cream if desired.

In a large skillet, heat oil. Sauté the onion and garlic until tender. Stir in the tomatoes and zucchini and cook for 5-6 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp. Drain any excess liquid from the vegetables and stir in the red bell pepper and beans. Season to taste with sea salt and black pepper and stir in 1/4 cup of the breadcrumbs. Transfer to a baking dish and sprinkle top of beans with remaining breadcrumbs and drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes at 350 degrees F or until the breadcrumbs are golden brown on top and bubbling. Serve hot!
Mix yogurt, pudding mix and raisins in a bowl. Refrigerate for one hour. Serve in ice cream cones. Sprinkle granola cereal around the edge of the cone.

Wash fruit thoroughly. Cut into quarters. Remove pits. Sprinkle with sugar, lemon juice and mint. Let stand 15 minutes. Place 1 cup of water in a small bowl. Sprinkle cornstarch over water. Stir until dissolved. Add to fruit mixture. Stir in orange juice. Bake at 350 for 45 to 55 minutes or until fruit is tender. Cool completely before serving. Note: For a lighter version substitute margarine for butter.

Put water, tea leaves, cloves, ginger, peppercorns, fennel seeds, cinnamon sticks, green cardamom pods in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to boil and turn off heat. Let steep 10 minutes. Discard the spices. Add brown sugar to taste. Serve hot with 1% or skim milk.

Beat cream until soft peaks form. Beat egg yolks with sugar until thick. Mix in coffee, kahlua and vanilla extracts. In another bowl beat the chocolate chips until smooth. Fold into the cream/egg yolk mixture. Fold into the chocolate/egg yolk mixture. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. (you may also use a metal pan to set in freezer for 4 hours to get a more solid texture).
Mix together in a jug and serve.

In a small pot, bring the mushrooms and beef broth to a boil. Cook until the mushrooms are soft, about 15 minutes. Strain the mushrooms and reserve the broth. In another small pot, melt butter. Add the flour and stir to combine. Cook over medium heat until the flour is golden and the mixture is bubbly. Add the mushroom broth and stir to combine. Cook until the mixture thickens. Set aside. Butter the bottom and sides of an 8-inch square baking dish. Heat the oven to 325 degrees fahrenheit. Add the mushroom mixture to the baking dish and spread evenly. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs and cheese evenly over the mushroom mixture. Bake until golden and bubbly, about 25 minutes.

Mix meat with breadcrumbs. Add eggs and milk. Mix together well. Form meat mixture into 1-inch meatballs. Heat oil. Fry meatballs until golden brown. Drain meatballs on paper towels. Serve hot with warm mustard.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Beat egg and add mustard, dried oregano and thyme. In separate bowl, combine breadcrumbs, salt and pepper. Dip pork chops into egg mixture. Then coat with breadcrumb mixture. Bake for 25 minutes. Turn pork chops over and cook for 15 more minutes. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Melt the caramels with the sweetened condensed milk in a 1-quart heavy saucepan set over medium heat and stirring until smooth. Remove from the heat and stir in the butter and marshmallows until the marshmallows are melted and smooth. Cool the mixture for 30 minutes at room temperature and then stir in the vanilla extract and salt. Pour the mixture into a 2-quart shallow glass dish. Place in the fridge for 1 to 2 hours or until firm and then scoop out and roll into balls with your hands. Roll in the toasted rice cereal to coat and then place on a waxed paper-lined sheet tray and store in the fridge until ready to serve.

Cut kernels off corn. Chop remaining corn. Combine chopped corn, olives, chilies and pimiento in large bowl. Combine remaining ingredients and toss with corn mixture. Serve with tortilla chips. Serves 12.

Preheat oven to 180c 350f gas mark 4. Grease 12 holes in muffin tin. Combine egg and vanilla. Mix in canola oil. Add bananas and syrup. Mix in sour cream. Fold in sifted self-raising flour. Chop walnuts and stir through batter. Divide batter evenly between muffin tin. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Bake for 5 minutes or until brown and cooked through. Serve warm.

In large skillet cook onion in 1 Tbsp. margarine over medium heat 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in garlic. Cook 1 minute longer. Add lima beans and tomatoes. Cook until beans are tender. Stir in okra and cajun seasoning. Cook 10 minutes. Stir in black-eyed peas. Cook 5 to 8 minutes longer. Add remaining margarine and remaining 1/4 cup butter. Cook 1 minute longer. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve. Makes 6 to 8 servings. Serve over hot cooked rice. Serve with warm cornbread.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease and flour 9x13 cake pan. Prepare yellow cake mix according to package directions. Pour batter into greased and floured cake pan. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cool cake 10 minutes. Spread about 1 cup of Cool Whip on top of cake. Sprinkle with crushed pineapple. Arrange mandarin oranges over pineapple. Spread with pudding mixture. Sprinkle with remaining Cool Whip. Refrigerate until serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 9-inch springform pan. Sift together the flour, sugar and cocoa. In a separate bowl, beat the eggs until they are thickened. Slowly beat in the oil, buttermilk and coffee. Fold the dry ingredients into the egg mixture. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for about 35 minutes. Let the cake cool for 10 minutes before removing it from the pan.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and cook for 2 minutes. Add the pineapple and bacon and cook for 2 minutes more. Place the shrimp mixture in a 9-inch square glass or ceramic baking dish. Sprinkle with cayenne pepper and lemon juice to taste. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until the bacon is done and the shrimp is cooked through. Serve over rice.

In a small saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic cloves and let them brown for 3 minutes before adding breadcrumbs, parsley, salt and pepper. Cook for 1 minute and remove from heat. In a bowl, toss shrimp with breadcrumb mixture and lemon juice and rind. In a 13x9 casserole dish, spread 1/4 cup olive oil over bottom and coat sides of casserole dish with cooking spray. Arrange shrimp on bottom evenly and bake at 400f for 10-12 minutes until shrimp are pink. Serve with a side salad.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Rinse chicken under cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Season with salt and pepper. Rub butter all over chicken inside and out.
