Place chicken skin side down on rack of roasting pan or large baking dish. Tuck herbs under skin. Pour lemon juice over chicken. Roast for 2 1/2 hours or until chicken is no longer pink at thickest part of thigh. Let chicken stand 10 minutes before carving to let juices redistribute throughout meat. Serve with steamed vegetables or rice.

To make the pie crustPreheat the oven to 375f. Cream together the shortening and brown sugar until it is light and fluffy. Sift together the flour, cocoa powder, and saltadd it to the sugar mixture. Stir together until it forms a doughchill it for an hour. On a lightly floured surface roll the dough out to 1/8 inch thickness. Transfer the dough to a pie platerefrigerate it for 15 minutes or until it is firm. Roll out the cookie dough to 1/4 inch thickness and cut it into 1/4 inch wide strips. Place the strips over the pie crust. Refrigerate the pie for 15 minutesbake it until the edges are firm to the touch 8 to 10 minutes. To make the ice creamcombine the creamy peanut butter with the honeyrefrigerate it for 1 hour until it is firm enough to spread onto the piespread it onto the pie crust. Top it with the ice creamcover it with the cookie

Preheat the grill. Cook the potato shreds as if they were hash browns until they are lightly browned. Drain on paper towel and put in a bowl. Cut carrots into thin pieces or use carrot sticks if you prefer. Cut green onions into thin pieces or use green onion slices if you prefer. Chop sun-dried tomatoes into small pieces or use whole sun-dried tomatoes if you prefer. Break goat cheese into small pieces or use whole goat cheese if you prefer. Combine all the cooked vegetables into a bowl with goat cheese. In another bowl, beat eggs lightly and add some salt and black pepper to taste. Place potato shreds and vegetables on a tortilla, then top with 2 slices of goat cheese. Fold tortilla into a triangle and place on grill for about 3-4 minutes on each side or until lightly browned. Serve hot or cold. Serves 4-5.
Combine all ingredients in blender or food processor. Blend thoroughly. Spread on top of small rounds. Garnish with cucumber slices and dill. Serve with crackers or on miniature sourdough rolls.
Mix all together. Place in a small serving dish. Chill for 2-3 hours. Serve cold.

Bring the chicken broth and mushrooms to a boil. In a blender or food processor add the spinach and the parmesan cheese and blend. Stir the spinach mixture into the mushroom and broth mixture. Continue cooking over medium heat. When the mixture is ready season it with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Lightly toast bread slices on both sides. Brush bread slices with oil. Layer on top of bread 2 slices of tomato, 1/2 slice of mozzarella cheese. Add 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes. Top each slice of tomato with 1 tsp of pesto sauce. Add a slice of mozzarella cheese. Add another slice of tomato. Add 1 tsp of pesto sauce. Add another slice of mozzarella cheese. Top off each panini with a slice of fresh red tomato. Place panini on a preheated grill for 5 minutes on each side or until the cheese is melted. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Trim peppers and discard seeds. Place peppers in a jar with vinegar and stir in garlic. Add remaining ingredients and seal jar. Allow to stand in a cool place for 3 days. Taste and season with salt and pepper if necessary. Can be used as a relish or on a cheese tray.
Wash and drain peas. Combine with remaining ingredients. Mix well. Chill several hours. Garnish with chopped parsley.

Pierce sweet potatoes several times with a fork and place on a baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 45 minutes or until tender. Remove from oven and allow potatoes to cool. Remove the peel and cut the sweet potatoes into small cubes. In a large bowl combine brown sugar, bourbon and butter. Whisk until smooth. Add vanilla and whisk again. Add the sweet potatoes and toss with a fork. Pour mixture into a greased 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with the cinnamon and nutmeg. Bake for about 45 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm. Serves 12.

Cut ciabatta loaves into bite-sized pieces. Drizzle with olive oil and bake until golden brown. In large bowl, toss tomatoes with cucumber and olives. Top with balsamic vinegar. Place half of the croutons in the bottom of salad bowl. Top with tomato mixture and the remaining croutons. Sprinkle with chopped basil. Serve immediately.
Combine all the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Serve immediately with tortilla chips or fajitas.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Boil spaghetti until tender. Drain. In large bowl, stir together 2 cups spaghetti, ricotta cheese, soup & broth. Place into an 8x8-inch glass baking dish. Top with remaining spaghetti. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 30 minutes or until heated through.

Heat butter and olive oil in large skillet over medium heat until butter melts and foams. Add shallot and cook until translucent. Stir in the rice and cook for one minute stirring frequently. Stir in squash and green beans and cook until squash begins to soften stirring frequently for about five minutes. Add thyme and sage and cook for one minute stirring frequently until fragrant. Add the water or broth and bring to a boil stirring occasionally until liquid is absorbed. Stir in the cheese and continue cooking for one minute until cheese is melted stirring occasionally. Add salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste and serve over rice and garnish with chopped parsley.

Combine zucchini and water. Boil for 10 minutes. Add sugar and lemon juice and cook until thickened. Add pineapple and apricot gelatin and cook for another 2 minutes. Remove from heat and cool. Pour into airtight containers. Store in the refrigerator.

Preheat broiler to high broil. Drizzle oil in 9-inch broiler pan. Broil 15 to 20 minutes or until done. Meanwhile, in small saucepan over medium heat, saute diced butter and rosemary in 1/2 cup wine until liquid evaporates. Whisk in remaining wine and boil 1 minute. Pour sauce over pork. Sprinkle pepper over top and broil 1 to 2 minutes longer or until sauce is bubbly and thickened slightly and pork is browned. Serve immediately.
Mix together mayonnaise, parmesan cheese, garlic, wheatables crackers. Put mixture into serving bowl. Garnish with sliced green onions. Serve with crackers or raw vegetables.
Drain banana slices and place in bowl. Add vanilla wafer crumbs and cool whip. Cover with pudding and drizzle with condensed milk. Chill before serving.

Slice pot roast into 1/2-inch thick slices. Sprinkle flour over meat and brown in oil. Add potatoes and onion and brown for about 30 minutes. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and simmer for about 2 hours or until meat is tender. Serve.

Heat a large pot of salted water to boiling. Cook linguini until tender. Drain well. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and saut until translucent. Add garlic and saut for 1 minute more. Add spinach to pan. Cook until spinach begins to wilt. Add flour, stirring constantly to cook for 30 seconds. Add milk gradually, stirring constantly. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add linguine to pan and toss. Add Gorgonzola. Top with Parmesan.

Prepare pasta according to package directionscook for 8-10 minutes. Drainrinse with hot water to cool slightly. Return to pot. Meanwhile, heat olive oil and butter together over medium heat. Add garlic and sausagescook until garlic is fragrant and sausages are browned. Draindiscard garlic. Add broccoli rabe and broth to pot. Cook for 15 minutes. Add cooked pasta to pot. Season with salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Transfer to plates. Sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease an 9x5x3 inch loaf pan (23x13x7 cm) or cast iron skillet (23x13x7 cm). Cut an 'X' across the bottom of each onion half lengthwise to create 4 'legs'. Place half of onions in prepared pan. Place remaining half of onions, cut side down, over onions. Rub onions with softened butter. In a medium bowl, combine flours and saltmake a well in center of flour mixture. Stir yeast into milkpour into well of flour mixture. Stir until smoothbeat until frothy. Add eggs and butter to yeast mixturebeat until smooth. Stir flour mixture into yeast mixture. Stir until dough is shaggyturn out onto lightly floured surface. Knead until smoothknead an additional 5 to 7 minutes or until dough is smooth and elastic. Place dough in prepared pancover with greased plastic wrap. Let stand in warm place until doubled in

Pour 4 cups water into a large saucepan. Add 1/2 tsp of salt and the rice. Cover and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and cook 15 minutes, or until the rice is tender and all the liquid is absorbed. Turn off the heat and let stand 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Place rice in a large bowl. Add the remaining 1/4 tsp of salt and the oil. Stir well to combine.

Cut pineapple in half, length wise. Using a sharp knife cut out the core leaving about 1/2 inch from the edge all the way around the pineapple. Remove the pineapple skin from the core, then cut the pineapple lengthwise to make four sections. Cut the pineapple sections in half so that you have two halves from the original pineapple. Drain the pineapple in a colander for 1/2 hour to remove excess juice. In a saucepan over low heat, combine brown sugar, maple syrup and cinnamon stick, stirring until sugar dissolves. Brush the pineapple slices with maple mixture. Put pineapple sections on a lightly oiled grill or barbecue grate over medium-hot coals, turning frequently until tender. (About 15 minutes.) Remove from grill to a serving platter. Serve warm or at room temperature with whipped cream. (Note: If you do not have a grill, bake the pineapple in a 350-degree oven for 30 minutes or until tender.)

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine the salmon fillets with the orange slices in a baking dish. Sprinkle evenly with sage. Drizzle evenly with the garlic-infused butter. Bake for 10 minutes or until salmon is done. Serve.

In a large bowl stir together milk and vanilla extract. In a large saucepan combine the milk mixture with the sugar-free pudding mix and splenda. Cook over medium-low heat stirring constantly until thickened about 2 minutes. Serve hot or cold with a dash of nutmeg.

Combine dried kidney beans with enough water to cover. Bring to boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer for about an hour or until tender. Drain. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute onions until tender. Add garliccook for about 30 seconds. Add tomato sauce, brown sugar, smoked paprika, cinnamon and chipotle peppers. Cook for about 5 minutes. Add drained beansstir well. Covercook for about 5 minutes. Remove from heatstir in soy sauce. Yields about 4 servings.

Remove and discard any wilted leaves from head of cabbage. Cut cabbage in half lengthwise. Cut cabbage in half again, crosswise. Place in a large bowl and add water. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from refrigerator and drain water from cabbage. Cut cabbage into 1 inch pieces and place in a large saucepan with a lid. Cover and simmer cabbage for about 1/2 hour. Remove cabbage from pan and drain water from pan into sink. Place cabbage in pan and add butter and lemon juice. Bring mixture to a boil and then reduce heat and simmer for about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and add dill weed. Cover and refrigerate overnight.

Cut carrots into thin strips (you can use a vegetable peeler or a knife) and mix with lemon juice, sugar, salt and soy sauce. Stir in sesame oil and parsley. Serve immediately or refrigerate for several hours. Serve at room temperature as a side dish or toss with cooked rice as a main dish salad.

Wash and dry cucumbers. Dice onions and place in a large bowl with the cucumbers. Sprinkle with salt. Pour vinegar and sugar over the cucumbers. Stir in celery seeds and mustard seeds. Place in sterilized jars and screw on lids. Add alum. Store in the refrigerator for 2 weeks before using. The pickles can be refrigerated for up to a year.
Add mint leaves to a glassadd sugarstir to dissolve sugar. Add ice and teatop off glass with bourbonstir gently to combine. Add lemongarnish with a mint sprig. Serve immediately.

Wash asparagus well and trim off the bottoms (where the asparagus comes out from the stalk). If using tougher asparagus, trim off the woody tips. Cut asparagus into 1-inch pieces. Warm 2 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add asparagus in batches so that they don t overcrowd the pan (you may need to do this in 2 batches). Cook until asparagus is tender (about 5 minutes). Sprinkle asparagus with salt and pepper. Transfer asparagus to a serving dish and keep warm. Add 2 tbsp olive oil to the same skillet over medium heat. Add fresh tarragon leaves and cook until fragrant (about 30 seconds). Add fresh parsley leaves. Cook until fragrant (about 30 seconds). Remove from the heat and stir in the lemon rind and juice. Keep warm in the skillet until ready to serve the asparagus. Serve the asparagus topped with the tarragon sauce.

Place frozen corn in a large sauce pan with just enough water to cover the corn. Bring the corn mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook for about 25 minutes or until the corn is tender. Drain the corn well. Put corn in a food processor or blender and blend until smooth. In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Whisk in the cornstarch and then the milk. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring frequently until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in the whipping cream until well blended. Add the hot corn mixture to the milk mixture, blend well and then season with salt, cayenne pepper, sugar and parmesan cheese. Continue blending until smooth. Serve hot with crackers or as a side dish with chicken or fish.

Cut bacon in half crosswise and place in medium skillet. Cook over medium heat 5 minutes or until bacon is crisp, turning occasionally. Transfer bacon pieces to paper towels to drain. Reserve 1/2 cup bacon drippings in skillet. Add onions to drippings in skilletcook 4 minutes or until tender. Add venison and cook 10 minutes or until browned, stirring frequently. Drain off excess fat and transfer venison mixture to bowl. Add remaining drippings to skilletcook 1 minute or until skillet is hot. Whisk eggs with remaining cornstarch and 1/2 cup water until smooth. Stir in sugar. Heat in skillet 1 minute or until mixture begins to thicken. Add venison mixture and stir gently until smooth. Spoon mixture into muffin cups. Sprinkle with seasoning salt. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20 minutes or until set.

Cut chicken into bite sized pieces and add to large sauce pan. Add bell pepper and onion and saut until tender. Add tomato and continue to saut until tender. Add ranch dressing mix and mayonnaise. Cook for about 3 to 4 minutes. Add macaroni and cook for about 10 minutes. Serve chilled.

Slice chicken breasts in half. Season with salt and pepper. Heat margarine in a large skillet. When hot, place chicken breasts in skillet. Cook until golden brown, about 4 minutes each side. Pour sour cream over chicken in skillet. Covercook 2 minutes. Sprinkle chicken with cooking sherry. Covercook 2 minutes. Stir in cream of mushroom soup. Covercook 5 minutes.

Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add rice, salt and cinnamon stick and cook for 20 minutes over medium heat. Stir in milk. Simmer for 20 minutes more or until liquid is absorbed. Transfer to a serving bowl or individual bowlssprinkle with sugar to taste. Serve warm or cold. 4 servings.

Melt butter and brown sugar in a saucepan over low heatstirring constantly until the mixture is smooth and the sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Sift flour, baking powder and salt together into another mixing bowl. Add the cooled butter mixture and stir until combined. Add eggs and beat until smooth and fluffy. Stir in toffee and pecans and chill 20 minutes. Roll dough into balls about 2 inches in diameter and roll balls in toffee pieces and pecans to coat. Place balls on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees for 15-18 minutes until edges of bars are light brown. Remove from oven and let cool completely before cutting into 16 bars.
Mix all ingredients together.

Soak beans over night and drain. Place beans in large soup pot with enough water to cover them. Bring to boil then reduce heat and simmer until beans are tender (approximately 2 hours). In the meantime, cook onion in broth in a large non-stick skillet until softened. Remove from heat and add spices and cocoa. Stir well. Add beans to the pot and stir until well blended. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with tortillas or over rice.

Slice salmon fillets and season with black pepper and salt. Melt butter and saute onions until transparent. Remove from heat. Mix together tomatoes, onions and sliced mozzarella cheese. Spread onto salmon fillets and top with sun-dried tomatoes. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until fish flakes with a fork. Serve with rice or pasta.

Clean pork chops and cut in half lengthwise. Sprinkle pork with salt and pepper. In a large skillet brown pork in hot vegetable oil. Drain pork. In a large saucepan combine the remaining ingredients and heat until hot and bubbly. Pour the sauce over the pork and heat through. Serve with rice and green beans.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Stir all of the dry ingredients into a large bowl and make a well in the center. Add the blueberry muffin mix and mix well. Place the cream cheese in a mixing bowl and cream with an electric mixer. Add the almond extract and cream until smooth. Stir in the granulated sugar and lemon juice. Add the beaten egg and blend well. Add the muffin mixture and mix well. Spray a loaf pan with cooking spray. Pour batter into pan and bake for one hour. When done, remove from the pan and cool.

Peel lemons and cut into wedges. Add salt, onions, cider vinegar, ground mixed spice to taste. Add raisins. Bring to boiling point. Remove from heat. Add mustard seeds. Cover. Let stand for 10 minutes. Stir and serve warm or cold.

Prepare the batter according to the recipe below. Spray a 13 x 9-inch baking dish with nonstick spray, then sprinkle the bottom with flour and shake out excess flour. Pour the batter into the prepared dish. Bake for 25 minutes, or until the edges are set and a knife inserted in the middle comes out clean. Cool in the dish for 15 minutes before removing and cooling completely on a wire rack. While the bars are cooling, melt the chocolate in a double boiler over hot (not boiling) water and stir until smooth. Once the bars have cooled completely, dip each bar in the chocolate and sprinkle with candy sprinkles.

Place meatballs in a slow cooker, add beef broth and diced tomatoes with tomato sauce. Add vegetables, onion and garlic powder. Cook on low for about 8 hours until meatballs are tender and vegetables are soft. Serve over egg noodles and top with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 375f. Mix sugar and butter in a large bowl until crumbly. Add pears and toss to coat. Put pears in 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes until pears are tender. While pears are baking prepare carmel sauce. Add brown sugar and corn syrup to a large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add the whipping cream. Stir until thickened. Pour sauce over baked pears. Bake for 10 minutes. Let cool.

Cream the butter and brown sugar in a bowl with the electric mixer until light. Add the vanilla extract. Beat in the eggs one at a time, mixing well. Stir in the flour mixture until just mixed. Fold in the chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350f for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Makes 5 dozen.

1. In a heavy bottom saucepan boil the milk. Add the badam powder and let it boil for about 4 to 5 minutes. Take off the heat and let it cool for about 15 minutes. 2. Add the condensed milk and continue boiling for another 4 to 5 minutes. Remove the badam mixture from heat and allow it to cool completely. 3. Place the bread in a blender and blend for about 15 to 20 seconds. Add the bread to the badam mixture and blend again for about 15 to 20 seconds. Let the mixture sit overnight in the refrigerator until the next day. Transfer the mixture to an ice cream maker and process it for about 15 to 18 minutes. Transfer the kulfi to the container and freeze it for at least one hour before serving it.

Heat oil and garlic clove in a saucepan and add red pepper flakes and stir for a few seconds. Stir in couscous and add a little water, stirring gently. Cook until liquid is absorbed and couscous is tender. Stir in wine and heat through stirring occasionally. Sprinkle capers over couscous and serve immediately with a drizzle of oil and a squeeze of lemon juice.

In large bowl, dissolve the jell-o in 1 cup boiling water. Add the cranberry sauce. Mix well. Add crushed pineapple and the remaining juices. Fold in the walnuts. Mix well. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours. In another large bowl, layer the lettuce leafs and cool whip. Spoon cranberry mixture over the cool whip. Sprinkle with walnuts. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve.
Mix dry ingredients. Add skim milk. Stir until combined. Pour into baking dish. Sprinkle fruit over cobbler. Bake at 400 degrees for about 30 minutes.

Heat oven to 200C/400F/gas 6. Roll out pastry to make a double thickness, cut into a circle large enough to fit into a pie dish and press into dish to form a rough edge. Prick with fork all over. Spread apple pie filling over pastry, then spoon peach slices around edge of pie. Sprinkle with sugar. Bake for 55-65 mins or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbling. Allow to cool slightly then dust with caster sugar. Serve with double cream.

Sautee the noodles in the oil and corn until tender. Add the cream of onion soup and stir to coat the noodles. Add the cooked meat and the green peppers. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 min.

Boil asparagus in salted water for 5 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain well, reserving 1/4 cup cooking liquid. In large skillet heat olive oil over medium heatsauté onion and garlic in oil until tender, stirring occasionally. Add hamcook over medium heat until heated through and browned on all sides. Add reserved cooking liquid and asparagussimmer 2 minutes or until asparagus is tender-crisp. Add tagliatelle pasta to boiling salted watercook according to package directions. Drain wellrinse with cold waterdrain again. Add ham mixture to pastatoss to coat. Drizzle with heavy creamtoss gently to coat. Sprinkle with parsleygarnish with additional parmesan cheese if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Toast bread lightly. Spread mayonnaise over one slice and spread prepared mustard over another slice. Add bacon to one slice of bread, then top with tomatoes & lettuce. Add salami to another slice of bread and top with american cheese slices. Sandwich the two together with the mayo side facing outward & the mustard side facing inward. Cut in half before serving.

Melt butter. Add pecans and stir until pecans are coated with butter. Add creme de menthe and stir until smooth. Add shortening and mix until smooth. Drop by tablespoon onto waxed paper. Roll balls of dough to about 1 inch in diameter. Place 1 inch apart and press together. Roll with a rolling pin. Melt chocolate chips and add to pecans. Roll again. Place on waxed paper until ready to serve. Makes about 3 dozen. Serve with powdered sugar.

Trim asparagus ends and blanch asparagus in boiling water for 1 minutedrain and cool under cold water. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with seasoning salt and peppertoss to coat. Place asparagus in an 11" x 7" baking dish and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake in a 375F degree oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until heated through and cheese is browned and bubbly.

Combine the mutton, bacon, beef broth in a large pot. Cook the meat until tender. Remove the meat from the broth. Discard the fat from the meat. Cut the meat into 1/2 inch cubes. Heat the oil in a large soup pot. Add the onion, celery and carrot. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the meat back into the pot. Add the beans. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 30-40 minutes. Add the tomato paste. Stir to combine. Cook for 5 more minutes. Taste for seasoning. Add more broth if you like it thin. Serve with crusty bread.

Place butter in small skillet over medium heat until butter meltsstir in onion, dried apricot & raisinscook over low heat for 1 minute or until softened. Stir in brothcook for 1 minute. Transfer mixture to slow cookerstir in chicken. Cover slow cookercook on low for 6 hours or until chicken is tender. Stir in cinnamon and ricecovercook on low for 1 hour or until rice is tenderstir in parsley.

Combine wild rice mix with 1 cup water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer 30 minutes. Drain well. Melt butter in a large saucepan. Add celery and onion. Cook 2 minutes. Add wild rice mixture, soy sauce, 3 cups water, stuffing mix, chicken and 1 1/2 cups chicken broth. Heat through. Pour into a 3 quart casserole. Top with cooked chicken. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until heated through.

In a medium bowl, beat together eggs, half-and-half, sugar, nutmeg, vanilla extract and rum extract. Dip slices of french toast in batter. Place in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until browned on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Dust with powdered sugar. Serve with maple syrup.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl, whisk the eggs and salt until frothy. In a medium bowl, whisk the butter and light corn syrup until smooth. Add the brown sugar and vanilla and whisk until well combined. Add the eggs to the butter mixture and whisk until smooth. Pour the filling into the unbaked pie shell. Sprinkle the pecans on top of the pie. Bake for about 15 minutes or until the pie is set. Let the pie cool for 15 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. Heat broccoli in a saucepan 3 minutes. Stir in soup mix. Cook 5 minutes. Combine cream cheese and sour cream. Add soup mixture and cook 5 minutes. Stir in broccoli and cook until hot. Add water chestnuts and cook 5 more minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve.

Melt the butter over medium heat and add the celery and onion and saute until translucent. Add the turkey and saute until hot. Add water and gravy mix and stir until dissolved. Stir in the milk and flour and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 2 minutes or until thickened slightly. Season with the salt. Makes about 1-1/2 cups of turkey gravy.
Cream butter and cheese together. Mix in cayenne pepper. Form into 20 balls. Roll balls in flour. Roll balls in rice krispies. Melt chocolate chips and drizzle over balls.

In large frying pan or cast iron skillet, heat peanut oil over medium-high heat to 350 degrees. Sprinkle generously with salt and ground black pepper. Season with coriander and ground cumin. Add beef to pan and stir occasionally until brown on all sides. Add garlic to pan. Stir occasionally until garlic is lightly browned. Add molasses and dark brown sugar. Stir occasionally to combine. Add water to pan to achieve desired consistency (about 1/2 cup). Once water is added, place lid on frying pan or cast iron skillet to cook meat until tender (about 30 minutes). Serve with lime wedges on side.

Remove all visible bones from the trout fillet. Set aside. In small bowl, combine flour with lemon rind, dried thyme, salt, and pepper to taste. Dip trout fillet into flour mixture, coating completely with flour mixture. Place fillet skin side down into heated oil to coat both sides. Remove from oil when golden brown. Drain fillet on paper towels. Place fillet in bowl with lemon juice and allow to marinate while finishing other side of fillet. Place fillet skin side up into heated oil to coat both sides again. Remove from oil when golden brown. Drain fillet on paper towels again. Place fillet on serving dish and drizzle with pan juices from cooking. Serve with lemon wedges on side.

Slice deli roast beef thinly. Add pesto sauce. Mix all of the ingredients together and serve on a sandwhich. You can make a pesto sauce from scratch and add some garlic or other herbs. If you'd like, you can also add some fresh basil. You can use store bought pesto also.

Place pork in a large roasting tin and season with sea salt & black pepper. In a small bowl, combine red wine, coriander seeds & olive oil. Pour over meat & rub in. Cover & roast in oven at 180c/350f/gas 4 for 20minutes. Uncover & baste with juices from roasting tin. Return to oven & cook until meat is cooked through (for medium rare meat is cooked through to a temperature of 60c/140f/gas 2). Serve with seasonal vegetables.

Bring the water to boil in a sauce pan. Add the rice to the boiling water. Cook for 10 minutes. Drain the water from the rice. Melt the butter in the saucepan. Add the rice to the butter. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in the green onions. Add salt & pepper to taste. Stir in the garlic salt. Cook for 2 minutes. Turn the heat to low. Stir the rice. Cover the rice. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir the rice. Cook for 5 minutes. Turn the heat off. Cover the rice. Let the rice sit covered for 10 minutes. Fluff with fork. Serve.

Preheat grill to medium heat and lightly grease grates with cooking spray. Place salmon fillets (skin side down) on grill. Grill for 5-7 minutes or until salmon is opaque throughout. Remove salmon from grill and place salmon fillets (skin side down) on a plate. Brush with the lime butter sauce and place under broiler for 3 minutes. Remove from oven and top with cilantro. Serve with steamed broccoli and rice pilaf.

Season salmon fillets on both sides. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Place salmon fillets in skillet. Cook for about three minutes on each side. Meanwhile, wash and dry spinach. Place spinach in large bowl and toss with vinaigrette. Add goat cheese and pecans to spinach. Place cooked salmon on top of spinach. Serve immediately.

Bring milk and 1/2 cup water to a boil in large saucepan over medium heat. Gradually stir in flour, salt and pepper until blended and thickened. Stir in cheese and herbs until blended. Serve over pasta or rice or other cooked vegetables.

In a large pot of boiling salted water cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain well and return pasta to pot. Add garlic and oil to hot water and cook for 2 minutes. Add pasta to pot and toss to coat with garlic oil. Sprinkle with Parmesan and serve. Serve with your favorite salad and bread.

Combine first 6 ingredientspour over beef. Covercook on LOW 8-10 hours or until very tender and meat can be pierced with fork, basting occasionally and turning roast halfway through cooking time. Shred beefdiscard garlic cloves and onions. Serve on rolls with gravy from drippings.

Soak black beans overnight in a large bowl. Drain. Place black beans in a large stock pot. Add water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook for 45 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Add onions and cook until translucent. Add cream cheese and cook until melted. Add broth and cook 2 minutes. Add black beans, salt and pepper to taste. Cook 2 minutes more. Puree soup in a blender. Add sour cream and stir. Add chives.

Add water to a medium saucepan. Stir in the sugar. Add the cream of tartar and heat to boiling. Remove from the heat and stir in the crackers. Pour mixture into a pie shell. Let stand for 1 hour or until crackers absorb liquid. Pour the mixture into a small bowl and stir in the lemon juice. Combine the crumb mixture and brown sugar. Stir in the margarine. Sprinkle the mixture over the pie shell. Bake for 20 minutes. Let cool. Store in the refrigerator.

Peel and slice apple. Add apple to a 10-inch cast iron skillet. Add butter to skillet. Heat butter over medium heat until melted. Add honey to skillet. Bring to a boil. Stir in yogurt. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes or until apples are tender.

Slice a piece of bread into two slices. Spread some cream cheese on top of each piece of bread. Slice an avocado and put on top of cream cheese. Slice a jalapeno pepper and cut into small pieces. Put a few pieces of jalapeno on top of avocado and spread a little hot sauce. Repeat for each slice of toast and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken thighs on lightly greased baking sheets. In a small bowl, combine broth and lime juice. Pour over chicken. Sprinkle thyme over chicken. Bake chicken until done. Combine butter and garlic cloves. Melt butter over medium heat. Add instant rice. Cook 1 minute. Stir in chicken and juices. Season with pepper. Serve with chicken.

Slice the onion and bell peppers into thin strips. Cut the chicken into small pieces and chop the chicken into small pieces. Warm up a pan with a bit of oil in it. Place the chicken into the pan and cook for about 5 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Cool the chicken. In a bowl combine the barbecue sauce and the chicken. Stir to combine. Place the tortillas on a baking sheet. Spoon about a tablespoon or so of the barbecue sauce onto each tortillas. Place a strip of red and green bell pepper on each tortilla. Place a piece of the chicken on the top of the tortillas. Roll the tortillas up and place them in a baking dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and bake for about 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. In a medium saucepan combine the graham cracker crumbs with the butter. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon until the mixture is crumbly. Remove from heat. Add the sugar. Mix well with a wooden spoon. Add the applesauce. Mix well. Transfer to a greased 8-inch square baking dish. In a large bowl beat the eggs with a mixer on medium speed. Beat in the sweetened condensed milk and lemon juice until well blended. Beat in the graham cracker mixture. Pour over the prepared crumb layer. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

Cook beef and tomato sauce according to package directions. Stir in taco seasoning. Drain well and set aside to cool for 10 minutes. Cook noodles according to package directions, omitting salt and fat from cooking water. Drain well and set aside to cool for 10 minutes. Add noodles to beef mixture and combine well. Place mixture into a greased casserole dish. Top with cheese and bake according to package directions. Serve hot.

Rinse chicken breasts with water. Pat dry with paper towels. Combine all rub spices together. Place in a Ziploc bag with chicken breasts. Squeeze the bag until all spices are evenly mixed into the chicken. Place chicken in the middle of a sheet pan. Spread the chicken out in the pan. Pour olive oil evenly over the chicken and place pan in the oven. Bake for about 40 minutes. Baste every so often with the oil and spices. Let chicken rest for a few minutes before removing from pan. Serve with fresh veggies and rolls.

Remove excess fat from chicken quarters. Stir together first 5 ingredients. Rub spice mixture over chicken. Place chicken in slow cooker. Pour apricot jam over chicken. Stir together next 2 ingredients. Pour mustard mixture over chicken. Cook chicken on LOW heat setting for 8 hours. Remove chicken from slow cooker. Discard spice mixture. Transfer chicken to serving platter. Serve with mashed potatoes. Pairs well with roasted asparagus.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to package instructions. Drain. Meanwhile, in a large bowl whisk together the dressing mix and buttermilk. Stir in the tomatoes, cucumber, olives, basil, crab boil. Fold in the pasta. Add shrimp. Stir in the basil just before serving. Top with cheese if you like.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain, but reserve some of the pasta water. Heat butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sloppy joe meat and cook and stir until browned and no longer pink. Pour in tomatoes and green chilies. Cook and stir for 5 more minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low. Stir in pasta and pasta water. Heat until pasta is tender. Add cheesestir until melted.

Melt butter in large saucepan. Add onions and cook until translucent. Add rice and cook 2 minutes. Stir in broth and cook for 10 minutes. Cover and cook for 25 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in tomato and cook 5 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in cheese and cook 1 minute. Serve.

Brown ground beef with onion and bell pepper, drain fat. Mix breadcrumbs with milk, add seasonings to taste. In a large bowl, combine meat with breadcrumbs mixture. Shape patties. Pan fry patties with cooking oil or cook on grill or broiler.

In large skillet heat oil. Add bacon. Cook over medium heat until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Cut bacon into strips. In large ziplock bag combine salmon fillets and dressing. Add bacon and feta cheese. Place one piece of bacon in the bottom of each bag. Add salmon mixture. Close bags. Grill salmon about 10 minutes per side or until done. Serve with fresh tomatoes.

Combine all dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients and mix well. Pour batter onto a hot griddle or skillet. Cook until pancake begins to bubble. Turn with spatula. Cook until both sides are lightly browned. Serve with any favorite toppings.

Place the frozen pie crusts on a large tray and cover with plastic wrap to prevent them from drying out while you prepare the filling. Preheat the oven to 400f. In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine the raisins, brandy and mincemeat and cook for about 5 minutes or until the raisins plump. Remove from the heat and let cool slightly. In a medium mixing bowl, beat the apple and walnuts with the brown sugar and lemon rind and juice. Add the raisins and mincemeat mixture and stir to combine. Remove the plastic wrap from the pie crusts and cut out a piece from one side to allow for filling the pie crusts. Spoon the pie filling into the crusts and dot with butter. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown. Let cool completely before slicing and serving. (Note: If you are using two pie crusts, you can cut one of them in half and use it as a plate for the other one.)

Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Season venison with salt and black pepper. Add venison to pan and cook for 4-5 minutes per side for medium rare. Remove roast from pan and let rest for 5 minutes. Transfer roast to a platter. Slice into 1-inch thick pieces. Serve.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Place tenderloin pieces in a 9 x 13 casserole dish. Pour soup over pork. Cook for three to four hours. Let cool 15 minutes. Dice pork into 1/4 inch pieces. Return to casserole. Bake another 30 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes.
Saute the onion in the oil. Add the garlic. Add the kale. Add the pineapple. Add the peanut butter. Add the tabasco sauce. Add the cilantro. Add the salt and the pepper. Let it all cook.

To prepare the filling, brown beef in 1/2 cup of water over medium heat. Drain meat. Add rice and 1 cup of water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender. Drain. Place 1/4 cup of beef mixture in center of each tortilla. Top with 1/4 cup cheese. Roll up each tortilla. Place seam side down in an 11x7x2 baking dish. Pour salsa over rellenos. Top each relleno with 2 tablespoons of shredded cheese. In a small bowl, beat together eggs and 1/4 cup milk. Pour egg mixture over rellenos. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with additional cheese and bake until cheese melts and browns. Serve with sour cream and salsa if desired.

Place broth, bell pepper and onion into a 4-quart Dutch ovencook over medium heat until tender. Add salsa, taco seasoning, beans and garlicmix well. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Add chickenheat through. Spread about 1/4 cup of light cheese inside each tortillatop with 1/4 cup chicken mixture. Fold tortilla overplace seam side down onto a foil-lined baking sheet. Bake at 400 F for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with additional salsa if desired.

Prepare pineapple chunks according to package directions. Drain pineapple juice. In a large resealable bag, combine shrimp, pineapple chunks, bacon, red bell pepper, mushroom caps and cherry tomatoes. Add sweet and sour sauce. Seal bagturn to coat shrimp. Thread shrimp mixture alternately with bacon strips onto skewers. Grill over medium heat for about 6 minutes or until shrimp is done. Makes 4 servings.

In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook broccoli florets until tender-crisp, about 5 minutes. In a large pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add garlic powder, lemon-pepper seasoning, carrot, and broccoli florets. Cook until tender-crisp, about 3 minutes. Add cauliflower floretscook until tender-crisp, about 5 more minutes. Drain in a colanderpat dry with paper towels.

In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add broccoli and yellow peppercook 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Remove vegetables from skilletdrain on paper towels. In the same skillet, cook pork over medium-high heat 4 to 5 minutes or until done. Slice pork. Place broccoli mixture on 4 platestop with pork. Serve with cooked rice and sauce.

Unroll one can of crescent rolls. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Cut each roll into 12 triangles. Place 1-1/2 Tablespoons of ham into each triangle. Top with 1-1/2 Tablespoons of reduced-fat parmesan. Top with reduced-fat Swiss. Roll up each triangle. Place seams together. Place seams down on cookie sheet. Brush each pinwheel with melted butter. Sprinkle with remaining parmesan. Bake at 400 for 18-20 minutes.

Peel and quarter potatoes. Add enough water to cover the potatoes and bring them to a boil. Boil for 30 minutes. Drain and cool. Cut eggs in half. Slice potatoes into bite-size pieces and place in a large bowl. Mix pickle relish and mayonnaise. Add sweet pickle relish and pickle relish and mix well. Add celery seeds and salt and pepper. Mix all together. Chill for at least two hours. Add potatoes and eggs. Mix well. Add mustard and vinegar and mix well. Chill for one hour. Serve.

Wash peppers. Remove stems, seeds and membranes from hot banana peppers. Place peppers in hot water with canning salt for 15 minutes until soft. Drain water and rinse peppers with cold water. Place peppers into clean jars with the vinegar mixture (1/2 cup vinegar to 2 cups water). Seal jars. Refrigerate for two weeks before using. These can be used as a spread on sandwiches or as an addition to salads or pasta dishes for extra flavor. Use as you would regular hot banana peppersthey are very mild but have lots of flavor.

Remove sausage from casings and crumble. Brown sausage in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Drain fat. Add broth to skillet and bring to a simmer. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add pasta to broth. Cook until tender. Stir in basil and pepper. Remove from heat. Top with crumbled sausage.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and carrots and sauté for 1 minute. Add chicken broth and bring to boil. Reduce heat and cook for 10 minutes or until vegetables are softened and mixture is clear. Use an immersion blender to puree mixture in pan, or transfer to blender or food processor in batches and puree to desired consistency. Add half and half and sour cream and return to saucepan and heat through. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve with a dollop of sour cream and a drizzle of chives and crumbled bacon if desired.

Brown chicken with oil and season with salt and fresh ground pepper. Drain. Shred chicken with two forks. Cook broccoli with oil until tender. Drain. Melt butter with chicken broth and milk. Add chicken broth with milk. Add shredded chicken. Cook for 2 minutes over low heat. Stir together. Add shredded parmesan cheese. Add cream of mushroom soup with milk. Add shredded chicken. Cook for another minute. Add cooked broccoli. Stir together. Serve over cooked pasta.
Combine all the ingredients in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat, simmer for five minutes.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees fahrenheit. Prepare a large baking tray by greasing it with cooking spray. Peel and cut the potatoes into thin wedges. Place them on the prepared tray and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with the breadcrumbs and season with the paprika and the spice blend. Toss to coat. Roast until the wedges are crisp and browned and tender, about 35 minutes. Serve hot.

Melt butter over low heat. Stir in cocoa and milk. Stir constantly until cocoa is dissolved. Remove from heat. Add the rest of the ingredients. Pour into a greased pan and refrigerate until cool. Cut into squares when cool.

Pour milk into two small mugs. Add a teaspoonful of creamy peanut butter to each. Drizzle with a little bit of honey. Place two marshmallows in each mug. Microwave for 30 seconds on high. Stir and continue to microwave for another 15 seconds. Watch carefully. Do not overcook. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Cut a hole in the middle of each quick-cooking yellow cake mix package. Set aside 1 cake mix per package and stir remaining together to form a dry mixture (add cinnamon if desired). Melt 1/2 stick of butter into 1 cup brown sugar with cinnamon. Spread into the bottom of the greased baking dish. Set aside 1/2 cup of the brown sugar mixture to spread on top of the cake mixture. In a large bowl combine the apples with the remaining brown sugar mixture. Add the cake mixture to the applesmix well. Fold the prepared quick-cooking yellow cake mix into the apple mixture by hand. Press the quick-cooking yellow cake mix into an even layer on top of the applessmooth with a spatula. Sprinkle with the 1/2 cup of brown sugar mixture to make a crunchy toppingsmooth with a spatula. Cut the butterscotch chips into pieces

Saute onion and pepper until tender. Set aside. Add hash brown potatoes to pan. Saute until tender. Set aside. Add mushrooms to pan. Saute until tender. Set aside. In a large bowl, mix cottage cheese with milk. Add eggs. Whisk together. Add salt pepper to taste. Stir into hash brown mixture. Pour into 2 quart baking dish. Top with ham. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 30 minutes.

Cut the beef into 1/2-inch cubes. Place the beef cubes in a large bowl. Add the oyster sauce, sherry wine and soy sauce. Mix well. Place the mixture in a large pot. Add the cornstarch mixture to the beef. Stir well. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent the mixture from sticking to the pan. Add the green onions and ginger. Cook for 10 more minutes. Season with salt to taste. Remove from heat. Let the mixture stand for 10 minutes. Serve with rice.

Put a large saucepan over medium heat and add enough oil to coat the bottom of the pan. Brown the pork chops in the oil. Remove from pan and set aside. In the same oil, sauté the green pepper and red pepper. Add the chicken broth, vinegar, brown sugar and cornstarch to the pan. Whisk constantly until the mixture thickens. Add the pineapple chunks and cooked rice. Put the pork chops back into the pan and cook for about 2 minutes or until the pork chops are done to your liking. Serve hot with rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease a casserole dish with olive oil. Cut the sandwich bread into small cubes. Toss the bread cubes with the parmesan cheese, parsley, olive oil, garlic, salt & pepper. Place the bread cubes in the prepared casserole dish. Cut the cherry tomatoes in half. Add the tomatoes to the casserole dish. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Place chicken breasts in a shallow dish. Sprinkle each with 1/2 teaspoon olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Heat a large grill pan over medium-high heat until hot. Grill chicken until no longer pink in center, 5 7 minutes per side. Meanwhile, cut apple into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Sprinkle each side with 1/2 teaspoon olive oil. Grill until lightly browned, 1 2 minutes per side. Grill cheddar until browned in places. Arrange a piece of cheddar on each slice of bread. Top each with a slice of grilled apple. Top each sandwich with a piece of grilled chicken. Serve with butter.

1. Prepare lamb by removing the rib bones from the racks of lamb. Sprinkle lamb with salt and pepper. 2. Heat oil over medium high heat in a large frying pan until shimmery. Add lamb to pan and sear for 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a baking dish. 3. In a small saucepan over medium heat combine lemon juice, juice of 1 lemon (reserve rind), garlic cloves and fennel seed. Bring to a simmerremove from heat. Whisk in honey until dissolvedpour over lamb. Cover pan tightly with foil and bake for 30 minutes or until lamb is cooked to desired doneness. 4. Transfer lamb to a cutting boardlet stand 10 minutes before slicing. Serve sliced lamb over rice or potatoesgarnish with lemon slices and fennel seeds.

Take the tortilla and put about 1/3 of the lobster meat in the middle. Put a tablespoon of yogurt, salsa fresca and guacamole on top. Fold up the tortilla. Add cabbage and the corn on top. Drizzle with lime juice. Serve with lime. You can add salsa on top if you would like. I think the lime juice adds a nice zest and the flavor of the lobster is enough.

Remove woody stems from asparagus and cut into 1/2 inch pieces. Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium high heat. Add asparagus and saut until tender (about 4 minutes). Add pepper and balsamic vinegar to asparagus and saut for 2 minutes more.

Put egg yolks and lemon juice in blender. Blend on medium-high speed until thick and foamy. (this should take about a minute or less). Add the butter and blend on high until thick and fluffy. Add salt and pepper. Pour over hot biscuits or use with poached eggs.

Preheat oven to degrees. In a medium bowl, cream together butter and sugars. Beat in eggs and vanilla extract. In a large bowl sift together flour, baking soda and salt. Gradually stir in flour mixture. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for approximately minutes.

In a large pot of boiling water, cook potatoes until tender. Drain well then return to pot to keep warm. Place potatoes back in hot pot with 1/2 cup of the butter. Mash potatoes with a potato masher until they are creamy. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup of butter until well blended. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately with basil leaves for garnish.

In the bottom of the crockpot combine onions, garlic cloves, jalapeno pepper, ginger root and tomato paste. Stir in madras curry powder. Add one can of mango chutney and 3 cups of chicken broth. Place boneless skinless chicken breasts in crockpot. Cover and cook for 8 hours on low. Serve with brown rice.

In a medium bowl beat egg with sugar, add butter, vanilla and cocoa powder. Beat at medium speed with an electric mixer until light in color (about three minutes). In a large bowl beat egg mixture with instant espresso powder and flour until smooth. Add milk in a steady stream beating just until incorporated. Pour batter into a greased and floured 12-cup bundt pan or 12 regular muffin cups. (If using regular muffin cups, be sure to grease cups well). Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 20 minutes or until a tester comes out clean. Let stand in pan for five minutes before removing from pan. Invert onto wire rack and cool completely. For decorating, mix together confectioners' sugar and cocoa powder for a dusting effect. Dust on top of cooled cupcakes or on top of pan. (If using cupcakes you can drizzle liqueur over cooled cupcakes before dusting with cocoa powder.)
Mix together the beef and the milk and simmer for about 40 minutes. Add flour and salt and pepper. Simmer for about 10 more minutes. Pour over slices of bread and enjoy.

In a small saucepan heat the butter over medium heat until the foam subsides. Add the sweet onion and cook until softened (about 5 minutes). Then add the apple, white wine, chicken stock and cream. Bring to a boil over medium heat and then reduce heat to a simmer. Cook the soup for 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Fold the blue cheese into the soup until completely blended. Serve hot with a sprinkle of apple over the top. Makes 4 cups of soup.

Wash baby carrots under cold water. Slice each carrot lengthwise. Then slice into smaller pieces. Place in small bowl. Add sugar and salt to taste. Drizzle lemon juice over carrots. Add pepper to taste. Add butter to carrots. Stir to coat. Serve.

Cook bacon in a large skillet until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet and crumble. Stir in onions and cook until tender. Stir in tomatoes and their juices and cook until most of the liquid is gone. Stir in cooked pasta and 1/2 cup parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat until sauce is hot. Add cream and stir until melted. Stir in parsley. Serve immediately.

Clean and trim artichoke hearts and chop into small pieces. Stir together olive oil and seasoning salt and then add to artichoke hearts. Add basil and tomatoes and mix well. Put sourdough baguette on a baking sheet and spread artichoke mixture on top of baguette. Drizzle baguette lightly with olive oil and sprinkle with pepper. Bake in a preheated 350 oven for about 10-12 minutes or until baguette is golden and the toppings are heated through.
Mix mayonnaise and worcestershire sauce. Add yellow mustard. Slice onion and add to mixture. Put chicken thighs in mixture. Let marinade over night. Grill on medium heat for about 12 minutes.

Cut 2 or 3 ripe bananas in half lengthwise. Arrange them in a medium bowl. Sprinkle with sugar. Add 1/2 cup coconut milk. Stir well. Add salt. Pour remaining coconut milk into a large glass bowl or baking dish. Cover tightly with plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. When bananas are cold and coconut milk is well chilled, remove bananas. Dip in coconut milk and eat. (Recipe courtesy of Cook's Illustrated magazine)

Heat oil in a large sauce pan. Add chipotle chiles, garlic cloves and pine nuts. Stir well. When the garlic is golden brown and the pine nuts are light brown add the parmesan cheese. Stir until cheese is melted.
Cover pretzels with warm water. Stir in ranch dressing mix and let stand 5 min. Coat pretzels in seasoning. Bake 5 minutes. Coat with olive oil. Serve warm.

In a large omelet pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add eggs and whisk until foamy. Stir in tomatoes and spinach. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until eggs are almost set. Sprinkle with feta and walnuts and cook until set. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Wash cauliflower and pat dry with paper towels. Cut cauliflower into florets and place on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and fresh ground pepper. Bake for 30-40 minutes until golden brown. Sprinkle with red pepper flakes and lemon wedge before serving.

Preheat oven to 350f. Peel and core peaches and cut into 1/2 inch thick slices. Place peaches in a large bowl. Mix sugar and flour together and sprinkle evenly over peaches. Dot with butter. Place peaches in a 2-quart baking dish. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Sprinkle oats and cinnamon over peaches. Bake an additional 10 to 15 minutes. Serve warm.

In a large skillet over medium heat cook onions and apples in butter until tender. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a slow cooker. Add chicken pieces and cook until cooked through. In a small bowl mix together the cream of celery soup and about 1/4 cup of water. Pour over chicken in slow cooker. Cover and cook on high for 4 to 5 hours or until done. Stir in rice at end of cooking time.

Melt butter over medium heat and whisk together chipotle chiles and adobo sauce until smooth. Whisk in seasoning salt and black and red blend and mix well. Grill steaks or chops over medium high heat for about 4 minutes on each side or until desired doneness is reached. Brush with chipotle butter on each side of steak or chop and place on grill for about 2 minutes on each side or until butter melts and steaks are heated through.

In a skillet over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons butter. Add rice to pan. Stir in chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Stir in garlic powder, parsley flakes, black pepper and parmesan cheese. Stir in almonds. Makes 4 servings.

Make pastry shell according to package directions. Beat sour cream and sugar together until blended. Stir in flour and salt. Spread in baked pie shell. Arrange berries in layers in pie shell and sprinkle with fine breadcrumbs. Dot with small pieces of butter. Bake in preheated 375f oven 30 minutes.

Cut the chicken into pieces. Place the chicken into a saucepan with 4 cups of milk. Bring to a boil over high heat stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through. Pour the milk through a strainer into a large bowl. Keep the chicken pieces in the saucepan to make the gravy. Melt the butter into the saucepan with the chicken pieces and the milk drippings. Stir in the prepared mustard. Add the honey and curry powder to taste. Stir until well mixed. Add the hot gravy to the large bowl with the chicken pieces to keep warm.

Brown chourico in olive oil. Add green and sweet red bell peppers and onions. Cook until tender. Deglaze pan with red wine and add chicken broth. Add tomato paste. Simmer until sauce is thick. Season with salt and pepper. Serve over pasta.

Separate yolks from whites. Beat yolks until thick. Gradually beat in sugar until blended. Fold in bourbon, brandy, heavy cream and nutmeg. Place egg whites into a clean bowl, beat until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into eggnog mixture. Chill at least 2 hours or overnight. Serve with a cinnamon stick on top or garnished with a cherry on top. (Recipe courtesy of Lydia McIntire)

Place carrots in a large pot with enough water to cover them by an inch or two. Add apple juice, cornstarch, and mint leaves to the pot. Cook for 20 minutes over low to medium-low heat. Add cinnamon to taste. Remove from heat. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 1 week.

Make yellow cake according to package directions. Spread pineapple in the center and cherry pie filling around the edge. Place 3 pecans on top of each cake layer. Cut cake layers and layer them together to make a 9-inch round cake. In a large bowl beat together margarine and powdered sugar. Beat in pineapple juice and vanilla. Frost cake with frosting.

Melt margarine and granulated sugar together. Add evaporated milk and bring to a low rolling boil. Remove from heat and stir in chocolate chips. Pour into 13x9 baking dish. Chill until firm. Pour marshmallow creme over chocolate mixture. Add nuts if desired. Chill until marshmallow is firm.

Melt butter in non stick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook until tender. Add bay scallops and stir until cooked through about 2-3 minutes. Season scallops with salt and pepper to taste. Remove scallops to plate and keep warm. Add parsley to skillet and cook until wilted. Reduce heat to low. Stir in red pepper flakes to taste. Add 1 t of the butter to skillet to make a sauce. Remove from heat and add the remaining butter. Serve scallops over pasta or rice with sauce poured over top.

In slow cooker combine the first 7 ingredients. Cover. Cook on low 3 to 4 hours or until chicken is done. Remove from the slow cooker. Shred the chicken. (Can be done ahead to this point.) Return the meat to the slow cooker. Stir in the enchilada sauce. Cover. Cook 30 to 45 minutes longer or until heated through. If desired, garnish the soup with shredded cheese. Makes 4 servings.
Cut the courgettes into thin strips and arrange them on a tray dish. Drizzle with a little olive oil, balsamic vinegar, capers and fresh parsley. Serve with a lemon wedge.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Cut the cornbread into cubes and place in a large bowl. Pour the broth over the cornbread and soak until soft. In a separate large bowl, combine the celery and onion and dice finely. In a third large bowl, combine the stuffing mix and chopped herbs. Add the cornbread mixture to the stuffing mix and combine. In a fourth large bowl, whisk together the eggs and 2 tablespoons of milk. Pour into the stuffing mix and combine. Pour into a 9x13 inch pan. In a fifth bowl, combine the remaining 1/4 cup milk with 2 tablespoons of butter. Stir to combine. Pour the milk mixture over the cornbread. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes or until golden. Remove and allow to rest 5 minutes before serving.

Brown beef in a skillet until cooked through. Add garlic powder to the pan. Slice potatoes into even sized pieces. Cut red onion into quarter inch slices. Cut green bell peppers into eighth inch pieces. Cut mushrooms into quarter inch pieces. Layer potatoes on the bottom of a casserole dish. Place red onion on top of potatoes. Place green bell peppers on top of onion. Place mushrooms on top of green bell peppers. Sprinkle garlic powder on top of mushrooms. Add beef to the top of mushrooms. Pour red wine vinegar salad dressing over the top of the casserole. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Combine water and wine and bring to a boil. Add cucumber and boil for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and drain cucumbers in a colander. Zest lime over cucumbers and toss. Place cucumbers and remaining ingredients in a food processor. Blend well and add salmon. Chill before serving. Serves 8. Makes 2 cups.

Brown the beef in hot oil and water mixture over medium heat until beef is no longer pinkdrain fat. Add taco seasoning, garlic powder, salt and peppermix well until blended. Heat refried beans in microwave until warm (about 3 minutes)stir well. Mix beef and beans in a large bowladd in taco shellstop each shell with about half cup beef mixture, about half cup of refried beans, about 2 tablespoons of shredded Cheddar cheesetop each shell with lettuce, about 2 tablespoons sour creamserve immediately.

Preheat your oven to 170c/350f/gas 3. Grease a 20x20cm/8x8inch square baking tin. Break up 350g/12oz of the chocolate. Melt it over a low heat in a small pan and set aside to cool. Meanwhile, in a large bowl beat together 250ml/9fl oz/scant 1 cup/250ml of the egg whites and 125ml/4fl oz/scant ½ cup/125ml of the hot water. Whisk in 80g/3oz/scant ¼ cup/60ml of the melted chocolate and ½ tsp vanilla. Pour into the prepared tin and smooth out the surface. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cool in the tin for 10 minutes before turning out to cool completely. Dust with 40g/1½oz of icing sugar.

In a large bowl whisk together the buttermilk and the eggs. In a separate large bowl sift together the flours and add the baking soda and salt. Set aside. In a large heavy skillet melt the butter and heat over medium heat. When the butter stops foaming add the buckwheat flour mixture and stir until smooth. Pour in the buttermilk mixture and stir until well blended. Keep stirring until the batter is very smooth. Add the granulated sugar and stir. Allow the batter to rest for about 5 minutes. The batter will thicken slightly. Pour about 1/4 cup batter into the hot skillet. When the bubbles on the top begin to pop and the pancakes are nicely browned turn the pancake over and cook the other side. Cook only 4 or 5 pancakes at a time. Serve hot.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute onion in oil for 4-5 minutes. Add curry powder, paprika, ketchup, and 1/2 cup of water. Bring to boil. Cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add remaining 1/2 cup of water. Continue cooking for 4 minutes. Serve with hot dogs.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Cut chicken breasts in half and place in a 9 x 13 dish. Pour cream of chicken soup over chicken. Top with parmesan cheese and lemon juice. Cover and bake for 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the cheeses. In another bowl, mix together the mayonnaise and the salsa. Stir the salsa into the cheeses until well blended. Turn the mixture into the crust-lined tart pan. Bake in the preheated oven until the tart is set and the filling is hot in the center, about 15 minutes. Sprinkle the top with the chopped cilantro. Serve warm with crackers.

Mix dry ingredients together in a large bowl and add yeast. Then add egg, sunflower oil and water to form dough. Knead dough for 10 minutes. Then add sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds and poppy seeds to dough. Knead again for 5 minutes to incorporate seeds into dough. Let dough rest for 15 minutes. Divide dough into 4 equal pieces and shape each one into balls. Form balls into loaves of bread, with seeds on top of each loaf. Place loaves in greased muffin tins to rise for 1 hour before baking at 375 degrees F for 30-40 minutes.

Melt butter in a medium skillet over medium heatstir in shallot and sage leaves. Cook until shallot is tender but not browned, about 3 minutes. Whisk in red wine until wine is incorporated. Pour in mushrooms. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and cook over medium-low heat until mushrooms are tender but not browned, about 20 minutes. Stir in thymecook until liquid is evaporated, about 4 minutes longer. Serve over toast or as a side dish. Makes about 2 cups.

Cut the steak into 1/4 inch thick strips. Put the steak into a shallow baking pan. Mix the brown sugar and soy sauce together. Pour the mixture over the steak. Sprinkle with the garlic and ginger. Mix the pineapple chunks with the sesame oil. Sprinkle over the steak. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Serve with rice.

Roll out the cookie dough to about 1/8-inch thickness. Cut into 1-inch squares with cookie cutters. Place 2 to 3 chocolate kisses on top of each cookie square. Place 1 wooden stick on top of each cookie square. Dip the top of the stick into the frosting for about 15 seconds. Place the stick on top of the cookie square so it sticks to the cookie dough. Roll the dough around the stick to cover it completely with frosting. Dip the bottom half of the stick into the frosting so it sticks to the stick. Place the cookie pop on wax paper and use another piece of wax paper to roll the bottom of the stick to smooth it. Use the ribbon to tie the cookie pop together.

In a shallow dish, place the cube steaks. Mix together the salt and pepper. Dip the cubes steaks in the salt mixture. Dip the steaks into the flour. Place the steaks in the egg substitute. In another shallow dish, place the saltine crackers. In a third shallow dish, place the vegetable oil cooking spray. Coat the cubes steaks on both sides with the saltine crackers. Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Coat the skillet with the vegetable oil cooking spray. Place the cubes steaks in the skillet. Cook and turn over until golden brown and cooked through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl mix butter, white chocolate chips and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time until incorporated. Add flour, baking powder, vanilla and milk chocolate chips. Mix well. Pour into prepared 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until edges are set. Cool on wire rack. Melt dark chocolate chips in double boiler. Drizzle on top.

Peel rhubarb and cut into 1-inch pieces. Cook rhubarb with sugar in a large saucepan until soft. Cool slightly. Combine oatmeal, flour, brown sugar and butter in a large bowlmix well. Add shortening. Mix well. Press mixture firmly into a greased 9-inch pie plate. Top with cooled rhubarb mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and chill. Cut into wedges before serving.

Cut eggplant into 1-inch pieces. Toss with extra virgin olive oil in a small bowl. Set aside. In another small bowl mix together yogurt with seasonings. Dip eggplant pieces in yogurt mixture. Dip eggplant pieces in breadcrumbs. Place breaded eggplant on cookie sheet. Bake 40 minutes or until breading is golden brown. Serve with lemon wedges.

Cook spaghetti until tender. Remove from heat and drain. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a skillet. Add garlic and onion and saute over medium heat for about five minutes. Add black pepper and red pepper flakes. Add bay scallops and cook for about three minutes or until scallops are done. Add cooked spaghetti and toss well. Add lemon juice and parsley. Taste for seasoning. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Toss carrots with extra virgin olive oil and fresh lemon juice. Place in 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle carrots with sweet paprika and crushed red pepper flakes. Bake carrots for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. In a small bowl, add parsley and cilantro to olive oil. Whisk together. Spoon mixture over carrots. Sprinkle with blanched almonds. Bake for 10 minutes.
Slice tofu into 4 slices. Spread hummus on each slice of tofu. Place tofu on bread. Top with plum tomato slice. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Bring water to boil in saucepan. Add rice and butter. Reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender. Remove from heat and add lime juice and cilantro. Serve.

Cook spaghetti according to package directionsdrain and set aside. Heat olive oil and saute onion and mushrooms until soft. Add spaghetti and chili and stir until well combined and heated through. Top with cheese and serve warm. Serves 6.

Melt gelatin and add boiling water and stir until dissolved. Add whipped cream and stir until well blended. Add sliced strawberries and stir until well blended. Refrigerate until thickened. Serve as dessert or as a topping for angel food cake or ice cream.

Bring water to a boil and add eggs and salt and pepper to taste and cook for about 5 minutes or until soft-boiled. In another container, mix together flour and salt and pepper to taste and add water and mix until it becomes dough like consistency. Grease a non-stick omelet pan and heat on medium heat until hot. Add butter to omelet and cook until butter has melted and then add eggs and stir to combine. Let cook for about 5 minutes or until eggs are set and then sprinkle cheese over and let cook for about another minute or until cheese has melted and then remove from heat and let sit for about two minutes before removing from pan to serve. On each plate add dough to resemble a flower petal and then add egg and cheese to resemble flower petals and then place fresh edible flower on top to resemble an eye and then serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Cut two 9 in (23 cm) circles from each pie crust. Press into 9 in (23 cm) pie plates. Bake until crust is light brown, about 12 minutes. In a large bowl combine sugar and chocolate. Melt over hot water. Add milk and eggs, beating well. Beat in vanilla. Pour into baked pie crusts. Bake for 12 minutes or until set. Cool completely. Fill with whipped cream and sprinkle almonds.

Combine fruit cocktail, pineapple chunks and banana in large bowl. Stir in cornstarch and walnuts. Combine cream, vanilla and sugaradd to fruit mixture and stir to blend. Refrigerate several hours or overnight. Serve cold.

Prepare pesto sauce by blending the basil leaves and pine nuts together in food processor. Add olive oil and lemon juice and process. Add salt and pepper and blend again. Heat the olive oil and sauté the zucchini and grape tomatoes in separate pans until tender. Remove from the heat and set aside. Transfer the pesto sauce into a small serving bowl. Spoon the zucchini and grape tomatoes into small serving bowls and serve the pesto sauce on the side.

Melt butter over medium heat in a large pan. Add garlic and cook until soft. Add sun-dried tomatoes. Cook for about five minutes. Add whipping cream and cook until sauce is reduced. Add brandy and cook until sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Add basil. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and toss with sauce.

Cook the green pea in a pan. When done, cool it down. In a bowl, mix the eggs and onion. Set aside. Take the skin of the chicken thighs off. Put the chicken thighs in a pan with the frozen green pea. Pour in the eggs and onion mixture. Add the mirin and sake. Cover and cook on medium heat. When the mixture is half done, add the green pea. Cover and continue cooking. When the mixture is done, it is ready to serve. Enjoy.

Combine soup mix and water in large saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add steaks and simmer covered for 1 1/2 to 2 hours. In a small bowl, combine the soup and water and the cornstarch. Stir to dissolve. Add to stew. Simmer about 15 minutes. Serve over rice. Serves 6.

Cream butter and sugar together with an electric mixer until smooth. In a separate bowl combine the flour and cornmeal. Make a well in the center of the bowl. Add buttermilk and stir until a ball forms. Do not overmix. Turn dough onto a floured surface. Pat or roll dough out to 1/2 inch thick. Cut with a biscuit cutter or a floured knife into desired shapes and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes until golden brown. Let cool slightly before serving.

Boil water and add pasta shells. Cook pasta shells until tenderdrain in a colander and set aside. In a large skillet cook beef and seasoning with salt. Cook until meat is tender and browndrain and set aside. In a large saucepan cook the onion and whole kernel corn in the beef drippings until the vegetables are tenderadd the cooked pasta shells and cooked ground beef and the tomatoes and tomato paste and blend well. Cook for 15 minutes over low heat and serve warm with a sprinkling of paprika.

In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add the kielbasa and cook until heated through. In a 10-inch nonstick skillet brown pierogi in heated oil over medium heat. Pour the green beans and pierogi into the skillet with the onions and sausage and heat through.

Beat sugar, eggs and butter with hand mixer until creamy. Add milk and beat until smooth. Add flour and baking powder and beat well. Stir in raspberry jam and chocolate chips. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until cake is done.

Unroll pizza dough onto pizza pan sprayed with oil. Spread pizza sauce over crust and sprinkle with turkey sausage. Arrange sweet peppers and mushrooms over sausage and cheese. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted. Worlds best recipes.

Brown ground chuck in large skillet. Drain. Add soup and milk. Cook until soup is heated through. Stir in sour cream. Spread tater tots in a 9x13 casserole. Pour mixture over tots. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake 350 degrees 30 minutes or until tots are heated through. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake 5-10 minutes or until mozzarella melts. Serve hot.

In a small bowl, combine sour cream and horseradish. Mix in lemon juice and stir well to blend. Add Worcestershire sauce and tabasco sauce. Set aside. In a large saucepan of boiling salted water, cook oysters for 3 minutes. Drain and serve immediately with horseradish sauce.

Rinse the rice under running water until the water runs clear, about 4 minutes. Heat the peanut oil in a large saucepan over medium heat until shimmering. Add the cumin seeds and cook until they darken in color and crackle, about 1 minute. Add the rice and stir until the rice is coated with oil and fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the water and bring to a simmer over high heat. Cook until the rice is tender and the water is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Stir in the black pepper and salt and cook until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Toss with fresh cilantro and serve.

Cook cabbage and celery in boiling water until tender. Drain and chop. Mix with beef. Add garlic salt and cooked cabbage and celery. Shape into patties. Bake at 425 for 15-20 minutes or until brown. Serve in rolls and top with sauce.

Beat eggs, sugar and salt until fluffy and light. Add milk and vanilla. Beat until combined and very foamy. Add nutmeg and beat again. Spoon into custard cups or ramekins and place on a cookie sheet. Bake at 325 degrees for about 15 minutes or until custards set and are golden brown on top. Serve warm with a dollop of whipped cream and a sprinkle of powdered sugar.

In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil. Sauté the garlic for about a minute. Add the chopped up green beans and sauté for about 5 minutes. Pour in the chicken broth. Bring the soup to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Add the parsley. Season with the salt and pepper. Whisk together the egg and the cream. Add the egg mixture to the soup. Stir in the thyme and bay leaf. Place the soup in a blender and blend until smooth. Pour the soup into a serving bowl. Sprinkle with the croutons.

Season beef with fajita seasoning. Put steak into crock pot. Add onions and green and red bell peppers. Pour beer over vegetables. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or until tender. Serve with tortillas.

Prepare the breadcrumbs by putting the breadcrumbs into a food processor and pulsing several times to break up the breadcrumbs into small pieces. Put the breadcrumbs into a large mixing bowl along with the parmesan and dried herbs and mix thoroughly. Add the butter to the breadcrumb mixture and mix together. Cut the butter into chicken breasts and place in the breading mixture and turn to coat all sides of the chicken breast thoroughly. Place chicken in an ovenproof skillet and put in the oven for about 30 minutes or until cooked through and golden brown on top. Meanwhile, prepare the sauce by melting the butter in the skillet and stirring in the flour and salt and cooking for 1-2 minutes without stirring. Add the milk slowly and cook the gravy over medium-low heat for 5-8 minutes or until thickened and bubbly. Pour the gravy over the cooked chicken and serve.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix teriyaki sauce and soy sauce in a bowl. Mix in garlic powder, onion powder, bay leaves. Stir in lemon juice. Dip chicken in mixture. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve.
Place all ingredients into crock pot. Cook on low for 8 hours or until carrots are tender. Serve with boiled egg and pumpernickel bread.

1) To make the butter, gently heat the chocolate-coated honeycomb candy with the honey in a saucepan over a gentle heat. Bring to a gentle simmer for 10 minutes or so, stirring occasionally to make sure the honey is fully dissolved in the candy. Remove from the heat and leave to cool.2) To make the hotcakes, in a large mixing bowl beat the ricotta cheese with the eggs and then the milk, followed by the plain flour, baking powder and the salt. Whisk in the cooled butter mixture from the honeycomb candy and the melted butter in small batches to form a smooth batter.3) Heat a lightly greased griddle or frying pan over a medium heat. Pour batter into the pan so that each hotcake is about 1cm thick, making sure there is enough room between each one to allow them to cook fully. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown.4) Serve hot with butter and the honeycomb candy, sprinkling over the top with a little icing sugar if

Preheat the broiler with a rack in the top third of the oven. Heat a small amount of oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the flank steak in a single layer and cook until browned, about 2 minutes per side. Transfer the steak to a platewipe out the saucepan with paper towels. Add the remaining oil and brown sugar to the saucepanbring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Pour in the orange juice and bring to a boil.
