Stir in the soy sauce, mustard, ginger and salsa. Bring back to a boil and cook for a few minutes over medium heat until the sauce is thickened, about 4 minutes. Transfer the sauce to a bowlset aside. Heat the broiler with the rack in the top third of the ovenbrush the steak with the reserved sauce on all sides. Place the steak in the broiler pancook until the sauce is caramelized and bubbly, about 8 minutes. Transfer the steak to a platetent with foil

Drain strawberries and place in a large bowl. Add condensed milk and stir until strawberries are covered. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Place in a freezer-safe bowl or a freezer-safe bag. Add cool whip and mix thoroughly. Stir in pineapple. Serve.

Melt butter in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in brown sugar and corn syrup until sugar is dissolved, about 2 minutes. Add baking sodastir constantly until mixture begins to boil. Immediately add popcornstir constantly until all popcorn is coated with caramel. Remove from heatstir in vanilla extract. Transfer popcorn to wax paper-lined cookie sheetlet cool completely (about 1 hour). Break into piecesstore in airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week or freeze for up to one month. Makes about 12 cups of caramel corn.

Prepare a sheet pan by covering with parchment paper. Peel the asparagus and cut off the ends. Remove any tough outer leaves and discard. Cut the asparagus in half lengthwise. In a small bowl or container, combine the olive oil, salt and pepper. Drizzle the oil over the asparagus and toss to coat. Place the asparagus in a single layer on the prepared sheet pan. Bake in the preheated oven for about 10 to 15 minutes or until tender and lightly browned. Remove from the oven. Drizzle the lemon juice over the asparagus and toss to coat. Sprinkle the zest over the asparagus and toss again. Serve warm. To garnish, place a small dill sprig on each serving.

Heat olive oil and red wine vinegar in pan. Add seasonings and herbs. Cook over low heat until heated through. Cut pork loin into 1 inch thick pieces. Place pork loin pieces into marinade and turn to coat all sides. Marinate 2 to 3 hours. Drain. Lightly flour pork. Place pork on heated grill. Cook 5 to 6 minutes per side. Serve with any of your favorite side dishes.

Preheat oven to 350. In food processor, blend oranges with 1 tablespoon of the extra virgin olive oil until pureed. Add remaining 6 tablespoons of olive oil to the food processor and blend. In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, sugar, flour, baking powder and salt until smooth and well blended. Add the orange mixture to the flour mixture, whisking until smooth. Add orange mixture to a bowl. Pour batter into a greased 9-inch round cake pan. Bake until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Cool cake for 10 minutes before removing from pan. Dust with confectioners sugar, if desired.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. In a bowl combine ground turkey with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Stir in the mustard and the breadcrumbs. Divide the mixture into 4 equal portions and shape each into a patty. Place the burgers in a baking pan. Bake the burgers for 20 minutes. Remove the burgers from the pan and place them on the baking sheet. Place the baking pan over medium heat and add the butter. Stir in the red bell pepper and cook until the bell pepper is tender. Add the cilantro and salt. Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Spoon the bell pepper mixture over the burgers. Cover the baking sheet with aluminum foil and return to the oven. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove the foil and broil the burgers for 2 minutes or until they are browned.
In large bowl mix cream cheese, dry ranch dressing mix, chicken, cheddar cheese and pecans. Form into 1-1/2 -inch balls. Roll in pecans. Refrigerate for 24 hours or freeze for later use.

Stir together cooked rice and shrimp. Set aside. Heat water in a saucepan over high heat. Stir in green onions. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Add stir-fry sauce. Stir until blended. Add hot chili pepper. Stir until blended. Transfer to a large bowl. Stir in rice mixture. Let cool completely. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight. Serve cold.

Heat butter in large saucepan over medium heat. Add shallot and asparagus and cook until softened about 5 minutes. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in coriander. Discard lemon peel. Working in batches, puree soup in blender until smooth. Return to saucepan and stir in creme fraiche and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot. Makes 4 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a casserole dish with cooking spray. Cook the beans according to the package instructions. Drain and cool. Mix together the cream cheese, mayonnaise, milk, green peppers, parmesan cheese and paprika in a small bowl. Pour the mixture over the beans in the casserole dish. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.

Preheat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Combine the egg yolks with the ricotta cheese, milk, half the grated mozzarella cheese (reserving the rest for the top of the quiche), the sea salt and cracked black pepper in a bowl. Heat the butter in the skillet until melted. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet. Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella cheese over the top. Place the skillet on the stove over medium heat and cook for about 6-8 minutes or until the quiche is set in the center. Transfer the quiche to a platter. Serve immediately.

Combine garlic cloves, cumin, allspice, paprika, salt and turmeric in a small bowl. Heat oil in an outdoor grill or cast iron pan. Rub the mixture evenly over the chicken pieces. Grill or pan sear until done.

Preheat oven to 325f. Combine the onions, cracker crumbs, tomato sauce, brown sugar, vinegar, mustard and egg. Add the chuck meat. Mix well. Shape into a loaf. Place in a 9x5x3 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with salt substitute. Bake for 1 1/2 hours or until meatloaf is done.
Mix the tuna with the egg noodles. Combine the soup and peas. Add the tuna mixture and the dill weed. Mix well. Bake at 325 degrees for 30 minutes.

Pre-heat oven broiler or barbecue. Sprinkle pepper and salt over pork chops and basil on spinach. Place pork chops and spinach on baking pan or foil and put in oven. Broil or barbecue for about five minutes on each side or until pork is cooked through. Remove and place on plate. Serve with tomato and onion on the side and sliced basil on top of each pork chop.

Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Bring a pot of water to a boil over high heatreduce heat to medium-high heat. Using a slotted spoon, carefully lower eggs into the boiling water. Cover and steam for 6 minutes. Remove from water and transfer to a platterimmediately sprinkle with cheese and chives. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook for about 5 minutes or until tender but still firm to the bite. Drain the pasta and keep warm. Add the cream and milk and bring to a boil. Stir in the dill, green onions, capers and the lemon peel. Cook for about 2 minutes. Reduce the heat and stir in the smoked salmon. Place the pasta in a warm serving bowl. Pour the sauce over the pasta and top with the sliced almonds. Serve immediately.

Prepare broccoli by removing the tough stems. Cut the broccoli into bite size pieces. Place broccoli in a bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients except for endive. Toss gently to coat. Fill each endive with the broccoli mixture. Serve.

In a 2-quart saucepan combine the hot water, bouillon cubes, onion powder, turmeric, and the salt. Add the rice, stirring to coat. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low, stirring occasionally, and cook for 20 minutes. Drain the rice and discard the bouillon mixture. Transfer the rice to a large bowl, add the cashews, raisin, ginger, parsley, and remaining 1/4 cup of the olive oil. Stir to coat the rice with the oil, adding more oil if the rice seems dry. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and set aside to cool to room temperature, about 1 1/2 hours. Transfer to 6 serving dishes or shallow baking pans or ramekins. Sprinkle the cashews evenly over the rice. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight to set before serving. Serve cold or at room temperature.

In a large bowl combine 1/2 cup water with 1/2 cup milk and yeastlet stand for 10 minutes or until foamy. In a separate bowl combine 4 cups flour with sugar and saltadd yeast mixture and mix well. Beat in 1/2 cup milkgradually beat in remaining flour until soft dough forms. Turn onto floured surfaceknead until smooth and elastic (about 10 minutes)place in greased bowl coated with oil or shorteningcover with damp clothlet rise in warm place free from draft until doubled (about 1 hour). Punch downturn onto lightly floured surfaceknead lightly 15 timesform into 12 rollslet stand for 5 minutesshape each roll into ballplace 2 inches apart on greased cookie sheetcoverlet rise in warm place until doubled (about 45 minutes). Bake at 375f for 15 minutes or until donebrush lightly with melted butter.
Blend all of the ingredients together until smooth. Pour into bowls. Refrigerate until set. Serve with fresh fruit.

Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Cook onion in the oil until tender, stirring often, about 5 minutes. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until thickened, 8 to 10 minutes. Whisk in cornstarch mixture until smooth. Stir in mustard and dill weedadd chicken. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 4 minutesadd noodlessimmer 2 minutes. Sprinkle with butter before serving.

Place chicken breast halves between 2 pieces of waxed paperpound chicken breasts with rolling pin to 1/4 -in. thickness. Place chicken breasts in 13x9-in. baking dish. Sprinkle with garlictop with artichoke hearts. In small bowl combine soup and mayonnaisespread over chicken and artichoke hearts. In small bowl combine curry powder and lemon juicesprinkle over artichoke hearts and soup mixture. Sprinkle with bread cubes and cheddar cheese. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes or until chicken is done. Uncoversprinkle with butter. Let stand 5-10 minutes before serving.

Roll each crescent roll into a 18-inch rope. Place the ropes on the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Remove the crescent rolls from the oven and brush with dressing. Top with bacon and cheddar. Sprinkle with green onions. Roll up the crescent rolls. Bake an additional 10-12 minutes. Cut diagonally into 1-inch pieces and serve.

Combine dijon mustard, garlic cloves and parsley in small bowl and mix well. Place halibut fillets in small glass dish and cover with mixture. Cover and marinate in refrigerator for at least 2 hours or up to 24 hours. Preheat oven to broil. Remove halibut from marinade and pat dry with paper towel. Place halibut fillets skin side down in hot oven for about 4 minutes. Turn and broil for about 4 minutes more or until fillet just begins to turn white.

Slice navel oranges in half. Scoop out the orange pulp into a medium mixing bowl. Cut avocado in half. Scoop out the avocado pulp into the mixing bowl. Combine orange pulp and avocado pulp. Place purple onion in small bowl. Pour dressing over orange-avocado mixture. Add dried italian seasoning to the dressing. Chop orange-avocado mixture. Drizzle the orange-avocado mixture into a serving dish. Sprinkle purple onion on top of orange-avocado mixture. Garnish salad with slices of orange.

Mix together the butter & oil until well blended. Add the potato & rosemary. Knead well. Press dough into a 13-inch round springform pan. Bake at 325f for 25 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes. Remove sides of pan. Serve warm or cold.

Slice mushrooms in half. Combine the feta cheese, parsley, cayenne pepper and olive oil. Stuff the mixture into each mushroom half. Bake 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until heated through. Serve with a baked potato.

Wash plantains. Cut both sides of each plantain lengthwise. Then cut lengthwise again into thirds. Place plantains in a baking dish. Sprinkle with ginger, red pepper, garlic powder and salt. Drizzle with cooking spray. Bake for 30 minutes at 400 f. Serve hot with melted butter.

Preheat oven to 375. Grease a 4-cup muffin pan and set aside. In a medium mixing bowl, beat together the pineapple and margarine. Gradually add the sugar. Add the eggs and beat until combined. Add the pineapple mixture to the bread. Stir in the pecans. Divide the batter evenly between the muffin cups. Place in oven. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until puffy and golden brown. Serve warm.

Prepare the filling by combining the brown and white sugar and cornstarch. Mix in ginger and cinnamon. Stir in the vanilla. Cut peaches in half and remove the pits. Arrange the peach halves in the pie shell and pour the filling over them. Bake at 400 degrees F until the peaches are tender when pierced with a fork. Let cool.

Quinoa can be cooked ahead of time. In a small pot, bring water to a boil. Add 1 cup of quinoa. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pan and simmer the quinoa until tender, about 12-15 minutes. Drain the quinoa and cool. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Spread the quinoa on the prepared baking sheet. Add the slivered almonds, cinnamon stick, bay leaf and dried cranberries. Drizzle with olive oil. Toast for 15-20 minutes until golden brown. Serve with yogurt and fruits.

Place pork chops, potatoes, carrots and garlic clove into an oven-safe 6-quart pot or Dutch oven and fill with enough water to cover by 1 inch and add the lemons and the olive oil. Bring to a boil over high heat and stir the potatoes until they are soft. Remove from the stove and transfer the chops to a plate and cover with foil and let sit for 5 minutes. Remove the chops from the foil and season them with your favorite Cajun seasonings. Then place the chops back into the pot and cook over medium heat until the internal temperature reaches 160 degrees F. Serve the pork chops and potatoes with your favorite side dish.

Microwave rice according to package directions for 10 minutes or until tender. Heat the tuna in a small saucepan over low heat. Drain the tuna from the saucepan and set aside for 10 minutes or until cool enough to handle. Cut tuna into bite-size pieces. Place tuna in a large serving bowl or individual serving dishes. Top with rice and spinach mixture. Garnish with almonds. Serve with lemon wedges if desired.

Melt butter in saucepan on low heat. Stir in flour to make paste. Cook for 3 minutes while stirring. Stir in stock. Bring to boil then reduce to medium-low heat and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in soy sauce and cream. Boil for 3 minutes while stirring constantly. Stir in salt. I like to add red pepper flakes for more zip. Cook for 3 more minutes. Transfer to small pot for serving.

In a large heavy casserole dish heat the oil and fry the garlic and onion for a few minutes until soft and translucent. Add the mushrooms and cook for another 3 minutes. Add the parsnips and cook for another minute or so. Add the beans and tomatoes and cook for 5-7 minutes until the beans are soft and the tomatoes have released their liquid into the casserole dish. Season and stir in the parmesan cheese.

Preheat the oven to 425. Remove the seeds and white ribs from the peppers. Place the peppers face down on a large baking sheet. Brush the peppers with the extra virgin olive oil. Bake the peppers until the skin is dry and cracked and the peppers are softened. Remove the peppers from the oven. Cool the peppers until they can be handled. Cut off the tops of the peppers and remove the seeds. Place the peppers in a large bowl. Squeeze the peppers over the bowl to extract the juice. Add the instant minced garlic to the bowl along with the cream cheese and the juice from the peppers. Using a potato masher or the back of a large spoon, mash the mixture together to create a dip. Serve with crackers. Makes about 1½ cups.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. Combine flour, baking powder, butter, egg and vanilla essence. Mix well. Gradually add milk and stir until a soft dough is formed. On a greased cookie sheet or jelly roll pan, pat dough into a thin round about 1/2 inch thick. Press a layer of raisins on top. Roll the dough lengthwise into a log. Using a sharp knife, cut into 1-inch pieces. Place the cakes on a cookie sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Slip a small knife around the edge of the cake. Turn the cake out onto a wire rack and remove the paper. Repeat until all the cakes are made.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Peel peaches and halve them, remove stones and cut into 8 wedges each. Place peaches in a 2 qt casserole dish. In a mixing bowl combine oatmeal, 2 cups of sugar, egg whites and extracts. Mix well and pour over peaches in casserole dish. Bake until golden brown and fruit is tender, about 25 minutes. Serve warm or cool.

Cook penne according to package directions. Drain wellkeep warm. Meanwhile, cook sausage according to package directionsdrain well. In large skillet, heat spaghetti sauce over medium heatadd sausage, red pepper flakes and half the parmesan cheese. Cook about 1 minute or until heated through. Spoon sausage mixture over cooked pennetop with the remaining parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Place the onions in a bowl. Add the vinegar, sugar, yellow mustard seeds, celery seed and salt. Cover the bowl. Marinate at room temperature for 24 hours. Drain the onions. Place them in a large plastic bag. Add the yellow mustard and turmeric. Close the bag. Shake vigorously to coat the onions. Refrigerate for 24 hours. Drain the onions. Rinse them under cold water. Place the onions in a medium bowl. Add the oil. Toss to coat. Drain the onions. Sprinkle with salt. Let stand for 15 minutes. Serve.

Add coconut milk to boiling water and simmer for 4 minutes. Add peanut butter and stir. In a small bowl, add ginger and black pepper and mix well. Stir coconut mixture into the peanut butter mixture and let sit for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Prepare rice according to package directions. Remove chicken from refrigerator and season with pepper and salt. Heat 2 tbsps. of cooking oil in a skillet and brown chicken on each side. Cook until done. Set aside. Stir together green onions, honey roasted peanuts and remaining oil. Spoon 1/3 of the coconut mixture on each serving plate. Place a breast half on each plate and spoon the coconut mixture on the breast. Sprinkle with the green onion and peanuts. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and saute until opaque. Add shallots and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add garlic and cook for another 2 minutes. Add half of the wine and cook until it is reduced by half. Add the rest of the wine and bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Whisk in the mustard and broth. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil again. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5-6 minutes. Serve over pasta.
Boil spinach in 2 cups water for 3 minutes then drain and set aside to cool. Blend the rest of the ingredients and add the spinach and blend again. Serve hot with rice and fried egg.

Cut mushrooms into pieces and fry in the olive oil along with the onion, garlic cloves, jalapenos and salt and pepper to your taste. Cook slowly for about 15 minutes to soften. Then add the water to the mixture. Add the cilantro at the very end, just before serving, to add some freshness to the soup.

1. Heat the oil in a large saucepan. Add the onion, garlic and bacon and fry gently for about five minutes until the bacon is browned. Add the butter to the pan. Pour in the stock. Add the Jerusalem artichokes. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to low. Simmer for about twenty minutes until the artichokes are tender. Stir occasionally. When the artichokes are tender, remove them from the pan and blend them using a hand blender. Return the blended mixture to the pan. Bring to the boil for about five minutes until thickened. Adjust the seasoning if necessary. Add the bacon back to the pan. Serve.

Melt butter in a heavy skillet. Saute fish for about 5 minutes or until it begins to flake with a fork. Combine dried oregano & chili powder with salt & pepper to taste. Sprinkle fish with seasoning. Serve with lemon.

Mix all the ingredients together in a large bowl. Put into a cookie sheet lined with foil (for easy cleanup). Spread out evenly. Bake in a preheated oven at 250 F for about one hour or until lightly browned. Cool completely before breaking up into pieces for serving.

In a large pot over medium heat combine the chicken broth, water, stir fry vegetables, chicken-flavored ramen noodles, baby shrimp. Cook for about 25 minutes. Serve warm. Serves two. You can also add cooked pork or cooked pork chops.

Preheat grill to medium-high. Season chicken breasts on all sides with salt. In a medium bowl combine tomato sauce, ancho chiles, 1 tablespoon of the mango salsa, 2 tablespoons of water. Set aside. Heat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Place chicken on pangrill 5 minutes on each side or until done. Transfer to a cutting board. Cut into strips. Brush tortillas on both sides with oil. Grill 1 minute or just until lightly toasted. On a tortilla place half of an onion. Top with 1 1/4 cup of shredded monterey jack cheese. Place 3 strips of cooked chicken on top of cheese. Top each quesadilla with 1/2 of mango salsa. Fold tortilla in half. Cook 2 minutes or just until tortillas are browned. Cut each quesadilla into 6 pieces. Serve quesadillas with mango salsa on the side.

In large skillet cook sausage over medium heat until brown. Drain sausage. Mix brown sugar, catsup and liquid smoke in small bowl until blended. Stir in onion. Pour over sausage in skilletcover. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Uncovercook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Stir garlic powder into mixture. Cook uncovered for about 3 minutes or until mixture thickens slightly. Serve with bread or crackers.

Prepare pizza crust according to directions. While crust is baking, heat olive oil in large pan over medium heat. Add eggplant slices to pan. Cook eggplant until tender. Remove from heat. Mix pesto sauce into eggplant. Remove pizza crust from oven. Spread pizza dough with pesto eggplant. Top with mozzarella cheese. Top with plum tomatoes. Sprinkle with salt. Bake pizza at 425 degrees for 10 to 15 minutes until crust is golden brown.

Bring a large pot of water to boil. Cook penne according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, heat olive oil and garlic over medium heat. Add roasted red peppers and cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Add penne, spinach and feta cheese. Toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Combine sugar and butter in large heavy-duty pot. Cook over medium-high heat until mixture begins to boil. Reduce heat to low and cook until mixture is light golden brown. Add evaporated milk and stir constantly until mixture is smooth. Stir in marshmallows and cook until marshmallows melt completely. Add chocolate chips and stir until melted. Stir in walnuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased wax paper. Cool completely. Break into pieces and store in airtight container in refrigerator.

Peel carrots and cut into 1 inch pieces. Cook them in 2 cups of water in a large pot until just tender (about 15 minutes). Remove from heat and set aside for 10 minutes to cool slightly. Place 1 1/2 cups of cooled carrots into a large bowl with 1 cup of beer (or enough to cover the carrots). Add the butter cut into pieces to the bowl of beer and carrots. Mix well and add the remaining carrots. Mix well until all are coated with the liquid mixture. Cover the bowl with a towel and refrigerate for at least 3 hours to blend flavors (overnight is best). Stir the mixture several times during the first hour or so. When ready to serve, place the carrots in a large serving dish or glass bowl. Cover with foil or plastic wrap and store in the refrigerator until serving time.

Rinse fish under cold running water, pat dry with paper towels and season with salt and pepper on both sides. Heat a large cast-iron grill pan over high heat until hot. Add oil and swirl to coat pan. Grill fish until firm and opaque throughout, turning once halfway through cooking time. Grill fish fillets until they are opaque and flake easily with a fork. Remove fish and transfer to plates. Top with pineapple salsa and serve immediately. In a large bowl combine pineapple, red onion, red bell pepper, jalapeno pepper and cilantroseason with salt and pepper and toss to combine. Squeeze juice from lime over mixture and toss again to combine. Serve with fish fillets. Tip: If you don't have grill pan, coat grill rack with olive oil or cook on grill over indirect heat.
Preheat the broiler. Combine all ingredients except for the sunflower seeds in a food processor. Transfer to a bowl and add sunflower seeds. Form mixture into patties. Broil for 2 minutes per side.
Boil water and add tea bags and lemon juice. Stir and remove tea bags. Allow to cool for one minute. Add sugar and serve over ice with lemon slices if desired. Makes one gallon.

Melt the butter and the peanut butter in a pan and remove from heat. Stir in the vanilla and powdered sugar. Remove from heat. Add the rice krispies and toss to coat. Form balls and put in the freezer for 15 minutes. Melt the chocolate and dip the balls in. Place on waxed paper and let them set. (Note : I find it easier to dip the peanut butter covered rice krispies in the chocolate than it is to dip the rice krispies in the peanut butter.)

In a small saucepan over medium heat combine dijon mustard with soy saucebring to a boil. Add minced garlic clove and minced ginger root. Cook until garlic is tender. Stir in rosemarybring to a boil. Remove from heatset aside. Preheat oven to 275 degrees. Place lamb in a roasting panseason with salt and pepper. Cook lamb 4 hours or until tender. Remove pan from oventurn off oven. Let lamb stand 30 minutes. Remove lamb from panplace on serving platter. Pour mustard sauce over lamb. Serve lamb with cucumber sauce.

Hard-cook the eggs until they're just barely soft and then remove them from the pan. Peel the eggs and cut them in half lengthwise. Remove the yolks and add them to a large bowl. Using an electric mixer or hand-held mixer, beat the yolks until they're completely smooth. Add the mayonnaise and honey mustard to the yolks and beat again. Fold in the bacon and cheddar and then transfer the mixture into a pastry bag fitted with a small tip. Pipe the mixture into the egg whites. Sprinkle parsley over the tops of the eggs. Refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours before serving. Makes 12 servings.

Melt butter over medium heat in a 2-quart heavy saucepan. Add scallopssaute 3 minutes or until just cooked through, turning once. Remove scallops with a slotted spoon to a platekeep warm. Saute mushrooms, onions and garlic in butter over medium heat until tenderremove from heat. Stir vermouth into mushroom mixture. Gradually stir in heavy cream and scallopsreturn to low heat and cook, stirring occasionally until heated through. Sprinkle with grated cheese and parsley. Serve immediately.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil. Add tomato slices and saute until they begin to soften. Stir in basil and cook for one minute. Add salt and ground black pepper to taste. Place bruschetta on slices of Italian bread. Sprinkle with part-skim mozzarella.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the water to boiling in a small saucepan. Stir in cornstarch. Add to the boiling water. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Remove from the heat. Stir in granulated sugar and brown sugar. Cool slightly. Combine cornstarch mixture and remaining 1 cup water in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from the heat. Stir in cherry pie filling. Spoon about 1/2 cup cherry filling into each of two crusts. Spoon about 1/4 cup cherry pie filling into the center of each crust. Brush with butter and sprinkle with oats. Cover and refrigerate until set.

Preheat oven to 350f. Trim apples in half, leaving the stem on. Remove core and seeds. Place in a baking dish and place in oven until tender when pierced with a paring knife. Let cool slightly. Drizzle with 1/3 cup of butterscotch chips. Top with 1/3 cup peanut butter chips. Place apples back in the oven for 1 to 2 minutes. Cool slightly and drizzle with 1/3 cup of chocolate pieces. Top with sprinkles and coconut.

In a medium saucepan, place basmati rice and enough water to cover by 1 inch. Bring water to boil over high heat. Cook rice until water is completely absorbed and rice is tender (about 15 minutes). Do not overcook rice. Add more water if needed to keep rice covered. Remove rice from heatset aside for 5 minutes. Transfer rice to a large bowlfluff with a fork. Gently mix in the butterlet stand for 20 minutes to allow flavors to blend before serving.

In a skillet, saute the red onions in the oil until they are softened. Add the tomato and bring to a boil. Pour the boiled tomato mixture into a greased 9 x 11 baking dish. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs. Add the water to the eggs and whisk again. Pour the egg mixture over the tomato mixture. Top with the Parmesan. Bake at 350 for about 30 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Let it sit for a few minutes before cutting. Serves 4.

Melt butter in a pan and add 1/2 cup flour. Cook for 1 minute. Add remaining ingredients. Cook for 2 minutes. Roll out onto a lightly greased surface. Cut into 1/8 inch strips and bake on a cookie sheet until lightly brown.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Season chicken breast halves generously with salt and pepper. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken to the skillet and cook until browned on both sides. Place chicken in an oven-safe baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes. Combine the lemon juice and parsley in a small bowl. Pour over the chicken. Bake for 15 minutes. Transfer chicken to a serving platter and serve.
Mix soup with beef and cook until beef is tender. Add Mac & Cheese mix and stir until well blended. Pour into a 13 x 9 baking dish. Sprinkle breadcrumbs over the top. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes.

Put a scoop of ice cream in a glass. Add in a dollop of chocolate syrup. Add about a third of the milk. Add a scoop of chai tea mix. Add about a third of the club soda. Add some milk. Keep doing this until the ice cream is gone. Drink.

Place cream cheese in a bowl and add vinaigrette dressing and mix thoroughly. Add garlic, thyme and black pepper and mix well to combine. Stuff each cheese round with mixture. Sprinkle a small amount of lemon peel on each cheese round and roll in a mixture of breadcrumbs and chopped fresh rosemary to coat well. Place in refrigerator for 1 hour to marinate. Serve on a bed of mixed greens with sliced tomato for garnish if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Sift flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt into large mixing bowl. Combine the vegetable oil, pineapple juice, eggs, mashed bananas, pineapple. Add dry ingredients to wet and mix thoroughly. Add nuts if desired. Spoon batter into 12 greased muffin pans. Bake 18-20 minutes or until lightly browned.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add sausage, ham, peppers, onions and garlic. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Add tomatoes, chicken stock, and seasonings. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to medium-low simmer for 12 minutes. Add pasta and cook for 8 minutes or until pasta is tender but still firm to the bite. Drain and rinse pasta with cold water. Add pasta back into saucepan and toss with arugula. Serve immediately.
Add all ingredients to crockpot. Cook on high for 5-6 hours.

Place the chicken in a large roasting pan. Put the peppercorns and the garlic in the cavity of the bird. Add the wine and oil to the roasting pan. Season the chicken. Cook the bird in a preheated 450-degree-Fahrenheit oven for 20 minutes. Turn the heat down to 350-degrees-Fahrenheit and cook the bird for another 20 to 30 minutes. Check the internal temperature and cook the bird an additional 5 minutes if necessary. Transfer the chicken to a carving board and let it rest for 5 minutes before carving.

Season steaks with salt and pepper. In a large skillet heat oil and brown steaks. Add onions. Cook until softened. Add dressing to onion mixture. Cook until heated through. Remove steaks from skillet. Add cheese to mixture. Cook until cheese melts. Place sandwich buns on a baking sheet. Place steaks on tops of buns. Top with onion mixture. Cover buns with foil. Bake in preheated oven until heated through.

Combine all ingredients except sprinkles in a medium-sized bowl and mix well with a fork until well mixed. Place a scoopful of the mixture in each mushroom cap and sprinkle each with a little of the sprinkles. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes or until the caps are golden brown.

Dice chicken into bite-size pieces. Combine with Miracle Whip, cheddar cheese and onion flakesmix thoroughly. Divide into two serving bowlsgarnish with celery, water chestnuts and potato chips. Serve hot or cold.

Put onion, garlic cloves, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, soy sauce into a slow cooker. Place spareribs on top of mixture. Pour in condensed tomato soup. Pour cold water over all of the mixture to cover spareribs by 1 inch. Cover slow cooker and cook on high for 4 to 6 hours or low for 8 to 10 hours. Serve with rice.

Place olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pork chops to the skillet and cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until browned. Transfer to a baking dish or serving platter and keep warm. In a small bowl, combine grainy mustard with the stock, honey and bourbon. Heat mixture over medium heat until slightly thickened. Spoon over pork chops. Melt remaining butter over medium heat in the same skillet used to brown the pork chops. Add pork chops to the skillet, pour any remaining sauce from the baking dish or serving platter over the pork chops and cook for 1 to 2 minutes more or until the pork is heated through.
Pre-heat oven to 375 degrees. Spray croutons with olive oil flavored cooking spray. Sprinkle with chili powder and paprika. Sprinkle with ground cumin. Bake for 8-12 minutes or until crispy. Serve.

Spread refried beans over tortillas. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Fold in half. Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add tortillas to skillet. Cook about 1 minute on each side or until crisp. Meanwhile, in a bowl, stir together sour cream, lime juice, ground cumin and pepper. Stir in chopped fresh cilantro. Serve quesadillas with sour cream mixture.

Bake cauliflower for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Place cauliflower in a deep 13 x 9 inch baking pan. In a small pan over low heat melt butter with the condensed milk. Whisk in 1 cup of milk. Pour over the cauliflower. Top with the cheese. Bake until cheese is melted and cauliflower is tender, 15 to 20 minutes more. Sprinkle with bacon.

Mix flour, cornmeal and chili powder. Add enough water to make a thick batter. Add salt, pepper and a little bit of mayonnaise to taste. Heat the peanut oil to 350-360 degrees. Dip oysters in the batter. Fry for 3 minutes or until golden brown. Drain. Dip in malt vinegar. Serve with lemon wedges. Sprinkle with the worcestershire sauce.

In a large saucepan over medium-low heat, heat olive oil and saute onion until softened but not browned. Add tomatoes and cook until softened and slightly reduced, about 10 minutes. -add chicken stock and bring to a simmer, cooking until reduced by half, about 20 minutes. -puree soup with an immersion blender or in a blender until smoothadd whipping cream and puree again until smooth. Add pesto and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Brew as desired. Serve over ice.

Preheat oven to 375F degrees. Grease an 8x4x2-inch loaf pan with butter. In a medium bowl mix together flour, baking powder and salt. In another bowl beat together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs and beat until well combined. Mix in vanilla. Mix flour mixture into batter. Stir in bananas and cranberries. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 45-50 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center of cake comes out clean. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan. Store loaf at room temperature for up to 5 days.

In a large stock pot over medium heat combine the oil and half of the onion slices. When oil is hot add the chicken pieces and saute until lightly browned on all sides. Remove the browned chicken from the pot add the remaining onion slices and saute for 2 more minutes. Add the stock, port wine, salt, pepper and oregano bring the mixture to a boil then reduce the heat and simmer for about 30 minutes. Add the green peas halfway through the cooking time. Serve over rice or with bread.

Preheat the oven to 325f. Grease and flour a loaf pan or bundt pan. In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking soda and salt. In a separate bowl, beat together the sugar, vegetable oil and eggs until well combined and smooth. Add the banana and apples and mix until well blended. Add the flour mixture and mix well until combined. Pour into the prepared pan and bake for approximately an hour or until a tester comes out clean when inserted into the center of the loaf. Let cool in the pan for about 10 minutes before removing from the pan and cool completely on a wire rack before slicing and serving.

Take one biscuit and spread with a thin layer of jam. Fold biscuit in half to form a triangle shape. Roll seam side down on a clean work surface and press together to form a blossom shape. Bake at 350 degrees F for 12-15 minutes. While blossoms are baking, mix sugar with a small amount of cinnamon together in a small bowl. Sprinkle on top of blossoms once removed from oven.

Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Add pudding mix, orange sections and egg substitute. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 40 minutes or until cake tester comes out clean. Let cool in pans for 10 minutes and then remove from pans and cool completely. Dip top in powdered sugar and serve.

Saute celery and onions in a large skillet in butter until tender. Stir in curry powder. Add shrimp and flour. Stir in sour cream. Stir in cream. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 5 minutes or until thickened. Add shrimp to sauce. Simmer 3 minutes. Top with chopped parsley.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Prepare 6-inch square casserole dish. Place chopped tomato slices on bottom of dish. Place bacon on top of tomato slices. Top bacon with chicken breast meat and then a slice of low-fat cheese. Bake uncovered until heated through and cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Serve with rice.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Place in saucepan with enough water to cover by 1 inch. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain. Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over low heat. Add milk. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Add potatoes. Cook 5 minutes. Add remaining 1/4 cup milk. Season with salt.

Preheat an indoor griddle or outdoor grill. Dip each steak into the melted butter. Place the butter side down on the griddle. Griddle each side until a golden brown color. Place each steak on a plate. Top each steak with a mushroom half. Drizzle each steak with the taco sauce and sprinkle with parsley. Serve.
Heat the oil in a pan. Add the garlic and ginger, stirring well. Add the green beans. Cook 5-7 minutes or until crisp-tender. Season with soy sauce. Sprinkle with honey. Serves 6.

Rinse brown rice under cold running water to remove any excess starch and then place the rice into a saucepan with water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then cover the pot and simmer for 40 minutes or until all the liquid is absorbed. Turn off the heat and let the rice stand covered for 5 more minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork before serving to loosen any remaining grains from the bottom of the pot. If desired add a splash of olive oil or a dash of salt or lemon juice for a taste booster!

Preheat oven to 350. Grease muffin tins. In a large bowl, blend the sugar and shortening. Beat in the eggs. Combine the milk and vanilla and add to the shortening mixture. Blend in the flour, baking soda and salt. Stir in the chocolate chips. Fill the muffin tins about halfway. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool in tins for 5 minutes and then remove to rack.

Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened about 4-5 minutes. Add the plum tomatoes and basil and cook for about 1 minute longer. Stir in the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Cook for 10 minutes or until the broth is reduced by half and thickens slightly. Add the penne pasta and cook according to package instructions. Once the pasta is cooked, stir in the cheeses and cook until melted and slightly browned. Serve immediately with additional cheese sprinkled on top if desired.

Cut crescent roll dough into 6 squares. Place one square in a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Place ham, bacon and eggs in the center of the crescent roll. Season with salt and pepper. Place the remaining crescent roll dough around the eggs. Place the baking dish in the center of a jelly roll pan. Fill the jelly roll pan with hot water. Bake at 425 degrees for 20 minutes. Allow pie to cool 15 minutes before serving.

In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment beat the butter until creamy. Add the garlic clove, sugar snap peas and pecans. Mix on medium speed until all the ingredients are well combined. Toss with sugar snap peas. In a small bowl whisk together the brown sugar, lemon juice and cracked black pepper. Toss with the sugar snap peas. Season with salt to taste.

Bring water and butter to a boil. Blanch broccoli for 2 minutes. Drain and cool under cold water. Finely chop onion and bell peppers and mix with broccoli and seasonings. Drain well and add more seasonings to taste. Serve immediately.

Mix ricotta cheese with 3 egg yolks and season with salt and pepper. Add pecorino romano cheese and mix well. Add dried breadcrumbs and mix. Refrigerate for about half an hour. Meanwhile prepare tomato sauce by mixing tomatoes and their juice with a teaspoon of water and cook for about half an hour until you have a thick sauce. Stir in fresh basil. Mix ricotta mixture with parsley and add 3 egg whites. Make medium sized balls and drop into tomato sauce. Cover and cook for about ten minutes. Serve with fresh parmesan cheese.

Prepare a large bowl with ice cold water. Peel your bananas, cut them in half and freeze for at least an hour or until you're ready to make pops. Place your bananas in a blender with a couple spoonfuls of honey. Blend well. Pour into a ziplock bag. Add a couple spoonfuls of ice cold water. Seal. Place a wooden popsicle stick into the end of your banana. When you're ready to make your popsicle, cut off the tip of your bag. Holding your bag over your bowl of cold water, slowly squeeze your banana until it is frozen. Place into freezer to harden. Melt chocolate. Dip bananas into chocolate. Place banana pops into freezer until chocolate is firm.

Mix potato and carrot in pot of boiling water to cook. Peel and cut them into large cubes. Grate hard-boiled egg and cut it into small cubes. Add beets to the boiling water and cook them for a few minutes until soft and tender. Drain the beets and cut them into large cubes. Peel and cut the red onion in half and cut it in large cubes. Mix all the cooked vegetables with the white rice and the oil and lemon juice. Add salt to taste and serve. This salad can be made in advance and refrigerated for later use.

Preheat oven to 350f degrees. Combine flour and salt in a bowl and make a well in the center of the mixture. Add butter and cut in with a pastry blender or with a fork until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in sour cream and then add enough water to make a dough that will hold together when pressed together with fingers. Place dough in a pastry bag and pipe dough onto a lightly floured surface into a circle about an inch larger than your pie pan. Place in refrigerator for at least 1 hour and up to 2 hours. Meanwhile prepare filling by dicing apples and combining with brown sugar and sour cream in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir until heated through and apples are softened slightly. In a large bowl whisk together egg yolks and brown sugar until combined. In a small bowl whisk together flour and salt. Add egg yolk mixture to apple mixture and mix well. Pour apples mixture into pie dough and arrange sliced apples on top of filling in a pretty pattern and pinch edges together and crimp

Cook noodles in salted water until tender. Drain well. Measure 2 1/2 cups of the noodles into a 1 1/2-quart baking dish. Set aside the remaining noodles. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in 1/2 cup flourcook and stir for 2 minutes. Gradually add milk. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Stir in the tuna and 3/4 cup of the noodles. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 25 minutes or until heated through. Top with the remaining 1 cup noodles and broccoli. Bake for 5 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with parsley. Makes 6 servings.

Melt sugar in top of double boiler set over simmering water, stirring constantly until sugar dissolves. Add evaporated milk and cook, stirring until the mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in butter and vanilla. Beat the peanut butter and marshmallow creme until smooth. Stir the peanut butter mixture into the sugar mixture. Pour into a buttered 9x9 inch pan. Cool and cut into squares.

Spread a thin layer of apricot jam on one side of each slice of bread. Top each slice with 1/2 tablespoon of cream cheese and 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon. Arrange bread slices, apricot side down, in a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Top each sandwich with another slice of bread. Spray or brush with oil. Broil 4 to 5 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from dish and serve immediately.

Put rice into a large bowl and pour boiling water over it to cover it. Let stand for an hour or two. Drain well. Place the rice, milk, sugar, salt, and cocoa in a large saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes or until the mixture is thickened to a custard consistency. Stir frequently to prevent sticking. Remove from the heat and stir in butter. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Wash and dry leeks well and cut into thin half-moons. Place leek half-moons onto a greased 9x13-inch baking dish and bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown and tender. Meanwhile, beat eggs and yogurt together. Place leeks on serving plate. Top with cheese mixture and fresh breadcrumbs. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and bake for 5 minutes more or until breadcrumbs are golden brown. Let stand for 5 minutes and serve warm.

Cut a whole orange into thin slices. Squeeze juices from one orange into a bowl. Put the orange slices into the apple to keep them from browning. Place the apples into a baking dish. Combine the figs, nuts, orange zest, brown sugar, allspice, and orange juice. Stuff the apples. Drizzle the butter on the apples. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Brown ground beef with onion. Add sauce. Bring to a boil. Add macaroni. Bring to boil again. Reduce heat. Cook until done. Stir in tomato paste. Drain. Stir in cheese. When cheese is melted, add bacon bits.

Place chicken in a bowl. Cover with cold water and add a dash of salt. Refrigerate overnight (12 to 14 hours). Drain. Remove skin by sliding knife down length of each piece of chicken. Place in a large bowl. Stir in mayonnaise, jam, raisins and onion (reserve some for the sandwich). Combine white bread slices with a little mayonnaise (optional). Spread chicken mixture over bread slicestop with remaining slices of white bread. Cut each sandwich in half diagonally for easier serving.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. Grease or line 12 muffin cups with paper liners. In a large bowl, whisk together the milk, butter and eggs until combined. In another bowl, sift together the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Stir the flour mixture into the milk mixture until just blended. Fold in the strawberries and nuts. Fill the muffin cups about 2/3 full. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Peel and core tomatoescut in half. Cut onion into 1/8-inch sliceshalve bell peppers crosswisecut into strips 1/8-inch thick. Place onion and bell peppers in a large bowlstir in seasoningsadd tomatoestoss gently to coat. Place bread on a large baking sheetspread tomato mixture evenly over bread. Bake at 350 for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown and heated through. Just before serving, spread gorgonzola on 1 side of each slice of breadtop with slices of bread. Place slices on a serving platterdrizzle with balsamic vinaigrette.

In a large soup pot or Dutch oven over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the flour and cajun seasoning and whisk. Gradually add the clam juice and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Whisk in the tomatoes and spinach. Cook for an additional 3 minutes. Ladle into bowls and top each with a dollop of the crabmeat. Sprinkle with fresh thyme.
Mix all ingredients together in bowl until combined. Place pretzels in sprayed baking dish. Pour mixture over pretzels and bake at 350f for 12 minutes.

Heat broth over medium heat. Add onion and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer. Add sauerkraut and apples and continue to simmer for 10 minutes. Drain and transfer to an ovenproof dish. Sprinkle with caraway seed. Broil for 5 minutes or until heated through. Top with low fat Swiss cheese.

Wash fruit and pick over for good ones. Wash berries and place in a 4-qt. kettle. Combine sugar and liquid pectin in a small bowl and stir to dissolve. Add to berries. Add lemon juice and stir to mix. Bring mixture to boiling. Boil for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and skim foam from surface. Ladle hot jam into half- pint jars, leaving 1/8 inch head space. Wipe rims. Place lids and rings on jars. Process filled jars in a boiling-water canner for 10 minutes. Yield: 4 half-pint jars.

Bake or grill chicken. Cut chicken into strips. Cut courgette into strips. Layer chicken strips over courgette strips. Fill with tomato mixture. Roll up. Place in oven proof dish. Cover with mozzarella cheese. Cook for 20-30 mins until chicken is cooked. Serve with cooked pasta.

Crack the eggs into a bowl and beat them lightly with a fork. Add water and beat until the mixture is thick and smooth. In a different bowl sift together the flour and salt. Add the egg mixture and stir until smooth. Add the chopped chilies and stir until the mixture is well combined and thick enough to coat the chilies. Add the cheese and stir until melted and incorporated. Spoon the batter into a greased baking dish and bake for about 40 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through in the center.

Combine 1/2 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup rice wine vinegar, 2 tablespoons lime juice and 1/4 cup sugar in a shallow baking dish. Add 2 tablespoons sesame oilstir in 1 teaspoon grated gingerroot. Place in refrigerator until ready to use. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine remaining 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar and 1/4 cup lime juice. Whisk in 1/4 cup sugar. Stir in 1/3 cup sesame oilset aside. Combine 2 tablespoons olive oil flavored cooking spray and 1 tablespoon grated fresh gingerroot in a small bowlstir in 1 tablespoon lime juice. Coat a large baking sheet with non-stick cooking spray. Trim squid bodies of tentacles. Cut squid bodies lengthwise in half lengthwise. Remove center membrane from squid bodies. Thread 4 squid bodies onto each
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine chickpeas and garlic powder in a large bowl. Spray a 9 x 13 inch baking dish with nonstick spray. Add chickpeas and bake for 20 minutes. Serve warm.

Season salmon fillets with sea salt and pepper. Mix garlic cloves, gingerroot and soy sauce together. Rub salt into the skin of the salmon fillets. Place fillets in a foil dish and pour garlic mixture over the top. Place in a hot oven. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley and green onions.

Boil the potatoes until tender. Drain the water. Peel the potatoes. Mash the potatoes with the garlic cloves. Mix in the corn. Mix in the buttermilk. Add salt & pepper to taste. Mix in the chives. Serve hot.

Melt butter in a large soup pot over medium heat. Add onions and cook until translucent. Add the beef broth and cook until reduced. Add water and Worcestershire sauce and stir. Let the soup cook for 1 hour. Add Italian dressing and stir. Simmer soup for 30 more minutes. Stir in seasoned croutons and cook 5 minutes. Top with mozzarella cheese. Serve.
Slice banana, orange and walnut halves. Mix together well and top with toasted coconut flakes. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cream together fat-free margarine, brown sugar and white sugar until light and fluffy. Add vanilla extract. Beat in eggs until well blended. Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Add flour mixture to sugar mixture, beating until well blended. Stir in bananas. Press half of mixture into 9-inch square pan. Top with remaining mixture. Sprinkle with chocolate chips. Bake for 25 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Remove from oven. Cool completely. Cut into small squares.

Place orange roughy fillets in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Place margarine in a small bowl. Add parmesan cheese. Mash cheese and margarine together until smooth. Sprinkle orange roughy with half of the cheese mixture. Top with green onions. Repeat with remaining orange roughy fillets. Sprinkle each with remaining cheese mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Serve hot.

In a small bowl combine mustard, lemon juice, rosemary and garlic. Sprinkle thighs on both sides with pepper. Place thighs in a shallow baking dish. Pour mustard mixture over top. Cover baking dish with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours. Remove plastic wrap. Dip thighs in bran flakes to coat. Bake for 30 minutes in preheated oven at 450 degrees f. Remove from oven. Turn thighs over. Bake for 15 minutes more. Sprinkle cheese on top. Bake another 5 minutes. Let cool before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f (200 degrees c). Trim carrots and cut them into 1/2 inch thick rounds. Place on baking sheet or roasting pandrizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic cloves, sugar, cumin and salt. Place carrots in oven and cook until tender but not mushy, about 30 to 40 minutes. Meanwhile, heat water for the raisin bath. Add raisins to hot water and set aside. Remove carrots from oven and place on plate or platter. Add 1/4 cup water to raisin bath and dunk carrots into bath for 3 to 5 minutes to blanch the carrots and keep them from sticking to the plate or platter when you remove them from the bath. Remove carrots from bath and place back on plate or platterdrizzle with lemon juice and sprinkle with fresh parsley to serve.

Combine water and sugar in a 2-qt. Microwave-safe pitcherstir well. Add mochiko. Microwave uncovered at high 1 to 1/2 min. Stir. Microwave uncovered at high 1 to 1/2 min. or until mixture becomes sticky. Add vanilla. Stir in red food coloring and soybean flour. Microwave uncovered at high 1 to 1/2 min. or until mixture is thick enough to form into balls. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto wax paper. Flatten with wet hands. Let stand 5 min. to cool. Store in airtight container in refrigerator up to 2 weeks. Yield: 2 dozen mochi. Makes about 2 dozen mochi.

Boil potatoes until tender and drain well. Peel and dice into 1-inch pieces. In a greased 3-quart casserole dish, combine potatoes with diced hard-cooked eggs and green onions. Combine mustard, salt and pepper to taste. Mix with potato mixture and pour in the low fat sour cream. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk and the eggs and blend into the potato mixture. Top with cheddar cheese and bake uncovered for 20-30 minutes at 350 degrees fahrenheit or until cheese is melted and potatoes are tender and heated through.

Slice zucchini into 1/8 inch thick slices. Place in a bowl of cold water to prevent discoloring. Drain and place in a large plastic bag. Shake to coat. Pour into a plate. Repeat with remaining zucchini. Place a nonstick frying pan on medium-high heat. Spray lightly with cooking spray. Add a few zucchini slices to the pan. Cook until crisp. Turn the slices over to cook the other side. Remove to a plate lined with paper towels. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve with marinara sauce for dipping. Makes 6 servings.
Mix ground beef with tomato sauce and tomato diced tomatoes. Place biscuits in casserole dish and fill with meat mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375 for 40 minutes.

Drain garbanzo beans well. Mash garbanzo beans with a potato masher. Add walnuts and mash. Add fresh basil leaf and mix well. Mix in oil and lemon juice. Add salt and pepper. Serve with warm pita bread.
In a medium bowl combine rice, spinach, carrot and garlic clove. Add salt and pepper to taste. Mix with dressing. Chill and serve.
Soak bread in a mixture of milk and eggs. Add sugar. Then add salt, vanilla extract and chocolate chips. Bake in a baking dish for an hour at 350F.

Drain and pat dry the tofu. Cut the tofu into 1/2 inch cubes. In a bowl, mix the bread crumbs and cornmeal. Sprinkle the tofu with the seasoning salt, sugar and pepper. Roll the tofu cubes in the bread crumb mixture and place on a baking sheet. Bake at 450 degrees F. for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Turn the tofu over and bake for 5 minutes more.

Clean mussels. Put in a steamer or pot with cold water. Cover. Bring to a boil. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Drain. Dissolve pickling spice in boiling water. Strain. Put in a 1 cup jar with the mussels. Add vinegar. Cover. Refrigerate at least 24 hours. Makes about 1 quart.

Mix all the burger ingredients together except the buns. Divide the burger mixture into 6 portions. Take one bun bottom and spread the other bottom with mayonaisse or mustard. Put 1/3 of the burger mixture on each bottom bun. Top each with the other bun bottoms. Grill for 20 minutes or until done. Serve on the buns with the desired topping (cheese, lettuce, tomato, onions...).

Place corn syrup and sugar in a large heavy pot and cook over medium heat until sugar melts. Remove from heat and stir in brown sugar. Mix in crushed pineapple and sweetened condensed milk. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook and stir constantly until mixture thickens and bubbles. Remove from heat and stir in butter. Add vanilla and marshmallows. Stir until marshmallows are melted. Pour into a greased and floured 9x13" pan. Cool completely and cut into squares. Store in airtight container in refrigerator.

Combine carrot, capsicum and cabbage in a large bowl. Add mayonnaise and mix well. Refrigerate for half an hour. Preheat grill. Slice sausages in half and cook for 6-8 minutes until cooked through. Grill hot dogs for about two minutes until grill-marked and cooked through. Sandwich sausage and hot dog halves in buns and add coleslaw.

In a medium saucepan bring chicken broth to a boil. Stir in ginger and reduce heat to medium-low and cook 5 minutes. Add rice and lemon rind and simmer for 20 minutes, until rice is tender. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes before fluffing with fork. Stir in coconut milk and ginger and heat through. Sprinkle with green onions and flaked coconut before serving.

Cook pasta according to package directions and drain. Meanwhile, place garlic cloves and oil in a medium-sized sauce pan over medium heat and cook for about a minute or until fragrant. Add the tomatoes and basil and cook for about 10 minutes or until tomatoes are softened and sauce thickens. Drain pasta and toss with the sauce. Add salt and pepper and garnish with fresh basil leaves. Serve immediately.

Roll out cookie dough into rectangular shape using rolling pin and pan. Bake according to package instructions. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Spread vanilla yogurt over cooled crust using plastic knife. Next top with crushed pineapple, strawberry and blueberries. Top with cool whip and place back into refrigerator for at least an hour. Once it is set and cold, top with chopped pecans if desired and cut into serving size pieces.

Preheat oven to 350. In a medium mixing bowl cream together the butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix well. Stir in flour, baking powder and ground cardamom. Add milk. Stir well. Fold in the banana slices. Spoon into prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes.

In a medium bowl, combine the butterscotch chips and the marshmallows. Heat the butter and the peanut butter together in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir until smooth. Add to the bowl with the butterscotch mixture. Add the cheerios to the bowl. Stir until the cheerios are coated. Add raisins and stir. Press the mixture into a lightly greased 8x8-inch square baking dish. Sprinkle with coconut flakes. Chill for at least 30 minutes. Cut into bars.

Dice apples into 1/2-inch pieces. Spread evenly in a 9 x 13-inch glass baking dishset aside. Combine raisins and apple pie spice in a small bowlset aside. Combine margarine and apple juice in a medium bowlmicrowave at HIGH 20 seconds or until margarine is completely melted. Stir in Splendapour over apple mixture. Covermicrowave 25 minutes or until apples are tender. Stir in raisinsserve warm. You can also use a 350 degree oven for 50 minutes or until apples are tender.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray and set aside. In a large bowl, mash bananas and stir in all other ingredients. Pour banana mixture in prepared baking dish and bake for about 35-45 minutes or until a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Serve warm.

Rinse chicken breasts and pat dry with paper towels. In a large bowl combine lime juice, lime zest, thyme, black pepper, salt and minced garlic. Add chicken breasts and marinate for at least 2 hours in the fridge, or overnight in the refrigerator. Remove chicken from the refrigerator about 1 hour before you start cooking. Heat cooking oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Grill chicken breasts in hot skillet until brown, about 4 minutes on each side. Remove chicken breasts from the pan and set aside on a platter. In a large saucepan, bring salsa, lime juice and lime zest to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Shake salsa mixture into a small bowlset aside. Arrange chicken breasts on serving platter. Top each breast half with a quarter of the salsa mixture and garnish with lime wedges. Serve with rice or mashed potatoes.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. In a large bowl, combine olive oil, pork tenderloin with herbs and spices. Dust with flour. Place the pork in a large baking dish. Pour the wine over the pork and sprinkle with the olives and rosemary. Bake for 45 minutes or until meat is tender. Remove meat from the baking dish and discard the liquid. Thinly slice pork. In a saucepan melt the butter over medium heat. Add the shallots and garlic and saute until tender. Add the heavy cream and bring to a boil. Cook for 3 minutes. Add the white wine and the pork to the sauce and simmer for 10 minutes or until sauce thickens. Serve the pork with sauce on top. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve warm.

Drain french-fried onions and pat dry. Bake chicken breasts in a roasting pan for about an hour. Once they have cooled a little, cut into strips. Arrange chicken on a platter and top with onions. Drain and rinse green beans. Slice beans and arrange on platter with chicken and onions. Heat soup, add milk and soy sauce. Pour soup into a gravy boat and spoon over chicken and beans. Serve with rice.

Cut each potato in half lengthwise. Remove the center portion of the potatoes leaving a shell to fill. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the water chestnuts, artichoke hearts, spinach, parmesan cheese and seasonings to the skillet with the melted butter. Cook until heated through, about 10 minutes. Fill each potato shell with the spinach artichoke mixture. Bake 20-30 minutes or until the potatoes are tender.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Halve onions lengthwise and brush with oil, then season with salt and pepper. Place on a cookie sheet and roast for 20 minutes, until tender and slightly brown. Halve zucchini lengthwise and brush with oil, then season with salt and pepper. Place on a cookie sheet and roast for 15 minutes, until tender and slightly brown. Slice peppers in half lengthwise and brush with oil, then season with salt and pepper. Place on a cookie sheet and roast for 15 minutes, until tender and slightly brown. Cut butternut squash into 1-inch cubes and brush with oil, then season with salt and pepper. Place on a cookie sheet and roast for 25 minutes, until tender and slightly brown. Halve tomatoes and season with salt and pepper. Place on a cookie sheet and roast for 30 minutes, until tender and slightly brown. Heat olive oil in a large skillet and add garlic and thyme. Cook until fragrant and garlic is tender, about 3 minutes. Add roasted onions

Mix together the olive oil and vinegar. Whisk in the garlic and mustard. Stir in the oregano. Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Thread the sausage onto the skewers. Place the skewers on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes at 400 degrees. Brush the sauce over the kebabs. Bake for another 10 minutes until the sausage is cooked through. Serve warm with a side of rice pilaf.
Preheat oven to 350f. Mix all ingredients together and bake at 350f for 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool completely before slicing and serving.

Spray an 8x11-inch casserole dish with cooking spray. Place broccoli in casserole dish. In medium bowl, combine mayonnaise, cheese, soup mix and eggs. Spread evenly over broccoli. Top with crackers. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes. Sprinkle with additional cheese. Bake for an additional five minutes. Let stand for five minutes before serving. Top with additional cheese. Serve warm.

In a medium bowl, combine the cucumber pieces and dill. In a small bowl, mix the lemon juice and olive oil. Pour the dressing over the vegetables and toss. Season to taste with salt. Serve on lettuce leaves or as a dip.

In a large bowl, combine pudding mix and milkstir until blended. Fold in peanut butter. Refrigerate 10 minutes or until pudding thickens slightly. Spoon into dessert cupstop each with a dollop of whipped topping and a dollop of peanut butter.

In a large saucepan combine coconut milk, sugar and cornstarch. Stirring constantly, bring mixture to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heatcook for 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in vanilla. Transfer pudding to a 1 1/2-qt. glass bowl. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Serves 6.

Prepare frittata: Preheat large skillet over medium heat. Add oil to pan and swirl to coat. Add onion and sauté until tender and translucent, about 2 minutesadd garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add parsley and sauté until fragrant, about 30 secondsadd bread cubes and sauté until toasted and fragrant, about 2 minutesadd egg mixture and cook until edges are set and center is almost set, about 3 minutesseason to taste with salt and peppersprinkle with chili flakes and parmesan cheesetransfer to oven to finish cooking until set and puffed up, about 5 minutesserve warm.

Trim away any excess fat from the pork loin. Sprinkle both sides with salt and pepper. Combine the lavender with the thyme and rosemary and rub the herb mixture over the pork. Grill the loin over medium heat for approximately 10 minutes per side. When cooked to your liking remove the meat from the grill. Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing. Serve the meat with the juices from the grill and the lemon juice and garlic.

Place chicken breast halves skin side down in lightly greased 13X9 baking dish. Sprinkle chicken with garlic cloves. Pour diced tomatoes over chicken. Sprinkle chicken with olive oil, dried parsley flakes, dried basil flakes and dried oregano. Place chicken in 375 degree oven for 35-40 minutes. Remove chicken from baking dish. Drain pasta. Stir in feta cheese. Spoon pasta over chicken. Return to oven for 5 minutes. Garnish with kalamata olives. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel potatoes. Cut potatoes in half and place in single layer in a baking pan. Sprinkle potatoes with seasoning salt and pepper. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake in oven for 35 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Slice bread. Put butter in a pan. Put bread butter side down in pan. Toast until lightly browned. Spread cheese on bread. Cover bread with cheese. Heat oil in a pan. Cook the bread until brown. Fry cheese sandwiches in oil. Serve warm.

Prepare hard-cooked eggs. Cut cucumbers and celery into 1/2 inch slices. Make cucumber boats by placing cucumber slices in the palm of your hand. Place egg in the center of cucumber and top with tuna. Top tuna with cheese slices and then add relish, onions and lemon juice. Serve on plate.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add sugar and stir until it dissolves. Add egg substitute and stir until well blended. Stir in pineapple. Add flour to the mixture. Stir until it is well combined. Pour mixture into a greased loaf pan. Bake for 60 minutes or until it test done. Remove from pan. Cool on rack.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bring a medium saucepan of water to a boil. Add eggs to water. Cook 6 minutes. Drain. Cut tortillas into 6 pieces. Place each piece in a greased muffin pan. Spoon salsa into each tortilla. Break an egg into each one. Top with cheese. Bake 10 minutes. Serve hot.
Fill large pot with water. Bring to a boil. Add greens. Cook for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. Add remaining ingredients and simmer for 20 minutes.
Place water, sugar, vanilla bean and lemon juice into a large pitcher. Stir to dissolve the sugar. Chill until ready to serve. Serve over ice cubes. Garnish with a lemon wedge.

In a large bowl beat together egg, oil, honey, lemon zest and carrots. In a separate bowl stir together flour, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger and salt. Stir dry ingredients into the carrot mixture until just blended. Add raisins. Spoon batter onto a cookie sheet lined with foil. Form into 18 1 x 2 inch fingers. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. Makes 18.
In a 6-quart crock pot combine ham, pineapple slices and 1 cup water. Place lid on crock pot. Cook on low 8 to 9 hours. Stir in Parmesan Cheese. Cook 1 hour more. Serve warm.

Beat eggs and milk until light and frothy. Stir in vanilla essence and half the almonds. Heat butter and a little olive oil in a pan. Dip each slice of bread into egg mixture and place into pan. Cook for 1 minute each side until golden brown. Serve hot with remaining almonds.

Cut chicken into 1-inch cubes. Dice onion. Cut carrot into thin coins. Thinly slice mushrooms. Cut spinach into 1-inch pieces. Heat oil in wok or large skillet over high heat. Add onion. Cook 3 minutes or until softened. Add carrotcook 3 minutes. Add mushroomscook 2 minutes. Add chickencook 3 minutes or until no longer pink. Add spinachcook 2 minutes or until just wilted. Remove from heat. Stir in tomatoes, sauce, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Divide evenly between serving platessprinkle with sesame seeds.
Place chicken in a bowl. Stir in jalapeno jelly. Pour the steak sauce over the chicken. Coat with cooking spray. Bake in a 375f preheated oven for 35 minutes. Serve.

Place the chopped vegetables and water in a deep saucepan. Bring to the boil and simmer for about 20 minutes until the vegetables are soft. Add salt and pepper. Put the chopped vegetables and the water into a deep saucepan. Bring to the boil and simmer for about 20 minutes until the vegetables are soft. Add salt and pepper. Put half the vegetables into the blender and blend to a purée. Add the blended vegetables to the rest of the vegetables and simmer for about 5 minutes. Add the half-and-half and season well. Serve hot. Serves 4.

In a large bowl, whisk together the flour and the whole wheat flour. In a smaller bowl or measuring cup, combine the beer and the butter and set aside. In a separate small bowl or measuring cup, combine the brown sugar and the eggs. Add the beer mixture to the dry mixture and stir to combine. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and bake for about 50 minutes. The bread is done when a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Allow to cool for about 15 minutes before removing the bread from the pan.
Slice potatoes and add to a saucepan. Cover with water and bring to a boil. Boil until tender. Drain the potatoes and add butter. Sprinkle in the madras curry powder and stir in the honey. Serve hot.

Rub short ribs all over with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. In a large heavy pot or Dutch oven over medium heat add oil. Once oil is hot add in short ribs and sear until golden and carmelized. In a medium bowl combine beef broth with red wine. Add in honey, brown sugar and season with salt and pepper. Pour the liquid into the pan with short ribs and bring to a boil over medium heat. Place a lid on top of the pan and seal. Place lid on top of the pan and seal. Turn the heat down to medium high and cook the ribs until they are tender and the liquid is reduced by half. Remove from heat and add in chopped sweet onion and garlic cloves. Transfer to a cutting board and shred the meat. Serve over mashed potatoes.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add potatoes and boil for 15 minutes. Remove potatoes from pot and cool. Peel the potatoes. Cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Boil the eggs until cooked through. Drain the eggs under cold running water. Cool the eggs completely. Drain the potatoes again. Cut the eggs in half lengthwise. Slice the cucumbers into 1/4-inch-thick rounds. Peel the eggs. Peel the potatoes. Peel the chicken. Cut into 1-inch cubes. Mix all the vegetables in a bowl. In another bowl, combine the mayonnaise with the sour cream. Add the vegetables to the bowl with the dressing. Chill for a few hours before serving. Garnish with thin slices of hard-boiled eggs.

Bake potatoes in a large saucepan. Peel potatoes and cut into 1 inch cubes. Place potatoes in a large bowl and add enough salted water to cover. Bring potatoes to a boil over high heat. Boil potatoes until tender. Drain. Place potatoes in a large bowl. Add mushrooms, green beans, onion, salt and pepper. Stir in potato mixture. Add flour, bread crumbs, salt and pepper. Stir well. Add milk. Beat mixture until blended. Pour mixture into a greased baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Sprinkle bread crumbs over top. Bake for an additional 15 minutes. Serve with French bread. Serves six.

Toss the apples with the caster sugar and vanilla extract. Place in an ungreased rectangular baking dish. Mix the plain white flour and brown sugar and then add the cold cubes of butter and rub in until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Sprinkle over the apples. Bake for about 25-30 minutes until golden brown and the apples are cooked through. Sprinkle over the hazelnuts just before serving. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Place ribs in large glass baking dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. In small bowl mix 3 tablespoons of the red sauce with the oregano. Pour over pork. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake uncovered at 350f for 2 1/2 to 3 hours. Serve with tortillas.

Place yeast and water in large bowl. Let stand until frothy. Add sugar and salt. Stir in vegetable oil. Add flour and mix well. Turn dough out onto floured board and knead for 10 minutes. Form dough into a ball and place in greased bowl. Cover with cloth and let rise until doubled. Punch down dough and form into loaf shape. Place in greased loaf pan and cover with cloth. Let rise until doubled in size. Bake at 375 for about one hour. Remove from pan and let cool.
Melt cream cheese in microwave. Combine all the ingredients. Stir. Put in refrigerator for 30 mins. Serve with crackers.

Cook the halloumi in a pan in a little olive oil. After a few minutes, turn the cheese and fry the other side. Let the cheese cool and slice into strips. Place the cheese on skewers and then add a few olives. Sprinkle with some oregano leaves. Drizzle with a little olive oil. Drizzle some lemon juice and lime juice. Enjoy with pitta bread.

Place 2/3 cup boiling water in a small bowl. Add 1 package (1 1/2 oz) orange gelatin. Let stand for 3 minutes. Add 1/2 cup orange sherbet. Stir to dissolve. Divide mixture equally between 2 dessert glasses or bowls. Top with mandarin orange halves. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or until set.

In skillet add bacon and onion and cook to your liking. Drain bacon and onion from pan add venison meat. Cook through break up meat with spatula while cooking and season with salt and pepper to taste. Add venison to bacon mixture form into patties or cook as is for burger meat. Bake at 350f for about 10-12 min or grill for about 7 min on each side. Top with cheese if desired.

Mix together egg white and dijon mustard. Dip each piece of turkey into egg mixture. Roll in bread crumbs. Heat a griddle over medium-high heat. Place the turkey on the griddle. Cook until browned on each side. Combine mustard and swiss cheese in a small bowl. Spread each turkey burger with the mustard/cheese mixture. Serve on a bun.

Preheat broiler. Season tenderloin steaks. Broil 4 to 6 minutes per side. Set aside. Top each romaine heart with 1 teaspoon crouton. Place 1 beef steak over crouton. Drizzle with salad dressing. Garnish with sliced tomatoes. Sprinkle with grated parmigiano. Serve immediately.
Slice your bread into 4 even pieces. Spread butter on each slice of bread, then add meatloaf to each sandwich. Top with barbecue sauce and cheese. Enjoy!

Saute the star anise in 1 Tbsp. butter and 1 Tbsp. oil. Saute the shallots in 1 Tbsp. butter. Saute the garlic in the remaining 1 Tbsp. butter. Add rice to the sauteed shallots and garlic. Saute for 1 minute. Add the remaining butter to the pan. Add the soy sauce. Saute for 1 minute. Add the sesame oil. Saute for 1 minute. Add the egg. Saute for 1 minute. Add the water. Saute for 1 minute.
Potatoes and clams are first cooked and then combined. Salt and pepper and add the half-and-half. Serve hot.

Season chicken breast lightly with salt and pepper. In a large skillet over medium heat add 3 Tbs of butter. When the butter is hot add chicken breast to skillet. When it starts to brown add green onions, garlic, parsley and thyme. When chicken is cooked through remove from skillet. Add remaining 3 Tbs of butter to pan. When the butter starts to foam add dried tarragon. Let it simmer for a few minutes. Add 3 Tbs of Drambuie. Simmer for about 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add chicken breasts to skillet. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray baking sheet with cooking spray. Trim ends of asparagus and cut into 4 inch pieces. In bowl, whisk together preserves, soy sauce, garlic powder, 2 tsp. Salt, and 1 tsp. Pepper. Brush asparagus with mixture. Spread asparagus in single layer on baking sheet. Roast 20 to 25 minutes or until crisp-tender. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 tsp. Salt. Serve warm. Makes 3 cups.
