Drain artichokes in a colander and reserve liquid. Coarsely chop. Combine in a large bowl with mayonnaise. Add artichokes and reserved liquid. Mix well. Add garlic powder and salt and white pepper to taste. Garnish with chopped parsley. Chill. Serve with crackers.

Preheat broiler. Remove all packaging from steak. Sprinkle steak with garlic powder and pepper. Heat 1 Tbsp. vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add steak and cook 4-5 minutes per side for medium-rare. Remove steak and keep warm. Add remaining 1 Tbsp. vegetable oil to skillet. Add shallots and cook until tender. Add wine and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until liquid reduces by half. Stir in half-and-half. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese and parsley. Season to taste. Spoon sauce over steak and serve.

Prepare a large pot of salted water. Bring to a boil and cook pasta shells according to package directions. Drain the pasta shells and set aside. In a medium saucepan on medium heat, warm the butter and gorgonzola cheese until melted. Stir in the heavy cream until blended. Season with salt and pepper. Add the cooked pasta shells and toss until well coated. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
Boil water in a teapot. Add black tea. Let steep for 5 minutes. Add ginger and let steep for another minute. Add remaining spices. Add 1 cup of milk. Serve hot.
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and set aside. In a saucepan, add the soup and milk. Bring to a boil and add potatoes and onion. Season with paprika and heat through.
Mix all ingredients in a large bowl. Knead into dough and let stand 10 minutes. Shape into loaves and bake at 375 degrees f for 25-30 minutes. Makes 2 loaves.

Cook macaroni as directed on package. Meanwhile, brown ground beef in skillet with chopped onion. Stir in tomato soup. Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain macaroni. Stir in milk. Stir in egg. Pour into greased 9x13x2 inch pan. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 13x9 pan with baking spray or lightly grease. In a large bowl combine the cake mix and water. Stir in the oil. Stir in the eggs and butter. In a smaller bowl combine the flour, cinnamon and sugar. Mix this into the cake batter. Pour into the prepared pan. Sprinkle with the powdered sugar. Bake for 45 minutes. Allow it to cool for 10 minutes before serving. It is also good the day after it is baked.

Cook bacon in a frying pan over medium heat until brown. Drain. Set aside. Cook pasta in a large saucepan of boiling water for 10 minutes until tender. Drain. Put pasta in a large bowl. Add broccoli, peas, butter, ricotta, and basil. Toss well to coat. Add bacon. Toss again. Season with pepper to taste.
Mix all ingredients. Serve with crackers.

In a large skillet, fry sausage over medium heat until browned and cooked through. Drain sausage on paper towels. In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs and cream. Season with salt and pepper. In a small bowl, stir the flour into the sausage. Add the sausage and egg mixture to the sausage mixture and stir until combined. Pour the sausage mixture into the prepared crust. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Let cool for about 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with a salad.

In a saucepan over medium heat melt the butter and brown sugar together. Bring to a boil and boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and add the milk and stir to combine. Stir until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon. Pour the mixture over the angel food cake and chill before serving. This can also be used as a filling for cupcakes or a glaze for cookies and donuts.

Boil crabs in water. Drain well and add curry leaves. Add hot chilli peppers. Dissolve corn flour in hot water. Add the hot water with the corn flour to the boiled crabs. Add salt, sugar and margarine. Boil till it thickens. Add evaporated milk. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a 2 quart casserole dish, combine broccoli, soup, curry powder, lemon juice and mayonnaise. Sprinkle cheese over mixture. Cover with chicken pieces. Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through. Serve.
Mix peas and carrots in large bowl with green onions. Pour ranch dressing over the salad. Add water chestnut. Add bacon. Add pepper. Toss well. Garnish with mozzarella cheese.

In large skillet over medium heat melt margarine. Add chicken breasts to pan. Add water and cover pan. Cook chicken 10 to 15 minutes until chicken is done. Remove chicken from pan and drain excess water. Mix ritz cracker crumbs with parmesan cheese and add to chicken. Pour soup over top and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in sour cream and mushrooms. Serve over rice.

Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the bacon and brown over moderately high heat until crisp. Remove the bacon with a slotted spoon. Reserve 2 tablespoons of the bacon fat. Add 2 tablespoons of the bacon to the bacon fat in the saucepan. Cook the bacon until crisp. Remove the bacon to paper towels. Add the onion to the saucepan with the remaining bacon fat. Cook the onion over moderately high heat until it is translucent. Add the garlic to the onion. Cook until the garlic is just fragrant. Add the potato to the saucepan. Cook the potatoes until they are tender. Stir the potatoes occasionally. Add the reserved bacon and the thyme. Cook until the potatoes are very tender. Add the stock. Increase the heat to high. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to moderate. Cook the soup until it is thickened. Add the cream. Cook for 5 minutes more. Season the soup with salt and pepper. Remove the th

In a saucepan melt oil. Sauté scallions and garlic until tender. Add celery and sauté 5 minutes. Add tomatoes, lemon pepper seasoning mix and cook 5 minutes. Stir in shrimp and olives. Cook 5 minutes or until shrimp are pink. Remove from heat and stir in fresh herbs. Serve over pasta.

Follow instructions on packaging for making pizza dough and prepare according to package directions. While dough is rising, mix tomato paste and oregano in small bowlset aside. Place pizza stone on pizza peelpreheat stone at 450 degrees F for 1 hour. Place dough on pizza stonetop with mozzarella cheese and tomato paste mixturesprinkle with olives and basil leavessprinkle with pepper to taste. Bake pizza on preheated stone for 12 minutes or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with sliced tomato and salad on side.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. In a skillet over medium heat, cook the onion and garlic until tender. Remove from pan. Place cooked chicken and bacon in a bowl. Add to chicken and bacon mixture onion and garlic. Pour ranch dressing and lemon juice over chicken mixture. Add pasta and toss. Serve hot.

Place cocoa in 2-quart saucepan and pour milk over it slowly. Bring to boil and cook slowly 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and let stand 30 minutes or more. Whisk in sugar and extracts. Stir in vanilla and spices and serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix sugar and eggs until fluffy. Stir in shortening and molasses. Blend in dry ingredients. Roll dough into balls and roll in sugar. Place on greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar.

Soak the whole wheat flour in 1/2 cup of cold water. (This step is not absolutely necessary, but it is helpful.) In a small bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, whole wheat flour and buttermilk. Set aside. In another small bowl combine the egg whites with the sea salt. Set aside. Place a medium nonstick waffle iron over medium heat. Brush waffle iron with melted butter. Add the egg yolk mixture to the iron, cooking until golden. Flip the waffle over and cook the second side until golden. Remove from waffle iron and repeat process until you have a stack of waffles. Serve immediately.
Beat ricotta cheese with sugar and vanilla extract for 2 minutes in a mixer or blender. Add orange juice and yogurt and mix well. Serve with fresh fruit slices.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel and quarter sweet potatoes. Toss potatoes with olive oil and salt. Roast in a single layer on a lightly oiled baking sheet at 400 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Melt butter. Add apples and cook until soft and translucent. Add cider and salt. Simmer until reduced by half. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. Combine cooked sweet potatoes and cooled apple cider. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Fold in cheese. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve.

Blend all the marinade ingredients together to a thick paste in a small bowl. Place salmon steaks in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over the salmon. Marinate the fish for at least 30 minutes to 1 hour in the refrigerator. When ready to cook, grill salmon on a barbecue or grill pan on medium-high heat, turning occasionally until salmon flakes easily with a fork, about 8-10 minutes total depending on thickness of salmon. Serve immediately with orange wedges as garnish if desired.

Melt butter over medium heat in a large skillet. Add the chopped garlic to the butter and cook for about 2 minutes. Stir in the wine. Cook for about 2 more minutes. Add the worcestershire sauce. Sprinkle in the seasonings. Cook for about 3 minutes or until the shrimp are opaque. Serve immediately over rice.

Mix together the dry ingredients. Add the butter and work it in. Add the cold water until the dough is the consistency of a ball of playdough. Knead it for a minute or two. Divide it in half. Roll each half out between two pieces of parchment paper to about 1/4-inch thickness. Place the parchment paper with the crusts on it on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven. Cut the crust into strips or squares with a sharp knife. Cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine first six ingredients in a large potbring to a boil. Add scalloped potatoes mixstir until thickened. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Add frozen mixed vegetablescook 5 minutes longer. Sprinkle with chivesserve immediately.

Cook rice in boiling water 25 minutes or as directed on package. Draincover and let stand 5 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Melt butter in large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook celery and onion in butter 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in remaining ingredients and bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer 10-15 minutes or until beef is done. Stir in drained ricecook an additional 5 minutes or until heated through. Makes 6 servings.

Put pork roast in large pot with water. Bring to a boil on medium heat. Simmer roast until it is tender about 2 hours. Take the roast out and shred. Add onion to the same pot. Cook onion for 5 minutes. Pour barbecue sauce over roast. Serve hot.

Melt 1 tbsp. Butter in a small saucepan. Add brown sugar and cook over low heat until mixture is smooth and syrupy. Stir in walnuts and cook for 1 minute. Add half-and-half and cook for 2 more minutes. Whisk in 3 tbsp. Brandy. Serve warm over ice cream. Makes about 1 cup.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Roll pizza dough out into a 12-inch round and place onto a pizza pan or a flat baking sheet that has been greased with olive oil or nonstick cooking spray. Top with freshly chopped garlic and tomatoes that have been purÃ©ed and spread evenly across the pizza dough. Spread the fresh spinach and ricotta cheese evenly over the tomatoes. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Remove pizza from oven and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and fresh basil leaves, if desired. Cut pizza into 6 wedges and serve warm.

Sauté garlic and onion in hot butter until translucent. Add tomatoes and cook for about 10 minutes or until softened. Stir in stock and cook until liquid has evaporated, about 15 minutes. Stir in rice and cook for about 12 minutes or until all liquid is absorbed. Season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl mix apples, bread, sugar and spices. In a small bowl, mix eggs and water. Pour over apple mixture and stir. Place in slow cooker and cook on low 6 to 8 hours. Makes 8 servings.

Cut firm tofu into 1/2" cubes and coat with soy sauce and balsamic vinegar. Dip in flour then coat with 1/2 teaspoon of the following spices mixed together - ground ginger, salt and white pepper. Heat olive oil and fry tofu cubes until golden brown and crisp. Serve over rice or noodles.
Add frozen limeade concentrate to pitcher and stir well. Add apple juice and ginger ale and stir well. Fill with ice and add maraschino cherry to the top for garnish. Serve immediately.

Cook potatoes and turnips in boiling salted water to cover for 20 minutes or until tender. Draincool slightly. Peel potatoes and turnips and cut into 1/2-inch pieces. Place in large bowl. Add onioncover and chill until ready to serve. Melt butter in small saucepan over low heat. Stir in flour until blended. Add milk and cook over low heat, stirring constantly with wooden spoon until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat. Pour over potatoes and turnipstoss to coat. Add salt and pepper to taste. Chill. Serve with green onions garnish.
Spread chive and onion cream cheese on bread. Top with capers and red onions. Drain sardines in oil. Top with sardines in oil and top with dill weed. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350f. In a small bowl mix together yogurt, oil and garlic. Set aside. Spread English muffins with yogurt mixture and top with tomatoes. Sprinkle basil leaves and cheese over top. Bake for about 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Melt butter in 1 1/2 quart Dutch oven. Add corn niblets. Stir in sour cream and bring to a boil. Cook 1 minute. Stir in creamed corn. Stir in eggs. Stir in flour, baking powder and salt. Pour into greased 2 quart baking dish. Bake 45 minutes. Serves 6.

Slice focaccia in half lengthwise. Spread each with olive oil. Layer with turkey breast (or other cooked meat) red onion, dried cranberries and cheese on half of each focaccia. Close sandwiches. Place on a baking sheet and brush both sides with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Broil on high until cheese melts, about 2 to 3 minutes per side or until golden brown on each side.

Put 250ml water and 50gm butter in a saucepan. Melt. Add 125gm brown sugar and mix well. Add 1 tbsp bicarbonate of soda and 2 tbs hot water. Mix well. Add 225ml wholemeal self-rising flour. Mix well. Add 275gm chopped walnuts and 275gm chopped pitted dates. Mix well. Put the mixture into a greased 1.2 litre cake tin. Bake at 180 degrees for 45 minutes. Once cooked remove from oven. Sprinkle 3 tbs slivered almonds on top and leave to cool. Serve at room temperature.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Salt water and cook pasta in batches until tender. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl combine tomatoes, pesto sauce and olive oil. Add cooked pasta and toss until coated. Add fresh mozzarella cheese and toss until evenly distributed. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and pine nuts and toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. In a large bowl, whisk together flour and baking soda. Stir in canola oil. Add mayonnaise and milk. Stir until a soft dough forms. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Roll out dough to a 1/2-inch thickness. Cut with a 3-inch round cookie cutter. Place cookies 1 inch apart on a greased baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes or until cookies are golden. Cool on a wire rack.
Spread nori on a baking sheet. Drizzle with sesame oil. Sprinkle with salt. Roast for 10 minutes or until crisp. Stir in sesame seeds. Roast for 5 more minutes or until seeds are toasted. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine flour, sugar, baking soda and salt. Cut shortening into flour mixture with a pastry blender or two knives until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add egg and almond extract. Mix well. Stir in sliced almonds. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.

Cut French bread into 4-inch lengths. Spread each piece of bread with 1 tablespoon garlic butter. Bake at 375 degrees for 6 minutes or until garlic butter is bubbly. While bread is baking, cook chicken breasts as desired (cooked or grilled). Slice cooked chicken breasts lengthwise into 6 strips. Place 2 pieces of bacon on top of each piece of garlic buttered breadplace chicken breast over bacon on bread. Top each with 1 slice mozzarella cheese. Return to ovenbake at 375 degrees for 4 minutes or until cheese melts.

Preheat oven to 425. Lightly grease 9x13 baking dish. Cut challah into 1 inch wide strips. Beat eggs with salt, honey, orange zest, and vanilla in a large bowl until frothy. In another large bowl, toss bread strips with melted butter and oil to coat evenly. Arrange bread in baking dish in a single layer, overlapping to cover bottom of pan. Pour egg mixture over bread. Let stand 5 minutes at room temperature to soften bread slightly. Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes. Serve with syrup or honey. Serves 12.

Slice off a bit of the top of the head of garlic and peel off the skin. Put the head of garlic in a baking dish, drizzle it with a little bit of olive oil and season with a bit of salt and pepper. Dot with a pat of butter. Roast until the cloves are soft and golden brown. Peel and slice the shallot and put it in a small mixing bowl. Add the butter and a tablespoon of the hot roasted garlic. Mash the shallot and butter together until well combined and then add the cream and sour cream and a pinch of salt and pepper. Taste and adjust seasoning as needed. If the mixture seems too thick for your taste, thin it out with a bit of the hot roasted garlic infused broth from the head of garlic or a little bit of hot water. Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium high heat and add the potatoes and cook until they begin to soften and release some liquid from the pan. Season the potatoes with a bit of salt and pepper and add a pat of butter and the sour cre

Wash pickling cucumber thoroughly. Place cucumber in a medium bowl. Stir in sugar and salt. Let stand for 30 minutes. Drain liquid. Place cucumber in a large bowl. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cover bowl and refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. Serve cold.

In a large skillet over high heat, heat oil until shimmeringadd chicken and cook until golden, about 4 minutes. Transfer the chicken to the bowl of a slow cookeradd the lime juice and gingerroot and cook, covered with the lid removed, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is thickened, about 1 hour. (You may have some liquid left overif so, add water and continue cooking.) Serve with basil and mint leaves.

In a small bowl mix egg, mustard and cayenne. Stir into a saucepan. In a separate bowl beat the eggs. Add the flour to the saucepan. Gradually add the milk and stir until smooth. Pour the sauce into a shallow baking dish. Place muffins in dish. Poke a hole into the center of each muffin. Break the eggs into the holes. Pour the milk mixture over the eggs. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes or until the eggs are done.
Cook ground beef and drain. Add beans and barbecue sauce. Simmer until beans are hot and tender. Serve with corn bread or tortillas on the side.

Melt butter and pecans together on low heat until pecans are almost done. Remove from heat and add cream cheese and vanilla. Mix well and pour into greased baking dish. Chill for 2 hours and cut into bars.

Prepare five-spice powder by combining all five spices in a small bowl. Mix well to combine. Rub chicken wings with five-spice powder to coat evenly. Combine soy sauce with honey, lemon juice, sesame oil, garlic, ginger in a small bowl. Combine soy sauce mixture with chicken wings and marinate for 30 minutes at room temperature. Remove chicken wings from marinade. Place chicken wings on a lightly greased grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes per side or until browned and cooked through. Serve warm or at room temperature with dipping sauce on the side.

In a bowl blend together egg beaters egg substitute, pumpkin pie spice, milk, pumpkin pie spice, all-purpose flour. Spoon into a greased baking dish. Top with apple butter. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before topping with cool whip free.

Cream butter and sugar together. Add eggs one at a time. Fold in bananas. Add flour and stir until thoroughly mixed. Fold in nuts. Grease a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until a toothpick comes out clean.

Preheat oven to 350. Add olive oil to a medium size pot with a lid. Add thyme. Saute onions and mushrooms with lid on until mushrooms are golden brown. Add sprouts and mushrooms to a large roasting pan and toss with oil. Season with salt and pepper and place in oven. Roast for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and add balsamic vinegar to roasting pan. Return to oven for 10 minutes or until brussels sprouts are tender. Serve hot.

Preheat the rice cooker according to manufacturer's instructions. Spray the inside of the bowl with nonstick cooking spray. Place frozen spinach in the bowl. Heat for 5 minutes. Turn off the heat. Remove the lid. Add the mushrooms to the spinach. Heat for 2 minutes. Remove the lid. Add eggs to the bowl. Heat for 5 minutes. Remove the lid. Add the green onion to the mixture. Heat for 10 minutes. Remove the lid. Sprinkle asiago cheese over the top. Turn heat to high for 2 minutes or until cheese melts. Transfer to a serving plate. Serve immediately.

Place tortillas in a shallow dish. Cover with warm water. Let stand 5 minutes, or until softened. Place 1 tortilla on each serving plate and top with 1 cup each avocado and cream cheese. Top each with 1/2 cup each tomatoes and cucumber. Arrange 1/4 cup each sprouts on each plate. Top with 2 tablespoons cheese each. Serve immediately.
Melt all chocolates in a double boiler. Add eggs, sugar, milk. Cook for 5 minutes. Pour into pan. Let set for 1 hour.

Bring broth and 1 cup of water to boil in large pot. Add rice and return to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender. Stir in orzo pasta and cook until tender. Remove from heat. Stir in scallions and butter. Season with pepper and salt.

Toast the nuts. Blend all the spices with the oil and liqueur. Pour over toasted nuts. Let marinate in the refrigerator at least one hour. You can also make this ahead and keep in the refrigerator for a week or two.

Beat eggs until thick. Add brown sugar, white sugar, vanilla extract. Mix in the flour, baking powder and salt. Stir in the coconut. Pour into a lightly greased 8-inch square baking pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Cool before cutting.

In a 2-quart casserole dish combine the pasta, soup and mayonnaisestir until well blended. Sprinkle with cheese and dot with pieces of salmon. Cover with foil and bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until bubbly and heated through. Stir together the milk and flour and blend into the casserole before serving. Top with the frozen peas and serve.

Mix the raisins and pine nuts in a bowl. Place the beet leaves in a bowl. Heat the oil in a large skillet. Add the beet leaves and cook until they wilt. Add the raisin-pine nuts mixture and cook for two minutes. Sprinkle with allspice and garlic. Drizzle with the remaining oil. Serve with crusty bread.
Mix all together in a large bowl. Spoon onto cookie sheet with wooden sticks. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Frost with white frosting.

Clean the corn well then remove the kernels from the ears of corn. Place the kernels in a large bowl and combine with the oil, fish sauce, sugar, water, green onions and salt. Place in a plastic container with a tight fitting lid and refrigerate for at least 2 hours to allow flavors to blend together. Pour the mixture into a large skillet that has a tight fitting lid and heat over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Place the skillet with the mixture in the center of a gas or charcoal grill over medium heat. Cover the skillet with the lid and cook for 10 minutes or until the kernels are tender and the sauce is caramelized. Serve immediately with a cold beer.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and cook until softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in rice, sour cream, cottage cheese, green chilies, cheddar cheese, and season with salt and pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until set.

Heat oil in a large pot. Sauté the onions until they are translucent. Add the sauerkraut. Cook for a few minutes. Add apple juice, water, caraway seeds, brown sugar, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about an hour. Serve with sausage.

In large skillet cook chicken legs in hot oil until brown on all sides, about 20 minutes. In a small bowl combine soup& paprika. Spoon sauce over chicken legs. Sprinkle with dried dill. In another small bowl combine sour cream & lemon juice. Stir well. Spoon sauce over chicken legs. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve hot with a side salad or vegetable. May be made ahead and stored in refrigerator for 24 hours or frozen for up to 6 months. Reheat in microwave or on stovetop until heated through.

In a saucepan combine water, sugar and gingerroot. Bring to the boil then reduce heat to low until the gingerroot is tender. Strain the liquid into a glass container to remove the gingerroot pieces and discard. Pour into a blender with the soy sauce, water, garlic and green onion and blend until smooth. Serve immediately or refrigerate for later use. This sauce can be used as a dip for spring rolls or to marinate chicken or fish.
Put pecans in slow cooker. Mix all other ingredients together. Pour over pecans. Cook on low for 2 to 3 hours. Stir occasionally. Keep warm until ready to serve.

Fry the chopped onions in butter until translucent. Add the stock, whisking to prevent the stock from splitting. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to low. Cook until the stock begins to thicken. Add the cream and season to taste with salt and pepper. Cook until the soup thickens. Cut the bread into slices. Toast the slices until golden brown. Ladle the soup into the bowls. Top each bowl with a piece of toast and some cheese. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375f. Stir all the ingredients except butter and italian seasoning together until the mixture is smooth. Mix in the butter. Drop the dough by teaspoonful onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes.

Cut pork into bite-size pieces and place in a large pot of cold water to cover by 1 inch. Add taco seasoning and bring to boil over high heat. Cover and reduce heat to low and cook for 2 hours. Pour into a colander and discard any fat. Shake off excess liquid and transfer roast to a slow-cooker. Add green chilies and enough water so it barely covers the roast. Cook on low for 4 hours or on high for 2 hours or until meat is tender. Cut tortillas in half and place in a shallow pan. Cover with foil and heat in microwave or on stovetop for about 1 minute or until warmed through and softened. To serve, warm up tortillas in microwave or stovetop and fill each one with carnitas and your favorite toppings like cheese and sour cream or guacamole and salsa.

Combine sugar and cocoa in a small bowlstir in milk. Set aside. Beat together peanut butter and butter in a large bowl until creamy. Beat in vanilla. Add sugar mixture and beat until smooth. Add oats and stir to combine. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto wax paper. Flatten cookies slightly. Refrigerate at least 3 hours or freeze until firm. Store in airtight container in refrigerator.

Cut beef into thin strips. Season with salt and pepper. Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the beef and saute until the beef is browned. Stir in the mushroom soup and bring the mixture back up to a boil. Add the cream of mushroom soup. Cook over low heat until the soup has thickened. Stir in the mushrooms and the remaining soup. Cook over low heat for about 2 minutes. Mix in the sour cream and the remaining salt and pepper. Cook for another minute. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 325f. Grease an 8x8 inch square pan. Place butter, sugars and eggs in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. Beat on medium speed until light and creamy. Gradually add in the flour mixture and beat until smooth. Fold in oreo cookies. Spread in prepared pan. Bake at 325f for 40 to 50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan on a wire rack.

Pierce the potatoes all over with a fork. Bake at 375 degrees for 1 hour until tender. Drain well. Slice into 1 inch wedges. Drain well. Toss potatoes with oil. In a small bowl combine the onions and garlic. Stir together with the remaining seasonings. Add to the potatoes. Toss to coat evenly. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-15 minutes until golden.

Combine bell peppers and chickpeas and place into a serving bowl. In a small bowl whisk together the oil and lemon juice and pour over peppers and chickpeas. Add sunflower seeds and parsley and mix. Top with feta cheese and green onions.

In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar and shortening and stir well to combine. Add milk and vanilla and mix together until well combined. Add eggs and mix well. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 30 minutes or until golden brown and cake tester comes out clean.

Finely dice the onions. Heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onions, cumin and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally until the onions are softened about 10 minutes. Add the tomatoes, cilantro leaves, jalapenos (if using) and habanero (if using). Cook over medium heat until thick about 1 hour. Let cool to room temperature and then pur refrigerate over night. Serve with warm tortilla chips.

Boil water and corn flake crumbs in 1/4 cup water until crumbs are softened. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Drain and add to cauliflower and mix well. Pour in melted butter and stir to coat. Add the almonds and salt and mix well. Add the soup and stir to coat the cauliflower with the sauce. Pour into prepared baking dish and bake at 350f until bubbly and brown around edges (about 40 minutes). Serve immediately and top with additional almonds if desired.

In a large skillet brown beef with onion and celery over medium heatdrain fat. In a large saucepan combine all remaining ingredients except green beanscook and stir over low heat until hot. Add beef mixturebring to a boil stirring constantly. Add green beansstir well. Covercook on low heat for about 15 minutes or until beans are tenderstirring occasionally. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese if desiredserve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 375f. In large bowl beat butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar together. Beat in egg until well blended. In separate bowl sift together flour, baking soda and salt. Add dry ingredients to butter mixture one at a time alternating with buttermilk. Stir in pecans. Drop batter by teaspoons onto cookie sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes or until cookies are set. Place pecans onto cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 5-7 minutes. Remove pecans from oven when they are golden brown. Immediately place pecans onto cookie sheet to cool. Let cookies cool for 3-5 minutes before removing from cookie sheet.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni until tender but firm. Drain well. Melt butter in a large pot. Add flour, salt, pepper and cook roux for 2 minutes. Gradually add milk and continue to cook until thickened. Stir in macaroni. Stir in cheese. Cook until cheese has melted. Stir in parsley. Serve.

Pour 2 cups of cold water into a large bowl. Sprinkle with 4 tbsp granulated sugar and stir until dissolved. Add 1 cup of double cream and 3 tbsp mascarpone cheese to the bowl. Pour 1 cup of whiskey into a separate bowl. Add the whiskey to the double cream mixture. Refrigerate the mixture for 30 minutes. Pour the mixture into a freezer-safe container. Cover with plastic wrap. Freeze for 4 hours before serving.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add garlic and saute for about a minute. Add stock to pan and bring to a boil. Add chickpeas and chili. Bring back to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until chickpeas are softened. Add kale to soup and cook until wilted. Remove chorizo from casing and crumble into soup. Simmer soup until chorizo is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

Cook the noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Bring broth to boil. Add noodles. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir cabbage into broth. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir green onions into cabbage. Add pork. Cook until heated through. Add mushrooms. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir gingerroot into broth. Cook for 1 minute. Stir crushed red pepper flakes into broth. Serve.

Mix together lime juice, cilantro, red onion, garlic cloves and jalapeno. Add olive oil and sugar to taste and mix well. Add salt and pepper to taste and mix well again. Place shrimp into bowl and coat with marinade. Refrigerate at least two hours before cooking. Shrimp can be cooked any way that you like.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place mushroom caps on a foil-lined baking sheet. Slice the garlic clove in half lengthwise. Drizzle each cap with oil. Sprinkle with salt. Place under the broiler until softened and blackened. Set aside to cool. Spread tomato slices over the bottom of each mushroom cap. Crumble mozzarella over the tomatoes. Place under the broiler until the cheese is bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together the sugar and oil for 1 minute. Add the egg substitute and beat until blended. Add the banana and beat for another minute until light and fluffy. In another bowl combine the flour, cream of tartar, and salt and stir with a wire whisk. Add the dry mix to the wet and stir just until blended. Grease two loaf pans and spoon the batter into each pan. Bake for 40 minutes at 350 degrees.
In large saucepan over medium heat, stir chicken, beans and diced tomatoes with chili. Add soup, milk and seasoning mix. Simmer, uncovered, 15 minutes or until heated through. Top with cheese.
Place all ingredients in a blender until smooth. Pour into a 9" pie pan or dish. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Combine pumpkin puree with the other ingredients in a heavy saucepan. Bring to the boil. Boil gently for about 10 minutes stirring constantly. Place in sterilized jars and seal. Makes about 1 ½ cups. Store in the fridge.

In a small bowl combine the onions, garlic cloves, worcestershire sauce, basil, salt and pepper, until well blended. Remove the pork from the refrigerator, so that it can come to room temperature before cooking. Slice the pork on the bias as thinly as possible. Place the pork slices on a work surface, season with salt and pepper. Layer onions and basil on the pork slices. Wrap each pork tenderloin with three slices of italian bread, making sure that the pork is completely covered with the onions and basil mixture. Place the wrapped tenderloins on a rack set over a roasting pan. Pour the tomato juice over the tenderloins until they are covered. Cover with foil and bake for one hour until tender and juicy. Remove the foil for the last half hour of cooking time and baste with the cooking juices every ten minutes during that time.

Cut bread in half horizontally. Spread cut sides of bread with cream cheese. Roll up bread slices and place in 13 x 9-inch pan. In a bowl, beat egg yolks and brown sugar together. Add powdered sugar and cinnamon. Beat in butter. Pour over bread. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand for 15 minutes. Cut into slices. Sprinkle with more cinnamon if desired.

Preheat the griddle or skillet to medium heat. In a bowl stir together the dry ingredients. In another bowl whisk together the wet ingredients. Mix the wet and dry ingredient together. Flip when edges are firm. Serve with syrup and fruit.

Preheat oven to 400 f. Whisk together the eggs and the oil in a large bowl. Add the carrots and pineapple and whisk to combine. Stir in the vanilla extract. In a separate large bowl, whisk together the flour, cinnamon, baking soda and salt. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir until smooth. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x5x3-inch loaf pan and bake for about 45 minutes. Let it cool in the pan for 5 minutes before turning out onto a rack to cool completely.
Cut muffins into quarters. Spread each quarter with pizza sauce and cheese. Add meat to taste (or make them vegetarian!).

In a large saute pan over medium high heat, heat peanut oil. Saute white onion, carrots, mushrooms in oil for 5 minutes or until translucent. Add bok choy and saute 2 minutes longer. Add broth, tamari and green onionsbring to a boil then reduce to a simmer for 1 minute more or until bok choy is cooked through.

In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat olive oil. Add halibut steaks and cook for 5 minutes per side. Place in a 350 degree oven for about 10 minutes or until fish flakes when tested with a fork. Meanwhile in a sauce pan over medium-high heat, combine chicken broth, scallions and garlic cloves. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the dried thyme. Pour sauce over halibut. Sprinkle with lemon-pepper seasoning. Serve.

Wash and peel potatoes. Slice off ends and cut into even pieces about 1 1/2 inches thick. Place slices in baking dish or casserole dish. Add cheese to ricotta and stir well. Stuff each potato with about 2 tbs of cheese mixture and place in baking dish or casserole dish with other potato slices. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and parsley. In a bowl beat eggs and water and pour over potato slices and cheese mixture. Cover with foil and bake at 375 degrees for 1 1/2 hours until potatoes are cooked through and cheese is bubbling. Serve hot with dinner or as an appetizer with crackers.

In a saucepan combine water, light corn syrup and white sugar. Bring to a boil. In another saucepan melt butter. Add hazelnuts and cook until slightly toasted and golden brown. Stir constantly to prevent hazelnuts from burning. Pour syrup mixture over hazelnuts. Stir constantly until mixture thickens and boils. Remove from heat. Add vanilla and chocolate. Stir until chocolate is melted. Add baking soda and stir well to dissolve. Pour onto a lightly greased cookie sheet and spread into a thin layer. Bake at 250f for about 50 minutes or until brittle. Cool completely on a rack. Break into pieces and store in an air-tight container.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut the apple into eighths, then peel them and quarter them again. Cut the apples into small pieces (about the size of a quarter), then set aside. Whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a large bowl, then set aside. Cut the butter into small pieces then cut the butter into the flour mixture with a pastry blender or two knives. Stir in the cheese with a fork. Add the buttermilk and stir with a fork until the dough forms a soft ball. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead for 30 seconds or so, just enough to bring the dough together. Pat the dough into a 1-inch-thick round about 7 inches across. Cut the dough into 8 pieces with a knife or pastry cutter (the pieces should be about 1 1/2 inches wide). Roll each piece into a circle about 1/2 inch thick. Place the rolled pieces on a cookie sheet. Spoon a teaspoon of butter on each circle (

Peel and devein the prawns and leave tails on or off as you prefer. Heat oil and garlic cloves over medium heat in a pan with a lid. Add prawns and continue to stir until prawns begin to change color to pink (about 5 minutes). Add the chili to taste and salt to taste. Serve immediately.
Place all ingredients in a blender and purée for a few seconds. Taste and add more orange juice if needed. Serve with mint leaves.

Mix softened butter and sugar together. Add the egg yolk and beat well. Add the vanilla extract and then gradually add the self raising flour. Mix together until you have a soft dough. Using a teaspoon, spoon the mixture into the center of the corn flakes. Roll the corn flakes up around the mixture. Place onto a baking tray lined with baking parchment. Repeat the process until all of the mixture has been used up. Bake for 12 minutes at 175 degrees centigrade until the corn flakes are golden brown.

Halve brussels sprouts lengthwise and cut crosswise into thin slices. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan over a medium heat until hot. Add the pancetta and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until the garlic is golden and pancetta is browned and crisp. Transfer to a plate and set aside. Add 1 tablespoon of the broth to the pan and cook over a medium heat until the liquid has almost completely evaporated. Repeat with remaining broth. Return the pancetta and garlic to the pan and add the brussels sprouts. Cook for 5 minutes or until the sprouts are tender. Stir in the remaining broth and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 1 minute. Transfer to a heated serving dish. Sprinkle with freshly grated Parmesan cheese. Serve.

Cook bacon in microwave or frying pan until crispy. Drain. Toss crumbled bacon into boiling water with penne pasta. Stir occasionally until pasta is tender (approximately 12 minutes). Drain and set aside. In small mixing bowl, combine sour cream with chive and onion cream cheese. Add milk and stir until blended. Add 1/4 cup parmesan cheese and stir until smooth. If too thick, add more milk. Taste and add more salt and pepper if desired. To serve, spoon the pasta and bacon into bowls. Top with the cream cheese mixture and sprinkle with the remaining parmesan. Makes 4 servings.

Dissolve yeast in milk. Heat sugar and margarine. Add to yeast mixture. Add egg and salt to yeast mixture. Add flour and mix until smooth. Add cardamom. Place dough on lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Cover and allow dough to rise. Form into 8 balls. Roll out each ball into a 12 inch circle. Put about 1/4 cup filling on each circle. Fold edges together to form a semicircle. Pinch edges together to seal. Place buns on greased cookie sheet. Let rise until double. Bake at 350 for 12 minutes. Drizzle with whipping cream. Sprinkle with vanilla sugar. Makes 8 buns.

Mix seasoned bread crumbs and coconut together in a large bowl. Dip pork chops into egg then coat in coconut mixture. In a large skillet heat butter over medium-high heat. Sauté pork chops for 3 minutes per side. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes or until cooked through.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees celsius. Grease and line a 20cm spring form pan. Beat together date with brown sugar until smooth. Add eggs and ginger. In a separate bowl, sift together flour and bicarbonate of soda. Fold flour mix into date mix. Press into spring form pan. Bake for approximately 30 minutes until golden brown. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Meanwhile prepare filling. Melt butter and add brown sugar. Bring to a boil for a few minutes. Add cream and boil for another minute. Add vanilla. Pour over cooled cake. Allow to set.

In large skillet, cook bacon until crisp and drain well. Remove bacon to a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess fat. Drain any fat from skillet and return to stove over medium heat. Add onion to bacon drippings and saute until tender. Add ground beef and brown. Stir in pork and beans with their juices and tomatoes with their juice and seasonings. Transfer to a 2 quart baking dish and sprinkle with the remaining 2 teaspoons of bacon. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until bubbly and browned.
Cook chicken until done. Chop celery and onions. Combine with walnuts and yogurt and mix well. Add mango chutney and mix well. Place on lettuce and garnish with chopped walnuts and celery if desired.

Preheat oven to 375F. Lightly grease a 9x13 baking dish. In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder and brown sugar. Stir in oats and apricots. Make a well in the center. In a separate bowl, cream together butter and egg substitute. Pour over oat mixture and stir until just combined. Pour into prepared dish and bake for 30 minutes. Let bars cool before cutting and serving.

Bake biscuits. Cut biscuits in half. Scoop out a small amount of cheese from one biscuit. Place in a small bowl and mix cheese with mayonnaise and onion. Fill cheese mixture into biscuit. Top with bacon pieces. Sprinkle sugar on top of bacon. Sprinkle garlic salt and hot pepper sauce on top of bacon. Place biscuit on baking sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes.

Peel the carrots with a paring knife and then cut into large matchstick pieces (thinly sliced carrots). Heat the oil in a heavy bottomed pan on medium-low heat. Add the carrot matchsticks and sauté for 5 minutes, or until they are tender. Add the bell peppers and sauté for 2 minutes more. Add the cashews and sauté until golden brown. Season with salt. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl and let cool completely. Sprinkle with the black mustard seeds. Add the cilantro and toss with a fork until the cilantro is coated with the mustard seeds. Transfer the salad to a serving dish and serve.

Peel cucumber and carrots and thinly slice lengthwise into thin rounds. Slice radishes crosswise into thin rounds, and slice onions into thin wedges. Place cucumber, carrot and radish on plate and top with onions. Drizzle with vegetable oil and toss well to coat. Combine next seven ingredients and pour over vegetables and toss again. Serve immediately.

Cut steak into strips. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Combine soy sauce, water and 3 of the garlic cloves and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and pour over steakrefrigerate 4-24 hours. Remove steak from marinade and discard. Combine cornstarch and remaining 1/2 cup soy sauce. Add to marinade and stir until smooth and thickened. Add ginger and sugar and stir to combine. Remove steak from marinade and discard. Reserve marinade for basting steak as it cooks. In a 5-quart slow cooker combine steak and 2 cups of the marinade. Cover and cook on low for 5-6 hours or until tender. Increase heat to high and cook 20 minutes or until sauce thickens. Stir in sesame oil and additional marinade as needed to baste steak while cooking. Remove steak to serving plattercover and keep warm. Strain sauce into measuring cup and discard solids. Spoon sauce over steak. Sprinkle with

Cut the hoagie rolls in half and spread each with 1 tablespoon of pizza sauce and 1 tablespoon of cheese. Top each with 1/3 cup beef mixture and 1/2 cup olives. Roll up tightly and place seam side down in 8-inch square casserole. Cover with remaining sauce and cheese. Bake at 325 for 20 minutes. Makes 8 servings.

In a large skillet cook ground beef with olive oil on medium high heat until meat is brown and cooked through. Drain meat from the skillet. Add onion to skillet with meat drippings in skillet. Cook onion until tender, about 5 minutes. Add bell pepper to onioncook until bell peppers are tender. Add mushrooms to skilletcook until mushrooms are tenderabout 10 minutes. Add garlic to skilletcook until garlic is tender, about 2 minutes more. Add pasta sauce to skilletcook until heated through, about 1 minute more. Stir in chili sauceseason to taste with salt and freshly ground pepper. Cook until heated through, about 2 minutes more. Serve over hot cooked pasta. Serves 4.

Melt the margarine in the large skillet over medium heat. Add the apples and juice concentrate and cook over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes or until the apples are soft. Add the greens and cook for 2 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lay bacon flat and cut in half crosswise so that you have two thin pieces of bacon per skewer. In a large bowl, combine the shortening and the white candy coating and mix well with a spatula or spoon. Divide mixture into 15 portions and form into balls about 1 1/2 inches in diameter. Roll in cocoa powder to coat completely. Roll each ball of chocolate in toasted pecans or pistachios. If using apple chips, roll in cinnamon and sprinkle with kosher salt. Arrange bacon pieces flat-side down onto skewers and insert one nut-topped chocolate ball into each end of each bacon strip. Place skewers onto greased baking sheets and bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes or until chocolate is hard and bacon is crisp. Let cool for 10 minutes before eating. Enjoy!

Combine soy sauce and sesame oil in a small bowl. Add the remaining marinade ingredients and stir well. Place beef in a large resealable plastic bag or shallow dish. Add marinade and turn to coat beef with marinade. Refrigerate beef overnight (or for at least 6 hours). Thread beef, green onions and sesame seeds on four 6-inch metal or soaked wooden skewers (soaked wooden skewers can be found in the supermarket or craft store). Set beef on a grill rack over medium heat or broil over medium heat on a rimmed baking sheet. Grill or broil beef about 4 minutes per side or until a thermometer inserted into the beef reads 145 degrees F (62 degrees C). Let beef stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Combine the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt together in large bowl. Cut in butter with pastry blender or your fingers until it looks like coarse cornmeal. Combine milk with egg. Make a well in the center of the dry mixture and pour in milk mixture. Stir together until combined. If mixture is too wet, add more flour 1/2 cup at a time until it is smooth. Turn dough out onto floured surface and pat into 1-inch thickness. Cut into triangles or circles using cookie cutters or knife. Place scones about 1/4-inch apart onto lightly greased cookie sheets. Sprinkle with raisins if desired. Bake at 375f for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 5 minutes before serving.

In bowl with electric mixer, beat eggs lightly. Add seasoned breadcrumbs and mix well with eggs. Place chicken in a large ziplock bag and add breadcrumb mixture. Seal bag and shake gently until chicken is completely coated with breadcrumb mixture. Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking, about 2 minutes. Add chicken pieces and cook for 4 minutes per side or until golden brown and done. While chicken is cooking, saute mushrooms and onions in olive oil until softened. Remove chicken from skillet and keep warm. Add chicken broth and cajun seasoning to mushrooms and onions and cook for 3 minutes. Place chicken in serving platter and add mushroom mixture over top. Top with muenster slices and serve immediately with steamed rice and your favorite vegetable.

Melt butter over medium-low heat. Add scallions. Cook until soft, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook until softened. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Blend with a fork. Add 2 cups of shreaded cheddar. Mix with a fork. Mix with remaining 2 cups of shreaded cheddar. Divide mixture evenly among 8 bread halves. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup shreaded cheddar. Place bread halves cut side down onto a baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until bread is golden brown. Remove from oven. Flip bread halves. Return to oven. Bake 5-7 minutes more or until golden brown. Remove from oven. Remove bread halves from sheet. Serve immediately.

Melt margarine in a pan over low heat. Stir in peanut butter and vanilla. Remove from heat and stir in powdered sugar until well blended. Roll in chocolate chips and place on wax paper to cool. Store in the refrigerator or freezer until ready to serve.

Cut each piece of bread in half so each piece is about 8-10 inches long. Place 1/4 cup of dressing on each bread piece. Top with lettuce, onions, peppers, provolone cheese, ham, salami and pepperoncini peppers. Roll up bread and secure with toothpicks. Bake at 350 degrees F for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool for a few minutes before removing toothpicks. Serve with remaining dressing.

Mix all the filling ingredients well. Cut out triangular shapes of pastry about 5 inches in diameter. Place a teaspoon of filling on one corner of each triangle and fold over, pinching in the corners. Press down on each samosa with your fingers so that it is firmly sealed. Cook samosas in boiling water for 10 minutes or till all are cooked through. Serve hot with chutney or tomato sauce.

Place all ingredients into the bread machine pan and follow the directions for making a whole wheat loaf. If you want a sweeter bread use white bread flour instead of whole wheat. If you want a cheesier bread use more jalapeno cheese. If you want a spicier bread use more smoked paprika. If you want a sweeter bread use more sugar. If you want a softer bread use less garlic clove. I made this bread for a dinner party at my house and it was the first thing to go!

Brown the bacon in a large skillet or Dutch oven. Drain the bacon, reserving the fat in the pan. Add the potatoes to the pan with the bacon drippings and cook over low heat for 15 minutes or until tender. Add the onions and the green peppers and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Add the eggs to the potatoes mixture and cook over medium heat for 3 minutes or until the eggs are set. Remove from the heat and stir in the milk, salt and pepper. Cover the pan with a lid or plate or use a small plate. Let stand for 2 minutes or until the eggs are set throughout. Remove the lid or plate from the pan and sprinkle the cheese over the eggs. Serve the eggs immediately. Makes 4 servings.

In a saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the beans and cook for 2 minutes. Add the sofrito sauce. Cook for an additional 2 minutes. Add the ham and olives. Simmer the beans for 15 minutes. Add the water. Stir. Cook for 10 minutes. Stir in the sazon seasoning. Cook for 5 minutes. Add salt and pepper. Cover. Cook for 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 13x9 inch baking dish, place breadcrumb mixture and melt butter over it. Stir in shrimp, sherry and spices. Bake for 15 minutes or until shrimp are cooked through and bubbly. Sprinkle with chopped parsely.

Sauté sausage and potatoes in a large skillet until sausage is brown and potatoes are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Lightly beat eggs with a fork and add to a 9-inch ovenproof skillet. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over the eggs. Add sausage mixture and tomatoes. Sprinkle with green onions. Bake at 375 degrees for 35 minutes or until puffy and golden. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 325f. Grease a 9 x 13 pan. Place half of the crust in the bottom of the pan. In a bowl mix together the cornstarch and 1/2 cup of water. Add this mixture to the remaining crust. In another bowl mix the remaining 1/2 cup water with the unsweetened chocolate squares. Microwave for 30-60 seconds or until the mixture is melted. Pour the melted chocolate over the cornstarch mixture. Add the condensed milk and eggs. Blend well. Add the butter and vanilla. Pour the mixture over the crust. Sprinkle with the pecans. Bake for 40-45 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes before serving. Serves 12.

Peel potatoes and onions. Dice potatoes into 1/2 inch cubes. Dice onions into 1/4 inch pieces. Boil potatoes for 10-15 minutes. Drain and cool. Whisk together buttermilk and mustard. Add butter. Stir in potatoes and onions. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into a 9x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle cheese over top. Bake for 30 minutes or until cheese is melted and potatoes are tender.

Fill a pitcher with ice cubes. In a glass bottle (such as a wine bottle or soda bottle), combine all of the wine and fruit juices. Stir gently. Add some of the sangria mixture to a glass with ice cubes and a slice of orange or apple. Serve the remainder of the sangria mixture in a glass over ice cubes with a slice of orange or apple.

Cream butter and sugar in bowl of standing mixer with paddle attachment. Add egg and vanillamix well. Slowly add dry ingredients to wet. Stir until well blended. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Roll dough into balls and place onto baking sheets. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and place a semi-sweet chip in the center of each ball. Return to the oven and bake for 15 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from baking sheet. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large bowl stir together long grain and wild rice blend. Add in bread crumbs and all remaining ingredients. Mix well. Place in 9 inch square baking dish. Bake uncovered until golden brown and heated through. Remove from oven. Cool 10 minutes before serving. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Brown ground beef over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain fat, add onions and cook until tender. Combine all the remaining ingredients and pour over the meat and onions. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes or until the noodles are tender and the sauce has thickened. Serve immediately.

Melt 3 tbsp. Butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add corn chex to skilletcook 6 to 8 minutes or until lightly toasted. Add wheat chexcook 4 to 5 minutes longer or until lightly toasted. Stir in rice chexcook 1 minute or until lightly toasted. Add oyster crackerscook 1 minute longer or until lightly toasted. Stir in pretzel twistscook 1 minute or until lightly toasted. Stir in pistachio nutscook 30 seconds or until lightly toasted. Stir in parmesan cheesecook 1 minute or until lightly toasted. Stir in dry ranch dressing mixstir in garlic powder. Stir in 1/2 tsp. Salt. Pour into a large bowlstir in pretzels and 1 cup Parmesan cheese. Transfer to a 13-in. x 9-in. baking dishsprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese. Coverchill 1 hour or until cool.

Melt butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Cook onion until tender, stirring occasionally. Add ground beef and cook and drain off any fat. Stir in flour and cook for about a minute and stir in cream of mushroom soup and sour cream. Stir in salt and pepper and paprika and cook for a few minutes or until thickened. Cook pasta according to package directions and serve hot with stroganoff on top.

In medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add corn and cream. Cook 5 minutes or until corn is tender. Stir frequently. Combine corn and 1 cup cream mixture with 1 cup prepared saltine crackers. Serve warm.
Cut the beetroots in half. Brush with olive oil. Grate some fresh tarragon. Sprinkle with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Roast in a preheated oven for 45 minutes or until tender.
Combine all ingredients in slow cooker. Cook on low for hours or high for an hour. Serve warm or room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sift together flour and baking sodaset aside. Cream together butter and sugars. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Slowly add flour mixture to creamed mixture. Add chocolate chips and mix in. Drop by tablespoons onto lightly greased baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 12 to 15 minutes. Makes 2 dozen cookies.

Cook shirataki noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold water. Meanwhile, in large skillet over med-high heat add olive oil. Add green pepper and onion. Sautee until tender. Add chicken and sautee until done. Add mushrooms and sautee for 3-4 more minutes. Add pasta sauce. Stir well. Add drained shirataki noodles. Stir well. Add basil. Stir well. Sprinkle with cheese if desired.

Cut chicken into cubesadd to boiling water and cook until tender. Add seasoned pepper to boiling water, cook 5 minutes or until thickenedstir in soup and bouillon granules. Cook biscuits according to package directions. In a large saucepan, mix biscuits with remaining soup mixturepour into a 2-qt. baking dish. Top with chickensprinkle with parsley.
Peel eggs. Chop eggs into small pieces. Place eggs into a large bowl. Add mayonnaise, mustard, prepared horseradish, salt, fresh ground black pepper, cayenne pepper. Stir to combine. Serve.

In a large bowl, place crisp rice cereal. Place large marshmallows in a saucepan over low heat. Heat just enough to melt marshmallows. Pour over crisp rice cereal and stir well. Let cool for a few minutes then roll in caramel squares or mini chocolate chips. Roll in melted butter, then roll in crisp rice cereal again. Place on waxed paper to cool for 5 minutes then roll in more crisp rice cereal.
In sauce pan add chicken broth and salsa. Bring to boiling. Stir in rice and velveeta cheese. Simmer until heated through. Serve with chopped tomatoes, sour cream and shredded cheese if desired.

Melt butter with baking chocolate in sauce pan over low heat, stirring until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth. Remove from heatcool 15 minutes. In a medium bowl, beat eggs with 1/3 cup brown sugar and vanilla extract until blended well. Beat in cooled chocolate mixture. In a small bowl, combine corn syrup with remaining 1/4 cup brown sugarstir well. Stir brown sugar mixture into chocolate mixturemix well. Pour filling mixture into pie shellspread evenly. Sprinkle pecans on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 55 minutes or until set. Cool on a wire rack 1 hour.

Sauté garlic in olive oil until soft. Add chicken stock and cook over medium heat until it begins to reduce. Add tortellini and cook until al dente. Add spinach and cook until it begins to wilt. Remove soup from heat and stir in white beans. Add salt and pepper. Remove soup from heat and stir in parmesan cheese. Taste for seasoning. Serve immediately. Garnish each bowl of soup with a sprinkling of freshly ground nutmeg.

In large sauce pan over medium heat, saute chicken tenderloins in butter until tender. Remove from pan. Drain fat from pan. Add wild rice to pan. Pour in 4 cups chicken broth. Add 1 cup water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered until wild rice is tender. Add cornstarch mixture. Cook until thickened. In medium bowl, beat half-and-half cream. Add cheddar cheese. Mix well. In small bowl, beat Velveeta cheese. Add to half-and-half mixture. Add to soup. Cook over medium heat until cheese melts. Stir in chicken. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cream brown sugar blend with splenda in large mixing bowl with hand beater or in stand mixer with paddle attachment. Add eggs. Mix in molasses, ginger, cinnamon, allspice and pepper. Mix in dry ingredients. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten slightly. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until light brown on edges. Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet before transferring to wire racks.

In large bowl, beat egg substitute and evaporated milk togetheradd salt and pepper to taste. Mix well. Drain hash browns. Add to the egg/milk mixture along with the ham and green pepper. Stir to blend wellpour into a lightly greased 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle cheddar cheese evenly over hash browns mixture. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Yields 6 servings.

Dice the broccoli into bite-size pieces. In a large saucepan brown chicken broth and 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Once bubbling add broccoli to broth stirring until broccoli turns bright green (about 1-2 minutes). Season broccoli with pepper to taste. In a separate saucepan bring 2 cups of broth to a boil over medium heat. Slowly whisk in 1 cup of flour until well combined. Once mixture has thickened whisk in milk to broth mixture, stirring constantly until thickened (about 2-3 minutes). Stir in remaining 1 tablespoon of butter and season again to taste with pepper. Pour soup into 4 serving bowls and top each serving with 1 tablespoon of shredded cheddar cheese.

Pour water into slow-cooker. Add carrots, celery and onion. Drain. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours or until vegetables are tender. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. Top with toasted almonds.

Beat eggs lightly until frothy. Blend in the other pumpkin pie ingredients. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 60 minutes or until center is set. Let stand 10 minutes before removing from pie plate to serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In a medium bowl, combine egg whites and sugarbeat on medium speed of an electric mixer until frothy. Add orange zest and vanilla extract and beat until well blended, about 30 seconds. Beat in salt and coconut. Add dried cranberries and beat just until combined. Drop batter by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets and flatten slightly with the back of a spoon. Bake for about 40 minutes or until cookies are lightly browned around edges and just set in center. Cool on cookie sheet for about five minutes. Transfer cookies to wire racks and cool completely.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees C (350 degrees F) and grease a 900g (1lb) loaf tin with vegetable oil. Combine the polenta with the salt, baking powder and sugar in a large bowl. Make a well in the centre and add the oil with the flour and stir with a wooden spoon until all the flour is incorporated into the dough. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about five minutes until smooth, elastic and no longer sticky to the touch. Place in the prepared loaf tin and bake for one hour until golden brown. Cool in the tin for five minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely before serving.

Preheat griddle or waffle iron. For waffles, coat griddle with cooking spray. Whisk together the eggs, milk and 1 cup of the flour in a medium bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk together the remaining 1 cup of flour with the baking powder and salt. Make a well in the center of the flour mixture. Add the egg mixture all at once and stir with a spatula just until combined. (If batter is thin, add 1/4 cup more flour. If batter is thick, add 1/2 cup more milk). Stir in the butter and vanilla. Fold in the nutmeg. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add 1/4 cup of the batter and cook the pancake until golden brown on the bottom. Turn and cook 1 to 2 minutes more. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with the remaining batter. For waffles, add the remaining 1/4 cup of batter to the waffle iron. Cook until golden brown and crisp. Serve with butter and syrup.

Mix plain flour, seasoning with salt and pepper and the egg in a bowl. Coat the fish fillets with the mixture. Heat the butter and the milk together. Dip each fillet into the hot butter/milk mixture and fry for 1 minute on each side. Drain on kitchen paper. Serve with lemon wedges.
Mix together all of the ingredients and pour into tall glasses. Serve with a straw and a sprig of mint for garnish.

Cut roast into 4 pieces. Brown meat until no longer pink. Add root beer and garlic powder. Cook over medium heat until liquid is reduced to 1/2. Add lemon pepper, cornstarch and water. Cook for 30 minutes until thickened.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In medium bowl, combine whole-wheat flour, baking soda and salt. In large bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Add applesauce and brown sugar. Stir in flour mixture. Stir in vanilla. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake 10 minutes or until cookies are firm and edges are set.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease muffin tins (or use muffin cups with liners). Sift flour, brown sugar, baking powder, salt togetherset aside. In another large bowl, combine yogurt, egg, oil, milkbeat with wire whisk until blended. Add flour mixturemix well. Fold in blackberries. Spoon batter into muffin cups, filling almost full (or 1/4 cup batter per muffin cup). Bake in preheated oven for 18 to 22 minutes, until golden brown. Makes 12 muffinscan be made gluten free by replacing wheat flour with GF flour blend.

Boil pasta for 10 minutes. Drain well. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in pasta sauce. Add pasta and toss well to coat with sauce. Serve immediately. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

In a large mixing bowl, dissolve gelatin in 1/2 cup of hot water. Let stand for a minute. Add hot water to milk and cream. Add gelatin solution to milk mixture and stir well. Heat in a saucepan over medium heat. Keep stirring constantly with a wire whisk. Add sweetened condensed milk and whisk until dissolved. Add cocoa powder and whisk well. Remove from heat and let cool. Grease the inside of the souffle dish. Pour in the cake mixture and place in the refrigerator for 2 hours. Beat cream in a large mixing bowl until soft peaks form. Whisk in powdered sugar until blended. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Pour the chocolate mixture on top of the chilled cake mixture in the souffle dish. Garnish with walnuts. Chill in the refrigerator for 20 minutes or until the cake is firm. Serve with warm cream and a sprinkling of chocolate shavings.
Cook baby carrots in boiling water for 4 minutes. Drain well. Combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Add carrots to bowl. Toss to coat. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Line a 9 x 13 inch baking pan with foil. In a large bowl, combine the butter, cracker crumbs, whole almonds, coconut flakes, ginger and sesame seeds. In a medium bowl, combine the condensed milk and chocolate chips. Pour the condensed milk mixture over the cracker mixture. Spread to form a layer. Gently press the crumb mixture into the pan. Bake for 15-20 minutes. Cool slightly. Cut into bars. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

Bring water to boil in a sauce pan. Add carrots and peas. Cook for about 3 minutes until tender but not mushy. Drain water from vegetables. Put vegetables in a bowl with tarragon leaves. Drizzle with mustard and vinegar. Salt to taste. Mix well. Chill at least 3 hours before serving.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain potatoes. Mash potatoes with butter. Mix with a fork. Add the garlic salt. Season with salt and pepper. Mix. Add the whipping cream. Add the fresh chives. Mix well. Serves 4.

Mix the cake mix according to the package directions. Stir in pecans and margarine until all the cake mix is moistened. Pour the mixture into an ungreased 9x9 inch baking pan. Spoon the pie filling over the top evenly. Sprinkle the pie filling with 2 teaspoons sugar. Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 to 40 minutes or until the center is set. Remove from ovenlet cool completely before serving.

Microwave butter for 20 seconds and add worcestershire sauce and seasoning salt. Stir with a fork. Add corn and rice chex and stir. Microwave for 2 more minutes and stir again. Add wheat and cheese crackers and stir. Microwave for 2 more minutes and stir again. Add peanuts and stir. Microwave 2 more minutes. Stir until all nuts are coated with butter mixture. Serve in a bowl and enjoy! This is great for a quick snack.

Remove outer leaves from cabbage head then cut the cabbage in half lengthwise. Cut the cabbage half into quarters. Slice the carrots lengthwise about 1/4 inch thick. Roughly chop the caraway seeds and the garlic cloves. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the carrots and cook until they are almost tender then add the cabbage quarters and the chopped caraway seeds and garlic cloves. Cook over medium heat until the cabbage is tender then season the cabbage with salt and pepper. Serve hot with sauerkraut on the side or on top of the cabbage.

To prepare the filling, sauté the onion and ginger paste with a little oil and season it with salt and chili paste. Place spinach and cooked onion mix together and season it well with salt and pepper. To prepare the bread, slice the bread into half and spread the spinach mix on the bread. Place the bread on a tray and keep it ready. To prepare the cheese filling for the bread, melt the panir in a pot and add the salt and water and stir till the mixture becomes soft and smooth and then spread the mixture on the bread and serve it hot.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease 9x13 baking dish. Peel and slice peaches. Mix margarine and sugar in large bowl. Add peaches and toss gently. In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt. Add to margarine mixture and toss gently. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes or until cobbler is golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

Place the chopped tomatoes into a medium sized pot and add the butter. Cover and simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. Remove from the heat and allow the tomatoes to cool slightly. Place the eggs into a small bowl or ramekin and season with salt and pepper to taste. Divide the cheese evenly between the 4 bowls or ramekins. Pour the cooled tomatoes into the bowls or ramekins and top with the eggs. Season with salt and pepper to taste and place the bowls or ramekins into the preheated 425F degree oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until the eggs are cooked through and the cheese is melted. Serve hot with freshly cracked black pepper to taste.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 9x13-inch pan. Melt butter with brown sugar and pecans over medium heat until brown. Remove from heat and add bourbon. Add bananas and vanilla ice cream and stir until combined. Pour into prepared pan and freeze until firm. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

In a large saucepan bring 8 cups of chicken stock to a boil. Add the rice and cook over moderate heat until the rice is tender. Drain and set aside. In a small saucepan bring 1 cup of chicken stock to a boil. In a medium bowl beat the egg yolks and gradually add the boiling stock mixture. Add to the rice and mix well. Add the lemon juice and the chopped parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into a shallow baking dish. Place in a preheated 350f oven and cook until set. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Cook turkey and diced green chiles in a skillet over medium heat until heated through and cooked throughdrain and set aside. In a saucepan melt butter and stir in cream of chicken soup and corn tortillas, cooking until tortillas are soft and heated throughremove from heat and cool for 5 minutes. Meanwhile in a large bowl combine turkey mixture, soup mixture and shredded cheese. Pour turkey mixture into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through and cheese has melted.

Soak lentils in a large bowl of cold water for at least 3 hours or overnight. Drain well and rinse lentils with cold water. Transfer lentils to a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the non-fat milk, water, thyme, sliced onion, red onion, ham, garlic and black pepper. Cover and bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for about 35 minutes or until the lentils are tender, adding additional water as needed. Drain the lentils in a colander. Place the lentils in a large bowl and cool completely. To the lentils add the sour cream, vinegar, dijon mustard and parsley and stir until well combined. Taste and adjust seasoning with additional salt and pepper, if necessary. Serve at room temperature or chilled.

In large bowl, combine cheddar cheese, cream cheese, bacon bits and garlic powder with electric mixer on medium speed. Beat 1 minute then beat in swiss cheese and club crackers with mixer on medium-low speed for 1 minute. Shape into ball. Refrigerate for 4-6 hours before serving. Serve with crackers.

Mix flour and pepper. Dip each breast in flour mixture. Shake off excess. In a large skillet or wok, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Cook breasts about 5 minutes each side or until golden brown. Meanwhile, heat the sesame oil in a small saucepan. Cook the soy sauce and sugar until the sugar dissolves. Add the sesame seeds and remove from heat. Stir in the sesame seed oil. Pour the sauce over the cooked breasts. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve over rice.

Cut the stems from the shallots and cut into large pieces. Cut the roasted garlic in half lengthwise. Put the shallot pieces in a bowl and add the roasted garlic. Drizzle with the olive oil and toss. Transfer to a roasting pan. Add the wine. Roast the shallots and roasted garlic until tender and golden brown. Transfer to a blender or food processor. Add the cream to the roasted shallots and roasted garlic and blend until smooth. Add the butter. Transfer the beurre blanc to a pan and bring to a boil. Add the fresh herbs. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve over a bed of rice with steamed vegetables.

For the banana avocado soup blend the bananas and avocados in a blender until smooth. Pour the smooth mixture into four serving glasses. Add the sugar to the lemon juice in another glass. Drizzle the lemon sugar over the soup and stir. Top with a dollop of yogurt. For the ice cream banana avocado soup pour the blended mixture into four serving glasses. Add the sugar to the lemon juice in another glass. Drizzle the lemon sugar over the soup and stir. Top with a dollop of yogurt. Garnish with freshly ground nutmeg. For the banana avocado ice cream blend the bananas and avocados in a blender until smooth. Pour the smooth mixture into four serving glasses. Add the sugar to the lemon juice in another glass. Drizzle the lemon sugar over the soup and stir. Top with a dollop of yogurt. Garnish with freshly ground nutmeg.

First, arrange a bed of lettuce leaves on a platter. Slice the tomato and cucumber into quarters and arrange over the lettuce. Cut the feta into squares and arrange over the tomato and cucumber. Cut the capers into rings and arrange over the feta. Then cut the red onion into 1/2-inch pieces and arrange over the capers. Lastly, cut the olives into quarters and arrange over the onions. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with dried oregano. Serve with a sprinkling of sea salt.
Bring water to boiling and pour over tea bags. Let steep for 5 minutes. Add milk. Remove tea bags. Add spices. Add splenda sugar substitute. Stir and serve.

Crush graham crackers in a ziploc bag. Add butter and cream cheese. Place in blender and blend until smooth. Add vanilla extract and lemon juice. Blend until well incorporated. Add nutriwhip and pineapple. Blend until creamy. Place in a 4x8 loaf pan. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours. Serves 4-6.

Make the mold. Fill a small saucepan with 1 in. of water and bring it to a boil. Add gelatin and stir to dissolve. Remove from heat and set aside. In a medium mixing bowl combine cream of mushroom soup and mayonnaise. Stir in the gelatin mixture and stir until blended. In a separate small mixing bowl combine the remaining ingredients except the cream cheese. Stir to blend. Add the cream cheese to the mushroom mixture and stir until blended. Spoon the mixture into a 1 in. deep mold or ramekin. Chill for 2 hours. To unmold turn mold upside down and remove. Serve with crackers or crackers and cheese.

Cut potatoes into thin wedges and place in large bowl of cold water for 5 minutes. Drain and pat dry on paper towels. Heat oil and 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat until melted and hot. Add potatoes and sausages and cook about 10 minutes until sausages are browned and crisp and potatoes are browned and crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Mix remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and onion and sauté until onion is tender. Add mixture to potatoes and stir until evenly distributed. Serve hot with or without feta and mustard on the side.

Combine all dry ingredients with warm water until dough forms. Place dough on floured surfaceknead until smooth, adding flour as needed. Form dough into small ballsplace on corn tortilla press with corn tortillas placed on top. Press down firmlyremove corn tortillasplace rice tortillas on hot pan for 1 min per side or until tortillas are cooked through. Serve warm with favorite filling.
