In a soup pot combine beans, water, onion and garlic. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until beans are tender and liquid is reduced by about one half. Add cumin and chili powder. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add sherry and simmer for another minute. Add salt, pepper and cilantro. Serve hot.

Cook spinach in boiling water for about 5-7 minutesdrain well and chop finely. Saute garlic in olive oil for 1 minute. Add spinach and artichoke hearts to garlic and saute for 2 minutes more, stirring frequently. Stir in mayonnaise and cream cheeseblend well. Fold in cheese. Spread into an ovenproof baking dish or 6 individual ramekins. Bake in oven at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until heated through. Serve hot with pita bread.

Prepare the orange cake mix according to directions using eggs, vegetable oil, instant vanilla pudding mix, water in the recipe. Pour the prepared batter into an ungreased 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Let it cool for about 20 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the mandarin oranges by slicing them thinly in half or thirds depending on the size of the orange, removing the pits if any and arranging them in the prepared pan in an attractive pattern. Bake at 375°F for about 30 minutes or until the batter is set. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

Combine olive oil, balsamic vinegar, dijon mustard and garlic. Whisk together and set aside. Pat dry your boneless skinless chicken breasts and rub with seasoning salt and black pepper. Place chicken breasts on grill and brush with olive oil mixture. Grill chicken breasts on medium to medium high heat. Grill for 4 minutes. Turn breasts and brush again. Grill for 4 more minutes. Turn and brush again. Grill for 3 more minutes. Brush with olive oil mixture. Grill for 4 more minutes. Turn and brush again. Grill for 4 more minutes. Remove from grill and let stand for 5 minutes. Slice and serve with cilantro and lime juice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a small bowl combine self-rising flour, cheddar cheese and milk. Stir in a few pieces at a time. Spoon into a greased muffin pan. Sprinkle with a pinch of sea salt. Bake 15-18 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand for a few minutes before removing from pan. Serve warm.

Thaw spinach according to package directions. Drain, squeeze water out completely and set aside. In large bowl or food processor combine spinach, artichoke hearts, mayonnaise, garlic powder and parmesan cheese. Mix well or process until smooth. Transfer to baking dish and top with mozzarella cheese. Bake until bubbly about 30 minutes. Serve warm with crackers.
Layer pita bread with beef, lettuce and tomato, olives (or chopped onion or garlic) and cheese. Grill for 1 minute on each side or until cheese melts.

Heat the oil in a pan. Add onions and cook until tender. Add the kale. Cook for a few minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook for a few more minutes. Add water. Simmer for about 15 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Cook pasta in boiling water as directed on package for 8 minutes or until tender but firm. Drainset aside. In 2-quart casserole, combine mayonnaise and soupstir in milk and next 5 ingredients. Add pastatoss well. Top with cheese and peassprinkle with remaining cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake, uncovered, at 400f for 15 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.

Preheat oven to 400. Place chicken breasts between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and pound to a 1/4-inch thickness. Mix together chicken breasts, pickled jalapenos, bacon, monterey jack cheese, bread crumbs, chili sauce, salt, black pepper in a bowl. Roll chicken into the mixture to coat both sides. Place in a single layer in a 9-in square baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Let chicken sit in the pan for 10 minutes. Serve hot.
Saute green chilies and cream cheese until melted. Stir together remaining enchilada ingredients. Pour into an 8 x 11 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes.

In large frying pan (or deep-fat fryer), heat oil to 350 degrees f. Dip chicken wings in soy-honey mixture in one at a time (you can add 1 or 2 tablespoons of honey if they seem too dry). Place in hot oil, frying wings for about 6 to 10 minutes until golden brown (fry in small batches if you have to). Drain wings on paper towels to remove excess oilsprinkle with sesame seeds if you like.

Bring wild rice and orzo to a boil in a large pot of salted water over high heat. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until al dente (about 20 minutes). Strain and set aside. While rice cooks, prepare vegetables. In a large saucepan melt butter over medium heat and saute mushrooms until tender. Add pecans and sage and cook until pecans are toasted, about 5 minutes. Add wild rice and orzo and cook until heated through and all vegetables are tender. Add frozen peas and stir gently to combine. Top with cooked chickpeas if desired and serve hot.

Crack an egg into the bowl of a blender. Add yogurt and salt and blend together. Set aside. Brush one side of each slice of white bread with melted butter. Layer ham, cheese and egg mixture on each slice of bread. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden. Serves 8.

Mix margarine and apple juice concentrate together in a large mixing bowl with a wooden spoon. Add eggs one at a time, stirring thoroughly after each addition. Sift together flour and soda and salt and add alternately with milk and water and bananas to apple mixture. Pour into a greased and floured 9 x 5 loaf pan and bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cool in pan 15 minutes and then remove and finish cooling on a wire rack.

Combine all the ingredients except the vinegar in the top of a double boiler. Cook the mixture for 15-20 minutes or until it is the consistency of honey. Remove the mixture from the heat and stir in the vinegar. Let the mixture cool. Transfer the mixture to a glass jar and refrigerate for about 8 hours until the mixture is cold and set. Stir the mixture and pour into the prepared jar. Let stand for 24 hours before using to allow the flavor to develop. Store it in the refrigerator for about 6 months.
In large skillet, stir together asparagus, olive oil, garlic powder and salt. Cook over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until asparagus is tender. Stir in sesame seeds.

Melt 2 cups of white chocolate chips and 1 cup of semi-sweet chocolate chips in the microwave. Stir together until smooth. Mix in cereal. Place the mixture in a shallow pan. Add diced almonds and cherries. Place the pan in the refrigerator. When ready to serve, top with chopped almonds.

Bring chicken broth to boiling. Meanwhile, whisk egg and sesame oil together. Add to chicken broth and stir until egg is cooked. Add cooked ramen noodles and stir. Cook for one minute. Add green onions and cook until wilted. Serve.

Spread cream cheese evenly over each tortilla. Top each tortilla with beef and cheese. Lay out lettuce leaves on each tortilla. Fold up the ends and roll up the tortillas as tightly as possible without tearing them. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight before serving.

Preheat oven to 400. Halve potatoes lengthwiseplace cut side down in a 9-inch square baking dish. Brush with 1 tablespoon butter. Mix together lemon zest and juice. Brush potatoes with remaining buttersprinkle with lemon zest mixture. Bake in 400 oven for 1 hour. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Serve warm. Top with chives or parsley.

In a large bowl combine pork and curry paste. Add breadcrumbs and stir until thoroughly combined. Form into 10 patties. Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook patties about 4 minutes per side or until cooked through. Add patties to a plate and cover with foil to keep warm. Add remaining 1/4 cup oil to the skillet. Add onion and cook until soft and translucent. Stir in remaining 2 tablespoons curry paste and cook 1 minute. Add lime juice and cilantro and stir until combined. Stir in brown sugar and cook 1 minute. Return patties to the skillet and cook until glazed. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve on rolls with slaw.

Prepare macaroni according to package directions. Drain and add to a large bowl. Stir in the soups. Add the tuna and the cheese. Mix well. Transfer to a greased 1-1/2-qt. baking dish. Top with sour cream and the onion. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Yield: 6 servings.

Preheat grill to medium-high heat (or broil). Sprinkle chicken breasts with salt and black pepper to taste. Grill chicken until just cooked throughabout 5 minutes per side. Slice ciabatta rolls in half lengthwise (or serve as buns) to make 4 sandwiches. Spread each half of roll with mayonnaise. Add lettuce to each roll. Top with cooked chicken, bacon strips, guacamole, mexican cheese and adobo seasoning. Serve with chips.

Mix together mustard, breadcrumbs, green onions and parsley. Combine chicken with mustard mixture until well coated. Thread chicken onto skewers alternating with cherry tomatoes. Bake for about 15 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve with rice pilaf or rice.
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and refrigerate for 12 to 24 hours. Serve the blueberries in yogurt or over ice cream.

Bring vinegar to boil in pot of large saucepan with lid on. Add garlic cloves and let garlic cook in vinegar for 15 minutes or until cloves are tender and softened. Bring garlic and vinegar to boil in pot of large saucepan with lid on. Cook for 10 minutes. Pour into glass jar or mason jar and let cool to room temperature before covering and refrigerating.

Melt butter. Add sugar and vanilla and mix well. Add dry ingredients and mix. Roll into small balls and place on wax paper. Freeze for about 10 minutes and then roll in sugar crystals. Place on wax paper again and freeze until ready to eat.

Place ham hocks in slow cookeradd onion, ketchup, molasses, salt, pepper, dry mustard and worcestershire sauce. Cook on low for 6-8 hours until beans are tender. Serve with cornbread muffins or biscuits.

Heat oil. Flip tortillas over. Spread monterey jack pepper cheese on each tortilla. Sprinkle with pepper jelly. Add one apple slice to each tortilla. Fold tortillas to form a triangle. Fry until golden on both sides. Cut into quarters. Serve with sour cream.

First prepare the parsley by cutting it up and placing in a large bowl with a little extra virgin olive oil. Then add the onion and the sumac. Mix until the sumac is well distributed throughout the salad. Then add the lemon juice and mix. Then add the extra virgin olive oil and mix. Serve immediately.

Cut potato into wedges. Toss wedges in a bowl with olive oil, salt and pepper. Place in a large pan. Bake at 375f for 35 minutes or until potatoes are browned. Sprinkle with chives. Add paprika and wheat germ. Serve.
Mix all ingredients together. Pour into a 9 x 13 pan lined with parchment paper. Refrigerate overnight. Cut into bars and serve.
Combine soup with cream cheese and mix well. Spread cream cheese mixture into a 2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with garlic salt. Broil for 3-4 minutes. Let cool. Serve with crackers.

Preheat grill or broiler to medium heat. Brush nectarines with olive oil. Place on grill or broiler pan and cook about 3 minutes on each side or until tender. Remove from heat, let cool slightly. Place prosciutto strips on each nectarine half. Roll up tightly and secure with bamboo skewers. Place on grill or broiler pan and cook until prosciutto is lightly browned. Remove from heat and serve with mint leaves sprinkled on top of each fruit.

Drain beans and place them in a 9 x 13 inch pan. Cut the pork belly in half lengthwise. Lay one half in the pan of beans. Pour over about 1/4 cup of the mustard. Add half of the savory, salt, and pepper. Spread beans in one layer. Repeat layers. Pour remaining mustard over beans. Top layer. Cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until beans are tender. Cool. Serve hot.
Shred cabbage. Thinly slice carrots. Toss with cilantro. Combine vinegar and oil. Add all other ingredients to vinegar/oil mixture. Toss all together.

Bring large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoescook 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. Add beans to pot. Cook 2 minutes. Drain. Combine potatoes, beans and remaining ingredients in large bowl. Serve immediately.
Combine jello gelatin with boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Add cold water. Stir until dissolved. Add light rum. Pour into small cups and chill until firm. Top with whipped cream and fresh fruit.

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees c. In a large bowl, cream together margarine and sugars. Beat in eggs. Add vanilla and beat well. In a medium bowl, sift together flour and salt. Add to creamed mixture and stir until blended. Stir in pecans and chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded teaspoons onto greased cookie sheets. Bake for about 10 minutes or until lightly brown. Cool 1 minute. Remove to wire racks and cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Place butter in a 1-quart heavy casserole. Add onions. Sprinkle with ground cloves. Cook over low heat 45 minutes or until tender. Spoon onto platter. Drain juice from casserole. Add juice and brown sugar to casserole. Cook over low heat 15 minutes or until mixture is thick. Serve warm with onions.

Mix beef and seasonings thoroughly. Shape into eight 1/4-inch-thick patties. Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot and the oil is rippling. Brown hamburger patties on both sides. Combine ketchup and mustardbrush over patties during last few minutes of cooking. Cook until the meat is done and the juices run clear.

Saute garlic clove in peanut oil for 1 minute. Add mushroom, snow peas, red bell peppers. Saute for 2 minutes. Add scallions. Saute for 1 minute. Add soy sauce. Saute for 1 minute. Add egg whites. Scramble. Add egg yolks and scramble. Serve.

Combine seeds with the olive oil. In a small bowl, stir together the onion powder and garlic salt. Add the seasoning mix to the seeds. Toss to coat well. Place on a cookie sheet with a silpat liner. Roast at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Stir every 10 minutes. Roast until seeds are crisp and lightly browned. Serve as a snack. Makes 1 cup.

In a saucepan heat chili over low heat and stir in sour cream and cheese until well blended. Add chopped tomato and green onions and stir until heated through. Spoon into a serving bowl and garnish with chopped olives and sliced green onions. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, saute the garlic and onions with a splash of olive oil until soft. Add tomatoes with their juices and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30-40 minutes. Discard the seeds from the jalapeno. Add to the tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes. Break the tortillas in half and dip one side in boiling water for about 15 seconds. Place the tortillas into the soup and simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in the cilantro and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with sour cream.

Combine yellow cake mix according to package directionsmix in 1 cup cream cheese, 1/2 cup sliced almonds. Pour into ungreased 13 x 9 pansprinkle with 1/2 cup chopped almonds. Bake at 350 F for 30-40 minutes or until done. Cool. Spread with 1 1/2 cups cream cheese frosting (1 cup softened cream cheese2 cups confectioners' sugar1/4 cup butter). Top with remaining chopped almonds. Refrigerate 1 hour to set. Frosting is enough for two 9 x 13 pans or three 8 x 8 pans.

Unroll the crescent rolls. Separate the layers and place them in a greased 13x9 inch pan. Spread the cheese slices on the bottom of the pan. Layer the rolls on top of the cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Wash potatoes. Cut into quarters. Boil for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. Cool. Chop into 1/2-inch cubes. Cut cabbage into quarters. Slice into 1/4-inch strips. Slice onion into 1/4-inch strips. Place potato, cabbage, onion and bacon into bowl. Mix. Add parsley. Mix well. Serve warm.

In a large bowl, combine the mashed bananas and lemon juice. Beat in the eggs and vanilla until combined. Fold in the flour, baking soda and salt until combined. Fold in the zest. In a large mixer bowl, combine the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time until well-blended. Add the banana mixture in thirds and beat until combined. Pour into a greased loaf pan and bake in the center of a 375 degree oven until a cake tester comes out clean. Let cool in pan about 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Bake cake mix according to package directions. When cake is done cooling, place ice cream in a blender and blend until smooth. Pour ice cream mixture over cake layers and spread evenly. Garnish with cherry. Serves 8.

Cut the ends from the bread. Cut the bread lengthwise into 4 equal pieces. Spread 1/4 cup mayonnaise over each piece. Place 1 slice deli ham over the mayonnaise. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup shredded cheese. Add 1/4 cup red onions. Spread with 1 tablespoon horseradish sauce. Add another layer of ham, cheese, onions and horseradish sauce. Spread with 1 tablespoon mayonnaise. Place 1 slice bread with ham, cheese, onions and sauce on it. Spread the top with 1/4 cup mayonnaise. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Toast until golden brown. Slice the bread diagonally. Serve with mustard.
Dissolve yeast and sugar in water. Stir in the rest of the dry ingredients. Stir until combined. Stir in egg. Add buttermilk. Pour into bread machine and let rise. Bake as directed.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add orzo and cook according to package directions. Drain. In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add oil and garlic. Cook until fragrant. Add broth and bring to a simmer. Stir in drained orzo. Add salt and pepper. Cook until orzo is tender but still firm to the bite. Remove from heat. Add parsley. Serve.

In a large saucepan, bring vegetable stock and 2 cups of water to a boil. Stir in couscous and cook for about 12 minutes or until tender and most of the liquid is absorbed. Add the onion, garlic and cumin seeds and saute for a minute or two. Add the mushrooms and chick-peas and saute until the mushrooms soften slightly and the chick-peas begin to release their juice. Stir in the couscous and continue cooking over low heat for a couple of minutes, until the juices thicken and the couscous is tender. Add the parsley and season with salt and pepper before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl, combine pesto and butter. Set aside. In a large bowl, toss together the cooked bacon and cooked chicken. Add the pesto mixture and toss to coat. Place 8 muffin halves in a small baking dish. Spoon the chicken mixture evenly over the muffins. Bake 15-20 minutes or until hot and cheese is melted. Sprinkle each muffin with mozzarella cheese and bake until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve immediately. Makes 8 servings.
Blend the curry and rice soup mix into the tuna. Add the sweet potato. Add onions. Add egg. Add remaining curry and rice mix to binding mixture. Pour batter into pan. Cook for 30 minutes.

Mix ham steaks with pineapple chunks and apricot halves in natural juice and brown sugar. Combine apricot juice and brown sugar to make a glaze. Mix pear halves in syrup with ham and pineapple mixture. Add butter and curry powder to ham mixture. Cover and cook over low heat for 15 minutes until heated through and tender. Cover and cook over low heat until pear halves are heated through and glaze thickens slightly, about 10 minutes more. Transfer ham mixture to a serving platter and arrange pear halves in syrup around it. Serve hot. Serve with brown rice and steamed vegetables.

Unroll pastry on floured surface. Roll to 1/8-inch thickness and cut into 3-inch circles to fit pie plate bottoms and sides. Place pastry circles over prepared pans and trim overhang to 1/4-inchfold under and press to flute edges. Using pastry scraps, seal edges of pastry to pan sides. In large bowl, combine peaches and next 3 ingredientstoss until peaches are well coated. In small bowl, beat egg yolksgradually add enough milk to blend. Pour half of egg mixture into peach mixturefold until fruit is evenly coated. Spoon into pastry-lined pansdot with remaining egg mixture. Roll out remaining pastry to 1/4-inch thicknesscut into 1/2-inch-wide strips and arrange on top of peach-egg mixture as desired. Press down lightly to seal edges of pastry strips and crimp edges to give decorative effect. In small bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks formbrush tops of pies. Bake at 40

Place the water and corn syrup in a medium saucepan and cook over medium-high heat until it reaches 300f. Stir in the butter and the sugar. Cook and stir the mixture until the sugar dissolves. Remove the mixture from the heat and stir in the chopped almonds. Stir the mixture until the almonds are well coated with the syrup. Add the melted chocolate chips and stir until the chips are melted and well combined. Pour the mixture onto a wax paper-lined cookie sheet and spread into a thin layer. Place the tray in the refrigerator and allow the mixture to harden for at least one hour. Remove the tray from the refrigerator and break the mixture into small pieces. Store the tray in an airtight container.

Mix cake mix as directed on box with boiling water, oil and eggs. Bake according to package instructions. Allow to cool completely on wire rack. Meanwhile, mix powdered sugar with orange juice until smooth. Add to cake until desired amount of orange juice flavor is attained. Frost with buttercream icing if desired.

Cream butter and icing sugar together in a large bowl using an electric whisk. Sift cornflour and rice flour together and add to butter mixture with lemon rind. Combine to form a dough. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness on a lightly floured surface. Cut into 2 inch squares using a sharp knife or biscuit cutter. Place on lined baking trays. Bake for 15-20 minutes until slightly golden brown around the edges. Remove from trays and leave to cool on racks. Store in an air-tight container for up to 1 week.

Mix together the tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese. Put the prepared pizza dough on a baking sheet and spread the sauce and cheese mixture evenly over the entire surface of the dough. Cover with the cooked chicken and then sprinkle with basil and parsley. Top with the remaining pizza dough. Use a fork to make some indentations in the dough to prevent the dough from puffing up too much while baking. Bake at 375 degrees for about 25 minutes or until golden brown.

Mix lemon juice, lemon zest, onion and capers in small bowl. Add champagne and stir until sugar dissolves. Bring mixture to boil over medium heat. Add salmon fillets and simmer 3 minutes over medium heat, turning fillets gently once or twice. Remove salmon fillets with slotted spoon and place on platter or on serving plates. Keep warm while poaching remaining salmon fillets. To serve, spoon remaining poaching liquid over fish and garnish with fresh tarragon sprigs and capers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Remove mushrooms from stems. Clean filet mignon by removing outer skin. Cut into 1/4 inch thick pieces. Put filet mignon in a 9 x 13 pan. Layer mushrooms and white mushrooms on top. Mix portabella juice with cajun seasoning and pour over mushrooms. Pour wine over juice. Add butter to melt. Add cream. Dot with green onion. Bake 30 minutes or until sauce thickens. Serve.

Soak 1/2 cup of tapioca for 4-6 hours. Drain. Add to 1/2 cup water and bring to a boil. Stir until clear. Remove from heat and stir in remaining 1/2 cup water. Add remaining 2 cups of water. Cook on low heat for 15 minutes or until thickened. Stir in vanilla extract and amaretto. Add almond milk. Add toasted almonds and flax seed. Stir well. Let cool to room temperature before serving. Store covered in the refrigerator for up to a week. For a thicker texture serve without milk.
Mix the milk and sugar together. Add the peanut butter and vanilla. Pour into a 9x13 pan and spread evenly. Spread crackers on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Let cool before cutting.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. In a small skillet over medium heat heat oil until warm. Add garlic to oil until fragrant. Add red onion and sauté until softened for about 3 minutes. Add spinach to onion mixture and sauté until spinach is wilted for about 2 minutes. Add in feta cheese, seasoning, salt, pepper and oregano to spinach mixture. Set aside to cool. In food processor pulse chicken until coarse. Form mixture into patties and set aside. Grease 12 muffin cups with olive oil cooking spray. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat until hot. Add in chicken patties to pan sear for 2 minutes per side. Reduce heat to medium low. Add butter to skillet and melt to coat pan. Add patties back to pan and cook for 2 minutes per side or until browned. Add patties to oven proof dishes sprayed with olive oil cooking spray. Place in oven until internal temperature reaches 165 degrees fahrenheit

Melt butter and add onioncook until tender. Combine cornmeal and sugaradd milk and eggs and stir until well mixedstir in butter and onionadd baking powder and stir until well blendedpour into buttered 8-inch square baking dishbake at 350f for 30 minutes or until done.
In a glass with ice, add coffee. Add ice cream until glass is about three-quarters full. Add sugar to taste. Top with sweetened whipped cream.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain. In a large skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef. Drain the fat. Stir in the tomatoes and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in macaroni. Add corn and barbecue sauce. Simmer for about 20 minutes. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Serve. Serves 6 to 8.

Mix together soy sauce, water, honey, and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon in a large bowladd chicken breasts and toss to coat. Place breasts in a large skillet with a lidadd 1/2 cup water to the skillet. Cover and bring to a boilreduce heat to lowcook until chicken is no longer pink at the center, about 20 minutes. Remove pan from heatremove chicken breasts from pankeep warm. Degrease pan with a paper toweladd carrotscovercook for 3 minutes or until tender-crisp. Add spinachstir until spinach is wiltedreturn chicken breasts to pan. Degrease pan with paper towelsmelt butter in panadd onioncook until tender-crispadd to pan along with chicken breaststoss to coat with butter mixturesprinkle with remaining 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamonserve.

In large sauce pan melt 1/2 cup butter over medium heat. Stir in flour to make a paste. Gradually whisk in milk until smooth. Bring to boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and whisk in sugar and salt. Stir in eggs and vanilla. Return to heat and cook over low heat until thick and bubbly. Stir in rice. Pour into baking dish. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Or pour into serving bowl and let stand 1 hour. Garnish with lemon wedges. Pour brandy over top. Stir. Serve.

In a food processor, pulse chickpeas until finely ground. Add remaining burger ingredients and process until well mixed and a ball forms, about 1 minute. Transfer to a bowl and stir in 1/4 cup water. Form mixture into six equal-sized balls. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heatfry balls until browned on both sides, about 10 minutes total, turning occasionally. Serve hot with your favorite condiments and toppings on a whole-wheat bun.

Preheat oven to 375f. Beat butter until creamy, add caraway seed and beat until well mixed in. In another bowl mix flour with salt and baking soda. Add flour mixture gradually to butter mixture. Add milk and vanilla extract, beat until light and fluffy. Fold in sesame seeds. Place rounded teaspoons of dough on cookie sheet about two inches apart. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool slightly before removing from cookie sheet. These cookies are best served warm.

Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat. Add the light corn syrup and light brown sugar and cook for 5 minutes over low heat. Add the evaporated milk and the baking soda. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the vanilla and cook for 1 minute more. Pour into a jar and refrigerate.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat until hot. Add onion and cook until softened, stirring frequently. Drain ground beef. Stir into onion. Stir frequently while browning beef. Pour flour over beef mixturestir until smooth. Gradually add milk stirring constantly until mixture boils. Reduce heatsimmer uncovered 20 to 25 minutes or until thickened slightly. Stir in butter, garlic salt, pepper and cheese until meltedstir in cooked macaroni. Serve immediately.

In medium saut pan, melt olive oil over medium heat. Add sauerkraut to pan and saut until heated through. Remove from heat and add creme fraiche to pan. Mix until well combined. Add chives and stir to combine. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350f. Slice pork tenderloin into thin pieces. Coat with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. In a large bowl whisk together chili powder, cumin, cinnamon, brown sugar and garlic. Pour over pork and toss to coat. Place pork in one large roasting pan. Add liquid and place pan on middle shelf of the oven. Cook until the pork is fork tender and juices run clear when pierced with a knife, about 2 hours. Brush with sauce and cook for another hour. Let rest for 15 minutes before slicing and serving. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Slice chicken breasts in half horizontally. Brush cut sides of chicken breasts with butter. Place chicken breasts on a lightly greased cookie sheet or broiler pan. In a bowl, combine flour, black pepper and seasoning. Sprinkle mixture over chicken breasts. Bake for 20 minutes or until chicken is done. Remove from the oven. Cut cheese into thin slices. Arrange cheese on top of chicken. Bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Top each breast with about 3 tablespoons of the broth. Bake for 5 more minutes. Sprinkle each breast with oregano. Serve immediately.
Mix all ingredients together and bring to a boil. Let cool and pour over pancakes for an extra boost of flavor!

Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add oil to the skillet and saute garlic until it is tender. Add shrimp to the skillet and saute for 3 minutes on each side until pink and cooked through. Add red wine and let simmer until evaporated (about 1 minute). Add tomatoes to the skillet with shrimp and cook for 5 minutes or until the tomatoes are softened and the shrimp is cooked through. Stir feta cheese into the skillet with the tomatoes and shrimp and cook for 1 minute more or until the cheese is melted and slightly bubbling. Add parsley to the skillet with the shrimp and serve garnished with a kalamata olive on top.

Brown hamburger and drain well. Stir in tomatoes with juice and peascook over medium heat about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally until vegetables are tender and hamburger is fully cooked. Drain if desired. Stir in sour cream and cooked noodles. Top with grated cheese if desired. Serve hot.

Trim and thinly slice the lemon and grate the rind of the lemon into a blender. Add the lemon slices and the juice and blend until the lemon has been reduced by half. Add the oil and honey and blend again until smooth and emulsified. Set aside in the refrigerator until ready to serve with the green beans. Heat a large pot of water to boiling and add the green beanscook until tender-crisp, about 2 minutesdrain and return the beans to the pot. Add the lemon vinaigrette and toss gently with tongs until the beans are evenly coated with the dressing. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and toss again lightly until evenly seasoned with the salt and pepper. Serve immediately or keep warm in the refrigerator until ready for serving.

Dice potatoes. In a large pot, boil potatoes in water until tender. Drain. Transfer to a large bowl. Add bacon. Saute onion in butter. Add to potatoes. In a separate pot, combine milk, cream-style corn and water. Stir in potatoes and bacon mixture. Bring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 15 minutes. Stir in bacon. Garnish with parsley. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Crush graham crackers and place in a bowlmix in sugar. In a large bowl, beat together butter, snickers bars and peanut butter until creamy. Mix in half-and-halfbeat until light and fluffy. Add crushed graham crackers. Press into a 9-inch pie plate and refrigerate at least 15 minutes or until firm. Beat together whipped topping and chocolate syrup in a bowl until smooth. Spread evenly over pie crust. Cut a small slit into each candy bar, breaking it into a couple pieces. Place one piece in each slit. Refrigerate for at least 15 minutes or until ready to serve.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute the carrots and zucchini in the oil until tender. Add the basil and the butter and cook until the butter melts. Stir in the broth and bring to a boil. Cook until the rice is tender. Stir in the cooked vegetables. Remove from the heat and serve immediately.

Place olive oil and preserves in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook 8 to 10 minutes stirring constantly until preserves are melted. Stir in soy sauce, dry mustard and cayenne. Remove from heat and add ground black pepper to taste. Dry rub tenderloins with salt and fresh ground black pepper. Grill over medium heat until internal temperature reaches 160 degrees F. Remove from grill and brush tenderloin with glaze. Allow glaze to set before serving. Serve with peaches.

In a large mixing bowl combine flour, butter, salt. Beat egg yolks into sour cream. Add yeast mixture. Knead for 15 minutes or until smooth. Cover bowl. Let rise for 2 hours. Dust work surface with flour. Turn dough onto work surface. Divide dough into 6 equal portions. Roll each portion into a 24-in. long rope. Arrange ropes 5 inches apart on a greased baking sheet. Cut each rope into 3 pieces. Twist 3 pieces of dough together. Brush top of strudel with egg white. Sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar mixture. Roll up dough. Place strudel seam side down on baking sheet. Brush top of strudel with egg white. Sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar mixture. Roll up dough. Place strudel seam side down on baking sheet. Bake at 375f. for 30 minutes. Remove from baking sheet. Serve warm.

Clean cucumbers and dry thoroughly with paper towel. Combine egg and breadcrumbs in a shallow dish. Mix well and set aside. Coat cucumbers with cajun seasoning and dip in egg and breadcrumbs mixture. Fry until golden brown in bacon drippings. Drain well and serve hot.

Fry onions in butter over medium heat until soft and lightly browned. Add seasoned rice and water. Stirring frequently. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. In the meantime, prepare broccoli florets and cook in a pot of boiling water until tender. Drain. In a large bowl combine broccoli with cheez whiz and soup. Mix well. Add rice mixture. Stir in corn flake crumbs. Pour into a 9x13 inch pan. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes. Top with cheese.

Cream together butter and shortening until light and fluffy. Add 1-1/2 cups of powdered sugar and vanilla. Add flour gradually until mixture is stiff enough to shape into balls. Roll into balls and dip half of each ball into the remaining 1/2 cup of powdered sugar. Place balls on ungreased cookie sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool on wire rack 5 minutes before removing cookies from cookie sheets. Roll half of each cookie in chopped almonds before serving.

Prepare a 9-inch springform pan by spraying it with cooking spray. Sift together flour and sugar into a large bowl. Mix well. Add baking powder. Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Add vanilla. Fold in half of the blueberries. Combine yogurt and 1/3 cup water. Stir into the batter. Pour into prepared pan. Sprinkle remaining blueberries over batter. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 55 minutes. Cool cake for 15 minutes. Run a knife around the edge of the pan and release the cake. Run a knife around the edge again and invert cake onto a plate. Cut and serve.

Heat the water and salt in a small saucepan over medium heat until the salt has dissolved. In a medium bowl combine the cocoa powder and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add the cocoa mixture to the water mixture. Stir in the half-and-half and the vanilla and almond extracts. Heat to boiling. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook 2 minutes. Strain into mugs and serve.

Wash and chop cabbage and other vegetables into bite-size pieces. Add all other ingredients to a large bowl and mix well until all is evenly mixed. Cover and refrigerate overnight or up to 24 hours. Enjoy!

Wash peaches and cut them into eighths. Place the cut up peaches into a large bowl. Sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar. Let sit for 15 minutes. Place butter into a small bowl. Add flour to butter. In another bowl combine milk with vanilla extract. Pour milk mixture over flour mixture. Beat with a fork to make a smooth dough. Roll dough out on a floured surface into a circle about 1/8 inches thick. Place dough circle into a greased 9 x 13 baking dish. Fill the dough with sliced up peaches. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake at degrees for 35 to 45 minutes or until dough is a golden brown.

Peel cucumber and cut in half lengthwise. Scrape out seeds. Slice cucumber into 1/4 inch thick rounds. Cut into 1 inch pieces. In a large bowl combine cucumber, tomatoes, pepper and onion. Add lime juice and red wine vinegar. Season with dill weed and salt and pepper to taste. Chill for at least one hour or more before serving. Delicious with grilled chicken or fish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place pork chops in a glass baking dish. Pour Ranch dressing over pork chops. Add Worcestershire sauce and dry mustard. Place garlic cloves and onion powder in a small bowl and mix together. Sprinkle this mixture over pork chops. Cover tightly with aluminum foil. Bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake uncovered for another 15 to 20 minutes or until pork chops are cooked through. Serve with your favorite side dish.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place asparagus on a large baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt. Bake for 15 minutes or until tender. Cool. In the meantime, heat the butter in a saute pan. Add the lemon zest. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the vinegar. Add the asparagus. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with the remaining salt. Serve warm.

Heat extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add roma tomatoes and cook for approximately one minute. Add crushed red pepper flakes and kosher salt and pepper to taste. Add calamari and cook for about 5 minutes or until tender. Transfer calamari to a large plate to cool slightly. Drain and discard marinade. Cut calamari into small pieces. Toss with tomato mixture. Sprinkle with capers and lemon juice. Serve with parsley and lemon.

Cook the bacon until crisp. Remove it from the pan to drain on a paper towel. Reduce the heat to medium. Cook the onion in the bacon fat until soft. Remove it from the pan. Add the clams to the pan along with the corn kernel. Cook the clams until all of them are open. Remove them from the pan. Add the chowder, thyme, and Tabasco. Cook until the clams are heated. Blot the mixture on a paper towel to remove some of the extra liquid. Mix the clams with the bacon. Mix the breadcrumbs with the softened butter. Press the breadcrumbs into the bottom of a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Spoon the clams into the dish. Top the clams with the crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Sprinkle the fresh parsley over the top of the pie.

In a small bowl combine the capers, pickled vegetables, and olives. In another bowl combine the olive oil and vinegar. Add the oregano and mix well. Add the salami and cheese and mix again. Place the mixture on the focaccia bread and garnish with the pimento stuffed olives.
Combine onion, ground beef, ketchup, chili powder and mustard in saucepan. Bring to boil, then reduce heat. Simmer for 20 minutes. Serve with buns.

Cook rice according to directions on the package. In a wok heat oil. Add chopped garlic and fry till brown. Add chopped onions and fry till golden. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder and fry for a few seconds. Add tomatoes, green chilies and fry for a few minutes. Add the cooked rice, salt to taste and some water (if required) to make the mixture slightly loose. Stir the mixture well. Serve hot along with some curds or lemon juice as a side dish.

In a skillet saute onion in margarine over medium heat until translucent. Add celery stirring constantly until tender. Stir flour into onion mixture. Add curry powder stirring until flour is coated. Stir in chicken broth. Bring mixture to a boil. Stir in tomato juice. Pour mixture into a large saucepan. Bring to a boil stirring occasionally. Stir in chicken. Cook over low heat until chicken is done. Stir in rice. Cook over low heat until rice is done. Serve over cooked rice.

Cut garlic in half. Cut tomatoes in half. Slice shiitakes into bite size pieces. In a bowl, add garlic, tomatoes, shiitakes. Sprinkle with lemon juice. Drizzle with olive oil. Add bay leaf and white wine. Cover with plastic wrap. Marinate in fridge over night. Remove bay leaf before serving. Stir in parsley. Serve with rice or bread.
In a large bowl combine olive oil, garlic, zucchini, pine nuts, raisins and mintadd salt and pepper to taste. Mix well and refrigerate for at least an hour before serving. Makes four servings.

Combine shrimp and celery in a large salad bowl. Mix in egg whites. Sprinkle with walnuts and onions. Pour dressing over the mixture and toss. Place romaine lettuce in a large salad bowl. Top with the shrimp mixture and serve.

In a large saucepan, combine water, brown sugar and maple extract. Place over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Boil 2 minutes, then stir in white sugar. Boil 2 minutes more. Let cool. Pour syrup into a clean glass bottle. Place lid on bottle. Let cool to room temperature. Refrigerate.

Sprinkle fillets with salt and spices. Place on a rack in a shallow roasting pan and pour 1 inch of water into the pan. Roast salmon in a 350 degree oven for about 20 minutes or until flesh is just opaque. Combine mayonnaise and lemon and garlic and spread on salmon before serving with sliced onion and pickles.

Season turkey with lemon pepper, lemon juice, worcestershire sauce and mustard. Place a nonstick cooking spray in a pan large enough to hold turkey cutlets, over medium-high heat. Add turkey to pan. Cook about 4 to 5 minutes per side or until turkey is cooked through. Place cooked turkey on a cutting board to cool. Slice turkey thinly to serve.

Prepare a cocktail shaker with ice. Add vodka and peach schnapps. Add cream. Stir. Pour into glasses and garnish with peaches. Serve immediately. You can also add a few drops of peach extract for extra flavor.

Mix the wine and the sugar in a pitcher. Add the chopped basil leaves and stir to combine. Serve the cantaloupe in individual glasses filled with the wine mixture. Garnish the glasses with fresh basil leaves. Serve cold.

Combine oil and garlic in a small skillet. Cook and stir over medium heat 3 minutes or until garlic is softened. Add capers and lemon juice. Cook 1 minute. Stir in sour cream and lemon-pepper seasoning. Spray nonstick cooking spray onto a 12-inch skillet. Place salmon fillets in the sprayed pan. Brush with marinade. Bake at 425°F for 12 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh parsley. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400f degrees. Bake the potatoes for 1 hour. While they are baking cook the hot dogs on the barbecue. In a large bowl combine the vegetarian chili with the hot dogs. When the potatoes are done cut them up into fries. Place the fries on a baking sheet and spoon the hot dog chili onto them. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake the fries for 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease or paper muffin cups or spray with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and saltstir in the sugar and mix well with a fork until well blended. In another bowl, combine the egg, milk, and buttermix well with a fork until well blended. Add the milk mixture all at once to the dry mixture and mix only until the flour is moistened. Fold in the frozen blackberries. Spoon into muffin cups and bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 18 to 22 minutes or until a pick inserted in the center of the muffins comes out clean.

Soak slices of nori in hot water for a few seconds. Cut into small squares. Brush chicken with soy sauce and then dip in cornstarch. Heat vegetable oil in a frying pan until hot. Add a few pieces of nori at a time, cooking for a few seconds on each side until golden. Add chicken to pan. Cook for a few minutes on each side until golden. Serve immediately.

Divide graham cracker crumbs and granola cereal evenly between 8 small glasses. Place two tablespoons of graham cracker crumbs in each glass and press down evenly to form base of glasses. Place water and country time lemonade in small bowl and microwave on high for 10 seconds. Stir mixture and pour evenly into graham cracker base. Add two scoops of vanilla ice cream to each glass and top with cool whip and lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350f. Slice each breast in half horizontally. Place each half on a cutting board and cut into strips. Sprinkle with paprika and season with salt and pepper. In a large bowl, beat eggs. Add flour and stir until combined. Coat strips of chicken in flour mixture. In large frying pan, heat oil and cook chicken in batches until browned. Transfer browned chicken to a baking dish. In a small bowl, stir together cornflakes and melted butter. Press cornflake mixture into the bottom of the dish. Top with browned chicken. Bake until cooked through and crunchy. Serve.

Brown beef with onion. Add salsa. Bring to a boil. Stir in refried beans. Simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Pour mixture into unbaked 9x13 baking dish. Stir in cornbread mix. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Cut spam into large pieces and brown in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drain off fat. Place spam in a large bowl. Add brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, prepared mustard and water. Mix well. Pour into a greased and floured loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Let cool for at least ten minutes before removing from the pan. Serve warm.
Blend all ingredients in blender. Serve immediately.

Rinse fish fillets. Dust each fillet with flour. Heat olive oil and butter in a frying pan. Fry fillets for 2 minutes per side. Drain oil and butter from pan. Add almonds and cook for 3 minutes. Remove almonds. Add lemon juice to pan. Bring to a boil. Turn down heat and add fish fillets. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove pan from heat. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place a heavy-based pan over medium heat. Add the butter and when melted add the cheese and parsley. Stir until the cheese melts and is well mixed. Remove from the heat and stir in the breadcrumbs. Add the seasoning. Stuff the cheese mixture into the chicken breasts. Place the breasts on a greased baking sheet and bake in the oven for 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 180c. Line a 20cm loaf tin with greaseproof paper. Cream butter with sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Add flour mixture alternately with the milk. Add the walnuts, fruit and raisins. Spoon into prepared tin. Bake for 50-60 minutes until golden on top.

Preheat oven to gas 4 180c 350f. Beat butter and sugar until creamy. Beat in egg and vanilla essence. Gradually beat in flour until just mixed. Fold in chocolate chips. Form into golf ball size balls and place on greased baking sheet. Flatten slightly. Bake for 12-15 minutes until just light golden brown.

Trim the fat from the pork chops and cut into serving-size pieces. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the pork chops in batches. Transfer to a plate. To the same pan, add water to cover. Bring to a boil and add rice and whole tomatoes. Cook 1 minute. Return pork to pan and stir. Add scallions and golden raisins. Cook over medium heat until rice is tender and pork is cooked through, about 10 minutes. Serve over rice.
Combine all ingredients except the egg substitute. Form into 12 to 14 mini meatloaves. Bake at 375 for 20 to 25 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes before removing meatloaves from pan. Serve hot.

On one slice of bread, spread mayonnaise and 1/2 tablespoon pesto. On another slice of bread spread 1/2 tablespoon mayonnaise and 1 tablespoon pesto. Top with oven-roasted turkey breast and tomato slices. Top with gouda cheese and red onion slices. Top with remaining slice of bread and butter. Place sandwiches between 2 slices of bread and lightly press together. Cut sandwiches into 4 pieces and serve.

Boil rice until tender (about 10 minutes). Drain well. In large bowl, combine rice, feta cheese, olives, cucumber, olive oil, vinegar and oregano to tasteseason with salt and pepper to taste. Toss well to combine. Serve at room temperature.

Brown beef with onion and garlicdrain grease. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer 15 minutesadd water if needed to prevent sticking. Pour over bunsgarnish with ketchup, mustard, pickles, and onions (if desired).

In a large pot combine beans with 6 cups of water and the chicken broth. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and simmer for 30 to 45 minutes or until beans are tender. Drain beans. In a medium bowl whisk together 3 tablespoons olive oil and 1/4 cup chicken broth. Add beans and toss until coated. Season with chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder and black pepper. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours to allow flavors to meld. Stir in remaining olive oil. In a large skillet heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 3 to 4 minutes until the onion softens. Add the beans and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the chicken broth. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Cook until beans are tender and the chicken broth has almost evaporated. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook for 2 more minutes. Taste and adjust the

Rinse fish and pat dry. Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and sauté until onion begins to soften. Add chili powder, white wine and water. Cook until liquid evaporates. Add parsley, salt and pepper. Set aside. Peel and clean the cauliflower. Cut into florets. Saute the florets in olive oil until slightly browned. Add the cauliflower to the fish mixture. Place fish in a baking dish. Place the fish mixture over the fish. Bake for 20-25 minutes.

Combine butter flavor shortening, brown sugar, granulated sugar, light corn syrup and eggnog in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the mixture reaches 240 degrees f (soft ball stage). Remove from heat and add the nutmeg. Pour the mixture into a 9″ by 13″ by 2″ pan. Place the pan in the refrigerator. Allow the mixture to set for 2 hours. When set, remove from refrigerator. Drizzle the mixture with hot water from a water bath. Remove from the water bath and allow to cool completely. Cut into 1″ pieces. Roll each piece into a ball. Place the balls on parchment paper. Roll the balls in granulated sugar. Place the candies on waxed paper until firm. Store in an airtight container.

Cut the escarole into 1-inch pieces. Add to a large pot with the olive oil and cook over medium heat until wilted. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes. Add the canned tomatoes. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes. Add the crushed red peppers. Add the escarole mixture and cook for 30 minutes. Stir in the broth. Bring to a boil. Add the macaroni and cook until tender. Stir in the beans. Cook for 10 minutes. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Sprinkle with the pecorino romano cheese. Serve with the grated pecorino.

In a large bowl, combine flour, bran and sugar. In a separate bowl, whisk together egg substitute and milk. Add wet ingredients to dry and mix well. Spoon batter into paper lined muffin pans and bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Cool slightly before removing from pans.

Preheat oven to 375f. Spread biscuits out on cookie sheet. Press down on the top of each biscuit with the bottom of a glass. Bake 5 minutes. Cool completely. Combine brown sugar and 1/4 cup of the cinnamon. Stir in butter and brown sugar mixture. Press 1/3 of the icing into the middle of each of the biscuits. Place ice cream scoops on top of the icing. Sprinkle remaining cinnamon and raisins over ice cream. Roll up the biscuit and serve. You can also make these in muffin tins. Just follow the same directions and put the ice cream scoops into the muffin cups. Bake until golden brown. Ice the muffin cups and top with ice cream scoops. Roll and serve.

Toast blue corn tortilla chips in 350 degree oven for 10 minutes. Dice avocados and scallions. Scoop out jalapeno and remove seeds. Cut roquefort cheese into small cubes. Put 1/4 cup sour cream in a bowl and blend in 2 teaspoons paprika and 1 teaspoon salt. Put 1/2 cup sour cream in a bowl and blend in 3 ounces diced avocado and 1 ounce scallions. Put 1/4 cup sour cream in a bowl and blend in 3 ounces diced jalapeno and 1 ounce roquefort cheese. Place all three sauces in bowls. Put tortilla chips on a platter and garnish with blue corn tortilla chips and scallions. Serve with Roquamole.

Crush the pineapple in juice and set aside. In a large mixing bowl, mix together the soymilk, tapioca and vanilla extract. Stir until tapioca is dissolved. Stir in the crushed pineapple until well blended. Let stand for 10 minutes or until thickened. Serve garnished with berries.

Cream cream cheese and chipotle together in bowl until smooth. Stir in cilantro and onions. In separate bowl, mix garlic clove and green onions with cream cheese mixture. Spray a large cookie sheet with cooking oil or use non-stick spray. Cut crescent roll dough into strips. Divide cream cheese mixture into four portions and pipe each onto crescent roll strips leaving about a half inch edge on either side of each strip unfilled. Roll crescent roll strips up and place on cookie sheet seam sides down. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool for 10 minutes. Slice each roll into three equal pieces. Serve with your favorite salsa. Yields 12 rolls.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, cream together butter and corn syrup. Add peanut butter. Stir in cornflakes. Drop dough by teaspoons on ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten with the bottom of a glass. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before removing from the cookie sheet. Cool on a wire rack. Makes 2 dozen.

Bring 1 cup of evaporated milk to a boil. Remove from heat and add 1 cup of white sugar. Stir until dissolved. Add 1/2 tsp of salt. Add cherry gelatin and stir until dissolved. Remove from heat. Stir in butter. Pour into 2 quart round casserole dish. Chill until firm (about 2 hours). Line bottom of casserole dish with wax paper. Pour chocolate chips over cherry fudge layer. Chill until firm (about 30 minutes). Pour maraschino cherry juice over chocolate layer to desired color (a little at a time). Top with maraschino cherries (optional). Refrigerate until firm (about 30 minutes). Remove from refrigerator and cut into squares or diamonds to serve.

Combine the sugar and water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the salt and the cayenne pepper. Add the pecans. Cook for 2 minutes over medium heat. Remove from heat. Stir occasionally until the pecans are glazed. Serve warm.

Put prepared yellow mustard into a mixing bowl with 1/2 cup of the dark corn syrupwhisk until well blended. Add dry mustardwhisk until combined. Add white vinegar, mayonnaise, soy sauce, sugar, cayenne pepperwhisk until combined. Pour into a heatproof container and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Slice rhubarb. Place in a saucepan with water. Cook over medium heat for about 8 minutes or until rhubarb is tender. In another saucepan melt the butter in the water with the flour until it thickens. Stir in the rhubarb juice and heat through. Place 1 cup rhubarb in each pie shell. Pour filling over rhubarb in pie shells. Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and continue baking for 45 to 50 minutes or until golden brown.

Cut beef into small cubes. If using lamb use same size cubes. In a large bowl add dressings. Add cubes and toss to coat. Heat oil in heavy fry pan or deep fryer. Fry cubes until desired brown. Serve with celery and carrots.

Combine all ingredients except breadcrumbs. Mix well. Form into loaf shape. Place meatloaf on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 45-60 minutes or until done (internal temp of 160 degrees). Let sit for about 10 min before slicing. Serve hot with mashed potatoes or your favorite side dish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 pan. In a large bowl, cream together butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Beat until combined. Add in vanilla. Add in half of the dry mixture. Stir in half of caramel sauce. Pour half of caramel sauce into pan. Add in remaining dry mixture. Stir in remaining caramel sauce. Pour in batter into pan. Spread batter evenly. Bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. While bars are baking, melt chocolate chips over low heat in a double boiler. Drizzle over bars once out of oven. Let cool for 10 minutes before cutting into bars. Store in refrigerator. Enjoy!

Make cordials in a ratio of 1/4 cup orange juice to 1/4 cup coffee. Combine juice and coffee in a jar and shake well. Pour into a clean jar. Add sugar to taste. Stir well. Add rum to taste. Refrigerate for at least 24 hours. Strain into a clean jar. Serves 8.

Bring a medium pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add the potatoes and cook for 5 minutes or until a knife can be inserted easily into one of the potatoes. Remove from the heat and cool for 5 minutes under cold water. Peel and slice the potatoes into 1/4 inch cubes and place in a large bowl. In a small bowl combine the pickle juice and mayonnaise and season well with mustard powder and salt and pepper to taste. Add the pickle juice mixture to the potatoes and toss well to coat. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight for best flavour and texture. Just before serving stir in the eggs and fresh herbs and season well again with mustard powder and salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

In a small skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until lightly browned. Add basil, orange and lemon zests and cook for about 1 minute. Pour warm oil over olives and mix well. Stir in vinegar, red pepper flakes and salt and pepper to taste. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

In a large pot of boiling salted water cook green beans until tender but still crisp, about 3 minutesdrain. In a large skillet over medium heat melt 2 tablespoons of butter and sauté pancetta until golden brown and crisptransfer to paper towels to drain excess fat. Add 2 tablespoons of butter to skilletsauté shallot until tender, about 3 minutestransfer to paper towels to drain excess fat. In a small saucepan over medium heat combine 2 tablespoons of butter with vinegarsimmer until reduced to 3 tablespoons, about 2 minutes. Add 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and pepperwhisk in remaining 1 tablespoon of butter. Divide green beans among 4 platestop each serving with pancetta and 2 tablespoons of shallots. Drizzle with vinegar saucesprinkle each serving with cheese.

Preheat oven to 375f. Wash potatoes then cut into 1-inch slices. Place potatoes into greased 8x8" baking pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Place onion slices in a single layer over potatoes then place garlic slices on top of onions. In bowl combine sour cream with milk stirring to blend. Pour over potatoes. Sprinkle with remaining salt and pepper to taste. Bake for 1 hour or until potatoes are tender. Remove pan from oven, place on serving platter then top with parsley if desired. Serve immediately with warm butter or warm sour cream.

Cook gnocchi according to package instructions. Drain. Cut onion into small pieces. Slice bell peppers into 1/4-inch pieces. In large skillet, cook onion over medium heat 1 to 2 minutes or until tender. Add bell pepperscook 4 minutes longer or until tender. Remove from skillet. Stir flour into chicken brothcook 1 minute or until thickened. Add onion mixture, gnocchi, chicken broth mixture to skilletcook 2 minutes longer or until mixture comes to boil. Reduce heat to lowcook 4 minutes longer or until sauce is slightly thickened. Add half-and-halfcook 2 minutes longer or until sauce thickens slightly. Stir in green onions. Drain chicken. Discard skin. Add to skilletcook 2 minutes. Serve immediately.

Cook chicken according to package directions. Cool, shred into bite size pieces. In a large salad bowl combine corn, cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, salsa and chicken mixture. Sprinkle with taco seasoning mix to taste. Top salad with kidney beans and tortilla chips. Drizzle with ranch dressing.

Place pear halves in a small bowl and pour boiling water over them until pears are covered. Let cool until pears are warm (but not hot) and softened, about 10 minutes. Remove pears from bowl and place in food processor along with almond extract. Add brown sugar and process until mixture is creamy and smooth. Transfer mixture to a small bowl and refrigerate until ready to use in recipe (it will keep up to one week). Add butter and salt to yeast and stir until dissolved. Add yeast mixture and pear mixture to bowl of bread machine and add enough warm water to make mixture 2 cups (480ml) in total. Add flour and stir until incorporated (do not overmix). Select dough cycle and press start button. When dough is done rising, remove from machine and punch down dough (you may need to flour your hands). Transfer dough onto floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Form dough into ball and place in greased bowl. Cover and let rise until doubled in size, about one hour. Remove dough from bowl and place on floured surface

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease and flour two 9x13 cake pans. In the large bowl of an electric mixer beat the vegetable oil and butter until smooth and fluffy. Add the white sugar gradually and beat until light and fluffy. Add the egg yolks one at a time beating well after each addition. Add vanilla and beat for one minute. Add the flour and baking powder alternately with the half-and-half. Beat until smooth. In the large bowl of an electric mixer beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold the stiffened egg whites into the batter. Divide batter evenly into prepared pans. Bake for 25 minutes or until cake tester comes out clean. Cool completely before icing. For frosting combine the cream cheese and butter and beat until smooth. Add vanilla and beat until creamy. Add the powdered sugar gradually until desired consistency is reached. Frost cake. Refrigerate if desired.

Boil eggs in a large pot of water for about 5 minutes. Drain eggs and chill them in cold water for about 10 minutes. Remove the eggs from the water and peel. Slice the eggs in half lengthwise and scoop out the yolk. Place the yolks into a bowl and mash them. Mix the mashed yolk with blue cheese, mayonnaise, parsley, celery salt and celery rib. Stuff the eggs with the cheese mixture and sprinkle with tabasco sauce. Place the stuffed eggs on a platter and garnish with more parsley. Serve with crackers.

Heat oil in a large frying pan or a sauce pan. Add onion and garlic. Cook until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, water, seasoning and wine. Simmer for about 30 minutes uncovered until sauce thickens. Stir occasionally. Add salt & pepper. Serve over any pasta or meatballs.

Sprinkle a few of the walnut pieces over each of the pizza crusts. Place a slice of salmon on each crust. Top each with a few of the green onions. Drizzle a little of the salad dressing over each. Sprinkle the parmesan over each pizza. Top each pizza with 2 or 3 cups of the spinach. Sprinkle the capers over each pizza. Bake for 10 minutes or until the crust is lightly browned and the spinach is tender. Cut into wedges. Serve warm.

Roll dough into balls and place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes at 425 F until light brown. Mix butter, sugar and cinnamon in small bowlstir well and brush over tops of cookies. Melt peanut butter in a small saucepan and drop by teaspoonfuls over cookies. Cool for two minutes before removing from cookie sheet and serving. Makes about 4 dozen alphabet dunkers.

In a medium saucepan, simmer the apricots and 3 cups of their syrup with the orange juice and water for 10-15 minute. Stir in the gelatin powder and let it dissolve. Remove from the heat and let it cool down. Pour it into a 9-inch springform cake pan and let it set for a couple of hour at room temperature and then refrigerate it for at least 3 hour. To make the cream, heat the cream with the sugar and the orange juice and simmer it for 15 minute. Add the demerara sugar and the orange zest and stir it around to dissolve the sugar completely. Pour the hot cream on top of the set apricot mixture and let it set for another 30 minute at room temperature before refrigerating it overnight. Remove from the cake pan and serve it with the orange cream drizzled on top of it. Store the apricot cream in the refrigerator for up to a week and the orange cream for 2 day. This recipe makes a nice gift and looks very attractive served on a dessert stand.

Mix flour, salt and pepper together in one bowl. Dip the boneless skinless chicken breasts into the flour mixture. Heat the butter and realemon juice in a 10-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir the chicken until browned and no longer pink. Add the mushrooms and cook for 2 minutes. Place the cooked rice into the bottom of the skillet and add the chicken. Cook 1 minute. Add 1/4 cup water. Cover and cook for 3 minutes. Turn the heat off. Sprinkle the sugar over the top. Let stand 5 minutes. Garnish with lemon wedges and serve with rice.

Mix together rice flour and salt and pepper. Make a well in the center and add in eggs and the juice from swiss chard. Mix until combined. Add in parmesan cheese and mix until fully incorporated. Grease a large cookie sheet with cooking spray and add in mixture. Flatten mixture and use a fork to make a criss cross pattern on top. Cook at 450 degrees until golden brown. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 400f. Cook macaroni in water until tenderdrain. In large sauce pan melt butter. Add cream soup, mayonnaise, cheese, & pimientos. Stir well. Stir in macaroni & mix well. Pour mixture into greased 9x13 casserole dish. Sprinkle with cracker crumbs. Bake for 15 minutes. Serves 6-8.

Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl. Mix well. Add in the egg whites and mix thoroughly. Spoon a small amount onto a parchment paper covered baking sheet and form into a ring. Repeat until all batter is used. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375f. Combine all dry ingredients. Beat together butter and sugar until fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition. Add dry ingredients alternately with buttermilk, beginning and ending with dry mixture. Stir in berries and cranberry saucepour batter into greased loaf pan. Bake for one hour or until a wooden pick inserted into center comes out clean.

Slice turkey into strips. Saute red onion and cherry tomatoes in a little olive oil and balsamic vinegar until soft. Top each pita with turkey strips, lettuce, onions and tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and lightly sprinkle with brown sugar. Enjoy!

In a large skillet, saute the chicken tenders in oil. Sprinkle with creole seasoning. Cook until golden and tender. In a large pot, combine the soup and broth. Stir in the cooked chicken. Add a dash of hot sauce.

In large bowl, blend all dip ingredients with electric mixer on low speed about 30 seconds or until blended and smooth. Chill 1 hour or until ready to serve. Serve with assorted fresh fruit. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

To make the mayonnaise, whisk the egg yolks and sugar together in a heatproof glass or stainless steel bowl. Pour the canola oil in a thin stream over the yolks while whisking constantly. Then slowly drizzle in the vinegar while whisking. When all the vinegar has been added, add the mustard. Whisk the mixture until it turns thick and pale yellow. Transfer to a container and refrigerate until ready to use. To make the tartar sauce, stir the mayonnaise until well blended. Add the minced celery, capers, minced pickles, lemon juice, and salt. Transfer to a container and refrigerate until ready to use.

Wash lemons thoroughly under cold water. Cut lemons into 1/2-inch pieces using a sharp knife. Place in a large potbring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-lowsimmer until lemon slices are tender when pierced with a fork, about 30 minutes. Drain in a colanderdiscard peels. (Do not discard juice.) Transfer lemon slices to a bowl of ice waterdrain when cool enough to handle. Squeeze juice from lemon slices into a pitcherdiscard peels. Add brown sugar and white sugar to juice in pitcherstir to blend. Add waterstir to dissolve sugar. Add ice to pitcherstir to blend. Garnish lemonade with lemon slices.

In a blender, make a paste of yogurt and oil. Add the chopped spinach and the chopped onion. Blend until smooth. Add the red chili powder and black pepper. Blend again to mix. Serve immediately. It is a wonderful accompaniment to vegetable and curry dishes.

Place the pecans in a bowl. Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Remove from heat and pour the butter over the pecans. Stir to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and chill for 1 hour. Line a baking sheet with foil. Arrange the pecans in a single layer. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and stir. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until the pecans are a golden brown. Remove pecans from oven. Stir in brown sugar and vinegar. Place on foil. Allow the pecans to cool slightly. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Combine flour, salt, and baking soda in medium bowl. Cream butter, sugar together in mixer bowl. Beat in egg and vanilla extract. Gradually add flour mixture to butter mixture, beating until dough forms. Roll dough to 1/4-inch thickness on lightly floured surface. Cut with 3 1/2-inch round cutter. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Sprinkle with sprinkles. Bake 6 to 8 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on cookie sheet 1 minuteremove to wire rack to cool completely. Makes 24 cookies.

Place beans in a large bowl and sprinkle with oil and soy sauce. Add garlic and ginger and toss together with the beans. Cover and refrigerate for 3 hours. Pour off the oil and soy sauce. Add oil and lime juice and stir until combined. Add the walnuts and cilantro and toss together with the beans. Season with salt and pepper if needed and serve at room temperature.

Dry salmon fillets with paper towel. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil and place fillets on a cookie sheet. Bake at 425 for about 10 minutes. Remove from the oven. Sprinkle with balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, orange juice, chicken broth. Return to the oven and bake for about 5 minutes. Turn the heat to 350, sprinkle with cornstarch and bake for 5 to 7 minutes. Serve with steamed broccoli.

Rinse pork tenderloin under cold water then pat dry. Season pork with salt. Place pork on cutting board. Insert 2 wooden skewers through both sides of pork at 1-inch intervals. Place pork on grill. Grill pork tenderloin 10-12 minutes. Grill pork for 20 more minutes or until thermometer inserted in center of pork reads 145. While pork is grilling, mix together chili sauce, soy sauce, orange juice, green onions and fresh ginger in medium bowl. Set aside. Remove pork from grill. Brush pork generously on both sides with mixture. Place pork on grill 5 more minutes. Sprinkle top of pork generously with sesame seeds. Remove from grill. Serve pork on platter with honey drizzled over top.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place chicken tenderloins in a shallow dish. Combine bread crumbs, Italian seasoning, salt and pepper. Dip chicken in eggs, then coat in breadcrumb mixture. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through, about 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Heat a saucepan over medium heat. Add the olive oil and heat until shimmering. Add the seeds and stir until they start to pop. Add the broccoli and saute for about 5 minutes until just tender. Stir in the lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Set aside. In a blender or food processor, add the yogurt and the spice mixture and process until smooth. Serve the broccoli over the yogurt mixture. Sprinkle with more freshly cracked pepper and serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 325. Place the bread in a 9 inch square pan. Cut the bread into 1 inch cubes. Heat the butter in a saucepan. Add the milk and sugar and stir until the sugar dissolves. In a separate bowl, combine the eggs and vanilla. Pour the egg mixture over the bread and milk in the pan. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake at 325 for 1 hour or until a knife inserted in the middle comes out clean. Serve with apple pie filling.

Wash salad greens. Place into a serving bowl. Add pineapple tidbits. Sprinkle cheese over salad. Drizzle mayonnaise on top. Sprinkle with sugar and salt and pepper. Toss lightly. Let stand 5 minutes to soften salad greens. Serve.

Heat olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic cloves to the pancook until onion is translucent. Add sugar to pan. Cook until sugar dissolves. Stir in beef bouillon cubes and red wine. Place mushrooms in pan. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Let sit for 5 minutes. Serve with fresh bread.

Heat half-and-half in a saucepan over medium heat until it just starts boiling. Add lemon juice and remove from the heat. Place the chocolate in a medium bowl and whisk in the hot half-and-half. Place a mesh sieve over a bowl and add the cold water. In a large bowl whisk the eggs until well combined. Gradually whisk in the hot chocolate mixture until well combined. Remove the sieve from the water bath. Sift the cocoa powder into the egg mixture. Add the salt, orange zest, and honey. Stir well. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking sheet. Spoon the linguine into each hole in the cake. Spoon a small amount of the chocolate mixture onto each linguine strand. Sprinkle the hazelnuts over the linguine. Cover the baking sheet with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight. Uncover the cake and serve it cold with ice cream. Store leftovers in the refrigerator.

Preheat grill to medium heat. Form a small patty out of the meat mixture. Roll in bread crumbs. Place on grill. Grill about 5 minutes each side or until done. For spaghetti meatballs, shape meat into small meatballs. Roll in bread crumbs. Cook meatballs as above. For stuffed meatballs, shape meat into small meatballs. Place meatballs in muffin tin. Add a half tablespoon of stuffing mix to each meatball. Cover meatballs in stuffing. Bake at 400 degrees for about 20 minutes or until done. For barbecue meatballs, shape meat into small meatballs. Roll in barbecue sauce. Cook as above. For salsa meatballs, shape meat into small meatballs. Roll in salsa. Cook as above.

Cook rigatoni according to package instructions or in a large pot of boiling water for about 12 minutes or until tender. Drain well in a colander and return to the pot. Stir in garlic and oil. Add beans and the rest of the ingredients (except bacon) and toss well. Transfer to a serving plattersprinkle with bacon. Serve with bread or crackers on the side.

Grease 13x9 inch pan with butter or margarineset aside. Melt butter in saucepanstir in carrots and cook over low heat until tender. Stir in the remaining ingredientsmix well. Pour into prepared pan and bake in the preheated 350 degree oven for 45 minutes or until lightly browned and set. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting into bars. Makes 16 servings.

Toss romaine lettuce with salsa and half of the ranch dressing. Put a layer of black beans and half of the corn on a tortilla chip. Layer a second tortilla chip and half of the monterey jack and cheddar cheese blend. Drizzle with more of the ranch dressing. Repeat the layers to make a full serving of salad. Makes 12 servings.

Boil new potatoes until tender. Drain. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop out the potato. Place potato shells on a cookie sheet. Top with a teaspoon of whipping cream and a teaspoon of chopped parsley. Place in the oven at 350 degrees for 5 minutes. Top with a teaspoon of boursin and a pinch of red caviar. Return to the oven for 5 minutes or until melted.

In a saucepan combine sugar, milk, butter, vanilla and baking powder. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until mixture comes to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heatcool for 5 minutes. Stir together the remaining dry ingredients. Add the cooled mixturemix well. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paperroll into balls. Place walnuts between each ball of dough. Roll balls in more walnuts. Refrigerate until firm, about 2 hours. Dust with confectioners' sugar.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Cut off the stem of each head of cauliflower and cut into florets. Put florets into water. Boil for 5 minutes. Drain well. Put cauliflower back into pot. Melt butter into pot. Add garlic to pot. Saute garlic for about one minute. Add cream cheese to pot. Stir until well mixed. Add bouillon, black pepper to taste. Add cauliflower to pot. Stir to coat cauliflower. Turn off heat. Top with Parmesan cheese. Serve.
In a large bowl mix together red potatoes, red bell peppers, artichokes and green onions. Add in freshly squeezed lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

Bring broccoli and water to boil in saucepan. Reduce heat to simmer and cook until done. Drain. In a glass baking pan layer broccoli in a single layer. Sprinkle with garlic salt and pepper. Sprinkle cheddar cheese on top. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Serves 6.

Combine all ingredients except the olive oil in a blender. Add a little bit of the olive oil to the blender to help the mixture blend. Blend until smooth. Stir in the remaining olive oil. Taste for seasoning. The dressing will keep for a few days in the fridge. It's a bit thick so thin it out a little with water if you prefer.

Mix yogurt with ginger, cardamom, salt, and pepper to taste. Stir in olive oil and pour over chicken breast. Place chicken breasts in a large bowl with the almonds, toss with the yogurt mixture. Marinate chicken for at least 3 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Slice chicken breast thinly. Cook chicken breast for 5 to 7 minutes or until no longer pink. Transfer chicken to a plate to cool for 5 minutes, then thinly slice on the bias. Arrange slices of chicken and almonds on a plate, drizzle with any remaining yogurt mixture and serve warm or cold.

Slice ribs in half lengthwise. Combine oil, garlic, dry sherry, chili bean paste and water in small saucepan. Bring to boiling on medium heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes.
