Remove from heat. Remove ribs from marinade. Place ribs in single layer in glass baking dish or 2 1/2-quart casserole. Pour marinade over ribs. Cover and refrigerate 24 hours. Bake at 350 degrees for 3 hours or until tender. Sprinkle ribs generously with hoisin sauce. Serve immediately.

In medium skillet, melt butter. Add carrots. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Add whiskey and brown sugar. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Remove from heat. Transfer to serving platter and serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine all dry ingredients and mix well. In a medium bowl, whisk egg and buttermilk. Stir wet mixture into the dry mixture. Add onion and stir to combine. Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer to 375 degrees F. Fill a medium bowl with ice water. Working in batches, scoop batter with a large spoon and drop into the hot oil. Fry for 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Drain on paper towels and serve.

Cream butter and sugars in mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until well blended. Add vanilla and mix well. Sift together flour, baking soda and salt and set aside. Add dry mixture to creamed mixture and mix well. Fold in pecans. Drop by heaping teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten with a fork. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutes before removing and cool completely on wire rack.

Melt butter in a large skillet over low heat. Add flour to butter and whisk. Add milk slowly and mix with whisk. Whisk in eggs. Add mustard and nutmeg. Stir in corn beef and heat until warm. Top with cheese.

Place 6 ounces of the chocolate chips (about half the total) into the top of a double boiler (or a bowl set over a pot of simmering water). Whisk the butter into the chips until melted. Add the espresso and whisk to combine. Remove from heat and set aside. In a large bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and sugar. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine the remaining chocolate chips with the orange juice and set aside. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until soft peaks form. Fold the whites into the reserved chocolate mixture. Fold the egg yolk mixture into the chocolate mixture. Fold the whipped cream into the mixture. Chill the mousse until thickened. Serve with berries.
Soak the beans for a few hours. Boil them for 2 minutes with the garlic cloves. Strain them. Whip the butter and cumin in a bowl. Then add the beans. Mix it all together. Serve it hot.

Cook the sausage on the stove top in a medium size skillet. When done set aside. Add onion and garlic to the skillet and saute for 2 minutes. Add sauerkraut and sausage back to the skillet. Cover and cook for 20 minutes. Uncover and cook until onion is soft. Stir in parsley. Serve on a bun.

Combine shortening and brown sugar in large mixing bowl and beat for 2 minutes at medium speed of electric mixer until fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until well combined. Combine flour and saltgradually add flour mixture and beat until well blended. Stir in vanilla extract and beat well. Stir in oatmeal and date mixturebeat just until blended. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for few minutes on cookie sheet before removing to wire rack. Makes about 36 cookies.

Bring barley to the boil in two cups of water, cook for ten minutes then drain. Meanwhile, cut pepper and sweetcorn in half lengthwiseremove the seeds of the pepper. Mix the barley, pepper, corn, vinegar, oil and parsley together in a large bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least one hour before serving. Taste and adjust seasoning with more vinegar or oil if necessary. Makes four servings.

Bring chicken stock to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, whisk together tahini with water until smooth. Gradually whisk in the oil until combined. In a small bowl, whisk together tahini with yogurt until smoothset aside. In a large bowl, stir together the couscous with the stock, oil mixture, tahini mixture, tomatoes, capers, and lemon juice until well combinedseason with salt and pepper. Stir in the tuna until combined. Serve immediately or cover and chill until ready to serve. Serve tuna tahini salad topped with scallions and parsley, if desired.

Beat sugar and eggs together. Add vanilla and beat well. Combine sour cream and flour. Add cream of tartar and beat well. Add sour cream mixture to sugar mixture and beat well. Add baking soda and beat well. Bake in a 15 x 10 x 1 pan at 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours.

Slice cooked chicken into strips. Mix chicken with dried cherries, pecans& chopped green onions. Combine mayonnaise, yogurt, lemon juice& black pepper. Spread mixture on the bottom of the croissant. Top with lettuce leaves.

Slice cinnamon-raisin bread into 3/4-inch thick slices. Soak in coffee creamer for 10 minutes. Arrange bread cubes in 2 1/2-quart casserole dish. In small saucepan, combine caramels and water. Cook and stir over low heat until caramels dissolve. Remove from heat. Pour over bread. In medium bowl, beat eggs and sugar until blended. Stir in vanilla. Pour over bread cubes. Sprinkle with pecans and cinnamon. Cover. Refrigerate for 4 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before serving. Melt butterpour over bread. Serve warm.

Cook ground beef with onions, add tomato paste and cook for about 5 minutes or until done. Add water and bring to a boil. Cook noodles in separate bowl according to package directions. Mix noodles with beef mixture and pour into greased 13x9 pan. Top with parmesan cheese.
Cook macaroni. Drain well. Add chicken and remaining ingredients. Pour into greased casserole dish. Bake at 350 until bubbly and top is browned.

In a pan over medium heat add a drizzle of olive oil followed by 2 slices of streaky bacon. Fry for 3-4 minutes until golden brown then remove from pan with slotted spoon and set aside. Add another drizzle of oil to pan and add garlic clove to fry for 30 seconds then add heavy cream. Next add peas to pan and cook for 3-4 minutes until they just start to soften. Add farfalle pasta and 1 tbsp olive oil to pan and cook for 6 minutes until pasta is tender then add 1 tbsp butter to pan and cook for 1 minute to brown butter then add sage leaves to pan and cook for 30 seconds then add 1 tbsp parmesan cheese to pan and cook for 30 seconds then finally add 1 tbsp more parmesan to pan and stir to combine then add farfalle pasta to pan with bacon, sage leaves, cream, peas and butter and stir to combine. Serve with crusty bread.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place corn flakes in a plastic bag. Pound to break up the flakes. Place in a shallow bowl. Mix flour, seasoning salt and black pepper in a second shallow bowl. Combine the poultry seasoning, eggs and water in a third shallow bowl. Dip chicken strips into flour mix. Then dip into corn flakes and finally into the egg mixture. Place strips onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Bake for 15 minutes or until brown and crispy.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Mix together rhubarb, strawberries, white sugar, butter and egg in large bowl. Stir in 1 cup of flour, mix well. Pour into pie shell and sprinkle with brown sugar. Bake for 30 minutes.

Sprinkle the salad dressing over the romaine lettuce. Place the lettuce on a serving plate with the apple slices on top. Divide the broccoli evenly between the romaine leaves. Then arrange the pecans on top of the broccoli. Finally, sprinkle the golden raisins over the salad. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Mix panko and walnuts together and set aside. Place tomatoes into a food processor and puree until smooth. In a nonstick skillet heat 2 tablespoons of cooking spray and add walnut mixture. Stir until mixture turns golden brown. Add butter and stir until butter is melted. Dip fillets into butter and lay them into a 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle tomato mixture over fillets. Bake for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, place tomatoes into a bowl and stir in lemon juice. Spoon sauce over fillets. Sprinkle panko mixture over tomato mixture. Bake for 25 minutes more.

Preheat oven to 180c/350f/gas 4. Cream together butter and sugar then add eggs. Mix in potatoes, milk and yoghurt until smooth. Fold in flour, spring onion, ham and seasoning until well combined. Spoon into cases (24 large muffins or 12 x 3-inch muffins). Bake for 20-25 minutes (for small muffins) or 35-40 minutes (for large muffins) until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Allow to cool for 5 minutes then remove from cases to cool completely on wire rack before serving.

Make the coffee syrup by adding the raisins, rum, golden caster sugar and black coffee to a small saucepan. Bring to the boil over medium heat, stirring often until it reduces to about 150ml. Remove from the heat and set aside. To make the creams, whisk the ricotta cheese, double cream, caster sugar, rum and vanilla extract until soft peaks form. Spoon the cream into four serving glasses or small glasses, making sure to leave some space at the top of the glasses. Divide the coffee syrup between the glasses so that it just reaches the top of the cream. Top each glass with a piece of dark chocolate. Dust the chocolate with icing sugar and serve.
Mix together all ingredients. Chill for several hours before serving.

Place ribs in 4 or 5 quart slow cooker. Mix bouillon cubes, paprika, caraway seeds and pepper together and sprinkle over ribs. Add bacon and pour the water to cover ribs. Cook on low for 5 to 6 hours. Remove ribs and sauerkraut from the cooker. Keep sauerkraut warm. Mix flour and water to make a paste. Cook on low heat for 10 minutes. Pour sauerkraut over ribs and cover. Cook on low heat for 1 to 1 1/2 hours. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Put onions into a large mixing bowl and pour beer over onions. Cover bowl and chill for at least 30 minutes or overnight. Drain onions from beer mixture and pat dry with paper towels. Combine beer mixture, soy sauce, molasses, rosemary, garlic, worcestershire sauce and steak in a large plastic bag. Seal bag and knead steak to coat evenly in marinade mixture. Refrigerate steaks for 24 hours. Remove steaks from marinade and pat dry with paper towels. Grill steaks on medium heat until desired doneness. Serve steaks hot or at room temperature.

Combine chicken, giardiniera, provolone cheese, parsley and salad dressing. Fill pita pockets with chicken mixture and romaine lettuce. Place pita pockets on a cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 12 minutes.

In a 9x13 pan layer 1/3 of the spinach mixture in the bottom. Then top it with 1/3 of the tortilla and repeat until the pan is full. Cover the pan with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for 4 hours. Before serving remove the plastic wrap and cut the pinwheels into bite size pieces. Serve with vegetables.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Remove brisket from packaging and pat dry with paper towels. Rub brisket with salt and pepper. Cut carrots and celery in half. Trim onions. Slice garlic cloves in half. Place all vegetables in slow cooker. Add brisket. Pour in diced tomatoes and beef broth. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Cover and cook on low for 12 hours or on high for 6 hours. Let cool slightly before slicing.

Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add pralines. Cook 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in eggs. Cool to lukewarm. Add cream cheese. Beat well. Add sugar. Beat until smooth. Add vanilla. Add noodles. Stir until coated. Pour into 10-inch springform pan. Bake at 350 degrees f. 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool completely. Refrigerate. Serve slightly warm.

Brown beef in vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat for 10 minutes or until cooked through. Stir in green peppers and onionscook for 5 minutes or until peppers are tender-crisp. Drain vegetables in a colanderreturn vegetables to skillet. Stir in pasta sauce and oreganobring to a boil over high heat. Boil for 10 minutes or until pasta is tender but firmstir in mozzarella and parmesan cheeses. Drain pasta in a colandertoss with vegetables in skillet. Transfer to an 11- by 7-inch baking dish coated with cooking spraytop with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 375 for 15 minutes or until heated through. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Melt the butter in a pan over medium heat. Add the sugar and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add the marshmallow cream and stir. Add the evaporated milk and the vanilla extract and stir. Stir in the walnuts and the chocolate chips. Pour into a baking pan. Sprinkle a little salt over the top and refrigerate for 24 hours. Cut into squares.
Blend together cream cheese and mayonnaise. Stir in onions and tabasco sauce. Arrange 1 slice each of salami and bread on each of 4 plates. Top each with cream cheese mixture. Serve with crackers.

Mix flour and sugar together. Cut in shortening using pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in enough cold water to make dough ball. Divide dough into two balls and refrigerate for about 1 hour or overnight to make flaky pie dough. To make pie shells, roll out one ball to 1/4 inch thickness and place in pie pan. Cut out excess with floured knife or floured round cutter and trim edges. Roll out second ball to 1/4 inch thickness and place on top of bottom pie shell. Crimp edges with fork. Refrigerate unbaked pie shells for about 1 hour before baking. Fill and bake as directed for each individual recipe or cover and refrigerate for later use.
Cut beef into thin slices. Place in large saucepan. Cover with gravy. Stir until hot. Drain. Pile beef on toasted rolls. Melt butter. Stir in seasonings. Pour over beef. Serve.

Prepare cube steaks according to package directions. Drain and place steaks back into skillet. Add butter and cook over medium heat until butter melts. Add cream and water. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Stir in salt and pepper. Cook and stir until gravy thickens. Transfer steaks to plate. Top with gravy. Top with crushed pork rinds. Serve.

Place all ingredients except margarine into a food processor. Process until smooth. Roll dough into small balls and place on a greased cookie sheet. Press a whole almond into each cookie. Place the cookie sheet with the almonds face down in the freezer for about an hour. Remove from the freezer and gently press each almond into the cookie with a fork. The cookies will not spread out much so do not worry about flattening them too much. These cookies can be made a day ahead and stored in an airtight container. To reheat the cookies, place them on a cookie sheet and bake at degrees F for 7 to 10 minutes.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add orzo and cook for 12 minutes. Drain. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and just beginning to brown. Stir in mushrooms and cook until tender. Remove from heat and stir in the drained orzo. Add the cheese and stir until melted. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat egg and add to butter mixture. Add flour mixture to butter mixture. Mix well. Stir in oatmeal and chocolate. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees f. for 10 to 12 minutes or until cookies are firm and just beginning to brown. Makes about 2 dozen.

Preheat oven to 350f. Prepare italian salad dressing mix according to package directions. Cut chicken into bite-size pieces. Pour dressing into 13 x 9in baking dish. Add chicken. Pour cream of chicken soup and cream cheese over chicken. Cover dish with foil and bake 30 minutes. Uncover and bake 30 more minutes.

Sage Rub for Roast Turkey: Butter 2 small pieces of foil. Place one piece of foil on a work surface. Place turkey breast side down. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon of the rub. Rub firmly into turkey. Place second piece of foil over turkey. Squeeze turkey to remove excess air. Tie turkey legs together with butcher's string. Place turkey in a large roasting pan. Pour in 2 cups of water. Cover pan. Bake until a thermometer inserted in thickest part of thigh reads 170-175 degrees. (Turkey is done when juices run clear when thigh is pierced.) To make a roasting pan brine, combine 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 teaspoon of sugar in a small bowl. Mix in 2 quarts of water. Pour brine in roasting pan. Tuck wings under breast. Bake turkey 1 1/2 hours. Remove foil. Cook until skin is brown. Baste with pan juices every 30 minutes. Baste with pan ju

Put the carrots in a medium saucepan and cover them with water. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook for 5 minutes. Drain well in a colander. Add the carrots to a large bowl and toss with the butter until they are coated. Sprinkle with the brown sugar and stir to coat. Add the rum and nutmeg. Toss to coat. Serve warm.

Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling water for about five minutes, until tender but still firm to the bite. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a skillet and add the garlic and cook for about one minute. Add the mushrooms and cook for another minute until browned. Add the tomato and cook for another minute. Add the shrimp and cook for another minute or so until the shrimp is pink and opaque throughout. Add the artichoke hearts and cook for another minute or so until the artichoke hearts have softened a little bit. Drain the pasta and add it to the pan with the shrimp and the sauce. Toss well and season with salt and pepper. Add the fresh parsley and toss well. Serve immediately with some parmesan cheese if desired.

Sprinkle the chickpeas with the oregano and black pepper. Put the pepper in a baking dish. Top with the chickpeas and tomatoes. Pour over the yogurt. Sprinkle with the olives. Layer the feta on top. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until heated through and the feta is golden brown.
Mix sausage, corn, milk and egg. Pour into a 2 qt casserole. Sprinkle with cracker crumbs and cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly.

Cook the potatoes in the saucepan of salted water until tender. Drain. Melt the butter in the saucepan with the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil. Saute the potatoes until they are golden brown. Transfer to a bowl and mash. Add the sauerkraut to the saucepan. Add the caraway seed to the saucepan. Add the potatoes and the butter mixture back to the saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the sauerkraut is tender. Season with pepper. In a bowl mix sour cream with the vinegar. Add to the sauerkraut. Sprinkle with the kielbasa. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375f. Brown broccoli in butter until slightly tender. Add all ingredients except broccoli in a large bowl. Mix well and pour into 10 inch deep dish pie plate. Bake at 375f for 25 minutes or until brown on top.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 9x13 inch pan. Whisk 4 eggs in a large bowl. Add green and yellow diced peppers, diced onions and sausage. Stir. Spread mixture in the prepared pan. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered for 35 to 40 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve hot with a toasted English muffin.

Salt chicken to taste. Add remaining seasoning to taste. Mix remaining ingredients in small bowl. Brush chicken with salad dressing mixture. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Grill or broil to desired doneness. (Chicken may be cooked on stove top). Serve with lemon wedges.

Add 1 tablespoon of butter to a large pan and cook until melted and foaming. Add the chopped onions and cook until tender and translucent. Add 2 whole green chilies and the fresh ginger and cook until fragrant, about 2 to 3 minutes. Crack the eggs in and mix with the onions until the eggs are cooked through and lightly set around the edges. Add the salt and freshly chopped cilantro. Serve immediately with your favorite breakfast bread or tortillas.

In a food processor or blender combine all ingredients except for peas and onion. Blend on high for 1 minute. Then add the peas and onion and blend until well combined. Serve with tortilla chips or pita wedges.

Brown the beef with water until no longer pink. Stir in ramen noodles. In a large skillet heat the stir-fry sauce to boiling over high heat. Stir the sauce until it is well-blended. Add the stir-fry vegetablescook until tender-crisp about 5 minutes stirring occasionally. Drain the noodles with the sauce from the skillet into the bowl with the beef. Add the vegetables to the bowl of noodlesstir to combine. Serve immediately.

Bring water to boil in a saucepan. Peel potatoes, add to water. Boil 5-8 minutes or until tender. Drain potatoes in colander to drain excess water. Set aside for later use. Add green beans to potatoes in the colander to continue draining excess water. Dice potatoes into small cubes and place in a large bowl. Chop green beans into small pieces and add to potatoes. Add mayonnaise to potatoes and green beans in bowl. Stir in eggs and shallots. Add chopped salmon. Salt and pepper to taste. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving to allow flavors to blend together. Serve cold garnished with chopped scallions or fresh dill.

In a small bowl melt butter and coconut oil together. Stir in vanilla and coffee. Set aside. In another bowl, mix together the dry ingredients. In a third bowl mix the egg yolks. In a fourth bowl whip the egg whites. In a fifth bowl mix the yolk mixture and the cocoa mixture. Fold in the oatmeal mixture. Drop by teaspoonful onto a cookie sheet you have sprayed with non stick spray. Bake according to the package directions.

Slice bread. Rub both sides of bread slices with garlic. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Place bread in pan. Cook for about 2 to 3 minutes each side. Remove bread from pan. Place bread slices on a plate. Rub both sides of bread slices with garlic. Top each bread slice evenly with tomatoes. Top each tomato slice evenly with chopped basil. Sprinkle bread slices evenly with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Make the crust: Press graham cracker crumbs into the bottom of 9 inch springform pan. Bake 10 minutes. Make the filling: In the bowl of a mixer, beat the cream cheese and sugar until smooth. Beat in cool whip. Fold in the pie filling. Spoon the mixture into the crust and chill until firm. Serve with whipped cream.

In a large saucepan mix together half-and-half, milk and granulated sugar. Heat over medium heat until sugar dissolves and mixture boils, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in egg substitute and vanilla extractcool to lukewarm (about 95 degrees F). Freeze mixture in an ice cream maker according to manufacturers instructions. Pour mixture into a shallow container and fold in chocolate chips. Cover and freeze for about 2 hours.

Preheat a 12-inch skillet. Melt butter. Add macaroni and sauté for 3 to 4 minutes. Add onion and bell peppers and sauté for 3 to 4 minutes. Add water and dry mustard and continue cooking for 2 to 3 minutes more. Remove from heat. Stir in cheddar cheese, pimento stuffed olives and roasted red peppers. Transfer to a 1 1/2-quart casserole and top with bread crumbs. Bake in a 350-degree F (175 degrees C) oven for 15 to 20 minutes.

Preheat broiler. Line a small baking dish with foil and spray with non stick cooking spray. Place ravioli in dish and top with sliced fresh mozzarella cheese and fresh tomatoes. Drizzle with a little extra virgin olive oil and sprinkle with fresh basil. Place in the broiler until cheese melts and tomatoes begin to blacken a bit. Serve immediately with additional fresh basil for garnish and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Lightly spray a 9x13 pan with cooking spray. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place tenderloin in the pan and sear both sides in olive oil. Deglaze with wine and add brown gravy mix. Cover and bake 1 hour. Let stand 5 minutes before carving. Serve with vegetable of your choice.

Slice bread lengthwise into 4 to 6 pieces per slice. Mix mayonnaise, milk, egg and season with salt and pepper. Dip bread into mayonnaise mixture. Dip in breadcrumbs until coated with crumbs. In a pan or skillet heat oil until hot over medium heat. Dip bread in oil to coat thoroughly. Cook bread 1 minute per side until golden brown. Serve with tuna salad if desired.

In a large salad bowl or glass container, combine the dressing, salsa, tomato, carrot and beans. Mix well. Layer the lettuce on the bottom of a glass bowl or container. Top with half of the dressing mixture. Layer the cheese, corn tortilla chips, onion, reduced fat cheddar cheese, salsa. Repeat layers until the cheese is at the top. Serve with a toothpick.

Cut sourdough rolls in half. Spread each with about two tablespoons of fig preserves. Place one prosciutto slice on each roll half and top each with half of a brie round. Butter the outsides of the rolls and place on the grill until the bread is toasted and the brie is oozy and hot. Serve immediately.

Mix together all the ingredients and drop by spoonfuls onto parchment paper. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until set. Cool and wrap individually with cellophane or plastic wrap. Store in airtight container.

Place chicken pieces in crock pot and add soy sauce and brown sugar. Cover and cook on low for approximately 6 hours or until chicken is tender and falling off the bone. Transfer chicken to a cutting board and shred with a forkreturn to crock pot. Add garlic and cook until chicken is heated through. Serve over rice and top with sesame seeds.

Heat the oil in a large pan. Add the onion and carrot and cook over a moderate heat for 5 minutes until softened. Add the minced beef and cook for a further 5 minutes until browned. Add the potato and cook for a further 5 minutes until tender. Stir in the beef bouillon cube and season to taste. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add zucchini and sauté until zucchini begins to soften. Add pine nuts and cook until fragrant. Add lemon zest and lemon juice and cook until zest softens. Season with salt and pepper.

Cook water and rice in microwavable bowl according to package directions. Meanwhile, combine beef, onion, water and salsa. Cook 4 minutes. Stir in corn. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in tomatoes. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in quick-cooking rice. Cook 2 minutes. Stir in peas. Cook 2 minutes. Serve over rice.

In a large bowl add self-raising flour and stir in water until combined. Make a well in the middle of the dry ingredients and add the remaining ingredients except the salt and pepper. Knead the dough until smooth and elastic. Place dough on a lightly floured surface and knead in salt and pepper to taste. Roll dough until it is about 2cm thick. Cut dough into small squares and place them on a greased tray or baking tray and sprinkle with parmesan cheese and chives. Bake in the oven at 220 degrees celcius for 25 minutes. Enjoy with tea and jam and cream.

Preheat oven to 425f. Cut tortillas into quarters and brush with olive oil. Sprinkle lightly with salt. Bake for 10 minutes. Make white bean guacamole by adding small white beans and red onion to a food processor. Process until smooth. Add avocado and process. Add jalapeno and cilantro and process until blended. Fold in lime juice. Serve guacamole on warmed tortillas. Sprinkle with cumin.

Soak the rabbit in a sink full of water and salt. Pat the rabbit dry and season with salt and pepper. Roll the rabbit in the flour to coat it. Heat the lard in a large pot over medium heat. Fry the rabbit in batches until it is a rich brown. Remove the rabbit from the pot and place it in a large bowl. Tap the rabbit to remove any excess grease. Sprinkle the rabbit with the breadcrumbs and the beaten egg. Set the rabbit aside and heat the lard in the pot until it is hot. Dip the rabbit in the lard and fry it until it is brown. Set the rabbit aside and repeat with the remaining pieces of rabbit. Arrange the rabbit pieces in the pot. Pour in 1 cup of the stock and bring to a boil. Cover the pot and reduce the heat to a simmer. Braise the rabbit for 40 minutes. Add the remaining cup of stock and the parsley and thyme. Simmer for 20 minutes. Serve the rabbit with the stock.

Preheat oven to 350F. Boil water in a large saucepan and cook pasta until tender. Drain. Meanwhile, brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain fat. Add onion, tomato sauce, salsa and enchilada sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Add drained pasta and sour cream. Stir until combined. Spoon mixture into a baking dish. Top with shredded cheese. Sprinkle with diced green chilies. Cover with foil. Bake 25 minutes. Uncoversprinkle with Tabasco sauce. Bake 5 minutes longer or until heated through.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees f. Heat canola oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add pecan pieces and cook until pecans are golden brown and fragrant, about 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Add brown sugar, maple syrup and salt. Stir well. Pour mixture into a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Bake granola in preheated oven until golden brown and toasted, about 30 minutes. Let cool. Stir in pecan pieces and cooking spray. Store granola in an airtight container.

Bake chicken breasts at 375 degrees for 45 to 50 minutes. Shred or cut chicken into bite sized pieces. Place broccoli in casserole. Pour soup in casserole. Mix chicken with mayo. Spread chicken mixture over soup. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with french fried onions. Bake 5 minutes. Serve.

Heat oil in a soup pot over medium heat. Add onion, garlic cloves and brown rice. Saute until rice turns translucent. Add vegetable broth, lemon juice and split peas. Bring mixture to a boil then reduce heat to low and simmer for 45 minutes or until rice is tender. Add ground cinnamon, cumin, salt and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes more or until rice is softened and split peas are cooked through. Serve hot.

Heat the olive oil in a large saute pan over medium heat. Add the shallots and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Add the wine and reduce for 1 minute. Stir in the beef broth. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in the cornstarch and water. Season with salt and pepper. Cook and stir until thickened. Stir in the tarragon.

Cut out a circular piece from the center of each slice of bread leaving about a 1/2-inch border on all sides. Place the cutout piece on a plate or plate-size piece of wax paper. Place another slice on top of the cutout piece. Top with a slice of cheese. Place a jalapeno or two halves on top of the cheese slice. Sprinkle with taco seasoning mix. Top with a second slice of cheese. Place the sandwiches on the grill for about 3-4 minutes on each side or until cheese is melted. If your sandwiches are too thick to fit on your grill, place them on a grill pan or on a cookie sheet with some foil on it. Sprinkle with salsa. Cut sandwiches diagonally into quarters before serving. Serve with your favorite sides for a tasty appetizer or snack!

Preheat oven to 180c/ gas mark 4. Grease and line a 18cm/7in round cake tin. In a large mixing bowl, beat together the butter and sugar until soft and light. Sift together the cocoa and flour and stir in the baking powder. In a jug, beat together the eggs and milk and gradually add to the butter and sugar mixture. Beat until smooth and well combined. Fold in the coconut and fold in half of the cocoa mixture. Pour into your cake tin and bake for about 45 minutes until risen and a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean. Let it cool in the tin for ten minutes before turning it out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm or cold, accompanied by icecream and a cup of tea. It is also delicious served with a cup of coffee!

Cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from skilletcrumble bacon into large soup pot. Drain off all but about 2 Tbsp of bacon fat from skilletadd onion to skillet. Cook onion for about 3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tenderadd bacon with any accumulated bacon fat back to onion mixturecook for an additional minute. Stir in potatoescover the pot with a lid or aluminium foilplace potato mixture into slow cooker. Cook on high for 3 hoursremove lid from slow cooker and stir mixture well. Pour chicken broth into the potato mixtureadd the cream cheesestir well to combine. Pour 3 cups of the soup into blenderadd the milk, cream of chicken soup, and pepper to the blender. Puree until smoothtransfer the pureed soup to the slow cookerstir to combine. Place the remaining soup into blenderpuree until smoothtransfer the pureed soup to the slow cookerstir to combine. Cook on high for an additional hourserve with crumbled bacon on top.

Boil potatoes until tender, drain and peel, cut potatoes into small chunks, saute garlic in olive oil and add potatoes and shrimp, saute for 3 minutes, add lemon juice and parsley and season to taste with salt and red pepper flakes, serve immediately and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large bowl, stir together flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and flax seeds. In another bowl, beat together yogurt, vegan margarine and vanilla extract. Stir wet mixture into dry mixture. Stir in blueberries. Spoon batter into muffin tins that have been sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until muffins are done. Cool before removing from muffin tins.
Mix all together except pecans. Shape into ball, place pecans around the outside and refrigerate for at least one hour before serving.

In a small bowl combine all the ingredients for salsa butter, then place butter into a small dish. Salt the fillets and place them on a plate. Spoon the salsa butter on top of each filletsprinkle with cumin and lime zest. Grill the fish over medium heat for about 3 minutes on each side or until the fillets are lightly browned on both sides and the fish is flakey. Serve with salsa on the side.

Cut the cucumbers in half and scoop out the seeds and membranes with a small spoon. Wash the cucumbers thoroughly under running water. Place the cucumbers in a colander and let them drain and air dry. Mix the sour cream with the vinegar, dill and salt and pepper to taste. Pour the mixture over the cucumbers and serve.

In a 6-quart heavy pot over moderate heat, heat the oil. Add the onions and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until softened and just turning brown, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the potatoes and enough water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook until just tender when pierced with a skewer. Drain the potatoes in a colander. Add the kale and chorizo to the pot and cook over moderate heat until the kale wilts and the sausage browns. Season the soup with salt and pepper. Transfer the soup to a 4-quart serving bowl and serve.

Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Then place them asparagus on a baking tray. Cut the stems from the asparagus. Place asparagus on baking tray. Add the asparagus to a preheated oven at 400 degrees. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove the tray from the oven. Sprinkle the asparagus with the grated parmesan. Bake for 10 more minutes until asparagus is golden. Serve immediately.

Spread the pesto evenly over one side of each bread slice, leaving 1/4 inch uncoated on the end that will be folded over the peppers. Sprinkle each slice with 1/4 teaspoon salt. Place the peppers on the pesto-coated side of a slice of bread, with the stems facing inward. Place another slice on top of the peppers and spread the cheese evenly over the top slice of bread. Grill or broil the sandwiches until the cheese melts. Fold the bread in half around the peppers and serve immediately.

Cook ground turkey with taco seasoning according to package instructions. Drain fat. Add sour cream, 1 1/2 cups enchilada sauce and 1/2 cup shredded cheese. Mix well. Heat remaining enchilada sauce. Cut tortillas into strips. Spoon about 1/4 cup of mixture down middle of each tortilla. Roll up tortillas. Place in 9 by 13 baking dish. Spoon remaining enchilada sauce over top. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with sour cream on top.

Season salmon fillet with garlic salt and ground black pepper. Dip into egg white and then into breadcrumbs. Set aside. Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Melt butter in a pan or skillet. Add green onions and lemon peel and saute for 2 minutes. Add parmesan cheese and cook for 1 minute more. Place salmon in pan and top with breadcrumbs and thyme leaves. Place pan in oven and cook for 10 minutes or until salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Thinly slice carrot and daikon. Put all ingredients in a jar and shake well. Keep in the fridge.

Wash broccoli and cut off florets. Add the florets and broth into a large pot. Bring to boil over medium heat then reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes or until broccoli is tender but still firm. Meanwhile make a roux by mixing flour and cold water together in a small bowl and stirring well. Stir cornstarch into the roux until it thickens slightly. Add the thickened roux to the broccoli soup mixture and stir well. Add cream of celery soup and milk and heat thoroughly until soup comes to a boil and thickens slightly. Add cheese and stir until cheese melts. Serve hot.

Combine apple cider, apple brandy and orange slices in large saucepan and bring just to boiling point. Remove from heat and add whole spices and orange strips. Let stand for an hour or until infused. Remove spice bag and orange strips and serve hot. Calvados can be found in liquor stores and specialty markets.

Cream the cream cheese and sweetened condensed milk in the bowl of an electric mixer. Stir in the banana cream instant pudding and vanilla pudding. Add the milk and beat for about one minute. Fold in the whipped topping and bananas. Spoon into the prepared dish and top with the wafer crumbs. Refrigerate for at least two hours. Serve chilled.

Cream butter and sugars in a large bowl. Beat in eggs. Stir in vanilla. Sift together flour and baking soda. Add flour mixture and peanut butter to butter mixturebeat until smooth. Stir in marshmallow cream and coconut flakes. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. Bake at 375f for 8 to 10 minutes or until edges are firm. Remove from pan. Cool completely.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking pan. In the bowl of an electric mixer on medium speed, cream the butter and sugars together for 2 minutes. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Reduce the speed to low and beat in the vanilla and baking powder. In a separate bowl stir together the flour and cocoa. Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture alternately with the sour milk. Add the nuts. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 to 40 minutes. Let the brownies cool in the pan for 30 minutes. Remove from the pan and cool completely before cutting.

Remove tomatillos from husks. Place them in a pot with just enough water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat for 10 minutes or until soft when pierced with a fork. Drain tomatillos well. Set aside to cool slightly. Place tomatillos, onion, garlic cloves and jalapeño pepper in a blender with enough water to cover tomatillos. Blend for 30 seconds. Strain mixture through a sieve to remove seeds from onion. Set aside to cool slightly. Add tomatillo mixture to a bowl with lime juice, cilantro leaves, sugar and salt to taste. Mix well to combine and chill for at least 1 hour before serving. This recipe makes enough salsa for 20 servings.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a 9 by 9 inch pan. In a large mixing bowl, combine all the dry ingredients. Make a well in the center of the dry mixture. In a separate bowl mix together the wet mixture (water, oil, and milk). Add the wet mixture to the dry mixture. Mix until combined. Spoon the batter into the prepared pan. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. About 20-30 minutes.

Cut chops in half and pound with mallet or meat pounder to flatten to 1/4 inch thickness. Pound chops with mallet until they are 1/4 inch thick. Sprinkle chops with Catsup to coat sides only. Slice onion thinly. Drain pepper rings in a colander until dry. Mix brown sugar and ground red pepper to make a rub for chopssprinkle mixture on both sides of chops. Sauté chops in olive oil or bacon fat until meat is no longer pink in the centerdrain on paper towels and serve on toasted buns.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile in skillet on medium heat heat olive oil. Add flour and cook until golden. Add milk and cook and stir until thickened. Add cheese and cook stirring until cheese is melted. Stir in half of the pasta and 1 cup of the corn. Place half of the pasta mixture in a 9x13 baking pan. Layer with half of the chilies. Top with remaining pasta mixture. Sprinkle with remaining chilies and 1/2 cup cheese. Bake at 375 for 30 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Wash the carrots and slice thinly. Boil for about 3-5 minutes until tender. Drain and set aside. Mix butter and brown sugar together and coat carrots. Place into 9 x 13 baking dish. Pour dressing mix over top. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Makes 4 servings.
Combine sour cream and cream cheese in a medium-sized mixing bowl. Stir in salsa until fully blended. Top with lettuce and cheddar cheese. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown chicken and broccoli together with oil. Mix cream of chicken soup, mayonnaise and lemon juice. Stir into browned chicken and broccoli mixture and bake for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Stir in curry powder and cheese and bake for 5 more minutes or until cheese melts. Serve with breadcrumbs sprinkled on top.
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and mash potatoes. Add onion and saute until translucent. Stir in potatoes and milk. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add green onion and serve.

In crock pot or slow cooker put in brown sugar, apple cider vinegar water and kielbasa and stir till heated. Add sauerkraut and stir. Cook 4 hours or until sauerkraut is tender. Serve over egg noodles or rice.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line an 8x8-inch baking pan with wax paper. Combine cake mix, egg, butter, and coconut flakes. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts. Spread into prepared pan. Top with sweetened condensed milk. Bake 45-55 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into bars.

Add mint leaves and sugar in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, add white rum and shake well for about one minute until sugar dissolves completely. Then add blood orange juice, ginger ale and shake for about another thirty seconds, pour in a glass full of ice cubes, garnish with a mint leaf on a cocktail stirrer. Serve immediately.

Add all soups together in a baking dish. Mix in chicken, soup mix, salt, pepper and sour cream. Mix well. Crush crackers with your hands over top of mixture until thoroughly combined. Bake in a 350 degree oven for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.

Mix together all the dry ingredients. Add the wet ingredients and mix. Fold in the chocolate chips and rice krispies. Drop by teaspoonful onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes.

Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Salt water. Add pasta. Cook for about 7 minutes. Drain pasta. Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic. Stir until fragrant. Add wine. Cook until liquid is reduced by half. Add parsley. Stir for 1 minute. Add cooked pasta. Stir to coat. Add lemon juice and salt. Cook until heated through. Add shredded chicken. Stir to combine. Stir in parmesan cheese. Add almonds. Stir to combine.
Mix all of the ingredients together. Place meat mixture into a loaf pan. Bake at 350f until fully cooked. Remove from oven and allow to cool before serving.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add leeks. Cook over medium heat until leeks begin to brown. Stir in garlic. Cook for 1 minute. Add wine. Cook until wine is completely absorbed. Stir in tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cook for 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in salt, pepper and dill. Cool completely. Place salmon fillets in a glass dish. Pour sauce over salmon. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight. Bake in 375 degree oven for 40 minutes.

Prepare a crust for each pie according to the package instructions. Divide the cherry pie filling between the crusts. Place 1/3 cup slivered almonds on top of the filling in each pie. Sprinkle each pie with cinnamon and a few drops of lemon juice. Cover the top of the pie with the remaining crusts and seal the edges with the tines of a fork. Bake for about 40 minutes at 375 degrees F until the crust is golden brown.
Cream margarine and brown sugar together in a large bowl. Add coconut. Mix well. Add nuts. Add milk. Mix well. Frost cake with icing.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Grease and flour a loaf pan. In a large bowl combine flour and sugar. Stir in beer and butter. Mix well. Pour into loaf pan. Bake at 400 degrees f. for 45 minutes. Serve with jam.

Stir together hot water and stuffing mix in medium bowl. Add butter and stir until moistened. Stir in pineapple and mix well. Spoon mixture into 4-quart baking dish or large pans to fit turkey. Bake at 325 for about 30-40 minutes or until heated through.
Combine all ingredients in food processor. Blend until combined. Serve with turkey or ham.

Preheat oven to 400f. Slice bell peppers into 1/2 inch thick pieces. Lay on a baking sheet with onion. Drizzle with olive oil. Salt and pepper. Place in oven for 30 minutes or until peppers begin to brown. Slice potato into 1/2 inch thick slices. Place on a baking sheet with peppers. Drizzle with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Place in oven for 30 minutes or until potato begins to brown. Slice sausages into 1/2 inch pieces. Place on baking sheet with peppers. Drizzle with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Place in oven for 30 minutes or until sausages begin to brown.

Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add paprika, cumin and ginger. Cook for 1 minute. Add prawns. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in sea salt. Add coriander just before serving.
Heat grapeseed oil in wok. Stir fry garlic and peppers over high heat until tender. Add baby bok choy and cook until crisp tender. Stir in toasted sesame oil. Serve.

Cut broccoli into spears about an inch long. Steam over boiling water about 4 minutes or until tender crisp. Drain well and add to a bowl with the garlic and drizzle the olive oil over the spears and toss until coated and well mixed. Add the lemon juice and black pepper and toss again. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve and enjoy!

Heat extra virgin olive oil in large saucepan over medium heatadd onion and garlicsauté until onion is translucent. Add crushed tomatoes with juices, diced tomatoes with juices, carrot, sweet Italian sausage, and thyme leavesbring mixture to a boilreduce heatsimmer for 40 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickenedremove thyme leaves from pan. Makes about 8 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line muffin tin with paper liners. Mix cookie crumbs and chocolate chips together and set aside. Mix cake mix according to package directions and bake according to package directions. Allow to cool completely before frosting. Frost cupcakes and place gummy worms on top of each cupcake.

Place steak flat side down over a strip of plastic wrap and season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Sprinkle thyme and garlic over top and drizzle with olive oil. Wrap steak well and refrigerate for at least 8 hours and up to overnight. Preheat grill to high. Remove steak from refrigerator and let stand at room temperature for at least 30 minutes. Remove plastic wrap and place steak flat side down over a strip of foil and grill for 5 minutes or until seared and cooked to your liking. Transfer steak to platter and allow to rest for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, zest and juice lemon and mix with extra virgin olive oil. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Drizzle over steak. Serve with crusty bread and a simple green salad with vinaigrette dressing.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Lightly brush pork chops with lemon pepper. In 9-inch round baking dish, mix together cider vinegar and lemon marmalade. Place pork chops in baking dish. Pour 1/2 cup marmalade mixture over pork chops. Roast for 15-20 minutes or until chops are done. Remove pork chops from marmalade mixture. Serve immediately with lemon wedge. Enjoy.

Mix together chili powder and remaining seasoningsrub on both sides of pork chops. Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add pork chops and cook until browned on both sides and pork is no longer pink insidedrain. Add onion and cook until tender. Add green beans and remaining seasoningheat through. Sprinkle with fresh lemon juice just before servingserve with steamed rice and hot biscuits.

Fry bacon in a large skillet until it is crisp. Remove from the heat and drain it on paper towels. Slice the bacon into thin strips and set it aside. Brown steak in the bacon grease until it is no longer pink inside. Remove steak from the skillet and drain the grease into a bowl. Put the beef bouillon cubes in the same skillet and add enough water to cover the beef. Bring it to a boil and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients except the mustard and stir until the mustard is dissolved. Place the steak in the center of the cabbage leaf and roll it up like a cigar. Place each roll in a 9x13 baking dish and pour the meat broth over the rolls in the dish. Cover the dish and simmer the rouladen for about 15 minutes or until the beef is done.

Crack eggs into a medium bowl. Whisk with a fork until blended and frothy. Add milk and whisk until combined. Sprinkle with salt, then whisk again until salt is dissolved. Add 1/2 cup of bread cubes to bowl and whisk to coat. Dip bread in egg mixture until coated on both sides. Place in a skillet coated with olive oil spray over medium-high heat. Cook until golden brown on both sides, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and set on a wire rack to cool slightly. Top with remaining 1/2 cup of bread cubes and remaining 2 Tbsp of Muenster cheese. Heat skillet over medium-high heat. Once skillet is hot, place French toast in skillet. Cook until golden brown on both sides (about 2 minutes per side). Transfer to a plate and let cool slightly. Serve immediately with maple syrup if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Melt butter and unsweetened chocolate together over medium heat in a medium saucepan. Whisk in sugar and cocoa powder. Bring to a boil for 3 minutes. Whisk in heavy cream and vanilla extract. Boil for 1 minute. Serve hot.

Sauté onions and jalapeños until softened. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add oil and soy sauce. Cook for another minute or so. Add rice vinegar and brown sugar. Stir and remove from heat. Let cool then refrigerate. Serve cold.
Mix blueberry muffin mix with vanilla extract, cranberry juice, cinnamon and coconut together. Spoon mixture into 2 cans or 9 x 5 x 3 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 55 minutes. Cool.

Combine rice vinegar, canola oil, honey and wasabi paste in a small bowl. Add salt and garlic and whisk together. Add edamame. Stir to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Combine green onion and cabbage and add to edamame mixture. Add cooked chicken. Toss to combine. Serve chilled.

Blend together the flour with the whole wheat flour, natural bran, sugar and baking soda in large bowl. Mix the sour milk in another large bowl. Add the oil to the sour milk. Combine the oil-milk mixture with the flour mixture. Beat the mixture with a wooden spoon until smooth. Knead the dough well in the bowl. Grease 1 large bread pan. Turn the dough out onto floured surface. Knead the dough for 5 minutes. Shape the dough into a ball. Place the dough in the greased bread pan. Cover the bread pan with plastic wrap. Let the dough rise until doubled in size. Place the pan in the oven. Bake at 350f for 1 hour. Turn the bread out onto wire rack. Cool thoroughly before slicing.

Cook rice according to package directions. Drain and cool slightly. In a skillet over medium heat, cook and stir beef and green onions in oil until beef is no longer pinkdrain fat. Stir in rice and soy sauce. Cook and stir over medium heat for 10 minutes or until heated through. Transfer to a bowlcool completely. Cut eggs into thin slicesadd to rice mixturegently stir in carrots. Spoon into a baking dishsprinkle with cheese and bread crumbsbake at 400° for 10 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Serve with your favorite hot sauce or ketchup.

Spread butter on one side of each slice of breadsprinkle with blue cheese and Havarti cheese on top. Place another slice of bread on top and press down so that all sides are completely covered with cheese and butter. Preheat grill over medium-high heat for about five minutes and brush with oil (optional). Grill sandwiches for about five minutes on each side. Slice pears and arrange on bottom half of each sandwich. Garnish with salad greens.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix flour, oats, brown sugar and butter together in a bowl with a wooden spoon. Add almond extract and stir in. Press half of this dough into a lightly greased 13x9" pan. Mix together pineapple preserves and remaining dough into a bowl. Spread over first layer and top with almond slices. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Let cool for 5 minutes before cutting into bars.

Microwave the sweetened condensed milk for 2 minutes (make sure it is not too hot). Stir with a spoon until it is smooth. Add the chocolate chips and stir with a spoon until it is smooth again. Stir in the walnuts (optional). Pour into a 9x13 pan and let it set for at least 2 hours before cutting it into squares or bars. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for about a week.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Add onion. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until tender. Add green bell pepper. Cook 5 to 7 minutes or until tender. Add tomato sauce. Cook 5 to 7 minutes or until thickened. Add beans. Cook 3 to 4 minutes or until warmed through. Remove from heat. Place bell peppers in an 11x7x2 baking pan. Fill each pepper with 1/3 cup bean mixture. Top with 1/4 cup shredded cheese. Bake for 25 minutes or until peppers are tender and cheese is melted.

Bring water to a boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Gradually add oats, stirring constantly. Reduce heat to lowsimmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, for 15 to 20 minutes. Add brown sugar. Stir in milk. Cook, uncovered, stirring frequently for 15 minutes longer or until the porridge is thickened. Serve hot.

In large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Saute onions, garlic and mushrooms for 3 minutes or until tender. Add bell peppers and saute for 2 minutes. Add tomato sauce, broth and thyme leaves. Bring to boil then reduce heat to low. Add eggplant and simmer for 10 minutes or until eggplant is tender. Add brown rice and stir to coat in liquid. Cook for 20 minutes or until rice is tender. Serve warm.

Wash and dry the tomatoes. Place tomatoes on a rimmed baking sheet. Drizzle with cooking spray and sprinkle with sea salt. Bake until the tomatoes are tender and have broken up into large chunks, about 45 minutes. Meanwhile, whisk together the vinegar and oil. Season to taste with mustard and pepper. Place tomatoes and herbs into a large bowl and toss them well. Drizzle the vinaigrette over the salad and toss. Top the salad with the feta and serve.

Cook and crumble beef. Drain well and add beef gravy and all other ingredients. Simmer for one hour. Remove biscuits from refrigerator and unwrap them. Bake according to package instructions. Place biscuit on each plate and top with stew and serve.

In a large pot of boiling water, boil linguine for about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, heat a large skillet with olive oil. Add garlic clove and sauté until fragrant. Add tomatoes, feta cheese, black olives and fresh basil. Cook until the tomatoes soften. Drain linguine. Add pasta to tomato mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss well. Garnish with fresh ground pepper. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease an 8x8 inch baking dish. Melt butter and brown sugars in a saucepan over medium heat. When the mixture has bubbled up and turned amber in color, remove from heat and stir in pecans. Place noodles in a large bowl and cover with cold water. Set aside. Beat eggs in a large bowl with a whisk. Add brown butter mixture and stir until smooth. Add flour and stir until smooth. Remove noodles from water and drain. Add noodles to brown butter mixture and stir gently until noodles are well coated. Pour mixture into prepared baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Cool and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Unroll hash browns. Cut into one-inch squares. Lay squares in a lightly greased 2-quart baking dish. Arrange ham in single layer over hash browns. Cut broccoli florets into halves. Arrange broccoli over ham. Cut cubes of cheese to fit pan. Arrange over broccoli. In a bowl, combine mushroom soup, sour cream and pepper. Pour over top. Sprinkle corn flakes over top. Pour butter over top. Bake uncovered for one hour.

Boil potatoes in a pot of water until soft (about 25 minutes). Peel potatoes and place in a food processor or blender. Add the shallot and garlic clove and rosemary. Process until smooth and creamy. Transfer mixture into a medium sized pot. Add the olive oil and margarine and heat on medium heat until warm (do not boil). Add the milk and process until creamy (about 4 minutes). Add the salt and black pepper and process until smooth and creamy (about 4 minutes). Serve immediately or store in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.

Peel potatoes and boil in a pot of water. Cook until tender and set aside. Melt the butter in a skillet and cook the potatoes until lightly browned. Remove the potatoes from the pan and place in a baking dish. Crack the eggs into the skillet and cook until whites are set and yolks are soft. Stir the eggs until blended and fold into the potatoes. Sprinkle with cheese and season with salt and pepper. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes until cheese is melted and lightly browned.
Combine the venison, water, bay leaf and onion in a Dutch oven. Bring to the boil. Simmer until tender. Add thyme and red wine. Simmer until tender and sauce thickens. Serve with cooked rice.

Put cold water and sugar into a pan and stir over low heat until the sugar has dissolved and the water is just simmering. Add the cinnamon stick and the nutmeg and remove from the heat. Add the peaches and the Drambuie and leave to soak for at least 30 minutes and up to 3 hours.

In a large skillet melt butter and saute chicken breasts in butter for 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from pan and keep warm. Add flour to pan and whisk for 1 minute. Add chicken broth and whisk for 1 minute. Add half-and-half and whisk. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Add dijon mustard and whisk. Add tomatoes and tomato paste. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add parsley and capers. Simmer 5 minutes more. Return chicken to pan. Simmer 5 minutes more. Add peas. Simmer 2 minutes more. Serve with pasta.

Thinly slice steaks. Combine all other ingredients. Pour marinade over steaks. Place in refrigerator for 1 hour. Grill steaks over medium heat. Broil for about 10 minutes. Serve with rice and vegetables.
Roll out dough to fit pizza stone or baking sheet. Spread pesto sauce over crust. Layer shrimp and goat cheese. Top with red pepper flakes. Bake for 15-20 minutes in preheated 375 degree oven.

Preheat grill or broil. Place salmon in a 13 x 9 inch baking dish and rub both sides with butter. Sprinkle with garlic salt and brown sugar. Broil or grill salmon 5 to 6 minutes per side or until done. Serve with red onions.

Brown rice according to package directions. Rinse rice well and then soak in water until rice is soft. Drain rice and put in a saucepan. Add scallion and parsley. Bring to a low simmer and cook until rice is tender. Add tofu and soymilk. Cook on low heat until tofu is soft and mixture is smooth. Cool slightly. Add herbs and hot sauce and mix. Pour into unbaked pie shell and chill.
Mash banana with egg whites. Mix in dates, rolled oats and cocoa powder. Spread out onto a cookie sheet. Cook in preheated oven at 375 degrees Fahrenheit for 30 minutes.

Brown bacon in large skillet. Cut meat into 1 inch cubes. Add meat to skillet along with onions. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Add carrots, potatoes, garlic salt and pepper. Cook until tender. Serve.

Remove neck and giblets. Rinse inside cavity with water, pat dry with paper towels. Cut off wing tips and discardset aside wings for later use. Cut down length of backbone with kitchen shearsset aside backbone for later use. Using a sharp knife, cut off and discard any excess fat on outside of the cavity. Place chicken on a cutting board with its breast side facing upwards. Make a shallow slit down length of backbone about 1/8-inch deep to prevent bones from curling up during cooking. Stuff cavity with thyme sprigs, rosemary sprigs, sage leaves, parsley sprigs, salt and a lemon quarter. Tie legs together with kitchen string. Place carrots, onion and celery into bottom of a 6-quart slow cooker. Place whole chicken on top of vegetables. Pour wine over top of chicken. Cover slow cooker and cook on low heat setting for 6-7 hours or until juices run clear when thickest part of a thigh is pierced with a fork. Place cooked chicken on a platter with

Melt butter and saute onions and mushrooms in butter and flour until tender, about 10 minutes. Season veal with salt and flour and brown on all sides in butter. Add wine and cook until evaporated, about 1 minute. Add onions and mushrooms and cook for another minute. Add cream and simmer until thickened, about 2 minutes. Serve over cooked rice or pasta with Au Jus sauce poured over top.
Mix all together and refrigerate. Serve cold.

In a large bowl combine soup mix with cream cheese. Blend in 1/2 cup of milk. Stir in mozzarella cheese. On a lightly floured surface roll out pizza dough to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut dough into squares about 6 inches long by 2 inches wide. Spread each square with 2 tablespoons of cheese mixture. Roll up dough starting from the wide end of dough and pinching seam to seal. Place seam side down on a cookie sheet or on a piece of aluminum foil to prevent sticking to cookie sheet. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with ranch dressing.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, saute onion and salt in butter until tender and onion is soft, about 5 minutes. Add soup and bring to a boil. Add chicken and cook until done (about 15 minutes). Remove chicken and set aside to cool. In a large bowl, whisk milk and flour together until blended. Whisk in half and half until blended. Stir in cheese and parsley. Add to chicken mixture with the noodles and cook over low heat until sauce thickens (about 5 minutes).

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large pan saute the onions with 1 tablespoon of oil until tenderadd apple slices and saute 3 minutes. Mix in granny smith apple juice, condensed french onion soup, caraway seed, brown sugar, paprika, black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon of salt & 2 tablespoons oilsaute 5 minutes more. Remove pan from heatstir in sauerkraut. Arrange pork chops on a foil-lined large baking sheetsprinkle with remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Top each with a generous dollop of apple mixture. Bake 20-25 minutes or until pork is donecut into chops to serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Unroll refrigerated biscuits. Spread with pizza sauce. Sprinkle with cheese. Roll upplace seam-side down on lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake 10 to 15 minutes. Serve with butter.
Mix all the dry ingredients together. Add the remaining ingredients and mix. Spread mixture on a baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

Melt butter and brown sugar together over low heat until butter is completely melted and sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and add evaporated milk and mix well. Pour into a lightly greased 9 x 13 pan and spread evenly. Bake at 375 degrees F for 18-20 minutes or until set. Cool completely. Mix together chocolate chips and miniature marshmallows and spread evenly over fudge. Sprinkle with walnuts and drizzle with chocolate syrup and vanilla extract. Allow fudge to cool completely before cutting into squares.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a bowl mix together the eggs, canola oil, sugar-free syrup, water and vanilla until well blended. In a separate bowl mix together the flax seeds, baking soda and baking powder until well blended. Add the flax mixture to the egg mixture and mix well. Add the cinnamon and salt and mix well. In a 12 cup greased muffin pan (or 4 small loaf pans) pour the batter into the pan and bake at 350 degrees F for 25 minutes or until done.

Place flank steaks in a large non-reactive dish. Pour in chicken bouillon and soy sauce. Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in refrigerator overnight. Preheat grill to medium-low. Cook meat 2 to 3 minutes per side or until no longer pink inside. Slice beef against the grain. Serve with chopsticks or toothpicks. Dip in honey sauce. Honey sauce: Mix all ingredients in medium saucepan. Simmer and whisk until smooth. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 13 x 9-inch baking pan. In medium bowl, mix brownie mix with water and eggs. Spread batter into prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool completely. In a medium bowl, mix cookie mix with butter. Spread cookie dough over cooled brownie. Cool completely. In a medium bowl, mix frosting with enough milk to make spreadable. Spread frosting over cookie dough. Let set. Cut into 16 bars.

Stir together flour, baking powder and salt in a large bowl. Beat butter and sugar in a large bowl until creamy. Add eggs and vanillabeat well. Stir in flour mixturebeat until blended. Pour into a lightly greased 9x13x2-inch baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely in the pan before slicing into bars or squares. (from allrecipes.com)

In a large saucepan on medium heat add olive oil and saute onions until soft. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add tomato juice and bring to a boil. Add tomatoes and basil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20-30 minutes. Puree soup in a blender or food processor. Pour pureed soup into a saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20-30 minutes. Stir in heavy whipping cream and allow it to simmer for 20 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in Parmesan cheese and allow it to melt. Serve warm.

Mix together salt, sugar and water and bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir until sugar is completely dissolved and let cool until warm to the touch. Combine warm coffee brine with mustard seeds, coriander seeds and peppercorns and stir until well mixed. Place the chicken breasts in a large zip-top bag and pour over the warm brine mixture. Place in refrigerator for 24 hours. Remove chicken from brine and pat dry with paper towels. Heat 1 tbsp oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until shimmeryadd chicken and cook 4-6 minutes per side or until browned on both sides. Drizzle with remaining oil and season with salt and pepper to tastecook 2-3 minutes more or until cooked through. Serve immediately with a side of rice or mashed potatoes and a green vegetable such as broccoli or asparagus.

1. In medium saucepan bring water to boil over high heat and add asparagus spearsboil until spears are tender and easily pierced with tip of knife. Drain and cool 30 min. 2. In food processor blend together cream cheese and chives and onions until smoothseason with salt and pepper to taste. 3. Spread each asparagus spear with cream cheese mixture and top with roast beef slices. Roll each asparagus spear into a tight roll and secure with a toothpick. 4. Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heatadd asparagus roll ups and cook 1 min. Turn roll ups over and cook 1 min longer or until browned and heated through. 5. Sprinkle with prepared horseradishserve immediately.

Dice pork roast into 1-inch cubes and place in a large crock pot or dutch oven with all other ingredients except hominy. Cook on low for 7-8 hours or until pork falls apart easily with a fork. Add hominy 30 minutes before serving and continue cooking until hominy is tender. Serve with toppings of your choice such as sliced avocado and chopped cilantro.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease an 8x8 inch pan. Mix sugar and honey in a large pot. Add butter and corn flakes and mix well. Press into pan. Place in refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Mix almonds and glace cherries into corn flake mixture. Melt chocolate and drizzle over the top. Let cool and cut into pieces.

Boil the potatoes until tender. Drain and cool slightly. Peel the eggs and cut into halves lengthwise. Remove the yolks and discard them. Set aside the whites for another use or for another recipe. Dice the eggs into very small pieces. Cube the cooled potatoes into one-inch pieces. Combine the chopped eggs with the mayonnaise and the finely chopped onion. Season with salt and pepper to taste and stir well to blend. Stir the mayonnaise mixture into the cooled potatoes until they are coated thoroughly. Then add the finely chopped parsley. Mix thoroughly again to distribute the parsley evenly throughout the salad. Serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve. If you are going to refrigerate the salad for later use, stir the parsley into the salad before covering with plastic wrap or a lid. This will keep the parsley from sinking to the bottom of the salad and will assure that every bite will have a little bit of parsley for flavor.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place peaches in a baking dish. Sprinkle cinnamon and brown sugar over peachestoss to coat. Bake 15 minutes or until peaches are tender. Meanwhile, stir together crumb cake mix and butter in a bowl until crumbly. Sprinkle over peachestoss to coat. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9 x 13 baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. In a large skillet melt the butter and saute the zucchini until tender. In a bowl, combine the light sour cream and the parmesan cheese. Pour over zucchini. Sprinkle with salt and fresh ground pepper. Bake for 25 minutes or until the cheese is melted.

Combine mashed potatoes with sour cream, cream cheese, chives, bacon, pepper, salt, cheddar cheese. Stir until well blended. Spoon mixture into an 8 x 8 greased dish. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into squares. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until brown.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Saute onions until golden brown. Add mushrooms. Stir in soup mixture, milk and soy sauce. Cook until heated through. Stir in cheese until melted. Serve on top of bread.

Make the cake according to the box directions. Cut the cake into 1 inch cubes. Make the topping mix according to the box directions. Put the yogurt in a large bowl. Fold in the cake cubes. Toss the strawberries and kiwi in a bowl. Fold into the cake mixture. Top each serving with a dollop of whipped cream. Garnish with slivered almonds.

Mix flour, baking soda and salt in large bowl. In another bowl, cream butter and sugars until smooth. Add eggs and beat well. Stir flour mixture into butter mixture just until combined (do not overbeat). Stir in vanilla and nuts. Shape dough into two logs (24 inches long) on ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten logs with palm of hand. Bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until edges are set (do not overbake). Remove from cookie sheet and cool on wire rack 5 minutes. Cut logs diagonally into 1/4-inch-thick slicesplace on wire rack and cool completely. Store in tightly covered container up to one week in refrigerator or up to one month in freezer.

Beat sugar and eggs together until thick and lemon colored (about 5 minutes). Beat in flour, baking soda and vanilla. Stir in nuts or raisins (optional) and pineapple. Pour batter into a greased 12x9x2-inch baking dish or 2 8x4x2-inch baking pans. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 50-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes then remove from pan. Cool completely before frosting. Cut into 24 squares (12x12x1 1/2-inch). Frost with your favorite frosting recipe. Store tightly covered in refrigerator.
Spread light mayonnaise on one side of bread. Spread mustard on other side of bread. Spread liquid honey on one side of bread. Layer ham and apple on sandwich. Top with cheddar cheese.
Combine all ingredients in saucepan on low heat. Stir often. Cook until thickened. Pour into greased pan to cool. When cool remove from pan.

Add onions and butter to sauce pan over medium heat and cook until onions are translucent. Add mushrooms and cook for about five minutes until mushrooms are tender. Stir in rice and cook for about five minutes until the rice begins to brown slightly around the edges and is lightly toasted. Add water and bring to a boil and simmer for five minutes until rice is tender. Stir in consomme and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for five minutes. Add the parsley and garlic powder and serve immediately.

Cut beef into 1/2 in. Thick pieces. Slice bacon into strips. In a skillet brown the beef in a little oil over medium heat. Drain. Stir in the cream of mushroom soup. Bring to a boil. Stir in the bacon and mushrooms. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes. Stir in the beef. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with grated Swiss cheese. Simmer over low heat until the cheese is melted. Serve with a toothpick.

Prepare your favorite mocha drink. Puree the chocolate frozen yogurt in a blender with 1/2 cup of the hot water. Add this to the mocha drink. Fill glasses with ice cubes and top up with the remaining hot water. Pour in the soda water and serve.

Boil potatoes until soft. In a large skillet, saute broccoli with butter and salt for about 5 minutes. Drain broccoli. In the same skillet, saute garlic and onion until tender. Add broccoli to the skillet and cook for another minute. Transfer broccoli mixture to a blender and purée. Return mixture to the skillet and add chicken broth and parmesan cheese. Stir over medium heat until heated through and thickened. Season with black pepper. Mash with a fork. Fold in cheese. Serve immediately.
Boil all herbs except orange and lemon in water for about 10 minutes. Remove herbs. Add juice and honey to taste. Chill and serve.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Peel potatoes and cut into 2-inch pieces. Boil potatoes until tender. Drain potatoes. Melt butter. Add potatoes and seasonings. Bake until golden brown.
Puree garlic cloves with 1/2 cup olive oil until smooth. Stir in remaining olive oil and remaining ingredientsseason with salt and pepper to taste. Chill until ready to use.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Heat olive oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add shallots and cook 5 minutes. Add garlic and thyme and cook 3 minutes. Add mussels and cook 5 minutes. Add half-and-half, stirring until heated through. Sprinkle with parsley and serve with bread.

Combine wine, olive oil, brown sugar, ground ginger, oregano and garlic in a medium bowl and season with salt and pepper. Place chicken in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade over chicken. Seal bag and turn to coat. Refrigerate for 4 hours. Drain excess marinade. Place chicken in a shallow roasting pan and cook for 30-35 minutes or until a meat thermometer reads 165 degrees f. Remove from the oven. Serve with rice.

Heat oil in medium saucepan over medium heat. Add cooked chicken, onion, garlic cloves, tomatoes with juice, green chilies, cumin seed, salt and black pepper. Cook until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in waterbring to boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer 15 minutes or until thickened. Stir in cilantrolet stand 5 minutes before serving.

Cut the jalapenos in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds from the jalapenos. Chop the jalapenos. Combine the jalapenos with the neufchatel cheese. Place the jalapenos in a plastic bag. Squeeze out the air from the bag. Add the cheddar cheese. Seal the bag. Refrigerate overnight. Cut the green tops off the jalapenos. Cut each jalapeno in half. Put the jalapenos in a small bowl. Add the chopped green onions. Drain the jalapenos. Arrange the jalapenos in a single layer in a glass dish. Refrigerate for 2-3 hours. Serve.

In a shallow dish combine the artichoke hearts and parmesan cheese. In another shallow dish, stir together mayonnaise, garlic powder and salt and pepper. Dip each chicken breast half into the mayonnaise mixture then into the artichoke mixture. Bake covered for about an hour at 300 degrees.

Preheat oven to 325f degrees. Melt 1 cup of the chocolate chips. In a small bowl, combine 1 cup of mini marshmallow and 1/4 cup of cinnamon. Place one biscuit on each half of two plates. Spoon 1/2 teaspoon melted chocolate onto each biscuit and top each with 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon/marshmallow mixture. Place one kiss on each biscuit. Top with another biscuit. Repeat with remaining biscuits. Makes 8-12.
Sauté garlic in oil until golden. Add shrimp. Cook until shrimp is pink. Add hot sauce and cook until sauce is thickened. Serve with rice.

Combine coriander with spring onions and breadcrumbs in a bowl. Mix eggs into mixture. Add fish and prawns and season with salt and pepper. Form into 10 cakes and place into a large bowl with the vegetable oil. Add beaten eggs and coat cakes in a thin layer of oil. Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Cook cakes 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Serve hot with sweet chili sauce or mango chutney.

Cook bacon in a medium skillet over medium heat until crispy. Drain on a paper towel. Reserve 1 tablespoon bacon fat in skilletadd onion and sauté until tender but not brown. Add reserved bacon fat to onion mixture along with tomato paste. Cook for 1 minute. Add tomatoes with their liquidcook until reduced by half. Whisk in cream and bring to a simmerremove from heat. Stir in pasta and cook until al dentedrain well in a colander. Stir in basilseason with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with grated cheese and serve immediately.

Put the beef and onion soup mix in a bowl and mix until well combined. Beat eggs and add to the meat mixture. Mix in the mustard and mayonnaise. Add salt and pepper to taste. Spoon the mixture into a 9 x 13 pan. Cover with the pickle slices and the cheese. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 350 degrees F. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting.
Layer the fruit in the glass bowl, first apples and bananas, then papayas. Crumble the yogurt on top of the papayas then the bananas, apples, walnuts and coconut. Sprinkle with honey if desired.

Cut cucumbers in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds. Chop onion and set aside. Combine half-and-half with sour cream, vinegar and saltstir well. Pour over cucumbers and onionmix lightly. Refrigerate covered 2 hours or more before serving. Garnish with parsley if desired.

Heat oil and garlic and saute for about two minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook for another two minutes or so until the tomatoes begin to soften.
