Add the beans and the tomato paste and cook for another five minutes or so until the beans are tender but not mushy and the tomato sauce has thickened a bit. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with parsley and serve warm or at room temperature with sliced bread or pita bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10 inch round cake pan or a bundt pan (you can make a bundt cake or a sheet cake with this recipe). Sift together the cake mix, sugar, flour, baking powder and salt into a large mixing bowl. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients. In a smaller bowl, whisk together the eggs, water, almond extract and Frangelico until combined well. Pour the wet mixture into the well of the dry mixture and stir until just combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 45-50 minutes until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool the cake completely on a wire rack. Make the frosting. Beat the heavy cream until it starts to thicken and then add the powdered sugar until the frosting is smooth and spreadable. Frost the cake with the frosting of your choice. Sprinkle the coconut on top of the frosting.

Heat a small amount of extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chopped shallot and chopped garlic cloves. Saute for 5 minutes. Add roma tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 15 minutes. Drain. Place pasta into a pot of boiling water. Cook for 4 minutes. Drain. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chicken breasts and cook until done. Remove from pan. Add tomato sauce to skillet. Stir to incorporate. Reduce heat to a simmer. Add cooked pasta and chicken. Add parmesan cheese. Toss. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400f. Cut the white bread into cubes. In a large bowl mix the milk with the chocolate chips. Melt the butter in a nonstick skillet. Stir in the sugar and add to the bowl. Add the bread cubes. In a medium bowl beat the eggs with the vanilla and cinnamon. Add this to the bowl with the other ingredients. Pour the mixture into a 2 qt. baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool slightly before serving.

Mix all ingredients together except for the hot dogs and heat for approximately 2 minutes. Add hot dogs to hot sauce mixture and cook for approximately 5 more minutes. Serve hot dogs in toasted hot dog rolls.

Place steaks into crock pot. Sprinkle generously with salt, garlic powder and black pepper. Place prepared stuffing on top of the steaks. Pour cream of mushroom soup over stuffing and steaks. Pour dry onion soup mix on top of soup. Cover crock pot. Cook on low heat for 8 hours.

Take a glassful of cold milk. Pour boiling water over it. Stir with a spoon till it dissolves completely. Pour this milk mixture in a large bowl and add ice cubes. Stir well. Pour in the instant coffee powder and stir till dissolved. Add cream and sugar to taste and serve immediately.

In large mixing bowl, beat shortening until light and fluffy. Add eggs and beat until blended. Stir in sugar. Add flour, cocoa, salt and cinnamon. Stir in vanilla and milk. Stir in nuts. Pour batter into pre-sprayed waffle iron. Cook as directed. Serve warm with whipped topping.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spread butter in 12-inch square baking pan. Spread pecans evenly over butter. Place caramel ice cream topping evenly over pecans. Roll crescent rolls in caramel sauce until completely covered. Place in baking pan. Bake until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Makes 12 rolls. Serve warm. Store in refrigerator.

Wash cranberries, raspberries & figs in cold water. Drain well in a colander. Combine in a large saucepan with raisins & raw sugar. Add lemon juice & cider. Cook on low heat until berries are tender. Add apple cider & lemon juice & cook on low heat until berries are tender. Remove from heat & cool slightly. Add walnuts. Taste & adjust seasonings. Serve warm or chilled.

Combine rhubarb, onion and brown sugar in large saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and cool to lukewarm. Stir in remaining ingredients. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Makes 2 1/2 cups.

Cut ribs into individual pieces. Combine tomato sauce, liquid smoke and splenda granular and stir. Heat a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat and add enough oil to coat bottom of pan. Add onion and cook for 5-6 minutes until tender. Add ribs and cook for about 5 minutes per side. Transfer ribs to a plate or bowl. Add remaining tomato sauce mixture to pan and bring to a simmer. Add ribs back to pan and simmer for 5-6 minutes.

In a large pot over medium heat, heat vegetable oil. Add tenderloins to pan. Cook meat until brown on both sides (about 5 minutes per side). Transfer meat to slow cooker and set aside. Add onion to pan. Cook onion for about 5 minutes until softened. Add garlic clove to pan. Cook garlic for about 1 minute. Add broth to pan and scrape up any brown bits that have formed on bottom of pan. Add chili powder to pan and stir. Add chili powder to slow cooker with meat. Add chili tomatoes to slow cooker along with tomatoes. Cook on low setting for about 4 hours or on high setting for about 2 hours. Add black beans to slow cooker along with chicken broth. Cook on low setting for about 2 hours or on high setting for about 1 hour. Add beans to slow cooker along with chicken broth. Cook on low setting for about 2 hours or on high setting for about 1 hour. Add remaining beans to slow cooker along with chicken broth. Cook on low setting for about 2 hours or on high setting for about 1 hour.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook 4 minutes per side or until done. Pour dressing over the top. Add the tomatoes and cook 2 minutes or until heated through.

Add all ingredients into a large pot and bring it to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender. Remove from heat. Stir in fresh ground black pepper. Let cool for about an hour. Serve over hot rice. Or serve cold for a light lunch.

Microwave margarine in a 1 1/2-quart microwave-safe bowl for 15 seconds at 50 percent power. Stir in brown sugarcook at 50 percent power for 1 minute, stirring after 30 seconds. Add corn syrupcook at 50 percent power for 2 minutes or until lightly caramelized. Remove from microwavestir in cocoa. Stir in puffed wheat cerealmix well. Drop by rounded tablespoonful onto ungreased cookie sheetsflatten slightly. Bake at 375f for 13 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned around edges. Cool on cookie sheets for 1 minuteremove from cookie sheets to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 30 cookies.

Bring large pot of water to boil on medium-high heat and add macaroni noodles. Cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until tender but not mushy. Drain and return to pot. Stir in butter and onion and cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Stir in diced tomatoes and garlic and cook until heated through. Season with salt and pepper and add fresh basil and chopped parsley to taste. Serve hot.
Place chops in crock pot. Add salt and pepper and stir. Add remaining ingredients. Cover and cook 5-6 hours or until chops are tender and cherries are cooked through. Serve over rice or potatoes.

Heat a pan over medium heat. Pour in oil to coat the pan. Add the onion, season with salt and pepper to taste. Saute onion until soft, about 5 minutes. In a blender mix together the spinach, onion and 1 cup milk. Place the spinach mixture in a bowl. Beat the eggs lightly in a separate bowl. Mix together the spinach mixture, eggs, 1/2 cup milk and the cheese until well combined. In a separate bowl sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. In the bowl of the waffle iron add the wet mixture first followed by the dry mixture. Pour batter onto waffle iron, close lid and cook until done on each side (about 5 minutes total). Serve the waffles immediately.

Bring water and dried pinto beans to boiling. Boil for 1 hour. Drain water. Add bacon and cook until tender. Add onion powder and water. Bring to boil. Add garlic powder. Cook until liquid is absorbed. Add salt and pepper. Cook over medium-low heat until pinto beans are tender. Add cayenne pepper. Cook until desired consistency. Serve with chopped green onions.

Combine all ingredients except the egg in a large mixing bowl. Mix well. Stir in egg. Coverlet stand for 10 minutes. Form into 1-inch balls. Roll in sugar. Place 2 inches apart on lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes. Cool 1 minuteremove to wire racks.

Mix sugar and corn flakes together. Dip bananas into melted butter. Sprinkle curry powder over bananas. Roll bananas in mixture of sugar/corn flakes mixture. Put bananas on foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes.

Melt the white chocolate over a double boiler or in the microwave (it will melt easily with a little oil or shortening added). Combine the cream cheese and powdered sugar with a spoon and then mix the cream cheese mixture into the chocolate. Stir until smooth and then add the vanilla and pecans. Stir again and pour the mixture onto wax paper or a cookie sheet covered with wax paper and allow to set up. When you are ready to cut the fudge into pieces, you can use a knife or a spoon to remove pieces from the wax paper and then cut them with a knife to the desired shape you prefer. You can also use your hands to shape the fudge.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add brown sugar and stir until dissolved. Add cherries and almonds and stir until coated in caramel. Remove from heat and spread onto graham crackers in a single layer on a lightly greased baking sheet. Let stand for 5 minutes. Remove crackers from baking sheet and serve immediately or store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

Boil carrots until tender. Cut carrots lengthwise. Do not peel carrots. Cook potatoes until tender. Cut potatoes in half. Cut onion in half. Place carrots on plate. Put potatoes on top of carrots. Put onion on top of carrots. Place flour on plate. Place milk in another plate. In another plate mix flour with milk. Put a little bit of flour and milk mixture in middle of each carrot. Sprinkle some pepper and salt over each carrot. Dip carrot in flour and milk mixture. Put carrot in pan with oil. Put a little bit of oil on each carrot. Turn heat on to medium. Cook until brown. Remove carrot from pan. Continue doing this with each carrot. Serve with mashed potatoes.

In a large skillet or fry pan, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and drain on paper towels. Drain off the fat from pan. Add vinegar and sugar. Bring to a boil and reduce heat. Add bacon and stir to coat. Turn off heat and cool slightly. To serve. Place a bed of lettuce in a serving dish. Top with bacon and hard boiled eggs. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve at room temperature.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, bring milk and chocolate syrup to a boil. Remove from heat and add cinnamon sticks and ground cinnamonstir until combined and cinnamon has dissolved. Divide sweetened whipped cream between 2 large mugstop with hot chocolate mixture and sprinkle with miniature semisweet chocolate chips and additional ground cinnamon.

Cut the cheddar and monterey jack cheeses into small pieces and put them into a large bowl. Mix in the mayonnaise and cream cheese. Add the juice from the pickles. Taste and adjust the seasonings with the mustard and horseradish. Refrigerate for an hour or so to let the flavors blend. Serve on a sandwich with a slice of tomato on top. Or spoon onto crackers with slices of red pepper. Or serve with chips. Serves 8.

Peel sweet potatoes. Cut each potato into 8 wedges. Place wedges on a cookie sheet. Drizzle butter over wedges. Sprinkle with garlic powder and ground red pepper. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Peel red potatoes. Cut potatoes into 1/2-inch cubes. Place potatoes on a cookie sheet. Drizzle butter over potatoes. Sprinkle with garlic powder and ground red pepper. Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. In a saucepan heat 1 cup milk, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 1/2 teaspoon salt, garlic powder and red pepper. Slowly whisk in 1 cup of flour. Cook on low heat for 3-5 minutes. Whisk until the consistency of gravy. Add scallops. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add potatoes. Cook for 3-5 minutes. Add sweet potatoes. Cook for 3-5 minutes. Add 1 cup milk.

Cut crackers into crisp pieces. Place in a large bowl. Add nuts and mix well. Beat egg whites with vinegar and sugar until stiff peaks form. Fold in baking powder and vanilla. Fold into cracker mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes. Yield about 14 servings. Serve warm.

In a large bowl, whisk together eggs and milk. Add flour and salt and whisk until smooth. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Brush pan lightly with butter. Pour about 1/4 cup batter into the skillet and swirl to coat. Cook until batter begins to bubble. Turn and cook 30 seconds more. Remove pan from heat and turn crêpe out of skillet onto a plate. Repeat until all batter is used. Fold over and serve. Serve with berries or jam.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Rinse and pat dry swordfish steaks. Combine egg yolk and pepper. Dip swordfish into egg yolk mixture and then press into bread crumbs. Place fillets in shallow baking dish. Drizzle clarified butter and dry sherry over fish and let marinate for 1 hour. Sprinkle with parsley. In a large skillet, melt butter and heat oil until hot. Dip each fillet in melted butter and saute for 5 minutes on each side. Place fillets in a 10x15-inch baking dish. Melt remaining butter and brush on top of fillets. Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes. Serve with macadamia nuts.

Place the cooked chicken in the bottom of an 8-inch baking dish. Add the corn, chili and cheese. Mix the biscuit mix with the milk. Stir until crumbly. Sprinkle over the corn mixture. Add the eggs. Bake 25 minutes at 350 degrees f. Makes 6 servings.

Cook pasta according to package directions using salted water and adding 1 tbsp of the pasta sauce per pound of pasta to the water to give the sauce more flavor. Drain pasta and set aside to cool to room temperature. Prepare tofu by draining the water from the baked tofu and then pressing firmly with paper towels for at least 15 minutes to remove the moisture from the tofu. Chop tofu into small pieces and set aside in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to firm up. Prepare sauce by placing all the sauce ingredients in a blender and pureeing until smooth. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat and add garlic and ginger, and saute until fragrant. Add spinach and cook until wilted and tender, about 2 minutes. Add sauce to pan and simmer for about 5 minutes to thicken slightly. Add tofu and stir until coated in the sauce. Add the cooked pasta to the pan and toss to coat in the sauce and tofu. Add remaining pasta sauce to the pan and toss

Preheat oven to 350f. Place chicken in a greased 9x13 inch pan. In a large bowl combine all of the stuffing ingredients. Spoon half of mixture into center of chicken. Roll up chicken and stuff with remaining mixture. Sprinkle with seasoning salt. Pour cream of chicken soup over chicken. Top with swiss cheese. Bake uncovered for 35 to 40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 180C/160C Fan/Gas 4. Sift the flour and baking powder and set aside. In a large bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs and then the milk and cream. Slowly add the flour mixture and beat until smooth and fully incorporated. Add the lemongrass and beat until just combined. Pour the mixture into a greased 20cm loose-bottomed cake tin and bake for 1 hour and 20 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out clean. Transfer the cake onto a wire rack to cool for 10 minutes before removing from the tin and transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Melt butter in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add the onions and carrots. Saute until the onions are translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the beef and saute until the meat is cooked through. Add the crushed tomatoes and the seasonings. Simmer until the sauce thickens. Serve over pasta.

Divide the frozen bread dough into 8 parts. Roll each ball into a 6-inch circle. Place one piece of cheese in the center of each circle. Fold the circle over the cheese, making sure the edges of the circle are even. Pinch the sides together to seal the dough. Repeat with the remaining balls of dough and cheese. Place the rolls on a baking sheet. Brush each roll with melted butter. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 minutes or until golden brown.

Prepare chicken breast according to package directions. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Combine the egg with thyme and season with salt and pepper. Dip chicken breast into egg mixture then coat with breadcrumbs. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat until hot. Add chicken and cook until golden brown on both sides (about 5 minutes per side). Place chicken on baking sheet and top with ham slices. Bake in preheated oven 15 to 20 minutes until chicken is cooked through (165 degrees F (74 degrees C) on an instant read thermometer).

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray 12-inch quesadilla pan with non-stick spray. In large non-stick skillet, cook beef until no longer pink. Add salsasimmer until liquid is absorbed. In skillet with beef mixture in bottom, place 1 tortillatop with cheese. Cover skillet. Heat over medium heat until cheese melts. Flip tortilla. Repeat with remaining 2 tortillas. Place quesadilla pan in oven. Bake about 10 minutes or until cheese is slightly browned. Remove from pancut into wedges. Serve with low-fat sour cream. Garnish with cilantro.

Sift together flour and poultry seasoning. Make a well in center of flour mixture. In well combine beer, cheddar cheese, and scallion. Using a fork or your hands form dough into a ball. Place dough onto a lightly greased baking sheet. Flatten dough into a circle about 1/2 inch thick. Make a 2-inch diameter hole in the center of dough. Brush dough with beer. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until browned. Serve warm with apple butter.

This salad is light and easy to make. In a large bowl, combine tomatoes and cucumbers. In another bowl, combine the olive oil and vinegar. Add seasoning, salt and pepper. Pour dressing over the salad and toss gently. Refrigerate for at least an hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Cream together the butter, sugar and eggs. Sift together the flour and baking powder. Stir into the creamed mixture until mixed well. Spread into 2 greased 8 or 9 inch pie pans or tart pans. Bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) for 35 minutes. Let cool completely before adding the jam and the nuts. To make the whipped cream, cream the whipping cream until thickened. Frost the cooled tarts and sprinkle with nuts before serving.

Peel and thinly slice leek. Clean squash. Cut squash in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds. Peel skin from squash. In a large saucepan combine oil and leek. Cook over low heat for 3 to 4 minutes stirring occasionally. Add curry powder and turmeric. Cook 1 minute. Add garlic and squash. Cook over medium heat until squash is soft. Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for 15 minutes. Transfer to a blender or food processor and purée until smooth. Return to the saucepan. Stir in the sour cream and heat through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve in individual soup bowls. Sprinkle with chutney.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Mix apples with 2 cups of quick cooking oats. Mix in 1 cup of brown sugar and 1/2 tsp. Cinnamon. Mix with 1/2 cup of melted butter. Pour into 9-inch baking dish. Place into preheated oven for 15 minutes or until apples are tender. Meanwhile mix yellow cake mix and remaining 1/4 cup quick cooking oats with 1 cup brown sugar and 1/2 tsp. Cinnamon. Pour onto apple mixture and top with 2 Tbsp. Butter. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve with ice cream or whipped topping.

Rub the chicken breasts with the olive oil and oreganoseason lightly with the salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a skillet until it is hot enough so that a drop of water sizzles when it hits the oil. Carefully place the chicken breast in the pan and fry for about 5 minutes each sideuntil golden brown. When the chicken is done turn off the heatadd the lemon juice and toss the chicken in it. Transfer the chicken to a platterserve hot.
Prepare Jell-O according to package directions. Let gelatin stand 5 minutes. Add pineapple tidbits. Serve over ice. Garnish with whipped cream.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Dip fillets in flour. Place in a glass baking dish. Spread lemon juice over fillets. Top with onions. Drizzle with mayonnaise. Top with parmesan cheese. Bake for about 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with remaining mayonnaise on the side.

Combine eggs with water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Sift flour into a bowl. Gradually stir in sour cream. Stir in dill weed. Stir in eggs. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Add more water if needed. Serve over toast with diced tomato or tomato sauce.

Pour cake mix, oil and eggs into a large bowl and mix thoroughly. Add sweetened condensed milk and hot fudge. Pour into 2 9 inch round cake pans. Bake at 350f for 25 minutes or until golden. Let cool on rack. Top with Cool Whip and Skor candy bars.

Place all the ingredients in a bowl and whisk until smooth and well combined. Cook over low heat until thickened. Let cool. Refrigerate until ready to use. Use it on pound cake, or as a filling for cookies.

Soak 1 1/2 cups rice in water. Add 2 cups milk and 2 tbsp sugar. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 30 min or until rice is tender. Add 1 cup milk. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in cinnamon and cook for 2 more minutes. Remove from heat and stir in remaining 1 1/2 cups milk. Serve hot.

Mix paprika and pepper together. Coat both sides of pork chops with this mixture. Place chops in a large frying pan. Cover with water and 3 chicken bouillon cubes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer for 1 hour or until tender. Remove from heat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter. Serve with your favorite side dish.

In a medium bowl add almond flour, cocoa powder, coffee granules, baking soda, sea salt and mix well. Add oil, agave nectar and vanilla extract and combine. In a separate bowl mix dark chocolate and set aside. In a large bowl combine the dry mix and dark chocolate. Add water and mix well. Drop by teaspoon into baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-14 minutes. Let cool.
Finely chop green onion and yellow sweet peppers. Place in food processor with remaining ingredients. Pulse until smooth. Serve chilled.

Combine first 5 ingredients in a saucepanbring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes. Remove from the heatcool slightly. Remove cinnamon sticks and cloves from syrup and discard. Blend in sour cream and orange zeststir in cranberries and cranberry syrup. Serve cold or chilled.

Make pie crusts. I use a mix of wheat flour, cassava flour, and corn starch. Place in crusts. Mix eggs with pumpkin until well blended. Spoon pumpkin filling into crusts. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until set. Let cool slightly before removing from pans. Place on wire racks. Refrigerate several hours before serving.

Preheat grill to medium high heat. Meanwhile, slice the top off the eggplant. Slice the eggplant lengthwise about 1/2-inch thick. Rub the cut side of the eggplant with olive oil. Place on the grill with the cut side down until softened, about 8 minutes. Turn the cut side up to grill until browned, about 2 minutes more. Meanwhile, toss together cherry tomatoes, capers, garlic cloves, oil, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Grill tomatoes on a grill rack set over medium heat until the skin blisters, about 10 minutes. Set aside to cool slightly. Cut the grilled tomatoes in half. Meanwhile, rub the cut side of the other half of the eggplant with olive oil and grill over medium heat until softened, about 8 minutes. Turn the cut side up to grill until browned, about 2 minutes more. Spread ricotta on the grilled cut side of the eggplant. Top with grilled cherry tomatoes and fresh basil leaves. Serve immediately.

Slice bell peppers in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds. Place peppers cut side down in a large skillet. Brush cut side of peppers with vegetable oil. Sprinkle with salt. Place peppers in 450 degree oven for 10 minutes. Remove peppers from oven. Place peppers cut side down in another skillet. Pour 1/2 inch of boiling water into skillet. Cover skillet. Cook until peppers are tender. Peel peppers. Place peppers in large bowl. Slice each pepper into 2 inch segments. Add bell peppers to the sauce. Simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add peanut butter and stir until well blended. Add hoisin sauce. Stir well. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer for 5 minutes or until mixture is well blended. Transfer to serving bowl. Serve warm.

Place 2 cups of creamed style corn into an 8x8-inch baking dish and stir it with the sugar and salt to coat it evenly with the sugar and salt. Dot with butter cubes and then pour in the remaining corn. Set aside and let it sit for 5 minutes before mixing it up and adding it to a greased 9x9-inch baking dish. Add the eggs and stir until blended and then add the cornstarch and cold water and stir again until blended and smooth and pour it into a greased 9x9-inch baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes and serve hot with apple sauce and butter for dipping.

Bake carrots and zucchini at 350 degrees for approximately 20-25 minutes or until tender. Remove from oven and place on a plate to cool slightly. Drain and reserve any liquid. Slice carrots and zucchini into 1/4" pieces and place on a serving platter or individual plates. In a small bowl combine olive oil, garlic and herbs. Toss with carrots and zucchini. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and add reserved liquid.

Butter croissants. Cut into quarters. Place in a baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Set aside. In a large skillet melt butter over medium heat. Add shrimp. Cook until just cooked through. Remove shrimp. Add green onions. Cook until tender. Stir in thyme. Season with salt and white pepper. Stir in eggs. Pour into croissant cups. Sprinkle with shrimp. Bake until golden brown.

In a large bowl combine pudding mix and waterstir with a wire whisk until smooth and well blended. In a small bowl dissolve gelatin in boiling water for 1 minute. Fold into pudding mixture. Fold in pineapple and mandarin orangespour into a 1 quart casserole dish sprayed with cooking spray and chill for 1 hour. Top with additional mandarin oranges if desired.
Cream together the butter and sugar. Beat in the egg. Add the dry ingredients. Drop the dough by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes.

Boil macaroni until al dente. Drain well. In a large bowl combine eggs, milk, cheese, and mustard. Beat well. Stir in drained macaroni. Spray a 2 quart baking dish with non stick cooking spray. Pour macaroni mixture into dish. Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until top is lightly browned. Serve with additional cheddar cheese on top.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Bake potatoes for about an hour or until done. Meanwhile, peel the potatoes and slice them lengthwise. In a small skillet saut the red pepper flakes in butter for about a minute or two until the butter is melted completely and the red pepper flakes are softened. Combine the butter, red pepper flakes and salt in a small bowl. Pour the mixture over the sliced potatoes in a baking dish or onto a cookie sheet. Mix thoroughly so that each piece is covered with the butter mixture. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese if desired. Bake the potatoes in a 400 degree F (200 degree C) oven for about 25 minutes or until the potatoes are browned slightly. Serve warm with your favorite salad or side vegetable.

Rub the roast generously with vegetable oil, salt and paprika. In a small mixing bowl, combine the onion, garlic cloves, salt, thyme, and scotch bonnet pepper. Stir the onion mixture into the roast. Place the roast into a large pot or crock pot (slow cooker) with enough water to cover half the roast. Bring to the boil on high heatreduce to low heat and cook for 4 hours or until fork tender (do not add any water to the pot after the first hour). Remove the roast from the pot onto a cutting board and let it rest for about 20 minutes before slicing to allow the juices to settle. Serve the roast with the vegetables from the pot. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 1 quart baking dish with butter or cooking spray. Combine walnuts, cranberries, pears and sugar with cider vinegar and fresh ginger. Place in prepared dish. Add cinnamon stick and clovecover dish with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foilbake for an additional 30 minutes or until cranberries are soft and bubbling. Sprinkle with raisinsbake uncovered for an additional 15 minutes until raisins are plump. Serve at room temperature with your favorite cheddar cheese. Serves 8.

Wash and clean ox tail. Cut it to about 3-4 cm pieces and fry with some salt till golden brown. Add water and boil till it is soft. Then add tomatoes, potatoes and carrots. Boil for about 15 minutes until all is soft and tender. Then add some seasoning and serve with bread and butter.

Make sure your shrimp are deveined. If they are not just use a dish of water and the shells and peel them. Place shrimp in a bowl and mix in mayonnaise and lemon juice. Place the shrimp mixture in a zip lock bag. Add the cream cheese and onion. Shake well. Add the mixture to a bowl. Add butter and stir until well blended. Serve on a plate with a side of garlic bread.
Season the chicken breasts with hot sauce and salt. Dust with cornmeal and coat with a mix of dry seasoned bread crumbs and the dried cilantro. Bake in the oven for 30-35 minutes.

Blanch asparagus in boiling water for 3 minutes. Drain. Cut asparagus into 1-inch pieces. Place asparagus in a 3-quart slow cooker. Add remaining ingredients and cook for 6 to 8 hours. Discard asparagus. Puree soup in blender or food processor. Return to slow cooker. Serve warm.

In a slow cooker, combine cranberries, sugar, water and lime zest. Cover and cook on low for 5 hours. (To use a regular saucepan, bring cranberries to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until cranberries pop open, 5 to 10 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to remove from pan.) Transfer cranberries to a food mill or blender. Purée the cranberries until smooth. To serve, stir in orange juice. Store in the refrigerator for up to 10 days.

In a food processor, combine soy flour, protein powder, garlic powder, seasoning salt. Add water. Blend. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites with a fork until they form stiff peaks. Add egg whites to mixture and mix well. Add water if needed. Place mixture in a baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes. Serve with pasta sauce or meat sauce.

Puree melon and lime juice in blender until smooth. Strain through strainer into pitcherdiscard solids. Add brandy and triple sec to pitcherstir. Add wine and sparkling waterstir until combined. Divide between glasses and garnish with limes and mint sprigs.

Bring chicken broth to a boil in a saucepan. Add orzo. Bring back to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 8 minutes. Drain. Set aside. Meanwhile, combine asparagus with 1/4 cup of the dressing. Cook over medium-high heat for 2 minutes. Drain. Combine remaining dressing with orzo. Transfer to a serving bowl. Add asparagus. Sprinkle with parmesan. Season with salt and pepper. Makes 4 servings.

Slice pound cake into six equal pieces. Place each piece of pound cake on a greased 12-inch square baking pan (I used a glass pan). Spread with a generous amount of crushed pineapple. Spoon about a tablespoon of butter over each piece of pineapple and sprinkle with a generous amount of brown sugar. Combine the vegetable oil cooking spray with the remaining pineapple juice and brush the top of the pound cake with the mixture. Bake at 375 degrees for about 20 minutes or until the pineapple is bubbling on top and the cake is lightly browned around the edges. Serve warm with a scoop of ice cream if desired.

Sauté onions and garlic in a large skillet over medium heat for about 5 minutes until tender. Add mushrooms and sauté until browned, about 15 minutes more. Add wine and bay leaf and cook until almost evaporated. Add broth and stir in flour and stir until bubbly, then add more flour as necessary for desired consistency. Simmer and add salt and pepper to taste.

Prepare rice according to package instructions. Drain. In a medium bowl toss the rice with the oil and vinegar. Add in the basil leaves and tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with shaved mozzarella.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9x13 pan. In a small bowl, mix together Oreo cookies and cream cheese. Spread half of cookie/cream cheese mixture on bottom of pan. Pour milk and pudding mix into a large bowl and beat with wire whisk until smooth. Stir in half of powdered sugar and spread over cookie/cream cheese mixture. Spread remaining half of cookie/cream cheese mixture on top of pudding and spread remaining powdered sugar on top. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.
Melt butter in small saucepan. Remove from heat and mix in sugar. Stir in pecans. Spread mixture evenly over crackers. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes. Allow to cool completely.
Melt butter in saucepan on medium heat. Add garlic. Stir in heavy cream and heat until just boiling. Remove from heat and add parmesan and cajun seasoning. Stir well.

Cook sausage. Drain and remove casing. Cut sausage into cubes. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add broth and bring to a boil. Stir in flour and cook until thickened. Stir in sausage and mushrooms. Cook until heated through. Stir in worcestershire sauce and pepper. Cook until heated through. Stir in sour cream and cook until heated through. Stir in parsley. Cook until heated through. Divide among four serving bowls. Top with cooked noodles.

Cut avocados in half. Twist avocado halves in opposite directions and remove pits. Firmly press down on avocados and twist gently. Scoop out flesh with a spoon and discard pits. Using a fork or potato masher, mash avocado flesh until smooth. Add chopped white onion and cilantro. Season with salt to taste. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Place the flour in a shallow dish. Dip the chicken pieces in the flour. Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the floured chicken pieces. Sauté until golden brown (about 5 minutes), turning occasionally. Remove the chicken to a plate. Add the broth to the skilletbring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Stir in the sun-dried tomatoes, capers, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Return the chicken to the pan. Cover and bake in the preheated oven until the juices run clear when the meat is pierced with the tip of a sharp knife (about 15 minutes). Remove the pan from the oven. Stir in the parsley. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Grease and flour a deep dish glass baking dish. Combine the dry ingredients and mix thoroughly. Add the eggs and mix. Cut the apples in half and remove the cores. Drop the apple halves in the dough. Sprinkle the top of the apples with some sugar. Bake in the oven at 400 degrees until the crust is golden and the apples are tender. Serve with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.

Cut the apples into small pieces. Add the nuts. Add the egg, sugar, flour, baking powder and salt. Beat until blended. Pour into ungreased pie shell. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Lower the temperature to 350 degrees for the rest of the cooking time. Cook for 30-40 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream.
Mix sugar, egg, and salt into the flour. Beat butter until soft. Add the flour mixture. Roll into small balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 375f. until golden brown.

Melt the butter in a saucepan over low heat. Gradually whisk in the flour. Cook, whisking frequently to prevent lumping, for about five minutes. Gradually whisk in the milk. Add the cheeses and continue cooking and stirring for about five minutes more until the cheese is melted and the sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. The sauce may be used as is or refrigerated until ready to use. It will thicken slightly as it cools.
Cut cucumber and onion in half and thinly slice. Place in mixing bowl and add vinegar and sugar. Stir and add sesame oil and basil. Mix until well combined and chill before serving.
Pour espresso into bowl of vanilla ice cream. Mix well. Pour into glasses. Top with chocolate curls and drizzle with chocolate syrup.
Brew a pot of dark roast coffee. Stir in sweetened condensed milk. Add vanilla extract. Pour into glasses. Top with whipped cream.

In a 6 quart slow cooker combine the broth, cajun seasoning, kielbasa, bell pepper, onion, celery, tomatoes and 1 tablespoon of the cayenne. Cover. Cook on low for 8 hours. Remove kielbasa. Shred the chicken. Add shredded chicken to the slow cooker along with the remaining 1 tablespoon of cayenne. Cover. Cook on high for 30 minutes.

In a large pot, simmer rhubarb with lemon juice and sugar for 30 minutes over medium heat. Meanwhile, cook ginger with 1/4 cup water until soft in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Let cool, then add to rhubarb mixture and simmer for 15 minutes more. Let cool completely, then pour into a 2-quart jar and seal.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain well. Add cream of mushroom soup and stir. Add mushrooms and onion. Stir in mayonnaise. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Top with more cheddar cheese. Bake in a greased 2-quart baking dish at 350 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Cream shortening and sugar. Add eggs and beat well. Sift together flour, cinnamon and salt. Add dry mixture to creamed mixture and beat well. Fold in pumpkin and vanilla. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until cookies are set and lightly browned. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from pans to cooling racks. Icing: Combine all icing ingredients in a bowl and beat well with an electric mixer. Frost cookies immediately or store in an airtight container in refrigerator up to 1 week or freezer up to 6 months.

Prepare a pan for baking the puffs. Peel yams and cut into slices about one inch thick. Mix together the yams, eggs, butter and baking powder. Spread this mixture evenly on the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle with sugar and salt. Bake in the preheated oven for about one hour or until the yams are tender and puffed. Serve hot or cold with your choice of beverage.

Cut the brie in half horizontally. With a small paring knife make a small opening in the center of each half. Invert each brie half. Arrange the walnuts in a shallow dish. Drizzle the raisins with the olive oil. Spread the walnuts evenly over the bottom of the dish. Place the brie rounds in the dish. Place the shallow dish in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. Serve with a dollop of raspberry preserves.

Saute onion and garlic in butter over low heat until tender. Stir in salt, pepper, flour and basil. Cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Mix cornstarch into water until dissolved. Stir into onion mixturecook until thickened. Stir shrimp into saucecook until shrimp turn pinkdrain well. Serve over rice or noodles. Makes 4 cupsserves 8.

In a large skillet heat 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium heat. Saute the onions until soft. Add the broccoli. Saute until tender. Stir in the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to simmer. Cook until the noodles are tender. Add the milk and cheese. Stir until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Place 10 graham cracker squares on a cookie sheet. Drizzle with condensed milk to cover the crackers completely. Top with a sprinkling of coconut flakes and a chocolate chip. Continue until all crackers are covered and the coconut flakes are gone. Freeze until firm, about 1 hour. Store bars in an airtight container until ready to serve.

Mix all the dry ingredients together in a medium bowl. Put butter into a medium saucepan and melt over medium heat. Add in sugar and cook until it reaches 300 degrees F. Add in the graham cracker crumbs and mix with a wooden spoon until the mixture is evenly moist. Pour in the sweetened condensed milk and stir to combine. Spread the mixture into a 9 x 13 pan. Press in cashew halves. Bake in the oven for about 25 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool completely. Cut into bars and serve.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Place oven rack in middle of oven. In a large bowl mix garlic cloves with oil. Add in sliced onions. Marinate in bowl for 30 minutes. Remove garlic cloves. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Dip chicken pieces in cornstarch. Add to hot pan. Cook 6 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate. Stir 1 tbsp oil into sauce in skillet. Add light soy sauce. Cook until liquid is thickened. Stir in remaining 2 tbsp oil. Stir in chicken. Heat through. Serve with a green salad.

Whisk together all salad dressing ingredients except parmesan and walnut oil. Toss greens with dressing until fully coated. Sprinkle with walnuts and parmesan and toss well. Toss with walnut oil and serve immediately.

Peel sweet potatoes and cut into 1 inch cubes. Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Boil until soft. Drain. In a saucepan over medium heat add oil and sweet potato cubes. Stir and cook until golden. Remove from heat and add sugar and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve.

Sprinkle chicken tenders with sea salt and sesame seeds and dried onion flakes and let marinate overnight in refrigerator. Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Lightly spray baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray and arrange chicken tenders on sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until cooked through and tender. Meanwhile, combine shallot and sherry vinegar and stir until blended. Toss chicken tenders with herbes de provence and drizzle with shallot mixture. Serve as an appetizer or on sandwiches and wraps.

Sprinkle both sides of pork with salt and pepper. Combine the breadcrumbs, salami and cheese. Place 2 or 3 eggs on each slice of pork. Cover the pork with the breadcrumb mixture. Roll up the pork and secure with twine. In an oven proof pan combine the pork and onion and saute for 10 minutes. Drain excess oil. Sprinkle with olive oil and place in the oven. Cook for 2 1/2 hours or until the pork is tender. Transfer the pan to the table. Remove the pork from the pan and cut into serving pieces. In a large skillet heat the olive oil over medium heat. Cook the pork until it is brown. Place the pork on the serving platter. Pour the pasta sauce over the pork and sprinkle with the chopped parsley. Serve with spaghetti or fettuccine.

Prepare your favorite chocolate cake mix according to package directions and pour into greased and floured 9x13 pan. Cool completely. Meanwhile, prepare your favorite instant chocolate pudding mix according to package directions and pour into a medium bowl. Add sour cream and whisk until combined. Stir in warm water and oil until well blended and smooth. Pour pudding over cooled cake and spread evenly. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and refrigerate at least 4 hours. Serve with whipped cream if desired. Enjoy!

Cut the ends off of the cucumbers and cut them into thin slices. Slice the carrots as well. Whisk together the vinegar, sesame oil and sugar. Pour over the veggies and mix. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve on the side or with chicken or fish.

Sift the flour into a bowl. Rub the lard into the flour until it resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add the margarine. Mix in the sugar and then add the egg yolk. Add the water a little at a time until you have a pastry that holds together. Cover the bowl and chill for 1 hour. Roll out the pastry to a 1/4 inch thickness on a lightly floured board. Line a 10 inch pie plate. Cut off any excess pastry. Cover the pastry with a sheet of foil. Fill the pastry case with your favourite mincemeat. Roll out the top crust in the same way as the base crust. Cut off any excess pastry. Place the top crust on the mincemeat. Make 4 small holes in the top crust to allow steam to escape. Brush the top crust with egg. Sprinkle sugar over the top crust. Bake for 25 minutes.

Prepare the marinade by combining olive oil, white wine vinegar, and frozen orange juice concentrate in a small bowl. Stir in honey and red pepper flakes. Toss together the cucumbers and grape tomatoes in the marinade. Allow the vegetables to sit in the marinade for at least 15 minutes. Toss together the marinated vegetables and mixed salad greens. Drizzle with olive oil and serve immediately. Serve with toasted bread for dipping.

In large bowl mix beef, salt, pepper, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder and cayenne. Mix well with hands. Shape into 28 thin patties. Place patties on plastic wrap. Roll into cylinder shape. Twist ends of plastic wrap to secure cylinders. Place patties in plastic freezer bag and freeze for 24 hours. After 24 hours remove patties from freezer bag and place patties back into freezer for 24 more hours. After 48 hours place patties into refrigerator for 12 hours. Drain patties from freezer bag onto clean plastic wrap. Roll up patties into cylinders and twist ends to secure. Place patties into refrigerator for 24 hours. After 24 hours remove patties from freezer bag. Cut patties into 1/2 inch slices. Place patties back into freezer bag for 4 hours or until ready to use. To make jerky, heat oil over medium high heat in large skillet. Add

Add instant vanilla pudding mix to milk. Stir in cherry pie filling and almond extract. Divide mixture into two dishes. Break macaroons into small pieces and sprinkle over mixture. Cover dishes with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight. Before serving, add whipped topping and garnish with cherries.

Combine the water and bisquick mix in a mixing bowl until thoroughly blended. Turn out onto floured board and knead until smooth and elastic. Divide in half and roll out until each piece is approximately 9" long and 2" in diameter. Cut each half into 12 equal pieces. Cut each piece in half crosswise and then diagonally into triangles. Place each triangle on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake in a preheated oven at 400° for 10 minutes. Combine the butter and parmesan cheese in a microwaveable bowl and heat in the microwave until the cheese melts. Spread each triangle with about 1/2 teaspoon of cheese mixture and top each one with about 2 tablespoons of pizza sauce. Bake until the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 5 minutes more.

In a saucepan over medium-high heat, heat apricots in 1/4 cup orange juice and 2 tablespoons water until tender, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and cool slightly. In a large bowl with an electric mixer beat pineapple and remaining juice until smooth and pour over apricots. Add pine nuts and stir well. In a small saucepan over medium-high heat bring orange juice and lemon juice to a boil. Add juice slowly and whisk constantly until it comes to a boil again and is clear (it will foam). Remove from heat and add to apricots. Add sugar and stir well until thick and smooth. Pour into sterilized jars and refrigerate for about one hour before serving.

Bring the water to a boil and add the flour and garlic cloves. Stir and simmer for 3 minutes. Add bouillon and pepper and continue to simmer for 2 minutes more. Stir the mixture with a wooden spoon and add the parmesan cheese until completely blended into the liquid. Pour over the linguine and stir gently with a wooden spoon. Serve immediately with a sprinkling of chopped parsley and a bit of extra pepper if desired. This is a sensible recipe and will keep well in the refrigerator for several days.

Place fish steaks on grill over medium heat. Season with pepper, cayenne & celery salt. Cook fish 3 minutes per side or to desired doneness. While fish is grilling, whisk together onion powder, garlic powder & paprika in bowl. Whisk in peanut oilset aside. After fish is grilled on both sides, remove from grill. Transfer fish to clean cutting board & brush with onion mixture on both sides. Serve immediately with hot buttered rice & steamed vegetables on the side.

Peel sweet potatoes. Cut into 1-inch pieces. Place sweet potatoes in a large saucepan with enough cold water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to simmer. Cook until tender. Drain. Put sweet potatoes in a 9 x 13-inch baking pan. Sprinkle with brown sugar. Combine apples, cinnamon, pecans and 1/4 cup sugar. Pour over sweet potatoes. Drizzle with butter. Bake for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon cinnamon sugar mixture. Bake for 5 minutes more.

Cut tofu into 6 strips. Place tofu in the baking dish with the liquid side down and bake in the oven for 30 minutes or until the tofu is firm. Remove from the oven and let cool for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, add the spinach to the blender or food processor and blend until the spinach is finely chopped but not pureed. Add the onion and blend until the onion is finely chopped but not pureed. Add the mustard and blend until the mustard is incorporated. Place the tofu strips on the bread and top with the spinach mixture. Drizzle with the cooking spray and sprinkle with the seasoning. Serve immediately.

Mix together ground beef, onion soup mix and egg and form into patties. Dip into beef broth and roll in seasoned flour and brown in hot oil. Remove from pan and keep warm in oven. Make a thick gravy from beef broth and add 2 Tablespoons of Worcestershire Sauce and 1/2 teaspoon of seasoned salt and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper and 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder and heat thoroughly and serve over patties and garnish with chopped parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place fillets in a shallow dish. In a small bowl, combine crabmeat and parsley. Sprinkle crab mixture over fillets. In another small dish combine breadcrumbs and parsley. Sprinkle over crab mixture. Drizzle with lemon juice. Dip fillets into egg mixture. Combine remaining ingredients in a shallow dish. Dip fillets in egg mixture and then coat with breadcrumb mixture. Place fillets in a greased 9x13 pan. Bake for about 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Sprinkle with paprika before serving.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Grease a 9-inch round cake pan with shortening or butter. Beat the butter until fluffy. Beat in the sugar gradually. Beat in the eggs one at a time until the mixture is very light. In another bowl, combine the flour with the lemon extract and baking soda. Add this to the butter mixture alternately with the 7-Up soda. Pour batter into the prepared pan. Bake for about 25 minutes or until the cake is golden brown. Cool the cake in the pan on wire rack for about 5 minutes before turning out onto the rack to cool completely before frosting. To make the frosting beat the butter until it is light and fluffy. Gradually beat in the powdered sugar until it is stiff but smooth. Add the vanilla extract. Spread frosting on the cooled cake.
Prepare chicken. Put in crock pot. Sprinkle with garlic cloves and thyme. Add broth and stir. Cook for 2 hours. Sprinkle in parsley. Serve over rice.
Boil cider in a large pan. Add cloves. In small bowl combine ground nutmeg and cinnamon sticks. Remove from heat. Stir in ground nutmeg and cinnamon sticks. Let cool for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Place a large pot of water over high heat. Bring water to a boil. Place the popped corn in a large mixing bowl. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Add the pecan halves and the vanilla extract and stir until evenly coated. Add the margarine and stir until evenly coated. Add the corn syrup and stir until evenly coated. Pour the popcorn mixture onto a cookie sheet lined with foil. Spread mixture evenly. Bake at degrees F for 30 minutes. Let cool completely. Melt the chocolate chips in a double boiler. Dip the nuts and corn into the chocolate and allow to cool. Makes enough for about 10 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut squash in half lengthwise and scrape out seeds with spoon. Place cut side down on greased cookie sheet or baking dish. Drizzle butter all over squash (you can also use olive oil). Sprinkle with nutmeg, salt & pepper. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes or until tender when pierced with a knife.

Bring evaporated milk to boil. Remove from heat. Add marshmallow cream and butter. Stir over low heat until butter is melted and marshmallow cream is completely blended. Remove from heat. Add sugar and stir until sugar is dissolved. Stir in vanilla. Pour into pan. Sprinkle with walnut halves. Spread evenly. Place in refrigerator until firm. Remove and cut in squares. Yields about 12 servings.
Put mushrooms in crockpot. Add butter and ranch mix and stir to combine. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese on top of mushrooms. Cook on low 5-8 hours or until tender. Serve warm or cold.

Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gradually beat in sugar until stiff and glossy. Fold in flour and potato starch until well incorporated. Fold in baking powder and butter until smooth and creamy. Pour into a parchment lined cake tin and bake for approx. 1 hour at 180c/160fan.

Prepare the zucchini and squash and set aside. In a large bowl, whisk eggs and add brown rice flour, xanthan gum, cinnamon and brown sugar. Whisk well. Add zucchini and squash and gently toss together. Heat a pan over medium heat and add 1/4 inch of olive oil. Using a small spoon or ice cream scoop, form the mixture into pancakes. Add about 2-3 tablespoons of oil to the pan and place pancakes in the pan. Cook about 3 minutes on each side. Place the pancakes in the refrigerator until they are cold. Slice each zucchini into 1/4 inch slices and cut the squash into 1/4 inch slices as well. Place 1 slice of zucchini, 1 slice of squash and a piece of peach onto each pancake. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Line a 9 x 13 pan with cooking spray and set aside. Whisk together all dry ingredients in a large bowl. In a smaller bowl combine wet ingredients using an electric mixer on low speed for 1 minute to combine the egg whites and yogurt. Add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients in the bowl and mix on low speed for 1 minute to combine. Fold in pumpkin puree to coat. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until cornbread is golden brown on top. Cool in pan for about 10 minutes before serving. This recipe can be adapted to be dairy free by replacing the greek yogurt with plain soy yogurt. It is also low in sodium, cholesterol, fat free, gluten free and low fat.

Unroll pastry on work surface. Cut into 12 equal-sized squares. Place 1 tablespoon of pesto on half of each square. Fold pastry over and press edges together. Cut each star into quarters. Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 15 minutes. Sprinkle parmesan cheese over the top.

Cook the rice until done but still a little underdone, about 10 minutes at a very low boil. Drain the rice and spread it out flat on a parchment paper lined sheet pan. Mix the butter with the broth and pour it over the rice. Add the wine and toss it around with a fork or a spoon so that the rice is evenly coated. Add the shallots and the soy sauce and toss everything together with a spoon or a fork. Then sprinkle with salt and pepper and spread it out flat again in a single layer onto a parchment paper lined sheet pan. Bake it for about 10 minutes and serve hot or warm with a green salad and a side dish or your choice.

Mix wafer crumbs and sugar together and press into the bottom of a pie plate. Cream butter and add to the crumb mixture. Pour in the vanilla and stir gently to mix in. Pour the mixture into the pie plate and chill for about an hour or until set.

Cut the watermelon into chunks and put in a blender. Pour the frozen lemonade concentrate into the blender. Blend until the watermelon is completely liquified. Strain through a fine mesh sieve. Pour into serving pitchers. Add 1/2 cup of fresh lemon juice. Stir well and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line an 8-by-8-inch square baking dish with foil and spray with nonstick cooking spray. Place apple in large pan over medium heat and cook 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, add oil and heat until hot but not smoking. Add onion and cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Set aside and keep warm. In a large bowl or the work bowl of your mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine turkey and all remaining ingredients except the diced apple and poultry seasoningmix thoroughly. Divide mixture into 12 even portions and shape each into a log about 4 inches long and 2 inches in diameter. Place 1 log in the prepared baking dish. Repeat procedure for the remaining 11 logs. Brush logs evenly with poultry seasoning mixture and top with reserved diced apple. Bake 30-35 minutes or until brown and heated through, brushing with additional poultry seasoning mixture during the last 10 minutes of b

Boil the potatoes until they are tender. Dice the potatoes into 1 inch cubes. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic, onion, and paprika. Cook until soft. Add the potatoes. Season with the salt & pepper. Cook for 10 minutes stirring frequently. Add the lemon juice. Cook for an additional 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in the spinach. Fold in the parmesan cheese. Serve. Garnish with parsley.

Sift the flour and salt into the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. Add the butter and blend at medium speed until the mixture resembles coarse meal. Add the egg yolks and blend for 15 seconds. Add the milk and the vanilla and blend until incorporated. Increase the speed to high and blend until the mixture is smooth. Add the coconut and blend for 1 minute. Pour the mixture into a 9 x 13-inch metal baking dish. Cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 3 hours or overnight. Preheat the oven to 325f. Remove the dish from the refrigerator and pierce the surface with a fork. Bake for 20-30 minutes. Cool the dough slightly before spreading with the ice cream. Top with macaroons and sprinkle with coconut.

Combine soup, milk and mushrooms. Add salt to taste. Add onions to soup mixture. Stir in mushrooms. Put chops in baking dish. Pour soup mixture over chops. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Serve with rice or mashed potatoes.

Combine chocolate and butter in microwave safe bowl and microwave for about 1 minute. Stir in fine sugar and continue to microwave for about one minute more or until mixture is completely melted and smooth. Stir in vanilla and whisk together until smooth. Place eggs in large bowl and beat until frothy. Pour melted chocolate mixture into eggs and beat until well blended. Pour into prebaked pie crust and top with whipped cream and serve immediately.

Beat eggs with 1 tsp baking powder until frothy. Heat a skillet over medium heat with 1 tbsp butter. Pour egg mixture into pan. Cover pan with a lid and cook 2 minutes. Uncover pan and continue to cook 2 minutes more or until eggs are almost set. Fold eggs over with a spatula and cook 30 more seconds. Place a slice of cheese in each omelet. Cover pan with lid again and cook 30 more seconds or until eggs are firm and cheese is melted. Top each omelet with a sprig of green onion. Serve immediately with warm whole wheat toast.

In a large saucepan heat 2 T olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Saute for 3-4 minutes. Add chili flakes and lentils. Saute for another 2 minutes. Add enough water to cover the lentils. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to a low boil and simmer for 35-40 minutes. Cover and cook for an additional 30 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve.

Cut squash in half lengthwise and remove seeds. Place cut-side down on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray and bake for about 45 minutes or until tender. Brush with oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. In a small saucepan over medium heat combine 1 tablespoon of the oil with the maple syrup and bring to a boil. Remove from the heat, add the sage leaf, cover the pan with a lid, set aside for 5 minutes then remove the sage leaf and discard it. Return the pan to the heat for about 3 minutes or until the glaze is thickened. Brush the squash with the maple glaze and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast until the glaze is bubbling and the squash is tender, about 20 minutes more. Serve hot with your favorite roasted vegetables or salad.

Heat a frying pan to medium-high heat. Add the oil and brown the fish fillets for about a minute per side. Drain the fillets and place them in a glass bowl. Pour the vinegar over the fish and cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight. In the morning, drain the vinegar and serve. The fish will keep in the fridge for up to two weeks.

Prepare a saucepan with a steamer basket insert. Bring water to a boil. Add applesboil until softened. Remove from heat. Drain well. In a bowl mix together applesauce, cinnamon and cloves. Refrigerate until chilled.

Wash and cut off the woody ends of the asparagus. Lay the asparagus upright on the paper bag and drizzle with the olive oil. Place the paper bag in a pan with enough water to come halfway up the sides of the bag. Bring the water to a boil and cook the asparagus until it is tender (about 8 minutes). Remove the bag from the water and add the bay leaf and sea salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature with lemon wedges on the side.

Rub the lamb shoulder with 2 teaspoons of sea salt. Sprinkle the rosemary and black peppercorns onto the meat. Place the lamb shoulder in a large glass or plastic container. Pour the oil over the meat. Add the dried oregano to the lamb shoulder. Pour the red wine vinegar over the meat. Add 2 cups of water. Cover with plastic wrap or lid. Refrigerate overnight. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. Remove the lamb shoulder from the refrigerator. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 5 hours. Add the lemon juice to the lamb. Cook for another 2 hours. The lamb should be tender enough to be cut with a fork.

Cook noodles according to package directionsdrainset aside. Melt butter in 2-quart saucepan over medium heatstir in half-and-halfcook 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in noodlescook 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in dressing mixcook 2 minutes or until blendedstir in cheese. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 3 days or freeze up to 6 months. Makes about 6 servings. Edit. Noodles can also be substituted with any other type of pasta. Use 6 ounces for fettuccini or 7 ounces for spaghetticook according to package directionsdrainproceed with recipe as directed above. Makes about 10 servings.

Heat 1/3 cup olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic, red pepper and cook until tender. Add sausage and pineapple chunks. Cook 3-5 minutes longer or until sausage is browned. Stir in mango chutney. Sprinkle with cilantro. Serve over rice.

Boil black beans until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and reserve 1 cup of liquid for later use. In a large bowl, combine black beans with remaining beans, onions, peppers, egg and 1/4 cup black bean liquid from earlier step. Add dressing mix and bread crumbs. Mix well until combined. Divide into four equal portions and shape into patties. Chill for 30 minutes before cooking. Heat 1 Tbsp cooking oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook burgers for 3 minutes on each side, until brown on both sides. Add 2 Tbsp butter to skilletadd mushrooms and cook for 4 minutes until softened. Spread 2 Tbsp mushroom mixture on bottom half of each buntop with burger patty. Spoon 1/4 cup cooked black beans over pattytop with remaining mushroom mixture and remaining bun halves.

Brown chicken in skillet in a little olive oil. Add onion soup mix and brown. Add the crushed tomatoes and tomato puree. Add the wine vinegar and stock cube to the mixture. Cover and cook for 20 minutes. Add the fresh chili pepper and fresh basil. Serve hot.

Place the chicken pieces in a large mixing bowl and cover with cold water. Add the salt to the bowl and mix well until the salt is completely dissolved. Add brown sugar to taste to the brine. Place the bowl in the refrigerator overnight or for a minimum of six hours. Drain the chicken pieces in a colander and rinse with cool water. Place the chicken pieces in a large non-stick skillet or a grill pan and drizzle with olive oil. Cook until the chicken is tender but still firm, about five minutes per side. Transfer to a cutting board and slice into serving pieces. Serve hot with a lemon wedge.

In a mixing bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Combine in flour mixture until blended well. Roll into a ball. Cut in half for each ball. Roll each ball into a ball again with your hands. Place a cherry in each ball. Roll in coconut. Roll in Rice Krispies.

Cut chicken into pieces and season with salt and pepper. Brown in large skillet over medium heat until done. Combine rice and seasoning mix and place in a greased baking dish. Pour soup into baking dish and arrange chicken over top. Pour milk over all and bake, uncovered at 350 degrees for one hour or until heated through and rice is tender. Serve hot.
Brush salmon fillets with ranch salad dressing. Sprinkle with dill and parsley. Bake at 350 degrees until salmon is cooked. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Beat butter and eggs well. Slowly add flour and baking powder and beat until smooth. Add 1/2 cup of the chilies (diced) and 1 cup of the cottage cheese. Mix well. Spoon 1 teaspoon of the mixture onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and cool slightly. Spread 1/2 teaspoon of the remaining salsa onto each tortilla. Top each tortilla with 1 tablespoon of the cheeses and 1 teaspoon of the remaining mixture. Fold over and bake until golden brown.

In a large bowl combine the soy crumbles, eggs and breadcrumbs. Add in minced garlic, parmesan cheese and herb seasoning. Mix to combine. Shape into meatballs. Place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350 degrees f oven for 30 minutes or until brown. Serve hot.
Mix all ingredients together in a saucepan. Simmer for 30 minutes. Serve over pasta.

In a large bowl, combine the crisp rice and chocolate chips. Set aside. In a separate bowl, combine the sugar and corn syrup and stir until sugar is dissolved. In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar mixture and butter. Cook until butter melts. Stir in vanilla. Pour over the crisp rice and chocolate mixture. Stir until well mixed. Drop mixture by spoonfuls onto wax paper. Place wax paper on counter. Press the mixture into a rectangular shape. Roll the mixture into a log shape and wrap with wax paper. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Roll in powdered sugar. Store in airtight container. Makes 2-4 dozen.

1) In large bowl combine honey, vanilla extract and 3/4 cup of the almonds. 2) In a 9" omelette pan melt butter. 3) In a small bowl beat eggs with salt and pepper. 4) Add peaches to honey mixture. 5) Spoon 1/2 of peach mixture into pan. 6) Sprinkle remaining 1/4 cup almonds over peaches. 7) Lift pan over med heat until butter is melted. 8) Cook egg mixture over med heat until set on bottom. 9) Carefully turn over omelette with spatula. 10) Sprinkle with icing sugar. Serve.

Boil water. Add whole cloves, cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, gingerroot, black peppercorns. Boil for 5 minutes. Add sugar. Boil for another minute. Add milk. Boil for another minute. Add tea. Boil for another minute. Turn off heat. Let stand for 2-3 minutes. Serve.

Peel and cube turnips and potatoes. Cook in boiling salted water until fork tender. Drain. Melt butter in pan. Add turnips and potatoes and saute for 3 to 5 minutes. Add onion and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Cook an additional 3 to 5 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve hot.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, stir together black beans, corn and tomatoesbring to boil stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered for 20 minutes stirring occasionally. Add salsa and cook for 10 more minutes stirring frequently. Stir in cilantro and lime juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or chilled with tortilla chips or celery sticks.

In a large skillet brown chicken breasts on both sides. Place in a large bowl. Add pasta sauce, parmesan cheese, and mozzarella cheese. Stir well to combine ingredients. Top with parmesan cheese for garnish if desired. Place in a greased 9x13 pan and bake for 20 minutes or until bubbly.

Mash the potato with the egg and salt and pepper to taste. Mix in the cheese. Add the breadcrumbs and mix until well blended. Shape into small balls and roll in flour or breadcrumbs. Fry in deep fat until golden brown. Drain on paper towels and serve hot with a sauce of your choice.

Make pastry dough following manufacturer's instructions for making flaky pastry (or buy a ready-made crust). Line a 9-inch pie plate with pastry dough, crimping edges decoratively. In a large bowl, mix flour with sugar, salt, almond extract, and cherries. Stir in the butter until it forms pea-sized pieces. Pour filling into pie crust and bake at 350f for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 325f and bake for 30-40 minutes more or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Cool on wire rack. Refrigerate leftovers at least 4 hours before serving. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

Take out 2 slices of white bread. Spread pesto sauce on one slice of bread. Then spread 1/3 of taleggio cheese on top of pesto sauce. Then top with sun dried tomato halves. Then top with arugula. Then top with a piece of prosciutto. Then crack an egg on top of prosciutto. Then top with remaining taleggio. Top with remaining slice of bread. Spray with olive oil. Cook in pan on medium heat. Flip over to cook on other side. Let sit for 5 minutes. Eat!

In a large bowl, combine the caramels and watermix well. Add pecans and crisp rice cerealmix well. Pour into prepared pan. Cover and chill for several hours or overnight before cutting into squares. Cut chilled bars into 1 inch squares and serve.
Pour omelet mixture into Ziploc bag. Add cheese. Ziploc bag into a pot of boiling water until eggs are cooked to your liking. Drain. Serve with ham and mushrooms.

Mix lime juice, orange juice, orange marmalade, mustard, salt, hot pepper flakes, butter, in a bowl. Spread mixture on salmon fillet. Place salmon fillet on broiler pan. Place under broiler and bake at 400 degrees until cooked through. Remove from broiler pan. Place salmon fillet on serving platter. Pour remaining mixture over salmon fillet. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add mussels and saute until they open. Discard any mussels that do not open. Pour the wine over the mussels. Cover and cook over low heat for 10 minutes or until all mussels have opened. Remove mussels from the pan with a slotted spoon. Discard any mussels that have not opened. Stir the parsley into the juices. Serve immediately.

Boil water and add salt. Bring water to a rolling boil. Stir in rice and return to boil. Boil 10 minutes. Add 2 tablespoons butter. Cook 20 to 30 minutes or until all water is absorbed. Keep warm. While rice is cooking, saute 1/4 onions in 2 tablespoons butter until tender. Add 1 cup frozen peas. Saute 2 minutes. Add 1 cup chicken broth. Cook over high heat until peas are heated through. Keep warm. Meanwhile, cut a lettuce leaf in half. Fold in half again. Fill one half of a lettuce leaf with 1/2 cup cooked rice. Place a small amount of the pea mixture in the middle of the lettuce leaf. Fold lettuce half over the stuffing. Place a second lettuce leaf over the stuffing. Fold in the sides to form a ring. Place in a pan. Repeat with remaining lettuce leaves and stuffings. Pour any remaining broth from peas into the pan. Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve. M

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease an eight-inch square baking pan with bacon grease. In a large bowl combine cornmeal, baking powder and baking soda. Add salt, black pepper, buttermilk and egg. Mix well until incorporated. Pour batter into greased baking pan. Bake for about 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot with butter.

Peel the celeriac (and potatoes if you are using them), then cut into thin wedges, then cut into quarters lengthwise. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add celeriac and potatoes (if using), cook for 15 minutes for celeriac, 35 for potatoes (or until tender). Drain well and set aside to cool slightly. Meanwhile melt butter in a large saucepan over a medium heat. Add the shallot and cook for about 5 minutes until softened. Add the potatoes (and celeriac) and cook for a further 5 minutes until softened. Season well with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Transfer to a food processor with a little extra butter (optional) and process until smooth (use a little water if it gets too thick). Transfer to a serving dish, drizzle with remaining butter and serve immediately.

Peel shrimp and devein if desired. Cook until just done. In a large bowl, combine tomatoes with shrimp, cilantro, garlic cloves, cumin, lime juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper to taste. Let sit for 5 minutes to allow flavors to blend together before serving. Serve with your favorite tortilla chips or crackers!

Boil tagliatelle for 3 mins or according to package instructions. Meanwhile, heat a large pan with 2 tbs oil. Saute mushrooms with 1 tbs oil for 5 mins. Stir in creme fraiche and mustard and cook for 1-2 mins more. Drain pasta and stir into mushroom mixture. Season with pepper and toss with chives. Divide among plates and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve with lemon wedges on each plate for squeezing over.

In a small bowl combine sauce ingredients. Pour sauce into a resealable bag. Add chicken breasts to the bag and squeeze out any excess air. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes. Meanwhile, lightly spray grill grates. Discard any remaining sauce from the bag. Place chicken breasts on the grill rack. Grill chicken over medium heat for 5 minutes on each side. Remove from grilldiscard any remaining sauce in the bag. Garnish chicken with green onions. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan over low heat, combine the sugar and syrup and cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture turns a dark brown color, about 20 minutes (the mixture will bubble up vigorously). Stir in the water and baking soda (do not stir vigorously). Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon to keep from burning the bottom of the pan. Stir in the vanilla. Pour the mixture onto a piece of waxed paper spread out on a cookie sheet. Spread the mixture out to about 1/2 inch thick with a spatula or a piece of waxed paper. Sprinkle with raw peanuts (optional). Let cool for 20 minutes. Cut into squares with a knife dipped into hot water.

Trim brisket of excess fat. Place in a shallow roasting pan. Cover with plastic wrap. Set aside. Combine all the sauce ingredients in a large bowl. Pour sauce mixture over brisket. Cover with plastic wrap. Marinate 4 to 24 hours in the refrigerator. Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Place brisket in the oven. Cook 2 1/2 hours. Uncover. Add water to pan. Cover again. Cook until tender, about 1 1/2 hours longer. Allow brisket to cool for 15 minutes. Cut across the grain into thin slices. Serve warm with barbecue sauce.

Slice scotch bonnet peppers and chop green onions. In a glass jar or plastic container combine scotch bonnet peppers, green onion and garlic cloves. Add white wine vinegar, brown sugar and spices. Pour in 1/4 cup hot water. Seal tightly and shake well. Pour seasoning into a jar. Store in a cool dark place up to 3 months.

Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla. Add peanut butter and beat until smooth. Stir in oats and milk. Roll dough into balls and place them on an ungreased cookie sheet. Press a small piece of powdered mix onto each ball of dough. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes. Cool for a few minutes and remove from cookie sheet. Let cool completely and store in an air tight container.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees f. Remove fennel greens from bulbs and discard. Cut off root ends from bulbs. Thinly slice bulbs and onion lengthwise. Brush bulbs and onion with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Place bulb slices and onion slices on a cookie sheet. Roast until tender and golden brown (about 30 minutes). Add sweet potatoes and carrots to pan. Season with salt and pepper. Roast until tender and golden brown (about 30 minutes). Set aside. Place garlic clove and rosemary on cookie sheet and roast until garlic clove is tender (5 minutes). Set aside. Toss together roasted vegetables. Serve warm.

Blend cream cheese with monterey jack cheese until well mixed. Spread mixture on a non-stick baking sheet or cookie sheet. Spread thinly with a rubber spatula. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and chives (optional). Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes until set. Once cool, slice thinly with a sharp knife and place on a serving platter or on crackers or toasted bread. If desired, spoon Worcestershire sauce or liquid smoke over slices before serving.

Place pork loin chops in glass baking dish. Sprinkle brown sugar over top of pork. Pour juice over brown sugar and rub juice into pork chops with fingers. Sprinkle rosemary over brown sugar and rub into pork chops. Place pineapple slices in baking dish. Pour sherry over pineapple slices. Sprinkle garlic cloves over pineapple slices. Bake in 450 degree oven for 30 minutes or until pork is done.

Mix cocoa powder, sugar, milk, margarine, peanut butter in mixing bowl. Mix well. Add quick-cooking oatmeal. Mix well. Add vanilla. Mix well. Add salt. Mix well. Drop by teaspoonful onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes.
Bring water to boil and add all the other ingredients. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes and let it steep for another 10 minutes. Strain the coffee and serve it hot or cold.

In a medium bowl whisk together soy sauce, tequila, honey, mustard and cloves. Add a pinch of salt and black pepper to taste. Coat the wings evenly with the sauce. Place them in a single layer in a large baking pan. Cover pan with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees f. Remove plastic wrap. Transfer the wings to a wire rack. Bake for 25-30 minutes, turning them over halfway through baking. Serve hot with fresh cilantro sprinkled over the wings. You can also serve with celery sticks and ranch dip.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Beat together egg yolks with 2 1/2 cups of flour in medium sized mixing bowl until smooth. Add the butter to the yolk mixture and beat until light and fluffy. Add almond extract. Beat until smooth. Stir in remaining 2 cups flour until dough forms. Shape dough into 1-inch balls and flatten to 1/2-inch thickness on lightly floured surface. Place dough on ungreased cookie sheets 2 inches apart. Bake 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 1 minute on cookie sheetremove to wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Cook macaroni according to package directionsdrain and set aside. Meanwhile, cook peas according to package directions.
