In large saucepan over medium heat, combine soup, water, cheese, and macaronicook 5 minutes or until cheese melts. Stir in peasmix well. Pour mixture evenly into a lightly greased 2-qt. rectangular baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake 25 minutes or until heated through. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Dissolve 1 cup boiling water with 1 envelope lime jello in a medium saucepan. Mix with 1 cup pineapple juice and 1 cup cooked rice. Pour over pineapple chunks. Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm. Cut pineapple into 1 inch pieces. Cut a small square from a large pineapple. Peel it. Cut away all yellow and brown skin. Slice into small pieces. Place in a blender with 1/2 cup pineapple juice. Blend until smooth. Fold in pineapple rice mixture. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch pan. Refrigerate 2 hours or until set. Garnish with remaining pineapple chunks. Cool. Refrigerate leftovers.

In a small saucepan over medium heat combine water with agar flakes and espresso powder. Bring to boil and simmer for 2 minutes. Whisk in silken tofu (do not let it curdle), maple syrup, cocoa powder, vanilla extract, and salt. Remove from heat. Pour into an 8-inch pie pan lined with a pie crust or crustless vegan pie crust (see recipe below). Refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. In small saucepan combine all crust ingredients and heat on medium-high heat for 3 minutes or until softened. Remove from heat. Spoon into prepared crust and press firmly into sides of pan. Chill for 1 hour before serving.

In a small saucepan saute leeks in 1 tablespoon of butter. Add fish stock, salt pepper and Dijon mustard. Cook over medium heat until reduced by one third. Arrange cod fillets in a buttered baking pan. Pour leek mixture over fish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 to 25 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Cook the pasta as directed on the package. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the garlic in the olive oil until it is golden brown, stirring constantly for about 1 minute. Add the spinachseason with salt and pepper. Cook until the spinach wilts. Drain the pasta reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid. In a large bowl toss the pasta, spinach mixture, pine nuts, feta cheese, parmesan cheese, salt and pepper until well coated. Pour pasta mixture into a lightly greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle the remaining feta cheese on top. Bake at 350 degrees F until golden brown for about 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Slice the cucumbers into bite-sized pieces and place in a bowl of cool water with a pinch of salt. Let sit for 30 minutes or until the slices are very tender and easy to cut. Meanwhile, cut the sweet red peppers into bite-sized pieces and place in a bowl of cool water with a pinch of salt. Let sit for 30 minutes or until tender and easy to cut. Place a wedge of lime in the bottom of each glass and cut the avocado in half lengthwise. Scoop out the avocado from the skin and set aside in a separate bowl. Squeeze the juice from the lime into the glass and toss in the cucumber and sweet red bell pepper. Add the avocado, chopped parsley, red onion and a pinch of salt and toss lightly to combine. Sprinkle with chili flakes to taste. Serve immediately.
Unroll crescent rolls. Fill each roll with sausage and cheese. Drizzle with honey mustard. Cut each into fourths. Serve with crackers.
Puree tomato sauce with adobo. Add tomato juice, Spanish onion, cilantro, ground cumin, salt and olive oil. Serve with grilled or baked tortillas.

Prepare the marinade in a bowl by mixing soy sauce, dry sherry and margarine. Add salt and black pepper and mix well. Rub the salmon fillets with the marinade and let stand for at least an hour before cooking. Place salmon fillets on the grill over medium heat and cook for about four minutes each side or until done. Serve with rice and your favorite vegetable or salad.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain, cool slightly and cut in half lengthwise. Put potatoes in a large baking pan. In a food processor combine oil, rosemary, parsley, mustard, lemon juice, butter and 1/2 tsp of saltblend until smooth. Stir in enough water to make a thin saucepour over potatoes and bake until potatoes are tender, 30-40 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 tsp of salt before serving.

Separate chicken breasts from skin. Cut chicken breasts into small pieces. In a large skillet, cook chicken over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain. Combine flour, seasoning and 1 cup butter in a large bowl. Stir in chicken and cook over medium-low heat until heated through. Stir in cereal. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Spread pesto over one side of pita breads. Spoon goat cheese onto pita breads. Add tomato slices to goat cheese. Place other side of pita breads down on top. Warm in microwave for 30 seconds or until cheese melts.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Grease a 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray. Place bacon strips on a foil-lined baking sheet and bake for 10 to 12 minutes until crispdrain on paper towels. Slice bacon into 1/2-inch strips. Peel potatoes and slice into 1/2-inch rounds. Wash and slice green pepperset aside. Cut onions into 1/2-inch ringsset aside. Whisk eggs in large bowl and stir in milk. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Coat a nonstick pan with cooking sprayheat over medium heat until hot. Add bacon to panfry until crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels. Remove bacon to a platterset aside. Add green peppers to pan and saut until tender but not brownadd onions and saut until onions begin to turn translucentadd potatoes to pansaut until tenderseason with salt and pepper to taste. Add bacon to pan

Place steak in slow cooker. Sprinkle with seasoning salt. In a large bowl, combine onions and green peppersmix in carrots. Add to slow cooker. Stir in juice, tomatoes and peas. Sprinkle with parsley. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 9 hours or until meat is tender. When meat is done, cut into 1-inch piecesdiscard bone. In a small bowl, mix gravy and cornstarch with a whisk until blended. Add to slow cookerstir to blend. Cover and cook for 15 minutes more. Serve with egg noodles.

Slice zucchini into rounds and place in a bowl. In a frying pan add oil and cook onion and pepper until softened and just beginning to brown. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add all of the above vegetables to a bowl and mix together with tomato and onion mixture. Place zucchini onto a tortilla and top with vegetables. Sprinkle cheese over vegetables and roll up tortilla and place on a baking sheet or pan covered with paper towel. Bake at 425 degrees for about ten minutes or till cheese is melted and tortilla is warm and softened. Serve with sour cream and salsa or taco sauce for dipping.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Remove the skin from the leg of lamb and pat dry. Season with fresh cracked pepper and sea salt. Toss with flour. Add to a large pot and pour in chicken stock. Add diced tomatoes. Add 1-inch square of lemon and 1 tsp minced garlic to the pot. Simmer for 1 hour. Remove from heat and let cool. Take the lemon out of the pot and peel away the skin. Take the garlic out of the pot and discard. In the same pot, add fresh garlic and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the tomatoes and bring to a boil. Pour mixture over the leg of lamb and roast in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Add a small amount of mint jelly to the pan to make the gravy. Once the gravy is thickened, strain the liquid to remove any small bits of meat. Pour the gravy over the meat. Serve with roasted vegetables and fresh parsley. Enjoy.

Rub ribs with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Place on the grill and cook over indirect heat for about an hour, or until tender and cooked through. Meanwhile, cut ramps into small pieces and toss them in olive oil and garlic and roast them over indirect heat for about five minutes or until tender and caramelized. In another small pan over medium heat, saute habanero peppers and vinegar until the vinegar has reduced by half and the habaneros are charred and have released their juices into the pan. Remove from heat and set aside until ready to use. Once ribs are cooked through and tender, remove them from the grill and brush them with balsamic reduction and place them on a platter or cutting board and serve them with pickled ramps and grilled onions.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (218 degrees C). Toss the brussels sprouts with the lemon-pepper seasoning in a bowl. Coat the inside of the baking dish with the olive oil. Place the brussels sprouts in the baking dish. Bake the brussels sprouts in the preheated oven for 35 to 45 minutes, or until tender when pierced with the tip of a knife. Serve brussels sprouts warm or at room temperature with butter or low-fat ranch dressing.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Place 6-8 cherry tomatoes on a small baking sheet. Cut tomatoes in half and scoop out the seeds and pulp. Place seeds and pulp in a small bowl. Stir in cream cheese and yogurt. Spoon filling into tomato shells. Sprinkle with green onion and oregano. Bake for 15 minutes. Let cool for a few minutes before serving.
Brown ground beef in a skillet. Drain. Mix in ketchup and mustard. Add in garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste. Spread over hamburger buns. Top with american cheese.

In a 9 x 13 glass dish place frozen broccoli. Melt 1 tbsp butter. In a bowl whisk flour and salt together. Add milk slowly to flour mixture. Add lemon juice to milk. Stir in cheese until melted. Pour over broccoli. Bake 350f for 25 minutes. Serve with tuna.
Mix in a large glass. Pour over ice. Garnish with orange slice and a straw.

Fill pie crusts with mixed vegetables. Sprinkle french fried onion rings over vegetables. Top with diced chunk chicken. Pour condensed soup over vegetables. Sprinkle with salt. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Serve immediately.

Mix ground veal and bread crumbs together in large mixing bowl. Add milk, garlic and onions. Mix well. Form meat mixture into meatballs. Brown meatballs in olive oil. Remove meatballs and set aside. In a saucepan over medium heat, add olive oil and butter. Add onions. Cook 5 minutes. Add garlic. Cook 2 minutes. Add tomato sauce. Cook 10 minutes. Add maple syrup. Bring to a boil and cook 5 minutes. Add meatballs to sauce. Cook 15 minutes. Serve over noodles.

Toast two slices of bread. Spread each slice of bread with butter. Top bread with the marmalade. Cut open the egg and place on top of marmalade. Cover the sandwiches with the remaining two slices of toast. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream butter and sugar together for 3 minutes. Add eggs and vanilla extract. Mix in sour cream and beat until smooth. Add remaining ingredients and mix until blended. Bake for 35 minutes. Let cool completely before frosting.

In medium size sauce pan combine margarine, marshmallows, creamy peanut butter. Cook over low heat stirring constantly until smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in oats. Fold in rice krispies. Pour into a 9x13 pan. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. Cut into small pieces. Roll into balls. Roll in chopped peanuts and raisins.

Cut cream cheese into cubes. Place in medium mixing bowl. Add tomatoes and garlic. Sprinkle with fresh ground pepper. Stir and refrigerate for at least two hours before serving. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Saute squash and bell peppers in olive oil for about 10 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook for another minute. Remove from heat and set aside. Place squash in a greased casserole dish. Top with bell peppers and cooked squash. Sprinkle with parsley and season with salt and pepper. Top with parmesan cheese. Bake for 20 minutes.

Bring milk, sugar and cocoa to a boil in medium saucepan. Stir in cornstarch and salt. Gradually whisk in eggs. Cook pudding until thickened and bubbly. Add semi-sweet chocolate chips and butter. Cook and stir 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve hot or cold. Chill and use as filling for pies or trifles.

Peel sweet potatoescut into 1-inch cubes. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boiladd sweet potatoescook until tender when pierced with a fork, 15-20 minutes. Drain wellreturn to potmash potatoes with a potato masher. In a large bowl combine sweet potatoes with bell peppergreen chili peppergarlic clovesolive oilfat free cream cheesenon-fat milkcoriander leavessaltfreshly ground black peppermix well. Serve warm.

Bring water to a boil. Remove from heat. Add all spices to tea bags. Steep for 10 minutes. Remove tea bags. Stir in juice cocktail and wine. Let sit for 5 minutes. Stir in sugar. Serve with orange slices garnish.

Cut boneless skinless chicken breast into 1-inch pieces (about 4 pieces for each breast). In a 4- or 5-quart crock pot combine chicken pieces, salt and pepper, onion powder, enchilada sauce and soup. Cover crock pot and cook on low setting for 6 to 8 hours or on high for 4 to 6 hours or until cooked through. Serve hot over cooked rice. Or serve over tortilla chips. For a more authentic Mexican flavor, sprinkle with a little bit of chili powder just before serving.

In a large bowl, combine gelatin and boiling water. Stir until dissolved. Add whole berry cranberry sauce and orange. Chill 2 to 3 hours. Fold in cooled gelatin mixture. Garnish with pecans and cool whip.

Mix ground beef with coffee until thoroughly combined. Mix in salt and soy sauce. Form into 6 patties. Cook on griddle or skillet until well done. Meanwhile, spread butter on each roll. Place a burger patty on each roll and cover with a slice of cheese. Place each roll, butter side down, on a hot skillet. Cook until cheese is bubbly.

In medium saucepan whisk together coconut milk and whole milk. Add tapioca and stir until dissolved. Bring mixture to boil over high heat stirring constantly until mixture thickens and comes to boil again. Remove from heat and stir in sugar and egg until well blended. In large glass or metal bowl combine strawberries, pineapple chunks and banana chunks. Pour tapioca into strawberry mixture and fold in shredded coconut and raisins. Refrigerate at least four hours or overnight until firm. -- also a good recipe for summer fruit cups.

In a blender or food processor, combine the beans and jalapeno pepper. Add the water and blend until smooth. Season with salt to taste. In a large skillet or pan over medium heat, heat the oil for 1 minute. Add the beans and cook, stirring frequently for 2 minutes. Set aside to cool for 20 minutes. Flatten each tortilla with a rolling pin on both sides to make them thin. On one side of the tortillas, spread the cheese, leaving a 1/2 inch border of tortilla on each side uncovered. Spread the beans evenly on the tortillas and add the avocado slices on top of the beans. Place another tortilla on top of the avocado slices and cheese mixture. Carefully flip the quesadillas over once or twice during cooking to ensure even cooking on both sides. Cook for 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Cut into wedges to serve.

Combine 1 bottle of raspberry-cranberry juice with 1 bottle of red wine. Stir in 1 1/2 cups of sugar (1/2 cup for each bottle of wine). Stir in 1 teaspoon of Grand Marnier. In individual wine glasses add 1/4 cup of each juice blend. Add 1/4 cup of club soda. Garnish each glass with 2 fresh cranberries and an orange slice. Makes 6 servings.

In a medium saucepan whisk together the sugar and cornstarch. Add the cocoa powder and cinnamon and whisk until well blended. Add the coffee granules and whisk. Add the milk and butter. Bring the mixture to a boil. Stir in the vanilla and then remove from the heat. Cover the pan and let the mixture cool for about 20 minutes. Add the milk. Place the pan in the refrigerator until the mixture is set. Stir the mixture to loosen it and then remove the pan from the refrigerator. Pour the pudding into a 4-ounce glass or a 6-ounce ramekin. Chill the pudding for about an hour or until it is firm. Serve the pudding with whipped topping or chocolate shavings.

Bake wagon wheel macaroni according to package directions. Drain and set aside to cool slightly. In a large pot, combine chili, tomato sauce, ketchup, chili powder and 1 cup of the shredded cheddar cheese. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to a simmer for 10 minutes. Add wagon wheel macaroni to the chili mixture and stir to coat macaroni completely. Sprinkle remaining shredded cheddar cheese over the top of the chili. Cover chili for 5 minutes or so before serving.

Prepare and place in a large roasting pan. Place in a pre-heated 275f oven for about 2 hours. When meat is almost tender, add apple juice and stir. Stir in tomato juice and water. Cover and continue cooking for about one hour. Add tomato juice and water. Cover and cook for an additional one hour. Add vinegar and spices. Cook for another one hour. Add cornstarch and water. Cover and cook for about one hour. Add apple juice and stir. Cook for about 45 minutes. Add water. Cover and cook for about one hour. Add apple juice and vinegar. Cook for about one hour. Add water. Cover and cook for one hour. Add vinegar and cook for about one hour. Add apple juice. Cook for about one hour. Remove from oven. Allow meat to cool. Refrigerate overnight. Slice meat and serve.

Drain fat from pork chops. Season with salt and pepper and brown in skillet or large fry pan until well done. Remove to a plate. Pour off most of fat from fry pan. Saute onions in fat until tender. Stir in tomatoes and green pepper with remaining fat. Place pork chops on bottom of a greased casserole or shallow baking dish with onion mixture. Pour consomme over the top of the pork chops and vegetables and season with marjoram and thyme. Cover with rice and bake at 350 degrees for about one hour or until rice is cooked through. Serve hot with fresh bread rolls or biscuits.

For the mashed potatoes, preheat oven to 400 degrees. Boil potatoes until tender. Drain, mash with sour cream until smooth. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. For the topping, heat the bacon in a pan until crisp. Remove the bacon from the pan and add the potato wedges to the pan. Cook until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. For the topping of the mashed potatoes, combine the mashed potatoes with the cheese mixture. Microwave until heated through. Top with green onion and bacon. Enjoy.

Slice the onions and toss them with the balsamic vinegar and the salt and pepper. Warm the butter in a small saut pan over medium heat and add the onions and the pine nuts and saut until the onions are caramelized and tender about 15 minutes. Place the cauliflower in a large bowl and toss with the onions and pine nuts. Serve immediately.

Slice each papaya in half horizontally. Remove the seeds and discard. Using a spoon, scoop out the flesh. Place the scoops into a bowl. Chop the kiwi into small pieces and add to the bowl. Place the strawberries on the bottom of the papayas. Place half of the banana slices on top of the strawberries. Place half of the orange slices on top of the bananas. Place half of the kiwi and strawberries on top of the orange slices. Place the remaining banana slices on top of the kiwi. Add the granola. Place the yogurt in the bowl. Pour honey over yogurt and stir gently. Serve in the papaya boats.

Preheat oven to 350f. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add soda crackers, fresh ground pepper, sage and thyme to butter and cook until cracker crumbs are toasted and golden brown, about 5 minutes, stirring often. Add salt to taste. Remove from heat. Add enough buttermilk to coat crackers, about 1 cup of buttermilk. Set aside. Pat dry the pork chops. Dip each chop into buttermilk mixture and then dredge in crumbs until evenly coated. Place coated chops on a lightly greased baking sheet and bake until done to taste about 30 minutes. Serve hot or cold.
Blend orange juice with pineapple tidbits. Add wine and apple. Stir. Add sugar and lime juice and stir. Add club soda. Serve over ice. Makes 3 quarts.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook, stirring frequently, until onion is translucent, 3 to 5 minutes. Add broth and water. Bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium low. Add chicken and hominy. Bring to boil, stirring frequently. Reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring occasionally, until chicken is cooked through and hominy is tender, 20 to 25 minutes. Season with oregano and red chili powder. Remove from heat and serve.

Rub the beef tenderloin with oil and season with salt and pepper. Place in the center of a foil-lined baking sheet. In a small bowl combine the dijon mustard with the herbs and garlic and mix well. Spread the mustard mixture over the top of the beef and fold the foil over the beef. Bake the beef in the preheated oven for about 2 hours or until the beef is tender and cooked through when tested with a meat thermometer or fork. Serve with your favorite baked potato and your favorite veggie of choice. Serves four.

In a large bowl combine water, yeast and sugar and let sit until foamy. Stir in olive oil and mix with water and yeast mixture until well combined. Add salt and then gradually stir in all-purpose flour and cornmeal and mix until dough is formed. Place dough on floured surface and knead until dough is smooth and elastic and then place in greased large bowl and cover with plastic wrap and let rise until doubled in size. Punch down and knead again and then shape into a ball and place on greased 12 inch round baking pan and let rise until doubled in size again. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden brown and then remove from oven and brush with olive oil and sprinkle with seasoning and let cool until ready to use.

Remove the shell from the avocados and peel. Remove the meat from the avocados and dice. Combine the avocado and hard-boiled eggs. Mix the onion with the lemon juice and vinegar. Pour over the avocado and eggs. Add the remaining ingredients. Serve. Serves 2.

Cut broccoli into pieces, about the size of your thumb. Boil in water until just tender. Drain well in colander. Peel red onion and cut in half. Slice into pieces about the size of the broccoli. Melt bacon pieces in skillet until crisp. Remove bacon from pan with slotted spoon. Crumble bacon over broccoli pieces, mixing well with broccoli. Cut old cheddar cheese into pieces about the same size as the broccoli & onion. Mix with broccoli mixture. Mix all the other ingredients together. Pour over broccoli mixture. Toss until combined. Cover & refrigerate several hours. Serve cold or at room temp.

Boil green beans. Combine milk and cream of mushroom soup until mixed well. Add green beans and white onions. Heat until hot and serve on top of french-fried onions. This recipe is from the LSU Tiger's 2005-2006 football season game day recipes and is a favorite of LSU's defensive line coach.

Wash and clean the beetroots under running water. Cut the beetroot into half lengthwise and then into 1/2 cm thick slices. Place the beetroot in a large bowl and add the vinegar, water, sugar, peppercorns and clove. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 48 hours or even better for several weeks. Transfer the beetroot slices to a large jar and place in the refrigerator for at least one day before serving. Enjoy!

Combine margarine and biscuit mix in large bowl and mix well with electric mixer or in blender until crumbly. Add lemon juice and parmesan and blend well. Coat chicken breasts with mixture. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heatadd chicken breasts and brown each side 4-5 minutes. Transfer chicken to baking dish and drizzle with melted margarine and lemon juice mixture over chicken and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes or until heated through and parmesan cheese is lightly browned. Serve hot.

Mix sour cream and mayonnaise together in a large bowl. Add parmesan cheese and garlic and mix until combined. Add parsley and feta cheese. Drizzle in the red wine vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Serve over pasta or vegetables.

In a large slow cooker (or in a deep 9x9x2 inch baking dish), combine the hamburger, pasta sauce and water. Stir to combine well. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours. About 1 hour before serving time add the mushrooms and onion to the crock pot. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes. Add the pepperoni and cook until the cheese is melted and the pizza is heated through, about 10 minutes more. Serve immediately with a green salad.

Put popcorn in bowl and stir in rice cakes and mix well. Put in plastic bag and cut off one corner of bag. Squeeze to distribute mixture evenly onto popcorn and rice cakes. Heat in microwave for 2 minutes on high or until butter is melted and mixture is soft. Serve warm or at room temperature with soy sauce or vinegar and sesame oil as desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cut cooked cornbread stuffing into bite sized pieces and place in a greased 9 inch pie pan. Sprinkle with white pepper and paprika. Spread evenly. Layer cooked turkey over stuffing. Cut Swiss cheese into strips and layer over turkey. Whisk eggs with evaporated milk and pour over mixture. Bake at 375 degrees for about an hour or until set. Serve warm.

In a large pot combine the chicken broth, broccoli and diced tomatoes. Bring to boil. Stir in the orzo pasta. Add the shrimp and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 3-4 minutes or until the shrimp turn white. Remove from heat and stir in the butter. Stir in the dried basil and serve.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heatadd garlic and red pepper flakes. Saute garlic for a couple of minutesadd the tomatoes with their juice and stir to combine. Bring to a boilreduce heat to low. Simmer for about an hour to allow flavors to meldseason with salt to taste.

Spread the hoagie roll with mayo and put in a sandwich press or panini grill until crispy. Slice ham and bacon and put on roll with mozzarella cheese and swiss cheese. Put in sandwich press or grill until cheese melts and ham and bacon is cooked through. Cut the sandwich in half and serve.

Cut pear into 8 wedges and apricots into 16 pieces. In a saucepan combine pears, apricots and lemon juice. Sprinkle with cinnamon stick. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook for 5 minutes then add cherries. Cook for 1 minute then remove from heat and pour into 4 stemmed glasses. Top with apricot preserves and a dollop of whipped cream. Pour rum over each glass and garnish with a cinnamon stick. Serve immediately.

Bring 2 cups of milk to a boil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Remove from heatstir in cornstarch until smooth. Return to medium-high heatcook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Stir in 1/4 cup of the sugar and the salt. Set aside. Stir together the remaining sugar and the butter in a bowl until smooth. Gradually stir in the vanilla. Roll the pastry out and line the bottom and up the sides of a 9 inch pie pan. Cut off any excess dough. Line the pastry shell with plastic wrap and fill with pie weights. Place in the freezer for 15 minutes. Remove plastic wrap. Bake at 425 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove weights. Bake an additional 5 minutes. Remove the shell from the oven. Reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees. Stir the cornstarch mixture until smooth. Pour it into the hot pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Let cool before cutting. Serve warm. Makes 8 servings.

Pour cherry pie filling into a glass dish. Refrigerate for 30 minutes. While the pie filling is refrigerating make the gelatin. Place the cherry pie filling in a blender. Blend until it is a smooth puree. Place the gelatin in a large mixing bowl. Pour the sour cream in to the gelatin and stir until the gelatin is dissolved. Pour in the cherry pie filling. Stir until combined. Add the sugar and pecans. Pour in a 9x13 glass baking dish. Refrigerate until the gelatin has set. Serve with a dollop of cream cheese.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Cook sausage over medium-high heat until no longer pink. Drain well and set aside. In large saucepan cook onion and pepper in oil until tender and beginning to brown. Stir frequently. In large skillet cook sausage with spices and onion mixture until heated through and sausage is fully cooked. Spread sausage mixture over bottom of 13x9x2-inch baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes at 425 degrees F or until lightly browned and heated through. Meanwhile, prepare breadstick dough as directed on package for 12-15 minutes or until dough is doubled in size and ready to use. Roll dough into 16 3/4-inch-long pieces. Place 2 breadstick pieces on each of 6 large plates. Spoon sausage mixture evenly over breadstick pieces and top evenly with green peas and Parmesan cheese. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until heated through and crust is golden brown. Yields 6 servings.

Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef and cook until brown. Add the celery and cook until tender. Add the water and rice-a-roni. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and simmer for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Serve.

Peel the avocadoes and slice in half lengthwise. Scoop out the flesh and place in a large bowl along with the cilantro, tomato, serrano peppers, onions, lime juice, orange juice and garlic clove (if using). Using a large spoon, mash together. Add salt to taste. Serve with tortilla chips.

Melt butter in a shallow baking dish. Place pork chop in butter. Combine green onion, red onion, bell peppers and pineapple in a bowl with teriyaki saucespread mixture evenly over pork chop. Cover with foil and bake at 325f for approximately 1 hour or until done. Serve with rice.

Prepare au gratin potatoes according to package directionsdrain and set aside. In 1-quart saucepan, heat water and milk over medium-high heat until just warm (105 degrees). Stir in potatoes and cook over medium-high heat until heated through. Stir in corn, tomatoes and green chilies and cook over medium-high heat 1 minute or until heated through. Stir in cheese and hot sauceheat through. Serve with parsley sprig, if desired.

Pour the olive oil in a medium bowl. Add the lemon juice. Squeeze the lemons in the bowl and toss. Add the olives. Pour in the herbs and sprinkle with the salt. Add the remaining oil. Toss with your fingers until the olives are evenly coated. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let stand at room temperature for 4 hours. Bring the olives back into the refrigerator for 24 hours before serving. Serve chilled. Store covered in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.

For the pasta: Bring a large pot of generously salted water to a boil over high heat. Cook the pasta until it is al dente and drain in a colander. Meanwhile, in a medium skillet over medium heat, heat the oil until it is hot and smoking and then add the pancetta. Cook, stirring occasionally until the pancetta is crisp and golden, about 8 minutes. For the egg mixture: Whisk the eggs in a large bowl until they are homogenous and pale yellow in color with no streaks of white left behind from the whites. Add the cheese and the black pepper and stir until the cheese is melted and the mixture is well combined. Drain the pasta and toss with the egg mixture until the pasta is thoroughly coated in the egg mixture and the egg mixture is evenly distributed among the pasta pieces. Transfer the pasta to a large bowl or serving platter and top with the pancetta and serve immediately with extra black pepper if desired.

Saute the beans and sweet onions in olive oil for 1 minute. Add tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in dried oregano and season with salt and pepper. Add enough water to cover beans and bring to a boil. Cook for 15 minutes. Remove beans from heat and drain.

Preheat the oven to 425f degrees. Spray a 9-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine the bisquick baking mix with the melted butter and cut in the milk until it makes a soft dough. Add the egg and mix well. Stir in the peaches. Spread half of the batter into the baking dish and top with half of the peach slices. Spoon the remaining batter over the peaches and top with the remaining peaches. Sprinkle with the cinnamon and bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream or freshly whipped cream. Enjoy!

Melt marshmallow creme in small saucepan over low heat. Remove from heat. Add evaporated milk and stir with a wire whisk until smooth. Add sugar. Stir until dissolved. Add chocolate chips and peanut butter. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla extract. Add melted butter. Stir until melted. Pour into 9 x 9 pan greased with cooking spray. Cool. Cut into 1 1/2 inch squares.

Slice potatoes in half. Boil potatoes until tender. Drain potatoes and return to pot. Add creamed soup, milk, kielbasa and seasonings. Mix well. Add the sliced onions to the potato mixture. Mix well. Transfer potato mixture to a baking dish. Sprinkle potatoes with additional seasonings. Bake in the oven until the top of the potatoes is browned and crispy. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

1. In a large stock pot bring apple juice and water to a boil over medium heat. 2. Add apples, raisins and cinnamon. Stir occasionally. Brandy can be added to taste. 3. Cook covered for 10 minutes. Stir and check for doneness. 4. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

Melt the brown and white sugars in a large pot over medium heat. Stir in corn syrup and butter until it starts to boil. Add salt. Continue cooking until mixture reaches 230f. Remove from heat. Add the vanilla and the baking soda and stir until the mixture is thick and foamy. Dip popcorn into the caramel. Stir in the pecans. Spread the caramel onto the parchment paper. Let cool. Store in an airtight container.

In a large bowl mix self-rising flour, sugar, cayenne powder and salt. In another bowl whisk together sunflower oil and buttermilk. Whisk mustard powder into buttermilk mixture. Add dry mixture to wet mixture and stir until combined. Stir in cheese. Fill muffin tin 2/3 full and bake for 25 minutes at 375 degrees. Enjoy!

Melt chocolate in double boiler over simmering water. Add wax. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat and add powdered sugar. Stir well. Dip each rice krispie in the melted chocolate and roll in powdered sugar. Place on wax paper. Refrigerate until firm. Melt remaining chocolate and add chips. Dip the balls in the chocolate and place on wax paper to set.
Mix cottage cheese, jello and cool whip until smooth. Stir in pineapple and orange segments. Fold in nuts and cherry.

Put strawberries in bottom of glass. Add heavy whipping cream. Add sweet chocolate. Cover with powdered sugar. Add vanilla and top with more powdered sugar. You can add a little whipped cream if you like.

Cut apple into thin slices. Place in a bowl. Mix cinnamon in to the apple. Cut bread in half. Spread the butter on the bread. Put a slice of apple on one slice of bread. Top apple slice with a slice of cheese. Top the apple slice with the other slice of bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Separate crescent roll dough into triangles and lay on a greased baking sheet. Bake according to package directions until golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes. Spread each triangle with 1 Tbsp thousand island dressing. Top with 1 tsp sauerkraut and 1 Tbsp shredded cheese. Roll up each crescent dough triangle and place seam side down on a greased baking sheet. In a small bowl combine egg and waterbrush lightly over each crescent ring. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle each ring with 1 tsp parsley and 1 tsp minced garlicserve warm.

Mix Worcestershire sauce, vinegar and water in large skillet. Add pepper and salt. Add steaks to skillet and cook until meat is done to your liking. Turn steaks over occasionally to brown evenly. Serve with vegetables or mashed potatoes.

Add all the dried fruits to a bowl and soak overnight in apple cider. Drain next morning. Add honey and cinnamon and stir. Add enough apple cider to just cover the fruit. Place in a large saucepan over medium heat and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir frequently until the fruit is tender. Stir in the lemon juice and cook for 5 minutes more. Serve warm or at room temperature. Can be refrigerated for a few days or frozen for up to 2 months.

Cook potatoes in boiling salted water until tender (about 20 minutes). Drain well and set aside to cool slightly. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise. Peel potatoes and cut into cubes (about 2 cups). Put potatoes in large bowladd vinegar, oil, salt, pepper, sugar, water and hot brothtoss gently to combine. Place potato salad in a large serving bowlsprinkle with chives. Serve warm or cold.

Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Drop wonton wrappers into the hot oil one at a time. Fry for about 30 seconds until the bottoms are golden brown. Flip over and fry another 30 seconds. Place onto paper towels to drain. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and kosher salt to taste. Serve immediately with soy sauce for dipping.

Peel the sweet potatoes. Cut them into bite size pieces. Place them in a large pot of salted water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Let the sweet potatoes simmer until tender. Drain them. Cut the apples into bite size pieces. In a large mixing bowl, combine the honey and the oil. Add the honey mixture to the potatoes. Stir until evenly combined. Add the apple pieces. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix to combine. Cover the bowl. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Dust both sides of steaks with flour. Heat oil in large skillet. Brown steaks on both sides. Set aside. In the same pan add the garlic powder and onion. Cook for about five minutes. Add tomato sauce. Simmer for about five minutes. Add steaks. Cook until tender. Sprinkle with mushrooms and seasonings. Cover. Reduce heat to low. Cook for about 35 minutes. Makes about eight servings. Serves two to four people.

Cook elbow macaroni according to package directions. Drain. Mix together salsa and taco seasoning. Pour over cooked elbow macaroni. Add cheese and stir until completely combined. Sprinkle with green onion. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in skillet and cook onion and celery until tender. Add peas and mushroomscook and stir until tender. Combine soup and milkheat to boilingadd peas mixture. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until heated through. Stir in pimientosserve hot.
Dice tomatoes. Add olive oil. Sprinkle with a little lemon juice and a little dijon mustard. Add salt to taste. Add olives. Add tomatoes. Add lettuce leaf. Serve on a lettuce leaf.

Combine flours. Add yeast and herbs. Make a well in the center and add water. Knead with spoon until smooth and elastic. Form into a ball and place in a bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for 30 minutes. Remove plastic wrap and punch down. Turn onto a well-floured surface and knead until smooth. Divide into 4 equal balls. Roll each ball out into a circle. Put on a lightly oiled baking sheet. Top with sun-dried tomato and pizza sauce. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 425 for about 10 minutes or until golden brown.

Peel and chop all vegetables. Place in a large saucepan. Add salt. Cover with 1-inch water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Drain. Mash with a potato masher or large spoon until smooth. Add more water as needed. Add butter. Stir. Makes 4 servings. Serve hot. Yield is estimated.

Preheat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the rice, stirring to coat with 1 tbsp of olive oil. Cover with a lid and cook for 1 minute. Stir rice then cook for another minute. Add 1 cup of water and 1/2 tsp salt. Cover again and reduce heat to low. Cook for 50-55 minutes until all liquid is absorbed. While rice is cooking, saute the remaining 2 tbsp of oil with onions. Add thyme. Cook for 2 minutes. Add remaining vegetables. Cook for 1 minute. Add broth. Cook for 1 minute or until vegetables are tender crisp. Add the rice. Stir. Cover. Cook for 3 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh ground black pepper. Serve.

Mix cake mix according to package directions. Add egg to cake mix and stir until mixed. Spread batter into a 9 x 13 pan. Bake at 350 for about 35 minutes. While the cake is baking mix the whipped topping. When cake is done let cool. Add the whipped topping and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Slice almonds in half lengthwise. Cut celery into thin slices. Place celery slices in a bowl and add sherry wine. Cover and chill for at least one hour. Just before serving, drain celery in a colander and pat dry with paper towel. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Saute celery and almonds in butter until just tender, about 1 minute. Sprinkle celery with salt and pepper and serve warm.

Wash and pat dry chicken breast with paper towel. Drain well in colander. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes and place in 8 x 8 x 2 baking dish. Add chicken stock and 1 can of low-fat cream of chicken soup. Bring to a boil in 200 degree oven. Cover with lid and cook in 200 degree oven for 35 minutes. Remove lid and cook for 5 more minutes. Turn off oven and leave chicken in oven for 15 more minutes or until chicken is cooked through and dumplings are cooked. Add egg substitute and milk and stir well. Pour mixture into a large baking dish. Using 2 spoons, drop dumplings into liquid. Cook for 10 minutes in 200 degree oven or until dumplings are cooked through and bubbly. Makes 6 servings.

Combine candy coating with shortening in double boiler over barely simmering water. Stir until melted and smooth. Remove from heat. Stir in peppermint oil until blended. Dip one cracker at a time into chocolate mixture allowing excess to drip back into pan. Tap cookie onto wax paper to remove excess chocolate mixture. Repeat with remaining crackers. Let stand until firm.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the onion and sweet bell pepper until tender. Add the beans and tomato sauce and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes. Stir in the rice and cook for 2 more minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper and add the bacon and coriander. Cook until the rice is heated through, about 10 minutes more. Serve hot.

Add the egg yolk to a bowl of a mixer. With the whisk attachment, beat the egg yolks at high speed for thirty seconds. With the whisk attachment running at medium speed, add the mustard, white pepper, sunflower oil, lemon juice. Add the mixture to a jar with a lid. Cover and keep in the refrigerator for a few days. When ready to use, shake the jar vigorously for ten seconds to emulsify the mayonnaise. Serve with sliced ham.

Slice tomato, green pepper, yellow pepper and zucchini into 1 inch pieces. Add to a large salad bowl along with red onion and garlic cloves. Mix Italian dressing and Italian cheese blend with tomato juice and pour over salad. Gently mix dressing with vegetable mixture and let marinate in refrigerator for several hours or overnight. Mix in basil just before serving.

Stir together raisin bran cereal and whole wheat flour. Set aside. In large bowl, beat butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat well. Add reserved raisin bran mixture and combine. Fold in flour. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets. Bake in 375 degree F. oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 1 minute before removing from cookie sheets to wire racks to cool completely.

Beat eggs and water until combined. Beat in half and half cream and vanilla. Add salt and sugar. Beat until well blended. Whisk together the flour and baking powder. Add to egg mixture. Mix just until combined. Pour into an 8 x 8 baking dish. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. (May be made 1 day ahead). Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Bake for 30 minutes. Let cool slightly. Meanwhile beat butter until smooth. Spread over blintz mixture. Cut into 8 squares. Serve with warm berry sauce.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Heat a small nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook the ham until it is no longer pink. Stir in the green onions. Cook until tender. Place a flour tortilla in the center of a greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Place a layer of the ham mixture down the center. Add a layer of cheese. Roll up the tortilla. Place the burritos seam side down in the baking dish. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Top each with a dollop of the tabasco sauce. Serve hot.

In a crockpot combine yellow onions and garlic with roast. Pour 2 cups of water and soy sauce over roast. Place lid on top of crockpot. Set to low for 4 hours. After 4 hours add 1 cup water and 2 cups strong coffee. Cook for one more hour. Once roast is done, remove it from crockpot. Place roast onto cutting board. With two forks pull meat apart into shreds. Place meat back into crockpot. Add cornstarch to mixture and mix together. Cook for 30 minutes. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Peel leek and slice. Wash and peel potatoes. Dice cauliflower. Saute leek and potatoes in butter. Add cauliflower and cook 4 minutes. Season with salt and white pepper. Place potato mixture in a 9x13 glass dish. Add milk and cook 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Puree soup with a hand blender. Transfer puree to a pot and heat. Add walnut oil and simmer 10 minutes. Serve.
Combine all ingredients into a large sauce pan. Bring to a boil. Cook until thickened. Remove from heat. Serve over grilled chicken or shrimp.

Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Pour into a 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

In a large bowl or mixer beat butter, Splenda brown sugar blend and Splenda sugar blend for baking until fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Mix in vanilla. In a medium bowl combine flour, cinnamon and oats. Gradually add to butter mixture alternating with milk. Drop by teaspoonful onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on cookie sheet for 1 minuteremove to wire rack to cool completely. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Clean and dry the bell peppers. Remove the stem end and hollow out the bell peppers. Fill each bell pepper with 1/4 cup ricotta cheese and 1/4 cup feta cheese. Place the bell peppers in an oven-proof baking dish. Sprinkle the top of each filled bell pepper with about 1/4 teaspoon of grated Parmesan cheese. Mix together egg yolks and fresh ground black pepper. Brush the egg yolk mixture evenly over the bell peppers. Sprinkle with oregano leaves and fresh parsley. Place in the oven and bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until the bell peppers are tender. Serve with pine nuts and additional grated cheese.

Mix juice, soy sauce, brown sugar and mustard in large glass or ceramic container (glass will prevent container from sticking to food). Place beef in marinadecover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 4 to 6 hours. Remove beef from marinadepat dry with paper towels. Grill over medium-high heat or broil 6 to 8 minutes for medium-rareturn when done. Prep time is an approximation.

Bring 4 quarts of water to boil in a large pot. Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil, and then add 1 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper. Add pasta and cook according to package directions. Drain. Meanwhile, combine garlic and 2 tablespoons olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Cook for 1 minute. Add lemon juice and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook for 1 minute. Add basil and squash. Cook for 2 minutes. Add pasta and cook for 1 minute. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 325f. Line an 8-inch square baking dish with wax paper. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Add sugar and beat until stiff. Fold in vanilla. Add cream of tartar and beat until stiff. Fold in pudding. In a large bowl, beat egg whites until stiff. Fold in sugar. Add instant pudding mix and beat until stiff. Fold in milk. Fold in pudding. Fold in bananas. Fold in graham cracker squares. Pour into prepared baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Refrigerate overnight. Turn out onto serving plate. Peel bananas. Slice bananas diagonally into pieces. Arrange pieces around edges of meringue.
Brown pork in large skillet. Drain off grease. Add all other ingredients. Cook over low heat until thickened. Add more water as necessary. Makes about 10 cups. Serve with spaghetti.

Rinse duck and pat dry with paper towels. Season with salt and pepper. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil. Add duck and cook about 3 minutes per side or until cooked through. Transfer to a plate. Place skillet over medium-high heat. Add remaining olive oil. Add asparagus. Cook 4 minutes or until tender-crisp. Add potato and cook 1 minute. Add balsamic vinegar and cook 1 minute or until balsamic vinegar is reduced and caramelized. Transfer to a plate. Place duck and asparagus on a large platter. Top with mesclun and radicchio. Serve immediately with your favorite bread.

Combine the coffee, chocolate syrup and mint extract in a small saucepan over low heat. Whisk the cocoa powder into the mixture. Once the cocoa is melted and combined with the chocolate syrup and coffee mixture, pour the mixture into your favorite mugs. Top each mug with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

Put oil flavored cooking spray on baking sheet and put popcorn on baking sheet in single layer. Sprinkle popcorn generously with nutritional yeast. Mix chili powder, salt, garlic powder and onion powder together and sprinkle on popcorn. Toss together until well covered. Bake for 20 minutes. Stir popcorn every 5 minutes or so until it is crispy, but not burned. Remove from oven and cool on baking sheet for 10 minutes or so until it is cool enough to handle. Store in an air-tight container.

In large bowl, beat butter and sugar together until fluffy. Add egg and beat well. Add vanilla and salt and beat well. Add flour gradually and mix well. Roll dough into balls. Place 2 inches apart on baking sheets. Flatten slightly with a fork dipped in flour. Bake at 350f for 10 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Cool on rack for 5 minutes before removing to cooling rack. Makes 4 dozen.
Dip chicken breasts into broth. Dip into corn flakes. Bake at 375 for 35-40 minutes.

Peel apples. Cut out the core. Slice into 1/2 inch slices. Place apples in a large mixing bowl. Add sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg and lemon zest. Mix well. Add butter, lard, salt and cold water. Mix well. Fill a 9 inch pie pan. Cover edges. Bake at 425 degrees for 20 minutes. Reduce temperature to 350 degrees and bake for another 45 minutes. Let cool before cutting.

Combine cumin, garlic salt and chili powder in a zip-lock bag. Add the chicken to the bag and turn to coat. Marinate for 24 hours. Remove from marinade and cook on grill or under the broiler for about 10 minutes on each side until cooked through. Serve over rice or quinoa with a green salad.

Spray an 11 x 7 baking dish with cooking spray. In a bowl mix the chocolate cake mix with coconut flakes, pecans and walnuts. Place one third of the cake batter into the baking dish. In a small bowl beat the cream cheese until fluffy. Stir in the powdered sugar. Spread half of the cream cheese mixture onto the cake batter. Sprinkle the remaining chocolate cake batter onto the cream cheese mixture. Spread the remaining cream cheese mixture onto the top of the cake batter. In a small bowl beat 1/4 cup softened butter until light and fluffy. Spread the butter mixture onto the chocolate cake batter. Sprinkle with the remaining pecans and walnuts. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 50 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes. Remove from the baking dish. Invert onto a serving platter. Serve with whipped cream if desired.

Preheat oven to 325. Brown the butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the diced onions and saute 10 minutes. Add the sliced tomatoes and continue to saute 10 minutes more. Remove from the heat and season with salt and pepper. In a large bowl combine the eggs, half-and-half and the browned butter and saute mixture. Stir in the chopped parsley. Cook over medium heat in a non-stick skillet until set. Serve warm.

In a large bowl, combine biscuit mix, onions, garlic clove, eggs, green chilies and cheese. Stir to combine. In a large frying pan, heat vegetable oil over medium heat until hot. Sauté onion until tender. Add zucchini and cook until tender. Stir green chili mixture into oil with vegetables, then add salt to taste. Transfer to a baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes or until set and lightly browned.

Cream sugar and shortening until fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, blending well after each addition. Add almond extract. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and saltadd alternately with milk to creamed mixture. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto well-greased cookie sheets. Bake 12-14 minutes at 400f. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pans to wire rackscool completely. Fill cherries with filling in centerplace one cherry in center of each macaroon half. Makes 24 cookies.
Prepare pizza crust according to package instructions. Spread pesto sauce on crust. Layer onions, spinach, sun dried tomatoes and feta cheese. Bake according to package instructions.

Place brisket in a large slow cooker, on a rack. In a bowl combine carrots, potatoes, onion and garlic. Place in slow cooker. In a small bowl combine thyme, black pepper, salt and beef broth. Pour over brisket mixture in slow cooker. Add cabbagestir to coat all ingredients in broth mixture. Cook on high 8 to 9 hours or on low 8 to 9 hours until beef is tender. Transfer to a plattercut into thin slices. Serve over mashed potatoes or rice.
Combine all the ingredients in a food processor or blender. Blend until smooth. Use as a marinade for meat or as a dressing for salad. This is delicious!

Preheat the oven to 450f. Cut the pork loin in half lengthwise. Sprinkle the inside of the loin halves with salt and pepper. In a bowl, combine the dijon mustard, herbes de provence, and garlic. Rub the mustard mixture evenly over the inside of the pork loin halves. Place the loin halves on a rack in a roasting pan. Place the roasting pan in the preheated oven. Roast for 30 minutes. Baste the loin halves with the fat that has accumulated in the roasting pan. Continue to roast for 45 minutes. Remove the roasting pan from the oven. Brush the pork loin halves with pan juices. Increase the temperature to 475f. Place the roasting pan back in the oven. Roast for 5 minutes longer. Transfer the roasting pan to a wire rack to rest for 5 minutes. Cut the pork loin into thin slices.

Peel the potatoes and cut into fries. Mix the garlic, chili powder, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Dip the fries into the mixture and then into the vegetable oil. Fry the fries until they are golden brown. Serve with a squeeze of fresh lime.

Melt the bacon in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and scallion. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in the tomato paste and cumin. Cook for 30 seconds, stirring constantly. Stir in the beans and water. Bring to a boil. Add the bouillon cubes. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer for 1 hour or until the beans are tender. Stir in the cilantro. Season to taste. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 425F. In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil on medium-high heat. Add shrimp and saute for about 5 minutes or until golden brown on both sides. Remove and drain on a paper-towel lined plate. In a large bowl, whisk together flour and eggs. Add in breadcrumbs and shrimp and toss to coat well. Place coated shrimp in a greased shallow baking dish and cover with mozzarella and parmesan cheese. Bake at 425F for about 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and shrimp is heated through. Serve over hot cooked pasta or zucchini noodles for a low carb option. Top with fresh parsley and serve with additional sauce if desired.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, stir together beans, 1/4 cup water, vinegar, and 1/4 teaspoon of the pepper flakesbring to a simmer and cook until beans are tender, about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, in a large skillet over medium heat, stir together oil, red onion, garlic clove, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon of pepper flakessaute until onion begins to soften, about 10 minutes. Add beans to skilletstir in cilantro and remaining 1/4 cup water. Simmer 10 minutes longerseason with salt and pepper. In a medium bowl, toss peaches with remaining 1 tablespoon oilseason with salt. Grill peaches over medium heat until they begin to soften, turning occasionally, about 10 minutes. Cut peaches in half lengthwisediscard pits. Transfer to serving plates and spoon beans over topgarnish with remaining cilantro leaves.

Put the oats, flour, coconut, sugar and sesame seeds into a large bowl. Add the margarine and golden syrup. Stir until thoroughly mixed. Add the bicarbonate of soda. Stir again. Make a well in the centre of the mixture. Pour the water into the well. Stir until the mixture is stiff. Turn the mixture out onto a floured surface. Knead lightly until smooth. Roll out into a rectangle about 5mm thick. Cut into fingers or 6cm x 4.5cm rounds. Place the biscuits onto a greased baking sheet. Flatten slightly with the back of a spoon. Bake for 15-20 minutes until firm. Remove from the oven. Allow the biscuits to cool for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.

Place 1/2 cup of ice cream and 1 cup strawberries on bottom of 12-inch platter. Top with pineapple and repeat layers. Top with remaining ice cream and strawberries. Drizzle with 2 tablespoons of the jam and sprinkle with coconut. Cover with plastic wrap and freeze until serving time.

Cut a 3" x 5" piece of brown paper and fold in half. Cut a 2" x 4" slit down one end of paper. Place a 5 lb ham in a large baking dish. Sprinkle dry mustard over ham. Pour root beer over ham. Sprinkle cloves and cinnamon stick over ham. Place orange juice and zest over ham. Place orange rind over ham. Pour steak sauce over ham. Cover and bake for 2 hours.

Peel cucumbers and cut them into pieces. Put them in a bowl and mix with salt and sugar. Pour vinegar over the mixture and cover it with plastic wrap. Let it sit for 12 hours in the fridge. Taste it and add more salt and/or vinegar if needed.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a medium saucepan, combine the vinegar, water, lemon extract, and sugarbring to a boil. In a large bowl, combine the flour and the egg yolksgradually add the hot liquid to the yolk mixture, beating constantly. Pour the mixture into a large bowl, cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and refrigerate overnight or at least 6 hours. Beat the mixture well before using. Roll out the pie dough and place a round of it into each of four unbaked pie shells. Pour the filling into the pie shells. Place the pies in the preheated oven for about 40 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Let cool before serving.

Put cornstarch in medium saucepan. Add milk and sugar and heat to boiling over medium heat. Cook 2 minutes more stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in cocoa and margarine until smooth. Stir in vanilla and pour into prepared pudding cups or individual servings of pudding. Let cool and serve.

Clean chops by removing any silver skin and any fatty parts of the chops. Place chops in a shallow dish and drizzle with soy sauce and plum preserves (or plum jam). Cover and refrigerate at least one hour or overnight. Preheat the broiler and broil on both sides for about 8 minutes or until done. Serve with steamed rice and sauteed vegetables.
Wash and stem the peaches. Place them and the rest of the ingredients in the slow cooker. Cook for 4 to 5 hours. Serve hot or cold.

Pour 3/4 cup boiling hot water over 1 package (8 ounces) sugar-free strawberry gelatin. Stir to dissolve gelatin completely. Cool until gelatin is soft but not set. Fold in lemon juice and pineapple juice. Place in refrigerator until firm. Cut 4 bananas lengthwise and remove seeds with a spoon. Cut crosswise 1/4-inch thick and add to gelatin mixture. Fold in 1-1/2 cups sugar-free 7-up and 1/2 cup strawberry syrup. Stir until well blended. Pour into a large serving bowl and garnish with 4 strawberries and 2 maraschino cherries per serving. Refrigerate until serving time. Serves 8 to 10.

Combine rhubarb and sugar in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cook for 5 minutes. Add water and cornstarch and bring to a boil. Cook for 2 minutes. Pour into a baking pan. Place berry in the center. Pour hot water into pan. Bake at 325 until bubbly and custardy. Serve warm with whipped cream.

In a large skillet or Dutch oven heat butter and oil over medium-high heat. Add pork chops to pan. Cook 2 minutes per side until browned. Transfer to a plate. Add apples to pan. Cook 3 minutes per side. Return pork to pan with apples. Add lemon juice, soy sauce and honey. Cover pan. Cook over medium-low heat 5 minutes or until apples are tender. Add garlic. Cook 30 seconds more. Transfer to a plate. Serve pork with apples.

Cut broccoli and cauliflower into florets. Cut shallots into slivers. Rinse broccoli and cauliflower. In a large bowl, whisk together orange juice, shallot slivers, orange juice, orange juice, orange juice, orange juice, orange juice, orange juice. In a large pan over medium heat, heat extra virgin olive oil. Add broccoli and cauliflower. Season with salt. Cook until tender. Add orange juice mixture. Cook until liquid evaporates. Sprinkle with scallions.
In a pitcher combine all the sangria ingredients. Stir to blend. Let stand at least 1 hour before serving over ice.

In a large frying pan brown the beef over med/hi heat. Drain fat and add the onions, tomatoes, okra, worchestershire sauce, creole seasoning and water. Cook for 30 mins over med/hi heat. Stir in rice for last 5 mins or so.

Slice zucchini lengthwise and then slice each half of zucchini into thin strips. Mix flour with garlic and seasoned dry bread crumbs. Dip zucchini strips in beaten egg and then coat with mixture of flour and garlic. Heat olive oil in fry pan over medium heat. Add zucchini strips and fry for about 2 minutes per side. Drain on paper towel and season with soy sauce. Serve warm with ranch dressing.

Preheat oven at 350. Grease a casserole dish with a non stick cooking spray. In a large bowl combine cottage cheese and spinach. Add soy sausage and cooked green onions. Stir in eggs and season with salt and pepper. Place in the prepared casserole dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle mozzarella cheese evenly over the top. Place back in the oven and bake for 5-10 minutes. Let stand for 5-10 minutes before serving.

Boil noodles in a large pot of salted water. Drain. To noodles add the eggs beaten with a pinch of salt and 1/2 teaspoon of sugar. Mix eggs with noodles. To this mixture add 3 tablespoons of oil. Mix again. Add a pinch of ground black pepper. Mix again. Place a sheet of parchment paper on a baking sheet. Spread mixture over paper to a thickness of 1/4 to 1/2 inch. Roll up paper tightly. Bake for about 1 hour or until mixture has puffed up and is golden brown. Cool and cut into 12 servings.
Put all of the fruit juices into a large pitcher or punch bowl. Stir the sugar into the water. Stir the fruit into the mixture. Pour into ice-filled glasses.

Cut flank steak into thin strips. Dice the carrot and cut the snow peas into thin strips. Cook pasta according to package directions. In a large pot combine steak, carrots and snow peas with water and the gravy mix. Bring to a boil and add soy sauce and hot sauce. Cook for one minute. Drain pasta and add to stew. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Mix beef, tomatoes (including juice), egg, breadcrumbs, salt, pepper, oregano, onion, bacon in bowl until all ingredients are moistened. Shape into 2 inch meatballsroll in breadcrumbs. Fry in a few inches of boiling oil for about 5 minutes until golden brown. Remove from oil with a slotted spoon & drain on paper towels. Serve with sour cream on the side for dipping.

Preheat oven to 350. Sift together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. Beat in oil. Add vanilla. Beat in egg and milk. Fold in chocolate chips. Pour into two greased and floured 9x13 pans. Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool. Cut into squares. Frost with frosting of your choice.

Cook noodles according to package directions. In a large skillet brown turkey bacon pieces. Drain. In a large bowl combine noodles, turkey bacon and the cheddar cheese. Add sour cream and blend well. Top with cheddar cheese and onions.

Trim the fat from the meat and slice into 4 or 5 portions. In a large pan on the stove heat the butter and sauté the carrots and onion until tender. Add the garlic and herbs and sauté until fragrant. Place the beef in the pan and brown. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to the boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes or until the meat is tender.

Add rosemary, garlic and oil to a pan. Cook on low heat until oil is heated through and rosemary is fragrant. Add honey, vinegar and salt and pepper. Turn heat up slightly and bring mixture to a boil. Add button mushrooms and simmer for 8-10 minutes. Remove from heat and serve.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, bring cream to a simmer. Reduce heat to medium lowsimmer 8 to 10 minutes. Add saltwhisk in egg yolks until blended. Remove from heatwhisk in vanilla extract. Divide mixture among 4 to 6 1/2-cup ramekins. Cover each ramekin with a piece of plastic wrapmake a small hole in center of wrap. Poke a small hole in center of plastic wrap. Place ramekins in a baking pan. Pour enough boiling water into pan to come halfway up side of ramekins. Bake 350 degrees about 20 minutes or until cream is just set. Remove pots from water bathlet stand 10 minutes. Transfer each ramekin to a serving plate. Serve warm.
In a heavy bottomed pan melt butter. Add brown sugar and stir until combined. Add heavy cream and hazelnut extract and stir until combined. Heat until bubbling. Pour over ice cream.

On 2 english muffin halves spread 1/3 cup no-salt-added tomato sauce and 2 tablespoons part-skim mozzarella cheese. Top with 3 slices fresh basil leaves and 3 halves grape tomatoes. Broil 4 to 6 minutes or until cheese melts and english muffin is toasted.

Bring broth to a boil in a medium saucepan. Cook fettucini according to package directionsdrain and place in a large bowl. Add the carrot and broccoli to the boiling broth and cook for 3 minutes or until tender crispdrain and add to the bowl with pasta. Mix in the parmesan cheese and parsley. In a small bowl, whisk the dressing and stir into the pasta mixture. Sprinkle with basil and serve immediately.

Wash potatoes. Rub with oil. Season with salt and pepper. Roast in 400 degree oven for 1 hour or until tender. Remove from oven and cool. Peel potatoes. Chop potatoes into medium pieces. Stir together potatoes with 1/4 cup oil. Stir in oregano. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

In a large bowl, beat together butter, sugar, egg and vanilla. Add dry ingredients. Stir in popcorn. Form dough into balls. Roll balls into popped popcorn. Place balls onto baking sheets. Bake at 350 degrees 10-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool 5 minutes. Melt semisweet chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl. Dip each cookie into melted chocolate. Place chocolate side down onto waxed paper. Sprinkle each with pecans. Let stand at least 20 minutes.

Bring 1/2 cup water to a boil in medium skillet. Add chicken breasts. Cook for 5 minutes. Drain. Remove chicken from skillet. Place chicken breasts back into skillet. Add chicken stove top stuffing mix. Stir until thoroughly combined. Place chicken breasts in a greased 2-quart baking dish. Add condensed cream of chicken soup. Stir until well blended. Pour sour cream evenly over the top of the chicken breasts. Sprinkle with frozen mixed vegetables. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine flour and salt in a large bowl. Stir in potatoes. Pour milk over mixture. Let stand for 10 minutes. Add cheese and stir to combine. Pour into a greased 11x9in. Baking pan. Sprinkle with pepper. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with onions.

In a pan add ghee and keep on low flame. Add cardamom powder and fennel seeds to ghee and keep stirring for few seconds. Now add sugar and mix well. Add milk and keep stirring until sugar dissolves. Add plain flour and mix well. Keep stirring continuously until mixture becomes sticky. Take a small ball of dough and roll it between palms. Put a small ball of ghee in center of ball and pinch together to make a ball. Roll this ball on rolling pin to give it a round shape. Deep fry in hot oil until golden brown. Serve hot with sugar and cardamom powder.

Bake potatoes in a 400-degree oven until tender. Remove from oven and cool. Peel and cube. Dice bacon. Peel onions. Cube onions. Cook bacon. Combine bacon with potatoes, vinegar, water, sugar, salt, parsley and pepper. Chill. Makes 10 servings.

Combine plum jam and vinegar in large saucepan. Bring to boil, stirring. Add onion powder, ginger powder, garlic salt and allspice. Boil 15 minutes. Reduce heat and simmer until plums are soft. Stir in water. Makes 1 cup.

Combine the chicken breasts and garlic cloves in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Drain the peaches. Cook the orzo according to directions. Add chicken to the pan with the garlic cloves. Cook over medium-high heat for about 2-3 minutes. Add the wine. Stir frequently until the alcohol has evaporated. Add the peaches. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the onion. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the peaches, onion, red bell pepper, water and the orzo. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir frequently. Reduce the heat to low. Cook for 15-20 minutes. Add the olive oil. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the salt substitute. Stir frequently. Cook for 1-2 minutes. Stir frequently. Transfer to serving dishes.

Prepare a custard using egg yolks, half-and-half, 1/2 cup of sugar, and 1/2 cup of whiskey. Fold egg whites into mixture until stiff peaks form. Fold egg yolks into mixture to make a custard. In a separate saucepan bring half-and-half and water to a boil. Add evaporated milk to half-and-half mixture, whisk until well blended. Fold in custard mixture. Allow to cool before adding whiskey. Chill thoroughly before serving.

Heat oil over medium-high heat and add onion and bell pepper. Cook until soft and tender. Add the ground beans. Cook over medium heat for about 15 minutes or until beans are soft and most of the liquid has evaporated. Add chipotle pepper sauce and season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Scoop the beans into a bowl. Crumble the cheese over the bowl and sprinkle with the chopped cilantro. Top with tortilla chips. You can also use whole wheat tortilla chips.

Prepare asparagus. Trim the ends of the asparagus. Cut the asparagus into 1 inch segments. Remove the tough ends. Cook the asparagus in a saucepan of boiling water for 2 minutes. Transfer the asparagus to a large bowl of ice water. Drain. Pat the asparagus dry with paper towels. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Whisk the cream into the melted butter. Cook the sauce, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Add the fontina. Cook until melted and the sauce is thickened. Remove from heat. Whisk in the parmesan. Stir in the asparagus. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in pan over medium heat. Add garlic and coarse black pepper to oil and stir to combine. Cook for 2 minutes or until garlic is lightly browned and fragrant, being careful not to burn. Add lemon juice and stir to combine. Add salt to taste. Add capellini and stir to combine. Cook for 2-4 minutes or until al dente. Remove from heat and stir in parmesan cheese and basil leaves until combined. Serve immediately.

In a skillet heat the olive oil and garlic paste over medium heat. Add the beef and brown on one side. Add the shallot and stir in the red wine vinegar and the balsamic vinegar. Cook over low heat stirring occasionally. Add the arugula and cook for 2 minutes until it wilts. Serve over the beef. Enjoy!

Cook macaroni according to package directions and stir in cheese mix as directed. Drain. In a large skillet, cook ground beef and onion over medium heatdrain. Stir in spaghetti saucecook over medium heat until thoroughly heated. Pour into a greased 13x9-in. baking dish. Arrange macaroni in a single layer in prepared dishspoon beef sauce over macaroni. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Butter an 8-by-8-inch square baking pan. Combine the butter, 1 cup granulated sugar, brown sugar, and 2 eggs in a small bowl. In a separate large bowl combine the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. Add the wet ingredients to the dry and mix to combine. Add the vanilla extract. Add the peanut butter to the batter. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Cool completely in the pan. Cut into 9 squares.

Combine condensed milk and ice cubes in a blender and blend until smooth. Add coffee and blend until combined and the ice is broken down. Add the remaining ingredients and blend until combined and the ice is broken down. Serve in a glass with ice.

Preheat oven broiler to high heat. Place 2 broiler-fryer chickens on rack of broiler panspray with cooking spray. Place chickens breast side up on rackseason with salt and pepper. Broil 8-10 minutes or until golden brown and done. Place tomatoes and green peppers on rack of broiler panspray with cooking spray. Broil 6 minutes or until lightly browned. Cut each chicken into 8 piecestransfer meat to platter. Spoon tomato mixture over chicken and peppers. Slice onionsstir onions and garlic clove into tomato mixture with ham. Broil 3 minutes or until vegetables are tender-crisp and onions are tender. Place chicken on platter with vegetablessprinkle with olives.

Cut pita bread into small cubes and soak in milk. Crumble beef into a large bowl and add the soaked bread cubes and season with salt and pepper and cinnamon. Mix well and form into 4 oval shaped patties. Fry the kofta for about 5 minutes each side until golden brown and remove from the pan. Serve with tomato sauce or catsup and onions.

Heat the oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the chicken breasts and cook until browned on all sides, about 3 minutes per side. Remove the chicken breasts and set aside. Add the onions and cook until translucent and softened, about 3 minutes. Add the tomato paste and cook until fragrant and slightly darkened in color, about 2 minutes. Add the chicken broth and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Whisk in the yogurt and bring to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium low and simmer until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly, about 5 minutes. Season the chicken with salt and pepper and add the chicken to the sauce. Cook until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly, about 3 minutes. Transfer the chicken to a platter and keep warm. Strain the sauce through a fine mesh strainer into a small bowl or a saucepan. Season with salt and pepper and keep warm. Return the sauce

Salt and Pepper. Add turkey legs and cook for 1 hour at 350 degrees. Add black pepper and hot sauce. Cook for 2-3 hours at 225 degrees. Shake container every 30 minutes. Sprinkle sugar and honey over meat. Add sweet onions and seasoning. Continue cooking for 1 hour. Serve with sauce. Reheat before serving. Refrigerate leftovers.

Combine spinach, ricotta cheese, tarragon, 1/4 cup of the cheese, salt and pepper in a food processor until mixture is smooth. Stuff each chicken breast half with 1/3 cup of the cheese mixture (reserving the remaining cheese mixture for another recipe or to use as desired). Place chicken in an ungreased 11x7-in baking dishsprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup cheese. Pour remaining 2 tbsp margarine over chicken. Bake at 350 f for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
Chop strawberry. Squeeze lemon into it. Slice watermelon into small pieces and add to strawberry mixture. Stir in vinaigrette. Toss greens with vinaigrette. Serve with topping.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line an 8 by 8 baking pan with foil. Cut brie into 6 to 8 slices. Place brie in prepared baking pan. Cover with brown sugar and sprinkle with pecans. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake for 7 to 10 minutes. Allow brie to cool slightly. Sprinkle with sour cream and serve.

Remove the stems from the rhubarb. Cut the rhubarb into 2-inch lengths. Put the rhubarb, onions, dates, malt vinegar, 1/3 cup water, 1/4 cup white sugar, salt, ginger, pepper and garlic cloves in a large heavy saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, uncovered, until rhubarb is very soft. Add the remaining 1/4 cup white sugar. Cook until the syrup is thick. Stir in the butter. Transfer the chutney to a bowl. Let cool for 15 minutes. Spoon into a jar or airtight container. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. This is a nice accompaniment to grilled meat.

Brown sausage and onion in skillet. Add scalloped potatoes mix. Stir in water and milk. Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in cayenne pepper and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add frozen mixed vegetables and heat through. Serve over noodles. Makes 2 servings.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan and saute the onion until translucent. Add the steak and cook for about 2 minutes per side. Add the pasta sauce and cook for a further 3 minutes. Add the wine and cook for a further 3 minutes. Add the seasoning and stir in the mushrooms, cook for a further 2 minutes and then add the small shell pasta. Cook for a further 7 minutes and serve.

Cream together the flour, sugar and salt. Mix in the pecans until they are well coated with the flour mixture. Cut the butter into pieces the size of walnuts. Mix the pecan mixture with the cut butter until it is well incorporated. Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a cookie sheet and bake at 325 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until the cookies are a nice golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place a pizza stone on the middle rack of the oven. Heat a small skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic cloves and sauté until fragrant and lightly browned. Remove the garlic cloves from the pan and set aside. Spread the pizza sauce onto the pizza dough. Top with the cheeses and the garlic cloves. Slide the pizza onto the hot pizza stone and bake for 12-15 minutes or until the cheese is bubbling. Remove the pizza from the oven and top with chopped parsley. Cut into slices and serve.
Melt butter in microwave or double boiler. Add cocoa powder and whisk. Add cream cheese and whisk. Add powdered sugar and whisk. Add vanilla extract. Add in cream.

In a small bowl combine oat bran, light cream cheese, vanilla extract, sugar substitute, graham cracker squares, and strawberries. Spoon mixture over oatmeal, stirring to combine well. Top with remaining strawberries.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large skillet cook ground beef over medium heat until no longer pink. Drain fat from the pan. Add the frozen mixed vegetables, condensed cream of mushroom soup, milk, onion powder and black peppercorns. Cook over medium heat for 5 to 8 minutes stirring occasionally until heated through.
