Spread 1 cup of the heated mixture into the bottom of an ungreased 11x7 or 8x8 baking pan. Top with 1 cup of the mashed potatoes. Spread the remaining heated mixture over the potatoes. Sprinkle with 1 cup of the cheese. Cover the pan with foil. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove foil. Top with remaining cheese. Bake for 10 more minutes or until heated through.

Place one artichoke heart in middle of tortilla. Arrange ham slices over artichoke heart. Place two green olives over ham. Roll tortilla with filling and secure with toothpick. Repeat with remaining filling. Place in 9 x 13-inch casserole pan. Refrigerate overnight. Remove from refrigerator about 20 minutes before baking. Sprinkle with peperoncini. Bake at 350 30 minutes.
Bring all items to boil and cook for 15 minutes or until thick. Transfer to an airtight container and refrigerate.

Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Stir in brown sugar and cook for about 1 minute or until sugar is dissolved. Add water. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat stirring frequently. Continue boiling for about 2 minutes or until mixture is reduced by half and thickened. Pour hot mixture over pecan pieces and stir gently until coated. Cool for about 1 minute before placing on waxed paper to cool completely. Store in an airtight container in a cool place for up to 2 weeks.

Trim fat from steaks. Sprinkle with fresh cilantro leaves, jalapeno pepper and garlic clove. Rub with lime juice. Sprinkle with cumin, salt and pepper to taste. Cook on a medium-hot grill for about 8 minutes per side or until steak is cooked to desired doneness.

Preheat the broiler. Lightly coat a 10 inch skillet with cooking spray. Peel and slice the eggplant lengthwise. Place the slices in the skillet and season with salt and pepper. Broil for 10 minutes. Flip the slices over and broil for 10 more minutes or until eggplant is tender. Meanwhile, prepare the sauce. Place 2 1/2 cups marinara sauce in the skillet. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to medium-low. Add the tomato sauce and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in the ricotta cheese and dried basil. Remove from the heat. Place one eggplant slice in each of 8 soup bowls. Spoon 1/4 cup sauce over each serving. Sprinkle with part-skim mozzarella cheese and dried italian seasoning. Top each with one tablespoon of fresh basil. Broil for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Line a 9 x 13 pan with foil or parchment paper so that the foil or paper hangs over the sides of the pan about an inch. Arrange the blueberries in a single layer in the prepared pan, then drizzle with the sour cream. Sprinkle the brown sugar over the blueberries and then dot the vanilla over the blueberries. Bake for 20 minutes until the blueberries are tender and the sauce is thickened and sticky. Cool completely before serving.

Wash potatoes well and put in cold water until tender (about 15 minutes). Drain well. Cut potatoes into cubes and put into a bowl. Cube eggs and add to bowl. Add onion, celery, carrot, radishes, green pea, green onions, horseradish, miracle whip, black pepper (to taste) and mix well. Chill 3-4 hours before serving.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and mash with margarine, onion and pepper. Blend flour and sugar and add to potato mixture. Mix and shape into a ball. Place on cookie sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes. While potatoes are baking, heat white wine and cream together. Add to potatoes and bake until melted. Top with mozzarella cheese and return to oven until cheese melts.

Place the oysters on their backs in an oven dish or shallow baking pan. Bake them for about 5 minutes at 400 degrees to heat them through. Meanwhile, cook bacon in a frying pan until crisp and then drain on paper towels. Chop finely. Add to hot pan, add onion, cook until softened. Stir in spinach until it wilts. Chop parsley finely, add to mixture and stir to combine. Season with salt and tabasco to taste. Pour mixture into oven dish with oysters. Place baking dish on a baking sheet and put in oven. Bake until top is crisp, about 10 minutes. Serve immediately with extra virgin olive oil drizzled on top to garnish.

Peel and grate the potato into a large bowl. Add grated onion and mix. In a separate bowl combine the eggs and flour with a dash of salt and pepper. Add this mixture to the potato and stir well. Heat up the vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Drop tablespoonfuls of the potato mixture into the pan and fry until golden brown. Serve with apple sauce.

Make double crust. Place rhubarb and blueberries in bottom of double crust. Sprinkle sugar on top. Dust flour on top. Sprinkle nutmeg and salt on top. Sprinkle butter on top. Cover with top crust. Bake at 450 for 10 minutes then reduce heat to 350 and cook for 30 minutes or until crust is golden. Serve warm.

In blender or food processor, puree the black beans and add the rotel tomatoes. Add the adobo sauce and the adobo chiles and puree until smooth. Add the onion, dried oregano, cilantro, garlic and lime juice and puree again. Transfer to serving bowl and sprinkle with the feta. Serve with tortilla chips or pita triangles as an appetizer or snack.

In a skillet melt 1/2 cup of butter over medium heat. Sauté green onions for 2 minutes. Add chicken thighs, brown on both sides for 3-4 minutes. Add white wine to deglaze pan. Add mushrooms to pan along with the green onions. Pour water over mushrooms. Place chicken thighs on a plate and cover with foil to keep warm. In a small saucepan add 2 cups of water to 2 cups of artichokes hearts. Boil until artichokes are soft. Add to pan with mushrooms, add chicken back to pan and cook 5-10 minutes until chicken is tender. Add parmesan to pan. Remove from heat and serve with a side of rice or orzo.

In a small saucepan, mix the teriyaki sauce and vermouth. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Pour the sauce over the chicken and marinate at room temperature for 1-3 hours. Grill for about 3 minutes on each side. Pre-heat grill. Rub the bacon with olive oil. Wrap the chicken breast in the bacon. Grill for about 10 minutes. Remove from grill. Place on a serving platter and pour the teriyaki sauce over the chicken. Serve warm.

In a small bowl mix tuna and eggs together. Spread the tuna mixture in a 1-1/2 inch thick layer in the bottom of a 9-inch pie plate. In a medium bowl combine parsley and tomatoes. Spread over the tuna mixture. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 15 to 20 minutes. Top with american and swiss cheeses. Bake for another 10 to 15 minutes. Let cool. Cut into pieces. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Sprinkle salt and pepper over the orange roughy fillets. Place in skillet with melted butter. Cook 6 to 8 minutes on each side until browned. In a small bowl mix mustard and lemon juice. In another bowl mix the worcestershire sauce and garlic. Combine both mixtures in the skillet with the orange roughy fillets. Cover and cook 3 minutes. Sprinkle with the fine dry breadcrumbs and bake 4 minutes at 350f. Serve with rice.

In heavy skillet, brown sausages in hot oil over medium-high heat for 12-15 minutes or until browned and no pink remains. In large bowl, mix together beer, mustard and onion. Add sausages and serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Cut the squash in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds and discard. Place the squash cut side down on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Rub the oil all over the squash. Sprinkle with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper. Place the squash in the oven and roast for about 30 minutes. When the squash is tender, remove it from the oven and place on a cutting board. Cut the squash in half. Rub the halves with the lime juice and fresh rosemary. Sprinkle with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve with a drizzling of butter and extra fresh rosemary if desired. The squash will keep in the refrigerator for several days. The roasted squash will keep for up to five days. If you are making squash soup, reserve the roasted squash for the soup. To make the soup, place the butternut squash in a large pot. Add water or chicken stock to cover the squash. Add the onion and garlic to the

Sift flour and cornmeal together into a large bowl. Whisk together soymilk and maple syrup. Add the soymilk mixture to the dry mixture. Stir until blended. Stir in vegetable oil. Pour batter into a greased and floured 9 x 13 glass baking dish. Bake at 375 degrees f for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Makes 16 servings.

Cook pasta as directed, drain and set aside. Meanwhile, heat oil and garlic clove in a small skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir until garlic is lightly browned and fragrant. Stir in seasonings and set aside. Cook prosciutto in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp and browned. Drain and set aside. Place pasta in a large bowl and stir in oil and seasonings and prosciutto until well coated. Toss with cheese until melted and blended with pasta. Top with fresh parsley and serve immediately.
Pour milk into a tall glass. Add chocolate syrup. Top with vanilla ice cream. Fill glass with club soda. Garnish with whipped cream.

Place sunflower seeds, cornmeal and maple syrup into a blender and process to a thick paste. Add oil and process until smooth and well blended. Add enough water to make a stiff batter (use 2 cups if the batter is too stiff). Pour into a greased 10x15-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Serve hot or cold.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add fava beans to boiling water. Boil until tender but firm to the bite, 10 to 12 minutes. Drain. Combine fava beans, butter, scallions, mint, cumin and cilantro in a blender. Puree until smooth. Transfer to a saucepan. Cook over low heat until slightly thickened. Add oil to pan. Season to taste with salt. Serve.

Slice the avocado in half and remove pit. Scoop the avocado flesh from the skin and mash with the lime juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix the tofu with the soy sauce and sesame oil and then add this mixture to the avocado mixture and combine. Toss the green onions and tomatoes with the tofu and avocado mixture and top with sesame seeds and a drizzle of olive oil.

Combine ground pork, onion, tomatoes, diced tomatoes, mozzarella cheese in mixing bowl. Mix well. Spoon mixture into mushrooms. Spoon mixture into zucchini. Place mushrooms on top of zucchini. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 to 50 minutes.
Combine cranberries and orange juice. Bring to boil and simmer 2 minutes. Stir in grapes and cook for 10 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

Mix all the spices and salt together and rub on the fillets. In a non-stick skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the tilapia fillets and cook about 4 minutes per side. Tilapia is done when it flakes easily with a fork and turns white throughout.

Sandwich: Spread mustard over one side of bread. Place tomato slices on the mustard side of bread. Top with Swiss cheese and honey. Place basil leaves over cheese. Sprinkle with stone ground mustard. Place other side of bread on top. Wrap sandwich in plastic wrap and freeze for 2 hours. Grill sandwich according to manufacturer's directions. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add sandwich. Cook until cheese melts and bread browns. Serve with mayonnaise and aged cheddar cheese on the side.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray a 9 x 9 square pan with cooking spray and set aside. Place bratwurst in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook 10 to 12 minutes or until browned. Drain on paper towels. Discard grease. Cut tops off brats and remove any stuffing. Mix cream of mushroom soup with sour cream and stir until combined. Place brats on a cutting board and gently spread topping over brats. Cover with foil and bake 30 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with cheese. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Place a frozen tater tot on each serving plate. Top with brat. Serve immediately.

Pour popped popcorn and pretzels onto a large platter. Drizzle margarine evenly over popcorn and pretzels. Sprinkle lemon pepper seasoning and then dried oregano leaves and chili powder. Stir to mix well and serve.

Heat skim milk in microwave oven according to package directions until warm (do not boil). Stir in pudding mix until well blended. Let stand for 2 minutes. Fold in raspberries and stir until raspberries are completely coated with pudding mixture. Fold in the drained pound cake and preserves. Cover with whipped topping and sprinkle with cocoa powder and a drizzle of Grand Marnier if desired. Refrigerate until serving time and serve chilled.

Combine butter, sugars and egg. Add vanilla. In another bowl combine flour, salt and baking soda. Add flour mixture to butter mixture. Stir until blended. Stir in chocolate pieces. Roll dough into balls. Roll balls in peanuts. Bake at 375 degrees f for about 10 minutes.

Put eggs in a large non-reactive pot (glass or ceramic). Cover with cold water and bring to a boil over medium heat. Turn off the heat and remove from the heat. Let sit in the pot for 10 minutes. Rinse the eggs under cold running water for about a minute and then drain them well. Return them to the pot. Add the vinegar and bring the pot to a boil over medium high heat, stirring constantly until the vinegar is dissolved. Add the sugar and stir to dissolve it completely. Add the mustard and stir until dissolved. Add the salt and stir until dissolved. Add the celery seed and mustard seed and stir until dissolved. Add the whole cloves and stir until dissolved. Add the onion and stir until the onion is completely covered with the brine. Cover the pot and let the eggs sit overnight in the refrigerator. You can also put the eggs in the pickling solution for a week or two and then put them in the refrigerator for a month before serving them. They are ready when they are a medium yellow color and the eggs are firm and hold their shape.
Wash and trim beans. Boil 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. Combine remaining ingredients. Add beans. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.

Finely chop onion and garlic. Fry in oil until onion is transparent. Add hot chili and cashew nuts. Fry until aromatic. Add lemon juice and soy sauce. Fry for 1 minute. Add palm sugar and ground ginger. Cook for 1 minute. Add chicken and stir to coat. Transfer chicken to a large container and pour the mixture over it. Seal the container and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. In a large wok or saute pan, heat peanut oil over medium-high heat. Stir in the chicken and cook until done. Remove chicken. Stir in the remaining marinade and boil until reduced. Transfer chicken to a serving dish. Pour boiling sauce over chicken.

Combine 1/2 cup brown sugar, curry powder, 1/4 cup corn flake crumbs and 1/4 cup dijon mustard in a resealable bag. Add 1/2 cup of the corn flake crumbs to each of 6 glass pie dishes. Add 1/2 of the brown sugar mixture to each pie dish. Add 2 thighs to each pie dish. Top each with remaining brown sugar mixture. Sprinkle remaining crumbs over each. Bake at 425 degrees for 20 minutes or until brown. Serve with rice pilaf and steamed green beans. Recipe is a favorite of the family. I hope it is a favorite of yours too.

Place chicken breasts in a large glass baking dish or large baking pan. Sprinkle with salt. Pour cooking oil over chicken. Place chicken in the preheated 350 degree oven. Roast for 45 minutes. While chicken is roasting, combine white wine, garlic and lemon juice. Place all but 2 cloves of garlic into a bowl and mix well. Spoon wine mixture over chicken. Sprinkle with remaining 2 cloves of garlic. Bake 10 minutes longer. Serve hot.

Season the pork with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Sprinkle with rosemary sprigs, then rub with the olive oil. Set aside at room temperature for 1 hour. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Place pork loin in the skillet, skin side down and sear for 6-8 minutes or until browned, then turn over the pork to brown the other side. Transfer pork to a 6 to 8-quart Dutch oven or 4 to 5-quart heavy-bottomed pot. Pour off all but 1 tablespoon fat from the skillet and set aside for later use or discard. Pour the vinegar into the skillet with the remaining fat to deglaze the pan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heatreduce heat to medium and simmer until mixture is slightly reduced, about 5 minutes. Transfer the vinegar mixture to the Dutch oven with the pork. Pour the wine over the pork. Cover the Dutch oven tightly with heavy-duty aluminum foilplace the pot on the center rack of the oven

Preheat oven to 350f. In a bowl, stir together margarine, eggs, milk and orange. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder and baking soda. Add orange mixture to flour mixture. Stir in blueberries. Pour batter into 24 greased or paper-lined muffin cups. Bake 25 minutes or until lightly browned.
Combine all ingredients in a shaker over ice and shake until well chilled. Strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with whipped cream.

Cut potatoes lengthwise into quarters. Place on baking sheet and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 45 minutes or until potatoes can be pierced easily with a fork. While potatoes are cooking, heat olive oil in skillet and sauté garlic until fragrant and golden brown, about 1 minute. Add spinach and cook until wilted for about 5 minutes. Drain well. Remove potatoes from oven and let cool. Cut into half-moon slices lengthwise and place them side by side in the baking dish and gently press down the potato slices so they fit snugly together in the dish. Add spinach and garlic mixture to the baking dish and gently press down the potato slices so they fit snugly together in the dish. Mash potatoes with potato masher or fork until smooth. Add cream cheese, butter, milk and salt and pepper and continue mashing until smooth and combined. Transfer mixture back into baking dish and gently press down the potato slices so they fit snugly together in the dish. Cover
In a small bowl, combine the vinegar, honey and mustard. Slowly whisk in the salad oil and salt and pepper to taste.

Sauté the onions and thyme in the oil. Season with salt and pepper. Add the beef stock, beef and bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add the carrots and the beef stock. Add the wine and bring to a boil. Simmer for 3 minutes. Add the flour and stir until smooth. Add the chestnuts and bring to a boil. Simmer for 30 minutes. Serve.

Place the meat in a large Dutch oven or heavy pot. Season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Add the olive oil and heat to medium heat until it just starts to smoke. Add the garlic and onion. Cook until translucent. Add the crushed tomatoes and cook until most of their juices have been absorbed. Add the dried ancho chile powder and cayenne. Cook for another 2 minutes. Add the bay leaves and ground cumin. Add the beef and stir until it is coated in the seasonings. Add enough water to cover by about 2 inches. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook at a gentle simmer for 2 hours. Taste and season with more salt and cayenne to your taste. Serve in soft flour tortillas with chopped fresh cilantro. Serve with sour cream and shredded jack or cheddar cheese.

Preheat broiler. Place chicken thighs in broiler pan. Brush with barbecue sauce. Sprinkle with chili powder, oregano & salt. Broil 5 minutes on each side. Chicken may be made 1 day ahead. Cover with plastic wrap & refrigerate. Reheat in broiler.

In a medium mixing bowl add flour, baking powder and salt and stir. Add eggs and mix until smooth. In a small bowl add cottage cheese and monterey jack cheese and mix well. Add ham and butter to the flour mixture and mix. Pour batter into a 9 inch round baking pan. Sprinkle cheese mixture evenly over the batter. Bake at 400 degrees for 40 minutes. Sprinkle green chilies over the top and bake for 5 more minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before cutting. Serves 6.

In a large saucepan over medium-low heat, melt the butter. Add the chicken broth, wine and parsley. Bring to a simmer. Meanwhile, using a sharp knife, cut the avocado flesh into cubes. When the broth comes to a simmer, add the avocado to the broth. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from the heat. Strain the consomme into a serving pitcher. Sprinkle with freshly chopped parsley. Serve hot or cold. Makes 6 servings.

Cook chorizo sausage in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Stir in frozen potatoes. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Stir in green chilies and tomatoes. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Stir in salsa. Cook and stir for 5 minutes. Spoon mixture into a 9 x13 baking dish. Top with sliced chilies. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Crack eggs over the top. Sprinkle with cilantro and cheddar cheese. Bake for another 5 minutes. Serve immediately with toast.

Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and saute until aromatic. Add 3 cups of warm water and bring to a boil. Add 1 cup of boiling water to 1 cup of cold water to make a total of 6 cups. Add to cumin mixture. Bring to a boil. Add 2 cups of basmati rice. Season with salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until liquid has been absorbed. Fluff rice with a fork. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir ground beef until brown and crumbly, stirring frequently and drain fat. Stir in taco seasoning and diced tomatoes until thoroughly mixedtransfer to large bowl. Stir in cabbage and cheese. Fold in sour cream. Serve in flour tortillas and top each taco with desired condiments and garnishes.

In a small bowl combine curry powder and garlic. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine the whipping cream and 1 cup of the cheese. Set aside. Spread a tablespoon of the curry mixture on one side of the bread slices. Spread 1/2 cup of the cheese mixture on the bread slices and sprinkle with pecans. Top with remaining bread. Cut in half and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Beat eggs and sugar until foamy. Add baking chocolate and stir until melted. Stir in almonds, raisins and flour. Mix in the baking powder. Stir in the milk. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet. Bake 10 to 12 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before removing from the cookie sheets.

Peel peaches. Place them in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with half of the sugar. Sprinkle the flour over the top of the peaches. Sprinkle with the remaining sugar. Sprinkle the nutmeg and cinnamon. Dot with butter. Place in a 350 degree oven for about 30 minutes. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Blend olive oil with carrot and zucchini in a food processor or blender. Add the garlic clove. Blend until smooth. Pour in the cooked pasta and blend until combined. Serve immediately over hot cooked pasta.

Mix the brown sugar and ketchup in a bowl. Add the lean ground beef and mix well. In another bowl, beat the eggs until foamy. Stir the milk into the eggs. Add the salt, ground black pepper and onionmix well. Stir the beef mixture and the eggs into the crumbs and mix well. Form the mixture into a loaf in a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan and bake for about 45 minutes or until a meat thermometer reads about 160 degrees when inserted into the middle of the loaf. Let the meatloaf stand for about five minutes before removing it from the pan.
Sauté the onions and kidney beans in the vegetable broth. Add the remaining ingredients and cook for 5 minutes or until hot. Serve with cornbread.

Follow bread dough instructions on package and shape dough into taco shells. Bake according to dough instructions on package. Heat hamburger and pinto beans according to package directions. Mix taco seasoning according to package directions and add to hamburger and beans. Fill taco shells and serve.

Melt butter in a skillet over low heat. Stir in spinach and cook until wilted. Drain and reserve 1/4 cup of the butter mixture. Set aside. Place eggs into a large bowl and whisk. Add spinach and 1/4 cup butter mixture. Add salt and pepper and 1/2 cup grated cheese. Stir until blended. Fill a 9-inch pie pan with egg mixture. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Lay turkey sausage over cheese. Arrange bell pepper and carrot over sausage. Bake 40 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut bread in half. Spread one half with butter. Sprinkle with prepared mustard and salt and pepper. Place another half on top and press down. Place cheese on top and press down. Crack an egg into the center and season with salt and pepper. Place in the hot oven and bake for 30 minutes or until the egg is cooked.

Cook ground beef with onion until no longer pinkdrain. Combine with pepper sauce, tomato sauce, cottage cheese, cream cheese, sour cream, green bell pepper & green onionspoon into greased casseroletop with noodles. Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until golden brown & heated throughserve immediately. Makes 8 servings.
Place all the ingredients into a slow cooker and cook for 4 to 6 hours on low. Add biscuits and cook for about 30 minutes. Serve with additional biscuits and parsley.

Put soybeans in crock pot and cover with water by 2 inches. Cook on low 6 to 8 hours or until tender. Remove soybeans from crock pot and drain water from crock pot. Return soybeans to crock pot. Mix remaining ingredients in blender or food processor and pour over soybeans in crock pot. Cook on low 2 to 3 hours or until mixture thickens slightly. Makes about 3 cups.

Crack the eggs into a bowl. Remove yolks and add to a medium bowl. Mash yolks using a fork or potato masher. Mix together the mustard, mayonnaise, sweet pickle juice, worcestershire sauce, salt, paprika and cayenne pepper. Fold into yolks until well combined. Spoon yolk mixture back into the eggs. Sprinkle paprika over top. Refrigerate until serving time. (Can be made a day ahead.)
Mix cream cheese and ranch dressing mix. Stir in beer. Add onion and shredded cheddar. Mix until blended. Spread on a plastic tray and refrigerate until firm. Serve with carrot and celery sticks.

Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add butter and melt. Add the onions and cook until softened. Add the squash and cook until tender. Add the soy sauce and cook for one minute. Stir in the cheese and cook until melted. Transfer to a casserole dish. Top with the crumbled bacon. Bake at 325 for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Preheat the oven to 180c/ gas mark 4. Tip the flour and baking powder into a large mixing bowl and add the sugar and bran. Stir in the salt and half the butter. Make a well in the centre and pour in the milk and enough of the remaining butter to make a soft dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently until smooth and elastic. Roll out to a thickness of about 1cm and cut out rounds with a cutter (I use the rim of a saucer). Place the rounds on the baking sheets and bake in the oven for about 15 minutes until well browned. Leave to cool for a few minutes on the tray before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line large baking sheet with foil. Place sausage on baking sheetcook in oven for 20 minutes or until cooked through, stirring often. Remove sausage from ovenset aside to cool slightly. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heatsaute onion for 6 minutes or until tender. Add garliccook for 2 minutes or until fragrant. Add spinachsaute for 4 minutes or until wilted. Stir in mushroomscook for 4 minutes or until tender. Stir in sausageremove from heat. Mix sausage mixture with pizza sauceseason with oregano, basil, salt and pepper to taste. Roll out pizza crust on work surface to a 12 inch squarespread with pizza sauce mixture. Top with mozzarellabake in preheated oven for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Mix whip and milk together until well combined. Add chocolate and whip again until well combined and smooth. Pour into prepared crust. Cover and refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place 3/4 cup of the peanuts in a food processor fitted with metal bladeprocess until finely chopped. Set aside 1/2 cup of peanuts for decorating. Add the remaining peanuts to a large bowl along with flour, salt and vanillastir to mix. In a large bowl or large measuring cup combine eggs and 1/3 cup granulated sugarbeat until fluffy. Fold peanut mixture into egg mixture until combined. Drop by tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto an ungreased cookie sheetsprinkle with reserved peanuts. Bake 16 to 18 minutes or until lightly browned around edges. Cool 1 minute on cookie sheetremove to wire rack to cool completely.

Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Add elbow macaroni. Cook 8-10 minutes. Drain and set aside. In a small bowl add 2 cups of the pasta water with the taco seasoning and salsa. Pour over the pasta and stir to combine. Add cheese and stir until melted. If you like it thicker add a little more cheese.

Wash and peel baby red potatoes. Boil until tender. Drain. Toss hot potatoes with garlic and dried parsley. Melt butter in a saucepan. Add garlic. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Toss with hot potatoes. Serve hot.

Remove the bread from the plastic wrap. Spread the dressing on one slice of bread. Add the tomatoes and lettuce. Spread the other slice of bread on top. Place the sandwich on a plate. Serve immediately.

Combine flour, baking soda, salt and strawberry powder in large bowl with electric mixer on low speed. Beat in butter until mixture is crumbly. Beat in sugar until well mixed. Stir in eggs one at a time. Beat in vanilla. Shape dough into ball. Press dough evenly over bottom of ungreased 12-cup fluted tube pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375 degrees F for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan on wire rack 10 minutes. Remove from pancool completely on wire rack.

In a small saucepan place fish sauce and vinegar over a low heat and stir until dissolved. Stir in the caster sugar and lime juice until the mixture is thick and syrupy, about 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the oil and mint. Drain and pat dry the prawns. Spoon the sauce into a small serving dish and arrange the prawns around the edge of the dish. Serve with crusty bread and a green salad.
